Reviews.Title: “Nice weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: almostfloridanative
Reviews.Content: I read others' reviews and understand that the rather long walks from many of the rooms can be a real downside, especially if you're trying to get as much Disney fun in as possible during your stay, or needing to go with children to/from the amenities. My husband and I weren't in that category. We live nearby and have been to the parks many times. This was the first time we splurged for staying on property instead of driving home, since we were celebrating our anniversary. We had a great experience from the moment we drove on to the property. The valets and bellmen in front were very friendly, even though we didn't use their services, and check-in was a breeze (we checked in around noon even though check-in is officially 3 PM). Our room was about an 8-minute walk, if that, from the lobby/restaurant area. (We were in a King bed room in building 25.) It was a very peaceful walk, past natural plantings and over little ponds/streams, and we didn't mind it at all. In fact, we usually saw rabbits hopping by or grazing, which was fun. Our room was very quiet (we did hear some kids playing in the nearby small pool on our last morning), and the decor was homier than most hotels (shuttered, corner windows, an amoire to hide the TV, no "hotel white" tiles in the bathroom/vanity area). The closet area was open and there was no cooler (dorm fridge) for drinks or leftovers - otherwise, I have no quibbles. The room was cleaned and made up nicely while we were away. Since our aim was to relax (and sleep in for once!), we skipped the morning rush, getting to the food court around 11 AM and heading over to the parks after that. One night we took the river boat cruise to Downtown Disney and back, and would highly recommend that for a relaxing change. Boats were running every ten minutes during peak times, and ran until about 11:30 PM. We never waited more than 10 minutes for a bus to go to and from the park. When going to the park, the bus displays instructions including advising you to ask the driver exactly where to return to catch the bus. We didn't, and should have, because the pick up area was not exactly where he dropped us off, and we missed one bus before we realized this. The food court had a lot of choices, including grab-and-go containers of fruit and so forth. I wasn't too impressed with the choose-your-own-toppings pasta station (shrimp was good, noodles were overcooked). One day we had breakfast at the French Quarter food court, and really liked the beignets and omelet we had. We may have saved some money compared with eating in the parks, especially since there are free refills on coffee and soft drinks. All in all, we really enjoyed our stay and would be happy to repeat the experience!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: carolwesterly
Reviews.Content: The room decor was very rustic and seemed old and tired. The two chairs were not comfortable and generally found the hotel a disappointment. The exterior and grounds were beautiful, but the actual rooms not impressive at all. From other reviews, it appears that some rooms have been updated, but obviously not the one we stayed in. Very few amenities in the room, believe only shampoo and small bars of soap. The bathroom was tiny, although the dressing area was large enough and contained two pedestal sinks. There was a small refrigerator in the room which was convenient, but an adjoining room for other family members had a fridge that was totally frozen with ice in it and had to be serviced before it could be used. It was a long walk to the lobby, the bus stop and the parking lot. Check-in was slow and I went to another line to purchase a 3-day pass to the parks. After an interminable wait for the pass, which took at least 15 minutes (supposedly a problem with the computers), I found the next day that the card was rejected at the park and had to be repurchased,so after waiting in line to get into the park, I had to get into yet another line to repurchase the pass. The food in the restaurant located in the lobby building was overpriced and of very poor quality. Fortunately the weather was good during our stay, but this hotel and location would have been a real nightmare had it been raining. If this hotel falls within Disney's "moderate" category, I can't imagine what the "value" category must be like.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay at Port Orleans with one or two faults...”
Reviews.Author: Mehlozzi
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at this resort one or two times when we visit Disney. we are an English family and our party size was 7, including teenagers and grandparents. we have visited Disney world 16 times so far in total so we are very experienced when it comes to planning your stay here. WARNING. if you do not like huge resorts with a lot of walking, this resort is not for you. however if size is not an issue and you are willing to take the risk of being placed right at the back of the resort, to take in the fabulous scenery, we would recommend this one for you!! we arrived at the hotel no problems checking it what so ever. very pleasant staff. Had a look around the hotel, huge gift shop filled with snacks and souvenirs, arcade is a decent size and you are greeted by a beautiful view of the water, horse drawn carriages and Disney boats. its so relaxing at night after a long long day at the parks. ROOMS- rooms are a good size with a decent sized fridge and coffee maker and the room was everything else you would expect from a moderate resort. our rooms were always cleaned out regularly. because of having senior citizens in our party we had requested rooms close to the amenities on our booking. we were on magnolia bend which was straight in front of the bridge, beautifully located by the water. the walk was still quite long to the bus stops, and food court but this was the closest we were going to get! i recommend you request close rooms before you travel. the food court is quite dark but we preferred to sit outside by the river and watch the boats. there is a good selection of eating options also a good point about this resort, if you don't want to keep walking to fill your resort mugs, take bottles of drinks to the room to store in your fridge. we found this very helpful. the buses. compared to resorts like the all stars, instead of separate lines to section each theme park off from one and other, all the buses were directed to only 2 depots. It is a free for all to get on the buses with no lines. we did not find this easy. we once got to the bus depot first and ended up not getting a seat because of no lines. plus ts the end of the night when you catch the bus home, it drops off at 4 other depots before arriving at the main depot. This was draining after a long day in the park.. the main pool was quite a distance from where we were staying but there was another small pool nearer to us. not big enough though. the boat to downtown Disney from the resort is so relaxing and such a better way to travel, also the boats you could rent out is such a great experience. also the bikes is a great way to see the entire resort!! overall, this resort is lovely, its a beautiful place to stay. just bare in mind if you don't like walking much to your room or you dont like crowds fighting over the buses, try another resort, i hope this review helped!

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: reillyran
Reviews.Content: I chose this place for the price, received a mailer with a discount code, and the cafeteria style setup. I got a "preferred" room in building 15 which wasn't too far from the food, arcade, shuttle to parks, and pool areas. The rooms are nothing special but the two sinks do help as well as the sliding curtain, when the kids aren't up yet and you need the light on. I didn't really like that we were on the first floor, near the parking lots (safety) but didn't feel unsafe during our stay. The beds were fine, the shuttle was consistent (never had to wait long), the main pool and jacuzzi was always crowded. The food was ok. We mainly ate breakfast, the choices were usually fried, more fried, sugar, healthy. We did not get the meal plan since I didn't want to commit, ended up spending $10-15 per person per meal. I wouldn't stay here again, especially at the normal rate. There's nothing special about the place. The extra hours at Disney, discounted rate, shuttle service to/from airport, and shuttle service to parks is the only reason why I chose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Least favorite Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: SS1971
Reviews.Content: I've been taking the family to Disney World annually for several years and we picked this property due to the cost and genuinely decent reviews. Having now stayed there - I wouldn't go back. I understand they are updating their rooms - but we got one of the old ones. It felt old. Smelled old. Was old. Lousy full size beds that are too small for two avg. size adults (I'm only 6' and weigh 150 - not large). The trundle bed for the 5th person in the room was a joke. I think most prison cell matresses are nicer than the one provided on this joke of a sleeper. The room aside - everyone I spoke with during the trip hated the bus situation. It simply seemed at times that the resort was too crowded for the number of buses provided. One night at MK the line for this resort extended completely through the lanes provided at station #5 and #4. People waited more than an hour. This was at a time when other resorts only had 10-15 people in thier lines. And one morning going to the Studios we waited 45 mins for a bus and when it finally came it was so full it had to skip the last two stops where people were waving and hollering bc they too had been waiting. All in all - I think this resort belongs in the "value" category at Disney and shouldn't be called moderate. I will spend the extra money next time and stay somewhere nicer. Also - Disney needs to review how they treat families with more than four members. That ridiculous trundle bed is a joke. I'd rather stay at Coronado Springs and have someone sleep on the floor than stay here again (but they don't allow that at CS - no more than four to a room).

Reviews.Title: “Family of 5 - Nov. 2011”
Reviews.Author: 8982jc
Reviews.Content: We selected the family room with two double beds and a trundle. The room was small... we were constantly in each other's way, but we did have two sinks outside the tub and toilet- which was very helpful. Our building was about 3/4 of a mile from the restaurant, pool and lobby.... a far walk... but there were several bus pick up stations and one was close to us. The buses were plentiful and never full... we waited the longest, maybe five minutes. The food was decent, we only ate breakfast and lunch though. Lobby is very nice and has things for children to do as you check in, which did take a long time. We flew in and took the Disney bus... our luggage took over 4 hours after we arrived to come... which was frustrating..... we called the desk after we had eaten lunch ... at 2 hours... and then again at 2-1/2.... my son went to the area and found our luggage just sitting but was not able to take it... it had to be delivered... and so we waited another 1-1/2 hours. Don't think I'd stay here again.... we've been to the Contemporary... Key West, Music Value and I really think for the money the Value was the nicest and we received the best service there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value On Disney Property!”
Reviews.Author: briny319
Reviews.Content: Most important, I HIGHLY recommend getting a preferred room. I did and I still thought the walk to the bus stop and the main building was too long. I usually stay at one of the Deluxe hotels but this time I tried to save some money. Was it as nice as the Beach Club or grand floridian NO WAY! Was it 2 to 3 times cheap, YES! The room was clean but a little worn, it could use some updating. The food at the restaurant was pretty good but the food court was awful aside from the ice cream. Overall not great, not overly "magical", but reasonably priced for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Take your princess here!”
Reviews.Author: FemaleTraveler85
Reviews.Content: Oh my gosh! This is the place if you have young girls who love their Disney princesses! In March, 2012, this property opened their princess themed rooms. Designed by Princess Tiana from "The Princess and the Frog", this room was a delight to my 5- and 7-year-old nieces. Princess-themed bedding and shower curtain, cute princess pictures on the wall, a great 3-D picture of all the princess, and these amazing headboards where when your princess pushes a button, they start a little light-up fireworks show from the movie. There are also "hidden" Disney things around the room - of course, only the 7 year old found them - I would have never spotted them! The property itself was amazing. Lovely grounds, plenty of extra things to do (don't forget the marshmallow roast by the campfire in the evening). The cast members here are wonderful and treat the kids so well. They also show a Disney movie every night outdoors under the stars, which my little princesses loved. I was a bit out of shape about the price originally, as I had never spent this much on a room for myself, but I can say that their little faces made it worth twice the price! A memory I will treasure forever!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, poor food and service”
Reviews.Author: casp77
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a brand new princess room in bldg 94. We were on the 3rd floor facing the river. It was a very nice room with beautiful headboards that shot off fireworks and it was themed for Princess and the frog. The grounds are very nice and well kept. The main pool is a good enough size with a waterside and games for the kids to play with the lifeguard staff. The dining room left little to be desired. The staff was very unfriendly and cold. Even getting a cup for water was difficult. The food quality vs cost was a 2/5. A dry, cold burger and fries for $10. The pizza delivery was our only saving grace. Reasonable and decent pizza. Don't order the chicken wings. Waste of money. They only give you 3 wings and they are not split. I don't think we will stay at this resort again. Carribean beach was nicer, I think.

Reviews.Title: “Riverside delight”
Reviews.Author: corgipooh
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Port Orleans resorts. We had stayed at French Quarter prior and this time at the Riverside. Both resorts offer bayou comfort and even though the Riverside is a much larger property, it was still peaceful and quiet. We had rooms on the river and the view was spectacular. The rooms were decorated in southern plantation charm and offered plenty of space to spread out. We had dinner one night at Boatrights and other than the service being a little slow to start, the meal was fantastic! We were on the dining plan and used our quick service meal for breakfast at the resort every morning. Breakfast was plentiful and no matter what we chose that day very tasty. The resort has a beautiful walking/jogging path that follows the river which we took advantage of in the morning. If you cross over to the French Quarter side, the loop is a mile total. All employees of the resort were friendly and helpful making for a no drama stay. This was our first trip to Disney in the spring, we normally come in the fall, and it was a little more crowded than we prefer. I think we'll stick to the fall when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility at Disney World”
Reviews.Author: bonefishwidow
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th trip to Disney World and our first at a Disney Resort. Yes, it is worth the extra money to stay in the World. Disney's Port Orleans Riverside is a moderate resort, but the grounds are beautiful, and everyone we met had the Disney sparkle to them. The transportation system worked great. My daughter was put in a cast the day before we left and I worried that the trip would be ruined. Other than I got an extra workout pushing the wheelchair around the trip was wonderful. Every Disney person we met from the resort to all the park employees, the characters and restaurant staff were extremely accommodating and helpful. We requested a newly renovated room on the second floor, and close to transportation - every request was met. The rooms are small but honestly you are really only there to sleep, but it was lovely to walk around the grounds in the morning. It felt like you were staying at someone's grand plantation manor. We did not eat at any of the restaurants as we are light eaters and would have a quick snack before we left in the morning and would eat something at the park. The Magical express from the airport was so stress free! Just get off the plane and hop on a bus, and they take care of your luggage! We usually rent a car from the airport - but this was much more convenient. We did rent a car for 3 days from Alamo on at the Disney car care centre. Alamo picks you up at your resort, and drives you back after you return the car. Very hassle free. I highly recommend Disney's Port Orleans - we will defiantly return.

Reviews.Title: “It's Disney!:)”
Reviews.Author: RAYounger
Reviews.Content: For us everything Disney is great. There is a level of service there unlike any other. The only downside this year was that the pool area was in desperate need of debris from trees. My guess is springtime had something to do with that as last year we were there in the winter and the pools were crystal clear. They are heated btw so take your suit year round!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: kluline
Reviews.Content: This resort has the best of everything. There are multiple pools, bars, a large food court, in room dining and the best part, you are located on the river with boat service to Downtown Disney on the half hour. It is true that this is one of Disney's older resorts, but Disney is great about doing cyclical maintenance of their resorts. It is not uncommon to find workers painting, pruning and cleaning the grounds to make your experience "Magical."

Reviews.Title: “Great Disney Resort - Royal Suite a good value”
Reviews.Author: keroppiNyc
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my daughter and husband for 4 nights to celebrate her 4th Birthday. She is a huge fan of the Princess and the Frog so we had to stay in one of the new royal suites at Riverside. I must say that i have not seen the standard room so i can't compare. However, we loved the room - it is not huge but there was enough room for us and all of our stuff. The room was new and you could tell, nothing to complain about the room. The breakfast was standard and pricey but worth it. The dinner at Boatwrights is very good. The shuttle service to Downtown Disney does get crowded but they cycle the boats fairly quickly. If you miss the boat back take the bus from Downtown Disney. WARNING: if you arrive late DO NOT USE THE MAGICAL EXPRESS to get your luggage. Our flight landed at 9:30 on a Saturday night - we did not see our bags until 2:30AM and thats with me hounding them at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids”
Reviews.Author: Grace123Orlando_FL
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice - 1) Sept. 2010 and 2) May 2011. We stayed in the "Mansion" section the first time, and the Alligator Bayou section the 2nd time. I personally liked the Alligator Bayou area best, lots of trees and vegetation and a few other pools bigger than the ones by the mansions. Also helpful is a trundle bed under one of the beds. There are many pathways in the bayou area, so keep a map handy until you get used to it! As far as proximity to the pool and food, I thought it was the same as the mansions. Our kids are 11 and 9 (9 and 7 at the time of the first trip), and they loved the pool at Riverside because of the water slide which is geared for kids their age. The food selection at Riverside is similar to French Quarter. There are also bikes to rent, our kids loved the 4 person bike. Both the Riverside and French Quarter are wonderful hotels - in fact we are staying at the French Quarter again this June, and we will walk the little way to use the pool at Riverside.

Reviews.Title: “Dated and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Erica H
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed. It is similar to a cheap/old Best Western. We had booked 3 nights but we didn't even stay one night. They agreed to refund our money so we left and checked into the Hilton Orlando Bonnet Creek and it was amazing(and cheaper)!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort.”
Reviews.Author: momtokande
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at all but three of the onsite Disney resorts now. This was only my second trip to the moderate category, I've also stayed at Coronado springs. Like Coronado it is really huge and spread out. But so much prettier! Lots more shaded pathways. The landscaping is lovely and the classic and charming room buildings are set around a river, one themed pool, and several quiet pools. The food court has good choices and is convenient but very crowded and chaotic during peak times. If a preferred room choice ( more $ ) is available to you when you are booking, take it, you will save some walking. The resort is located relatively close to Magic kingdom, Epcot, Downtown Disney and Hollywood studios. So once you get on a bus, you won't have too long a ride. But there are 4 stops at this resort and sometimes they also include a stop at Port Orleans French quarter. They provide extra busses during peak seasons, but if you are at Disney during a non peak time you are going to wait a long time for a bus. The entire resort is in the process of room renovations. Some travel agents still have incorrect information that the resort has replaced all the full size beds with queens, but be aware that this is not to be the case until much later this year. All in all, it is a very nice resort. Positives outweigh the negatives.

Reviews.Title: “We love it here, feels like home”
Reviews.Author: BlaineandAimee
Reviews.Content: Right from word go, we found disney transfer from the airport to our resort very efficient. At check in the lady behind the counter was extremely helpful, I think her name was Roxanne (sorry if spelling is incorrect) and lovely to talk to. ROOM: We booked a kingroom and wanted to know if the room is one of the newly renovated one as from the reviews here, I got the impression that the rooms that have not had the reno done would be rather crummy so initially was disappointed to find out our room has not been renovated and there are non available at time of check in but without us requesting again, Roxanne made a call to see if there would be one avail the next day and she did get one for us and advised us that we'd get a call at 9am the next morning to confirm if we want to go ahead with room change. We got to our King room which is in the Alligator bayou section, room 2633 and we loved it! It won't suits everyone's tastes but it was homely, and reminded us of a room you'd find it you had a cottage like room in snow white, well maybe not quite that but the king bed was big and comfy, the bedhead had that 'log like' look about it, flat screen tv which is kept in the cubboard that you can open up when you want to watch tv, fridge, coffee machine. there's a curtain that separate the bathroom/sink area, overall, we were happy so made the trip back to Roxanne to tell her not to worry about the room change. Before we cancel room change, we walked over to the newly renovated area and had a peek into the new room and we actually prefer ours, the nenovated room had a more modern feel ofcourse but I rather like our rustic look of alligator bayou room and also prefer the building that its in. As mentioned, if you prefer more modern look, you may prefer the reno room. Alligator buyou area was also lovely and quiet, away from the noisy section. Resort: Love the look and feel of this resort, we saw French Quarter which was the other one we had considered but glad that we ended up chosing Riverside. We were so busy themeparking that we didn't have a chance to enjoy the serenity of our resort but walking around the garden area was just lovely. It is lush with lots of beautiful trees/plants. It reminds me of someplace I've been but can't remember or a place I'd like to be but has never been. I certainly feel like I was on a holiday but still at home. There's also coin laundry for guests to use. FOOD: We don't like to spend too much money on food so the fact that it has a food court was great for us. My faverite was the Marinara Spegetti pasta with prawns at around $12 inclusive of tax was excellent, it usually costs over $20 at home to buy the same type of food! Considering we're at a themepark resort, I thought that was really good value, but you can chose the type of pasta, sauces, prawns or chicken and what vegs you want and its the same price. Ofcourse, there's pizza and roasts etc there but I was very happy with my prawn pasta so didn't try anything else there. Overall, after staying here I don't think I'll stay anywhere else next time we come to Orlando, when we left the hotel to stay at another hotel near universal (to do universal parks) it could not compare and as my partner said, the pixie dusts have gone (as soon as we left Disney) and back to reality!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, neat, average - like a Super 8 Motel near Disney”
Reviews.Author: SFKSAW
Reviews.Content: Maybe we are spoiled - maybe we are jaded, but after staying at a variety of Disney on-site properties we have to declare this one to be the least interesting. It is a bit of a flop on a variety of levels. First, they appear to install their "trainees" at the front desk - at least this was our experience. Then the place was under construction. Then the room was a long distance away. The room was clean and functional - but nothing more than one would find at a budget motel. A Hampton Inn, typically charging $150 a night in most cities beats this hands down. So we checked in at midnight and thankfully our main reservation was at the Beach Club...so we checked out at 8 AM. We couldn't get out fast enough. The one saving grace - the doorman was a terrific character in a lovely outfit. Go over there and get a picture taken with him - but don't stay there!

Reviews.Title: “How to spend you money wisely”
Reviews.Author: rew345
Reviews.Content: First of all we had a WONDERFULL stay OFF site and ON site at Disney ! We will definitely go back to Orlando but will spend a better way our money. Universal area in Orlando was very hardly hit by the economic crises. Disney is so far the only company that seems to be spared by this crisis. Don't expect deals or rebates at Disney, they are even full in low season. We were impressed by the number of tourist at Disney, all parks were packed with tourist like a can of sardine. The only way to get some sort of â€œimpression of a deal" is to book your holidays 5-6 months in advance (like we did). A similar hotel room that has a real view cost $50 on I-Drive North: Best Western Plus. So this hotel at $220 is really expensive. In addition Waldorf Astoria discounts its huge rooms for $230 ! We stayed in room 413 a remodeled room (with water view +30$ but no real view) still smelling new. The plastic smell is due to use of a large quantity of cheap Chinese plastics everywhere in the room. The room was clean, it had a bad view. The decoration of the room is nice (all plastics) However the furniture in the room is very basic. We lived like homeless people in a shelter. All of our belongings were stored in plastic bags during 4 days. There is only 2 and half beds in the room. There is no place to put your clothing! Don't expect much and you wonâ€™t be disappointed. Since the bus service is not running very well, the resort is far from everything. It took us as much as 2 hours commuting per day to get to and back from Magic Kingdom!! After 2 days, we ended up using our rental car to travel. So the Hoper option to change Park the same day. Basically you don't have ANY advantages to stay on site! Commute is slow, Lines are long and slow to get into parks, Fast passes are available to everyone, you even pay more $$ for food as the off resort guests!!! That's being said if you want still stay on site here is the guide how to spend you money wisely (This is something that Disney don't want you to know). THE LITTLE SECRETS OF DISNEY RESERVATIONS: Disney wants you to buy as much as unnecessary things in advance as they can sell to you. The online booking system was built to take your money and mix up your mind. It was not built to explain Disney in detail. The online system is a brain washing system to take your money! Believe me, I am an experienced traveler. The entire Disney holiday system could be explain on 3 pages : Hotel, Park Ticket and Meal Plan. PARKS AND TICKETS: All parks have 3-4 times more shops than rides. LOL. This is ridiculous. MAGIC KINGDOM: We were able to do 90% of the park in one day. It was full of tourists but still enjoyable because of its size. Don't hesitate to take a little 4 years old girl to this park. It will be her princess dream. EPCOT : It is like a huge commercial fair/exposition for $80. Only a very few rides (Am I right 9 rides ?). Basically it is a walk around the world's finest shops. An endless succession of shops and restaurants but it is spectacular. Maybe we will come back here. Actually my 6 years old daughter loved Epcot more than Magic Kingdom ?!. Maybe because she saw more animals at Epcot than at Animal Kingdom ! LOL HOLLYWOOD STUDIOS: Again a few rides a lot of shops but nothing really interesting. If you have been at Universal studios, it will be disappointing. Fast passes are all given out by 11AM in low season !! ANIMAL KINGDOM: Are there any animals ? It was so crowded (300% more folks that it can take). that we only managed to do/see the African section on a Monday !!! This park can't handle tourist visiting it. It is a spectacular place (Kilimanjaro and Tree of life) but again it is an endless succession of shops and waiting lines. You better go to Sea World. The best deal regarding Disney tickets is the 7 days base ticket even if you only go 5 days to the parks !! Dont try to beat the system you will only spend more money. Kids and adults won't walk more than 4-6 hours per day, even if you are a triathlon champion. FOOD AND MEAL PLAN: We had the Dining Plus meal plan for $56 per day. Count my dollars, if I had paid one by one each meal: A snack $4 + Fast food meal $15 + Meal with service $34 = $53 Hey Disney your food plan was more expensive: LOL One advice don't get the meal plan but buy the food as you go. The food on site at Disney is very good. I have nothing to say but good world about what is available. The only advantage of the Dining plus plan is that it will force you to taste and visit different restaurants. We loved the Boma and Cafe may buffets. Best deal for your money. Anyhow if you plan to go to a Disney restaurants book as early as 5-6 months in advance ! (Including buffets !!) Lines are HUGE at restaurants even if you have a reservation. Basically the meal plan is a set of vouchers for each meal. You can use one by one each meal vouchers and snack vouchers. For instance at noon don't take a meal for all family members (unless your body mass index above 30). 1 or 2 meals is enough for 3 ! It doesn't count what time of the day you take your vouchers. Some high end restaurants require 2 vouchers per person per meal (Like the Cinderella castle restaurant). Don't hesitate to ask questions from Disney staff and don't pay for extras! Our favorite place at Disney was the Boardwalk area. A nice trip to Disney but I will need a week to recover from the exhaustion. I would rather spend $3000 on an all inclusive resort in the Caribbean than going back to Disney again. However I did this trip for my daughter. Obviously Disney did a very good marketing job. Now I feel like a good father :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bogey5380
Reviews.Content: Great hotel..love the feel and theme. You feel like you are really in the bayou..real quiet...great for couples

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: tromba61
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our clean, quiet rooms at Port Orleans. The room had a camp feel with beds frames made to look like natural tree limbs. Landscaping was terrific, and our 8-year old daughter loved the swimming pool just a few yards away from the building. We loved the breakfast in a large cafeteria-style room just was a short walk away; you can even get a Mickey-shaped waffle. Great linens and pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, moderate price”
Reviews.Author: gourmand47
Reviews.Content: This was a vacation for two families, we were taking my son and his family to Disney to celebrate my grandson's fifth birthday. We were able to get two adjoining rooms. The staff at the hotel are extremely helpful and the amenities are many. You are close to most of the parks and the buses run frequently. However, the buses can be crowded and you may have to stand the entire trip. There is a beautiful pool on an island adjacent to the lodgings, you just have to cross a bridge to get their. Their "quiet" pool at the center of each of the villages. The food in the main building is fast food style, but tasty and well prepared. It is good for a quick breakfast in the morning, or a late snack in the evening. There is also a boat that will take you to Downtown Disney, but it doesn't run if it is windy. You can rent bike cars, or boats, and there is an area for fishing, you rent the poles. I can highly recommend this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip!”
Reviews.Author: WDWFan12
Reviews.Content: Riverside is a beautiful resort, whether you stay on the bayou side or magnolia bend side. The quick service restaurants are great but the table service restaurant was a little disappointing. This resort is great for families with young children. I have stayed here twice now and highly recommend it for a moderate resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, pretty grounds”
Reviews.Author: tobique
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth trip to Disney and our first stay in Port Orleans - Riverside. We called ahead to request a renovated room and then renewed that request on check in - our request was not honored. By the time we got to our room, we decided just to stay in the room we were assigned. It was very dark with no view, but it was close to the parking lot behind us so we ended up using our car because the bus transport was time consuming. The lobby and food court were a bit of a walk and we were in the Parterre building, which is closer than most of the other areas. The food court is very large and has a great selection of food items as well as a sit down restaurant so you can eat there if you can't get reservations in the parks for a sit down meal or if you just want the convenience of eating close to "home". There a few pools, but the one nearest to us is very large and in a beautiful location. There are also a lot of activities for children including a big video arcade and rentals of boats for the nearby river and bicycles and surrey with the fringe on top bike type transport for the entire family. We took the river transportation to Downtown Disney and it was pleasant and probably took less time than the buses. This resort is pretty close to Epcot and Hollywood Studios so the bus transport to those should be easy. We took the bus to Animal Kingdom and Magic Kingdom and the wait was fairly long upon exit from the parks. After that we decided to drive to the parks which made it quicker and more convenient - hate that we increased our carbon footprint! If we had been younger, I would have definitely made the effort to continue with the Disney transport. All in all, the hotel was good, but not the best we have visited.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time, lots of acreage”
Reviews.Author: orionreplay
Reviews.Content: We have stayed on Disney property before, but as a couple. We now have children (4 and 2) and this was our first time back to Disney property with them. This was our first taste of the Port Orleans area (French Quarter or Riverside). We arrived on Februay 27th and immediately were bogged down by a resort wide reservation outage, that I was told had been out since 0600 that morning. We arrived at 1230 and were without rooms until it all got cleared up approximately at 4pm that day. That added some stress to our trip I had not expected at all. We were all dressed for a winter morning in the Northeast and it was in the 80s in Orlando. We probably should have packed a change of clothes in our carry ons. We ended up exploring the grounds for several hours. When we did receive a room I was told we were upgraded to a two queen bedroom with river view and stayed in the Acadian House (building 80). Though we did face the river, a giant tree actually blocked our second floor's window's view of the river. I was okay with it as I never really imagined my family would sit at the window wacthing the river while at Disney World! The room was a good size by Disney standards and held the two queen beds, a breakfast nook table with two chairs, a bureau that held the flat screen television and a small dorm fridge. There was a single night stand between the two beds. The bathroom was separated from the living space by a closeable curtain. It contained two mirrors and two sinks. The toilet and shower was behind a door. There was no closet, but an area was available next to the sinks with rod and hangars. My two year old son required a pack n' play which we received from the staff. We managed to squeeze the pack n' play into the bathroom next to the sinks in order to draw the curtain and put him to bed earlier than my wife, my daughter and I. Some PO Riverside rooms have a trundle bed or murphy bed for children. Mine did not. My daughter slept in one of the queen beds and we slept in the other. The beds were a firmer mattress than we were accustomed to, but after a couple tiring days of parks, we didn't care anymore. Wireless internet was available free of charge. This hotel was not listed as a Disney property with free wireless, but it had it none the less. We enjoyed it for making last minute dinner reservations. The signal wasn't the greatest, but it worked. The acreage of the property is quite expansive. If there was any "con" to the resort it would be that. After walking the parks all day, the walk from my bedroom to the main building to refill my resort mug seemed awfully far. Coffee was available in the room, but it was not great. So every morning I'd trudge to the main building to get my coffee and bring it back to the room. We tried the cane fishing on the river and my daughter loved it. We also enjoyed the quiet pool next to Building 80. We never used the "loud pool" on the island. We saw many people using the horse and buggy for rent, but never did ourselves. In hindsight, I wish we had. Movies were played outdoors between Buildings 90 and 95, always starting at 8pm. That was fun to watch for a short while before bed. All in all, a great trip at a great resort. A little bit of a rocky start on our first day, but by check out on the 5th of March, we were in love with the place.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: prtynpnkFortAnn_Ny
Reviews.Content: Just checked out 3/3. We love this resort....EXCEPT for the signage (as someone previously reported) either not enough direction or, the one sign that is facing the wrong direction - tells you that you're heading to the lobby, not so! We are going back in December for 12 days, my kids 15, 9, & 8 would rather enjoy more resort days than park days. It is so beautiful walking the paths at night...I don't mind getting lost. My daughter and I would just laugh walking back to our room from the main pool because each time, we ended up on a different route, getting lost...OH - memories! I figured out the last night that if you remember the building # (the one on the interior path to the pool and lobby) - you can then find your building (if your building is on the outside, closer to the parking lots) Mousekeeping was awesome! Our Mousekeeper used "white glove standards" tending to our room ... Do you think they'll honor a request to locate us in her building the next time?!! I forgot to mention, we were in a refurbished room in the Alligator Bayou section-love the murphy beds. Boatwrights was the best meal of our entire trip. Every cast member we came in contact with at our resort was just wonderful, helpful, and professional. Can't wait...9 more months!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: kbx4
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel, with lovely grounds. They were refurbishing the rooms when we stayed but even our 'old' style room was lovely - a nice size for 2 adults and 2 children. We were put in the Parterre Place building 95 which was a short walk across the river to the main building and was perfect for us. The swimming pools were lovely, staff extremely polite, shop great, lots of bus transfers which in February were not at all busy (I can imagine they do get busy at peak times). The only downside was the food - although a good quality, we were here for 11 nights and they served the same meals every day - can get a bit boring! Maybe a variation even on the sandwiches and pizza (2 options - same everyday!) but can't fault anything else!

Reviews.Title: “Where was the Disney Magic”
Reviews.Author: donr5000
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying this is my 6th trip to Disney and the 3rd time staying at Port Orleans Riverside and the worst trip I have experienced. First of all when checking we were greeted by do you want the good news or the bad news that is the good was we were at Disney and the bad was the System was down and therefore we could not check in, but as a consulation they would give us tickets to the parks (which had already been paid for). As we waited for 3 plus hours not once did anyone (management) announce what the progress was as there was many many people waiting in the lobby. After 3 and 1/2 hours waiting we decided to go to the Magic Kingdom and upon our return about 9:30pm went to check in. The receptionist proceeded to check us in as nothing had happened. I had requested a 1st floor room and was assigned a 2nd floor room. When I told him we had already given all the required information he looked it up and proceeded to show us where the room was on the map sending us on our way. Since we had the dinning plan we were told to pay for our meals and we would be re-payed if we brought our reciepts. Proceeding to the concierge I was asked if I wanted room credit on the account but since the trip had been all paid for in full I requested cash which seemed to confuse them and a supervisor had to be called to approved. The transaction complete it was now 10:30pm as we set out to find our room. On our two previous visit I always booked a stardard room and stayed at the Magnolia side but this time we were sent to Aligator Bayou. As we wandered around in circles late at night trying to find our rooms and following the signage for over 1/2 hour. (the signage is confusing and inaccurate) we finally found our room overlooking the parking lot. (this would have been great if we had a car) and as far away from the lobby, and food court as one could get. I returned to the front desk to complain and was told that they had reclassified the roooms and that all the stardard rooms are facing the parking lot (too bad).I notified the supervisor how misleading the signage was and how one sign for the lobby, ole man island and lodges 1-14 would take you directly away from them to he parking lot, he replied that he would have the engineers check it out. I meet other equally confused.and the sign was never changed. The room is nothing special,bed frames made of logs, the faucet handle fell off, houskeeping did not leave any regular coffee after the first days supply, ice bucket was never emptied,shower faucet dripped, and the room not really cleaned. Overall this was a disappointing experience as this resort seems to be going down hill. It would have been appropiate to have some transportation (golf carts) to transport guest that were incovienced by the check-in system being down and returning after dark to their rooms. I agree with other posters that the buses are always packed and standing room only to this resort with longer lines, (probably because all the park busses except the Magic Kingdom serve both the Frencah Quarter and Port orleans) I will offer that if you are a mobile senior as we are, you must either pony up the extra $25.00 per night for a perfered room (what ever that is) or find a better resort. I appears that the "Disney Experience is all about selling goods and not a magical experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but very large”
Reviews.Author: Michiganmom45
Reviews.Content: As background, we are in our early 40s, have an 8 year old daughter, and have stayed at the Polynesian, Wilderness Lodge, Coronado, Pop Century, and All Star Movies in the past. Riverside was nicer than some, less nice than others. My biggest complaint is the size and layout. It was so easy to get lost and it took us 8 minutes to the main lobby. Not a big deal in the morning, but a pain when you are tired. Also, most of the buses were standing room only, and the dining area was very hectic during peak times. On the plus side, the renovated rooms are lovely and the new queen beds are very comfortable. The grounds are beautiful and the pool was fun. Our room was cleaned well each day, and a tip ensured some cute towel animals. Overall, our stay was fine, but nothing special. To be honest, we have enjoyed the theming at other resorts more, and our 8 year old actually preferred the colorful (ie somewhat tacky) decor at Pop Century. She did not care for this resort, and in turn, as much as I wanted to like it, I just wasn't "wowed".

Reviews.Title: “Good value for $$, basic comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: melonball3
Reviews.Content: We are sitting in the airport on a delay so I figured I would post. We booked 5 days/4 nights at Port Orleans Riverside (POR) the last week of February. Overall, the hotel was good value for the money and was centrally located to all of the parks. Nothing was more than 15 minutes away by bus. When we arrived, the hotel's computer systems were down and after a long day at the park, we returned to find our room still not ready (at almost 5pm). That really was the only negative. The hotel is overall well-kept - is it the Grand Floridian? NO. But you are also not paying that ticket. I thought the food at the main dining area was not so great but my boyfriend liked it. We were in a King room (river view) in building 95, Parterre Place. It was fine. No frills but clean though the hair dryer was terrible (if you have alot of hair, bring your own). Tip for travel: if you are in building 90 or 95 you can walk to South Depot at POR but if the line is long for the POR bus, you can take the French Quarter bus and walk over - follow the river path then cut up and across the bridge (the one that you drive over - so up the grass hill). We were there in same amount of time as from South Depot. Would we stay again? We agreed yes, of we had friends with us or had more "adult" things to do (like drink service at the pool, etc) or could make our own fun with friends. For couples, I would blow for the Grand Floridian, it is much better when you don't want to go to the parks and just relax. That's what we both agreed (29 yo male/32 up female). Overall though, a good Disney experience. And there IS a bar there with live music Wed-Sat.

Reviews.Title: “I guess I expected a little more from a Disney "resort"”
Reviews.Author: jjj5278
Reviews.Content: Well overall this resort was only okay. I have numerous complaints and some are only minor and some may not even be their fault but it impacted my overall experience nonetheless. First off, we arrived at a little past midnight and the check in line was pretty long. There were four people working at the front desk, but the process seemed painfully slow for some reason. We didn't get to our room until after 1am b/c of the wait to check in. Then in the room the doorknob for our bathroom was broken, on both sides. The ring was separated from the door on both sides and was slightly annoying. The light to the actual bathroom took awhile to "warm up" so midnight bathroom breaks were a little hard to navigate. The water pressure in the shower was HORRIBLE. The sinks had way more pressure, to the point that I considered washing my hair in there, haha. The pillows on the bed were also pretty bad. I laid my head on it and sank all the way through and felt like I had NO support on my head/neck. Made sleeping a little less comfortable that's for sure. The cleaning was not very good either, there were things on the floor that we had not brought w/ us (and no way we tracked them in). Also where the sinks were they never left us any hand soap, just facial soap. Not sure why a place like Disney would not give you handsoap outside a bathroom, but they never did. A few other quick thoughts for people thinking of staying here, the buses to go to the theme parks seem to be always be packed and running VERY sporadic. When leaving a park expect to wait in the longest line for a bus, not sure why but every other "resort" seems to have a short line or none at all. We spent a lot of time standing on bus rides to and from the parks. Also the food prices in the quick restaurant were very pricey for what you got, but that is common in Disney (and the water tastes odd, probably so you'll buy a bottled water). I think next time we will spend a little more money and stay at one of the resorts on the monorail line (Contemporary, Polynesian, Grand Floridian, etc). They seem to be nicer inside, easier to get to the parks and you get to avoid the terrible Disney theme park bus service.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAY!”
Reviews.Author: 301Canadians
Reviews.Content: We were at Disney for 10 days in February 2012--spent four nights at the Port Orleans Riverside and five nights at Port Orleans French Quarter. We have nothing but good to say about both places. We had asked for one of the renovated rooms at Riverside, garden view, on the top floor and were given a room covering all three requests. Yeh to Disney for putting queen beds in these newly renovated rooms!! We used the boat to Downtown Disney twice--even if you aren't going down to shop, the ride is excellent! The food court food is wonderful! From check-in to check-out, we never encourntered one staff member who wasn't polite, friendly and knowledgeable. One common complaint on reviews is how far everything is from the main building, but look at a map of the grounds before you book--just by looking you should be able to figure out that it covers a big area! We were in building 36, which is about as far from the main building as you can get and it took us eight minutes to get from our room to the food court--who can complain about eight minutes out of your day!! It was a wonderful walk in the morning. If you have small children or have walking difficulties, request a room in one of the buildings that are closer to the main building. This was our ninth trip to Disney World and we have stayed in most of the value resorts and several of the moderate and we couldn't have been happier with our stay at Riverside. We will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: bkiesster
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about the front desk staff at this place. This was my family's first trip to Disney and I gather that all staff are helpful, but the front desk staff at this place was exceptional. Our daughter got sick on the day that we arrived and the front desk staff was friendly, sympathetic, helpful, courteous, and professional. We contemplated ending the vacation and just going home and they helped us look at all options with hotel nights and park passes. The front desk staff acutally helped save our vacation with all of their help! The food is also pretty good at the cafeteria for a quick service option on the meal plan and the grounds are pretty awesome. We didnt have time to utilize the pools, but the main pool looked pretty fun! I would definately come back to this place. THANK YOU FRONT DESK STAFF!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great combination of a nicer Disney resort at a reasonable price!”
Reviews.Author: VacaynDisneyLover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans Riverside for 7 nights at the beginning of February. There was 6 of us in our group, my family (husband and 2 small kids) and my parents. We were in the Magnolia Bend Mansions. Loved Disney Port Orleans for many reasons. What I loved the most was that it's a nicer resort than the value resorts and that alone makes it easier to come back to the resort in the middle of the day for a break from the parks and to come back at the end of the day. The boat to Downtown Disney is a nice alternative to the busses. My daughter thought it was great. I've read mixed reviews about the bus transportation for Port Orleans Riverside, but I thought it was just fine. The busses do rotate where they start and finish on the resort, but for the most part they start at the South Depot. So if you want to make sure you get a seat on the bus, go to the south depot. Sometimes going back to the resort from the park, the bus would stop at French Quarter, and then go to Riverside. But they are so close together, it really didn't tack on that much more time. The main pool is wonderful. The water was nice and warm, except the kiddie pool was kind of cold, but my kids didn't seem to mind. The waterslide at the Ol' Man Island is fun for kids and even the adults. We did not eat at Boatwrights but did eat at the quick service restaurant a few times. A great selection of food that tasted good. The salad bar part was great. The only thing I thought it lacked was bagels/muffins/pastries out during the day. We like to pick those types of things up in the day and eat breakfast in our rooms. Loved that they had the zuper movies at night. This was a nice way to end our day. My kids are young, so we don't keep them out late at the parks, like many parents do- trying to cram in as much as possible. My goal is quality time, not quanity time at Disney. So having the movies in the evening and the boat ride to Downtown is great because it's something to look forward to in the evening for the kids. Our room was not one of the recently refurbished ones, however it was still a nice room. Beds were not the most comfortable, but I'm sure once they replace them in their updates, they'll be fine. This was our 3rd trip to Disney in the last 3 years. We've stayed at Pop Century the first 2 times. We will definitely keep going to the moderates. If you're wondering if it's worth the extra money to go to the moderates....I'd say definitely. Maybe not for your 1st trip because then you're just doing the parks all day every day. But for all other trips to Disney, it's certainly worth the money. We'll be back to Port Orleans for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Setting”
Reviews.Author: Ty B
Reviews.Content: The ground at this hotel are absolutely beautiful! The rooms are very nice, above average. Very large and spread out hotel. Pay the extra and get a room close to the restaurant or you may not like all the walking, but you will love the view.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but POOR customer service”
Reviews.Author: RainerRock
Reviews.Content: The pictures make it look grand, but the biggest problem with this resort is the shear size and layout of the place. At an evening check-in, there were no bell-men available, so we decided to take a map and stroll to our room. NUMBER ONE PROBLEM: The map for Riverside has many buildings, but does not list their name or number. The desk clerk drew a line to Magnolia Bend and said "It's just over the bridge". There is alot "over there" We wandered around trying to find the right building for a good 1/2 hour. We stopped a housekeeping person who, a) could not speak English, b) could not direct us to our room & c) had no means of communicating with the front desk. We were schlepping back to the front desk, when we flagged down a bell man, who grudgingly deigned to take us, where he unceremoniously dropped our bags at the back of our building, said "It's up those stairs" and drove away. This is the biggest complaint about Riverside - true lack of customer service. There are just too many lodging options not to have good personnel at a Disney Property. The property itself is beautiful - Gone With the Wind facades facing a meandering stream. If you are spending time at your resort, this is a nice one. You can rent a boat, kayak, bike, surrey, or just walk the shaded paths. The main pool is busy & noisy with kid activities throughout the day, but the large pool in Magnolia Bend is relatively quiet and uncrowded. It's nice to take the boat to Downtown Disney, but if it rains/storms you will have to rely on the bus system, as the boats won't run. Food was just so-so in both the Food Court & Boatwrights, but you do have a small fridge in the room for leftovers. The Disney Magical Express is one reason to stay on property - no worries getting to and from the airport, and the resort will store your bags until you depart. Transport to Disney properties is also frequent and fast. They drop and pick you up in front of the attractions. Rooms are nicely appointed, beds comfy, but skip the 'water view' unless you are spending a lot of time in the room. Overall, ok for the price, but if you really only sleep in the room, there are far better deals in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: Ashley N
Reviews.Content: Wow, we just came back from our Disney vacation two weeks ago and we're so impressed with this hotel. At first I was a little nervous because of some reviews I have read and the fact that this is one of the more inexpensive Disney resorts. I was very wrong. The room was so beautiful and re-modeled. We stayed in the Alligator side in Section 14. We were so close to the main bus stop and the restaurants, we loved it. The staff is so wonderful and helpful. They were very nice and most times went out of their way to help us. Overall this resort was worth the money and we are already planning our next trip to Disney in December and will be staying at this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Moderate Place to Stay at Disney”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoAnnabelle
Reviews.Content: We are not frequent disney visitors so consider this in your review. We do travel often so our comparison may be driven by an overall experience rather than a disney one. This was our second stay at a Disney resort for the Disney Princess Half Marathon. We previously stayed at the All Stars Movie Resort last year. The resort is beautiful and the layout is nice. We stayed in building #95 Parterre and felt that although it was a distance from the main lobby it was a nice to be away from all of the resort traffic. We had been told that we would have a riverside view room however when we checked into our room it was a view of the back, which didn't matter since we were hardly in our room. I would have to check if we were charged extra for this view or not. The room itself was tastefully decorated but was not spotless clean, since there was human hair in the drawers of the dresser (didn't put our clothes in there after seeing this) and there was a stray button by the refridgerator which made me wonder if a vaccum was used at all in the room. The comforters on the bed were worn and there were a few stains on them. As with any hotel, I am not convinced that comforters are ever cleaned. Housekeeping did come each day and made cute animal towel arrangements and made the room tidy, however the stray button stayed on the floor our entire visit until I picked it up and threw it away. The restaurants were average, and the service was fast and the staff friendly. The dining area was clean. Keep in mind that there are lots of kids running around so you need to be careful making your way to a table. We used the water taxi to Downtown Disney and the Bus to get to the parks. Convenient but time consuming. For the Expo for the Race packet pick up we took a taxi because it would require us to take 3 buses to get to the ESPN Center and that seemed not the best use of our time. With all said, the resort is pleasant and is well cared for. Not sure if our room is one of the remodeled ones that are referred to in the previous reviews. In comparison to the All Stars Resort this place is far better and worth the extra money. It is quiet and comfortable. Keep in mind that you are staying at Disney you will not be getting a 4 star hotel service unless you pay for this. This is a moderate hotel and it meets those standards.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: TxRanger9
Reviews.Content: There is nothing not to like. Great rooms, peaceful layout, great ambiance and theme, good food and staff. Has all the great perks of a Disney resort with lots of onsite features (boats, fishing, nice southern feel). The best price vs advantages Disney resort.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not Great”
Reviews.Author: HereHere
Reviews.Content: I've been to several Disney World resorts and the Disney World area several times, so I feel I can give a useful, unbiased review of Disney's Port Orleans Riverside resort. We just came back today, so it's fresh in my mind as well. So here's the good and not too good: This is considered by Disney to be a "moderate" level resort. No problems checking in until I asked for late check-out the next day. My wife was running the Disney Princess Half-Marathon this weekend and we needed the extra time. I thought the check-in lady would certainly understand our need, but she acted like I was asking for the moon- however, we did get the late check-out after her initial few minutes of annoyance display. She was nice otherwise, well pleasant at least, though a bit impersonal. (Remember, Mickey, a smile goes a long way when customers are paying top-dollar!!) I've only had a problem checking in one other time at a Disney Resort a few years ago, so I know this is not the norm for Disney. Our building was in the Alligator Bayou section, but our room was not one of the renovated rooms at Riverside- you can actually check the renovation schedule for all their resorts on-line to see which buildings have been renovated at your resort- and you have to ask for those rooms early! We arrived at the room and I immediately noticed two things- there was a big window cleaner spray bottle in one of our sinks, evidently forgotten by house (or MOUSE) keeping, and there was no shampoo or soap in the bathroom area(!). Now, this is probably no big deal to many people, but I go nuts for the high-quality Disney Resort shampoos and soaps, that's one of the things I like about staying at Disney! I called for some and they came up and gave us a treasure trove of soaps to make up for it. All is forgiven. The room, again, was not one of the renovated ones so yes, it did have that dated Brady Bunch feel to it. The picture on the wall was dated "1980" and I'm sure it has been in that one spot all these years. The big square yellowing plastic smoke detector (or whatever that electronic box of yesteryear was) on the wall was off-kilter, looking like a picture hung crookedly. The safe was impossible to find, here's the secret- it's behind the curtain in the sink area. Challenge one of your kids to find it and see how long it takes! I had to call downstairs because I actually thought our room didn't have one! The safe itself is very, very, very small. Did I mention small? It had enough room for my wife's small purse and my car keys- that's about it. The shower looked dated, you know the look, but the two sinks were very clean and having two was nice. The room itself, with two beds, looked generally worn and I can understand why Mickey finally decided to renovate these units. The only modern amenities were a flat-screen tv and small refrigerator. The beds actually made noise when I sat on them, like they were creaky old men waiting to be retired. The carpets were not that clean, you know after several years you just can't get all the dirt out. Ceiling fan was dusty- older a/c unit under the window was touchy with the controls- in sum the room needed renovation and I'm glad Mickey is working on it. (I think Port Orleans French Quarter (next door) has all been renovated, so keep that in mind.) Port Orleans Riverside offers a great pool with slide, and the pool was heated for those cool Florida winter mornings. Poolside bar, kids pool, and small play area. Also marshmallow roasting. As usual, the on-site restaurants have excellent breakfast, lunch and dinner options. Super food at Disney. The great thing about Port Orleans (Riverside or French Quarter)- you can take a cool boat ride down the river to Downtown Disney. Or, you can take a bus anywhere to any Disney resort or theme park. Absolutely no driving required. If you want to take the great monorail, you'll have to stay somewhere else like the Polynesian (my FAVORITE Disney Resort), Grand Floridian, or Contemporary Resort. In sum, we were happy there, but not overly impressed. Wait till renovations are complete, in my opinion, before staying at Port Orleans Riverside.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice!”
Reviews.Author: Jodean C
Reviews.Content: My husband & I went to Disney for the first time for our 30th anniversary. After weeks of planning, reading & researching most all of the properties, we chose Port Orleans Riverside. We had no idea what we find until we got there. What an amazing choice for us. It was perfect. We got one of the remodeled rooms close to the north bus depot. Everything was so beautiful. The grounds, the bus area, the pools the rooms and the main building where you eat and shop. Everyone is so friendly. We loved the boat ride to Downtown Disney! We never had to wait more than 10 minutes for a bus. Be prepared tho, the buses are very full. Most of the time we stood for every bus ride we took. ( which was a lot) The other reviews are right...you will wall a ton, but you are going to be walking more than you can imagine your entire trip. Wear comfortable shoes. We have been back 3 weeks and my husband just said yesterday that we can't wait to go back again! next time we won't wait 30 years!

Reviews.Title: “Treehouse Jungle”
Reviews.Author: Momstraveling450
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a treehouse villa, and this was our first time staying at a Disney resort. We enjoyed the convenience of taking the Magical Express. We loved the uniqueness of the treehouse. The location to Downtown Disney was convenient, and we enjoyed taking the ferry over. The ferry drivers were very friendly, and helpful! What we did not like was that some of our party arrived on an 8:30pm flight, and it took much later than we realized to receive their luggage at the room. It ended up being after 1am, and they did not pack pajamas, etc in their carry ons. Another challenge that we encountered was this: The first afternoon we arrived we took the ferry over to Downtown Disney. When we returned, we took a swim at the main pool because the pool near the treehouse was closed. When we asked how we could get a ride back to the treehouses, we were directed to the bus. We asked the bus driver which stop to get off at, and asked to be directed towards our treehouse number. We went in the direction given by the busdriver. After about 20 minutes, we still could not find it in the dark. We went back to the bus stop, and asked the next bus driver that came along if he could help us. He pointed us in basically the same direction. We tried again unsuccessfully. Since we left in the daylight, and returned when it was dark, it was difficult because the unit numbers are not lit up. After a very frustrating 1/2 hour, we finally found that we had been pointed in exactly the opposite direction by the drivers. When we checked out we reported this to the desk, and they were very understanding and apologetic, and would address this. While the treehouses were very nice, and the property was beautiful, we would prefer something with the resort amenities more conveniently located. Our group did not have a car, so sometimes it was a challenge relying on the buses or ferry's.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: jimfromalberta
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Riverside. This time we were in a newly refurbished room (3817) in Alligator Bayou. It was a corner room with water view. I was especially impressed with the greater effort to maintain the theme in the room. We previously stayed in the mansions area. While nice, the room was simply nondescript. The resort is large. This room was relatively close to the central area of the resort and not that far from the bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: khevin
Reviews.Content: Transport to the hotel from the airport was fast and efficient, and gives you a rundown of the resort before you arrive. Check in was fast, and informative about the resort and dining plan. It is a bit of a walk to any room at the resort to the restaurants, pool, front desk, bus stop etc. Rooms are simple hotel rooms, nothing special. I would not pay extra $$ for the riverview room {which I did}. ! you are never in the room. 2. the view is not that good. We had 2 house keeping requests, and it was fast and courteous. The pool is heated and is warm enough to swim in on a February day. Nice waterslide for the kids, and a big hottub!! The ferry boat will take you to downtown Disney and the other port Orleans resort. Very fun, the kids liked it!! The bus system to the parks and other activities is easy to figure out, and picks up about every 20min. be prepared for a 30-40min trip to any park. Food in the sitdown restaurant is surprisingly good, and Huge servings! the quick service meals are good, not great. Servings are big, and choices are great, from fast food, to handmade sandwiches and salads. If you are not on a meal plan be prepared to pay 12$ per person per meal at the quick service restaurant, and 35$ per person at the sit down restaurant. All the employees were friendly and ready to serve. Grounds were typical Disney {Beautiful} Overall a nice resort, rooms nothing special, service good, food good. If a friend asked if they should stay at the resort, I would reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Reviews”
Reviews.Author: jwatrel
Reviews.Content: I was trying to find a hotel on the Disney World Resort property that was reasonable and had space available for a long holiday weekend. I read the previous reviews about the Disney Port Orleans and reviewers raved about it, so I thought to give it a try. Very average rooms and a long walk around the resort. They made several mistakes in my billing, charging me for things I never asked for and did not furnish the riverside view that I thought I reserved. When asked to correct these problems, the front desk people practically threw up their hands. Not the happiest place on earth in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Moderate Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: hotmoltenlava
Reviews.Content: For reference, I have stayed at The Polynesian and All-Star Movies Resorts. The Polynesian is awesome, if you feel like dropping a lot of cash. It has everything and more. The All-Star Resorts are what they are. Low priced and low quality. I'll never go back to All-Star. Now, as for Port Orleans Riverside, I was very pleasantly surprised. It wasn't more than a two or three hundred more for a week than All-Star and was many times better. The rooms are modern and clean. The beds are adequate, but not awesome. The grounds are very well done and meticulous. The quick service food is better than most resorts (I was addicted to the made to order pasta bar. Very good). I didn't try the sit down restaurant, as I save my credits for the really good places at the parks. The check in and out was pretty good. It is not too far of a bus ride, as opposed to All-Star, which is a nightmare. It is almost worth an extra grand to stay at The Polynesian, just for the monorail service. You learn to hate the busses, especially after several nights of over crowded buses after the parks close. I'd go back to Riverside, but tend to select resorts based on the discounts they are offering at the time. Hope this helps. It is overwhelming to choose where to stay at Disney, especially if you are new to it.

Reviews.Title: “Family vacation, starting good ended in disaster.”
Reviews.Author: mk3wolf
Reviews.Content: I was staying with my family at this resort, but looks can be deceiving. It was a great hotel to start, the people were friendly, the food was delicious until the last night we stayed there. We were at the pool, and it was just us two, my friend and I; I had left my phone and my wallet wrapped up in a towel and placed it on the chair next to my friends' belongings. We seen people who were "cleaning the bathrooms" and a man on a golf cart. Now mind you, this is 3:30 in the morning, and we just wanted to make our last night stay a good night stay..... Well it didn't turn out so great, here, I come to find that my phone and my wallet were stolen from the towel next to my friend's belongings. I had a debit card in the wallet, along with my mechanics license and a few other things. My cell phone was a motorola droid razr, which retail value of it was $700......No security camera's at the pool, and when I was talking to the security guards, the one man let it slip that this wasn't the first time. They had told me that the people I described were outside workers who were paid by Disney, but not employed by Disney. I asked for the Company's name and phone number and the woman at the desk did not want to give this information up. They didn't even care that a guest, with a group of people, spent over $4000 for a week at this resort; and one of them had they're belonging's stolen. So if you stay at this hotel, PLEASE hide your belonging's, or just leave them in your room's safe. You would think that these people would commit a crime, but they will.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, very accomadating”
Reviews.Author: Leika01
Reviews.Content: Our first time. Great room, had a newer renovated room close to the bus stop and close to everything. Room was cleaned everyday! At first thought the room was small- there was 5 of us- but it was not bad at all- we only were there to shower and sleep. Would def. be back if we do Disney again. The only thing I was not happy with was the laundry- the dryer took a very long time- this should be on the list of up-grades for the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: athome407
Reviews.Content: Loved this resort! I requested a renovated room in the Alligator Bayou section and received it. We tipped the housekeeper $5.00 per day and she left the cutest towel animals for my son! The room was spacious (even for five people). My son loved the pull-down bed. The theming was wonderful. Disney did a great job with the renovation of the rooms. The pool was great. The food was better than expected. My only complaint was the bus service could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Disney HOtel”
Reviews.Author: southplainsgroup
Reviews.Content: We love the atmosphere of Port Orleans Riverside. Our favorite rooms are the aligator bayou rooms. The relaxing atmosphere of the property does transform you to another word in your mind. There is a great deal of walking with many of the properties, but just a Disney trip in general does tend to commit you to about 5-10 miles of walking each day, so be preapred.

Reviews.Title: “Great Disney Resort for the price”
Reviews.Author: stones2125
Reviews.Content: Rooms are great with their theme. Resturants are good and pool is nice, but not quite as nice as other resorts. For the price it is worth it

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: RingetteBunny
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights of a 7 day trip but wished we had booked all 7 nights there. Resort and staff were great. Pool was great too. Booking with Disney travel is another story....I called to upgrade to a two queen bed room and was told it was $65 more. However upon arrival, we were not given the upgraded room. The staff on site fixed the problem, but there is some kind of disconnect between the systems. Beware.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT RESORT! WE WILL BE BACK!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gabriella724
Reviews.Content: We just go back from Port Orleans Riverside yesterday after staying from February 15th-21st. After reading some of the negative reviews, I was a bit hesitant about staying at Riverside, however my husband and I were pleasantly surprised. We absolutely loved Riverside. The grounds are beautiful and we were in one of the renovated rooms, which was very clean and nicely updated. As mentioned by other reviewers, the resort is LARGE and will require a lot of walking, but you're at Disneyworld and so it is to be expected. The resort is much quieter than the All Star resorts, Pop Century etc., which is a big plus for us because with a 5 year old the parks are stimulating enough and we liked the "quiet time" at the resort. The pools are large and a lot of fun for children. We also read reviews regarding the buses being late, not frequent enough etc., however we never had an issue. The buses ran smoothly and we never had to wait more than 15 minutes (both to and from the parks) and we also were there during a peak time. The buses did get very crowded on the way home and they tend to pack the people in, but the bus ride is only 15 minutes long and so it really wasn't a big deal. It is much easier to bus rather than drive to the parks. My only complaint is that there is not a closet in your room, just a rack near the sinks, but is spacious enough. My husband and 5 year old daughter had plenty of room. The dining room had your typical quick service Disney food, nothing outstanding. It is definitely worth getting the Disney Dining Plan to make everything relatively hassle-free. The ladies in the dining room were not the most friendly and moved VERY SLOWLY, but we've found this to be the attitude of many of the quick service restaurants at the Disney parks, but in my opinion you're there for the Disney experience and not the food. We had reservations at several restaurants at Epcot and they were fabulous. All in all we had a WONDERFUL experience at Riverside and we are already planning a return trip next year.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very nice, quiet and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: Luhrs02
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice experience with this resort. We had a "riverview" room, which was a very short walk from the main part of the hotel and from the main Disney bus stops. The room was average; Disney has a way of charging way more for their rooms, because we'll pay what they charge! But this resort seemed to have more activities than most. There was a campfire/marshmallow roast at 5:30pm daily, a movie shown outdoors nightly at 7pm, a pool party each afternoon with activities, etc. It was very nice to have the boat directly to Downtown Disney. The quick-service food was good, no complaints there. We were there for 7 nights, had a great time overall.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I remember”
Reviews.Author: EvilAsh14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans Riverside in 2007, and I recall being underwhelmed.
