So when my parents suggested staying there for two days as a stopover before our Caribbean cruise, I reluctantly agreed. I don't know how my memory could be so distorted. The grounds of this resort are some of the most beautiful of any Disney lodging. It is wonderfully relaxing to simply stroll from your room to the main building alongside the lazy river. The pool is outstanding (even though we didn't use it). The gift shop is one of the largest and well-stocked resort shop I've yet visited. The River Roost bar was hoppin' every night. The quick service restaurant had a decent variety of food. There is hair wrapping, a horse-drawn carriage ride, a playground for kids, and boat service to Downtown Disney. If I have to quibble, I will only say that I think the bed linens are extremely uncomfortable (stiif sheets and pillows; scratchy horse blanket quilts) and the bus service is a bit sluggish and ALWAYS crowded. But in short, if you must stay or choose to stay at a Moderate Disney resort, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not much to brag about but good basic place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: travelmom519
Reviews.Content: This is my first time in a moderate resort at Disney World and I was pleased with the price, the staff was nice, but the surroundings were very basic. Granted, I am used to staying at the Wilderness Lodge so I guess my expectations were a little high although this time our budget was not. We had an upgraded room with two queens and a bathroom separated from the sinks by a door which came in very handy having 2 adults and 2 teens in the same room. Two could primp (two sinks and mirrors) while the other was taking a shower. Made getting ready in morning easier. The best thing about the resort was it was very quiet. The worst thing was the restocking of the soda/coffee island in the eatery. By the early evening all the lemonade was just water and in the morning the coffee was very watered down. This happened all through the week. Rooms were clean and the extras really catered to little ones but for teens it was, as my 17 year old stated "boring". Because of this we just used the place to sleep. The "mansions" all looked alike and the pool was just a big pool, nothing special. The grounds are pretty and there is a boat that takes you to Downtown Disney which was nice. The bus route seemed to take forever to get to one place or another. Again, I am used to staying at hotels closer to the action. I did not like the entertainment in the piano bar. Everyone there seemed liked they were having a blast but it just wasn't my cup of tea. I found the piano player to be a bit screechy and doing the conga line well... So in a nut shell: The Good: Price, it's quiet, separation in bathroom, scenery, staff The Bad: Boring for teens, far from attractions with long bus rides, no wow factor to resort. If you want a really memorable place especially for teens, save up and stay at the Beach Club or Yacht Club. They are right on the boardwalk and walking distance to Epcot, mini golf, great pools, even a beach. My teens were very envious of the place. Mind you, we saved 3 thousand dollars by staying at the Riverside and with college looming ahead of us, we did what our budget could afford but would have loved to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite Disney property, but it is still far and away better than off-property”
Reviews.Author: jonnylbluejeans
Reviews.Content: Good- My family of 6 (including 2 babies) stayed in one room. This REALLY kept the cost down. This was, however our ONLY reason for considering this property. Usually we choose the Disney Carribbean Beach resort in value season, because the free Disney Dining Plan is usually offered in the spring of each year. Our family has grown, and would need a suite or two rooms elsewhere. Bad- Even without 6 people in our party, the room was small. It was super clean and Disney-fied, but small. Ugly- OK, here is where the only *Real* comlaints lay. In the, 33yr span in which I've been going to WDW, I can remember only a handful of negative memories (with 3 or 4 being horrible). As it happens to be, half of the negative (and horrible) times have been spent eating at the Riverside resort. The first horrible experience that I ever experience that we had was dinner service at Boatwright's Dining Hall. The service was horrid and the food was so-so. The other negative times at the resort involved the food court. Now, I understand, food courts are not expected to be quiet peaceful places. This one however, I think can be blamed on layout... you'll see. It's crazy and subdivided, enjoy taking a stroller in there btw, and don't even think about a double. it was insane. Seemingly over-busy and crazy. By contrast, the CBR has a fantastic food court (for what it is) and while busy, not overly... nuts. OH...and... if you wanted to find the single most distant place from anywhere in the park (incl your room) try this food court. The walk may not seem far walking from your car in the main bldg parking lot...through the drop-off area to the lobby, but keep going. Through the back side of the lobby to the back hall? Keep going. You're almost to Boatwright's. Keep going. If you reach the black hole of Disney existence, you went a *little* too far, it's just before that. Oh, and when you're done... you going back the same way. Got kids? Enjoy doing that more than once. All in all, I'd still stay there over an outside property, but please for the love of God...your family, and your sanity, eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, scenic, and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Pitaresq
Reviews.Content: POR is the best moderate Disney resort. The location is very convenient to the parks and to Downtown Disney. Guests can walk or ride the boat to POFQ, which is a relaxing activity. Food options are good, and the Cotton Mill is one of the most scenic resort dining areas available. The only problem is the distance to the front if you het put in the back at the aligator bayou. There are bus stops in the back, though. Swimming areas are relaxing an d very enjoyable. Also, there is a marina, fishing, and carriage rides available. Try for the mansions over the bayou. Don't pass it up if you can get it for $140 or under.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite moderately-priced Disney resort”
Reviews.Author: Lricecsp
Reviews.Content: I love the quiet atmosphere at Port Orleans Riverside. After all the frantic activity in the theme parks, it's great to come "home" to a quiet spot that's beautifully landscaped. Added bonus: free boat ride to Downtown Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds”
Reviews.Author: ssalcorn
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely a beautiful resort! It was quite large and lots of really nice places to take a quiet stroll. The lobby and main pool were also very nice. The secondary smaller pools did remind me of typical hotel pools. The rooms were pretty in-line with a Disney moderate resort. Not super nice but gave us a place sleep. The main dining area was really the only disappointment with the resort. It was a large self-serve type cafeteria and really not our style. A definite plus is the ferry to Downtown Disney. Very convenient. Tip: the re-fillable coffee cup was really the way to go for us. Could re-fill with coffee and pop for free the entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: dharri1
Reviews.Content: We last stayed at this hotel in 2005 and had a fantastic trip and nothing much as changed - which is a good thing. We stayed in a joining rooms as there were 7 of us and we were in two of the "older rooms" which was fine with us. The rooms and beds in particular were very comfortable a few minutes walk from the restaurant/shop/south depot etc and was such a peaceful location. The bus service to all the parks worked excellently - buses were frequent and we never had to wait for another bus. I think this was mainly due to using the south depot as sometimes when the bus was full we went straight to a park with no stops and in other quieter times we went to the other 3 bus stops on Riverside. Our only issue on the whole stay was the lack of clear communication from the receptionist at our initial check in. She pointed us to the further bridge rather than the nearer one and ended up giving us an extra 20 minute walk with 7 suitcases after our flight! Plus she could have suggested the bell service dropped our bags for us rather than take then ourselves as we had 3 children with us. Apart from that the Disney Cast were fantastic and our party had an awesome holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great renovations!”
Reviews.Author: jem621
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a newly renovated room in Magnolia section... Room was beautiful! 2 queen beds were very comfy! Our meal at Boatwrights was excellent and the quick serve meals were also tasty. Loved the large arcade as well. This hotel was a great addition to another wonderful Disney vacation. Another great feature was being able to use the pools at both Riverside and the French Quarter!

Reviews.Title: “great deal”
Reviews.Author: Denise S
Reviews.Content: Our family chose this hotel for our recent vacation as it was in our budget and we had stayed here in the past and enjoyed our stay. The only thing really dissapointing about the resort was the state of the rooms in Alligator Bayou. They really need an upgrade as the beds are very uncofortable and lighting, bedding, etc is very rundown. That being said you can't beat the value at this resort and the staff really go the extra Disney mile to make your stay enjoyable. We were travelling with 5 children 10 and under and we were placed close to the bus stop to minimize their walk each morning and evening. Expect quite a long bus ride to the parks but at Disney World that is to be expected as it is a HUGE area. The food in the food court was delish and very good value as we had the free dining plan disney was offering when we booked. One tip for those on the plan we learned was you could substitue a salad for a dessert for your dinner quick service meal. Pools were fantastic and warm for the kids to play in

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cathy W
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Riverside. It is a beautiful hotel inside and out. The rooms are clean - although I would love to see the newly renovated rooms! The food in the food court area was great with lots to chose from. Thanks to Lynda Hower from Dream Makers Vacation Services for the recommendation! We will be sure to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Greenskeeper19
Reviews.Content: This moderate resort is beautiful and has everything that you would want or need while in Disney. We stayed in one of the mansions (Panterre) and it was very conveniently located to the lobby, marina, the restaurants and most important, one of the bus stops (I think there are 3 total). The room was not one of the refurbished rooms and desperately needs it. The new rooms have 2 queen beds plus a murphy bed, our room had 2 double beds and no murphy or trundle bed, the bathroom is tiny and looks old. The good news is that we spent almost no time in the room so it didn't matter, maybe next time we will request a newer room. Watched the superbowl at the River Roost and had a great time with other families also from the Boston area even though the Patriots lost. Would definately stay at this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Its a good idea they are renovating this resort”
Reviews.Author: honeybunnyandhubcap
Reviews.Content: First, the resort is beautiful and will maintained. After 20+ years of going to WDW this was our first stay in a WDW resort and it was great. The airport pickup and return cancels the need for a car rental. The overall resort is spotless, I don't know how they do it. They are in the process of renovating all their rooms, but we were given an upgrade to a river view room instead of a renovated one. Still the room was very nice, but the bathtub had some mold around the edges. A little bleach would have solved that. They rest of the room was still nice given the age and their reason to revovate. Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “A Southern Charm”
Reviews.Author: McGoy
Reviews.Content: Disney captures the feel and charm of New Orleans with beautiful design and ambience. The Sassagula Riverway to Downtown Disney was a calm ride after a long day. Knowledgable staff and ease of access to parks. I would recommend a stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nateyates
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend here and thought it was a wonderful place to stay. We brought our 2-year old to Disney and were very happy with our lodging choice. The hotel staff were great, responding quickly to anything we needed (called to make sure a port-a-crib was going to be delivered and it was there almost immediately; forgot a toothbrush, called the front desk, and within minutes one was delivered). The room was comfortable, check-in went smoothly, and we had no problems. The grounds were absolutely beautiful. The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is that we spent so much time at the parks that we didn't do much at the hotel so I can't comment on much else there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and pretty hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jaybuff
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in the summer of 2009. I thought that the room was nice and the grounds were well maintained. It doesnt seem to be a top choice for tourists travelling to Disney for some reason. Therefore it is usually a bit quieter then the other resorts. They had hot tubs for the adults which was nice as well as a kid-friendly swimming pool. I would rate this hotel a 3 (average) if it was anywhere else, but being that it is so close to the Disney parks it really makes this a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: Verbelly
Reviews.Content: We reserved our room online, we reserved a "garden view room with queen beds" because we are a family of three adults and double beds are just too small for a comfortable night's sleep. In fact a few years ago we had booked this same resort only to change our reservation to another resort when we found out about the double beds which is all they had back then. I read about the renovation and that they were gradually converting to all queen size beds, so I thought now was the time to go! I was very careful about what I reserved. So what happens? They put us in an unrenovated alligator bayou room with...double beds. But it only took one phone call to get us into a completely renovated queen bedded room in Acadian House. (so why did't they put us there in the first place?) All problems ended there however. We had a totally enjoyable four night stay there. The boat to downtown Disney is a great plus. Our greatest pleasure was walking along the beautiful river It was quiet there despite several large high school age tour groups.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, nice refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: lilibee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Port Orleans, Riverside the last weekend in January. We arrived at 11am and were immediately given access to our refurbished room. The refurbishment that Riverside is currently undertaking is fantastic. We had a great time finding hidden mickeys in the room, which was spacious and comfortable. The bathroom, in particular, looked sharp with the great subway tile used in the shower. Our room was located in Magnolia Terrace which was a great location for both the pool, lobby and East bus depot. We had a ground level room which was on a corner (2 windows!!). Room number 8582. Would definitely recommend. Everyone working at Riverside went above and beyond to make our stay magical. We ate at Riverside one of the nights of our stay and it was amazing. Wendy was our waitress and she was helpful, prompt and responsive. Our drinks were always refilled and she took a mid meal change of order without blinking. The barbeque pork chop was outstanding! The buses were prompt and it took no longer than 30 minutes from arriving at the bus stops to getting to any of the parks. We also took advantage of the downtown disney river boat which was convenient but could be cold coming back at night across the open waters. Having stayed at Deluxe resorts (Grand Floridian, Wilderness Lodge) - I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Riverside over deluxe accomodation. The value (in my opinion) is so much greater.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, lovely resort”
Reviews.Author: annar76
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Magnolia Manor in a refurbed room.....close to a bus stop. Absolutely peaceful and quiet. Pool adjacent to this bldg. Not too far to get to the dining area - shopping, etc. We have stayed in value, moderate and deluxe Disney resorts....this is one of our favorite resorts. LOVE the boat ride to Downtown Disney. So many fun things to do at Riverside. We just don't ever have enough time to do all that we want to do. (This was our 2nd time at Riverside. Have stayed at French Quarter 5 times. We just love both of them!!)

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Little Secret :)”
Reviews.Author: KSEMunch
Reviews.Content: First off, this is a very late review (my family and I stayed here last Easter). This resort seems to be the one moderate resort that everyone overlooks. Well, my girls and I don't even look at other options after our last stay - this resort is fantastic!! When we arrived we were checked in by very friendly staff. When I made my reservations I had requested adjoining rooms (my mom came with us) in one of the mansions. When we arrived we noticed we had adjoining rooms but in one of the Bayou buildings. We asked (NICELY - that's the ticket people!) and were moved into Parterre Place without issue. The Room: clean and comfortable, everything worked and great housekeeping with towel animals for my girls (note: we tipped every day - you get what you pay for!). Only two complaints - double beds made for close quarters sleeping (that said we slept well). The other is there was no wifi which seemed odd considering this is a resort in Disneyworld! On our next stay I might consider the extra few bucks for a Royal Room for the queen beds. We had a view of the parking lot which didn't bother us because we only went to the room to sleep and change. That said, it was the prettiest parking lot I've seen LOL. Food: We only used the buffet for breakfasts and the odd supper. The menu didn't change much but the food was good, hot, and enough selection to keep my girls, my mom, and me happy. No complaints - if you want five star food that changes dramatically everyday at a buffet, this isn't the resort for you (and I'm not sure what resort would be for you). For the rest of our meals we ate in the parks. ** If you are planning a trip and thinking about getting a meal plan I highly recommend the Deluxe Dining Plan (3 meals + 2 snacks per person per day). This pretty much gave us the freedom to eat wherever we wanted and eat whatever we wanted, including dinner at Cinderella's castle! It's not cheap but I didn't have to carry gobs of cash - made our lives very easy and I'll definitely have it on my next trip! Pools: the main pool on the island is usually pretty crowded and busy. My girls went a couple times but weren't real thrilled by it - they didn't dislike it they just didn't find it worth the walk. The pool right next to Parterre Place was usually empty and became the pool of choice. Extras: I highly recommend renting one of the little two person "speed" boats (they don't go fast LOL). An hour is around 50 dollars and you can zip down to Downtown Disney, circle the bay and back in that time. Great way to spend an afternoon! Also, an evening horse drawn carriage ride is a big hit for my girls and it was pretty cheap too - just make sure you make a reservation, they book up fast! The grounds are amazing!! It was really a treat to take such a beautiful stroll first thing in the morning to go to breakfast. Even coming home at night with two bagged kids and a grandma was made better by such a nice walk. Bus service was fantastic!! Never waited more than 15 minutes for a bus and they are all pretty much direct runs to whatever park you are going to. Yes, you might circle your resort for other stops but it's a bus, not a taxi. They were always clean and comfortable. Yes, I stood probably half of the time but I believe in letting women and children sit first (I wish most men thought this way, kind of embarassing but that's another rant) and it wasn't a hassle. The drivers were very polite and didn't drive like maniacs which made standing fine. Overall, my satisfaction with this resort has meant we will be making a reservation here for Easter 2013. Yes, you can find cheaper but for what you get, the dining plan, the transportation, the early entrance hours, it's all worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: anemales
Reviews.Content: First let me start off by saying this is our 5th trip to WDW in the last 7 years. Our first in 2004 was at the Polynesian and the next 3 were at the Animal Kindom Lodge Jambo House (2006, 2008 & 2009.) I have written reviews for both deluxe hotels of which we loved both. Since we wanted to mix it up and save a little money at the same time, we looked into this hotel (POR.) After looking at some photos of a trundle bed before we booked the hotel, I was a bit skeptical but we still gave it a shot anyway. Let me just say the grounds are just beautiful. We had a room in the Alligator Bayou in Building 28. There were 5 of us on this trip (2 adults with a 17, 16 & 12 yr old) thus we needed a room with a trundle bed. Although the bed feels like your sleeping on the floor, my daughter didn't mind sleeping on it every night even though she didn't have to. The room was clean, quite and exactly what we expected. There were two nearby small pools which was very welcomed considering it was 90 degrees for about 23 hours a day. We rented a Pontoon boat one day and took it to Downtown Disney in which we all loved it. We were all satisfied with the food court and it's menu. One drawback is the large layout of the hotel. It could be a bit of a hike to your room after a long day at the parks and confusing at nights in the dark. Also, there are 4 bus stops and buses can get crowded at times. Another drawback is the lack of a decent restaurant. The one sit down restaurant there was poor at best which explains why it was always empty. Overall we loved our stay there at the POR Resort and wouldn't hesitate in staying there again. In fact we are planning to go again in December 2012 and this resort along with AKL are our two places of preferrence. I hope this info was helpful. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “First Stay - But will return.”
Reviews.Author: JoeRoulstone
Reviews.Content: Clean, safe, comfortable accommodations. Friendly helpful staff We would highly recommend this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: deegog
Reviews.Content: Disney amazing place first of all! As in all holidays hotel just as important and Port Orleans Riverside will not let you down found it all it should be clean, friendly service, good sized rooms, location perfect and plenty things to do in hotel grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Lost some of it's Sparkle”
Reviews.Author: Valleyresident
Reviews.Content: Our room in the Aligator Bayou was only average. If it was anywhere else, i.e. without all the wonderful Disney nearby facilities, we would probably have complained. The lady who checked us in said they were in the process of renovating the rooms, but had not reached the part she was checking us in to. The room was a bit tatty with plugs loose and slightly shabby furnishings. We've stayed in many other Disney hotels, normally deluxe, but we wanted to revisit this hotel 20 years later for sentimental reasons, however, we found it quite disappointing on this occasion. I don't know why it is that anything less than the superior rooms at Disney hotels have such poor soundproofing. We hate hearing other guests in their bathrooms. The surrounding areas though are still very nice, and it's great to be able to take a boat to Downtown Disney. Sadly, we felt it was a lot of money (New Year period) for a poor return. The reception staff in the table service restaurant were a bit superior, although I'm not sure why they felt they were. Fortunately the staff in the fast food area were lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Such an awesome complement to a hectic Disney vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca S
Reviews.Content: I will be hard pressed to ever stay anywhere else. I loved it. We did a week at Disney and my husband booked us for a real pacer of a time and coming home here every night was so worthy. Moreover, the free parking and the Extra Magic Hours are so worth it. We stayed in Alligator Bayou, right after it was renovated and it was so nifty. For a family, it is a perfect room and there's a ton of privacy with all the trees and the overall layout. We went at Christmastime and the tree in the main lodge is awesome. We ate at the Mill one day and it was nice. We sadly did not get to partake enough of the activities so next time, we are totally booking a day just to enjoy the resort. Also, the boat ride from there to Downtown Disney is so cool and idyllic and my kids even loved it. For a moderate resort, it is definitely the one to do.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Gypsy617
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in early December and it was great, not to crowded and still enough people around to kill any loneliness. We were able to get check-in early which was a plus since it was 11am. I had read a tip about requesting the renovated rooms prior to your trip and I did this, we did indeed get a newly renovated room in the magnolia area and it really wasnâ€™t that far from the main area. The room was great and the location was quiet, I was able to get up in the morning and walk to the main dining area and get coffee, it was a nice little walk. The dÃ©cor in the room was really cute and still elegant for an adult. The resort was very accommodating with our early arrival and we even bought so much souvenirs that they helped us organize it to be shipped back to our home, they provided us with a box and tape and packing materials. The front desk gave us a label and it was picked up and delivered back to our home, all with a smile. We ate at the Boatwrightâ€™s dining hall and the food was very good. Overall I loved it and I would go back again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: mbniedermier
Reviews.Content: We loved this resort. It felt like we had escaped our everyday lives. The trees, tropical plants, and resort feel made this an enjoyable stay. We stayed in the Acadian House room and loved the southern plantation feel on the hotel. Our girls especially liked the pool and the pool party games in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Our Disneyworld Adventure”
Reviews.Author: mauitikitikitribe
Reviews.Content: An absolutely perfect resort for our family. We stayed in building 85 and it was so nice. The grounds were amazing and the pool areas are all great. It truly was a great spot for our family to go to. We would definately stay there again in a second :-) A wonderul trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Moderate Budget”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth W
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this hotel and we really liked it. We had always stayed in the deluxe hotels, but wanted to see what a moderate hotel was like. We were impressed with the quality of the hotel. The property was spread out and you need to be prepared to walk, but that was no trouble for us. This hotel isn't the quality of the deluxe hotels, but was far from disappointing. The atmosphere was beautiful and the room was nice and clean. It was worth the money for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Best family holiday!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Samantha1238
Reviews.Content: Adored everything about being here. If you have kids prepare to make some very special memories, excellent hotel, excellent location, rooms snug but great, hotel set in amazing grounds and the pools are great, the Disney transport in fantatic and we had an amazing time!!!!! Definatly would go back ;)

Reviews.Title: “Should visit for vacation sometime”
Reviews.Author: DallasKJG
Reviews.Content: Every time I stay here, it's because I'm at a conference and the main hotels are being reserved for customers. So, I have a pretty negative attitude going in - it's very inconvenient for business travelers. While the building layout is very pretty (it's basically an apartment complex, not a single hotel building), you will be doing some walking if you don't have a car. My assumption is that as in a motel, you would check in once, and then park near your room. At the conference, the buses for the Swan and Dolphin left from the main building, so you had to add that walking time into your schedule. The rooms are fine - I had two double beds (are there no king beds available?), and the room was a reasonable size, especially for one. The table was near the (dead) wired Internet connection, but I was using Wi-Fi. There was a small flat-screen TV, but I never used it. The pillows were a bit squishy for my taste. The rooms feel old, not in the "Mark Twain on the river" sense, but just like it was built a while ago, and never updated. I know it's part of the motif, but modernization can be a good thing. I did appreciate (but didn't need) the ceiling fan - it's one of the first hotel rooms with a ceiling fan. It reminds me of a basic motel - they're not to the level I expect from business travel, but they are adequate. The Wi-Fi connections can be spotty, which is an issue if you need connectivity. The wired connection in my room was dead. Also, my room did not have a safe, so I took my laptop with me a lot - some of my colleagues mentioned they had safes. I did have a mini-fridge (would prefer a mini-bar.) This was the first trip where I used the free water taxis, and they are a very useful way to get around the resort areas - you do have to make connections from time to time, but those are relatively quick. You will find there are some areas where it is actually faster to walk than use the taxi service (in Downtown Disney, we walked to our restaurant rather than waiting for the next water taxi to go to the next stop - a ten-minute boat ride was replaced by a five-minute walk. You will find some distances are magnified greatly when you have to drive or use the water taxi, because the roads are not in a straight line.) I didn't use the regular bus service, since the conference had its own buses. I have never tried the "real" restaurant, but the quick service cafe (pizza, sandwiches, desserts) is fine. The $15 unlimited refills mug can be worth the money if you remember to carry it with you, or don't mind going to your room to collect it before meals. I would see people with handfuls of mugs heading into the cafe in the morning, probably for coffee. The food seems a bit pricey, but it is convenient, and it is open relatively late (I think it was open until 11pm.) I'm not sure if there is any food delivery to the rooms - I did have a brochure left on my table for a non-Disney pizza delivery one day, so I'm assuming not. The bar is very quiet on nights the piano player is not performing. When he is there, don't plan to have any quiet conversations! If you are into sing-alongs, it is a lot of fun. If you are trying to have a quiet drink, it's not the best place, but it is the only bar I've found on the property. The business conference mindset is completely different from the vacation mindset, so that may be part of my issues. However, I do think it could be a bit more business-friendly without compromising the vacation flavor.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans Resort”
Reviews.Author: Walter D
Reviews.Content: I have been staying in Port Orleans Riverside in the last 15 years, since it was named Dixie Landings. It is my favorite in Disney Properties, and I think I know almost all the Disney Hotels in Orlando. Great cost x benefit, peaceful place filled with astonishing views.

Reviews.Title: “Can't get enough of POR!”
Reviews.Author: lizzyshakuntala
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in POR or in any Disney property in Orlando. Per request we got a corner room, which has two windows, in building 28 in the Alligator Bayou part of the resort that's not too far from either the dining hall or the west depot bust stop. At first I really wished we would get a room in one of the Magnolia Bend buildings as they look quaint and more 'feminine' than those in the Alligator Bayou area. But all I needed was a first look into our room (and where it's located) and my mind was completely changed. For whatever reason, it turns out I love the Alligator Bayou's 'mysterious' yet charming landscape way more than the picture perfect Magnolia Bend. The entire resort ground is absolutely pretty, the food is nothing like a high end restaurant meal but it's great for what it is, there are ample recreation options for everyone in the family and, of course, there's that Disney magic you can't get elsewhere outside of WDW. POR will be our first choice the next time we're staying in a Disney property. And getting a room in Alligator Bayou wouldn't hurt either.

Reviews.Title: “out of this world”
Reviews.Author: mary186460
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in Port Orleans,we love it there.The grounds are beautiful,clean and well kept.The rooms are a little dark but you're hardly in there.Very comfortable beds and pillows.The boat to Downtown is an added bonus,used the bus one night but went back to using the boat ,much nicer.The food in the dining hall not quite to our taste but not a problem for us.Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Magical Week at Disney”
Reviews.Author: Wejoy
Reviews.Content: My son and I went to Walt Disney World for 5 nights and stayed at Port Orleans. We loved the resort. Our room was close to busing, (which they have several stops at Port Orleans), the room was a nice size with 2 queen beds and it was also very quiet at night. There was a pool by are room that we went to a few times, not as busy as the main one. The front desk was great, very friendly. Over all we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great on-site property for a WDW visit”
Reviews.Author: LBOskiBear
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at Port Orleans - Riverside. Last time I was in Magnolia Terrace, this time in Alligator Bayou. The property is very comfortable and has all the usual amenities of a Disney moderate resort. The pool area is great and the on-site dining option is also well-situated. Food options are good and reasonably priced for Disney. I really have nothing to complain about other than not being a big fan of places with open walkways. That's just part of the design of the place and it's a known quantity when booking. For the price I paid, there's really no better deal out there.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans”
Reviews.Author: lsomm
Reviews.Content: This was the third time we have stayed at Disney's Port Orleans Riverside. We love how quiet it is. We love the trundle bed and the fridge that comes with the room. The only issue we had this time (Christmas 2011) was the maid service was very bad. We enjoyed the jet ski boats and the four person bicycles :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: RykersGrandma
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1/20/12 thru 1/22/12. We were given a room in the newly remodeled section near the main pool / hot tub and close to the food court. The remodeled rooms have 2 queen beds now which is way better then 2 full. The room was very nicely decorated and extremely clean. The resort is nicely landscaped and the walkway by the waterway is beautiful! The food court is small but the selections were ample and the food was very good. We will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great because its Disney, but.....”
Reviews.Author: Frank S
Reviews.Content: You can not go wrong with a Disney owned property, they are all landscaped beautifuly, have terriffic pools and are all very clean. My but is.... I feel customer service is dipping, some at the front desk seemed a bit indiffferent to excited tourists, we also asked for bed rails 2 days in a row and never recieved them. Small beans, but when you look at what you pay to stay here, you could easily find 5 hotels for less money that are nicer right outside of disney, and if your driving or renting a car, what difference does it make? Honestly riding the buses, which you will have to do from here, is quite painful, especially with kids. The buses are crowded, slow and make many stops. In my opinion there is little reason to stay at a Disney Moderate Resort, save your money and go Deluxe where you can walk or monorail into the parks. If thats too expensive I think you will have nice a time if not better off property for a whole lot less money. However, you will not have a bad time here, check out Bob the piano player in the bar!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Time”
Reviews.Author: Lyssa15
Reviews.Content: Great service, clean rooms, fantastic stay. Absolutely no problems. Extremely helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you get a renovated room!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LThia25
Reviews.Content: Well when we first arrived everything seemed really nice...lobby is nicely decorated and clean...line was quick for check-in...we used online check in so it was very fast...almost too fast though because we had some unanswered questions and the man helping us didn't seem to want to let us ask them which is very odd for Disney workers not to answer everything...then he sent us off to our room in the wrong direction which would have been fine if we weren't lugging all our suitcases with us. When we got to our room I was a bit disappointed...it was very bland and old feeling...it was also kind of dirty...there was a thick layer of dust on shelf as if no one had been in the room for months! I let it be and just went on with our day but as the day went on I realized how unhappy I was with our room it was actually interferring in my day...Disney is supposed to make you super happy not super depressed...We stayed in the room for 1 night and the next morning my husband went to the front desk to ask if we could be moved...For $100 they changed our room...I don't think he really told them how we felt about the room cause otherwise I don't see how they would have charged us to move but being how depressed I felt in that room I didn't care about the money! Once we got into the new room and it was decorated with a pretty green color on the walls, a fancy headboard, and pictures hanging I felt so much better! I then realized that the first room was never renovated and they were trying to see who would just stay and deal with it and not complain! That upset me to know they were doing that....they should have said something about not all rooms being updated or something when we booked or when we checked in. After that was all over with we finally began to enjoy our trip! The grounds of the hotel are beautiful and green, the river runs through the middle and you can catch a boat to Downtown Disney which was really cool! We did that one night when we were going over to Fulton's Crab House for dinner, which is definintely worth going to! The bus system was a little disappointing around the hotel but we did use it some of the time. But we also took a lot of cabs because it could take and hour or more sometimes to get to where we were going. I don't think it's really worth renting a car but taking a cab for $10-15 at night to get back in 15 minutes from where ever we were was well worth it instead of taking the trek on the buses! Also they really need a system to get to other hotels from your hotel...Unless a hotel is on the same bus line as yours you can not get there with out an hour or two of travel time...you have to go to a park then get a bus or monorail or boat to whatever hotel you are going to...and if you don't have a park hopper pass and need to walk through a park to get to transporation this all can be a big hassel! Our family was staying at the Yacht Club Resort and it was super annoying trying to get over to them without a taxi! I learned for next time to check that before booking! I do want to compliment 2 wonderful people at the concierge ....I wish I knew their names because they made our last day a very happy one...they were super sweet! I was so afraid to go down there cause the girl that was there the night before was so nasty to me but they made me forget how mean she was cause they were so delightful! I wish I had talked to them in the beginning of the trip...when I told her what I needed and said I'm not sure if you can do this...her answer was "Of course I can help you! This is Disney...everything is easy!" It was wonderful! All in all I would stay at this resort again since I have the knowledge of what to expect and I know to ask for a renovated room! It's much better and closer to everything then staying all the way at the all stars. We enjoyed our stay and all the parks were so great! This is a reasonable price for what you are getting...oh and the pool was heated and also had a hot tub open late which was great after a long day of walking!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mjczoey
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in Dec for my almost three year old's first Disney trip. We stayed at Magnolia Terrace. We also upgraded to King bed. The room was nice, decent size, and especially liked the refrigerator in the room. There was TV, but not too great selection of channels. Internet cost extra so never used it. They came and tidy up the room everyday, but don't change the linens. This building was close to the main swimming pool which we used it only couple time due to it being slightly chilly (it was december), but my husband and daughter did enjoy it. We also took advantage of the movies that have for the kids at night (free), the bicycle rides around the ground ($), and arcade. But mostly, we usually came back to hotel exhausted and had a nice night sleep. The ferry boat was great. We took it multiple times to go to downtown disney. The bus-ride to the parks were tolerable. Not having car made us feel trapped but that probably would have happened at other resorts. We had quick dinning plan. The cafeteria was ok. I think the food was waay over-salted, I feel bloated immediately after I ate. And the idea of having same choice everynight drove me little nuts, so what we ended up doing was after the park, we would go to downtown disney where there are many different options for food, then just take the ferry boat back to the resort which was so much better that if we had to take the bus home.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite resort - even without kids!!”
Reviews.Author: tippynkc2002
Reviews.Content: Now that our kids are grown and gone, we decided to go to Disney World as a couple. We chose Riverside due to the gorgeous photos of the resort. Once we got there, we were shocked at the peaceful environment and the calming surroundings. Despite all the other families there with kids everywhere, we were able to spend time together without being disturbed by anyone. You can do as much as you want or as little as want. This resort is in the perfect location with a variety of transportation options. We love it. We've gone back several more times since and it has quickly become our favorite spot for a full getaway.

Reviews.Title: “You Can Not Go Wrong Here”
Reviews.Author: KershKomments
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this resort a few a years ago, and other WDW Resorts three times before that. Without question, this beautifully maintained property is one of the best values you will find at WDW. I just have to laugh any anyone giving this gorgeous property a negative review. After our six day stay in early December 2011, my entire family was in love with this hotel and couldnâ€™t wait to return. Yes, the rooms are a little small, but my family of 5 did quite well. This is one of the few Disney properties that will allow 5 per room, with one child needing to sleep in the trundle bed. This sure beats paying hundreds of dollars for an extra room. And besides, if youâ€™re spending most of your vacation in a hotel room, you may be missing out on a lot of Disney fun. I have to say that in my experience of staying at WDW properties (five in the last ten years), you do not here a peep from other guests. You would almost think you are the only family staying at a given property it is so quiet. The grounds are simply gorgeous and immaculate. Disney still keeps all of itâ€™s parks and properties spotless. Every trash can looked like it is brand new. And in todayâ€™s economy, you might excuse Disney for needing to cut back on keeping everything spotless, but to their credit, their attention to detail concerning cleanliness has not wavered. We were fortunate to have the Disney Dining plan included (at no additional charge) with our package. So, if you can get Disney to include this to your package, for your entire stay you will not have to look at how much any meal costs, and you will eat like kings. The plan was a little confusing to both myself and many of the cast members at times, but is so worth it.. The food court at POR was terrific, and if you canâ€™t find anything you like, shame on you. We ate either lunch or dinner perhaps five times at the POR food court and found a nice variety. The place is packed about an hour before the parks open, so make sure to get up early enough to either grab a quick muffin or breakfast, in time to arrive at the parks well before â€œrope dropâ€�. You donâ€™t want to rush thru your park experiences, but every minute is precious and you donâ€™t want to sleep in and miss out on any of the parks rides or attractions. It was sunny and in the upper 70s during our stay, and 40 degrees back home. We wanted to enjoy every possible moment of â€œsummerâ€�. We were not big fans of the sit-down restaurant, Boatwrights. The food was average, salty and the service was uneven, at best. The waitress brought my wife the wrong entrÃ©e, and didnâ€™t clear any of the used dishes. She can call us â€œSweetyâ€� all she wants, but Iâ€™d rather she cut out the fake hospitality and get our orders correct. The meal would have cost close to $90 without the dining plan, but was, of course, included with our plan. Iâ€™d be really upset if I had to pay that kind of money for that dining experience. But when itâ€™s â€œfreeâ€�, you just move on and learn from it. The main pool area was amazing, with a very nice slide for the kiddies. Iâ€™m sure our kids could have spent all day, every day, in the pool. They also have at least three lifeguards intently watching the kids in the pool area. Very comforting, to say the least. Be sure to take the boat ride to the downtown Disney area. This is an attraction unto itself that other properties do not offer. Iâ€™m a rather demanding traveler, but can not say enough about our WDW vacation, with POR being a big part of it. I challenge any POR reviewer to say with a straight face that this property is not magical. Yes, Iâ€™m sure an occasional reservation is confused, and, incredibly, you may find a microscopic hair on the floor, but all and all, POR will guarantee your WDW vacation to be truly amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Time to update”
Reviews.Author: Elizabethpt
Reviews.Content: I was at this resort from 1/5-1/8 for the Disney Marathon. The rooms are clean I will say that. I get the whole riverside theme deal they have going - but the bedspreads are ancient!! Also the main cafeteria style restaurant has maybe the worst coffee I have ever tasted. For the rediculous prices they charge for food - the quality should be a bit better tan it is. Also - we booked connecting rooms in a preferred building and guess what - when we checked in - none were available. They will NOT guarantee connecting rooms unless you are traveling with a minor- thanks for letting us know. This extended check in to 40 min. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this nightmare!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bixwafer
Reviews.Content: Our stay was from Black Friday until the following Friday. This was our sixth vist to Disney. We always stay in a deluxe hotel, but being so close to Christmas, we tried to save some money. I would have had a better stay in a NYC jail. The room is very small to accommodate 5 people. Disney should be ashamed of themselves. My son slept on a pull out bed that we were told it was like a futon. It turned out to be a dog bed that pulled out from under one of the queen beds. The bed was 1" off of the floor. But that's a minor reason to stay away. The kicker was we had items stolen from our room. Disney did nothing about it and basically told us it was our fault for leaving our personal property in our locked room. You would be better off staying across the street at the Best Friends Pet Center.

Reviews.Title: “Disney is magical!”
Reviews.Author: Kaz759
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive everything is taken care of. The magical express picks you up at the airport and takes you straight to the resort. The amenities are great for couples aswell as families and it is easy to get to all the Disney parks. Food and beverage packages are available. The atmosphere is magical which is just how a holiday should be!

Reviews.Title: “It was worth staying at Disney”
Reviews.Author: Terry9
Reviews.Content: I made two reservations for a 5 night stay beginning New Year's Eve to take advantage of a great deal the last three nights. At $269 a night, the room we had (unrenovated) didn't feel like a good deal. With the other three nights at $111, it did feel like a good deal. Even though the room wasn't renovated, it wasn't too bad, just a bit worn. We could have moved to a renovated room after the first night, but the location of our room was really convenient to everything, so we stayed where we were. The grounds are very nice. We only used the main pool once (before it got record-breaking cold). Our kids really enjoyed it and there were a lot of activities going on (music and games) that afternoon. We ate at the Riverside Mill several times. It was easy to grab breakfast from the bakery there the night before to get an early start in the mornings. The pasta bar was a great deal as each serving easily served two of us for $11. The pizza was good, too. Check in was a bit rough. We came in late, but were relieved to see there wasn't too long of a line. However, when we finally got sorted out (our clerk was nice, but was struggling), there was a long line behind us. Not what you want to be doing at 2am. We also weren't charged correctly and our credit card "dropped" from our reservation??, so we had to spend 45 minutes of our morning two days later sorting that out (it wasn't due to anything on our end, apparently). The courtesy bus from the airport is nice, but it was a long wait and ride getting to our hotel(including dropping off at all the other resorts first). The bus was over half an hour late picking us up when we left. It was supposed to be a 5:30 am pickup, so it felt like an even longer wait after scurrying to be there on time. We made it to the airport, but not with much extra time. Going to Universal without a car? The price seemed crazy through Mears (for a shuttle), but appeared to be the best deal ($75 round trip for four per day). The first day went well using them. They were on time both directions and took us straight there and back. The second day they were over 45 minutes late picking us up at the hotel and added a stop at Sea World, getting us to the park over an hour later than we had planned. Returning that evening was just as bad--late with lots of stops. I'd have a hard time signing up with them again after that.

Reviews.Title: “Very cute resort”
Reviews.Author: Mary M
Reviews.Content: I loved the theme of this resort, and the grounds around the whole area was incredibly tidy and beautiful. My boyfriend and I stayed in the Alligator Bayou building #39 which wasn't too far from the restaurant or bus stops. There were a bunch of pools spread out around the resort so we didn't have to walk far to find one. They also had a bonfire area and fishing although we never participated. It did have a couple negatives though. The beds were double beds and really uncomfortable (it was like sleeping on a rock). However, I know the resort is being updated right now and the old double beds are being replaced with comfy queens. The other negative was the walls were paper thin. We could hear everything our neighbors said or did and they were not even loud people. Overall we did like the resort but we'll probably be staying somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort for Families with Preschool + kids”
Reviews.Author: misskrisnewyork
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite Disney Resort on a moderate budget. While there are certainly nicer pads out there, this one is good for the price, with plenty of character and tons to do. Disney resorts are expensive, especially during peak periods, but the benefits of staying onsite are numerous. If you're hung up on the price you paid at the Holiday Inn Express in suburban Cleveland for that conference back in September, don't read any further. A Disney resort isn't for you. I'll start with the good: - Good food choices. Everything from filet to turkey dinner to burgers and fries. The make your own pasta bar is good for every taste. Food options might be tough for the vegan traveler; however there *seemed* to be plenty of vegetarian options. - Meandering paths wander through the bayou themed, park like resort. Little bridges travel over streams, and private foot paths lead to several well placed pools; - Grounds are meticulous and clean; - Fantastic feature pool and kiddy pool with poolside activities. Small water slide is perfect for both swimmers and non swimmers. Now the bad - I focus on this aspect not because it was a bad trip, but because these issues may influence where someone else stays. - No elevators. This, by far, is the biggest negative if you are traveling with small children. We traveled with my 2 year old son, who still needs a stroller and is sketchy on stairs. We were in the farthest building from the main dining hall on the 2nd floor farthest from the stair case. I have never stayed at a resort without elevators in my life, so I didn't think to ask. - The resort is huge. It's a 10 minute walk for a fit family from Building 24 to the main dining hall. - Most of the cast members were great, but some were borderline rude. It's the first time I've ever experienced this in a Disney resort. They were no worse than your typical chain hotel, but I expect more from Disney. - The resort is big and buses are busy. Some buses are shared with French Quarter and it may take time to get to and from the resorts. The Animal Kingdom bus is painful, since it's shared with French Quarter, and has a stop at Blizzard Beach. - Again, the buses are busy, so for the love of peanut butter and jelly, leave your sinking BOB jogging stroller at home! I have one, too. I love it, but this ain't the place for it, sister! Get yourself a good lightweight, and leave the jogging one at home. - The people driving the club cars for housekeeping are insane drivers, so keep your toddlers at arms length so they don't get hit on the paths. - The bathrooms are in desperate need of updating. The grout in the tiles is dingy and old, but clean. It's not awful, but I expect better from Disney. This is a great place if everyone in your party can walk on their own. If they can't, try to arrange for a first floor room. We will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter is not up to the standard that you expect from Disney”
Reviews.Author: Jen M
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews before booking this hotel. I was expecting it to be lovely. I was so disappointed. The room was far from clean. There were hair clips on the floor from the last guest proving they didn't vacuum. The sheets had long curly black hairs on them when I pulled the sheets back to go to sleep the first night. The trash wasn't always taken out each day so we had smelly takeout food in there unless we disposed of it. Online check in didn't work and we had to check in three times because of the way the reservation was done. It took a half an hour to do that. The parking passes they gave us weren't valid. Even the room key didn't work. . . .need I go on? I know that other people have had a good experience but there's no denying that it didn't happen for us. We rented a car but the one time I waited for a bus, it took an hour to get to Animal Kingdom and it's not that far. We had to stop at all the stops for Riverside too and that is very time consuming. When we come back to Disney for the 11th visit, we will splurge on the Floridian or Contemporary or stay outside the park. I never thought I'd say that but the French Quarter charged way too much for what we got. That said, the managers were great and we got a partial refund because of the problems we had. I can't believe it was just redone - the beds were really mushy and the decor was a bit depressing. I really think it was too pricey for the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Riverside vs French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: jnjm
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Port Orleans Riverside for 1st time, because we couldnt get the dates for the French Quarter where we have stayed before. We opted for a room in a building close to the main building/restaurant/lobby. The rooms at Riverside are all being renovated and this was not one of them, which was our choice. The renovated rooms are further from eating areas. From what i understand one of the main differences would be queen beds vs double. The room was fine - basic, but clean. Our main complaint about Riverside was the transportation. We were the "south depot" which was one of four stops at Riverside and always seemed to be the last. Also waiting at parks, if it was the end of the evening, they would need at least two if not three or more buses to get everyone back to Riverside, and the timing of bus arrivals wasnt great. So would I stay at Riverside again? not really -- would rather be at the smaller French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Not luxurious but beautiful spot...”
Reviews.Author: EWATWC
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice place for a 4 night getaway at Disney. Amenities in the room are fine, clean, and comfortable. You don't stay in the room anyway (good thing, TV choices are spartan and very Disney controlled). The grounds and facility are the attraction, very pretty, nice pool, and transporation is Disney (boat/bus). Like all of Disney, the food needs improvement and the prices are too high. This would have been a three star rating but for the grounds and the access to the parks. That having been said, we would stay again (budget).

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing, relaxing, beautiful - outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: lajasa
Reviews.Content: This resort is the whole package - and I couldn't have enjoyed my trip more. It was wonderful - from the southern hospitality to the beautiful landscaping throughout the walking paths, to the unique architecture in the food court and sit-down restaurant, to the quality and cleanliness of the rooms. I stayed in the Alligator Bayou portion of the resort and loved the tranquil, natural surroundings. I simply cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “A Relaxing World with the World”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustcrazy2
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans Resort is divided into Port Orleans Riverside and Port Orleans French Quarterâ€”two distinctive resorts. Within Port Orleans Riverside are two sections with multiple buildings in each sectionâ€”Magnolia Bend (mansions) and Alligator Bayou. Years ago, when we visited Port Orleans Riverside (not stayed), it was called Dixie Landings and since then Iâ€™ve always wanted to stay in one of the mansion buildings. So there was no decision to be made when planning this trip as to which section we wanted within Riverside--it was Magnolia Bend. Note the themed dÃ©cor in the lobby areaâ€”very unusual ceiling fans. Room â€“ We requested a recently refurbished room on the top floor in the Magnolia Terrace building which is right across from the main area where all the action is and close to an internal bus depot as well. We got our request and got a surprisingly nice view of one of the quiet pools as well (we expected a parking lot or trees view). It took a while to find our room especially since we had to find the elevator with our luggage. (For the duration of our trip, we used the stairs which were closer to our room.) Upon opening the door, we were greeted with a towel-created Mickey on the bed. We carefully moved it to the top of the dresser where it would remain for the rest of our stay. The room was nicely decorated with colors I would not normally choose (greens and blues), but they coordinated nicely with the southern theme of the resort. There were double sink vanities with a hairdryer outside the bathroom which is especially handy in the mornings when you are rushing to start the day. Toiletries provided were less than what we remembered when we last stayed at a Disney resort 8 years ago. Now, only adequate supplies of Mickey soaps and shampoo/conditioner are provided. Our double room was furnished with a flat screen TV on a dresser and a table with 2 chairs with upholstery coordinated to the bedspreads. An oval mirror, riverboat prints, and hanging chandelier over the table completed the look. The refrigerator was handy to store our supply of bottled water and there was a coffeemaker in the room. The hooks and shelf was a nice addition to the closet area since it allowed us to hang wet stuff and bags away from the clothes. The luggage rack was not your standard type, but a cushioned one that looked more like a bench. Never saw scenic headboards like these beforeâ€”must be custom-made. Beds were very comfortable and provided restful sleep. Riverside Grounds - On our way to the room, we saw a horse-drawn carriage hitched up by the marina ready for rides. It was a nice touch to the southern theme of the resort. (It would be the only time we would see this horse since the rides are only given in the late afternoons to early evening and we were never at the resort at that time.) The grounds are immaculate and the grass always looked freshly mowed. I heard someone comment that he wished someone could come make his lawn at home look like this place. There's even a gazebo to add to the scenery. Since this resort is built along the Sassagoula River, you can take a nice boat ride from the dock here to Downtown Disney making a stop at Port Orleans French Quarter. We did this on our first night just to get in the vacation mood. There is also a lovely riverside path to walk from Riverside to French Quarter. Also by the dock are various watercraft for rental as well as bicycles and surreys for the landlubbers. It may not be apparent when you are actually there, but the main pool is on its own island in the middle of the Sassagoula River and accessible by footbridge from the lobby and from the rooms. There was always music and activity there. Also on that island is the quiet Fishinâ€™ Hole with the catch and release rule. Here you can rent both equipment and bait. Scattered throughout the resort grounds are 5 other quiet pools. There are also self-service laundry facilities which we did not need. We saw the Alligator Bayou section of the resort from across the river, but didnâ€™t venture there due to time constraints and the fact that we were told its theming was a bit swampy which is not our thing. The gift shop, lobby, game room, restaurants and lounges are all connected in a long building. Nicest and most helpful cast members in Fultonâ€™s General Store (gift shop). This store is very large for a hotel gift shop. The game room is called the Medicine Show Arcade and itâ€™s not quite as large as I would expect. They utilize tokens for the games. Dining â€“ For food, there is Riverside Mill Food Court, Boatwrightâ€™s Dining Hall, and River Roost Lounge connected to the lobby. For those of you wondering, there is no room service, but I understand there is pizza delivery available. In the evening live music emanated from the River Roost lounge and people seem to be having fun in thereâ€”we were always too tired to stop by. We also didnâ€™t get to dine in Boatwrightâ€™s because we already had all our dinners reserved for the duration of our stay. However, we did have breakfast and lunch at the Riverside Mill. Breakfast was abundant and good with the breakfast platter which included a mini Mickey waffle, but lunch at the pasta station was disappointing. Summary â€“ Riverside has become one of our favorite Disney resorts and if we were to return, we would definitely stay in Magnolia Bend again. It is not how one would picture a Disney resort, but after a busy and tiring day at the parks, the beauty and serenity of Riverside is most welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK, not terrible.”
Reviews.Author: iamaws
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Port Orleans Riverside for only one night. I ran Disney Marathon and it looked convenient to stay there to get to the start line at 4 am in the morningï�Š. This property was on sale and I got a deal for $150 per night including tax. The shortest description I would give is â€œnot completely badâ€�. The property is in a very nice setting and looks pretty good from outside. Inside, room was clean, but VERY dated. The bathroom is pretty old. Actually, it reminded me Red Roof in for the most part. Towels were clean, toiletries: just soap and shampoo. There was a fridge and coffee maker in the room. TV is 32â€� flat screen, but most channels are Disney. Two things that I did not like about this property: 1. It looks close, but actually is far from everything. You need to use a bus, and the buses run with VERY long intervals. Guest service at Epcot told me that they ran every 20 minutes, but I had to wait more than 40 minutes. 2. Check out time is 11 am. Which is really early, in order to get a slightly late checkout I had to speak with several levels of management.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Virgin Holidays traveler
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a late flight from San Francisco, check in was poor, was given a map of location of our room, no help with luggage, had two prams with a 2 and 4 year old. Food court, crowded, if you like plastic cutlery and paper plates, burger pizza and chips you will be fine. 1 Restaurant for dinner only very limited choice, very nice, but could have more choice Rooms not serviced properly Staff around resort are lovely and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Virgin Holidays traveler
Reviews.Content: Accomodation is gourgeous. Rooms are lovely and the layout of the hotel is great. Lots to do and the setting is just beautiful. Food excellent and the staff could not have been more helpful. Courtesy buses into Disney ran very smoothly. The courtesy boat trip to Downtown Disney was excellent too. Swimming pool and lifeguards just fantastic. All in all, we would highly recommend this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Skye J
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip last minute to have some special family time before my husband deploys in Febuary for 7 months. I'm hoping we just stayed at the wrong resort, because it was a horrible experience all around. The room was very small, the beds were uncomfortable, but the worst was the dirty bathroom. There was a ring around the tub and I found a hair in the soap dish. The room was cute, but not small kid friendly. The beds were high up and made to look like they were made from pine trees. I worried that someone would fall and get hurt the entire time. The trundle is small, sits on the floor, and isn't very comfortable even for a small kid. The property is beautiful, and spread out. We made the mistake of taking the boat to downtown disney without checking for our bus stop. On the way back the driver put us off the bus at the wrong stop across the property in the freezing cold. He told us this was our stop, that it was the closest he went to our room. We were dropped off in the dark and completely lost, we finally found our way across the bridge back to our side of the resort, cold and hungry. My husband decided he'd had enough and went to complain about our room and the bus driver. The manager Tracy didn't really seem to care and couldn't get him out fast enough and didn't do anything to fix the situation. We went off property for dinner and for tub cleaner so I could bathe the kids. We started fresh the next day, trying the bus again to Magic Kingdom, but with 4 stops in this resort it takes a while and gets very crowded. It was a challenge holding a baby and 2 year old while standing the entire way. This was our first visit staying on property, and the magic we hoped for, was lost the first day. It wasn't remotely worth the money we paid, and will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every dollar”
Reviews.Author: Elvira B
Reviews.Content: Clean, safe, comfortable accommodations. Friendly helpful staff. Good to stay while in The Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Limited Value in this Property”
Reviews.Author: Nancy C
Reviews.Content: Disney offers guests many lodging and resort opportunities at price levels to fit family needs, budgets, and expected benefits. We have stayed on property many times since our kids were preteens, and now we still go with our grandkids at least annually for the January Disney Marathon Weekend [Four days of managed chaos when 50,000 or more runners, families of runners, volunteers, and unfortunates who unknowingly schedule their visits for the same time invade the parks.]. This year we planned our visit for Port Orleans Riverside and were booked into the Alligator Bayou section. Unlike other sections of the property our room did not have queen beds; we had two double beds and one trundle. The beds were comfortable with good pillows and the two adults and three kids slept fine. However, the room was like the Holiday Inns of the early 70s with the commode and tub/shower in a closeable room while two nice pedestal sinks were in the sleeping area. There is a pullable curtain that adds privacy when needed. Unfortunately, when there is a runner in the family who must get up and out at 3:30 AM for the race, this room layout does not work well. Still, these rooms are VERY quiet, even when they face the heated pool which gets busy at night. These mid-range rooms are booked well over $200 ++ for this weekend, and one must balance the price with the value of being only one mile from the marathon starting line. There is a refrigerator and coffeemaker in each room. The property is huge! Folks have to walk from the registration area to their rooms at night, since there were no bellmen to help. For our section we had to walk thru the food court dragging luggage to get to the walkways; not the efficiency one expects from Disney, masters of que management and productivity efforts. Food in the food court is quite good as are the offerings at the Boatwright Dining Hall. The "Saloon" is busy every evening, and very lively with a family-friendly show. Prices for food, beverage, and libation are at levels typical for a resort at this mid-range. There is lots to do for families with older children, but with the under 9 crowd we were limited on property with suitable activities. Staff is Disney friendly and helpful. Complimentary buses to the parks leave from one of four depot areas (north, west, east, and south). At park closing these buses are more than jammed... this property is so big it takes bus after bus to get lodgers home. Plan to wait in lines; they are trying but you are tired and the kids are cranky. Be prepared. Still, being in Disney World has its perks and we will always return.

Reviews.Title: “Alligator Bayou is the place to be”
Reviews.Author: sweetT13
Reviews.Content: After splurging on a night at the Contemporary (which we loved), we moved over to the Riverside. The grounds are very nice. The main pool is pretty crowded, but there are smaller pools near each cluster of rooms. Our first room was in the Oak Manor section and it was very outdated. I thought we would have a trundle bed or at least a rollaway since I requested it, but they were not available. After a quick visit to the front desk, we were transferred over to Alligator Bayou which was wonderful. My 3 girls walked into the room and were amazed. It's newly renovated, smells clean, has a pull down berth like on the cruise ships and a very "Princess and the Frog" but not too girly decor in the room. Kids loved it. I loved it. Great night's sleep. Good for bigger families on a Disney budget (meaning still not inexpensive, but less than deluxe WDW properties). We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: bregmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a week in early October. We requested a refurbished room next to the north bus stop and we got what we asked for. The online check in line moved very slow but once you were checked in your stuff was handed to you immediately. The other line was moving fast but everyone had to wait for their info folder to be put together. I am glad we got the refurbished room or otherwise I am pretty sure we would have been unhappy. We got 2 adjoining rooms since we have 4 kids ages 16, 11, 10, and 8. The queen beds were good to have compared to a full. Daily cleaning service was good. I think they made some bunny washcloths but our kids have outgrown those things so no big perk for us. We enjoyed using the Disney transportation but what I read before is definitely true--the Riverside line is always the longest for the return trip back to room at night! We would have to wait through 2 or 3 buses before we could get on sometimes. We didn't mind much as our kids are older and we weren't dealing with toddlers, diaper bags, and strollers. Our oldest child also used the transportation on his own since he loves to hang out in Epoct and catch up with the rest of the family later. He even took his sisters back to the room one day early and took them to the arcade. It was very easy to use. We enjoyed the property but it was a large spread out resort. We stayed in a non-preferred room and didn't mind the 5 or 6 minute walk to the lobby, arcade, and gift shop. We thought it was a pleasant walk. We never used the boat to Downtown Disney so I can't comment on that. We only ate at the quick area not the Boatwright restaurant --lots of options and desserts though. The menu looked good at Boatwrights but not worth a table dining credit. The gift shop was nice and having packages sent to it from the parks for later pick up was very handy. We had the deluxe dining plan and had several reservations. Our kids weren't much into the character meals though. We did the Beach Club breakfast and the Norweigan princess meal. We thought the food was really good overall at our table service meals, but we like to try interesting new food. Boma was our favorite--went there twice! The only fault we found was the size of the kid friendly pool. It was way too small for the size of the resort. We didn't even use it. It was crowded and loud. We enjoy the parks so much that we probably wouldn't use a pool much anyway so that didn't bother use either. Overall a great trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Picturesque with Southern Hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: pinnochio69
Reviews.Content: First let's preface my review with we're Disney regulars that live 3 hours away from the Parks. We've stayed at the value resorts to the high lines, including some outside the park. We were extremly surprised at the quaintness of this resort. The views of the waterways and bridges along with the gazebos and manicured grounds, made this resort seem like a honeymoon spot more then a high volumn motel for family fun. As I walked around my first night after check in, I came upon a Gazebo that was lit up with about 25 candles. I watched some guy make sure the candles were lit and then to my surprise, up pulled a horse and buggy, the kind I'm used to seeing in Central Park in NY City, with a couple riding in it. (They have buggy rides and bike surreys to rent) A young couple stopped at the gazebo and the young man got down on one knee to propose. The girl accepted and I couldn't have asked for a more perfect life moment to witness then that. It's more then a magical place and there were other good things to note about this riverside resort. The food lines moved more quickly then any of the other hotels I stayed at. The 10 minute water taxi ride to downtown Disney is another plus as well as the short bus rides to Epcot and Magic Kingdom. This is an automatic pick for our next trip. I'll make sure to book in advance as not to miss out. Well worth a try!!! Please make sure it's the Riverside you book and not the French Quarter! Enjoy the magic.

Reviews.Title: “Never go back”
Reviews.Author: kferranto
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back last night, thank God for my bed!! The hotel was gross. The room was booked for 2 adults 3 kids and they gave me double beds and a MATTRESS inch and half thick on a musty gross carpet floor. I couldn't figure out why the bathroom and dressing area always smelled, then I realized the curtains were moldy and dirty. My 6&8 year old daughters even thought the room was gross and they haven't a clue normally. The food was GROSS. Never stay there again especially that it's not like it was cheap. I did ask while checking in for Queen beds but they couldn't accommodate me, whatever never again!

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans Riverside Was Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: KendrasTravels
Reviews.Content: Our first impression of this resort was that it was beautiful. It only got better. When we checked in we had the nicest person to help us. I think her name was Roz. She checked us in at the Magnolia Terrace building which had just been renovated. The room was spacious, clean, and the beds were heavenly. The beds had a towel folded like a cute little animal each night by housekeeping. The building was a short walk by the main pool and over a little bridge from the main entrance. The main restaurant is right next to the main entrance also. It was nice too. I would stay here again. The resort far exceeded our expectations. Oh I almost forgot. There is a boat that takes you to Downtown Disney. It only takes about 15 minutes. Disney is Great!!

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans Riverside”
Reviews.Author: MicheleDahl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the moderate category at Disney World. The grounds are beautiful, and the big pool has a nice waterside. The cafeteria is great and has many choices. There is also a sit down restaurant that we didn't try. The rooms are not any bigger than at the Value Resort, so that part was a downer, but the amenities we better than the Value Resorts. It was also very convenient that you can take a boat to Downtown Disney instead of a shuttle. Sometimes the shuttles to Dwntown Disney are very, very crowded. The ferry boat was a much nicer option!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but the price is not so reasonable for what is offered”
Reviews.Author: Marquitos_RJ
Reviews.Content: I spend a considerable ammount of my vacations with my fianceÃ© in this hotel. It is pretty good, altough staff members are not so patient with guests as in other Disney hotels higher priced.
