Furthermore, there was not so many options to spend some time in the hotel, specially if your room is not near to the main entrance. Some rooms are really far from the entrance and there were no way to get to those parts except if you go by feet. In our case, I did told the guest member while we were checking in the my foot was hurt, but she did not give any attention to that.

Reviews.Title: “Most relaxing Disney property”
Reviews.Author: Mom3boyssc
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 arrived a day early in Disney to start our trip and spent one night at the Riverside. It was a great place. Space was small for 5 but for a short trip, it would be okay. We were not in the updated rooms but will try it once they are finished. Check in was a breeze and the hotel grounds were excellent. We decided to stay that night at Riverside and never went to the parks. We ate at the counter service restaurant and all enjoyed it. Different stations made everyone happy and with the dining plan, we were able to use our dessert to come back and get milkshakes. Wonderful service. The grounds are laid out a bit too secluded and we got lost a few times going to our room. Seems to happen often at the resort as we heard many lamenting it. But the grounds are so nice, we enjoyed it. After a long day in the park, I probably wouldn't have found it so enjoyable. We stayed in the Alligator Bayou section. We asked for and were given a top floor room and were also given a corner unit (two windows.) The pull out bed is indeed made for a small (short) child. Our 6 year old barely fit. The pool was wonderful and the kids also enjoyed an hour at the pool at the neighboring French Quarter. As we were moving to a new resort the next night, we dropped our luggage with bell services and it was delivered with no problems to our next resort. With the updating of the hotel and the cost and beauty, we look forward to coming back to Riverside soon!

Reviews.Title: “I will definnitely be back”
Reviews.Author: ardana1
Reviews.Content: This was my first experience staying on-site at Disney, and I will never do it any other way again. The resort was beautifully laid out (I was in one of the mansion buildings), the room was clean, comfortable and welcoming with many fun touches such as a Mickey head made from towels on one of the beds. I really appreciated the cast members at check in, they were quick, efficient, friendly and very helpful. The grounds are beautifully maintained, and the choices of swimming areas was greatly appreciated. I enjoyed the restaurant as well as the food court.

Reviews.Title: “No problems”
Reviews.Author: pookanu
Reviews.Content: Would have been nice to have had bigger beds. Our bed was hard and squeeky. The staff was nice. Nice to have a trundle bed to pull out but it was not comfortable. Would like it to have a sheet that had a cleaner look to it. Loved the check in area, the trunk display in the lobby. My son liked the water wheel thing - can't remember what it is called. It was very clean in my opinion. Swimming pool at Old Man Island was nice, hot tub also nice.

Reviews.Title: “Love the disney magic this hotel provides”
Reviews.Author: Scotsgirl7911
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this resort from the 19th -31st March 2011. During the Annual Epcot flower and garden festival. We had requested a quiet king size room in the Magnolia Bend area of the resort with a refrigerator. All of these requests were met.The staff were very helpful and friendly and the location of the room was lovely and quiet (no-noise at night). The bed was very comfortable and mouse keeping did a great job of keep our amenities well stocked as well as surprising us every couple of days with towel creations. The maximum time we waited for any bus was 20 minutes going to the parks and about 30 mins coming home after fireworks from Magic kingdom. We dined at Boatwrightâ€™s (the table service restaurant on site) and really enjoyed our meal there. We also took the ferry boat to Downtown Disney a few afternoons after we had finished in the parks and really enjoyed the relaxing ride. We loved the location of this resort and will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved riverside - best moderate Disney hotel”
Reviews.Author: miranda2008
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in previous years at Pop century, Caribbean Beach, Port Orleans French Quarter and Animal Kingdom Lodge, but this year tried PO Riverside and I think we have now found the best compromise between cost and quality! If you are going in December when it is generally too cold to swim, or if you really are just going to sleep in your resort and spend the rest of your time in a park; then choose one of the value resorts. If you will spend some time in your resort, then by choosing a moderate you get a slightly larger room, a fridge in your room, and nicer pool facilities. Riverside has a main pool area on Old Man Island, which is lovely, but after lunch it becomes very noisy with the kids pool party. If you have little ones it is a great thing for them to be involved in, but if you don't have kids you may wish to move to one of the resort's other quiet pools around the grounds. For my husband and I, we loved the landscaping of the resort, and enjoyed walking along the river to our room each night. You should be aware the resort is very spread out with a fair walk to most rooms, which may be a bit much after a day in EPCOT! The food court has a very wide range of hot and cold options, and I think it is the best quick service food court in disney world for the food quality and range, but it is a shame that there is just one small bank of fridges for the drinks, which leads to long queues building when a child in front can't decide what drink they want! It's obviously not a luxury hotel, but it has just been refurbished. The mattresses and furnishings were all very comfortable, everything felt like it was new. If you have money to burn, stay at one of the deluxes. But if you want something just a bit more roomy and with more landscaping to spend time in, then this is the moderate resort for you. We have already booked our next trip here for later in 2012 and I am sure we will come back to Riverside again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Port Orleans -Riverside Acadian Room”
Reviews.Author: daisyrae0926
Reviews.Content: We requested a room close to transportation and that is what we were provided. Our room was a very short walk to the bus transportation. We were located in the Acadian Mansion section. The room was very nice and appeared to have been remodeled. LCD tv, 2 vanities, coffee maker, refrigerator and 2 queen beds. We ate breakfast at the Riverside Mill and the selection was very good. We had make your own yogurt parfait, and eggs, bacon, etc. We also had dinner there one of the nights which consisted of a personal pizza and pick your own pasta. The make your own pasta was very good and you got quite a bit for the price. It could have easily fed 2 people. Pick the type of pasta, i had fetticini, pick the type of sauce, I had alfredo, and pick your toppings, I had prosciutto, peas and mushrooms. mmm. The room we had was also very central to the main pool and lobby. We had a very nice stay and would definitely stay in the acadian rooms again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Luvs2Travel75
Reviews.Content: This is one of Disney's Moderate resorts but true to Disney, not a single aspect of this resort is left untouched. What I like best about this resort is all the greenery, the walking paths, waterways, bridges, etc. The rooms are nicely done.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: JSFRaleigh_NC
Reviews.Content: November 26 - December 2nd 2011 First, this review is from someone whose last trip to Disney was when she was five, and it was a one-day affair while visiting family friends who lived an hour away. I am also a huge Disney fan and have dreamed for years of completing that "once-in-a-lifetime" trip. Take this into account as you read the review. About the pics? I just happened to have them. I really was expecting this to be my "once-in-a-lifetime" trip, as money is an issue, so I took over 350 pictures during my trip. My digital camera is a life-saver! 1. Your experience will depend upon your attitude. This goes for the whole shebang and not just the resort. If you are excited and willing to experience the "magic," then you will have a great time. If you let every little thing bother you, you won't. 2. When we arrived: we had paid for the trip in full before we got there - hotel stay, theme park tickets, dining plan, everything. The only money we needed to take was spending money. With this said, check-in was a breeze. We went right after Thanksgiving, which all the guidebooks said was the lowest point in the year, so that might also have something to do with it. Everyone was friendly and attentive. The lobby and grounds were beautifully decorated for Christmas. We had to wait until our rooms were ready as we got there before the 3 pm check-in time. Our luggage was stored - for free - and we toured the grounds. We found the two pools - one small hotel pool next to the laundry building - and a bigger pool that had more "decorations." It also had upbeat music playing during the day. There is also a rather nice children's play area next to the bigger pool. My daughter loved it. We also saw the dock where you can take a boat straight to Downtown Disney. Everything was clean and well-maintained. There was some renovations going on in the building next to (the actual building we slept in), but I thought the noise was actually quieter than smaller projects I have heard in my own city; put it like this, we could nap if we wanted to do so. Once our rooms were ready, which was actually quite a bit earlier than 3 pm - we went to the desk, received our room keys, and went to our rooms. We called for our luggage, and it was delivered to our room within fifteen minutes. 3. During the visit: The room stayed very clean with the help of a daily maid. The beds were comfortable, and I loved the sheets. The room was nicely appointed. I thought it was very pretty. The grounds were beautiful. I took quite a few pics of my family out and about on the grounds as they made such a lovely backdrop. Bus Depots- We were very close to one of the bus depots, which was very nice. We never had to wait more than 10-15 minutes for a bus, and that's being stingy. Usually the bus we wanted seemed to pull up as soon as we got there. Boat - You could take a boat straight to Downtown Disney. Look for the hidden Mickey made out of rope underneath one of the bridges! 4. Checking Out: A breeze if you pay for your trip in full before you go. Just pack up all your stuff and walk out. We got to keep the room keys as souvenirs, which I thought was pretty neat. 5. Dining Plan: GET IT! If you're staying at a resort, your opportunities for dining off-site go down unless you rent a car. AND if you rented a car, would you really want to travel off-site to eat every day? We didn't. The dining plan was wonderful. We got the Deluxe because we didn't understand how much food it was going to be. It's more than you can eat, and the portions are very generous. The great thing about the Deluxe is the two snacks per day. We used those for water in the parks. Even with that, we still had 17 snacks at the end of the week unused, and quite a few meals. There was so much food, we usually ate a brunch or just a lunch and a dinner. The cool thing is that you can "cancel out" your meal plan. Any unused meal plan items can be traded in the resort quick-service restaurant and the snacks can be traded there or in the gift shop for certain snack items. The gift shop items are the best. Goofy's sour worms. Chip 'n Dale's bag of nuts. Those kind of things. They make great things to bring back for families or friends. With that said, if I ever get to go again, I will not be going with the Deluxe plan. We brought back, literally, a lot of food. There were way more than enough "Mickey" rice krispy/chocolate mouse ears for my daughter to bring back one for every student in her class, the teacher, and the teacher's assistant. And we still had some that I was giving away to family and friends. I would rather go for the plan where you get one sit- down, one quick-service, and one snack. That would get us through lunch and dinner (which some of the food from those would be brought back to the room in case someone needed a snack), and let us indulge in a treat that is high-priced in the actual park. I recommend the ice cream cookie sandwich from the Bakery on Main Street in Magic Kingdom. It was so big that my daughter and I couldn't finish ours! My husband could, though! Riverside Mill: There are actually two different places to eat at POR. There is a quick-service part and a sit-down restaurant part. The quick-service has food for everyone. It was delicious, and it was not just fast-food junk. You could make healthy choices. The sit-down restaurant is styled in the Louisiana fashion. The food choices are from that region, and it gave my family a nice chance to try some different cuisine. Alcohol is not included in the dining plan. You have to pay for that out-of-pocket. 6. Tips/Gratuities: The grauities are NOT included in the dining plan. I thought they were, but they aren't. When you sit down, tell the server you're on the dining plan first thing and specify the type. They will help you figure out what you can order; it actually doesn't take long to figure this out on your own. I did notice that service was not quite as fast as I wanted as the sit-down types, but this was my impatience. The sit-down types are expected to be leisurely, and I wanted to explore the parks. I helped speed the process up, though, by ordering everything I wanted in one go and then the next time I saw the waiter, I asked for the receipt. With the dining plan, you just have to sign the receipt so it can be deducted from your meal plan account. There is a line at the bottom telling you the diiferent gratuities you could give. However, I could not tip 18 - 20% on every meal, as the sit-down meals were usually at least $100 at one time, so I generally left about $5 as a tip. I felt bad, as the servers were really great, but money was an issue. One last thing, I did tip the maid five dollars per day. They work hard, and I bet they're one of the lowest paid workers there. 7. The "Magic" - The workers at the resort and the parks did a lot of little things that seemed to go unnoticed by the majority of people. One fabulous example was when my family got off the bus from one of the parks during the day, and there was an outline of Mickey, Minnie, and Donald Duck on the concrete. It was so cool! A cast member was standing by watching as all the people just walked by this creation, and he noticed my family's reaction. I thought it was neat, so I took pics. He saw that we were "open" to the "magic," and said, "See, Minnie knew you were coming, so she appeared just for you." I told him thank you for drawing the pics, and he said he couldn't accept it because "it was just the magic. [He] couldn't draw to save his life." I then told him to tell the magic maker thank you, It was a lot of those little things over the entire trip - and the big ones - that made it really magical. So keep your eyes open, and look with the heart of a child. Your experience will be better for it.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Gorgeous Gettaway!”
Reviews.Author: RedDragon17
Reviews.Content: This was a great and unforgettable trip! This hotel is very very clean and very comfy. We brought our toddler for the first time (to Disney). And we were also celebrating my mother's bday. Our entire family loved it!. Beds are very comfortable. The Hotel is so homy, you almost dont feel like you are in a hotel. Our room was walking distance to the shuttle--very convinient! The Pool looked like fun (too cold in Nov). Food was delicious (at the food court). Staff was very friendly and helpful! I definately recommend staying at this hotel. I will return! Ive also stayed at Port Orleands French Quater. This hotel, Riverside, Is much nicer and more beautiful. Downside: we requested a pack n play for our toddler. First, its not guaranteed. Thats not very assuring. No one wants to run to a local store and buy one or bring their own (since they are so bulky). Second, they dont place the pack in play in your room until you check in. Huge inconvinence since we arrived several hours past (due to traffic) my toddler's nap and she was very upset. Other sidenote: Shuttles are not always every 15-20 mins. We waited 45 mins for a shuttle and missed our reservation for lunch. Try to schedule your shuttle rides 30 mins in advance. Also remember that shuttles pick up other patrons along the way and the total ride could be 30 mins. When leaving the park to go back to the hotel, the entire trip can be up to 45 mins (waiting for a shuttle, picking up more ppl, traffic, ect).

Reviews.Title: “Great way to enjoy Disney”
Reviews.Author: Shaun R
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at Port Orleans Riverside having stayed in recent years at Pop Century, Caribbean Beach and Port Orleans French Quarter. We absolutely loved it there! It's a big resort (a fair amount of walking required, but it's worth it. It's one of the prettiest resorts we've been to with immaculate landscaping and built around lovely waterways. The room we stayed at had recently been updated and was superb. Really nicely decorated and one of the most comfortable beds we've slept in anywhere. A bit bigger than than rooms at Pop Century which worked great for us as we were using a wheelchair due to my wife's poorly foot! One of the highlights of the resort is undoubtably the resort's food court. Definitely the best we've enjoyed at a Disney Hotel. Burgers, chicken and pizza are all good, but the make your own salads and pasta were big hits with us. Pool area is really nice, but does get slightly noisy in the afternoon with the kids pool party. It didn't bother us too much - weather was great (in October) and we spent many happy days here. Pool bar is pretty good, although does close a bit early (10.30). The one bit of the resort that could use some improvement is the evening entertainment in the main bar - very child orientated (ok it is Disney!). We gave that a miss - usually being out in the parks or at dinner. French Quarter had a much better schedule with a jazz/blues type act on most nights - would have liked to have seen a bit of that at Riverside too. Finally we do really love the boat option to get over to Downtown Disney - a very nice and relaxing alternative to the bus! Going back in May!

Reviews.Title: “Still a great choice, but transportation slipping”
Reviews.Author: Salt78
Reviews.Content: This was my third time staying at this Disney property, and it is as beautiful as ever. We asked for a renovated room when booking and were lucky enough to get one. Soon enough all rooms will be new. For anyone who hasn't stayed here the property is very big, but so are all Disney moderates except for French Quarter, so expect to walk. The grounds are well maintained and the staff is first class. The food is good enough, but we mostly eat at restaurants in the parks so not an issue. The only problem which I don't remember being as bad last time I visited 3 years ago was the park transportation. Its understandable because it is such a large resort for there to be lines, but on two occasions we waited an hour for a bus. I guess it just luck sometimes when you get to the stop. All in all wouldn't deter me from staying at this property again. Too many pluses for one con to stop me. Stay with confidence.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay down in the Bayou!”
Reviews.Author: AwfullyBigAdventures
Reviews.Content: First a note- I am giving this a 5 out of 5 based on the type of resort this is. It is a moderate resort, not a 5 star hotel. For a moderate resort, this is wonderful. We stayed here for 8 nights in early December 2011. We were in the Aligator Bayou section of the resort. Note, this is the ONLY section of the Disney moderate resorts that sleeps 5. It was a fabulous stay for my family. We had requested a new refurbished room, but due to delays at the airport we checked in too late for that and were given a standard room the first night. It was nice, and I loved the beautiful location of the first building. The next morning I requested we were moved to the new rooms and they got us a refurbished room right next to the parking lot. My kids got a kick out of the Princess and the Frog theme just like I was hoping they would. â€“(See pictures) While the first room was nice, the second was better. In the refurbished rooms, the trundle bed pulls down from the way instead of rolling under one of the beds like it does in the old rooms. The room we were in on nights 2-8 was a connecting room. We only heard the people to us on night two though- it sounded like a poor little kid having a meltdown/tantrum late at night. Wasn't too bad though, all of my kids slept through it. Didn't hear a peep other than that. The resort was beautiful- but I say that as a nature lover. It might not appeal to those without a fondness for trees, streams and fuzzy little animals. My kids loved it. They got so excited every time they spotted a squirrel, rabbit, lizard or bird. I thought the staff did an excellent job, everyone we interacted with was professional and treated us with respect and kindness. Everyone was very friendly, and my kids were made to feel special. Pros- Beautiful resort Boat to Downtown Disney was very convienient Pools were great (1 large and 4 small at Riverside, plus access to 1 large at French Quarter) Refurbished rooms were fun Food court had lots of options Quiet and peaceful Lots of biking and jogging trails (I saw many joggers each morning) Cons- Rooms are small Trundle bed was small (my oldest was too tall to use it) Only a curtain between the sink/vanity area and the sleeping area No free internet (Are you kidding? I can get that at coffee shops or fast food places but not the hotel.)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to relax and enjoy Disney”
Reviews.Author: gettabook
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December 2011 for 7 nights. There are 2 sections that are completely different. We stayed in the Magnolia Bend section in a recently renovated room. It was spacious, very nicely decorated, and quiet. There are several bus stops for this hotel, so you can't be more than a 5 or 7 minute walk from any of them. The pool was magnificant. My husband and son enjoyed it. I enjoyed catching up on email at the pool with the now free internet service this hotel has. The food court was adequate for a quick, hot meal. We enjoyed the "Create your own Pasta" meal twice. I would definitely stay here again and could not imagine anything that I would like better.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel room and grounds are very nice.”
Reviews.Author: rifrafmom
Reviews.Content: We got one of the renovated rooms in the Acadian Building and it was very functional and lovely. Much more storage than we anticipated which was a bonus since we had to sneak in and hide a small Christmas tree in the armoire and still store all our clothes. We had a very roomy mini-fridge and small coffee maker. There is even a shelf area under the double sinks which is great for storing personal items and luggage. The soundproofing in the rooms was great and we never heard anything except for an occasional muted toilet flush from the adjacent rooms. Our maid Diana did a fantastic job cleaning the room and must have been trained by a Marine Drill Sargeant in making beds because they were made so tightly we practically had to tear the bedding apart to get into the beds at night:) My suggestion is to skip the food at the resort though as it is marginal and skimpy at best in the quick service areas. I would also skip those ridiculously expensive resort mugs which hold almost nothing and can only be refilled at the one restaurant. And NESCAFE is the only "coffee" they serve. The pool near us looked gorgeous and fun and we would have loved to have had the time to try it out but just couldn't work it in. We also didn't make it to the cane pole fishing or playground. Caught a little bit of the evening entertainment guy on my way to refill the $17 refillable mug as often as I could and he seemed to have quite a following. My kids liked the arcade the one evening we came back a little early. We took the boat to Downtown Disney and it was pleasant and scenic but ultimately took a very long time and was crowded so we opted to drive for future trips. We used our car the whole time so I can't really comment on the bus service except for the one time we rode it one evening to EPCOT and the first one was too full to take even half those waiting and the second was also PACKED when it got to our stop with just enough room to squeeze on 4 adults and 4 little kids all standing right in the area where the doors open. On the "return" later that night well before park closing we waited a very long time before again squeezing as tightly as possible onto the fourth bus for our resort that came and the que remained overfilled the entire time we were there and as we left. That is really my biggest complaint about any of the resorts during high volume times is that the bus system is inadequate in the mornings and evenings. Disney should really stop cramming every single body it can onto every bus. It's truly not safe. You've got little kids piled on laps or squished between very large standing adults. If the driver slams on the brakes or makes a sharp maneuver and someone loses grip on a pole, a larger person falling could seriously injure or kill someone. It used to be that the buses were a great reason to stay on site but it seems now Disney is building rooms and decreasing buses. And the wait in the evenings for the buses can be outrageous. This is made much worse by the large number of people who do not normally need them opting for those motorized scooters to get around the parks. They are always allowed to break in line and get loaded on the next bus no matter how many other people are waiting for bus after bus (which I never understood because those people are sitting down while they wait for the bus while the rest of us are standing). And before someone thinks I am talking about the handicapped, let me assure you I am not. I've got no problem with accomodating the handicapped. I am talking about people who rent one and then change out who in their large party is driving it throughout the day and use them to get preferred "handicapped" seating for their group on rides and even let the kiddies who were hanging off the handrails like monkeys moments before take a spin around while waiting.

Reviews.Title: “ok place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mlm123
Reviews.Content: Grounds were beautiful but rooms left something to be desired. We didnt get one of the newly renovated rooms. While staying on a resort has its perks not sure of the amount of time spent there makes it worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “First and last time at Riverside”
Reviews.Author: degeroma
Reviews.Content: My family and I ventured down to Disney for our annual trip for a stay at Port Orleans Riverside from Oct 23-Oct 29. We normally stay at the Port Orleans French Quarter and that is where we were suppossed to stay for a trip that was scheduled to begin on Aug 28, but Hurricane Irene put an end to those plans. Upon rebooking the trip for October, I found that there were no rooms available at the POFQ, and decided to book into Riverside instead. With that said, I can honestly say that there is no comparison between the two hotels. Riverside is actually a very nice hotel and the grounds are beautiful, but that's about it. The main problem is its size. If you're not staying in a room near the main building and pool, be prepared to walk and walk and walk. It takes forever to get where ever you are going. The other major issue I had was with the bus service for this hotel. There are four depots here and you have to stop at all of them at one point or another. It takes forever. After having stayed at the POFQ on our previous three trips to Disney, I couldn't get away from Riverside fast enough. The rooms are fine, the hotel is beautiful, but it has to be the most inconvenient property on Disney. Too much walking and too much waiting to get where you need to go. POFQ is a much better place to stay. Not as crowded and everything is close by. Bus service is much better there. We will not be staying at Riverside again. If Riverside is your preference and have never stayed at the French Quarter, I suggest you give it a try next time. You will see the big differences between the two hotels and I gaurentee you'll prefer the FQ over Riverside.

Reviews.Title: “This was everything I'd hoped it would be.....”
Reviews.Author: ronniecook7
Reviews.Content: I've read other reviews where people seem unhappy with this resort. I found it perfect. I called 10 days before my arrival and got the exact room I'd hoped to get. I was upstairs on the corner. I had two windows, one faced the pool the other faced the river. I was in Oak Manor near the bridge that is closest to the main facility. One night on the way back from Magic Kingdom we had just missed the bus to the Riverside resort, so we decided to take the bus to French Quarter and walk the path over. We weren't halfway there when a security guy picked us up in his golf cart and dropped us at the bridge that goes straight to our building. This trip was during the holiday season and the resort was decorated beautifully. I would definitely stay at this resort again. I highly recommend it to families. The food court was great. The prices were high, but you expect that at Disney. Although we did order a pizza at the food court to take back to the room and it only cost about 15.00. And that fed us all. We flew so we were sort of at the mercy of Disney prices as we didn't have a car to go off property. I would definitely recommend having a car if at all possible. We had a fridge in the room so if I'd had a car I could have gone to Walmart for lunch meat. But whatever, it was fun. The hotel was great. Again, I would recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort. Nice place to stay. Would Return Again!!”
Reviews.Author: edfc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans Riverside the first week in December 2011. We have enjoyed our stays at this resort in the past and enjoyed this stay also. We were given a refurbished room in Arcadia House. This was a garden view room very close to one of the quiet pools. It was a 3 minute walk to the main pool and 5 - 6 minutes to the main building and 3 minutes to a bus stop. We arrived at about 10:00am and our room was not ready but we were called about 12:00 and the room was now ready. The girl at check-in was pleasant and very helpful. Our room was cleaned properly every day and we experienced no problems with the room. The boat to Downtown is very quick and efficient. Its also much quicker and more pleasant than taking the bus to Downtown. Transportation to the parks was quick. Most wait times for a bus was less than 10 minutes. In the past the cheerleaders have been an unfortunate issue at this resort. This was a cheerleader week however they seem to be staying at Caribbean Beach Resort because we did not see any of them this visit. The grounds in the Mansion area are beautiful and I would not hesitate to stay in this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “The week before Christmas at Riverside (Alligator Bayou)”
Reviews.Author: Allison L
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our first Disney vacation, stayed at Port Orleans Riverside in the Alligator Bayou section. Had a great stay, would go back for sure. They just renovated most of the rooms in the hotel and switched all beds to queen size ( as of 12/23/11 - there were only a couple of buildings with the double beds.) Plus our room had the additional trundle bed. I was looking at the pictures of the old trundle beds and it was scary, just a thin mattress on the floor attached to another bed. The new trundle beds are great, fold down from the wall, have a very cute picture on the wall next to it and there are even very convenient ( for a child) set of drawers right beneath the bed. My 5 year old loved it and called it his "lucky" bed :-) The room was not very big, but clean and comfortable. The grounds were gorgeous and peaceful, it was very nice to come back to beautiful and quiet surroundings after braving crowds at the parks all day. There were several pools - the main one with the slides, music, activities, nice playground and a bar and a few "quiet" ones where you could just relax in the sun. The resort is pretty big but the shuttle to the park had 4 different stops so you could walk to the nearest stop and don't need to go back to the main one by the lobby. There was a typical Disney food court, nothing too exciting but nothing bad either. We only had a few meals there and it was fine. The kids liked the Mickey shaped waffles in the morning. There are plenty of other options in the parks and Downtown Disney to please anybody if you don't like the food at the hotel. One day we took the water taxi from the lobby to Downtown Disney - it was great, very pleasant and relaxing experience. There is a river that goes thought the entire property and you can even rent a boat or fish right there! One day we were tired of the parks and just rented a surrey bikes for a ride along the river - it was beautiful! The kids said it was one of their favorite experiences ( only cost $20 /hour)! All and all, this is not a 5 start resort but you get your money worth for sure. If you come to Disney for a few days with kids - you won't spend a lot of time in your room but you would appreciate coming back to a quiet room with comfortable beds surrounded by beautiful grounds. Would recommend this resort for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Above average amenities but room disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: FloridaFamilyofFive
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this "moderate" resort after wasting $100-150 more per night at the more upscale resorts near Magic Kingdom. I have to say that at the price of $150-200 per night, Port Orleans was a good value. Sure the rooms are tiny and dated, but the amenities like pools, boating and walking trails made up the difference. (Note there is NO fitness center and the coffee is horrible.) It is very close to Hollywood Studios and the kennel. Otherwise, driving to the other Disney parks took about 10 minutes. There is direct bus service to Magic Kingdom, Animal Kingdom and Hollywood Studios that is fairly frequent (about a 10-15 min wait) and short (10-15 min ride).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Disney Property”
Reviews.Author: exporider
Reviews.Content: This was the second time staying at the Disney Port Orleans Resort, Riverside. The hotel was just as we remembered it, nice scenery, pleasant staff and decent room. The bed is not as comfortable as a Marriott or Hilton, but serves its purpose. We never had any issues staying here. The great part about staying at a Disney property is the free transportation to/from the airport, the Disney parks and also Downtown Disney. We will probably be visiting Disney World again in a couple of months and we will definitely try another resort property just so we have something to compare it too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Disney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NottinghamPsb
Reviews.Content: This was our first time 'On-Site' when visiting Orlando specifically for the Disney Parks and Universal Studio's. We took a while to decide but were so very glad we picked this hotel, to say it was excellent is an understatement. The grounds are wonderful to wonder around in or walk down by the river to the French Quarter. Rooms were excellent and clean. There is one main pool and several other smaller pools dotted around the property. The property is large and spaced out really well and is in the style of elegant 'Old South'. The large food hall has everything you could want and is set out like a Food Mall so there is a large choice for every taste including Pizza's (design your own) Fried Chicken, sandwiches etc. All of which was good. Breakfast was as big or small as you wanted to make it. If you decided to eat in any of the parks your room 'key' also called your 'Key to the World' only had to be presented to charge your food (or shopping come to that) to your room for you to pay at the end of the holiday. All the staff, without exception were brilliant and informative and the wonderful 'BOB' who entertains in the main bar in the evenings has to be seen to be believed - he is a joy to behold and much fun is had by all when he is on for the evening. We had a car for the duration of the holiday but only used it when we went to Universal Studio's as the free transportation system from each of the hotels is run like clockwork (next time we would not even bother with a car). The free ferry boat to Downtown Disney are a lovely trip there and back especially in the evening. The only thing which was a light let down was the lack of internet access while we were at the hotel but I read only yesterday that they now have free WiFi at the hotel and are rolling it out throught all the Disney properties now. Wonderful Hotel and wonderful holiday

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely visit again!”
Reviews.Author: Naomi R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at in Lodge 26 of the Alligator Bayou section of POR for a week in early September, 2011. This is one of the cheaper, but well themed,Disney hotels. We've stayed in quite a few of the on-site hotels, namely, the Polynesian, the Boardwalk, and Old Key West. Both the main pool and the quiet pools are well kept to Disney standards. The room was great, not at all tired as others have suggested. Busses came frequently, and weren't too busy. (the queues for the other, cheaper hotels such as Pop Century and All Stars, were always very long at night). There is also the option to take the boat to Downtown Disney, which is a very pleasant journey. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, but this is the case all over Disney property. The Food Court located next to the lobby of the hotel serves a wide variety of food, enough choice for everyone! This is even better if you choose the Disney Dining Plan option, which also includes a free refillable mug. This can be used for unlimited soft drinks, as well as hot drinks. Smoking is not allowed within the rooms, but there are smoking points, which are never too far away. The overall atmosphere of the hotel is hard to beat, with the grounds beautifully maintained. I would definitely recommend that people stay here, it is quieter than other Disney hotels, but manages to keep the charm and excitement of being in Disney. (I should also mention that we have stayed here before, on a number of occasions, and keep returning!)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a Disney property at a reasonable price!”
Reviews.Author: Elwaysway
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 9 day stay at Disney World with the family and we absolutely loved it! We chose the Port Orleans rather than staying off property when Disney through in the FREE dining plan. Made it pretty much a no brainer. The Port Orleans seemed like he best bang for the buck according to other reviews and I don think we were really disappointed. I heard complaints about how BIG the property was and how aful he walking could be......but we just didn't get that complaint. The ground are absolutely beautiful and the weather was great....so a little walk never really bothered us. We stayed at the newly remodeled Accadian House at the suggestion of the very helpful gal at front desk. It was very comfortable (Disney rooms are always pretty small) and didn't disappoint. Pros - Great food court with an Awesome past bar (huge portions) , proximity to Epcot and Downtown Disney, pool complex Cons - noise (seemed like you could hear everything around you i.e. toilets flushing, doors slamming, etc)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Katherine H
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at a Disney hotel as you get the free shuttle everywhere which is fantastic and well worth paying to stay at a Disney hotel. The rooms were nice and clean and so was the surrounding area. They had a little shop to purchase Disney items and make good use of the dinning area for breakfast as they have a huge selection to choose from. Overall a good place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay!!! Great resort!!”
Reviews.Author: snowmom239
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this property last May for 10 days. We had our immediate family and my parents who traveled with us. We had requested we be close to one another. Done. We had adjoining rooms in the Magnolia House. The maids made cute animals everyday with our towels which I thought was very sweet. We were very close to the main pool area which was amazing!! My son is 5 and LOVED it. The main eating hall features cafeteria style food. For "cafeteria" style, the food was great! There were plenty of options for light eating as well as, "I'm really hungry, feed me!", eating:) I love the look, feel, and atmosphere of the enitre resort. Disney's amazing attention to detail never ceases to amaze me. The upkeep of the resorts is truly amazing. We had not been to disney in over 12 years, and all the properties we visited looked brand new. Although it was May, it never felt too crowded or overun. The option to take the boat to Downtown Disney was a HUGE plus. I definitely reccommend using this. We also took advantage of the pool area on the French Quarter side of the resort. Also an awesome pool that our son really enjoyed. For people debating between staying on property vs off property, I think it would be WISE to stay ON property. The PERKS are well worth it. The average drive time to any of the parks was less than 15 minutes. I knew my son loved the place, because after we left Florida, he kept asking if we could "go back to our room". Disney is amazing and the Port Orleans Resort is well worth your time and money. Thank you for an amazing vacation that we will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: sunshine02008
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Magnolia Bend. The room was newly renovated and beautiful. It was cleaned spotlessly every day. We asked for extra pillows when we arrived and they were brought right away. It was very quiet and we never heard any noise at night that disturbed us. We chose this resort as we thought it might be a bit quieter than some of the others as we were here without children and were looking for a relaxing vacation, and it did seem to have a lot of older guests without children - perfect for us. The food court is VERY crowded in the morning before 9 am. It was almost impossible to find a seat. The line to buy oatmeal was about 30 deep and we gave up and left with only coffee (which we carried back to the room). The pools are very nice. Internet should be free. There is no excuse to charge for it when most cheaper motels provide it free. The transportation to the parks really needs to be stepped up. At peak times, there just aren't enough buses to transport all of the guests in a timely manner. Either the wait time is unreasonable, or you end up standing on the bus for the trip. (not fun when you are older and it is difficult to stand and keep your balance). There are long waits to get to the parks in the mornings and HUGE lines at night when the parks close and everyone is trying to leave and the buses are still running on a 20 minute schedule. Riverside is a very nice place to stay if you want to stay at a moderate price Disney hotel that is beautiful, clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Truly magical”
Reviews.Author: Yakimm22
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one week stay at Riverside. It was awesome. We traveled with two small kIds 4 and 10 months and they were more than accomidating. We hardly waited for any bus and the pool was refreshing after a long day. The room we had in Magnolia bend was a perfect size to fit us. Thank you Disney for a beautiful family holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans. A repeat customer review.”
Reviews.Author: CuteGargoyle
Reviews.Content: There are two types of themed residential areas in this resort. The â€œAlligator bayou.â€� area has smaller accommodation blocks and an informal feel and atmosphere. The other region (called Magnolia Bend) is an impressive and formal deep south, old grand mansion, look and feel area. There is a (0.9 mile) walkway / cycle path which forms a loop around and across the Sassagoula river which runs through the center of the resort. The pathway has a link to through to the French Quarter resort. The path affords great views of the resort as you wander, jog or cycle around it. Depending on which accommodation you get you may get very familiar with the walkway as you trail back and forward to the food court. Aside from the theming the rooms are identical. The Alligator bayou rooms have (fake) log bed frames which are really easy to stub your toes on. (yep I speak from experience there.) The rooms are slightly bigger than an All Star Resort room and have a refrigerator and coffee making facilities. Other than that they are the same basic layout with the door at the front and the bathroom (with no window) at the rear. The room can be a little dark if the lights are switched off. (Why would you be in the room during the day anyway?) The air conditioning is a through the wall unit rather than a central type and it can be a bit noisy if you leave it on. (Itâ€™s Florida, you will probably leave it on.) There are some good swimming pools with the relaxed â€œOlâ€™ Man Islandâ€� pool having a water slide. All Pools at Disney are heated so you can swim all year round. Food court. The resorts reception, bars shop and restaurants are located in the â€œSassagoula Steamboat Companyâ€� building. There is service restaurant (Boatwrightâ€™s) and a general dining area (Riverside Mill) with a reasonable choice of food. Both are nicely themed. There is also a bar which serves snack food in the main building and a bar poolside on Olâ€™ Man Island. The shop has a limited choice of essential items and the usual large choice of Disney items. This is a nice calm and relaxed resort. It is a more grown up resort than All Star for not excessively more money. The grounds and general ambiance is superb and this makes the resort feel like it is a higher standard than the moderate grade it is afforded. I would not recommend this as a first choice for families with young children as it isnâ€™t quite as â€œDisneyfiedâ€� as other resorts. If you want a similar standard that is a little more kid entertaining go next door to French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Very good resort for family of five”
Reviews.Author: Kenm357
Reviews.Content: Great value for family of five. Very nice grounds great good.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and fun resort!”
Reviews.Author: JLEinCT
Reviews.Content: The last few times I have visited Disney I have stayed at the All Star Resorts, and this time we wanted a bit of a change. I could not have been more pleased with the hotel. Check in was easy, with friendly cast members. Our room was clean and well appointed, and was a 5 minute walk or so from the main lobby/restaurant. The grounds are beautifully landscaped and very private- you do not feel like you are in Orlando at all! We stayed in the Alligator Bayou building 25 which was great- very close to the west end bus stop, a short walk at the end of a long day! The food court was better than the All stars- much better selection at breakfast (healthy choices such as cereal and oatmeal bar with fruit). We actually had dinner at the hotel most nights because it was quiet and had a good selection- I really enjoyed the make your own salad bar and the make your own pasta selection. Both were reasonably priced and tasty. We also loved strolling along the river walk at night, passing horse drawn carriages and other people out running/walking . I definitely think alligator bayou was nicer than magnolia bend and French Quarter. We walked to the French Quarter one night, and I think the cafeteria at Riverside has a much better selection, and is bigger. You can take a boat right to Downtown Disney, which is nice for a change. We never waited more than 10 minutes for a bus going to/coming home from the parks. Only complaint- the mattresses are HORRIBLE! one bed in our room was slightly better than the other. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “2 Adults 55+ room was a little small”
Reviews.Author: Mary Ann R
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort. Clean well kept. First trip to Disney. Not cheap! I was feeling claustrophobic in the tiny room. Did not know there was a pre teen cheerleader contest. ( what a nightmare not Disney's fault) Lower room with kids above not good. Food is expensive, very limited choice and not very good. Boat ride to downtown Disney is a good choice. Checked in in the dark and couldn't find our room. Check out was smooth and easy.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Ariane G
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back from 5 nights at the Port Orleans Riverside and were so pleased with our experience. The hotel is beautiful and very convenient to everything. We were in the Alligator Bayou section with a view of the quiet pool, and it was just that, quiet! The food and service were wonderful and the rooms was very clean. We will be back for sure! On a side note - We were there for a wedding and I spent time in both the Polynesian and Contemporary hotel rooms while getting ready for the wedding. I was far more impressed with the POR than with either of the Deluxe resorts.

Reviews.Title: “All the charm of Disney for a relatively decent price!”
Reviews.Author: Leslie H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (as well as my parents) stayed at Port Orleans Riverside as part of a great Disney promotion that included a free dinner plan. It had been my first time staying on Disney property in over 10 years, and it was a definite treat! The service upon checking in was absolutely efficient, and every part of our stay thereafter was pretty much perfect. The decor was clean and bright - without the colorful childish flair that is available at many other Disney resorts. It was the perfect place for a married couple to stay - comfortable beds, generous lighting, great water pressure and temperature, and of course, a wonderful place to eat! If we hadn't been there in January, we probably would have tried the swimming pools, but we were a bit too chilled to go out in our bathing suits. The only reason that I'm not giving this place 5 stars is that, as a child, I stayed at the Polynesian Resort in Disney, which is even better. So, in a way, I've been spoiled by Disney hospitality, and since I've stayed a more luxurious, expensive place, I would have to reserve the fully five stars for such a place.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: Anna R
Reviews.Content: I visited with my boyfriend in 2011. We stayed here from the 1st-15th November. We booked because it was one of the cheaper places to stay and after booking and looking at the photos and reviews I became very tempted to change to the Caribbean resort which was the same price. When we got the hotel I was really glad we didn't. We arrvied around half 6 in the evening after a 9 hour flight. (got through customs quite quickly and used Disney's Magical Express which was wonderful and simple) We we're checked in by an employee from Sheffield Hallam University, which is our local university at home which was quite interesting. He talked us through our dining plan and (after reading reviews on TripAdivsor) I asked if we could have a room located near the reception. He said it wasn't a problem but said we had been put in a recently renovated room and that it wasn't too far from a bus stop. We agreed on the new room and decided to take our own cases there. We ended up in Magnolia terrece, room 8504. I must say, I was impressed. It looked nothing like the photos and was much more updated with a lovely blue bedding and headboards with characters from Princess and The Frog which was a lovely touch, but not over powering. There were a few little things such as a stain on a throw pillow and mark on the bathroom wall but it didn't really bother us. There isn't a wardrobe but the rack seemed to work just fine for us as there were plenty of drawers too. We ordered pizza using the inroom phone which was great and it was with us within about 20 mins, which was great. The TV channels had a decent choice so it provided some great relaxation after a long day. We found that our room was VERY close to the east depo bus station but we mainly used the south depo near the reception as buses seemed more frequent (maybe just our timing) but we never really waited more than 5 mins throughout our holiday for a bus to the parks. It was more crowded coming back but they seemed to have enough coaches, even if it was a little tedious after hours at the parks. The bus service itself was great, we used it to go to EPCOT on most nights so we could 'eat our way around the world' and with them coming back late, we thought it was fantastic. We also surfed a Typhoon Lagoon and chose not to stay. There were no buses back to hotels at this time and a very kind employee took us in his car back to our hotel without any charge, definatly something that made us happy as it was a cool day. The grounds are fantastic and wonderful to walk around. we saw some wonderful wildlife, mainky squirells and frogs and a couple of newts but it was rather refreshing, it was great to just escape all the rush when we were there. We took a few walks down the river on warmer days and also used the water taxi which was again, great. The onsite restaurant was also great and we ate there on our second night. Not a huge menu, but still very nice. The starter bread tastes a lot like victoria sponge cake which we loved. The food court also has a huge selection and I really enjoyed the 'make your own pasta' which was a refreshing choice from the burgers and nuggets. We used the dining plan, which I would recomend to everyone as we were never left hungry and saved a fortune. Meals in the park came to around $16 each and on sit down meals we ended up spending what would have been $130, so it was well worth the extra money. My only real problem was that after the first week we wanted to lay in bed a little longer and during the late morning the pathways are cleaned and it's very loud. If you intend to be out by 10, you won't notice this. The maid cleaned our room every day which made me very happy and we also got some lovely flannel ducks made. Overall I would go back here again and again. It has a wonderful, relaxed atmosphere, and my partner, who wasn't really a Disney fan before going, can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Quality, Disney Prices, Excellent Rennovation”
Reviews.Author: domer2007
Reviews.Content: I've previously stayed at Port Orleans Riverside multiple times and made another return visit with my parents this past week for the Disney Christmas season. In the time between my last visit, the resort has begun (and is currently undergoing) a massive rennovation which has yielded some VERY positive results. That said, if you plan to visit in the next few months, do ask reservations for a room in one of the rennovated buildings, if possible. After that time, I suspect the project will be completed and all rooms will be back up to the quality one would expect from Disney. A few notes to consider with respect to this review (and likely any other for this hotel): 1. You are paying for the convenience of being on the Disney Resort property. Thus, you'll likely find that the rooms are priced according to Disney's normal pricing structure (aka: a bit higher than you'd find on the open market). If that's a problem for you, consider staying off-property or looking for one of the many Disney sales that happen through the year. Otherwise, accept that it's just a bit more expensive to stay at Disney, overall, and move on so you can enjoy your experience. 2. The resort is LARGE. That means you'll have lots of peaceful grounds to stroll, a variety of great photo opportunities and possibly some choice when it comes to room selection. It also means that problems can be a bit trickier to sort out as there are a lot of other guests. So, the good news: the rennovations are simply lovely. During our stay, we stayed in both a rennovated Alligator Bayou room and a Mansion room both of which were expertly done. The more rustic Alligator Bayou rooms contain quaint Mickey-themed quilt bedspreads, nicely detailed tiled floors in the bathrooms and beds that appear to be made of unfinished wood. All rooms have fridges and these are hidden in a nice wooden cabinet next to the new flatscreen television. The Mansion rooms are made to look like southern plantations and carry the charm of the "old south." New, bigger sinks make storage easier, the bathrooms are tiled in bright white which was nicely cleaned for our visit and the new, bigger queen beds have inlaid paintings featuring scenes from the resort. All in all, the changes are most welcome and give the place the fresher, cleaner look one desires from a resort of this nature. As always, service is quick and pleasant here. At busy times, you'll wait a bit for a bus (again, you should expect this from Disney) and there will likely be lines at reception and in most eating areas. That said, service is efficient and we had no difficulty obtaining bellmen to help with luggage, desk clerks to assist with boarding passes and the team of fantastic folks at the on-site airline check-in desk even arrived a few minutes before the posted time of 5:00 AM to help ensure our bags were checked for our flight back home. We did have an issue at check in which was not able to be resolved immediately. That said, I do feel Disney did all they could to fix the situation. My mother has extreme difficulty with stairs and some trouble walking and thus we had paid for a preferred room to ensure we could cut down on walking at the resort. When we arrived (very late at night) we were given a second-floor Alligator Bayou room. We promptly called check-in to request a different room and I was told all rooms were full at that time. That said, the staff said if we could stay there that night, we would be moved to a new room first thing in the morning on the first floor of the Mansion buildings. While we were terribly inconvenienced having to move my mother into the second floor room, the staff was true to their word and a first-floor room was presented to us the next day. They also promptly removed the "preferred room" charges from our bill to compensate for the trouble. All-in-all, I feel they did the best they could to fix the situation. Additionally, I was told that should we visit again, we should absolutely call the Disney special-needs reservation line, a number dedicated to visitors who need additional assistance, and they would ensure that the problem was not repeated. If you are in a situation to need this service, please investigate via the Disney website. I certainly will next visit. The bad news? The resort is often crowded (as one of the more reasonably priced moderate offerings, many families do stay here) and the breakfast hours in the cafateria style section often reflect that. The room is reasonably sized, though, and I never had difficulty finding a place to sit. Food served here is of reasonable quality and priced, again, as one would expect at a theme park. (You're basically a captive while on property so expect to pay for that!) The best deal available, in our opinion, is the large cheese pizza which was surprisingly good (no, seriously, we were shocked) and could easily feed a family of four for about $16. Also, if you're to stay more than a few days and did not bring your own collection of beverages and/or groceries, we suggest the refillable mugs. Four visits to the beverage station at the main building pretty much pays back the investment in the mug. Since we flew in, we found it to be a good deal with respect to the benefits received/cost ratio. Like everything else, the key, we found, was to just ask nicely for anything we needed. Even though the resort was VERY busy for the holidays, we never encountered an instance where someone was unwilling to assist us.

Reviews.Title: “Preferred Room at Port Orleans Riverside”
Reviews.Author: cfudge
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay from Sunday to Friday at POR. We paid for two preferred location rooms and had requested that they be connecting and on the lower level and POR was able to meet all our requests. We were located in Building 18 - Rooms 1811 and 1812 (this was a corner room with the extra window). These rooms have not yet been renovated but Building 14 directly across from us was well into it's renovation so I'm sure it won't be long. We've stayed at POR before and it really is a beautiful resort, especially if you make use of the boat service to Downtown Disney. We'll be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “The best moderate resort on property.”
Reviews.Author: Vikkioria
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, there is nothing like staying on property at DisneyWorld. The perks of the extra magic hours only available to resort guests, transportation, and free parking help make up for the price difference compared to off property resorts. The resort is private and wooded and feels less crowded than any other Orlando hotel I've stayed at, even though we were there for Halloween. The rooms are very nice and comfortable. The resort is very wooded and relaxing. There are several pools on the property and they never seemed over crowded. My one of my only complaints would be that the food court is crowded and set up in a confusing manner. It is difficult to decifer where each line leads. The secret is to go early in the morning or after the rush. My only other complaint is the lack of signage leading to this resort but in the age of gps it's barely an issue. All-in-all I would recommend this resort over all other moderate and value resorts including off property hotels.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok but not perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Tenderpaw01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights. The good: the buildings and grounds were beautiful. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The room was a good size and everything worked well. The annoying: the pillows were small and not that great. The room was clean enough, but it could have been cleaner. It is an older property and i don't think we had a renovated room, so maybe that is a factor. The off season rate we paid was about $30 than a Hampton Inn and considering the benefits of being in a Disney property (transportation, etc), it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: katieanne1977
Reviews.Content: We loved the Port Orleans Riverside resort. It is sometimes described as "rustic" which is not true. We went for a beautiful carriage ride around the grounds, and it has beautifully manicured gardens, wrought iron streetlights, wrought iron gates, beautiful "mansions" along the riverbanks. Our kids loved the warm pool and although it is maybe not THE most exciting pool at the Disney resorts, it is still a lot of fun, has a great slide, and is just perfect for the kids. The staff around the resort were always smiling, very courteous and helpful, and everything was just perfect! The rooms were basic, beds comfortable, and clean. We were in building 25 in the Alligator Bayou. It is not a long walk to the restaurant, the bus depot was 2 min walk around the corner and we had a pool right next to us. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: Rion0712
Reviews.Content: This is the second time that we have stayed at Riverside and were not disappointed. This time we stayed in the Alligator Bayou rooms-which are exellant, and have a rustic feel; I liked these better than the Mansion rooms. The beds were very comfortable. The food court has many choices, one of my favorite is the Mickey waffle with strawberries. The gift shop is also great! One feature that keeps us coming to Port Orleans is their boat service to Downtown Disney. This is such a relaxing ride, and much better than taking the bus. It is also a short walk over to French Quarter. On evening we walked over to French Quarter and had a drink at their lounge (highly recommended is the Tropical Ginger Lemonade [I think that is the name]) and relaxed while looking at the Christmas decorations. The only bad part about the building our room was in is that there was no elevator in that building (some buildings have them and some don't). Overall I was very happy with our stay and highly recommend both Riverside and French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Just one problem”
Reviews.Author: Aaron M
Reviews.Content: Nice,clean hotel with friendly service. But the walls are paper thin. We heard the people in the next room perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, but I wouldn't return.”
Reviews.Author: LConwell
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and nicely decorated, but nothing great. Trying to find our way around was confusing, and we were far from the pool and main lobby where the restaurants were. We did like the boat to Downtown Disney, that was a nice perk. There are several small pools throughout the complex, but they don't have pool towels anywhere except at the main pool, so we had to bring our room towels. I wouldn't come back to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Standard”
Reviews.Author: StephV44
Reviews.Content: The resort is nice, but needs updating. It also needs management to oversee more details. I.E., trash on the ground from dinner the previous evening first thing in the morning the next day. Should have been picked up by then. Washer machines were dirty, lacked cleanliness and maintenance. First load we put into a washer and the machine is busted. Called maintenance, but was told that staff was not on duty to go to the laundry facilities to assist at 8:30 in the morning. We had to truck our way all the way to the front desk to get our money back. Was not happy, because it's a loooooonnnnnggggg walk. Housekeeping failed to replace the basic every day necessities like coffee, cups, take the trash and old glasses, etc., but they did leave some awesome towel animal figures. Why can't the quick service restaurant turn on the toasters in the morning so we don't have to do it ourselves and wait for these huge contraptions to heat up? We would go for breakfast between 7:30-8 and they opened at 7. Most of the days, one of the toasters was broken, which I reported and the other took 4 times to go through the cycle on the lowest speed it had. So, while the place is nice, we won't go back to it. I do NOT recommend anyone with a disability to stay there. Long walks to transportation, restaurants, etc. My mother began to dread leaving her room every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Disney Magic”
Reviews.Author: Flakenbake
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by telling you a bit about myself, I go to Disney, A LOT. So I have stayed at many different Disney hotels. This particular Disney hotel was in the Moderate price range. Being in the Moderate price range means you can go cheap, but still get more of the Disney Magic than you would at the Value resort. Let's do the basics: The room was clean and nicely decorated, the staff was AMAZINGLY nice, the food was good (two food options, one was quick service cafeteria style, the other was a sit down place. The bar had food too, I think?) The maid started doing fun and clever things with our towels it was nice. It was a very nicely maintained property too. We did a lot of the activities they offered, we saw a movie under the stars, watched Bob preform in the bar (Fun, you should see it) rented bike etc. So the resort itself had a lot to do. Transportation. The bus system was good, I never had to wait very long, but sometimes when you just want to get home at the end of the day it was long. The boats to get to Downtown Disney also took a fair amont of time too. But this is to be expected at a Moderate resort, after all the more expensive, the closer to the park. The reason this does not get a 5 out of 5 was the room itself. Our Toliet wouldn't stop flushing and our bed creeked a bit. Neither one of these were HUGE problems because we weren't in the room the whole time. And after we called (twice) someone came to fix it. The walls were also thin. Not paper thin where you could hear every word, but thin enough where you would know something was going on. I would reccomend a prefered room, it's a few bucks more, but it gets you closer to the main building. All in all, if you want the full Disney Magic Cheap, a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Room on arrivial was moldy, musty smelling, one front desk staff rude”
Reviews.Author: JackJohn1948
Reviews.Content: I have been to Disneyworld 22 times, this is my first time I ever had an issue, when arriving on 11-10-11, we had 3 rooms in our party, 2 out of the, 3 were moldy , musty smelling, one room had hair in the tub, when reporting issue with front desk staff {Aimee} she could move us but not together, in another area, or we had to stay we were. we had 2 babies , and one adult that had major surgery on his lung, with severe resp issues..we needed to be near each other, which we had requested , not seperated, the room was moldy couldn.t stay there, after over talking to manager, my agent {Magical vavations } was able to get our rooms moved,next day, we arrived @ 10am we requested on booking, plus on arrivial for 2 pack n play , one in each room, after over 3 calls , then finally @ 9:30 pm after calling the Manger we received the pack n plays, nobody ever called to see if we ,were all set the next day, other area's were great, most of the staff , except for 2 at the front desk was great,

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: BigBigAl
Reviews.Content: We were in Alligator Bayou, bldg. 15. They had started to gut and renovate the bldg next door - much needed. Our room was tired, with poor ventilation - generally clean, but just worn out. Main pool was nice. No internet in public areas - only in room for $10 a day. We had a car - If I were to return, I would stay at an off site hotel and pay the parking. Downtown Disney was not special. I am obviously not a "Disney" person.

Reviews.Title: “Disney, but not magical”
Reviews.Author: snowy1974
Reviews.Content: I always thought staying at a Disney Hotel would be that little bit more special but to be honest it was just like most of the accommodation in Orlando you just get the Disney branding, the ease of being on site and the little extras such as the Magic hours where the park isn't open to non-residents. For what we paid to have a riverview apartment for a week we could have had a nicer apartment on International Drive. Having said that, with two small kids now I will stay at Disney again to make it more special for them. The room was clean and comfortable but had no river view. I queried this and was essentially told that water had to be visible from the window and there was a small pond type area about 50 yards away that I could see if i stood on tiptoes on a chair lol. To be honest that is a minor gripe because I really couldnt care less about the view, but it seemed a slight con. Overall, it's worth staying in Disney for a few nights if you plan it for the days you're going to their parks. Then stay somewhere on Idrive, in Kissimee or LBV.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful holiday!!!!”
Reviews.Author: buntybutler
Reviews.Content: We have just had 2 wonderful weeks at Disney's P.O.R . We had previously read some bad reviews and were a little concerned but were put at ease the minute we arrived in the welcoming lobby area. The staff were very helpful and always available to answer our questions.The hotel grounds are beautifully landscaped(quite romantic).Although it was a good 10minute walk to our room we enjoyed being in Alligator Bayou building 24 as we had a lovely quiet heated swimming pool right by us.(The main pool gets very busy).The Mousekeeping staff were all lovely and very thorough.The in room fridge was very handy as also the coffee maker.The food hall although nearly always busy had enough choice for the times that we ate there.We hardly waited more than 10mins for a bus to any of the parks from the West side Depot.Port Orleans offers various entertainment schedules for families with children who want to relax away from the parks for a while.We have previously stayed at Pop Century and loved it but now would choose Port Orleans Riverside for it's more laid back atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: travelmomof3Kentucky
Reviews.Content: We recently returned for POR and had a wonderful time! When we arrived at 9 am. We were allowed to check in to building 37 which had just opened the day before due to refurbishment. We essentially had a brand new room! It was very well put together but a murphy bed that folded down so that 5 people could sleep in the room. Very, very nice room! It was 2nd floor and a corner room so the extra window made it seem larger :). We always used the North Depot and the bus wait time was minimal. I did notice the South depot was always busy and packed! This was Thanksgiving week so there were always plenty of buses. Food court nice and overall nice general store. My only complaint was that building 37 made us feel like we were out in the boondocks :). I recommend this resort to ALL!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !!”
Reviews.Author: 4thehellofit
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from Port Orleans-Riverside resort in Disney World. We have traveled there several times in the past, and again, were treated to an outstanding vacation. We took advantage of the Magical Express, which wisks you from the Orlando International Airport directly to your resort, and handles all of your baggage for you. We also did "online check-in" which simplifies the process a great deal. We found the room (in the Mansions section) to be spacious, comfortable, and clean. As a bonus, our room was not far from the food court, front desk, store, and dining room portion of the resort. We utilized the fine bus system that Disney provides to travel throughout the entire Disney World complex, and also used the ferry boat to go to the Downtown Disney area. As in the past, we also used the boat systems located within the parks to travel to other portions of Disney World (as example from the "back door" of Epcot to the Boardwalk). We had the Disney Dining plan, and found the food to be outstanding (as usual). With the plan, all we had to worry about was the tip, which makes the experience much simpler. Our personal favorites were Mama Melrose's in Disney Studios, Le Cellier in Epcot, The Wave in the Contemporary, and the Italian Restaurant in Epcot. The park attractions were fun, and all of the staff (called Cast Members by Disney) were friendly, informative, and very accomodating. All in all, this was the experience that we have grown to love and expect, and is the reason that we will undoubtedly return again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room and surroundings!”
Reviews.Author: mrconnelly
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here the week of Thanksgiving in the Acadian House, Magnolia Bend. I had requested a refurbished room and thats exactly what we got! It was so beautiful when we walked in and everything was spotless and brand new. The property was peaceful and where we were was in the back of the property and the walk to the lobby area was so beautiful with the bridges and canal. We took the ferry ride to DTWD and that was great because coming back we could see the fireworks at MK! Everyone was helpful and all the christmas decorations were beautiful!! WE could not have asked for a better place to stay and plan on coming back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Prices for Motel Quality Service”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn T
Reviews.Content: My husbnd and I stayed at Port Orleans Riverside for 3 nights over Labor Day weekend. Although I've come to expect higher hotel prices over holiday periods, this hotel was very overpriced for the quality of service and the quality of the room. We arrived Friday afternoon, a peak arrival time for any holiday wekend, and there were only two staff members checking people in - something that management should have probably better planned for given the number of reservations that they had for Labor Day weekend. The check in line weaved through the entire lobby and out the front door of the hotel. After nearly an hour wait, we finally made it to the front of the line. While checking in, my husband reminded the staff member that we were meeting up with my in-laws, who had checked into Port Orleans a couple of days prior. We booked our Disney trip through Disney Vacations, not through an outside service, and while making the reservation provided the representative with my in-laws reservation number over the phone in order to ensure that our rooms were near each other. This part of the reservation was apparentally "lost" and the "best" that the hotel could do was provide us with a room on the complete opposite side of the hotel in the Alligator Bayou building closest to the lobby, while our in-laws were already checked into Parterre Place in the Magnolia Bend area. This was a no go, and after asking several more times for a room closer to our in-laws, we were finally given a room in Magnolia Terrace, two buildings away from Parterre Place. Better, but still not ideal, especially since the request for adjacent rooms was made at the the time that we booked the trip. This was topped off by overhearing the family next to us trying to check in, whose entire reservation had been lost n the computer system, despite the fact that they had a copy of the reservation paperwork that Disney had sent them. Needless to say, the entire check in process left a bad taste in our mouths. Then, we got to the room, which was very underwhelming considering the price that we were paying to stay there. We hadn't checked any luggage, so we had very little in the way of personal toiletrees. For the price we paid for this hotel, the least I expected was a bottle of shampoo AND a separate bottle of conditioner, but alas, only shampoo was to be found. Considering the room rate was comparable to that of high end hotel chains, I expected to find more at the bathroom sink when we arrived than just a single bottle of shampoo, which wasn't replaced by the maid once during our stay. It is clear that paying the extra money to stay on Disney owned property comes at the cost of sacrificed service. This certainly wasn't a case of "you get what you paid for."

Reviews.Title: “All Dreams Do Not Come True At Disney”
Reviews.Author: Compassrose87
Reviews.Content: I took my mother (age 87) on her first trip to Disney. Wanting it to be as special as possible, I booked a room a a Disney resort, off-season so that the parks would be less crowded. Our dream vacation became a nightmare when the handicapped room that I'd especially requested was not simply a long walk from reception, but up a steep flight of stairs, with no elevator. Needless to say, the room had no handicapped facilities (tub bar, etc.).
