To facilitate a change, I needed to leave my mother alone in an isolated, unfamiliar place in the dark, while I hiked back to reception. The new room, still far away, had a bad chemical smell when the air conditioning was on, which became a burning smell when the heat was on. Repeated calls to reception elicited no response for nearly an hour, when room service came by, offering to spray something on the unit to cover the odour. About 20 minutes after that, two managers showed up and our room was finally changed. My mother was exhausted. Our bags didn't show up for another hour. We'd arrived at 5pm, it was 10:30 at night when things were straightened out enough so that I could finally bring some dinner back to the room. None of the rooms we were offered had facilities for the handicapped, quite a drawback for my mother. The managers had agreed to refund the first night, since we couldn't use our passes. The room was not refunded until I insisted upon it at check-out. Things only got better when I decided to send a few things home by UPS, a service the hotel offered. My UPS bill was under $19.00. The charge to my credit card was over $127.00. The concierge (who pouted when I didn't tip him for weighing my package) had "somehow" overcharged me. He also "forgot" to send the parcel for 5 days. The resort itself is very generic looking. Complaints about the handicapped rooms elicited a response that the booking agency hadn't requested them. Since I personally saw my agent request same, it was simply one more issue. Be aware of this if you're traveling with someone who needs these facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans- Riverside did not disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: homerton
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Port Orleans-Riverside and we were very happy with our stay. Rooms were roomy and nicely appointed. Beds were a bit hard but not awful. Room was comfortable and clean. We were in Building 85 Magnolia Bend with I recommend because we were right next to the quiet pool and walk to lobby and dining was minimal. Bus stop was close also which was important! If you are facing the louder kids pool it may be nosier but not sure you would be able to even hear inside the room. I had to call the front desk for a few questions and they were happy to help me out. Check in was a breeze. We enjoyed Port Orleans-French Quarter last time so I was tempted to stick with it but I think I like Riverside even more mainly because there was another eating option other than the cafeteria style which I am not a fan of personally. Overall great for a Disney Moderate. Not fancy but perfect for a family get a way. I will be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience Overall”
Reviews.Author: ItalyFanNJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November (week before Thanksgiving) for 2 nights. There was 1 glitch which I explain below, but otherwise, we had a wonderful stay. Our room had a river view and was within easy walking distance to the pool area and the food area. Although I imagine that that might not be the case for everyone...the resort is huge so it might be difficult getting around depending on where your room is. The transportation to the parks was great and convenient, although we waited 1/2 hour for the epcot bus. The buses to the other parks seemed to run much more frequently. The river boat was nice but also took a long time to pick us up and then 1/2 hour to downtown disney so plan accordingly...we barely made it to the appointment at the bibbidi bobbidi boutique. Here's the issue I mentioned before. We had 3 adults and 2 children so we were given one of the "older" rooms which could supposedly accomodate that number of guests. The room was dark and dreary, but besides that, it had 2 double beds and a "trundle" that consisted of a small, thin mattress on a piece of metal that slid out from under one of the beds. There was no way 2 adults could fit comfortably on the double bed and there was no way we were letting one of the kids sleep on that contraption on the floor. So, we called the front desk and they very easily agreed to move us to one of the remodeled rooms that had 2 queen beds but proceeded to tell me that someone was going to have to sleep on the floor??? We made do with 2 adults and 1 child on 1 bed and 1 adult and 1 child on the other bed...the comment about someone having to sleep on the floor was unnecessary. Other than that, I really have no complaints. Everyone we encountered was very nice and pleasant and we had a great stay. I would definitely return although I would make sure to ask for one of the remodeled rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location!”
Reviews.Author: Pasoporaqui
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location, great room, nice ambiance...I'd definitely stay here again. It was a little pricey for the room; yet the proximity to Downtown Disney and Epcot is certainly worth it. The professionalism and kindness of their "cast" definitely added to the enjoyment!

Reviews.Title: “Mansions for Me”
Reviews.Author: janiejake
Reviews.Content: Love this resort! Beautiful theming throughout, with wonderful landscaping. A real pleasure to walk around when you're not in your room. So convenient to stay on-site, and this one gives you the added bonus of taking the boat down to Downtown Disney, and enjoy the scenery on the way. We've always stayed on the "Mansion" side of the resort, as this appeals more to us. Across the "river", the Alligator Bayou side is charming, and meant to look a bit more rustic-it's all in the theming. Should you need elevators for anyone in your party (or don't want to haul strollers up the stairs), you need to be Mansion-side. Mansions have elevators, Alligator Bayou lodges do not. But, the Lodges have the advantage of being able to accommodate a 5th person(child) in your party. You're not able to do that on the Mansion side, unless the 5th person is a baby in a pack-n-play. Great food court(Riverside Mill). We have enjoyed the evening entertainment in the Lounge (River Roost). YeeHaw Bob provides a fun show, meant for the whole family-rockin' piano music that involves the audience. Looking forward to another visit here, as the whole resort is undergoing a remodel, and the double beds are being replaced by queens. Once we'd stayed on-site at WDW, we've never considered staying off site again. Definitely worth the extra coin. We've vacationed here multiple times since 1999, and consider it our "home" resort. We've tried a few others...we always come back. It's special. Works for family trips (we've had connecting rooms in the past, when kids were younger), as well as just the two of us. This resort is family-friendly, yet appropriate for adults only, too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: kille003
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean, the staff was amazing, the pools were great! The food at the resort was very good (Boatwrights)! We plan on staying again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to go Back”
Reviews.Author: IanH6
Reviews.Content: Went a couple of years ago, wow! such an amazing place to stay. Large,clean rooms, good choice of food and a good night-time entertainment programme. Also, as it is in Down-Town area of Disney, you can get a boat down to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back.”
Reviews.Author: Dinahgail
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Riverside section and it was very nice. The landscaping was gorgeous. Our room had two double beds which is standard, I would have rather had a queen or king, but it was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: sequinsandstars
Reviews.Content: Just back from a wonderful florida trip!! We checked in after a 3 hour delay on our flight and I really thought we were going to end up with a dreadful room miles away from the main building after reading reviews on here- We were checked in promptly and had newly refurbished rooms in Magnolia Terrace - excellent location as really near the main building, East depot bus stop and the main pool. Beds are very comfortable and all 8 of our party commented on how good they were!! We were on the Disney Dining Plan so used the Riverside Mill Food Court quite a bit - staff were helpful and for me the best food options were the Omlette for breakfast and the pasta for lunch/dinner! Bakery was also good. Never found a problem with seating just tried to avoid the busier times between 8.30 and 10am. Buses were good and frequent - there were 2 occasions when we had to wait about 30 minutes for a bus to Hollywood Studios and Typhoon Lagoon but generally they were prompt. Boat to DTD is a real bonus and great in the evening (sometimes a little cold so take a jacket!!)- also meant that most times I did not have to disturb my 2yr old son if he was sleeping in his stroller as we could wheel it straight on!! (Unlike the buses where you have to collapse the buggy). My only criticism (not a big one but worth a mention!) is that as it is a non smoking hotel in all of the buildings, all of the benches around the property have cigarette bins next to then - not very pleasant when out for a walk with my little boy!! Having said that this is a tiny issue and there is loads going for this resort - its very picturesque and a great location - will definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: FrostyIndiana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at POR in October 2011. Just my husband and I. We loved the property. Our room was on the first floor in Acadian House and it had been recently refurbished. It was absolutely beautiful and felt very elegant. Naturally, all the curtains, shower curtrains and bedspreads were brand new and gorgeous and so were the colors of the walls, carpeting - well everthing! We walked the grounds and it was very relaxing. It was clean and well manicured. We didn't swim so can't comment about the pools. The gift shop was very nice and the cast members working there were helpful and friendly. We drove so we drove to the parks and did not take the bus. The only negative we found was the food court. It is huge and we went to the food court one night at 7:00 to get something to eat and it was very crowded and there were only two cashiers to check people out. Those two lines were almost to the back of the food court where food is ordered. They should have more cashiers at busy times of day which would also include breakfast. Other than that, our stay here was perfect. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value and Themed Experience @ Disney”
Reviews.Author: TampaChristopher
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this resort about 8 times, most recently in October 2011. In addition, I have stayed at the majority of Disney World's other "on property" resorts. Port Orleans Riverside continually delivers the best themed Disney experience for the dollar paid. This means you feel totally immersed in the environment once you check in. As you know from the description, there are two areas, Magnolia Bend (antebellum mansion style) and the "Alligator Bayou". Request the Magnolia Bend if you want the more formal room/building setting which is closer to the front desk, restraunts, and other ammenities. Stay in the "Bayou" if you want solitude and a more relaxed setting. Both are great- each area has access to "quiet pools" while the "feature pool" area is a short walk from everywhere (closer to Magnolia Bend). In my latest stay, I was housed in the Bayou. The only problem I experienced was with my room keys.... The front desk encoded them incorrectly and once in the Bayou, they didnt work. It took Disney front desk staff around 20 min to come out to the room to replace them once alerted (while I was standing outside holding all my luggage near by - not happy). This experience isnt normal but do be aware due to the layout of this resort, any type of assistance is NOT immediate (including but not limited to housekeeping requests). Riverside has a better selection of food items at its informal food court than its sister resort, Port Orleans French Quarter. In addition, Riverside has the on site formal dining option, Boatwrights, which serves Breakfast and Dinner (no lunch). Finally, Riverside offers more in the way of recreation. Riverside is the home of the main marina for both Riverside and Port Orleans. From here you can rent personal "Sea Rayers" and other water craft for sailing down the Sassagoola River all the way to Downtown Disney. Riverside OR French Quarter are both excellent places to bring or rent bicycles. The paved loop around the resort is a couple of miles I believe and a really pretty setting for a leisurely ride. (more serious riders should seek another location for riding). I believe (but cannot confirm) that most rooms contain 2 double size beds. Most couples today find these beds too small. Just something to consider or ask about. I didnt think the comfort of the beds were superior, just average. If I had to say anything negative about this resort, it would the comfort of the beds (which I know is very subjective). Finally, the only other negative comment is lack of wireless internet connectivity. It just amazes me that in today's world, Disney wouldnt have wireless connectivity (at no additional charge) in all of its resorts. I understand that they have made great progress recently in their deluxe and convention resorts but not everywhere (including Riverside). Many vacation spots (and business hotels) now offer wireless internet free of charge - its becoming expected in my opinion). I would strongly encourage Disney to do the same. Overall though, I highly recommend this resort and will be back myself (even with no connectivity to the outside world - maybe that isnt such a bad thing afterall?)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place!”
Reviews.Author: pinkfaerie24
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a two week family holiday, there were 8 of us, at the port Orleans riverside resort. Such a wonderful place, the surroundings are beautiful and the rooms were lovely, spacious and clean and we were lucky to have the newly refurbished rooms. This was our first time in a Disney hotel and would highly recommend this resort, in fact two of our friends stayed in the grand Floridian for 3 nights but weren't that impressed! There were quite a few different pools to choose from, the main pool was very lively and a nice pool bar there, the other pools were quieter and we had one right near our room so that was great! There was a boat service to downtown Disney which was fab, although getting the bus was quicker. Bus service was great, always loads of buses, they would fill up quickly really early in the morning but always seem to put enough buses on to accommodate. Overall we had a fantastic stay here, didn't want to leave, definitely going to go back there! Disney dining plan is highly recommended too as we saved so much on that, food great in our hotel and wolfgang pucks in downtown Disney was a great place to use the DDP. On the last day between myself and my partner we have 13 main meals left and 21 snack credits, we used the snack on sweets to bring home(which would have cost over $100! also if you have main meals left you can ask at your hotel for them to change them to snacks so you can use them up! So highly recommended, not even a bad word to say about Disney or the hotel to be honest! If you stayed here you would have a great disney experience for everyone of all ages! Our group consisted of 8 people, the youngest was 2 and the oldest was 81! So it was great for all of us! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: babyputter
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very clean. Service was fantastic. Every member of the staff went out of their way to make sure we were having a great time. Dining cafeteria was very large, had a wide selection of good food, and was reasonable priced. Transportation was very prompt to all parks by both bus and ferry.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: jennyd08520
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the wonderful Port Orleans Riverside hotel (POR). We were fortunate to stay in one of the renovated rooms in the Magnolia Bend section of the resort. It was beautifully decorated and very quaint. The night before our stay there we stayed one night at the All-Star Sports resort which was decent, the kids really enjoyed all the sports decorations but it doesn't compare to POR. It didn't have the big hotel feel to it, which was important to us. The staff at POR were so friendly and helpful with EVERYTHING. We really enjoyed the grounds and the boat ride too Downtown Disney. The restaurant Boatwrights was very good as well. My kids enjoyed the pool, although the main pool tended to get crowded in the afternoon, so get there early if you want a lounge chair in the sun. The grounds were really breathtaking, and the room was extremely clean. I would definitely stay there again. Just a tip for others traveling during the Wine and Food festival at Epcot, I wouldn't go there on a weekend or with small kids. My kids are 8 and 10 and we couldn't even see the countries at Epcot, the crowds were unbearable as well as all the drunk men and women. Other than that the trip was fantastic, a big part of that was due to our stay at POR. The buses were frequent and we had our own stop right outside our building. Wish had wished we had more time to stay there to enjoy the marshmallow roasts and the outdoor movies on the lawn. Either way it was a blast and I would highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - but did not have time to enjoy it”
Reviews.Author: The_Swede
Reviews.Content: Arrived to the hotel at 9 AM and the room was ready for check-in! We left our bags in the room and headed for the Magic Kingdom. We had to wait some time for the bus, and it was quite crowded. After a full day at the park we returned at 9.30 PM and it was the same story again with a crowded bus. Perhaps a cheaper hotel and paying for parking would be better?

Reviews.Title: “Fun Times, Beautiful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: JMU1997
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6 night stay at the Port Orleans, Riverside. We loved it! I had read about some of the rooms needing updating so when we checked in my husband requested a newly renovated room. They said there were none available. If they hadn't told me that I would have thought my room was newly renovated. It had a flat screen t.v. and was spotlessly clean. I liked the sinks being outside the bathroom and liked the big curtain you could pull to change in privacy. My husband and I went with our three daughters, and while the trundle bed was small, it didn't bother my 9 year old. I can't see putting anyone much older than that on it though. The beds although not a comfy as home were fine. We also were unable to get a room close to a bus stop. But really, what's 5 minutes when your going to be trudging around the parks all day. And the grounds were so beautiful and lush. We stayed at the Pop Century previously and the surroundings here were much prettier. My kids loved the pool, it was great it was open from 7am-Midnight. The water slide did close at 8:00pm though. Nice to let them swim after coming home from the parks. Take some time to enjoy the pool and relax. Running from park to park from open to close is no way to relax. We did take the boat to Downtown Disney. We didn't like Downtown Disney it was crowded and full of overpriced merchandise. The only good part was the Margarita Bar, and the Dinosaur Restaurant was loud and overpriced with yucky food. We saved a ton of money by NOT getting the Dining Plan. We brought cereal and lots of snacks and got milk at the general store. The Liberty Tree Tavern was worth the money, while the Prime Time Cafe did not live up to expectations. I would stay at Port Orleans again, we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet escape at disney”
Reviews.Author: Hannikins
Reviews.Content: we loved staying here. The rooms were a little small but very nice and spotless. Getting to and from the parks was pain free and the boat ride to downdown disney was an added bonus. We loved the walk back to our room each night as the gardens were lovely

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Port Orleans Riverside”
Reviews.Author: Renee C
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Port Orleans several times and have never been disappointed. We especially enjoy the entertainer, Bob Jackson, in the bar. It is a family friendly show and is a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great food at Port Orleans”
Reviews.Author: traveler125
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Port Orleans for 5 nights to take our kids for their first trip to Disney. We loved it there! It is a very large property so you may be walking quite a bit but it is very scenic and beautiful property. We enjoyed eating in the food court there and compared to a few other resorts we thought their food was much better. It is a great value to eat there on the Disney Dining Plan. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Random thoughts on Port Orleans Riverside”
Reviews.Author: Cocobam
Reviews.Content: Hi, our family of 5 has just returned from a wonderful 10-night stay at POR. This was our first stay at a Disney resort, and we picked POR because it was the cheapest option for a family of 5! These are just some random thoughts I thought I would share for others who are interested in POR. We checked in at 1PM, and our room was ready. We were in Alligator Bayou, building #25, first floor. Our room was a fairly long walk from the main building (it seemed longer toting our carry-on luggage), but a nice short walk to the West Bus Depot, where we went much more often. BUSES - Disney did a great job with the buses. I actually tracked how long we had to wait for a bus each time we went to a bus stop (because I'm just that nerdy), and our average wait was 8 minutes, including three times we went before park opening for early breakfast reservations at a restaurant inside the park. We only had one wait longer than 15 minutes - we waited 25 minutes at peak bus time (8:45AM), and when the bus arrived, it was full. Another bus followed shortly. We always used the West Depot (one stop after the South or Main Depot) - buses come around to all the stops at all times, even for early breakfasts. If you just plan on the bus always taking 15 minutes to arrive, you'll usually be pleasantly surprised. Do plan on allowing an hour to get from POR to another resort - that's just about how long it typically took us. BOAT - We took the boat from POR to Downtown Disney once and back from DD twice. It stops at French Quarter both on the way to DD and on the way back. The first boat of the morning is scheduled to depart at 10AM, but the morning we were headed to the dock at 9:50, we saw the boat already leaving, but it was just a short wait for the next one. It was a beautiful boat trip, especially one evening when we returned to POR by boat with a full moon! It passes by the Saratoga Springs Treehouses, which were fun to see. A nice change from buses! NOISE - Alligator Bayou has got to be full of families of 5 with lots of kids, but it was pretty quiet. We rarely heard noise from the rooms around us. The exception was toilet flushing, which we could hear clearly, and thumping when kids ran on the 2nd level outside walkway. BUGS - Sorry to kill the magic, but there were bugs in the room. I wake up long before everyone else, so I sit in the bathroom and read or otherwise entertain myself until the others wake up. I saw one or more bugs in the bathroom every day ranging from tiny (size of a gnat) to small (size of a pencil eraser). We also saw them in the room a few times. I didn't complain to the hotel, because I didn't want them to come squirt poison in the room while we were staying there. And after all, it is Florida - even Disney can't coax the bugs away. There were also LOTS of mosquitos at the bus stop - we all got bitten multiple times while waiting for the bus, especially in the dusky mornings. I never noticed mosquitos elsewhere in the resort or at the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised in an great way.”
Reviews.Author: Brian B
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to WDW the previous year I stayed at animal kingdom lodge, which is their deluxe property and it was a good resort - never the less. I decided to save a few hundred dollars and stay at one of Disney's moderate resorts. Well stepping off the bus I comforted by the beautiful exterior which one would expect from Disney. The front lobby was beautiful, tasteful and vast, check in was effortless quick and easy I was told I was getting one of the recently re-furbished rooms in the "acadian house" only draw back is a moderate walk to the building, but the landscape and water lined walk ways make up for the walk. Upon arriving at the Acadian building which faced a nice calm waterway was beautiful and a plus was that we had a smaller private pool right next to our building. Upon entering the room they did not mislead what so ever clean new carpet brand new t.v. furniture nice double sink granite counter tops and an average water closest but the nice feature with the tub area was that it had a big ledge that you could sit on and soak your feet after a long day of walking, and also ample storage for all your shampoos and soaps etc etc etc. The room was also a quick 1 minute walk to one one the 4 bus stops through out the property. Overall extremely pleased with this resort. Would return for my next visit with out a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay at Disney World”
Reviews.Author: hrmills71
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Port Orleans Riverside many times over the years and it is my most favorite place to stay on property. The size of the room is just right, the beds are comfortable, there is an complimentary refridgerator in the room, the rooms are QUIET, and the grounds are beautiful. It's a quick walk to the pools, boats to the market place, bus stop, and to the food court. The food court has pleanty of choices to please even the most picky. I have stayed at levels of Disney resorts from the deluxe to the value, and this is by and far my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans Riverside Best Bet”
Reviews.Author: Dap987
Reviews.Content: As far as value, location and amenities you need to look no further. On Disneys moderate price scale , the rooms and grounds are spotless. Short bus waits and rides to the parks are key. Don't forget to try the river shuttle boat rides to Downtown Disney they have for the shops and dining. Great scenery and very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great first Disney resort experience!”
Reviews.Author: ronniesherard
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out, we had an amazing experience! To start, we arrived a bit later than we had planned. However, since we had checked into the resort early via the online check-in, the front desk had everything in order for us. From parking the van to having my room key took less than five minutes! And, the gentleman behind the counter gladly answered a few of my questions to make sure we were all set! The buildings for the guest rooms are modeled after old, southern-style mansions, so we were in awe by the shear size of the resort. Our room was clean, had a rustic feel with the decor, and the beds slept GREAT! There was a TV, refrigerator, and coffee pot in our room. So, a few amenities from home, but not required since we were out all weekend. A big plus was the in-room safe to lock up our valuables. With a dining plan and credit card on file with the resort, we didn't need to carry around our wallets or cash! If you want to relax a bit while you are there, you can rent a boat or four-person bicycle at the marina. We did neither, as we were too busy at the parks with the kids. However, we did see a few families with the bicycles and they look like a LOT of fun! The main lobby area also has an arcade for the kids, a lounge for the adults, a food court, and a restaurant. The entire place was simply amazing! We will definitely be back, hopefully sooner rather than later!

Reviews.Title: “How we saved money at this beautiful resort.”
Reviews.Author: Momsthebest
Reviews.Content: We returned today from our family holiday to Walt Disney World and I wanted to share with others immediately my thoughts on our stay. First and foremost, we saved a ton of money by planning ahead & using recommendations I had read on trip advisor about buying groceries online. I used wegoshop.com. Amy not only met my expectations, but exceeded them. I visited her website and chose her because she would shop where I wanted her to and pick up the items I requested - unlike other choices I found online. In addition to regular grocery items, I had her pick up beer and wine for me as well. We met her out front of the hotel at the time mutually agreed upon and had bell services assist us with delivery to our rooms. I packed our toaster from home as well. This tip allowed us to eat breakfast in our room, pack a healthy lunch and snacks for the day. We ate in the hotel restaurants each night for dinner. We found the resort to be everything we expected. Clean rooms, friendly staff, and very scenic. We enjoyed the ferry boat to Downtown Disney, which was a nice option. When heading to the theme parks in the morning you are best to walk to the South Terminal for pick up - once the bus is full at this terminal it will not carry on to the West, North and East Terminals. One more thought on transportation, the Disney Magical Express bus from the airport - once you have your luggage, find the registration desk to receive your boarding passes! This will save you a fair amount of time when trying to board the bus with out your pass...

Reviews.Title: “Great room for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: mtngirl_7
Reviews.Content: Our first time staying on a moderate Disney property and it was nice! We always stay at Wilderness Lodge or Animal Kingdom, but for the price we may stay again. Room are newly upgraded, very clean and plenty of room. The only down fall is having to check in, then drive to your room. No valet service, but other than that it is a beautiful property. What a savings on money this time!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely it!”
Reviews.Author: djd73
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've visited this hotel. The first time was in May 2009. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves - the hotel, parks, everything, was 'just magical', just like Disney is!!! We really want to go back again, just have to save those pennies! The food is nice, and there's something for everyone. We particularly liked the turkey and their gravy, and corn cake (think this is what it was called). The swimming pools were good, clean. All staff were friendly and polite, everything was clean and tidy, we experienced no problems at all. We stayed in Magnolia Mansions (room 800 and something - sorry can't remember exactly), and we walked down for breakfast every morning (some have moaned that it was a long walk, but we honestly didn't think it was - you're on holiday, enjoying yourselves, the sun is out, it's a nice gentle walk; the walk only seemed to take no longer than 3 minutes). And coming back from the parks we got off at the North Depot (bus stop), and it was a very very short walk to our room - just what you want when you've had a hectic (but fun) day. The only downside to this hotel was the pillows on your bed. They were hard and thick (high up), which we just could not sleep on. We asked the maid for smaller ones, which she did manage to get, though they were still big they were much better than the originals. So, if we go back I would have to take my own pillows. The rooms were dark as well, we always had to have the lights on. Though this is not a problem - who goes to Disney (or even on holiday itself) to stay in your room all the time? Overall, this is a fantastic hotel, I would recommend it to family and friends, and would go back there in a flash without any hesitation. I give it a 10 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Cruisesinc92
Reviews.Content: Very large resort. Beautiful landscaping. Park bus's frequent enough although standing room only at popular times. Nice boat to downtown disney. Both restaurants pricy but that is WDW. We enjoyed it as a couple but there were mostly families enjoying the pools.

Reviews.Title: “FUN AND ROMANTIC AT ONCE!!”
Reviews.Author: Malibu_Barbie_JennyW
Reviews.Content: I have been to Disney's Port Orleans Riverside 3 times and each time I've been, it has lived up and excelled past expected standards... The front desk staff are polite, courteous and helpful. The restaurants are welcoming and delicious. The lounge is perfect for a pre or post dinner cocktail and the menus will accompany any craving. My personal favourite is the jambalaya. Very tasty. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Stay!”
Reviews.Author: OttawaDevine
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for the value. Rooms are spacious and clean. Each room has a microwave and fridge. Beds are very comfortable. The ability to take a boat to downtown Disney is also a great amenity. There are smaller heated community pools at Riverside. The larger themed serpant pool is in the french quarter, which you can walk to or take the boat over.Front desk staff very friendly and helpful. The on site restaurants are o.k. and will provide the basics with child friendly items. One is a cafeteria style, the other sit down format. Overall great stay. Would recommend for families on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it! (except for the bus wait time)”
Reviews.Author: EAmering
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many Disney properties before (Animal Kingdom lodge, Polynesian, Pop Century, Carribean Beach and Coronodo Springs), and this was one of my daughter's favorites- she loved the hug swimming pool with slides, and we all loved the lush grounds and pretty scenery. The room we had was nice and clean and tucked away among pretty trees- we stayed in the Alligator Bayou rooms, which are more rustic and surrounded by nature. The food court was pretty standard...very similar to the other food courts at disney with a wide variety of foods & not as crowded as the Pop Century. The gift shop was very large with many offerings, and we also had fun at the arcade (all within the hotel). Our only complaint is that the bus line from the parks back to the holtel was always very long (so long that we would have had to wait over an hour....so instead we took the bus back to the Port Orleans resort, and then took the free water ferry over to our hotel- it was actually quite enjoyable but still took a bit of time....shorter than waiting for the bus though). Front desk guy didn't live up to the disney standard of friendliness in my opinion, but everyone else was great. We would stay there again, but for young kids, I would recommend Pop Century (just a little more lively there). Port Orleans Riverside is very relaxing....we woudl stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Way better than expected”
Reviews.Author: jeremieblust
Reviews.Content: First off let me say this, this place is beautiful! the grounds, the buildings, all recreate a South Carolinian ambiance that I did not expect. The pool is fantastic with a large deck and plety of chairs, but don't forget about the poolside bar, probably the best on Disney property. The food oniste was also better than expected. We ate lunch here on one day, and if on the dining plan, your options are huge. For desert that have huge pasteries, ice crream and other items that I was shocked were part of the dining plan. This also seems to be one of the few Disney Resorts with nighttime enterainment. In the hotel bar, I don't remember his name, but the show that he puts on is very entertaining for the whole family. Downsides -- rooms were cramped (we had 5) and decor needed updating, however from what I understand, they are currently refurbing the rooms, so this may not apply any longer. I've stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge (twice) Wlderness Lodge and here, and this is actually my favorite!

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Kristenlemley
Reviews.Content: Incredible. The service was fantastic. We stayed for 4 nights, and felt like we knew the employees when we left! The maids made the kids towel animals, the greeter knew our name. Very clean, fun kids activities every day, and you can request a room facing the river. You can also take the riverboat to downtown Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: timeout23
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside property October 2011. Read some reviews of outdated and dirty rooms, but was pleasantly surprised that the rooms were quite nice. The scenery and grounds were beautiful and peaceful. Spent one of the mornings taking a stroll around. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to stay anywhere else!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sue_asselstine
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here 2 separate times now, and we absolutely love it (last trip was Nov 2010)!!! No matter where your room is, everything is within walking distance (it is a large resort, but everything's pretty close). I love everything about it - the walkways, the Sassagoula River, the beautiful Plantatation-like mansions, etc....we love taking the boat to Downtown Disney, too, it's so fun!!! This resort has it all - quiet areas, the arcade, a great food court, a great main pool, and a few bus stops throughout so you don't have to trek all the way to the main bus area if you don't want. We'll be coming here as long as it stays open!

Reviews.Title: “A very relaxing and beautiful resort at WDW!”
Reviews.Author: UNCNate
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 (2 adults and 2 children) stayed at this resort for 4 nights in the Alligator Bayou section. We absolutely loved this resort, especially how the Alligator Bayou rooms are set back in a more secluded area of the resort to make it look like you are truly far back in the Bayou region of southern Louisiana. You will need to do a little walking to get to the main area of the resort (e.g. lobby, restaurants, pools and bus stops) but at worst your walk to any of these spots shouldn't take more than 5 minutes and it's probably less than that for most Bayou rooms. Our room was very clean and the decor was fine (not elegant but very cozy). We appreciated housekeeping coming in every day to tidy up our things, make the bed, replace linens and they always left our kids with a treat of towel creatures or mickey ears on the bed. When we had the air conditioning unit on, it was a little smelly (musty). That just tells me that they need to replace the older AC units in these rooms, which I'm sure is part of their re-furbishment plans that they are currently doing at PO Riverside. What's extra nice is that you can take advantage of all the amenities at PO-French Quarter by staying at Riverside, and vice versa. You can either walk over to French Quarter (which I wouldn't recommend) or take the boat up the river for a short 5 minutes if you are car-less. We had our car, which made the 2 minute hop b/t resort sides very easy. We loved both main pools at Riverside and FQ and used both. The slides were a speical treat for our thrill seeking kids, and the pool activities in the late afternoon was also fun for both our 6 and 9 year olds. We also ate at both food courts, and thought food selection was great. Make sure you check out the bakery at the FQ food court. Yummie! My only dissapointment about Port Orleans is the upscale restaurant - Boatrights. I expected a little more, but the food was still pretty good (our service was not too good that night). The kids menu choices with the dining plan were fast food-like only (pizza, corn dogs, etc). That was very dissapointing for us, considering our kids like trying out different foods and we would've liked to seen something like shrimp jambalya or something else Cajun-sytle on their menu similar to what was on our adult menu options. You will love taking the boat up the river to Downtown Disney (esp. at dusk), for free. The bus stop delays were aggrevating, but aren't they all that way across the WDW resorts. We waited for 20 minutes both times we chose to ride the bus instead of take our car, but I don't think that's any reflection on the resort itself. All in all, it's a great resort and we can't wait to stay at Port Orleans again! Well worth the extra few dollars to upgrade from value to moderate resort (you're already spending a mini-fortune to take a WDW trip anyway, so afford yourself a little extra comfort and scenery).

Reviews.Title: “Ranks among the best (and above French Quarter)”
Reviews.Author: dstephendesign
Reviews.Content: As a visitor the year Disney World opened in 71 and someone who has been back more times than I can count, I've stayed in so many hotels both on and off Disney property. Port Orleans Riverside ranks among the best (and above French Quarter)...the grounds, buildings and general setting is just beautiful...quite possibly the prettiest hotel campus in Disney (remember, I've stayed in almost all of them). It really is that pretty. Even the lobby/main building, while not as nice as The Grand Floridian, is really a nice lobby, restaurant etc. As for the rooms...nothing special here but I think this goes for most of the hotels ON Disney property...I've found nicer ones OFF Disney Property. The photos found on here and other places clearly show what they look like....they are nice but nothing fancy. They DID have a refrigerator which was convenient when coming back late with some left overs and a place to keep water cold. As for buildings to stay in...Magnolia bend area...Oak Manor would be my choice again and definitely go for the water view for sure (those can be a longer walk from the parking lot but a closer walk to the pool or the main lobby building). Oh...and the general location of this hotels is VERY convenient. VERY short bus ride to downtown disney or parks....OR you can take a the boat or your car to Downtown Disney -both very close

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Alpine524
Reviews.Content: We originally checked into two rooms at Nickelodeon Suites, and after having problem after problem and encountering numerous disappointments and roadblocks from staff, we left. Luckily, Disney had two adjoining rooms available for a four-night stay for our party of 7. The reservation staff was on their game and had our room within minutes of my call. The check-in staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were beautiful, clean, and near one of the great pools. The food in the large dining room was excellent each time we ate there, and the staff even located balloons and a special cake, and sang happy birthday to our daugher. Each staff person we encountered went out of their way to make our stay great. We had our four kids ages 4, 7, 10, and 13, along with mom-in law with us, and the rooms were roomy enough and very comfortable. The plug-in internet was convenient and worked well. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to access the magic”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Virgin Holidays traveler
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans Riverside was a great location for our two week holiday to Disney. Check in was easy with the online check in service and our room was really comfortable and ideal for our stay. The location of our block was right next to the river and was lovely walking along it each day. Loved the pop up cinema that they had every night to show films sitting outside on the grass. Brilliant hotel and just ideal for popping around the Disney resort on the busses Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “fab stay as expected”
Reviews.Author: riversway1
Reviews.Content: this was our second time here, were were there in august for 3 wks, all the rooms are being refurbished, very nice they are as well, as always disney can not enough to make your stay enjoyable, would recommend the dinning plan well worth the money

Reviews.Title: “The Magic Of Disney”
Reviews.Author: jpalm2p
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Port Orleans-Riverside in May 2008 and loved every minuted of it. The grounds are extremely well kept and a stroll through them to the old mill is nothing short of amazing. the room was extremly nice as well and captured the old south relatively well. We went on our honey moon here and returned one evening to an autographed Minnie and Mickey picture congratulating us on our wedding, it was a nice touch. Easy access to Disney buses that take you any where in the park you want to go and friendly staff to boot! Will be staying here again in Summer 2012!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Resort”
Reviews.Author: Paula G
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful 2 weeks at Port Orleans Riverside. Newly refurbished room 8054 (building 80 Arcadian House). Room was clean and cleanliness was maintained daily. Would recommend building 80 as it was perfectly placed to enjoy all ammeneties and some other buildings are far removed from restraunts, lobby etc. Good family entertainment schedule daily at the main swimming pool - my daughter loved the 3 o'clock pool parties on day off from the parks. Fairly good choice of food - all cooked fresh. The pasta was a treat, huge portions big enough for 2 to share. Quick service dining plan worked really well. (Food in parks was generally hot dogs, burgers, pizzas etc but do your homework first and you can find excellent nutritious food at Epcot and Animal Kingdom on qick service plan). Hotel were always keen to offer advice on how to get the best out of the plan (have refillable mugs in resort but pick up bottled drinks as part of your dining plan allowance to use in the parks). Landscaping was lovely and every walk to breakfast involved either squirrel, spider or turtle spotting. Perfectly placed for a lovely riverboat trip to downtown disney. Would have no hesitation in recommending Port Oreans Riverside.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay at this Disney hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eastbourne101
Reviews.Content: Had a river facing room in block 14, close to the main pool and restaurant. Room was very clean and comfortable and had everything you could reasonably expect. Coffee machine supplies were topped up every day and fresh soaps etc left when needed. The main restaurant area was always busy but we always found a table during our stay and rarely had to queue for long to be served at the counters or at the till. The parks were all a bus ride a way and the journey varied from 20 to 30 minutes. The buses were usually busy but we never waited for very long before one came along. Stayed here 9 nights and would certainly consider the hotel again for any future Disney stays.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay as Usual”
Reviews.Author: Minnesota_Traveler09
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay here in the second week of October for a family trip. First of all our family has stayed here many times over the years, and the past few times we stayed the hotel was beginning to show its age. This time, I was pleasantly surprised, I walked into our room, which was in the Magnolia Terrace House, and it was completely remolded. New TV, new carpet, new beds, a vast improvement over the past. The room was very comfortable, the only complaint was how they had boxed the air conditioner. The vets all point off to one side, so the person sleeping in that bed is frozen, while the rest of the room does not get as much Air. While it did stay cool (It was in the high 80's, low 90's while we were there), it was frustrating not being able to shift the vents to another direction. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “our favorite moderate resort at Disney”
Reviews.Author: randallfamily8
Reviews.Content: We love this resort and its convenient location near Epcot and Downtown Disney. The rooms are standard Disney (a little small), but just fine for our family of four. The pool areas are great and the food court is adequate. Be sure to take advantage of the free boat shuttle to Downtown Disney. The grounds here are just amazing, so even thought you may end up doing a lot of walking, the scenery along the way is beautiful. And DO NOT MISS the piano man at the Riverside Bar at night. The show is free and one of the best I've ever seen on Disney property. Have Fun...it is Disney, after all :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: ALH57
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful holiday in Disney. We've stayed at Caribbean Beach many times and French Quarter but it was our first time at Riverside and we enjoyed it. Rooms were clean and had everything we needed. We had the free Disney Dinning Plan that we upgraded to include a daily table service meal and found it to be excellent value. We didn't manage to eat all the snacks so was pleased to see that we could use them to buy Disney sweets to bring home. I was concerned about the buses after reading reviews but we had no problems. The buses were frequent and we never had to wait longer than 20 minutes, generally the wait was less. At night the buses were crowded and so we had to stand but it wasn't a problem. The only thing that surprised us on this trip that we haven't had before was the mossies. I've been to Disney many times in October but don't ever remember being bitten so much. Also found this October to be busier than previous Octobers. All in all a great resort but I think we'll be going back to Caribbean Beach in future.

Reviews.Title: “Won't go back unless renovated and updated”
Reviews.Author: shezwhitey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans Riverside. First off, I don't know if the buses to the parks are just random or if there is some sort of order but it didn't make sense. Several times 2 buses would show up at the same stop right after each other, as in both stopped at the same time destined for the same park. Meanwhile there are a bunch of people standing around for buses to other parks. As for the room, the best part of the room is that I didn't hear anybody else around us. The bathroom is too small and always seemed damp. FIrst thing we saw when we opened the door for the first time were a pair of cockroaches. There were holes in the comforters and the carpeting was warn to the point of looking like it was in need of repair near the tile floor. The 2 pedestal sink design is not good considering those should be in the bathroom. The bathroom should just be bigger. There is no closet and no Wireless Internet. The beds seemed small and weren't very comfortable. Needless to say we won't be staying there anymore nor would I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “I Loved Riverside!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gaelicmom3
Reviews.Content: I just returned from another visit to Walt Disney World in Orlando. This trip we stayed at Port Orleans, Riverside. This is a Disney resort, on property, in the moderate category. I really enjoyed Riverside. Our room was in Alligator Bayou (Building 17), one of the two areas at Riverside. I loved the lush vegetation in the landscaping and the feeling of being in an exotic place. You do not see building after building, and cement, you see the beauty of the outdoors that Disney does so well. Just walking around the resort was relaxing. Our check in was easy even though our name was misspelled. The cast member was able to find it by the reservation number. One piece of advice, always have your reservation number, for resort and dining reservations!! That way they can find you no matter what!! Don't assume you can be found just with your name. Our room was quite spacious and had all we needed. Besides the 2 queen beds there was a table and 2 chairs, small fridge, plenty of drawer space for clothing, and lots of towels were provided. Our "mousekeeping" service was great. My daughter sleeps in and we were never bothered because we put the do not disturb sign on the door. However, when we returned later in the evening our room was always clean and fresh. I still say the only drawback to staying on property is you have to pay for internet. I have checked off property hotels and some have free internet yet some also charge. I would rather be on property. We did not use the buses this time so I cannot comment on that. There is also a boat that takes you to the Downtown Disney area, and I love the boat rides. My trips to the food court showed me that it is better to avoid the busy eating times because this is a large resort and you are going to find lines. If I went in during the breakfast rush (while darling daughter was sleeping) it was quite overwhelming, many families with many kids!! But when I was there later in the morning, say after 10am, it was no problem at all. If you can, either eat a light breakfast in your room or go to the place (park) you are visiting that day and eat breakfast there. I was however pleased with the offerings at this food court, as they are different at the various resorts. I liked this set up much better than Coronado Springs, another moderate resort at WDW. I LOVED the "build your own yogurt parfait" station. A fabulous breakfast, rich in protein, for under $5. Yum!! Great raspberries! I would have to say that Riverside is now my favorite resort, with the exception of the Wilderness cabins, but that is a different type of experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good not great”
Reviews.Author: starshine296
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Disney resort about once a year and always try to stay at a different hotel on property each time. This year we decided on Riverside. At first we noticed all of the positives...great food court, beautiful grounds, decent location to the Disney attractions that we tend to find ourselves at most often (magic kingdom and epcot). And we knew that many people complain about the size so we were pretty concerned before we got there, but I would encourage people to look past this because it really isnt so bad. Anyway, a day or two in we did start to get tired of all buses all the time and we noticed just how ragged the towels were (one had a yellow stain on it-ick!). The walls are really thin and if you're like us and the people abive you are up all night in the bathroom, you will know it! With all that said, I would still rather stay at Riverside and have the convenience of being on site as opposed to staying at a nicer hotel off property. But thats just a personal preference. However, we are not planning to stay at Riverside again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: BOb07544
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans Riverside is a very nice and quiet place for a romantic retreat and what better place than the Walt Disney Resorts. The rooms are a nice size for two without running into each other getting dressed. The bathroom is a little small. The views are quite nice with woods and pool views. The staff is both considerate and helpful. The bus transportation runs about every 20 mts. so not a problem getting to the parks. Love the main pool. The food court has a nice selection to choose from for snacks and meals. We love it and plan to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant visit during the marathon weekend”
Reviews.Author: travln-beegees
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 2 year old daughter and I have traveled every January to Disney for the last two years for the marathon weekend. Last year we stayed at the value resorts and this year because we were traveling with my mom and brother we decided to step it up just a little bit. So, we chose the Port Orleans - Riverside. We took the Magical Express from the airport to the resort and barely had to stand in line which was a nice change because last year the line was really long. When we pulled up to the resort, you automatically get that feeling that you're on vacation. Everyone was "dressed for the occasion". The grounds lived up to the part. There were no lines at the registration desk and everyone was super friendly. As you can imagine, there are hundreds of rooms, but although we checked in at 11 a.m., we were still given access to our room. It was quite a hike to the room and it was quite confusing to actually find the room. When we walked in, my husband and I were kind of shocked at how similar it was to our room at the value resort. The only noticeable difference was the furniture was themed, but the room size was the same...or that's the way if felt! Once we got settled in, we walked to the bus stop to catch a ride over to the Animal Kingdom...that took a almost an hour! Buses to other attractions such as Magic Kingdom, Downtown Disney or EPCOT seemed to come through more regularly. Getting back wasn't as difficult probably because they anticipate the big crowds at the end of the day. Next leads me back to meals. The Riverside has cafeteria style dining as well as a bar and full service restaurant. We tried all three during our 5 night stay and we were thankful for the choices. It was of course overpriced and the quality was mediocre at best. The piano player in the bar was fun to listen to and he really got the crowd into it. For those that are thinking of staying here during the marathon weekend, give yourself a little more time if you're going to use the shuttle buses. My husband was able to get something quick to eat in the cafeteria before heading to the marathon, but the buses weren't running very often so he was afraid he'd miss the start of the race. The bottom line...remember you're on vacation. Try to relax and just go with the flow. Pros: Very friendly staff, several choices for food, clean rooms with daily cleaning services, grounds are well manicured and there are different activities throughout the hotel. Cons: Size of rooms aren't any different than value resorts, rooms need updating, food was hit and miss, often long waits for the buses and buses are often overcrowded.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, like Savannah”
Reviews.Author: Sheriff3477
Reviews.Content: For being a moderate resort, you will feel like you are in the most amazing deluxe resort. This hotel reminded my wife and I so much of our honeymoon to Savannah, GA. The resort is beautiful and laid back. The service was great, the room was clean, and the amenities were on par with a deluxe resort. Be sure to see Bob Jackson's music show in the main building, River Roost Lounge, Wed-Sat 830P-12A. What an amazing time, we miss it there already! The carriage ride through the resort was a nice treat too for the romantics. Gluten-free pizza available in the outstanding food court, as are gf cookies.

Reviews.Title: “Disney hotel”
Reviews.Author: margshel
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Port Orleans Riverside late evening. We had requested one of the newly renovated rooms in the mansions. However the rooms were full and to make up for our disappointment we were allocated an upgraded room with a river view at Parterre Place. The room was lovely, very comfortable and very close to all amenities. Lovely animals left by the maid made up from towels. We just had to cross the bridge over the river and walk a few yards to be at reception and the dining areas. Just past there were the bus stands. We bought the Disney refillable mugs (about 15 dollars each). You can refill these as much as you want whilst staying at the resort. These were well worth the investment. Never drunk as much diet coke in my life! We had breakfast in our room with cereal we had brought with us from home. Just bought some milk at Fultons General store on site. This enabled us to have a quick start every morning. Mostly we ate our evening meal in the quick service dining restaurant. We shared meals which was plenty for us. We especially enjoyed the pasta and marinara sauce. Great choices here for sauces and additions. Far too much pasta for one person. Our favourite sweet was the cherry cobbler with the addition of ice cream. Often we saved this to order on our return from the parks in the evening. Although there are many complaints on here about the Disney buses we must say that most of the time we had no problems. The only night we had a long wait was from Downtown Disney when the rain was lashing down(did this for 48 hours).

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: sb2001
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried after seeing so many horrible reviews on here! Firstly, I cannot disagree with them more! The grounds are absolutely stunning and are maintained very well. Each and every cast member was attentive, helpful, polite and couldn't do any more for us. We stayed in room 8005 Acadian house (I think it had just been renovated) and the room was very clean, bright, comfy, airy and just a very short walk to the main reception and food court. There were only 2 of us (adults) in the room and we had plenty of space but not much in the way of storage space - families may struggle but we didn't have any issues. Disney buses were superb, we rarely waited over ten minutes but I would definitely recommend using the main bus stop near reception for getting to the parks in the morning as they did regularly miss the other stops and go straight to the parks. Even coming home after fantasmic, fireworks or late stays we never waited long for a bus an the north bus stop was so close to our room after a long day on our feet! Food was good - definitely try the create your own pasta - delicious and enough to feed two hungry adults! Using the dining plan took a while to get used to but staff were patient and happy to help and explain. To sum up our stay - simply magical!

Reviews.Title: “Bus lines are long!!!!”
Reviews.Author: laguirre3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and Disney transportation would pass every 25 minutes!! The lines were super long, wait time of 35+ minutes and that's when the park is still open. Good luck finding a seat on the bus!! Never again will I stay here. Besides the long lines, the hotel was very average:(

Reviews.Title: “Another magical trip!”
Reviews.Author: KJPrincess
Reviews.Content: Second visit to this hotel... 1st was 2000. Stayed in the mansions both times. Used the main bus stop and only waited more than 20 mins once. Got a seat on the bus everytime except for the last day. Was there for six. Not usually a food court person, but this one had so much variety. Our party really liked the "make your own pasta bar.". Most beautiful grounds of all Disney resorts. Only bad part was waiting six hours after I checked in to get my luggage... They blamed the rain. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best value of any Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: brusselsdaniel
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans Riverside is one of Disneys' "Moderate" resort properties, but is always highly ranked among visitors. I read dozens and dozens of reviews before I chose to stay here with my girlfriend for a birthday weekend at Disney. The Riverside property has gorgeous landscaping, a property with two distinct feeling areas (the plantation style buildings and more backwoods bayou type housing). The rooms are essentially the same in both, but both seemed great. We loved our room in the Parterre building. It was a bit worn around the edges, but everything was very clean. I read recently that they are in the process of renovating all of the Port Orleans rooms, so my only negative comment is probably nullified by that work. I guess the only thing I can say is that I wish they had started renovations BEFORE we stayed there! The center of the property has a food court and a sit down restaurant, as well as a swimming pool. The pool looked really fun, but we weren't around long enough to really take advantage of that. One morning we walked from Riverside down to the French Quarter sister property for a begnet breakfast. They were not quite up to the New Orleans standard, but they were close enough that we could pretend a little bit! It was an easy 10 minute walk to the other property along the property's river (actually a canal I think). In any case, the overall stay was fantastic and we can't recommend it highly enough. This will definitely be at the top of my list for our next Disney stay!

Reviews.Title: “First time at Riverside”
Reviews.Author: laura l
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a Disney trip. It was our first time there together and at the Riverside. The resort is absolutely beautiful. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The grounds are amazing. I don't know when we will go back but, when we do, I hope to stay there again. I cannot say enough great things about it. There was plenty of activities for the kids on the little bit of down time we had, My kids loved the pools, the game room and the surrey rental, which was a blast, and a great way to end our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay.”
Reviews.Author: mrs_fk
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fab 14 night stay. Check in was very quick. I was in the Oak Mansions building. This was peaceful and close to all we needed. The room was functional and clean, and although it was next to the pool we were plesantly suprised as you could not hear anything in our room. The boat to downtown disney was lovely. Infact all the disney transport was good. The dining plan was very good and saved us alot of money. The foodhall was also good with alot of choice. Altogether i have no complaints and was very happy with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “One of our new favorites!”
Reviews.Author: E.S.B.Statesboro
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Yacht Club, Wilderness Lodge and Fort Wilderness Campground, I can say this one's right up there with them all. We visited Oct. 12-15. The resort is broke down into the "Mansions" and the "Alligator Bayou" areas. We asked for one of the newly refurbished rooms in the Acadian House Mansion. It was absolutley perfect. The rooms are a nice size for a family of four. Everything was new....beds, furniture, carpeting, paint, bathroom. The beds were very comfortable. We were in room 8230 right beside the Northside Bus Stop. The main pool was just a short walk away through the beautiful manicured grounds. The main pool was a generous size. Nice big kiddie pool as well. There's a fun water slide for the kids and pool bar for drinks. There's also a quiet pool between several of the buildings throughout the resort but the one closest to ours was closed due to repairs. The main common buildings were just a short walk from the pool... general store, food court, restaurant, marina.and check-in area. Having visited many different resort dining options over the years, this is one of the BEST food courts at Disney. Riverside Mill is the "Quick Dining" option and has something for everyone....a grill for burgers, chicken sandwiches, battered fish, fries, a sandwich area for deli and soups, a pizza area, a create your own pasta area and a bakery/ice cream area. Loved, loved, loved the pasta area! We didn't visit Boatwright's Dining Hall (casual dining restaurant). The piano bar was packed our last night and standing room only. Kids and parents all singing along. Was a blast! The boat ride to Downtown Disney is very convenient and the bus stops were never too crowded. I am so pleased we gave this resort a try. I can't speak for the rooms not yet refurbished but ours was new, clean and felt like home! p.s. For one of the best breakfast meals at Disney, try the Kona Cafe. We've visited before and it's amazing every time! See separate review for that.

Reviews.Title: “Cant wait to stay again”
Reviews.Author: thinktink79
Reviews.Content: We LOVE Disney world and have been every year if not twice a year since our honeymoon. We stayed here during our honeymoon in 2006. It was great then and now with the new renovations we cannot wait to stay again Christmas of 2012. This location is great for parties with up to 5 persons, especially now that instead of the trundle bed you get a Murphy style bed.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans Riverside Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tomatoworm95
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed a fantastic week at the WDW Port Orleans Riverside. The property is laid out with a main building that houses the front desk, the main transportation pick up- drop off depot, a gift shop, a sit down restaurant, a bar and a buffet. We were on the Disney Dining plan, so we ate a couple of breakfasts and 1 late lunch in the buffet. The food was great, especially the design your own pasta bar. The actual rooms are set up in small buildings with swimming pools conveniently scattered about. There is a bit of walking involved as this is a large property, but we enjoy a little stroll. We were located in one of the back buildings and there was an additonal bus pick up spot nearby . We never waited more thatn 20 min for a bus. This was our 1st time to WDW, so it took a couple of days for us to learn that too much park hopping in a single day can result in too much time on the bus. The other side of this Resort is the Port Orleans. A 5 min along the river to pick up FRESHLY made benieghs is a nice breakfast treat. We also spent a couple of evenings cocktailing in their lounge with wonderful live jazz, a very nice end to a great and tiring day. This resort is located very close to Epcot, where we enjoyed some very nice dinners. The top pick of the week was the Canadian Le Cellier. Should you go there, expect excellent service and one the best meals of your life. Make reservations early. You may want to carry a little cheap rain poncho with you.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: david f
Reviews.Content: good food selection- might be a bit crowded at times for food but what isn't at Disney. relax, always remember you're ON VACATION. Tried everything to eat- always fresh and not made "fast food style" nice selection. See BOB on weekends at the Rivers Roost next to the main dining hall. Fun show for everyone- we had children in front of us- all had a good time.Drinks for adults there.Pool for kids was always active and we had a pool close to our room with few people. Nice.Overall great-quiet, clean and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Overall not for me”
Reviews.Author: lourhys
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 7 celebrating our daughters birthday and spent Â£10,000 on this holiday. First impressions were not good, We requested an upgrade to adjoining room for my family of 5 (my parents had their own room). This was not given - I know a request for upgrade is a long shot....however we were angry when we realised we had been given a room with 2 double beds in it (Magnolia) I asked where they assumed my 3 children were going to sleep (clearly in 1 bed they had planned). I stood there for an hour arguing (after 13 hours travel time) and all they could say was that it was ok in America that an 11 yr old boy sleeps with his 6&4 year old sisters. EVENTUALLY they brought a blow up mattress and plonked it down in front of the door ( clear fire risk as the door would not open properly) So in upshot my Son who had paid adult price for the privalidge lay there! I'm not used to such tiny rooms and our holiday was no holiday given we couldnt move without waking the children let alone put the TV on. The room allocated to a family of 5 was exactly the same as my parents were given...awful crammed for two weeks with 5 people, a buggy and 7 cases. I must say this ruined our holiday for myself and my husband. The double bed wasn't really big enough anyway and only had 1 bedside cabinet. The grounds are immaculate no question and the transportation is brilliant. The boat to downtown Disney was lovely and I loved Downtown Disney! The quick service meal plan was a great money saver without a doubt but we were sick to death of 'junk' food. At least one counter in the restaurant could change daily surely? The restaurant was busy, hectic and reminded me of school meal hall...stressed me out badly and often a wait for tables. Food: pizza, burger, salad, pasta, fries......on repeat for two weeks. Epcot had great selections so it can be done! Birthday: a gift was left for the children which was very greatfully received and a welcome touch indeed. The shop staff are friendly and happy. A huge miss for hotel entertainment and we were bored. There is a beautiful river they could make the most of with seating areas etc but there isnt any. I think most people must go off to a park (and we did go for parades etc) but when you want a relax without facing the crowds you may as well go to bed and watch a movie (unless you have 3 kids in a small room with you) The main pool wasnt my cup of tea at all....busy, noisy, shaded and kids play there until 11pm with no supervision. The French Quarter pool is better as are the quiet pools (but there are no towels) I think this hotel will come down to individual taste. I didnt like the theme, felt like I was in a summer camp and I wouldn't go back. I think Carribean or one of the more luxurious hotels would be better for me or downgrade this one as I don't think it is 'moderate'. I feel let down

Reviews.Title: “Transportation makes this a horrible place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cmbeatty
Reviews.Content: Do NOT stay here unless you like being the ones standing in long lines waiting for a bus. Resort is fine, comparable to the other moderate options. However, bus transportation is frustrating. I've stayed on resort before. I know that they have to move around a lot of people. I know that they monitor the buses to try to get everyone home asap. I just don't undersand how they get it so wrong for this resort. Demoralizing to stand in a line that wraps around and interferes with the lines for other resorts while watching bus after bus pass you by.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: KarenPartyof6
Reviews.Content: We love the Port Orleans Riverside! It's wonderful to stay here because of the shuttle service to the parks. The service is great and the rooms are very nice and the entire area is extremely well kept. The rooms has a minifridge, and 2 beds and a trundle if needed. It works out well for our family of 6. The theme is very nice. The food court is ok, we don't really like it too much, but the arcade is wonderful. The pools are very nice and the water taxi to Downtown Disney is free and always a nice treat. The staff is always disney style wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans Riverside”
Reviews.Author: shelliespantry
Reviews.Content: We just visited PO Riverside in late September and had a fabulous time. We have a family of five and stayed in a trundle room in Alligaor Bayou. Great room, very clean, and we had towel creations throughout the stay. The kids loved finding surprises left by the cleaning staff. They arranged toys in cute ways also. Food court was easy to figure out and staff was always there to answer questions. Our favorite part of our visit was the Ol'Man Isand Pool. The kids loved the organized activties. The staff remembered our kids throughout the stay and made this trip very memorable. Great Vacation. Thank you DISNEY!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Rymafree
Reviews.Content: We were visiting the US from South Africa. It was such a treat to stay at Port Orleans Riverside! Absolutely beautiful resort! We stated in the newly renovated Acadian House, and loved our room. We enjoyed the food we ordered in the Food Court and thoroughly enjoyed our time at Port Orleans Riverside. I would love to stay at Port Orleans Riverside again!

Reviews.Title: “Our RETURN visit to Port Orleans Riverside....Just like we remembered!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Teacherdrd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Oleans Riverside back in 2009 & decided to stay here again in Sept. 2011 since its the only Disney Moderate Resort that can accomodate 5 people in a room. Its just like we remembered!! We love the grounds!! I requested a 1st floor room in a building next to the South Bus Depot. Last time we were in Bldg #15, this time we were in #18, in Alligator Bayou, which was just a tad farther from the depot BUT closer to the pool. We are looking forward to our stay in either 2013 or 2014. By that time the entire Alligator Bayou section will have gone through a complete renovation. I think its time. Port Orleans is my favorite Moderate Resort on Disney Property. This time we had a few bumps in the road that I wanted to mention though. We had a Garden Grocer Order that was delivered to the hotel. We arrived at the hotel at 4:00 p.m. I called bell services at 4 p.m. & gave them our room number. We were told about 10 mins for delivery. 30 mins go by, NOTHING. Called them again, & was told 10 more mins, they were on the way. Still NOTHING! Now it was 5 p.m. Still no delivery. Called again at 5 p.m. & they somehow mixed up our delivery & showed that it was already delivered. Um.....NO! We waited around for an HOUR! By this time we had to leave for dinner. Told them we were upset & would call them when we got back from the Magic Kingdom which would be around 11 p.m. In this respect, i don't think luggage/bell services knows what they are doing. No apologies either. My other complaint, again, would be that there is no "queue" line at the Bus Depot. Pop Century has one but Riverside does not. Aggravates me because we'd be waiting there for a bus in morning sometimes for 10-15 mins, bus finally pulls up, & then people who just walked into the depot would walk up to the loading area. Those waiting on the benches for the longer period of time should be first. All in all the Port Orleans Riverside is one of the best Mods on Disney Property. I think that there were a few more "bumps" on this visit but overall we would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome first visit to Disney.”
Reviews.Author: Mmellonmont
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2010. Beautiful resort. We were two adults and 3 kids, 9,10 & 4. Plenty of room with the roll out bed. Only thing that could be improved is replace the double beds with queen beds. Little tight for two adults. Also ask for a room close to the lobby for access to the restaurant etc. The kids loved the pools and all the wildlife on the property from an otter in the lake, rabbits in the bushes, frogs in the ponds, ducks and more. Only negative was returning to the resort from the parks, horrible. The line for the buses were always the longest of all the resorts. Also the line was always at the end of the bus lines. Even the value resorts were closer to the parks and had shorter lines. Getting there never took long. Other that that the Orleans Riverside was great. We have booked another trip in Feb. 2012 and will be staying at Coronado springs. We will see how that goes. I like to stay at different hotels for different experiences.

Reviews.Title: “good for families”
Reviews.Author: bobntiku
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, well maintained and designed property. The 5 of us stayed for a week in Bldg. 26 in the Alligator Bayou. Our room was a bit snug for all of us (and we had to use the trundle bed), but everything worked and we slept comfortably. We spent most of our waking hours at the parks, but we also spent some time on the property: walking on the trail that follows the river; resting by the pool; even renting a 4 seater bike. The boat-ride to downtown Disney was a lot of fun. My only negative experience was with the Disney dining options for Quick Dining -- there is very little in the way of healthy vegeterian options on the menus. At breakfast times the food court was too busy. Otherwise, it was a good place to stay and I would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty and Peaceful”
Reviews.Author: Ana N
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September and it was very quiet and easy to get around. The grounds are vast with pretty landscaping, pools, food, horsedrawn carriages, free water shuttle and bus to all the Disney Parks and Downtown Disney.
