It's a great place to rest after a long day of play. The free airport shuttle to and from the hotel was a money and stress saver. Everything was very professional and made for an easy going vacation. The foodcourt also is reasonably priced and the pasta bar gives a ton of food for the adult portion. One serving is definitely enough for two meals.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel but we had a cockroach!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Geordie75_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the last two weeks of September in the riverside quarter and on arrival they had placed in an apartment block without a lift and we have two children one who is in a buggy, they changed us when asked. The walk from the room to the main area is really nice and the surrounding area really well looked after. The quick disney dining plan is brilliant and there is a huge range of food on offer. We asked for a transfer to one of the new refurbished rooms and they did this very quickly but this was TOO QUICK...... They gave us the wrong room number and when we tried to get in to the room we were confronted by another family who we had woke up along with our two young children who were a wake thinking they were going to their new bed for the night, I complained about this and they arranged character dining for our family for my daughters birthday (I tried for six months and it was fully booked). Holiday was going great until the back end of the vacation and housekeeping in the new room seemed to disappear even though we tipped every day. we requested on my daughters birthday to leave some TOWEL animals (If you been to disney resort you know what i am on about) on the bed and we left $5 tip. Returned to room on the off chance and the money was gone, room clean but nothing in the form of animals, I complained and within an hour there was a zoo of towel animals on my daughters bed. the last friday morning of the holiday and my 15 month son starts to chase something on the floor between the beds its a COCKROACH!!!!!!! I trapped it and yet again complained to the manager, they said someone would come round straight away, two hours later a supervisor arrived and said a pest control officer would come in, spray the room and dispose of the little visitor. I placed the little friend on top of the sink cabinet in full view (still under the glass), we went out for the day and came back at around 8pm, walked in and housekeeping had cleaned the room and even around the cockroach which was still there under the glass looking at us. That was the last straw and i stormed to the reception area and demanded to see the general manager after being fobbed off by other lower spec managers and she did not believe me when i explained the situation. After she was notified of the earlier compliant in the morning she offerd me $100 cash and said the cockroach would be dealt with. Within ten minutes two people came and took the unwelcome lodger away to a better place. the moral of this story is if you have a compliant to make or anything you are not happy about then do something about it because disney will do anything to keep everything quiet and you happy.......... I can not fault the disney parks at all but within this hotel the housekeeping and communication needs to be addressed asap. I was also told a lady badly bruised her foot (not broken)on a ride at one of the parks and she was offered a weeks free holiday next year at disney., lucky for some

Reviews.Title: “Great Moderate Resort”
Reviews.Author: TravelMel1
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review by saying that I am a Disney Nut! Now that we have that straight, I seem to travel to Disney World at least once a year if not more and have stayed at many hotels both on and off site. This trip we went for the "long weekend stay" and decided to stay at Port Orleans Riverside. It's been several years since we stayed at this resort and we found it to be very pleasant. We took the Magical Express to the resort and it all worked well. I had done the online check-in from home and when we arrived everything was ready to go. Only took a couple minutes to check in and our room was even ready even though we arrived at 10:00 AM. The resort was very clean and the housekeepers had left a Mickey made from towels on the bed to greet us when we arrived. The past few times that we have gone to Disney World we have stayed at Caribbean Beach, Port Orleans French Quarter and the Hilton Downtown Disney. Rooms are a little smaller than the Hilton rooms but the free parking at both the resort and the parks, transportation system, and the amenities in general just make this a very nice place to stay. The main pool is very large and offers kids games and activites but the smaller pools between the buildings are very nice and laundry facilities are right in the pool area which makes it very convenient to do laundry and lounge at the pool at the same time! Almost makes doing laundry fun! The only issue we had while we were there was that the hair dryer broke. I called housekeeping and they sent someone right up and replaced it within a few minutes of my call. Great service. Food court is nice and offers a variety of menu options. They also have a sit down restaurant and bar area in the main building as well as a bar by the pool for adults. Overall I think this is a great option for families looking for a moderate resort. it is a little louder than the Port Orleans French Quarter mainly because it is a much larger resort. I liked the layout and rooms better than the Caribbean Beach. I would recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “great vacation”
Reviews.Author: howard b
Reviews.Content: we had a great time at port orleans, first time for me in disney, cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay at this hotel, AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: Travelagent_UK
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my partner to the Disney Port Orleans Riverside in September 2011 for 14nights. I stayed in this hotel in September 2009 and was looking forward to my return visit. Since the last time the rooms have been refurbished with the old style tvs away and with a nice flat screen and the bed covers and some of the in room furnishings were up to date which made my stay even more enjoyable. The grounds of the hotel is definitely the best part of the resort the gardens are absolutely beautiful and well kept. When your booking try and get the FREE quick service dining plan it saved us roughly $70 per person per day which is amazing leaving us more money to spend on shopping. The only gripe i have with the quick service is that everywhere you can eat there is not alot of healthy options unless you want to eat salad every day, no thanks lol. Now i think the official rating for this hotel is a 3* however it is Disney and the magic you experience from staying in a disney resort makes me rate my review higher, the staff are fantastic and really do make the Disney difference, one night we eat in the Planet Hollywood @ downtown Disney and it was amazing a great party atmosphere with amazing food, i later learned that if we had been on the Disney dining plan (usually free with the deluxe resorts) then we could have eat in there so next time i go to disney i may splash out and go to the animal kingdom lodge instead. Bare in mind this resort is massive however we were in Acadian House which was only about a 5 min walk to the main lobby and the dining hall, not that far at all and the walk is lovely, plenty of pools for everyone and the kids all seemed to be in the main pool as there was regular activities for them every day so you never really seen them at the other pools which was good. I really think anyone would enjoy staying at this hotel i am a travel agent and never usually stay at the same place more than once even if i loved it but this is the one hotel i made the exception for and i'm glad i did, absolutly amazing holiday and can't wait to return to disney in the future, if you have any questions feel free to ask and i will try and answer as soon as possible. So don't delay just get it booked! LOL If you are booking a stay for next year Disney once again are doing the free dining plan offer with some of their holidays this is excellent value for money, take my advice if you want to save money book up in advance if you wait for a late deal it will possibly be slighty cheaper however you won't get the free dining plan so its not worth your while alot of people who were staying in the hotel who had booked late deals actually paid more than me and never got the dining plan, which if it was me i really wouldn't be happy!

Reviews.Title: “Great memories made but I'd try another Disney property next time.”
Reviews.Author: rsc344
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week staying at Port Orleans, Riverside. We chose this property due to the moderate cost and fact that we wouldn't be in the room all that much. Overall I'd say I left with an ok experience. The good...newly remodeled room (MagnoliaBend) was crisp and clean, property was huge and pools were enjoyable. The not so good...be ready to wait as the bus lines are long coming to and from Port Orleans. One particular trip to Epcot took 1 hr and 45 min because of overcrowdedness and delays. The Riverside Mill food court was an absolute free for all with crowds and general disorder. I couldn't wait to get out of there and avoided it after the 3rd day. Would I stay there again? I'd probably try a different property next time.

Reviews.Title: “recommened by friend so glad l listened to them.”
Reviews.Author: andrea g
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st vist to disney land, after speak to a friend who had been before we booked the hotel they recommend, which l am glad we did. the hotel room was really well laid out, as said in other reveiws this resort is going through refurb, which is need in some rooms. before l left Scotland l called the resort and asked to be near a pool and bus stop, which they gave us a room 5 min walk from main reception and the south bus stop and a small pool right on our door step, which the kids loved. We went to the french quarters pool, but only stayed an hour as it loads of fly like insect everywhere, the following day went to the main pool at riverside and exact same thin so just used the pool by our room for rest of holiday. Used borth resturants,in the morning between 9.30-10.30 it was impossible to get table in quick service resturant, so we used the smaller resturant to sit on a few occasions. We were also on the dining plan(friends recommendation) which saved us a fortune as our 4 yr old lived on chicken nuggets and hot dogs for the 2 weeks. When we go back to disney we will check this resort out to see if refurb finished and will probably book if it has. Our room maid was excellent, she left all different charactors made out of towels on our daughter birthday, and we always got extra towels for the pool with no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Average, not magical experience”
Reviews.Author: albanydr
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Disney's Port Orleans Resort - Riverside and were a bit disappointed simply expecting more from a moderate Disney resort. When we arrived we checked in ahead of time online completing all of the information. When we arrived on site we entered the on line check in part of the lobby. There was a line and waited 15 minutes to see a representative. When we finally did the check in process took a good 25 minutes due to the person at the front desk asking us ALL of the same information that we already filled out and was on the form. Did not save us any time at all. When we got in the room, there were towels that were used by the previous guest hanging in the bathroom and the sheets on the one of the beds were questionably changed before we arrived. We also had luke warm water our entire visit and our AC unit smelt like something was burning. When we call the front desk about the AC unit the gentleman's response was that there was a camp fire burning near the pool (keeping in mind we were about a 5 min walk away from the pool area). Everything is too crowded from the boat service to the Market place to the busses, Disney really needs to increase the number of busses for Port Orleans. The gentleman at the front gate was RUDE and the staff was not what we have experienced before at other Disney resorts. We have stayed at Port Orleans - French Quarter and had a much better experience. I would also recommend looking into Key West Resort as an alternative for typically 20 dollars more or so a day, might be worth it. Overall the grounds are still Disney and the food was pretty good, okay resort. Just not the experience we expect and have come to love from Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family holiday”
Reviews.Author: CHOBBO
Reviews.Content: We visited Walt Disney World Florida in September for a two week stay. There were eight people in our party, including two children ages nine and seven, and my parents aged seventy five and seventy six. It is fair to say that there is something to please everyone whatever their age. We stayed at Port Orleans Riverside in the mansions and what a wonderful setting it is in. Our rooms were comfortable and kept clean daily by a maid,who made animals out of the towels,the kids loved that. The beds in our room were quite small and we ended up having one child and one adult per bed, i would ask for kings next time. Whilst there we used the river shuttle to the French Quarter to have a look around and used the hot tub there. Again all towels were provided poolside, and the whole set up was lovely. We upgraded the quick service dining plan to the waiter service plan, because we thought that there would be more variation in food. The meals were very nice and they averaged about $110 for four of us. All we had to pay was gratuities which worked out at about $17 per meal. We enjoyed all of the meals although we though that the children's meals were quite poor really, for choice and amount. In fact we found the whole dining plan a bit confusing. The information given by the very helpful staff varied depending on who you asked. Maybe a bit more info displayed in the parks and restaurants would help. At the end of the holiday we had 13 waiter service meals unused. The prices were a bit steep in the parks, ie, chicken nuggets & fries outside the parks was 0.99cents, inside the parks $9.99... so the dining plan is essential really with a family, but i think Disney is inflating the prices to ensure you need to go this route and pay up front for food. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a comfortable stay in a decent hotel with friendly helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: Pauline C
Reviews.Content: We had a two week stay at the resort this year in August. We were lucky enough to have a newly renovated room, opened to reservations about two hours before we arrived, in the Mansions area. Lovely room, beautiful building and close to the quiet pool and a short walk to the food court etc. The resort was so pretty that when looking at my photographs my mother actually thought they were taken on a day out! Quick service dining plan was a great addition to the holiday and very easy to use. Pizzas are well recommended. We had so much food between my daughter and I that we just couldn't eat it all. As my daughter and I went on our own, I was a little worried initially, but we had a great time and felt very secure at all times. Room service were very friendly and we had a lovely collection of towel animals left for us every day. Personally I preferred using my car rather than waiting for the buses but then I am just impatient! Location was excellent- close to good shops in the car, and the boat to DTD was a nice touch too. Loved it so much we have decided to go back there again next year rather than to an upgraded resort that we had intended to go for. I would recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tammy7777
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans is a resort and it is huge. It is a 5 or 10 minute walk to probably anywhere on the property, but it's a beautiful walk. The grounds are very beautiful and well kept. The main pool is a lot of fun with a great slide. The lifeguards are the most professional I've seen. They are very organized and vigilant. We saw them jump in on two different occasions (on this trip) to help someone (both children). The resort store is a nice size store with lots of souvenirs to buy and some food items. The food court has a nice variety of food of "fast food" for lunch. There is a good variety of breakfast items, too. We also enjoyed eating at the sit down restaurant, Boatwrights. Our room was very clean and housekeeping did a good job. Our room had the "old-fashioned" kind of a/c that you could leave on all night and helps drown out any outside noise, which was great. The only noise we heard was our neighbor's baby crying through our connecting door (which was shut and locked but not as thick as the walls, so some sound came through).

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Port Orleans - Riverside”
Reviews.Author: daisyrae0926
Reviews.Content: Our stay was only for one night but we wanted to stay at the hotel to check it out as we are going to be coming back for longer stays. We were very happy with the accomodations. Our room was in Alligator Bayou. The room we stayed in was very clean and well-kept and appeared to have been recently re-done. There was a small pool close to our room and we weren't far from transportation. The grounds were very well maintained and had the feeling of being in the bayou. The WDW Port Orleans - Riverside is right across the street from WDW's Best Friends resort. We enjoyed that it was so close and we could visit our fur baby on our way to and from the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Its alright.”
Reviews.Author: gritreid
Reviews.Content: We stayed there beginning of june and we booked it because my son and dil like french quarter so we decided to stay nearer to them. To be fair, we have always stayed at deluxe monorail hotels and never had to rely on busses as main mode of transportation. The busses sucked for the first 3 days and enough people must have complained because the last 3 days were much better. But it was awful and everyone we talked to said same thing. We took a boat from Hollywood studios to boardwalk and it was like the heavens opened up and we realized this is how a vacation should be. We used online check in and the line was as long as the regular line but clerk was wonderful. I had requested general area of resort and they gave me differnt one but she found us room and gave us late check out. The room was a hotel room;nothing more. Our housekeeper was wonderful. There was a pool we went to every day and there were tiny white particles that I have never seen in pool before and I felt dirty after I left pool. The food court seemed to always be messy. But its a good price. With the money I saved staying there I upped us to deluxe dining plans and we had the MOST spectacular meals at disneys finest restaurants. So it was a tradeoff. Would I recommend it....I guess for a moderate hotel its okay.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: alliballib
Reviews.Content: After reading several negative reviews, we had fairly low expectations for this resort. If you are in the same position, you needn't worry at all. This is a huge resort - all the grounds are lovely and very well kept, main pool is a good size with a slide and scalding hot tub! We stayed in room 8006 in the Acadian House - the rooms in this section have just been refurbished so everything was new. Rooms have two sinks, bath/shower, LCD TV and fridge. This is a great position to be in as the pool is a 2 minute walk and it takes about 5 minutes to get to the main bus stop, although there is a closer one right outside the block. There is also a private pool around the back of the lodge just for Acadian House guests, but unfortunately this was being refurbished during our visit so we never managed to use it. Only minor downside to the room was the noise from other rooms when they flush the toilet which was quite loud. We never ate in the sit-down restaurant, only the Riverside Mill Food Court but they offer a good variety of food. There is a bakery (the cupcakes are delicious!), pizza, pasta, burgers and fries etc. with soda machines where you can fill up your refill mug. Buses come and go all the time and the boat trip to Downtown Disney is also nice when you fancy a change. One thing we did seem to notice though is that at every Disney park the bus queue for Riverside always seemed to be the longest one. One night in particular at Hollywood Studios there was a huge queue which we would have had to wait about 30 mins in - in the end we ended up getting the bus to French Quarter and the bus driver kindly dropped us off at Riverside. Whether this is because its the largest Disney resort I don't know, but Disney could do with getting more buses in operation at night for Riverside. We would definitely return to this hotel although Animal Kingdom Lodge still remains my favorite!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic holiday”
Reviews.Author: winnie1212
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a two week holiday. We have had the best time ever, we have stayed at the higher end of Disney to the lower end and found this resort to be the best for all. The boat ride to down town Disney Is the Most relaxing time and a great start to your time at down town Disney. We never waited for a bus more than 5min's. Always got somewhere to sit at breakfast no matter what time we went. Best holiday

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great value”
Reviews.Author: chriscox85
Reviews.Content: i chose port orleans riverside because i like to have more-than-the-minimum available to me, but don't always need the premium locations. this resort hotel offered just that. the lush environment was perfect, spread out so it was not too noisy. the central pool was a great size and with many life guards for us and our small kids. there were a bunch of events going on while we were there, so many we could not participate in all of them. it was so much fun, i wanted to stay at the hotel a day instead of going to a disney park. we didn't get to go, but the evening entertainment with a guy singing and playing the piano looked fun when we were walking back through the building after being out. i also queried a number of folks who we ran into during our trip, and they said port orleans was their favorite. i would definitely stay there again, i really don't have any complaints. disney has the customer experience thing down, including at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: claire l
Reviews.Content: First time staying in a disney resort. The grounds were so beautiful. Is worth the extra money staying at disney rather than on internation drive where we had previously stayed,Had the quick service meal deal. definately worth it. Food was really nice at this hotel. Boat trip to down town disney was really quick and the kids loved it. Room was really nice and clean.Staff OK dining room chaotic at times. We have booked to go back next year and can't wait!!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Disneygrammy
Reviews.Content: I can't wait to go back to Port Orleans. We have stayed there (4) times and will go back again. Everything about the resort is comforting. The people are friendly and helpful. One of our trips there in 2001, we were given a river view room on a corner which was an upgrade from what I had booked. I am always so depressed when it is time to leave. I would not stay anywhere else. I love the boat ride to Down Town Disney. We love just sitting on a bench behind the Main lobby and take in the views. The food is good, the rooms are clean and the maid service is great. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone looking to book a vacation at Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend This Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Deelucy1
Reviews.Content: We went to the Port Orleans Riverside on the 05/09/11 to 19/09/11. We had an adjoining room (3 in 1 & 2 in the other) in the Magnolia Bend building, the rooms had recently been renovated. The Rooms were superb & the service was excellent. In the food court there was plenty of choice & all the food was very good. We were on the Disney food plan & I would recommend this as we recond our food bill for 5 for 2 weeks would have been about Â£175 a day (3 meals each). It was my 1st visit to Disney & I can strongly recommend this hotel.(Fantastic time. Peter (England UK).

Reviews.Title: “Great place!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sandjmonroe
Reviews.Content: This is a great place. Pools were good. Hotel was clean. Staff was polite and heplful. Would go back in a heartbeat!! The bus system works great. We were there for a week and never moved the car. The grounds are beautful and well kept. They have different thngs available at the hotel to do. I would higly recommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: “We Were Pleased”
Reviews.Author: barbrn
Reviews.Content: There were 5 of us, 2 adults and 3 children so we used the trundle bed. That was pretty flimsy, which is about the only complaint we had. It was very clean and transportation to and from the parks was so easy. Buses were running all the time, so wait time was pretty minimal. We ate in the dining hall once and it was good food, lots of options We also took the boat to Downtown Disney and were glad we had this option. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: emydaa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Port Orleans Riverside for 6 nights. We checked in online thinking it would save time but when we got there at the check-in time, the online check in counter was closed.The hotel building and grounds look very pleasant and serene. It was a short walk for us to catch the bus to the different parks; Epcot being the closest. We could take the boat to Disney Downtown and that was a nice ride. Our room was nice, although some of the furnishings need to be freshen up. For example, the bathtub has anti-skid mat marks on the tub surface. Housekeeping was inconsistent: we didn't get toiletries on 2 days nor coffee one day. Only coffee was provided in the room, not tea as is the usual case in a hotel. Also the coffee pot wasn't cleaned after the first day I used it and I decieded to wash it myself instead after that. When I called about not getting some of the amenities, though, it was taken care of quite quickly and supplies was brought to our room. Our experience overall of our stay though was good.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly above average but overpriced per the Disney standard.”
Reviews.Author: beestingers
Reviews.Content: Rooms were fine. Got lucky w. Queen beds. Pools are unkempt & full of kids, even at the "quiet pools." Everything is about a 300% upcharge from what one would expect outside of Disney. Staff, especially the concierge are often just shy of rude. Buses are crowded but came quickly enough. Overall its the best value at Disney but nothing mindblowingly good or bad.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Tashsco
Reviews.Content: Just returned yesterday from WDW and Port Orleans Riverside. Loved the resort. Stayed in the Magnolia Bend section. You are close to pretty much everything in any one of these buildings. Kids loved the pool and waterslide. Food court was very good and usually fairly empty if you went at off times. We ate over at French Quarter one night and the Riverside foodcourt is much better as is the pool. Buses were great and seemed to come with regularity. We hardly waited more than 10 minutes for a bus. Resort Grounds are pristine and calming to cone back to after a hectic day in the parks. Highly recommend POR!!!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious grounds with many amenities”
Reviews.Author: Andrea8673
Reviews.Content: My family, husband and 4 year old daughter, stayed at the Port Orleans - Riverside for 7 nights after booking a package thru Disney World's website. We had a terrific time and enjoyed the resort. We were in building 85 which worked out very well. We were told at check in that we recieved an upgrade to a river view room. We were close to the main pool, a second smaller pool and not too far walk to the main building with the resturants and front desk. The walk to the bus stop wasn't more than 5 minutes either. One thing I really liked about the resort, was even though we were near the pool where kids were playing most of the day and night, you couldn't hear much in our room. We never heard neighbors or had any issues with noise. The stay was peaceful and relaxing. The rooms are nothing exceptional but they were very nice. The housekeeping staff did some fun stuff each day with the towels and my daughters stuff animals which was fun. We had a small fridge and table which were nice to have some breakfast in our room or keep water. There are 4 bus stations within the resort so sometimes you can be on the bus for a little while. They also pick up Port Orleans French Quarters on certain buses. I did walk to the Port Orleanes French Quarters to check out their pool and it is a hike from where we were. You can take the river taxi down and back as well which is helpful but it's slow and is a wait. I did prefer the French Quarters pool to the Riverside but they were both nice. Overall this is a very nice large property that is quiet and relaxing and works perfect for the Disney experience.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ashleigh P
Reviews.Content: This was my families second visit to Orlando, but the first time we have stayed in a Disney hotel, and I must say it was fantastic! The staff are the most helpful people I have ever met, helping with everything from phone cards to carrying bags, and in my opinion it's the little things like that which really make a difference to the holiday. The maid service also could not be faulted, our room was always spotless and we were always given clean towels. The transoprtation service was just a short walk away, and we never waited more than 5 minutes or so for a bus. The bus to french quarter and Downtown disney is also very reliable, and an enjoyable boat ride. Yes, the resort is big, the hotel seemed to be very good at giving you a room near the lobby if you asked. Ours was just under a 10 minute walk, which might sound a lot but we enjoyed seeing the scenery each morning. The food court is lovely, and offers a good range of food. The desserts are lovely. For anyone looking to go I would definitely reccomend the Disney Dining Plan. We loved it! Overall, the holiday was fabulous, and staying in a Disney hotel just added to the magic.

Reviews.Title: “Love the ferry to Downtown Disney”
Reviews.Author: grandmamajoy
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great pool is huge with slide even has a fishing pond lot of walking ferry to Downtown Disney is a plus

Reviews.Title: “Disney Please Update your Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Stingray93
Reviews.Content: Wow! We have stayed on Disney property many times, but this hotel really needs to updated. They still have the BIG old T.V's in the rooms. I guess it;s true what the say, you get what you pay for. Also, if anyone from Disney reads these things, just wondering when they might jump into the 21st century and get WFII in all the rooms for free. It's a shame you can go stay at a Holiday Inn for a lot less and get it for nothing. All that a side, the resort is spread out and like I said, the rooms really need an update.

Reviews.Title: “My Holiday Vacation”
Reviews.Author: akw1980
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. This was my first disney vacation. The room was fine, and had enough room for my husband, his scooter, two daughters, and myself. You don't really spend that much time in the room, anyway. The staff was helpful and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Magical Resort! We Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: momofthree2215
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans is a beautiful, peaceful, and fabulous resort. It was out first time on Disney property and it exceeded our expectations. We were in building 27...about a 5 minute walk to the main lobby. I would not want to be any farther though (in the back by the west depot area). It was a short walk to the bus depot and we rarely waited more than 5-7 minutes for a bus. The buses were not crowded this time of year either. The bus drivers were fabulous. Check in was quick and all the cast members were great. The girls in the general store were super helpful and the life guards at the main pool were great. Our kids (age 5 and 8) loved the pool and the big water wheel. They enjoyed looking for squirrels and lizards and running along the dock area every morning. What a fabulous setting. The room was good, the maid service was good, and the grounds, buses, pools and customer service were GREAT! If you are thinking about staying here, I highly recommend it, especially the Alligator Bayou area. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Still as awesome as ever!”
Reviews.Author: Sharpay10
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at this hotel this past summer (end of July, first week of August) for nine nights. We stayed here a couple of years ago and fell in love with the place. The atmosphere, landscaping and attention to detail at this hotel is so nice. You can really feel the old southern charm. We arrived mid day and check-in wasnâ€™t crowded. The person that checked us in was either having a bad day or didnâ€™t like her job because she wasnâ€™t nice to us and didnâ€™t provide that Disney charm we were accustomed to. But it didnâ€™t last. After checking in and purchasing our park passes, a wonderful gentleman wisked us over to our room in a cart. His cheerful personality made up for the reception we had at the front desk. Our room was in a great location (Oak Manor) close to the food court/store, bus stops, main pool and quiet pool and was on the first floor. All our room request were met. The rooms are a little older looking and dÃ©cor could definitely use an update but overall the rooms are nice. The fridge is especially great for water, milk and snacks. The beds are super comfy. The air conditioning seems strange and we could never could get a good temperature in the room. The double sinks separate from the bathroom are great. The food court is great. Lots of choices and good hours, although if you eat here frequently you will get tired of the menu. We also went over to Port Orleans French Quarter and ate over there a couple times. Atmosphere at this hotel is quiet and relaxing. Even though you know there are lots of people, it never sounds or looks like it. The bus waits were not bad and the covered waiting area was great. The store is large and has a lot of merchandise. One of the great things about this hotel is the boat to Downtown Disney â€“ however if itâ€™s raining or chance of thunder storms the boat will not run. Overall this hotel is charming, relaxing and beautiful and a good deal for the price paid. Youâ€™ll feel like you never leave the magic!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: beer4paul
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four with two children aged 7 and 4 - we all loved this hotel. We stayed in the Arcadia rooms which had just been refurbished , they were spacious and clean. The grounds to the hotel and the pools were fantastic as is the location to the disney parks. Lots of things going on for children throughout the day for when you want time away from the parks. The food court we did find a bit limited especially for children, but not really a problem as there are so many places to eat at the parks or get the boat to down town disney for more choice. We had the quick service dining plan and thought it was great. Buses were always frequent and easy to use from this resort. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel - we will be definitely staying again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “like another world”
Reviews.Author: davsbabe
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the pors from the 7th 14th of sept. we took our two adult children and our 2 year old grandaughter for this trip to disney. check in day we got to the resort about 9:30 am.we used the magical express this is a great way to start you trip.when we got to the resort there was cast members giving out neckless to everyone and some were shooting bubbles for the kids it was a nice way to be greeted.we used on line check in. so i went to where it read on line check in to get our keys to the world we were told that our room was not ready yet and they would call us when it was ready.so we went to buy our refillable mugs and to get some thing to eat,then we went on the boat to dtd just to get a look at things. this is an amazing resort such lovely grounds and the blds are just like steping back in time to another world.just about the time we got to dtd we had a call your room is ready..wow that was fast so we stayed on the boat and went back to the resort to see our room.we were in bld 14 in the allgater section room 1403.when we went in to the room there was minnie face on the bed to greet us how cute,but best of all our bags were there as well now thats service! we had a great mouse keeper she made cute towel animals for us.the room was not a updated room,but it was very clean and neet. the trundel bed had a dust cover over it so no dust would get on it the 2 year old loved sleeping on it..bath room and tub was small but where the two sinks were was big for changing.no problems with our special diet needs the chef made us what we needed for breakfast.we did not eat ther for dinner.we loved the piano player he was so funny bar staff was friendly.one night my daughter lost her handbag we went to the front desk the lovely yung lady that i forgot her name SORRY!did everything to help us. we did get it back. thanks to a cafe staff member who seen a person take her bag off the table and got it back from them.oh it was a yung girl not a adult who took it.well durning all this my 2 year old grandaughter had a meltdown as it was late, a super nice bell staff member named Said talked to her and gave her a bloon to make her happy and it did,but my son has a very bad allergy to laytex so i had to tell her that she could not keep it.i think i made Said feel bad,but i did not mean to.that was the worst thing that happend to us at this resort.the bell staff helped us with our aireline check in and bag check.this is a great thing magical express. our bags were at the air port when we got there to pick them up. ok i'm all over the place with this review but bottom line is this is a great resort with very nice and very helpfull staff members.the grounds are breath taking and the hot tub is great just ask my son who needs heat thearpy for his back.we are booked to come back in feb next year and i can not wait!!try it you will love it...

Reviews.Title: “Only one problem”
Reviews.Author: Tater69
Reviews.Content: After staying here a few years back, we decided to stay here again for our vacation. Everything was as we remembered it from back then. From check in to check out, everything was really good. Grounds are really kept up and the pools were in great shape. The only problem that has arisen at this Disney Resort is the transportation issues. At times it seemed like it was non existent. We waited for over 30 minutes one day for a bus, and when it did arrive it took another 30 minutes to get to Magic Kingdom. Bus never got over about 30 MPH. Don't know if it was a driver issue or a bus issue. When we got back to the resort I went to express my concerns to a member of the resort management, but she didn't want to hear it. I was told this was a transportation issue, not a resort issue, and I would need to take it up with them. We have stayed at just about every resort on Disney property, and by far the transportation issues and the lack of managements concern, make this about the worst property at Disney in terms of moving guests, unless you have your own car or rent one. Even the value resorts have better transportation. We will probably not be staying here again, unless there are some transportation and resort management issues corrected. Take these two issues out of play and this resort would have gotten a better review.

Reviews.Title: “First Disney Resort Stay”
Reviews.Author: Amanda S
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for one night because we stayed at a non-Disney resort the rest our stay and we wanted to see what everyone referred to as "Disney Magic." We really liked this resort. Staff were great and the place was so clean. The resort was full yet the pools weren't overcrowded even though it was extremely hot. It did cost a lot to eat in the cafeteria way more than we expected. Would definitely recommend buying the dinner plan. The room had everything we needed and they even asked us if we needed a pack and play on arrival and had one set up in our room by the time we got to our room. Very impressive service. We really enjoyed using the shuttle to and from the park. It always seemed that this was the most crowded and longest wait in comparison to the other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “An Honest Review”
Reviews.Author: skeetman33
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying this, ease your mind, forget all the negatives you have read and pack your bags in confidence. Now I must add this in. This place is huge, my wife and I are fifty somethings in good shape, if you are in the Alligator Bayou section, your walk to the lobby will be five to fifteen minutes depending what building you are in. That's not so bad on a pleasant day but a 90 degree day with high humidity and your soaked by the time you reach the lobby. The walk is beautiful, the grounds are pristine but do request a room close to the lobby if your going to be eating breakfast in the food court each day. Our room was in building 34, it had been refurbished including a flat screen TV. These rooms feature double sinks but the area above and around them is small with not so much space for all of your toiletries. The toilet and shower are a bit cramped but you can make do just fine. The maid service is very good, whatever you ask for they will be happy to get it for you. The main pool is a wee bit small for such a large resort, we were there the second week in September and on the weekend it was crowded, I can only imagine this area in the busy season. The food court is good at best. I would suggest having a danish or fruit bowl for breakfast using your snack option and use your quick service for a nice lunch in one of the parks. As for Boatwrights on the property it was ok but I would not waste a sit down option here. On the weekends a piano player entertains in the lounge, Bob, is very energentic and gets the crowd to participate, including children, so go at least one night while you are at this resort. We never waited more then five minutes for a bus, but it was the off season. The bus ride to all parks in about 10 minutes. Be prepared to spend $2.50 for a bottle of water and if your not on a dinning plan forget the food court, it's simply not worth the money, I believe everything is overpriced to make those that are on the dinning plan feel like they are getting their moneys worth. In summary, the place is lovely, I would stay again. I would in no way attempt to stay in one of the outer buildings with small children, your on vacation after all, you dont need to get in a good workout just getting to the lobby or pool.

Reviews.Title: “A breathtaking resort that will leave you lovestruck.”
Reviews.Author: Josho19
Reviews.Content: I cannot even begin how to say how much we loved this resort. My girlfriend and I went here this September for a 9 night stay and everything was perfect. We are both in our low 20s for anyone who cares about that. First of all we were worried about what people said about so much walking...we couldnt figure it out as we walked all over the resort and there are four bus depots and the longest walk to a depot would be just over five minutes...considering you walk for 8 hours in a park the five minutes is doable!!! Our room was full of southern charm and had much needed ice cold a/c, a fridge, a double sink, a separate shower and toilet and two queen beds which we wish were one king but wasn't worth the extra 25 bucks per night. It was extremely functional, not the fanciest room ever but the price reflects that and honestly was more than ample for the one hour a day and sleep that we used it for. The double sinks were a lifesaver as were the separate shower and toilet when you are getting ready in the morning. Howbout the service!? It was pretty good again. I found front desk to be very accommodating and friendly. The cleaner gave us a swan towel art thing the first day and made us a cute little toothbrush holder character which really made us smile. So we tipped her two dollars two days in a row (keep in mind we are staying for 9 nights) and she didn't make another shape which kind of sucked so we stopped tipping haha. The service was fine and our rooms were fairly clean when she left. The transportation is a key factor at staying on a Disney property and here they exceeded expectations all around. Again, there were four bus depots, we use the north and the south depot as the north was right by our building and the south was by the main lobby. Both places we got buses within 15 minutes and some were full and some were empty...the big thing is we got on them and didn't have to worry about renting a car or anything. The boat to downtown Disney is amazing and runs about every 10 minutes after 5 so it's easy and actually quicker than taking a bus. We took a cab to Universal Studios and it was about 20 minutes away and only $40 dollars each way. We also might note that we got a free Disney dining plan with this. This value was incredible!!! When we go back we will buy the plan regardless as you get about 70 dollars worth of food per person for free each day for a lot less money. We ate at le cellier, boma, crystal palace, California grill, and the brown derby all with the better portion or all of it included in our dining plan. Even if it's not free, trust me and get it, you will be q happy camper. We had an amazing stay here and if you are debating whether or not to stay at a Disney hotel bang your head on a table and wake up. The transportation, extra magic hours and dining plan options alone make it worth it! What really does it for me is the Disney magic and nostalgia you will feel when staying at the resorts. Every detail is considered and everything is kept meticulous and perfect. They say it's all in the details and Disney has that perfected. As far as the port Orleans riverside specifically it has all of these things. The grounds are breathtaking and so romantic. The cafeteria and restaurant seemed fine. The service was great. Stay here and you'll be happy. If you are deciding between here and french quarter than chose riverside as the French quarter looked a bit more cheesy while riverside was full of class. Thanks Disney for making my trip so amazing!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great moderate resort!”
Reviews.Author: msmith27
Reviews.Content: Our first time to WDW and requested a newly renovated room at the Acadian house. Got it no problem, was nice because we could go to the quiet pool (even though it was shut down half way through our trip for renovation). The resort is HUGE, lots of walking involved, but worth it. Grounds are beautiful and clean. The riverboat to downtown disney was nice at night. The newly renovated rooms were really nice! comfortable beds, bathrooms were updated and extremely clean! My daughter really liked the swimming pool/slide. I think it was a beautiful resort, would definitely consider coming back if we went with a moderate again. Had to stay at All Stars the first night (came in a day early, and it was the only place available) and Riverside blew them out. All Stars was pretty cheesy and the rooms were SO cramped and not so clean. The only reason I gave the resort a 4 was because the breakfast food was so so in the food court and a few of the people working in the food court had some grumpy personalities, also, some of the other people/families that were staying at the resort were really rude (although I realize that is not indicative of the resort at all)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort!”
Reviews.Author: carriembrandt
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying for 8 nights at this property, and have stayed at many different hotels in Orlando, and thought this was one of the best! The rooms were nice and spacious, the grounds impeccable, and it felt like we were not at Disney. We had a renovated room with two queen beds, which were very comfortable. We thought the staff was friendly, and service great. The food court was always busy, but the food available was above average, and loved the "Create your own salad and pasta bar." We will definitely stay here again when we go back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort.”
Reviews.Author: happycamper186361
Reviews.Content: We have been to Orlando a few times, but always stayed on International Drive. Staying at Port Orleans Riverside has been the best hotel yet. We stayed in Oak Manor. We are a family of 2 adults and 2 teenages and found there to be plenty of space to move around. Thre are 2 double bed in the rooms, which are comfortable and if you need any more pillows etc housekeeping will provide them. In the dressing area there a 2 wash basins, a rail for hanging clothes, an iron and ironing board and the safe, which is closed by a key. The bathroom was very clean and the towels seemed to be changed every day. We did get of complimentary toiletries when we arrived and at the begining of our 2nd week. The air conditioning was great, though a bit noisy, we did turn it to just a cool fan at night as it got too cold. The grounds are fantastic, the river runs through and the paths are quite shady so it is nice to have an amble. We did not use the pools as we were in the theme parks everyday, but towels are provided at the main pool. There is a disney film shown on the lawn every night for the kids. We were on the quick service dining plan and found this was all we needed. Breakfast had a choice of pastries,muffins,ceareals, fruit as snacks and waffles, omlettes, US cooked breakfast as meals and a drink. Dinner had a great choice from salads, pizza to choice your own pasta dish. A refillable mug was included in the plan and all cold drinks plus tea, coffee and hot chocolate were available until 11pm at night. The restaurant does get busy between 8am and 9am in the morning and from 7pm at night. The food in the Disney parks were great and very varied on the plan.

Reviews.Title: “The time of our lives!!!”
Reviews.Author: GOLTLOKS
Reviews.Content: This was an awesome, relaxing, beautiful hotel on Disney property. Will definately be staying here next time too!!!! Loved it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “You can't top Disney!”
Reviews.Author: tiggerfitzpat
Reviews.Content: I am never disappointed at Disney! This was our first visit to the Riverside. We stayed in the Alligator Bayou section.The landscaping was lusciuos and really keeps the noise down.It is spread out so it is quiet and more private. The boat to Disney Marketplace is a bonus. The service is amazing! It is so wonderful to stay right on the Disney property if Disney World is the reason for your visit. The transportation system is so well organized it never ceases to amaze us. I really recommend this location for couples and older travellers due to the peace and beauty of the resort. There can be a fair amount of walking if your room is located farther away from the restaurant area but I am sure the staff would be ready to assist you if this is a concern. Lots of bus stops so they are never too far away and the walk is so enjoyable. We had a king room and it was very spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property with laid back vibe”
Reviews.Author: SK3674
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that I have stayed at Disney many times, and at many different properties. Port Orleans Riverside is the best property for the money, hands down. The grounds are beautiful, with paths running along the river and by the pools. The pool side bar was so tranquil and relaxing that I could have stayed there all day sipping on my drink. (Note: we did go at an off-peak time). The room was as expected, a standard Disney room. Two queen beds, separate sink and toilet areas. Pretty standard hotel arrangement. However, Disney is very good about making those standard hotel rooms feel like home. Everything was very clean and and looked good. My only complaint is finding the room. The building is built like a maze, from trying to find the stairs, or even worse, the elevator, and then twisting and turning your way to the room. But, once you do it a couple of times, it becomes second nature. The lobby and check-in was easy and quick, waiting only a couple of minutes before be called to the check-in window. The "general" store was very large, and could fulfill your need to buy a Disney souvenir without venturing to Downtown Disney. The food court was large, but got very busy during peak times. We took our food to go, but it looked like most of the tables were filled. Overall, I would highly recommend going back to Riverside. There are better properties at Disney, Animal Wilderness Lodge seems amazing for example, but for the value, you can't be the Riverside.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: thesoftnoodle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 10th anniversary here and we would both agree that it was everything we wanted...and more! We stayed for 6 nights and the resort was beautiful. Our room at Acadian House was apparently recently renovated because everything was shiny and new. From the paint to the bathroom tile to the bed spread. Our house keeper Diana did an amazing job everyday. She would leave our room spic an span and she continuously added little details that gave us the feeling she took pride in her job...like cute towel creations...even simple ones like one that looked like a man's dress shirt folded and then she would place our toothbrush and paste neatly on top. I felt zero hesitation about leaving our smartphones and jewelry behind in our room while we spent our days at the theme parks. Sometimes we would not leave our room til after 12pm and then we sometimes came back as early as 5pm and housekeeping would always see to it that our room was always clean and set. We made sure to keep our clothes and shoes out of her way a bit and leave her a nice tip as a thank you. Thanks again Diana. We enjoyed all the restaurants on site, the pool, and a nighttime carriage ride. It was very romantic. Highly Recommended! One morning I took a nice bike ride around the property while my husband slept in. It was very quiet along the trails and there was plenty of beautiful landscaping with clear bike paths. A boat would come along quickly and regularly to take everyone on a 20 minute ride down the secluded river to get us to downtown Disney. Along the way we get to spy on Treehouse Villas and serious golfers. Thank you again Port Orleans Riverside. It is going to be an easy decision to visit again and again. Thank u.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING RESORT, DEFINETLY ONE OF DISNEY'S BEST!!”
Reviews.Author: butterflysugha
Reviews.Content: We have been to WDWFL 100s (if not 1000s) of times; we have stayed on almost every resort on and off property, and lived (and worked) in Orlando for a spell back in the late 1990s through early millenia. However, this resort is not only gorgeous in landscaping, it is perfect for anyone...the trails are easy to manuever for strollers or that early morning run, I love how close our building was to the main hub, and the pools are perfect. I was a little bummed to learn that the Magnolia Bend "house" was under construction, however, once we got into out rooms over at Oak House Terrace, we were pleasantly surprised! The rooms was the perfect size with our two kiddos and also on the corner, facing the pool. We loved it. The staff is super friendly, and any issue we had were resolved promptly. Upon checkout, we were unable to secure a late checkout, but we had three rooms tied to ours, so we suspected it was due to our large party (one of the other rooms did get a late checkout). As for food, we did NOT have the Disney dining plan, and we did just fine. For a family of 4, we spent about $20 for breakfast, and about that for lunch, maybe more for dinner. We brought snacks with us (we flew, by the way), and it saved us $$S! Plus, we bought the resort souvenir cup - it is worth the investment if you are there for more than 3-4 days. We did not eat at the nicer dining facility, the prices looked crazy for the same food at the cafeteria location. Plus, we ventured out to DT Disney and ate at the parks when we could... ACTIVITIES: We happened to go towards the end of summer, so there was SO much going on for the kiddos. If you have kids from 4-10 yrs old, sign them up for the Bayou Pirate Adventure. It is a great 2 hr excursion for your little pirate to learn a great story and go on a treasure hunt up the Sassgagoula River (sp?) - it is a little extra, but SO worth it! The three kiddos in our group had a BLAST, it was worth the investment! There was also "Rec Agents" at the pool that engaged the kiddos with games and contests, which was fun for all kiddos (especially the young at heart). We roasted marshmellows in the evening and then had movies under the stars, right next to our building! It was an amazing time - my daughter STILL talks about watching "Tangled" under the stars with mommy to all her friends - you can't buy that kind of moment! My only complaints were the weather - August in FL is not only H-O-T, it is humid. We can handle heat, especially over 100 degrees...however, you toss 100%+ humidity into the mix, and it is almost unbearable! On top of that, both my husband and I got sick (we were there for a whole week); we pushed through it and made it work, taking naps with the kiddos did, and staying very hydrated. All in all, we recommend this hotel - we hope we can go back in the fall - I have heard the decorations around the resort are amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jenn312
Reviews.Content: I don't know why anyone had a problem with this hotel it was wonderful!! We were traveling with 2 other couples and before we arrived I requested one of the newly renovated rooms and to my surprise we all got one!!! It was beautiful and extremely clean. This is a large resort but the bus stops are located around the resort and we had no problems. Defiantly recommend the dining plan it is the way to go because the food is expensive but the dining plan makes it easier. We had a hard time using all our snacks before we left but managed to use them all! I would defiantly recommend this hotel! I love Disney world!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!! Been before and going again!”
Reviews.Author: anya9399
Reviews.Content: My family first stayed here Christmas thru New Years 2010. We stayed in one of the Alligator Bayou rooms with the trundle, to accommodate the five of us and our infant daughter. We were very comfortable. My 11 year old son was very comfortable on the trundle. The resort lobby had a beautiful Christmas Tree. Everything was decorated so nicely. Awesome food court!!! We were on the dining plan and had plenty of choices. The kids LOVED the pool. It was heated and warm enough to get in in the cold weather at night. (In the past we have stayed at Carribean Beach Resort and the water was FREEZING!) The hot tub was great for the adults. The Old Mill is so great for pictures. My kids love to walk up at night and see it lit up. We had such a nice stay we chose Port Orleans Riverside again this past July when we took my 81 year old grandmother for her first visit. She has a wheelchair, and we rented her a motorized scooter that was waiting for us upon our arrival. When the cast members at the front desk realized she had a wheelchair they gave us an adjoining room at no extra cost to make her more comfortable! I was so happy! The refrigerator in one of the rooms was not cold and maintenance replaced it with a new one even though it was late at night when we returned from the parks. And he was soooo friendly about it. The staff went out of their way to make us comfortable. It was very clean,and great service. We can't wait to go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but kind of expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: BAMW
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family of four on our quick visit to the Magic Kingdom. The rooms were clean, but needed to be updated. I expected a higher quality room being at a Disney resort. The quick service meal restaurant (cafeteria) was nice and had adequate choices for both breakfast and lunch. We didn't eat at the full service restaurant at this resort. They had many hourly activities for kids on the grounds including a movie on the lawn each night. We didn't swim in the pool, but it was very large and looked like fun! Check in was a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Family of 4 loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Giforsure
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice! It's Disney! What can I say? We were very pleased overall. Can't say anything negative since everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans with a family of five!”
Reviews.Author: sfaillajr
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans Riverside is one of the few affordable resort on the Disney property that can handle a family of five. Our room was what you would expect from Disney: comfortable size, clean and well themed. Our family loved it during of 5 night stay. Our room had two double beds and a trundle bed that slid under one of the double beds. One of my five year olds slept on it without any complaints. We stayed in the Alligator Bayou building 39. Its a bit of a walk to the main building and bus stops so if you don't want the long walks every morning to get your coffee request a building closer to the food court. Bottom line is my family and I have never stayed a Disney hotel we didn't like and that goes for Port Orleans Riverside.

Reviews.Title: “The MOST magical holiday ever!”
Reviews.Author: EMMA M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the POR from 10th August - 25th August 2011. I was slightly apprehensive when we booked as the reviews were not always good relating to the rooms, but I am pleased to say the resort is absolutely immaculate and had a lovely relaxed feel about it. The landscaping and wildlife you see in the resort is very welcome after the bustle of the parks and a long day. We had a room in the Magnolia Bend Section, we were put in Acadian House which had just re-opened to guests on 4th August after renovations. Everything was brand new and the beds were amazingly comfortable. We had about 4 towel animals in the two weeks but we were happy with that! Our kids loved the pool and the food choices we great. Breakfast especially. The dining plan was great, we onl had to pay for about 3 meals the whole holiday, everything else including the snacks were included. The disney transportation service buses were so well organised, we only had to wait a couple of times from the water parks but that was due to heavy rainstorm and a mass exodus from the parks! Otherwise there were buses every time no matter what time of day or night whithin 10 mins of our arriving at the bus stops. We thought that our disney holiday would be a one off holiday of a lifetime, but we cannot stay away from the magic and are planning to go back maybe 2012!!! Unforgettable!

Reviews.Title: “poor customer service and nasty room!!! never coming back”
Reviews.Author: gabriel19632
Reviews.Content: We checked in and K from Port orleans check -in desk was rude, and unattentive to her customers. She gave us our packet and told us our directions to Port Orleans . We got to Port Orleans and relialized that she had not given us our room number, not even a welcome to Disney! ... once we found our room due to our surprise the room had a moldey oder ... and definatly could not accomadate our family size even though we where assured that it would.. we went back to the check -in desk and spoke to the mannager to find that there were no other rooms avaliable the mannager told us that we could upgrade to a diffrent resort but it was goning to cost us an additional $1,300.00.. after agreeing to pay this price we where moved to the Beach Club Resort we arrived and was greeted persoanly by an attendent we checked in and was given our room keys . We arrived at our room to find out that it was to small for our family size . We went back to the check -in desk to be assigned another room finaley we had a clean room and the room accomadated our family size. this took up half of our day! Therefore we could not visit the first theme park on our aggenda that day.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely our favorite resort so far!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pace_FloridaPam
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at some value resorts and one other moderate priced resort. Port Orleans Riverside is absolutely our favorite so far. Everyone we came in contact with made us feel so special and went out of their way to help us with any question or need we had. The room was very nice, the food at the food court was wonderful - I especially appreciated the made-to-order omelets and the potatoes for breakfast were delicious. The staff in the lobby and the gift shop were so friendly!! This is a very spread-out resort so if you can, you will be happier if you stay in Alligator Bayou, or buildings 14 - 18. We were in bldg18 and it was close enough to the lobby/restaurant area that we did not have far to walk in the evening after a long day of DisneyWorld walking. I highly recommend this resort and we will certainly stay there again. Thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again”
Reviews.Author: flacajun
Reviews.Content: As ts the disney way, easy check in and very clean rooms . we stayed at the Magnolia Terrace side the ones that look like old plantation mansions very nick quite rooms. eleavators are in the center of the building.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful resort that made me feel like I was down south”
Reviews.Author: izzygirl123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside for our first visit to Disney. The hotel is very large and there are many units on the property. Loved the feel of the hotel from the beginning. It did make me feel like I was down in New Orleans. We stayed in unit 3544 which was quite a walk from the main entrance where everything is located. The room itself was very nice and clean. Enough room for a family of five. Two double beds and a pull out trundle. Beds were comfortable, however if you are used to a bigger bed they can seem quite small. Trundle was fine for a smaller child, I don't know if it would work for an adult though. Staff was very helpful whenever we needed someone. Loved the horse drawn carriage rides around our resort and Port Orleans French Quarter!! Kids loved the pools! We had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans - Security”
Reviews.Author: CRR63
Reviews.Content: Be careful what you leave in the room safe, We had over $500 taken from different money wallets, they were clever as they only took a bit from each wallet, I suppose hoping we would not notice, The safe was locked and we had the key. It is probably worthwhile putting it in their safe in Reception Disney are investigating but I have had many versions of who actual has additional keys to these safes.

Reviews.Title: “Dont believe the Negative Reviews - this was FAB!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stephen C
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I stayed here from the 16th - 30th Aug and it was fantastic. We stayed in Acadia area on the 3rd floor and there were elevators available for our arrival and departure with suitcases. Room was clean and big - LCD TV, small safe, Refridgerator, Air Con etc. Staff were very friendly and helpful from the start but we never needed to do much interaction with them except at meal times. We had the Disney Quick Service Dining plan and had breakfast here most days. This would highlight the only downside which is that not all of the staff were familiar with the process and so some days we would get something and then have it knocked back the day after. The QSD plan is great value so try it. The hotel is very big so it is a good 5 minute walk from our room to the central point (but hey that will burn off some of those calories). Take the boat to Downtown Disney, lots for the kids to do, films, barbeque etc. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Southern Relaxing Charm Disney Style”
Reviews.Author: MrsMariaD
Reviews.Content: Disney's Riverside resort is our favorite hotel on Disney's property. We love the mansions with their charming southern style, large magnolia trees, azaleas and even wild bunny rabbits. The mansions were just renovated and they absolutely gorgeous. Queen beds, large flat screen TV's, coffee maker & refrigerator in each room. The main pool has a great water slide, there's a baby pool and hot tub, The food court is awesome: made to order pasta dishes, salads, pizza, burgers, homemade veggies and meats for dinner, pastries, ice cream, cookies and so on. Lots of variety to choose from. I highly recommend getting the food plan during your stay,its well worth the money. Just make sure to make reservations way in advance as the most popular places are booked 6 months in advance. There is a game room, giftshop, full service restaurant and bar in the main lobby. There are bicycle , mini one person boats, & pontoon boats for rent. You can also take a horse and buggy ride in the evenings. Honestly, there is so much to do and enjoy at the hotel you could make a weekend get away withoutgoing into the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of special touches!”
Reviews.Author: Cari O
Reviews.Content: It was the best vacation ever! Love the service they provided! The maid came in each day, and we would come back to a clean stocked room. She would even put the kids dolls(toys) nice and neat on their bed. The food was great. The grounds were great!!!!!! I recommend this resort! Good location too!

Reviews.Title: “Ist Disney Holiday”
Reviews.Author: LeedsAndrea
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with beautiful grounds. Very clean and tidy with helpful staff. Peaceful and relaxing after a busy day at the Disney parks. Fantastic swimming pool. Rooms nice with plenty of space. Bus service good. Food nice. Would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient”
Reviews.Author: daninet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans riverside for 7 nights, on August, 8 people in 4 rooms. We checked in late afternoon and didn't wait too long at the reception. We got 4 rooms next to each other, including 2 with connecting door for the family of 2 adults and 2 children. The rooms look "tired", but convenient and clean, and you have a coffee machine and complementary coffee each day. The resort is very nice and well looked after. We didn't enjoy the food that much (at the self service restaurant) - at dinner time it's crowded, and the food is quite basic. We had some dinners at restaurants outside the resort. The resort has a main bigger pool and a smaller pool next to the rooms, which is open till late. Also, next to the pool there is a self laundry facilitiy, so you can rleax at the pool while the washing machine/dryer are working for you... We used the Disney busses to get to the parks. You have to wait some time for the bus, and the queue for returning back from the parks when they close, is long, specially for our hotel. But, it is operated quite efficiently, and when there were long queues they brought 2-3 busses together to take care of the queue. On the whole, it was very convenient and well organized. We rented cars from Hertz, and the agent recomended to take them at the office in kissimee, which is close the the resot. However, we found out this office is small, oeprates only till 5 pm etc. On the positive side - they give you free pick up service from/to the hotel. If you want to rent a car, while staying at Disney resort, check for a more convenient arrangement. On the whole, we recommend this resort warmly. Dont' expect luxery, but it's very convenient, clean, friendly, who needs more. Maybe just upgrade the food services, please...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: koolstar
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at this hotel we experienced nothing but friendly and great staff. We have been to Orlando several times before but this was our first experience of a Disney hotel and I have to say it was one of the best we have stayed in. Check in was smooth and we were allocated a room in Acadian House which has just been renovated and was very nice. Not the biggest rooms in the world but there again the room is just somewhere to sleep at night! It was lovely and clean and the cleaners did an excellent job everyday. We were on the Disney quick service dining plan and ate many times in the hotels food court and had many good meals there. The pasta to go was one of the nicest meals we had. As its been previously mentioned, the pasta is made to order and you can choose the ingredients from a list. The walk to the main building wasn't too far and was very scenic. We used the North Depot bus stop and preferred this stop to the main one in the morning as the bus stopped here first so you always got a seat. We never had to wait too long for a bus and found it quite easy to get around on the buses. The staff were helpful when we needed to book taxis. The mansion block we were in was very close to one of the quiet pools and it was lovely to go swimming after a busy day in the parks. The pools were open until midnight so we had plenty of opportunity to enjoy it! Also the hotel put on films on a large screen every night for the children which were great. Overall I can't find a bad thing to say about this hotel and would not hesitate to book to stay here again. We really enjoyed our 2 week stay at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “LOVED POR!! New rooms are awesome!”
Reviews.Author: bubblykiki
Reviews.Content: We stayed at POR for 3 days the week of Aug.20th, 2011. This was our first time at a moderate, and boy was I pleasantly surprised. This resort is GORGEOUS!! So nice. Beautiful greenery and flowers everywhere. The main pool was amazing, the slide was so much fun and pretty long too! The food court was impressive, make your own pasta & salad. YUM! We stayed in the Acadian mansion, so we got to try out the newly refurbished rooms. Soooo nice. We just loved it. My son was in love too. We only had one problem, that was the in-room safe. I couldnt get it to open. I called maintenance and they came very quickly to help me. Theyre awesome! Mousekeeping was great too, left towel animals every day. We rented the bikes, I couldnt believe how cheap it was! So much fun to have those options. The water taxi to DTD was convenient and relaxing. I would definitely without a doubt stay here again. its my new fave resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved and and plan to come back every year !”
Reviews.Author: sharonrotha
Reviews.Content: I loved this resort ! I had previously stayed at the French Quarter resort, but decided to give this one a try and very glad I did. While the French Qtr has its charm and Mardi Gras atmosphere, I liked the quieter, more southern charm about Port Orleans. One other thing that I loved was the boat rides into Downtown Disney. Very relaxing and scenic vs. taking the bus. Its nice to stroll down to the main area and hop the boat. The food at Boatwrights was good, we enjoyed breakfast there at least half of the trip, but since we were on the dining plan, we mostly ate at the restaurants in Epcot. Found everything to be clean and the staff was more than happy to help. We found when we checked in that the internet cable was missing and the showerhead was partially clogged. They sent a repairman there who fixed everything by the time we got back to our room. We found a new showerhead, new internet cable and an apology note. It felt like they really cared. I vacationed with my husband and son, who is 18. Everyone loved this place. I plan on coming back each year. Everything was wonderful !

Reviews.Title: “yikees!!!!!! roaches!”
Reviews.Author: chetta c
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed in WDW for the past 25 yrs ,depending on my budget for the trip I stay at deluxe or moderate.This yr I choose the riverside despite the lukewarm reviews about the rooms (alligator bayou).First the the front desk couldnt get my room key to work after arriving and being @ the hotel for 7 hrs after I complained,then the roaches in my room (I requested VIP cleaning) the room was spotless but there seemed to be a roach situation .My family and I encounter a few more and after2 more trips and several phone calls to the front desk,we were relocated to the Yacht club at the expense of Disney.Please do not fall for the beautiful landscapes the hotel rooms needs a major overhaul and the trundle bed is a mattress on the floor( A JOKE!!).PLEASE do yourself a favor if the budget allows stay @ a deluxe resort. The staff was very helpful despite my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mollys998
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Port Orleans Riverside previously and liked it so much the first time, we thought we would do it again. I found it very inconvenient and pricey this time. I have Rhuematoid Arthritis and found the stairs to our second floor room very difficult. We had dinner at the Boatmans restaurant the night we arrived and the menu was very very limited and pricey. I was however surprised and disappointed to find they did not serve breakfast. The noisy and cluttered cafeteria style food court was not of my liking. The food was like nursing home food. We never had towels at the smaller pool, the buses do not run often enough and a our room was so far from the buses it was hard for me. We will not be staying there again

Reviews.Title: “Best holiday we have had - we will definately be back!!”
Reviews.Author: Tracy G
Reviews.Content: Port Orlean Riverside - superb hotel. Room was a very good size, mickey mouse was on our bed made out of towels when we arrived, what a lovely welcome!! Two double beds in the room, two sinks, bath with shower over it, toilet, ironing board, iron and hairdryer. If your going from England don't bother taking your hairdryer - it won't work, thankfully straighteners did!!! Take some coat hangers, we only had 6. We also had a fridge which we used to stock with beers from the supermarket as they are quite expensive in the hotel. Our room cards were also our tickets to the Disney Theme Parks, free buses run every 10 - 20 mins and there is a ferry to Downtown Disney from the resort. The buses sometimes get quite full but you are only on them for approx. 20 mins. The whole atmosphere in the resort is so laid back. The food selection is okay but we also liked to eat out, make sure you book in the restaurants in the parks otherwise you will be living on burgers and hotdogs! The pools are lovely and don't get too busy, at night a large video screen was put on the grass outside our room showing Disney films. There is also a laundrette which we definately had to use. You can hire bikes, boats and canoes from the hotel. I cannot sing the praises of this hotel enough, what are you waiting for - go and book NOW - I know we will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “50th Birthday”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne K
