Reviews.Content: Travelled with my husband to be,my son and future step daughter and son. My fiances 4th time,my first. Say no more,hotel great (Big),everything you need for a disney break,great transportation,food passes (Couldn't use them all,sooooo much).Grounds are second to none for value,staff are very good (Take a note UK),Anyone who is disappointed needs to get a life and stop moaning . US know how to make your holiday good,its bred into them. Florida, (Not just Disney), best place on this planet. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort, rooms need updating, too many smoking areas, too many smokers”
Reviews.Author: twaid
Reviews.Content: Riverside is a beautiful, spacious setting with a river and walkways. My biggest complaint is that the designated smoking areas are where the rest of us have to pass to get any where. I wish there were smoke-free areas. Another disappontment was that both change machines in the laundry were not maintained for at least three days. There are water crafts, bicycle surreys, horse carriages, and boat transportation; the seven swimming pools are great; especially the kiddie pool. The rooms badly need to be updated. King-size rooms were an additional charge and our requests for adjoining rooms were not fulfilled. We were also denied certain buildings even though we called in advance. Upon arrival, there was a very long wait to check-in; later we learned that it was there lunch shilft. Later rooms were still not ready when expected. There is a lot of walking to get to some of the hotel areas. Most areas are covered for protection from sun and rain. The General Store had a good variety and supply of Disney merchandise. The large counter-service dining room always had tables available. The rooms were quiet and beds were comfortable. The double sinks are great and the curtain provides privacy. There is no fitness center or spa.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than our last stay here”
Reviews.Author: Travelingmama1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel last year. I was really happy last year and this time too. We got a newly renovated room with new everything - bathroom, bedding, carpet - in "Acadia". Even though we didn't request it we got a king size bed instead of the two doubles. Last year we stayed in "Magnolia" and it was clean but the carpet and bedding looked a little worn. I saw that the "Magnolia" house was closed for renovations this time as we walked past it on our way to the room from the front desk/main building area. We did the on-line check in so when we got there, our room was ready. We picked up our room keys, stopped by our room to freshen up, went to Hollywood studios, and when we came back that night our luggage had arrived in our room. On the day we left, we waited by the bus stop for the Magical express that we had booked ahead of time and they told us the bus was too full and that we would have to stay behind. I was kind of pissed, but just asked if we were going to get to the airport on time. They called for someone to pick us up and a driver came within 10 minutes - just for us! This time we took the boat to Downtown Disney - it's a nice ride and a change from taking the busses.

Reviews.Title: “I am already planning a return”
Reviews.Author: JimmyAcox
Reviews.Content: In my opinion this hotel is the best bang for your buck of all the Disney hotels. The cost is low and the atmosphere high. they have a little of everything anyone could want, but for couples it is a treasure trove of privacy. The layout of the bungalows is perfect for easy access yet there is a definite feel of you being the only guest in the entire resort. This is enhanced by the way the staff seem to make you there top priority (not once in our eight days did we encounter a rude or slow staff member). The food is Magnificent, and the portions never leave you wanting. All that good comes at a small price. Walking you walk everywhere and most of it is outside so in Florida's rainy season you are going to get wet, very wet. So bring a poncho or umbrella and everything will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: squeaks120
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed here with 6 other family members. I have stayed in this resort before and loved it and was looking forward to bringing my family back. This trip by far was not the experience I had before. The hotel is clean and the rooms are comfortable. We also enjoyed the food choices and took advantage of the transportation. Even though all these things were great we had an awful experience with the maintancw and house keeping. We had several problems in our room from fridge not working, soap dish in shower falling off to a nasty smoke smell comin through the walls. After calling several times and no one coming to fix any of our problems, we became very frusterated. It took them almost four days to do anything to help us. Their final suggestion was to move rooms and by this time we were leaving in two days and our other family members were attached to our room, so we decided to stick it out. Finally a nice maintenance man came and he let us in on a secret, they had just renovated the building we were in and we were the first to stay in the room we are in and no one really had made sure things were working. In the end, we had a nice trip and enjoyed the resort but we will think twice before coming back to this resort. Maybe paying for deluxe resorts will give you better maintenance!

Reviews.Title: “Disney... but not Disney (plus Comparison to Value Resorts!)”
Reviews.Author: French_Viking
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth time to WDW but the first time staying at a Moderate resort (the three other times we stayed at the Value resorts - All-Star Movies, All-Star Music and All-Star Sports). As others have commented, the general theme of Riverside is well executed. Whether you end up in the Alligator Bayou or Magnolia Bend section, you do feel like you're in the deep South... and hanging around Ol' Man Island (i.e., the pool), the Fishin' Hole and the restaurant/boat landing area of the resort does make you feel a little like Tom Sawyer. The landscaping at Riverside is lush and it does a really good job of providing "distance" between each building, especially in the Alligator Bayou section. Strolling along the river and interconnected pathways is also quite enjoyable. My kids were a little disappointed, though, that the grounds didn't have some of those "quirky/fun" elements they remembered from the Value resorts (e.g., character sculptures to discover here and there). Personally, after a full day at one of the parks, I was kind of Disney-ed out and actually welcomed the break. In terms of the room, I saw no differences in the size of a Riverside room and one at a Value resort. There was more natural light, however, as our room had two windows (i.e., one on each exterior-facing wall). (Most rooms looked to be the same, too.) I also noticed that even the standard-category rooms in the buildings at the back of the property and facing the parking lots are very often shielded by some greenery, unlike my experiences at the Value resorts where your view in these types of rooms can literally be the parking lot, and nothing else. Otherwise, the quality of the furnishings and layout of a Riverside room is the basically the same as a room at a Value resort. Riverside's food court (i.e., Riverside Mill) was where I did notice a difference. Unless things have changed at the Value resorts, the food available here is better. I was surprised to see a cook-to-order pasta bar (you choose you own combination of noodles, sauces and toppings), a create-your-own salad station as well as a beef/turkey carving station with with vegetables (in addition to the standard hamburger, pizza and sandwich stations). I think all Value resorts have pool-side activities and outdoor movie screenings now, so there are no differences in that regard, but I found there was more to do at Riverside on non-park days, however. Things like a campfires, boat rentals, bike rentals, water-taxi to easily check out French Quarter resort and/or Downtown Disney, kids' pirate adventure cruise, fishing... Check the schedule when you're there if you're interested in the campfire as it's not held every night. In terms of transportation, if you leave for the parks before 10:30 a.m., you never share a bus with guests staying at the French Quarter resort (as I had read in reviews prior to going). Also, Riverside has four bus depots so those too tired to walk to/from the main (i.e., South) depot (just off the lobby/general store), can catch/get off the bus at the West, North or East depots, whichever is closest to their rooms. We never used this service, though, as we enjoyed the scenic walk to/from our room. Note that early-morning buses leaving the main/South depot head directly to a park and do not stop at the other depots; other buses service the other depots in the morning. Once at the parks, Riverside's buses essentially drop you off the same distance away from the entrances as the Value resorts' buses. The only exception I noticed was at Hollywood Studios where you get dropped-off closest to the entrance... closer than the Deluxe resorts' buses! Still, even being dropped off furthest from a park's entrance is really not a big deal... it maybe adds 2-3 minutes to your walk. From my research before going, there is roughly a $75 per night difference between staying st Riverside and a Value resort. Though the rooms aren't materially different that ones at a Value resort, Riverside feels more "polished" and more like a resort than any of the the Value resorts (which feel like motels) and so worth the extra dollars, in my opinion. If traveling with younger kids, especially if its their first time to Disney and/or you are a Disney enthusiast, I would actually recommend the Value resorts as they carry on the "Disney fun" much better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort, best choice ever will be visiting again for sure”
Reviews.Author: SaraDallal
Reviews.Content: It was the best vacation ever and the resort is beautiful. The staff were very helpful and always very sweet. The host keeping crew used to do very cute animal shapes with the new towels. It was a magical touch for sure. I stayed in rooms that are in the 8000 they are great very clean and very comfortable. I arrived at 1 am and the reception was great. The restaurants there are great for take away or sit in. There was always something to do around the resort and I was really close to the bus stop. The pools were great and relaxing. you get to choose which pool to use around the hotel and my room was close to two. The shop in the resort was also great and you can find anything you want from there. One of the nights when I was there it was raining heavily and I decided to stay in the resort than to go to the parks for the evening. It was great. I had time to relax and enjoy my time around the facilities of the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: momtipsfortraveling
Reviews.Content: First of all, why stay at a Disney property? Location, convenience, service and the sense that you never leave the magic. It's true you could get a better deal for an equally beautiful hotel for cheaper but you'd miss: a) complimentary transfers to and from the airport complete with complimentary luggage transfer AND check in, b) extra magic hours (1 hour before a select park opens and 3 hours - yes, THREE hours - after the park closes, c) complimentary bus and boat transportation to the parks and d) the sense that you never leave Disney. In this hotel, that meant wonderful Disney movies at 9 pm outside on a green lawn, fun themed entertainment at the restaurants, excellent service and the use of the Disney meal plan if you purchase that. As for Riverside, you'd have to be a very sour person to not fall in love with this place. I'm a single mom and I went with 3 teens, and we LOVED it. I should say we had the fortune to be in one of the gorgeous newly renovated rooms--the room was large (two queens) and very tastefully decorated. Honestly, I've stayed at Polynesian, Contemporary and other more expensive Disney properties, and Riverside outshines them all, & is very reasonably priced for what you get. If you like privacy and beauty, as well as a beautiful, peaceful boat ride to Downtown Disney, this is definitely the place for you. We took long walks by the river, my kids swam in the main Riverside pool and the youngest did the slide and played the fun games the lifeguards led -- while I relaxed and read and soaked in the hot tub; at night we watched Disney movies on a screen outside while sitting on a lovely lawn. Service was excellent and helpful; at one point we were given wrong info on how to get to another restaurant and Riverside's concierge paid for complimentary taxi just to get us there on time. Best of all, they did this with a smile and proactively, offering this before I could even get upset. Wonderful. Strongly, strongly recommended. The rooms are constructed around a courtyard, and each major courtyard has its own tiny quiet pool, if you like more private swimming. In our case, the main pool was a five minute walk over a beautiful bridge. If you get the non-renovated rooms, I'd still recommend this place, particularly if you like beauty, privacy and quiet. The only negative would be for people with very small children, say, 3-5: too old to be in a stroller, can't really appreciate the beauty, a fair amount of waiting and walking for little feet. Families with children this age would be better served by a more convenient location such as the Contemporary . Otherwise, it is wonderful and for my own children (teens & young adult), as well as elementary school-aged children, and younger and older childless couples, it is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT! Going back next year!”
Reviews.Author: astroud_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went here for our honeymoon. The food was delicious, everyone was friendly even the gardners! haha! Loved the mickey waffles with strawberries for breakfast! Our room was really easy to find and very clean! We highly recommend it for couples! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, clean and just a normal standard US hotel”
Reviews.Author: riisereplica
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really nice, great amenities and travel to the parks etc and DTD. Its a basic US hotel (if you know what I mean). Nothing to blow you away but safe, secure, and most of all clean. Cost was 'ok', you do pay more as you are in Disney Dont forget, if you stay in a disney hotel, you dont pay to get in any of the parks and can get in early to most of the parks with 'magic hours' Internet cost $9.95 per day

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorite places to stay”
Reviews.Author: southplainsgroup
Reviews.Content: The atmosphere here is EXCELLENT. We have stayed in all three resort categories, and this is our favorite resort by far. The transportation time is far less than several of the deluxe resorts we have stayed in. This resort is wonderfully relaxing. You will LOVE it. The only issue is the distance from other buildings, but if you have mobility impaired members in your party, you can get rooms close to the main buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Well managed...”
Reviews.Author: Chris_CinPrague
Reviews.Content: From the complimentary transportation from the Orlando international airport to transportation back to the airport after the vacation....Disney's Port Orleans Riverside resort can't be beat for value and convenience. We stayed at the resort with the theme park package Your Way, using the same hotel room card for entry to the parks, all shopping charges, etc. The rooms are small but comfortable, the cleaning services were excellent, the transportation links excellent to every park, very covenient local food court and well-stocked local shopping area, all the staff polite, friendly, and very knowledgeable.... there were NO negatives on this vacation. We have never stayed in a better-managed resort. Disney knows how to take your money and make you feel happy to hand it over. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “We were very pleased overall”
Reviews.Author: MrFoxy888
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean. The maids even left us cute animals made out of towels each day. The grounds were well kept and beautiful. We loved the Alligator Bayou theme to the place. The pools were nice. The restaurant on the grounds was nice. There is a great ferry to Downtown Disney if you are in a shopping mood. The front desk staff was great, especially a nice English guy named Matt that checked us in. We were very pleased and would definitely stay here again if we come back to Disney World next year. The only complaint that we have is that they don't provide free wireless Internet service in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and a Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: Sheriann98
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just enough for us, it was big enough and the beds were comfortable. The bathrooms were clean and the sweet housekeeper had our room cleaned up for us with cute little animals made out of towels every night. The kids really like that she made it special for them! If your going to stay here and will be gone to DW all day then this is the place for you; it's convenient and is there for you to sleep and shower.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Carol M
Reviews.Content: I was worried when I read some of the bad reviews. I stayed at the Port Orleans side a few years in a row. This year I decided to stay at the Riverside. What a good decision. It is very clean and everyone that works there is very friendly and helpful. If you decide to stay there you need to ask to stay at Alligator Bayou sections. Sections 14, 15, & 27 are the closest to the food court and bus depots. All the others are some walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Lovely, Lovely Resort”
Reviews.Author: sophe25
Reviews.Content: Our first stay onsite at disney and Ive been bitten by the bug and can't wait to go back. The resort is beautiful. Immaculate grounds in a very peaceful setting. The rooms are a bit out dated (but I think this is being remedied soon). Bowrights was good for the first night but we went elsewhere afterwards and ate better meals. The food court was very crowded even when the resort was quiet, however the food was very good. For lunch we often had some of the lovely made to order pasta and salads which were huge and delicious. Great to feed kids and 4 of us shared one of each thus saving up some dining credits. We bought two of the free refill cups which were good value, however the design was a bit odd as the handle kept getting in the way and the lids leaked often. Also, in the dining hall there were two sinks to wash them out (if switching from coffee to soda) but they had this rediculous water saving thing that was motion censored to only provide a squirt of water after waving the cup back and forth in front of it. Very frustrating. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Boat ride to downtown disney was lots of fun and our captain gave us a running commentary of the history of POR and FQ and lots of disney stories. The rooms, as Ive mentioned, were outdated and the two double beds felt very cramped. They are not the biggest rooms and as two adults and two kids we were a bit tight for space. Bathroom was clean and we had exceptional Mousekeeping. Had a small problem with one of our room keys not working and they sent someone out very quickly to help. We were on the 1st floor of magnolia terrace, room 8511 which was right by a lift. Parking was nearby, but far enough that it was a bit tricky loading and unloading our bags. We were right by a bus stop however and buses were very frequent. The quiet pool next to magnolia terrace was lovely and great to have a quick swim in each morning. Overall, this is a lovely resort and great for families. The rooms need a bit of a spruce up but that seems to be happening. I loved it and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Have Been & Going Back”
Reviews.Author: Ornella01
Reviews.Content: We have been to Disney eight times but only stayed at Riverside six. We are going back in a few days & can't wait. All I can say is it gave us a life time of memories the first time and to be able to go back again & again is a wish come true. Riverside eating area is one of the best we have seen. There are so many options and the people there are nice to ask question to about what we should eat. The rooms are so wonderful. There is five of us and we are pretty comfortable. The people that come to tidy are room do a great job. We never have to worry about anything. I hope that never changes. I have to say some are better than others. Lets face it everyone has a bad day once in awhile but as long as it's not the norm. Again we will be there soon & hope that when I come back to comment it will just be even better!! If you decide to stay at Riverside you won't be disappointed!! Canadian Friends~

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CAAPrestonLancashire
Reviews.Content: After reading so many negative reviews on this Hotel, I wondered if I had made a huge mistake booking here and was very apprehensive about what my holiday would be like. I needn't have worried at all - the resort was absolutely beautiful, and I would not hesitate to go back again and again. The Staff were so helpful and polite. We did not eat in the Food Hall as we preferred to go out of the resort for meals. We were staying in the Parterre Place section of Magnolia Bend, very conveniently located to the Lobby and the quiet swimming pool. The boat transport to Downtown Disney was an extra bonus for staying at this Resort. Cannot praise this place enough, a stunning,totally beautiful environment to spend 2 glorious weeks. Heres to next time!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the grounds and common areas!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingJam2
Reviews.Content: Disney's Port Orleans Riverside Resort is a fantastic resort on the outside but not very impressive on the inside. What I mean by that is the grounds, pools, main lobby and main building are wonderful, while the motel-style room accommodations are unimpressive. If your idea of a good hotel/motel/resort is one that provides you with an excellent guest room, then Riverside will not be your idea of a good resort (the guest rooms are smallish, the bathrooms are tiny, and the beds are narrow.) However, if you are like me and only think of the guest room as a place to sleep during your stay, and that the primary reason to be at a Disney resort is to enjoy the common areas of the resort (and to visit the Disney theme parks), you will probably like Riverside. I have noticed a few reviewers mention that their rooms were not clean. That was not the case with our guest room. The interior of our room was very clean, and the outer perimeter of the building we stayed in was immaculately kept, with impeccably landscaped gardens. Riverside is a motel, not a hotel, but as far as motels go, it is by far and away the most exceptional motel I have seen. If you are arriving at Disney World by car (or intend to rent a car while at Disney World), you will appreciate the convenience of being able to quickly access your guest room from the parking lot. If you will not have a car during your stay at Riverside, be prepared to do a lot of walking, because this resort sprawls over a huge property. One of my favorite things about staying at Riverside was going for long walks through its spectacular grounds. My family stayed in the Alligator Bayou section of Port Orleans Riverside. This was not by choice, but rather it is the only section or Riverside which accommodates a family with 3 children. Disney resorts are not very accommodating to families with 3 children (once the youngest child is older than 2 years of age), for the most part limiting their options to the most expensive Deluxe resorts, or to having to pay for multiple rooms (or suites) at the Value resorts, most sections of Moderate resorts, and at the two least expensive Deluxe resorts (Animal Kingdom Lodge and Wilderness Lodge). In my experience, it is common for a family to have 3 children (nearly as common as families with 2 children), so it baffles me that Disney can't provide trundle beds, sleeper sofas or roll-a-way beds at its less expensive resorts, when it can do so at its most expensive Deluxe resorts (Contemporary, Boardwalk, Beach Club, Polynesian, Grand Floridian). Perhaps fire codes have something to do with Disney's policies, but it is difficult to understand why the Alligator Bayou section of Port Orleans Riverside can have trundle beds, but all of the other areas of Riverside (as well as French Quarter and Caribbean Beach Club Resort) do not have any rooms with trundle beds. For those of us who are allergic to mold, the Alligator Bayou section of Riverside is not an ideal place to stay. As the name suggests, this area of the resort is patterned after a Louisiana bayou, with dense vegetation surrounding the resort buildings, and an algae-coated bayou running right through this section of the Riverside resort. We stayed at Disney's Riverside Resort when the rooms were discounted to $96 per night, so I have trouble conceiving of how I would have reacted to this resort if I had paid the higher rates that I have seen mentioned in other reviews (I have seen references to rates as high as $250 per night.) If you are faced with paying a high rate for a room at Riverside, I strongly recommend that you consider paying a bit more to upgrade to a Disney Deluxe Resort. I felt it was well worth it to pay $96 (or $129) per night to stay at Disney's Riverside Resort, but to pay in the vicinity of $200 per night would be to overpay for this resort. At that price you might want to keep your eye out for a discounted room at the Contemporary, Polynesian, Beach Club, Boardwalk, and at either the Swan or Dolphin resorts (and if your party is 4 people or less, add Animal Kingdom Lodge and Wilderness Lodge to that resort search).

Reviews.Title: “Better cleaner places to be had”
Reviews.Author: beerbellyhillbilly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 days and 2 nights, and we couldnt wait to get out. We spent most of the day at the disney parks, but still spent a fair amount of time in the room. When we first got there the place had a bad smell coming from the extremely small bathroom. W e called and told the desk about it, we decided not to switch rooms since it was getting late and we were all tired. So they send over a house keeper with a bottle of spray. She comes in squirts 3 tiny squirts in the corners of the room. I couldnt understand a word she was saying, and when i asked her about spaying the bathroom, she replied" i can do nothing" and left. lol i still don't know what that was about. TH e room just felt dirt, and by bed time on the 2nd night we all had a small rash. Proof that the room could'nt have been cleaned properly? We found what used to be a chocolate doughnut under the air conditioning unit in the room. This thing had been there for some time and had begun hosting a colony of mold on it. Great huh?! The only two things i sort of enjoyed here was the pool area in back, and the cafeteria, which is very big and room. Still it is sometimes hard to find a table since they are super crowded. in my opinion for the money ($250 per night) WAY better cleaner places can be had.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: mickeyfanforever
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 1829 bldg 18, perfect! Beautiful grounds, pool just footsteps away and the laundry was convenient. It's a beautiful little walk to the lodge and to the bus depot, we enjoyed every step. July was hot!!!!! Bring water/gatorade, not soda with you to every park and for the ride to and from parks. The staff at Riverside was amazing. So polite and friendly. We've stayed at the Mansions and now in Alligator Bayou and I have to say both are convenient and beautiful. Our rooms at Riverside were very pretty, clean and roomy. The extra bed was nice and we were always comfortable in the room. I will say that it would be nice if there were cabinets or a table or something around the pedestal sinks that would hold your toiletries, however, we made out just fine. I love PO Riverside. We had the opportunity to stop by some of the deluxe resorts and let's just say PO Riverside will always be home to us. Thanks Disney for a wonderful family visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: RonBarnes
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong staying in a disney resort. Very clean rooms, Nice pool and very fun bar to hang at. Our room overlooked a river and on the otherside was a golf course...very nice view. And love the disney transportation...weather its the shuttle buses or the boats that pick you up on the river...AAAA++++

Reviews.Title: “still lovin' Port Orleans Riverside!”
Reviews.Author: sujari
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our stay POR and a great time!. This is our second time we have stayed here and we still love it! Although I will say the room was a little dated but acceptable. However they are in the process of updating all the rooms so in time they will all be better then ever. The rooms are good size for a family of four! We stayed in the Magnolia section at Parterre Place. Even though it was a busy time of the year our wait times for busses were minimal (we never waited more then10 minutes for a bus to get to anyone of the parks,) The pools are great. The staff were very friendly and helpful! The grounds are still beautiful! One of the things I love at POR is the boat to Downtown Disney it is a nice alternative to taking the bus. And if you get a chance make sure you have a drink at the bar when Bob is playing the piano, he is fantastic and so much fun!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Kellyl28
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. A friend had gotten a discounted rate on the room. I was shocked when I saw the real room rate. The room was small, kinda cramped for two couples. It was just a normal room and way to expensive at 350 a night.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time here and it's still great!”
Reviews.Author: naenae248
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here in September of 2010 and we returned in May of this year. Port Orleans Riverside did not disappoint. We arrived after a long day of travel and check in took less than 10 minutes--that was for 2 rooms. My in laws came with us this trip. The hotel was also able to accomodate our request of having adjoining rooms. Our rooms were pretty close to the main building, Parterre Place, I believe. They were nice and clean, they only problem was that the bedrails that I requested were not there. I made a call to the front desk and when we returned from dinner they were there just in time for bed! We also had a small issue with our fridge not being super cold, but they sent someone up within an hour the day we noticed it. So all in all no big issues with the room. The room was clean and that's always my biggest concern. We went to the pool on two different occasions. Both times, we really enjoyed it. My oldest son loves the slide and my youngest had fun in the baby pool. We were there over Memorial Day weekend and it wasn't really crowded at all. We also ate a few times at the food court, it's pretty typical fare. The pizza is nothing to shout about, but the chicken fingers and hambers are pretty good. Breakfast is also nice there. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: HollieHoliday
Reviews.Content: Me and Paul went here for my 23rd Birthday, From arrival the resort is well designed and well laid out getting to each of the Disney parks is very easy with the free shuttle buses running every 5 - 10 minutes. The room was idle and very big.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice!”
Reviews.Author: DisneyJoe
Reviews.Content: Set in a plantation theme, the grounds were really well maintained and although their were two sections of the hotel in the process of being renovated, our room was really clean and in excellent condition even though it had not yet been renovated. Transportation to the parks and downtown Disney were convenient and timely. The food at BoatWrights, (the on premise sit down restaurant), was 4 out of 5 stars. The food court had adequate choices and as always with Disney, clean and organized. My only complaint is luggage. There is a Bell counter just outside the main entrance to the Riverside. Not a single Disney employee or Bell person made any effort to help or explain and believe me, some of the rooms were quite a distance from the Check in area. The Management at the Hotel needs to get this part of the process working.

Reviews.Title: “Spartan...”
Reviews.Author: ChinaTraveler63
Reviews.Content: As a Disney property, I was expecting more. Staying here for a conference was pretty much a waste of money. The room was profoundly out of date (like much of Disney anyway) and in need of a good cleaning. If you need a place to crash before or after visiting the parks - this would work, but then why pay $$$ for an otherwise cheap room?

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.....great base for Disney holiday”
Reviews.Author: lollypop1874
Reviews.Content: This is the first review i ever put on Trip Advisor.....i wanted to say how much we enjoyed our holiday in July 2011 ( 2 Adults and 2 kids ( 3 and 7). The hotel is set in very pictuersque grounds and has a really nice reception with a fantastic shop and bar. The food was good, you had a choice of a la carte but we only did this once, we ate a few other times in the 7 days we were there but mainly in the "barn" where you get multiple choice of freshly prepared food ( in the main) which was always great. Out kids loved having the choice to pick what they wanted as opposed to it arriving on their plate and not liking it ! The breakfasts were the best by far....fresh made omlette every day my DH had ( just the way you like them)!! Fresh pastries and pancakes were lovely! The rooms themselves ( we stayed in 9415) - quite close to reception , they are in little blocks of what must be 30-40 rooms, the room we stayed in had 2 double beds ( small doubles) + chair and 2 seats, bathroom with 2 sinks seperate from toilet/bath. It was a little old fashioned in terms of the furniture/bedding but nothing bad just a bit dated. If they had put new up to date bedding on and generally "jazzed up" the room i would have probably given the hotel 5 stars......it was a great base for Disney with the great shuttle service to all the parks and we loved every minute of our time there ! Would recommend to families looking for a good hotel in Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Very outdated, in desperate need of renovations”
Reviews.Author: traveller_TO_Canada
Reviews.Content: We did not enjoy this property much. We thought the accomodations were motel level at best. The grounds are beautiful, the hotel is located on this enormous property. However, the rooms were so small and totally outdated. I felt we were ripped off - could've stayed for a fraction of the price at a much nicer property that's not classified 'disney resort'. Our friends stayed in a non-disney hotel and enjoyed most of the perks that disney promises - e.g. buses, etc. It's quite a long bus ride to almost all of the parks. Also, I recommend to stay away from disney buses, they are way overcrowded, and at certain times of day (park closing, etc) it's totally packed. Not my type of a vacation riding aroun in a stuffed bus.

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely LOVED this property”
Reviews.Author: lizharrell1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Disney Resort and fell in love with it!!! The buildings looked more like condos than standard hotel rooms. Of course, as usual, Disney paid attention to EVERY detail. The free shuttles to the parks were both convenient and easy to use. Never had to worry about finding parking. There was also a ferry onsite that takes you to Downtown Disney, and if you time your ride back to the resort JUST right, you get to see the Fireworks from the Magic Kingdom while on the boat!!! Lots of kid friendly amenities, such as beautiful pools, arcade, fishing, etc. We will NEVER stay at an off site hotel again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best value at Disneyworld”
Reviews.Author: dad2spam
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans is a mid priced hotel that has top notch themeing. The rooms are nice, the area is great with the water way, and wide walkways. It is a nice relaxing area to come home to at night. One central large themed pool and 4 other regular pool around the resort. Restaurant, counter service, and fast food options on site. You can take the water taxi for a relaxing 1.5 mile ride to downtown Disney. Have stayed here a couple of times, and other family members also. It never disappoints. It is our favorite on site hotel at Disneyland. It is centrally located, but closest to Epcot, Disney Studios, Typhoon Lagoon and downtown Disney.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Themed Motel Choice for an on-site Disney Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mattsaab
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a more Motel Resort than anything else. As long as you understand this isn't a Hilton, Westin or full-service hotel, you may enjoy the price and location. As always, it's best to be on property if your main intent is seeing Disney World. The rooms are glorified motel rooms, clean and average in almost everything. The shower and toilet room are the most depressing however, and downright dark. Some people also have a problem being able to see the bathroom sink from the bedroom (think Disney cost savings). The pools are large, many and themed. There is standard 2-3 star cafeteria food and the staff is helpful. So, if the price is the most you would spend to be on Disney property -- this isn't a bad choice. It's better than the Caribbean Beach "Resort," but won't blow your socks off either.

Reviews.Title: “We Return Here Every Year!”
Reviews.Author: dvbassist
Reviews.Content: Love this resort! Always clean, several nice pools, balcony to sit out on in the evening. Best part is the boat trip to Downtown Disney. Looking forward to returning this September.

Reviews.Title: “So much to do without even visiting a park!”
Reviews.Author: FlowerShopDaisy
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here maybe 5 times and it's always great. This time had some negatives. It seems they were short on buses as we had to wait quite some time for them. We waited so long on our return from Magic Kingdom at 11 p.m. that we decided to take bus to French Quarter and then ride the ferry boat to Riverside. However, Ferry Boats were closed due to the river rising to high for the ferry's to fit under the bridge and we had to carry our sleeping 2 yr old on a long walk to make it back. The pool was very chilly. The sidewalks were slippery. Our room was quite a long walk from everything and we woke early everyday to kids running outside our room. Some of these things were understandable (due to rain & large crowds). The pluses are that you can park your car and never get in again until the end of trip. You can ride buses or ferry boats, Hop to different resorts and areas for dinner or entertainment, The gentleman who sings in the bar at the Riverside Mill is outstanding (and kids are welcome). Our room even had a little fridge so we brought breakfast & lunch items to save some $$. There is so much to do that you don't even have to visit a park to have a great time. It's worth some of the inconveniences. Take advantage of the pools, the restaurants, the entertainment on the various properties and you'll have a ton of fun without using your car!

Reviews.Title: “nice and friendly”
Reviews.Author: suitcase0810
Reviews.Content: Some rooms far from centre but no more than 12mins walk. Fine when sunny but not so goos in downpours! Shop was lovely and friendly as is Disney. Bar was atmospheric with live entertainment some nights. Bit small so could be crowded at busy times. Reception area lovely with small tv playing Disney films for children. VERY useful for 5 year old! main pool was excellent with a great slide and life guards. Other pool by room was nice and peaceful but no guards. Surroundings were lovely and well kept. Boat rides for Disney Down town. Could easily walk to Port Orleans French Quarter for a change of scene - i.e different eateries. Good and different food in the French Quarter as well. Child had dinosaurs etc as gifts and maid would place them in different positions daily! Loved coming back to see what the dinasours had been up to!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming resort-mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: juscruzin
Reviews.Content: I brought my 22 year old daughter to WDW for a college graduation present, and chose Port Orleans because of pictures of the grounds and mansions. We stayed from July 12-19. I also chose Disney lodging because I wanted the luxury of being able to have onsite Disney transportation and the extra magic hours. I have a mixed review about the resort itself. Magical Express: This is an absolute bonus to have all luggage taken care of at the airport and placed in your room for you. It was quick and we were in the lobby from the airport after two prior stops. It took just about 45 minutes. Check-In: I did online check-in 10 days in advance. I had requested a mansion room and this was granted. We were placed in building 85, very close to a bus stop and over the bridge from the lobby/restaurant/ferry. We arrived just before 11:00 and our room was already ready for us, so we freshened up and took the ferry to Downtown Disney for the afternoon. Nice. Check-in took less than 10 minutes. Easy. Room: We reserved a King room as this was the only option available when I booked, and this worked out fine. We had plenty of room to spread out and unpack. There are drawers in the armoire and in the two night tables. There is a refrigerator, a tube tv that we never turned on, a very tiny safe, an ironing board and iron, and a hairdryer. There was also a privacy curtain in the double sink area for dressing and getting ready in the morning. The room was clean, but definitely showed wear on the carpet, walls, bathtub and toilet. On the fifth night, I went to get ready for bed and there was a GIANT spider on the sink sill next to my toiletries bag. I screamed and asked my daughter for assistance. Unfortunately, I'm terrified of spiders and cannot be anywhere around them. My daughter took a picture on her cell phone and my husband identified it as a brown recluse. My daughter went to try to hit it with a shoe, then turned towards me, then back, and it was gone. We nervously dumped out bags, looked everywhere very hesitantly, and then called the lobby. It was after midnight at this point and we were so tired. To make a long story short, after three calls to the main desk to get pest control (the 2nd I was laughed at by the gentleman on duty), I was finally able to talk with someone who understood that there was no way I was sleeping in this room with this spider about. By 2:30, we were finally ensconced in a double with a river view (don't even bother to upgrade to this type-the view is behind trees). By 3:00 we were finally asleep. Of course, after this mess we slept almost to noon, losing out on getting an early start on the last day of our vacation. Basically, if you have an issue with spiders or pests you will be laughed at and it could take some time to get someone to take you seriously. (As a side note, the gentleman who came to pick us and our luggage up in a golf cart was wonderfully patient and kind). Grounds: Gorgeous, peaceful, very scenic. Bring comfortable walking shoes and take care of your feet. You will walk like you've never walked before, both at Disney Parks and at this resort! Food: We opted not to do the dining plan-honestly- we just don't eat this much food or this way on vacation. We brought food for breakfast and I made a pot of coffee in the room every morning. We ate something snacky for lunch and then ate an early large dinner that kept us going until we passed out everyday from exhaustion. We ate in the cafe once here and had chicken sandwiches. They hit the spot. Also, went to the French Quarter and tried the beignets-pretty much funnel cake in a doughnut form. Staff: Mixed here. The check-in person was hardly what I have experienced from a cast member on past visits to other resorts. Efficient, yes, but hardly friendly. Was not welcoming or particularly happy I had arrived. There was no one else in line for online check-in when I arrived, but the brusqueness would have made you think there was a whole long line waiting. Ferry staff were friendly on all occasions. Restaurant staff was just fine. Magical Express staff and luggage handlers were awesome. The concierge I dealt with on the last day was less than friendly or helpful. I had a revised bill under my door on checkout day due to the room change and there was an additional night's charge on the bill. When I went to get this settled, I was told I could not recieve a bill with a -0- balance like it showed on the concierges' computer, but was assured that I owed nothing. I felt very uneasy walking out without getting a printout that showed no discrepancy on my bill, but was told that if there was an issue when I got home, that I could call a 1-800 number. He also wrote his name on the bill as further assurance. I was not told to have a magical day, a nice day, or anything else for that matter, not even an acknowledgment of goodbye. So much for Disney charm or courtesy here. Housekeeping: Towel art two nights in a row-very cute. Room was cleaned everyday. I felt they did an okay job. There was dark hair on the bathroom floor on day 2 and I'm not sure if this rolled out of a corner or what. I felt that the inital room and the double were both just okay. I understand they will be under renovations soon-they need it. Disney Transportation: A joke while we were here. We spent countless hours riding buses, some that were packed beyond capacity. I spent one late night home from MK with a woman bouncing and rubbing against me in wet clothing for close to 30 minutes-where is the concept of personal space. We also waited many times for more than an hour for a bus to take us where we needed to go-sometimes with very tight timing to dining reservations. It made for an anxious and frustrating time, and was a true downside to our vacation. We did rent a car for the weekend to go to the beach and it was wonderful to have the freedom to come and go. All-in-all, I would stay at this resort again in the future, if for nothing else than the beautiful surroundings and Disney Magical Express. I would request a renovated room. We also loved the late night Magic Hours on several nights-there's nothing like staying until 3:00 a.m. at Magic Kingdom. I would also highly recommend renting a car. Disney parking is free at all the parks while staying at the resort. I would also suggest that Disney get up with the times by giving free wireless internet like many of the other off-site hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very happy.”
Reviews.Author: ROBnMO
Reviews.Content: Was at Disney as a business traveler - uncommon to be sure, but I had a great experience at this hotel. The rooms was a bit far from the amenities in the main building, but for a place to sleep, shower, etc., it more than fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “2 weeks at Riverside”
Reviews.Author: brmen
Reviews.Content: For being a moderate hotel, this hotel provides high quality service and amenities. It is centrally located in Disney World and only seems far away from Animal Kingdom. I enjoyed using the ferry to DT Disney and also the bus service to/from the parks. All of them ran efficiently and were noticably better than other Disney hotels. The hotel offers one large themed pool and several smaller ones located throughout the property. I found that they were all busy and well-used at at all times of the day. Restaurant options at the hotel are standard - one table service and a cafeteria. But it also offers a lounge where live music is performed, which I really enjoyed. Food selection at the cafeteria was quite good and average at the table service restaurant. I would recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a comfortable stay at a reasonably priced Disney World Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: CCH19904
Reviews.Content: We've never had a family vacation, so when my husband returned from his 6th deployment, we decided it was time. Booked far in advance for a week at Port Orleans Riverside with great anticipation. Unfortunately, it was a huge disappointment. We walked and weaved through pathways in search of our room. Although the grounds were beautiful, the room was very far away from everything. Once we got to the room, the real nightmare began. Small, DARK and cheap. 2 small full size beds and a trundle. Once it was pulled out, there was little space to walk to get to the other side of the tiny room. A curtain divided the sink area from the sleeping area. Bathroom was even smaller - small closet sized. When we pulled the dividing curtain across, we realize it was splattered with... something. Odd stains on the carpet as well. (Truly looked like someone had bled all over the room.) I was sickened at having my daughter sleep so close to the filth. Since it was late, we stayed the night. Woke up the next morning and vowed to get out of our situation as fast as possible. Spoke to the management and expressed our disgust. We decided to sink an enomous amount of money and transfer to Key West Villas. Manager made the arrangements, arranged for a few minor "perks" (preferred viewing for EPCOT fireworks, and a pass for Blizzard Beach - which we couldn't use due to the weather) and gave us a free family Hopper Pass to be used within the next 2 years. It would have been a lot more appropriate if we could have gotten a discount on the upgraded room. In all, we wasted a whole day changing hotels and sorting through the problems. Our 4 year old showed more patience than most adults would since we only got to the park at dinner time. The remainder of our trip was wonderful- we were very happy that we upgraded. Most of the staff were helpful thoughout the issues. Still, there is no excuse for the disgusting conditions of the room!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: onebigfellah
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. The room was very clean, and everything was fully functional. The bed was comfortable. The bus to and from Disney World was easy to get onto from pretty much any point on the property. The staff was pleasant and professional. Our check-in time was a bit on the long side (~ 20 minutes). The food bar they had in the hotel more then adequately met our needs...which is good because my wife has a gluten sensitivity and they prepared her meal special for her. The landscaping was very nicely done and well maintained. Overall it was a very welcoming and enjoyable stay! Thanks Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Slow to start off, but beautiful grounds & beautiful holiday.”
Reviews.Author: KeithyB_10
Reviews.Content: First of all, a party of 11 is not going to be a very quick check in.. so along with misspelt names and a mix up with the amount of adults and children, it made for a pretty monotonous first half hour. However, once the rooms were assigned and everyone was settled, i couldnt have asked for a nicer holiday. The rooms were a nice size, i wouldn't have said they were small (not that your in them for 80% of the time) and i found the housekeeping done a fine job of keeping on top of the mess we made! And the staff are also very helpful with any request or questions we put to them. The riverside resort had about 3 pools that i was aware of after walking the grounds, one of which is a childrens pool and was extremely busy from what we saw. The other two were quite nice and quiet at times, although could get a little busier around mid afternoon.... but we were there during spring break, so didnt expect anything less. If you get time i strongly advise just to have a long walk around the grounds to take it in as the grounds are just fantastic, you may even see an aligator here or there if your lucky (just in the lakes though, i wouldnt worry). Breakfast time was a little manic and my personal opinion turned me against the food on offer. Lunch & tea were alot more civilised and the food was a lot better than i actually expected, with a wide variety to choose from. The dining area is also open late if you want to nip down for a snack or something after wishes or a look to downtown disney etc. The transport from the hotel very handy, buses run from the depots for all parks every 15minutes or so, and you can jump on a boat if you wish to go along to downtown disney which is a nice change. Overall, i absolutely loved my stay here and would book up again in a heartbeat (if i had the money!!). Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will be back”
Reviews.Author: jvrealtor
Reviews.Content: We stayed there at the end of may before the holiday rush. The rooms were clean. The grounds were clean. The staff minus one (we missed the Disney Express and were going to get on the next one. the lady at the stand didn't tell us it had arrivred as she told us she would, she was to busy chatting up a storm. Luckily we asked one of the bell hops and he called over the bus driver who then let us on). other than that the rest went above and beyond. Can't wait to book again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: anjulil
Reviews.Content: We picked Port Orleans Riverside partly on cost (Yacht Club unfortunately out of price range even for honeymoon!), partly on location - loved the idea of getting a boat to Downtown Disney, and partly for the romantic riverside setting. It was absolutely everything we wanted it to be! The cast members at the resort were super friendly and really spoilt us when we had our 'Just Married' badges on. Mousekeeping made us little towel animals which was a fantastic surprise after a long day at the parks! The 2 restaurants on site were great - Boatwrights is the table service restaurant with pricier but higher quality food. Riverside Mill is the counter service restaurant with the most incredible selection of food I've seen! The pools are plentiful and clean and Ol Man River is open until midnight! On occasion at breakfast the restaurant was heaving so we just grabbed some fruit and water and headed straight to the park of the day for a later brunch. Buses were always there within a 10 minute wait - though there are more first thing in the morning. The staff at reception, the concierge desk and the shop are always super willing to help - seriously it really was the friendliest place we have ever stayed. I did not want to leave after 2 weeks there and would recommend it for honeymoon couples or families.

Reviews.Title: “Totally unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: jbag50838
Reviews.Content: The rooms were Ok. We were not impressed. We entered our room to an awful smell. Iâ€™m not a complainer however, after a few minutes we decided we couldnâ€™t take the smell all week and decided to ask for another room. The next room wasnâ€™t much better, shower wasnâ€™t clean! The pillows were terrible. There were 5 pillows for 4 people and they were all thin and/or lumpy. This was disappointing due to the fact that you are so tired when you get back to your room from the parks that all you want to do is crush in a nice cozy bed. The most disappointing was that it was a 50/50 chance with the staff whether or not it was going to be a pleasant or rude transaction. Cast members at the Disney parks were AWESOME, however the magically experience stopped there for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great themed resort”
Reviews.Author: essexstardust
Reviews.Content: Great resort, the theming is so relaxed and peaceful. easy links to all the parks and usual disney efficiency. The rooms are a little compact, its a place to sleep and thats all. We had just stayed at the Royal plaza near downtown disney but had treated ourselves to a few days at a disney resort, but the rooms seemed so dark and small in comparison, but didn't spoil it still a great resort.

Reviews.Title: “I Love All Disney Hotels if the Price is Right!”
Reviews.Author: djkBuf
Reviews.Content: Great atmosphere as you'd expect for a Disney hotel. Port Orleans has smaller more intimate pools than the value resorts I've stayed at like Pop Century. Honestly our kids enjoyed the value resorts we stayed at more and picked it over Port Orleans mainly because there's more kids and activities at value resorts. The rooms were nice but not really that different from value resorts. So to sum it all up I'd say stay here if the price was really good, but remember your at Disney so all you'll reall do in the room is sleep and wash up and go to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Disney was great but room was just ok”
Reviews.Author: sparkymax1
Reviews.Content: First of all, its Disney - so your overall experience should be awesome. However, the room at Port Orleans Resort - Riverside (Alligator Bayou) was just okay. The rooms aren't very big and were old fashioned. The carpet had dust bunnies and small dirt debris at the edges of the carpet where it met the wall. We weren't wild about this considering the kind of money we put down to stay here. The double pedestal sinks were nice and the small refrigerator was handy as well. Overall, the room was very average and if it weren't a disney property many people would bypass staying here. We looked at it like since we were rarely in our room and were out enjoying the Disney parks that we could accept that we were paying more for the room than it was really worth. Bus service was adequate to the parks and we went during the peak time of the year. I would recommend getting on at the South Entrance (which is by the Main check-area). If your room isn't close to this bus stop you would probably be better off using a stop closer to your room, however, the South stop is usually the first stop for pick ups and drop offs. Which means your chance at getting a seat is greater there. Overall we loved Disney our kids ages 9, 7 & 4 would love to go back - our room was just outdated and not the cleanest considering the money we paid for it. Overall, I rated this property very good - only because its Disney and so many other things about our stay was awesome. If I were just rating the room itself it would no way be higher than an average rating.

Reviews.Title: “excellent as always”
Reviews.Author: mumbread
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th stay at port orleans riverside disney hotel and i can agree with the fab reviews it receives on trip advisor. A great moderate disney hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite resort!”
Reviews.Author: LuvMK2011
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at Port Orleans Riverside, but the first just as a couple. We really enjoy the beauty of the resort. Our room in the Mansions section had a King size bed as requested and was neat and clean. We overlooked one of the "quiet" pools and lots of lush greenery. We were steps away from the walkway around the river. The walk to the main building was a little bit of a hike in the heat, but enjoyable at night when it cooled off. The food court can be a bit noisy and overwhelming but we just try to hit it at off times and it is much calmer. We really enjoyed the spa at the "big pool" after a long day walking in the parks. The staff couldn't have been nicer and did everything they could to make our stay enjoyable. This is the perfect mix of "nice room and facilities" versus expensive hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation Spot at DIsney - Loved It and Did Not Want to Leave!”
Reviews.Author: AdventureGirl919
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Port Orleans Riverside the week of July 4th 2011. It was a mother daughter trip and our first time to stay at this resort. I had read through all the information on the resort on this website and others and was a little nervous about what to expect. I ended up deciding to stay in one of the mansions rather than on the alligator bayou section mostly because the mansions have elevators! I did not want to carry my luggage up the stairs. Two days before our arrival, I sent in a fax to the front desk requesting to be on the top floor (I had read it was more quiet on the top floors) and in the Magnolia Oaks building. I wanted to be in that particular mansion because it is the closest to the main lobby and restaurant. We checked in around Noon and were told we had gotten the exact type of room we wanted. We were able to check in within the hour too. Our room was perfect! The only little problem was that the door on the cabinet for the refrigerator was hanging off the hinge when we got there. But I called maintenance and someone was there to fix it within 15 minutes. Our room was perfectly clean. There was plenty of light. The bathroom was small but fit our needs. We were at the corner of the third floor and had a view of the area overlooking the front lawn leading to the back parking lot. It was quiet the entire time we were there (5 nights total). Yes, we could occasionally hear the toilets flushing in the other rooms but this was really only in the morning. We traveled by car and brought a fan with us to drown out any noise. The air worked perfectly, in fact I was cold most of the time! There was more than enough hot water and the water pressure was great too. The beds were very, very comfortable with very soft and clean sheets. We had plenty of coffee and towels. And our housekeeper Luv was amazing! She left us the cute little animal towel decorations and also made pretty designs with washcloths on the sinks and side of the tub. I actually called housekeeping on our last day so I could say a special thanks and leave her a tip. My mom and I loved coming in every day and finding a new piece of towel art! I have stayed at All Star Sport, Pop Century, Caribbean Beach, and Coronado Springs and Port Orleans Riverside is by far my favorite. My mom and I had a wonderful time walking around the resort at night and swimming in the quiet pool during the day. We chose to skip the main pool because we didn't want to be around kids. There was a family who brought some very annoying children to the quiet pool, but we packed up our stuff and went to the next one and found it to be kid-free and very quiet and relaxing. Our favorite thing to do was to ride the boat over to Downtown Disney at night. It is so relaxing and you get to see some beautiful Disney property that is not viewable from any other area. I loved going by the Tree House resort for the DVC members! We ate in the main restaurant for breakfast, lunch and dinner and loved all of our meals. If you are in there are prime time for breakfast, you can easily carry your tray over to the fancy restaurant and eat in there where it is very quiet and beautiful. We ate our breakfast in front of the fireplace there on our last day and loved it. The food portions are huge so we ended up sharing the chicken salads and pasta meals but it was always more than enough food. The desserts were wonderful. We brought resort mugs from a few years ago (10 years ago actually) and had no problem using them for our drinks. Overall, I highly recommend staying at Port Orleans Riverside and hope we will be able to stay there again on our next Disney trip. The grounds are beautiful; the rooms are comfortable and clean; the staff is very friendly and helpful; there are plenty of pools to choose from and it was so much more quiet and peaceful than the All Star or Pop Century. Our only problem was having to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Vacation 2011”
Reviews.Author: TheSaylors2004
Reviews.Content: We've only stayed in three Disney hotels and they have all been great. Our rooms have always been within a short walking distance to the bus stops, to the food court and "big" swimming pool - no longer than 10 minutes to each. Let me just say this is not a "bad" review - I'm only telling this info for large families - In the Port Orleans Resort - Riverside - the descriptions of the rooms with the trundle bed say room can accommodate 6, but it cannot. My husband and I stayed last week with our 10 years old son and three small grandchildren, and it was too crowded and no where for 6th person to sleep. Beds are only doubles and trundle only big enough for one. However - I would definitely stay here again, but not with a larger family.

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: OttawaTravelcrazy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a very quiet time at this resort deliberately as we had heard that it can be akward to get around during a busy period and I can see that would be a problem however, not for us in January. We asked for and got a room in the Alligator Bayou close to the food court and were totally charmed by the decor and theme. The rooms were lovely and with the trundle bed for our little guy, it slept 4 of us very comfortably. Busses were great and again, we had picked our building right because we were the first stop. For our money, we like the moderate resorts- great pool, great theming and great price!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful place!”
Reviews.Author: seasidegeordie16
Reviews.Content: As soon as we arrived we felt very welcome, the check in desk queue wasn't even that long but as we were waiting they added extra staff so we could be checked in right away. Our room was in Parterre Place which was only a 5 minute walk away from everything including the South Depot bus station which was definitely the best one to go to in the morning! The rooms were lovely! The double sink was great and although the decor was a bit dated, it is getting a full refurb soon but it didn't bother us. The food court was good, we only used it for breakfast to get something quick, but although sometimes it got very busy, this was usually for the hot food queues and we normally just got bagels and cold foods so this wasn't a problem. The grounds are beautiful! The boat to Downtown Disney took a while so we only used this once but it was very nice to do if you have the time. The bus service for us was never a problem, we always seemed to catch it at the right time and the one time we did wait was only 10 minutes. We did hear people complaining a few nights coming back from Downtown Disney as they had waited a while, but we never encountered this. Buses to this resort always seemed to be more frequent than for other resorts. All of the staff, especially in the shop and bar/lounge were very friendly and always had the time to talk to you. Also Yee Haa Bob was brilliant! We caught him playing when it was raining one night and couldn't go out and we were so glad we did! He put on a great show for both adults and children and the songs he chose were great to sing a long to! Overall I would definitely recommend this resort, especially for the bonus of extra hours in the parks which we took advantage of a few times and also the disney transportation was worth staying on property!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel! There is also a quiet pool when you want to get away from the crowds.”
Reviews.Author: DSwen3
Reviews.Content: Went to Disney World and stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside Hotel on Disney Property. Love this hotel, and actually I have been going back there for 20 years. I can say, I have NEVER had bed bugs at this resort. I know there are people out there that say this, but I have never experienced it.You can come and go as you please, they have the BEST MAID SERVICE. I don't like to go on vacation and have to have valet parking, I like to come an go as I please without walking through a main lobby all the time. If you are like me, you will love this hotel. There are full service restaurants plus a food court for the quick days. The food court has, fried food, healthy food, salads, fruit, oatmeal, full service breakfasts to turkey dinners, ice cream and desserts. They have an awesome main pool for everyone and each section I believe has another quiet pool. Yes, they still provide pool towels which is awesome. The staff couldn't be more friendlier at this hotel and that is what keeps sending me back. It is conveniently located to everything and you can get plenty of exercise just walking around the beautiful property to riding the boat to Downtown Disney and riding the buses to the theme parks. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “First Disney Vacation-Loved this resort! Great resort to keep fit!”
Reviews.Author: Irishlass60
Reviews.Content: This was a pleasant setting for our first Disney vac. Room accomodated myself, husband, mom and two girls. My 11 year old fit easily on the trundle bed and loved sleeping on it. -something I had been concerned about before the trip. Resort provided alot to do if you so wanted-boat rentals, swimming (with little pools strategically placed near clusters of bungalows), arcade games etc. For myself an avid exerciser this resort was ideal. Every morning I was able to get a great walk/run in along the river, which provided a wonderful setting. I was also able to use the stairs, and railings for some light strength training (using resistance bands). The one con for my family was the fact that the main pool and restaurant/lobby were quite a distance away. This was hard for my elderly mom to trek. On the upside though our bus depot was right down the path from our bungalow. There is also no handicapped accessiblity to bungalow rooms and if you rent a scooter (which my Mom did for one day) there is no way to get it into your room to plug it in...at least that we could find. Overall, I loved the setting of this resort and would stay here again. I would however, try and request a room closer to the main lobby/pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful landscaping and whimsical detail”
Reviews.Author: jennz_id
Reviews.Content: My family and I (hubby, 2 kids, my parents, a sister-in-law, and a niece and nephew) stayed at PO-R and really enjoyed the relaxing atmosphere. The walkways are lush with vegetation. We stayed in Alligator Bayou building 14, and it was great - we were right next to the main building.Pools all over the place, besides the great main pool. Look for the river otters when walking along the river! If you are staying with 5 in a room, make sure one is a small child because the trundle bed is really unacceptable for anyone over 5 foot. They have started work on this resort and are revamping all of the rooms, straight through 2012, and I heard a rumor they may be installing murphy beds instead, although I can't imagine where they possibly could put them. They are, however, replacing all of the full sized beds with queen beds, which really makes the moderates like PO-R a more desirable option. I like the moderate resorts' addition of a fridge and coffeemaker. My kids don't do well with the mad crowds in the food court in the mornings, so having those ammenities really helps; we bring breakfast items and they have cereal, oatmeal, hot chocolate right in the room, and then we can move on into the parks quickly! And - it helps keep your food costs down, too - so you can spend more in the shops!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort @ Disney”
Reviews.Author: sdlivengood
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to the Port Orleans Riverside resort @ Disney, and it was another great stay. The online express check-in made the check-in process a breeze, which got us into the parks faster, and the staff was very friendly and helpful with any questions that we asked. We have a family of 5, and chose this resort since it is one of the only ones that can hold all of us, without having to rent a suite or 2 adjoining rooms. The only thing that would have been able to make this into a 5 star stay is if they had microwaves in the rooms. Minor inconvenience, but would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not great. There are better Disney options.”
Reviews.Author: FamilyMan1919
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that our expectations of a Disney Resort are higher than others. We stayed here because the rooms boast a trundle option to sleep 5 instead of the usual 4. The trundle is a joke. You'd be better off bringing your own air mattress. The bed mattresses are worn out and sag around the edges making it difficult to sleep two to a bed (full size mattresses, not queen). Also, the rooms were not very clean. We found dust and dirt in obvious places. The air conditioning units are also outdated. No thermometer, just the high cool or low cool, which made it difficult to get the room to a comfortable temperature. The poor TV channel selection and lack of free WiFi access were also disappointing. You don't spend much time in your room, but a few channel options would have been nice in the evenings before bedtime and the kids were disappointed they couldn't use their iPods to access the Disney apps via WiFi. The resort is very nice. Restaurant staff was excellent and the pool and arcade areas were great for the kids. As with other Disney resorts, you do enjoy many benefits such as extended park hours, transportation, room delivery of purchases etc. but these are available at all the Disney resorts.

Reviews.Title: “best place so far”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel1257
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many hotels on Disney property. Port Orleans has been the best so far. It's not as loud as some of the others. We did tour French Quarter while we were there, but I do believe Riverside is the best out of the two. The only downside was the restaurant. A bit pricy. The food court was very good. They have healthy foods also. Definately take a carriage ride. It was worth the cost. Our 4 year old loved it! It was her birthday while we were there. The hotel put an autographed pic of Mickey in the room. What a great suprise!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Disney Resort!”
Reviews.Author: disneydill1
Reviews.Content: This is a great resort! the rooms are clean and spacious and the cleaning staff is great. the rooms were well stocked with towels and soaps. There is a bit of a walk from the room to the main building, but nothing too bad. The restaraunts are good and the pool was great. The kids really enjoyed the watreslide! The shops inside the hotel are very nice and the main building is well decorated to make you feel like you are in old New Orleans. There is a bus to take you to the parks, but if you drove there or rented a car it is better to drive to the parks. This was a great resort and helped make our second trip to disney magical

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Disney Experience”
Reviews.Author: rrgrant11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Port Orleans Riverside on Disney Property for nine days in August 2010. We LOVED the peaceful, quiet walkways and the plants and flowers along the way. The service was excellent. We arrived at 3am due to spending 12 long hours in the Baltimore airport unexpectedly (never flying Airtran again- horrible service!). We were quickly checked in and walked to our room. This resort is absolutely beautiful! My 8 year old daughter loved the slide at the main pool, and we spend most mornings there. The rooms were nothing special, but clean and quiet. We will stay here again and thought it was a great value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mdouthitt
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home from our stay at Port Orleans Riverside (Alligator Bayou) and wanted to share our experience. The room was great, exactly like the picture on the website. The resort staff was awesome, we were allowed to check in early and the kids were given buttons and balloons. The cleaning staff did an excellent job, the kids couldn't wait to get back to the room to see what towel creatures they had created while we were away. We really enjoyed the pool area which was clean and well supervised by lifeguards. At first we were concerned about the buses as this was our first time staying on premises and this is a large resort. However, our concerns were unfounded. We waited for 20 minutes on one occassion, but every other time it was more like 5 or 10 minutes. The grounds are beautiful and I would recommend taking the carriage ride through both Riverside and the French Quarter during your stay. Our family of five will definitely be staying in this resort again and also telling friends/family about our great experience.

Reviews.Title: “So much fun! Worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: ddking33
Reviews.Content: My family of three really loved staying at this hotel. Please, if you're going to Disney, spend the extra money and stay on the property. It's so much easier - you don't have to deal with traffic. There's easy shuttle transportation to all the facilities. We really enjoyed our hotel with the many pools (six in all!!) and different down home cooking type of meals. Also, it was neat to ride in the ride on the boat to Downtown Disney.

Reviews.Title: “information”
Reviews.Author: camEron011
Reviews.Content: i went to port orleans river side for 2 weeks it was very nice. to get to disney theme parks there are disney buses that arrive at the bus stop around every 20 minutes it tells you which theme park its going to at the front of the bus. there isnt much choice at the resteraunt there but there are lots of different types of resteraunts in the disney parks so it dosent matter. it is a good idea to bring 1 empty suitcase with you as there are lots of things to buy and if your suitcases are to heavy you have to take stuff out and leave it at the airport. the maids do a really good job of cleaning your room. remember to take insect spay because there are alot of biting insects there. the last and final thing is sun cream you need to take factor 50 there is simply no point in taking any thing else because youll just get burnt. thanks for reading if you go to disneys port orleans river side have an amazing time.

Reviews.Title: “Never, never again!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MayK22
Reviews.Content: This was my first Disneyworld visit, and leave it to this hotel to make it a BAD one! First of all, the pathways to your room has a very distinct foul odor I can't describe... we stayed for 9 days and it was there on every single day! The room service was really bad! On our 3rd night, I decided to use their glass to drink water... BIG mistake since I CUT my lip on it from a gaping gap from the glass, I called front desk! Next, my coffee maker was filthy ... I let it go for 1...2...3 days to see if they even check, even left a note, but NADAH! Frustrated, I called again ... this time when they replaced it with a clean one, but it didn't work with the coffee maker coz it wasn't the same manufacturer. Another call. They must've been in a hurry for us to check out cuz the very next day (our 4th) stay, we received VM on our room reminding us of the next days checkout. What?!!! My reservation's not over yet! So if I ever go to Disneyworld again, I willl NEVER, NEVER, NEVER go back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: smassey320
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at a disney hotel. Me nad my sister was very impressed with this hotel. The service was really good. The food in the food cort was not badly priced. I lost my glasses in my hotel room. I was contacted we they found them and they offered to mail them to me. This was very important because it saved me from having to buy a new pair. We took the busses to the parks and did not have a long wait. I will definitly be back to this hotel and recommend it to anyone to stay on disney property.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting! Disney, hang your head in shame!”
Reviews.Author: George6965
