Reviews.Content: Refrigerator did not work ENTIRE time...got 3 new ones! Lied ti from the Manager who, suddenly was "off duty" after he lied about fixing the refrig. The cockroaches held an electric light parade for us each night! Myself and son got sick, which we believe came from milk in the refrigerator that did not work properly. Snide desk clerk. Far to walk to main building. No line formations at the busses so if you are there an hour early the late comers push right ahead of you! This hotel wrecked our Disney vacation! We DREADED coming back to it each night. Begged the hotel for help with the disgusting situations and finally, on our second last night, after threatening to come to the lobby with a bullhorn(loudspeaker) and some of the cockroaches in a jar as well as pictures of our sink which we filled with ice to use as a makeshift refrigerator.........FINALLY AFTER A WEEK OF TURMOIL.... were we helped. I told them to call the police because I am coming to the lobby with a bullhorn (loudspeaker)! I was so upset from day after day of lies, snide remarks from staff, no help, begging for a cool refrigerator day after day, wrecked food, long walks to the main building...etc. etc... that I cried at the end of my vacation. I HATE this place! STAY ELSEWHERE! I wish I had the lying manager's name, I would post it over every website I could!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Antebellum Splendor”
Reviews.Author: bethoc
Reviews.Content: To begin with, we were a little uncertain about our new room before seeing it. We had stayed at the Alligator Bayou section of this resort in building 14 which is very close to the dining hall and South Bus Depot and had been very happy with it before. When we arrived at check-in we were informed that the building we had requested was unavailable due to it having been up-graded to the new 'character-themed' style and already fully booked. The cast member told us that we would be located in the Magnolia Bend section of the property and gave us a map on how to get there. At first I was a little concerned because we have a 6 year old and 2 senior citizens in our group and I had read reviews about how long of a walk it was for some guests staying in this section of the resort. We drove around and found our room and opened the door and were pleasantly surprised! The initial look of the room took our breath away! It was in Magnolia Terrace building corner room 8707 and was a bit larger and brighter decorated than the alligator bayou rooms were. There was much more room inside and the lighter colored walls and up-scale lighting and theme made us truly feel like we were guests in the old gentele South. Our fears about the bus stop were quickly melted away as we saw that the East Depot was just a 2 minute walk behind where we parked. I would suggest that people arrive to their resort before sundown because we had no idea how to walk to the dining hall and main building so we we had a bit of a time naviggating the twists and turns around our building and past several pools and down a lushly landscaped path across the bridge, past old man island, across another bridge to get to the dining hall. We didn't mind this brisk walk each morning for breakfast because it is so peaceful, quiet, and lovely but be aware, you'll want to get yourself acquainted with the path you'll take for the dining hall before going on to do anything else. Good things about this resort: people here are paying for a Moderately priced hotel so the guests are very friendly and the kids were well behaved. Everyone we met was from a nice background and knew how to behave themselves very well in public. That was a plus for us because I'd heard about the noise at Pop Value resorts and rude teenagers and wanted none of that on my vacation. This had GOT to be THE quietest resort on the entire property. We never heard any noise the entire time and slept very well. In the evenings we spent many a magical romantic moment strolling around the lushly green bushes sitting under carriage lanterns on benches admiring the views. I loved seeing the bunnies late evenings the best! The bad: I did notice there were obvious nicks in the furniture and scratches which led me to believe that this furniture hasn't been replaced in many a year. Also, We were incredibly disappointed that the water never got hotter than lukewarm. There is nothing better than a very hot bath full of sore muscle bath salts to ease a middle-aged mom in the evenings and prepare her for the grueling schedule she's gotta walk and stand throughthe next day. I would highly recommend to everyone staying at a resort to know exactly where the hot tubs are at your resort and MAKE USE OF THEM as often as possible. It really helped take the pain away and prepare our bodies for the physical stamina we'd need the next day. Try taking one very early in the morning @7 when no one is there or at 11 pm when it is much less crowded. Trust me when I say that it makes ALL the difference in the quality of the vacation you will create for yourself and you're tired aching feet will certainly thank you. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed the good of this section of the resort over the few bad things and will definitely book a room here in Magnolia Terrace again and again! You just can't beat the incredibly pleasant guests nor the peace and quiet you'll find at the Port Orleans Riverside Resort. We won't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “I'm definitely not in Anaheim!”
Reviews.Author: Travelovers11
Reviews.Content: I think the first and most crucial thing to mention about any Disney resort is that regardless of it's quality, design, decor, price, etc...staying inside the Disney grounds is an amazingly faster way to get through the parks than having to drive in and park daily. I've stayed in both scenarios and I much prefer using the Disney bus transportation system. That being said...the Disney resorts are getting very tired and the quality is not what you can find outside the limits in other more popular branded hotels. You have to really know what is most important to you. This resort is romantic and lovely. The grounds are well kept and the feel is very Southern. Of all the Moderate Value resorts, this one has the BEST food court and the BEST value for your dollar if you do the Disney dining plan...and you SHOULD do that. It's amazing. As for the rooms...they are old and tired and they lack and sort extra comforts. Again, know what is crucial to you. If you're mainly there to be in the parks most of the day and just need a clean place to sleep, this resort is charming. If you want to splurge and have comfort, choose Grand Floridian, Polynesian or Contemporary resort. The boat ride, bike rentals and pools are terrific and the staff is superb. The food is great and the location of this resort means you don't have to wait too long on the bus system. Note that there are the Mansion rooms and the Bayou rooms...be sure to do your homework and pick the one that you want.

Reviews.Title: “Most Amazing Trip!!”
Reviews.Author: GroomerCrystal
Reviews.Content: This place is GREAT! It was clean and easy to get around. We used our own car so we did not use the buses. But walking to the main area was a very short beautiful walk! This time of year (May1-May12) is a Wonderful time to go to Disney World! My husband and I came for our anniversary trip and we are going every year! This place is a great place to stay for couples of any age!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag...Great and Not So Great”
Reviews.Author: LiveOakNewOrleans
Reviews.Content: I am at Port Orleans Riverside right now and will be for another several days. This is my family's second stay here. The grounds here are beautiful. We have stayed at Caribbean Beach and Coronado Springs in the past, and the surroundings here are perhaps our favorite. There is a very nice Ole' Man River vibe going on and you do almost expect to see Huckleberry Finn setting a trot line. It is marvelously lush, and in the Alligator Bayou section it gives the impression of being very secluded. The main pool is really cool with a long twisting water slide for the kids that always has a long line. This pool is always crowded, but if you look at a map of the grounds you will realize there are several pools around the resort, some in secluded areas that offer a nice alternative to the madness at the main pool. The food service is really nice and continues with the Mississippi River theme. There is a big interesting water wheel on the side of the building. Boat service to Downtown Disney is cool, but probably slower than taking the bus. You do this for a nice experience rather than convenience. Bus service is adequate if spotty at times. You may for example have three buses for Blizzard Beach or Typhoon Lagoon (water parks) before you see one for Magic Kingdom. As a result, you are in a crowded bus standing very close to strangers. The rooms are what needs work. The beauty of the surroundings belies the actual accommodations. The last Sleep Inn's, Homewood Suites (stayed in one of these in Ocala, FL on the way here), etc. I have stayed in have had far better rooms than this resort. The rooms are showing signs of age. The carpet appears worn, the bathroom fixtures are very dated. Our shower has a WaterPik shower head that does not adjust. The room is very small...two double beds, one night table in between them, and the combination TV cabinet / wardrobe for clothes. There is also a small table with two chairs. The thing that amazes me is the audacity of charging for internet service. There is no free Wi-Fi. This is a universal amenity in the cheapest of motels, but Disney cannot seem to offer it. Instead, you have to connect your computer with an ethernet cable and are charged $10 per day. I can leave the computer alone for vacation, but my wife is a graduate student and needed to complete a couple of things during the trip that required web access. Also, the ethernet cable is not situated near the table where a laptop would fit, but on the the small side table between the two beds. I am precariously balancing the computer there as I type. The cable is not long enough to reach to the table, so any work one has to do is extremely uncomfortable. Listen, staying on Disney properties (as opposed to hotels outside the grounds) really changes the complexion of your vacation. You really do immerse yourself in the Disney experience and forget about the outside world. We haven't touched our car since we got here. Disney simply needs to make their accommodations comparable in quality to the better national chains. As far as atmosphere goes, Port Orleans Riverside can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bad restaurant services”
Reviews.Author: nursejookie
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with a nice southern touch, we found the rooms very neat and clean. All of the staff were very pleasant to work with and helpful in answering any questions that we had. As for the quick service dining hall it is extremely frustrating and the staff are plain rude. When we arrived at the resort hungry after being on a plane for 6 hours, we went straight for a bite to eat. Upon opening the doors there was pure chaos! A little space for a lot of people! We got into a line and were flat ignored by the woman on the other side of the counter, she kept walking past us without a regard to help take our order. The staff who add up and total the bill weren't very friendly or helpful either. We decided to do the Disney Dining Plan, which I believe to be a JOKE, and were told what we could and could not purchase in a confusing way, I finally just paid cash. So overall the hotel, pool and hotel staff were amazingly wonderful, but eat elsewhere if at all possible!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Fan”
Reviews.Author: SeatheMagic
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans Riverside definitely has it's fans... however this family is not among them. GROUNDS: One thing to know is this property is HUGE. It can take 10 minutes to walk from your resort room to the main pool, lobby or food court. This adds up. Say you want a quick coffee in the morning, 20 minutes total there and back, say you want to swim in the main pool (cause the kids love the slide), another 20 minutes, and then say you have a problem with something and they ask you to stop by the lobby to get a corrected statement (happened to us twice, and no they wouldn't bring it to us) another 20 minutes.... an hour of your day walking back and forth and that's after all the Disney park walking, and not even including all the walking to the bus stop at the resort to get to the parks. The grounds are beautiful, but in the beauty is a lot of creatures. The bunny was cute, the SNAKES that frequently cross the walking path right in front of you... not so much. Main pool is great. Chairs plentiful, kids loved the waterslide, lifeguards very attentive, and some games going on for the kids. ROOMS: We were in Alligator Bayou, which is where you should typically expect to stay if you are booking as a family of 5. These rooms are currently scheduled for a rehab (taking place this year and next), and they are definitely in need of one!! The look is very country, very dated and not at all our style. Mismatched, kitschy. Our room was very clean, no bugs. The room had two double beds and a pull out trundle that is pretty small, with a thin hard mattress. Our very petite 10 year old is about as big a kid as I think would be comfortable, height wise. We had booked a preferred room (closest to bus stop, food court and main pool), but when I got our final confirmation it was for a Water View room (same price, very different locations as Water View rooms are typically at the back end of the resort furthest from everything). I called immediately to get it changed and they said the computer wouldn't allow the change but it was noted on our reservation to put us in a preferred room. At check in we were told no preferred room was available and put in a Waterview room in one of the furthest buildings. Our waterview consisted of a view through trees of one of the smallest pools. If I held 2 fingers in front of my face I could block any view at all of water. I called the front desk and was able to get a refund for the difference between a waterview and standard view room (I also could have moved rooms, but at this point I didn't want the hassle). The room safe is miniscule. Considering we have experienced theft of a DSL camera at a Disney property, we were disappointed to find another room safe that would not be deep enough for a DSL (not that we brought one to Disney this time). It held an Ipad (standing up and resting kind of precariously), 2 Iphones, kids ipod, our passports and that's it, with some creative stacking (not usually something you want to do with electronics). A 13" laptop would not have fit. It also had a key that you had to carry with you, verses the newer electronic ones you program. A hassle on the day our family split up for a boys/girls day and I got back to the room before my husband who had the key. FOOD: Food court was great. Kids Pizza is teeny tiny but other portions were big (Kid's spaghetti portion was great). We enjoyed the Pasta bar. For $10 we got a huge shrimp and chicken pasta and lots of veggies and garlic bread that was more than enough for myself and my husband to split. 2nd time we got 2 orders and fed the whole family of 5 for $20, and it was good (nice change from all the theme park fries, nuggets, and burgers). Kids loved the ice cream. We would have eaten here a lot more if it was more convenient to our room. We did run into an issue where there was a severe thunder storm in the immediate area with alarms and everything and warnings not to go outside for four hours. We were stuck in the room (10 minutes walk from the lobby) with no way to have food brought (hotel staff not helpful, not that they should have been out in the weather either, but at least they have carts to get between buildings). This would not have been an issue in the deluxe hotels with the rooms attached via interior doors to the building and room service options. BUSSES: This hotel frequently had the longest line at every park we went to. Usually 2 busses worth, meaning you waited for one bus, only to watch it fill, and have to wait for the next bus (they tell you the average is 20 minutes between busses but we found it to be more like 30). I spoke with one of the people manning the lines after Magic Kingdom closing and he said this is always the case, with Riverside having the longest line. It also is the furthest stop on it's side at every theme park. At the resort itself there are 4 different stops. It appears to be random if the South or West stop is reached first. However, when the South stop (main one by the lobby) is done first the bus usually arrives at the other 3 stops already full and you are left waiting for the next bus. Our longest wait was 50 minutes for a bus to MK, 30 minutes for one bus to arrive full, 20 more for the back up bus the driver called in to arrive... standing room only ("great" with kids). We had much better bus experiences staying at Animal Kingdom and Beach Club. OVERALL: We had a great time in spite of the resort. When we've stayed at Animal Kingdom, Beach Club, Poly we've had a great time added to by the resort (especially Animal Kingdom). We chose Port Orleans because it is cost prohibitive to stay as a family of 5 at a deluxe resort (at the time we booked it over $1200 more for Animal Kingdom than Riverside for a 4 day trip, because you are forced to book either 2 rooms, or a one-bedroom villa). As a family of 5 Riverside is your most budget friendly option. That said, I would not stay there again. And since Disney is reaching out to families of 5 by creating family suites that cost even more money at values (more than Riverside, for a lower category resort), I won't be doing that either. Given the large amount of families of 5 staying at Riverside (all for the same reason as us) and as many of them as were unhappy (50 minutes at the bus stop gives you a lot of time to chat and a lot of that chatting was vacationers sharing various resort complaints), I would think Disney would do more to reach out to bigger families (Deluxe category rooms for 5 for not much more than a deluxe room for 4, please). Until they do this we've been converted to Universal which is more than happy to put our family of 5 in a deluxe level room for a great price (less than Riverside), and with the addition of Harry Potter is every bit as worth visiting as Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Shuttle service was the worst!”
Reviews.Author: alphalassie2
Reviews.Content: Rooms were nice/very clean, excellent housekeeping. While I appreciate the energy conservation aspect, some people like myself need the "white noise" of say an air conditioner or bathroom fan that stays on to drown out the flushing/doors closing/voices of others. The "Ol Man River" major pool (a big factor in our decision since the rest of the "theme" seemed less fun for kids than any of the others-look at the picture of the discarded sink at the "focal point" of the pool, how "fun" is that? ) was always so packed with people (thus overflowing our own immediately located pool-we made a lot of use of around the crowds) we never even got the chance to enjoy it-I'm talking shoulder to shoulder packed (just like the parks are). The food was very good, the "cast members" very pleasant, the ice makers at the beverage dispensers were always empty/near empty. The only serious drawback that would cause me to dissuade myself and others from staying here was the shuttle service (aside from the fact that a "riverboat" theme isn't really that exciting and the decor reflects that compared to other resorts). First of all, in spite of routes cruising by more convenient boarding depots that would serve many buildings (say hit the 4 corners of the resort instead of just 2), you need to walk to either of 2 boarding depots (although located side by side, they're considered 4 separate depots?). We'd heard that there are cameras installed to keep an eye on the crowds/people waiting, and send more if needed, and that they generally run every 20 minutes. False, false and false. Not only for the resort pick-up, but once you're at the park trying to return. As an example, on our last day we waited around 9 a.m. (along with a fairly large crowd) for the shuttle to go to Magic Kingdom while the small group waiting to go to Epcot (a separate depot next to ours) was picked up by the first shuttle, and 3 more shuttles going to Epcot arrived and departed while our waiting line (with tired kids in hot weather and a disabled person-extra time, less capacity since they roll up rows of seats to make room for the scooters/wheelchairs, requires special boarding before anyone else can board-get out of the heat) for the Magic Kingdom kept growing. That was bad enough, but then trying to return, Riverside always had the biggest waiting line, yet maybe one bus would come while several others came and departed for the other resorts. On our last day, after the parade/fireworks (closing) at least 30 of us "tail-enders" tired from a hot day at the park with lots of kids simply decided to take the shuttle to the Port Orleans "French Quarter" and walk back to our own resort rather than wait upwards of an hour. Luckily, the driver of the shuttle was able to get an "okay" to make a stop at the Riverside to drop us all off. Maybe 10 of the total passengers got off at the "French Quarter". Still doesn't seem that bad? Imagine doing so with anxious/tired kids adding at least an hour's wait both to and from the parks. (even then, walking at least a city block or more back to/from your room) The Riverside by far had the largest number of passengers, but the fewest shuttles, not planned, not monitored, not coordinated in the least. The only real bonus (aside from being very clean-I've heard many of the others aren't) of this resort is the entertainment of Yahoo Bob (hilarious). Also, I'm sure this isn't exclusive to the Riverside, but I'm a light sleeper and so the white noise of say being able to keep the bathroom fan on (instead of motion activated-I can appreciate the energy conservation aspect, but if I'd known, I would've brought my air cleaner along to make up for the lack of white noise while keeping the room cool), keep the air fan on to drown out the neighbors' flushing, shutting doors, walking by, etc. would be a huge benefit. The other minor thing would be to design curtains to pull closed away from the room so that there isn't the 1 inch gap of early sunlight (or peering eyes) facing into the room (i.e. the inside track away from the room) nothing a chip clip can't cure, but if the curtains were installed properly it wouldn't matter.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and accomadations”
Reviews.Author: djpat78
Reviews.Content: The service and the rooms were very nice. We stayed in alligator bayou. short walk to the bus stop and the lobby. Decent quick service breakfast. the only small complaint would be it is a very popular resort and didn't seem to have enough buses schedules at times to get you back to the resorts. We will probably look at staying at one of the resorts closer to the parks next time. It was a great hotel for our first visit and would recommend it for your first visit. especially since it is relatively affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Made 1st trip to WDW absolutely brilliant”
Reviews.Author: deegog
Reviews.Content: WDW itself as the yanks would say "Awesome"! But Port Orleans Riverside was absolutely brilliant! We were at the mansion side of the resort which was very beautiful, the rooms clean, the staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Graham7720
Reviews.Content: I have been reading some of the reviews written by some whiney folks that sound like spoilt brats. Although I do understand bad experiences, Riverside is really what you make it. I came back yesterday after my fifteenth (or so) trip to Riverside and spent the whole time in the resort. No theme parks. I had the misfortune to lose an ipad of all things while we were there (my bad) but we went there for my wife's 50th birthday and I'm glad we did. We swam, ate, walked and cycled. It was lovely. Really nice. Yes, some of the staff are more accommodating tham others and some of the tourists can be a pain but most of the people there are great. The river walks are beautiful and there are pools all over the place. The rooms have always been fine. So lighten up and just enjoy it. It's a privilege to be able to spend time in a place like Riverside. A little gratitude goes a long way.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: dclcbc4
Reviews.Content: Overall we were pleased with our stay at POR. The rooms are not large or fancy at all. There was two full size beds, a microwave and small fridge in each rom. The pool was adequate..not very large. You can also use the pool at POFQ which is more of a kiddie pool with a cute water slide. The staff was very very nice and ready to assist you. The grounds were beautiful and well-maintained. You can catch the boat to Downtown Disney which was nice. The boat came routinely so there was never a long wait. Our longest wait was maybe 10 minutes. It's very easy and convenient to use the Disney transporation. The buses run very frequently...again never a long wait. We dined at the restaurant at the resort, Boatwright Dining Hall. The food was actually good...best dessert I had during the entire trip was their Bananas Foster...to DIE for. The chef came to our table to see how we were enjoying our meal. I would definitely recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Disney stay was ok but...”
Reviews.Author: needmoretime
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 days but heading back home. The room was ok but we noticed that the bathroom was small. The whole resort is beautful for walking around and the buildings are well kept. Another positive for the resort is the caferina. The food selection is varied for all meals. Outside the lobby is the parking lot and the bus shuttle, which is convenient to the various theme parks. I would do more research on other Disney resorts to see which one would suit one's needs.

Reviews.Title: “Will spring for a resort with a monorail next time...”
Reviews.Author: rubymagee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at several different WDW resorts, and this one is definitely not my favorite. I realize that June is a peak season, but this resort was so loud and so crowded we were a little disappointed as we had heard this was a "quieter" resort. The room was pretty basic, and as another review said, there really wasn't anywhere to put clothes away and we were there for 8 days which was a little inconvenient. Also, the rooms are all outside rooms, so if you have your drapes open to let in some light during the day while you are in your room, there are always people walking by your window so it's a little weird to sit and relax. The part of this resort that bothered us the most though, was that the bus system took SO LONG to get anywhere, it took us almost 2 hours to get from our hotel to Epcot for our lunch reservation one day. We started eventually hopping on any bus that would take us to a monorail to save some time getting around. The bus was usually packed to standing room only by the time it got to us, and the Epcot bus did not show up but every 40 minutes. The grounds were beautiful though, the food court was nice, and the boat to Downtown Disney was nice, but also filled up very quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation for those on a budget!!!”
Reviews.Author: esm78629
Reviews.Content: Don't listen to the negatives from others, this resort is really nice! Although there were some very minor things that could have been better, all in all pretty good. We recently spent 5 days at this resort and I was really pleased. I would rate the rooms at this resort at about 3.5 stars(enough room for all 5 to be comfortable). Rooms were cleaned daily and everything seemed to be in order. The trundle bed was a good fit for my 9 year old too! We stayed in the Alligator Bayou section and the rustic theme was very charming. The grounds are beautiful! I wish we would have had more time there as the pools were very nice. A few things... the plumbing was a little loud but in my opinion not too bad; other than that it was pretty peaceful there. There is very little drawer space so bring extra hangers. (I read there will be room upgrades in the near future:) The beds are a little on the hard side but we were so tired at the end of the day it didn't really matter to us. The food court is great(lots of choices at a fair price) as is the gift shop(great place to shop for last minute souvenirs as they offer a little bit of everything). If you use Disney transportation go to the South depot(near the lobby) as by the time buses get to the other stops they are almost full. Of course there are nicer resorts but we found the rooms pleasant enough & if you are on a budget this is a great place to stay with a family of 5. Keep in mind that most people spend a lot more time at the parks and other Disney areas. We spent very little time in our room as there was much to do & see. Make sure to take some time at the resort! If you plan on visiting Downtown Disney there are 2 stops(let your driver know where you are going to avoid having to walk clear across the massive property if that is not your intention) and keep in mind if going from a park to Downtown Disney that you must first travel to a resort & transfer to another bus to Downtown Disney or Boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Moderate means a lot of other things too~”
Reviews.Author: galofmanycities
Reviews.Content: We went to Disney on a large family vacation. We booked in early April, and added the meal plan. This seemed to confuse the counter staff when we went to the online check in area. Ideally, the online check in is get one checked in quickly. Two hours later our room still was not ready, and we were ready to go to a park. We were told the system was down due to a new resort opening in Hawaii. When we returned from Animal kingdom at 4 our room still was not available, other people in our party luckily had rooms...but we did not. Management was not willing to assist us even after several calls. Ada, the manager was to move our reservation at Le Chefs De France...........but did not. We went to dinner after missing our first reservation, and were told we did not have a table. Some more things- Pros- The grounds are lovely, the fact that you can take a boat to Downtown Disney is nice. The restuarant Boatwrights was good, one of the better meals I had. They have a few pools are are very well kept. The outside staff, and wait servers were very nice and friendly. The lifeguards were wonderful!!! Cons- The rooms are very outdated. I know you don't spend too much time in them, but when your Holiday Inn in Mobile, Alabama looks like the Four Seasons in comparison.....well you catch my drift. The buses do not pick you up often at parks. I think Moderate for Disney means....we will pick you up AFTER we do the higher end locations first. We have stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge in July and NEVER waited long for a bus to return us to our hotel. I think you have a lot of other options with Disney............look elsewhere before chosing Port Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Very upset”
Reviews.Author: windycity76_11
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very very old and dingy. The pictures of the room are deceiving and it's very small and not fit for a family of four. My family was very unhappy and we had to go out and purchase towels. The towels at the hotel were off black (VERY VERY VERY DINGY) instead of white. It was very disturbing. Disney, It's time to purchase new towels and stop being CHEAP. If Walt Disney was alive today would these low standards be approved. Families pay a lot of money at least provide a hotel that is updated and have clean linens and towels. We ended up staying at the Embassy Suites (more money spent) at least the towels were clean, not dingy, and a cook to order breakfast was included. It will be a long long time before I do this trip again.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than I Expected!”
Reviews.Author: tmiv
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans - Riverside this past May/June for 10 nights. We had stayed at French Quarter 3 years ago. This time we travelled with three children (6, 4, 2) and enjoyed ourselves very much. We arrived to the hotel very late on our first night. We had a wonderful surprise to be put up in the Alligator Bayou, Building 15. So close to everything - the lobby, the food court and the bus depot. We were greeted with a Mickey head on the bed. The room itself was pretty standard. It was clean and tidy but older (it is going to be going through a refurbishment soon). Since we are a family of five, we had a room with a trundle bed for the youngest; however all the children took turns sleeping on it. As a heads up to those with small children, the trundle bed is right on the floor and it rolls under the bed for space. On the third night my 2 year old was caught under the bed as she rolled off. She was yelling for help once she realized she was stuck. She sleep in the bed with me after that. My son also ended up rolling off one night but the other way, he slept on the floor for the remainder of the night. There were no sheets on the trundle bed so we used an extra blanket. Maid service was good, however I do not think it was vacuumed during our stay. She did put the children's toys in funny poses for them to greet us. The grounds were amazing, so beautiful and spacious. You rarely felt that there were many other guest at the resort. The food court was huge, lots of seating and had a great selection of food. The salads were amazing, as was the cheesecake. The children really enjoyed the pizza. The swimming pool was great, the kids loved the slide and the waterfalls. We did not find out until the end of our trip (day 9) that lifejackets are complementary and are provided near the boat dock. There are bikes to rent as well but we never had a chance to enjoy them. Disney bus transportation to and from the resort and parks is good, we only waited longer than 20 minutes a few times when returning to the hotel at park close. Leaving Epcot was a nightmare after park close, there never seemed to be enough buses for the amount of people going back. Only once did we have to wait longer than three buses (almost 45 minutes). At the resort, there are four bus depots that service the hotel (South, West, North and East) so that you do not have to walk too far depending on where you are staying. We were closest to the South depot. We did have to stand a good amount, which wasn't a problem at all. The children only had to stand a few times, other guests gladly gave up their seats for them. We also enjoyed a boat ride back from Downtown Disney one evening, it was a nice change from the buses. All in all, we had a wonderful time in Disney. The resort was nice and spacious. We didn't enjoy it much as we spend the majority of our time in the parks. I would go back to stay at this resort, but not until the rooms are upgraded. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We never received rude or unkind service during our stay. I was pleasantly surprised with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luv Luv Luved it!”
Reviews.Author: KellieMiller
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 10 days in february 2011. 2 adults and 2 children ages 9 & 10. Rooms: Super clean, good sized, separate sinks and shower were convienient. Beds were fine. Housekeeping was wonderful! We stayed in the mansion section, newly updated. We used South Bus Stop Front Desk: Very Helpful Dining We were on the Dining Plan and we enjoyed the counter service - great choices and nice eating area. We chose to dine at Boatwright's Dinsing Hall and it was great! The riverboat ride to Downtoewn Disney was awesome. We had a great driver who gave us all sorts of "River Info" The kids loved this option. We also used it to spend a day pool hopping back and forth to French Quarter - awesome pool at the French Quarter. We loved the "quiet pool" in the Mansion section - it was near our room, it was warm and never crowed. It's a large resort - be prepared to walk but it's abslutely beautiful and everyone we dealt with was typical Disney Friendly. Awesome gift shop and Piano Player show! We loved our stay and would certainly recommend and choose this resort again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough room, transportation wait not worth it”
Reviews.Author: WVTravelers4
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans Riverside was nice. But I would advise NOT staying on this side. We were in room 8262 which is the north side of bus pick-up/drop-off. We were the last to be picked up/dropped off each time, which meant bus was filled already when you got on, and you are the last to get dropped off. The Port Orleans bus stops were always the most filled when waiting for busses regardless of which park you were leaving. We waited one morning for 37 minutes for a bus to pick us up to go to Epcot! The overall Disney experience was wonderful though. Great customer service no matter where you were. They do everything right. Too bad the transportation issue overshadowed this though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Night Sleep!”
Reviews.Author: StinaAshton
Reviews.Content: I stayed for only one night but it was a very important night, it was the night before my first Half Marathon. It was important that myself and my sister-in-law got a good night sleep and we definitely did! We had lunch just after we checked in and the sandwiches at there quick service restaurant we great. I have stayed at this hotel before and will always go back, I have always had a good experience there.

Reviews.Title: “Just as I remembered it”
Reviews.Author: Cruella10861
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd or 4th stay at this resort. In recent times we have stayed at the deluxe resorts but were looking for a cheap last minute break and it was just like coming home! Although undoubtedly geared to families and children, the realxed atmosphere still makes it a worthwhile consideration for couples and groups of frends.We particularly like it's proximity to Downtown Disney and the boat ride to the shops and restaurants. the food in the food court has canged over the years and there is now a healthier, wider choice - but you can still get the burger and fries, if that is what you want. The pools were busier than I remember them but even so, were enjoyable. Housekeeping was fine and, we met cast members from years gone by, still giving "Disney" service. Transport is good at this resort with several bus stops around the property so no need to walk too far. We will return to try out the new themed rooms coming next year!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: TorontoPrincess11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans Riverside in one of the Magnolia Bend rooms. The rooms were always cleaned daily, always fresh towels and clean glasses, and beds made. The rooms could use upgrading, however, were still sufficient for a family of 4 on vacation touring the theme parks. The grounds of the hotel were beautiful, clean and well groomed. The staff hotel and service staff all over the resort were friendly and helpful. The main pool bar staff were especially friendly and provided excellent drinks and service. A few perks of this resort for the kids was the Bayou Pirate Cruise (Sun/Tues) from 9:30-11:30. The cost is around $30 per child. Both of our girls went on the cruise, ages 9 and 10 and loved it. The ages are from 4-12, but the staff really catered to each age group. The riverboat picks them up at the resort and takes them on a 2 hour cruise. It is a definite must do to send the kids on. Another great feature of all disney resorts is the purchasing of items at any theme park and having the items delivered to your hotel for no additional charge by the next day at noon. Our items always arrived, intact, and the staff always left messages as a reminder to have the items picked up. It saved a lot of "heavy lifting" during our tour of the parks. The transportation system to all theme parks as well as Downtown Disney worked well, the wait times were never more than 15-20 min, and the average time to the parks was approximately the same.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Resort!”
Reviews.Author: TravelDragonFl
Reviews.Content: Took my daugher for her birthday to Disney and stayed at POR in the Alligator Bayou area. It was so beautiful! Nice woodsy smell, beautiful, clean room. Everything you would want in a Disney resort! Loved the store and the walk to and from the busses was not too far, very pleasant. Rooms were pretty small so I would not stay there unless you had small children. For the two of us though, it was absolutely perfect. The cast member at check in was funny and so friendly!! No complaints at all, the place was great!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the extra money!!”
Reviews.Author: nikten
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 7 day trip in May 2011. It was our first time at Disney. We thought the moderate would be better for a family of four. We had two full size beds. There is not much room for your suitcases and the drawers under the tv where we could have put our clothes to make things easier were dirty and had some garbage in them. The rooms were not loud and it was peaceful, check in was easy, and all of the rooms seemed to be within walking distance of food court and pools. The grounds were beautiful but they could put more money into the rooms and less on the grounds. The room itself was basic and not cleaned the best. We had towel animals on a hit or miss basis. We had trouble with the ice and vending machines and were told by the manager to go to another floor to find ice. The washers and dryers by the pools we disgusting - most of the dryers had gummy chunks in them and all of the dryers smelled moldy. I would not stay here again and while we were at WDW we actually asked to look at one of the value resorts and that is where we will stay when we go again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - Fantastic like paridise”
Reviews.Author: NFFC-fan
Reviews.Content: 5 star holiday --- just wish more hours in the day resort set in fantastic grounds and rooms good -- experienced no noise transport perfect ans boat to downtime disney Require a holiday to recover as we packed so much into this trip book this you will not be dissapointed

Reviews.Title: “We will NOT return”
Reviews.Author: doclegler
Reviews.Content: Room was extremely dirty upon check-in. Layers of dust covered everything, and there was garbage left in the room. After asking for a thorough cleaning with the front desk twice, I gave up. The toilet leaked onto the floor and the shower knob was loose and wouldn't keep a good temperature. We were put in Bldg. 37, quite a drive to the main lobby. For Disney property, this sure was a let-down! Hope they get those rehabs done soon....

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday”
Reviews.Author: JulieWEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried about staying here especially after having stayed in the Yacht Club the last time but it was nothing to worry about. In fact, I think I preferred it as I like the fact that we could eat at the Riverside Mill when we wanted to have lunch at the hotel. I honestly cant think of much that I didnt like about the place. Yes the rooms are a bit dated but thats the style of the property - if you want a contemporary design then stay in the Contemporary Resort or the Swan & Dolphin. The only thing I would say is that the plumbing was a bit noisy and you could hear the toilet flushing in the next room! Apart from that I heard no noise from surrounding properties (and hopefully they didnt hear us at 4am as we adjusted to Florida time). We were in Oak Manor which was about 5 minutes from the main reception/poo/restaurant. There was a small pool close by which had a laundry. This is great as you can put in your washing then have a swim/lounge by pool then go and put it in the dryer - it almost makes it enjoyable. If you're looking for a room with a view then I think most people will be disappointed as there are a lot of rooms which overlook the gardens and the carpark. Having said that we weren't really in the room all that much. The grounds of the property are really lovely and you wouldnt think it had over 2000 rooms as there are very few people walking about. Its really well designed as the pools are pretty much hidden by trees. Also there are rabbits and squirrels running about (and sometimes ducks in the pool!). The last reviewer advised not to buy the plastic resort mugs but I found them really good value as we were there for 14 days and had lots of coffee, water and juice. They are about $15 each plus tax so if you're only there for a few days they might not really be worth it. We used to get up early most mornings and head over to the bakery in Riverside Mill - they do deliciious muffins (the bran is really nice), croissants and pastries in the morning. These count as a snack from the Dining Plan. For lunch the queues can get quite busy so its a good idea to go before 12 especially if you want a few different things. There are 4 main counters for lunch: - Chicken nuggets/burgers - Pizzas/pasta - Sandwiches - Salads At night they also do some extra things. Also the cakes from the bakery are great - try the magic cookie bar and the blue cupcakes!! We got the free quick service dining plan and upgrade to the disney dining plan. We felt it was really worth it and had lots of great meals but its a good idea to go online and book restaurants otherwise you might not get to the places you want. We didnt hire a car and had no problems with the bus from the South Depot - sometimes it was the last stop but we just got off at the main reception and walked over the bridge. When you're walking for miles round the parks all day another couple of minutes wont matter. The buses can get crowded especially after the fireworks and they really pack everyone on as much as possible. It probably took 10 minutes to get to each park (Animal Kingdom a bit further) altho it took a bit longer if the bus stopped at the French Quarter. All in all we had a great holiday and this was a great property - you have all the benefits of being in a Disney hotel but the hotel itself is a nice break from the hustle and bustle of the parks. I'd definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Another Amazing holiday in Disney”
Reviews.Author: kimmc77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans Riverside for the 1st time but have stayed on disney property before. The staff were helpful and changed our allocated rooms so we had connecting room with my mum. The rooms were clean and fit in with the themed Port Orleans theme. We Stayed at the Aligator Bayou section and with its greenery, river and bridges over pond it was a nice walk back to your room after a busy day at the theme park. There are plenty of pool. Them main pool being very busy and the other pool better for when you want quiter time. They had a lovely playground. We would go back and stay here tomorrow if we could afford. The bus system at Riverside stops at a few stops around the site. They do fill up quickily and we found the stops close to our room (west) was the second stop at Riverside so there was a chance of seats. When you get on the bus try to avoid sitting on the right hand side were the seats can be lifted for the disabled as you will have to give your seat up to accomodate. If you don't have children this is ok but for parents with young kids its hard to hold onto them if there are no otherseats available. TOP TIP, water is expensive in Disney, if you catch the bus to Downtown disney Westside and walk over the carpark and to the petrol station you can buy a tray of about 15 bottle for $6 (approx) In Disney it is $2.50 per bottle in Disney. This is also the case for beer. (take a small suit case with wheels to help you carry if all)

Reviews.Title: “Best family holiday ever”
Reviews.Author: 187046Joanne
Reviews.Content: The standard of service at this hotel is second to none. The room had plenty of space for a family of 4 and was very clean and well maintained. The maid ensured our children had a welcome home every evening from a new character sculpted from towells. We had a room to the rear of Magnolia Terrace overlooking the Garden, on the 2nd floor. It was very quiet and we were never distrurbed during the night. Magnolia Terrace is also very close to the main pool and to the food court. There is a Disney bus stop to the rear of the Terrace where the numbers of waiting guests are far less than at the main stop. The staff in the hotel were always friendly and helpful and provided good advise even when asked about non-Disney parks, taxi's, shopping etc. The package we booked with Thomson holidays, that included the free Disney Dining plan was great value, we estimate that we saved over Â£1000 in meals, snacks, drinks etc. When you take into account that there is also no need to hire a car and you are therefore saving on the cost of insurance and petrol as well , then Disney hotels can be a cheaper option than they might seem, compared to other hotels. We used Taxis to Universal - $35 approx each way, Sea World - $21 approx each way and premium outlets - $23 dollars each way. It is possible to book transfers wiith 'Mears' from the conceige desk, however for a family of 4 tcost of the taxi was equal to or cheaper than this option. Overall the holiday was magic from start to finish. No problems at all, just fabulous fun filled, sunny days!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but no wireless!”
Reviews.Author: strider64NewJersey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at both the Riverside and French Quarter resorts during a recent visit to Disneyworld. They both offer an excellent value and it's nice to stay at a Disney resort where you can actually take a decent walk, in this case along the river. The rooms are small and ingeniously designed with double sinks and a separate toilet and shower area to maximize the space for families. These are not rooms that you would want to spend much time in during the day; Disney wants you out in the parks, in any case. Our room was spotless and the service was friendly and efficient. My main gripe about the Disney resorts is that except for the Wilderness Campground, they don't have wireless.There's an ethernet port in the room, but only one person can go online at a time (and they charge $10.00 a day). Disney said "if you can dream it, you can do it," I guess this doesn't apply to the internet. Bring a router if you can, so you can get a wireless signal in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this resort! Awesome trip to Disney World!”
Reviews.Author: firstdisneytrip
Reviews.Content: Building 36, we paid extra to face the pool (water view, not to be confused with river view), short walk to North Depot for Disney buses and a little farther from the lobby/dining etc. than we would have hoped. But still a very nice stroll when the weather is nice. Room was clean, towel animals etc. every day. Nice pool, also laundry facilities by pool made it easy for us. Cane pole fishing was a bust, not even a nibble but that's why they call it fishing. Boatwright's dinner was good, recommend the tenderloin medallions. Food court was good, great bakery items. The General Store has lots of stuff, so much that you can get most souvenir items from them instead of lugging them back from the parks. Staff at hotel was very nice, everyone helpful. Would love to go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: 5kmama
Reviews.Content: Great moderate resort. Convenient to all Disney parks. The food court is good. We enjoyed the scenery & pool. I especially liked the running path along the river.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Resort!”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaTraveladict
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful property this is! We stayed in a basic room, very similar to the one we stayed in at Disney's Coranado Springs last year. Everything was clean, and I dont expect a lot out of a hotel room here, as we only sleep in it. Beds were comfortable, I just wish they were queen size instead of doubles. The great thing here is how beautiful everything is, from the walkways, the landscaping and layout. Swimming pool was great, and kids always had a blast. The quick service restaurant here had delicious food (cherry crumble was wonderful!). I love how simple Disney makes it to get around to their properties, from here you can take a boat down the canal to Downtown Disney. All staff we encountered were friendly, and some even went the extra mile. When my mother in law misplaced her resort refillable mug, they just gave her another one! Everything went smoothly and the staff can answer pretty much any question you may have about the parks in general. We would definitely stay here again, and recommend it to anyone looking for a great value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Another Hit But........”
Reviews.Author: luke35whelan36
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a seven night stay at POR. Paid extra for a preferred room. Request for top floor room was granted. Stayed in Alligator Bayou building 14. Location was fantastic. Short walk to the main buildind and buses. Rooms show thier age but were OK for a place to crash. We got towel animals, plenty of soap, towels and coffee every day but the room was far from clean. Dust was piled up in the corners and on the furniture in plain sight. TV was the older CRT type and channel selection was lacking(still no FNC). French Quarter has been upgraded with queen beds already, hope POR will soon follow. This was by far the quietest resort we've stayed at thus far, at least the area we were in. Cant speak for the Magnolia area. Bus service was fine but using the South Depot which was closest to our room meant we had to stand most of the time as that depot was the last of 4 stops for morning pick up. Laundry room by the quiet pool next to building 18 was small and we ran across 2 dryers that had no heat at 10:00 at night, not happy to have to feed another one another $2.00 and wait another 1/2 hour. Our goal is to stay at every resort at Disney, scratch one more off the list. If I had to stay at a repeat moderate, I'd pick CBR of PORFC before this resort. Avoid building 18 unless you enjoy the sound of screaming children at the "quiet pool"

Reviews.Title: “Even though its a huge hotel, you felt like you were secluded....great time!”
Reviews.Author: lmnnelson
Reviews.Content: Love the pools and extra activities for the kids....easy bus service to Disney. Awesome place to stay at the happiest place in the world ;)

Reviews.Title: “Checked out within the first hour...”
Reviews.Author: Viper1994
Reviews.Content: We had an unlimited budget for planning our honeymoon and after looking at all the options we choose port Orleans for the apparent charm... We were in the room not even ten minutes, there were lights out, spiderwebs in every corner, a piece or the floor board was falling off the wall leaving tack nails exposed but the kicker was the bed. My husband went to turn down the bed and it wasn't even made, sheets were all over the place so we started to make the bed and found a disgusting amount of dust right at the head of the bed on the decorative curtains. We called the front desk and they said they would see what they could do and someone would call back, well 30 minutes later someone called back and said we could move to another room and they would call as soon as it was ready. We waited and Waited and waited until we said no more, went to the front and request they transfer our reservation to the Grand Floridian. After our transfer was made we requested our bags that came through the ME and were told we needed to ask for them later at GF because they didn't have them. That answer was not acceptable, considering we had checked in over 3 hrs ago so I asked the bell captain and guess what they had been sitting in hold waiting for our new room number! We grabbed our bags and hit the road. The hotel is beautiful but so not worth the money when you could spend 600 more and stay deluxe!

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans Riverside. We loved it. Restaurant like a zoo though”
Reviews.Author: CotswoldMummy
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a one week stay at the Port Orleans Riverside resort during the UK Half Term week. We loved it. We have been to Disney World twice before and both times had stayed at the Grand Floridian so we were slightly wary of staying at a moderate resort. We were delighted with our choice though. We are a family of 3 (6 year old boy) and had friends over in Orlando with us although not at same resort. The room was perfect for us and also when our friend's son stayed with us too so for a family of 4, I would say it is ideal. We felt it was plenty spacious and we liked the fact we had a good sized fridge to keep drinks/fruit in etc. Housekeeping was very good and we had plenty of towels etc. We stayed in Building 95 Room 9763 and it was great. Nice and quiet and the beds were ultra comfortable which was super as we normally do not sleep very well when we are away from home but we slept like babies :-) With regards the pool facilities, the only comment I would make is that pool towels are only provided at the main pool.The smaller pools have towel collection points but no new pool towels. The laundry room was an added bonus too beside the Magnolia Bend pool. Boatwrights Dining Hall was okay - nothing special and a fairly limited choice of food we would say. The Riverside Mill was okay too and fine for breakfast or pizza for dinner etc but it was like a zoo - hugely busy no matter what time we went and fairly disorganised. If you are going to Epcot for the day, then have breakfast at the Sunny Seasons in 'The Land' - well organised and plenty seating etc etc. Twice we went for dinner at the excellent 'Flying Fish' at the Boardwalk. We were on the Dining Plan and on the whole, this worked well for us. When I booked our holiday last year, a friend (who is a very seasoned Disney visitor) advised us to make dinner reservations 6 months in advance. I thought she was mad as we do not like to be too constrained by bookings when in the theme parks etc. Oh oh - she was absolutely right! I could not get bookings to my fave restaurants (the Signature restaurants) at Disney at all and only took a booking at the Flying Fish because it was one of the few decent restaurants that had a slot for us but we are very glad we did go there. My advice would be that, if you are on the Dining Plan, book the tables at the good places you want to go 6 months in advance so that you can get decent reservation times and plan your park visits around that instead of the other way around. We had a great visit all in all. Buy some mozzy spray called 'OFF' from the on site shop as soon as you get there and use from sunset...no-one in our group got bitten :-) Also - we flew with Virgin and they have a special agreement with Universal Studios where Virgin customers can access the Harry Potter World exclusively before the park opened. Again we thought our rep had lost the plot when she said she was booking us to arrive at Universal at 6.45am!!!!!!!!!! yes you read that right!!! for access to the Park at 7am but it was a fantastic piece of advice. For over an hour, there were only around 100 people in the Wizarding World of Harry Potter and we had exclusive use of this area. Breakfast was included and it was great to get photos before the crowds arrived to do the Hogwarts ride. By 9am, there were literally thousands of people heading straight to the Harry Potter section. All in all, the longest wait we had at either Disney or Universal was around 40 mins at this half term week. A lot of the rides stated waits of 60 mins or more but we didn't find this to be the case although we would advise getting Fast Pass tickets for the Toy Story Midway Mania ride at Hollywood Studios to avoid the queues.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Disney Stay”
Reviews.Author: thetravelingfam
Reviews.Content: We went to Disney for my little one's 4th birthday and after much research, decided on Riverside. So glad we stayed there and would not hesitate to go back. The grounds were beautiful, we never waited more than 10 min for a bus, even though the place was huge the staff was attentive. There is a lot to do there and we loved the ferry boat to French Quarter and Downtown. Food was good in both the dining hall and boatwrights. My only complaint is that the bathroom in our room was pretty filthy. Other than that, the room and layout was really good. Basic room, but you are never really in it and the perks of staying with Disney are so worth it. Do your homework and request a building that is in a good location for your group. Try to get close to a bus depot, pool, and walkway to the main lobby. I don't think you will be disappointed here. Disney is so Magical!

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: FrazKent
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks (20 May - 4 June 2011) for our first ever visit to Disney and I would thoroughly recommend it. We were in Magnolia Terrace, which wasn't at all far from the fab pool or reception, main pool and restaurants. Fantastic grounds, lots of Magnolia trees (of course!) which smelt devine! We took a horse and carriage ride on our last day and visited the French Quarter. This didn't look as nice as Riverside, but we wish we had visited their main pool and restaurants! We found all staff very friendly and helpful at all times, nothing was too much trouble. Rooms were cleaned every day - no complaints there. Food court got very busy in the evenings. The music man on the piano was a little annoying, but obviously that is down to taste, so we didn't hang around when he was there. Amusement room has a good variety of games etc for children/adults. Although we loved the hotel, we won't be returning to Disney as it was just too hot and crowded. We need a holiday to get over this one!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: eyesee
Reviews.Content: We came to Orlando for a business convention and couldn't miss a stay and visit to Walt Disney World. The meal plan was included for free with our hotel and ticket package. That made the cost very affordable. The property itself is pleasant. We were so busy at the theme parks, that we didn't avail ourselves of the lovely surroundings of the hotel itself. The rooms are adequate. Absolutely nothing more. But ours was large and quiet. The service is friendly. I read all the reviews on TripAdvisor before I made the reservation. I requested a manor house rather than a bayou lodging. I did not want to wait for hours for the bus service, so I did have a rented car. Wow, that saved time and aggrevation. Since we stayed on property, the parking is included at all the theme parks and Disney destinations. It was much easier to jump in our car which was right by the staircase to our room, drive to the parks, park and walk or take the trams to the entrances. We then also had the freedom to decide where to go next instead of worrying about bus schedules and which bus went where. One time we did park at The Magic Kingdom, but took the monorail to Epcot and back, or vice versa. Can't remember. This moderate hotel is definitely better than the Value resorts in atmosphere and comfort. Do note that whatever hotel you are in on Disney property, the layout of the rooms is exactly the same. Just the decor of the room itself and the landscaping of the properties really change. But a nice quiet river and stately trees surrounding the building accommodations can be a relief to the barren and stark atmosphere of the value hotels after an action packed day.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: bberthel
Reviews.Content: As other have commented everyone has their own opinions and i have never left a review but I have to say that our stay was fantastic. As for the hotel not having that Disney feel, you are staying at Port Orleans Riverside and it shouldn't really have "Disney" feel that is why we go to Disney World. The staff is wonderful and made sure that everything was done for us in a timely manner. We didn't spend much time at all at the hotel but our time at the hotel was very pleasant. We had absolutely no issues with transportation with buses or boats, and if we did have to stand up on a bus it sure beat driving to a park. I want to thank Disney's Port Orleans, WDW travel and Walt Disney himself for the best vacation of my life.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: valie520
Reviews.Content: We found POR to be a thoroughly enjoyable hotel for our recent May 26-June 1 stay at WDW. We had purchased the hotel package along with our park tickets and dining package. One of the best bonuses of staying in any resort hotel, of course, is the free airport transportation and inter-park/hotel bus service. Our room in building 38 was closest to the North Depot but most often departed from the Main/South Depot in the morning. We never waited more than 20 minutes to get a bus. If you start your day at one of the other three, you risk less frequent bus service. The room was perfectly fine; no frills, but nothing to complain about. I would have liked a vanity instead of the double pedestal sinks, but there was a ledge above the sinks to hold our toiletries. Where we stayed was a very quiet section; no noise from foot traffic, pool visitors, or bus travelers. I liked the option of taking the boat to Downtown Disney. It was a lovely ride down the river. You can also stop at PO - French Quarter, which is a good option if you want a change of scenery. POR guests can use all of the amenities at French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay, however rooms were just fair”
Reviews.Author: schwhite
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed that my family of 5 was limited in where we could stay. Port Orleans Riverside was one of the cheaper options so we decided to stay there. I was dismayed to find out after I booked our vacation that the Port Orleans French Quarter rooms had all been recently renovated and that Riverside will be undergoing a renovation later in 2011 and 2012. So basically, we were staying in a room that was in need of a renovation. I called the hotel several times before we left to make sure our room would be clean because of my son's allergies. They told me we would get a VIP cleaning, which I was happy about. I also requested a room close to the main building as this resort is rather large. I am happy to report that we were put in building 16, which is pretty close to the main building. The room cleaning was OK. The carpets looked clean, but there were dirty areas in the corners of the room and the mattresses were a bit rough looking. Since I read all about bed bugs before the trip, I made sure to inspect the mattresses very good. I didn't see any signs of them, but I did notice several large stains (coffee maybe?) That first night was rough for me as I kept thinking bugs were crawling on me. After the first night, after another inspection of the bed, I slept better. The room was cleaned pretty well each day. The first day I left a tip and it was taken. The second and third day I left a tip with note requesting a towel animal and the tip was never taken. On the last day, I left another tip. Just an FYI, if you need any sheets changed after they have cleaned your room for the day, they will just give them to you to change yourself. Not a big deal, but just know you will have to look at those mattresses again! Anyway, the food court was pretty nice, though we just ate breakfast there one day, and the restaurant, Boatwrights, was very good. One of the best meals I ate on the trip was eaten there. The lobby is pretty rough looking. The carpets are worn and the floors are scuffed up. I think they need to do a renovation on the lobby as well. The main was great...loved the slide. Watch out for pesky tweens though. They cut you in line at the slide and act obnoxious in the pool when they are together (one boy kept sticking his middle finger up to anyone who was watching.) The boat to DTD was great too. Nice little perk to staying at Port Orleans...though again, if I had my choice, I would stay at FQ for the simple fact that all the room were redone, it's smaller (half the size of Riverside), and they have a really cool looking pool! The transportation to the park was fantastic. Never had to wait more than 15 minutes and usually was able to get a seat. Also, the staff was very friendly at the hotel and the drivers were nice as well. I would recommend staying here, but just be aware that the hotel rooms are clean, but in fair condition.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: kren250
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our Disneyworld trip; while there, we stayed at Port Orleans Riverside resort. We absolutely loved it. The grounds are gorgeous--winding paths, many ponds, foliage everywhere. So pretty. And, the river that runs through the middle of the resort is really neat. POR has a marina with boats that will take you to French Quarter or Downtown Disney, which is fun. There's also a walking path along the river from POR to French Quarter; we walked this a few times on our trip and found it very relaxing. We did not find the resort too big, but we do a lot of walking. For folks not used to walking much--it may seem like the resort is too big, and exhausting. We were in building 28, which was *maybe* a 5 minute walk from the west bus depot. The west depot was great, since we were often the first stop int he morning and the bus was empty--or the second stop, and there were still plenty of seats. The south depot was often the last stop, and most of those people ended up standing. The pools were fun. We used the quiet pool near our building most often, and there were times when my kids were the only ones in it. We also swam at Ol' Man River Swimming Hole a few times, and really enjoyed that as well--it's always very busy though. And, once we took the boat to French Quarter to swim there (since they are "sister" resorts they can use each other's pools), and the kids loved the dragon slide. We did not eat at Boatwright's, but we did have several meals at POR's food court. The food was fine; but there was always a long wait in line to get it. We preferred eating at French Quarter: the fried chicken and beignets were delicious, and the lines for food and check out much shorter.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is nice but......”
Reviews.Author: Kellyjo68
Reviews.Content: I found the place to be clean, although it's very large and if your tired from the parks expect a good walk back to your room. The problem? Well the last night we were there it's was late after returning from a park My family ran into a bear black/brown not sure of the color. I mention the color because the hotel seemed to focus on that when we reported it. It was dark and beleive me I wasn't going to approach it to find out. It was standing on the walkway I am so thankful the children were tired that night and did not run ahead. We made it to our room and called the front desk right away all I could think of was some other family running into this and maybe not so lucky. well no one ever came down to check things out. I waited but no one, you would think security or someone would come and make sure things were o.k esp. with a potentialy hazardous situation.

Reviews.Title: “An okay Disney resort to stay in, beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: darlynnski
Reviews.Content: I had won Disney gift cards thru my work & decided to go to Disney for our anniversary & try out a Disney resort. This resort for us was the best value price wise. They benefits I find about staying @ a Disney resort from staying outside is 1- the shuttle buses are readily available and 2-earlier entrance to parks on certain days. I don't mind paying for quality but dont nickel & dime me. No free internet, you'll pay $10/24hr period. They only offered about 10 TV channels and 8 of them were Disney related. I'm sure this is because they want you out spending $. They have restauranst onsite which the price is about average for Disney but food was nothing to rave about. The meal plan maybe a way to save some $ but you really need to plan where and when you want to eat with it. They have a store onsite also where you can get souveniors and food (sodas, snacks and such) They do have fridge in room, so it's worth bringing some of our own beverages to have on hand. The room was clean, 2 beds, 2 sinks in bathroom, coffee maker, safe, and small table/chairs to eat at. The pool area is nice and they have an outside bar by it. At the bar, ask for $ of specialty drinks before ordering. 4 drinks cost us over $40. They do offer a mug you can buy to be used @ the resort only for unlimited drink refills. That is definitely worth investing in. You can bring in small coolers w/ plastic drink containers into Disney parks. The grounds of the resort were beautiful and they have boat you can take to downtown Disney and to the french quarter side of the resort. At this resort and maybe other Disney properties, @ check-in they charge your form of payment for your stay, instead of doing it @ check-in. You can change your form of payment @ check-out but it'll take couple days to get refund. This they should of said @ check-in. This is not a bad place overalll to stay for Disney property. Going to Disney your gonna pay everywhere. The time of yr we went was great, no lines anywhere @ the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: brenhammomof3
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans Riverside was the perfect place for our 1st family vacation to Disney World. We had our 3 children - 4 yr old twins & a 3 yr old - and both sets of grandparents. Check in was painless. The resort had already accomated our request for the rooms to be near each other on the grounds. We were all in house 36. Like most of the reviews stated, this resort is spread out and you have to walk a decent distance to get to the bus stop, pool, or dining hall. That was no issue for us. We welcomed the exercise and it was always a pleasant walk in the shade. The kids loved seeing the squirrels and lizards runing across the sidewalks. The walk was often times an adventure for them. Considering we were at Disney, we spent a lot more time by the resort pool than I would have ever imagined. We'd start off early at one of the parks and be back to the room usually by 5pm. We'd throw on a swimsuit and head to the pool. I was a bit disappointed that there was no zero entry/beach type entrance to the pool and all the water was over 3 1/2 feet deep which required us to be in with the kids the whole time, but that wasn't a big deal. They did have a small baby pool but our kids wanted nothing to do with it. They had a great water slide that my 4 yr olds loved. The lack of lifeguards in the slide area made me a bit nervous, but there were plenty of parents around the bottom of the slide to keep things safe. The first day I thought the dining hall food was great... by day 7, not so much. We did have one table meal at Epcot, but other than that we stuck to our Quick Service Dining Meal. A dining plan is a must in my opinion. It was so nice to not worry about carrying cash or having to budget meals. We paid up front and were done. We learned that breakfast between 8:00 - 9:30am was the busiest and if that time could be avoided we got through there pretty fast. My kids loved the coloring table in the dining hall (so did hte adults!) and two nights when we ate, kitchen staff did a musical parade with the kids and let them make sugar cookies - lots of icing and sprinkles for a night time snack. As mentioned on many of these posts, the rooms are nothing to brag about. After reading several reviews, I was expecting worse. The rooms are average, and considering we were rarely in them, a great bargain. The beads were comfy, though by bed time we are usually exhausted. Showers were fair. I will note that the resort had a shampoo/conditioner combo. To save space in my luggage, I didn't pack my sperate bottles and regretted it because between their combo and the pool, my hair felt like sandpaper by the end of the week. The shuttle system isn't always the quickest, but I'd opt for it any day over driving myself. We had one occasion when we had to wait almost 20 minutes for a shuttle. Besides that our waits were usually less than 10 minutes. It often times felt like we couldn't have stuck one more person on, but most people didn't care, they just wanted to get to the parks. The people who complain about the shuttle have probably never had to wait in line for anything. It was tolerable, even with 3 young kids. Overall our trip was great! If you are traveling with young kids, this resort is a great option because you are surrounded by hundreds of other families with small children so embarassment isn't a worry. No need to hush them during dinner when everyone else is loud. I am not sure if we will stay here again next time we visit Disney only because I want to see the theme accomodations of some of the other resorts. I would highly recommended this place for a first time visit with small children!

Reviews.Title: “The water slide is the best!”
Reviews.Author: sydneykatej
Reviews.Content: Loved staying here! Slept like a baby and It was so nice to walk the grounds to get to breakfast. We sat pool side while we ate and finished off with a trip down the water slide. I can't wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Too big, too sprawling”
Reviews.Author: klytia
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans Riverside is categorized as a Moderate resort on the Disney property. It has the feel of a Lousiana bayou with spanish moss and a river running through the property. It's a sweet, relaxed, and homey sentiment but the problem here comes down to size. Riverside is just too big! After arriving and checking in at the lobby, it took me forever to find my room (all the way on the opposite side of the lake/river from the lobby), carting my luggage with me. To get back to the lobby area for breakfast, which also housed the shops and restaurants, too equally as much time. There are FOUR bus stops scattered around the edges of the property that are serviced by the complimentary bus service to the parks. Depending on which park your visiting and which route you take it sometimes feels like forever to get anywhere as you make the loop around the entire property. And make sure you remember exactly which bus stop is yours before you get off the bus! There is nothing wrong with Riverside except for the size. For a moderate resort, I much prefer the sister property, Port Orleans French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for couples...”
Reviews.Author: alainemcfly
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Port Orleans to celebrate my birthday, and I found the resort very pleasant. There is much more to see and do at this moderate resort, rather then at one of the value resorts, so the "value" is definetly there. Bearing in mind we were in Disney World in January, the resort itself was fairly quiet. We stayed in Aligator Bayou, at the opposite side of the resort from the main building (where the restuarants, bar, and check in/out is), and while I can understand that it would be a long walk for families with young children, it didn't bother us at all. The grounds are well kept, and there is a river winding throughout.
