When we checked in, the gentleman at the desk informed us we would be on the second floor, and that there are no elevators, and asked if that would be a problem. We assured him it wouldn't be. The king bed was large and comfortable, and while the bathroom was small, there is a dressing area, and the whole room was very clean. When my boyfriend asked for more coffee for the coffee pot, which is in the room along with a small fridge, they were more then happy to help. The main restaurant was never overly busy, and we did eat there one evening around 8pm or so, and the food was very good. The bar is very cozy, with couches and a fireplace, and even live music later in the evening, and the bartenders were very friendly. There are three or four bus stops on the property, and we never waited more then 20 minutes for a bus. There is also a water taxi to Downtown Disney, and the boat operators were all friendly. And one quick trick we learned for getting back to our hotel in the evening, as a lot of people stay at the value and moderate resorts: Nothing is as far away as it seems. Hop on an empty bus (like to one of the more expensive resorts), then grab a taxi back to your home base. It never cost more then $15, and after a long day in the park, it was more than a fair price to avoid having to wait an hour to get into bed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andytut
Reviews.Content: We have just returned 22.5.11, we stayed for two weeks at Riverside in Magnolia Terrace with a quiet pool view. It was a great location for parking and close to the check in, restaurants etc... we stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge May 2010 but preferred Riverside, as it was more relaxing and was more 'open' for walking etc.... The staff were friendly and the on-site Restaurants had a good selection and were priced slightly cheaper than the parks. I felt that the theme parks overall sevice had been reduced and the food prices increased since last year. The new Harry Potter ride at Howarts was out of this world, combination of Spiderman 3d and a roller coaster, also Star Tours 3D was on a differnet planet ;-). Even though we thoroughly enjoyed our vacation at will be a long time before we return to Orlando; not a negative comment by any means, just a personal view. p.s. 2012 a new themed area opens in magic kingdom fantasyland, the drawings looked superb

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: AmyA85
Reviews.Content: After leaving another Disney hotel at 1 am.... The staff at Riverside almost made us forget the horrible experience we had experienced the previous day. The rooms were very clean, which I loved! The staff was friendly and welcoming. The transportation wasn't always the greatest, but that's not the resorts fault. I found this place to be great and would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: mjhan01
Reviews.Content: This was our 8th visit to Disneyworld, 6th time staying on site. We have stayed at Pop Century, Caribbean Beach & Old Key West all if which were wonderful. However, this resort is a different story. Although the grounds are beautiful and very clean and the food court is very good, the rooms are in dire need of renovation. Our room was shabby and worn. The carpet looked like it had never been cleaned. The extractor in the bathroom did not work and the A/C unit sounded like the Shuttle taking off! Cannot comment on the buses as did not use them. The location of this resort is very good and the food court is good. Did not have the Disney feeling at this resort and would choose Pop over this place anytime. Okay for the couples without children who value a bit of peace and quiet. Nice pool bar. Don't worry if you are travelling here and are having second thoughts, it's just that we all have different tastes and expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Visitor149
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic holiday at Disney Port Orleans Riverside! The staff there were very efficient and helpful from the start! We stayed in Oak Manor which wasn't far from the restaurant / shops etc. The only slight negative of the whole holiday was that the rooms could do with an update (this did not detract from our holiday in any way), but they were clean and nicely done and had everything we needed! We also had a corner room which was great as it made it a little lighter. As for the grounds...they were beautiful and very peacful! It felt like you were in a different world wandering round! The disney buses were regular (only the odd occasion did we have to wait for very long in the whole 14 nights) - but we did hire a car for 7 days of this to explore Universal and Seaworld and loved the freedom it gave us, so would probably do this again! The only bad thing about the buses is if you go to a show ie. fantasmic - as you have to queue a while to get a bus back to the hotel in the evening. Or if its raining/stormy and you are at a water park (the queue seems to go out the window and people just dive to get on the buses first! we had to wait for 4 bus loads before we could get on, and by then the storm had nearly passed). (Also loved the little boat to down town disney for a change). Overall thought this hotel was really good, and would definately stay here again! You wont be disappointed. We also got free disney dining which was brill, so if you can get that then is an added bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Had a really great time!”
Reviews.Author: jaysunhoffman
Reviews.Content: So first off just as everyone else has said this resort is big. It will take you a while to get around, that being said it wasn't unmanageable. We traveled with 3 kids 8,6,4, and we didn't really hear from them about walking around the resort. Around the parks though? That was a different story. First off the Lobby, very nice and interesting decor, when I checked in I had pre registered a few days before and only had one other person in line in front of us. The regular check in wasn't that busy either to be clear. Check in was super fast and I was given our package and off we went to find our room. We were located in House 35 in the Alligator Bayou, which took about 10 minutes to walk there. The room was clean and quite large, some people have been harping saying the decor was dated, etc.. We didn't find that. The trundle bed was interesting, all 3 kids tried sleeping on it but they all ended up in bed by the morning. When I asked them why they moved, they didn't remember, and they said it was comfortable. Who knows... The resort is well taken care of and the pools were excellent. The large pool on old mans island was jammed with people so we kept to our own pool near our building, far less bells and whistles but the kids and my wife loved it. Holy chlorine though!! Your eyes will be sore after swimming. My only gripe about the grounds was when we came back from Epcot at like midnight we got off at the West depot and followed the path back to our building. This path wasn't marked very well and it took us a while how to figure out which building was ours. Not fun late at night with tired children. From then on we walked back to the ring road and just walked along the grass to the bus stop (5 min walk at the most) The quick service restaurant was great. Awesome selection from Burgers to Pasta to Sandwiches and it was never super busy, although we never ate breakfast there. We also ate at Boat Wrights, decent food, but my Prime Rib was severely undercooked and didn't agree with the stomach to well. I know I could have sent it back, but I didn't so its my own fault for that experience. We also used Disney Dining with no issues at all for our entire trip... All in all the staff were amazing, everything one of my daughters wore a princess dress out all the staff would bow and call them princess and open doors for them, amazing... What else can I say. Its a good resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort & wonderful vacation (stayed in Acadian House)”
Reviews.Author: mcb123456
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a great resort! Lovely grounds, wonderful dining (food court & restaurant), and lots to see & do. Rooms were nice - could use a bit of updating - but were good for us. Happy to hear about the Royal Rooms coming, wish they were done when we went! The beds were SO comfy though!!!! Stayed in Acadian House (Magnolia Bend), and it was a bit of a walk to the main building, would've preferred to stay in Magnolia House. Pools were great, main pool was a tad colder than the quiet ones. There were lots of animals roaming around those pretty grounds. Transportation was good - loved the boat to Downtown Disney. We never had to wait overly long for the buses - so I don't understand why so many people choose PO-FQ over Riverside for that fact. OH, and if you get the chance, rent the surrey bikes!!!! I would highly recommend this resort, it was very beautiful - although you can't go wrong with any resort you choose - whether it is Value, Moderate or Deluxe!

Reviews.Title: “Lush grounds, fun theme, and quiet, clean room. A relaxing stay.”
Reviews.Author: jeanmm65
Reviews.Content: After booking a 4 night stay at The Port Orleans Resort, Riverside, I had some reservations about staying after reading other reviews. We arrived around 10:00 am and we were able to check in right away, enabling us to go the Magic Kingdom soon after our arrival. The room was across the river from the restaurant/lobby and couldn't have been more convenient. It was clean, had a refrigerator, laundry line, two sinks, beds and was on the first floor near a quiet, empty pool. The staff was friendly and helpful. The resort had a fair number of amenities, inlcuding a great gift shop and arcade. The quick serve dining hall had good food and fairly fast service, but by the end of the our stay, it had gotten quite busy and the coffee/hot water ran out quickly and the lines were long for breatkfast. The resort has a great location with boat service to downtown Disney, convenient and frequent bus service and only 10-12 minute drives to the theme parks. We did get cute "towel" animals, so that was bonus. I would recommend staying at Disney Port Orleans as the grounds were lush and beautifully maintained, has a great location, friendly staff and is conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans - Riverside - Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jan1959Cheshire
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from two weeks at The Port Orleans - Riverside. This was our fourth trip to Disney and by far the best hotel we have stayed in. OK the rooms could do with a general update, but they were clean and housekeeping kept us supplied with towels, etc. on a daily basis. The grounds were immaculate and it was nice to be able to get away from the parks and relax by the pool. The main pool was busy, but the pool inbetween our building and the next was generally quiet - in fact sometimes we had it to ourselves. We had the Quick Dining plan - which I would recommend, as food isn't always that cheap, but there was plenty of choice, and we were even able to get ice-creams in the parks with the snack option. We also had some snack points left, and were able to bring sweets home with us using the points! The extra facilities at the hotel were great - we used the boat to go to downtown disney quite a few times. We also hired a surrey bike, a pontoon boat and one evening had a horse drawn carriage ride around the park - at this point my son (who was with us) proposed to his girlfriend - which made the holiday extra special. The staff were all friendly and helpful whenever we saw them. If we go back to Disney again we would definitely use the Port Orleans as our base.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip!”
Reviews.Author: Travelingmama1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room in the Magnolia section. The room was clean. It had a coffee maker and dimmer switches (the only two differences from our room at the All Star Music). The pool looked very nice but we didn't use it because we went to the parks each day. The transportation to and from the parks was great (we did have to walk about 10 minutes to the bus stop but I didn't mind that). We ate at both restaurants there; the food at the quick service for lunch was okay and the food at Boat Wrights dinner restaurant was great. The staff were all very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice resort”
Reviews.Author: FamilyCasa
Reviews.Content: The only reason I gave this a 4 instead of a 5 was because it does need a bit of updating- HOWEVER- this resort is undergoing refurshbishment shortly. Also while we did get housekeeping each day, we did not get cute towel sculptors that we had heard about. we were staying at the resort with my sister's family who had their own room and they got the cool towel figures so that was dissappointing. we didn't have any problems with the bus service and the food court was actaully really good as well. they do over preferred rooms but they are not worth the extra money i think. sometimes they count fountains and pools as a "waterview". save your money! overall we would stay here again in a heart beat and recommend to any family wanting a fun expereince while staying as disney.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful stay! Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: disneygiggles
Reviews.Content: I admit... I really fretted about booking Port Orleans Riverside because of negative reviews regarding its run-down condition of the rooms. I'm used to staying in the deluxe resorts (Boardwalk Inn... my all-time fave!), but this time, we were taking my daughter's best friend, our treat, and booked a separate room for the girls. So, we had to work on a little more of a budget than what we've been used to. With all that said... we loved, loved, LOVED this resort. The rooms might need a little bit of a refurb, but we were so pleasantly surprised! We stayed in Oak Manor, adjoining rooms 9104 and 9105. The rooms weren't too small, 3 in one room, two in the other. They were neat and tidy... not "run down" at all. Mousekeeping did a fabulous job! (Don't forget to leave them a tip every day... they deserve it!) I took advantage of the online check-in and everything was ready and waiting on us. Check-in was very hassel-free, smooth, and convenient. The grounds were BEYOND beautiful! It was just a short walk to the main resort, but such a beautiful one... so quaint and peaceful. We enjoyed the quiet pool next to our resort. We had a car at our disposal, so we drove to all of the parks and to miniature golf, although we did take the boat to Downtown Disney. It was a little too chilly to do this at night in February... just go prepared with a jacket or buy yourself a neat Disney hoodie at the Disney Store to wear on the ride back! :D We had the dining plan and the food in Riverside Mill was soooooo delicious and there was an abundance of it! We didn't eat at Boatwright's since we had so many reservations at the parks and other resorts. I would definitely stay at Port Orleans Riverside, again, without question. The only thing I missed was not having the option to buy souveniers in the parks and have them sent to the resort... what can I say? The deluxe ones have me spoiled... ;)

Reviews.Title: “Anyone who slates this resort is insane”
Reviews.Author: davelewin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans Riverside may/june 2010 and anyone who stays here and slags it off is mental. The rooms are fine and adequate as described, the food hall is better for choice than the more expensive resorts, we stayed at Animal kingdom Lodge in 2009 and believe me you have a much better food choice at Port Orleans. The ultimate difference approx -$2000 is Piano Bob Jackson...... this guy is the consumate performer. Sometimes there maybe only be a dozen people in the bar but he gives it all like there are thousands. Well worth the moderate fee alone. overall afantastis experience, we have stayed at pop century resort, animal kingdom lodge, and port orleans riverside. Next time I book will be the port again.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday of a lifetime!”
Reviews.Author: Tulip021
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews for this hotel I was slightly dismayed about our choice of hotel, but I can honestly say it was the most wonderful holiday ever and the hotel was fabulous. Upon arrival we were greeted warmly by a cast member who made the three children we were travelling with (ages 1, 3 and 5) very happy by giving them stickers and talking to them. Check in was a bit chaotic, there was 11 of us staying in 4 different rooms and it took over an hour to sort out who was going where and to issue the cards. The rooms themselves were wonderful, the housekeeping was very good and we even got a message from the manager asking us if our room was okay which was lovely. The maid made us towel animals regularly; something really nice to come home to after a long day around the parks. As has been said the hotel grounds are stunning, they are impeccably kept and make the whole experience even better. The food court was good too, a great option of quick service meals and snacks, however it can get very busy if you hit peak times in the morning (around 8:30-9) but there is plenty of seating. I would recommend buying the refillable mugs as you definitely get your moneys worth out of them. The Boatwrights dining hall is also delicious, the service is wonderful and the food is cooked well and there is a good variety. Within the hotel the staff were very kind and welcoming, saying hello to you as you pass and always willing to help you with anything you need. The Disney transport really is a dream, however they aren't very well co-ordinated. Sometimmes 2 or 3 buses will come for the same place at the same time however we were told they are working on it when we mentioned it to staff. It was a treat to be so close to downtown Disney, we spent many nights there as it is a short bus or boat ride away. A tip if you're going to be coming back to the hotel late at nigh; buy some Off! from the hotel shop, mosquitos are out in force on a night as you're so close to the water and it works a treat. But all in all, the hotel was incredible. Of course there were a few things that could be improved but if you spend your time worrying about the little things you'll only ruin the holiday for yourself. Though some people will complain about anything I suppose. I would say there was no reason to worry about this hotel at all. You'll love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Disney Experience. Nice moderate hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LiveforOBX
Reviews.Content: Grounds and location of the resort were great. The first rooms we were given had not been completely cleaned (still trash in the trash cans). It was also difficult to get the connecting rooms we requested. With persistence, we did get two clean connecting rooms, which were perfect for our vacation. Layout was perfect. Bus service was great. We would also recommend the meal plan (especially during special weeks when free!). We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay-quiet, peaceful, relaxing”
Reviews.Author: agrillo47
Reviews.Content: We stayed from April 29-May 3. First time here. Very enjoyable.Check-in was prompt and informing. Our room was in magnolia bend. The room was spacious,clean,somewhat worn but acceptable. Bed was comfortable, queen update would be better. Fridge and coffee maker handy. Food court and lobby area only a 5-7 minute walk. There are a lot of food choices, all good quality, pricey but what isn't. Grab a mug a good deal. They are open late. Great landscaping, walk-ways, pools, grounds all well maintained. Transportation is timely and convenient. We were closest to the north depot and it was only a 3 or 4 minute walk from our room. The boat taxi to DDD was very enjoyable. WE would stay again....

Reviews.Title: “Stick with the value resorts”
Reviews.Author: thiton
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at a moderate resort for the first time. We have stayed MANY times at the value resorts. It was NOT better! The mattresses squeaked EVERY time you moved and it was hard as a rock! It took 3 days and a new cleaning person to swipe down the bathroom floor. It came with the dirt upon arrival. The trundle bed is definitely NOT fit for a small child even though that is what it is for. I don't know of any small child that would sleep basically on the floor. Disney is a wonderful place, but go for the value! The only difference was a mini fridge and a trundle bed. The decor and area were nice though. We had to wait and wait for conceiage(ms), even though 3 people were at their stations and not waiting on others.

Reviews.Title: “Best Moderate in WDW”
Reviews.Author: FastPass
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans Riverside is great for us because it's got great landscaping, walking paths, and feels spacious. It's also quieter then any other moderate on property. We've stayed at every moderate resort in WDW and this one is the best. Also, great pool that is relaxing but still fine for kids. We travelled with our 5 year old Godson and he found a frog that he just loved. I get asked if Port Orleans French Quarter is better then Riverside. If you like a busier, louder and more active hotel - French Quarter is great. It's also closer to the restaurants and store. But, Riverside is a nice break from the parks.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful and relaxing resort”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELDISNEYLOVER
Reviews.Content: check-in very easy with nice friendly cast members. Have enjoyed every trip we've taken to Disney World over last eleven years. Rooms are always clean, fresh towels, and well maintained. I would rate this resort right up there with the Deluxe resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Stick With All Stars or Delux if youhave kids”
Reviews.Author: SuperAndy11
Reviews.Content: After staying at the All Stars I have to say - Don't bother with the upgrade unless you ae going without kids. The rooms are pretty much the same and the pools and food court are no better. What makes Port Orleans great for couples is that it is quiet and the nice boat ride to downtown Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds Expectations! One of the best Disney Resorts!”
Reviews.Author: OhioItalian
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times. We travel to Disney twice a year and always stay here. Great service! Clean and comfortable rooms! Excellent quality food court! Beautiful atmosphere! Close to all Disney property attractions! I read some of the other reviews that gave his hotel negatives. What a bunch of BS! I have never run across anything but quality at Port Orleans. It is like my home away from home. I cannot say enough about this beautiful resort. One thing I would like to comment is about the buses. There is nothing wrong with them! Port Orleans is a big resort. If you go to Disney during the peak times, ie... spring break, the crowds will be huge, which results in longer lines not only at the parks, but waiting for a bus. Disney does an excellent job of getting people moving as quickly as possible. So, if your complaint is waiting in long lines, then go down in the off-season. Disney offers excellent hotels for all budgets. YOU WILL not find any off-property quality like you find at a Disney Resort. You are taken care of 24/7 with great Disney service. So for you complainers, stay in one of the off property hotels and see what service you get!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sp00kyfish
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week in April -- two parents with kids 6 and 10. We've previously stayed at French Quarter and enjoyed it, but we all liked Riverside better -- more to do and see! We loved the extra pools. Stayed in Alligator Bayou lodge #16 -- found that to be a good location. I was worried we'd be too far from things, but that wasn't the case. Quick walk to dining area, pools, bus stop. Room was clean and the dining options were reasonable. No big delays using the Disney buses. We'll definitely stay here again while visiting Disney.

Reviews.Title: “great holiday,place ,location and sevice”
Reviews.Author: Cath025
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed for 2 weeks in early april we had a great time the hotel was great , the setting was excellent and service was great. we would defintely return to this resort.The dining plan was great and overall the holiday was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED it at Port Orleans”
Reviews.Author: cabertelsen
Reviews.Content: This resort was perfect for our family of five. The rooms were wonderful and pretty roomy. We have both a teen and very young children. There was things for both ages to do at this resort, no one was ever BORED! The busses were great, we didn't wait very long for a ride and crowdy was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place for a WDW vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: disworldfan
Reviews.Content: I have nothing bad to say about this resort. It has been my favorite resort since the 5 years i have been going to Disney! The rooms are amazing, The food taste great, the beds were so comfy! Amazing that i wished i lived in this resort every day! That is how much i love it1

Reviews.Title: “Convenient relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: bcnj
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I enjoyed our third stay in 4 years at Riverside in April 2011. I love the grounds of this property. Find them so restful after a day at the parks. The Ol' Man Island pool is a lot of fun for the kids but the quiet pools are fun as well. The four bus stops located throughout the property are very convenient. We hardly ever had to wait anytime for a bus at the Easy Depot or South Depot - we were staying in Oak Manor - it was easy to pick up a bus in the morning at the East Depot but, if on returning the South Depot was the first stop we found it easier to get off there and walk over the bridge to the room. Like taking the boat over to Downtown Disney for dinner. We usually take the bus back to resort after dinner. I find that quicker than the ferry. Rented a boat for the first time at the marina this year. That was a lot of fun. Drove over to Downtown Disney and cruised up to the Key West resort to check it out.

Reviews.Title: “No Disney Magic Here!”
Reviews.Author: camproberts
Reviews.Content: For years, everyone we know has been going to Disney. We waited, saving our extra money, to do a once in a lifetime trip that the kids would never forget and forever hold in their mind as something special. Well, had I known more details about this hotel, I absolutely would have waited even longer to save enough $$ to stay at premium resort. Buses...horrible!!!! For some unknown and inexplicable reason, Port Orleans Riverside was the ONLY resort with painstakingly LONG lines. Our first night in Disney took us an HOUR to get home from MK. What the heck is the benefit of staying on grounds with this travel time???? Completely took the magic out of our first day. Not to mention that the buses were so crowded at that point that it was hard to avoid the hundreds of coughing kids in our faces. My husband and 5 year old had the flu by day 6. Do not waste your time here! Save the extra money to stay somewhere that is walking distance to at least one park or on the monorail line. Hint: Take a cab. We had 7 people including my parents and the $15 cab ride was WELL WORTH THE $$$ and TIME!!! I wish I had realized that option sooner and it would have saved us some agony. Food: You know, I did not have high expectations of the hotel food court. The quality of the food was okay, but I can't seem to understand why the choices NEVER changed. Night after night, the food court offered the SAME EXACT choices. We did not plan to eat there at all, but as the flu would have it, we finished our trip with two dinner at the hotel. How difficult would it be to change it up a little?? Even the cheapest hotels (homewood suites, etc) slightly change their continental breakfasts each day. Really disappointing. Pool: Towels were hard to find and people left towels on the chairs after they left the pool. No one cleared the towels to make the chairs available. The hottub was disgusting. Eight thousand unattended kids. I have three kids and I don't let them in any hot tub for more than 5 minutes (or unsupervised) since the high temps are really not meant for children. Room: Maybe it's supposed to be the "charm" or New Orleans, but the squeaking, bouncing bed didn't do it for me. It's 2011 for crying out loud...I'd like a quality bed with beautiful bedding. Also, we requested a connecting room with my parents, which they confirmed, and still DID NOT HAPPEN. They were next door, but not the connecting side. I don't get it. Don't stay here unless you just can't wait one more year of saving. Parks, on the other hand, truly are magical. We'll get back, Mickey, just not here.

Reviews.Title: “Love it here!”
Reviews.Author: cruzrmomma
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Conemporary last time, which we LOVED!! But if you are more of a budget, not complaints here! We love the beautiful grounds, good food court, and the boat ride to DDD is very relaxing! It's pretty big, we stayed at Aligator Bayou, which was just fine (we had 5 in our room). Don't hesidtate to stay here-beds a little hard, and I wish bathroom was bigger for 5 people!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds, Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: CK95
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Port Orleans Riverside in April 2011. We reserved a preferred room and were in building 27 which was very convenient to the main building, pool and bus stops. The Magical Express and check in process went very efficiently and smoothly. We got to our rooms about an hour after our flight landed. The room was fine - not luxurious by any means but comparable to any Holiday Inn Express or similar hotel. I found the double beds to be pretty small, but knew this ahead of time so I was not surprised. They are upgrading them to queen beds later this year, which is a good thing. The room was clean, not spotless, but overall clean. The bathroom was very clean. We ate at the food court only for breakfast, and found it to be good. We ate at Boatwrights the evening of our arrival and it was good, the service was a little slow, but the food was good. The grounds were just beautiful, well worth taking a walk or bike ride around. We saw rabbits, lizards and squirrels daily. The bus service was better than I was expecting - we waited about 5-7 minutes on every occasion, except one. That one time we had a wait over around 40 minutes for an early bus to Animal Kingdom for a character breakfast. We greatly enjoyed the boat ride from the resort to downtown Disney. All in all, we had a great time at Disney and really enjoyed staying on property. Can't imagine staying off property.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: nightnurse2000
Reviews.Content: My daughter and 2 granddaughters ,my sister and I stayed in alligator byou we thought the room was a bit small for 5 but it was clean beds comfortable. enjoyed walking trails. Easy access to bus stop. Had meal plan not much varitey. We will go back and would reccomend to other folks. People were wonderful on the resort!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families.”
Reviews.Author: Dawnpop
Reviews.Content: Good size rooms. Restaurant great for families. So easy to get to all the attractions from this hotel, with the transportation system. Lovely quiet rooms, everything you need. Will go back.

Reviews.Title: “A great MODERATE resort choice for your DISNEY Property Stay A+ Value!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Teacherdrd
Reviews.Content: We booked this resort after we decided we wanted to upgrade to a MODERATE resort since we were on the Disney Dining Plan. We stayed at the value POP CENTURY the year before & had some complaints about that particular resort. We decided to pay the extra $400 it would cost for us to upgrade to the Moderate. I read several travel books at the library & they all said that the Port Orleans Riverside was the most beautiful resort for the Moderates. I have to agree with this one. It was very nice! The resort is LARGE & SPRAWLING but I did my research online before we went & requested a certain building to be closer to the main bus depot & food court. My request was honored & were were also given a corner room which was nice since it has 2 windows. We knew we had to stay in the Alligator Bayou section since we had 5 people. It was me, my husband, Grandma & 2 kids, ages 4 & 5. Yes, it was a little cramped but....we barely spent ANY time in our room. The room was clean & the surroundings were beautiful!! Loved all the walkways & lush trees. I only have 2 complaints & they are rather small. The a/c unit would kick on many times during the night & wake us up. Loud unit. But I have run into this at other places as well. The other thing I wish is that they had an actual "line" at the bus-stops. POP had an actual line but it had NO SHADE. Port Orleans had SHADE but no line. WHen the bus pulled up, everyone would just charge to the door. SOme mornings were better that others but there is always that family or person who cuts in line & was not nice. Overall we enjoyed our stay VERY much & are returning this September again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: janika3375
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel for the Price.. My water view was of the pool which is great when you have a small child and you don't want to walk too far.. The room was great with the two sinks.. Yes they don't have towles at the smaller pool, but every time I called for more they were there in 20 mins to my room..I love the boat ride to down town Disney... The food prices were good in the dinning hall.. 4.99 for a kids meal.. That is cheaper then Mcdonalds..All and All a great hotel... I will be back next year!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun time”
Reviews.Author: GEM2011_11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took our 3 girls for their 1st ever trip to Disneyworld. We stayed 4 nights at Disney's Port Orleans-Riverside resort. Overall our family enjoyed the resort. We opted to upgrade from a standard room to a "preffered" which would guarantee us a room in the 4 building closest to the main building with restaurants, etc. Despite requesting building 14 we got building 15 which was indeed close to everything and the south depot bus station. I wasn't thrilled with our view of the parking lot and didn't bother to request a change. Our only real gripe with the resort was the room which we felt was just average and didn't feel that is was worthy of a "moderate Disney resort". Room was not that big and one of the beds was equipped with a slide our trundel bed but my wife took one look and said no way anyone is sleeping on that...as it looked pretty ratty. We ended up squeezing to kids in one double bed with my wife and I had the other with me in the other double bed. I understand that Riverside is going to be upgrading to all queen size beds pretty soon which will be a definite improvement. Despite the 5 pools at the resort, we only used the primary/largest pool on "Ole' Man Island" which my kids just loved! They especially had fun on the water slide and one day the staff ran a splash contest and gave out necklaces which was a nice touch. We didn't eat at Boatrights...the table service restaurant but used the quick service restaurant for a few meals and snacks which were adequate. This resort has 4 bus stops (North depot, East, South and West). I don't think we waited longer than 20 mins. for any bus (Disney's goal is for buses to run no more than 20 mins. to any of the parks). For the most part my family was able to get on the bus early enough to get seats but a few times we had to stand in a packed bus which was ok. The grounds of Port Orleans Riverside are beautiful and if our trip had not been so quick we would have opted to walk around a bit more and try the boat ride to Downtown Disney. Overall for value, location and kid-friendliness I'd recommend this resort as it is the most affordable in the "moderat" Disney resort level.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with family”
Reviews.Author: stephanier76
Reviews.Content: I was very worried after reading some past reviews about staying at Riverside. My family and I arrived in Orlando and my two daughters and myself utilized the Magical Express while my partner and son picked up the rental car. We arrived within 25 min to the lobby of Riverside and proceeded to the Online check in station. Where we were greeted by such a pleasant young man who quickly went over everyting in our package, directions to our "lodge" and the parking lot for us to utilize. He was very detailed and helpful with all my questions. Withing 15 minutes I was on my way. We arrived to our room to find it as described online on the WDW site. Nothing huge but spacious enough for the five of us. It was clean and didnt smell and we had our Mickey towel on the bed which delighted my little ones. The grounds of the hotel are just gorgeous. It seems to be very sprawling but honestly its a nice walk around. Just have to not get yourself back wards as the buildings do all look alike but they are all numbered. While here we uitlized the boat to DTD, we also ate dinner at Boatwrights and also in the cafeteria style dining hall. We were on the Dining plan which was not confusing for us at all. It actually was pretty simple and quite conveinent for my family. Food was plentiful for sure. We did a good amount of swimming at Ol"Man Island which my children loved. I happen to enjoy the water slide also. Its great to be a big kid. Yes the bedding is not "luxury" style but its right with the setting of the rooms. The trundel bed was bigger then I expected but my poor almost 6 ft 16yr old got stuck on it most nights as my little ones were to scared to sleep on the floor and that is where the bed stays , right on the floor. All in all I had a great stay here with my family and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: emjay2us
Reviews.Content: I had read some very disturbing reviews on this hotel. So that made me very apprehensive of what I would find during our stay. I was pleasantly surprised. This resort is very beautiful. The landscaping is wonderful. It creates a feeling of taking you to the bayou. For being such a large resort (and we were there during spring break), we really didn't see many people, until we went to the lodge to eat. Our room was small, but accommodated our family of five just fine. The beds were doubles, but each of us adults slept with one of the kids and the third slept on a trundle bed. We were so tired at the end of the night, those slight modifications did not bother us at all. The beds were comfortable. The pillows were a little small and to puffy, but that is personal preference, as my husband loved them. We did utilize our space wisely. We set up the ironing board in the bathroom under the closet rack and used that for additional storage. There is a clothes line in the shower to hang clothes on. The curtain that separates the bathroom area from the sleeping area, although it doesn't block sound, did block out light adequately. The paths throughout the resorts were a little confusing and both my husband and I got lost a few times. Our kids were better navigators than us. From previous reviews, I would of thought from our building you would had to have walked miles to the main eating area, but that is not the case. From any building, I think the walk wouldn't be more than 5-7 minutes. The landscaping and decor is so beautiful, it was pleasant walking every time (even in the pouring rain). The disney transportation was outstanding. We never had to wait more than 20 minutes for a bus and never had to wait for another bus to come, due to overcrowding. For people who have complained about transportation in the past, I'm not sure what they were talking about. For Spring Break week, there were only a few times we had to stand while riding...but the kids actually found it enjoyable. On the one occasion where my 12 year old daughter was carrying our sleeping 5 year old, people did offer a seat to her so she would not have to stand. My only disappointment was the quality of food in the disney kingdom. The only good food I had for the 8 days we were there was pizza and a hot dog (from casey's hotdog in Magic Kingdom). Food was either bland, cold, or mass produced. For the amount of money you pay, I would expect higher quality.

Reviews.Title: “From the Contemporary to Port Orleans "I had nothing to worry about"”
Reviews.Author: eghrain2
Reviews.Content: I have been to Walt Disney a number of times over the past few years, and have stayed at the Boardwalk Inn, The Pop Century, The contemporary and finally Port Orleans Riverside last October of 2010. After staying at the Boardwalk Inn, I was worried that I would not be happy at the pop, but it was great! So the following year we got a deal for the Contemporary and loved it. I should have learned that I would not be disappointed in any Disney property but once again when I booked a room at port orleans I was concerned and not very excited. Well let me tell you, it was very nice and when you first come through the doors of the entrance it is very elegant and they had hair braiding, portrait artist, boats on the river going to downtown disney, face painters, surrey bikes and winding paths leading to beautiful mansions with large fountains and courtyards . There was some confusion with our room, and we had 5 people and a baby so we needed one of their alligator b rooms with the trundle bed, but come to find they didn't have any. So they instead let us have a roll out bed and it worked out fine. The buses were ok, they were usually packed and if you didn't get on in front of the main building, you might find yourself standing while going to the parks because this is a large resort with 4 bus stops, so by the time the bus gets around to stop 3 or 4 it will fill up, and forget about getting a seat coming home at night! You will be standing. the counter service was good, and in the back they have a childs table and a tv playing childrens shows as well as a mailbox to put letters to mickey in. Really pretty graceful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: DonNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Port Orleans Resort and enjoyed it. The lobby is lovely and the grounds truly are beautiful and well maintained, you saw workers constantly working the grounds, they do a great job. Having said that, we had requested and were told we were going to have a 'river view' and did not once we checked in (it was a pool view, not the same thing). But more importantly, the room was nice. The maid put the Mickey Mouse towel on the bed, which was very cute. They fold them so cute! The bathroom was clean and the bed was good to sleep on, very comfy. Furniture not the latest, but I would not call it 'shabby.' I will say that the breakfast place (cafeteria style) is quite large and the menu is quite varied. Reasonable prices as well. I will say that the buses that come to pick you up can be an issue. They are not only very crowded and don't seem to run as frequently as they do at Kidani, I felt bad for parents who had kids and strollers. It was a tight fit, they should try to send more buses to get to the parks. As many people do, we stayed at the Magic Kingdom til after the Fireworks, so it was late and dark when we returned to Port Orleans. The bus stops do seem a bit confusing (they make several stops without much information). If you get off at the last stop, you'll be near the actual hotel (lobby area) so that can help with any confusion. A pleasant stay and we would return to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding place to stay and a terrific value!”
Reviews.Author: Yes2travelling
Reviews.Content: I was concerned after reading some of the reviews prior to our trip but found none of the things that people had wrote. Our room was clean, well lit, and had comfortable beds with amazing linen. The maid was terrific and although we had no small children, she provided us with a funny towel character everyday. Maybe some of those other travelers forgot to be nice to the maid and leave a little extra for them as well. The resort had a cafeteria type dining facility as well as a sit down restaurant. Food and service was great at each with lots of selection. Travel to the Disney Theme parks was great as you have four bus stops to choose from and we never had to wait very long. My tip - don't always use the main lobby (north stop) as it was the busiest. Find the one closest to your room. Pools were fantastic with quiet pools for those of us without kids. For a moderate priced resort you really got your money's worth and I would recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay very friendly!”
Reviews.Author: sandyOttawa
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay, very friendly and helpful staff! very clean, lots to do including a free boat shuttle to Downtown Disney swimming, bike rentals etc.

Reviews.Title: “Kids loved it”
Reviews.Author: sammd1983
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our three children (1-it was her birthday while we stayed at disney, 2 and 14) in sept 2010 and stayed at the port orleans riverside hotel. We requested a trundle bed, which we had no problem receiving. We put right on our reservation that it was my youngest daughters birthday and upon check in there was also a package for her in the room. With celebration buttons and special things for her. We were in a building that was a couple minute walk to the main building in alligator bayou. Would pay the extra to get the prefered room next time. Upon arrival there was a towel made mickey head on the bed (kids and I thought that was a wonderful touch). Pools were great, and we received free dining with our trip and the food was wonderful. We thought the room was clean and the housekeeping staff always had our room clean and ready to go when we got back. The ease of having the bus transportation to all the parks was a great feature. I would reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: strelkmd
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans has free transportation to all of the Disney Parks, Downtown Disney and the Boardwalk. The only thing I didn't like was the amount of time it took to go from one place to the other. We had to add an hour onto our trip just to go to and from the parks. Once we started using cabs it seemed much faster and worth the 8 dollars total for us to get to places within 10/15 min. The resort was very pretty and well maintained. We do not have kids so it was nice that the resort offered more than one pool. There was a louder and more fun pool that the kids hung out at and a much quieter pool with a lot of sun and a lot of shade right next to our room. The check-in took about an hour. If you are staying here do the online check in and your wait time will be cut in half.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need to be updated but the grounds and service was great”
Reviews.Author: anng43016
Reviews.Content: The hotel was accommodating to change my room from a water view to a preferred room. Not sure why anyone would want a water view when there are no balcony's. We stayed in Alligator Bayou, building 18. It was close to everything (pools, parking, restaurants, and the boat to Downtown Disney). The rooms are in need up a update. They have old air condition units under the windows, & full size beds with acrylic bedding and itchy pink blankets. The bathroom was okay, 2 pedestal sinks and a separate bathtub/toilet room. I hear their the sister property, French Quarter underwent renovation recently....maybe worth looking into.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!!! BED BUGS!!!”
Reviews.Author: nitnole711
Reviews.Content: We were sooo excited to take our 1st trip to DW and stay at a resort!! It was the 2nd night there, upon pulling the comforter back for my kids to goto bed, we noticed a small dried blood stain on the sheet. Gross, yes, but bed bugs didn't enter my mind. Called housekeeping and they delivered a clean sheet. Throughout the week I noticed maybe 3 bites in all on my legs. Again, didn't think of bed bugs...I'm prone to get bit/stung by insects and since we were outside sun up til past sun down, I just figured it was from a bug outside. 4th night there, pulled comforter back again to find another dried blood spot on the sheet, gross, called housekeeping, got a clean one. (I now know, since coming home and reseaching, that this is a sign of bedbugs, didn't know then)! Got home Saturday, one of my daughters and I both woke to our bodies covered in bed bug bites. She's 7 and has over 30 on her tiny body. I counted 96 a couple of days ago! Upon discovering this, I did a lot of research online about bedbugs. Seems you can get bit, and it won't show for up to 9 days sometimes. Also, not everyone will bet bit that are exposed to bed bugs. My husband and other daughter RARELY get bit by bugs, lucky them....so that explains why my husband only has 3, and my other daughter, 2 bites. I have contacted them and made a claim, I just want EVERYONE to be aware before staying at this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Breathtaking and Magical Stay at Port Orlean's Riverside Resort!”
Reviews.Author: travelchik01
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Port Orlean's Riverside Resort for the last week of Spring Break, 2011. We checked-in at 11:00am on the morning of Saturday March 19th, to find that our room was ready for us. While walking from the reception area, we couldn't help but "ooh-and-ahhh" all of the way to our room which was housed in Acadia House, one of the mansions of the Magnolia Bend. The resort is divided into 3-4 storey mansions along the riverside, and two storey buildings in the Alligator Bayou 'swamp' area. Whether your room is in Magnolia Bend or the Alligator Bayou, you are sure to be in a very beautiful setting. The rooms appeared to be recently renovated and were clean and very quiet. If you plan on taking the Disney Transportation to Disney World, there are four bus stops conveniently located in different areas of the resort. The Riverside Mill, located near the main reception, is a cafeteria style eating place with reasonably priced meals and snacks. It is opened from 6:00am to 11:00pm. Fulton's Gift Store is a handy place to purchase Disney souvenirs, stamps, magazines and refreshments, as well as other everyday items and toiletries. There is a swimming pool located near every building on the resort. And they all have their own features and character. The main pool provided the most shade with cozy little seating areas all around and provided pool towels, a water slide, kiddie pool, playground, hot tub and was located next to the Muddy Rivers pool bar. We couldn't get over how spotless and well-maintained the grounds were. Everything was so beautiful. If you plan on venturing to Downtown Disney, I highly recommend on taking the ferry boat. It is a beautiful and relaxing ride down the river, and you get a good view of the Treetop Villas of Saratoga Springs and Old Key West Resort. Disney World can be costly if you aren't on the Dining Plan and are feeding a family. We saved a lot of money (and likely ate more healthy) by purchasing a package of bagels and jar of peanut butter at Fulton's for breakfast. And while at Downtown Disney, we stocked up on fresh fruit cups ($1.99) from Earl of Sandwich. With freshly made and delicious sandwiches and salads for $5.99, you can't go wrong. This place is always busy! Bottled water is also costly to purchase, so we filled up our water bottles when empty. The water in the fountains at the Disney Parks is filtered and tastes great. The worst part of the vacation is having to come home. Disney is a hard place to leave, but we will be back again and will definitely stay at Port Orlean's Riverside.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: atcmom
Reviews.Content: We traveled twice in the past month to this hotel for two separate stays in order to use our 'Florida Play Four' passes. There were five of us, kids aged 5, 7, and 9. We got a room with a trundle bed for our son. He said it was pretty hard though. Pros: LOCATION! It was so much easier being on disney property and being able to use the bus system. The buses ran pretty regularly and stopped at four locations on the property so no matter where you were located you were a close walk. They also have boat transport to Downtown Disney which the kids love. You can do horse and carriage rides, boat rentals, bike rentals, surrey rentals, or fishing all for a fee. We didn't get a chance to do any b/c of being so busy with the parks, although we really wanted to do the horse ride. I would plan a day to hang out at the hotel next time. The grounds are beautiful and well maintained and the pools are perfect for the kids. They were heated, but still too cool for me! The hotel handles the crowd great and we never felt as if we were crowded even though they were booked up. There are two food choices, either the self serve or sit down service. We only did self serve. The food was really good and well priced. Kids meals were between 5 and 7 dollars and included two sides and a drink. They did have a coffee maker and fridge in the room so we also brought food and microwaved it in the restaurant. As far as the previous complaints about customer service we experienced the total opposite of that. We checked in online and therefore had no wait (there is an online window to check in it at the hotel) and the staff was awesome. We have stayed at the value resorts before and this is a far far step above! Also, my husband noticed some mold in the bathroom and complained to the manager, she immediately apologized, offered to move our room, and then offered a discount on our next stay (she took a total of 25% off our second stay of three nights, which was a HUGE savings!) We did not change rooms, but gladly took the discount! The rooms aren't huge, but you don't stay in them long so it's not an issue. They are more than comfortable for our family of five, I especially liked the double sinks! Cons: None really, other than the property is quite large and if you are in the back it's a hike to the restaurant. The bed could be more comfy and the blankets do need updating to something cozier. Although I was so tired after the parks I slept solid.

Reviews.Title: “Keep your expectations in check”
Reviews.Author: carrieflorida
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many Disney properties in the past which quite honestly were just fine, not great. We prefer the Loews hotels at Universal which are far nicer both in quality and service. We have noticed that over the years both have been lacking at Disney. As they build more they repair and maintain less. This was obvious at this hotel. The outside of the property was fine, but the room was old and worn. We wisely brought flat sheets and pillow cases. We asked in advance for a room near the front of the property but instead were placed at the back of the property most likely because we were paying a florida resident rate. We did not go back to the lobby because it was late and we were tired Quite honestly a room like that would be a $50 hotel by the side of the road anywhere else. Complaining to Disney is of no use we have tried in the past and they do not care. As for the buses yes they were often overcrowded, far to get to and because of our location the very last stop. We will not stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “My go-to Disney hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust1982
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at Port Orleans way back when it was called Dixie's Landing. Since discovering this property I've stayed there three times with family, friends and a significant other and have always been happy with the facilities and service. The rooms are basic - two beds, twin sinks and a separate toilet and shower area, which makes it convenient for families who have to get ready together. The rooms have fridges but no microwaves. It's certainly not luxurious but you don't go to Disney World to sit around your hotel, so the room was more than adequate. The thick landscaping and relatively small buildings ensure a quite stay. One of the best features of Port Orleans is the numerous pools. The main pool with its slide and waterfall is great for kids, while the smaller satellite pools offer quiet spots for adults. I do wish the pools had been colder - after baking all day at the parks it's a bit of a let-down to hop into a pool that's the temperature of bath water. On the plus side, there are laundromats next to every pool which gives you something to do while you wait for your clothes. Bring your own laundry detergent to save some money. A note about transportation: I would definitely recommend skipping the bus system, especially if you're staying at Port Orleans Riverside. Relying on the buses is rookie mistake. The time saved waiting in the hot sun for those buses more than makes up for the $200 you spend on week's rental, particularly if you have young children. Park and hotel parking is is free and, if you book through AAA, you get access to a reserved lot near the entrance. Port Orleans Riverside is a great place if you want an upgrade from the economy resorts and not blow your budget on luxury digs. With a rented car you can get from your doorstep to the front gates of any park within 15 minutes, and it's a great place to unwind after a busy day of touring.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort at Disney”
Reviews.Author: sragaines
Reviews.Content: We found Port Orleans to be a pleasure to stay at. The rooms were pretty good and the buses usually ran pretty frequently from the stop to the parks. We only had problems the day we visited the Magic Kingdom. The day we left, the kids went on a pirate cruise that costs about $30/child ages 4 to 12 I think. It was worth the money for the kids to be gone two hours. We packed the car and were ready to go and the kids had a blast. We did not get to experience the pools very much, but had one right outside our room and there is a bigger one at the front that most enjoy. If I could have done one thing, it would have been to plan a rest day just at the resort to enjoy all the amenities. We did have problems with internet service while staying at the hotel. My husband was quite disappointed that he did not get to put his picks in for the March Madness.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Horrible - Ruined Disney Vacation”
Reviews.Author: TacomaVet
Reviews.Content: This hotel's motto should have been "Request are not guaranteed" because that is what we heard the whole time we stayed there. Upon our check-in we were surprised to have gotten a standard room with two full/twin beds when we specifically reserved one with a king-size bed. So re-visiting the front desk, we were told "requests are not guaranteed" and to upgrade would be an additional $25. I refused to pay the upgrade when we had specifically reserved a king size bed. After heading back to the room I called the service desk and requested to speak to the manager. I got the PO Riverside bicycle and was forwarded to the operations center whom was unable to do anything and was once again told that "requests are not guaranateed". I had trouble believing our reservation could be switched by the hotel as they please. Aside from that, we we're told we could buy Disney residence 1-day passes at the hotel. When we visited the lodge (yet again) were lied too. The not so friendly customer service adviced us that the 1-day Florida residence deals had stopped "like a year and half ago!" funny...Cause I've been here several times since then and always get the pass. Luckily I called Polynesian Resort and Shades of Green to verify but somehow, they both still sold the 1-day passes (how strange). When I returned back to our non-so-wonderful hotel and called again about the passes the story had changed. Now I could get them but the request had to be made 24 hours in advance. Aside from this and the horrible "park" food they sell, hard beds, the pillows which are roll up and stiched into small pillows cases to make them look more "fluffy", outdated and nasty bathrooms, rude customer service, and the new motto "requests are not guaranteed", we tried to have a pleasent stay. Not to mention the fact the family members we were visiting were clear across the hotel grounds when we "requested" that our rooms be near each other when making the reservations. They also requested a roll out bed or slide out cot and never got that either. This place should fire everyone, shut down, be destroyed and re-build something else. I requested numerous times to speak with a manager and never saw one. The hotel customer service refused to connect me beyond the "operations center". I'd give this place a big fat ZERO star rating if I could.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Disney”
Reviews.Author: kaleartist
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review in the hope that MAYBE the Disney Corp may realize that they are a brand that people expect a cetain level of customer service & quality. We were a family of 8 adults with 4 rooms. We came in 2 different cars at 2 different times. I arrived first in a group of 4 and we checked in early prior to hitting the parks hoping to avoid the later rush when the rooms would actually be ready. We were asked for a contact number so when our rooms WERE ready they would call us. We gave 2 different cell numbers neither one of us were contacted. We were told later by staff they never really call any way. It didn't matter TO US because we were at a park and we didn't get back to the property until around 6 so we knew our rooms definetly would be ready by then we could just go to our room at that point. That unfortunetly wasn't the case, not only didn't they assign us a room a gave us worthless plastic cards we had to wait in line all over AGAIN ! So after already standing in line in the morning we once again had to stand in line to get assigned rooms. From the minute I open the door to room 8525 it smelled musty & moldy but after being on the go all day we were exhausted and just wanted to find a place to eat and get some rest. I didn't feel like being put on hold to complain or have to be moved after 8 or 9 pm so I only mentioned it to the other people in our party. We ate dinner and simply went to bed. Hard sub standard sized pillows, stiff bedding, the bath towels were what most people would use as rags. They were old and worn, Sorry I was expecting a little fluff from Disney. The next afternoon when I was in the bathroom ( the lighting was so poor) I was looking at the wall next to the tub and I saw what I thought was blood all over it. I thought NO that couldn't be we're at DISNEY. Well It was. It was splattered all over approximetly a 21/2 foot wide ( tub to wall) to foot high , there were small spots of blood on the shower curtain, the tub and even under the toilet paper roll. It looked like some one had cracked thier head open because it was small dots of blood but there was just so much of it everywhere in such a small area. When I showed it to my husband it wasn't until then that i thought to tell him, when I took a shower that morning there was a left over bar of soap in the shower as well and I couldn't believe the room attendant hadn't throw away the wrappers from the soap I HAD OPENED. He said 'WHAT'????? He used the USED soap not knowing and we were in such a rush that morning hours prior to seeing the blood on the walls that I didn't even mention the left over soap. It was then we looked for our room attendant and asked her to come back and clean the blood off the walls,take the other guests soap from our shower. My husand was so sick about having used SOME ONE ELSE SOAP IN A BLOODY BATHROOM he called the front desk and asked to speak with a manager that's when the house keeping mgr came down to look at what we were talking about but unfortunely after 80 % of the blood had been removed by my request . The houekeeping mgr keep on insisting it wasn't blood. So I asked her what else is a brownish red and is splattered over the entire bathroom. I understand her wanting to deny the fact it's blood,but I know what I saw and I showed others in our party of 8. IT WAS BLOOD, not only that but some one else in our party pointed out that my room didn't even look like it had been vacuumed and she was right, there were plastic tags from other people's clothing,lint,stains, etc.....on our rug which I hadn't even noticed becuase I was still so grossed out over the blood on the walls that afternoon. To Disney's credit they promptly sent more cleaning staff down. We of course were gone for the entire day and when we got back the room was clean, no longer smelt like mold or mildew but it was like to little too late. When we went to check out this morning my husband was going to get ice for our small cooler and that's when he noticed we never had an ice bucket. So I called the front desk just to let them know we were checking out and let them know about the ice bucket and of course she apologized. So I had proceeded to tell her about what had transpired the day before and that this room should have NEVER been rented out in the condition it was in. We have stayed at Disney before and haven't had any problems and our rooms were fabulous but this was not to what I think anyone visting Disney would expect to be acceptable standards and was very disapointed. Having said all that. I didn't ask nor was I looking for any comps for what was a time consuming waste of time I wanted to be spending enjoying myself with family but at no point did they offer, a free ANYTHING !!!!! All I got was denial and I'm sorry. Well at those prices I expected a bit more it's called customer service and it goes along way. I would have been NICE If they had said "you know what because of the condition of your room dinner's on us" or even a small card with a mint on the pillow for acknowledging the filth and inconivience. It not only caused us but my entire group that had to wait on us because we had to wait for staff to get to our room or call us back. What"s happened to customer satisfaction and service ? I guess it doesn't matter or exist anymore.......Very sad. WALT DISNEY himself would probably have been disappointed. If it wasn't for the trip advisor board other's may also have the same misfortune. I live here in Fl so I can visit Disney or any other park at my leisure but others that travel far and wide to visit the 'HAPPIEST PLACE ON EARTH" After saving and waiting forever to experience Disney, Which truly is Beautiful and magical shouldn't have to waste there time or money sitting and waiting to have a room clean or cleaned the way it should have been at check in. Port Orleans Riverside is considered by Disney standards the moderately priced accomadation not the Deluxe accomadations but having a clean room should be standard accomadations not only for every hotel but especially for those we hold with such high regard. Hard working Families DESERVE THAT MUCH !

Reviews.Title: “Staying on property is the best thing we've ever done!”
Reviews.Author: MKCB
Reviews.Content: This was our 6th trip to Disney World, no kids this time, just my mom and I. We decided to stay at Port Orleans-Riverside to take advantage of their transportation system and close proximity to everything! LOVED IT! I don't think I'll ever go without staying on property, so many advantages. Our room was basic, no frills but clean and well appointed. You're not there to hang out in your room anyways. We enjoyed the pool, only had time to visit the Riverside pool; it was clean, kids kept to themselves. The food on the resort was cafeteria style (blech) and we mainly had breakfast there most mornings. I wouldn't rely on it for lunches or dinners because the food is so much better at the parks, especially Epcot! We were there for the Food & Wine festival and cannot wait to go back; that time of year was great because there were almost no line ups, but would really recommend booking restaurants in advance! We wouldn't have had the same experience without doing that! Staff at the front desk were very professional and we had no problems. Plan to do Animal Kingdom next time! p.s. Buy the Disney cups for $13; free coffee in the morning was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: Lavabingo
Reviews.Content: PO Riverside is an award winning, beautifully landscaped resort full of mature magnolia trees, a winding peaceful river, and wonderfully treed nature trails. One side of the river has 3-story old style pillared mansons surrounded by formal gardens and the other side has 2- story veranda cottage styled units surrounded by lush vegetation. The resort has a total of 5 pools, the most at any Disney resort, including a central main themed "Ol' Man Island" complex with a very large pool, a hot tub, kiddy pool, water slide, bar/lounge and a large play ground with climbing/slide equipment. Recreation includes rental bikes, various rental boats, and rental horse carriage rides plus an arcade. There is even rental fishing poles and Disney stocks the river with fish. Most enjoyable is the PO Riverside Boats (50 seat capacity) with 2 way transportation that takes you on a relaxing 20 minute cruise down the river to Downtown Disney. The boat runs late in the evening and the captains give a great story filled ride. Arriving- Disney picked us up at the airport-have your bar-code booklet readily available & don't worry about the luggage-Disney delivers it to the resort. I would advise you do the early on-line check-in to save time although we had no problems and received curtious & effecient check-in service. Luggage will be delivered to you with just a phone call from your room. Groceries & a baby stroller that we had ordered were ready and waiting for us at the luggage pick-up when we arrived.The room has a bar fridge for convenience of groceries etc . Our room was in Parterre Place, with 2 very comfortabe double beds, well appointed (if not a little worn) & clean; with a tub/shower/toilet & 2 sinks in a curtained off area outside the bathroom. The sink set up worked very well as one can take a shower & have privacy & the other person still has access to the sink - so it was a great time saver. If needed the drape can be pulled for privacy to separate the sinks from the bedroom area. Also the room has Internet hook-up available at an additional charge. Our group had one computer & we used it to look at the Disney Photopass pictures (another great thing -just get a card from the Park photographer & use the card to have your picture taken and then check on-line to order) and we used it to check news weather etc.The room was well maintained for the 10 days of our visit. We also enjoyed the pool at nearby Oak Manor as it was closer, warmer and quite. Meals were at the main Riverside Mill cafeteria complex. Excellent offeringings and quick; even when very busy. First, buy the refillable hot/cold mug $12. It is refillable at any resort ( not at the Parks) and is well worth the money. I suggest getting a table first before you pick up your food. We had the Disney Dining Plan-1 quick, 1 snack, 1 table service plan-we made reservations 6 months ahead for the dining supper shows etc.; character dining is 1quick or 2 dining credits which is the best way to have all the Disney Characters come to your table. We really enjoyed it all. Usually we ate a big breakfast-1 quick, and had an ice cream or drink- 1 snack, at the Park and then a big dinner-2 dining credits. We had a number of snacks left over but felt the dining plan was well worth it. Disney gives you a computer print out at the end of your visit & you can amend/adjust any discrepanies-very easy to deal with customer service as we had one small dinner mix up with our credits. The resort had a very nice gift shop and can receive packages from the Parks but expect 1/2 day wait for delivery. The Disney Card you are given at check-in has all your info, tickets, hotel key and $1000 pre-approved credit card limit that is accepted anywhere at Disney. Now for the downside- this is a 2200 room complex so lots of walking-seating space on the bus is limited and always crowded. Getting to the Parks from PO Riverside wasn't too bad but the pick up area at every Park for PO-Riverside is always the last & farthest away bus station. There would be long waits and hudge crowds for our resort when other buses came & went for every other resort. Disney needs to monitor this more closely as I have seen the same review complaint over and over about PO Riverside transportation. Disney says expect to walk approximately 7 miles per day on a visit to a Park. I would add another 3 miles for the resort and back and forths to the room, breakfast, pool, buses etc. Expect 80-100 miles of walking for a 10 day trip and many hours of standing in line. You need at least 3 pairs of walking shoes, to change them up & a med-kit for blisters etc. We had all that and my feet hurt for 4 days after I got home. Disabled people had rental scooters ($50/day) and they were marvelous for anyone with walking problems. So I would highly recommend Port Orleans Riverside but avoid the bus and rent a car-parking is free for Disney guests. A car means you can go to outlet shopping or to Universal ($40 taxie one-way). Also Disney books return airport transportation approximately 4 hours ahead for internatinal flights-sounds like a lot but the bus stops at several resorts to pick up other quests & the check-in at the airport has long slow lines. Oh yes avoid major holidays. We were there over Presidents weekend and it was crazy busy with 2 hour waits for any ride even the Jungle Cruise. Cheers and enjoy your Disney holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Buses - Take note if you have kids under 2!”
Reviews.Author: r19sky
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our stay at disney port orleans riverside. The hotel is absolutely fine nothing bad but nothing great. The surroundings are lovely but large. The rooms are basic - you get the minimum - clean enough. The dining area for quick service meals can only be described as a feeding pit - chaos, stressful and indigestion central! The bar - although they have one is the only bonus - the service is absolutely awful. Staff rude and ignorant and be prepared to wait. Its absolutely fine for what its purpose is and yes you are hardly there but don't expect to be impressed. My main point for the review is actually regarding the buses to the parks - yes this is a good frequent service but I wasn't prepared for the horrendous stress getting on the extremely conjested buses with a baby and a stroller. We were a party of 4 adults and one 8 month old baby. I do not know what we would have done without the 2 extra pairs of hands - nevermind if had another young child. You have to collapse the stroller and therefore take a sleeping baby out of the stroller and carry onto a heaving bus - someone has to carry the baby (standing) someone hold the stroller and if you have a backpack then this too. It was awful - i saw men holding babies and double strollers on the way home whilst standing! I would rather have waited for another bus and have the stroller on a section at back than this - it was very hard work and you dreaded the journey each day. So be warned and prepared - take extra hands if possible! I will not return to disney till my child or future children are out of strollers!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Melodiejayne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our Honeymoon, although we have visited Disney and the area before we had never stayed in a Disney property before so we were hopeful we had made the right choice. On arrival the reception area is bright, exciting and you already feel caught up in the magic. The staff....every single member of staff were outstanding!! On check in we went to our room which unfortunately was beside a car park and next to a loud generator. We called reception straight away (we may have settled for this normally , but as it was our honeymoon we decided not too). They moved us to another room immediately. The first room was within the mansion houses and the new room was in the Alligator Bayou. The rooms, although they look different from the ouside are very similar inside, with 2 double beds, 2 sinks. I would say basic but cute. The Aligatir Bayou had a theme a bit like a wooden cabin - with a log bed which we really liked. The rooms are mainly by the lake and within a lovely stroll along the lake to the reception, food hall and restaurant. We loved the hotel. There is a main pool which was great for kids, always at least 2 life guards on duty and plenty to keep kids entertained. We chose to relax by the quieter pools dotted inbetween the blocks of rooms, often in the afternoons we were the only ones around them which was blissful, another bonus is that the pools were open till midnight! The only thing i would have liked was if there was a possible room upgrade, maybe a few suites. The foodhall here is great and the restaurant is AMAZING. Try the soup and the steak. We visited the neighbouring French Quarter and were very happy with our choice of Riverside. Riverside had a lovely relaxed feel to it, it was quiet and felt a million miles away from the bustle of the parks even though it was on their doorstep. The transport to the parks was fabulous we never waited at the bus stop for more than 5 minutes. The transportation system is great and wonderful for no one to have to stress about driving and directions, you really can just kick back and enjoy the atmosphere. We visited most of the Disney hotels, either for spa treatments, dinner, breakfast or just to have a look and we felt for value for money and atmosphere we couldnt have chosen better that Port Orleans riverside. HAVE the Disney dining plan its wonderful. It means you can try all the restaurants that you may normally not eat at, without worrying about daily budgeting as you have already paid for your food when you booked your holiday. We did the deluxe and it was wonderful. We reccommend dining at the Contemparary hotel in the evening, you can then watch the magic kingdom fireworks from their viewing deck - they even pipe in the music - this is a special evening :) All in all this was amazing - staff were amazing, food was amazing, atmosphere amazing - book it!!

Reviews.Title: “nice property but poor transpertation”
Reviews.Author: nickjim1
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week at Port Orleans Riverside , weather was good , grounds where nice , room was ok , but the transportation was a nightmare . the bus was always crowded , we where the last stop coming back to the resort , the bus makes four stops at the resort . We normally stay at a deluxe resorts but couldn't do it this time . We found that they go out their way to make your trip great at the better resorts . The day we where leaving we where waiting for the Magical Express bus , when a different bus pulled up , we didn't think it was ours , my wife said I should check to make sure , there was nobody around to ask ,so i walked over and asked the driver , and it was our bus . If not for my wife thinking we should check , we would have missed our bus . If possible if you can stay at the better resorts your trip will be much better , and less stessfull.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: saritvlc
Reviews.Content: I was concerned about staying at this resort due to the fact I had heard so many mixed reviews. Upon check in we originally were placed in a room far away from the main hub I asked the front desk person to search if there was anything closer.
