We ended up in Bldg 90 room 9296, Great location, the room was totally fine, it was clean, didn't smell, there was a small pool right in the courtyard. The only drawback was that we had 2 strollers with us and our room was on the second floor and the elevators were completely out of the way but we managed. The buses were timely but PACKED every night. This resort is HUGE, you cannot even imagine how big it is. I was glad I asked for a better located room. We would defiantly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay somewhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: midwest4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first trip to DisneyWorld. While it was our first trip I am a huge planner and had been researching Disney for 2 years so we managed to do everything I had planned during our trip and did not feel we missed a thing when we left. I want to say that we have 2 boys age 8 and 10 and most of our time was spent at the parks so we were gone all day. The grounds of this resort are actually very beautiful so if you were coming to Disney but, spending less time at the parks and more time at the resort, this may be the resort for you. The check-in was extremely crowded. A nice man named David helped me check-in and was very helpful. I really found that throughout our stay the staff was hit or miss. You either got great people like David or people who were not so helpful so there was no consistency. Food wise we did not eat at the sit-down place but, did eat at the cafeteria area. We found the food to be just fine and comparible to similar eateries throughout the parks. Entering the room, I did not find it dated. I found it rather quaint. It was clean and we did get mouse ear towels on our first and last day. THE WALLS ARE VERY THIN!!! We heard the toddler next door every morning very early and sometimes very late. They checked out very early too so there was not much sleep for us at this resort. That being said, I assume we would encounter this issue at any resort we stayed. Our last evening some jerk was bouncing a basketball above us. I thought the family next door was annoying but, this was much worse. What was most troublesome for me since we were spending all day at the parks was the bus system. Port Orleans Riverside was consistently the longest line compared to all other resorts. Also, we had requested alligator bayou building 14 as it had been recommended highly but, unfortunately when you are coming back from magic kingdom late at night and exhausted this is the last stop (about 4-6 stops at this resort) so 99% of the time we were standing and unable to sit and so wished we had at least stayed by the first stop. It would have made things much easier for us. Since we spend all our time at the parks next time we would choose a resort closer to the parks (not for aesthetics) but, with a shorter busride and shorter busline.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Disney experience. Beautiful, restful surroundings.”
Reviews.Author: travelinda20
Reviews.Content: I know the resort is scheduled for renovation, and I had read some not so great reviews, but our experience was great! We were in the Magnolia Terrace, which was quite nice. Our room was scuffed up just a bit in places, but exceptionally clean. Bed was comfortable (except for rock hard pillows). Not a lot of room, but it IS a moderately priced resort. The grounds were amazing! So beautifully maintained, and the main pool had lots of shade trees...loved it! Every staff member we met was nice, very efficient. Airport transfers were a dream, they even printed our boarding pass for the airline and hung it on our doorknob. Never had that happen before at any hotel we stayed at! The location is not the best, you have to bus to everything, but on the other hand, it is nice to get away from the parks to some peace and quiet! Kudos, Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: LAJAMoo
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans Riverside was absolutely not what I was expecting from a Disney resort. It is so quiet, peaceful, romantic and classy. Not at all brash or 'in your face'. The resort is spread out but I enjoyed the walk. Seeing the wildlife was wonderful. The room was nice. Nothing special but it is a moderate resort and most of the time we were in the parks anyway. We loved the quiet pool near our building in the Magnolia Bend area. The food court was busy but I loved the choice and the theming is great. I wish we'd had more time to enjoy the resort. The boat trip to Downtown Disney was lovely. Very relaxing and romantic. The buses to the parks were frequent, but often busy. Checking in took a long time, especially tiring after our flight. All in all, this was a wonderful resort. A perfect antidote to the busy parks.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay”
Reviews.Author: thestaleys
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived at "the most magical place on Earth" everyone was so excited. That was until we entered our room. The short walk to the room was beautiful and well maintained. Once we entered the room, we immediately noticed that this place was not so magical. The rooms were very dated, and not clean. We had to stay at this resort because we were a family of 5. The "extra bed" was a small trundle under the bed that my 7 year old slept on. The beds were hard and squeaked every time someone moved and the pillows. . . you are better off finding a rock to sleep on. We also purchased the meal plan which gave you one quick service meal, one snack and one table service meal. Sounds good on paper but to find a full service restaurant without a reservation is impossible. I would not recommend the meal plan unless you know the park, know the time it takes to get from one place to another and do lots of planning. The service at the hotel and the parks was also not what we expected. What happened to the "customer is always right" philosophy? At one of the parks, when I ordered a meal and paid, the cast member just handed me my change and told me to "move forward". I didn't get a thank you or a "have a magical day". What has happened to Disney??? My last gripe is that we all know how Disney can nickel and dime you, well they have stepped it up a notch to $5 and $10. You have to pay for internet, McDonalds even gives that away. We did have a great family vacation, I would just probably stay outside the park in a more updated and probably less expensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great stay. only one drawback”
Reviews.Author: TravelMama3DE
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel - beautiful grounds, quiet, peaceful, great activities, inlucluding bike rentals, horse-drawn carriage, boat rides, etc. Rooms were pretty generic - nothing special, but comfortable and clean - perfectly fine. We would definitely stay here again! My only complaint was the evening bus transportation back from the parks. Every single night, our bus line was terribly long - one evening we waited an hour and 10 minutes at the bus terminal waiting for transportation, while other hotel's bus lines were very short and their buses came more frequently. It is frustrating to stand in line with three tired, young children, watching bus after bus to go virtually empty bus stops, while the P.O. line was stretching all the way down the bus teminal. Seems like the transportation folks could do a better job of providing more buses for P.O. at this time of day. Other than that we were very very pleased with Port Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Alligator Bayou - Really Nice!”
Reviews.Author: paradiseinNH
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th trip to Disney World since 2008. We stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside the last visit in February 2010. The first time we stayed at POR we stayed in the Magnolia Bend section and did not enjoy that stay so much. This time we stayed at the Alligator Bayou section and we loved it! It was alot quieter than our visit to the POR was the last time. The building was still quite a bit away from the main lobby and food court, but it was really quiet and pretty. The grounds at Alligator Bayou were quite beautiful - lots of bald cypress trees and lovely Spanish moss hanging from trees. I've been to the South and this looks very much like it. We had a nice room and the quiet pool was located right outside our door. The only downside to POR is that it takes forever to get around. The buses take forever to get there and then you have to walk quite a ways to get to your room. It is cheaper to stay at POR since it is moderate. However, we decided that we are going back to the deluxe resorts next trip which is planned for the end of this year. We've stayed at AKL, POR Magnolia and Alligator, as well as the Grand Floridian. All in all, the time that we spent waiting for buses, walking to get to our rooms, traveling on buses to get around the WDW compound, walking to the lobby/food - we've decided the extra bit of money you pay for the deluxe resorts is way worth it when you consider these factors. When we stayed deluxe, the travel time on buses and waiting were very very minimal when compared with staying at the POR. So for this reason, I would say stay here if you must because it really was a lovely resort, but splurge with the deluxe if you can. It will give you way more time swimming, park hopping, and having fun instead of spending 1/3 of your vacation waiting.,,

Reviews.Title: “Great staff but the room was awful!”
Reviews.Author: Disney23
Reviews.Content: From the outside this hotel is great, the design is really lovely and our room was in the Oak Manor building which looked really impressive HOWEVER the room left a lot to be desired! The room was really dark and depressing, it just seemed tired and in desperate need of renovation. Plus the room actually smelt damp and musky, not very pleasant at all. One of our biggest concerns regarding the room was the huge ancient looking air con unit on the floor â€“ a magnet for our daughter (13 months at the time) who kept sticking her fingers in it and turning the dials from freezing to boiling in the blink of an eye. We certainly didnâ€™t want to spend the whole time moving her away from this huge contraption plus the dangerous aspect of her poking her fingers in it was a big worry. We were so disappointed as the resort itself looked lovely and Disney can never normally do any wrong in our eyes but this room was just plain awful. Within a couple of hours of checking in we decided that we really couldnâ€™t put up with the room any longer and had to speak to one of the staff on reception. I have to say that the staff were brilliant and didnâ€™t make us feel like we were being a nuisance, they couldnâ€™t have been more helpful to be honest and called round the various other same value resorts, firstly to check for availability and secondly to see which ones had a small air con unit on the wall. We were moved to the Coronado Springs with no problems at all and thankfully we absolutely loved it there. I wouldnâ€™t stay at the Port Orleans Riverside again but still love Disney and cannot thank the staff at the hotel enough for looking after us so well.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable and peacful”
Reviews.Author: Rona31
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this resort and loved every second of it. Our room was always cleaned and the staff was plesant and helpful. Thanks for a terrific stay! Highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay hotel, nice grounds”
Reviews.Author: MommyRoc
Reviews.Content: The setting was very pretty. It's on the river with a quaint feeling. Transportation to Downtown Disney by ferry was very pretty and fast, The ferry, bridges, and style of the buildings were all very true to the theme. The hotel room was small and a bit outdated. The check-in time was time consuming, with slow staff. Dining was good but peak times were crowded. Staff could have been more helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “The exterior of the lodges were well kept but the inside was a different story.”
Reviews.Author: LoneStarAsh
Reviews.Content: The rooms we had at Port Orleans - Riverside were not well lit (strike one), nor were they as clean as one should expect. If we didn't want to choke on dirt/dust our only option was to clean the a/c filter and fan blades ourselves (strike two). There was a small fridge that was so in need of defrosting that the door would barely shut.(Strike three) I expected better but on the plus side, there was no noise disturbance (don't know if we just didn't have "neighbors" or if the sound insulation was good). Overall, the rooms were very threadbare and no one would pay as much as we were charged for these rooms outside the park. The grounds were well kept and pretty and the outside of the lodges were kept up quite well.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for Disney”
Reviews.Author: Kikijolly
Reviews.Content: We stayed a full week early in February (2011) and was very disappointed. We selected the Riverside after our great stay in January 2010. Boy have things changed. First, I do not like food courts, so we selected the Riverside because of the restaurant. Well, they no longer are full service for all meals. That was certainly not made clear on their web site! Second, I wanted to use the internet only one day--and we planned our activities around that. Unfortunately the internet did not work in the room. I spent over an hour with the tech service and was told it would be fixed tomorrow. So we needed to take a late night trip off property to get my work completed. Unsatisfactory. Check these things frequently, please. Third. We had a king room with queen sheets. Not one night did the sheets remain tucked in. How fun it is to sleep on sheets bunched under you. When I spoke with housekeeping, they promised they would come right over to fix it (about the 4th night). After two calls and no show, we went to bed anyway. If they say they will fix something and come right over, then do it! Fourth. Several days they didn't restock the coffee and cups. Some days didn't get clean glasses. Grounds are beautiful, location is great. But there are many Disney resorts to choose from. Last time Riverside is my choice!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting and Filthy”
Reviews.Author: ShelleyCanada_68
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to stay at the moderate resort. Not worth the money. Rotten food form previous guests in the fridge, food all over the carpet, leaky tub , worn and old.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Spidertravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a week and cannot complain about the room or the service we received - everything was as expected. The hotel provides everything you need - restaurant, shop and a nice pool (there are also more pools on the grounds where there are usually fewer people). The staff at the front desk was always friendly and helpful. Access to the parks were easy and we only once had to wait a while for a bus during our stay and that was on a day that we left the hotel later in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful first time Disney trip”
Reviews.Author: collins606
Reviews.Content: Last year in March was our first time going to Disney World. We decided to stay in this resort because it was reasonably priced and the closest moderate resort to Magic Kingdom. Although the rooms are far apart from each other and far from the main front desk. The rooms were very nice, clean, and spacious. We had no problems checking in, it was a fast process. However checking out took nearly forever. They texted us when our room was ready, which I thought was a very convenient idea. This year we are planning to stay in the Contemporary Resort because it is a more convenient location to the parks. I hope this year our stay is just as good as the stay at Port Orleans Riverside.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again !!!!”
Reviews.Author: FAMILYTEMPLEMAN
Reviews.Content: For my 40th birthday I planned what I thought would be the trip of a lifetime. My family which consists of Mom, Dad and three children aged 18, 15 and 6, went on the Disney Dream Cruise for 4 days (which was fabulous) and then were booked into Port Orleans Riverside for 3 nights following the cruise. This hotel was suggested to us when booking on the Disney Site on-line by an on-line Disney representative. They assured us that for 5 people to share 1 room this was the best hotel by far out of all Disney resorts. When we arrived we were disgusted. The room was old fashioned and dingy. There were only 2 Double Beds. When I phoned the front desk to complain that the room was not made for 5 people they told me to pull a cot out from under the bed by the door. When we did this we found that there was a small cot (made for a five / six year old) that you could pull out to accomodate the fifth family member. I went directly to the Front Desk to complain, There was no way that my 18 year old daughter was staying with my 15 year old son in the same bed. The manager was very unaccomodating and proceeded to tell me that he didnt see the big deal since they would be supervised ???? What he meant by that I can only begin to imagine. In the end the best they could do for us was wheel in a normal size cot, so we basically had no room to walk around our room and had to suffer with it for 4 days. Even though we had a preferrred room, it was a long walk from the Parking Lot with all our luggage, and to the main building for the Food Court. The night before our cruise we had stayed at a Radisson in Orlando that slept six for 1/5 the price of this Disney resort. Needless to say we were very disappointed and will not be visiting a Disney resort again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: michndiaz16
Reviews.Content: From the moment I entered the property, I probably should have known. I took full advantage of the on-line check in, which claims to be the "fast" and "convenient" way to check on. What it really meant was that while other hotel guest had 4 attendants to assist them, our line had 2. I realized very quickly as the line for regular check in moved right along that maybe I had made a bad choice. Making matters worse, was the fact that out of the 2 attendants available, 1 was tied up with a really really upset guest. However, being an avid WDW proponent I simply thought that there were going to be some delays due to the long weekend and crowds. I made the best and finally checked in 35 minutes later. I was given very little direction on how to get to my room ( the resort is absolutely huge). When we finally arrived at what seemed to be our "depot" our building was not even in comfortable walking distance from the parking lot. We asked various employees if maybe we had parked in the wrong parking lot - but no body knew. Our room was located on the second floor of a two story building that did not have an elevator. I am not sure what the point of letting Disney know you are traveling with infants is - if they are going to put you on a second floor without an elevator. Unpacking was a nightmare and it just set the tone for the worst vacation we have ever had. It was nothing short of watching our money being flushed down the toilet. Don't expect the service to be any better. With the exception of a young man by the name of Alex at the Riverboat Service area, no one is helpful, no one knows anything or is willing to help. Our final straw was a Captain at the boat ferry. My mother joikingly said to him, thanks for waiting for us and he said, I wasn't I would have left had you not been at this rope when I walked up to it. Then, after having taken the ferry various times with our open stroller, he commanded me (asking is associated with politely asking and he was not) to wake my sleeping child up to close our stroller. When I complained, his answer was simply, each Captain has their own rules. I told him I would wait for another Captain. He followed that up by telling the young little boy behind me whose father was simply tantalizing his imagination by recounting pirate tales that " THE PIRATES AREN'T REAL." The father was shocked. My husband then turned to him and said and you sir are not a real Captain just an old man in a costume that should not be working. I am not proud - but I must say he had it coming. He then left an older couple at the marina, because he only goes to escort "once" a trip and does not go back if you are not there. Our boat had 15 people - plenty of room for the couple.

Reviews.Title: “VERY DISAPPOINTED ...”
Reviews.Author: 301Canadians
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside for two nights in January. We'd been at another Disney Hotel for seven nights and thought we'd try Riverside for a change the last two nights. We had stayed here for a couple of nights years ago when it was the Dixie Landings. I had reserved the room in November and we paid extra for the "water view". The lady at the front desk for check-in was excellent. After I had booked our room, I had read in some information that some rooms have a king bed, so I asked her about that and she said yes. She went to check with the supervisor and came back and said "for sure, she said there are lots of king rooms available" and changed us to a king bed room. If there were "lots of rooms available" I have no idea why they had to put us in a handicap room. which only have a shower and no bathtub, right beside the elevators (which make a noise everytime someone runs them), with a very scanty view of the water (even though we had paid for "water view"), internet that we could never get to work (even after calling the IT help desk and being told it was our computer, although miraculously it worked just fine the day we got home) and an adjoining room that had doors that must have been like tissue paper thickness! There were none of those stands to put your luggage on, so I put mine up on the table and my husband had to put his up on the end table beside the bed. The bathroom fan was making a banging noise--even when it was turned off. I called the front desk, and they sent someone up immediately and he fixed it. That service couldn't have been better! At all costs, unless you need adjoining rooms, make sure and ask for NOT adjoining rooms. And don't bother paying the extra money for "water view"--it just isn't worth it. We went over to the food court the one evening and the clerk was extremely rude. We should have asked to be moved away from the elevator and the adjoining door, but once you're in and have your luggage there, it is a real nuisance to change. We will definitely NOT be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Sweetreets
Reviews.Content: I let my Disney Travel Agent pick everything. SHe did a fantastic job. The stay at Port Orleans Riverside was 5 star and above, all the way around. I lost my drivers license, photopass and CREDIT CARD to the World, as I called it, on my second night there. Within an hour the front desk staff had me good to go with a new credit card and photo pass got me fixed up the next morning. DISNEY LOST and FOUND did find my credentials and mailed to me within days of my return home. The hotel food was wonderful and i just wish we had more time to enjoy all that the hotel had to offer. WE WILL BE BACK.

Reviews.Title: “This resort is wonderful, do not believe everything you read.”
Reviews.Author: droshek
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I was very nervous to come to this hotel, I even bought the travel Clorox wipes with me after reading these reviews. I almost switched my hotel to a deluxe resort based on the reviews. I have no idea what happened to these people because our experience was WONDERFUL. The resort is absolutely beautiful, our room was spacious, the resort was spread out but very walkable. We stayed in the Magnolia Bend area in a King sized bedroom on the 3rd floor. Our room was quiet, beautiful, clean, and absolutely wonderful. The boat to Downtown Disney was great, as was the bus service. The people that work there are so incredibly friendly and it rubs off on the guest as well, everyone is really friendly there. I would totally stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Resort in Disney”
Reviews.Author: angeSouthWales
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riverside part of Port Orleans, Family of 5, 2 Adults 3 girls aged 15, 14, and a 7 birthday celebrated in Florida. From the moment we got to the complex we new we picked the right one the atmosphere was electrifying, The staff made it extra special with an extra request for a B'day Cake to be presented at the main meal area, not only did they come with a beautiful cake but extra's included balloons and necklaces and signed photo from the disney characters, our daughter was over the moon. We did however get stuck out for an extra 10 days because of the ash clouds and out of curiousity we went on an adventure of other Disney Hotels and we are all defo happy with our hotel Port Orleans. We had a vehicle but did use the Disney Buses often and at No point did we have to wait very regular. Rooms were cleaned everyday 100% standards, Staff were very helpful with any enquires.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans Riverside is Fantastic...Strongly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: who_we_talkin_about
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans Riverside is a great Disney property. I had to laugh when I read some of the other reviews. Most of Disney's moderate resorts are large and spread out over a big territory so plan ahead. There are lots of rooms close to the main building for families with small children if you want to avoid a longer walk. We reviewed the map and requested a building that was the perfect distance away. The kids loved the pool. The dining was good (classic Disney), and the location is PERFECT (close to all the parks and a boat ride away from Downtown Disney). The room was nice, clean and well appointed. No, it's not a luxury room. It's a MODERATE resort. If you want to spend another $200 per night for a room you're almost never in, Disney has those to. Port Orleans Riverside was the perfect get a way for our family trip.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: CubbieBear_11
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure where to start. The four Disney parks were great but our hotel experience soured our first trip to Disney. The customer service at Riverside was absolutely horrendous. Since we had two families with small children(5 year old, two 3 year olds, and a 3 month old), we were "promised" a conjoining room on the first floor. Instead, we were given two rooms on the second floor(w/o an elevator) that were neither conjoining or adjoining. In order for them to correct the mistake, we were required to pack/unpack and move our suitcases/strollers to other rooms 6 different times within the first 3 days. We had also requested a crib for our 3 month old daughter. When we checked in at 10:30 am, we were "promised" that the crib would be in the room(which was the wrong room anyway) after we returned from the park. That did not happen either. I actually had to make two separate trips to the front desk(which was about a half mile from our room) before the crib was finally delivered at 11:00 pm. On the second day, they gave us keys to a room that was already occupied by another visitor. Despite all of their mistakes, I had two separate managers try and tell me it was our fault. It seemed like every manager I spoke with was more incompetent than the last. Each one kept making promises that the next manager wouldn't/couldn't uphold. It was a customer service nightmare!! When I asked for some sort of compensation for our extreme inconvenience, each of them looked at me like I was crazy. Finally after three days of empty "promises", they credited us $100. $100 credit, are you kidding me?!? If you have ever been to Disney, you know that's not going a long way. As a family, we have been taking two vacations a year for some time now. This is by far the worst experience I've had with a hotel and it's staff. I don't want to come off as a bitter person because we had a blast at the actual parks. I just want to make sure everyone is aware of what they should expect if they decide to stay at Riverside.

Reviews.Title: “All-Disney Exterior Quickly Peels Away to Reveal Grime and Filth”
Reviews.Author: VSings
Reviews.Content: The Disney corporation has brilliantly marketed itself as Eden here on earth. It promises to wisk people away from the grind of the 9-to-5, and it tantalizes children with hopes of a picture-perfect world of blemish-free princesses and heroes whose dreams are enough to help them beat all odds. Its movies are polished, its merchandise too good to be resisted, and its saccharine paradises extend the promise of something better in a world that often disappoints. Port Orleans Resort - Riverside has and does none of these things. Its all-Disney exterior quickly peels away to reveal poorly maintained accommodations--from sticky bathroom floors to filth-stained bedspreads. A tropical paradise it is not; take a dip in the resort's bacteria-infested pools at your own risk. Shower with your eyes closed, lest you'd like a closeup view of the unidentified brown substance even housekeeping won't touch. If you must stay here, prepare for the disgusting conditions by packing items to safeguard against the conditions. Then, spend as much time outside your room as possible--perhaps Disney World, where you can escape the funk for a li'l bit of magic, for just a few hours.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: poppyCheshire
Reviews.Content: Our holiday at the Port Orleans was from December 16th to 30th with a short break in between to Clearwater Beach. I had read quite a few negative reviews for this hotel before hand so was a bit worried about the cleanliness etc, but quickly found out that there was no need for concern. We were allocated a room in the Magnolia Bend section and this is what I would recommend for people who want to be close to the main reception, shop restaurant etc, as it was less than a 5 minute walk from our room. The room was adequate, far from luxurious but was clean and comfortable, had a fridge, safe and hair dryer with plenty of hot water and clean towels were provided daily. The restaurant on site is worth a visit and also the bar area was cosy after returning from the parks to warm up with a drink by the fire. (most days were freezing) We picked this hotel for it's location close to Downtown Disney; we found our stay to be excellent value for money, we had free hotel and park parking, extra magic hours were useful for this time of year and the Disney transportation when we didn't drive was very efficient. The grounds of the hotel are beautiful and very peaceful, due to the weather we didn't make use of the swimming pools but would love to return in the summer months.

Reviews.Title: “Just being told- Have a magical day - will not make your day magical”
Reviews.Author: student2002
Reviews.Content: I would say one thing to the management of this hotel â€“ Stop saying meaningless things like â€“ Have a magical day - and instead focus on actually providing the service that would make the day of a guest comfortable, less stressful, and enjoyable. Then you can standup and say â€“ We make your day magical (because we do x, y, z ) ! If for some reason you become sick like I did while staying at this resort, you will be totally out of luck. They had no room service expect for a large pizza and no system in place to extend my stay for one extra day without me physically standing in front of their reception window (giving credit card, etc). The reception window can be a 10 to 25 minutes walk from the room depending on which dilapidated building you stay at. Not to mention the foul smell in the room, pre-historic TV, decrepit air cooler system, outdated Phone system, and odd arrangement of furniture. In any case, this place offers no service other than a bunch of parrots repeating â€“ have a magical day. I would run from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty property, average Disney hotel...”
Reviews.Author: azroxie
Reviews.Content: -LONG walk to room...a bit frustrating when lugging luggage and kids in tow. Didn't know the golf carts driving past us every few moments were available to transport us to the room - why didn't the front desk clerk mention this? Elevators are not conveniently located and hard to find, esp if you are NOT on the first floor. -Another reason WHY the LONG walk was a negative, was that our room key didn't work on three separate occasions, had to walk all the way back to the front desk to have this resolved. No apologies from the (disappointing) front-desk clerks. -Check-in took over 40 minutes in line (even though we arrived around 7pm). There is a separate line for "express check-in", which is checking in online before you get there. -The room was typical WDW Disney property, very small, esp the bathroom. The room was quiet, never heard other guests in surrounding rooms. Complimentary shampoo and 2 bars of soap. (don't forget YOUR conditioner and lotion!). In room coffee maker and mini-fridge. Older t.v. set. -The property and grounds are very pretty and scenic...great for joggers. -Two themed areas - one is the "mansions" and the other is "alligator bayou". -On-site gift shop and sundries store if you need any souvenirs, toiletries, snacks, or bottled water. Expect to pay "Disney" prices. Good size store. -After peeking in the windows when we went to visit the Pop Century Resort (which had a newer flat screen TV, towel animals like on cruise ships, and room looked newer....)...we wished we had stayed there instead and it's even cheaper than Port Orleans. -Difficult to find a table in the main cafeteria dining. TIP: GRAB a table, then get your food. Prices were not too bad - esp for what you expect to pay at Disney. Breakfast was a madhouse! The food is decent, many different choices. -Port Orleans has 4 bus depot stops for the WDW bus. -One thing to keep in mind, the property is very HUGE...thus MORE people staying there (crowded dining, longer check-in, tons of rooms, crowded bus)...next time I will probably stay at a smaller property that is not so spread out.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Bad Stay”
Reviews.Author: sventhor
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans has been recreated to look like an old American river town. And they have done quite a nice job. I would rate the hotel as average - ok. Pros: Nice settings and surrounds Reasonably Priced Ok location in Disney World Cons: Below Average Food Towels a bit tardy and small Room getting a little tired I can't really compare it to other resorts in Disney, because this is the only one I have stayed in. But I would probably come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, beautiful setting.”
Reviews.Author: jnj2003
Reviews.Content: I was a bit nervous after reading some of the "iffy" reviews on this site, but we loved the Port Orleans Riverside. The resort is beautiful, quiet and relaxing, and we wished we could have stayed longer to enjoy more of the amenities. Bus travel to/from the parks was easy. The "quick serve" restaurant had lots of variety for both breakfast and lunch. I particularly enjoyed the giant cinnamon rolls! Our room was a bit of a hike from the main hotel lobby, so if you are traveling with seniors or others who have difficulty walking, be sure to request a closer room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: maysi111
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with my two year old daughter for a week and had a fabulous time. This is truly a moderate resort and you get what you pay for. The sheets are rough and the mattresses are bit uncomfortable. I priced out a Disney Deluxe Resort for the the week and it was over $1,500 more. I chose to stay at this Disney Moderate Resort since it had the best reviews of all the moderate resorts. If you are looking for a Disney Value Resort, I know that Pop Century is fairly new and the reviews are pretty great. We were just looking for something with a few more amenities otherwise we would have probably stayed at Pop Century. The property of Port Orleans Riverside is absolutely beautiful, however, the rooms are a bit dated but very clean. You truly only sleep there so it was not much of a concern for us. We had no problems checking in mid week and the staff was very friendly. Breakfast was a bit crowded but we always found a table. The buses to Magic Kingdom in the AM are bit crowded, try to go on a weekday. Also, try to find a bus stop near you other than the main one and you will have first dibs on seats as it will not be as crowded since the main stop is the last stop to pick-up. I have to also mention Character Dining. Whether it is Cinderella's Castle, Chef Mickey's, Crystal Palace or many others.... I would suggest to only make reservations for breakfast. The breakfast buffets are much better than the dinner ones and they are a lot less money. I recommend going to the countries in Epcot for lunches and dinners. We visited Japan and Italy and had fabulous dinners. Port Orleans Riverside is very nice for a Disney Moderate Resort and I can say that I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Riverside”
Reviews.Author: Texas4familyfun
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a night during Marathon weekend. I was terribly disappointed in the cleanliness and size of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay at the Port Orleans Riverside again”
Reviews.Author: quake_ace
Reviews.Content: After travelling for 10 hours to get to the Port Orleans Riverside resort it was very frustrating to have to stand in a line for at least 30 minutes just to get checked-in becuase the registration desk was understaffed. Our clerk gave us a tiny map of where our building was located on the property and said it was an easily "walkable" distance. Under normal circumstances it would have been easily walkable but at 10:00 at night with 6 suitcases and small children, the hike to our room was unpleasant to say the least. It ended up being a 20 minute walk in the dark hauling our luggage the entire way. We were passed numerous times by employees in golf carts, none of them stopping to offer directions or to take our luggage (and it was very obvious that we didn't know where we were going - since we had to keep stopping under the dim street lamps to look at our map). We didn't know until the next day that the golf cart bell hops were an availble service to us and I think that the registration clerk should have offered that to us especially being that late at night with all our luggage and small children. The buildings and properties were very clean and beautiful but our room was not up to "Disney" standards. We had a disgusting moldy smell in our room and little note explaining that our carpets had just been cleaned and may still be wet, so why put people in there right away? Luckily we were only staying 2 nights or I would have left the property.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay would return”
Reviews.Author: frozenathome
Reviews.Content: Loved Port Orleans Riverside (POR). Lots to do at the resort. Staff friendly and helpful. We were offered free taxi vouchers for our whole party to get to supper because our plane arrived late. Staff very good with the kids and provided lots of activities for them. Able to go to Downtown Disney by boat a plus. We travelled with another family of 5, our 4 and my parents. Faxed POR 3 days before our arrival and they put us all together in building 15. We were close to the bus stop and the main building. Read reviews about road noise from this buiding, but nobody in our party heard any. Rooms were as clean as any other resort, and much cleaner than Caribbean Beach. Have stayed at POP Century and Caribbean Beach in the past. POP Century good for a value resort, but not as many ammenities like a waterslide for the kids and the grounds aren't as nice. Did not like Caribbean Beach for the same money would return to POR. No WIFI available at any of these resorts we have stayed at, which I find to be lacking for Disney resorts as even places like Comfort Inn offer free WIFI.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, not so great bus service”
Reviews.Author: angeella
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical about staying here with all of the mixed reviews but since the trip was planned ahead of time we went with it. I have stayed at Disney 6 times and typically go to All sports or Coronado Springs. I chose Port Orleans because we had five in our party and this is the only moderate that will sleep five without paying for a suite at Coronado. The check in was great. We arrived at 7am and they were quick to process our paper work (I did use the advance check in), and gave us our room. The staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was in building 38 in alligator bayou. It was a very, very, very long walk through a twisting path from the main building. On the up side it was close to one of the bus stops, which was made that quicker. On the first trip out we went to Magic Kingdom, no problems and when we came back to the room it was fast as well because Orleans French Quarter & Riverside had two seperate stations. That unfortunately was where the ease of the bus use stopped. For the rest of our trip we were sharing buses with French Quarters. The extra stop was not a problem at all, we still made it to the parks in reasonable time. The problem was especially at night, having to get everyone back to the two resorts from one stop. During our first night for the extra hours at Hollywood studios the line was so long it went well past 6 stops for other resorts, it was so cold that night and the line was so incredibly long we took a cab because our eight year old was miserable. For the rest of the time it was decent in the mornings, packed in the evenings and I can't recall to many times the buses werent packed to the seams with people at night... long wait and very crowded ride back to the resort. The housekeeping was excellent, clean room everyday and when we needed extra towels they brought us a huge bag full that we used through the entire week. We never ate at boatrights (which I have heard great things about), the quick service breakfast was so so, okay I suppose but a muffin in the room would have been as well. I will say if you have five people and two rooms at the value are to much and the deluxe is out of the question this is an excellent option as long as you are aware that the buses can and may very well be combined. This was what used to be a slow week at Disneyworld but it was not for the buses at Port Orleans and for this I will never stay here again, but it is clean, comfortable and the grounds are amazing. FYI the trundle is like a slide out tray with a mattress similar to a hospital gurney on it. My son couldnt rest on it so we shared the bed. Buses and trundle were awful, the rest was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Place to Stay at Disney”
Reviews.Author: donnot
Reviews.Content: Visited in Nov. 2010 for a 5 day stay with my 4 kids, plus extended family in several other rooms. We have stayed previously at All Star Music in the family suites. I liked Port Orleans in general, but the rooms were dated. Ours had several large stains of what looked like paint or nail polish (although the stains were too big to be just a nail polish spill) on the carpet. We didn't ask to change because we were in Bldg. 14, which is close to everything, and our family members were all together, and it was not enough to make the room unusable. The carpeting in the room should have been replaced, though. I had no issue with housekeeping. The room was always clean and I thought the bathroom and sink area looked newer than the rest of the room. Buses were hit-or-miss. Sometimes we got right on and got a seat; other times there was a big wait and no seats, particularly to and from the Magic Kingdom. The boat ride to Downtown Disney was great. I recommend taking it and eating at Wolfgang Puck Express for an enjoyable counter service dinner. The Food Court was always crowded but the lines moved; breakfast was edible but unremarkable. The Pasta bar at dinner was good. Kids liked the pool and the slide, but have remarked to me that they prefer All Star Music.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Fantastic Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: luvdisneyengland
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Disney World Orlando, please please consider staying here!!! Its so beautiful, the scenery is gorgeous, the staff are lovely, the food is great, there are loads of things to do in the resort alone, free transport to Disney Parks! Also let me enforce the staff will help you in anyway possible, there was an extremely lovely man at the entrance called Chris, who made our stay just lovely, everyday when our family and other families passed he would recommend parts of the parks, and tell lovely stories about Disney. Its just fantastic here I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Disney Riverside: My Place of Zen.”
Reviews.Author: drwn
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved the Riverside. I work in the people profession and when I go on vacation, I want to get away from people. The Riverside is a spread out resort and because of that, people are not stacked on top of each other like the value resorts. Yes, you have to walk to the main lodge, but you are walking through well-manicured pathways with little streams, bridges, and wildlife. It would be on thing if it were a parking lot walk, but these paths are wonderful. The room was spacious and well maintained. The boat transportation system to downtown Disney took about 20 minutes and added to the relaxed touch. The resort had four bus depots and we were close to the north depot. The building surrounded a well-heated pool. I recommend this resort if you like the wide open/spread out feel. If you donâ€™t like to walk, this is not the resort for you. For me, it was perfect. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “nice facade shame its a bit samey”
Reviews.Author: scunnybird
Reviews.Content: have been to florida a few times before, and have stayed in disney carribean beach, port orleans is very much like that middle priced disney hotel, location is one of its best features, designed like a new orleans mansion in the river boat era, once inside however, just like a cheap motel, 2 beds 1980s tv and decor, curtain across from room to wash area, though everything is there that you need and it is clean.Bit of a shock how pricey everything has become since 2 years ago! I would strongly recommend taking half as much money again as you will certainly need it!Buy the cups straight away if you have kids or even if not, as refills of hot / cold drinks are free in the canteen like food hall, which should be saved for emergency use only far better choice and quality in the parks, even better if you have transport and can get to international drive, will save a fortune, food in the bar at port orleans is plentifull good value, but lacking in choice, drinks are very expensive, small cocktail yummy but pricey at $10, can recommend pineapple upside down cocktail, beers around $6 to $7 dollars.Disney park prices also have risen considerably, but choice and quality is good, and food is so much part of the holiday, so I WONT KEEP ON about prices.A few words of advice though, if you want a quiter time dont go to florida when the marathon is on as we did! So check the dates, and the weather which was freezzzzzzing!Also airport arrival immigration is stil horrendous, expect and hour wait at least and the usual interogation, have fun !!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: xara116
Reviews.Content: We had wonderful service while we were there, the staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast offerings were varied and good, their bakery items were yummy :), we did not eat any other meals at the dining facility. The grounds were nicely landscaped with vegetation, winding attractive walking paths and routes along the water. The Disney Express was convenient, check in was quick and easy. We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge on a previous visit and our room at the Riverside was no better nor worse. The only negative was that the lobby/dining are NOT centrally located. This is a very large complex with 4 bus stops for the shuttle service. I wore a pedometer so I know my distance to the dining is accurate, from our room it was .5 miles one way and there were many more rooms beyond ours! The distance is something to consider if you have young children and the added walking to what will be required at the theme parks. Take advantage of the boat ride to Downtown Disney, it was very enjoyable, convenient and a nice change from the buses.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: viparky
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Grand Floridian before Port Orleans had a lot to live up to. Rooms were ok, considering you only really sleep there we had everything we needed. Resort was nice, pools good for kids and nice little shop. Loved the food, we took the Dining Plan and once again did not have a bad meal. Staff a bit slow but food was perfect with lots of choice. Although expensive it works out much cheaper on the Pan and we visited some fantastic restaurants during our stay (Whispering Canyon is a fav and we had Christmas Lunch at the Palace int he Magic Kingdom for no extra cost! Didnt queue for any rides, what with Magic Hours and Fastpasses so we got to do everything at a leisurely pace. Disney transport was also spot on and buses were regular and we always got a seat, even when it was particularly busy. Great atmosphere and amazing decorations. We are just about to book again fro next christmas and would definitely go back to Port Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: GoPackers52
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Disney so we had no idea where to stay and found out we were limited on choices since therer was 5 of us. Riverside was one of the places that did allow 5 in the room. It was very nice looking place but not practical in the least. You enter the main hub of the hotel and everything looks great. Everyone is so nice and helpful. We did the online express check in and it was anything but express even at 10 at night. Once we received our room cards they told us to go out back and follow the map. A half a mile later through a bunch of twists, turns and bridges we finally arrive at our room. I'm not kidding, at least a half a mile walk. So for the rest of our trip if we wanted to go to the main pool or to the main dinning hall we had to walk all the way back. The only nice thing about being way out there was we were closer to the one bus dock to catch the buses to the parks. The room is small but what do you really need except for a place to sleep. No microwave or DVD player. Just a TV, Dorm size fridge and a coffee maker. The room was clean and the daily service was excellent. New towels, extra pillows, extra blankets whatever you needed. When we first walked in the room there were only two beds so we called to make sure we had the right room for the 5 of us. They told us to look under the one bed and we started to laugh. There is was, a pull out roller shelf with a mattress on it! That was the 5th bed! hahaha Thankfully our 5 year old was cool with sleeping on the floor on this tiny mattress. They did have a bunch of channels on the tv. The air and heat worked great. I would bring a power strip like we did to plug in all your camera's, phones, DS's etc...as the outlets were limited. Also, don't expect to find any luggage rollers. You either have to carry your luggage to your place or have he bell service drop it off. We were part of the disney express so the luggage was delivered to our room at about 2 in the morning. Leaving however was ridiculous. We called an hour before we had to check our luggage in to be taken to the airport and they were too busy. Now it was raining about an inch an hour so I had to walk my luggage to the front. That's right, a half mile with two large bags of luggage in the pouring rain. Needless to say I was soaked when I got to the front and when they asked me how I was doing I told them crappy (not the actual word I used but I couldn't use profanity in my review). They were then able to find someone right away to go and retrieve my family and the rest of our luggage. Make sure you have a bunch of 5 dollar bills handy. From the bus guy that drops you at the hotel and back at the airport, to the bell service both coming and leaving, to the room service, to the luggage check guys everyone has a hand out for a tip. I'm not knocking it just giving you a heads up. The food in the main dining hall was pretty good. Then again after a half mile walk I would have eaten just about anything! haha You can catch a ferry at the back of the main hotel to downtown disney which was nice. You could also take it over the Post Orleans French Quater which looked like they had a nicer main pool. That reminds me that we were back at unit 35 which happened to have their own little pool right there. That was nice even though the kids wanted to go all the way to the main pool since it was bigger and had a slide and jacuzzi. That is also where the bar was. I was going to have A beer but wasn't about to pay $7 for it! Towels were availabe too which was also nice. Internet access was also $10 a day if you wanted it! Good think I had my iphone! Needless to say I would not come back to this hotel nor would I ever recommend it to anyone. For the few positives it had the distance to the main hall and pool was ridiculous especailly with 3 kids. I do enough walking at the parks, I don't need to do more at my hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location - good value”
Reviews.Author: tlm100
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Oak Manor rooms during our stay in January and liked the building. The room was clean, quiet and comfortable. Our cleaning lady was great, she left towel animals, extra towels and filled requests made during our stay for other room amenities. The front dest staff was very friendly and helpful. Our initial room was obviously booked to someone else, as there was luggage in it when we arrived, so we were given another room after notifiying the front desk. The boat service to Downtown Disney is great, we never had an issue with crowds for the boat. The bus service was okay to the Theme Parks, was busy on the weekend as the hotel had several large groups in house. Even though the bus service was busy, we never had to wait more than 5 minutes and always got a seat on the bus. The hotel is great for those that don't want to hear the hussle and bussel of the resorts closer to the theme parks, but be prepared to walk if you are in one of the outter buildings. I hear that Disney is going to renovate the rooms this year, which is a positive, as the bathrooms look tired. Our beds were great and the other furnishings were comfortable. The one thing that I did not like about the room was that the room felt damp at times and our cloths did not dry well. (hand wash items that normally dry over night)

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans - Riverside - Not Up to Its Former Glory”
Reviews.Author: AGentlRose
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at one of Disney's Deluxe resorts, but since we had moved to Florida, and were just staying one night for the Mickey's Very Merry Christmas Party, we decided to go to a moderate resort. I have stayed at this resort when it first opened as Dixie Landings and thought (in those days) that it was great. Yes, it is beautiful on the outside and the rooms weren't bad on the inside either, although at the Deluxe resorts, you get, 2 bars of soap, shampoo, conditioner, body wash, and lotion, at this resort, there was just a bottle of combination shampoo and conditioner and one soap, that you had to take from the sink when you wanted to shower. (Disney -- do you really think a guest doesn't notice these things when they are return guests?) Transportation was okay, however, at times Port Orleans-Riverside does have 4 bus stops and at times, it shares a bus route with the French Quarter. If your room is located at the last stop, my advice is that you either walk to or drive to the Main Bus stop. The Food Court used to be the best on Disney property, however, compared with then, now is it is barely adequate. (Disney, you make tons of money, why do you scrimp?) My problem was with checking in. I had booked the room months in advance, requested a ground floor room with a king bed, because I do use a wheelchair. When we checked in, we had been assigned a room on the second floor of Alligator Bayou -- which has no elevator. The front desk cast member told me there were no other rooms available and I had to insist that we can't "do" stairs with a wheelchair. It took the front desk manager an hour and half to find us a available room, which was still not ground floor, but at least it was in the Magnolia Bend section, which had an elevator. Needless to say, I was annoyed because we were just there so we wouldn't have to drive home after MVMCP, and at this point, it was getting so late and I didn't want to miss the party. We finally got to our room, after all the winding corridors, dropped off our overnight bag, and drove back to the Main Bus Stop to head over to the Magic Kingdom. Mickey's Christmas Party was great, our third year in a row and I would not hesitate to go back again. However, next time, we will stay at my beloved Polynesian and pay the extra money, rather than deal with this hotel or another moderate. I would however, choose this hotel rather than one of the Value or staying off property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Will Be Going Back”
Reviews.Author: diamond2772
Reviews.Content: We stayed in building 25 in the Alligator Bayou and absolutely loved it. The room was clean and pleasant. We had five people so we had a trundle bed which the kids actually argued about who would get to sleep on it. The location of the room was convenient with a short walk to the bus stop, pool, and parking lot, and about a five minute walk to the main building. As with any Disney hotel they do an impeccable job with the landscaping and we really felt like we were in the bayou. The main pool is very nice but it is busy and we spent a lot more time in the pool closest to our room. It was warm and quiet, and the kids loved late night swimming there. The dining hall is big and airy. Breakfast was crazy in there and we had a few days where we had to practically mug someone to get a table, but other meals weren't nearly as crowded and the food is good. We utilized the early online check-in but it didn't really seem to save much time at when we got there, but either way, it only took about 15 minutes. The game room is awesome, but we were so busy we didn't get to spend much time in there. While there we rented a boat which I highly recommend. The staff was all very friendly and the girl who cleaned our room was wonderful. The bus lines can get very long and although the bus service is convenient, sometimes coming home from the parks can be an absolute nightmare. If you stay until closing you'll get on a huge line to go back to the hotel and sometimes wait as 3 or 4 buses come and go, then when you finally get on one they pack you in like sardines. Halfway through the trip we decided that since it is free parking at the parks if you're staying on property, it was better to drive since we had a car. We have stayed in the Disney Value hotels at least 10 times and while they are also very nice, the Port Orleans is a big step above. For the people who say that the Coronado or any other Moderate Disney hotel is nicer, well of course it is, it costs twice as much or more. As far as a decently priced Disney hotel, this one is great. If you're going to Disney, staying on property is the way to go, and we have utilized their free dining plan offer three years in a row and it is WONDERFUL. We have already booked our next trip and we are staying at the Port Orleans - Riverside again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with convenient location”
Reviews.Author: northstar223
Reviews.Content: This is a great resort for couples and for families. We stayed in the Alligator Bayou Building 37 which was very close to the North Depot for the Disney Transportation bus service. The room was clean and had a very cute rustic theme. Housekeeping did a good job and were very friendly. The food court at the resort was very good, breakfast was delicious and cheap....for two people around $14 per day and better quality food than Denny's. The grounds at the resort are lovely and full of wildlife. Check- in and check-out is very convenient with no hassles. We didn't use the pool, when we walked by the chlorine smell was so strong it burned our eyes just standing near it, but the kids swimming seemed to be having fun and it was a large pool area with lifeguards on duty. When taking the bus service to other resorts Epcot is the closest park to Port Orleans Riverside, so its the best point for catching a bus to other resorts. Overall it was a great place for a quiet, romantic vacation with convenient access to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value for family wanting a better resort than the Disney Value resorts.”
Reviews.Author: skibran
Reviews.Content: Nice looking resort for less than the cost of the deluxe resorts at Disney. It's on the bus route to everything except you can also take a boat to downtown Disney. Decent rooms, though it said waterview and I guess that meant if you look out the corner of the window you could see a pool nearby, not the riverview I expected. The hottub wasn't hot while we were there, though the temp outside was down to 28 degrees one evening, so the pools were out of the question. The pools could also have been heated better in winter months to like 85 degrees, then people might be able to swim, otherwise what's the pool good for? A very long wait to check in also--over an hour (that may have been a fluke).

Reviews.Title: “have to try”
Reviews.Author: GreeceDiana
Reviews.Content: the place of the hotel was perfect river plants trees everything was wondreful but the breakfast was extra every morning we have to walk till the restaurant and pay eveything we get extra per thing eg other price for kids omelete more expencieve an adults omelete how many thihgs you get you pay for everyone of them seperete i have never seen something like this all the hotels i have been have the breakfast included in the price or you pay an amout per person and you get what you want from a buffet but not in there you have to wait long in lines waiting the bus to take to the theme parks the front desk was perfekt no caracters in hotel area just 30 minutes in 25/12 the room was small and not so clean i was surprised with the laundry normaly they get the things you have to wash or you bring them to the front desk not there you wash them by your serf it was so .......mass the food and the entertainement

Reviews.Title: “It's Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: joym126
Reviews.Content: I have been to Disney World several times and stayed in 3 other Disney Resorts. This one ranks as "just okay" to me and I probably wound NOT stay there again. I booked this through a travel agent, who told me that if I wanted a specific area of the resort, that I should call the resort direct 2-3 days in advance of my arrival date. I did that and requested a top floor in the Alligator Bayou section. Upon my arrival, we were given a first floor room in the Magnolia Bend area right in front of the main walkway by the main pool. I went back to the check-in area and told them I had called in advance and what my request had been. They said that they could not change my room that night and that it was doubtful that I would be able to get a room change at all. We took the Disney Magical Express and we were supposed to receive our luggage within 3 hours of our arrival. It took 5 hours before we finally got our luggage. Apparently, it had been sitting at the resort and they just hadn't gotten it to us. It was finally delivered at 11:00 that night. The next day, I called the manager at the front desk and he was able to move our room to our requested area. The rooms are not real clean. The first room we were in reminded me of a room at Motel 6. It was just old and the floors looked like they hadn't been scrubbed in a long time. When I'm paying extra for a Disney themed resort, I expect the room to reflect that. The theme of the outside of the resort is apparent and the grounds are nice. The resort is very spread out, so expect to do a lot of walking. Also, I was not aware that the Pop Warner Football/National Cheerleading Championships were the same week we went (Dec 4-11) and Pt. Orleans Riverside is the host resort. The food court was an absolute madhouse with no place to sit every time we went. I do not recommend going to Disney World at that time.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it !!!”
Reviews.Author: FionaBarnard
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel our first impression was that it was quite nice. This is our 4th Disney hotel stay and as other reviews state the rooms are dated and we had some nice stains on the carpet. My daughter is 10 but still gets excited to see what towel animals we have been left, the only one we got in the nine days we stayed was a snake which obviously didn't take much effort to make. Other than that breakfast was a complete nightmare so busy, queues for food, queues to pay and nowhere to sit. After the first day we had to split up and stand in different queues just to get our breakfast over and done with in about an hour. After returning from breakfast one day we found a maintenance worker in our room, I tried to get in to the room with my card but after three attempts I shoulted to my husband who was a few steps behind me to get his card out as mine had stopped working, at this point my door was opened from the inside by the female maintenance worker, who told us she was fixing our door! We had been in the room for five days at this point and had not reported a problem but thought nothing more of it and got on with our day. The following day I went to the safe to get out some money and found my wallet all open and I knew I had not left it like that so I checked our passports and money and found both us dollars and English money missing. I immediately went to the reception and was told a security guard would be sent out to me to take details of what had happened, the security guard was at least 70 and I had to repeat everything three times for it to sink in. I left it at that and tried not to let it ruin my holiday but the day before I left I went back to reception to see if they had an update as no one had been in contact we us since the incident which I thought was not very good customer service. A manager was bought out from the back to see me who informed me that they had no record of the incident so I had to waste yet more of my time going over everything again. I described the worker and she contacted the maintenance department to confirm that that was one of their employees, then she checked the computer and found that there was no work order so she shouldn't have been in the room. Then the manager called the sheriff so I had to go over the story again. The only two people who had access to my room were the cleaner and the maintenance worker and since the safe was locked and the key hidden the money didn't sprout legs and run away. I will not stay at this hotel again And I think they need to improve customer service dramatically and take a long hard look at the staff they employ!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended! Will definately come back!”
Reviews.Author: Chorini
Reviews.Content: Stayed one week at the Riverside and we absolutely loved it! Beautiful, light, airy and spacious room, with a great view. Loved the surroundings and the river where you can take the boat to Downtown Disney. Recommended! Going back in Feb and can' wait!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: lewink
Reviews.Content: Staying at Port Orleans for the second time, I still found the hotel very enjoyable. While the hotel is spread out over a large area, it does make for a relaxing setting. The room is large enough for the family and access to Disney transportation is a huge bonus. FYI- My daughter is in a wheelchair. When we were there in 2007 it seemed we had some trouble with not enough room on the busses. However, this time we had no problems. Though it is the busiest week of the year the transportation was wonderful. However, due to the crowds and the high prices, I won't do Disney again at Christmas. This is not an issue with the hotel, just my opinion. For those looking for a place to stay at Disney I recommend the Port Orleans. There is one issue though I was unhappy with unrelated to the hotel, but feel it should be stated. The meal play is really not as good as it used to be. In 2007 your sit down included an appetizer, meal, dessert, and tip. Now it is only meal and dessert. That alone adds 20 to 30% to your food bill. In addition, drinks are very expensive, and many nice restaurants don't even take the plan. Though it does help when making reservations, we were very disappointed with it. We will not do it again unless Disney adds more value.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money.....keep looking”
Reviews.Author: NoMagic2010
Reviews.Content: This was my kids first trip to Disney, so I didn't want to sour the trip by making an issue of the hotel while we were there. Now that we are home, the time has come to vent. Upon arrival, we had to wait in a line for over 40 minutes to check in. Once at the desk I was greeted by a rude woman from France who I had trouble understanding due to her hard accent. We were traveling with two other groups, and requested rooms close together. Two buildings away must be their definition of close, and when I requested a different room I received a look that could kill, and had to wait another 15 minutes for her to accomplish my request. Upon entering the room, we were greeted with a musty septic odor which we all found gross. The odor eventually went away, but you never get a second chance to make a first impression. We found the rooms to be very dated, and had the overall feel of being dirty. We found papers from the previous visitors on the shelf, and the shower that would not shut off all the way was like water torture during the night. One of the two sinks drained very slowly making it unusable, and after two calls to maintainance I gave up. I found the house keeping staff to be very rude, and this was not just one person having a bad day- it was every time you had to communicate with them - like when you return from breakfast ant they are in your room and you want to get your things for the day. I have been told to come back later by cleaning staff- It happened here. Overall I found the staff to be rude, and acted as though you were bothering them even if you asked something simple like directions to the bus stop. Fortunately my children have not traveled much so they did not notice the poor service and rooms. We had to spend an extra night off site due to a flight cancellation, and my daughter commented how much nicer the room was, and the staff was at the Orlando Hilton than at the "resort" we just spent a week at- pretty sad......

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best”
Reviews.Author: dsHonolulu
Reviews.Content: It's somewhat sad that Disney has a market that they really don't need to cater to. There is only one Disney and people will still go even if they built shacks for you to stay in. Here's what I experienced during our stay 12/24-1/1 Pro's: 1. Gorgeous landscaped grounds with nice wide walking paths thoughout the property. 2. Decent hotel staff. Young and somewhat inexperienced but cheery. In fact, most folks on staff are either very young or very old. I understand Disney doesn't pay well. 3. As a previous reviewer said, the buses were very convenient. Running anywhere from 20 minutes to every 10 minutes. 4. Boat shuttle was very enjoyable but doesn't take you everywhere. From the Riverside the main destination by boat was Downtown Disney. 5. The temperatures dipped into the 30's but the outside pool was heated. Pretty cool. 6. The Boatside restaurant was decent but as with everything at resorts overpriced. The cafeteria was the best deal. Breakfast was totally not worth it. They count the number of bacon they give you and nothing is outstanding although the made to order omelet isn't bad. The lunch and dinner are far more worth it. Cooked to order pasta and a carving station with turkey and roast beef (I think). As a quick meal from the meal plan it's hard to beat. Con's: 1. Rooms are seriously in need of renovations. Our rooms had the following problems: a. A/C/hearing unit really smelled bad when used in heater mode. b. Shower head leaked c. Shower vent fan stayed on intermittently and rattled. d. Coffee cups were used (go figure) e. There was tape over our telephone for no reason (go figure again!) f. Tube tv's! Flat screens have been around for years!!! g. Distance to rooms from lobby is quite a walk and we were situated in one of the closer units. 2. The bus drivers aren't very sensitive to older handicapped folks. My dad was in a wheel chair up to the bus' door and walked into the bus. All the handicap seats were taken up by young kids and parents. The driver made no effort to find a space for my dad. Happened constantly. 3. While it's cool to be here for Christmas and New Year's I would never do it again. The crowds are crazy. It's a huge place and when you walk you are shoulder to shoulder with people. Unbelieveable. 4. Distances to each park is very far. The bus rides took anywhere from 15-20 minutes. 5. Many of the park workers don't know much about anything. We tried to ask folks about the Magic Hours times and got six different answers. If you plan on using a meal plan take the time (which will be a lot) to research the different restaurants you can go to. It seems as though the better restaurants are at the parks and not at the hotels. Planet Hollywood and the Irish Pub were excellent. Places like Sanaa were just okay. If I had to do this over again I'd go off season and probably go to the California Park and stay off property. There are far better lodging alternatives than Disney properties. I guess if you can afford to stay at places like the Floridian or Animal Lodge than it'll be a little better but for that kind of money I'd prefer to stay at a Ritz Carlton or similar.

Reviews.Title: “Don't think I'd stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: countdown6
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from our 2nd annual Disney Holiday Trip, the memories of Port Orleans Riverside are still fresh so here's my opinion: Pros: -The Magical Express is a great service we utilized to and from the airport. - The shuttles to and from the four parks was better than I expected especially given the negative reviews I've read. Christmas Day had buses going to and from Magic kingdom every 10 minutes. That was really appreciated. -The boat to downtown Disney is great. I highly recommend it over the crowded bus to downtown . Again the buses to the parks were good but downtown not. - The staff were all really nice right from our early arrival at 11:00 am being able to check in with our room ready. - The outside area of resort is really attractive. - Daily housekeeping was good -Fulton's General Store is adorable and fairly well stocked Cons: -The rooms seriously needs an overall. The interior is really dated. Reminding me of an older Best Western -Grout in tub surround was discoloured -Room smelled really old and musty -We actually had two adjoining rooms. One of the rooms seemed to be in better shape than the other, maintenance wise. -Daily internet fees: Highspeed internet(not wifi) 9.95 for each 24 hour period(not unique to Port Orleans) -Food Court: This was prob the worst quick service meal we had in Disney. The portions were small. Food was only lukewarm in temperature. I just felt it was not good food. I should add we only ate breakfast here twice so maybe other meals are better but a complimentary breakfast at Homewood Suites beat this hands down. You are much better off going to the Main Street bakery in Magic Kingdom and getting a breakfast sandwich along with a drink and baked good(I gave the cinnamon bun to my son who is a light breakfast eater) and saved a quick serve and snaack on my dining plan to be eaten at a more convenient time. If you're going to Epcot for the day, go to the French Bakery and get the ham/cheese croissant. This counts as a snack and is way better than the bounty platter or french toast you get at Port Orleans. -The only thing I really feel this hotel has going for it is the resort grounds are beautiful, and being a Disney property you don't have to worry about transport at all. I really liked the all inclusive feeling. Again though you'd get it at any Disney property. My husband seemed to like Port Orleans better than me. My plan is to save my money earlier in the yr and try and stay at the much better located and recently renovated(2007) Contemporary for only another $1500. If we stay at a moderate we will try Coronado Springs. Seems to have better reviews.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in Disney that I ever had the displeasure to stay at!”
Reviews.Author: CheerMom5
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to start off by saying that I have stayed at Disney in Disney Hotels for many years. This is by far the worst hotel that I have ever stayed at. I travel alot and have never felt compelled to write a review, but this time felt that I needed to make my awful experience known. And NO...I am NOT a complainer, but the customer service at this hotel was nothing but AWFUL! When arriving at the hotel I proceeded to stand in a line that took about 30 minutes to check in. Upon checking in, I noticed that all of my information was incorrect and that they had my name completely wrong. OK ...after being exhausted and tired with 3 young children, I just dealt with it. We were told that we were staying in Alligator Bayou Building#17....a far distance from the lobby and food court for a family with an infant and 2 other small children. Not only was it far away,but the layout of the buildings at this hotel is extremely confusing. The girl at the desk gave us a map and told us how to get to our room.....30 minutes later with 3 children and 5 suitcases in tow we found it. Not a great start after just arriving after a 3 hour flight and being exhausted and tired. The rooms were outdated and just gave the overall appearance of being unclean. Crowded room for a family of 5. We used the trundle bed and a pack and play, and it was much too crowded. During that first night, when we were ready for bed,we noticed a terrible constant noise coming from our refrigerator. Our family did not sleep all night.!!! In the am i walked directly to the front desk @7:30 am to inform them of the problem. They said that they would get someone there by 11:00 am. Nobody showed up.... Needless to say, 2 calls were made that afternoon to AGAIN remind them of the problem and nobody showed up. Everytime that I called, it was like I was calling for the first time. Nobody at the front desk or maintenence dept. seemed to know what was going on. I was trying to get this problem resolved before night time and nobody seemed to care. I finally gave up, because I just did not have the time or energy for it. I wanted to enjoy my vacation with my family, not spend it talking with the most disorganized and apathetic staff that I have ever come across. Suddenly at 9:30 at night someone shows up @ my door to fix my Air Conditioning. The maintenance dept. had the wrong message.
