I was so excited to finally have someone from maintenance come, that I told them what the real prob was and they then informed me that it was not their job and that I needed to call housekeeping. I decided to do that in the am and deal with another night of no sleep. We were all attempting to sleep when I heard a knock on the door @ 10;30p .....it was someone from maintenence coming to exchange my refrigerator. Half asleep, I told them to come back in am. Needless to say they woke up the baby who spent the next hour crying . Next day ...nobody showed up again...and guess what...I gave up trying! I unplugged the refrigerator and dealt with it the rest of the night. My daughter had a 24 hour virus 3 days into our trip. At night, she had vomited all over her bedspread and blanket. I took the dirty linens off of the bed, and she slept with only a clean sheet the rest of the night. Next am I told housekeeping. Our family went out for the rest of the day and came back 8 hours later to find one bed mad and my daughters bed untouched. They would not even chang ethe sheets or touch the bed that she had vomited in. When I called, someone was to be sent right away. I left and came back a 1/2 later to find a pile of sheets and blankets waiting for me. I guess that they had expected me to make the bed and change the linens. I called again. The gentleman was flustered and visibly angered and said that some one would be righ there after she finished another room. 10 minutes later I opened the door to an angry hostile woman. She stormed into the room and would not make eye contact with me. She was obviously angry with me for calling. She proceeded to mumble to herself under her breath. I decided that I would just remain quiet, in order to get her out of there as fast as I could. Sorry If I asked her to do her job!! She proceeded to ask me to hand her the sheets individually as she made the bed. She then left in a huff. I would have stayed in a Motel 6 for that kind of treatment! and would have made the bed. Luggage check in at the end was just as eventful.. The gentleman basically called me a liar to my face before I left when he gave me misinformation and I verbatim told him what he directed me to do. We stayed with multiple other familes during this time...and we all had problems. We all could not wait to get out of that hell Hole!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel. Some people just like to complain.”
Reviews.Author: OttMomof2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans Riverside from Dec. 11-18. It was great. I didn't request it, but we received Alligator Bayou building 14, which is apparently a hot commodity. We were SO close to everything. It was perfect since we were traveling with 2 young children (2 and 3 years). Our room was clean and spacious. The bedding is outdated, but functional. The maid service was wonderful, leaving fun towel and stuffed animal creations for my kids each day. We did leave tips daily. The food court was awesome. I loved the pasta bar and my husband really liked the turkey dinner. There were plenty of healthy options and my kids were happy with the food, which makes everyone happy. It did get very busy at certain peak times, but we often got our food to go and ate back at our room or outside. Check in was VERY slow. We did the online check in thinking it would speed up the process. However, apparently everyone else had the same idea. The online check in line was very long, and the conventional check in line was empty. It did take about an hour to check in. Luckily, even though we arrived early at 10 am, our room was ready for us! The staff did serve complimentary hot chocolate and had movies and coloring activities for the kids. Magical express had our bags in our room when we got back from the park that first day. Checking out was a breeze. Our boarding passes were printed and left for us at our room on our second to last day. The staff were fantastic. One of the bell hops gave my kids "lucky" wooden Port Orleans tokens. When we had a misunderstanding over the dining plan, a concierge took care of it and promptly credited us 7 extra snacks just for our trouble. The gift store is great. The grounds are beautiful. The boat service to Downtown Disney is fantastic and definitely worth it at night. I loved this hotel! Previously I have stayed at the Caribbean Beach Hotel and I liked the Riverside much better. My experience was that the room was cleaner, the food court was better, and the grounds were more enjoyable. Plus, the boat service to Downtown Disney is a great touch. I'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Our Favourite Hotel -Port Orleans RIVERSIDE!!”
Reviews.Author: BocaBoo
Reviews.Content: This is my favourite Disney Hotel, love being able to get boat up to Disney Marketplace. Great landscaping, and pools, although it is a very large hotel the planting makes it seem smaller. There are mutliple bus stops so never far to walk for transportation. One of the better food halls, good choice. What is good about this hotel is it has a bar /lounge that is indoor, alot are outdoor in other moderate/value hotels and are therefore subject to the weather. We enjoy sitting down for a glass of wine when returning from the parks before turning in. It is a hotel room and not self catering but does have fridge/kettle and table & chairs in each room, which was really handy for our toddler could store snacks etc for her. decent size shop with selection of food toiletries etc obviously a bit more expensive. Think this is a great base to explore from. We do prefer Riverside never stayed at french quarter as not as appealing decor/landscaping, also no indoor bar!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: happy911
Reviews.Content: We were so excited to head to WDW this December for Christmas. We decided to stay at a moderate resort this time. Previously we have stayed at the Contemporary, Wilderness Lodge and Grand Floridian. We arrived on a bad day for Disney because their computers were down. The lines were long, but we were able to get through in 20 minutes...until we realized that our reservation was not correct. We called POR, because we left to eat lunch and they made the changes we wanted. A room in the Mansion Area with a water view. Our experience with Disney is they do their best to accomodate their guests. The walk from the parking lot to our room was long the first time, (especailly pulling luggage) but then our girls found us a short cut. The room itself was felt spacious, was clean and decorated traditionally (just as you see on the Disney's site). We were greeted with a Mickey towel shape on our bed. We had no problem with Mousekeeping, room was neat and clean each day. As for the food court...we preferred the French Quarter over Riverside. It was smaller, fewer guests and our food was hot. Loved the Po' Boy sandwiches for lunch! It was quite cold the week we stayed but our last day we did get to swim a little. The girls enjoyed the slide and landing in the "warm" pool! The grounds were beautiful and serene. There's a quiet, slow pace which we enjoyed. The parks can be soooo crazy. We rented a car (we have tried several combinations and feel this works best for us) so we had no bus issues. The only reason I marked the service down was due to the computers being down...I would stay here again. Lastly, we had a really, really loud family next to us...they came in at 1:00 a.m. with small children...one of them screaming for chocolate...I called the front desk and security was dispatched immediately. The family was warned to quiet down or they would be "removed" from the hotel. Disney is serious when they need to be.

Reviews.Title: “WDW 2010 Great PLACE for Family of 5”
Reviews.Author: pc_96
Reviews.Content: Great food and location, rooms are small for 5 but who spends that mcuh time in the room at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Here Again Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: radford5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alligator Bayou, building 36, room 44 this week. Our room was a little ways from the main building but we did not mind because we got to see all of the beautiful landscaping and enjoy the moment. The room service and housekeeping was awesome. The housekeeper we had the entire week throughly cleaned our room everyday, left us new towels with some on the bed shaped as mickey mouse and Dumbo. She even cleaned our coffee pot and was able to get us a microwave to use in our room. Room service was extremely quick; we received the extra coffee we wanted in less then ten minutes. All of the Port Orleans staff was cheerful and polite. In the quick time area, the staff went out of their way to start conversation while we were waiting and line and they all had a smile on their faces. The Christmas decorations were gorgeous and we got to take a picture with Christmas Mickey on Christmas Eve Day in the morning, go on a carriage ride for 30 minutes for $45, shop in the general store, and play in the arcade with our arcade voucher. We did not really run into the quick time meal crowds, because we got up early and got breakfast at the hotel by 7:30, 8:00 each day and we would get supper about 4:30. With the buses, the same thing. We got up earlier and missed most of the big crowds. Here is a tip for those who are into the Magic Kingdom and want to ride the rides without waiting forever: If you are able, don't get to the park until 8:00 or 9:00 at night and stay until it closes. We were able to re-ride all of our favorites and get on rides that we had not rode yet in a lot less time. The wait time was anywhere from 20 for the big thunder mountain, 5 minutes for Pirates of the Caribbean and Its a Small World, no wait for Aladdin's Magic Carpet Ride. Overall, we throughly enjoyed our vacation with Port Orleans Riverside and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning grounds, terrible dining experience”
Reviews.Author: melandtimgoeck
Reviews.Content: The grounds are stunning. Everything was well landscaped and the fresh smell of pine was everywhere. Our room was large enough for my husband and I and our children (2&6). We were in #37 in Alligator Bayou. It is a bit of a haul to the dining hall but that's ok as it off-set some of the calories we consumed. Housekeeping was mediocre and they left character shaped towels for us only one of the days. They have a nice playground near the pool area which was nice for down time. We got to use to the pool one out of the 9 days we were there becuase it was so frigid. That was nice as well. We rented a surrey one day and the kids loved it. We took the boat over to Downtown Disney one day and the ride was a nice change of pace. I am particular about the comfort of mattresses in hotels and was nicely surprised about their's. The dining hall was so busy it was like watching starving farm animals fight for slop. Seriously. There was no place to sit. The quality of the food at the quick service was no better than Mc Donald's and cost a heck of a lot more. The Disney parks were insane. For this being their "slow" time, I was shocked at the number of people. There were far too many pushy, rude people everywhere. The dining plan was a nice way to see the characters but would opt to dine out in the city on our own next time. To sum it up-I'd stay here again but would dine elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “DISNEY'S DISGRACE”
Reviews.Author: Indianatheart
Reviews.Content: This is run down-like the recession hit this the most-carpets from the 80's, towels with methicilin resistant staphylococcus aureus which will give you cellulitis and congested rooms that will give perfectly normal people claustrophobia. The worst nightmare is the service-bell service was terrible-bell boys were rude; receptionist behaved as if greeting prison inmates! Boatright restaurant is essentially a fast food joint with the price of a michelin star eatery. Dont stay here-PLEASE.

Reviews.Title: “Pick another place to say”
Reviews.Author: Flame89
Reviews.Content: This was my families first trip to Disney. I'm disgusted that I payed more money to stay in a ,moderate hotel" , wonder what the lesser is like? Payed extra for a water view, yeah we got that alright, it was of the POOL! Called the front desk 3 times to address this issue, nothing could be done. Tried to sleep past 9:00, Housekeeping knocked on our door 3 times in 25 minutes to clean! They drive their carts extrememly to fast! I have kids and every time I heard one flying through, I had to holler get off the path! Also upgraded to the Disney Deluxe Dinning, that was a big mistake. At there rest. they literally made us get all the drinks and food entitled to us. What the freak? If we don't want 6 drinks we don't want them! Had to throw ALOT of it out:( That restaurant was sooooooooooo packed you had to sit on the FLOOR, that is disgusting. The rooms aren't to clean either. Trust me STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, spotty housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: NatureMomma
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Alligator Bayou section for the Christmas holiday season. The property was landscaped nicely, as are all of the other moderates on Disney property. However, as we are from Louisiana, it was not as exotic to us as the others. It was shady- which would be a relief on hot days. It would be easy to get lost as there are not straight paths anywhere. The pools were nice, even the quiet pool right by our room. Housekeeping completely skipped our room one day and only did a so-so job on several of the other days. When we arrived our 'clean' room had leftover food crumbs on the chairs and wrappers under the beds. One day we found someone else's makeup in our room?? The bus rides to the parks (we did not go to Animal Kingdom) were very short. Holiday decorations are subtle. We brought our own for our room. The boat ride to Downtown Disney was fun but on colder nights- absolutely freezing. The food in the Quick-service food court was okay. T-Rex in DD was amazing- not for the faint of heart. The kids preferred Caribbean beach for the Nemo or pirate rooms and the pirate kids pool.

Reviews.Title: “2 Star Hotel for 3+ Price, Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: bemellow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on December 9th, 2010 to take advantage of the Disney Transportation for the Mickeyâ€™s Very Merry Christmas party and we were extremely disappointed in the quality of the room. My wife and I stayed at the All Star Sports last year for a week and felt that the Port Orleans Riverside was only marginally better. We felt as though the difference in price did not translate into a significantly better experience. Rooms: We felt as though we were staying in a 2 star motel. The room was very dated and looked like it was in need of a major renovation. The carpets were soiled and looked like they needed a thorough cleaning. There was little overhead light in the room. The bathrooms were very dated and didnâ€™t feel as though they were that clean. I know that on a Disney vacation you typically donâ€™t spend much time in the room, but when you are spending $150+ a night for a room in Orlando where there are many options to chose from, this room simply did not cut it. Grounds: Well kept. Location: The location was on the resort so you had access to the Disney buses. This worked out well with minimal wait times for the bus. Conclusion: Fortunately we only stayed at this resort for one night. We spent the other 2 nights of our trip at the Hilton Garden Inn Seaworld which was half the price and significantly better. The rooms were larger, updated, and it was convenient to I4 (which allowed us to travel back to Disney with ease.) I only mention this hotel to demonstrate that for amount of money we paid for the Port Orleans Riverside we just felt the value wasnâ€™t there. Save your money and stay off property or if you absolutely want to stay on, stay at one of the Value Resorts. The rooms are a bit smaller, but they are less expensive with all of the benefits of the transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Waste Your Money”
Reviews.Author: miller01Buffalo
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend trip and what a terrible experience. Arrived early in the am only to find that their computers were down so check-in took a long time. I did check-in online which helped save some time. Got a text message when our room was ready. Went back to the hotel only to find that our room keys didnt work. Called the hotel and was told someone will be down in 10 minutes to look into the issue. We waited 30 minutes and nobody showed up. Walked all the way back to the lobby (1/4 mile) only to wait another 30 minutes in line, missing our dining reservation. The conceirge desk was rude and unhelpful. A work order was put in again to fix the door so that our keys would work. That didnt last long, 2 days later and it was broken again. Was told the manager would call me and of course he/she never did. Was told i would receice a credit and of course did get that either. Rooms were old and outdated. Bedding was so worned, i think they are the originals. Carpet was so dirty. Needs a good shampooing. THe fridge had a huge build up of ice. It didnt work well. The bathroom was so tiny and dirty. The TV was a 32 inch back from the 80's. and the remote worked when it wanted too. I would not waste my money on this hotel again. It needs major updated and staff improvements.

Reviews.Title: “Gross Rooms but Decent Place”
Reviews.Author: rockface67
Reviews.Content: In short, the rooms are gross but the property is pretty nice with enough amenities to satisfy you while you are there. A large gift shop, a few pools, indoor and outdoor bars, a huge modern game room. The food we ordered at the bar one night was good, the dining hall or whatever you call it, is OK but it gets crowded and is poorly staffed. We were there as part of a large youth sports group. Our reservations got screwed up bad the first night resulting in us having to check out the next day and go to a new room. This blame is probably more on Disney Sports Travel but the hotel promised they would call us when the room was ready and the bags would be brought to the new room. None of this happened of course. Pissed me off, but whatever. We didn't spend much time at the hotel so the crappy room grew on us eventually. We paid group rates and for the cost, something like $450 a person for 6 nights with the Hopper passes was well worth it. I don't know the rates for regular visitors. if you haven't stayed here just know that you need to be prepared to walk as the hotel is a series of buildings not connected. you learn to get around, but I am glad I had a car. i would not stay here again. I actually think Disney hotels are stupid, I'd rather stay on that road by Downtown Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: HorribleExperience1
Reviews.Content: Our first famlity trip to Disney was crushed by the unprofesisional staff at Port Orleans Riverside!!! We had booked and payed extra to visit the Mikey's Very Merry Christmas Celebration and our flight was delayed, therefore we were late. Upon arrival, the front desk attendant recommended we check our bags at bell services so we could make our way to Magic Kingdom. We did as they recommeded, and was instructed to call with our luggage number when we arrived back to our room. We did so, and were on hold until 2:00a.m. trying to retrieve our luggage. I began calliing again at 5 a.m., and finally had to get ugly with the front desk. When they finally brought us our bags, we looked through them to find out that our MacBook Pro laptop and two iPads were stolen!! We filed a police report and our week was pretty much ruined!! We still have not been compensated for our loss. Our loss of equipment, and a so called "Magicall" experience that we feel we paid alot of money for. To say disappointed is probably a nice way of putting what we experienced and are still going through with the hotel and Disney :( I would NOT recommend this hotel. We later found out that they had been having a problem with vacationers' items being stolen!!

Reviews.Title: “Just ok! Very basic”
Reviews.Author: Reee65
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Port Orleans Riverside with extended family. We booked 3 rooms for 13 people earlier this year. We booked the rooms with the trundle beds. We double checked at check-in... when we got to the rooms...No trundle beds. They did deliver cots later that night. Rooms were very dated. Housekeeping was hit or miss depending on the day. They left 2 towels for 5 people . I had to call housekeeping to get more towels daily. We picked early December to avoid large crowds...Did not know they hosted a huge Pop Warner and Cheerleading competition first 2 weeks of December. Wish we would have known this when we booked. Hotel was very crowded with screaming 10 to 14 year old cheerleaders and their parents. Very crowed parks. Always at least a 20 minute wait for buses, a few times waited about 40 minutes for a bus to the parks. Lines for rides were really long. Dining package was worth the cost. Would choose a different hotel next time. But, my kids had a good time and thats what really matters to us!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: travelfamily1201
Reviews.Content: The magic express to and from the hotel was great. The bus/transportation to the parks was great â€“ this hotel is a great location for that. I am amazed at how efficient the system is and how well Disney moves people. The check in was great. I did the on-line check in but that line was packed so a regular check-in person took me. I didnâ€™t get any of the things I requested but it worked out just fine. The Quick Service restaurant was always busy and I found a wrapper in my salad which I was not too happy about. Buying the mug that you could refill was also great â€“ but you can only use it at the resort not at the parks. We got one and shared it with our family of four. The restaurant also looks like it needs a bit of an overhaul and a good cleaning! I think the people who work in the restaurant have just given up and have stopped caring. The hotel room was nice. A bit tight for our family of four but we were not in the room much. I have to say it was not the cleanest room I have been in and felt the need to keep my shoes on while walking around. We tipped our maid the first day and got a ton of towel art and then tipped her the rest of the week and really got nothing (not a big deal â€“ just an observation). The best part of this hotel is the swimming pool and the little park behind it. They always had someone cleaning it which was great. Having lifeguards at the pool was very helpful. Taking the boat to Downtown Disney was nice but not that efficient. Took the bus after that. The store at the resort is also great. The prices were the same as at the parks and downtown Disney so just saved up my shopping and did it at the end at the resort. All in all â€“ it was a nice place to stay but not the cleanest. Please feel free to send any questions â€“ I would be happy to answer them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: SteveAndrea08
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at a Disney resort (first one - All Stars Resort) and this was by far a much better hotel with more to do and friendly staff. Hotel. The hotel had a food court, restaurant, bar, games room, bike rentals, boat rentals, horse and carriage rides. there was free boat transport to and from Downtown Disney which made for a nice ride. The hotel was quiet and peaceful despite its size. The walks to and from the main building were picturesque. Room. We stayed in Magnolia Terrace. The room was basic but comfortable. We always had plenty of towels, soap and shampoo left for us. The room was clean and benefitted from being on a corner and therefore having two windows for additional natural light. The room had a fridge and coffee machine. We needed extra coat hangers but once requested they arrived in minutes. The air con also needed fixing and again once reported this was fixed within the hour. Hotel Staff The staff were incredibly friendly, polite and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble. Transport We used the Disney transport to and from the parks which was prompt as ever apart from one occasion when there was a new driver who turned up at our hotel in error with a bus load of people who were trying to get to Magic Kingdom and he was lost. Thankfully we were not on that bus and as far as we are aware they could still be riding around on that bus now!! Weather The weather was pleasantly warm (not hot) and sunny everyday apart the afternoon of our last day when it rained and the day we came home which was cloudy. Food Court We usually had breakfast at 7am and it was pretty quiet in the food hall at that time meaning it was easy to move around get served quickly and eat before the majority of people came in at around 8am. The food was fine although after two weeks was a little repetative.

Reviews.Title: “Come to Port Orleans; you will love it!”
Reviews.Author: PepperHudsonWI
Reviews.Content: We have been here over 10 times and have enjoyed all of our trips. We stayed at the French Quarter last March and thought it was a great place too. We prefer Port Orleans because we have been there so many times. I just read some reviews and I don't understand the negative ones; I guess you will always have people who just can't be pleased. We will be back again next year! This was our first time in Nov. and we really liked it; good weather and fewer crowds. It is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms a bit dated but complex amazing”
Reviews.Author: hsqos
Reviews.Content: We got really good deal through Walt Disney Travel Co, which included tickets, room $300 gift card which we used to buy food during the 6 day 5 night visit. The extra magic hours and free parking makes it a real benefit to stay in a Disney Hotel The rooms are a bit dated however the setting was lovely, it was a short walk across the river to the self service restaurant, shop and reception. The self service food was very good, pasta excellent and salad bar is really good. Breakfast was really busy and I was surprised how busy it was given it was November. I would stay there again if I got a similar deal however I don't think it is worth paying full price.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Portland_ORDdb
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Disney World. I had very high expectations based on the Disney web site, reviews and the friendly phone reservation attendant. We spent our first night in Orlando at the Hard Rock at Universal and loved it. From the beginning, the Port Orleans stay was a disaster. They were upgrading their computer system the day we checked in (without any advance warning to us). The system was up and down all day. Even though we completed the online check in it took us one hour to check in on site! They couldnâ€™t â€œseeâ€� our reservation since it wasnâ€™t accessible so could not honor any of our requests and no upgrades were given on this day. We checked into our room to find the bathtub almost overflowing with water. We pulled the plug to let it drain but had to call maintenance due to the constant drip of water. The maintenance man finished but left the tub dirty with debris. The cleaning staff did not follow up. The room was small and dark a stark contrast to the comparably priced Hard Rock. When I went back to complain about the entire experience up to that point, I received no apologies or sympathy from the front desk manager. The check-in area was filled with angry guests. They would not let us change rooms and offered up nothing for the inconvenience. One definitely got the feeling of the customer as cattle - move em in, move em out - without any regard to hospitality. Many of the front desk staff were inexperienced, grumpy, and were not given any authority to make any decisions. With each complaint, and there were many, the staff would excuse themselves, go to a back room for 4-5 minutes or so and then come back with an apology that there was nothing they could do. The next day our single key card stopped working (yes, one key card for a family of four). We didnâ€™t have time in the morning to deal with it since we needed to head to the park. Upon returning, I had to wait in a line at the Concierge desk and heard many raised voices with a common refrain of â€œthis is unacceptable!â€� Apparently the meal plans were also really screwed up and not recognized. People who paid in advance were forced to fork out money for their meals and save receipts for reimbursement. This time, after relaying my experience once again, I received four key cards with family membersâ€™ names printed on each and a credit for a half a nightâ€™s stay (of course this after the staffâ€™s 5-minute consultation with their supervisor). When we noticed kids walking around with â€œFirst Visitâ€� buttons, I went back once again to ask why we had not received them. After waiting in the concierge line for an hour (I know, over a stupid button, but this was my kidâ€™s first visit!) and sharing horror stories with other disgruntled folks in line, I was finally helped by a triage staff who approached me as I was at the front of the line and simply got me the buttons. Why they didnâ€™t think to send somebody out much earlier to triage the line is anyoneâ€™s guess. How long have they been in this business?? Next time I will stay at the Hard Rock and take a shuttle over to the park. Besides, I thought that The Wizarding World of Harry Potter was by far the best attraction among all of the Disney and Universal parks.

Reviews.Title: “magical as usual”
Reviews.Author: bob62_10
Reviews.Content: our rooms very nice clean well kept only wished tv were updated to flat screens thats the only reason i missed home other than that very family freindly kids and fellow travelers enjoyed pools choice of eatieries. way to go team disney.......................

Reviews.Title: “With the Dining Plan Never Miss!!”
Reviews.Author: Esperanza_Turkey
Reviews.Content: Thanks to many reviewers of TripAdvisor, we stayed at Disney's Port Orleans Resort, with free dining plan, it was worth every penny. First of all, the car park was so close to our room. The room was clean, only thing I didn't like was the pillow, it was so thick, but I didn't have time to ask to the front desk if they had different kinds of pillows, so can't complain about it. The hotel was close to the parks so we didn't have to wake up early, we used the restaurant for the breakfast only once, and had good omelets. There is a good shop, near the lobby where you can buy milk,soda etc. as well as good souveniers. We used the car we hired through Traveljigsaw(it was Dollar Rent a car) for going to the parks, and never had much problem in parking. We thought only maybe going to Magic Kingdom would be much easier if we had taken the shuttle, because, after parking your car at MK car park, you have to take monorail, or the boat, to reach the park, shuttles on the other hand go directly to the park. For the money we have paid for this hotel, including the dining plan, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT TRIP”
Reviews.Author: ivblueyes
Reviews.Content: Our room was just as expected, quaint and needed updating, but okay, since we were only in it for sleeping. The only drawback was I kept getting lost because the signs to and from the hotel room to the lobby were a bit confusing. The food in the Quick Service dining room was okay, but undercooked at times. Overall, a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Small but worth it”
Reviews.Author: Lunalakota
Reviews.Content: I'm a Disney nut. Last 2 trips were at deluxe hotels so since we are hardly at the hotel we opted for a moderate. Nice hotel. Rooms are very small. No closets or desk to work at. Basically you get what you pay for. Comfortable beds but the rooms could use a painting and new carpets or something. They just seemed "old". But in the end they were quiet and peaceful. Well worth the price to stay in "Disney" area.

Reviews.Title: “Family loved the place !”
Reviews.Author: mutter38
Reviews.Content: Family of five had a room in building 18 ,room 1818 our maid made us nice towels animals every day and kept us with toiletpapers , shampoo etc, and made our beds looks nice every day and we gave her tipping every day too :-) Trundel bed for teenager sort of ok, but nearly to short for him. the building 18 is near the food court and near a quiet pool If staying at a quiet pool You will need to bring the towels from Your room to the pool the same thing with life west they can get picked up around the bridge area, we never found any so ended up buying some swim ring for the two daughters. We had a lovely view of the river and the mill. We got ballons delivered to our room when we where away for dinings one evening wich I thought was a great gesture for our daughter that turned 5 years old , I had asked at the qonsiuer about that. The food court - always filled with people lots of people so a lot of quing to expect for getting the food and to pay for the food and for finding a table, and it didnÂ´t matter wich time on the day You come there it was filled. The bus service if staying here and going from the parks back to the room You should expect the bus to go to the other places before the reception area , wich took abit of a time. The bussÂ´s filled up and was a bit to crowded for my liking and very many times we where standing from the parks and back home, and I didnÂ´t feel very safe about that, so we ended up taking a taxi to many times. Its ok with the bussÂ´s using the aircon in daytime , but at night time it was frezing cold inside the busÂ´s so maybe bring a little jacket to have on You on the bus. Port Orleans Riverside with all the hotel blocks speard far away so I was very happy we stayed so near the foodcourt and reception area as we did. We where on the dining plan and the big pool has a nice play ground and slide and a bar, just remember to take money to that bar, because we could not use the snack plans to get a soda there . Would I stay there again , Yes, If I come with 5 people I would stay here again, but if we are fewer people I would prefer to stay at the French Quarter. My husbond would love to live at Port Orleans Riverside :-)

Reviews.Title: “Not our favorite Moderate”
Reviews.Author: garpts
Reviews.Content: My wife and I did a 'Disney for Adults' 5 night trip, and due to a really good special that included free dining we stayed at the POR. To keep things brief... The Magical Express service was great, we checked our bags at our home airport and didn't see them until a few hours after we checked in. Our check in was very smooth, we didn't know about the on-line check-in, but it still only took us about 5 minutes to get through the process We were in building 37, which was about the farthest away from everything, and had a corner king bed room. It was about a 5-8 minute walk to the main building, so although the resort is large, it's not unwalkable. If you have a disability, I would suggest a building closer to main building. The room was laid out fine, but there was some cleanliness issues with a little mold in the tub and our ceiling fan was very dusty. We had no issues with neighbor noise, although we thought they were banging on the wall the first night we got in only to find out it was firework percussion... :) We thought the food court was average. We were split on the cinnamin roles, the waffles were good, the coffee and fountain soft drinks were poor because of the water used. We didn't eat at the table service restaurant on-site. The lounge has a good variety of drinks, as did the bar lounge. The Disney Transportation was bad this time, we waited up to a half-hour for bus transportation at times. And our bus stop near our room was the 2nd to last on the runs so you had to plan accordingly. We used the main stop most of the time, and sometimes the buses only went to that stop. We used the water taxi several times to Downtown, they run every 10 minutes after 4:00pm. It's about 20 minutes each way to go this route, but it's nicer than the bus. We had a situation where we left a bag at a restaurant, and when we called the restaurant from the conscierge desk we were told they had it and were sending it to lost and found. The conscierge was very unhelpful. We asked, since the restaurant had the bag and knew it was our if they could ship it to our resort or hold it, and she said it was policy to send to lost and found. We went to lost and found the next day and they didn't have it, and said since there was food in the bag (chocolates) they wouldn't keep it anyway so it never was going to go there. This really annoyed us. The pool was nice, the hot tub small. They have towels at the pool which is helpful, and the bar there was nice. The grounds were well manicured, although there appears to be a lot of standing water on the property. Check-out went well, but not wonderfully as the computers were down. Again, we checked our bags at the resort and didn't see them until we got home which was great. If I had to rank the moderates I've stayed at - Coronado Springs, PO French Quarter, Carribean Beach and then PO Riverside would how I would lay them out, but Carribean Beach was quite a while ago so it may have slipped. I will do separate reviews of the restaurants, we did Fultons, The Yachtsman, Coral Reef, Raglan Road and Tutto's.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: Jeffroyboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here and we absolutely loved the subtle theming and the landscaping. It was my wife's first time at a Disney property and she was thrilled with the experience. We loved the boat ride to Downtown Disney which we enjoyed as a great and relaxing experience. We really took advantage of the pool area as it was great to swim, go down the slide, sit in the hot tub and then have a drink and relax. Finally, the staff was attentive, friendly and made us question why all service-based companies did not foster these characteristics in their employees.

Reviews.Title: “Gross Hotel”
Reviews.Author: michelle_wright3
Reviews.Content: We came for my Birthday. I grew up in California and been to Disneyland mank of times so I had to come and do the big park. I got upgraded when we got in because I had a small baby and needed to use an elevator to get up and down the stairs. We stayed at the mansion and our room was gross. There was only hair in the corner od the bath room floor, the floor although looked clean it felt dirty and gresy. The beds were nice and soft but I couldnt get over how dirty the floors were. The walk to the bus, and the food was far and really that just because it was all poorly designed. I did have a good time at the parks but they hotel was just plain dirty. We actually are going back in June but were staying at a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic pool, quiet at night, close to parks.”
Reviews.Author: disneyaddictweymouth
Reviews.Content: A TripAdvisor Member 3 visits in 3 years, we must like it! The resort is very well kept, there always seemed to be armies of men painting. We went in October 2007 for a 'once in a lifetime' holiday with First Choice for 14 nights. After reading reviews we decided to go for this one as we are light sleepers and value resorts had 'thin walls and large groups of loud teenagers and sports groups'. The French Quarter is best, better pool, not so sprawling, cheaper food court than Riverside, we stayed in block 2 close to pool and food court, still quiet at night. lovely walk along the river to Riverside. we also booked the 'Disney Dining Plan'. The first time we went we didnâ€™t know you had to book restaurants in advance, we managed to get most of what we wanted but ended up eating quite late and in resorts as parks were booked up, but this turned out to be good because we might not have thought of going to other resorts before and it really does add a new dimension to the holiday as the resorts are so interesting. I also like being nosey! We booked to go again 2 days after we got back, still jet lagged! We found a good price, Â£1,000 less than the one we had just been on for 3 weeks with free dining! The only drawback was it was in August and very hot, we also had 5 hurricanes in the 3 weeks, including the one we had to do an emergency landing in! we got diverted from Sanford after nearly landing for an hour (ran out of sick bags!) to Orlando International, and had to sit on the tarmac for 2 hours, (the plane, not us). Also very busy in the parks (and Magic Hours were very late, sometimes 12 midnight to 3am!) for 1st 10 days, after 1st September Q times were slashed. When we were on the 'Sorin' ride we saw Disneyworld all lit up for Christmas and i thought...... So we went again in December 2009. Again in the French Quarter this time block 3. I actually booked a cheap hotel with flights with TCD, (Â£1,300 for 4 of us!) but decided not to stay in the cheap one and booked the room direct with Disney, only Â£85 a night for the 4 of us with free counter service dining! Its well worth booking a Disney resort to get free dining, at low season the room is only Â£85 - Â£100 a night for 4 people with free lunch ($50) evening meal ($100 - $130), and 4 snacks ($8 - $20) nearly $200 = Â£150.00! Also Magic hours are worth the extra, day time 60 - 90 min wait, evening Magic Hours walk straight on! If you stay in a moderate resort you get free counter service dining. We paid for upgrade to table service last time but it is actually the same price to stay in a deluxe as it comes with table service. (We have booked Saratoga Springs for next year). I've done a separate review for our Dining experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Grounds and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: MrsT23
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Florida for Halloween and could not fault this resort. We had a fantastic time at this resort and loved the way it was spread out in its own grounds, it was so beautiful. We all loved the pool area and enjoyed early morning spa/hot tub(nearly always to ourselves). Would recommend Disney Dining Plan to UK visitors and booking restaurants early to avoid disappointment we were lucky enough to know this and went to some great places Cinderellas Royal Table is a must!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Setting, Convenient,,,,,Simple Rooms and amnenities”
Reviews.Author: LovinDisney_10
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a one week stay at Port Orleans Riverside. The property is beautiful and although it's a huge resort, it seemed peaceful and quiet......that is until you enter the dining area during breakfast. For the counter service option during breakfast time, plan on waiting in line for a good 20-25 minutes by the time you get your food, then you wait in line to get your beverage, then wait again to pay. Bus transportation was a bit slow at times. I would say our average wait time was 20 minutes to the various Disney Parks. We loved there was a boat to take you directly to downtown Disney. Rooms had older decor than I had expected. Carpeting was stained, the fan in the bathroom made a dripping sound all night long. It wasn't the cleanest, but not the dirtiest. House Cleaning was friendly and always willing to bring by extra towels and anything we needed. But don't bother complaining about anything because nothing will be done about it, i.e. the dripping sound from the fan and an issue with a food order. We would go back again, but if this is a 'Moderate Resort,' I'd think I'd hate to stay at one of Disney's 'Value Resorts".

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay at Port Orleans Riverside”
Reviews.Author: perkiegreeneyes
Reviews.Content: This is my second trip to Disney World, but my first time staying on Disney Property. I traveled with my mom, my 2 yr old daughter and my husband. We stayed at Port Orleans from October 1st-October 8th. We loved our stay at Riverside. The weather was perfect! 80's and low humidity. The Magical Express was awesome. BUSES: We did not have to wait long for the buses to and from the parks. We did not stay during peak season though. ROOM: We stayed at Oak Manor in the Mansion Section. The mansions are beautiful on the exterior. The rooms on the inside are average, but clean. They remind me of a bed and breakfast room. The beds were comfortable. BUGS: The only thing I complained about to my family was those love bugs. You will see them in the parks, on the resort and outside your room. They will fly in the room when you open the door. I killed like 10. I hate bugs, but it was not too bad. I just had to shut the door, spot them, and kill them. I'll take Love Bugs over Bed Bugs any day. RESORT: The resort itself is beautiful. The landscaping was breathtaking. I loved the river, the pathways, the trees, and watching the ferry pass by. The scenery make you feel so relaxed. POOLS: My husband enjoyed swimming at the main pool at night, but it was too cold for me. I loved the hot tub by the main pool at night. It was HOT, but felt good after a long day at the parks. We all swam in the quiet pool at night. The water felt cold, but It probably feels nice during the day. FOOD: We all enjoyed eating at both food courts. Riverside had alot to offer. Make your own pasta, deli sandwiches, pizza, and a bakery.. French Quarter has a great cheese steak. My husband and I loved it! The Beignets were okay. I never had them before so I have nothing to compare them to. I might have enjoyed them more with a cup of coffee. NAVIGATING: The walk to FQ was nice. I never got lost or confused walking around either resort sides. If you did get lost, there are signs everywhere. LAUNDRY: We did laundry while we were there. It was located in a close and convenient building by our quiet pool. OVERALL: We are planning on returning this February to Port Orleans-Riverside. I'm not interested in trying another moderate resort because in my opinion they don't have more to offer. Riverside has more food options with one sit down restaurant and two food courts, two main pools and 5 quiet pools, on time transportation, a free ferry to downtown Disney, breathtaking views, and a relaxing environment much needed after a long day the the parks. I am interested in trying other Deluxe Resorts, but I don't think they are worth it for the money (an extra $1000) even during value season. I'd rather use that $1000 towards another trip to Disney at Port Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Port Orleans Riverside!”
Reviews.Author: mc10t
Reviews.Content: My family (me, husband, 4 year old son and my mom) stayed at Port Orleans Riverside Oct 30-Nov 6, 2010. The grounds are beautiful! The pool was so much fun, especially the waterslide! It was a great escape after exciting, yet tiring days at the parks. The decor is very subdue and peaceful. I would definitely recommend this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Real nice place to stay with kids with that southern feel, y'all !!!”
Reviews.Author: disneyrulesNJ
Reviews.Content: We traveled Nov. 2nd to Nov 8th and upon our arrival, which was at approximately 10am, we were met by a very courteous cast member who checked us in. The wait was about 10 minutes. Surprisngly the room was ready and we were able to get our room early. Anticipating problems from reviews I read on this site, I was pleasantly surprised by how clean the room was. Yes they need to be updated and yes there is a very very slight musty odor in the room (bring or request an air freshner, we did) but the cleaning staff surely did a great job with what they had to work with. Outdated doesn't mean not clean. Extra towels were provided which never was a problem for the length of our stay. We had our beds made and the room cleaned every day. As far as some comments posted here about not getting their rooms cleaned or vacumed , all you have to do is pick up the phone and push 1 button for housekeeping and they will be more than happy to oblige. TIP: Hunt down your housekeeper and meet her. Tell her your needs & concerns and you will be surprised at the service you will receive (a couple of extra bucks wouldn't hurt either). We stayed in the Magnolia Terrace (Bldg #85, 1st floor). Try to get the second floor, we had to deal with the sound of the toilette draining when it was flushed. Very close to the main pool and the lobby. The pool is nice and very warm. Average temperature was 65 degrees during the day. Although the East Depot is closer, use the South Depot because that's the 1st stop it hits when it enters the Riverside complex. If the hotel is crowded you will understand why. I agree with the person who posted the comment about the staff not being too thrilled to be there but I only encountered that at the River Roost, they are interns from colleges around the country. I will say they were very friendly when engaged in conversation. I would probably chalk that up to their supervisory staff. Be sure to get all the park maps ahead of time and plan. Also if you have the dining plan be sure to understand it and figure out what eateries accept it. Overall it's a nice place to stay. Are there better, of course but for the price it was well worth it. If you are like us you are not going to be spending much time in the room anyway. If you feel you need to be waited on hand and foot don't bother, it's not that kind of place. That's probably why there were so many nice people at this resort. TIP: If you encounter a long wait for your bus return ride from the's parks take a cab. It should cost you about $10 and if it's late and your kids are exhausted it's worth it. Be aware of the gypsy drivers, they are in the parking lots and they will charge you about $15.

Reviews.Title: “not impressed”
Reviews.Author: saturncmc
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to staying at a moderately priced hotel instead of the economy ones I am used to at Disneyworld. First of all, the rooms need updating and the bathrooms are shabby. The place is so spread out that the walk to our room was long and tedious after a long day in the parks. There are numerous pools, but towels are only provided at the 'main' pool and there is a pool bar only at the main pool, too. I think the economy hotels are cleaner and the buildings are closer to the consession buildings. I did not have the energy to even walk to get a cup of coffee because of the distance. The food court was extremely crowded in the morning with long lines even to get a juice out of the refrigerator. I will not stay here again nor do I recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the resort, but needs to modernize”
Reviews.Author: grouchydad57
Reviews.Content: This was my families first trip to any of the Disney resorts so I really have nothing to compare this to but I figured I would provide my feedback. Our family trip consisted of Myself and My wife, my 65 year old Mom and my 11 year old twins and 8 year old son. We arrived around mid-morning and check in was easy, although the check in attendant was not the most welcoming person in the resort and were assigned 2 adjacent rooms in section 37. Not being at the resort before, we were provided a map and although it did not look like a far walk, it felt like a lifetime to get from the lobby (and restaurant area) to our place. We got to the room and asked to be relocated since my Mom was not able to walk that far to get to the lobby and there is no means of transportation thoughout the resort for the elderly or people that have trouble walking for a long period. The second check in attendant was a bit nicer (not much though) and relocated us to an area we thought was closer to the lobby and restaurants (Lodge 17) and although it was shorter, it was still over a mile walk. that is not an exageration either! Once checked in, we headed to board the bus on the South depot to head to Epcot and looked forward to a start of a great vacation. Not a long wait (about 15 minutes) but a packed bus since the buses pick up passengers for the Riverside resort (4 depots) and then go to the French Quarter resort too. If you are last to be picked up and have a large party, it could be an uncomfortable ride. After our rained out visit at Epcot, we returned to the resort to grab dinner on our meal plan. The huge cafeteria is ALWAYS packed between normal rush hours and very difficult to get a seat for 6 of us. The food in the main dining area was mediocure at best. Nice selection, but not very good. If you are a buffet lover then you will not find this place to be all that bad, but we are not buffet style eaters and were not at all impressed with the food there. The best meal was breakfast because the kids loved eating the Mickey Mouse shaped waffles. My wife and i did not eat there after our fist day. The other restaurant on site at the resort (Boat Rites) was fair to moderate also. OK menu, but it appeared to be the same kitchen staff that works at the cafeteria style restaurant. Good deserts here, but not a very good meal overall. As far as the rooms go. I agree with most of the other reviews. The rooms are a bit outdated and need to be renovated. the bathroom and shower areas were clean, but the hoousekeeping services were not very good. Although they did make our beds daily (not sure they changed the sheets each day), it appears they do not vacuum or remove any finished glasses or plates left in the room. My wife and I had our drink glasses from the bar on the first night there in the room with us when we checked out on Saturday! You would think they would take the empty glasses after the 2nd day they were left there. We decided to see how long it would be until they removed them and sure enough, they were still there when we checked out. If you are planning on visiting this resort, please be prepared to walk. Since there is no transportation between buildings, your venture to the lobby area could be a long one depending on where your lodge is located. Also, i recommend renting a car. Although buses are convenient, you are at the mercy of waiting constantly and then risking them being very crowded. The Riverside and French Quarter resorts are VERY crowded places, so there are many people trying to do the same as you and get on the fastest bus to get to your final location. With a rental car, it may cost a little more money, but you have some more freedom and it is worth it it in long run. Lastly, although I was on vaction, I was trying to stay plugged into the happenings at the office but the resort charges $9.95 per day for internet service and it is very shotty to say the least. On several occasions, I had to re-pay because the internet service would stop working during the 24 hour period. The front desk staff said that has happened before and they did reinburse me for the double charges but it was still not something I can say worked well. For all the money we are spending, the least they could do is offer free wired internet service (since there is no wireless access ANYWHERE). Based on our experience, we would not stay at this resort again strictly because of how crowded it is. We visited in an "off peak" time and it was crowded then, i could not imagine how it would be if we were there during a peak period.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, everything you could want.”
Reviews.Author: busymama03
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice and clean, a step up in every way from the disney value hotels. Very quiet!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort”
Reviews.Author: bjtjcarter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at riverside Sept. 20th to 28th. Clean room through our hole stay thank you. We requested Alligator Bayou building 25, 2nd floor & a corner room and that is what we got. The walk to the main building was a little longer than I though but no problem. We had a pool just outside our building that was great. My two girls ages 9 &7 went for a swim every night before bed. I Love Alligator Bayou. We stayed 4 years ago at riverside in Parterra that was our first stay in Disney and we loved that too. Big difference between the two places but love both places. Alligator Bayou felt very comfortable. The only thing that put me off was on our second night there while the girls and I were at the pool my refillable mug went missing. I took my receit to the supervisor at the food court and she told me flat out that there was nothing she could do. I get one each time we go to disney we use them alot at home but not this trip I came home with out one. We were on the dining plan. I would not even think about going to disney without it. We ate at the Boatwright My girls opened the dining room that day food as alwas great. We also ate at the - Crown and Rose (yes to the food) Cinderella Royal Table ( enjoyed it very much but it is not something I plan to do again) Whispering Canyon Cafe ( loved it will do again great food loved the resort very much) Mama Melrose ( enjoyed the food alot) Biergarten was a nice place we eat to much so did the kids did not mind sitting with another family of four. Plaza Restaurant food was very good long wait to get in almost 1 hour wait. Big rain storm hit just after we checked in and no one seamed to want to leave in the rain. But we had to wait in the rain until we were called in for supper. But we didnot come across any restaurant that we didn't like. We went to the French Quarter's pool one morning. The girls wanted to try out the slide there. They say it was ok. But the love bugs were every wheres and it was Bad and I mean it was really Bad they were all over you. No thank you. All and All We will be back Because we love riverside. But we will not be back in September much to hot for us. I would say end of Oct. to the end of Nov. or Jan. and Feb.

Reviews.Title: “Probably would try another resort!”
Reviews.Author: karona118
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 days at POR. Originally was going to stay at CBR but was told by friends that they liked POR and had more negative to say about CBR..so we went with their recommendation. It was nice - nothing great. Rooms were like a hotel, no real Dinsey theme. The night we checked in there was not enough help at the front desk and we waited awhile to be checked in and the staff was not very friendly. Our flight landed at 7:45 pm and our bags showed up almost 4 hours later. Got really tired of the food after 4 days. These are all typical comments i see on all the reviews of the resorts. It was a nice place but would try CBR next time to see for myself if the reviews are pretty much the same at all the resorts

Reviews.Title: “Love love love this resort”
Reviews.Author: mommysmail
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port orleans riverside Oct. 19-24th. I was so nervouse because I wasnt sure if we would like it, in the past we have always stayed at the value resorts and loved them because they were so Disney themed. Port orleans was wonderful though, a lot of walking but beautiful grounds. Its was very nice to come back from the parks to the relaxing style of a resort. The gift shop is so cute. THe pool is great for the kids with a cool waterslide. I'm so glad we stayed here and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay at a beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: jen76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans Riverside for the second time Oct 7-16th. Our first visit in 2008 was in the Alligator bayou section building 39. This visit we were in Magnolia Terrace building 85 which is on the water and very nice. I much prefer the Mansion section. While the rustic outdoor look of the bayou is unique I enjoy the decor and style of the Mansions. Upon entering our room there was a card saying that the carpets had just been cleaned and may still be damp and I was pleased to know they were freshly cleaned. While our room was kept "clean", the housekeeping is mediocre at best. We never received any towel buddies despite leaving tips and our family who was also staying at the Resort in building 27 in the bayou received as many as 5 in one day. Not a big deal but my kids looked forward to getting towel buddies and were disappointed daily after returning from the parks. We also saw a handful of small lego parts from the previous guests on the bathroom floor behind the toilet. Yuck! My daughter spilled a small amount of powder on the floor in between the beds on about day 5 of our trip and it remained there until we checked out. I guess housekeeping didn't vacuum the last half of our stay. My Mom had a bag of personal items on the bathroom counter and one day she noticed things moved around and the bag unzipped not like she had left it so we wondered if housekeeping looked around in it. Nothing was taken so no harm done. Bus service is nice and all but if we used the depot closest to our room we would definately have been standing the majority of the time so we walked to the main stop at the front of the main building to catch the bus before it stopped at the rest of the depot's. One day we waiting an hour to get a bus to the Magic Kingdom and watched while at least 2 buses came and went for Epcot and Animal Kingdom. After that day Disney had a cast member there daily to coordinate buses which was really nice to see and it helped alot. Bottom line is I really love this Resort and the problems we encountered were minimal in comparison to all the wonderful things this Resort has to offer. My kids loved the pools and I enjoyed the atmosphere, the music and meeting people from all over the Country. The food court was good and Boatright's was OK- not very good service the night we were there. Server was very busy. I will definately stay here again when we get the chance to go back. Would also love to see a renovation of the Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed Port Orleans Riverside”
Reviews.Author: oscarsmom06
Reviews.Content: Just home from 8 days at WDW staying at Port Orleans Riverside. After reading some of the negative reviews I was a bit nervous about what our room would be like. Arrived approx. 11 am and our room was ready and not too far of a walk from the lobby. Had requested Magnolia Terrace near the east bus depot and got just that. Room was clean and comfortable. I would say that some of the furnishings could stand to be updated but a clean room is more important to me. Staff was always helpful even when calling for more towels at 10 o'clock one evening. Used the quiet pool next to our building a couple of times, nice to have the laundry room right there so the kids could keep swimming while I checked on the laundry. Buses were a bit overcrowded at times... probably my only complaint. All in all a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Rockette1
Reviews.Content: Lovely surroundings, very well themed, rooms were good, as were the pools. We had the free quick service dining plan which worked well but the food in the hotel restaurant was the same every day. Yes, the idea is to eat in the parks and DTD but a little variation would not hurt.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: Tiggerfan42
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at this hotel. It's well situated. The rooms are a nice size and ours included a trundle bed and small fridge. This is Disney's cheapest moderate resort. Our room was clean and Julio made sure we had enough towels for all five of us. The cafeteria food is average and what you would expect. We were on the food plan and got more than our money's worth. We arrived back at the hotel after midnight almost every night and it's very safe. We were close to the main building. The kids loved the pool, which is average. Our room was clean and we were only there for a small amount of time to sleep. My only complaint is that our beds weren't level. The head was a bit lower than the foot.

Reviews.Title: “Disney calls this a moderate resort. I'd hate to see a value resort.”
Reviews.Author: sammi321
Reviews.Content: Pros: The hotel grounds were very well maintained. The exterior was beautiful. It was very picturesque. There is a bar and two restaurants in the hotel. The laundry room was more than adequate with 10 washers and 16 driers. Cons: The beds were very firm (hard) and felt cheap. The tag on the mattress indicated it was made in 2004. I also found it odd that the tag listed the mattress as plush, but it clearly was not. The sheets did not fit the beds and exposed a foot of the mattress cover at the foot of the bed. It was itchy on bare feet. There was no free Internet and no business center with Internet access. I was there for five nights, but housekeeping only left soap and shampoo the first two days. No pens or note paper in the room. The TV was old and not HD. There was not a safe in the room. There was a sign on the room door that asked guests to go green and turn off lights and turn up the A/C when leaving the room for the day, but one day when I returned to the room housekeeping had left on every single light (literally) in the room and turned the A/C down as low as it would go. They also left the curtains open so everyone passing by could see into the room. One of the A/C units for the vending machine area was malfunctioning and made loud noise constantly. There is no fitness center. There was mold over most of the tiles in the shower. It was so thick in places there was no way housekeeping could have missed it. It must have been months since the shower was last cleaned well. You get free bus service to the Disney parks, but in exchange you give up many of the amenities that you get in other, even cheaper hotels. The exterior of the hotel is immaculate. They should get the people that take care of the exterior to also take care of the rooms. The hotel needs to be renovated.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms provided a place to rest”
Reviews.Author: lamersont
Reviews.Content: We have been to Disney five times in the last seven years. We have stayed in several locations. We are a family of 6 (one infant), so these rooms were fantastic with two beds, a trundle, and a pack-n-play. There was a small refrigerator in the room. It was not too much larger than the value rooms at Disney. The overal theme was nice, but we spent most of our time at the parks, so we did not get to enjoy the perks of the resort. I would not choose this resort over the value resort if I had a family of 4. The value resorts also provide more of a "Disney" theme if you have small children. Overall, I don't think it is worth the extra money if you can fit in a value resort room.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: rk74
Reviews.Content: So looking through trip advisor before booking, we thought this hotel would be a safe bet on price and what you get for your money. Now that we've returned home, it's safe to say we were disappointed by the hotel. Here's why,... - For a Disney hotel, there was no Disney magic other than the friendy staff in the main shop. - Most other staff were unhelpful and/or not very welcoming. - Food resembled that of a large canteen ( although we never tried the main rest.) - The room had no signs other that the soap bars, that you were in a Disney hotel. Close the curtains and you could have been in any low end hotel in the world. - Room was relatively clean, but housekeeping only ever made the beds. No evidence of any other cleaning done during our 3 day stay ( even found items belonging to previous guests just under the bed ). - No travel cot even though we had requested it prior to our arrival. - Bell staff (other than one or two) gave the impression their job was to stand about and do nothing all day. You felt that you were encroaching on their time by asking for help. The good points (there were some).. - Nice environment. A walk along the riverside to get to the main building was nice. - Plenty pools. - Bus Service to other Disney parks and Downtown disney was good. ( although we did have one driver give us some incorrect information which cost us some valuable time on our last day). Also, bus service isn't really related to the hotel. Would we stay here again ? - Not likely. It wasn't the worst hotel we've stayed in, but it certainly wasn't the best. Value for money wasn't really that great and the hotel staff didn't really seem to know anything about anything which wasn't in their hotel. Would I recommend it ? - No. But like in all things, individual taste and experiences can differ.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home”
Reviews.Author: dixietrouper
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I have stayed at this hotel, both times with 3 adults and 2 children. The trundle bed is a wonderful addition to the room, and easily slides out of the way when not needed. My MIL lost her ring in the bed, and my husband took the bed apart looking for it. It was very clean underneath, and appeared to have recently been moved to clean under. The only downfall that we have found is when you stay in the Alligator Bayou rooms (which have the trundle beds and sleep 5), you are often a 10 minute walk from the food court and main pool. The small quiet pools are very nice and well maintained however, and are at most a minute walk from most rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere- ok rooms”
Reviews.Author: krhst25
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 day vacation to Walt Disney World. We arrived late and were promptly checked in. Bell services drove us to our room. He was very nice and informative. The room was ok. It seemed a little dated. The beds were a bit small. Cleaning services were sporadic. One day they were great the next day they were lacking in service. For example, we didnlt get soap or shampoo on several days. The room smelled musty if we didn't run the fan. We were in building 24- far away frm the main building,but fairly close to the west depot. The bell services were all very kind and courteous. We loved the pool (although it was fairly cold) and slide. The food court was great-all you can eat pasta is a bargain. The staff would routinely play games with the children- that was great when we wer waiting for the bus to the airport. We truly enjoyed the atmosphere at the resort, but were not crazy about the rooms. We will probably choose another resort next time.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, Beautiful, Quiet”
Reviews.Author: amandasprice
Reviews.Content: The rooms here were nothing fancy. The differences between this room and the one at the value resort were: we had a double sink, close to 1 of the 4 bus stops, and a frig in the room at no extra charge. The resort itself was BEAUTIFUL, well maintained, and very VERY peaceful. We loved that part enough to stay there again as opposed to a value resort, even though the rooms were not much different.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place BUT...”
Reviews.Author: anextremeskier
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at Port Orleans Riverside before so we decided to take our children down (who are 1 1/2 and 3 years old). We were very disappointed with staying here. Stayed here from Oct 7 to 17th 2010. I called a few days ahead to request Magnolia Terrace since it's where we decided to try if we ever returned. Upon arrival everything was perfect as far as check in, getting the room, and the grounds were still beautiful. When we finally did get our room it was filthy. The border around the ceiling was peeling off as well as there having mold or mildew spots above the border the entire length around the ceiling. The in room fridge was frozen solid with a huge yellow stain on the ice inside, as well as hair inside on all four sides of it. Soda or juice was spilled from a prior occupant in the air conditioner. Food was on the floor in the corners of the room with ants feeding off of it, as well as more hair in both sinks and the bath tub. I called the front desk and requested another room, thinking that would fix the problem. Another room was given in the same building, but had more of the same problems. Fridge was ok, still had mold or mildew around the ceiling border and the border itself was coming off the walls. Hair in both sinks again as well as the tub. The ceiling fan which we would rather use instead of the airconditioner had atleast an inch of dust caked on the entire thing. We decided to stay in the room and cleaned what we could (which we shouldn't do since we payed for this). I left a note for the housekeeper to clean the ceiling fan and they did which was fine. We only had one towel made animal on the bed once throughout the entire trip, and even that was chessy. They just glued fake eyes and put stickers all over it. All in all this is a nice resort on the outside, but seriously needs some major renovations. We are there to sleep yes, but were worried about creepy crawlies at night since the rooms are poorly taken care of, but we didn't have any of those. Grounds (beautiful), rooms (horrible), would we stay there again? NO.... (unless they renovate).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel-only worth it if you get free Disney dining”
Reviews.Author: jandy23
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean and had a few extra nice touches such as a curtain diving the sinks from the sleeping portion allowing for privacy and a place to turn on lights without waking everyone else. We were in a building (24) that was about a 15 minute walk from the main pool and restaurants. There was a perfectly good, normal hotel pool right behind our building and it was only a 2 minute walk to catch the shuttles which was nice. We got the free Disney Dining plan which was fantastic-we had plenty of food. I have mixed feeling about the free shuttles-we never waited less than twenty minutes for a shuttle to a park and we could have easily driven there faster. However, at the end of the day, we usually waited ten minutes or less (even on crowded days) to ride the shuttle home. Many times we were standing though since they were so crowded (and this is NOT the busy season). Bottom line-nice hotel but not worth the extra expense unless you get the dining plan for free.

Reviews.Title: “Will definately stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Sloanrangers
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading many favourable reviews and were not disappointed. We stayed in the Magnolia Bend area of the resort in the Parterre Place building. We felt we were ideally situated as we were only a short stroll across the bridge to the main food court, restaurant and shop etc but the building still had a lovely tranquil feel. The room was plenty large enough and the beds comfy. The theming here is beautiful - we had the Sassagoola River passing outside our building and beautiful fountains nearby. We had a quiet pool nearby which was clean and handy to grab some peace and quiet after a busy day at the parks. We had the Disney Quick Service Dining Plan as a freebie for staying in this resort but upgraded to the Disney Dining Plan so that we got a Quick Service and Table Service meal each day as well as a snack. We thought the Dining Plan was great and made good use of it in various restaurants during our stay - inlcuding hopping over to other Disney resorts to try out their restaurants! Have to agree that the bus service can be a bit erratic and we often had to wait ages for a bus only to find it was either full or 2/3 would turn up together! On the whole, we really liked this resort and felt it was much better than others in the same category such as Caribean Beach where we've stayed in the past. The resort was clean and tidy and we found all of the staff to be polite and helpful. The water taxis to Downtown Disney were great and made a nice alternative to the buses - in fact during the evenings they were more regular! Would definately stay at this resort again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: macymichael
Reviews.Content: Disney Port Orleans Riverside was one of my favorite parts of our vacation. It was very clean and had a great location. The whole place makes it easy to relax after playing. The food court has amazing food with so many choices. The only issue we had was with the front desk staff. They are not helpful, and almost rude. We had a hard time finding our room at first since the front desk does not give directions and we took the wrong exit off the bus the first night as it was not explained that there are several different bus depots. But other than that our stay here was wonderfull. If we return to Disney I would stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Layout and Beauty of this Resort is Simply Stunning.”
Reviews.Author: jinx1_8
Reviews.Content: WE LOVE RIVERSIDE! The layout and beauty of this Resort is simply stunning. Yes it's big - but that's the point. It is like staying in a small town with winding paths, rivers, trees, gardens etc. It manages to feel cosy and intimate as the buildings are set amongst the trees and each area has it's own pool (Six pools inc. Old Man Island - good fun to try them all and find your favourite). This was our fourth visit - first time without children and to be honest we came back more for POR than to visit the Parks. We have always stayed in Alligator Bayou before - which was fine -(although I think the Hickory bed frames are a theme too far) so requested a room in Magnolia Terrace this time. Lovely location, Oak Manor 2nd floor corner room overlooking river. The rooms are similar but furnishings seemed more luxurious and grown up. Beds were very comfy too. A few things we've learnt that may be useful: Buses - Coming back from Magic Kingdom after fireworks bus queue to Riverside was huge! Would have taken at least an hour in line to get on bus - checked out queue to French Quarter and hardly any wait so we took that bus. Driver was kind enough to drop us (and quite a few others - we all cheered and clapped him) off at Riverside but you can either catch the boat up to POR which goes every 10 minuites between 4p.m. and 11 p.m. or walk along the River path - not as long as we expected - takes about 10 minuites stroll to main building. Meal Plan - We had the free meal plan and often used snack option for breakfast e.g. Bagel or Cinnamon Roll and had with a coffee in our room as we got ready for the day. We found the best place to eat counter service was Wolfgang Puck Express at Downtown Disney - thoroughly recommend it - good quality well prepared food. We did have the full service option but quite frankly we wouldn't bother again - lots of restuarants were disappointing - even Californian Grill and Brown Derby the food and service left much to be desired. I think if we went again we would pop into themed restaurants out of peak time and just have a starter or dessert and enjoy the atmosphere. Boardwalk - If you are spending a day at Epcot and the crowds all get too much - take a break - catch the boat at the International Gateway between England and France and hop over to The Boardwalk for a stroll along the Prom and a cool glass of something outside Big River Grill and watch the world go by. Swim/Jacuzzi - We found the best time to go was pre 10 a.m. we were the only ones there. Suprisingly, a Disney moderate, family friendly hotel can be romantic ( : Hope you enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly and helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: wood1961
