Reviews.Content: great disney place to stay. good points staff pools games room for kids and boat to downtown disney. for nice just to walk round as its very quite and well kept grounds. only down point i would say is buses. you can wait for a while then when one turns up people worry that they have just got there they will just push in. i would say a line system should be used like they do at all stars. other slight thing, not that its bad is the food. if you are staying for two weeks it can be very same old thing by the time the first week has past. i think more things on offer at food court would be nice. but saying that never had a bad meal. i would say even after what ive just said is make sure you have dinning plan its great.

Reviews.Title: “Our not so magical stay at Port Orleans”
Reviews.Author: clturpin
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth visit at a Disney Resort but our first stay at Port Orleans. My family and I were disappointed. The furniture was scarred and dirty, the carpet was soiled, centipedes invaded our room nightly, and the housekeeping staff needs to take more pride in their job. The grounds and outside of the buildings was attractive and set a relaxing tone. The bus service at this resort was extremely poor. We waited for very long periods of time each day for a bus to take us into the parks. The food court is small but adequate. I do not think we still at this particular resort again when others in the moderate category are much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Will return to POR!”
Reviews.Author: trvlgirlmq
Reviews.Content: Our first onsite stay at WDW was at Port Orleans Riverside. We were 2 adults and 3 kids in the AB section. Room was smallish but we did not spend a lot of time in it. Beds were firm and comfortable for us. The trundle is shorter than a regular bed but my teenager still found it comfortable. The fridge was handy to hold milk, juice and water for morning breakfasts in the room. The double sinks are great for larger families. We loved the pool! The slide was a big hit and th hot tub was great for soaking tired feet at night. The food court and Boatwrights were both great meals. The grounds are quiet, peaceful and really beautiful. We plan to stay again on our next Disney vacation.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay was just as great!”
Reviews.Author: DisneyVaca
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Port Orlean's Riverside. We love this resort - it is quiet, it is spread out, but you are still close to all the action! We enjoyed the small pool in our cluster of rooms and also the larger pool which was re-furbished recently. When we go to Disney World, we really only use our rooms to sleep, so this resort is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, tranquil property and very family-friendly”
Reviews.Author: locolola
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th consecutive stay at the Port Orleans Riverside in Disney. You can't beat the value for a moderate hotel. The grounds are simply beautiful. Walking around the hotel is very tranquil, especially at night. The rooms are comfortable and clean. They could use a reno. soon, though. The food court has a great variety of foods for every liking. It does get busy in there so it's best to eat breakfast and dinner earlier rather than later. The staff is very friendly and accomodating. Pools are great. Activities are always fun. Our favorite time to visit Disney is around the holidays....shorter lines at the parks, cooler weather and breathtaking decorations.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews scared me, but I was impressed!”
Reviews.Author: bucknasty94
Reviews.Content: Traveled with our 3 and 18 mo. old. Resort is beautiful. Front desk staff were not very helpful or pleasant. Only bad thing I can really say. We stayed in building 24 in the Alligator Bayou and the walk was FAR! It was a pain being so far away from the lobby and riverboat. We were the 1st to be picked up in the morning and the bus would be full by the last stop- it was nice to always have a seat! Rooms were clean, no complaints. We had a pack n play and that was clean- easy to set up. Food was GREAT at the food court! My favorite was the river boat to Downtown Disney. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Has it's pros and cons - With small kids? - go to another hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Revonse
Reviews.Content: Beautiful landscaping and great rooms, but the whole hotel is HUGE. If you're going with young kids (or others that can't walk long distances easily) choose the sister resort, Port Orleans French Quarter. Rooms were great and spacious. The best thing was the trundle bed that pulled out from one of the beds - perfect size for our 3yo to sleep in. Only the area of the resort called Alligator Bayou has the trundle beds - and NO elevators in that section - so beware if you have strollers with sleeping children at the end of the day. The bus stop was near by, but the main building and also the large pool was quite a haul. There was a smaller pool, no frills, close to our section of buildings, but it was just a pool - no hot tub, no towels, no exciting decor. There were bathrooms/changing rooms right there though. Buses only picked up from our hotel to go to the parks, but on the way home often our resort stop was combined with the sister resort, Port Orleans French Quarter. When the resorts were combined they picked up FQ first, then Riverside, which would have been fine had they reversed the hotel stops, but they then attempted to drop off FQ patrons who were seated, before the Riverside who were standing blocking the way out. More than once the bus had to nearly unload and reload for the FQ stops. All that said, the hotel staff was great. Delivered packages that we had ordered right to our door. Carted and checked our baggage straight through to home on our last day. Huge food court and nice atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort”
Reviews.Author: DallasDisneylover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at POR for 7 nights. We arrived at about 11:45 a.m. and were thrilled that our room was ready for us, even though we were earlier than the 3 p.m. check-in. We were originally assigned to the Alligator Bayou rooms. However, upon opening the door and seeing the rustic furnishings, I immediately called the front desk to request a room in Magnolia Bend. I didn't want to feel as though I was roughing it for a week and we were again pleasantly surprised to find Disney to be very accommodating. They quickly rerouted us to Magnolia Bend, with a room ready for us. We loved having an in-room refrigerator and the pool and laundry were very close. The walk to the main pool and dining hall was lovely and relaxing. In the mornings the dining hall is very crowded with limited seating, even until about 11 a.m. We ate on the patio one morning and realized later that they open Boatwright's for extra breakfast seating. Boatwright's doesn't serve at that time; they simply allow you to bring your food from the other restaurant. We suggest sharing meals as some of the portions can be large. Disney frowns on sharing meals, especially if you're on the DDP, but it really helps to stretch those credits. Sharing a Quick Service meal is possible--but they won't let you share a Table Service meal. And remember that if you're fortunate enough to get the free dining plan, tips are generally not included and the 18-20% suggestion can be costly, so make sure you figure that into your budget. Dining at Cinderella's Castle will cost you two credits per person and the tip is included, along with a souvenir photo. We only waited an extended amount of time for one shuttle to Magic Kingdom and when the crowd grew restless, three shuttles showed up. We stayed near the North Depot and it was never crowded. Expect to stand on the buses, though, on weekend stays as this is quite a large resort. The main pool temperature was frigid, even on hot days due to the water slide and fountains. The pool near us was quiet and warm. We loved having the use of pool towels and never had to use our room towels to dry off. The pools are lovely and have ample seating, much of it shaded.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: anjuliw
Reviews.Content: We picked Port Orleans Riverside partly on cost (Yacht Club unfortunately out of price range even for honeymoon!), partly on location - loved the idea of getting a boat to Downtown Disney, and partly for the romantic riverside setting. It was absolutely everything we wanted it to be! The cast members at the resort were super friendly and really spoilt us when we had our 'Just Married' badges on. Mousekeeping made us little towel animals which was a fantastic surprise after a long day at the parks! The 2 restaurants on site were great - Boatwrights is the table service restaurant with pricier but higher quality food. Riverside Mill is the counter service restaurant with the most incredible selection of food I've seen! The pools are plentiful and clean and Ol Man River is open until midnight! On occasion at breakfast the restaurant was heaving so we just grabbed some fruit and water and headed straight to the park of the day for a later brunch. Buses were always there within a 10 minute wait - though there are more first thing in the morning. The staff at reception, the concierge desk and the shop are always super willing to help - seriously it really was the friendliest place we have ever stayed. I did not want to leave after 2 weeks there and would recommend it for honeymoon couples or families.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: am77Ma
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans was great My daughter was sick for 24hrs and they brought us all new sheets and comforter. They even offered to clean the room while we were still in it. They were great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice atmosphere and amenities”
Reviews.Author: gopherfootball
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Port Orleans for a part of our honeymoon. The resort has a nice laid back feel to it. Whether you are walking through the buildings or taking the boat to Downtown Disney you are able to go at your own pace and you are not rushed like some other resorts I have stayed at. There is a decent amount of walking to get from pace to place but there are nice walkways and since it is spread out it is never overly crowded. If you want the ambiance of the New Orleans Mansions or you want to be relaxed and laid back then I would recommend the Port Orleans Riverside.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing and laid back”
Reviews.Author: PhilNorwich
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 weeks here, and agree with WOW. We both really enjoyed this resort. Check in was simple and straightforward, with pretty much everything explained. Room was fine; clean, 2 queen beds, fridge (a little noisy), iron, ironong board, coffe maker, hair drier, everything we needed. Safe is a little small though. There is also a laundry that was really handy. The grounds are outstanding, and it was nice to wander through them after a visit to the parks. Eating - the food court was pretty good, frantic (even frenetic) and loud at times, but a reasonable choice including made while you wait salads which were big enough to share. The Boatrights restaurant was also pretty good, a fairly limited menu but the pork chop was yummy! Transport - generally good but we were located close to the East Bus stop which was the last bus stop on the route. We soon realised that we were best to take the short walk to the main building and catch the bus at the first stop. Getting around using the transport was easy and straightforward, but do expect to wait for a bus back to the resort at kicking out time as the queues can be loooooooong. Boat from Riverside to Downtown was fun and runs every 10 mins in the evening. The bar was also good, a little expensive but kinda livley at times whent he pianist was there. The shop sold the usual Disney mechandise and a small selection of 'essentials' as well. Overall really pleased with PO Riverside and would definitely return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “First Time Visitors from California”
Reviews.Author: PurpleSterling
Reviews.Content: I am a HUGE Disney fan and I have been an annual pass holder for years (Disneyland / DCA), so when we decided to take a cruise out of the Florida I knew we had to add a stay at WDW. My husband, son, and I stayed at Disney's Port Orleans Resort for 5 nights. We were assigned to an upstairs room in one of the Magnolia Terraces. Checking in was a breeze and the grounds were beautiful. Be sure to check out the little store near the entrance, it's adorable. The family friendly "bar" near the lobby is a nice place to relax and mingle with fellow guests. My son and husband espeically loved watching the last world soccer match with other fans. The room was clean and comfortable, but pretty basic. The room has a small fridge so you can save money if you bring your own bottled water, juice, and snacks. Our room was close to the bus depot and not far from the water taxi, so getting around the "world" was a snap. I highly recommend downloading a few Disney World apps on your phone to maximize your experience. One of the best apps gave us instructions on the fastest way to get to and from our destination. I'm not sure if we would have loved the Disney transporation system as much without it! Overall, the hotel was ok, comparable to a Holiday Inn. The grounds surrounding the hotel made all the difference. We are glad we took the time to explore WDW, but we prefer Disneyland and DCA and the three Disney hotels in California.

Reviews.Title: “A resort for family with kids”
Reviews.Author: aLPha-G
Reviews.Content: The resort is huge. The rooms are comfy and roomy. I recommend to get a room nearer to the bus stop or the lobby area. Lucky for us, our room wasn't too far away from both. It was our first Disney World Vacation which we booked on Disney website. We stayed five nights. Every day the room was cleaned when we returned from the theme parks. House keeping service is good. One of the best features in the room is the two bathroom sinks outside the bathroom. There were five of us staying in one room and with that feature, it allowed us to finish getting ready faster than usual to catch the bus to the theme parks. We also love the onsite restaurant. I forgot the name. But we had breakfast here every day. The prices are very reasonable considering this is a Disney Resort. Kids meal is around $6 and regular meal around $6-$10. They even have an ice cream counter in there. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone with kids and on a budget. Would love to return to this wonderful and magical place soon.

Reviews.Title: “POR was better than I had even hoped for!!”
Reviews.Author: mermaidwannabe
Reviews.Content: My family of five stayed in a room with a trundle bed at the Port Orleans Riverside, and we loved the resort and our stay. My thirteen-year-old daughter stayed on the trundle bed, and it was plenty big. The room was clean and was fine size-wise since we were gone most of the time either at the parks or swimming in one of the great pools at POR. We actually enjoyed the quiet pool near our room most as we had it to ourselves most of the time. The grounds are just beautiful, and I thoroughly enjoyed walking to the food court or bus stop as the foliage is so pretty. If we go back to Disney World, we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our new Disney "Home away from home"”
Reviews.Author: calngavinsmom
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several Disney properties but all I can say is Wow this place won me over. The grounds are so very beautiful, a nice tranquil place to relax after a hectic day at the parks. We stayed in Alligator Bayou building 18 and it was a perfect location. It was close to the main building, but still far enough away from it to be nice and quiet. Our room also overlooked the river. So pretty. It was also nice and clean, in good repair and our two little boys liked the trundle bed and also thought the beds (which looked like they were made from logs) were cool. It was plenty big enough for our little family of four, lots of room for our stuff and the fridge came in handy as we were able to buy milk and have breaky in our room before heading out to the parks for the day. The main pool was great, lots of sunny and shady places to lounge, and a fun little pool slide to enjoy. There were also several quiet pools around the property, nice way to unwind in the evening. The foodcourt was very good. They have a design your own pasta station where you can pick from different pastas, sauces and toppings to create something just to your liking. The boat from POR to Downtown Disney is a nice relaxing ride and offers a nice change from the buses. The buses were also good here too. We never waited more than maybe 10 minutes to be picked up. We loved this place so much that my hubby surprised me by booking it for our 15th wedding anniversary next fall. I cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “A LITTLE TIRED BUT STILL CHARMING”
Reviews.Author: Karen_Kingswinford
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel for many years, we accept that certain areas, are in need of a little TLC, and some of the rooms have become a little tired. However, the grounds and main public areas are still very nice, and have a lovely ambience. I believe the room standards are in decline because of the Housekeeping staff. They do not seem to take the time and care to clean the rooms in a more professional and hygienic manner. The food court at this hotel is adequate, nothing too elaborate just ordinary every day fast foods, but not a bad selection. The table service restaurant is called Boatwirights, and they have a very good selection of menu items. The bar is good, but expensive, as is all Disney resort bars, however, this hotel has, appearing two or three nights a week, Bob the pianist, who most seem to find appealing but we find him absolutely awful, loud and amateurish. For a Disney moderate resort the POR definitely needs a re-vamp to bring it up to the standards of say the Coronado Springs Resort, however, for nostalgia reasons, it will always be our hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “nice, rural resort that gives you extra magical hours”
Reviews.Author: Psymaggie
Reviews.Content: ...BUT: almost no reception for cell phones, no wireless internet only ethernet to plug into your laptop (so don't bring your ipad to use the internet!), no tasty dining besindes Disnesy in this rural area, no Business Center, no room-service, no minibar, very small safe (laptops larger than 12" won't fit), A/C for all floors is outdoors but so loud that you will still hear the sound during the night (the same is true for the in-room refrigerator) nevertheless a nice, reasonable, and comfy stay compared to the huge Disney hotels spreading charme and neat atmosphere, also nice for parents w/kids due to nice outdoor pools that are observed by lifeguards (pooltowel service included), parking included directly in front of your building

Reviews.Title: “Great place/service/food”
Reviews.Author: sphinxteratrophy
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a week on Sept 25. The grounds were immaculate. There is enough to do at this resort even if you didn't want to go the parks. Rooms were ok. Food was good. Take advantage of the boat ride into downtown. Our kids are 6 and 4 and they fell in love with place. Bus rides can vary from extremely packed to fairly empty time depended. Since this is a large resort, you will have more people in the bus than other resorts. Bugs were really bad the first couple of days. Get the dining plan. I would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay”
Reviews.Author: naenae248
Reviews.Content: Took the family (myself, hubby, 4yr old and 1 yr old.) to Disney for 8 days. Stayed at Port Orleans Riverside and had a great time. Arrived late our first day, around 10:30 or so. We had completed the online check in and they had our packet ready and waiting for us. Only took a few minutes to check in and we were on our way. Which is where I will list my only real complaint, the lady at the front desk gave horrible directions. She sent us towards the wrong section (we were to go to Alligator Bayou). Luckily we ran into a very nice employee outside, who upon seeing us look a little lost, sent us in the right direction. The property is large, very large. But hey, it's Disney and everything is large. Be prepared to walk and walk some more. The grounds are beautiful though so it's really not a big deal. When we got to our room, it was neat and clean. Nothing fancy as far as decor, but very clean and that's what I care about. All during the week our mousekeeper did a great job. Our boys frequently made a mess eating snacks in the room and each day it all disappeared while we were out at the parks. She also left towel animals on the beds most days. She also arranged the boys stuffed animals on the bed. Hotel staff was very courteous. Never ran into anyone with a bad attitude. While we were there we had to cancel and schedule some new dinner reservations (turns out my 1 yr. old is terrified of characters!) I called Disney Dining and they were great. Got me reservations at or near the time I needed and did it quickly. We ate at Boatwrights one evening (this was a dinner reservation we had to get at the last minute) We weren't sure if it would be that good or not, but it was great! Lots of different things on the menu, and they were very happy to make substitutions for a picky eater like me. We were too stuffed for dessert that night and they even bagged it up for us. Hotel is right on the water, so you can take the boat downtown. Very convenient. We visited the big pool a few times. My oldest loved the waterslide. Couldn't keep him off of it. There was also a "quiet pool" right outside our door (room 1722) that made it very convenient to swim during our youngest's naptime. Overall it was a great place to stay. We plan on going back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful”
Reviews.Author: scott27Glencoe_ON
Reviews.Content: This was our first real family vacation with just the three of us & couldn't of asked for a better vacation. From the moment we stepped off the bus I was in love with this resort, it is so beautiful I don't know where to begin everything was so perfect. Staff is incredible and this resort is beautiful beyond words. The main pool is great for small children as well as adults & the boat to downtown disney is a very relaxing way to travel back and forth. We will be staying at this resort again next year when we go back for 2 wks this time. We won't stay anywhere else in Disney, best value for your money and you won't be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service”
Reviews.Author: cuvcu
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Port Orleans Riverside from Sept 16-25. We stayed at alligator bayou section in building 16 on the first floor. I would recommend the first floor to anyone who does not want to walk up the stairs. The location was near the south bus depot and the main building. The buses ran efficiently and did not wait anymore than 5 to 10 minutes going to and from the parks. The hotel is close to all the parks and did not take long get to any of them. All bus terminals at the hotel are covered, which makes it worth the extra price to stay there. My wife and I agree that if you can't stay at the Magic Kingdom hotels than this hotel is not that far behind them. Overall the service at this hotel is great. However, I do think the housekeeping needs to be better. Rooms are not filthy, but do need to be cleaned under the beds and behind the furniture. They advertise there towels and washcloths in a book so one could purchase them. I recommend them having those towels and washcloths in the room instead of the very worn ones used. Did these negatives ruin the trip? Not by a long shot. It just areas that Disney needs to improve. Is this a 5 star hotel? No but I don't think any of the deluxe resorts are either. If you want that service the don't go to Disney. If you want a decent room near the major attractions, then stay at Disney. Don't worry about those negative reviews. The hotel is great for location, ammenties, and a night for rest.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Nod79
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth visit to Orlando in 10 years but our first at this hotel - we would DEFINITELY stay here again. Travelling with our 15 year old son and 15 year old nephew we felt this year we needed somewhere they could have fun on their own without myself and husband breathing down their necks but still near enough if they needed us(!). This hotel was ideal and they had plenty of 'them time' with us knowing they were in a safe environment! We were situated in the Magnolia building which was a 2 minute stroll to the pool next to our accommodation and 3 minutes from the main 'feature' pool. The boys spent time at both pools but, to be honest, the pool nearest our block was more than ample and had its own laundry room situated poolside so parents could use this whilst the kids are in the pool if need be. We were approx. a 4 min stroll from the main reception/restaurant/food court bar, etc. We (unknowingly) were on the Disney Dining plan which was fantasic (if you haven't already arranged this, find out more and book it!) and the food and snacks were really good, freshly cooked and massive in portion. If not on the dining plan, food was fairly reasonably priced but obviously that's dependent on your own budget. Only downside is paper plates and plastic cutlery but unless you book a 'service' restaurant off-site, much of the hotel food courts are the same. The refillable mug that you can purchase for, I think, something like $20 is also worth it if you have youngsters but depending on what Disney Dining Plan you get, this is included. The foodcourt in the hotel consisted of five or six different stations: Breakfast ranged from 'All American' to pancakes, freshly cooked omlette with your choice of filling, croissant, fruit, muffins, cereal, etc. with dinner from a meal of meat, potatoes veg. to freshly cooked pasta/noodles with your choice of add-ins to your usual burger and fries! The hotel has a fantastic, extra large arcade where a 'top up card' was used to play (parents can top up so children aren't carrying cash), play park (our boys were too old!) fishing hole where you can hire rods (small fee), bike and speed boat rentals (small fee) and horse & carriage ride (small fee). We took a bike for 4 towards the end of our holiday just to have a ride round the grounds (approx. 1.2 miles) and didn't realise how huge and well kept the hotel was! A free boat is available near the foodcourt to take you to Downtown Disney and if you haven't got a hire care it's a fun way to get there - approx. 15 mins. I could recommend this hotel all day! All in all, extremely clean, polite staff, excellent facilities and good food - GO THERE! PS Fantastic themed decor, stunning grounds and water-wheel!

Reviews.Title: “can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: cutemagi
Reviews.Content: We thought Port Orleans Riverside was great, really pretty, we even saw otters in the lake. It was nice and relaxing and even though it is a big resort it never felt crowded around the grounds ( although the restaurant got busy, but that is to be expected when you are in school holidays). We walked to French Quarter a few times which seems nice too, although i prefered the look of Riverside, we ate in French Quarter restaurant which was nice and it didn't seem to get busy. We used the bus service all the time which was really good. All in all this was a great holiday and i really want to go again to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful WDW Choice for Family of Five”
Reviews.Author: max_webster
Reviews.Content: We stayed at PORS during our first family trip to WDW last fall. It was wonderful! We were in the Alligator Bayou section of the resort. The room was not large, but it was very functional and everything we needed. The trundle worked out well for your 5 year old, but may have been too small for a larger child. However, for families with 3 children, PORS is an excellent choice in that it is the only Moderate or Value WDW resort that accomodates 3 children (outside of the more expensive suits found at some of the Moderate and Value resorts). The grounds are amazing and there are pools everywhere. We enjoyed exploring the resort! The food court was large and had many good choices. We head back to WDW and PORS next month, and we can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: klmsw2010
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this resort and the New Orleans atmosphere was great. I was pleasantly surprised that the beds and pillows were pretty comfortable and I usually have a very hard time with sleeping well at a hotel because beds are generally very hard and keep me up all night. The Disney transportation to the Parks and the Magic Express to and from the airport was GREAT! No complaints there. Our ONLY real complaint with this hotel was a few bugs in the room......first couple were roaches......but we were in the room so little it didn't make that much of a difference. If I return to Disney I'll probably try another resort just for some variety BUT I would definitly stay at P.O. Riverside again. Excellent VERYFRIENDLY service all over resort and Disney. Great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Very peaceful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: primcrafter
Reviews.Content: This was our very first visit to Disney with our three boys, ages 17, 12 and 7. We really enjoyed our stay at Port Orleans and we absolutely chose the best time to go to Disney! The Magic Kingdom was decorated for Halloween and the most we ever waited on a ride was 15 minutes! The rooms at Port Orleans were clean, the pools and grounds were clean and it was very peaceful! We stayed in cottage #16 which is close to one of the quiet pools and laundry. This resort is spread out and there is a walk to the lobby/restaurant area however....while there, we visited the Polynesian, The Boardwalk, The Yacht Club, Animal Kingdom Lodge and Wilderness Lodge and they are all large resorts as well. The Port Orleans has several cottages that are only two levels, so that is why it seems like a long walk, but if you stay in the other resorts there would still be a long walk to the lobby area because they are resorts... HUGE! They accommodate a lot of people! I would compare the Port Orleans to accommodations in Pigeon Forge and Gatllinburg, TN. The walkways are winding and beautiful. There are small bridges that are over small ponds of water throughout the grounds so we saw lots of lizards, frogs, squirrels and bunnies! The river is alongside the jogging/walking path where ducks, geese and other birds hang out and you can take a boat ride to the French Quarter section of Port Orleans and to Downtown Disney. Everyone at the resort was friendly and helpful....you will never be confused or lost if you just ask for help. The Concierge was so helpful with dining reservations. They are located in the lobby area and they will assist you with dining, attractions, printing maps, etc. The General Store in the lobby area was wonderful and that's where I did all of my shopping! This resort has four bus stops: North, South, East and West. The buses were really good about rotating which depot to pick up and let off first. A little tip: If your room isn't close to the lobby, you can drive over from your cottage and park at the lobby area near the first depot. That way, if you wanted to get dinner at the end of the day, you could go into the cafeteria through the lobby and drive your tired kids to your room at night instead of "dragging" them like so many people were doing:) Our kids loved the 'Ol Man Island with a water slide and there's a bar at the pool...they make the best margaritas! For dining, we ate breakfast in the cafeteria most mornings, except on morning we at at Boma's in the Animal Kingdom Lodge...LOVED IT! They make American breakfast foods and African-inspired items plus they make their own orange, guava and passion fruit juice they serve...yummy! Inside the Port Orleans is Boatwright's restaurant....we ate there one evening and highly recommend it. For your dinners, I do recommend you make reservations! We ate at the Flying Fish Cafe inside the Boardwalk Resort...excellent fine dinning; the Yachtsman Steakhouse inside the Yacht Club Resort...hand-cut steaks, excellent; The Hoop-De-Do Musical Review dinner show at the Wilderness Campground...The BEST! Funny and entertaining! They served the best home-style food and my kids LOVED IT; we also went to the Polynesian Resort for their Luau....great show complete with fire eating and yummy Hawaiian-style food! We did the dining plan and I do recommend it! It's so much easier to have everything on on a card, your "key to the world" that is your park pass, your room key, use it to lift the security gate to get into the resort, use it as your credit card and your dining payment. I really wanted to stay at the Polynesian originally but after staying at Port Orleans and visiting the other resorts, I have to say that I don't think the Polynesian would have been worth the extra money. Keep in mind that you don't spend much time in your room and the most important thing for me is the beds...I have back issues and these beds did not bother me at all! They have very nice mattresses and I slept like a baby! If I had any complaints, it would only be that the channel choices on the TV were sparse and mostly Disney-oriented and they charged $10 for 24 hours of Internet usage...I really think that should be included for free. Other than that, I really don't have anything bad to say about this resort and the atmosphere really is comforting.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at riverside”
Reviews.Author: boothy16
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our 2 week stay at disney port orleans riverside resort and was definatley a great choice. Now this resort is not a deluxe so most of the people who usually complain should pay a bit more if they are not happy (these people who usually complain also are the ones who complain in the parks resturants and airports) and it is definatley better than a value resort. Now we stayed in the oak manor which was a lovely mansion building on the third floor room which was clean on arrival and cleaned everyday with fresh towels soap flannels they also made animals out of the towels on a couple of occasions. Now the grounds are just perfect and everything is kept very well and staff where also helpful and polite. Now one benefit to the resort is the boat to down town disney which takes about 10-15 mins which is really nice. Now we didn't take the buses to parks as we usually had plans in the afternoon and we would drive to the parks as it was free to park if you stay at a disney resort, and for those people who complain about the bus service should just do this as it makes life easier for them. I would recomend anyone to go to the resort and for those people who complain pay a bit more money stay in a delux or don't bother coming its disney your meant to enjoy it we did :). The overal experience was one we will not forget and we plan to hopefully come back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, shielded from the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: jjb5199
Reviews.Content: The Port Orleans Riverside resort is a nice change of pace from some of the more traditional hotel layouts on the property. It is quite large and contains several "small" 2-story buildings surrounded by trees and pools. Because of this, it is hard to appreciate how many people are actually staying at the resort until you get to the restaurant or bus stops and encounter the crowds. I like it because of that. However, the room service was not up-to-par with what I would consider Disney service. In fact, it appears as though our room was barely touched on our last night. Also, if you have strollers or wheelchairs, be sure to request a lower-level room as most (if not all) buildings do not have elevator access. The food in the cafe is good and the pool was nice. Also, be sure to map out the closest bus stop as there are four and finding the nearest one can save you some walking and some precious Disney time. All staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good with some disappointments.”
Reviews.Author: righteous
Reviews.Content: Pros: Staff is mostly nice. Most areas are very clean. Pools well maintained. Bob Jackson in lounge is a great entertainer. Boat transport to Downtown. Cons: Don't bother to do early electronic check-in. We waited an extra 15 minutes in line while everone in the regular check-in line walked rigt up and got waited on. Food court serves fake iced tea (Peak). You have to make your own from hot tea. Grounds trash removal needs attention. Invasive vines are in need of removal. Bus service was very erratic. 2 or 3 empty buses to same place and sometimes long wait for standing room only buses. Many stops. Makes you want to rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “port orleans - riverside excellent”
Reviews.Author: maibobs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks 29/08/10- 12/09/10 excellent. We stayed in magnolia bend section, this was a great location, we were close to everything. The boat to downtown disney was a lovely way of travelling, we used this many times, as it was very relaxing. The bus service from this hotel to the parks was also very good, did find the air con on the buses a bit cold though. We were on the disney dinning plan, fantastic would recommend to everyone, could'nt manage to eat all the meals 10 left over by the time we left, As the kids were'nt to fussed on waffle omelette and pancake breakfasts that were offered every morning in the hotel, We tended to use a snack for breakfast, bagel. coissant and coffee, and then had 1quick dinning plan meal out in the parks, and then our second meal in downtown disney in the evening, would recommend Wolfgang puck and The earl of sandwich, The dinning plan meals consist of meal, dessert and drinks, my daughter and i frequently shared a meal as we would never have eaten a whole meal to ourselves, . The room was spacious, and very clean, our mousemaid left us towel animals, very clever how they are made. One of the reasons we had booked disney hotel, is so that my husband and son could play golf and have the free golf hire for all the disney courses, this is offered in most of the uk holiday brochures, unfortunately disney reception staff had never heard of this, as we had not taken our brochure on hols with us we had no proof of this, we eventually convinced the receptionist to look up on the uk disney web page to confirm this with us, we did eventually have the free golf hire, as it was in black and white on the page when she looked it up, so if you are planning on playing golf take along proof of the free hire. Reception staff are also not very helpful in directing you off the disney area, we asked how to get to universal, not much help nobody seemed to know, unyet when we asked the bus drivers they were a great help. If you need directions its best to ask the bus drivers they are way more helpful than reception, If you go to down town disney . get off bus at marketplace, cross the main road and there is a local bus service, the 111 takes you to the florida mall shopping centre, we used this bus stop to get to universal, cost us 6 dollars for the whole family, rather than the 40 dollar taxi ride. Would stay in this hotel again, did take a quick look at some of the others but this was by far my fav glad we choose this hotel. and best of all we had a fantastic holiday weather was amazing, wish we could have brought the hot sunny weather back to wales

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds!”
Reviews.Author: Vanie_V
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Labor day week with my family (Spouse, mother, 4year old son, 17month old daughter and 7 year old Nephew), We all enjoyed the grounds. The trees are a great escape from the Sun and the heat, we saw many lizards, different types of birds and rabbits on the property. The room was perfect for what it was a place to sleep, shower and change and NOTHING MORE. Very small, the bathroom was outdated and dingy. The maid cleaned daily and left us towel art on the bed and in the sink area holding our toothbrush. My kids needed a rest throughout the day from the parks so we would head towards our room and the TV channel choice's were not the best, being a Disney Property I was hoping for at least a channel that showed Disney movies non stop but no only one or two Disney Channels that the majority of the time showed more preteen friendly programs (zach the suite life?, etc) Reading the reviews on this site prior to our stay and looking at a map of the property I called a few days ahead and requested building 14 Alligator Bayou and what a great LOCATION Close to all!!!! Our room was steps away from the main building which is close to the bridge towards the pool and close to the parking lot. Our room location was PERFECT because walking all day in the parks the last thing you want to do is WALK to your room or WALK to get a drink, WALK to the pool etc. I didnt expect much but years ago I stood at the Caribbean Beach Resort and from what I can remember I prefer that Hotel to this one I dont know why I just do. I did not like the food options at the Hotel at all if we didnt have the Dining Plan I would have eaten out all the time (for a few days we drove about 5min out of Disney and ate at a McDonalds, Chilis, Olive Garden etc.) If you rented a car there are many options ride outside Disney World ;) We did some Character Meals and My fav are The Chip n Dale at Epcot and the Winny the Pooh in Magic Kingdom, we went for breakfast and are allowed into the parks before anyone and get to the rides early my kids were able to get on Splash Mountain, and the Railroad roller coaster twice with no lines at all. We took the boat to Downtown Disney and it was beautiful we never waited for the boat long and always got a seat. The staff at the resort seemed fine some were "Disney Happy". The pool was a great escape the boys LOVED the slide. There was always a chair and always a shaded area. All in all the Hotel was a perfect location for leaving the parks and enjoying a swim. The hotel was super quite I loved how quite it was.

Reviews.Title: “Not Clean”
Reviews.Author: petunia1
Reviews.Content: My room was not ready when I arrived so we opted to check our luggage and go to the parks. Did not get into the room until about 11:00 PM. I had requested a room close to the main building and near transportation. I was assigned to building 15 of the Alligator Bayou section. I guess this was pretty much as close as you could get but at Disney World nothing is that close. The room was decorated in sort of log cabin style and felt it was dark and dingy looking. The only things that were white were the two sinks which both appeared to be very dirty including toothpaste residue from previous guests and black grime around the faucets. The furniture appeared dusty but it was kind of hard to tell because it was so rustic in style. It also appeared as though the corners were never vacuumed. I could only assume that the rest of the room was just as dirty as the sinks but it was hard to tell because it was the kind of color scheme that camoflauges dirt. I called to complain and a woman did come with cleaning supplies but my kids were already in bed at this time so I opted to clean the sinks and tub myself. I spent almost no time in the room other than sleeping and showering. The bed was comfortable enough. The linens looked worn and kind of shabby and I would have preferred a cleaner and brighter decor. It also had an old type of TV, not that I used it too much but even the Hampton Inns have flat screens. The other section of the hotel that looked like mansions appeared more attractive to me but the buildings seemed to be farther away from the main facilities. The lobby and expansive gift store were very nice. The food court was OK. I did not use the table service restaurant but it looked justed OK. The pool area was nice enough. I did feel the price was good, especially being that at this time of year a free meal plan was offered and we took advantage of this. If I came here for a resort experience I would have been disappointed but we were here only to sleep and we had a great time at the parks so it was OK. I suppose if I had taken the time to really complain maybe I would have gotten more satisfac tion. I have to say that I am suprised that Disney allows a property with their name on it to be in such shabby condition.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Orlando, Florida”
Reviews.Author: finkelk
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Port Orleans...Riverside in Orlando, Florida. It's a clean and beautiful hotel in the Disney resort area. One of the reasons we chose this location is the ferry that takes you to Downtown Disney. Our travel agent at "NJTravel.com - Affordable Vacations" was knowledgeable and so helpful in choosing our package and hotel. They are an awesome agency and wonderful to deal with instead of doing all of the work on your own.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Pleasant Resort”
Reviews.Author: domer2007
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had a very pleasant stay during our Disney vacation at Port Orleans Riverside. First, let's make sure we are all on the same page: Port Orleans is a Disney owned and operated resort. That means you'll likely a) pay a premium and b) endure some waiting in lines and/or for services. If you're planning a trip to Disney World and expect anything other than the above, you should perhaps reconsider and travel elsewhere. At any Disney resort, you're paying for the convenience of staying on the property and all of the perks that come with it. Riverside is no exception but here we found the prices to be reasonable (breaking down our Disney package, we estimated our stay to cost approximately $180 per night for three people in a room with two double beds) given the number of amenities offered on site. The property itself is lovely with tree-lined walk-ways, attractive buildings and a small river running through the complex. Regular boat service is offered from the hotel to Downtown Disney and we found we had no difficulty getting a seat on a boat with very little wait. Transportation to and from the parks is provided and while it's been knocked pretty badly on this site, our experience suggests Disney is actually doing quite a good job managing that process. We never waited more than ten to fifteen minutes for a bus (Disney promises 20 minutes or less) and often were able to walk up and get on a waiting bus within only a few minutes. Once on board, the ride is always quick and painless. (As well as being much more eco-friendly, riding the bus also saves you from the daily parking charge you would be subjected to at the parks if you opt to stay off property.) Even in the mad rush to leave Epcot following the fireworks, there was no difficulty getting a bus quickly back to Riverside. We used the Disney package delivery service (transporting purchases from the park to your Disney hotel) during our stay and found that the employees at Riverside did a great job. There was never a wait to obtain our packages at the store and the long hours of availability (opening early morning and closing at 11:00 PM) meant we never had a problem getting back to the hotel in time to obtain our purchases. Room quality is perhaps not what one would otherwise expect from a $150 to $200 per night room. However, our room was clean, well-lit, and easy to access from the lobby/restaurant area. We selected the Magnolia Bend area and found we had more than enough space in our room for all our extra purchases and luggage. The staff was friendly and helpful (they can do anything from making dining reservations - necessary in the World now with the new dining plans - to printing boarding passes and offering directions). Our "mousekeeper" Elizabeth even left us creative towel animals each day in our room. We had a problem with our air conditioner on the third morning of our stay and found that it was repaired almost instantly once I called to report the issue. Our repair guys even apologized to us, multiple times, for the problem and couldn't have been more polite. It's true, the furniture could use some replacing and I agree that a rennovation is about due. That said, I was in no way disappointed in my stay and would happily select Riverside again in the future. It's showing a bit of it's age and is not as fancy as some of the higher end resorts but it is functional, convenient and the exteriors make up for what the rooms themselves lack. If you cannot afford the premium price attached to the higher end resorts, please consider Riverside. It's a great balance between value and luxury vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Love this resort”
Reviews.Author: cheerdad2009
Reviews.Content: This is my families 2nd trip to Port Orleans-Riverside and for the 2nd time it did not disappoint.....My wife and I love this resort because of the atmosphere, the pool and the fun that can be had by all ages. Just taking a relaxing trip down the river to downtown Disney is enjoyable ( Except for the new safety rules with the Air Horn on the boats) Our kids really enjoyed themselves ( 10, 9 and 5) My only complaint would be the food, though some things tasted good (desserts and Mickey Waffles) the rest was a little over priced for the flavor....I also had one other problem with our room but a very nice Customer Service rep named Anna (Front Desk) helped solve what could but been a disaster....We take small getaways several times a year and this resort is well worth the trip....

Reviews.Title: “Set in Lovely Surroundings”
Reviews.Author: Tracey M
Reviews.Content: Disneyâ€™s Port Orleans (Riverside) was a very nice hotel, and we had a great time staying here, we could have done with some seats out side our rooms to sit and wait while the rest of the family was getting ready. Recreation: I thought that the horse and trap, bikes, fishing ect were included in the cost of staying at the Port Orleans but this was not the case, the cost of a Horse and Trap was, I think, $45 for 20mins I felt rather expensive. Dining: choice of meals was boring/repetitive after a week, (we were there for 14 nights) although what you where entitled to for a meal was filling. I thought the price of food/meals were expensive IE $2 for a yogurt (I would not have wanted to be staying in a resort with out the Disney Quick Dining Plan which was â€œfreeâ€� with our holiday) At breakfast you were entitled to umpteen drinks IE for breakfast I had a Yogurt, orange juice, and milk to go with cereal and unlimited refillâ€™s of coffee, I asked if I could have a banana instead of the orange juice but this was not allowed Disney Quick Dining, which worked on a points system, took a bit of getting your head round. Knowing what you where entitled to for a 1 point meal. Staff also seemed confused by it

Reviews.Title: “Not the special place I remember”
Reviews.Author: csblinky
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans is a well maintained and well run resort, but everything was not top notch like I remember it being a few years back. First - transportation from the airport. Our bus was not the nice Disney Magic Express bus - it was a leaky and run down Mears yellow bus. There were TV's but no shows playing. Water was literally pouring down on the seat beside me from rain on the outside. The bus was smelly and musty. Yuck. The first time we stayed at Port Orleans our luggage was wisked away by a porter and we were carried to our rooms on a golf cart. That was classy. This time we had to hunt down the porter to park our bags, and you get a map showing you the mile walk to your hotel. Not exactly the service we expected. When we got to our hotel room later in the day - our room was hot. The maintenance person was quick and friendly. The fix to the AC unit was a simple knob replacement and someone had duct taped the old knob to fix it. Our room had a great view of the parking lot and the busy road, but you could not hear it as long as you kept the AC going. The room came with a trundle and a fridge which I was happy about. I expected the trundle but not the fridge. Everything was clean except for the tub in the bathroom. I have a pet peeve about clean bathrooms. The tile in the tub had mold in the grout and I could rub it off with my finger. That told me that no one had bothered to scrub this tub in a while. Also the tub itself was just plain dirty and looked like it had not been scrubbed. Yuck again and not what I expect from Disney. You would think that once a week they could scrub the tub. The dining hall was actually better this time around. The first two times we stayed I didn't really like it at all. I was a bit more choosy with my food this time and I hit on a few winners. The carved beef was terrific and all of the deserts were great. But the cleanliness again was only average. Over all I was underwhelmed with my stay at Disney. The cleanliness and service were not what I've experienced in the past and needs updating. No internet. Old CRT TV's. I don't know if they are short staffed or what, but the attention to detail just wasn't there and all of the workers seemed stressed out to me. Dirty shower, worn furniture and AC unit, no VIP treatment upon arrival, yucky magic express. When we were leaving at the end of our week, the bus driver was slinging luggage into the bus like he was in a race. It was too many little things to ignore. The disney parks as well just weren't magical like I remember. The "cast members" acted frazzled and on edge. Several times while we were there rides broke down or were delayed. The magic hours were a joke - you waited longer for a ride during Magic Hours than you did during regular hours. I felt like I was a part of a big machine and they were just crunching us through to the next gift shop. I had a horrible experience getting my food in Epcot at the Morrocco counter service restaurant. They took my order then literally served everyone else and forgot completely about me. When I tried to tell the server she said "I'm just giving out the food they give me" - so I had to yell at the "cook" and order him to make my food. The big kicker was waiting almost two hours for Fanstamic only to have it cancelled due to "weather" when there wasn't even a cloud in the sky. I suppose a vacation is what you make of it but Disney standards have fallen since we stayed last. If they expect people to stay in their resorts and pay movie theatre prices for everything (3 bucks for water, 5 bucks for popcorn, 25 bucks for a decent meal) - then they need to step it up on the service side of the house. Employ more people - treat their people better - whatever they need to do to put smiles back on employee faces and put a special experience into the visits of their patrons.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed this hotel and would return!”
Reviews.Author: TravelToSeattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights and enjoyed the stay! The room wa a good size, a little run down but not bad for a moderate hotel. We appreciated the refrigerator, it was quiet and comfortable. We stayed in the Magnolia Terrace section and it was not my first choice but I ended up liking it better than what I originally requested for location. We were close to the main pool, dinning, parking and bus stop. This was important with the amount of walking at Disney World we did off property we were tired when we got to the hotel. One thing I really appreciated after staying at the Disney Coronado (we were not happy with this property) was that we had 2 large windows with lots of natural light. This is a property that was quiet in the room but offered lots of fun and action for kids and parents. They have bikes, boats, carraige rides and swimming to mention just a few things. They have of course the disney buses for transportation but they also offer a river boat to downtown Disney for a nice change in transportation. The dinning areas offered a nice selection with quick service in the dinning hall and we were able to use a "quick service" meal from our dinning plan for good value. The staff was freindly and helpful. They even entertain the kids with games and fun in early evening that my daugher enjoyed. On the down side the main pool was too small and always seemed over crowded. The slide was also not as good as the previous hotel we stayed at. Our over all experience was very good and we would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Riverside is a hidden gem.”
Reviews.Author: ILoveWDW
Reviews.Content: Literally just finished a 21 night stay here (today - delayed at Sanford but luckily have internet access!) and it is a wonderful hotel. Stayed in building 95 - very quiet just what we like and did not get the next door room noise as it did not have connecting doors. Cleanliness you would expect from Disney, however the foodcourt let that side down. Food okay but the cleaners need to clean more often and more efficiently. (Disney should give you score cards when you check out). That aside the design of the buildings that house your rooms are amazing, from old mansion style to Alligator Bayou rooms separated by fountains and immaculate grounds. Your choice of six pools, always a convenient one near ( but not too close to your room if you like it quiet) and plenty of clean towels. A walk along the Sassagoula River is a must at any time of day and just soak in it's beauty. There is always grooming of some kind going on and it shows it the finished product. Visit once and prove me right!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Port Orleans, Riveside”
Reviews.Author: korgman1
Reviews.Content: Had a great week at Disney Aug1-8th. We chose this hotel based on the DVD we ordered about planning a Disney vacation. After talking with friends, they confirmed that this hotel was their favorite of the moderates. The Disney express from the airport was a great feature. We were able to check into our room (2505) and head right to the Magic Kingdom. We arrived back at the hotel about 11pm to find all our luggage in the room. The shuttle buses to each park were great. Very little wait. The most we waited was about 10-15min. The rooms were clean and adequite size for our family of 4. However, the beds were very loud (squeeky). Our 6 year old lost her tooth the first night we were there. We went to the front desk the next morning to ask them if they could let the Tooth Fairy know where we were staying. To our surprise the Tooth Fairy had visited the front desk and left a goody bag of Disney items for our daughter. Great memory! We had the deluxe dinning plan, More food than we could eat. We started most dinners already full from the previous lunch. This hotel definately put you back in time and was very quite and relaxing. A very nice place to return to after a day at the parks. Boat wright restaruant was great as well. This is our first trip to Disney as a family and I am already wanting to plan next years trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with horrible housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Sportofino
Reviews.Content: Overall we loved the Hotel. It is a beautiful property with great pools and awesome architecture. The service was good.The food was Disney level food (mediocre with high price). My only complaint is the horrible housekeeping. The room didn't look clean from the time we entered until we left. I'm not going to get into detail but it was unacceptable for any motel/hotel and it continued throughout my stay. I probably should have complained, but I didn't feel like it. I would still recommend this hotel but housekeeping needs to improve.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: IloveCarlos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans Riverside the 3rd week of August . It was our first trip to Disney World. The hotel was wonderful, we loved the property. Everyone was so helpful and cheery. I would absolutely stay here again. We were thinking about staying at one of the value resorts, but I am glad we decided to stay at Riverside, it was well worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel,the best Disney hotel so far”
Reviews.Author: Magpies66
Reviews.Content: (Travelled from UK in August)This is our second time at this Disney hotel,we stayed there last year and loved it so much we came back.I'd say this is the best out of the Disney hotels Thomson offer.We have stayed in a couple of other Disney hotel which were ok but not great. What we liked about this hotel : The grounds are beautiful.The river that runs through it stunning.Go around them on a Surrey bike( early or late when cooler as its a bit too hot in August!!! unless you are super fit)The resort is large but we have never had more than a 5min walk to pool or food court.If you find the walking a problem you will struggle in the parks as you do a HUGE amount of walking. The room is basic,clean & comfortable.You don't spend much time in it so I don't know why people moan about the size!! You sleep in it,grab your gear & go to parks.We didn't travel 5000 miles to sit in a room. The food court has great for me as I don't eat meat(I've struggled in other Disney hotels to find anything other than a pizza or veggie burger)There was salades & pastas to design for your own taste,plus chicken/beef 'Sunday' dinners,burgers, pizzas etc.I'd try to get there early for breakfast as it can get packed at this time.We had the Disney dining plan which was great as food can get rather expensive after eating at Disney for two weeks. (this can be used in parks too) The quiet pool was just that.Its right next to where you can wash & dry your clothes $5 a load to wash,dry & powder .We didn't use the main poolbut it looked great if you have young children. Altogether a great base to stay at for visiting Disney & Universal. P.S If you do Harry Potter get there early,we got there at 8:30 as gates open then we only waited 25mins for the HP ride & 5min for other 2 rides.By 10;30 the queues were 3houres & 1houre just to get in the HP world

Reviews.Title: “POR - Would recommend and stay again!”
Reviews.Author: crazy4seattle
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just returned from a 5 night stay at Disney's Port Orleans Riverside. We stayed in the Magnolia Terrace building, room 8605. Check-in was a quick and painless process, especially since we took advantage of Disney's Online Check-In. We arrived earlier that planned so our room was not ready upon arrival. We left our cell phone number with the desk and were sent a text message once our room was ready. How many hotels do that?? Our room was spacious enough for 2 adults and 2 kids. The amenities included a ceiling fan, mini fridge, a small table with two chairs, hair dryer and iron with ironing board. Although the furniture did look a little worn, cleanliness was not an issue. (and I'm a self proclaimed "germ-a-phobe") We tipped our Mousekeeper daily and were greeted with cute towel creations 3 of the 5 nights. The grounds are absolutely beautiful! Disney does take pride in its appearance, that's for sure. The grounds are spread out but the scenery distracts from some of the distance that you have to cover. Ducks and rabbits were a daily sighting. The pool was large and has a fun slide that I could not get the kids off of! The lifeguards were very attentive and friendly. One even made gave my daughter a set of beads to wear. Every Princess LOVES getting jewelry! The food court has a great selection, although it gets crowded at peak times. A friendly recommendation - buy the refillable drink mugs. Always having unlimited access to cold soda, iced tea, hot chocolate and coffee was very convenient. The only form of Disney transportation that I can comment on was the boat from the resort to Downtown Disney. You may have to wait in line to board but it was a nice, relaxing cruise that we all enjoyed. MUST HAVES for visiting the theme parks: snacks, bottled water, drink mix, ponchos and or/umbrellas, misting fans, lots of sunscreen and the greatest thing ever invented...FAST PASS! We must have saved HOURS of time waiting in line by utilizing this system. We felt guilty everytime we'd get in the Fast Pass return line and walk by dozens upon dozens of non-Fast Pass, sweaty, cranky park goers. I'll never understand why more people don't take advantage of it! Overall, I would recommend a stay at Disney's Port Orleans Riverside and hope to return in the future! It was a memorable vacation full of Disney Magic that everyone should experience!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality and service not plush but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: riverside66
Reviews.Content: This was a holiday for myself, wife and three children. Lovely clean pool, well supervised with trained lifeguards. Quite bedrooms but beds were too small for two adults to sleep comfortably 4' 6'', we had to purchase two blow up beds from wallmart and put these either side of the main beds as the pullout bed was uncomfortable even for our young daughter. Food in the dinning room was confusing, potion sizing and variety seemed to change each day as did the supervisors instructions to their staff. Did not like the fact that they would weigh the food in front of you, it made us feel like oliver twist. Front of house staff were always friendly and willing to assist. Beware of tipping for food, we had 14 sitdown meals booked and ended up cancelling 9 as the tips that were expected were high, example:charater breafast at the Floridian was $120 tip $24, evening $182 tip $35 this was for two adults and three children, if the tip was low the looks were stern. The bus service was very good to the attractions

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at this quality hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinMommy31
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night at Port Orleans - Riverside before we had to join our group at All Star Music Resort. We actually tried to leave the group to stay longer at this location as we liked it so much! We had several choices of pools, which was really helpful seeing as it was SO humid and the temperatures hung around the high 90's the entire time we were away. We took advantage of the trundle bed and my son had a comfortable place to sleep! We ate at the a la carte restaurant and purchased the refillable cups that can be used at any Disney resort. Overall, we felt that this location felt pretty private and has a lot to offer for kids and adults of all ages (even fishing!). We would not hesitate to stay here again, with or without the great deal that we got during this stay!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: chasnative
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed in several of the Disney Value and the Deluxe hotels. This was our first stay in a Moderate level hotel. We were very pleased. The theming was excellent. The staff courteous, and the location very convenient to Downtown Disney. We stayed in the Alligator Bayou section - bldg 14. It was terrific location close to the food court, the main pool, and another quiet pool. The room was a good size and my family of 4 was never cramped. My 5 yr old LOVED the trundle bed. We received different towel animals everyday. In addition, the bed were high enough to be able to slide the empty suitcases underneath. This gave a lot of extra floor space. We never had any issues with housekeeping or maintainence. Our building did not have elevators. This was not an issue for us, just ask for a ground floor room or the Magnolia section if needed. The selection at the food court was ample with a salad station, pasta station, burger station, sandwich station, home cooking area, and a bakery. The main lobby building had a piano bar, concierge, food court, general store, and arcade. On our last day the kiosk at the arcade broke down. Disney then switched all the video games to free. More than a fair trade for the inconvenience. The boat ride to the French Quarter and Downtown Disney was handy. After 4:00 pm the boats ran every 10 minutes, but they do fill up quickly. Overall, this is one of our favorite Disney hotels and we would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Our best Disney experience”
Reviews.Author: wi_travelers4
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Disney many times, this has been our best experience. Somehow Disney manages to take you back to a previous time in the deep South. It was a relaxing experience to stay at Riverside. It is close to Epcot, the food court is outstanding, and the staff was extremely helpful. The pool was kind of small, but our kids liked it. The rooms were neat but they weren't anything special. For our family, Riverside was a true Disney experience. It made our trip more special. This resort was one of the most quiet hotels I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good for teenagers”
Reviews.Author: travelcatsDoha_Qatar
Reviews.Content: We could not fault the room or the surroundings of this resort. There are trees water and plants everywhere. We really enjoyed watching the squirrels, lizards and various birds. We were in a lodge near to a swimming pool and family laundry area. There was an ice and vending machine close by. Shuttle busses ran to all the other parks on a regular basis. We could only go to Downtown Disney on the river boat which was disappointing as I hoped that other areas were accessible by water. After rave revues I was expecting the main pool area to have many slides and features. It did not and was in fact quite dull and boring. Once we got to our resort in the evening there were no activities for teenagers. Our son is nearly 18 and was hoping to spend time with other young people. This is definitely an area in need of improvement. I really think that Disney World is a wonderful for families with young children or families with older teenagers who could go out together.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley Awesome”
Reviews.Author: kellyjoyriley
Reviews.Content: Super family friendly. Eatery or Sit-down dining. Ferry (BOAT RIDES) to Downtown Disney. The kids were happy enough to stay at the hotel. Not to mention Beautiful grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Port Orleans - Riverside Resort”
Reviews.Author: elliemax
Reviews.Content: My daugther, husband, sister and I stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside Resort for 6 nights at the beginning of August. I was sad to leave. We had a wonderful time here. This resort was beautiful and very relaxing after a long day at the Disney parks. We've stayed in all the Value Resorts as well as the Caribbean and hands down this is our favorite. I've also stayed at the Grand Floridian, but this of course is not a moderate hotel so can't compare apples to oranges. If you are looking to stay in a moderate resort this is the one to stay at. I read previous posts where people mention having to walk to far and complaining the resort was huge. Yes, the resort is big and there is much land but this is what makes it beautiful to me. If you are not in the greatest of shape or don't like to walk much, then I advise you to stay elsewhere. We were fortunate to get a room in Magnolia Bend so a bus stop was right outside our building and the lobby was right over the bridge. I personally didn't think any of the rooms/building were that far from the bus stops or lobby but I am also a runner, so I probably have a different viewpoint than some. Because the grounds are a bit more spacious than other Disney resorts, it gives you space meaning you aren't on top of a gazillion other families and kids running around. Not once in our 7 days did we feel over crowded anywhere on the resort. We registered without a problem. We had to wait maybe 5 minutes at most to check-in. We took the boat to Downtown Disney and that was a nice ride. Again, very relaxing after a long day at the parks. The room was clean, our housekeeper was great - always arranging my daughters stuffed animals and dolls on the beds. She made some really cute animals/characters out of towels as well. We used the pool next to our room instead of the main kids pool. This was great as well. A nice size pool with hardly anyone there. There are a few pools on this property which makes it nice. We loved the Cafeteria too - it never felt too crowded. We loved the brownie and Carrot Cake. We mainly ate outside of the resort but we did end up eating one meal at the resort and we enjoyed it - it's the basic disney fare. My sister and I asked the main desk for a running path around the property and they told us where to run - the path ended up being the main path around the resort - we took it into the french quarter and so we ended up with a nice 1 mile loop. We ran this a few times - it was so nice to have the 'river' on one side, and the trees on the other side of you. One note to parents is that this hotel isn't as 'disney commercialized' as the value resorts. the rooms are not decorated with disney characters, mickey, etc, like the value resorts. The one and only negative I have about this resort is that you had to pay $10 a day for internet in your room. On our next trip if our budget only permits a moderate or value resort, we will hands down be staying at this resort again!

Reviews.Title: “Room 8720 needs to be completely restored before allowing any other guests to stay there.”
Reviews.Author: tripnew01
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans Riverside is a wonderful destination for DisneyWorld. Yet my room 8720 was a filthy disaster, and after calling the manager and inviting them for a room tour, I received a 50% discount for the appauling conditions. They apologized for my being given such a terribly worn down and dirty room, and mentioned they would be putting the room up for refurbishing. I took pictures once I arrived to document what I walked into. Hope they stand by their word and restore the room. If so, then I would love to stay there again, and actually enjoy my trip there. The staff was excellant and kind. The atmosphere with river boating was fantastic. Overall, with exception of the room I had a good vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked Port Orleans Riverside - Magnolia Bend Mansions”
Reviews.Author: Tampa_FL_Girl
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed on the 'mansions' side in March 2010 & really enjoyed our stay. We had previously stayed on the 'alligator bayou' side a few years ago & found that we really liked this 'mansions' side MUCH better. Since it was just us this time around, we got a room w/a king sized bed, which was nice (most rooms on property have 2 double beds). Our room was nice, though a little 'worn/tired', but clean. It had a typical bathroom w/toilet & shower/bath combo & an outside dressing area w/2 pedastal sinks. There is an in-room safe in the dressing/sink area, an ironing board/iron & hair dryer. There was also an in-room fridge. The resort was nice & our building was not far from the bridge that took you over to the main building w/the restaurants & registration area. It was a bit chilly when we went (for FL standards) & we did not go swimming, but the 'fishing hole' pool area was very nice & there were many who did go swimming there & seemed to be having a great time. If possible, I highly recommend opting for the 'Disney Dining Plan'.......a MUCH better deal in my opinion than paying ala carte w/o the plan. While we were there, we visited EPCOT, the Studios & Animal Kingdom.....by far, my favorite park is still EPCOT, though I do love to go to the Magic Kingdom w/my kids :) We also took advantage of Disney's great transportation system & 'magic' hours as resort guests. All-in-all a nice mini getaway w/my hubby & a nice, middle of the road, Disney resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Disney experience”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneCaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Alligator Bayou for 8 nights which was great as the kids didn't have to share a bed. Our 10 year slept on the trundle bed which he was fine with, he is a tall boy and fit pretty well (anything is better than sharing a bed with your older brother). Pool was great. We had free dining which is just awesome - we saved so much money and had some wonderful food. We had a car so drove everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Large resort, fun amenities, uncomfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: Tom L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside first week of August, 2010, as part of our park-hoppers ticket package with dining through Disneyworld. First off, if you're doing Disneyworld, I highly recommend going for the whole package, meaning, park-hoppers ticket with waterparks, along with dining plan. We took full advantage, and saved a lot of money on food. Book your dining reservations well in advance, and you'll be golden. PS, go check out the Hoop Dee Doo Revue. 2 dinner coupons, but well worth it. Endless Merlot and bounty food, along with cheesy entertainment full Disney-style. Great fun! Riverside Resort: The property is Enormous, with a capital "E". Better get used to lots and lots of walking. The lobby was a billion miles away from our room, and yeah, that's where the food is. But, hey: You're in Disneyworld, and Walt knows...Walking is good for you, in fact, better get used to walking everywhere. That's the Disney experience. So, no negatives for the walking. Still though, the lobby is like, really far from the room. The resort itself is gorgeous. Everything is master-planned, from the lagoons, to the surrey bikes, to the gorgeous architecture, to even the geese 'honking' at 1am in the morning, and the frogs and the trees. It's like stepping back in time, rolling back to the 19th century New Orleans, along the river, complete with moving water wheel. Thoroughly enjoyed the resort. Very beautiful, surreal, fantasyworld of Port Orleans. We enjoyed the whimsy of the rooms, with the the curtain divider for the bathroom, but my one complaint would be the beds. they were so very, very very, very very very uncomfortable. No covers hiding the bedspring (come on, you spent all this money on a resort, and you can't spring for nice beds? really??), the beds were very hard and very loud, and very uncomfortable, which is weird, because the rest of the resort is so beautiful. We ate at the restaurant, and enjoyed the food. The piano player in the bar is a riot. Room attendant was good, front desk was helpful and informed. All and all, we enjoyed Port Orleans Riverside, and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “VERY VERY GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: TelAvivSar
Reviews.Content: we just came back from 2 weeks tour in USA. We staied 5 nights in this hotel. we got room with 2 big double beds plus 1 extra bed. so we could stay 5 person in 1 room. at first the room was not so clean but after we complaine they send someone to clean again the room. the hotel have some small builidings, all 2 floors, you must ask for the most closest houses to the receptien, they have some swimingpools and laundering rooms, withch are colse to the pool, so you can rest while the machine is working. the only thing that was missing is free internet, they wanted 10$ for each using . we recomend this hotel very much

Reviews.Title: “Disney magic, but more relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Canada420
Reviews.Content: We had been wanting to come back here for many years, infact since it was Dixie Landings. We decided as we were coming to Florida for a wedding that we would push the boat out and stay where we wanted. We did contact the hotel twice with a request to stay in Magnolia Terrace but when we checked in that wasn't an option though we did stay in the Mansions as we wanted.
