We were given a good location overlooking the gardens and the river. The room was clean and tidy with plenty of disney toiletries (showergel/shampoo). The towels looked a bit tired though still white. The maid came in every day and always left us a nice display on the bed made out of towels. We bought the mug in the restaurant as you can then refill it at the drinks fountains whenever you want for free. We noticed people were doing this with old mugs but even though thats not allowed nobody seemed to care. The food in the self service area was good though quite expensive and the portions quite small. You have to expect this at Disney though. If we had stayed at the hotel a few weeks later we would of got a free food deal. now thats worth having. The main pool area was always busy so we used the other pools nearer the mansions. Always lovely and warm too.Coin Laundry facilities are available at these pool areas too.A Great idea as you can swim and watch your washing at the same time. We used the free buses to the parks all the time and found them perfect. Yeah sometimes 3 buses would arrive all for the same park but it wasn't any hardship to wait in the sun for another bus. Much better than using our car and less hastle. The resort is lovely to walk around and enjoy away from the busy shops and theme parks. The only thing that got on my nerves though my husband says I am being picky, is that the maintenance men were always out with those power blowers clearing the leaves away.You are relaxing and snoozing around the pool and all you hear is that noise. I suppose they are just trying to keep the place nice and clean for us moaners. All in all it is just as good as I remember it and I would definitely go back, as we stayed 10 days and I didn't want to leave. That is always a good sign. Just one thing, please could they get a small gym?

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Uding
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from a 10-day trip to Walt Disney World. We stayed at POR as we have 3 of the 4 times we have vacationed there. (The other being the Caribbean Beach.) We have visited several other Disney resorts for meals and such, and find that nothing else compares to POR. The staff, rooms, grounds, atmosphere, food, etc., always exceed our expectations. We did not encounter a single problem during our lengthy stay. In fact, it was quite the opposite. The staff goes out of their way to make you feel like you are truly at home. We find the Disney transportation to be quite efficient as well. One bit of advice - allow around one hour to make it to dinner reservations when using their transportation. Especially if you have to first travel to a park and then transfer to a monorail or boat. The extra time will ensure that you make it on time, plus give you a nice relaxing pace to do it in. I always recommend POR to anyone who asks about vacationing there. We find it to be top of the line. We will continue to stay at POR on all future trips to Disney World!

Reviews.Title: “Truly Disney---A great place to stay....”
Reviews.Author: Zebra11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and well maintained. The rooms are nice but not anything too special. You have plenty of space and there is very little noise. This is our second stay at this hotel and we will definitely return. The food court is good and there is a nice variety of items to select. The grounds for the hotel are exceptional. You get the true feeling of the South. The bus stops are well marked and conveniently located. We had one very close to our room. The pools are great for kids and are well kept. This is a great place to stay with your family. It has a lot to offer and the location is good if you enjoy EPCOT. The staff at the registration desk and the concierge were very pleasant and extremely helpful. We stayed at All Star Movies and Music as well as the Carribean Beach resort and this is, by far, our favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Very tired”
Reviews.Author: Bo94114
Reviews.Content: Hi,. Stayed here for 4 nights. This is our 2nd stay. They did not honour our request for a king but they did for Magnolia bed. We were in P Place about as far as you could get from the parking lot. Lots of guests smoking on the sidewalks outside their rooms. Grounds still look great. The rooms are very tired. Marred furn, lumpy pillows, rough towels, previous guests hair on the floor in bathroom. Mildew in tub. stained carpets. They get away with alot because of the free parking and the extra magic hours but this place really needs a reno. If you are not going to take advantage of those items then you will find a better room off site

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: hehobbie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleands Riverside during a week's vacation in April. We weren't in our room other than to sleep, so it worked for us. However, if you expecting legendary Disney pizazz, you are not going to get it in these rooms. They resembled an older Comfort, Hampton or Quality Inn in size and room quality (i.e., typical 2 beds, tv, small table, fridge layout). Other than some pieces of Disney material laying on the bedside table, you would think you were staying somewhere other than the Happiest Place on Earth. As for the rest of property, it was standard Disney. The themed pool was nice, but it was a little sheltered by trees. If you are looking for some tanning time in the Florida sun, visit one of the other non-themed pools or the waterparks. The other common areas were nice as well. The main dining room was always slammed in the mornings. Either time you trip there for early, early in the morning or wait till after 10:00. Also, the layout tends to lead to guest confusion. People going every which way without any kind of obvious flow. Also, we did not experience any issues with Disney transportation (as I've read in other reviews). The depot closest to our room was convenient, and we never had any issues catching a bus at the main depot. Overall, this was a good place to stay. While we probably won't stay there again (only because we want to try other Disney hotel options), I would recommend it to a small family that plans to spend the bulk of their time at the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Trainman10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great time at Port Orleans riverside. We were there the first week of March 2010. We stayed in Oak Manor and have requested it for our second trip this year coming up Labor day. We will be staying 6 days. Can't wait to experience the nice hot weather. I'm sure we will make alot of use of the pools and water parks which it was a little too cool in for in March. In 2009 we stayed at Carribean Beach which was nice but a little too spread out. At POR we enjoyed walking across the river to breakfast and the shops. Mousekeeping was great. We had towel animals every day and everything we asked for was there when we came back in the afternoon from the parks. My wife left tips and candy everyday. The only thing we have to complain about is the coffee in the rooms.We learned to bring our miny Keurig and K cups from home. The taste of the coffee provided is much too bitter for our taste. We would highly recommend this resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: DisneyFan4evah
Reviews.Content: Have always enjoyed the boat ride to the resort when at Downtown Disney, and decided to book a stay (9 days) at the Riverside. We had such a great room in one of the mansions. The room was spotless and always well-maintained, respect the staff and tip them! Anything we asked for or requested was immediately taken care of by the staff. We have stayed at multiple luxury and even value resorts at Disney and this had the feel of a luxury resort with its incredible grounds, yet incredibly affordable - barely more than a value resort! I do not see the need to try anymore resorts at Disney, unless a new one opens up. We have been going to Disney every couple of years for over 20 years and wish we could have stayed even longer...it never is long enough!

Reviews.Title: “My family has found our new Disney property.”
Reviews.Author: fquinter
Reviews.Content: This was my family's fifth Disney trip in six years. My family of four ages are 39, 37, 13, and 9. We stayed in the Port Orleans Riverside for six nights, from July 15 - July 21st. In this review I will break down several parts of the entire experience. Please read as much or as little as you feel necessary. MAGICAL EXPRESS/CHECK IN: At the Orlando International Airport, we found the Disney Transportation to be as efficient as it can be. I had my Magical Express boarding documents in hand which saved me time. We waited for no more than 15 minutes, boarded our bus with people staying in the French Quarter and Old Key West resorts. The Riverside was the first stop. In less than 30 minutes we arrived at the Riverside. I did on line check in the day before our arrival. Upon entering the lobby, there were two active windows for those who checked in on line and 5 for those who had not. I was "next" and the young man was courteous and pleasant during check in. I really don't feel checking in on line lessened my time. OUR BUILDING/ROOM We were in "Magnolia Terrance," building 85. I made three requests during my initial reservation, two of which were granted. I wanted this building as one of my three choices, and ground floor. We were very satisfied with our room and the grounds. I timed a casual walk from room 8562 to the lobby and it took 4:35. It took 2:20 to get to the main pool. In 2007 we stayed in the French Quarter, which is the sister resort to the Riverside. The rooms are identical and take advantage of every 340 square feet. My wife and I slept very comfortably in the double beds. For your reference, I am a 180 pounds and my wife is 115 lbs. The two sinks and curtain separating the room from the sinks allowed for enough privacy. THE GROUNDS: This resort's grounds are truly beautiful. If I were a bird, squirrel, rabbit, or snack I would want to live at the Riverside. We saw all four of these when walking around. One snake that my kids anxiously appreciated, and we never saw again. MOUSEKEEPING: We tipped on two separate days. My daughter decorated some envelopes to leave money in. One one day my wife said commented the decaf coffee wasn't replenished. On another day our used wash clothes were left; and during our six night stay, we never had an animal made from towels. DISNEY TRANSPORTATION: My family and I had some really good luck with the bus system. I only remember having to wait for buses going to EPCOT, and those weights exceeded the "every 20 minutes" by 20 more minutes. EXTRA HOURS IN MORNINGS/EVENING: Going to the parks when they first open is the best way to maximize your experience. On three days we were at the park with magical morning hours. We fast passed and waited in modest lines to ride the kids favorites. We did all we wanted in those parks and were walking out by noon. Expect 60-90 minute waits during peak hours for Toy Story mania, Space Mountain, Expedition Everest, Soarin', etc. On one of the nights Magic Kingdom stayed open till 3 AM. We had one of our table service dinners at Magic Kingdom that night and had planned on taking advantage of the late night, on property privilege. Magic Kingdomâ€™s regular hours were till midnight. The crowds at this park were the worse I have ever seen!! Stay away. There were so many electric carts, baby strollers and people it was the most miserable experience of our days. DINNING PLAN: This was our fifth time to take advantage of the dinning plan and it is really a good deal. Do some research and plan to eat in some of Disney's wonderfully themed restaurants. It will be hard green vegetables unless your eating a table service meal. This trip I learned how to get more from my snacks. In years past we were utilizing a whole snack for pint size milk. At the end of our 2009 trip I found 1/2 gallon milk jugs being sold in the resort stores. I paid 2.99 for a 1/2 gallon that lasted as long as we were there. Plus, when flying Southwest, I spread a case of water into four different suitcases. That, too, saved some snacks and cash. We packed cereals, granola bars and pop tarts and were glad we did. OVERALL: This was my families best Disney Experience. Since we had been before we werenâ€™t on a quest to do all we could each day. On our early days in the parks we took three naps in the afternoon and felt like new people for the evenings. We initially chose the Riverside for a simple change from the French Quarter, but feel it offers more. The Riverside has six pools, bikes and boats for rent, and a full service restaurant. The food court food was carb heavy, but needed for the long days in the park. We have stayed in Animal Kingdom Lodge, Wilderness Lodge, The French Quarter, and feel The Riverside is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: chlobert
Reviews.Content: I just came back from the Port Orleans Riverside resort and was beyond impressed with it. Check in was very efficient with an extremely friendly staff. We loved our room. It was in a perfect location right outside one of the quiet pools and very close to the lobby and bus stop. The grounds were beautiful and well maintained. The pools were great and clean. The food court had a huge variety allowing for even the pickiest eater to find something. The room was extremely clean and well designed. On the one day we declined the maid service they put a bag of towels, shampoo, cups and soap on our door handle. We had the time of our lives and would recommend this resort to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Family Tradition”
Reviews.Author: SAC5286
Reviews.Content: My family and I have always stayed at this, back to when it was called Dixie Landings. I have so many memories of going to Disney World as a child and staying at this hotel that it has become a new tradition now that I'm grown and married. It's a very romantic and wonderful hotel. Definitely the best of the Moderate Resorts, and should be included in the Luxury Resorts. The food court is amazing! My wife and I even moved to Orlando and would go there just to eat, walk around, and enjoy the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: ALJARN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Disney resort for three days in July-the end of a 10 day vacation. I wasn't expecting a lot but clean a clean room is kind of a biggie, especially when paying the inflated Disney prices. We checked in without a problem although there was no offer of help for our bags-just a map and sent on our way. Our room was on the second floor-no elevators so we drug our luggage up the stairs and into our room. The room size was good; large enough for a family of five for a few days, although the trundel bed (for the 5th person) is only good for a very small person. Toilet and tub are in one room; double sinks are outside and there is a curtain that can be closed to separate this area from the sleeping area. This was a nice feature that allowed the kids to sleep a little longer. Room provides a small safe and a fridge, both nice to have. Grounds are beautiful-well kept and very nice to walk around. Disney transportation is very effecient and convenient-one of the ONLY reasons to stay on a Disney property. Cleanliness of the room left a bit to be desired. I realize humid Florida weather can be a problem but the mold/mildew on the shower tiles was unacceptable. I made coffee the first morning we were there-the coffee pot was not touched by housekeeping after that. Pot was not cleaned nor was additional coffee ever left. Basically, housekeeping made the beds and brought fresh towels-towels that felt like sandpaper, but at least they were clean. I am not a Disney fan to begin with and this reaffirms my belief that they are not worth the money paid. This hotel was listed as a moderately priced property-anywhere else it would be rated below that. I would compare the room to something you would find in a Days Inn or Motel 6. Very glad our kids are getting too old for Disney and this should be our last visit!

Reviews.Title: “Just as nice the 2nd time”
Reviews.Author: coulaid
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to take my mother to Disney World at Christmas and I chose POR. I had been there in May 2009 with my husband and son and really liked it. I was excited to go back and take my Mom this time. We were both very happy with the entire experience. She was especially happy to be greeted with our towel animal on the bed upon arrival! We stayed in Acadian House, which is wonderful. It is by one of the quiet pools (the nicest pool, I think.) The room was sized well and we didn't have to fight each other for space! Neither of us minded the walk to the lobby/food court, as the grounds are beautiful. We took an afternoon to tour the "Deluxe" Disney hotels, and we both agreed that the grounds at POR were much nicer. We ate at the food court 4 or 5 times and were always happy with our selections. We rented a car, but used the buses mostly. It was just much easier to have them drop us off at the front of the parks. There were a few waits in the evenings to return when the parks closed, but nothing out of line. We also rode the boat to Downtown Disney one evening - one of the employees in a golf cart stopped to pick us up and give us a ride when it looked like we might miss it! Overall, I was very happy that this was the place I chose to take my Mom for her 1st visit to Disney. She thoroughly enjoyed herself and that made me happy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - If Only The Bed Bugs Didn't Bite So Hard”
Reviews.Author: gordonc1960
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth stay in a Disney resort and our first at Riverside. We had taken the boat trip up the river from Downtown Disney on previous visits and the mansions looked spectacular. On this occasion, we arrived at the resort after a long flight from the UK, feeling a bit tired. Check in was very straightforward and the member of staff was very courteous. We were allocated room 5592 at Parterre Place, one of the 'stately mansions' on the other side of the river. The trek to the room was a bit of an adventure, but we managed to find it eventually. On arrival, the room was cool, and a welcome haven from the 95 degrees outside. We were disappointed to note that although the room had been prepared, there were potato crisps (potato chips) crumbs on the floor and melted chocolate was sticking to the carpet. Furthermore, there were a couple of dirty johnson cotton buds on the floor next to the wash hand basin and clumps of human hair were found in the drawers. We decided to complain about this and made our way back to the reception. The housekeeping supervisor was suitably shocked and promised to clean our room. It was late afternoion and we decide to head off to Hollywood Studion for a couple of hours. On our return there was a voicemail message from the supervisor offering a further apology and a refund of our first night's accommodation costs ($196 dollars). This was a reasonable response from Disney and it was gratefully accepted. During the holiday, we managed to go for a swim in our nearby pool every morning, around 7 am. it was glorious and my wife and I had the place all to ourselves. This was followed by a walk around the beautiful grounds, before breakfast and we were able to walk along the riverside at its peaceful best taking in the sights of all of the local wildlife, including ducks, squirrels, butterflies and othere birds. It really is quite spectacular and makes up for the slightly cramped rooms, where there is no place to sit outside. As has been said before, all of the staff are very attentive and brighten up your day. On one occasion, the battery on my hire car was flat, as I had left the lights on overnight. I asked for assistance at the reception and within ten minutes, a security car turned up at my car with a jump start. A tip was offered but politely declined by the very smart security lady, who told me that it was 'all part of the job' - most impressive. Two minor complaints worth commenting on: 1. We bought four of the refillable mugs a a cost of $14.99 each. Although we made great use of them over the two weeks, our strong view was that, compared to other restaurants outside Disney, the soda (Coke, Fanta etc) was over-diluted. This may be a cost cutting exercise by Disney and I welcome any other comments on this. 2. The bed bugs .in our room were rampant. All of us, except my daughter who wore lycra trousers at night, were badly bitten. I've been bitten before, but never to this extent and never at Disney. Finally, its important to say that we did have a great holiday, although we've probably had enough of Disney now for a few years. We would recommend thius resort to others, as the plusses far outweighed the negatives. Just a pity about the bed bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Laid back, very cozy”
Reviews.Author: courtni89
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about this hotel at first because of all of the crazy reviews, but it was nothing like that. We absolutely loved this hotel. Alligator Bayou was very very very relaxing and quiet. It wasn't very spectacular but it was great for our family of five. We have stayed at disney hotels before and this one was by far the most relaxing. The gardens are beautiful and the pools are very nice. We stayed in the Alligator Bayou in building 14 which was at a wonderful location because it was right next to the south depot for the buses. Our room was cozy for the five of us but all we did was sleep in it. It's really no use spending a lot of money for a hotel especially when you have three children (8, 15 & 20) haha. They loved staying out late every night to see what disney had to offer. We were a little shaky about the dining plan, but BELIEVE ME, it was well worth it!!! My youngest daughter loved the pools and my son took advantage of the boats. Everyone had a great time and I would stay at this hotel again in a heart beat. It's great for any age.

Reviews.Title: “Staying here is a trip in itself!”
Reviews.Author: Disneyfinatic3
Reviews.Content: This Disney resort hotel is ANYTHIG anyone could imagine wanting. My kids LOVED it we could barely tear them away to visit the parks. My youngest daughter took great interest in the gift shop (unbeliveably packed with merchandise.) Also the food was amazing my kids loved the Mickey shaped pancakes and bacon and my husband and I also enjoyed their food very much. The room cleaning was exellent it's amazing I don't even need to clean on my vacation (you might want to to tip the cleaning service if you want a little extra service.) My girlfriend, my brother, and my parents also went to Disney with us and they all stayed in the same hotel and they all said at one point "next time we come back to Disney I am definetly staying here again!" if you want an unforetable vacation experience and to be living in comfort for however long you will be staying then Disney's Port Orleans Riverside is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Disney trip ever!”
Reviews.Author: mattfred98
Reviews.Content: The service was unimaginably bad! We had a late flight into the Orlando Airport. We went onto a coach bus to get to this hotel and it was the last stop and once we got there we were ready to close our eyes. We got to the front desk and we got our room. They gave us nothing to carry our bags and there were a lot of bags. They gave us no flashlights and they gave us one map. It was 2 in the morning and it was pitch black and it took us about half an hour to find our room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in every way”
Reviews.Author: happyincinci
Reviews.Content: I have read the reviews and was a little worried about staying here. But we did not have anything that we could complain about. The room was clean, no dirt in site. We got fresh towels and towels made into Disney characters everyday. I do suggest that you leave a tip for the maid service especially if you want the extra service. The room was quiet. The landscaping and design was wonderful and very relaxing. The bus service was fast, we never waited for more than 20 minutes and we only waited 20 minutes once on a very busy day. The food was also suprisingly good. The best was the make your own omelete and pasta bars. Every employee that we met did there best to make your day a happy one. They were very friendly, helpful and always with a smile. I truely believe that the people who have left the bad reviews were probably the type who would not be happy with anything. You will see them at Disney, although not very often. They are ones whose sole purpose is to be there but not to enjoy. They are the ones who push ahead in lines, ram their strollers into your heels. Thankfully there are not many of them. Stay here with confidence. You have to look hard to find something wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: murphy8271
Reviews.Content: This place was so hard navigate if you like to walk its the place for you. If not be prepared to walk around in circles. It was loud you could hear toilets flushing all night and frogs . Just like staying at motel . They say they are smoke free "NOT" we had to walk through cigarett smoke from our neighbors every morning and night . They smoked right out side the room so cigarett smoke filled our room eveytime we went in and out . The pools are a joke and its not worth the walk to the big pool but who could find it we stayed there 4 nights before we found the big pool. On top of it all while trying to find our way around we had to listen to a worker say a ugly word (GD) in front of my 5 yr. When we upgraded out tickets the guy who helped us was so rude it was unreal he was so concerned with mine and my husband conversation that he couldn't do what we asked him to do he keep interupting us with hateful comments.While in the gift shop my son and I had been looking a the disney pins trying to pick him out one when this lady butted us out of our spot then a worker came over and gave them a pin just because right in front of my son now try explaining that to a 5 yr The only thing good I have to say about this place is the lady the checked us in was very nice and the pizza was ok. I will never stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “My Impressions”
Reviews.Author: chadb19
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June of 2010 while spending a week as Disney. We didnâ€™t want to stay at an economy Disney resort so, we chose something one or two steps up. From the outside it looks magnificent. It has the look and feel of old southern architecture with the white columns and a river flowing through the middle. Very impressive exterior but we were somewhat disappointed in the interior rooms themselves. The inside rooms are not any nicer than your typical Super 8 hotel. Though not cheap, it just doesnâ€™t match the detail, efforts and cost they put on the outside. I've been to the Disney economy resorts and the rooms are about the same. However, the food at Port Orleans Riverside was better than other Disney Resort Hotels we tried. They also, have boat transportation to Downtown Disney but be careful, this gets crowded in the evenings. The pools are average with one having a water slide for the kids. Overall it is a nice resort but if you donâ€™t need the river and nice southern outside decor, you may want to save your money and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “SO BAD-WE LEFT!”
Reviews.Author: amanda1997
Reviews.Content: this hotel was the most discusting hotel. NOT disney enough. the environment around it was horrible. bugs, plants, too many swamps. the people that stay there were very very unfriendly and LOUD. one person even yelled out at 10:00 PM, "Give me the remote to the car so i can get my lighter!" we swiched to the wilderness lodge after ONE night. the wilderness is the best place to be, really. This was not worth $169.00 a night! very very dissapointed. if you are a disney person, i would NOT recamend this. the only good part was the food. that was fantastic. but the alligator bayou rooms were hidious and NOT beautiful like in the pictures online.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: Msia52
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a seven night stay at this resort. The resort itself is beautifully landscaped. The quiet pool near our room was very nice. The main pool was very crowded all the time we were there. The food court was large and had a decent selection. This resort had a great arcade for the kids and other recreational activities. The boat to Downtown Disney was pleasant. In the lounge was a piano player named Bob. Go see him if you can. He was very entertaining. The downside to this resort is that it is huge. Therefore, very spread out and more crowded. Our room in the Bayou section was average. It definitely needs to be updated. The housekeeping was terrible. While the place was average clean, it wasn't immaculate by any means. One day there was no shampoo, other days no face clothes. The floor was never swept. I thought I saw a roach on the floor in the bathroom. The housekeeping leaves a lot to be desired. The beds were uncomfortable and creaked like crazy. While my room was quiet most of the time, I could hear kids running over head and toilets flushing all night long. I didn't like the bayou theme of this resort. I like tropical and prefer Olde Key West. While we had an okay stay at this resort, I wouldn't choose it again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here is you can't walk”
Reviews.Author: msar1076
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for 6 nights. I would rate this as an average resort. I wasn't thrilled but I wasn't disappointed either. The rooms are definitely on the small side. We stayed in the alligator bayou, bldg 17. It was close to the small pool and laundry facilities but far from everything else. Walking isn't an issue for us but if it is for you then this isn't a good choice for you. It's a 10 to 15 min walk to busses and to eat or use the larger pool. Let me start with the room. Like I said it was on the small side and the beds were so creaky. Everytime you rolled over the bed made a noise. They are full size beds so if you sleep in a larger bed at home you might find this annoying. Some days our room was cleaned well and other days it was like they went in and changed the towels and threw the blankets up on the bed. I think they could have done a better job. I tipped and felt like they just took the money and left. We had a corner room and it was nice and bright with two windows. We requested a second floor room and roll away bed and we didn't get either one. You could hear toilets flushing all night. The grounds are pretty nice. It does look like the Louisiana bayou. Lots of greenery and very little flowers. I like the more tropical feel. We took the boat to Downtown Disney which was very relaxing. The food court was good and the bar with Bob the entertainer was a fun night. Someone mentioned that the bus transportation was slow. I just learned an inside tip from someone that drives for Disney. She said each resort is responsible for their own transportation. They all have budgets and create their own transportation budget. So if the busses here are slow it's the management at POR that sets the budget to hire the busses and drivers. Maybe if enough people complained they may increase their budget. I didn't find that an issue. Once we waited forever for a bus to Epcot while four magic kingdom busses went by. I wouldn't stay at this resort again because I want more of a tropical feel but it wasn't terrible either. It's a huge resort with a ton of people but it always seemed quiet.

Reviews.Title: “VERY nice”
Reviews.Author: Rion0712
Reviews.Content: My mom and I figured we would try Riverside because the last 2 times we stayed at French Quarter. Riverside was pretty great...still had the boat to Downtown Disney (which is one of the best perks). I also recommend renting a Sea Racer (a little pricy but very fun!). Riverside is pretty big so I would recommend trying to get a Mansion House because they are pretty close to the dining, buses, and renting the boats or bikes. We stayed at the Mangolia Mansion and had 2 pools close by, the main pool and a smaller quieter one. The main pool is very nice with lots of chairs, both is the shade and sun. Another good thing about Riverside is the washers and dryers. They are pretty clean and do the job. I would very much recommend Riverside.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous grounds, however, a 15 minute...”
Reviews.Author: lchilds72
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous grounds, however, a 15 minute walk or more to eat or to the main pool. We had many housekeeping issues that took awhile to be addressed, but finally were. Dining hall and lobby are beautiful! I would recommend this resort for able bodied individuals. If walking is difficult for you, this is too spread out. The ferry to Downtown Disney is also a must!

Reviews.Title: “My Disney Vacation”
Reviews.Author: JoeChgo
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel ... beautiful grounds ... spacious rooms. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to Return!! Awesome time at POR!!!”
Reviews.Author: MSLuv2travel10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at POR June 5-10. I had requested either Magnolia Bend or Oak Manor but wound up with Acadian House. While initially disappointed, once we got to the room, our doubts were erased! The grounds are beautifully landscaped and it is so peaceful. We rarely heard outside noise in the rooms. We spent a great amount of time in the main pool and also did laundry while at the quiet pool. That worked like a charm! The pool area did get crowded but not terribly so. I had also heard complaints about the size, but the walk was no worse than my "Preferred" room at ASSports last year. All of the Cast Members were so friendly and helpful, some going out of their way to assist us. Sarah checked us in efficiently and quickly. The boat ride to DTD was a great way for transportation! We actually did this numerous times. My husband was a huge skeptic regarding his 1st visit to WDW and before the trip was over, he said to book another visit at POR!!! Our one complaint (and this was major !!) is the bus system. The buses are slow. We never had over-filled buses but sometimes we waited over 30 minutes for a bus! Even previously at ASSPorts the buses were so fast and efficient. I had heard bad reviews on the buses and I can now confirm that those reviews were dead on!! It is one thing you would think Disney could easily correct!! We can't wait for our next visit and plan to utitlize more of the amenities and really relax next time while visiting POR.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Pleasant Property”
Reviews.Author: Librarierin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while on a week-long trip to Disneyworld. It was a tight fit for my family of 5, but the roll-away trundle bed was a good solution for my 3 year old (too big for pack and play, too small for a "real bed"). Navigated through the property necessitated a lot of walking (definitely plan on using strollers for younger kids), but it helped give the entire resort a sleepy, relaxed atmosphere--a very pleasant contrast to the crowds found in the Disney theme parks. The themed pool was lovely, as was the riverside setting of the food court and playground. We were very busy in the theme parks, but I do wish we had had a bit more time to just relax and enjoy the resort.

Reviews.Title: “An honest review for Port Orleans Riverside”
Reviews.Author: NashvilleDisneyFans
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans June 6-11th this year. Our family has stayed at many upscale hotels, as well as your standard Hampton Inn/Fairfield Inn, etc. I would compare Port Orleans rooms to a nice Hampton Inn, and the grounds to one of the more upscale resorts we have stayed at. The grounds are gorgeous. Our room was recently redone so we had beautiful all new bedding, 2" wood blinds, etc. It was spotless and we never saw a single bug, even being on the ground floor. We had a corner room by the pool which was especially nice. The rooms are very sound proof so we never heard a peep at night, even staying near the pool. I would agree with some of the other posts that the food court is not as good as the one at the All-Star movies resort, but remember that this resort also has a sit down restaurant where you can go for a nicer meal, something the All Star resorts lack. The gift shop is great. We never needed to call the front desk in the entire time we stayed there. The Old Man River pool is fun with a great water slide that our 5 and 7 year old girls loved. Here is the best hint I can give you....request a room near the food court and main pool. Otherwise you will be walking forever to refill your drink mugs or eat. It is a very spacious, sprawling resort. My only real complaint is that at the bus stops, there is absolutely no organization. It is a free for all. There are no "lanes" to stand in, so basically you can be waiting for 10 minutes, only to have a family walk up at the last minute, jump ahead of you in line, and miss a bus. Not fun if you are in a hurry. We are not a confrontational family, but I can't tell you how many times this happened. That is truly our only complaint though. Everything else was great. You will enjoy a stay here. However, having smaller children, we might stay at a more colorful, "kid friendly" resort next time like Carribbean Beach. Port Orleans strikes me as a place to go for peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: asatterfield
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful resort. We have stayed in a few different Disney properties and this was one of our favorites. The grounds are beautifully landscaped, the staff was friendly and helpful and the rooms were clean. We arrived at 12 a.m. and our room was already clean and available for us to check in. We used the trundle bed for our 3 year old and it was fine. We really had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Good resort, lovely view and location but uncomfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: richa678
Reviews.Content: the resort is lovely. it has a nice pool. It has a good choice of restaurants and the food court is good. The overall feel is great. It is huge resort. Our rooms were closer to main part of the hotel, so we were lucky but you could be unlucky too/ However i expected the rooms to be larger. The beds were very very uncomfortable. The bathrooms were ok but there were no toiletries provided. we had to take extra shampoo from housecleaning lady as none was replaced in our rooms after 2 days. Thats the negative. But it was great to stay in disney resort due to sheer comfort of the disney pick-up and drop. other than for the bed i would recommend it to others

Reviews.Title: “Three Strikes, they're out ... Clueless, Rude & Did NOT respect the "Do not Disturb" sign!”
Reviews.Author: violetcarrie
Reviews.Content: We arrive at midnight, ask for a king size bed upgrade... "we can't do that now, you'll have to ask tomorrow", says the front desk clerk. He can't check the computer for incoming guests tomorrow and housekeeping has to let him know of the availability (huh??). On the way to the room, I slip on some water on the walkway and bust open my knee, not completely their fault, but... slippery walkways, really? Our room is filthy. Coffee or ? splattered all over the walls in the bathroom behind the sinks, and half-sucked on mini m&m's all over the carpet. Was fun cleaning up the bloody knee in a dirty bathroom sink! Day two was fine... Day three AM, ear-piercing fire alarm goes off, waking us up and I call the front desk... "What alarm?" She asks. Yep. 20 minutes later, the alarm was shut off. We leave our room a bit dis-shoveled and put a "do not disturb" sign up on the door so they won't see our underthings everywhere. End of day three, and SO tired from the alarm incident, we wander up to the front desk and ask for a late check-out for the morning. Three cast members say we'll have to take it up with housekeeping at 7 am... & they are rude about it. Ummm... why would a hotel leave a late check out decision up to housekeeping? We ask them if they could call housekeeping for us at 7am... "no". Friendly folks... so much for sleeping in, right? Get to the room... "Where's the do not disturb sign?!?" Removed, but our room is clean, underthings and all, do not disturb sign on the table. UGH. Strike THREE. I LOVED this resort for the past 16 years (have stayed here over a dozen times) we've been coming here but this visit was awful & might keep us away in the future!!!! Less cute little bottles of mickey shampoo, less clean and pretty, less communication from front desk staff to... frankly anyone else in the resort... and more rude & clueless overall :( What can you learn from this? Throw everything you know about staying at normal hotels out the window and blame housekeeping for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: nrsatheart36
Reviews.Content: We had booked the Port Orleans for our Disney resort vacations. The room was cleaned well.(of course we left a tip everyday). It was roomy and for the amount of time the 4 of us spent in it. We stayed at Oak Manor and it was fairly close to the main buildings and the feature pool.(other pools are between the buildings) I could see where people who stayed at other buildings that they would have to walk aways . the French Quarters Grounds looked very nice too. The boys did get to go fishing one day and were glad of that . the best feature was that we could take the boat to Disneytown to go to another resort to eat or to shop and eat. The buses were nice and although the wait wasnt long the ride was sometimes long depending on how many stops they had. Of all the 7 days we were there, I only ran into 2 rude people at Disney and the resorts. (they were rude to other people not us). I was impressed with the cleanliness of the resort and the parks. the meal plan was definitely worth it. and the food was great... a lot of food. I was happy with the hotel service they were always happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite resort @ Disney”
Reviews.Author: niczackkatiestruzz
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here 3 times going back to 1998 when it was called Dixie Landings. And I've got nothing but good things to say about the resorts staff, landscaping,rooms, and amenities. We've also stayed at Caribbean Beach and Coronado Springs yet we always come back to P.O. Riverside. We have a family of 5 so the trundle bed is a great feature for us. We love the boat ride to Downtown Disney, and it's central location means short bus rides to all of the parks. The food court is very good, the pools are excellent, and our rooms have always been very clean. We're going back this August, can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere and wonderful Disney service.”
Reviews.Author: jess0334
Reviews.Content: The grounds were beautiful. The rooms were quiet and clean. I have been to Disney over 20 times and this resort is one of my favorites. We have stayed at many of the resorts from the Contempary to All Star Music. There were blooming orchids by the pool. My son who is six loved the big water wheel in the dinning area. I don't think you can go wrong with any Disney resort. We stayed at Pop Century the last two times and enjoyed that as well. The service at Disney can't be beat (at any hotel or Park). I would highly advise getting the meal plan it is a great deal if you plan on character dinning and sit down dinning. Also use your fast pass. We will be back. Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely do again.”
Reviews.Author: Tina0531
Reviews.Content: I am just returning and wanted to leave a review since I did much review reading before I left for my trip. I would like to help others before they visit WDW due to it all being so overwhelming. I made this trip by myself and my 7 yr old daughter and was a little nervous to do so but I have to say everything was made so easy. The magical express brought us from the airport with plenty of people to give you instructions on the way. We LOVED Port Orleans-riverside. We got to stay at our requested Magnolia mansions, great place for pictures for princesses in their gowns to pose. Great fun at the swimming pool. We were lucky enough to have the shuttle depot right behind us which came in handy after long days at the parks. We also enjoyed the boat transportation to Downtown Disney. The rooms were lovely and had two sinks which is nice for two girls to have. Food at the quick service restaraunt was good. Dining plan a little confusing at first but we got the hang of it. It was really too much food. I left with 5 quick service meals left on my acct. We just couldn't eat that much. (little pointer, take ziploc bags with you for left overs. That came in handy.) My only complaint would be the shuttle transportation. When we were returning from the parks, we were the only resort with an extremely long line waiting for a ride back. Very frustrating after long hot days and especially during a really bad thunderstorm to look around and see every other resort lines were empty bc they had their customers back quickly and safely. Otherwise the trip was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: bellaluv528
Reviews.Content: Very nice resort. The staff very friendly and made my granddaughter feel special on her 5th birthday. The rooms are small but clean.. We ate breakfast and dinner at the dinning hall. (a bit expensive) Good choice of food. The pool was nice and clean, grounds are beautiful. I really didn't know what to expect, reading some of the negative reviews, But we were very lucky..our stay here was very pleasant and I would come back to to this resort..Will Come Back..

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here. It stinks! "wink, wink"”
Reviews.Author: ReimLaw
Reviews.Content: It pains me to give this resort a 5 star rating because I don't want anyone else to know how great it is. What an outstanding resort. We stayed at this resort with our 2 kids from May 27th to May 30th for our 10 year anniversary. We live a little over an hour from Disney so we have stayed in the value resorts on numerous occasions but this was our first time staying in a moderate resort. I think I'm hooked. POR is absolutely beautiful, quiet and offers so much for kids of all ages. We did the carriage ride to French Quarter for the whole family and the Bayou Cruise for my oldest. We had the option of renting a surrey bike or boats at the marina. There's a piano entertainer named YeeHa Bob that performs Wednesday through Saturday but unless you get a dinner in the River Roost area and stay at the table until he performs at 8:30pm, be prepared to stand. The lack of space in this area is the only negative we experienced. We stayed in the Magnolia Terrace mansion of Magnolia Bend. We were in room 8912 and did not experience one single problem with mousekeeping. When we got to the room, the carpet had just been steam cleaned and the employee was getting his things together. He apologized for how he was in our way from getting in the room. Dude, seriously?!?!? We thanked him for making the place spotless. This was just a prelude to the service we received from mousekeeping on our trip. Around 11:30 pm the night before our check-out, my oldest daughter got sick. She spewed all over the pillows and linen of her bed. I called the front desk and received, what I felt to be, a sincere well wish for my daughter from the cast member and was told she would summon mousekeeping. We waited about 10 minutes and a young college student working at Disney showed up to exchange all the linen. Although it, technically, was his job to do it, he did it with care and did not rush though it. Not once did I feel it was a bother, even though I know it was not something pleasant to do. If I had to give POR one negative, it was the breakfast we chose. We only ate there one day and we ordered the bounty breakfast. The food was your typical fast food type in quality but the quantity is what I found to be poor. For nearly a $9 plate, the portion was that of a $5 plate. Although this was a negative at the time, it is also something we could have avoided and learned from had we eaten there on other days. There are other options to choose from that would have better suited us. We most definitely recommend POR and do not see ourselves staying at a value resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but not that roomy”
Reviews.Author: racso12
Reviews.Content: This resort was nice.The rooms were very clean but kind of crammed for us because there was five of us.I would not recommend it if you have older kids. The grounds were beautiful and green. Meandering paths lead you to all rooms and sign posts point the way . It can be tricky at night. We had one of the furthest buildings from the the lobby and that was a good block walk. The resort has 4 disney bus depots so that you can catch a shuttle bus nearest your room.If you come in on the Disney Magical Express from the airport ,you need to "reserve " your pickup at the lobby earlier before you depart. Be careful because Disney uses their Magical Express Buses (Airport) and Disney Cruise Line bus interchangeably . No one at the lobby said anything to us that the Cruise Line Bus was going to be our transport back to the airport. Good thing WE asked. Keep in mind that this resort is not one huge building but numerous two floored buildings. It has complimentary boat service to Port Orleans French Quarter and continues on to downtown disney. I was told that all Night Clubs at downtown disney have been closed.Overall it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...But, You Probably Won't Fall In Love With It.”
Reviews.Author: GVTrai58
Reviews.Content: My review is coming from a spoiled individual that has never stayed at a moderate resort before. And I took my family to the Boardwalk Inn in December and the hotel and room are on another level. Now, that being said this is what I think of the Port Orleans Riverside. For the money it is good. The room is certainly smaller than the rooms at the Deluxe hotels. The rooms have two double beds instead of two queen beds. And our bed did was not comfortable. We were in Alligator Bayou and the room faced the parking lot. The pros were I pulled right up to the room and unloaded the car easily. The disney bus stop was fairly close to the room also. The hotel is nice looking. The negative for my particlular room was it was a pretty good walk to the lobby/food area. Now, we were right next to A swimming pool - BUT - my kids always wanted to swim at the big pool with the waterslide which was a decent little walk. But, they loved the waterslide. The buses ran pretty good. I am certain we never waited more than 10-15 minutes for a bus. We ate at Boatwright Dining Hall on our last night and it was excellent. My wife and I both had the prime rib. We also had an appetizer of shrimp over fried green tomatoes with a remoulade sauce drizzled over it. It was a good meal and the waiter - forgot his name but he was a Columbian - was outstanding. Sometimes an excellent server can make the dining experience. Overall, I was pretty satisfied with the hotel considering what it costs compared to some of the other hotels we've stated at. The discounts Disney is offering made it hard to pass up. We had 5 days of tickets (family of four) and four nights in the hotel for $1,260. I added on the Disney dining plan and we were out the door for $1,700. You cannot beat that. So, if you are on the fence about this hotel you should get off the fence and check in. You get all the benefits of staying on Disney's property for a very low price.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Honeymoon!!!”
Reviews.Author: cortneyelwert
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were so excited when we were planning our honeymoon and thought this resort would be perfect for us. We were right. Not only was it the perfect resort for the money it was perfect for the time of year. We stayed there in mid January of 2007. First we arrived at the air port and we got on the magic express bus. It was a nice relaxing ride. We were the second to last stop and we went right into the lobby to check in. It was about 11:30 in the morning and there was no line what so ever. The cast member at the desk was very nice and explained how our dining package worked. I was worried we would not be able to check in yet since it was not even noon but I was wrong, we were able to check in right away. We made it to our room and opened the door and I was blown away. I had never stayed on Disney property before and it had always been a dream of mine and I was not disappointed!!! The room was wonderful. Clean, and bright, 2 large windows (i am big on windows). Our luggage was already there!!! I was so excited and on the bench in the room was a gift basket from my sister in law with cracker, cheese and wine!!! Apparently she called ahead when we were on the plane and had them bring it to our room!!! We had a nice view of the courtyard right by the river, and we were a stones throw away from the main building where the restaurants, pool and lobby were. There was a bus stop in front of the main building and we never had to wait more than 15 min for a bus to anywhere in Disney. We stayed for a whole week and we just loved it. I dont really have any complaints about the resort. Going in mid January was the best time to go. We did hit 2 90 degree days which was nice because the pool after a long day at the parks was great. Other than that the weather was great. Only rained once for an afternoon as well! Checking out was a breeze and they actually send you a reminder when your magic express bus left the next day to remind you!!! It was great, it was under our door that night when we got back from the Magic Kingdom. My suggestion to ANYONE who is celebrating ANYTHING is to get hooked up with a dining plan, stay in a resort, and use the Magic Express service.....it is so worth it!!! I hope to get back next year for our 5th anniversary!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: GoBucks22
Reviews.Content: Our family really enjoyed Port Orleans Riverside. The grounds are excellent. Beautiful flowers, landscaped areas, etc... The room is not really big but if at Disney I guess you aren't going to spend that much time in the room anyway. The room was clean and we had no complaints there at all. We didn't go to the main pool but rather enjoyed one of the "smaller" ones because it was right next to our room. We heard the main pool was nice but crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Solid value, disney feel at a lower price”
Reviews.Author: brunoTaTa
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at POR. We caught a promotion and got $50 in disney bucks along with a room that ran about $100/night. As always we go when the crowds are lower and the prices are better. The main snafu we had was at checkin, when the clerk said they had no record of any $50 gift card promotion. We had booked 2 rooms for ourselves and some family members coming along, so $100 was at stake. Rather than let it waste more time, we agreed we'd contact Disney and settle the matter later, especially as the clerk didn't seem to care enough to even call over management to ask if they were running this particular promotion. (we later got an apology and $100 in cards from Disney's guest relations manager in CA) If there is one problem at the lower cost disney resorts, it is that sometimes the desk staff seem undertrained and almost always "new" to the job. Some definitely are not really into the job, too. The resort grounds are nice, very lushly landscaped, if not always manicured to a high standard. Mowing quality was mediocre, some shrubs needed work, but overall the look is nice and most wouldn't notice the little flaws. The view from the dining facility is very serene, with the water wheel and a view of the "river" outside. It is very spread out, so if you hate walking you may want to stay at PO French Quarter down the street instead. It is somewhat more compact in nature. The theme is either ante-bellum mansions or Disney's idea of homespun backwoods. Ours was the latter, and the effect is quaint, not trashy. My wife really liked it a lot. The rooms are comfortable enough, quiet enough, and convenient enough. It's nice not to have an interior corridor where you hear late night partiers and doors slamming. I also love being able to park near the room and get to the car fast. There are not really any "views" from the room, even the water view rooms you probably want to keep the curtains drawn, because people are walking by a lot at times, and they always seem to be checking your room out! Cleanliness was fine, the bed comfort is typical (not great, but bearable), but I'd like to see Disney do a better job with in-room TV quality. A cheap old tube TV and scratchy cable doesn't really cut it for an entertainment corporation. You don't watch much TV while there, but for a modest cost they could upgrade it. In room internet is avail for $10/night but only if you plug in. No wireless in the rooms. The amenities are fine, though we didn't use the pools. The main building has a table service restaurant, counter service offerings, and a convenience store type place for snacks and small items. They also have a bar. The counter service tastes ok, but service there on two trips has been mediocre. One time they didn't even staff the pizza kitchen and people stood waiting and wondering. The layout is done wrong, causing people to pile up together. They also require you to order each different type of food at a different station. I would imagine this to be hellish for a family with small children each wanting different food types (burgers, pizza, sandwiches, pastas etc). As with most Disney fast food offerings, prices are roughly double what you'd expect in the "real world". Food really is where Disney gets familys' money, I think. Bus service is ok but slow. If you miss a bus mid day, you might sit there 20 min till the next arrives. And to me, riding a bus really saps away any pretense of "disney magic". I prefer to drive to the parks from this resort, whic is much faster, and if you've been there before and understand Disney's strange way of not telling you road names (only showing arrows to go here or there) it's easy enough. A $150 GPS also helps. I find the fact that people go to WDW in the summer and on holidays when it's packed proof that a large number of people are insane, but in the off season this is a nice resort for a relaxing trip. If staying with more than one small child, I'd stay off-site and get a much bigger place for the money. Just be aware that Disney charges $14/day!!!! for non-resort guest parking at the parks. But food and lodging will be less, and many non-disney resorts are nearly as close by. You will get to a park faster if you are driving from off-site than if you are taking a bus from this resort most of the time. But in the world of Disney the moderate resorts are the closest thing to a "good value" that you will find. The "value resorts" are said to be too noisy for many, too small, and lack the attractive peaceful vibe. But if you are simply a park commando, you might find them to your liking due to the reasonable price. If stopping in for a night I may stay here again, but in the off season one can usually find deals at Swan/Dolphin for a better more convenient location, and the Downtown Disney resorts are also a good alternative for a cheap but nice room that is close to dining and fun at night. Disney, being kid oriented, gets VERY quiet after a certain time at night around the moderates. If you like doing things after about 8pm there are more things to do staying other places. You may feel "stuck" at this resort if you do not have a car after dark. Budgeteers. Especially those with families to feed. Disney zaps you on food, park passes, and lodging. Consider staying at a more expensive resort there but for fewer nights. This will allow you to spend less time getting TO the parks and more time ENJOYING them. You can also pop back to the room for breaks and get more out of each day. Go in the off-season, when heat and crowds won't ruin your trip. Plan park outings for mid-week days, when crowds are smaller and you can walk on many attractions. Basically, a family man staying at this resort will be dropping maybe $500-$700 per NIGHT to stay here, eat, and have fun. Don't spend your valuable time standing in lines for attractions, waiting on buses, standing in more lines for food, and waiting to get somewhere. Turn a 7 night trip into 5 by going at the right time of year, staying in the right place, and you will probably have a better time.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at Port Orleans-Riverside”
Reviews.Author: johnnymike
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth stay at Port Orleans-Riverside and I still love it as much as I did the first time. In my opinion this resort is Disney's best value. It's not so stripped-down (like All-Star/Pop Century) that you don't actually get anything but it's not as overpriced as the deluxe resorts. It's better than it's sister French Quarter only slightly in the sense it has a full-service restaurant, more pools, and more recreation. The boat ride to Downtown Disney (while not fast) is a great excursion and bus service seemed quick enough. The food court is great and I could sit by their pools for hours. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, do not listen to the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: foxhood
Reviews.Content: I seriously do not understand how people can write bad reviews on this hotel. First of all, it was one of the most picturesque and well landscaped hotels that I ever stayed at in Disney - and I've stayed in at least 7. I stayed in Magnolia Bend, which I would highly recommend because everything was right there with very little walking. The room was very well kept and clean, and the service was wonderful. The dining area was great, they had all kinds of different foods. The restaurant, Boatwrights, was incredible (I would recommend the slow roasted prime rib). The General Store "Fultons" was so nice! They had everything you could possibly want. The French Quarter is a very nice 5 minute walk from Magnolia Bend, which I would recommend doing on a cooler night. The "Fishing Hole" is a lot of fun, and very inexpensive. So please, if you are considering staying here, but are veered because of these nasty comments, please disregard them because after staying at the Caribbean Beach, The Beach and Yacht Club, The Boardwalk, and the Wilderness Lodge; I really enjoyed Disney's Port Orleans Riverside the best =)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but lots of walking”
Reviews.Author: phototimeUk
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival our room was still dirty so we had to be moved which wasnt the best start after a lot of travelling. Our fridge door was broken, the tv remote didnt work and the floor was dirty but all problems were sorted within a few hours so we cant fault their service.The rooms were comfortable,but nothing special. The surroundings at the hotel were beautiful, but you will have to walk lots to get around. We would recommend eating at the hotel for a couple of nights as its quick and affordable, but the menu never changes. Buses at the hotel run all the time so you never have to wait long, if you fancy a change there is a boat that runs to down town, takes a lot longer but nice to say you've done it. Warning - getting out of the parks and waiting for buses after the firework shows in the evening may take some time. Enjoyed our time at Disney, and eat out at Planet Hollywood at downtown disney!! Hollywood studios and Epcot are a lot of fun, and go see auditions on american idol, the warm up guy was hilarious!!

Reviews.Title: “Landscaping was nice, but rooms were dirty. Shame on Disney”
Reviews.Author: cincin57
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at numerous Disney resort's and this one was even worse than the All Star Sports Resort. This resort was way over priced for the quality of the room. The dressers were dirty and the area surrounding the tub had dust and bugs on it. Furniture in room was chipped and the whole room had bugs. I would not use the small refrigerator because it looked dirty. The dining area (not the table service area) was noisy and dirty. The location was pretty far removed from the parks that we visited but it was very well maintained outside. I really enjoyed sitting on a bench by the river. I also left a very valuable diamond necklace in the safe and did not realize it until I got back to PA. After repeated phone calls over several days and a police report I did get the necklace back. Thanks to the supervisor at the resort it was shipped back to me overnight. Overall I would rate this resort as a poor choice for those wanting a clean room and a less noisy eating area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: saffron1000
Reviews.Content: Okay after reading several reviews here I was a little nervous about this resort. I went with Lysol wipes in hand ready for a dirty room. I was shocked. The room was meticulous. Housekeeping was also wonderful. We had funny towel animals left for us each day. The grounds were lovely. I was in room 1433. (I requested a room in building 14 as I heard these were close to all the amenities. ) Overall we had a wonderful stay and would recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but watch out for bus service”
Reviews.Author: anhmzz
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with many things about this hotel. We stayed in one of the "mansions," not one of the bungalows. The staff was very nice and our room was kept clean. It wasn't the largest or fanciest room I've ever stayed in, but I had no complaints about the size and thought it was quite nice for a 'moderate' level hotel. I should note this is the only Disney resort I've ever stayed at, and have no point of comparison for their other in the park accommodations. Things I liked: beautiful grounds; lush trees; great attention to detail; great atmosphere. Several fun choices such as a horse and carriage ride. A fishing hole that was perfect for my 3-and-a-half year old (possibly not as much fun for older children). Multiple pool choices, including a good sized wading pool, outdoor hot tub, and fun water slide. Anoles and geckos which were fun to spot. Nice sized general store with a good choice of souvenirs. A dining hall which I think has a tendency to get crowded but we never had a problem (could be lucky). Babysitting service. A housekeeping staff with a whimsical sense of humor (for example - my daughter's Cinderella doll was placed with one slipper on, one off to the side like it had fallen off as in the movie). Several bus stop choices. Things I did not like: for our first day, the bus service was horrible. Not inconvenient, not less than perfect, not annoying - horrible. We waited over 45 minutes to see a bus to the Magic Kingdom before giving up and driving our rental car. Then we waited over 30 minutes to see ANY bus for our resort in the evening. We were in a line that extended to the end of the bus depot and witnessed MULTIPLE busses arrive for EVERY other resort before a single bus arrived for this hotel. When we called to complain (we were not the only ones who did) there was not even an apology, just the excuse "they're doing the best they can." How good can the service be when literally every other hotel can get 2 or more busses in the time it takes ONE to arrive for one of the largest bus-needing resorts in the park? I repeat, the service was beyond bad - the WORST bus service I have ever experienced. An absolutely miserable way to start our vacation. Having said that, AFTER the first day, the service was VASTLY improved. Even though lines got long to leave the parks (it's a very big resort), there were at least busses arriving with a much steadier frequency. Naturally when it gets crowded you can expect to wait, but after that first day we didn't experience the horrible service again on our trip. I've read other reviews that mention the bus service - both good and bad - so it does seem to be spotty for this resort. I get the sense they can handle an average sized crowd, but are completely unprepared for peak levels. I hate having to mention the terrible bus service, since overall I really enjoyed our stay and thought the resort was very lovely with lots of choices to stay entertained. In many ways the resort was better than I'd expected. My recommendation would be to STRONGLY consider taking your car to head to the parks, especially if you are travelling to Magic Kingdom or if you will be travelling during busy times such as park close. It's just too much of a risk in my opinion - especially if you have young ones - to be left stranded by the possibility of awful service. Hopefully you won't experience the bad luck we did, but better safe than sorry.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: krissyrae823
Reviews.Content: I am a very picky person so I had my concerns about this hotel after reading some of the reviews. However, for budget purposes I decided to give it a try since we only sleep there anyway. In the past we have stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge, & Grand Floridian - so I was hoping not to be disappointed cause lets face it those are both GORGEOUS :) I'm so glad we stayed here - I LOVE LOVE LOVE this hotel!!! We stayed in the Oak Manor mansion with a river view (I wasnt interested in the Alligator Bayou section). Sure the room could use some updating (mostly in the bathroom area) but it wasnt so bad that its a deal breaker...we were pretty much just there to sleep. We enjoyed the grounds and one of the most fun things we did on our trip was rent the surrey bike....that was a BLAST!!! Housekeeping was there everyday restocking our towels and making our beds...and always left a towel animal or did something cute with our daughters stuffed animals on the bed which she loved. Ate at the quick service restaurant often - which fortunately is open LATE. One night at Magic Kingdom the park was still open for EMH but we couldnt find an open restaurant to eat at, so we had to wait until we got back to the hotel. One night we even ordered pizza from pizza hut and they delivered it to the lobby. We were on the regular dining plan but it only has 1 table service, 1 quick service, and 1 snack - so on late nights that wasnt enough and we were STARVING :) The pool was fun - our daughter LOVED the slide, and I have to admit even us adults loved it. We also walked to POFQ and used that pool too - i think both are fine. Bus transportation was sometimes frustrating but mostly just at busy times. We would hang out in the shops in the parks and wait for the crowd to clear out before we would even try to catch a bus in the evening. And its good to have early bkfst reservations so that you can get in the park before it opens and then you dont have to stand in those crowded lines ;) We are on a mission to try all the WDW hotels so our next trip we are trying Wilderness Lodge - but I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. In fact, I think so far it's my favorite as far as the overall package. It was a fair price and a GORGEOUS hotel with friendly staff who were always willing to help!

Reviews.Title: “This place needs work.”
Reviews.Author: debhalter
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very dirty and needed fumigating. The front desk staff is less than accomodating. Upon check-in, we were given our room number and a small map which was to help us find our room. Good luck with that! It's EXTREMELY difficult to find your way around. We asked for a late check-out as our flight was later in the day. Micheal - a front desk manager - was rude and insisted he needed our room cleaned as soon as possible so that a large party could check-in later. The room wasn't clean when we checked in; far from it! We found the staff (except for housekeeping) to be unfriendly and we didn't feel our business was appreciated. The food court was filthy. I'm surprised we didn't get sick eating their very expensive food. No one seemed to care about the customer... We'll stay in a non-Disney property next time.

Reviews.Title: “A Bear loose that will Attack you..."”
Reviews.Author: inspired60
Reviews.Content: DO not stay at this hotel... We got a letter on our table Thursday saying that there is a black bear loose on the grounds eating out of the garbage and trying to get into rooms. The advice they leave is if you see it to go indoors. Where are you supposed to go? They communicated this via open letter on a desk which my 7 year old picked up and read. He now has nightmares being attacked by a black bear. Please change hotels immediately for safety of your family.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful place, great value too!”
Reviews.Author: ahhbeachdreams
Reviews.Content: We loved loved staying here on our last trip to Disney. As a family of 5, there were some limits on which hotels you could stay in on Disney property. This room had a pull-out mattress under 1 of the beds. Our 9 yo loved that! She felt like she was sleeping alone... There were several pools, & our kids loved them all! The one closest to our section was a small one compared to the main resort hotel, but it was still big by pool standards! Of course the big pool was incredible with waterslides and sprinklers and just fun things everywhere! We walked up to the dining area for most meals--don't get turned around! As usual for Disney, the grounds were beautifully kept and themed to go with the resort. This was just a beautiful place and we really had no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Housekeepers steal! Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Dune813
Reviews.Content: great stay at the resort. Until we left and accidently forgot to empty the rest of our stuff do to our kids melting down. We left our video camera and our MP3 player in our safe with it unlocked and wide open. We walked out and called that night. No one returned our call until the next day after multiple phone calls. We called lost and found, the property manager, house keeping...they said they couldn't find it. Since, we used neither of these on the trip- they were in the safe the entire time! The housekeeper is lying or the new people who moved into our room took it. Not sure which one- but it is pretty sad that someone has the heart of stealing someones expensive personal belongings that are so cherishable. Watch your back and clear your room!

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel EVER- Floor never cleaned”
Reviews.Author: 4duffys
Reviews.Content: This was by far the worst hotel I've ever had the misfortune of staying. The room was FILTHY. The floor had clearly not been mopped between guests- it was dirty and covered in hair. Despite our call to housekeeping, it did not improve. There was a rubber band on the floor the first night there and it never moved! We used it as a gauge as to whether they ever cleaned the room. They sheets were too short and left the bed bare with just the mattress cover for about the bottom 12 inches. Left my pregnant wife with a nasty rash. Again, despite pleas, the sheets were never changed. NEVER CHANGED DURING OUR 6 NIGHT STAY!!!! The alarm clock was flashing, by the second day, we tried to set it and discovered it was broken- apparently we were on Alaskan time. There are no towels by the pool, you have to take you room towels and then ask for new ones. Of course, they brought 3 towels even though we asked for 4. Disney spends so much time and $ on their image, but apparently that does not apply behind doors. We will NEVER stay at this or any other Disney resort again. The transportation system is so slow anyway, you're better off staying off site- less money and cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “new orleans vibe”
Reviews.Author: Picotine71
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at the New Orleans Port Riverside. Overall, really liked it, scenery is beautiful. Nice pool area, good for kids - kids playground. Easy to get to any locations of Disney with the bus. Don't forget to book the Magical Express if you go to any Walt Disney Resort. Real New Orleans Vibe. No beach area and not much to do around the hotel (besides going to a theme park). I enjoyed that they had salads and fruits in the cafeteria area, some healthy choices.

Reviews.Title: “The fifth bed dosent exist”
Reviews.Author: Daniloto
Reviews.Content: I went with my family and we are five. I ask for a five room in the disney web page. And be carefull if you are a group of five because theres no rooms that big. I must sleep on the floor . In the lobby the manager always said no , no and no.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: nikiola
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at Port Orleans Riverside. This was our second time visiting Walt Disney World and this by far exceeded our expectations. It seemed real close to all of the parks, bus rides did not appear to be long at all. Beautiful atmosphere and a relaxing environment. Can't wait to plan our next adventure at WDW and we will most definitely will be booking at Port Orleans Riverside!!!

Reviews.Title: “CAN'T WAIT TO STAY HERE AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: jenmoreno
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Port Orlean, Riverside. We were very pleased. This was our first time taking the kids to Disney and we had a very pleasant experience. Rooms were nice and clean and big enough for 2 adults and 3 children. Transportation to and from the park was quick and convenient. Great perk being able to arrive at the park one hour earlier than the general public. It had a very nice dining area and rooms were reasonably priced. Would stay there again and would recommend to anyone. This is coming from a mother who reads all reviews and does the research before booking a place!

Reviews.Title: “good family hotel”
Reviews.Author: inspiredmommy
Reviews.Content: Ok..this resort was very pretty and really nothing was wrong with it..that being said I wasn't wowed at all..Grounds have a lovely southern charm..rooms were small for a family of 5 and the trundle bed was a joke..Ended up with myself, 5 yearold, and 9 year old in one bed and my husband and 5 yo son in the other-double beds none the less. Room was clean. Food court was ok, and the onsite restaurant was very good. Resort is very large and confusing to find room..several times we found ourselves turned about. Pool was very nice. Fishing was a joke but kids enjoyed it. Bell staff very friendly and helpful..Found the conceirges to be not very friendly or helpful..Transportation was fine. All being said nothing glaringly wrong but next time will stay at the Polynesian....

Reviews.Title: “The grounds are absolutely beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: bethyah
Reviews.Content: This resort is truly a nice place to stay. It is a "moderate" resort that Disney offers and by no means is it a "deluxe" resort. However, it is a step up from the value resorts and it offers a pool with a slide that the kids absolutely love! The room was OK. It was clean. The bathroom was small. The beds were small. The room itself could have used a bit of "refurbishment". Mousekeeping always makes towel animals which the kids look forward to. The table service restaurant BOATWRIGHT'S was ok. The food was good, but it could have been warmer. It is expensive, so make sure you're on the DINING PLAN! The quick service restaurant is a "food court". Avoid the morning rush by getting up early and getting to the parks early as well! The food again was just OK.
