The resort offers horse drawn carriage rides for 45$ and you can rent pontoon boats and sea racers, which is a bit pricey! Stay at the Magnolia Terrace buildings closer to the main lobby and pool complex. I didn't see anyone fishing. They offer a "catch and release" fishing experience. I am not sure of the cost. We didn't visit the arcade. The "store" has typical disney items, but nothing special like Downtown Disney stores. You can take the boat to Downtown Disney and Port Orleans French Quarter. All other transportation is by bus. Eat at Chef Mickey's for the kids. My 5 year old twin boys really enjoyed visiting the countries at EPCOT and stopping at the "kidcot stops" for a mask and charms that attach to the mask. Get to the Magic Kingdom Spectromagic Parade at least 1 hour early for a good spot. The WISHES fireworks are good anywhere you are. We will visit again! I can't wait until 2011!

Reviews.Title: “Totally amazing - Disney at it's best”
Reviews.Author: Hols_and_Meals_Out
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing resort. Having been to quite a few, there are a few things to know about Disney Resorts before booking to stay in one: 1) The higher price you pay to stay on Disney is made back by the Free Transport ANYWHERE in DisneyWorld, the service that takes any goods you buy in DisneyWorld back to your room for free and the non-stop Disney magic all day and night. 2) Disney Resorts do have bars, however these aren't the resorts to go to if your sole aim is to get drunk. 3) Disney standards of service, at all levels, are 100%...always. The food here is amazing as is the pool. It is well worth renting a boat and sailing on the River that runs through the resort. Disney staff amaze me always as they constantly go the extra mile to wow you. I would recommend this resort and Disney Resorts as a whole to anybody and I will guarantee no regrets.

Reviews.Title: “luxeAs long as a good walk dosen`t bother you, you`ll love RIVERSIDE !!!!!,”
Reviews.Author: rayc1744
Reviews.Content: Riverside is very beautifully landscaped !! The exterior is just as nice as Deluxe Resorts we have stayed at recently in Disney. The rooms are more modest than a Deluxe Resort however, but keep in mind they are half the price. The Lobby, Restarants, stores, etc. were all very nice although we didn`t eat or shop there much. We did ride the bicycles and try the fishing, which were both nice. Our building was a water view, which was lovely, but I found out afterward this put us a little farther from the bus stop. This was a little challenging after long days at the parks, but was still not that bad. Riverside is very spread out, wooded, and lush which makes it very relaxing and peaceful dispite being very large and often crowded. This sometimes means quite a bit of walking is required, but for half the price of a Deluxe Resort it`s still a great value. We will definetly return to Riverside again !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “" a great family hotel "”
Reviews.Author: hihi56
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! the acivities were amazing. i really enjoyed it. when we first checked in it was about 3:00. we walked in to see a huge wait line- one of my cons - to check in. there is a great amount of boats that take you to various places, we went to downtown disney. another great faily time is the bikes. you actually ride in a bike that looks like a trolly and you have to petal! its hard work but it makes you laugh. if you stay at riverside alligvator bayou you get a great closure of everything if you walk about moment you come to a small pool without a slide, but its still fun and not crowded at all. you can also walk a few more minutes to come to a crossroad which leads to the cafe the buses and a bigger pool with a slide, and if you go on your way to the busses you will reach a parking lot. the port orleans is a quiet place for family fun.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: islandgetawaygirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from March 25th to April 1st. This was my 2nd time at this particular restort and it was very nice. We didn't do the pool at all while we were there for 7 nights but it was very busy every night and it looked fun! Our room was near the more quiet pool and it was very quiet. It's a large resort so my best advice is make sure you get off at the right bus stop when you return from the park or you are going to be doing a LOT of walking just to get back to your area of the resort. The food was average and offered many things for quick service and we loved the muffins for a quick breakfast :) They have a pasta station that is not bad at all. Love the fact that we can take the boat to Downtown disney as an alternative to the bus. It comes pretty much every 10-15 minutes to get you there for dinner reservations too.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: erobertson4654
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. The resort is very accommodating with their concierge, shipping, busing, and water taxi service. Our room was adequate - nice, slightly small, but clean. (After staying at another hotel the night prior in Orlando, we were relieved. So many Orlando hotels charge too much for mediocre rooms.) The Port Orleans Riverside beds are full-sized, which is fine for us. The bathroom was also small, but clean. What we liked were the two pedestal sinks and long counter above them. With the 5 of us, those sinks got a workout! What is especially nice is that there is a long curtain that you can pull to separate the sinks/bathroom from the sleeping area. Gave us a tad more privacy for getting dressed or if someone woke up a bit early. The floor was nicely tiled with slate, which was a great touch. There were lights over each bed with a dimmer switch for each. The room also has a ceiling fan. The dining hall was a zoo in the morning - a downfall. We never ate there but saw the craziness firsthand. We never ate breakfast because we were on the Disney Dining Plan, which doesn't cover breakfast. (We just ate lunch early). We always ate at the parks or resorts - not there. The restaurant/bar there did have a fabulous entertainer play piano and sing one night - and really had the crowd going. What fun they had! You won't wait more than a few minutes for a bus. Port Orleans Riverside has stops at the front and 2 other locations towards the back of the resort. This was nice since we didn't have to walk all the way back to the front of the resort. A bus stop was a short walk across the parking lot for us. There is also a water taxi that can take you to a few other locations at the parks. We rode to Downtown Disney on one, which was a relaxing ride. As far as being on the "riverside", we in a building next to the water (a pond). Still, it was very nice. The Riverside resort has mature trees and shade, which many of the other resorts lack. Our building was totally quiet. No interruptions or excess noise at all. We had neighbors and never heard them. Personal recommendations: 1. Stay here if you want a quiet and wooded location that's family friendly - as long as you don't mind the slightly smaller rooms. We only slept in ours, so it wasn't a big deal. 2. Pay for the Disney Dining Plan. Food's expensive! With the plan, we at $200 meals each night that were covered by the plan. Pretty nice having crab legs, steak, desserts.... Mmmmmm.... Drawback: 1. $10 a day for wired internet. We passed on it and went internet-free for 4 days. My email inbox was only full of junk when I came home and got online. 2. No elevator - we had to drag our luggage to the 2nd floor. (Somehow we managed to get the 2nd floor of every hotel we stayed at on our trip!) If you need a 1st floor room, ask and see if they can guarantee you one. The internet can wait - spend the time with your family!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “I WON'T PAY THAT MUCH TO STAY THERE AGAIN. ROOMS NEED WORK!!!!”
Reviews.Author: teamtinkerbell
Reviews.Content: First the positives: The landscaping was beautiful! Bus stops were close. The pools and kids water areas would have been nice, if there would have been staff to constantly clean the tree gunk out of the water and away from the deck of the pools. I know it's spring, but come on! You couldn't get in the pool with out your feet being covered in tree pollen and pod like things. The food was good at the restaurants and food court areas. The biggest gripe was the condition of the rooms. We were in 8254. The walls were scuffed and dirty. The furniture was shabby, but not chic. The carpet was worn. The chair wood trim in the room had so many coats of paint on it you it was globby. Everything needed to be recaulked. For a Disney hotel, I was disappointed. I think the hotel should be downgraded to a Value level hotel instead of a Moderate level. Or they need to dump some money into the rooms and remodel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Peaceful Resort”
Reviews.Author: keylarose
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the stay, so we decided to return in September at Port Orleans, Riverside, Again. The room was a little small, the service was excellent, if you need anything just ask, and they'll do it. The location is excellent you are a five minute walk to the food court and shops. Just the atmosphere the Southern Mansions is relaxing in itself. From our hotel we could walk across the river or behind our hotel to catch a bus. When we return in September this will be our 3rd visit in 2 years. We are becoming Disney Addicts we can't get enough of the Disney Magic. Disney World is a hassle-free,carefree vacation, if you plan ahead do your research and keep a refuse grow-up attitude. We leave our vehicle in Albany, New York touchdown in Orlando, catch the Magical Express, from their we let Disney World do its magic. Plan your day and your meals (use the dining plan) don't try to enjoy more than you can in a day and you too will become a Disney Addict.

Reviews.Title: “can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: kcmpx2
Reviews.Content: We had so much fun we didn't wan to leave. We were only a 2min walk from the bus stops. Are room was clean everyday we got back. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem!”
Reviews.Author: RockyMountMama
Reviews.Content: This was a delightful resort that made us feel as if we were far away from the hectic pace of the Magic Kingdom. It is peaceful and beautiful, with lovely rooms and friendly staff from the housekeeping staff to the grounds keepers to the restaurant servers. The food was not gourmet but certainly above average, and definitely a bargain on the Deluxe Dining Plan. We had more food than we could ever eat. We loved the mother duck and her ducklings that visited every morning, the kayaking, and the exercise friendly paths. Our most favorite part was the wonderful ferry boats that allowed us to spend a positively incredible canal ride winding through the WDW properties to Downtown Disney, and we were able to avoid the crowded buses and long waits that are just part of the Disney experience. We've made many trips to Disney and each time we stay at a different resort. This was by far our favorite. It's beautiful enough for an antibelum wedding!!! Make this a "must stay" if you're heading to the Wonderful World of Disney! You won't regret it. Just keep in mind that Disney charges for just about everything, but the ferry trips were FREE! Well, sort of! At least we didn't have to pay "extra" fees.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort - Terrible Bus Service”
Reviews.Author: KramerNashville
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at Disneyworld, but our first at Port Orleans Riverside. What a beautiful location! The grounds are meticulously kept, with lush landscaping and great attention to detail. Our room near the main bus stop was a real plus, especially when walking back to the room on a rainy afternoon. The resort restaurant was overpriced, as typical for Disney, but nicely themed and located in a wonderful timber framed building. The only real negative, AND THIS IS SIGNIFICANT, is that the Disney bus service to/from this resort is by far the worst that we've experienced, primarily due to heavy demand, but also due to long waits in the middle of the day. At Magic Kingdom, the Port Orleans (Riverside and French Quarter) bus stops are at the far end of the bus depot. On one occassion, the line literally extended beyond the bus depot, with approximately 5 bus loads of people ahead of us in line. Unfortunately, Disney was very slow to respond with more buses. Throughout our week-long stay, it was easy to find the Port Orleans bus line from a distance -- just look for the longest line (no kidding). Granted, we were there during a very busy spring break week, but Disney should know how many people were staying at this resort and planned accordingly. Last year we stayed at All Star Sports (very basic; poorly reviewed in this forum), but we never experienced such a problem with the bus service. Despite these challenges, we really loved Port Orleans Riverside, due to the beautiful surroundings. Note that the Port Orleans "Riverside" and "French Quarter" resorts are side-by-side, but significantly different; the French Quarter resort was less appealing to us, more of a cliche, but the French Quarter had a more kid-friendly pool, which we used because the Riverside pool was closed for maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Won't go back”
Reviews.Author: elwoodSouthCarolina
Reviews.Content: As an annual passholder I have stayed at all the moderates in Disney this year. So I thought I would try PO Riverside as it was the last one on the list. During all of my other stay's, at other moderates, they have graciously upgraded me to a water view room. Not the case with this place, we were upgraded to a view of the parking lot! The rooms were just OK...the pool area seemed very nice, but we had no time to enjoy it. And this place is HUGE...4 bus stops, just way too big. Opt for Port Orleans French Quarter or Coronado Springs. French Q is very small and 1 bus stop and Coronado's rooms are all remodeled..trust me I would go for one of those!

Reviews.Title: “No Magic Here”
Reviews.Author: klwheaton
Reviews.Content: It was dirty. There was hair on the floor behind the bathroom door, the guests before us soap in the tub, an inch of dust on the bathroom fixtures, a broken globe over one of the beds and some of the furniture was just plain old worn out. I would have expected this from a $50.00 a night hotel, but not a Disney hotel. We asked to have our bathroom cleaned while we went to one of the parks right after check in and it still had not been cleaned when we returned to our room after midnight. My husband talked to the manager on duty and asked for another room and we were told that there were no more rooms available. They did refund our money for that night and sent a man to clean the bathroom. The man who came even told us that it was nasty. There was food on the glasses that were stocked on top of the mini fridge. The next morning we were told that we could move to another room and that it was clean. Upon checking the room, there was toothpaste spit on the bathroom mirror from the previous guests. I asked to be moved to another Hotel and we moved to the Carribean Beach and had a much better stay. Dealing with changing rooms and then hotels took up most of the next day and we did not get to take full advantage of our park tickets for that day. Management acted like it was nothing and we were being to picky. I will never stay here again, not even for free. It was a nasty hotel and Disney should be ashamed.

Reviews.Title: “a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: go_vacation123
Reviews.Content: The room we booked had double beds was functional. Besides that being in a Disney resort has it's perks especially if you are visiting the Disney Parks. Bus rides into the parks are convenient and frequent. No hassle parking etc. We spent a late night(11pm) at the Rain forest cafe in Animal kingdom(Animal Kingdom closes at 8pm), Disney sent a bus just to pick us up. Late hours at Parks are available but we were too tired with small kids. The resort has a great pasta bar in their food court we kept going back there. They had Bike rental. We rented a Surrey (4 wheeled tandem bike). That was fun. Other than that did not try any of their other amenities. No Free internet. That sucked. Overall we had a good experience at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great time had by all”
Reviews.Author: momli7
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a fabulous vacation at Disney! We traveled with 6 kids (5-11 yrs old). The Port Orleans Riverside was very nice and had beautiful grounds. Our rooms were close to the lobby which was nice. I would request building 14 or 15 if you can. Our room was fine. It was clean. The food court was pretty good but we had some really delicious food at the restaurants in the parks! The buses to the park were always there when we needed them. We really didn't wait that long at all. We were also there during a very busy time (spring break). I heard they closed 2 of the parks one day due to too many people! The main pool was great and the kids really enjoyed it! We also rented a surrey bike and that was fun! I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad stay, but with Disney would have expected more”
Reviews.Author: spracr
Reviews.Content: We loved the access to Disney Downtown on the water taxis. 20 minutes by a charming boat and we used it multiple times. Much more friendly feeling than the buses. The room was okay. The beds were a bit hard and there are no queen size doubles so my boyfriend and I were cramped on a very hard double bed that lent to numb limbs throughout the night and tossing and turning... We paid extra for a "water view" that we thought would be the river and we got a great view of the pool. We had to call housekeeping to have the room made up which really surprised me. The food at the food court was below average and, for the three of us, it was wasy to hop on the boat to Downtown for a great meal, but for families hearding little children this would have been a chore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place that makes you Disney Visit easier”
Reviews.Author: bighead9
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable rooms. Our room in building 95 was a 5 minute walk from the main lobby/restaurant/bus stop. The room size was normal but it had double sinks seperate from the bath/toilet and a curtain seperated the sink area from the bedrooms. This curtain created the feeling of a larger room. All disney things are overpriced but I think it's worth it to not have to drive anywhere. The room has wired internet for $10/day.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: pie89
Reviews.Content: We are a family with three kids, two teens and one child (all girls), they loved it and so did me and my wife. This is a excelent facation spot too.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice - would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: JustWalkingSomePlace
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first week of March 2010. We had a great week despite some chilly weather. The resort offered lots of activities. (Horse and carriage rides, pools, arcade, boat rides, fishing, etc) We had a King room with a pack n' play in the Magnolia Bend section and found it to be ample room for the three of us. Acadian House was about 7 minutes to the lobby and restaurant. Our housekeeper was great - each day we found my daughter's characters posing in different places. We had the quick service dining plan. I would get this again. Riverside Mill had lots of variety and the food was great. Some of my favorite choices for quick service was Wolfgang Puck Express at Downtown Disney and Captain Cooks at the Polynesian Resort. (You have to try a Dole Whip!) The resort was centrally located between all the parks. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Disney experience ever”
Reviews.Author: LetTheTravelerBeware
Reviews.Content: Having been to Disney World many, many times since 1974, I have seen it grow and change. I stupidly thought that the "great deal" Disney offered - 35% discount on select moderate price resorts - would be right for me and my husband. BOY, WAS I WRONG! Apparently, Disney herded everyone who fell for the "deal" into this one resort. I emailed and called prior to our stay indicating that I was facing knee surgery and would require a room near the lobby/food court. Upon arrival, my request was not granted, even though I practically begged. We were situated in building #24 - the very last building in its section. While not too far from a Disney bus depot (read on), it was extremely far from the main part of the resort. Furthermore, my silver earrings were stolen by the housekeeping staff -I have no doubt about this since I know where they were left and my husband walked back into the room while both a male and female housekeeper were there and they freaked when they saw him and scooted out before replenishing the coffee supplies (exactly where the earriings were left). The room itself was okay although there was a stain on the carpet. The staff, in general, was less friendly than in years past and if I heard one more "Have a Magical Day," I thought I would throw up. With regard to the Disney buses -- because this particular resort was loaded to capacity by bargain seekers (nothing is a bargain at Disney World), we had to wait up to 40 minutes for buses to arrive and to take us back to the resort from the theme parks. Needless to say the parks were mobbed - and for $75/day to enter a park, one should be able to go on all the desired rides and attractions. This was not the case - couldn't get into Pirates of the Caribbean on the day we went to the Magic Kingdom - it was a one hour wait on line (NOT!) and on one day in Epcot, a Fast Pass obtained at 10:30 AM for Soarin' had us coming back at 8:12 PM ! (NOT!) The most egregious - $10/day for Internet access!!! Even McDonalds offers free WiFi. What a Disney rip off! What could have made this trip better? Staying at a better resort - we loved the Dolphin and Coronado Springs on previous visits - and Pt. Orleans has no spa, gym or other adult amenities Definitely would rent a car next time - the buses are free but you get what you pay for Need to leave Disney property on a regular basis - less costly food options, souveniers, and simply to leave the "Stepford Wives" feel of the Disney experience Travel during an off time - but not in the heat of summer. I thought we would be okay because we traveled the week before Palm Sunday, but apparently, many schools were already closed and it was spring break

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: alpLewes
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were going to return North by way of the auto train so we decided to stop in Disney World and take in Epcot for a day. We didn't want to break the bank so chose this hotel because of reviews here. We stayed two nights. The grounds are lovely but for a Disney property I really can't say much else good about it. We were in building 34 in room 3431and it really is at a far point away from the lobby and they certainly don't make it easy to get there. The paths meander along and there are signs to help guide you to the lobby but really, even by looking at the map and following directions it was hard. The room? I just kept saying to myself over and over, "you get what you pay for". I almost was afraid to take a shower. The shower curtain was moldy - YUK! The towels were scratchy and the sheets very thin. The food court was ok but messy and hectic. The bar the night before was relaxing and the drinks were good. The store had a nice supply of everything. The staff was very friendly. We did not use anything else on the property - pools, watercraft, etc., so I can't comment on them. Bus service to Epcot was near our building so that was convenient. If our room was like all the others this whole property needs updated. Oh, and really, I am sick of hotels charging for high speed internet. McDonalds gives it for free for heavens sake. Get with it Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: SupaLee
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here at the Port Orleans Riverside and loved it!!!! The resort was beautiful and the location was perfect. We satyed in the alligator bayou section and it was a picture perfect setting. The transportion to the parks and downtown Disney was great. Although the wait for the buses where a little long it was worth the wait. I would most definitely stay here again. The food at the riverside mill was great, but the food at the Boatwright dining hall needs a lot of improvement. The pool was fun and we enjoyed the water slide.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Trip”
Reviews.Author: Dolphin237Girl
Reviews.Content: Very accomidating with nice hotel rooms and pools. Has a river view out the back and fun for kids who enjoy pin trading.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, moderately priced resort”
Reviews.Author: JaneyZee
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms - we had a poolside view in bldg 24, corner unit - quiet, clean, nice atmosphere. Close to the Disney bus stop, never had to wait long for the bus. Took the riverboat to Downtown Disney which was a very nice way to get there. Shopping at Fulton's was great, we found lots of Disney items there, plus the ladies in the "post office" area were very nice about locating a missing Tower of Terror ride photo we had sent to the resort, very friendly staff at Fulton's. I live in east central Florida and was visiting the parks with a Minnesota friend, otherwise I probably would not stay at one of the resorts since I'm within driving distance of all the parks. But this resort was centrally located and was reasonably priced, so we chose it for our stay. I'd stay there again, but might ask for a room in a building closer to the lobby and store if I could, would eliminate driving back and forth to the lobby area. Overall a great stay, we enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay at Beautiful Port Orleans Riverside”
Reviews.Author: czang76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Disneyâ€™s Port Orleans â€“ Riverside resort Mar. 12-17 with our three sons ages 22 months, 6 and 9. This was our familyâ€™s first trip to Disney and first time staying in a Disney Resort. This resort was perfect for our active family. I picked a moderate resort because I knew with a toddler we would not be spending hours and hours at the parks, so I wanted somewhere that would be a nice alternative when we were not at the parks. Port Orleans fit the bill. First, I am not sure what the heck some of these reviews are talking about when they criticize the cleanliness and lack of updates to the rooms. We continuously saw things being cleaned, blown off and dusted. My husband even noticed the glass on the fire extinguisher in the hallway did not have a fingerprint on it! We stayed in the Alligator Bayou section, building 38. We did pay extra for a waterview room, which was nice in terms of convenience because we were at the front of the building, but I would probably not spring for this again. Since none of the rooms have balconies, the â€œwaterviewâ€� is not really necessary. At first I thought building 38 would be too far from the main dining hall and pool area, but for our family it was perfect. The kids enjoyed walking over the bridges and we actually liked the more secluded location. It felt like we were camping in the woods. Plus, we were equidistant from both the South Depot and the North Depot bus stops. This was great because on return trips (depending on how the bus traveled), we could get off at whichever stop came first. The room itself is your basic hotel room. I did not feel it was overly small or cramped. The two sinks were great for convenience. With a toddler, we utilized the fridge for milk and made coffee one morning (bring your own, the stuff in the dining hall is terrible!). My boys took turns on the trundle bed and got a kick out of that. We enjoyed going for walks around the resort. We also rented a surrey one morning and liked riding around for a change of pace. We LOVED the water taxi to Downtown Disney. What a great perk! We also walked over to the French Quarter section and rode the water taxi back one night. The pools were always clean and my boys enjoyed the water slide. We only visited one â€œquiet poolâ€� which my kids found boring, so we headed back to the main pool, but it looked nice if you wanted serenity. The food court was fine. Even though it almost always had a crowd, we never waited very long for our food at the counters and we always found a table. We had the quick service dining plan, and the cashiers were always helpful and willing to explain it to us (and many other confused guests). I would recommend the chocolate croissants for breakfast and the make your own salads for dinner. Yummy! Overall, I would definitely stay at Port Orleans Riverside again. We loved the overall relaxing feel of the resort as well as the additional amenities that the moderate resorts offer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Grounds...Mediocre Rooms”
Reviews.Author: ohiomother
Reviews.Content: The review were correct. The Grounds were peaceful and nice after the parks. The area is spread out. We stayed in building 18 1834. It was located at the back of the building so it made it a little further of a walk. If you ask for 18 ask for a room closer to the lobby and building 14. We asked for 14 as a first choice and 18 as a second choice and we got 18. The room was just NOT clean. It wasn't filthy where we had to ask for a new one but the cleaning lady could do better. When we got there she had just passed our room. We went in and there was TOOTHPASTE in the sink. Just like the other reviews. I couldn't believe it. There was also some hair in bathroom. I asked the cleaning lady to come back and clean the sinks. She was very nice but brought a DRY rag. I asked her "Do you have any cleaner?" She agreed and washed out the sinks insisting it was paint. Paint that washed away!!!! Anyway we never got cute washcloth animals either. I'm guessing it doesn't matter which one you stay at with disney you may have problems like this depending on the cleaning person. It also looked like it hadn't been dusted in years! Seriously. It was small like others said and that was only a problem when it rained. Which it did. Then we had to spend more time there. But the lobby and shop were very nice. Food Court was ok...All of Disney nickle and dimes you. We would have used the food plan so we wouldn't stress over it but they gave us a $500 gift card as a promotion. We ate for five days with five people on it...but it wasn't easy!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for the money”
Reviews.Author: drdotbrown
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here one evening before going on the Disney cruise. It was very nice; the grounds are beautiful. For the money it was great!! The rooms were not the cleanest I have ever seen but not enough to complain. The trudle bed is small!! Luckily, my 4 year old is tiny. I would say an average teenager would not fit on it. All in all, it was a good experience!

Reviews.Title: “This is the best value and place to stay in Disney World .”
Reviews.Author: MerriRowes
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many places in the "world" and out side of it for the 22 years we have been visiting Disney World. POR (formerly Dixie Landings) is the best. They have the best spacious and gracious food court of all the resorts. I perfer the Mansion side to the Bayou it seems more open and brighter.

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: disneywithkids
Reviews.Content: We stayed at port Orleans Riverside last year. It was great. We are going back there again for another 4 days. However don't expect this to be a 5 star resort. However expect it to be tranquil and relaxing. The resort has many paths in a tropical lush environment, lots of Green. Bubbling streams. Plus lots of wildlife (we saw lizards, birds, rabbits at night...the kids loved that part) It also offers fishing, which our kids really enjoyed (their first catch). The main pool has lots of fountains, and a slide. The cafeteria is a food court, so you can get your food fast, especially important with small kids. There is an arcade. Also you can catch a boat ride to downtown disney. This next trip we are going all out and staying at the Grand Floridian for 5 days. But our kids really want to go back to Riverside for them to relive their first trip to disney memories. So we are switching to Riverside for the last four days. I the dad look forward to walking the path of tranquil tropical peaceful surroundings, which is very contrast to stay in the resort. Please note for those of you who are a family of 5. This is one of few resorts who can accomodate a family of 5. However what they call is a trundle bed, is a materess that pulls out from under one bed. I the dad slept in it, since I didn't want my kids to sleep on the floor. But after a day in the park, I could even sleep on the hard floor. So it's not luxury, but after you consider the price. It not that bad. Sleep is the last thing on my mind for going to Disney. Overall I the dad loved it. But this time we will spoil mommy and go to grand floridian for a 5 days. Then back to Riverside for 4 more. However we will never stay in Port Orleans French Quarters the sister resort. THe food is beter, but the pool is not for kids, and it not a much fun for young ones.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans Riverside-Where the magic begins.”
Reviews.Author: missmolly333
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this resort. From the moment we went to check in everyone was amazingly wonderful. Lisa at the check in desk was Fantastic. We even went back to chat with her later. Our room was immaculate and roomy. Housekeeping always tried to add a little touch to brighten my 9 yr. old daughter's day. The layout of the resort is great. Everything is easy to get to and is just a quick walk away. I will highly recommend this resort to anyone planning a vacation to Disney World. Our vacation was wonderful and mostly thanks to Port Orleans Riverside and their magical staff.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in hotel”
Reviews.Author: nanasedona
Reviews.Content: I felt the room was dark and small .The beds were noisy , I couldnt sleep with husband .The food court was crowed with very long lines.Unless your family eats the same items you have to stand on several lines ,for different items.The menu never changes and a week of the same food it not a vacation. The resort was far from theme parks 20 minutes to get to theme and some days we had to wait 20 minutes fro a bus .Felt some of the staff was rude and not very helpful. I would have been much happier with a car ,staying outside disney with a choice of resturants and a better room .

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: disneyfan331
Reviews.Content: This was a great resort! Very friendly, great food, great service. Pool/hot tub is open 24 hours! went after back from parks! Have several bus stops through out property! did not use boat service since it was a bit chilly but would love to try next time! Room is pretty clean, could have been a little bit cleaner but its a resort.. so it cant be prefect. We would go back again, it was a wonderful stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't wait to switch hotels”
Reviews.Author: alohagirls
Reviews.Content: Last summer we stayed at the Coronado Springs which is the same quality hotel and loved it so we felt comfortable booking the same category again. When we arrived at POR, we felt the landscaping and theming was really cute and exciting. The service at the hotel was excellent. Getting to the room was a hassle - we have 2 small kids (5 and 7) and our younger daughter has diabetes and does get tired after a long day of traveling. After check in we had to walk walk 15 minutes with luggage in the dark through the grounds. This was not fun with 2 tired kids and luggage. I did really enjoy the vegetation plants and "river" but it was so cold that we couldn't consider using the pool, but it looked neat. Our room was in the alligator bayou section building 34. When we finally arrived at our room we were very let down by how run down it was and by the lack of cleanliness. I saw little black hairs (from shaving?) all over the sink - you could tell someone had wiped it around, but not cleaned it. the comforters on the beds were very beat-up and the motif was extremely dark. The room was very tiny even compared to the Coronado room last yea and beds are double not queens which makes a big difference. Maybe when it gets refurbished it will be better, but we were so grossed out by the hairs and dirty look that we all slept in our travel clothes. The trundle bed was a joke. The service level was very good though - when we called to ask about moving to a different hotel the Disney staff went out of there way to help us and even moved our bags and drove us to the Beach club. All the cast members were nice and service level was there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lerma_alvarez
Reviews.Content: Great landscaping, nice rooms, outdoor activities, good restaurants and great pool!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel where you will have a really good holiday”
Reviews.Author: MinnieMad
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at Port Orleans Riverside and we love it. The rooms are clean and spacious with two double beds, twin sinks and space for a table and chairs as well. The resort is large and has 2 great pools with waterslides and numerous little quiet pools for lengths or just chilling. There is a food court which sells nice breakfasts (try the waffles) and other meals, also a restaurant and a bar. You could have a perfectly nice holiday here even without the main daily draw of the Disney parks. The bus service is reliable (perhaps the odd wobble, but pretty good) and you can get a boat to Downtown Disney which is a lovely 15 minute ride. If I had a critisism it would be that the hotel is more expense than a similar hotel outside Disney World. For your money you could probably get something more upmarket elsewhere. But then it wouldn't be Disney. I would happily go back, if we can afford it. Avoid Florida altogether in Janaury. It is absolutely freezing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: limencoconut
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside in Sept 2008 for a 3 day get away. We usually travel 3-4 times a year and this trip still stands out as a favorite of the last 10 years. The hotel is lovely. We stayed on the Mansion side. It's absolutely gorgeous and the grounds are impeccable. We had a room overlooking the pool and river. It was very quiet and romantic. Our room was clean and the staff was phenomenal. If you are looking for a short romantic get away, this is the place to go. We spent one afternoon touring the Countries of Epcot and another strolling around downtown disney. We also took a little boat ride to the other Port Orleans resort for some delicious Beniet's. I can't wait to go back for another visit!!

Reviews.Title: “It's just a hotel room but with extra benefits because of it's location.”
Reviews.Author: lizzardsu
Reviews.Content: My husband, four year old son and I stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside for two nights. I chose this hotel because of the reviews but mostly because it's on Disney property. I'm so glad I did. The conveinence was great! They have shutlle buses to all the areas of Disney and you don't have to wait more than 10 or 15 minutes for the one you want. It only took 10 minutes by bus to get to the Magic Kingdom so it was great to come back to the room to take a nap in the afternoon which made for a much more relaxed vacation. They also have a ferryboat that takes you to Downtown Disney so that was great also. We stayed in the Alligator Bayou section because I wanted to have the trundle bed for my son. It worked out great and he slept well. My husband and I did too, we thought the beds were very comfortable, except the pillows were too soft but that's our taste. The only downsides of staying here is that it's a bit pricey for the average hotel room that you get and that the food and general store are expensive. The price of the room is probably worth it though beacuse you don't have to pay for parking at the theme parks and you don't have to pay for transportation either. I would highly recommend taking as much as your own food as possible. There is a small fridge in the room that can hold drinks and snacks. Overall we had a great time and would stay here again but we would bring a lot more food!

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans was just what we ordered (and needed!)”
Reviews.Author: Canabrits2
Reviews.Content: We spent one week at Port Orleans Riverside in May 2009 and I thought it was fantastic. We travelled with 3 adults, 2 teenagers and a 5 year old girl and this hotel was terrific. What I liked: - Check in - AWESOME!! What a fun experience they made it with little TVs. and quick too! - Great food choices - lots of variety and fresh options at the food court - all very quickly and very well prepared! I personally LOVE the fresh yogurt and berries and cereal station for breakfast!! We did not eat at Boatwrights... - Beds and room size and layout (loved the external vanity area with 2 teenagers trying to get ready!) - Grounds - WOW, just WOW.... Some people complain about the size of the resort and having to walk 10 mins to the central food court....oh, please. We stayed at the furthest point from the food court during a week that rained 5 out of 8 days straight and still loved the grounds... - Service - FAB! My daughter bought a Queen Amidala set at the Star War store in Hollywood Studios and it broke. We were on our last day and trying to leave the giftshop took back the whole package and gave my daughter a credit to buy anything that store, saving us a crazy trip to Hollywood Studios on the buses before we left! Pool - only got to use on one morning because of terrible weather all week....my daughter really liked it but did't get to try the slide because we were there too early and it wasn't open.... Buses - never waited very long at all. I'm not as picky on transport as some reviewers....at least there IS transport and it is professional and well done. That's soemthing that you're paying the premium Disney prices for that other resorts simply don't have. Possibilities for Improvement: - Covered areas during rainy days. It POURED down 5 of 8 days were there ...I mean from when we woke up until when we went to sleep!! Some covered areas outside would have been great. - Breakfast - they need multiple fridges to get drinks in the morning...the food lines are very quick moving but there is always a hoard at the fridges trying to get bottled drinks. Crazy dangerous when you're trying to balance trays with food. - Nothing else. All in all, this resort is EXCELLENT value if you manage your expectations up front. This is a moderate resort (yes at a premium price but you DO get what you pay for). I don't think the extras at the Deluxe resorts are really worth the tonne of extra cash in comparison. We loved Port Orleans but felt like we didn't get to enjoy it much. The week was an absolute wash-out :(, so I guess I'll just have to go back and try again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans Riverside DisneyWorld Moderate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LaDonnaM
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at Port Orleans Hotel. Very clean, decorated nice, maid service was wonderful with fun animals made out of the extra towels. The grounds were very pretty with a beautiful lake and bridge. Wonderful restaurants with different kinds of food and prices. It is evident that every attention to detail was observed. But what else would you expect from Disney? THe staff that checked us in and answered our questions were very friendly and helpful. A very enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “A great place and great value....Will be back”
Reviews.Author: strife46
Reviews.Content: I just got back yesterday and I was a little concerned before we left because of a few bad reviews but I was pleasantly surprised when we got there. The stay was wonderful the rooms were great and the scenery was beautiful.. Food was ok but that could be expected for any hotel. I will mostlikly use this resort again

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans Riverside.”
Reviews.Author: loretta1012
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Easy to get around. Family friendly. Great playground and swimming areas. Easy to get to buses for rides to the parks. Rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Ok...but not what I was expecting from a Disney hotel”
Reviews.Author: djhskh
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five night stay at Riverside. We have been to Disney several times and have stayed on and off campus and really like staying on property and will do so in the future...However, we will stay at one of the deluxe resorts next time...Perhaps we are jaded travelers, but the room was small compared to several other hotels we have stayed. The double beds were uncomfortably small. For a few nights this might have not been so bad. But putting up with five nights of not so good sleep especially after walking all over the parks all day got very tiring to say the least. They advertise a trundle bed for a fifth person - our 9 year old daughter was able to sleep on it but only because she was so tired she could have slept on bare floor. The mattress was no more than 3 inches thick and was narrow. It would be perfect for the five and under crowd but anbody much bigger would be uncomfortable. Check in took quite a while - when we checked in at 3 pm there was only one person checking everyone in. We had to wait at least 10 minutes and the line was getting very backed up behind us. Check out was not quite so bad but still overall not up to what we experienced with Disney hotels previously. The girls loved the swimming pool. It was heated and made swimming pleasurable even when the outside air was in the 60's. The walk from the food court to our building took at least five minutes but it didn't bother us too much. The landscaping is nice and it makes for a pleasant walk. We enjoyed having the boat available to take us to Downtown Disney in the evenings. I have read some reviews about the food - it's typical fast food but the service is so-so and the food very expensive. We ate there only a couple of times. We each got a Disney grab and go mug and refilled them constantly. We liked being able to refill with any kind of pop, coffee or hot chocolate. I doubt we will ever stay off property - but as long as there are five of us we will not stay at Riverside. Unless the children are small and you are used to double beds, I suggest you bite the bullet and book one of the deluxe hotels....

Reviews.Title: “The rooms and food were rundown and crummy- the magic has left this place.”
Reviews.Author: Nellie3000
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 6 nights at the Port Orleans Riverside in WDW. The state of the room was really unpleasant. Smears of random things and scuffs on the walls and Rust all over the bathroom door jam and toilet piping. Wow. Disney used to be so special. I felt like I was on a budget holiday backpacking in a third world country. It took an hour and fifteen minutes to check in and by the time we got a room, we were too exhausted to go anywhere but the food court. The tables were dirty and there were old bits of food on the floor. We found a quieter table by a window- and there were crumbs and garbage all over the window sill. The food was quite expensive and was all reprocessed corn product. The chicken had the strangest spongy texture and the painted on brown lines to make if appear "grilled." One of the reasons we had chosen to return to Disney was b/c in the past, they had been so good with my child who has food allergies. Well, quite a bit of this service and support had gone. They seemed much more aware of the potential liability issues then providing my daughter with a cookie or an ice cream. Oh well, I know Disney is just another giant corporation, but in the past I really felt that it was special. No more magic.

Reviews.Title: “Below standard service and accomodations”
Reviews.Author: lindainmadison
Reviews.Content: From talking with my male co-workers they learned a long time ago to 'give in' to their wives when it comes to vacation planning. However, my husband is not as easily swayed, but after this trip, I think I could have him more easily convinced to stay in higher-priced venues or at least off Disney property. I have already shared these sentiments with Disney in their own corporate survey. It was our first-ever trip to Disney and in an effort to save money we opted for a moderate - PO Riverside - versus a deluxe. The accomodations were a bit too hokey and outdated for us (and believe me, we are not 5-star hotel snobs).We didn't witness the alleged world-reknown service so often heard about. No one ever approached us and asked us how our stay was going. And when we had repeated mechanical incidents with vending machines and the arcade we got mediocre responses from service folks. No towels at our satellite pool and as previous customers mentioned, the noise level of people walking by your room is somehow amplified. The convenience of the buses that take you to the parks doesn't make up for the lack of great service and mediocre accomodations. If you're going to spend hundreds of dollars a night on a room - stay off site and figure out other transportation to the parks. We never brought our 4-year-old back to the room for naps as everyone suggested. She slept in the stroller. Also, at the height of dinner time, the hallway backs up with guests and their strollers and no one seems to want to budge. The layout is cramped. Save your money, don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay! can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: daddyschamp
Reviews.Content: An enjoyable stay over Valentine's weekend with my family. The layout of this resort is great. Not as spread out as Carribean Beach. It was packed for the weekend with President's day holiday and the Daytona 500 but yet the building we were is was quiet all the time, and the grounds were easy to manuver. The food court was packed throughout the day but still the waits were not that long. The pool's slide was closed on Saturday because the air was too cold, but open all day on Sunday. The kids had a blast. The boat to downtown disney is definately the way to go. We live within driving distane so we always pack the car with drinks and snacks as to not spend all our money on the overpriced food at Disney World. The room was in great condition and very clean. Most of the negative reviews have to deal with cleanliness of rooms. To me that is not fair to the rest of the resort. It is a great resort for the family on a 'moderate' budget. We plan to return in April. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Port Orleans Resort-Riverside”
Reviews.Author: MeganP2
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Orlando with 16 other family members. We all had seperate rooms for the families. It is very kid friendly and everyone is really great. The rooms are perfect. If you need anything they are right there to help you. I highly reccommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Grossed Out”
Reviews.Author: gaytonj
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews of this hotel but had no choice except to stay here and figured "it's Disney, it can't be that bad." It was; the night we checked in there was toothpaste in the sink, dirty glasses(not just smudges, lipstick and grimey fingerprints), and yellow stains on the comforter. I was thoroughly grossed out and told the front desk the next morning. They said they would have housekeeping clean the entire room again that day while we at the park. For three more days we returned to find those same nasty glasses sitting there. The problem is not the glasses it is what else has been overlooked. This hotel is completely out of date and needs refurbishing in a bad way! If I pay the same amount as all of the other "moderate" hotels cost then I should get as nice a hotel as the guests that paid for the same thing. The grounds are gorgeous and the staff were very friendly but that does not make up for a nasty hotel room in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous time at a relaxing hotel during the most magical season!”
Reviews.Author: SoonerJJ
Reviews.Content: Great trip in December, this hotel came reccomended to us by friends who go to Disney mulitple times a year. It is a nice place to stay for people who dont want the small, cheesy overcrowded value resorts. The hotel is kind of a middle ground between the other moderate resorts. It isnt as hectic or busy as either the Cor Springs or Car Beach. It is more spread out & relaxing than Fr Qrtr. The grounds literally encourage you to walk out & around & enjoy the river views. The room itself was a decent size. Nicely furnished with more than enough storage room for a family of 4 for aweek. The shower could have been bigger, but it was comparable to most mid range hotel chains. The food court had great selections & was able to be very diversified. It overlooked the river & some of the Magnolia bend buildings. We stayed in Magnolia Bend... btw. The main lobby was nice & helpful for first time visitors. We checked in online 3 days earlier, it was very easy to do & we had no wait literally when we arrived. The resort provided us with good information about the ferry, DTD & the available recreation at Riverside. We enjoyed the pool & went one day to the Fr Qrtr pool. It looks fun, but not nearly as much as the Riverside pool which isnt pictured in the slide show. We had a great tie & will go again this December. The bus transportation was not bad, sometimes we waited about 15 mins, but it was due to where we were more than crowds. It takes longer to get from like downtown disney to animal kingdom, than the riverside resort to hollywood. So ofcourse, at times you will wait. The plus to this resort is that it isnot as far out from theme parks as others & so you can have a great time, stress free, on a relatively lower priced stay (compared to the resorts right at the theme parks).

Reviews.Title: “This palce is truely great!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie123Ga
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. We just got back, and I have to say we had absolutely no problems whatsoever. We stayed in building 14 in the Alligator Bayou. I had requested close to the food court and this is as close as you can get! Our room was really, really clean. I asked for extra soup and shampoo, and they gave me tons of it. This room has the trundle bed which is great. There is plenty enough storage space in this room. The beds are high enough where you can easily slide your suitcase underneath. The food court was awesome. My 2 boys are really picky and they loved it, as did my husband and me! The variety is wonderful, and don't forget to try the milkshakes. Also, the oatmeal is fabulous at breakfast. I would highly recommend the dining plan. We had the QuickService plan and had so much food, it was great. Riverside is a place I would highly recommend and I will definately return again and again! I didn't find our room to be dark or outdated at all- It was very charming and cozy!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE, COULD NOT ASK FOR ANYTHING MORE!”
Reviews.Author: kerrinicoles
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful resort, yes it was a bit spread out, but as much walking as you do in the parks all day who is really going to complain about a 5 minute walk to their room. The staff was great and we did not have a problem in the world, they helped us change up some of our reservations for dining because of a rain out day. We also took a carriage ride through riverside and the french quarter, which was a nice way to relax after a long day. I can not say enough nice things about this resort, as far as a moderate resort goes this is the only one we will stay at on disney property. The bus transportation was great, we even stayed for extra magic hours one night and bus driver all but brought us up to the front door of our room, pulled in the parking lot and all. We had a very magical time here, and even had cute little towel animals all but one day when we would get back "home" at night. I would recommend this resort to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to unwind after a day in the parks.”
Reviews.Author: Marmaduke16
Reviews.Content: The place was perfect in every way. The staff was helpful and courteous, the food court was great, and the grounds were peaceful and gorgeous. I could not of ask for a better hotel. I will stay here every year that I come to Disney. My family comes to WDW every other year and we have always had a great experience at Riverside. You guys rock! Tim, MIchele, and Aislinn Akin Anchorage, Alaska

Reviews.Title: “stayed here for our honeymoon and it was okay, but French Quarter is better”
Reviews.Author: Angelfan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a week on our honeymoon and really wish we went back to French Quarter or just paid a little more and went with a deluxe. The Riverside is nice enough but it is huge and usually will be a long walk to any room after a day at the park. The feel isn't Disney either. French Quarter is much smaller and intimate. I liked that. The rooms are carbon copies of the French Quarter so that is the same. Food court is nice and big. Many bust stops to deal with since the resort is so huge. The cast members were really awesome though. The grounds are beautiful but I would probably not come back. Go with French Quarter or go deluxe.

Reviews.Title: “Room not the greatest..Resort was good....”
Reviews.Author: Fourleafclover7
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Disney's Port Orleans Riverside...The previous reviews stated the rooms where tired and dated..I have to agree....This resort should be slated for refurbishment soon...I would have been really disapointed if I had paid full price for this room. The housekeeping staff...(Marta) does the best they can but it only really feels surface clean...not in the nooks and crannies clean.....We had the first nite in building 28 which is way out of the way for my liking. The next day we got building 14 which was great. Close to the dining hall which was really good. The best thing is the Disney transportation system....and the dining plan was great...I don't know how you could afford to eat for a week unless you had the plan. Next time I would plan on a different resort just to try something different.

Reviews.Title: “This place was so relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: LehighValley
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Disney and we absolutely loved staying in PO Riverside! We stayed in the Alligator Bayou in building 18 which was close to the main lobby and near the south depot bus stop. The room was quiet and clean and right near a private pool and laundry area. The fridge in the room was great and the beds were cozy. The front desk was always very helpful. The food court was amazing especially the build your own pasta and salad areas. I recommend going to the food court on the first day and purchasing the refillable mugs so you can grab sodas or hot cocoa on the way home from the parks at night. We also ate at Boatwrights our last night there (we had the dining plan) and it was great! Everything about this place is relaxing and it reminded me of the Princess and the Frog setting! I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK- Disney needs to get it together”
Reviews.Author: ohiotraveler10
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Port Orleans Riverside for a week long trip with our 4 yr old daughter. We stayed at French Quarter last year over Christmas and loved it. This time, French Quarter wasn't available, so we booked through Disney for a water view room, which was all that was available . First of all, the water view room was a view of a pool (which I knew could happen from reading previous reviews). That's all well and good, except for the huge travel groups of teenagers staying there that stayed up yelling until 1 AM in the pool area, waking all of us up even with the fan on in the room. Disney had a lot of conferences and large travel groups of teenagers in this hotel, so it wasn't nearly as relaxing as we had been told. Our first room ended up having a large amount cigarette smoke coming in through the bathroom vents, which I am allergic to (and so much for a "non-smoking" hotel). In order to move, due to the hotel being at capacity with all the groups, they made my husband come back to the room before 11 AM so they could clean and turn our room over to another guest. That morning we had a scheduled character breakfast at another hotel, so we lost at least 1/2 day in the parks getting back and forth and trying to move rooms. The next room we had was fine. The rooms are in need of a refurbishment, but the staff overall was friendly. However, Disney needs to decide what is more important, all these conferences and huge travel groups of teenagers, or families, as it really ruined the family oriented atmosphere for us that we had last trip.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: shelbeeee
Reviews.Content: my family and I stayed here last march break and we had an awesome time! beautiful resort with a great main pool, very clean! loved this place and would recommend it to anyone! lots of plans makes for a scenic walk, only thing I disliked was the long days of visiting the parks ha ha

Reviews.Title: “Alligator Bayou section was great”
Reviews.Author: Englewoodlian
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Alligator Bayou section in building 26, which was convenient to the Steamboat Company (main building), feature pool, restaurants and bus depots. This is a moderate resort with two double beds. It was furnished in a rustic manor that was very charming. The grounds are swamp-themed and well done. We did not get to eat there, but it had two restaurants that had a very nice atmosphere. You can take a boat from this property to Downtown Disney. It is a nice, relaxing ride.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort!! Best moderate on Disney property!!”
Reviews.Author: amy_617
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Port Orleans Riverside several times, and love it EVERY time! Great location. Nice quiet pools throughout the resort and a main pool with hot tub and kiddie slide! The rooms are nice....alittle smal, but cozy!! We love the food court as well, they stay open pretty late and open early...so you can get food just about any time you want! The resort is alittle spread out, but that is one of the things my husband and I LOVE about this place. You are not right up on top of everyone! There are two sections to this resort, the Magonlia Bend (which is the mansions) and Alliagater Bayou (which is smaller building that kind of look like cabins). The alliagater bayou sections is very woodland. Alot of trees and much smaller buildings. These buildings also do not have elavators in them. The Magonlia Bend (which we LOVE) is BEAUTIFUL!! Small walkways, sitting areas, full of flowers. Very romantic! If you can't afford to stay at Grand Flordian....stay here....It's as close as you are gonna get! Absoultely beautiful! They also have a boat ride that takes you directly to downtown disney! One of two only moderate hotels that have this wonderful feature! If you haven't stay here yet, please do! Trust me...you will not be dissappointed!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Real Dump”
Reviews.Author: Saildrummer
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night but I could not have lasted another. I understand beat up and dated furnishings but I DON'T understand when a room is filthy. Our carpet looked like it had not been swept in several weeks. Many areas were dusty and dirty (mirror on the bathroom door had not been cleaned - splattered). The furniture was all banged up with knicks and scrapes - worse than a place I once stayed in Mexico. Overall, it was one of those places where I was afraid to walk without my socks or shoes on. Really disgusting. From the outside (and the overall grounds), looks like a great resort. And the location is great for the parks. But this place REALLY needs refurbished.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Disney, great value!”
Reviews.Author: Lkrow
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 7 nights at Port Orleans Riverside in the Parterre Place building in Oak Manor. The hotel grounds are exceptionally beautiful and well maintained. The resort is quite large, so you should try to book a room that is close to one of the four bus stops on the resort if you are planning to use the Disney bus system. We were pleasantly surprised by the bus system, after reading some negative comments about it. Our wait at the bus stop was usually less than 10 minutes and buses take you to all the theme parks and also to downtown Disney. A time-saving tip for the hotel is to do the online check-in because when you get to the check-in area, there is a smaller line for those who have checked in online. If you buy a vacation package then you get a personalized room key that is the key to your room and also your admission to all the theme parks. If you put a credit card on file with the hotel, then you can use your room key to charge food and other purchases at all the Disney theme parks. This was great, because then we didn't have to keep using our charge card everywhere. You can also have express check-out when you have a credit card on file, so this saves time. We did call ahead 3 days and gave three choices of buildings that we would like to be in, but when we got there they tried to put us in a building that was very far away from the food court. When I complained about this, they were very accommodating and gave us the building that was originally our third choice. Although they don't guarantee room requests, don't be afraid to call ahead and try to get the building you prefer. We wanted a room that was close to the food court and also close to the bus depot. The room we got was in Parterre Place and had a beautiful view of the river. The room was very nice and clean and we were happy with it. We did eat at the food court quite frequently and the food there is pretty good. I would recommend buying the refillable mug for $12.95, because that will save you some money on drinks. The omelet station and the breakfast platter are very good and the food is reasonably priced. We also ate dinner there once and that was good also and they give you a lot of food for the money. The resort also has a free boat that takes you to downtown Disney. This is a scenic 15 minute ride and is quite nice. (Tip:A good place to eat in downtown Disney is the Earl of Sandwich. They are reasonably priced and have a wonderful selection of hot sandwiches, soups and wraps that are quite delicious.) Overall, we were quite pleased with this hotel and would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Can't imagine a better moderate resort onsite”
Reviews.Author: Beausdad
Reviews.Content: My wife, 3 year old, mother and father in-law and sister-in-law and her husband stayed 5 nights at the Port Orleans Riverside in the Panatierre Bldg. It was absolutely wonderful.. The only annoyance was the parking. The rooms were roomy and clean. With a child we decided to give them the once over with Clorox wipes anyway, but they were fine enough when we moved in. Beds were comfy. Bathroom was plenty big enough to use the toilet and take a shower. Not sure what the other people on here do in the bathroom, but it was fine for normal bathrooms duties (pun intended). Grounds were beautiful. Service wonderful. Food court is as stated by others a madhouse at certain times, but still navigable and manageable to find food and a table to eat at. The refillable mug is great, but don't wait till the second to the last day of your trip to get it. The pools were great. A little chilly, but not overcrowded at any time. The bar at the main pool was fantastic. I found it was a great place to celebrate getting a new job with a few drinks. Resort is convenient to all parks. We rented an Expedition and drove down from NC and simply drove to the parks each day as 1) it is free to park if you are staying at a resort property and 2) it is easier to leave and get back to your room if you have a little one that needs a nap. We were not there long enough to utilize the boats to Downtown Disney, but loved sitting on the banks in the evening watching the boats go to and from before bedtime. All of that being said the Disney Port Orleans Riverside Resort was wonderful and a great experience. Next time we are going to be a little more frivolous and stay at a Deluxe, probably the Boardwalk just to have the ability to walk into Epcot every night for a good dinner at Le Chefs du France or Tutto Italia. We will definitely stay here again, but our goal is to stay at all of the moderate and deluxe resorts eventually so keep your eyes open. You will see me on here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great grounds, great food court, great common space, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: golf_slc
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here before going on a disney cruise. The overall hotel is wonderful. When you arrive you will feel very pleased with your decision to stay here. The resort entrance and lobby have a feel of a very nice resort. I found the service to be just fine. Nothing overwhelming, but sufficient. Upon checking in and walking to our room, we were amazed at how wonderful the grounds were. There were walking paths everywhere, peaceful rivers, large shade trees, and small wildlife running around. The pools were very nice. The main pool was large and fun for the kids. It was a little cool at night, so the one hot tub at the main pool was very crowded. The food court was very nice. We never ate in the main dinning room. We typically ate at the food court in the morning, and ate there once at night after returning from the parks. We were able to get a cook to order pasta with shrimp for a quick service meal credit. It was delicious. We also enjoyed the piano bar where the piano player was very entertaining. Everyone sung along and had a lot of fun. Other activities that we participated in included taking the free river boat down to downtown disney. It was a very relaxing ride and convenient for getting around. We also played in the video arcade (decent arcade), fished (don't believe there were any fish in the water), and went for walks on the grounds. Overall, I would have enjoyed spending even more time relaxing at the hotel and less at the parks. Finally, the room. The room was ok. It wasn't anything amazing and was fairly basic in its ammenities. I wouldn't book this hotel if you are looking for an amazing room with great features. Two beds, tv, standard bathroom, fridge that never got cold, and two sinks/ mirrors. If you are planning on spending a lot of time out doing things, then this place is great. If you want something nicer than the budget hotels, that has great grounds, pools, and food options, then I would recommend this place. I would stay here again without a doubt. I spent a lot of time researching hotels, and felt very satisfied with my decision to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and grounds but loud rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkTarmale
Reviews.Content: My family and I arrived at the Port Orleans Riverside on January 8th late (around 11pm). I had, under the advisement of a Disney Representative, did a precheck in so that we would not have to wait for a key when we arrived especially since we were checking in so late. However, there was noone at that desk when we arrived. After waiting on the regular check in line I asked the woman why did I bother doing the pre-check in. Her only response was that they send the precheck people home by 10pm!!! I was not happy. Also, there were workers taking down the Christmas decorations and two of the men were sleeping on the couches in the lobby-not very disney like. We were a little concerned at this point as to how our trip would go. We checked in to one of the mansions on Magnolia bend. The room was very nice and clean except for some obvious mold and dust in the bathroom. It didn't really bother us though. There is a safe in the room that you can open with a key and it was very useful to us. It's only about 3-4" thick though so you can't put anything bulky in there. The room itself was very nice the problem is that the walls are very thin. We woke up several times during the night when people flushed their toilet. Also, one night out next door neighbor was having a coughing fit and it was as though he was in the room with us! DISNEY REALLY NEEDS TO TAKE CARE OF THIS PROBLEM WHEN THEY REFURBISH THIS HOTEL. The grounds are just beautiful. I read alot about people saying they were so far away from the main building but we didn't think it was so far. We had about a 5 minute walk to the buses and appreciated it so that we could see all the beautiful flowers and trees. We enjoyed the pool very much. Even though the temperatures were at freezing and just above most nights we still went in after we got back from the parks. It was heated to about 75 degrees and we alternated between that and the hot tub and were just fine. We did the Disney dining plan and had breakfast several times at the main dining hall. The Mickey waffles and bacon were good. The eggs, no matter where you were in Disney, were scrambled but very runny. We didn't care for them at all. Lunch was good as you have many things to choose from. I had custom made pasta one day and it was good but the portions are HUGE and the woman who was making it for me seemed absolutely miserable like I was bothering her or something. We found that most of the employees in the parks and hotels were nice but now and again we came across one that could care less that we were there and you could tell they would rather be elsewhere. All in all we were happy with the hotel and would recommend it to others. We would have liked to have been given a schedule of events for the hotel as there was a campfire one night and bingo during the day. We didn't know anything about it and would have like to have participated in them. The buses were very timely, there is boat service to downtown disney, a very large game room and gift shop with a small grocery store.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel , awesome stay!”
Reviews.Author: Theresa K
Reviews.Content: I think this is one of the loveliest resorts at WDW. We stayed there for 7 nights, Jan 7 to 14th. We had a room at the Alligator Bayou section, and it was very well kept and spotless clean. Mousekeeping did wonderful and my daughter was delighted to find towel animals and Mickey shaped heads on the bed everyday. Food court has an excellent selection, I highly recommend the beef carving station for dinner. Boatwright's Dining Hall offers tasty southern cuisine at honest prices, which was a surprise, because food at Disney is usually overpriced. Hotel theming is beautiful and the atmosphere is very calm and relaxing. There is a boat ride to Downtown Disney which is really pleasant. The only advice I'd leave is, if you do not have a car, pay for a preferred room, beacause this resort is HUGE and depending on the location of your room, you'll be doing a lot of walking. I was very glad we did rent one, our room on building 34 was very far from the lobby and food court, so we drove there for meals every day. If you don't have a car and are not willing to walk you can also wait for the resort bus at the nearest stop to your room and go around the resort , their last stop ( South Depot) is right by the lobby. In overall we had a wonderful time and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Time Ever”
Reviews.Author: Jbeaud
Reviews.Content: It has only taken me two years to write this, I guess better late than never. We traveled with our three children our 9, 7, and 4 year old. We found the hotel staff very friendly and helpful when we arrived, After a small walk to our room, we found a nice, clean room. I was a little nervous from some of the reviews I had read on here but we found the room wonderful. (You really aren't in the room long) It had a pull out bed for our oldest son to sleep on. It was great. The pool is great. We went when we would get home for the park in the evening. Very nice. The ground are wonderful. One night my husband and I had a nanny watch our children and we caught a boat right from the hotel to go to downtown disney. The food at the hotel was good to. I have to say when your children are still talking about the trip every week. That must say it was a success. Disney sold my husband he was not all that excited but really enjoyed it and says Disney knows how to do thing the right way. It truly is a magical place.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Cubsfan_1974
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent a week at the Port Orleans-Riverside resort. This is a good, no-frills resort for people who want to stay at a Disney resort without paying the high prices of the other hotels. The rooms were clean and certainly what we expected for the price. The decor is nothing special and they're not very large. Also, it costs $25/night more for a King bed vs. two double beds. There is wired internet service available at a cost of $9.95 for 24 contiguous hours. The TV was outdated and the picture quite grainy. The channel options were typical of limited cable (the ESPN channels, networks, CNN, HLN, ABCFAM, etc.) with no movie channels or channels like MTV. (I probably wouldn't even be mentioning this if it hadn't been so cold... keeping us in our room more than we wanted.) The resort is HUGE which is probably true of all Disney resorts. We had to walk rather far to and from the main building with the restaurants every day. Again, had the weather been nicer, we probably would have enjoyed this walk (the grounds are beautiful). The restaurant options are Boatwright's (moderately-priced sit-down) and the food court. We did not eat at Boatwright's but they seemed to have New Orleans style cuisine. We ate at the food court several times and liked our options. They have a dessert station, burger/chicken station, pizza/pasta station, and sandwich/salad station for lunch and dinner (they also have several stations (waffles, omelets, etc.) for breakfast). I thought the wait times were reasonable. Although we may have had to wait in line for 15 minutes once or twice, the waits were usually under 5 minutes for our food. The food quality was very good (especially liked the pasta and sandwiches), and the staff was very helpful with my husband's dairy allergy. We averaged around $20 per meal (for two people). You might want to consider buying a souvenir mug for $15 that you can keep and use for unlimited refills during your stay. There is plenty of seating in this area as well. We were fortunate to be put in a room that was close to one of the 4 Disney bus stations at the resort. It literally was 50 yards from our hotel room. This was convenient for picking up buses to the parks and downtown disney. Unfortunately, not all of the return buses stop at all 4 stations so we often had to walk from the main station at the front of the resort back to our hotel room (about a .5 mile away). We were happy with the wait times for buses as well. Our longest wait was maybe 20 minutes, but we probably averaged 5-10 minutes. Depending on the time of day and where we were going, sometimes we had to stand the entire time, but the longest trip to a park was about 15-20 minutes to Animal Kingdom.
