The resort is closer to Epcot and Hollywood Studios (maybe 10 minutes). I'd also recommend using the resort's complimentary Disney Magical Express for transport to/from the airport. Very convenient. There is also a small souvenir/snacks shop at the resort. They have a lot of the same t-shirts, toys, jewelry that the stores in the parks have. They also sell a few snacks, magazines, etc. I don't have much to say about the pools since the weather wasn't good enough for us to use (although some people braved the 40 degree weather!). There is a also a hot tub at the main pool.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans - Riverside”
Reviews.Author: Ranxkilluslow
Reviews.Content: 1st trip to Disneyland. So obviously we researched as much information from the internet as we could. You could say we overloaded, but im glad we did. This hotel complexe I have to say was extreamly well done. Right from the start you were ment to feel welcome. But right from the off we had a problem. We flew with Thompson Holidays, we got Disney dining plan, but when checking in the reception sais we have quick service. The holiday company were obviously at fault here NOT Disney. after 30 mintes of toing and froing, it go sorted. Happy all round. The lady showed us where to go (on a map) and we found it easlily enough. Room very good, dropped cases, changed and straight out. We caught the ferry boat to downtown disney, again staff members (boat captain) very happy to see us. All way through the 2 weeks we were there all staff were very approachable, and even (promptly) changed my sons bed covers at 2am.. The pools were in easy reach, the whole place was very peacefull, even when creaming children walked past you... The daytime restraunt was quite like it is in any hotel, crowded, fast paced, noisey, but seamed clean, and what the hell, your only there for 20 minutes or so. Problem is the toasting machine was rubbish. took 6 times to toast my bagel. The evening restruant was good, meals were very well, and again like many places you had staff who would meet you like it was their first day at WDW, and some who seamed tired (like they were there for 2 shifts in a row) but still smiles all round. A pitty that when you have been used to the days heat, that you come for dinner and the air con is blowing freezing air. Take a jacket. (or maybe I'm nesh All in all I loved Riverside, my son who is autistic really enjoyed it too, a great retreat from the sometime very noisy and stressing parks.

Reviews.Title: “Best Time”
Reviews.Author: pinkvintagerose
Reviews.Content: Stayed here back in october 09 and stayed in a room in magnolia terrace in what they call manisons. The room we had was lovely maybe a bit old and in need of updating but that added to the port orleans feel. we loved the two sinks just outside the bathroom, was a huge help when getting ready and not fighting over the mirror! tea and coffee facilities wernt up to much, i recommened you bring your own food and drink into your room. We stayed for 10 days and had the food included where we had 2 main meals a day and 3 snacks which was great and could be use in any of the parks. food and drink would of been pretty expensive otherwise but plently of choice! great idea to use snacks on micky mouse lollys or bottle of water. The grounds are lovely, and the boat that takes you to the riverside and down to downtown disney was fantastic and the boat drivers were always helpful and sometimes singing disney songs. Downtown disney is worth visiting, it has plently of shops and food places (which you can also use your food package credits) they even have a christmas shop all year round plus a HUGE cinema. We went to disney quest which was included in our unlimited disney park ticket which was fun had plently to do and you could kill couple hours in there. The balloon ride is also worth a go and wasnt to expensive. I recommend going to port orleans riverside rather then french quarter as there is more to do and the food hall is bigger and better. People have said on these reviews that the buses are awful, we never had any trouble we went to thebus stops and got straight on a bus, you find coming back after fireworks or went the parks are open late that you have to wait but that is to be expected..dont let it put you off going here! Also, if you can go to discovery cove its worth the money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans-Riverside was a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: parrotheads03
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a quick 3 night getaway. Besides the weather - the 3 coldest nights in Orlando history - we really enjoyed our stay. At time of booking, the Reservation Specialist suggested the Alligator Bayou section since it was more rustic and the kids really liked the looks of it. Most Disney resorts have the same basic room layout, just different decor. I did the on-line check in and requested Ground floor. I updated it the next day and tried to change my request to Transportation, but it wouldn't let me. I was very surprised when we got there that we had Bldg 14 which is right next to the main bldg and a bus stop - very nice considering how cold it was. It made it nice to run over to get hot chocolate or coffee after an evening at the park. I did some exploring on the hotel grounds but the wife and kids were content staying warm. We did take the boat to Downtown Disney, but road the bus back - too cold! Some prior posters have discussed the state of the rooms. They were clean and mousekeeping was very nice by making some funky things with towels. In the Alligator Bayou, the decor was kind of backwoods - the bed posts were logs. There were two sinks which really helped as we all tried to get ready at the same time. The shower had pleanty of hot water. We had a water view room with a full view of the river that winds through the Port Orleans resort. We did the Express Dining Plan which is two quick service meals and two snacks per day per person. We saved a little money not selecting the table service option because most places require reservations - we didn't want to be tied down and the kids are picky eaters. The DP was nice to have and we came out ahead money wise considering you get an entre, drink, and dessert for each meal. Plus you get the resort mug free so unlimited beverages at the resort. We have stayed at several of the resorts over the years and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: supersport22
Reviews.Content: Ok...so we just spent a week in Disney's Port Orleans. I don't understand the negative reviews. Maybe since this is my first visit to Disney I'm not able to compare it to the other resorts to see how it stacks up. Here are a few of my thoughts: * Room was nice and cozy......(nit-pick -- hot water in shower was not that hot actually.) * Our room was located a good ways from the restaurant so we ended up walking quite a bit, but the grounds are so pretty that no one seemed to mind. Never saw a piece of trash laying on the grounds the whole week. * Staff was very friendly and helpful, which must have been difficult with the masses of people who were there and fighting, scratching and clawing for food and services. I don't know how they kept a smile on their faces, quite honestly. * The shuttle was always consistently-there, without ever having to wait more than about 10 minutes. * Food was excellent.....prices were extremely reasonable, I thought. Sometimes the lines and crowds were irritating, but hey.....everyone needs to eat, right? There are ways to avoid the crowds: don't eat when everyone else does! simple logic. Get up and out a bit earlier. * pools were heated, but a bit cool in the evenings -- too cool to swim, actually. My kids were a bit disappointed with that..... Yea, it's expensive.....no doubt about that...probably too expensive.....but hey.....we had fun. I can't complain. We ate good, slept good, enjoyed the property, liked the food, loved the coffee, appreciated the courtesy and were shuttled around flawlessly. What else can you expect?

Reviews.Title: “Disneys Port Orleans Riverside has slipped!”
Reviews.Author: robtroxel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort hotel over the Chrsitmas holidays 2009. At a return guests we noticed a general decline in the room condition and the amenities offered. The recently painted front door had paint splashed on the brass entry door handle plate. (The plate itself was corroded and needed to be polished>a detail that Disney was known for doing in the past). Upon entry into the room, we notice a funky odor and scratched furnishings along with several vanity lights that did not work. There is no lotion provided at a very high rate! Internet access costs 10 bucks a day! How tacky! Disney has jacked up the rates over the holidays to $220 a night, plus the taxes. They should step up the service and at least offer coffee iin the lobby for what they term>> a moderatly priced hotel. In our opinion this is at best >>a room that is worth no more that $129 a night! Of course we realize the value of Location but we left disappointed. Something that has never happened in twenty visits over the last 25 years. Disney is resting on past laurels>We won't be back!

Reviews.Title: “BRING BACK EISNER”
Reviews.Author: clamchowda
Reviews.Content: Disney, what on earth are you doing? We've stayed in both moderate and deluxe resorts and up until a few years ago have always had stellar service, immaculate rooms, and fabulous meals. I regrettably have to say that all three have gone down the toilet. Our last stay at POR was in 1998 and while the room wasn't spotless, it wasn't "dirty." I wish I could say the same about this trip. I'll start with the cleanliness issues. The tiles in the bathroom area looked like they hadn't been cleaned in years, the bedspread smelled of something I don't even want to know what (we threw that right in the corner), you could build a pyramid with the amount of dust behind the nightstand, and the walls looked like a child had used them as a coloring book. Now, I'm not sure if I should be more disgusted with the housekeeping Disney employs or the guests who have obviously treated the hotel room like a garbage dump. It's very disconcerting to me and my family that people have so little respect for others property. That said, filthy floors and dirty bedding is unacceptable. The room was utterly disgusting. Smoking. I don't smoke and neither do my family members. I get that people are addicted to smoking (as disgusting as it is). That said, when a hotel mandates a non smoking policy in all rooms and specific areas are NON-SMOKING, it doesn't mean pull up a chair on the balcony and smoke away. While we didn't moan to the front desk (not that they would have resolved the issue, but we'll get to that later), Disney really needs to do a better job at enforcing this non-smoking policy because people obviously have a difficult time reading. Food court. Atrocious. I swear I thought I was waiting in the bread line for the last loaf. Where on earth have people's manners gone? Soccer moms were pushing 5 year olds out of the juice line so they could get on the next bus for Magic Kingdom opening. What an embarassment. Come on people. The cast members working in the food court were trying their best to put on a happy face, but it was evident they hated their jobs. I've never seen such forced smiles in Disney World. Boatwrights. We only ate there once but the food was fine and the people working there were quite nice. The gift shop also had wonderful employees. Boat to downtown Disney was very nice and the grounds were just gorgeous. The landscaping company must not be employed by the same company as the housekeeping staff. Main Pool. HORRID. We didn't even swim in it because of the vast amount of people swimming around. I don't even want to know what kind of "stuff" was floating around in there. The pool was closed twice during our trip due to "accidents." You get my drift. The quiet pools were nice and we don't use hottubs but I couldn't help but notice the toddlers and preschool aged children jumping in and out bothering the other adult guests. Are hottubs for kids? The one time we used the bus was fine, but I can see waiting getting real old. Front desk personnel. Blah. No comparison to the front desk personnel at the Animal Kingdom Lodge or Contemporary (they appear to know what they are doing). I really want to cut the employees of Disney some serious slack given the amount of rude, ignorant guests we saw and I know they are over worked and underpaid. I can't help but think that Disney is their own worst enemy by wanting to jam as many people in their parks as they can and pay no regard to the little people working to make the parks clean and operate properly. :/ So, would I recommend POR? HECK NO. I'd stay off site and rent a car. You'll get clean rooms, better service, and much better prices if that is a big consideration. Our next trip in 2010 will be spent at the Ritz Carlton or Portofino in Universal (The beautiful Royal Pacific is the same price as a Disney moderate resort and much nicer, lavish, and clean). Did I say clean? It pains me to do it because we love Disney (have been on-site Disney guests since the late 70's when we were children), but we can't justify the cost anymore. Perhaps when more people start doing what we are, Disney will wise up.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: ge0rgette2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the PO Riverside during the Christmas holidays.. It was a great experience. We normally are 'value' stayers... we'll never go back to a value resort after staying here. The room was large enough for 5 - the alligator bayou section. It was clean. My only disappointment was that my daughter was looking forward to some towel 'buddies' to greet her on our return from the parks... We only rec'd one during our stay - was a bunny rabbit for Christmas Eve. My daughter is 6 and that would have made her trip to see more of those - other than that - it was awesome! Take a boat ride to Downtown Disney - you won't regret it. We ventured over to the French Quarter side as well .... I personally liked the pool at the POR rather than the POFQ. I would recommend this hotel to anyone ... We had a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, Nice pool(s), good location, long long walk to my room.”
Reviews.Author: TimmyTuna
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the French Quarter last time and decided to try Riverside this time. I didn't realize how much larger Riverside was. Overall we really liked it, but it was a long long walk to get to the lobby and to the main pool from our room.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience overall!”
Reviews.Author: Cram0120
Reviews.Content: This resort is much like every other resort on Disney property. The rooms were a bit on the small side, but neat and clean. The resort is fairly large and spread out, but the transportation systems make it a little easier to deal with. The restaurant, gift shop, food court, and bar are all very nice, and the staff is friendly enough and we did not have one problem. This resort, like all the others, is functional and should be a decent place for families to stay at. Now for some opinions which may offend some, but sometimes the truth hurts. After reading some complaints from all the resort reviews.....travelers should take note of the following. #1 - It's Disney World! There are anywhere from 150,000-250,000 people on this property at any given time. That right there should tell you a couple things. One, you will have no privacy. People will be coming and going at all hours and you should not expect a serene and quiet place. Yes, you will hear toilets flush, and yes people will be walking by your room. You didn't visit a retirement community where bedtime is scheduled for 6:00 just after The Golden Girls. Realize what you are getting yourself into. The restaurants will be busy, kids will be running around, and it may take a few minutes to catch that bus or get your buffet in the morning. Despite the sheer volume of people, everything runs pretty efficiently, or at least as efficient as you can be with so many people. Each resort will have 1500-2000 rooms. Just think about that. #2. For the money, the moderate resorts are fine. In all honesty, what are you going to do in the room other than sleep? Those reviews that claim they didn't get their 5-star experience need to realize once again.....you are at Disney. All the resort rooms are fairly clean, the beds are comfortable, and each resort has all the amenities you need. If you are that concerned about a big room, or a leather chair in your room, or the selection of TV channels.........why are you here in the first place? #3. Do NOT expect a relaxing trip. While the folks at Disney will do everything to make your stay enjoyable, this is a chaotic place. Just look at the numbers. Prepare to do lots of walking, lots of waiting, and be butts-to-elbows wherever you go. Don't like large crowds, then this probably isn't the place for you. Go sit on a beach somewhere and relax. Back to Port Orleans. I would certainly stay there again. Try the boat service to Downtown Disney, the 6 pools are nice, the setting is very authentic, and the people are nice and helpful for the most part.

Reviews.Title: “Magical time and place...”
Reviews.Author: Tchwawa
Reviews.Content: This is our second trip to Disney World at Christmas time. We were so impressed with our stay the first time at Carribbean Beach Resort that we were afraid Port Orleans Riverside would never measure up. We had nothing to worry about! Port Orleans Riverside is a sprawling beautiful resort. I get tickled at people complaining about the size of the resort and the walk to get the main area and/or bus stops. If you don't like to walk, don't to come to Disney World. We checked in about noon on the day of our arrival. We were travelling with our daughter's family and so we had requested connecting rooms. We paid for the upgrade to King bed for the two of us but still requested connecting rooms. When we checked in, they told us we had "adjacent" rooms but not connecting because we had a King. I politely explained that if that was the problem, then I would happily move to a doubles room and be connected because that was my primary request. The Cast Member went to her manager and explained the problem. He resolved this quickly and with a huge smile by explaining that in order for us to have connecting rooms - they would have to upgrade us to a water view room for free. Woo hoo! Happy Disney Customers! We were in our connecting rooms by 1:00 and our luggage arrived shortly (woo hoo Magical Express). We did laugh a little as the "water view" was merely a view of a tiny concrete pond outside our windows, but the grounds at this resort are SO beautiful that the pond was beautiful. The resort is home to a lot of amazing flora and fauna. We saw many different water fowl and birds and even saw some lovely wild turkeys. We were in Building 17 of the Alligator Bayou. I was a little worried that our close proximity to one of the satellite pools was going to be a problem when we would get home at 11:00 at night from the parks and be exhausted and children would be whoopin' and hollerin' in the pool. But, it was never a problem...once in bed with the heater/ac running, we crashed with no further thoughts about the pool or the people in it. The food court was awesome! They have a couple of stations that give you LOTS of choices for salads, pasta, omelets, sandwiches, soups, baked goods, etc. I stood behind many people checking out and the Cast Members would patiently describe how each person's Dining Plan worked. I saw an earlier complaint about being confused with how it worked. We were there for 8 days and I have to say, if you don't understand your Dining Plan, then that is your fault. Cast Members at every turn are VERY helpful about what is and isn't covered on your specific plan. Just ask until you understand. The gift shop was a really nice size and contained many of the items that we found in the parks so we were able to wait until the last day and do a lot of our shopping there. With regard to the Motel windows and the need for updating. Well, I think that some people are just never happy. The windows to the outside world never posed a problem for our two families. We left our curtains open during the day and shut them at night. If the curtains were open and I needed a little privacy I just used the curtain that separates the dressing area from the rest of the room and dressed behind it. As for the need to update, I would prefer that Disney concentrate on a good experience rather than worrying with matching someone's ideas about "updated" rooms. If you are at the parks during a "busy" time then you have a clue how many people that place shuffles through...EVEN with an update there are going to be scratches, dings and signs of usage. This place is a value AS IS, a room in a resort that has the grounds and amenities available such as those at Port Orleans and is affordable for a family of 6 is the bomb! NOTE: If you are a jogger, you will CERTAINLY appreciate the jogging trail there. Lack of free Internet Access is the one thing I do agree that needs to be updated ASAP. In today's world where we all depend on the internet for daily access to information, I think Disney has to step that up. However, on the other hand, we used our phones to update Facebook and answer emails, so maybe Disney thinks if they wait long enough it won't even be necessary to provide internet access. The Alligator Bayou rooms are not nearly as "fancy schmancy" looking from the outside as the Mansions section but are still awesome accommodations and the doubles rooms have trundle beds. Although our family didn't use it, had we wanted to use it, we would have appreciated it. We liked the Alligator Bayou. Mousekeeping was great. We got what we needed and towel animals too! Happy little Mousekeepers were more than happy to go away and come back when we were in the room too long... We used the Concierge to answer questions about park hours, best transportation suggestions for destinations and to print out boarding passes. If you like a beer with your Disney trip, not a problem at Port Orleans...We were able to buy beer AND they have a very nice bar. We never were able to work that into our schedule but it looked fun! They also have a nice sit down restaurant, again, our schedule had us eating most nights at the parks so we never got to use the resort restaurant, but it was crowded so somebody musta liked it! Overall, a huge thumbs up once again for Disney giving us a fantasy place to stay and enjoy our Christmas vacation with our family and grandkids! You can't go wrong with Port Orleans, Riverside! One note for those planning a Christmas vacation to Disney World. If I were to plan this trip yet again, I am now firmly convinced that you should get the heck out of town by the weekend before Christmas. Both times we planned our trips, although we wanted to be at WDW close to Christmas, the crowds become insufferable the weekend before and week immediately leading up to Christmas. Up to that point, the experience is truly enjoyable and magic. We never waited more than 30 minutes for any ride and with the use of Fast Pass and Extra Magic Hours we were able to get on all of the "popular" rides multiple times! and we never waited more than 10-15 minutes for the busses... If you have specific questions about the resort or the trip, please feel free to contact me!

Reviews.Title: “Fine, But Deluxe Resorts Worth The $ Difference”
Reviews.Author: NJ973
Reviews.Content: We were only in Disney for four nights and decided that we'd save some money by staying at one of the moderate resorts instead of one of the deluxe properties. Port Orleans Riverside was fine: the rooms were a bit small (though all Disney property rooms are on the small side), clean, and in decent condition: about the level of a three star motel. The grounds are very nice and the service was fine as far as it went. Our two main complaints, and the reasons we wouldn't return are: A) THE RESORT IS TOO SPREAD OUT. It was a ten minute walk from our room to the main building. Which is not much of a hassle to get the bus or breakfast (it was a pretty walk) but was an issue if we wanted to run to the gift shop to get a bottle of water or a cup of coffee. Ditto the main pool: the satellite pools were fine, but the main pool was something of a hike and was the only one that had water slides and a bar/restaurant. B) THE BUILDINGS ARE LAID OUT LIKE MOTELS, so that the only windows in the room open up onto the outdoor hallway. This means we had to keep the windows closed the whole time unless we wanted to be on display-- there was a steady stream of traffic past the room in the AM. There were no curtains that might let in light while maintaining privacy - just venetian blinds and blackout shades. It's nice to wake up in the morning and be able to let the sunlight in. OVERALL: The deluxe resorts at Disney feel more like hotels and for us, are worth the extra money for the reasons stated above. But if those are not important to you, or if the savings trumps morning sunlight, then Port Orleans Riverside is a great option. We certainly were not disappointed with the room or the grounds. NO WIFI: This is a major Fail on all Disney properties: not sure why they don't supply WiFi at a kid-friendly resort and why they charge $10/day for wired internet. We brought our own WiFi and used to to check out reviews of restaurants and exhibits (on TripAdvisor and other sites), opening and closing times, flight status, weather reports and a host of other things we've all come to rely on the internet for. Disney really needs to upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Best experience ever.”
Reviews.Author: Condor98
Reviews.Content: This was me and my wife first trip to Disneyworld, after promising her I would take her for the past 11 years. We wanted to go somewhere that was pretty descent and wouldn't cost an arm and a leg. We booked our resort at the Disney Port Orleans-Riverside. I have to say it was one of the best places to stay. Everybody from the staff at the hotel to the bus driver was great. We stayed there for 7 days. I have to say that I could have stayed there for another week. The one mistake I made before going was listening to all the negative feed back from other people on sites like this one. I can't believe that things really happend the way they said it happened. As for me, I would truly recommend this hotel for anybody wishing to stay at a descent hotel and to not listen to all the negative feed back. I say this because I believe people want attention and this is one way for them to get it. So if you are thinking about staying at the Port Orleans-Riverside, I would recommend staying here. I don't think you wil regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort - friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: arice319
Reviews.Content: Our perience at this resort was wonderful. Parking was easy and close to the main building. We checked in after a 2 minute wait. Our room was ready at 9:30am, even though check-in was supposed to be at 3:00. We had one minor issue with our dining plan not being added, but they resolved it as quickly as they could and were very friendly. Throughout our stay there, everyone was smiling, friendly and always giving stickers to our kids. Our room was spacious enough for the 2 nights we were there, even with our 3 little boys. The beds were comfortable and everything was clean. We had a mini-fridge which was convenient. Not having free internet access was one negative thing. Not quite sure why they would charge for that. We were on the top floor of a 2 story building and couldn't hear noise below or next-door from any other guests. The resort exterior was very pretty - nice landscaping, scenery, and nice to be near the water. The shuttles never were never that long of a wait from the resort to the parks - no more than 10 minutes. We did wait about 20 minutes for a pickup from The Magic Kingdom back to the resort at the end of the night, but they say that's the max you have to wait. We took the boat to Downtown Disney and it was nice. Hassle-free is always a plus with young kids. The food in the restaurant was surprisingly good for a cafeteria like setting. It was nice also to have a good-sized gift shop right on the property with Disney gifts, drinks and snacks. We would come back here again, most definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms in need of serious updating!”
Reviews.Author: johnjohn42
Reviews.Content: I will start out with the positives about this hotel. The grounds are kept very nice and the boat ride to downtown disney is a plus. The negative about this hotel is that the rooms are very outdated. All the furniture is damaged with scratches. The rooms make you feel like you are in a motel. If you are used to staying in nice quality hotels do not make the mistake of staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great theme, great staff”
Reviews.Author: ttfan29
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time at Port Orleans Riverside. The grounds are so pretty based on the "Big Easy" American south. The transportation to the parks was frequent and quick and convenient. The rooms were clean and the maids made sculptures of characters from the regularly changed towels. The swimming pools were great fun and never over crowded. The reception staff were helpful and were able to book restaurants at a moments notice. The shop could stock a wider variety of food but not a huge problem - they had English papers if you need to know what is happening at home.They arrange singing round the camp fire and Pirate trips for the children down the river to Downtown Disney and back. There are horse drawn carriages to hire and cycles.As you can tell , we loved it. Going back next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Mickey should be ashamed of this resort!”
Reviews.Author: RMVM
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our recent stay in Disneyworld. We were guests at Port Orleans Riverside. While we had a wonderful time at the parks, our stay at Riverside was terrible. From the rude girl that checked us in to the nasty woman at the food court we really did not enjoy ourselves at the resort and never plan on staying there again. We had specifically asked for a king size bed and to be on a top floor. The girl said that we would not be able to get a king size bed but that we would be on the 2nd floor, so I thought one out of two I guess would be okayâ€¦not so muchâ€¦.the building that we stayed in had 3 floors and double beds. For 5 nights, every night and all night we heard the toilets above us constantly flush. The beds were too small for us (newlyweds) to sleep together so after the second night of getting elbowed in the head by my husband I decided to sleep in the other bed alone. When we checked in, the girl did not explain anything to us and seemed extremely annoyed at any questions that we asked her, not exactly a warm welcome to the best place on earth. The room size was okay; however I found the room to be old and dirty. The bathroom really turned my stomach and the beds made my skin itch! The food court experience wasn't too pretty either! Stalking other guests for seats every morning to eat breakfast really wasnâ€™t too fun. The second to last day we were greeted by the rudest person I have encountered at the food court working the cashier desk who argued with us that we werenâ€™t doing the dinning plan as we should, which was really strange to us since we ate the same exact thing every day we were there. The busses were a nightmare! We waited an hour an a half just to get a bus to go to Downtown Disney only to wait another 20 minutes for the bus driver to load a handicap cart. The rest of our travels took about an hour to get anywhere and forget it when we were leaving the parks. The busses were extremely overcrowded. The bus drivers weren't exactly friendly. Our last visit to Disney we stayed at the Caribbean Beach which we thought was heaven, however we thought we would try to experience all that Disney has to offer and try somewhere different, what a mistake that turned out to be! I am seriously re-thinking ever staying at a Disney resort again! Our experience at Port Orleans Riverside has really put a bad taste in my mouth! I would not recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: dayooper_53
Reviews.Content: Drove to Disney from Michigan...arrived and was pleasantly surprised....kind of a far walk when unpacking the car but younger people did it...lol...room was very nice indeed..clean and quiet room...rented a battery operated cart to get around since i'm older and the walking was rough on me...breakfast at lodge was great but very hectic...lots of people....but thats Disney...pools were nice and warm but should have more hot tubs...i would stay at riverside again if i ever get to go back.....employees were very friendly and helpful...

Reviews.Title: “Typical Disney Quality- Nice clean rooms but service could be improved.”
Reviews.Author: travelweeklyforwork2
Reviews.Content: We just visited the Port Orleans Riverside over Thanksgiving and have stayed there for the past eight years. Its a nice clean hotel, average rates, very convenient to parks. It may be the holiday but we notice that the service and food at this location get a little worse each year - no one seems to know what they are doing or how to handle crowds - which is what you would expect Disney to excel at. The rooms are clean, bathroom is tiny but there is a curtain that can be closed to allow a larger changing area. There are two double beds with a trundle bed in most rooms and they are reasonably sound proofed. There is a refridgerator in each room which is also nice. The grounds are nicely landscaped, and the kids will like the boat dock area. We had a lot of problems making dining reservations at Disney in general this year- so just a tip but book early or you may be banished to eating in the food court. If you have a car - its cheaper and better food to leave the area and travel outside of the park. It also give you a break from too much Disney. We would recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Walt would be embarrassed!”
Reviews.Author: realreviewFlorida
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 horrible nights in alligator bayou before moving to the Wilderness Lodge (which was terrific). The theme was lovely. We thoroughly enjoyed the grounds. The room however was horrible. I have severe allergies and asthma so the nightmare began the first evening. My throat began to tighten and i had to take some fast acting medication. The next afternoon my partner wasn't feeling well. We visited one of the parks and while there we both felt much better. When we returned to the room we both began to feel ill again. When we reported this to the front desk they acted unconcerned with our issues and asked if there was anything else they could help us with and refused to let us speak to a manager. That place is truly horrible. Once we arrived at the wilderness lodge the concierge made contact with the riverside manager for us and we at least received an apology. We believe that there was mold in the carpets as it smelled musty. Don't waste your time and money on this hotel. The deluxe hotels are a bit pricey but certainly worth the money for the service and experience.

Reviews.Title: “Healthy Eating at Port Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: SouthernIN
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans Riverside is a great resort to visit while in Walt Disney World for all of the many reasons already mentioned in reviews on this site. I would like to offer another terrific reason to choose Riverside - the power to eat healthy while on vacation. Of course, the ability to have some control over your diet is diminished if you are in the parks every day. However, when youâ€™re just hanging out at this resort, opportunities to eat better are abundant. I must begin by saying that I donâ€™t believe the Disney Dining Plan is an option for anyone wishing to eat in a healthy manner. Disney advertises the cost savings of purchasing the dining plan and how easy and stress free it is by having the meals prepaid. Iâ€™m not really sure either of those advantages really exists. The savings may be there if you are willing to eat large meal platters with huge desserts twice a day. The plan certainly encourages you to eat more than you should or normally would because of whatâ€™s included and, of course, you want to get your moneyâ€™s worth. I also canâ€™t tell you how many times Iâ€™ve witnessed parents arguing in the dining court over what items are included in the plan and what arenâ€™t. How they can substitute item A for item B to leave no prepaid food item uneaten. Not exactly stress free. Taking the dining plan (literally and figuratively) off the table, Iâ€™d like to point out some of the options that Riverside offers which wonâ€™t derail all of the progress that you have made watching your nutrition at home. While few people actually want to diet while on vacation, these choices will at least help you to maintain and not gain weight and make more healthful choices for your children. There are four dining options at Port Orleans Riverside. They are Boatwrightâ€™s Dining Hall, the River Roost Lounge, the Riverside Mill Food Court and Fultonâ€™s General Store. The best opportunities for clean eating are at the food court and general store. The store has many healthy snack choices and this particular food court offers an option not found at other food courts on the Disney properties - the create-your-own food stations. These fix it your way food stations allow you to enjoy freshly created meals by choosing from fresh fruit and vegetable selections and eliminate hidden calories by letting you speak to the person who is preparing your food and direct how your entrÃ©e is being prepared. For breakfast, the create-your-own Oatmeal/Yogurt/Cereal station features slow cooked oats and yogurt. Some of the choices available for adding are fresh strawberries, raspberries, dried banana chips, cranberries and nuts. Cartons of skim or 2% milk are available in the drink cooler and artificial sweeteners like Splenda and Equal are available free of charge as a substitute for brown sugar. If choosing yogurt, ask the chef to go easy on the yogurt and heavy on the fresh fruits. For kids who like cold cereal, itâ€™s a great way to sneak in a serving of fruit for the day. Another healthy breakfast alternative is to purchase the multigrain bread at the pastry counter in the dining court or if you are feeding a large family on a budget, you can purchase a loaf of the bread and jar of peanut butter from the general store. Toasters, as well as microwaves, are available in the food court. Honey, jellies and jams and low fat margarine spread such as Smart Balance are available at the drink station. While the multigrain bread is perhaps not as nutritious as 100% whole wheat bread, it still beats choosing from the extra extra large pastries and muffins that are offered. Individual prepackaged cold cereals are also available in the food court and multi packs of cereal are available in the general store. Cartons of Skim or 2% milk can be saved in the refrigerator in your room. The cereals are also great as an evening snack. When you buy the multi-packs in the general store, they have disposable bowls and spoons behind the counter available free of charge. If they donâ€™t offer them, ask. Bananas, apples and oranges are available at the food court throughout the day. For lunch and dinner choose the create-your-own Salad or Pasta stations. The salad station features Romaine or Spring Mix salads with several fresh options to add such as cucumbers, tomatoes, olives, peas, mushrooms, onions, carrots, broccoli, chick peas and grilled chicken. The salads are mixed to order behind the counter. You choose the ingredients. One note: some of the salad dressings offered are not low fat or low calorie so asking for them on the side is very important. This way you can have control over how much is added to your salad. Not advertised, but available, is vinegar and oil. They also have malt vinegar packets in the condiment section by the toasters. This can be combined with another dressing to lower the calorie content. With the create-your-own pasta station, guests choose from three different pasta selections and then add ingredients such as marinara, sun dried tomatoes, fresh spinach, black olives, peas, onions, chicken or shrimp. The pasta dish is prepared to order in front of you. Ask the chef to go easy on the oil that they use to sautÃ© the vegetables in. Also, asking for extras of vegetables in place of the chicken or shrimp is also an option. Other healthy fare besides the Salad and Pasta bars are available such as turkey sandwiches with lettuce and tomatoes and PBJ Uncrustables. Again, you can make your own PBJ by getting multigrain bread and an individual sized peanut butter from the pastry counter and use the jelly at the condiment station. Soup options include selections such as Minestrone, Chicken Noodle, Chicken Gumbo and Tomato Bisque. Smaller side salads, yogurt, grape and melon bowls, sliced apples with caramel dip and veggie packs with low fat Ranch dressing are available in the drink cooler. For snacking, buy the refillable resort mug for unlimited access to two types of unsweetened iced tea, light lemonade and coffee. Or you can take the disposable cups from the guest room to use for ice water from the food court. Fultonâ€™s General Store also carries several different types of dried fruit, nuts and pretzels. If you must have the double bacon cheeseburger, fried fish, French fries or chicken strips, consider sharing a meal. The adult sized portions are generous. The desserts (brownies, cake, cookies, cupcakes, ice cream) that are offered in the food court and general store are huge â€“ definitely enough for sharing. Or consider choosing a kids meal. Besides the smaller portions, the sides for the kidsâ€™ meals include raw carrots and grapes. Bottles of water, apple juice and milk are included in the cost of the meal. Ask for meals to go. All adult meals can be halved and saved in the guest room refrigerator and warmed up in the food court microwave at a later time. As you can see there are several healthy food options available at Port Orleans Riverside. One sad commentary but convenient aspect to choosing the healthier fare is that the serving lines and wait times are always considerably shorter!

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving week @ Port Orleans Riverside”
Reviews.Author: Rowedog
Reviews.Content: I read several reviews on this site before my trip.Â  I am at a loss as to how anyone did not enjoy their stay at the Port Orleans if they had an experience similar to mine.Â  The room was simple but very nice.Â  The room contained a table with two chairs, twin beds, TV, and a mini fridge.Â  It was a pretty normal hotel room.Â  It was clean and neat.Â  The cleaning staff came everyday and it was very well maintained.Â  The grounds were wonderful and very well kept.Â  Disney does a great job of keeping everything clean and neat.Â  This place was no exception.Â  We greatly enjoyed our stay.Â  The Magnolia Bend section is very nice.Â  The buildings look like Old South plantation homes.Â  The Sassagoula River runs through the property.Â  There is a sidewalk that runs around the edge of the river and the property.Â  I used it to jog every morning.Â  The pools were heated but they were too cold for my taste.Â  We had sandwiches in the dining area and they were very good.Â  My son enjoyed the arcade.Â  I saw a man performing in the hotel piano bar but did not stay for the show.Â  The TV selection is limited with mostly Disney affiliated programming (It did include all the important ESPN channels).Â  All in all I really enjoyed the stay and considered it a good value for the price.Â  Our room purchase included meal plans.Â  That made all the difference for us.Â  It was great and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall y nice place”
Reviews.Author: coricluster
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I visited Riverside over the thanksgiving holiday. this was my first time to disney in about 18 years. The hotel check in and everything was very smooth. We arrived late and was not a problem. The rooms were OK to say. They are in serious need of an update. The maid service was good, they were there around the same time everyday and very quick. The food at the restaurant was good, but the food court was kinda cheesy and very busy in the morning. Transportation from the hotel to the parks was prompt and easy, the thing i was upset about was not being able to get a late check out for the last day. they insisted that we be out by 11 and our flight was not till 5 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great time in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: Mitches
Reviews.Content: We stayed at POR in Oct, booked through Virgin. We arrived late evening, via Mears Transport from MCO. There was no queue to check in, procedure went smoothly, got map and keys for our room in Parterre Place, which was quite near the main building. The rooms are in small mansion blocks, in a lovley setting. It is the grounds that make this place, lots of well manicured greenery, water features and plenty wildlife going about. We saw squirrels, toads and fish. There is a big main pool with water features and a flume, and towels that you can help yourself to. There are also several smaller pools, beside the mansions, these pools are usually quieter. The rooms although not plush, are more than adequate. Plenty room for all our stuff, we are a family of 4, with 2 boys aged 14 & 10. The rooms have 2 double beds, a fridge, tv, ironing board & iron and a safe. Ours was cleaned everyday and plenty of towels and toiletries were provided, although the soap and showergel doesn't lather up too well! We visited the main building for breakast most mornings, it gets very busy, especially if you go after 8.30am, but you always get a seat. There is plenty food to choose from and the quality ifs pretty good. We liked the omelettes and the pancakes. We sometimes just carried out criossants and coffee and had it in our room whilst getting ready to go out. We had a couple of meals in the evening, the fish and chips are good and also the ceaser salad and the bottles of red wine. We didn't eat in the restaurant, the menu was quite expensive and I don't think the food would have been much better.The refillable mugs are well worth it, you can fill up as much hot and cold drinks as you want. The shop is good and full of all the usual Disney merchandise, my kids liked the arcade, and the pub seemed good, especially if you had little kids as there was some good entertainment on for them. The staff we very effeciant, nothing seemed too much trouble, the porters were very friendly, and bell services can get you a taxi any time. The shuttle busses run very effeciantly, we didn't have to wait more than 10 mins for them. We loved the atmosphere at POR, and the boat trip which takes about 20mins to DTD is a nice perk. We enjoyed the whole experience here, and are glad that we stayed in Disney for our first time. If we are to go again I think we would get an apartment, nearer to Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice...”
Reviews.Author: chadp1
Reviews.Content: We were enticed to stay on property by the free dining. Eating at Disney has gotten so unfathomably expensive, we thought we'd give it a try. My family of 7 go to Disney every year. Usually we stay off property at Marriott Vacation Clubs. This time we got connecting rooms at Riverside. I'll try to give a list of pros and cons to staying here compared to off property. Pro's The grounds are beautiful, and the staff are all very pleasant. We were there at a busy time, and we didn't run into a single worker who was not over the top pleasant. Pools are very nice and well kept...and they are open late. Rooms were very clean, and in great shape. Double sinks that are separate from the shower/toilet are very convenient for big groups of people. Boat ride to downtown Disney is nice. Good departure from taking the bus everywhere. It's a bit slow, but enjoyable. Food at the food court was over priced, but of good quality. Many options, and all seemed pretty good. Disney magical transportation really was magical. They pick up your bags from the baggage claim belt, and deliver them to your room. Once we checked our baggage in Chicago, we didn't see it again till we got to our room. This was really really nice. Cons Place is pretty spread out. Some one mentioned they had 2000 rooms. We had a pretty long walk to the theme park buses. Rooms are nice, but small. And the beds are doubles not queens. After a week, we were looking forward to getting back to a larger bed. I would really consider staying off property with 4 or 5 people. That room gets pretty cozy after a week. They really could provide either free internet, or at least a free internet area. They charge a premium to stay here, and another ten bucks a day seemed kind of silly to me. There aren't many hotels left that still charge for internet. Comaprison to staying off property We really loved the resort, but We'll probably go back to staying off property. We really missed not having a kitchen and the extra space. Eating out is fun, but three times a day for a week started to be more work than fun. We also missed not having a car. For the most part, outside of being crowded, the disney buses were pretty convenient. It was, however, a challenge if you wanted to visit another hotel for dinner. You needed to give yourself a good hour, and be prepared to switch buses. Tough for a family of 7. Overall, it's a really nice resort. I can't imagine anyone not enjoying it, especially if you haven't been to Disney before. However, if you have a larger family, and like a bit more flexibility, renting a car and staying off property is probably a better choice. Be prepared. You will have to wait for buses once in a while, and there are 2000 other families there, so things can take a while to get done. But having said that, the staff really do try to make the trip special.

Reviews.Title: “great, great resort”
Reviews.Author: MICHAELJBcCanada
Reviews.Content: beautifully landscaping,everything from the New Orleans theme style buildings to the riverrunning through the resort,we liked the egrets that wander around;so tame.We never ever had a bad meal throughout Disneyworld,forget the whiners complaing about the chaos at breakfast after all it is a buffet style cafe ,we just used to go sit in the Boatbuilder restaraunt next door it always had lots of empty tables since it does not open till much later.Great staff as we expected with Disney,our grandchildren had a blast there.Highly recommend,be prepared for lots of walking though as unlike Disneyland it is enormous ,great bus service.sad to go.Mike/Joan Wright BC Canada

Reviews.Title: “Clean but needs updating and just really Basic”
Reviews.Author: Biz_TravelerMaryland
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great housekeeping and grounds Cons: Very thin, stained bath towels and needs updating Summary: The room was clean and kept clean during my 8 night stay. I attended a conference and spent a few days at Disney. The transportation to Disney & other Disney properties was available but could consume a good part of your day (not the speediest). The room really needed to be updated. The linens looked worn, the bath towels were thread bare and had lots of stains. There was really basic bath amenities (bar of soap & shampoo/conditioner combo). Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort to stay at whilst at Disney”
Reviews.Author: gronk27
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and it was just lovely. The resort is beautiful, we felt relaxed as soon as we got there. There's a river that runs through the resort and it's very green and leafy. We hired bikes and little boats whilst we there which was lots of fun. The food court was very good, the breakfasts are huge and then at lunch and dinners they have a good selection of salads, sandwiches, fast food, pasta and pizza and a carvery in the evenings. Check in was fast and painless and they even had Happy Anniversary badges waiting for us despite the fact we'd only told one restaurant. The room was very nice, I was hoping that we would be in the mansions section as the decor wasn't really to my taste, but it was still a very high standard with good amenities. The pools are really nice, particularly Old Man Island which has a jacuzzi and water slide. The shop on location sells basics and Disney souveniers. There's also a lounge which has entertainment and a good pool bar. We had a wonderful time at the resort. The only downside was that because it's such a large resort it was very busy in the food court during breakfast time and there were often long waits for the buses. They were only minor inconveniences on what was a great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Best Moderate Resort”
Reviews.Author: IslandAdventure4
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at Port Orleans Riverside this November. We have been to Disney quite a few times and it is our first time staying here. We realy enjoyed the resort. it was quiet, the grounds were really nice. they offer quiet pools other than the main pool on Ol` Man Island. It is a large resort so depending which area you stay in, it could be quite a walk to the main hub, and/or busses. but other that that we really enjoyed staying here and would stay again. Oh yeah a really nice boat ride to Downtown Disney right from the dock.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Port Orleans Riverside”
Reviews.Author: Mom153
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this resort the week before Thanksgiving . It was a wonderful time of the year to go to Disney World because the crowds are down. This resort has beautiful grounds and the rooms were what we expected for a moderate hotel. The room was clean although it could use some updates: there were a few stains in the carpet and the furniture had knicks. Our room was in Oak Manor which overlooked a courtyard and it was very quiet, near one of the quiet pools and a bridge that connects the lobby, restaurant and food court. The room had a refrigerator and a coffee pot. We didn't eat at the restaurant but did eat a few times at the food court. The food was good but one morning we made the mistake of going around 8:00 and it was very crowded. I would suggest going around 7:00 or 9:00 for breakfast. We did rent a car but did use the bus to a few places and the wait was minimal. In summary, Port Orleans Riverside is a very good value! We will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Weed whackers at 6:15 a.m. and mayhem every breakfast”
Reviews.Author: effavess
Reviews.Content: This was one of the least relaxing places I've ever stayed - and by far the least 'resort' like resort I've visited. I was awoken on the last day at 6:15 to weed whackers outside my door - when I called front desk about it, they simply said 'well, groundskeeping starts at 6:00" - I asked to be transferred to goundskeeping, no one answered that transfer. I later called back and asked to speak witha manager and was told one would be paged and I'd get a call back - never got a call back. In my township it is illegal to run power tools before 8 a.m. - one would think at a leisure resort, it would be unheard of. The breakfast spot was mayhem every morning - you had to wait in line at many different stations to get a full breakfast together - on the flip side, the staff was very pleasant in the restaurant and 'cafeteria' though. Food at Boatwrights - the sit down restaurant was very good too. Also, not having wireless internet was a major disappointment. Get with the times Disney! What's worse, the wired internet required a half hour conversation with the IT guy on the phone and costs 10$/day. I've stayed places less than half the cost that have wireless for free. Finally, the room was awful - super dark, and there is no way to get fresh air in the room without either leaving your door open or running the noisy fan - I got to FLA thinking how nice it will be to be in bright, fresh, warm air - not allowed in the room apparently.....all I could breathe were the carpeting, wallpaper and clearning fumes in the room - each morning after a night in the room I felt horrible - I'm guessing from the lack of fresh air and sound sleep. I will not stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: goferris
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here this past week for a vacation. It was anything but a restful trip! We have been to Disney a few times and usually stay at Animal Kingdom. We thought we'd save some money and try this Moderate hotel. What a mistake! Since there are less Pro's than Con's, I'll review them first. The hotel property is well decorated with vegetation. It was scenic and there were a lot of flowers, plants and local animals. It made for a nice walk. There is also a dock that rents boats and bicycles. I would definitely recommend this as the boating down the outdoor hotel river is relaxing and beautiful. It's a bit pricey ($45/hour for a 2-person boat). Now the con's: The room itself has a outside door, so anytime you leave your room, you are outside. Not too fun if you want to walk to the lobby and it's raining. This also means there is only one window in the room that points to the outdoor hallway where all guests walk to their rooms. This, along with the MANY children running around, the paper thin walls, really squeaky beds, and early morning ground cleaning (yes, gas blowers and trimmers going at 7:00am every day!) made our room very loud. Plus, any time our neighbors flushed the toilet or took a shower, we could hear it very clearly. For security and privacy, I left the blinds shut since every guest in my building was walking by. This made my room very dark--who goes to Florida to not see the sun???? Housekeeping was no better. Every morning they entered our room at 8:00am. When they saw we were still sleeping, they left, but you'd think after the second or third day that they'd realize the pattern (even with the privacy sign up!). They did a good job cleaning, but there were a few times when we received bath towels that looked very old (mine had a huge tear in it!). The hotel is just around 2000 rooms I think. The hotel was not full when we were there, so I can only imagine the chaos when it is full! On the entire property, there is only one 10-person hot tub. Every night we tried to use it, it was full of unsupervised kids or teenagers drinking. Breakfast was an absolute nightmare where people were bumping into each other, no tables available, and staff that was so overwhelmed that food was just slopped on your plate. The buffet was the only option for breakfast as the sit-down restaurant was only open for dinner (5:00pm to 10:00pm). In terms of service, this was some of the worst service I received--ever. After the second night, I called the front desk and politely requested to be connected to Animal Kingdom as I was uncomfortable and wanted to switch hotels. The woman would not transfer me and advised the only way I could speak with someone at AK was for a manager to call me back. After 20 minutes of not receiving a call back, I called my front desk again. It was a 10-minute fight to be transferred to the AK, but I finally was transferred (the woman from AK was extremely helpful). Ultimately, we chose to stay at our hotel and "rough it out" but that proved to be a mistake that my husband and I both regret. On the night before my departure, I tried to check in to my flight (via my phone--Disney charges $9.95/day for internet). I was already checked in so I could not change my seat or pay my baggage. After much confusion and talking to about 6 different people, I learned that Disney checked me in to my flight (without my knowledge or consent). It took a 20 minute call to the airline to clear up the situation. My airline does not allow pre-paying of luggage via phone and Disney had no way for me to do this online (no business center or check-in kiosks and in-room internet is $9.95/day). When I asked for a 15-minute complementary internet session in my room just to check in, I was rudely denied by 2 different people who told me to use Disney's luggage service. So, I paid Disney, received a receipt and took my baggage to the airport....only to find that my airline had no record of my payment and I had to pay for my luggage AGAIN! This seemed to be common as the rep at the airport told me she deals with this many times per day and there were at least 12 other people behind me that had the same problem with their luggage. I'm still fighting Disney to get the refund of their baggage "service." Overall, this was one of the worst vacations I've ever taken. I was nickled-and-dimed for every extra service (and double-billed for a few things that I had to clear up prior to check out), the staff was rude and unhelpful (I can't even count how many times I heard "I'm sorry" followed by "You'll have to go talk to someone else"), check out and luggage service was horrible, the Disney Magical Express shuttle service to the airport was 30 minutes late, the rooms were dark and very loud and the dining options limited. If you have a family with lots of small children and you are going to Disney on a budget, you might not mind this hotel. However, if you are trying to relax or want genuinely caring service or a non-hectic return home, stay away from Port Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Disney stay”
Reviews.Author: 70cuda33935
Reviews.Content: awesome, not one bad thing to say. i would stay there even if i didnt go to disney

Reviews.Title: “We had a great experience at Port Orleans.”
Reviews.Author: dunfordhome
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans in September 2009, during our first trip to Disney World. While it was nothing fancy, the hotel had friendly staff, the room was clean, and the bus service to the parks was convenient. We also enjoyed using their ferries to go between the hotel and Downtown Disney in the evenings. I would recommend staying in building 14, because it's close to the main building where the restaurants are, as well as the main bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Merc1974
Reviews.Content: This has been my fourth time staying here since it was "Dixie Landings" back in the 90s. I can't say enough good things about it. The grounds are beautifully maintained, each building looks a little different on the outside. All the staff was extremely helpful. The rooms are starting to show signs of wear, but were very clean. We loved the pools shared between the buildings in addition to the main pool. This is my favorite of the moderate resorts!

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans Riverside was GREAT”
Reviews.Author: CoquinaRat
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay. Our last accomodations 7 years ago were at Coronado Springs. We wanted to try something else for this stay and Port Orleans was great. There are 4 shuttle stops here (one just happened to be outside our bldg.) which makes catching a ride to the parks convenient. There was no hassle in checking in. The Magical Express delivered our bags to our room without incident while we enjoyed the afternoon at Epcot. Food on site is convenient and good and the general store is convenient for anything you may need. The rooms were comfortable and clean. The two sinks are also a nice feature. TV channels were adequate during the rest periods in the room. Everything was restocked for us with no problems each day. The beds were very comfortable. The grounds were very clean and everyone friendly. I have 0 complaints and would stay here again for it's location and size.

Reviews.Title: “Moderate hotel. Moderate expectations.”
Reviews.Author: minortj
Reviews.Content: Check in and room assignment process left something to be desired. I had to go back to the front desk three times in the first 30 minutes (normal check-in gave us the wrong room type, second time the room keys wouldn't work, third time was the charm). We probably didn't make it too easy as we requested connecting rooms with another party that was checking in three days later than us. Didn't have shampoo in the room originally, plus it wouldn't hurt the cleaning staff to clean behind the bathroom door either. On the plus side, location is pretty central to all the major Disney parks and Downtown Disney. Several pool options. The staff in the Country Store was great and very helpful! Disney transportation is reliable. Even the resort airline check-in process was nice and easy. So overall, nothing overly great or bad...just moderate, like the hotel category. Next time I'd like to try one of the Disney Vacation Club locations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - better service is needed - Awesome pool”
Reviews.Author: NewEnglandCamper
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at Disney's Port Orleans Riverside. The room was spacious and clean upon arrival. The room was always properly cleaned (although we did find the previous' guest rotting fruit in the fridge). Yuk. After that was cleaned up the fridge came in handy. Not really quiet in the morning... you may here other guests leaving for the day but it wasn't that bad. We weren't provided with much shampoo or soap this time around. I think they were cutting back. There was enough towels for showering but a few extra could have been provided for the nearby pool. The main pool has towels available. Laundry area was wonderfully modern! The Riverside Mill food court was AWESOME (even though the 1st day we had some service issues). Very good snacks and lunch, breakfast selection. I would potentially come here again if I was staying at another resort. The big pool and the Muddy Waters poolside bar was great! I didn't have to worry about the kids because there are LIFE GUARDS on duty! Free life jacket rental as well. I really liked water slide and yes, even I being 40 went down it and had fun! Lots of pool deck chairs. We even played BINGO by the pool with the activity staff. The Disney bus system is really lousy at this hotel. There is too many guests and not enough busses. We wasted a lot of time waiting for buses.

Reviews.Title: “Magical and Romantic Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Princesskain
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at a Disney Resort. It was the most amazing experience for us! The scenery is beyond words, and the feel of 'old time Mark Twain era' is abundant. We especially loved the costumes that all the cast members wore. We booked our 2 night stay through expedia for $190 total after taxes (the room was $109 per night, plus we had a $50 off coupon through expedia because we have travelled alot this year). We stayed in the Alligator Bayou. Property layout is easy, but locating our room in our building was confusing. The room itself was beautiful (we had 2 double beds). They paid so much attention to detail when creating the rooms! My favorite part about the room was the sink area (the tile work on the floor and the woodwork on the walls were so pretty). And the curtain that seperates the main room from the bath area I think is a wonderful idea (for privacy as well as blocking out lights when one of us was getting ready for the day and the other was still sleeping). We dined on property for breakfast one morning and found the prices and options to be quite fair. We paid $20 total for 2 full breakfasts (Mickey Waffles, pancakes, scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, biscuits and juices for both of us). We took advantage of the boat which ferries between the resort and DownTown Disney. It was a beautiful scenic tour. Both times we had great captains that were funny and entertaining and gave educational tours along the way. At the end of the evening, there was quite a crowd waiting to board at the dock in DownTown Disney, so we did have to wait about 40 minutes to catch a ride back to the resort, but we didn't mind. If you have the time, walk the property, it is so beautiful. We did not get the chance to use the swimming pools or visit the fishing hole, but they looked inviting and fun. We would definately return to this property again if given the chance. It was a magical experience for both of us!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Environment with limited food options nearby”
Reviews.Author: RCollier
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with this stay. The rooms were very clean and the environment is wonderful and does feel like a bit of a time travel back to New Orleans. My one and only complaint, and it won't stop me from staying there again, was that there are very limited food options at the hotel. There is no room service (only a fairly ordinary and expensive pizza delivery), the food court offers very limited selection and the on-site restaurant is Cajun-themed, very expensive and often requires a reservation well in advance to get a seat. Because the other restaurants are so far away, I found the best way to eat was to take the on-site river taxi to Downtown Disney and then eat there, where the selection is much better. Still, I will definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “The resort was comfortable, nice quiet and fun.”
Reviews.Author: JulieKat
Reviews.Content: We will definitely return to this resort. Our room was comfortable for five people-2 adults, a 15, 11 and 5 year old boys. Although we didn't use the trundle(it was too small) in the room we brought a air mattress for the 11 year old to sleep on. The 15 and 5 year old shared a bed. The big pool with slide was a nice perk. We even rented the surrey bike for the five of us. We had a blast on that. The bus service was good. We were in building 24 and it was a short walk to the bus stop. We took the boat to Downtown Disney and we all liked that. The food in the food court was good and had a good selection.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing more you could ask for”
Reviews.Author: Itsinthemagic
Reviews.Content: We wanted to upgrade a bit from the value resorts and stay at POR. Boy! were we delighted. The rooms were clean, the staff was wonderful. We paid for a prefered room and it was a short walk to the food court and bus stops. Of course we purchased the food plan ( which everyone should do) and had the pleasure of eating at the resort "sit-down" resturant. Had prime rib that was to die for. I can not do this review justice if I didnt mention the entertainer that preforms at the lounge. Bob the piano guy is as good as Disney offers ANYWHERE! on property. The whole family can enjoy it. We went three nights out of the eight we were there. A complete joy. If you just wanted to enjoy a quiet vacation and never leave the resort you wouldnt be dissapointed. The boat ride to Downtown Disney is a quick pleasurable ride. You really cant wrong with this resort. Another best kept secret his the horse and carriage ride after dark. Expensive, but to us it was well worth it. A special treat for that somone special. I already sound like a Disney commercial, but If you have an ideal Disney vacation in mind. This resort will not disapoint you .

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans is Great !”
Reviews.Author: indonesia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside in Sept 2009 and it was great. The food was fine for the odd snack you needed or breakfast before your long days at the parks. The main pool was quite full all the time so we opted to go to another around the back of our hotel room which was a lot less quite which was fine. The staff were very friendly, the only thing i would say was queing when checking in. they seemed to take forever with people and not enough people to help. The hotel is ideal located, this was my 3rd stay at a Disney resort and it was ideal to get to Downtown to eat and all the parks. The rooms are very big and the beds very comfy, towels changed everyday and if you are too tired to go out to eat order the pizza delivery, they are great ! The weather that time of year is beautiful, but very humid so be sure to drink lots of water. We hired a car for 5 days to do Universal/Sea World etc, it was easy to drive out there and signposted very clearly so you shouldnt have any problems. For dinner out of Disney, we recommend Tony Roma's on International Drive, the Ribs are out of this world !!

Reviews.Title: “Beautful resort, ample size rooms”
Reviews.Author: MarylandMel
Reviews.Content: Riverside is a beautiful resort! We enjoyed the landscaping and the "quiet" pool. There are lots of paths to walk and a beautiful waterway that runs throughout the resort. The food court was great with lots of choices. Our room wasn't huge, but it was plenty for two adults and two preschoolers. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay at POR”
Reviews.Author: tanya4
Reviews.Content: I, like you, scoured the reviews of POR almost daily. Since we had never been, I definitely wanted it to be magical for my 5 yr old daughter. I booked the resort primarily based on reviews and of course we had free dining. However prior to our arrival, I think I was looking at to many reviews, and was second guessing our decision. We arrived about 2:00 via ME (Magical Express - see below for comments) and since I previous had checked in "online", I headed to that section of registration. I personally think people get too rapped up in "where is the best location" or "which rooms should I request". We did not have any special requests, however, I was prepared to ask for a room change, if I thought it was going to be too far of a walk to a bus stop or a pool! We were greated immediately and were assigned AB building 14. Pretty much the closest building to anything. It was perfect! a 1 minute walk to the food court, 2 minute walk to the pool, and a 2 minute walk to the main bus stop via the shortcut through the back parking lot. No complaints here! The rooms themselves are pretty dark. Everything was clean. Loved the area near the sinks, that allowed for the curtain to be closed. Great for families, one can start getting ready while the others sleep. Our mini frige worked perfectly...actually if you placed items in the far back - they froze....perfect for water!!!! I really have no complaints about the room. However, they are definitely starting to reflect some age and wear and tear. The bath area is one are that needs an update. Our shower handle kept sliding down from warm to extremely hot, so needless to say, my daughter didn't like that! The tiles did show some wear - no mold - did look like it was recently caulked. Just looked pretty dated. Shower curtain rod was all rusty. Other than that, it was kept clean and tidy. Every day we received towel art...which my daughter tried to recreate, unsuccessfully. Food...we only ate at the Food Court a few times, mostly for lunch, and once for dinner. Decent selection. In the am, get there before 8:00 am to avoid the crazy madhouse! Lunch time was also busy, however just more spread out. Our daughter liked the kids pizza and ice cream sundae station. We liked the Turkey Sandwiches, Make your own Salad and the bakery items. My only complaint would be more related to the guests of the hotel, who just seemed rude, or maybe just in a fog. We opted for the refillable resort mug, which worked out great for us, as we were in building 14 and could just walk over quickly for a refill. Pool - always crowded. Chairs come at a premium. However there were always some available in the shaded areas. The main pool area seemed small to me, however the theming was decent. The restroom at the pool always seemed dirty to me. Decent drinks at Muddy Waters. The quiet pools are deep. I thought my daughter might enjoy a change of pace and I brought her to the quiet pool near our room. WOW - it was 4 -6 feet deep with very little being 4 ft. Gift Shop - Nice size with a decent selection. We decided to buy 2 bottles of Rum at 12.95 each. Much cheaper that $6 a drink at the bar. So, now you know what was in our resort mug! :) Buses - Mostly good experience. We waited only a few minutes each time and it seemed like we rarely shared with POFQ. We only had a few bad experiences with the buses - mostly because we used them to go to another resort. We went to the Poly for dinner and it took us 1.25 hr to get there. Our mistake was taking the bus to Downtown then switching. We should have taken the bus to MK then switched or walked/mono etc. A few times they were standing room only - which is to be expected. Magical Express - the name says it all. Not one problem! We waited maybe 5 minutes at the airport and off we went. POR was the first stop. Our luggage arrived about 3 hrs later - we think. We didn't care we went to Downtown Disney for dinner. We did use the resort check in on our return trip and once again - all went like clock work. All in all I would give POR 4 stars, as I think there are nicer hotels out there. HOwever, for a Moderate - this definitely fit the bill. Would I stay again - Yep!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and luxurious hotel with excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: freefam5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans Resort during our disney trip and this hotel had so many options and the rooms were all nice, it was very clean and everything was well organized. The customer service was wonderful, we would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “dont go Port Orleans Resort Riverside”
Reviews.Author: iworkman
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Orlando. My family and I checked in on 1/10/09, On the seconded day my younger son eat at your food court, and had a kids meal, chicken nuggets. He was throwing up the next day, he was sick for two days. I was sick after throwing up eating your food. we called the maid to come a clean the bathroom and to change the bed sheets, throw up all over, then my older son got sick too for 3 days, we checked out on 1/17/09 and spent over $2,300.00 and didn't have time seeing Disney world. we would like to come back but our family doesn't have the money to do so. after writing to them they sad NO.

Reviews.Title: “port orleans riverside from october 2nd-10th”
Reviews.Author: travellingsoon4
Reviews.Content: We just returned last weekend from disney staying at disney port orleans. We have travelled to disney many times always staying at the value resorts and wanted to try a moderate. LOVED this resort. Let me start by saying it was hotter than it had ever been in October. Some days it was almost too hot for the parks. We would instead go to ee hours. My boys loved the fact they could catch a boat to downtown disney and go to Disney quest. The pool was great. The food court was as good as a food court gets. Table service restaurant, though not our favorite was good.We loved that we could get a milkshake as a desert. The rooms were nice. We stayed in building 27. It was a great location. I wouldn't pay extra for a water view though. Not worth it. We liked the fridge and even the trundle bed. My average size 13 year old slept on it with little problem. I would say it is the same as an inflatable pool mattress size. We had planned on using the surrey bikes etc, but it was too hot. Bus service was great. We had to stand often but never waited long for a bus. We plan on booking again as soon as I find out when the ESPN weekend will befor 2010. My only big tip. While the restaurants at Disney are great, we will do the quick counter service meal plan next time, especially if staying at a moderate.
