Sitting for a meal takes alot of time, and keeps you on a tighter schedule. Especially if you had been there before.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice but a bit small”
Reviews.Author: DE_Auditor
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from our first visit to Walt Disney World in Orlando. We selected Riverside because it was WDW middle tier hotel. The rooms were a tad small if you're traveling with two girls: 15 and 9 years old. The beds were doubles, not queens. If a double sounds small, it is. Be sure to request a room with a roll-out trundle bed. Our 9-year old slept on it and loved it which was nice so Dad could have his own bed. The cleaning staff did a great job fixing up the room each day. Washcloths and hand towels were made into different shapes each day which we looked forward to. They started cleaning the rooms early (about 8 - 9am) since most people are heading to the parks. This is great when in case you want to go back to the room for an afternoon nap because your room is already cleaned. The concierge staff was wonderful (Allison - you're the best!) and went out of their way to help you book a dinner reservation or offer suggestions since there is SO many opportunities. The guide books to doing Disney are correct - book dinners and character breakfasts in advance. They suggest 90 days in advance. Popular places were challenging to get into for the normal dinner times - even in October. However, the dinners at WDW were delicious and the service was impeccable. Riverside is a great location. WDW offers bus transportation to its parks and Downtown Disney. Riverside has four stops (South which is the lobby area, West, North, and East Depots). You can take the water taxi to Port Orleans-French Quarter and to Downtown Disney. Downtown Disney offers a respite from the parks: shopping, live bands, special "street" performances, and restaurants. Great for families as well as adults w/o kids. Portebellos is a fantastic Italian restaurant that will surely leave you with a full stomach. In summary, Riverside was a nice hotel, close enough to WDW parks, and clean. For our family, it sufficed however I would have personally liked a bigger room with queen beds (I'm a big guy) like at the Polynesian Resort but that was the upper tier WDW hotel with their upper tier cost. If you have four in the family, be sure to ask for a trundle bed. If you have five or more, you may want to consider booking two rooms. All said and done - WDW proves it has cornered the market on superb customer service.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: stesuec
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 14 nights and what a beautiful resort. We had paid extra for a waterview room and it came up trumps. We were in the mansions at Magnolia Bend, overlooking the river and a short walk to the pool and foodcourt. Check in was quick and I was impressed with the friendly and polite staff. The room had 2 queen beds, plenty of storage space and most importantly, was clean. Apart from one day, the only time we used the foodcourt was for breakfast, which had typical breakfast fayre and was a bit chaotic if you went in at the busiest time, which we found to be between 8.45 and 9.30. The grounds of this resort are really beautiful and are great to have a stroll around. There is a boat that you can catch to Downtown Disney, though it is quite a noisy ride! There are small pools dotted around the resort as well as the main pool in the centre of the resort. The resort is very big and some of the rooms are quite a walk from the main pool and foodcourt. As mentioned earlier, we found all of the staff at the resort to be very pleasant and polite and we had no complaints about anything or anyone. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at POR and after staying at the CBR last time we came and saying it was our favourite resort, I think we may have a new one!.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, good food, nice pool, but really far to walk”
Reviews.Author: cooper2296
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside and requested a River view. We paid extra for it but it ended up being a REALLY long walk from the parking lot to our room. It was borderline ridiculous. The rooms were pretty small, the beds were only double sized. They were clean and the pool was really nice. They also had really good food at Boatwrights. There wasn't WIFI available which was really surprising.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort on the Disney property”
Reviews.Author: Lambo71
Reviews.Content: I have to say, we have stayed at a lot of hotels over the years, but this is definitely one of my favorites. It feels like you're staying on Tom Sawyer Island. It's quiet, beautiful, and themed just right. We stayed in Alligator Bayou and it felt a world away from the hustle and bustle of Disney World. They have 7 pools and the Ol' Man Island pool is wonderful! Lots of amenities too. They have the Old Mill food court that has a working water wheel and gearing going through the restaurant. The Boatright's restaurant was nice, but a little pricey. Still, nice to have a sit down restaurant in the resort. Then, outside were all sorts of boats to rent and a free boat trip from Port Orleans to Downtown Disney, which is HIGHLY recommended. It's one of the best rides in the park, especially at night. The Mansion rooms across the Sassagoula river are really beautiful too. For the kids, and kids at heart, they have a huge arcade with all sorts of diversions. They even have carriage rides and bicycle rentals. I can't wait to go back. We actually visited every resort during our stay and none compared to the look and feel of Riverside. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “great place for great price”
Reviews.Author: kellyat
Reviews.Content: The place was great for the price we paid. We liked the onsite restaurant, the pools, and fishing right there. We also liked taking the boat to French Quarter to swim a day and to go to downtown Disney. We had a car, so didn't take Disney transportation to the resorts. We loved having our car parked right outside our room and had a quick, easy drive to the resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a beautiful resort.”
Reviews.Author: Adamyyc
Reviews.Content: I am a seasoned Disney traveller, and this year decided to go to Port Orleans riverside. It was such a lovely resort....where do I start? ROOMS The room although not huge was more than ample for myself and my friend who was travelling with me. Unlike at the value resort this room had 2 sinks, which was fantastic for getting ready at night and in the morning. We stayed in Alligator Bayou Bldg 26, a short walk from the main complex which offered many amenities. The Bayou rooms, are themed with rustic wood carved beds, lanterns and a wooden trunk and furniture. They were VERY soundproof, although we were on the 2nd floor so perhaps that helped. Bear in mind there are no elevators for the Bayou rooms so if you are needing access to an elevator, you should stay in the Magnolia Bend section across the river ( themed like southern mansions with elevators). Room service was impeccable and our room was a welcome retreat at the end of a tiring day. RESORT AMENITIES There is an onsite restaurant Boatwrights, that serves plentiful portions of southern themed meals, as usual the Disney servers were friendly and service oriented...no complaints. The food court was large and had wonderful selections including an onsite Bakery with warm cinnamon rolls, squares and cookies. The food court could be crowded at peak times, but it was never hard to find a seat. Fultons general store had LOTS of merchandise including clothing and sundries..... great shopping options. In addition there were bike and boat rentals, horsedrawn carriage rides and power boats. Transportation options included Boat Service to Downtown Disney, as well as Buses to all the parks. From experience we found it best to wait for all buses at the South Depot ( Main Depot) as they seemed to be faster from there. Only negative.... despite requesting an Alligator Bayou room for months before our arrival and following up on the day of our arrival, they initially didnt have one for us, saying they were not available.....after speaking with the Manager on Duty one magically became available..... I was courteous and explained how special our trip was... and Disney accomodated. I have always found that the kind approach when dealing with service people is the way to go, and this once again was the case. The resort grounds were peaceful, despite there being hundreds of people on property, the design and landscaping of the property is amazing, would not hesitate to return. Last thought, if you are unsure of French Quarter or Riverside, I would recommend Riverside, it is the main complex with full amenities....French Quarter guests need to come over to Riverside to take part in all the fun there... as welll French Quarter had minimal lush landscaping and had a stark feel to it...... just my opinion. Bottom Line....Riverside is a very beautiful special place to spend your holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday gift”
Reviews.Author: FoxViews
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights booked into the Port Orleans as a birthday trip. Between special deals sent from Disney via internet, and being able to use Disney Visa points, got an exceptional deal. We had stayed on 2 other properties before (All-Star and Caribbean Beach) so decided to give Port Orleans a try... Check in was a challenge. We arrived at 1:00 pm, so not the peak time. We had dione express on line check in on the computer, so there was a 'special' line set up for us. Well, the wait in that line was longer than the others, as only 1 person was staffing it. I would suggest that you don't even bother with the express, if this is the norm. The other problem with the check in was that they had secured the room on the credit card, and had already charged the card before my arrival. SInce we w ere using DIsney points, they had to do a credit card return transaction, which took some extra time. They also didn't give us a room per my request (no parking lot view) I had spoken with reservations agents at least 3 times about that, and it was supposedly noted. Of course, they were directing us to our room, which we could clearly see was in the parking lot. We complained, asked to see a manager...the room was changed for us but all new key cards had to be made, etc. The room itself was fine. We had a king sized bed, and there was just enough room for us not to feel cramped. The landscaping and grounds were beautiful, and were very appealing. There are nice walking paths which provide lots of places to walk. Be careful though--the staff fly around on golf carts and we were almost bowled over several times. Another perk of the Port Orleans is that you can ride a 'water taxi' to Downtown Disney. We did this several times during our stay, which cut out having to look for parking. In fact, we didn't move our car the entire 3 day stay and used several modes of Disney transportation Added time on to the trip, but was kind of fun.

Reviews.Title: “A great value for a Disney hotel”
Reviews.Author: bonleeballerina
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. We stayed here for our honeymoon and although it wasn't a very romantic hotel it was wonderful as we stayed in the parks most of time. We booked a standard two bed room, and at check in we asked for an upgrade to a king bed, but they weren't able to do it because they didn't have any available. The hostess seemed very willing to do it, but couldn't because there just weren't any available. Also, if you're on your honeymoon, mention it at check in and they will give you "just married" pins to wear during your stay. We got so much free stuff with those pins, not to mention a ton of staff members congratulated us. The room was nothing special, but the double sinks were nice and the room was spacious and clean. We didn't get any towel animals even though we tipped everyday, but that could be because we didn't have any kids with us. The grounds were beautiful. We stayed in the Magnolia Bend part and all the buildings were very beautiful. The pools were also nice. The main pool had a waterslide and looked like a lot of fun, but was pretty crowded during the day, We used the quiet pool right by our room only once because it was a little too cold for us. We used it after it was technically closed, but we were quiet and it wasn't an issue. The food at the hotel was okay. We ate at Boatwrights one night and the service was good and the food was okay. The cafeteria wasn't anything to brag about. I had the build your own pasta and it was burned. Also we found that the breakfasts were actually cheaper in the parks. The shuttle to and from the parks was very convenient. Our room was right next to the East depot, but by the time the bust got to us it was pretty full and we usually had to stand. We quickly realized that if we walked the short distance to the South depot right near the gift shop and hotel restaurant the bus was nice and empty. The gift shop was very adequate with lots of souvenirs and clothes. Also, I recommend using the feature where you link your credit card to your room key to pay for things in the park. It was so convenient to have one card for everything (room key, park tickets, and credit card). I didn't think it would be so convenient, but I'm glad we did it because it was one less thing to worry/think about while on vacation. We used the shuttle service (Magical Express) to and from the airport and it was great. It's wonderful that it's included in the room price. We didn't have to wait long either to or from the airport and it was very comfortable. We didn't use the feature where they pick up your bags from baggage claim because we booked our trip too late to get the luggage tags, so I can't comment on that. A word to the wise: If it rains a lot during your trip some of the walkways around the hotel will probably flood. We didn't mind because it just made it more of an adventure. Also, I think most (if not all) of the gift shops, including the hotel gift shop, sell ponchos, but they hide them behind the counter so you have to ask for them. This hotel was great if you aren't looking for something too fancy. It was definately a step up from the economy resorts like Pop Century. Even though we didn't have any kids with us, I think I would be good with kids, too. The shuttle to and from the parks alone is probably worth the difference in cost of staying in an "off campus" hotel and a bona fide Disney hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at Port Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Tayjha
Reviews.Content: I'd like to first compliment the Port Orleans cast members. Everyone was helpful, friendly and well informed. Not once did I run into someone at our hotel who was not this way. Upon arrival we were in the check in line for no longer than 5 minutes. Check in took no more then 5 minutes as well. We were given our key to the world cards, some direction and a map to our room. We arrived at about 11am and our room was ready. Our room was in Acadian House(mansion side) right next to the quiet pool. As we walked to our room we did notice a maid cart with cups sitting right next to the dusters. Overall that was the only thing we saw that made us kind of cringe. The rooms were comfortable. There was a Mickey Mouse towel shape on the bed, I wouldnt say the rooms were anything to brag about but it was clean and comfortable for the 5 days we were there. I would not recommend staying here if you plan to spend more time beyond sleeping(its disney your not going to spend much time in the room anyway) in the room. It was def. big enough for myself, husband and our two boys. Age 5 and 8. The quiet pool next to our hotel was nice and warm. It's a standard square pool 3ft to 5ft. The main pool was close to our room and was usually pretty full. It def. is noisy so stay away if your looking for some wuiet. The hotel grounds are beautiful. Overall it is a very quiet resort. I did the in room pizza delivery one night. It took about 45 minutes to arrive. I didn't really care for the restaurant on the grounds. The "quick-service" food was pretty good and I would have to say I preferred that over the sit-down restaurant. Hope this helps some. Please feel free to message any questions!

Reviews.Title: “Way too big”
Reviews.Author: ginnylou
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Riverside from Sept 26-Oct 1. First, don't bother to check-in online for faster check-in, this was absolutely a joke. We waited longer in this line than if we were in the regular line. Then we got our room, that was in Magnolia Manor, the room was nice, but it was way too far from the restaurant and everything else. So we asked for a closer room. They gave us a room in Alligator Bayou, it was nice, but rustic whereas the Magnolia Manor room was more elegant looking. But it was close to the food court, and was had a pool really close. The complex is extremely large and getting lost is easy to do. But this is where the trouble began, when we changed room, they gave us a new key and told us we had one more use on our old key to retrieve our luggage . We we got to the old room the key wouldn't open the door, so we walked all the way back up front to fix it, then we went back and again the key doesn't work, then we go all the way back again. When we get back to the room the key still doesn't work after 3 tries and a family is sitting outside my door. They had been given my room, that fast. They entered my room with all my luggage, my purse, money everything we own. But she said when she saw someone was still in the room, she closed the door and left, she was honest, but what if it were someone who wasn't. Finally we got our stuff out and went to the other room. But I called the manager on duty, to tell what had happened and that I wasn't happy and he pretty much called me a liar, telling me they would not have given those people our room. Other than this horrible ordeal, the room was decent and the food court was good. We had the south depot bus run close to where we were, so that was good. The buses come frequently, so you don't have to wait very long. The pool was nice and the ferry was relaxing. Our room was cleaned everyday and that was good. The bed did squeak, which was an small annoyance. I have stayed at the value resorts and would probably stay there again, because I don't think it's worth the extra money, you get the same amenities as this.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Disney Vacation...”
Reviews.Author: TripLuxe
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the disney Port Orleans for 7 days. It was a tight fit but very cozy. I went with my husband and nephew who was 18 and we shared a room with double beds. Though there is very little in room privacy i expected as much since I was going with a teen and this wasn't meant to be a romantic vacation. But with double sinks and the large walkways the resort worked well for us. No fighting for a sink in the morning and as long as I woke up before the boys I could hog the bathroom for as long as i wanted. Then I could go for a walk in the morning while they got ready. The resort has beautiful landscaping and lots of quiet pools I never really heard any noise in our room or around the resort. The dinning hall was a bit busy in the morning but otherwise I never saw a crowd. I did not use disney transport so I cannot comment but it was great being able to park right outside of our room. Mousekeeping were excellent and we had towel animals every day when we returned from the park. Honestly when we got back everyone was so tired the space was never an issue. I don't know that I would comfortably stay with 5 people as they say you can in this room considering the room has two double beds and a small trundle. Perhaps just enough space for parents and 2 kids maybe a toddler in trundle but it would truly be a tight fit I think that since we were essentially adults it was easier to give each other there space. If I were to come back with nieces or nephew I think i would get a cabin in fort wilderness so as to have the private room but sharing the bathroom was never a problem.

Reviews.Title: “A great resort with all the Disney amenities”
Reviews.Author: Jenn126
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2009. Went to Disney for 7 days and decided on this resort as it was the most reasonable option for a family of 5. The rooms were clean, yet for a growing family--mom, dad, son age 10, dtr age 8 and dtr age 5 it was a little tight. But when you are in Disney, you spend very little time in the room. The resort pools were great and the resort grounds are beautiful and very quiet. Very helpful staff and the resort was so nice my kids would have just loved to stay there and never venture into the parks. Lots of walking though--the rooms are in separate buildings from the food court so be prepared to walk. When making your reservation, be mindful of where you want to be--close to the pool, the food court, the parking lot, etc. Otherwise, it was a great value and a nice escape from the craziness that Disney can be for two tired parents.

Reviews.Title: “Nice setting but spread out and small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: jacRochesterny
Reviews.Content: This was nice interns of the accommodations and extras on the hotel grounds.. the room was very small to accommodate 5 yet it is one of the few disney resorts that does fit five in one room. The resort is very spread out which has its pros and cons... multiple pools that you can use, but a good walk to the lobby and dining areas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: amadormom
Reviews.Content: This was our second time to a Disneyworld resort... last year we stayed in Caribbean Beach. The grounds of this resort were fabulous. There were so many tree-lined walking paths, canals, and ponds. People complain of having to walk so far to the lobby/food court/bus stops, but that is what Disney is all about. I think people are just lazy these days. It just gave us less reason to feel guilty about eating all the wonderful food! We stayed in Alligator Bayou #28, which was pretty far from the lobby, but the walk was very pleasant. It was very quiet also. Our room was ultra clean; we had 6 clean towels, new toiletries, and room cleaned every day. They even left us a new towel animal every single day of our 5 night stay. We left $3 tip every morning, which I think is a very small price for a big difference in how they handle your room. Our 13 year old daughter slept on the trundle bed, even tho she is 5'4" and the bed is only 5 feet long, but she said it was comfortable. They made it up with clean sheets every day. The beds and pillows were very comfortable, too, and I am picky about my comfort while sleeping. I agree with others about the shuttle busses... it was VERY hard to get a bus back to the resort from anywhere at night. We usually had to wait for a second or third bus, and the parks were not even that busy (the longest we ever waited in line was about 10 minutes, and never had to get a fast pass). We watched busses for other resorts half fill and then another bus would come when no one was waiting. Food at the food court was excellent and PLENTIFUL... the pasta bar fed about three people for one serving. We could never finish. Mornings were hard to find a place to sit, but that is my only complaint. Overall, I would recommend it to anyone who doesn't mind being around a LOT of people (but if you did, why would you go to Disneyworld?)

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: stefantastic1
Reviews.Content: The room was great with two double bowl sinks and a draw curtain for privacy. Coffee pot and frig (a must for my folks.) A short walk for a boat ride to Downtown Disney was wonderful. Mickey waffles for the kids. A big hit for my daughter. The only bad thing was the pool. Not nothing to write home about. Hey, your not there for a pool all week!!

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere, good amenities--would recommend Disney's POR”
Reviews.Author: wendykopaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Port Orleans-Riverside in the end of August for one week--me, my husband, and 3 daughters--16, 11 and 9. The room itself was a bit tight for the 5 of us, but with smaller children, it would be perfect. the beds were comfortable and the trundle bed was fine for my 11 year old--who actually opted for it because she wouldn't have to share a bed! I would recommend leaving the trundle OUT in the morning (as opposed to pushing it back under the big bed) so that the housekeepers make the trundle bed up for you. We were there the day that the Free Dining Plan started, so I think the hotel was filled to capacity. Took the Disney Magical Express over to the hotel and got in line for the express check in. Only had to wait 1 or 2 minutes, although on the day we checked out, I noticed ALL check in lines were extremely long. We were in building 27 in Alligator Bayou, which at first, looked like a haul from the main building, pool, etc. It really was not far at all. They honored our request for a first floor room, which was so much more convenient. Since we were somewhat centrally located, we were relatively close to a bus stop, another pool and the laundry facilities (which i did use--no problems there). The main pool was great, as was the bar by the pool! They even had a small smoking section where my husband could enjoy his cigar. We ate at both the quick serve food area (Riverside Mill Food Court), which was good and had everything needed for a quick breakfast or lunch, and at the sit-down restaurant, Baotwright's, which was delicious! Great food there. Keep in mind that it was free, though, for us. If I had to pay the prices they charged, I would say it was a little overpriced for what you got. The boat ride over to Downtown Disney was very convenient--we did that a few times. And the bus service to the parks is super-convenient. Out of all the trips we took to the various parks, I think the longest we waited was 10 minutes. The caricaturists in the lobby and the hair-wrap staff were excellent. The entertainment in the lobby bar were great as well! The housekeeping service was just so-so. This is the closest thing to a complaint that I had with our experience. Now I don't expect perfection at all, but I just don't think the attention to detail was there. On the first day we arrived, there was a "towel animal" (for lack of better term!) left in our room, and another one on day 2. On day 4 or 5 after a few days of not having any of these creatures left, my 9 year old daughter wrote a very nice note asking the housekeeper if she would please leave a creation in our room. She attached a $5.00 bill as a tip, to the note. Much to our surprise, after returning from our day at the park, the note was still there, the $5.00 bill gone and NO towel animal. So much for Disney Magical Moments! LOL! Anyway, Disney's Port Orleans Riverside is a comfortable, no-frills place to stay. For the price point, it is not bad. It had everything we needed and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay there and would return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “This resort is huge”
Reviews.Author: lfigment99
Reviews.Content: Would actually recommend this hotel even though it was too large for us to enjoy many of the amenities. Felt it was too far after a long day at the park to enjoy the food court or Boatwright's. Landscaping is beautiful, rooms were very clean, boat ride to Downtown Disney was very relaxing and bus service wasn't yto bad although we didn't really like having to stop at four additional bus stops before we were on our way to the parks or make two or three stops on the way "home". If you spend a lot of time at the resort I would highly recommend Port Orleans Riverside. If you plan to spend a lot of time at the parks and only sleep or eat breakfast at the resort, I would encourage you save money and go Value Resort. (Bus service is much better at Pop Century).

Reviews.Title: “FILTHY”
Reviews.Author: mxkids
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Alligator Bayou were AWFUL! Dirty, filthy, awful! The bathrooms were never cleaned the entire stay! There were dead frogs along the walkways that completely freaked my kids out. I wouldnt recommend this place to anyone. Its too wide spread and the staff is not at all friendly. Sad!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful grounds + great location”
Reviews.Author: eltab
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this site for ages before we went, I didnt know what to expect after reading a lot of negative reviews. The hotel is very big, with beautiful grounds full of wildlife. Try requsting a room near the food court, we heard other guests saying that it was a long walk from their room. We stopped in the mansions on magnolia bend. We got all of our requests that we asked for and our room, although its ready for an update, was very comfortable. Mouse keeping were good! our maid left us animals made from towels nearly everyday. We also had the free disney quick service dining plan which was great, you got far too much to eat, and we didnt even use all our meals. We caught the bus from the south depot (main depot) and didnt wait much longer than just over 5 mins for any bus. There are 4 bus stops in riverside, and during the busy seasons i can imgine that it will not be good getting a bus from any of the smaller stops.

Reviews.Title: “Room was not what was expected?”
Reviews.Author: ronfunlover
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed 28Sep-01OCT and were not happy with the room conditions at the hotel. First when we made the reservation we asked and had confirmed a king bed. However on arrival we were given 2 fullsize beds. After about 5 minutes in the car to get from the lobby to the room we stayed in the room to call the front desk about the king bed. We were told a callback would be soon. However after over 30 minutes of waiting for a call we called again. This time we were told a manager would call us right back. However after another 30 minutes of waiting for the call that twice never came I drove to the front desk and spoke to a supervisor. He told me that no king or queen beds were available and our reservation was for a standard room. This is quite different news from when they took our credit card information during the booking. He gave us $30.00 credit and since it was already 9:30 pm I raced back to the room to get my girlfriend so we could make the last sitting for dinner which was prepaid. The room was not the cleanest however we stuck it out for the 3 nights as spent very little time in the room anyway. We would stay at a motel 6 outside Disney before we would stay at the Port Orleans "Riverside" again. Atleast you know not to expect as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Average place to stay, not in room long enough to be a problem”
Reviews.Author: lmickey
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans-Riverside was an average hotel. The outside of the resort was excellent and beautifully landscaped. It was a decent walk from the main lobby, so it was not like you could go back and forth easily. We very much enjoyed the food court and it was convenient to get to the bus stop from there. The refillable mugs were also very convenient. All of the employees were very nice. The negative things were it was it could have been cleaner and the bus service to this resort was horrible. We waited going and coming and there were very long lines at the resort and at the parks. I am not sure if Disney was ready for how busy this week was. Overall, I would stay there again unless I decided to upgrade to the next level.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, large rooms, but bus system leaves a bit to be desired”
Reviews.Author: MomofTwoBoysVa
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on this website for months before our Disney trip, so I decided to leave my thoughts after our recent trip the week of Sept 20th. We traveled with our two young children, one set of grandparents and one great-grandparent, and we requested two connecting rooms with a water view. Despite reviews I've read where people haven't received what they requested, we received everything we requested. Our connecting rooms were located on the 3rd floor of the Acadian House (which has an elevator) and we had a view of the quiet pool. I would highly recommend Acadian House (at least, where our room was located), as it's not a long walk to the main pool and dining hall, etc. Our rooms were nice, if not overly luxurious. They suited our needs perfectly. We especially liked the fact that the two sinks were separate from the toilet/shower and that there was a curtain separating the sink area from the rest of the room. We arrived at the resort before noon on our first day of the trip and we were pleasantly surprised to learn that our rooms were ready. We were very pleased with that. Perhaps it was due to the time of year. We flew to Orlando and used the Magical Express to travel to the resort. Everything was very organized and we received our luggage later that day without any problems. I would highly recommend using the Magical Express if you're flying to Disney. When we checked out, we were also able to check into our flight at the hotel and the agent was able to get our seats together on the airplane (hint: not all of the agents know how to do this...there's a trick to it and it definitely involves luck too). We left our luggage at the hotel and they took care of getting it to the airport for us. No problems there, either. The only thing I wish I had known before choosing this resort was more information about the bus system. We were visiting Disney during the off-peak season, so it was not super-crowded in the parks; however, Riverside was sold out. We found that we had to wait up to 30 minutes for the bus to arrive. Most of the time we waited between 15 and 20 minutes for the bus to arrive (usually 20), and sometimes we got very lucky and got right on the bus. There didn't seem to be any pattern to when the buses would arrive. Additionally, all of the buses except those going to the Magic Kingdom stopped at the French Quarter first. We had to stand on the bus many times, which wasn't a big deal for us. And all but one time people stood up to offer their seat to our 81 year old great-grandmother and the person in our group who was holding our infant. However, when leaving the parks (no matter what time of day), Riverside always had the longest lines and the fewest buses. It was a bit frustrating. Also, be aware that if anyone is in a wheelchair, they are loaded into the bus first and it can take quite a while. We had to wait a number of times for wheelchairs to be loaded. All in all, Riverside is a nice resort and I don't have any complaints about the hotel itself. We are planning to return to Disney in a few years, but we will stay in a resort on the monorail line to make transportation easier. We had an infant with us this year and had planned to leave the parks in the middle of the day so he could take a nap, but with the travel time of up to an hour to get back to the resort & back into our hotel room, it wasn't worth it. Overall, I felt like we lost a lot of time waiting for the buses and riding on them. If you stay in this resort, I would recommend staying in the park all day. There is a way to "work" the bus system, so if you park hop, look into that (for example, we wanted to go to the Magic Kingdom from Downtown Disney but you can't go straight there. We took a bus from Downtown Disney to the Grand Floridian and then hopped on the monorail for one stop to the Magic Kindgom). I hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans Riverside Worth A Try”
Reviews.Author: Simmer15
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel two times and it was better than I expected and prettier than I realized. It took me two days to find the food court the first time we were there and that made everything better. A helpful tip is that they have a microwave in the food court you can use. That took the 2nd trip to find out. The gift shop is sufficent but has a very small grocery attached that only sells beverages, Entermain cakes, chips, some first aid items, and candy and cigerettes. There is a piano player that jokes around while playing piano a couple of nights in the lounge and that is fun as he gets the people there laughing and singing and kids even sit quietly there. We had cake in the resterant and it was really good. The food court has good pasta dishes and wonderful chocolate crosiants as well as yogurt. The yogurt is almost $2 but the pastry is average price. They have very small bottles of wine also. Then there's the hamburgers and chicken dishes and fries. The main theme pool is nice but can be a difficult walk in the very hot months. Luckily there are some regular pool near the behind the hotels to share. The Ferry can take you to visit the other pook at the French Quarter or to Downtown Disney. Just make sure to use the safe as I lost all my ID and wasn't sure how that happened as I thought for sure I'd left it in the drawer. The hotel paid for my cab service to and from the airport so I could file a report but I had extended my stay two more days due to that and that I had to pay for. Stil it is a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT & MAGICAL”
Reviews.Author: daygemma21
Reviews.Content: From the word go with a pick up from the disneys magical express, we were on a bus within five minutes and taken straight to our resort. Service at the hotel was wonderful with friendly, helpful and polite members of staff that were just as helpful throughout the entire stay. In the room a few days we used the privacy door stop so the maids would not come in if we had left all our stuff over the floor and they would leave on our door handle a fresh bag of towels and bath soaps at the door in case we needed them which was wonderful. The ferry was well accomadated that took you to downtown disney if you didnt want to use a bus, wait times were low and the staff again were very friendly. Food choice was large and the gift shop was huge and entertainment at the bar was fabulous. The only downfall to this hotel was that it wasnt free and we had to leave to come back to the UK

Reviews.Title: “Liked it, but......”
Reviews.Author: LovedDisney
Reviews.Content: I really liked this resort! We stayed in room 1623 in Alligator Bayou. I had requested a king bed, but alas didn't get it. Had two queen beds instead. The grounds are beautiful. The room maid service left a lot to be desired. I had made coffee on the first morning that we were there, and when we went to the parks and came back later in the day, the coffee pot was still dirty. I purposely left it that way and it wasn't cleaned all week. The maid never left any more coffee either. I found bobby pins in the bathroom from previous people, a razor cap on my bed, and the tiles had mildew on them. Let's face it, we paid a lot of money for this trip, and I expected a clean room. Needless to say, the maid was not tipped at all. I find this just inexcusable. I also walked around in a clean pair of socks in that room and they were filthy on the bottom after that. It was gross. The food court and Boatwright's had very good food. I have no complaints about the food or service in there at all. We had the deluxe meal plan, so we ate very well. I would highly advise getting the meal plan, as the food is very, very expensive. I would never go back to Disney again without it. We never had to wait more than 10 minutes for a water taxi or a bus to go to the different parks. That was awesome! However, they really do pack the people in on these, so if you are claustrophobic, beware. Overall, I was satisfied with my vacation. We weren't in our room much, but I do expect at those prices that the room would be clean.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: sk8erguy
Reviews.Content: Recently my wife and I stayed at Disney's Port Orleans Riverside resort and the experience was incredible. This resort is located near the French Quarter and is within walking distance to each other. The resort staff were very friendly with the exception of the concierge we dealt with who was a little rude when we asked to make a dining reservation. However, we dealt with one Disney cast member named Chris who in particular astounded us with his knowledge of the parks and his tips were spot on. Chris greeted us just about every morning at the door and this person is a must before heading into the parks, designate 10-15 minutes out of your schedule to speak to him. He has so many tips be sure to take notes and make sure you ask him about theme park locations with "stories" he will let you know where to go. The rooms had all the neccessary amenities and plenty of room to move around and store luggage/ souvenirs. Our room was kept very clean by the maid staff and all maids we encountered were very friendly and courteous. One disadvantage to the rooms is the bathroom its very crampt with very little room to move around however there was more than adequete towels available. The resort has three bus stop locations around the resort area just be sure to give yourself plenty of time you will wait for buses. Some disadvantages to the bus system is Port Orleans services both resorts with the same bus so it can get very packed. The resort does offer a boat to the Downtown Disney area and this is a great alternative to the buses and is highly recommended. With the boat ensure you again have time to wait with boats docking every 20 minutes until about 4 or 5pm where they run every 10 minutes. Overall, this resort is great with everything you could need from a nice foodcourt, good restaurant variety, ample resort market shopping, a descent transportation system, and a world class staff. Make this resort your destination when heading to WDW you will not be disappointed. I hope this review has helped with making your WDW resort decision.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel was great but more needs to be done with directions”
Reviews.Author: cherryTrinidad
Reviews.Content: so the room and general staff was as helpful as they could be but since this was our first time in disney we got lost a few times. it would've helped if when we checked in we were are supposed to take the bus to the different parks, instead of only getting brochures which we had to read. overall it was a peacful stay at riverside and the service was great. I will visit again now that I know exactly where I'm going. P.S a week is to short a time to stay

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: sujari
Reviews.Content: We found our stay here to be very enjoyable.The grounds are beautiful and the hotel rooms are spacious and clean. The main eating area was also clean and the food was good and plentiful(buying the refillable mug is a great idea and great money saver) I would say however it is important to request a specific area/room otherwise they will put you in the farthest and worse view possible even though our package said a water view instead we were given a view of the parking lot. We did get it changed but I still cant understand why we were given a nicer room in the first place after all we did pay for a water view. Thats basically the only negative. After reading all the negative reviews about the bus system I was a little hesitant when we started to use it however we were pleasantly surprised-no big waits and the buses were not that crowded and there are several stops. I have stayed at many resorts in Disney and would definately say Port Orleans is a resort that I would stay at again.Great resort for everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful”
Reviews.Author: ourfamilyvacation
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights here and wished we had booked a 7th. We had always stayed at Caribbean Beach in the past and really enjoyed it but were ready to try something new. We absolutely loved Port Orleans Riverside and it is our new favorite. The big advantage here is the boat ride to Downtown Disney which has beautiful views of the peaceful river scenery. The grounds at Caribbean Beach are nice, but Riverside is even more beautiful. The pool was tons of fun - my husband and I enjoyed the slide as much as the kids. I loved my morning strolls around the river. The Mansions were very pretty from the outside. We stayed in the Alligator Bayou section which has very lush and shady landscaping. It was a nice break from the September heat. The room decor is not very attractive but I suppose in keeping with the theme. We had a trundle bed room which will accomodate 5 people. The trundle bed is very small. I had intended for my 11-year old to use it, but realized she was too tall and let my 8-year old have it instead. The only negative at this resort is that the beds are doubles instead of queens. We stepped outside the door to our room to a very pretty "swamp" area. There were lizards running around all over the walkway which delighted our kids. The food court and gift shop is great. Bus service is very good except for the trip home from Animal Kingdom. We left the park early and had to make an extra stop at Blizzard Beach and Port Orleans French quarter. Our 8-year old cried a river when we left for our weekend at the beach. The beach hotel looked so shabby after this beautiful resort. This is where we will stay on our next trip. It is a beautiful, quiet, peaceful, fun resort and a great value. We can hardly wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: ddragon1221
Reviews.Content: Family came because I had a conference during the day in downtown Orlando.....I was able to catch a cab every morning and wife, my parents, and 2 kids were able to use Disney transportation to the parks.....I was then able to join them in the afternoon........Something unique with this resort was the around the clock boat trip to the downtown Disney area.......My son and I visited Lego land often........The food court at resort was reasonable....The kids loved the main pool.......Service was Disney quality.......Would visit again

Reviews.Title: “Best holiday ever!”
Reviews.Author: BellStaffordshire
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful resort in all ways possible. The room was exceptionally clean and tidy, very well furnished and maid serviced daily. Beds were comfortable. TV had not too many channels but the Disney guide channel was a great help. The pools were lovely. Breakfast room, shop, lobby all top notch. Staff were extremely polite and helpful. I really can't rate this place highly enough. Food was great - but you will need to book your evening meals in advance, either on your first day there or online beforehand. Disney dining plan was a bargain! Don't forget on the basic plan you have to get your own breakfast but you can buy bread\bagles from the shop and use the toaster with the free marg and jam etc. The refillable cups saved us a fortune. Disney parks so good again in every way. Wish we were still there!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sherleycastellanos
Reviews.Content: I stayed over labor day weekend and the staff is super friendly. I have a 3 year old and 4 month old and there was many ammenities I could do with the kids. Downtown Disney is really close and my son left his favorite blanket and Disney mailed it back. His smile was truly magical. PT. Orleans Service of Lost and Found is amazing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disney..Old Southern Style”
Reviews.Author: rjhawk
Reviews.Content: our family stayed the the Riverside labor day week. It was the second straight year staying at this resort. The grounds are beautiful, as well as the buildings. The rooms are very clean with a southern feel. The cast members thru the resort are very friendly and helpful. If you travel with young children, take them on the horse drawn carriage ride. A true Disney experience.

Reviews.Title: “Most stunning surroundings right in the thick of things”
Reviews.Author: HappyWelshTraveller
Reviews.Content: This place is so beautiful and truely looks like something out of gone with the wind. Although they call it a hotel, it actually consists of lots and lots of big white mansion houses which each house a number of studio appartments. The houses are set along the sassagoula river which has weeping willows all along it and is very beautiful. There is a main building which is located in the centre of this resort which houses the reception, the shop, bar, restaurant and food court. The shop sells the usual disney apparrel, some general first aid such as tablets, creams and plasters etc, sweets and snacks and sun creams. The restaunt 'Boatwrights' serves delicious food but is a little on the expensive side. The Food Court is far more reasonable as you would expect and serves delicious food for breakfast lunch and dinner. The bar is good fun in the evenings as there's usually some form of entertainment for the whole family to get involved with. Just outside the main building is the main pool area called Ol Man Island. This is great for kids and has the usual slide and fountains. The very warm whirl pool is also great especially later in the evening when you need to soak those aching muscles after a day at one of the parks. There are also several other 'quiet' pools if you'd prefer a bit of piece and quiet. Rooms are clean but quite basic and usually have 2 queen size beds and are all air conditioned with a free to use safe. The beauty of this hotel is that it's right in the thick of things near the Downtown Disney area and a stones throw from Typhoon Lagoon water park. You can even get a water taxi to downtown disney in the evenings which means you can leave the car and have a good drink. I've been luck y enough to have stayed there twice and would not hesitate in staying there again and again. All in all it's great and is rated as a Moderate Hotel but I'd certainly say it's on the high side of moderate and although it's not quite as good as the Deluxe resorts like Animal Kingdom Lodge, it's far less expensive and very nice indeed.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best on property Resorts Disney has to offer...”
Reviews.Author: Geoff1725
Reviews.Content: This resort is got to be the best in Walt Disney World! Check in was hassle free, I requested a certain building and we got it no problem at all! The grounds of this resort are simply amazing. We felt as if we had gone to another part of the country. Everything is beautifully manicured and maintained. The rooms are not big but have very comfortable beds. The sinks are separate from the bathroom and there is a curtain to pull across the sink area from the room giving even more privacy from the bedroom area. This made it very easy to make a little coffee in the room without waking up the rest of our party. The food court is not really what I think of when I think "food court". This is a huge complex with awesome food in a beautiful setting, not food courtish if you ask me. Disney went all out when designing this resort. There are 5 pools to choose from. Ole' Man Island has the largest pool with an absolutely awesome slide and a very hot hot tub. The boat ride to Downtown Disney is a very pleasant way to go out for dinner etc... at Downtown Disney. Do not make a mistake and go to Port Orleans French Qtr. The rooms are basically the same but the grounds and food area don't compare at all. Overall we had an absolute awesome time at Port Orleans Riverside and are going back no questions asked!!!

Reviews.Title: “We Liked It”
Reviews.Author: roadtriper1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Disneyâ€™s Port Orleans Riverside Resort in August â€™09. It was very nice resort. Disney will pick up your bags at the airport and deliver them to your room for you. It is an excellent service as long as you donâ€™t need your things in any hurry. We arrived in Orlando around 9:30pm but, did not receive our luggage in our room until 1:30am. Make sure if you use this service that you are aware of the three plus hour delivery time and pack a carry on with anything you will need in the mean time. We took advantage of the free meal plan which included one quick service meal, one sit down table service meal and one snack per day. The resort cafeteria food was good, the only complaint was that we found that the staff really scrimped on the portions. Booking reservations for the sit down table service meal was challenging. Since the meal plan was included with the resort package, reservations filled up quickly. We had to alter park plans to coincide with the dining plans. The Coral Reef (Epcot), Liberty Tree (Disney), Tappan Edo (Epcot), Nine Dragons (Epcot), and Spirits of Aloha (Polynesian Resort) were all excellent. We also ate at Tusker house (Animal kingdom) which was okay and the Plaza Restaurant (Disney) which had the worst service. We arrived 20 minutes prior to our reservation time and did not get seated until 20 minutes after our reservation time. While waiting we noticed that there were numerous tables waiting to be cleared and nobody clearing them. They did however have three people working the front door who spent most of their time standing around and talking. The manager should have pulled one of them from the front door and their conversation to clear off the tables to seat the people waiting with reservations. When we finally did get seated, we were in the back room of the restaurant which seated eight tables of which six still needed to be cleared. The grounds at Port of Orleans Riverside are very well kept and maintained. The rooms are nice but, while they are not spotless (we did see some cobwebs), they are clean and comfortable. The main complaint in regards to the room was the shower towels. Disney supplies the cheapest most basic towels. Weâ€™ve stayed at the Holiday Inn and had nicer more plush towels. Disneyâ€™s transportation to and from the parks was excellent. We never waited more that ten minutes for any bus. One night after leaving Disney, the line up for the bus to our resort was long and we thought we were in for a long wait. Disney brought in two busses and loaded them up and then within five minutes brought in two more and cleared the line right up. A good tip for you would be to book a room close to the main building as the bus service makes its first stop there and the bus is empty. Overall we had a great experience staying at Port Orleans Riverside and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “A great and beautiful value at Disney area”
Reviews.Author: kbertocco
Reviews.Content: It was my first experience at a Disney resort and I choose a moderate one and was not disapponinted. It`s very convenient to stay on site at Disney area, especially because of disney dining plan and extra magic hours. This resort is relaxing and very beautiful. I just wish I could have spent more time there. The rooms are big, not very modern but ok. The hotel amenities are also interesting, 3 or more pools, a river and it's boats, a good food court area. I just felt the restaurant was not open for lunch. It can be a very romantic place, good choice for couples. We had a great time there!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: ncmc
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed in Port Orleans Riverside from Aug 22nd â€“ Sept 5th and had an amazing time. We had previously stayed in this hotels sister hotel, Port Orleans French Quarter in 2007 and enjoyed our stay there, however after staying in Riverside, I have to say I much prefer it to the French Quarter. The theming of Riverside is flawless and the grounds are absolutely stunning. Even though the hotel was filled to capacity during our stay, the grounds were still amazingly peaceful and it was so wonderful to come home here after a busy day in the parks. There was such an abundance of wildlife here, everywhere you looked, there were rabbits, squirrels, ducks, lizards and birds, I even saw a turtle (or tortoise, I never know the difference!) swimming in the river a couple of times! We checked in about 5pm on a Saturday and there were only 1 or 2 people ahead of us, we were being served within 5 minutes of joining the queue. I had requested a room in the Alligator Bayou section of the hotel, but unfortunately this section was totally booked and so our room was in the Magnolia Terrace building. Our first room was fine except for it overlooking a very noisy air conditioning system. I tried to put up with it for a couple of nights, but eventually had to ask to be moved to a different room. I have to say, the front desk were very helpful about this. They didnâ€™t have a new room the day I asked, but were able to move us the next day. Our new room was in the Oak Manor building, it was a lovely location, less than five minutes walk from the main building, overlooking a lovely fountain and right beside a quiet pool, I was delighted with this room. The rooms themselves are nice, if not massively fancy. Our room had two queen beds, table with two chairs, locker, drawer unit with TV, fridge and coffee making facilities. There is a separate dressing area between the bedroom and the bathroom, which contains a hanging rail, two sinks, iron and hairdryer. The bathroom is pretty tiny with toilet and shower over the bath. I would think the rooms are a pretty tight fit for 4 or 5 people, but for the two of us, it was more than adequate. The twin sinks are great, it was so handy that both of us could get ready at the same time and I would imagine this is a Godsend if you had 4 people in the room. If I was being very picky about the room, I would say that I would prefer a full wardrobe rather than a hanging rail and also there was only one locker, rather than one each side of the bed, this meant that I had to drag over one of the chairs to act as a locker and rest my book on! But overall, the rooms are comfortable and nicely decorated. You donâ€™t tend to spend that much time in the room anyway, so they more than serve their purpose. The housekeeping was ok, again if I were being picky, I would say that there was a lot of dust on one of the shelves when we first went into the room, and the corners of the bathroom looked dusty. However, we were always left plenty of towels and toiletries. We never received a towel animal during our whole stay despite leaving a tip everyday! Maybe they didnâ€™t bother when they saw it was two adults in the room, but Iâ€™m a kid at heart and would have liked a towel critter or two! This hotel has a lovely pool with a slide, but it can get pretty busy and it can be hard to get more than one lounger together at busy times. There was a nice (if overpriced) pool bar. We preferred to use the quiet pool beside our building, it was lovely and peaceful and suited us better as two adults without kids. However, there are no towels at the quiet pool, so you either have to take them from the room or get them from the main pool. There was a laundry beside our quiet pool, which meant we could do our laundry while sunbathing, very handy! This hotel has a sit down restaurant and a food court. We didnâ€™t try the restaurant as it seemed pretty overpriced and didnâ€™t look to have a particularly nice atmosphere (when Iâ€™m paying $25 for an entrÃ©e, I expect tablecloths!). We ate at the food court a few times as we had the quick service meal plan, it got seriously busy after 9am, I would really advise getting there between 8-9am as otherwise it was like a zoo! I wasnâ€™t keen on the breakfast choices, but then Iâ€™m not a fan of cooked breakfast, we ended up using our snack credits to get pastries instead which were always nice and fresh. There was also cereal and yoghurt parfait for those wanting a lighter choice. The selection of food was the same every day, which was a shame, although the â€˜make your own pastaâ€™ was seriously tasty and you got a huge portion. I got shrimp in mine, and there was a huge amount of shrimp in it. There was also a lounge bar in the hotel, however we didnâ€™t go in to it as every night there was a very loud, irritating piano player and we didnâ€™t fancy it. He seemed to be a big hit with the kids, so this is probably a big plus if you have children, but certainly not our cup of tea. There is also a shop, which has a pretty good selection of Disney merchandise as well as snacks and some essentials you may have forgotten. We didnâ€™t use the bus transportation as we had our own car. In addition to the buses, there is also a boat service to Downtown Disney, which is lovely, but be prepared to wait at busy times. All of the buildings have a car park behind them, so if you do rent a car, you shouldnâ€™t be too far a walk from it. People talk about how huge Riverside is, but I walked the entire property and walking at a reasonable pace, no building should be more than 5 minutes walk from the main building. For joggers, there is a nice walking path along the river to the French Quarter, it is about a mile long I believe. Overall, we absolutely loved this hotel, it was so beautiful and peaceful, especially after the busyness of the parks. The staff were all lovely and very helpful. I would find it very hard to stay anywhere else on future trips to Orlando, I didnâ€™t want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “another lovely holiday”
Reviews.Author: GwenU
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a lovely stay at Port Orleans Riverside Resort, Its a large resort we were in Alligator Bayou Lodge 34, we got lost numberous times gettting to and from the lodge!! There are 3 small pools and laundry facilities shared between the lodges and one big main pool. There are 2 places to get food, we ate in the large caferteria type place, I had a burger one night but it was raw in the middle. Put me off of eating there again. Meals are pricey, a large size pizza was $16 and burger $10. We bought the re fillable mug option which is a good idea and we made good use of it. The weather was hot and humid and it rained for 2 days of our stay. Not sure if it was because of the wet weather and lots of grass but I got covered in bites but just on my legs. The rooms tend to be dark, the fridge which was standard in all rooms at port orleans was a big bonus, the air conditioning works well but tends to be noisy at night. There are 2 hand wash basins, and every day a fresh supply of soap and shampoo/conditioner and fresh towels. On arrival we had a towel animal on the bed but despite tiping the maid on a regular basis we didnt get any more towel animals. There is a safe in the wash area which is handy for passports etc., The bus service is good we were by west depot which is one of the first stops. We walked over to french quarter and had a nice meal there. The boat service to downtown disney is fun to do. The on site shop sells lots of disney goods and also milk, plasters and cereals, bread and pretty much most things you might want. We found the bell service to be good, we were given a map on check in to find our lodge but as we had stayed at Port Orleans before I knew bell hop was just outside the lobby and went and asked them to take us and our bags to our room and they did it with no problems and when we left we rung them about 10 mins before we needed them and they came promptly and then stored our luggage in the luggage hold until we departed. All the staff were helpful and friendly. And we are planning to go back there next year. My only negative comment would be that is there isnt free wi fi there, we took a laptop with us and paid the $9.99 for internet connection for 24 hours and it was good to be able to communicate with friends and family in the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Needs complete renovations especially the entire staff”
Reviews.Author: baggsNewYork
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate enough to travel to Disney for a second trip. First time stay was at Coronado Springs in 07'. Prior to my travel I reviewed all the moderate resorts with a fine tooth comb, so I thought! Previewing all the month of July's reviews and high recommendations all the way across the board. So it was no contest to book at the RPO this time. Room was clean the first two days of stay only. There is some sort of linen shortage in Disney so you do not get your sheets changed every day nor do u get clean towels. Oh yes, did u know that ur towels might not be getting washed everyday, but rather hanged dried. They spray them with some disinfective and thats it!!! How disgusting and unsanitary is that!!! They actually put cards in ur room asking u too hang dry ur towels as well. OMG !! What is this world coming too? One day my 2 children and I wanted to swim in the main pool only to find out some child was extremly ill in it!!!! So they shut the pool down for only 1/2 day!!! What about completly emptying the pool and doing some serious disinfecting. There's only the SWINE FLU going around and god knows what else!!!!! Very unsanitary. Needless to say we went over to the French Quarter Pool to find that no child had been ill in that one. The service was aweful throughout the resort. There was a variety of food in the court, however I really cannot believe how it is served and handled!! You must stay close to the main bldgs or plan on long walks and getting lost. Arcadian, Magnolia and Oak were pretty close to everything. Ladies do not leave any jewerly items open and loose anywhere in your room. THEY WILL BE GONE!! Even the cheap stuff!! The management is terrible here. One thing that I have learned throughout Disney is that the employees are not what they use to be!!!! First of all at least 50% of employees do not speak or understand English!!! They are not knowledgable of anything. Nor are they trained well!!!! Its too bad Disney does not take better Pride in customer service relations these days but rather just hiring massive amounts of internationals. Although it was nice to have two resorts under our thumb at the same time (French Quarter and RPO) to use I would rather spend the extra $$$ to get treated better and my $$$ worth at a Delux Resort. Always ask as many questions as possible when u travel. Talk to people who u know that have stayed at the resort. Make sure it has everything u need and want for ur family. Do as much research on the place u want to stay at way before u leave so u have plenty of time to change ur mind!!! Especially if u are on the Dining Plan, which by the way I highly recommend to everyone traveling if it is available !!!!!! Yes I will return to the most Magical Place on Earth with my family, but I will not be staying at the RPO. P.S. It's too bad because the grounds are just picture perfect !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Do not Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: Hallie10
Reviews.Content: We were told we could request a room and they would try thier best to accomadate. Apon arrival We were put farthest from where I requested and on the top floor where wasp's were all over. Not to mention we had a baby with and thier is no way to the second floor with out hauling the stroller up and down stairs everytime! They were not kind about moving us we had a tons of carryon luggage with us and they wanted me to walk back to the front desk to get new keys. It was 100 degrees and the walk back is not close!! With a baby and luggage. They told me they would send someone to pick us up we waited about 20min. that never happend. When we finaly got checked into our new room only half our luggage was thier. When everything finaly arrived we were WAY off the schedule that I had been planning for we missed the parade I wanted my kids to see. I was so upset I called the manager and he told me (not sorry) but I can appreciate that and basicaly TOO BAD!) He could have cared less that I was upset. The food here is awful and so is the service. When you are on the dining plan you feel like cattle geting fed. The transportation is another story. The only way you can get back to your hotel is to first go to a disney park. So if you booked your dining plan reservations at a resort that is not on the monerail it wil be at least an hour to get back!! I personay did not want to spend half my vacation on a disney bus! another thing to note they do not have wireless. We did enjoy the parks although our favorite was Universal Studios!!!! I hope this might help someone who is thinking about booking here.

Reviews.Title: “A Deluxe Resort for a Moderate Price!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jersue96
Reviews.Content: We loved the resort, had a mansion right across the Sassagoula River, corner room on second floor, facing the courtyard. The room was just the right size for a family of 4. We tipped the maid 4 dollars a day and she kept us stocked in soaps and shampoo. We had 2 zippie bags of toiletries to take home with us to remember our stay! The room was always clean upon arrival back from the park. We can say nothing negative about the resort. My husband had to be taken by ambulance for a ongoing medical issue and the manager came to our room and gave myself and 2 children cab vouchers to and from Celebration hospital and took great care of us. We were very greatful for the compassion and assistance during this time. The ducks in the morning were always a pleasant sight to see by our family as the kids loved to chase them around! The grounds were always neatly manicured and the cast there was extremely friendly and helpful. Even though breakfast at any time of the morning was a zoo, the staff did a teriffic job moving the lines quickly and we did not have too much difficulty finding a place to sit down. We would come back here and use one of our counter services for dinner as this resort had such a variety of food and what a great value. We were on the dining plan so it made it great. We also bought one resort mug that my husband used for his coffee in the morning and we took a bottled water as his beverage to the parks. I would defenetely recommend this resort to families and those on a honeymoon! This is the perfect resort for a wonderful disney stay. We have stayed at DVC resorts and we have to say that this resort ranked right up there with them. Make time to go to the RIver Roost bar and hear the piano player. He is wonderful and it is fit for all ages. My kids had a blast doing the hokie pokie with the group. We are already planning our next trip for 2010 at Thanksgiving and will be back to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Honeymoon at Port Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Kellyaf79
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our Honeymoon in Oct. 2007. I will admit to being a Disney Snob...B/c my parents used to pay (hehe) I had always stayed at The Contemporary in the past, and once for my Senior Trip at All Star Music...So I was a little nervous about booking a 'Moderate' resort. I would stay at this resort again even if I had more money to stay at a Deluxe...In fact we are going back and staying in December. The theming is great, and follows thru into the rooms as well...I wouldn't pay more for a 'water view'. We stayed in the Acadia House facing the parking lot, and all we had to do was turn a corner and we saw a beautiful view! I think it was actually a bonus to be facing away from everything, b/c we were never bothered by noise outside our room. The buses ran pretty regularly, the only time you really waited for a bit was to go to the Magic Kingdom...Most of the other parks you could just walk right on. You can take a ferry to Downtown Disney, and that was very relaxing and a nice break from crowded buses. The Boat Captains were really nice and would talk about the birds we passed or about the Treehouse Villas we passed as well. The Horsedrawn Carriage rides were very romantic as well!!! It's $35 for a 1/2 hr. I believe, but you get your moneys worth, and the horses were treated very respectfully and carefully. The food is pricey...But so is everything at Disney!!!! It's mostly 'down home' and Southern food...I had turkey and fixings one night, and though it was a little overpriced it was good. The 'Mousekeeping' was great...Although they did ignore my 'Do Not Disturb' sign one day while my husband was jogging and caught me coming out of the shower!!! But she was very apologetic and came back later to clean. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Lisa631
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Port Orleans Riverside. We thought it was great. We have 3 children ages 11,8 and 6 and found that this was the only place Disney offers for a family of 5 that is not a "Deluxe" resort. The kids took turns on the small trundle bed, It was fine. After a long day at the park, they were too tired to care where they slept. Our room was very clean. The kids loved the main pool which had a fun water slide. There was also a small pool outside our building (17). We took the boat to downtown Disney for dinner one night. The food court was adequate and the sit down restaurant was quite good (only open for dinner). We rented a surey bike (they had boats too). OK the big question...the bus system. It is hard to know whether the buses in general are slow or just at Riverside. I would tend to think they are just slow everywhere. We stayed at the All Star in the past and it was worse. In the morning we always got on the bus and generally the buses run more frequently during an extra magic hours day. One day we left Animal Kingdom with a full bus and instead of going straight to the resort it went to Typhoon Lagoon. Not sure the point, you couldn't squeeze one more person on. One complaint I had was 24 hrs before our Southwest flight I went to the Concierge desk to have them print our boarding passes, I stood there for 30 min while they planned meals for those people who didn't do it advance. (The line moved so slow) And for those of you who fly Southwest you know the timing on printing the boarding passes is crucial. I told them they should have a separate window for air travel business and they didn't seem to care. In summary I would say for the approx $159 a night to stay here, it is a great deal. We paid more than that to stay at a chain hotel in PA to visit relatives. Also if you have a car, the parking at the park is free. We didn't need the car, the magical express worked fine. When going to Disney, remember before you go (and you'll be happier) nothing is quick or express, there is a lot of waiting.

Reviews.Title: “not what we were expecting.”
Reviews.Author: disneyyisgreat
Reviews.Content: We recently got home from a 10 night stay in disney. We were originally supposed to stay in POR. When we checked in we were told the room we requested was unavailable, and we would have to be transferred to French Quarter. Well, FQ does not have trundle beds for our 3rd child! So, we headed back to the front desk and explained that we had booked our stay in riverside, and thats where we intended on staying. So, they found us a decently-located room. When we arrived, there was a large wet spot on the ground next to a bed. The shower/bathroom smelled strange, the room was just plain old! After waiting an hour for our luggage to arrive we decided to see why it was taking so long. I was put on hold by the front desk for over 15 minutes, so i decided to go to the front desk, (yet again) to see what the issue was. they apologized and our luggage was finally delivered. There was no way that we were going to be spending one more night in this room, so we asked if there was any possible way we could be transferred to the contemporary, our usual disney resort. Luckily, there was some availability there, and we were saved out of that terrible room. Port orlean's grounds were gorgeous, pools were fun, it just needs a big renovation! I do not reccommened this resort... splurge on the extra money and stay at a deluxe, it's worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “2nd time at Disney, First time at Port Orleans Riverside”
Reviews.Author: shadow1Pittsburgh
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 (mom, dad, 3 kids-12, 7, and 4) stayed at Port Orleans Riverside on Aug. 24-29th. Being a family of 5, we were somewhat limited in our choices in where to stay. Two years ago we stayed at the Wilderness Lodge. We loved it. We could not go back there again because our yougest was over that we could stay in one room. We were going to stay at another Deluxe hotel (Contmporary), however, discovered that we could stay at Port Orleans Riverside for $1000.00 less. I was a little leary about staying at Riverside after reading the reviews about the poor transportation to and from the park. I thought for a $1000.00 price difference, I could put up with the transportation. Since we were just on another vacation last month I thought, this would be a good deal. Everything I read about Port Orleans on Trip Advisor was correct. This is a beautiful resort. The room was fine for the 5 of us. Our two younger children took turns sleeping on the tundle bed. Which as others have mentioned is a mattress on a wooden frame. It was fun for them. I loved the double sinks. The refridgerator in the room was great. I will warn you about one thing. Everything I read about the transportation system at Riverside was true. We stayed in Alligator Bayou Lodge 27. Less than a 5 minute walk to the South Depot. After reading all of the reviews, I requested certain buildings near the main building and this bus depot. It is the first stop on the bus route. Every morning we arrived at the bus stop around 7:20 for extra morning hours. The bus stop was packed. Every day a good number of people had to stand on the bus. 3 of the days, there were too many people so they had to wait to get on the bus. We never went to another stop at Port Orleans because there was no room. On some days, they did stop at the French Quarter first too which limited space on the bus. Every time we left a park, the bus stop back was full. Again, people standing and being left to wait for another bus. We never stayed at a park till the end of the night. I read about how difficult it was to get back. I also heard that from 4 people through conversations on the bus. (All 4 said it took them almost 2 hours to get back from the parks at night.) We had dinner at Ohana's on night and watched the fireworks. We actually took a $12.00 taxi back to our hotel to avoid the bus. (Someone said they did this as well. That is where I got the idea.) People actually cheered on 6 different occassions when the bus pulled up to the stops at the parks when we were standing there. I, as do many other people, wonder why Riverside does not provide more buses being that the resort is so big. We are going back in 2 years again. We will not stay at Riverside only due to the fact that the transportation was inadequate for us. I will tell you that it is a great hotel. It is a great value. If you don't mind waiting for transportation or are going off season, this might be a great place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Simba1NewYork
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our trip to this resort. We have been to Disney several times before and this is the best place to stay for the value. The comfort level was excellent. We traveled with our 2 year old and they accomidated all our needs. Everything was in short walking distance from our room. Parking was close to the building we stayed in (Acadian House)infact all of the individual buildings had their own parking lots, but their are no luggage carts at the individual buildings. However, if you choose you can unload at the check in and they will bring all your luggage to your room for you. Everything was in excellent condition in our room and on the resort grounds. Our room was always neat and clean when we returned for they day, which was about 12:30 since we had a two year old that needed to nap and it was very hot.
