We did not have to wait long for busses or to sit down and eat at the food courts. Tips: Do online check in and make reservations for sit down resteraunts before arriving it can be very busy especially when they offer deals and doing these two things makes life a lot easier. We had no wait during all the busiest times. Once again Disney came through top notch

Reviews.Title: “Good value, bad service”
Reviews.Author: MickeyMouseMom
Reviews.Content: We had an experience similar to one below with a rating of "2" overall. The bellhop service is the worst I've ever encountered - and I've travelled many times for business. We, too, got into the resort itself (after a long wait on the bus to leave the airport) at about 10:30. Then it took another 45-50 minutes to get checked in - they were understaffed with one manager dealing with an irrate customer while another worker looked on. Many of us wondered why it took them both to resolve the issue. Then, the checkout went smoothly and she recommended we ask a bellhop to show us to our room at that hour. Well, they handed us a map and sent us on our way in the dark with a tired 5 yr. old and 2 yr. old and two very tired parents. We finally found our room and then were awakened at 2:00 a.m. for our bags. I would never plan to come in past about 7:00 p.m. in the future. We enjoyed the motel for our stay - it was clean, quiet and safe, and the other staff were generally helpful and friendly. But then, the day we left, my husband checked out early and asked about getting help with our bags to the front where our bus would pick us up. He was told adamantly to call 5 mins. ahead of time and they would be there. Well, he called 15 mins. ahead of time and if we had "waited" we would have missed our bus. Then we were met with attitude when we asked for help to the curb! My husband was wrestling with our 2 year old having a meltdown and I had two large suitcases and two carry ons. The property is nice and the pools are nice. The food is pretty good and they do well to get so many people served, but their overall service is lacking. So our trip beginning and end were very stressful with very poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: discoverywoman21
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, clean and safe;thinking in Florida's weather, we never saw any bug around the rooms or the hallways.Great location near to all the parks and attractions;beautiful landscaping and friendly staff. Good food in the food court for breakfast and luch;we recomend the dining plan,which allows you to eat well in many restaurants all over the "world",you dont need to eat "fast food" if you don't want to. Make reservations in advance.We loved this hotel!...Great and fun vacation!

Reviews.Title: “This was a waste of thousands of dollars”
Reviews.Author: happymom211
Reviews.Content: I've never complained about ANY trips we've taken before.....but---We took our 2nd Disney vacation in May of this year. Had saved up for it for a couple of years as we are a budgeted family. When I booked, I booked with the meal plan and hopper passes to the resorts. Before we left for our trip, I made our reservations for each nights dining as the booking agent had suggested. When we arrived at this resort, the desk clerk informed me that we did not have the meal package included. When I explained to her that we paid for that package and the agent even helped us with our meal reservations, she didn't care. She said that there was, however, a "mysterious" $500 gift card in our package.........obviously their way of trying to make us forget that we lost a couple hundred dollars for each day of our trip. I became very upset, the kids were crying in the lobby and I wanted to leave and go to another resort at which the clerk said "go ahead but you are not getting your money back". So....we go to our room which is honestly like a mile walk with all of our luggage and when we go inside, we have a room with one queen bed for all four of us to share. They tried to tell me I booked that size of a room. By the way, I had my confirmation numbers and a printout of my itinerary and it didn't matter. I don't get how Disney can treat people soooo bad and honestly not care that the kids, who were soooo excited to be at Disney World, were completely heartbroken. I will never forget this horrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “For a first timer, it was a pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: DjMillion
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Riverside for two nights (August 9-11) and it was a great stay overall. Even though the resort is quite huge, the walk from the main building to my room (Lodge 17 in the Alligator Bayou area) was not that bad. There are many bus stops around the resort as well if you don't want to walk all the way to the main bus stop. This was my first time ever going to Walt Disney World and I'd have to agree that the cast members are phenomenal. They treat you with so much hospitality that it was almost sickening! Since I didn't have a rental car, the luggage service came in handy and the bell men transported my luggage to my room so fast that they got there even before I did! The room was nice, and it did have that "country" camp feel, but it was comfortable as well. The beds were okay, not too lumpy and not too hard, and I was able to fall asleep very fast after a long day at the park. The quick-service area was huge, seating was plenty, but the food was typical; burgers, pizza, sandwiches, salad, etc. I do want to note that their desserts are absoultely delicious, specifically the cheesecake! There were a couple minor things that I would like to note. When I got to the room, the refrigerator was broken, but maintenance came in while I was out and fixed it immediately. I even called the front desk and they said they would reimburse me for the food that got spoiled. Also, for those who aren't morning people, houskeeping wakes you up early in the morning to check if you want your room cleaned up. I even put a "Do Not Disturb" sign on the doorknob but they ignore it. Overall, I liked my stay at Port Orleans Riverside and I'd definitely go back next year and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wunder
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans for five nights in August 2009 and had no problems. The Magical Express picked us up from the airport and dropped us off at the hotel. We had checked in online before we left for Florida so our check-in involved one minute at the desk to pick up our folder with our keys (which do triple-duty as Disney tickets and Dining Plan passes). We stayed in Parterre Place, which is about a two minute walk from the lobby and a three minute walk from the bus pick-up. The building was lovely and our room was clean. Housekeeping was good and actually decorated our room with mardi gras beads one night. They also left a birthday card from Mickey for my husband and made a towel Mickey-ears sculpture on the bed for our arrival! The only problem we had with the room was that although the a/c worked well, it made funny noises when it was on, so we had to turn it off at night and just run the room fan and the ceiling fan. Despite it being 100 degrees outside for most of our trip, this was completely satisfactory to us -- having the a/c on low during the day while we were gone was enough to keep it very cool all night. We only ate at the hotel twice during our stay. The food court create-your-own pasta station was good, and Boatwright's was fine. Both were overpriced as compared to normal life but about par for the course in terms of Disney. The gift shop attendants were very friendly and helpful (more helpful than the concierge in terms of hotel information), and we used the package service twice with no problems (if you buy things in the park, they deliver them to the hotel gift shop for pick up the next day so you don't have to lug them around). Our one disappointment was that we didn't reserve a carriage ride in advance. By the time we decided we wanted to do one, all the slots were taken until 9:30 at night and we had an early flight the next morning so we didn't get to ride. Magical Express was on time for our departure and we had no problems making our flight at the end of the trip. Bottom line: This hotel was completely acceptable. Not swanky, but comfortable and quiet, and a great place to relax after a long day at the park.

Reviews.Title: “not what i expected”
Reviews.Author: stevenson5
Reviews.Content: I was under the impression that this was a moderate hotel rating not a value hotel...however it looked like a value deal hotel and we were treated like value customers. We drove all night and checked in at midnight with 3 small kids. The buildings for the units are all a bit of a walk from the parking lot. As we unloaded our suitcases we looked for a luggage rack but none to be found. I went to the room and called the front desk and asked where they kept the luggage racks however the not so pleasant lady said we don't offer luggage racks but a luggage attendant will help you bring your luggage to the door. (that is if we could find one). As we continued to unpack and carry our luggage to the room we saw one of those luggage attendants and as he drove his little golf cart by, we asked for his help "he said he is on his way to do something else and said it looks like we have it under control". So after we managed to drag all 3 sleepy kids and luggage to the door â€¦.we noticed the disgusting trundle bed underneath one of the double size beds where I guess they expected our 3 year old to sleep. The sheets were discolored and nasty and the mattress laid low to the stinky carpet, the mattress itself was as thin as paper. I called the front desk to see if we could get a cot but she said we would have to move all of our stuff to another room because our room doesn't allow for a cot. Of course we decided against that due to the fact we have already broke a sweat bringing our stuff to this room. We pushed one bed against the wall and had all three kids sleep in one bed and my husband and I squeezed together in the other one. The refridgorater is certainly a plus to have in the room however it helps if it works. We loaded our fridge with $30.00 worth of food and the next morning it was all hot and the fridge over heated somehow. We tried to save our food by putting it back in the cooler we brought but when my husband went to get ice from the icemaker down the hall, it was broken. The front desk did send someone immediately to fix it. they said they had to replace the fridge however, after we bought more food to put in the fridge â€¦â€¦it broke again and now lost another $30.00 worth of food. SURPRISEâ€¦SURPRISE! We also ate onsite at the hotel restaurant which was not bad. The attitudes of the people working there could have been more pleasant since we are in disney and the food cost a fortune. I would recommend going out to breakfast somewhere else or at least go to down town disney for breakfast. On a positive note the front desk did reimburse us for the food we lost. Other then that I wouldn't say that our time in this hotel was a positive experience and would certainly never come back. We have had better experiances staying in near by hotels. Oh...and the cute pool they show on the website is not the pool. You have to go on a nice long walk to get to the nice pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, clean and reasonable.”
Reviews.Author: PhilaPrincess
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't stay anywhere else! Staff was helpful and friendly, room was always clean. The buses and boats were always there the longest wait was maybe 5 minutes. The food was good and fast in the main dining area. Strongly suggest the dining plan, it is worth every penny. The only complaint was Boatwrights Restaurant, for a party of 3 adults, we were kept waiting for well over 45 minutes with empty tables. When my husband asked how much longer of a wait we would have he was told it depends on the size of our party. I'm sorry I think a party of 3 is easier to seat then a party of 6 or more. We turned in our pager and went into the main dining hall and down-graded our meal plan. My suggestion AVOID Boatwrights Restaurant. Overall a great time was had by all!

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous resort”
Reviews.Author: michmom5
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was a little worried about staying at Riverside. We stayed in bldg 15.....less than 2 minute walk to EVERYTHING: bus depot, main building, pool, We never waited more than 10 minutes for a bus to go to the parks or to be picked up from the parks. The resorts grounds were so beautiful and peaceful after a day at the parks. The main pool was great for the kids and they even enjoyed the "quiet pool" some days. We had 3 rooms and they were always kept immaculate....I have stayed at Beach Club and actually enjoyed Riverside more!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sharpay10
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at this lovely resort. I have previously only stayed at Disney's All Star resorts and this resort is definitely worth the increase in price. The grounds of this hotel are spectacular and very romantic. There are many trees and a winding river contributing to a very laid back, relaxed atmosphere. The front desk/guest services were always very helpful and cleaning staff very adequate. There are horse carriage rides, surrey bike and boat rentals available at this hotel. We didn't have time for any of them, but would have like to have tried them. The resort was a great place to return to after the parks every night...very peaceful surroundings even with a large number of people at the resort, it was very quiet. The food court had a nice selection of food including a "make your own salad" station. Our room was located in Oak Manor, close to the lobby and the food court but away from the main pool. The room was a nice size and the double sinks in the bathroom was a nice treat. The store at this hotel includes the regular disney merchandise as well as food like chips, bagels, bread peanut butter, jelly, etc. and other pharmacy items if you've left anything behind. There is also a sit down restaurant, Boatwrights, which we did not use. As we were close to the lobby, we only used the South Station bus depot. We did not wait long for buses at any time and only had to stand on one bus. Transportation was very efficient and enjoyable. The boat to downtown disney was also very nice - much quicker than the bus. Overall, this resort is like an oasis. I loved every minute!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for Family of Five on Disney Property”
Reviews.Author: Deedge
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Port Orleans Riverside and we will return. When traveling to a Disney resort with a family larger than 4 - your options are either limited or very expensive. We have priced the other Disney properties and have found PO-Riverside to be the best value. Our family of five stays here with use of the trundle bed. The trundle bed is small, however, and may not be comfortable for any person over 5'. The rooms at PO -Riverside are nothing fancy and small but the beautiful grounds and amenities make up for that fact. It really is a beautiful property. I enjoy walking to the food court in the morning to refill our mugs and looking at all of the plants and wildlife (the ducks and birds are very friendly). We enjoyed use of both the quite pool and the larger pool. Muddy Rivers pool bar is a great place to get a drink. We also took advantage of the cane pool fishing this trip - my son enjoyed that. The staff in the gift shop are always very helpful and friendly. And be sure not to miss Bob Jackson's performance in the lounge - very funny and enjoyable! The staff was very welcoming and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Port Orleans Riverside”
Reviews.Author: karoleigh
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a beautiful wedding that took place at Disney World. We spent three nights at Port Orleans Riverside. I can't think of anything I didn't like about the property. For anyone considering going there, I will describe it: It has a large pool on a little island in the middle of the resort. You can walk across a pretty bridge to get to the lobby. We stayed at a place called Alligator Bayou, and it was located on a beautiful, lush, tropical-style setting with a bayou. Although there is one large pool on the island, there are smaller pools near the lodges. The dining area is large and set up like a food court. You have many choices for food. If you buy the refillable mug, you can get as many drinks as you want during the duration of your stay. The mug makes a nice souvenir to take home. We actually found that the food was better at the lodge than in the parks. The lobby and other main building areas are very attractive. There is a large paddle wheel at the back of the building, and people apparently rent paddle boats and bicycles there. The gift shop has a lot of Disney souvenir items, some of them reasonably priced. We liked this resort because it was quiet. We were actually able to sleep there. The room was very cute, with log beds and New Orleans bayou themed items. Service was good at the hotel, and the employees were very friendly and helpful. Bus service goes from several places, including by the lobby. It is probably better to get onto the bus at the lobby area, even though you can get on at a location closer to your room. The bus tends to fill up at the lobby area, so you will most likely have to stand when the bus gets to your bus stop. The only thing I really hate about Disney transportation is that they really need more buses than they run. We rode on one bus that had enough people on it for two buses. I'd definitely stay at Port Orleans Resort Riverside again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent mid-range place on Disney property”
Reviews.Author: DJC17
Reviews.Content: We were here for only 2 days, so didn't see much or room or resort. The rooms are OK, with sinks outside of bathroom. 2 double beds. Safe was a nice touch. Only problem here was that the shower curtain had mildew on the bottom (also other small spots of mildew in bathroom). We complained and Disney replaced with a new one within the hour.

Reviews.Title: “Beatuiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovemytrips64
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! The garden scenes and landscaping was gorgeous. The dinning area had amazing food and a very beautiful look to it The staff was very kind and made you feel at home. After a long tiring day at the Disney parks it was nice to come to a cozy comfortable room. The rooms were pretty and kept extremely clean. The staff always left extra towels that came in handy. The scenery around the hotel was the best part. It was very nice to take walks at night. The pools were very pretty although they were a little crowed at times. Over all I loved this hotel and would do it all over again!

Reviews.Title: “Good moderate resort”
Reviews.Author: sunnysidesup
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Port Orleans and have had a very pleasant stay. We asked for an upper floor (due to previous mentions of critters!) We had a great location in Magnolia Bend. Room is a good size - air conditioning unit is huge and noisy. The main pool is located on an island where everyone has to cross a bridge from their rooms to go to. This pool really was packed at all times of day. It was too busy for our children and they opted for the quiet pool next to our room. Sunbeds always available here - however you had to obtain pool towels from the main pool. Refillable drinks mug a must at 14$ but you have to go to the main food hall to use - like the pool you have to cross to the island then cross to the food hall. Not miles but far enough in the heat! The staff were very pleasant and the hotel very clean. This really is a 3/4 star hotel nothing flashy but does a good job. Personally if we went again I would upgrade to the next level of hotel - as a bit of Wow would be nice from the rooms, rather than this is fine. The bus service was very good - especially to Magic Kingdom from here. Loved all the parks - we spent 2 weeks just in the Disney parks. If you do go do not miss out on Disney Quest - if you have game loving children - this far exceeded our expectations! Also if it is a birthday while you are in resort - you get a gift card for the value of a days pass - my son got 63$ to spend - he loved it!

Reviews.Title: “We stay here everytime we travel to Disney”
Reviews.Author: rachaelem
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love Port Orleans Riverside. We've stayed at the Caribbean Resort, the Wilderness Lodge, Animal Kingdom Lodge, and Beach Club. The Port Orleans is by far our favorite. Even though the Caribbean is essentially the same resort, we have found the service and cleanliness of the Port Orleans to be much better. We don't have any kids, so it's just me and my husband. The rooms are plenty big for 2. Everything is always kept clean. The staff is always very friendly. The dining hall gets pretty crowded in the mornings, but if you get there fairly early, you won't have a problem. One of our favorite things to do at Port Orleans is to take a little boat out on the water. You can take it all the way to Downtown Disney and back. It's a great way to spend some time with my husband and get a little sun. The Port Orleans is the best moderate hotel in Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Getting Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Hotelwarrior
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th visit to POR and have to say nothing has changed. It is a beautiful resort: beautiful groups, pools, buildings. However I was disappointed that the rooms have not been kept up like I would expect Disney to do. We stayed in the Magnolia Terrace mansion. Upon entering the room, its decor and furnishing were the same as prior visits. I was disappointed to see that the furniture was chipped and worn. The arm on the chair was loose and the refrigerator cabinet didn't even match the other furniture. It also was worn and chipped. I recommended this resort to relatives that was traveling with us and was embarrassed to see this. The towel/wash cloths were thin and worn-very cheap looking. The amenities were at a minimum so we had to ask the room attendant for more soap/shampoo. The rooms were clean but lacked the polish you would expect from Disney. The beds were fine and the bed linens were of quality. It is a shame that Disney would neglect the resort to a point that it would need a complete rehab very soon before its too late. My stay was enjoyable and would consider staying on property but at another resort. POR is showing its age and unless you get a great discount, I would look elsewhere in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome maid service!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kmdelarosa501
Reviews.Content: Cozy room. Very helpful with some lost luggage. Room was kept very clean. We were always greeted with a fun seen...towel animals, our stuffed animals having a crazy party, a good-bye written in towels on our last day, etc. Quick service restaurants were very good...especially breakfast. Only issue was that our building was so far from the main lodge...not always easy with bags, 2 kids, stroller, etc. Laundry faciltiy was useful. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to relax after parks”
Reviews.Author: Co_ClareCathy
Reviews.Content: Everything was great about this hotel. Lots of pools etc. Very clean....nice place to stay if there are 5 people in the same room. Boat takes you to Downtown disney!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax with your family”
Reviews.Author: ddbuggins
Reviews.Content: This resort is beautiful, with all of it's gardens and scenery. The main pool is great with a water slide my kids loved. We also used the quiet pools too, which were just as nice. Loved the cane pole fishing and playground. Nice being able to take the boat to DownTown Disney(relaxing). The food in the counter service area is great, especially the create your own pasta(enough for 2) and the cheesecake at the bakery. The bus stops are close to your room and come often, don't take long either. You can also walk over to POFQ or take a carriage ride.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds with great pool”
Reviews.Author: DenverWelovetotravel
Reviews.Content: The rooms at Port Orleans were very adequate for our family of four. The age of the hotel is showing a little bit but, all in all it is a fabulous hotel with so much to offer as far as free bus service, a wonderful pool area, nice sit down restaurant and the ability to use the disney dining plan. The rooms were okay but, if you are at Disney and you have time to analyze your room something is wrong. The beds were comfortable, the room was clean(just a little worn), the proximity to downtown Disney via boat is a lot of fun for a change of pace. Make sure to take advantage of the Disney Dining Plan as I have no complaints about any of the Disney restaurants and they do a wonderful job catering to special needs. My son has a severe peanut allergy and we could eat at all the sit down restaurants with no problems. Make sure to check out T-Rex cafe although it is expensive the food was some of the best we had, shocking for a rainforest cafe affiliate. We had a wonderful stay at disney and would definitly stay at Port Orleans again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property and Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: SoCalJay
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay 7/22/09 through 7/29/09. I was very concerned based on reviews that I read prior to visiting. However, our family had an excellent experience at the POR. We found that location of their building at the hotel (the place is huge) had everything to do with the people being unhappy and that they were not disatisfied with service or the cleanliness as I have read in complaints. Our maid was on top of our rooms cleanliness throughout the morning and everyone I asked for help went out of their way. The rooms are no smaller than some rooms I have stayed in some luxury hotels chains. The trundles are smaller and probably would not accomodate any taller than 5' comfortably, so they are really made for kids. With three kids, ages 10,6 and 2, feeding everyone can be a chore. The food court had a variety of the things kids like and were rarely crowded at lunch or early evening. Breakfast is very crowded. The mark up on food was not that bad, you can get a large pepperoni pizza for just under $16 that can feed two adults and two younger children easily. If you are staying for more than a couple days and intend to eat at the property at least once a day, get the refillable mug. I never had a complaint about anything I had to eat but you have to remember that it is a food court, not a gourmet restaurant! They also have the Disney channel playing in the food court and a lego table with crayons and pictures to color that are a nice distraction so that mom and dad can eat!! All my interactions with cashiers and counter help was very positive. Transportation was efficient and each morning Disney had somone at the South Depot letting you know about how much longer your wait would be. Be prepared for long waits to return from the parks to this hotel at rush times. It is so huge that it always had the longest lines for buses, especially after fireworks. The pool was a blast for the kids. The water slide is a bonus! If you are honeymooners or don't want to be bothered by noise, use one of the quiet pools on the grounds, they are MUCH less crowded. The playground for kids is practically brand new. If you use the Airline Check In, be sure that you check the information that is delivered to your room ahead of time!!!!! If you are checking bags you must call and pay the airline fee prior to checking your bags in! Do not wait until check out time, or you will not be able to get through and be stuck on the phone forever, trust me, we made the mistake. Again, the staff that assisted us was friendly and very eager to help. Overall, I really enjoyed our stay at the Port Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: neilmcmurdo
Reviews.Content: Location of hotel in Disney area seemed central Transport system 1st class, especially river taxi to down town Room was kept spotless. A nice touch by the staff making animals out of the towels. Beds comfortable. Air conditioning good as was ceiling fan. Lots of room for family of four. Lodge 14 on Alligator Bayou was really well located for restaurant and lobby. Bar area pleasant and staff attentive. Good range in shop. Pool areas and grounds well maintained. Some nice wildlife around the lodges. Really good base for holiday at Disney world. Not a big variety in food was the only negative of our stay

Reviews.Title: “No Frills in a Nice Way”
Reviews.Author: yournobetter
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort, lush landscaping, room was adequate and clean, great for a good night sleep but not much else as the table and chairs are on the same wall as the television so if you wanted to watch the television you had to sit or lay on the bed and that could get uncomfortable after awhile. The rooms are dark and there aren't any lamps in them either so you always have to have an overhead light on unless you open the blinds and let all the people who walk by the window look in and see you. Stayed in Aligator Bayou where the beds were high off the floor but comfortable for sleeping. Mousekeepers kept room nice and tidy for us and well stocked with soap, shampoo, and towels. Staying on site definitely had great rewards which help balance out the negatives. It is really no frills but in a nice way.

Reviews.Title: “Best holiday in Florida”
Reviews.Author: mickeymouse04
Reviews.Content: If we went to Orlando again, I would definately only stay in a disney hotel. Your room key was your park ticket, car park ticket, disney dining ticket, and credit card (but not the childrens one, phew!) Disney dining plan saved us a fortune and also not having to pay $12 for each disney park entry. Ate in some fantastic restaurants, i.e. The Wave in the Contemporary resort, The Crystal rooms in WDW for a lovely lunch, Grand Floridian for a character breakfast (not many characters but lobster for breakfast) and Citrico's (I think) in the Grand Floridian next to Albert and Victoria's for dinner. Dessert is a must have, although the whole meal was one of the best that I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: hbighamjr
Reviews.Content: beautiful resort, staff was great and no problems with bus transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here and Use these tips”
Reviews.Author: Vanderneucker
Reviews.Content: We are season pass holders and have been to Disney 40+ times. Port Orleans is a great moderate hotel. Our room was clean and the bathroom is a little small but very functional. The food court met our needs and was moderately busy during our stay. The location of this resort is central to all the Disney parks, but I still would recommend renting a car. Here are some quick tips on Disney 1) Get out of bed and arrive at the parks when they open. 2) Stay at the park until noon and then go to a hotel to eat lunch and return to the hotel to cool off in your pool. 3) Rent a car. Go to the car rental sites and become a member of their rental clubs, this will help you to go to their "express" line and save time. 4) Time your meal times for off peak hours. 7-8am breakfast, 11 am lunch 4-5pm dinner this will help to avoid the crowds 5) Rainforest cafe in downtown Disney is popular. Join the Safari Club and get priority seating and a discount on dining 6) Don't get the meal plan, you are spending 10-15% more on food and you won't eat it all. Go to the grocery store for food items and eat breakfast in your room. 7) If you have young children, go to the parks early and leave by 11, go back to the resort and go to the pool. Eat an early dinner and go back to the park when everyone else is leaving or eating around 4. These are just some quick tips. Riverside has nice landscaping and nice clean rooms and in my opinion is a better value than the Disney luxury resorts. Have fun

Reviews.Title: “The fairest (on your wallet) Disney Resort in the landâ€¦”
Reviews.Author: JudyJackpot
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several of the Walt Disney World on-property resorts in all price points over the years, and the Disney Port Orleans Riverside is by far, my favorite of them all. A vacation at Port Orleans Riverside is most definitely worth the extra couple hundred dollars you will spend compared to staying here and staying at one of the value-priced resorts (see my previous review on one of the All-Star resorts) and along that same vein, a better value and bang for your buck â€“ especially in this economy - than staying at one of the high priced luxury resorts. If you have no need to keep up with the Joneses back home, the Disney moderate resorts are THE best value at Walt Disney World. Before I left for my trip, I opted for the advance online check-in tool now being offered by Disney Destinations, the Disney travel company I booked my vacation through. This entails logging in and completing a form with my room preferences, and I was under the notion that I would breeze into the hotel lobby and have room key in hand faster than the Fairy Godmother can turn Cinderellaâ€™s mice into men. Not. We arrived at the Port Orleans Riverside at around 7:00 in the evening, and the line for regular check-in was about ten families deep, with only two clerks to check them in. No problem (so I thought) because I did the online check-in from home and the designated line for online check-in had no line, but it did have one family at the counter. So I stepped up to the online check-in area and waited my turn. And waited, and waited, â€¦ for a good 15 minutes before my sister in law offered to stand in line for me at the regular check-in since the Magical Express airport bus had just pulled up with a full load. It turned out that the people in front of me had a credit card issue or something because they had to speak to someone over the clerkâ€™s phone several times. Needless to say they took a very long time to get checked in but the worst part was that the clerk didnâ€™t have the courtesy to direct me to the other line, or at least let me know she would be a while â€“ a LONG while. When I finally made it to the counter about 20 minutes later, I asked the clerk what was the purpose of having express check-in if it was not speedy or efficient. She told me that the people in front of me were pulled from the regular line and had she known they would have problems she would not have allowed them in the express line. Then she handed me my packet with our park hoppers which also serve as room keys, showed me on a map where my room was located and handed me some extra â€œcelebrationâ€� buttons to appease me. Everything I asked for on the online check-in form was in order so I thanked her and went along my merry way. We were on a ground floor room in building 17 in Alligator Bayou and on a corner, so we only had neighbors on one side. Building 17 is about a 6-8 minute walk to the bus transportation via the parking lot as well as the main building where the lobby, food court, and gift shop is located. On our morning walks over to the food court we meandered along the designated pathways and were greeted by bunny rabbits and ducks along way. From our building it was about a 5 minute walk. On one rainy afternoon, and on the day we had extra magical hours (until 2 AM) at the Magic Kingdom we drove to building 15 and parked there because it is only steps from the bus transportation, and since we had a 4 year old we knew she would be zonked out by nightâ€™s end. (For some reason, a 40 pound child seems to weigh 100 pounds when she is sleeping.) My next trip there I will ask for a room in Building 15 because it is so convenient to everything but most importantly, transportation. The rooms are decorated in a rustic back woods dÃ©cor which is casual and relaxing. I like that the bathroom area has a privacy curtain and TWO sinks. The shower/tub is average, but it does have a sitting bench for people who are bathing small children, or for elderly to sit on. The room can actually sleep five people because underneath one of the queen beds is a trundle bed, just the right size for a child. My 8 year old niece slept there and she said it was like camping. There is also a refrigerator which will help you save money if you take bottled waters (we did) and other refreshments. We ate at least one meal or snack at the food court each day and all of the food is excellent â€“ the breakfast grits are among the best Iâ€™ve had. Dinner of pasta and salads along with Mickey shaped crispy treats for two adult women and three children on our first night there ran around $60. Adults who are not heavy eaters can opt for a childâ€™s meal to save money as well. Also, for $12.99 you can buy a souvenir cup and refill it as much as you like for your entire stay. I am a heavy coffee drinker and I LOVE Disney coffee so I got my moneyâ€™s worth from the cup however, the room does have a small coffee maker if you donâ€™t feel like making the trek to the food court. One of my favorite things to do at any Disney resort is to walk to the food court at 6:00 AM before the rest of the world wakes up, and to get my coffee and sip it alone on the terrace as I watch the joggers and the landscapers, all while taking in the general splendor of where I am. We had so much fun in the WDW parks that we did not take time to use the resortâ€™s bicycle rentals, carriage rides or even the swimming pools, but they looked inviting. I did do laundry one morning and the laundry facilities were clean and tidy. My only issue was with some inconsiderate guest who opened a dryer I was using thinking it was hers, but she didnâ€™t bother to restart it, so I fell behind by about 30 minutes. Finally, on our last day we boarded the river taxi from Port Orleans over to Downtown Disney. The ride alone was an adventure in itself, making just one stop to pick up guests from the French Quarter section of Port Orleans Resort. The boat captain handed out pirate hats at random to the little kids. When you get to Downtown Disney, take the kids over to World of Disney where the Fairy Godmothers will sprinkle you with fairy dust as you make a wish â€“ I wished that I could come back to Walt Disney World, and real soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! Lots of fun, and very nice staff and scenery!”
Reviews.Author: Lolababy09
Reviews.Content: i would definitely stay here again, and recommend this place to anyone. All workers were very friendly and maid service was good. We would go to breakfast and stop back at the room and everything would be all done. It was just overall a great place! And a lot of people say its very expensive with food and stuff, but when you go on vacation, especially to disney you have to expect to pay more!! Stay at Port Orleans Riverside!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay- but easy to get lost!!”
Reviews.Author: pianoperson
Reviews.Content: My 22-year old daughter- who is a law student, and I- with a Master's degree- got lost every time we came back from the parks. The resort is pretty, the room was fine- but the buildings are numbered strangely, and the signs are minimal. The resort is so huge and spread out- that we had quite a trek every time we returned. However, if you don't mind that- the resort really was lovely, the room was quite nice. They had a great breakfast area which came in handy before we left for the parks. Just make sure you drop bread crumbs on your way out!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay and would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: mdhoule67
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 days at DisneyWorld's Port Orleans Riverside resort. It is a in a good location (in the park) and a step up from some of the lower priced resorts. The convenience of being on Disney property outweighs the possibly higher price you might get just outside of the park in Orlando or Kissimmee. You save the money by not needing a car to get around (other hotels have this service also, but I find that for DisneyWorld the park shuttles are convenient and frequent). The rooms were laid out well and it was nice that there was a curtain to separate the sinks/bathroom from the rest of the room. This meant that I was not forced to change in the bathroom if my daughters were awake or around. The bathroom was not large, but a decent size for a hotel. The only possible issue we had was the room cleaning. The room was clean, but we did not get coffee packets dropped off every day. While this might not seem like much, it means a lot to the mass multitude of Coffee Achievers - even if it is Decaf. The cleaning staff also left a package of trash liners behind one day (they picked it up the next), and this seemed a little odd to us. All in all, it was a nice place to stay and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Magical stay and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Bklyn4ever
Reviews.Content: My children (11, 6) and I had a great time staying here. I wish I could give it a perfect score, but Housekeeping was definitely lacking. There was grime in the corners of the bathroom and lavatory; I noted that if a I dropped a hair in these areas before "cleaining," it was still there when we returned in the evening. Ever tried to store duffel bags on top of the TV wall unit? Don't even think about it: upon retrieval the bags were coated with dust bunnies. Nobody ever dusts up there ?!?! Fortunately, that was the only negative aspect to our stay. The wait for the shuttle buses was not that bad. Buses were packed coming back to the hotel at peak times but what could one expect? Some of the bus drivers did not speak English well or know anything about the resort. I saw one guest ask for directions at night to get back to his accommodations and the driver just shrugged his shoulders. The man and his tiny daughter walked off in what I realized the next day was the wrong direction, toward the vast pitch-black open spaces. The food was good (beer and wine a rip-off, but I expected that). The "better" restaurant was actually more limiting for the kids and hence just a hassle. I ordered a jambalaya that tasted more tired than I was. Abita ales were the only real plus to the sit-down restaurant. The pool on "Ol'Man Island" was great fun; however, the lifeguards should be more stringent about enforcing safety rules. Now for the truly important: the beautiful architecture and landscaping and cute room appointments let you know that you are in Disney World round the clock. The convenience of it all enables you to enjoy the parks to the fullest. I wouldn't bother shuttling to other hotels to take advantage of this or that. If you are headed to a shuttle stop, get thee to a Disney park.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: angeleyes27
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Port Orleans. I thought that the rooms were just average in the Alligator Bayou section, but the grounds were very nice for strolling and walking around. The grounds were huge with birds to feed and bridges to cross. There were bike rentals on the property. We took the boat to Downtown Disney. It took about a half hour, but was very relaxing. We had no problem with it breaking down as a previous poster had. I booked this hotel mainly because I brought my older children along. They had things to do, 6 pools to choose from, a boat ride, arcade, and a food court. And they could go back and forth to Disney at their leisure. I had wanted to take the carriage ride, but didn't have time to do it. If I went again, I would try the Manor section or the Port Orleans French Quarter. The pool there looked nicer. I didn't eat much at this property, but my children said that the food was okay.

Reviews.Title: “We thought it was great for a moderate priced resort!”
Reviews.Author: ohiomom09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans Riverside for 7 nights from July 1st-July 8th. This was our first visit to Disney World so we really didn't even take advantage of all the resort had to offer because we were in the parks. The grounds are so beautiful & I loved seeing the rabbits. You could walk right up to them & they wouldn't run! We were in Alligator Bayou. There was a pool right behind our building so that was convenient. We only went swimming at night & it was never crowded. Our room was fine. I agree about the TV stations but then I had to think we didn't drive 800 miles to watch TV! Our mousekeeper was good. My husband was sick one day & never left the room & they called wanting to know when they could clean it. My husband & son had lunch at The Mill food court & enjoyed it. We were on the dining plan & had dinner at Boatwright's & it was excellent! Every time I went to the concierge or the check-in desk for something, they were all helpful & friendly. Our only complaint is about the busses. It seemed to us for some reason, Riverside was overlooked several times. One day when my daughter & I went to Typhoon Lagoon, we waited 30 minutes for a bus & we had dinner reservations! We planned what should have been accordingly for plenty of time, but that was a long wait! Another time we rode the bus for over an hour trying to get to Downtown Disney! That may have been our fault because we were rookies but that was the way the person on the phone told us to go. Overall, it was an absolutely terrific time!

Reviews.Title: “so good I'm back this year for more”
Reviews.Author: angienewby
Reviews.Content: been reading some of the reviews and whilst all are allowed their own opinion I must just say that I stopped here last year with my husband and two teenage daughters (16 & 15) and had such a great time that when I arrived home in England I booked up straight away and I'm back Aug 27 for 2 weeks this year. I really can't wait. The grounds were immaculate, the room was really clean and little towel animals made appearances the whole 3 weeks I was there, the staff were very friendly and helpful. I've stopped at Disney resorts a few times this is the only one I've made a repeat visit to. Really, couldn't recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “very magical.......but”
Reviews.Author: tomansoniact
Reviews.Content: during our stay the 3 nights free really compensated for the dining plan....with 3 small kids the chioces were limited.... very time consuming just to make the reservations...all that money just to have my 3 yr old eat nothing!!!!the magical expresswas also a letdown ,lost a minimum 1hr. just going to all other hotels... POR was nice but the room had a vomit smell(3731)(others also did) the bus drop off is the longest walk to and from the theme parks....but for me the grounds were awesome...(i like to walk alot) ....my wife and I valued every second we had there but the kids prefered the pool....Disney we will be back but on cheaper terms and most likely a different hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Amenities, rooms nothing special”
Reviews.Author: bchappelle
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay on the Disney property to take advantage of some of the Disney resorts' "extras" this is a good value. But don't expect anything special in the rooms. We benefited from the "Extra Magic Hours" offered to resort guests, and this made it worthwhile. The sheer magnitude of this place amazed me. The buildings are all 2-story, so this place is sprawling, with four different bus stops, 6? pools, and a river running through the middle. It takes a LONG time to walk from just about anywhere. I don't know if this is possible, but if you can look at a map before hand and request something near the main building, do it. Rooms: Clean Motel 6. Nothing more. Wall A/C units are annoying to control, but it provides what you generally need at a place like this: Two clean beds and a working bathroom. Not too many people head to Disney World for the hotels last I checked. I'd stay here again based on that premise alone. Facilities: You could easily spend a day or two just enjoying the fun at the hotel. There are several pools (which can get crowded, we were there in high season), a fun (but expensive) arcade, cane pole fishing, and rental boats. We took advantage of all of these and if you need a relaxing day in the middle of your busy vacation, you can save a few bucks and do this. Food: Like all Disney food, they offer a mix of pizzas, sandwiches, and other basic American fare. I personally despise Disney food, although the kids were fine with it. If you're there for more than 3 days and plan on eating on site a couple meals a day, get the $13 mug for free refills. It pays for itself eventually. Go to Downtown Disney for real food. They do offer healthy choices for the kids, which i appreciated. We did not try the on-site, nicer restaurant. Transportation: I think this is a fundamental problem right now. The buses are pretty frequent, but are always packed and it can take a long time to get where you want to be. If you're going to EPCOT, you will have no problems. Otherwise it was tough. Rant: There are people in this world that are handicapped, and Disney provides special consideration for them. I saw people that genuinely needed these services and used them. This I have no problem with; I can wait an extra 5 minutes for them to board a bus. I could be wrong, but there seemed to be more than a few people that stretched the definition of "handicapped" in order to get around the park easier. Example: Overweight 50+ year old with a family of 6 hanging along side. So the 6 people get to pretty much go to the front of every line. I hate feeling this way, because I just don't know, but there were people that just didn't seem like they needed the little scooters, they were just lazy. Some I have no doubt needed them. Either way, it slows your day down, rent a car if you can. Complaint: This is probably just bad luck, but we took the free boat down the river to/from Downtown Disney, and had severe problems. They shut these down twice out of 3 times we used it due to weather, in the middle of the trip. One time we were probably 5 minutes away, and the guy just stopped at Saratoga and told us to get off. The end. No help for about 25 people. It was a terrible way to handle people. So we trek through rain and lightning with two kids to a mosquito filled bus stop (no safer than being on the water, yet I digress). There a bus arrives with an angry driver who wasn't offering any help. We go to another hotel, then back to Downtown Disney, and finally to Riverside. It took over an hour and a half. I certainly appreciate safety concerns, but if you're going to drop people off like that, HELP THEM. The other time they stopped the boat at least at Port Orleans French Quarter, where it was easy to get back. But that time it was due to "high wind." The boat wasn't even rocking. It was ridiculous. Bottom Line: Good value, nice facilities. Nothing luxury at all. Avoid the boat to Downtown if there is any weather at all in the area; if it's good weather USE IT. I would recommend renting a car if you can afford it. The transfers from the airport take a long time, the buses to the parks can sap a good hour or so from your day.

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of being called a Disney Resort..where was the MAGIC?”
Reviews.Author: Travelhappy2009
Reviews.Content: We are local to Orlando but decided to take a stay-cation at Disney, this of course included staying at POR. We paid for 4 nights and after 2, we checked out early. Cons of hotel: *Double beds are TOO small (3 words Disney "QUEEN PILLOW TOP") *Maid service was a joke. By 2 pm the 2nd day of visit, the beds were still unmade and no clean towels (dirty towels still on floor)..however the glasses were turned upside down again and a photo op card on table....if it werent for the card on table, we never would have known anyone was in the room. floors were filthy and one of the towels had red (blood like) stains on it. No coffee filter on 2nd day. *Trundle bed was also a joke (board on wheels with 2 inch mattress next to door-height of trundle was about 4 inches off floor) *Water taxi takes so long from point A to B *Hubby's biggest complaint...lack of tv stations...if there are 15 stations, 10 of them are Disney channels giving tours of the parks, dining, etc..Even at Motel 6, you get free HBO! *Main pool too crowded most of the time *One handicap entrance on building 27 and to get anywhere, you ended walking around the entire building to get there because of there only being 1 ramp. Pro's of hotel: *We only paid $114 (July 5-9), could have been worse paying $184 as non Fla residents *Quiet environment *Pretty environment *Friendly ducks *Food was good *Water taxi was peaceful *Smaller quieter pools nearby *Beds in room, while highly uncomfortable and small, the frames were very cute (log beds) *Bus service was nice but crowded since the monorail was shut down from the tragic accident *We are a family of 5 and we found the room to be a nice size When we checked out 2 days early, I was not even asked why we were checking out...Guess they dont care to improve themselves. Tips: *Bring your own drinks (they have refrigerators) otherwise the soda machine will charge you $2.75 each *Food Court had some dynomite cinabuns for about $2.50 each (hot and fresh and affordable) *For lunch, eat light, eat kid meals (drinks are included) and portion and price is right FYI: We ate at Rainforest cafe, this was our 3rd and 4th time. We returned because the first 2 times were enjoyable BUT both these visits were a waste and time and money. Food is over priced and the whole "jungle" environment was lost to us as we were seated on the hot patio on day 1 of our trip and then on day 2 of our trip while the entire back of the place was empty, we were seated next to the bar...and I have small children who would have enjoyed the jungle coming to life....Oh yeah and because my daughter and I had just bought $2.50 Rainforest waters at the gift shop, we only ordered 1 soda to split for our meal (waitress did not bring an extra cup or straw)...when I asked for just 1 refill, we were denied. So I paid $2.99 for a soda and got no refills, meanwhile my hubby got 4 refills of sweet tea....yep, the bad economy has hit Disney and in return, the MAGIC is gone!

Reviews.Title: “One of Orlando's best and most relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: flasw
Reviews.Content: This hotel is WONDERFUL for relaxion! I am a native Floridian and I visit this hotel several times per year with family and friends. I can't understand why anyone would leave a negative review about this hotel; everyone that I speak to that has been there loves it! The resort grounds are totally gorgeous. Everything is always freshly landscaped and manicured. There are several pools throughout the grounds. The central pool has a waterfall and slide for kids, along with a hot tub and a pool bar for adults. There is a play ground behind the pool area. The food is great, too. Even the food court has far better food than most hotels in this price range. The resort is divided into 2 different sections that have totally different looks. I do not care for Alligator Bayou, but if you have small kids you may like it. The outside of that area looks like country type cottages in the woods. Even the landscaping is different on that side of the resort. The rooms are done in furniture that looks like it was made from tree logs (think rustic log cabin type furniture). Magnolia Bend, however, is gorgeous. It is made to look like sprawling mansions in a southern area. There are little gardens that are perfect for pictures. There are magnolia trees everywhere, too. Totally romantic and relaxing if that's what you're looking for! The rooms are different inside on this area of the resort, too. They look like old fashion mansion style with very traditional furniture and arrangements. All rooms have double pedestal sinks so it's convenient for 2 or more people. The resort has an amazing boat ride that you can take to go to the French Quarter (the other Port Orleans resort) or to Downtown Disney. The boat ride is about 15 minutes and again, is totally amazing! You pass along through the Treetop villas and the golf course on the way to Downtown Disney. If you're going to a park, the buses area great. You never have to wait more than 10 minutes (maximum) and usually get right on a bus. Disney's buses do not stop at any other resorts or any other stops. They have buses that go to every park so you never get stuck waiting to drop people off like you do on all other non-Disney resorts. You are at whatever park you're going to in less than 10 minutes ALL THE TIME! Same goes for leaving the parks. Buses are constantly coming to pick you up and they go straight back to your hotel. When you stay at another hotel outside disney, you often wait for 30 minutes (or more) and then you have to stop at other hotels and/or other parks making your ride back to the hotel very long! At this (and probably all disney resorts) you do not need a car for anything. We park in the parking lot and don't even go to the car until we are leaving and we have never been inconvenienced in any way from the resort transportation, which makes a HUGE difference if you are traveling with children! It really takes a lot if stress out of the issues that can arise on vacation. Also, the resort has paddle boats, small motor boats and larger party boats for very reasonable renting prices. They have an arcade and a general store that sells anything you need. There are bike rentals and buggy rentals. At night they have a horse drawn carriage for a great price. The resort has a beautiful walking/running track that is very peaceful at any time of the day. Also, there is lots of wildlife here. We've seen tons of rabbits, otters, hummingbirds and may others. Even the Disney rep that I made reservations with in Tampa said this is his favorite Disney hotel! The resort grounds are luxury all they way with the exception of the room decor. I say that because the inside of the rooms don't look like a Hyatt, though they are immaculate and comfortable. The grounds are unparalleled to any other resort I have stayed at in Orlando. 2 possible issues for some people- the rooms don't offer pay per view; there is no room service since the resort is massive.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but nothing MAGICAL!”
Reviews.Author: kytravelerslm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans Riverside room # 9202 (Oak Manor) for 2 nights with our teenage boys. The full size BEDS are too small!! Need to update to Queen size. The room was outdated, and over priced at $200 a night, but we decided to stay there for the MAGICAL experience, which we never seen. It was VERY difficult to find your way aroudn the resort, there are VERY few signs directing you or even signs to identify the buildings. We arrived late at night and had a very difficult time finding our room. need better signage. We tried to ride the boat to downtown Disney early one morning, but the boat only took a dozen or so people at one time every 20 minutes,and after waiting over an hour, we gave up and drove. We were not impressed with Downtown Disney, but were told it was better if you wnet at night. I enjoyed the towel handiwork that was left for us, but other than that I did not see or feel anything Disney like or Magical. Our room had several bugs in it. i even took a picture of one of them. not sure what kind they were. We got confused when we rode the bus back from the Parks on where to get off the bus, becasue there is several stops at the Port Orleans. Tip: Pay CLOSE attention to which bus stop you board the bus that is near your room so you remember where to get off when returning. The busses were over crowded and we always had to stand up which was difficult. THis hotel is good for Adults and Teenagers because it was not decorated or geared for serving small children. The pool near our room, was nothing special very much like a pool you would see at any Holiday inn.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the money”
Reviews.Author: disneyfan61165
Reviews.Content: We had stayed there in years past ... It was much better then ... it appears as though the bad economy has perhaps reached Disney .... never thought that would happen. The staff was friendly ... our rooms were decent size and were plenty big for two teenagers, one child and one adult. We found an empty water bottle on our floor, a raisin on the floor, purple stains on the shower and the outside of the toilet was disgusting. As a test I asked the kids to leave the raisin where it was ... needless to say it was still there nine days later when we checked out. I had to actually had to call houskeeping to get toilet paper delivered to our room. I have never had to do that before. Other than dropping off towels and making the beds, I am not sure what housekeeping did. Although crowded it was quite and clean elsewhere ... other than our room. We did drive vs taking the buses ... they seemed crowded and lines were long awaiting buses. One other thing ... We had the meal plan ... I have had this for years ... they changed it from when I made my reservation a year ago ... If you had your big cups from years past, bring them ... they should have been included and no longer are with the meal plan that included one snack, one quick service and one sit down meal per day. It specified these were included when I made my reservation but they no longer were when we arrived. Also appetizers are no longer included as part of this plan ... no biggie but just a heads up. In the future, I will print out what is promised when I make the reservation ... since all I had were links, they took me to what was offered now vs when the reservation was made.

Reviews.Title: “A great resort for families”
Reviews.Author: rysmom
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed here the week of 6/19-6/26. Upon check-in we were put in bldg 36. Very far from the main blg, which I had requested we be close to, so I was offered a room in bldg 14 starting the next day if we wanted to change rooms, which I accepted. The dining plan was very convenient and we were more than satisfied with the size and cleanliness of the room. The trundle bed was fine for my 9 yr old twins but too small for my 13 yr old. On the days we got up early to get to the parks at opening the food court was not very crowded at all (between 7:30-8) On the mornings that we slept in and tried to eat around 9ish the food court was extremely crowded. The buses ran fairly regularly but got very crowded in the evenings. Tips: We made ADR's for the Crystal Palace in MK for 8am. We were able to get in to the park before opening walking down a virtually empty main street which made for great pics of the castle with no crowds and finish brkfst (which was fantastic) before the park opened, so we were able to be first in line at the rope drop to get over to splash mntn and thunder mntn. Because of being there early we were able to do all major rides with no more than a 20 min wait and were done by 2pm. At hollywood studios we got there at opening and I sent my husband and the 3boys to rock n rollercoaster while I went to get fast passes for toy story then was able to meet them as they came off the ride and we all got on tower of terror with only a 20 min wait. We ate lunch at 50s prime time-woiuld not recommend it really was not very good. Epcot was the most crowded and had we not been there at opening we probably would not have gotten on soarin. We got fast passes for mission space and had to get in the single rider line and ride separately for test track. Animal Kingdom we went to on the afternoon that we arrived. We got to AK around 2pm and found it to be very manageable crowd wise. We got on all rides including Everest with only a 20 min wait and no fastpasses needed. We also ate at at Tusker house which was fantastic! We are not adventerous eaters and I really was apprehensive but needed to use a sit down meal credit and I was more than pleasantly surprised. Actually on our last day we decided to go back. I tried to get ADR's at the concierge desk at the resort only to be told there was nothing available and so upon getting to the park we walked up to the restaurant at 5:10 to try our luck and were able to be seated with a 25 min wait. which was fine with us. I really was very satisfied with the resort the only complaint was that the pool water was very warm and not at all refreshing in the 100 degree heat but I think that had more to do with mother nature and all the hot bodies in the water than with the resort so I would definately recommend POR to families looking for a place to stay. I have to stay that I was shocked at how expensive everything was. Tshirts ranging from 20-30 dollars, baseball caps were $20, sweat shirts $40-$50. The small sized stuffed animals were $13-15! AT one point I needed to get medical attention for my 13yr old, We had used Magical Express (worked great) so we had no car, I went to the concierge desk and they were able to call a walk-in clinic that picks-up and then brings you back (free of charge) we only had to pay our co-pay and they had a pharmacy on site for medications. So in the event of an illness care is readily available and about 15 mins from the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay with Expectations Met”
Reviews.Author: HonestOpinionSC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Disney's Port Orleans Resort â€“ Riverside during a family vacation in early June. No surprises based on online research and reviews. We do recommend that anyone planning to stay here visit www.portorleans.org for valuable information. Our stay was for the seven nights and we flew into Orlando. We chose to use resort transportation and purchase the Quick Service Dining plan. We are a family of four with two children. Our room was in the rustic Alligator Bayou section at Building 15. We followed online advice to request this building location with a second floor, outside corner room. As recommended, the second floor room was quiet and the extra set of windows in the outside corner room did make the room brighter and less â€œcave-like.â€� Buildings 14 & 15 are close to the main complex (lobby, restaurant, food court, store, arcade, baggage station, etc.), main bus station (South - Blue Bayou & River Delta), and water taxi dock (Riverside Levee). The convenience of this room location was great! The close proximity was really appreciated during stormy weather and you will have the shortest wait times at the South bus station; especially during peak hours. FYI â€“ be sure to use the path between the bus platforms to shortcut your walk to buildings 14 & 15. Heed online comments that rooms located closer to the main complex had more wear-n-tear than rooms further away. Our first night was in Building 39, as our room request was not honored at check-in. This building and room was in much better condition than the room we moved to, but the walk to the main building was a long trek. For us, convenience was of higher importance than condition. Room size is not spacious, but was comfortable enough with two large suitcases, four backpacks, and three carry-on bags scattered about. However, it may be too cozy for four adults or a family of five. Housekeeping was adequate, but we did need to request that the second room be vacuumed at check-in. As always, we travel with disinfectant wipes to quickly go over the room upon returning each day. This practice tends to make the place feel cleaner. We also wear flip-flops in the room. Daily tipping kept us well stocked with extra towels and toiletries. We also chose this resort because of good reviews for its food court. As expected, the selection was fine and meals were mostly good. Actually, it was better than most over-the-counter meals at the attractions. During peak times the lines moved quickly and we always found a table. We agree that the pasta bar and warm cinnamon rolls are a very good choice. The make-your-own salads were a favorite for my wife. The roast beef was usually overdone. The only drawback at the resort is the water taxi transportation to Downtown Disney (DD), as the wait is quite long during dinner hours. Also, the boats stay docked during bad weather and you are rerouted to the bus service. We got delayed going to and leaving DD during thunderstorms. Disney does react to these situations by dispatching additional buses, but the wait can be quite long. We never regretted hauling around umbrellas and rain jackets in our backpacks. Overall, this Walt Disney World (WDW) resort is pleasant and relaxing. The setting and buildings are charming. The grounds are picturesque and well kept. We found the room quaint and adequate for the price of our discounted package. The staff members were friendly and courteous. We felt welcomed and were treated respectfully. In fact, the staff made our stay more enjoyable due to their conduct. We would return for another stay at this resort. Additional Notes: The best surprise was the WDW Water Parks (Blizzard Beach and Typhoon Lagoon). Highly enjoyable! Purchase the Water Park & More Option to visit both for less cost. Disney Quest was a huge disappointment. We are glad that we did not pay admission for this attraction (included in the option price above) Buyers beware of the Quick Service Dining (QSD) plan. Do the math. You must average about $11.50 per meal and $3.50 per snack to BREAK EVEN. This price point is above most QSD meals with drinks or QSD snacks. The 20% discount comes into play if you normally eat dessert with a heavy lunch and dinner each day. We overindulged ourselves to use up credits and meet price points and we still had 14 unused snacks remaining. A quick trip to Goofyâ€™s Candy Company at Downtown Disney solved that problem. QSD Tips: The best WDW QSD meals/deals are at Wolfgang Puck Express, DD Market Place. Do not estimate the cost of meals based on Disneyland, as WDW food costs less. Creative use of the QSD plan (i.e., use snack credit for breakfast croissants, muffins, etc. and resort mug for hot drinks) and splitting large portion meals, allowed us to stretch the seven night QSD plan for all meals, snacks, and drinks for the entire stay (eight full days). The bottom line cost for food was $105 per day for our family of four. The Disney Magical Express and resort bus service were both efficient and convenient. We had no ground transportation costs. Baggage services were also good. Since we arrived in the early morning hours, it was nice to check our carry-on baggage at the resort then head off to the attractions for the day. Airline check-in at the resort is easy, but pay baggage fees beforehand. Last wordâ€¦ Being from Southern California, we found the staff at Walt Disney World more pleasant, courteous, and helpful than those at Disneyland.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: 10onCullen
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Disney World, however, my husbands 654 (not literally) and he insisted that we stay at port orleans riverside, formerly dixies landings i am told. I have to say i absolutely loved it. We did go around and check out all the other resorts and i would have to say that this one was my favorite. I loved how big and beautiful everything was. Boatwright's was also excellent!! My husband and i stayed in the Acadian house and it was beautiful. The maid even made this sweet little holder out of a towel for our tooth brush and tooth paste. We stayed there for seven days and i do not have a single complaint. Why spend more when riverside is so great?

Reviews.Title: “Not too impressed”
Reviews.Author: dfanelli
Reviews.Content: I stayed at POR with my husband and 3 children from 6/14-6/21. Our first impression was that the grounds were absolutely beautiful. We arrived at 10am and were told at the check in counter that our room wouldn't be ready until about 3 pm. Much to our surprise, I called at 11am and our room was ready. We were in Alligator Bayou, building 18. The location of this building was great. We were close to the dining hall as well as Ol' Man Island, the main pool. There was a small "quiet" pool located right outside of our room, but we chose to go to the main pool instead. The room itself was nothing special. The rooms were definitely dated, but clean. They are not big enough for a party of 5. We did notice a few critters in the room, but when you are surrounded by that many trees and bushes, what can you expect. The trundle bed was a joke. It was basically a small mattress on the floor. It was located right next to our door, so we had a hard time going in and out if the bed was out. My husband ended up sleeping on the trundle bed because my kids were scared to sleep so close to the door (not to mention the fact that they were scared that "critters" would crawl on them). The bathroom was very small, barely enough room to move from the toilet to the shower. One good thing was the double sinks, that was a great thing considering there were 5 people in the room. Mousekeeping was ok, but could have been better. The food in Boatwrights as well as in Riverside Mill was very good, no complaints there. There were plenty of options for everyone in Riverside Mill, and you can't go wrong with Disney's Dining Plan. The lines did tend to get very long at certain times during the day. POR is an extremely large resort. In my opinion, it is just too large. We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge several times before and I don't have a single complain about that resort. The reason was stayed at POR this time is because they have rooms to accomodate 5 and we took our neice along this time. I can't say that it was a terrible place to stay. It was okay, but I will not be going back there again!

Reviews.Title: “Decent value”
Reviews.Author: agie95
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very large but that goes with most of Disney's properties. The room was a decent size and included two double beds, a trundle bed, fridge, and other normal items. We were not in the room much, but while we were there it was very quiet. The A/C worked well along with the shower/tub, etc. The hotel was clean. The day we arrived there were towels forming the head of Mickey Mouse on the bed. I tipped for two days and did not have any other formations or above average service. The rest of the stay I did not tip, since it was not receiving above average service. Service was good though. I did not like the sink area. There were two pedestal sinks with a granite surface area just above them. It was hard to splash water on your face due to the granite surface. They have a sit down restaurant and an a la carte restaurant. We only ate at the a la carte restaurant. The food was ok. The roast beef was a bit dry and for $10 for a sandwich I def. expected better. The other food there was average. The desserts were wonderful though. We were eating on the Disney plan.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - lush grounds, and relaxing atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: fishiana
Reviews.Content: Everyone warned be that we would come back exhausted after 7 days of DisneyWorld - not when you you are staying at Port Orleans Riverside. Teh greenery, the birds, the river, all made the beginning of the day, and end of the day so relaxing. We chose to spend a full day just hanging out at the hotel and the pool and it was wonderful. Amazing how at the end of a very busy and loud day, you can come back and see bunnies just outside your hotel room. The staff were very friendly and we were happy with our room in Building 18 as it was close to the main food court and Ol Man Island Pool. Bus service was so-so, but we made the best of it. It was our first time going to family and we will certainly be back - it was magical!!

Reviews.Title: “A BIG Moderate resort”
Reviews.Author: joejup
Reviews.Content: Just back from Disney on a very busy, rather hot week, but we had a blast! We stayed at Port Orleans Riverside (POR for short) with our middle/elem school sons in the Alligator Bayou section. I disagree with the reviewer who didn't like AB. We thought it was neat, and the price was very budget friendly. POR is a moderate resort. It's not fancy, but we weren't looking for fancy. We're at WDW. We spend minimal time in the room. The rooms are larger and better equipped than the All Star Value resorts, and they come with mini fridge and 4 cup coffee makers. Since we eat breakfast in room, this was a big plus. The bathroom area has a curtain between the bed area and sink area, and the toilet/shower area has a door. As the only girl in Man Town, this mom liked the privacy this set up afforded me. When choosing b/w POR and POFQ, keep this in mind. POR is ENORMOUS (2048 rooms!! FQ has 1008). We were there when it was rather busy, so bus lines and boat lines were long at times. Getting back from Downtown Disney was really difficult, especially from the West Side. Buses kept filling up, and boats only depart from Marketplace. Parking is included when you stay on Disney property, so we just chose to drive to the parks. It was more convenient for us. The food there is good, but typically Disney pricey. Boatwrights was good, but a little highbrow for our boys. The food court is fine - wide variety and the pasta dinner will easily feed 2 waist watching adults. They offer the "buy a $14 mug and you get free refills" deal, but we decided not to do this. Just couldn't see spending $50 on cups when we had a cooler full of diet Coke back in the room. It was a splendid week, and we are looking forward to a return trip soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great moderate resort”
Reviews.Author: disneyfan17
Reviews.Content: I stayed at POR for the first time this past week. I had stayed with family at POFQ for Christmas 2007 and loved it. This time I wanted to try POR. Overall, I had a very nice stay. Here are some specifics: Magical Express - The bus shared a route with BC, YC, and BWI. (No one on the bus went to BWI though!) I was at the resort about 70 minutes after landing. The resort airline check-in was quite convenient. I never saw a lot of people there. The return route made stops at POFQ, OKW, and SSR. It took about 30 minutes for those stops before we were on the way to the airport. Online check-in - The sign at the front of the registration desk has an arrow pointing to the right. I followed it and had to ask at the regular check-in where I was supposed to go. The desks were at the far end of the lobby (the bottom of the U shape). One other family was checking in, and another cast member was available to help me. I had made three requests upon making my reservation - near the main building, Magnolia Bend, and top floor. The first most important one was not granted. The room assigned to me was on the back corner of Parterre Place facing a parking lot. I asked about a different location, and after a few minutes, I was assigned room 9717 in Parterre Place. I had ordered a case of water, which the cast member got for me. She had it sent to my room, since my hands were full. Overall, online check-in was easy and quick. The room - It took me 5 minutes to walk from the main building. The room itself showed a little wear, but it is a hotel room! It's not going to be absolutely perfect. My mousekeeper had left me a towel Mickey head on one of the beds. (The next day, I had more towel creations.) I had a view of a quiet pool in the distance. I am guessing the room was classed "water view" because of it, so I suppose I received an upgrade as I paid for a standard room.
