Transportation - I really have no problems with the transportation system. I always use the busses to travel around the parks and I love the boat to Downtown Disney. A few times I had just missed a bus so I had to wait 15 min or so for the next one, but Disney does say that busses run every 20 minutes. Sometimes you're lucky, and sometimes not. One night I did have to wait for a third boat to DD, as there was a long line of people waiting. It's free and a relaxing ride, so I didn't mind. The bus depots were a long walk from my room. It took 5+ minutes to get to the South Depot, and it took 7+ to get to the East Depot. I usually went to the South Depot. Sometimes the busses stopped there first, and other times they stopped first at the West Depot. I'm sure there is a logic to it, but I stopped trying to figure it out. Riverside Mill - I usually eat breakfast in the room, but this trip I splurged. I had something in the food court most days. There were very few people up as early as I was (usually between 6:30-7:15). I never had to wait in line and I never had trouble finding a table. I only ate lunch there once. Overall I had a great trip to Disney World (again) and will be planning my next trip soon!

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Gina-Gina-Bo-Bina
Reviews.Content: Our family of three stayed at Port Orleans Riverside in January 2009 to celebrate our son's 13th birthday. The resort was selected based on the recommendation of the Disney specialist with whom we booked our trip, and we were definitely pleased with our decision!! Though we assumed we'd be placed in Magnolia Bend (due to our family size), we were thrilled to be assigned to the more rustic and lush Alligator Bayou. The buildings in the mansion section were GORGEOUS, but we just preferred the relaxed feeling of the lodge-style accomodations a little more. All those green ferns and plants were so welcoming to a Canadian family who departed Toronto in the midst of a deep freeze. The room was immaculate and spotless, and maintained beautifully thoughout our stay. We received three towel animals during the week, and the mousekeeping staff were amazingly generous with the toiletries. I left a short note asking for a wee bit more shampoo (I have very long, thick hair) and they literally left me a BAG of various items. Some of the aspects of the resort we LOVED: - the theming....loved that "old south" feel. - the boat ride to Downtown Disney. So convenient, so peaceful, such a great way to travel! - the proximity to Downtown Disney. We went there four evenings out of six!! So much to do, great shopping, and Goofy's Candy Company!! - the food court.....the make-your-own pasta was fantastic, and a great counter-service choice on the dining plan. - the pool and hot tub. Ol' Man Island was a great place to hang out, the waterslide was fast and fun, and the hot tub was ALWAYS hot. - Piano Bob. Take your family, he's a fantastic entertainer that's suitable for all ages! - the general store....an excellent selection of items (though the staff there didn't always knock my socks off as compared to the other Disney cast members we met) - being able to share in the amenties at Port Orleans French Quarter. How nice to have the choice of 2 feature pools! - the buses.....we didn't wait more than 10 minutes for a bus from this resort, and in most cases, it was 5 or less. We were extremely satisfied with Disney transportation!!! The resort is very big and there's a lot of walking, but honestly, that didn't bother us at all. We loved the way the resort felt so private and secluded. While at Disney, we visited the Polynesian, the Contemporary and the Grand Floridian (dinner reservations at each one). With the exception of the Poly, hubby and son stated more than once that they'd much prefer to stay at POR over the deluxes. We were so happy with Port Orleans Riverside that I honestly can't think I'd ever pay out the big $$'s to stay at a deluxe. Should there ever be a return trip to Orlando, this property will top our list of places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Went from "Ahhhh" to "Ewww" really quick”
Reviews.Author: MHS70
Reviews.Content: Upon driving up through the gate and around the grounds, it was just beautiful. The grounds are amazingly kept up and very lush. However, upon entering our room it was a big letdown. We stayed in the Alligator Bayou section â€“ which is very rustic inside. The beds and other dÃ©cor are made from wood branches (perhaps simulated wood, not sure) and it was very small and dark inside. Since we were only staying for 2 nights and then switching over to Caribe Royale (please do yourself a favor and seriously consider this hidden gem of a hotel which is a stoneâ€™s throw from the parks) we were willing to deal with it. However, when we visited the pools, it was another disappointment â€“ people were clearing out of the pool since someone left a deposit in the pool. OK â€“ these things happen, I understand. Upon our return to the pool later, it was mobbed. There was a line for the slide that took about 5 minutes each time and it just felt a bit grimy in the water. However, none of these things were horrible until the next morning when we found a roach in our room â€“ and that was just after taking a shower with a mildewed shower curtain to stare at! I understand Florida has an insect problem â€“ but Iâ€™ve been coming to Disneyworld for 10 years and never saw a single roach. We complained at the front desk and we were moved to the other section of this hotel (Oak Manor I believe) â€“ WHAT A DIFFERENCE! The room was brighter; the grounds were even more beautiful. This room I could actually find myself staying in for a week. If you must stay at this hotel, definitely avoid Alligator Bayou and try for the Oak Manor section. Perhaps the bugs just do a better job hiding over there â€“ but we didnâ€™t see any! :-) And definately take a look at Caribe Royale and the reviews for this great place, we paid $99/night using the Mouse Savers discount rate and it was leaps and bounds better than Port Royale. Finaly, I woudl say that if you're looking for a comparison - we often stay at Courtyard's by Marriott and from a room perspective, this is far below a Courtyard...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Willabe
Reviews.Content: This resort is very close to all of the Disney Parks. This was our second time staying at PO-Riverside. We have stayed at other resorts and while we like most, this is one of our favorites because of it's central location. The food court is good and the restaurant is great...especially at breakfast, try the sweet potato pancakes! My son loved the pool. The small wading pool was the perfect size for him to splash and play. Some of the rooms do need some updating, but overall it is a nice resort.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: pbobonis
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my husband, and 15 yr old daughter from May 22 to May 29. We stayed in the Magnolia section, and I really loved that old Southern Style "Mansions". The rooms were average hotel rooms. The services that I requested were good. Of course it's close to the parks, so that's a plus. We rented a car because I hate waiting for buses. But I liked my stay here even though if there were another visit, I would not rent a car, and stay at The Contemporary (because of the Monorail).

Reviews.Title: “This time Port Orleans Riverside was very dissapointing.”
Reviews.Author: SuwaneeGA
Reviews.Content: Four years ago our adult family of four had two connecting rooms in Magnolia Terrace and they were very clean and well maintained. This year our two connecting rooms in Acadian House were filthy. The carpets had stains and the bathroom floors needed to be moped. Shelves and furniture were dusty. There was a hole in the wall in the bathroom that was hastily repaired and painted. The mattress on one bed was so badly worn out on one side that it was like sleeping in a hammock and if you lay on the other side, you would roll to the worn out side. Internet access in the room costs $9.95 for 24 contiguous hours when other high quality hotels have free Internet access. Compared to four years ago, the dinning plan this time sucks. We purchased the same dinning plan that included a snack, a counter service meal and a table service meal per person, per day. We made our table service meal reservations 90 days prior to arrival as per the new WDW policy, but couldn't get all the restaurants and times we wanted. Secondly, with the table service meal, the gratuities and appetizers are no longer included. If I would have known these changes prior to booking, I would have chosen the Quick Service Dinning Plan. On the plus side, the rooms were in reasonable walking distance to the bus stop and main lobby. The buses, boats and other transportation had reasonable wait times. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We took advantage on the extra early and late hours at the theme parks for guests. There was very good family (kids) entertainment in the River Roost Lounge in the evenings. The gift shop was very nice, but a little pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Good - but could be better”
Reviews.Author: hswatts
Reviews.Content: Arrived 16 May for a 17 night stay with husband and 11 year old son. Check-in was very quick and smoothe and the clerk was helpful. Stayed in 36 Alligator Bayou. Quite a long way from the lobby but with a very pleasant pool nearby. Be warned that the pools get very busy late afternoon as everyone returns from the parks. Room was fairly dark, even with the blinds open, and we found we had to put the lights on in the day (if you opened the blinds people stared in as they walked past). It would have been nice to have some chairs on the verandah to sit on. Also the air conditioning was very noisy so the overhead fan was a big help. As stated in previous reviews room was 'tidied' every day rather than cleaned and I was disappointed to find stains on the comforter on Day 1 that were still there on Day 17. We weren't lucky enough to get any towel animals - despite tipping generously. Grounds were beautiful and well maintained. The boat ride to Downtown Disney is a must-do - the Captain of the boat will give a very informative commentary, pointing out places of interest on the way - although once you've heard it a few times it can get a little boring. Ate at the food court a few times. Food was ok and quite reasonably priced but a little like a school cafeteria. We did enjoy the pasta station - very generous portions and very tasty. One annoying thing - we saw many people with refillable mugs that had quite obviously not been bought at the resort, (some were even from Sea World and Universal) filling them for free at the beverage station in full view of the staff, who seemed to turn a blind eye. This is something that needs to be addressed!! The main pool was pleasant, with very attentive lifeguards and my son loved the slide (we saw a couple of occasions where the lifeguards jumped in without a moment's hesitation to assist a child in trouble, even before their parents knew there was a problem). However we were disappointed to find the pool closed on our last day for cleaning - with no prior warning. When we asked the pool staff when it would re-open they were a little vague and evasive?? Overall I would recommend this hotel. This was our first stay on Disney property - we have stayed in villas and other hotels in the past and I think we prefer the freedom of a villa. We didn't use the Disney transportation as we hired a car. The buses did seem to run very regularly and we never saw more than a handful of people waiting. I would suggest hiring a car to take full advantage of all that Orlando has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying with friends”
Reviews.Author: rescue43
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Disney many times. Wilderness lodge. Polynesian, Carribean beach. Have enjoyed all. We have stayed at the Port orleans the last few times. We find the stay there to be relaxing, comfortable and just the right amount of excitment after being at the parks. The staff have always met our request and seem to go that extra yard to help. We find the alligator bayou section works best for us. The 14 or 18 sections give you convience to pools, bus stops and the main building. The lodge very convient when you get back from the parks and very relaxing. The boat ride to Downtown Disney at times you may have a long wait but the ride is nice. Young kids may get a little restless. The buses to the parks and back are about the best we have had. The rooms are nice but the shower area a little tight. The grounds are very nice to walk through. So have your selve a magical time, Thanks again DISNEY!

Reviews.Title: “Disney can do better”
Reviews.Author: vikingteacher
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights during our visit to WDW. Upon arrival, we were very surprised that this is a moderate Disney resort. While the grounds are beautiful and there are many on-site amenities, the rooms were very average, both in size and decor. For the price that Disney charges for a moderate resort, we expected it to be nicer. The Alligator Bayou buildings are in need of a good remodel. Also, our building was an extremely long walk from the parking lot, which is not a good thing when you are taking luggage to and from the car. Overall, we would have expected a bit nicer place to stay for the money.

Reviews.Title: “My birthday Trip from Heaven”
Reviews.Author: uf1579
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a one night stay at the Port Orleans Resort-Riverside and would absolutely stay there again. The resort was easy to find and very beautiful. The room was on the second floor with a very pleasant view of the river and two pools within sight. Also, the foodcourt and the bus stop was within a easy five minute walk from our room, which was very neat and clean. The only glitch was the electrical outlet next to the t.v. did not work and it could have been a little bigger. Overall, I would certainly stay there again and would recommend it to anyone looking for a relatively inexpensive room in the Disney Resort Complex.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for adults to stay in Disneyworld”
Reviews.Author: chriskaia
Reviews.Content: The Port Orleans Riverside was convenient to Downtown Disney via shuttle boat, which we enjoyed much more than when we took the shuttle bus. There are also several shuttle bus stops to get to the theme parks. Be careful when booking offsite character meals early in the morning since the shuttle buses do not start very early. We had to scramble to catch a taxi to get to Epcot by 7:30 for the Segway tours, even though we were told the buses would be running early enough to get us there. The hotel had everything two adults needed. Our room was clean and close to the shuttle bus stop for the parks. There are conveniently located pools for use later at night, although I never did find any pool towels.There was plenty of room to unpack and hang clothes on the open rod and large dresser. We particularly liked the two individual sinks outside the toilet and tub area. The hotel has a small store to get snacks, drinks, etc. to put in the refrigerator. If you have pre-teen kids, they may prefer a hotel with more activities and water facilities. Our favorite Disney World restaurant was Chefs de France --be sure to look for Remy the rat from Ratatouille when there. The food was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “One night on the bayou”
Reviews.Author: dilidali
Reviews.Content: For my husband's birthday, we stayed overnight for the convenience and the extras Disney has to offer. We paid rack rate because our stay fell upon a Friday. The resort is nice in appearance, but nothing extraordinary jumps out at you even upon entering the lobby. It is clean and well maintained. Matt, the Cast Member who checked us in, was friendly and quite helpful with our questions. We did not find elevators in our building (17), so we walked up the rather long flight of stairs to reach our room on the second floor. The room is a standard room with two very comfortable queen beds. Our extra towels were displayed in a Mickey head icon shape on one of the beds. Nice touch. There the two pedestal sinks just outside the bathroom. The soaps they offer are creamy and rich. The shower has a bench in the back. I noticed the shower head is also adjustable to some degree. The bus stops are not close to our building and finding one was not very easy. The paths tend to wind around and you quickly feel lost. Having the map of the grounds is a good thing to keep when walking about. Since we are adults with no children, we did not use the pools. We did opt to take the boat to Downtown Disney for some shopping the next day after we checked out. The boat ride to Downtown Disney takes approximately 20 minutes and is a nice way to relax and enjoy the sights.

Reviews.Title: “4-star resort but 3-star room & service”
Reviews.Author: goodolympian
Reviews.Content: We were there for relaxation and enjoying disney world. The resort was realy good, 4 star with nice boat access to downtown disney. Very much enjoyed the resort and its beauty. But rooms are 3-star level, not bad but not luxury of any sort. Old (and seemingly not clean) carpets and old everything. Servie was also 3-star, you wouldn't get much room service and if you happen to have a privacy sign on your door when the cleaning crew came, your room would not be cleaned that day. They would give you towels/soap and thats it. So choose, if you are ok with 4-star resort and 3-star room and service this is your place. Doesn't deserve the full price but if you get a discount it is a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort & Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: swacer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5/12-5/19 2009. This was our first time staying on-site at WDW and we absolutely loved this resort. We requested and got a room in the Alligator Bayou section, which is beautifully themed and the landscaping all around the buildings was gorgeous. The room was a very good size...there were only 2 of us, but I could see a family easily having enough room. The decor was very cute and fit in with the theme of the resort perfectly (I wish I could get one of the quilts from the beds, very pretty). Housekeeping was great each day and always gave us way more towels than we needed. Also, having two sinks was a very nice touch as we coud both work on getting ready at the same time. The fridge was an average size mini-fridge and fit a gallon of milk and 12-pack of soda with plenty of room to spare. The best part of this resort are the grounds surrounding the buildings. They are peaceful and sprawling and make for a great evening walk (and there are *plenty* of walking/running/biking trails to be had). The walk along the river between Riverside and French Quarter is especially nice, and the boat from the resort to Downtown Disney is a must-do at least once just for the scenery. The food at the food court was also good. Be sure to try the make-your-own pasta...everything is so fresh, they don't even drop the pasta and start cooking the meat until you have ordered it and it is all prepared right in front of you. Service was also very nice. Every Cast Member we dealt with was courteous and ready to help. All-in-all, this is the best hotel/resort stay we have ever had and would not hesitate to stay again. It only left us with one problem...next time do we stick with what we know we like or explore and try out other Disney resorts!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience; Beware - They're after every one of your pennies!”
Reviews.Author: tiktok4321
Reviews.Content: I used to work at Walt Disney World 12 years ago and during my time there, one of my favorite places to just spend leisure time was at Dixie Landings, now known as Port Orleans - Riverside. For the first time, I was able to afford to take my family there on a very short one night getaway. Whereas 95% of my stay was extremely enjoyable, the 5% was enough to make me decide to write a letter to Walt Disney World's VP of Resort Operations. First, the good. The Hotel is owned by and located at Walt Disney World. This means that as a guest, you are entitled to complete, unrestricted use of Disney World's phenomenal transportation center, access to extra hours at various parks at various times, and of course, it's Disney! Our room had a rustic flair, and on the surface seemed to be extraordinarily clean and inviting. The themed decor was beautifully simple, and there was plenty of room to store quite a bit of personal belongings for extended periods of time. Port Orleans - Riverside is the ONLY resort in the Moderate or Value categories that accept 5 persons. Regrettably, it didn't take too long to find out where WDW Co., was skimping on cash. Sure, these are tough times for all, but there are some certain hotel no-nos that Disney should be setting an example for - especially when you spend on average about $100 per night more for a room just because of where it is. First of all, I can understand using the absolute cheapest toilet paper in the theme parks, but in a NICE hotel, they should consider stepping up at least one grade level of paper. Disney also chooses to use lesser grades of blankets and coverings. None of that soft under cover at THIS $200 hotel. Next, there was a fruit loop under the bed. Ok - no big deal. Hard to vacuum under there. The last straw is perhaps the most unforgivable. In every hotel I have ever stayed at, paper cups (or in this case, some sort of paper/styrofoam/plastic hybrid) are individually wrapped in plastic to ensure their sanitation. Not so at cheap-skate Disney. They just plop however many cups they need to for the next check in. The problem is, they don't throw away the cups from a previous guest. This can cause MEGA problems. Family of four stays in room, everyone drinks from their various cups and stacks them nice and neat on the counter. Guest checks out. Housekeeping sees cups nicely stacked and assumes they are not used. Next guest unwittingly uses same cups. How would I know this? When I separated my cups, there was grape juice all over one of the stacked cups. Again, unforgivable. Other than that, I loved my stay. I hope you do, too. Just remember to call Housekeeping and ask for fresh cups when you check in. Maybe someday they'll realize that 2 cents per cup is worth spending for sanitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good value Disney resort with beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: arkansanbelle
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed at Port Orleans last summer (we have previously stayed Disney at Boardwalk, BeachClub, and Animal Kingdom Lodge). This was a good value for our trip and helped us save money. The rooms were a little cramped but very clean. The grounds were beautiful with rich smells of old oaks and the atmosphere of the South which we love. The biggest hangup we had with this resort was the distance we had to walk to get to the lobby and the pool and the restaurant. (our bus stop was right behind our building, which was nice). Buses ran on time and the longest we waited was maybe 20 minutes one morning. The pool and hottub was a great treat for the kids and tired legs. The cafeteria was convenient but nothing to write home about. We rented bikes one day (which kids enjoyed more than we did). Overall, we would recommend this resort for the money.

Reviews.Title: “More like the East River-side.”
Reviews.Author: SnowH8er09
Reviews.Content: Upon my arrival at the Riverside resort I was informed that the room that I requested in the alligator bayou section was not avaiiable. This in spite of the fact that I had taken an extremely early flight from New York in order to obtain it . I was under the impression that rooms were assigned on a first come, first serve basis. Apparently ,these rooms are only for people with five members in their party. However a simple walk through the resort indicated otherwise.. Thanks for lying Disney. As if this was not enough aggravation for one day, the folks at Disney made my most magical dreams come true again by assigning me a room in the illustrious " Mansion Section". My "Mansion" came fully equipped with a larg array of various types of filth. Including dirty rugs, dirty scuffed up walls, a slimy remote control, a disgusting bathroom complete with bugs on the ceiling and mold in the shower. Oh and I almost forgot the grafitti written on the underside of the bed spread. It seems that the only thing disney failed to provide was a drug dealer in the stair case. (but then I didnt look in the staircase as I was too afraid). In the evening I wasnt sure if It was the Magic Kingdom fireworks I was hearing or 9 millimeter rounds being exchanged by rival gangs in the parking lot. Thank you for making my dreams come true indeed Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - More than we expected”
Reviews.Author: nick1981
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans for 5 nights in April and had a fantastic time - All the staff were very helpful and when we asked at check in to move to the magnolia bend area (better if you don't have kids with you) it was no problem and our room was changed in no time. We checked in at about 2ish and this seemed to be the best time as later in the day the check in queues were much longer. The resort itself is very well looked after and very pretty with plenty to do, the boat trip to downtown disney is a huge benefit as well and was so easy. Our room was very nice we had plenty of room for the two of us and everyday we came back the room was very nicely made up and there was a towel animal waiting for us. I have never stayed at a Disney hotel before but have been to florida several times and next time would defineatly come back to either this hotel or one of the other disney hotels as they have a certain magic to them that you would expect from Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Port Orleans Riverside”
Reviews.Author: FloridaGators
Reviews.Content: The past two times we have stayed on site at Disney, we have stayed at Port Orleans Riverside (mainly because that was the only hotel that had rooms available for the nights we were to be there). We were not at all disappointed when we arrived to the resort. It is one half of Disney's Port Orleans, with the other side being the French Quarter. Like all Disney hotels, the theming here is impecible. Check-in is easy, but can be a bit of a wait if you happen to arrive at the same time as a bus from the airport, but thats just the luck of the draw. The food court at this resort offers breakfast, lunch, and dinner, with basic foods (burgers, chicken tenders, etc). My main suggestion for this hotel would be to request a room in the Alligator Bayou section of the resort (prior to arrival). The rooms are fine, and the beds comfortable. And of course, the theming in the rooms is right on too. There are two bus depots by the Alligator Bayou rooms, but you may still have to walk, but not more than 5 mins. I still say that Coronado Springs is the best moderate in Disney, but the Riverside's Alligator Bayou rooms were a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Alligator Bayou section”
Reviews.Author: Brittll
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the 5th time last week. I love the theme of this resort. It's clean, comfortable, has a fridge, easy access to parking and bus stops if you need them, we used the laundry facility and it was clean and comfortable. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, peaceful resort”
Reviews.Author: LindaSeattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Acadian section of the resort and found it to be a very relaxing, quiet area of the resort. The adjacent pool was much quieter than the main pool and was never over crowded (even though the temps were in the high 90's) The dining area offered many food options and I felt the prices were fair. The layout of the resort is a bit confusing at first and it's easy to get turned around especially at night for the bus shuttle drop off. Rooms were clean. Staff were helpful. The boat shuttle to the Downtown Disney area is a pleasant ride but there is quite a backup line to return to the hotel. The busses to the parks were all timely.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Iloveemeraldisle
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights and loved this hotel. It was so beautiful and there was a ton of bunnies, otters, squirrels,and beautiful birds. My daughter loved the water slide more than the disney parks I think! The food court had reasonable prices and a wide selection to choose from. We ate such a large breakfast at the food court that we did not need a lunch and only had to eat dinner. They have a boat service to take you to Downtown Disney, you can rent boats to see the sights yourself, they have bikes that seat 4 people to rent, a horse carriage to also see the grounds, and my daughter loved the braiding hair section where she was able to get her hair braided with pretty beads. This hotel made our experience wonderful, we did not want to leave!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the hotle dont bother with the disney parks unless you have a mobility scooter”
Reviews.Author: eireflo
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel we were there for 2 weeks with our children age 9 (diabetic), 3 and 20 months. The pools were great, staff were great, and food was horrid - typical american rubish (but thats everywhere not just this hotel). We stayed in number 18 which was not too far from everything with over 3000 rooms the place was quite well for the first week at least the 2nd week turned out to be thanks giving and the food hall was crazy the the place itself was quite enough. we would reccomend the boat to go to downtown disney not the bus. we booked 2 weeks for all the theme parks and never went the 2nd week because of the buses and the parks were crazy but the buses were unreal. it takes 30mins to each park on the bus in florida. you have to fold down the buggys to get on to the bus even when the bus is empty and your child is sleeping. people who hire MOBILITY SCOOTERS get preference regardless of weather they need one or not (not talking about people in wheelchairs thats fine) people who are well able to walk hire these scooters and cant drive them it takes them 15mins to get on to the bus while you with the toddlers and babies have to wait for them to get on and then their family gets on so they can sit together and your left standing up holing a baby and /or seperated from your family and children because they take up all the seat and do you know what THERE JUST PLAIN LAZY they can WALK but couldnt be bothered too. so to get first preference hire one of these scooters. If you have kids you come 2nd disney world florida is not focused on kids its focused on the disabled but thats fine but not the fat lazy people jumping on the scooters and some of them wernt even over 12 stone and taking advantage they were just lazy. if your looking to go to disney world with young kids go to paris. cant fault the hotel at all, the surrey bikes are great fun also hire out a boat thats fantastic we never drove a boat before and it was great fun and easy too. my cousin went to florida he is paralised and can sit in a wheelchair he loved it and so did his family... my sister in law is in a wheelchair and also another cousin so im not against disabled people im against abled people who abuse it. (Big tip for people in ireland + uk pick up a cheep wheelchair in argos and bring it along with you get first preference..... lol only a joke)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Sunjack
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the POR from May 8th to the 15th and loved it. After reading the reviews we asked for building 34 in the Alligator section and requested the second floor and that is just what we got. Corner room too! It is very close to the West bus stop which was very convenient. We had a pool nearby, but it was a long ways to the main building but the walk was worth it. We hand fed the birds along the way and enjoyed the lake. We took a boat to downtown Disney which takes about 15 minutes and well worth it, much better after riding a bus to and from the theme parks. The room was very nice no complaints at all. It was large enough and the bed was comfortable (we had a king size). The maid even made animals out of the towels for us. The view was a garden view, it was quiet even though we were close to the bus stop. The air conditioner was a little loud but after walking around all day at the parks we fell asleep fast and it never really bothered us. The food is over priced in the food court but so is everything else (when you think about the beauty of Disney, the parades, entertainment etc the price is right). We had the dining plan which was way too much food for the two of us so we tried to eat right. We ate a lot of salads that were really yummy. It was about the only heathly thing besides the fruit. They have pizza, a pasta bar and and sandwiches. My husband and I split a turkey sandwich and it was plenty of food after it came with a side dish, drink and a dessert. Over all we enjoyed the hotel, the buses were frequent (only once did one run late and it was due to them having to pick up a handicap person prior to our stop) the boat rides were pleasant and the healthy food was good. We decided when we return (and we can't wait) we will definately chose the Port Orleans Riverside. One warning - if you drink buy your booze off the resort, a 6-pack of beer was $31.50! We bought hard liquor and it was much cheaper!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but would not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: travel4nj
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful vacation to Disney, but I would not recommend this hotel. I had called prior to arriving to request a certain room location. Although the woman was very nice on the phone, when we arrived my request was not met, nor even close to where I was looking to stay. We never received Disney animals made from the towels (which my kids were looking forward to after staying at the Caribbean Beach 4 years ago). Housekeeping was a run through each day ... I literally think they NEVER clean the rugs! The bare minimum was done! I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Relative peace, quiet, and less noisy kids!”
Reviews.Author: superbethany
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside, Magnolia Bend section (8090) to celebrate our 1st Anniversary. The grounds are gorgeous and IMMACULATE, as is the case everywhere in Disney. The staff is great. Obviously, you don't come to Disney World if you are trying to completely get away from kids, but if you're going as a couple or with adult friends, it's nice to have the inside scoop for grown-ups! So here are my pluses, minuses, and tips: PLUSES 1) Magnolia Bend (at least our immediate area) was VERY quiet. We booked a king-sized room and had a very peaceful stay. Perhaps this section is adults-only? Not sure. But anyway, it was a really nice break from the commotion of the parks. Please see cons for my FYI on 'other' noise issue! 2) The staff is fantastic (with the exception of Mousekeeping). We had a major glitch with our check-in, but the front desk staff really went above & beyond the call of duty to get things corrected. They even sent a little gift to our room to apologize...very nice gesture. Mistakes will happen, but they way you handle it is what really matters. These women & men were top-notch! Honestly, we were a little worried when we heard how Disney was cutting back staff, but we were still impressed with the level of service. 3) Food on the property, and all over Disney, was awesome. We were on the dining plan and found it to be beneficial. Probably wouldn't have been as thrilled if we had to actually pay the listed prices (which are outrageous), but we milked the dining plan for all it was worth! Filet mignon every night LOL. We dined at Jiko (killer!), The Wave (best in Disney, in my humble opinion), Boatwrights, Tony's, and the Sci-Fi Diner. We had great counter-service at Flame Tree in Animal Kingdom. BEST BBQ on the planet! The biggest downside to the dining plan is there are NO substitutions. We don't usually like to eat a big dessert after lunch, so that part was a waste. Would have been nice to have an appetizer instead, or to be able to pick up something else later. 4) The boat to Downtown Disney is a must-do. So relaxing & serene. Can't comment on other Disney transportation svcs, except that it seems to run pretty consistently. We had a rental car since we also had tickets to Universal Studios....which, btw, was fantastic. The attractions are far better than the Disney Parks if you are with a group of adults/teens....highly recommend. 5) Cirque du Soliel. You simply have to experience this. Now for the minuses...and none were bad enough to keep us from coming back! 1) Mousekeeping is hit or miss. Don't expect to be wowed. I overheard other guests saying the same. Weird, b/c Disney seems to really set the bar for service. The first couple days we left healthy tips, hoping things would improve, but sadly, they did not. On a bright note...no tropical bugs surprised us, and the maids respect the do-not-disturb signs (probably b/c they aren't in a hurry to clean, anyway!) 2) Toilet flushing! These are some MEGA flushes, and you WILL hear it through the walls & the ceilings. It woke us up a few times, but it still beats screaming kids. 3) Room size. We knew what to expect ahead of time & the pictures are very accurate. This room was fine for the two of us, but I don't know how larger parties would manage. Also privacy could be an issue if you're that type of guy/gal. Overall, I would probably stay here again if the price was right. TIPS for those traveling without kids, or who want to avoid throngs: 1) Ask about non-peak times at restaurants 2) If you're gonna do the Magic Kingdom, wait until the Extra Magic EVENINGS, or on an overcast/drizzly day. Parents scrambled out of the parks at the first drop of rain, and also at night after the fireworks show, which was lovely for us! 3) Epcot is great for boozing, gluttony & peacful strolls through lush greenery if you're into that sort of thing..and is the least favorite park for many kids! Wink wink.... 4) Animal Kingdom is great for a day in the shade. Seems to be 10 degrees cooler. 5) Not many (any?) baby attractions at Hollywood Studios, so this tends to be an older crowd. 6) The Boardwalk Hotel area has nightclubs, a sports club and a piano bar...all kid-free!!! (At night, anyway). 7) RENT A CAR!!! Totally worth the extra expense. Nothing beats the freedom of traveling when you darn well feel like it....and without other people's noisy little ones. :-)

Reviews.Title: “best value in disney”
Reviews.Author: WIFamily
Reviews.Content: Our family of five just returned from a week's stay at Riverside. It was awesome! We looked at some of the other properties while there and were glad we picked Riverside. Compared to other resorts it was much more peaceful and private even though it is huge and sprawling. Bus system works almost flawlessly. We stayed in bldg 14 which I would recommend. We were three minutes from the restaurants, bus stop and two pools. The main pool is nice but crowded, so we really appreciated the others pools scattered throughout the property. Quick service restaurant is good for the cafeteria it is. The sit down restaurant, Boatwright's is nothing special at all. If possible make reservations at Boma, an African buffet at Animal Kingdom Lodge--it is one of the best meals out there for families--plus kids get to see giraffes, zebras and more right outside the window. All in all, Riverside is good value. Because it is centrally localled it is never more than a 15 minutes bus ride to Epcot, Magic Kingdom, Animal Kingdom or Hollywood Studios. There is nice boat shuttle down the river to Downtown Disney where kids will love a huge Lego store and big shop with all the Disney stuff available in wide variety. Rooms are small but bearable. We had two adults and three kids (11, 9 and 8) and the trundle bed works great. Plus with the curtain area toward the bathroom, you can close the curtain and read while the kids fall asleep (which won't take long as they will be very tired). All in all I think Riverside is the best value at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic vacation”
Reviews.Author: HarrisMom
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend trip with my two daughters (ages 4 & 8) and we all loved the Port Orleans Riverside. Had originally wanted the French Quarter but we ended up going to Riverside and happy we did. The hotel grounds are quiet and serene. We've stayed at other Disney hotels including Pop Century and the Wilderness Lodge, but definitely enjoyed the Riverside just as well, if not more, than those hotels. The evening carriage rides were very charming, and our room (in Magnolia Bend area) was very nice and really close to the main lobby (less than a 5 minute walk). We did have to wait for the bus on more than one occasion, but nothing too excessive. One oops that we made was getting off the bus at the French Quarter stop rather than Riverside. No announcement was made and after we exited the bus, and it drove away, we realized our mistake. A cast member took pity on us (since it was 90 degrees and I was attempting to carry my sleeping 4 yr old) by offering us a lift almost to our room door in a golf cart. The comment he made was that we weren't the first to make the mistake. I'm just appreciative he was kind enough to offer us a ride. Regarding the pools, we used multiple pools at the Riverside as well as Doubloon Lagoon at the FQ during our stay. All the pools were very clean and best of all not cold. The kids especially loved the water slides which were sized just right for the younger crowd. The food selection in the food court was surprisely good (don't miss the create your own pasta station, it was amazing). The bakery items are not to be missed either, especially the chocolate croissants. Everything we got there was delicious and very fresh. That's not something we've always found at the other resorts. The one negative comment I have to make was about the room cleanliness. While the bathroom area was always spotless, my kids found chewed up dried gum under one of the beds as well as a dirty headband and a partially rotten apple. Overall though, we were very pleased with the hotel, and it was an excellent vacation. We're already planning our return visit to Disney and the Port Orleans Riverside.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent grounds, ok room”
Reviews.Author: beckypooh
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 including myself, my husband, and our 2 year old twins stayed in the "Magnolia Terrace" building May 2 - May 9, 2009 using the Buy 4 get 3 free promotion. I booked through a travel agent this time and while I still faxed in our room requests, I think our requests were largely ignored because we didn't book directly with Disney. We stayed at Pop last Sept 08 and had all of our requests honored. This time when my husband went to check us in we were able to get a ground floor room only because my husband insisted; we were able to check in early though which was a big plus. I was pretty disapointed in the room furnishings. The armoire and tables & chairs had plenty of scratches on their finish which I thought was unattractive. The light fixtures and any "hard to reach" areas were very dusty which was off putting, to me at least. The bathroom fixtures were always clean however. The hotel was quiet and the grounds were very serene which was the best part of the hotel in my opinion. We only used the bus once since we rented a car; nice plus about this all exterior corridor hotel is you can get a room very close to where your car is parked. We didn't recieve any towel animals although it must have been apparent that we had 2 young children due to our 2 pack n play cribs which Disney provided free of charge. We did tip every day and recieved lots of extra soaps, shampoos and towels which we didn't really need. I'm not sure we would stay here again; both my husband and I thought we couldn't really tell much difference in the room size from Pop Century and Pop had more child friendly features like scratch resistant furniture, wall thermostats as opposed to free standing air conditioners, and better positioning of the furniture to accommodate pack n play cribs. The beds were comfortable and over all we were happy with the resort; we just didn't think we'd be willing to pay the additional cost over a value resort unless Disney offered an exceptionally good deal again.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly suprised by everything...”
Reviews.Author: hake
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans in April 2009 and was pleasantly suprised that it was nicer than we imagined. Having our initial worries that it was going to be very full on disney it was very relaxed and scenic with the river running through the grounds and lots of greenery and wildlife. The rooms however were not very big and sharing it with 3 young children the lack of wardrobe space was a problem. The room had what looked to be a large wardrobe but when you opened it the extremely large TV was inside. But the beds were comfortable enough and due to the fact that you were never in it apart from sleeping it served its purpose well. The disney transportation was just so easy and efficient and we never had a problem getting a seat or waiting for a bus, apart from when a private hire one picked us up and took us to the wrong water park. The food was a little boring after 2 weeks of eating the same things in the hotel but in downtown disney you struggled to get a reservation so i would suggest that if you do have a planner then make reservations (your hotel reception will do this for you) can reccommend Portobellos in Downtown Disney and Primetime Cafe in Disney Hollywood Studios. Watch out for Mamma ! The parks are so well organised and would recommend getting ultimate disney ticket as it was so easy to use and fastpass was a saviour but still struggled to get on the more popular rides. Toystory Mania is a must for young children but the queues for fastpass went quick. Did not use the disney dining plan and when looking at options dont think it would have saved us money. All in all would definately reccomend this hotel if your main plan is to visit all the disney parks as it could not be better located and the boat to downtown disney was one of its benefits as it meant not having to queue for the bus back to hotel at night.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING resort - very relaxing after a day in the parks”
Reviews.Author: ontariocanadafamily
Reviews.Content: I promised that I would write a review as I found all of them on here so helpful.... We stayed here April 19-26 (myself, husband and 8 year old son). We were in Aligator Bayou building 14 which was right beside the food court and very close to the south depot (I could go and get coffee in the mornings and be back in less then 5 minutes). Our room was comfortable and mousekeeping was great. The grounds were amazing and a big relaxing change from the crazyness of the parks. It was a great place to unwind. The food court was very busy in the mornings but we expected that ater reading other reviews, my husband found the portions small for an adult male compared to most other Disney restaurants but there was plenty for me (so we only ate here twice). The buses were crouded at times and the drivers really pack you on but oh well..... at least you got back fast! We had very small wait times for a bus so we really liked this system and wouldn't rent a car next time. We used the quiet pool by building 18 instead of the busier old man's island and some highschool groups showed up midweek and made things louder there. Overall we had an amazing time. We were also on the meal plan which is very handy and saved us quite a few dollars. Disney has a lot of amazing restaurants! This was our first time onsite (stayed offsite in 2005) and I would stay here again hands down!!

Reviews.Title: “Super!”
Reviews.Author: glbkge
Reviews.Content: Our room was very comfortable & the grounds. were lovely. The building we were in was a short walk to the east depot of the shuttle & close to one of the smaller pools which we ended up preferring over the themed pool because it was less crowded. The quick service eatery was great once we learned our way around. The sit-down restaurant was lovely. The only negative was the charge for wifi.

Reviews.Title: “I will not stay there ever again!”
Reviews.Author: jules825
Reviews.Content: We had an item stolen from our room, and the front desk said they we not responsible for it. It was not some thing of great value maybe a twenty dollar value,But they had no apology for us. I have been to Walt Disney World 18 times in my life and that was the worst trip ever! I have stayed at the other resorts and have vary good experiences, but this one has really disappointed me and my family.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds”
Reviews.Author: Kaw5454
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here and experienced a wonderful time. Our rooms were clean and comfortable. The pool was a beautiful. I actually witnessed a child having difficulty swimming in the pool and the lifeguard immeaditly jumped in the pool to help her. It was impressive. Getting around was simple and did not take long. I would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for a family”
Reviews.Author: Wisnative
Reviews.Content: This was my seventh trip to WDW and 5th time staying on property. I discovered Riverside three trips ago and decided that this was the one that made me the most comfortable. My five year old lost his lanyard with two days to go, with his room key, Park Hopper Pass, and all his pins. We went to guest services. After a quick search, they replaced the lanyard, room key, Park Pass, and gave him a dozen exclusive pins that hadn't even been issued yet. That is providing service way above what is expected. They will go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable, but may be less likely to if you demand it. They are human too.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Stunning resort”
Reviews.Author: tinkandpetersmum
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful resort this is!!! We stayed here for the first time and had a wonderful time. The resort itself is beautiful. Set along the Sassagoula River the rooms are lovely, well equiped and very clean. The food court does get bustYat times but this is just testament to the great food they serve in there. The pool areas are great and very clean and my children loved the slide!!! The check in and concierge staff were very friendly and helpful and always had a smile on their face. All in all this is a simply stunning resort with fantastic facilities and I wouldnt hesitate to recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Had a blast!”
Reviews.Author: djbc
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week at POR - 4/18-4/25. Traveled with two teens (19 & 18) who had their own room. We saved over $500 by getting two rooms at a moderate resort instead of having 4 adults stay in one room at a deluxe resort (this suggestion was made by Walt Disney travel company. Pools were great, grounds are beautiful, kids raved about food options at the food court (we had Quickservice plan). This was our 4th trip to Disney - first at this hotel and if/when we go back we will stay here again. Our rooms were in Oak Manor and were a little tired looking but spotless.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I was still there!”
Reviews.Author: cam3Halifax
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Port Orleans on April 21st and I wish I were back already. The grounds are absolutely gorgeous! The resort is tranquil and very relaxing and the weather was delightful, sunny and warm! There are boats that take you to Downtown Disney and that is a great esperience in itself. The rooms are "moderate" as they are listed, clean but not fancy. The rooms have two sinks which was very convenient and there is also a frig. which is great for fruit , milk and other drinks. If you love coffee, take your favorite kind with you as the coffee at disney (everywhere) is horrible. There is a small coffee maker in the room and you can get half & half at the food court. Towels were rather dingy for the first 3 days and then we got nice white thick ones for the rest of the time we were there. The beds are only changed once every 3 days. We stayed in Magnolia Terrace and were pleased and found it very quiet. The only con for us was the check-in staff -----not great--- and for us they were not accommodating after requesting a room with a king size bed and on an upper floor (I have severe allergies to mold, dust, etc) way back in February. We were first put in a room on the first floor way at the back of the building facing a parking lot, and it was musty smelling and damp when we went in. We had to go back to the desk lugging heavy suit cases and insisted to be put on the second floor. After 20 minutes the young fellow finally came out and gave us a room on second floor, not offering to have our luggage taken back there for us and clearly not particularily pleased to have to wait on us for a second time. Perhaps another clerk would have been more helpful. I should have insisted on speaking to his Supervisor and would definately do so another time. I would only go back to this particular resort if I were guaranteed, in writing, a king size bedroom on the upper floor facing the river or side. That was the only thing I can complain about as the rest of the vacation was just spectacular!!I You can rent bikes, boats, surey's (bicycles with 4 wheels and 2 seats) horse and carriage rides (even the horses have a bag type catcher so that the droppings are not going on the grounds!) The food court has a lot of good selections. If you like coffee, tea, soda pop, lemonade, etc., it is a good deal to purchase one of the mugs that they sell for about $13.00 and you can get all the refills you want for the duration of your stay at any resort. It is not good at the Theme Parks. If you want a real eye opening treat, go to the Grand Floridian Cafe for a lunch of dinner, it is absolutely awsome! The entertainment in the evening is out of this world. You can use your dinning plan there and the food is great. To get there you take a bus to downtown disney and catch the bus to the Grand Floridian Hotel or you can get there by monorail. It stops in front of the Hotel. Allow about an hour to get to any restaurant for reservation. Also, most restaurants require that you arrive and check in with them 20 minutes prior to your reservation, we saw folks turned away from Crystal Palace because they arrived at the time of their reservation. Be there early!!! The little french pastery shop at the French pavillion in Epcot is wonderful, you can have them pack up a sandwich or what ever takes your fancy, grab a nice bottle of wine across the street and have a wonderful supper in the comfort of your own room after a busy day of exploring. If you are going to the swimming pool take a towel from your room, there is a rental charge if you get them at the pool. If you plan to take a cell phone and you are from Canada, check to make sure (from a reliable source) that you will have service. We asked at the aliant shop and they told us it would work, it did not. The cards you purchase at the resorts at Disney are $10 or $20 dollars and give you 19 minutes for $10.00, the problem is that you are charged connecting fees and on top of that, it starts deducting minutes as soon as you dial the number .... I was left with 5 minutes of actual talking time. Get a calling card from Canada before you leave --they don't have connecting fees. Hope this is helpful if you are planning to go here.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Disney Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Thumper650cs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at PO - Riverside April 19 - April 25 2009 (weather 80-90 degrees all week) - We booked our trip through Boscov's Travel out of North East PA. They were VERY helpful and VERY knowledgeable regarding our visit to PO Riverside. Our Travel agent (Julie W) was great in helping me plan my trip. I highly recommend if you are in the North Eastern PA area and plan on going to Disney, you use Boscov's Travel. (I know it sounds like an advertisement but I feel strongly about our experience.) Check-In: We arrived at PO Riverside at 9:00 AM - We stood in line for about 4-5 minutes waiting to check in when a Cast member of PO Riverside came and whisked us away to a free check-in attendant. She was very sweet and happy to assist us; everybody at the hotel ALWAYS treated us like we were their most important guest. We were told that our room may not be ready when we check in BUT to our surprise, it was. Our room was in Building 95. (Great Location). We were given a map to the hotel and where our room was and to our amazement it was right across the bridge from the main lobby and food court. Pools: The quiet pool was also directly next to our room. When our girls (12yrs old) asked how long the pools were open till they told them the main pool was only open till 12:00 mid-night but if they were quiet they could swim in the pool next to our room all night. (Which they did). Food: The food court was always clean and the food was really good. I would have to say the Mickey shaped waffles were our favorites. Transportation: There are only four Disney Transportation stops in PO Riverside which made getting to the parks and back quick. The busses always arrive at the South Depot first then go on to North -East-West. Knowing this: on your way out you have to stop at all other depots but on the way back in from parks you are the first stop. Great after a long day. Atmosphere: The overall atmosphere of PO Riverside is beautiful. This resort has a Southern feel to it. As you will see in my attached photos the hotels look more like mansions than hotels, makes you feel like youâ€™re in the Deep South. Recommendation: I highly recommend Port Orleans Riverside to ANYONE. I feel you can't go wrong. Enjoy our photos and have a great trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Good as always at Disney”
Reviews.Author: Nochmar5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans Riverside for the third time and it was good as always. To compare the "level" of the hotel to a chain; I would say it's comparable to a Holiday Inn. We were surprised and unaware that the table service restaurant onsite is now only serving dinner, so we ran into some problems with our meal plan; only table service credit remained and our early flight wouldn't allow going elsewhere the next morning. I spoke with two people at the front desk and concierge and was told there was nothing that could be done; I spoke with the Quick Service Restaurant Manager and she helped promptly. The rooms are always nice, clean but a shade on the small side. We were bordering a smaller pool, but the noise never bothered us. The walk to the bus stop and store was short and filled with lovely scenery. One thing that's always driven me nuts about the Port Orleans is that the bus stops to return from the parks are always at the furthest parking stall from the entrance/exit. No matter which park; it's the same. When you're dragging after a day in the park, it seems significant.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking!”
Reviews.Author: Disneygrammy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here (4) times. We would not go anywhere else. I love the atmosphere of the resort. Everyone is so kind and helpful. The first time we stayed here was 1999. It was called Dixie Landings then. We came back in 2001, 2005 & 2007. I cannot wait to book another trip to Disney World. I am 63 and my husband will be 72 on May 1st. I think that I get as excited as our grandkids do when they know that they are coming.

Reviews.Title: “okay accomadation for the money”
Reviews.Author: disney-pals
Reviews.Content: We stayed in port orleans riverside for 14nights in july 2008, i had read alot of reviews and i have to say people must complain about anything. I have stayed in many disney hotels, this year i am staying in the yacht resort but as for port orleans it is a big resort it has about 4 small pools (but there is no lifeguard only at the main pool ) The room was big enough for my family of 4 with 2 double beds. The sinks are outside of the toilet which is more convinient as this means if someone is in the shower u can use the outside dressing area. There is a main food court area which sells burgers, pizzas, sandwiches etc there is also a bar that has live music playing it sells a graet selection of beers and cocktails and even my fav champagne by the glass, the atmosphere in the bar is very friendly and inviting this is a bonus to this resort. There are a few bus stops as the resort is so big but saying that the disney transportation system i think is very good, of course u no off a night if you want 2 avoid the rush leave just before the end of the fireworks or find a place 2 view them nearer 2 the exit. on a whole this is not a deluxe resort but you are not paying for a deluxe resort but i would recomend this hotel it is a great base and it allows you extra magic hours in the park and free transportation . i would say that this hotel is far better than a value resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!”
Reviews.Author: jalicea
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an 8 day stay at this resort. Although we have been to WDW on several occasions this was our first time staying in a Disney resort and I have to say that overall the experience was fantastic. Check-in was fast and easy as I had used their 'Online Check-in' service prior to arrival. The cast member was very friendly and helpful. The bellman that drove us to our room was also exceptionally nice and friendly. The grounds of the hotel were beautifully kept and had all the little 'theming' details you come to expect from Disney. The room itself was very clean upon arrival and stayed that way throughout our stay; it was a bit on the smaller side but suit us just fine. It had a small fridge, safe, iron and ironing board. There was 5 of us in the room so the trundle bed was used by an adult. She seemed to be okay with it as there were no complaints. The hotel also had an expansive food court and sit-down restaurant; I recommend the food court but not the full-service restaurant (Boatwright's). We were quite disappointed with our meals. My wife and I ordered the Jambalaya and I have to say it was the worst I ever had, meats were tough and salty. My wife sent hers back to get just chicken with rice. It came back extremely salty so she ordered something else from the menu. That was prepared so tough she chose to skip the dinner altogether. We had eaten a turkey dinner at the food court the night before and that was ten times better than the Jambalaya. The main pool was very nice and big. The wife and kids had a good time there. There is a boat that takes you to Downtown Disney at this hotel, which was pretty cool and convenient. Also we had the convenience of having a bus stop real close to our room. During our entire stay I only had an issue with waiting for a Hollywood Studios bus. It took one hour for one to get to the resort, which was very uncommon considering that the most we usually waited was 10 mins. on any given occasion. And although we did not take full advantage of the Early/ Extended hours I have to say it is a nice perk to have. NOTE; I highly recommend getting the meal plan if you are planning on going to Disney. We had it for the first time and we got our money's worth and then some.

Reviews.Title: “The Good The Bad & The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: benjsda
Reviews.Content: The Good. The grounds are beautiful. The Food court is actual quite reasonable and the pool is great for the kids. The Bad. The front of house was the worst I have ever experienced. They lied to me and questioned my integrity. The Ugly. We had to move rooms three times. The first room (Alligator Bayou, 15) was filthy, hair in the bath, remains in the toilet and the heating/cooling system was hanging off. The second room was located in Magnolia Bend Room 8925. This is located right beside some sort of system that kept us awake all night. The third room was ground floor on Magnolia Bend (8540). Very noisy at night (not the fault of the Hotel). We could hear upstairs flushing the toilet all night every night. We did not sleep for 10 nights then finally moved hotels. We stayed at Easter/Spring Break so it was a very busy time but that shouldnot be an excuse for the front of house service. It really was verging on the appalling.

Reviews.Title: “Good resort, reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: zoomerOntario_Canada
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a weekend getaway to Disney World, April 16 - 20. My boyfriend and I stayed at Port Orleans - Riverside for four nights, our first time at a Disney resort. Staff members were very helfpul, bus rides and water taxi's to theme parks abundant and puncutal, the grounds well maintained. Housekeeping did an excellent job supplying us with plenty of towels and necessities, and our room was cozy with two double beds - a family of four would be very crammed! The cafeteria style restaurant is great for breakfast, staff/cooks are very efficient and keep the lines moving. We ate dinner one night at the restaurant on the resort, which was overpriced and lacking quality - Downtown Disney is a short bus ride away if you're looking for a better meal. We took advantage of the jogging trails, pools, and boat rentals at the resort as well. I am pleased with our decision to stay at Riverside; it is spacious enough that you aren't walking on top of people or bumping into kids everywhere you go. A great choice for families/couples looking for a good deal at a laid back resort.

Reviews.Title: “The grounds and ammenities were perfect for us.”
Reviews.Author: Canadianmotherof4
Reviews.Content: I had done some research ahead of time and read the reviews for the moderate value resorts at Disney World. This resort was everything the reviews promised. The grounds and location along with the food court was fantastic. We traveled as a group of 8 which included myself, my husband, our 4 children aged 9, 12, 13 & 16 along with both our Moms aged 71 & 75. We stayed in the Magnolia Bend which was centrally located to the pools, the food area and two bus stops. The service we received was excellent. Our only complaints were that the check in line up and the concierge line up were both very long. We were supposed to have ground floor rooms as our Moms' struggle with stairs but ended up on the second floor which luckily had an elevator, but this was still inconvenient for our Moms' who were driving rented electric scooters. Also we did not get the adjoining rooms we were promised (as the resort could not put the six of us in our immediate family into one room). We were right next door to each other but this wasn't a great way to sleep at night . Our room was a little dusty in some hard to reach places and our fridge initially wasn't working but it was fixed immediately. However the grounds and location more than made up for it. The highlight of this resort was the boat ride to downtown Disney. It was so beautiful and for the most uncrowded. It was a great way to unwind from the huge crowds in the parks. We loved the pools and the laundromat was right next to our building (another plus for us). When the check in and baggage delivery took too long the staff found a private van to get us on time to our dinner show reservation. The food in the food court was reasonable and no long line ups and always an empty table. Beware though, no free internet services any where and no business center to access a computer. We used the Disney Magical Express to travel from the resort to the airport and this was a definite bonus. On of our real disappointments had nothing to do with the resort but one of the benefits in staying at the resort which was the added hours that were supposed to be available only to those staying in the resort. This did not happen in any of the late evening hours, anyone who was already in the park was allowed to stay. As the parks were very busy during regular hours we were looking forward to this perk which turned out to be a falsehood. Shame on Disney for that.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good but not a great value”
Reviews.Author: noduh
Reviews.Content: It's always nice to stay on Disney property even though you know you're paying a premium. My wife and I have vowed off Disney theme parks, especially the Magic Kingdom and Epcot (which is so outdated as to be a joke). Our kids and grandkids are on their own. But we like the resorts, which brings me back to Port Orleans Riverside. There are better resorts though you'll likely pay more for them. The Riverside pluses: beautiful grounds, convenient location, great transportation by bus or boat, decent room size and amenities by Disney "moderate" standards. Cons: the other critics are right about the loud plumbing especially neighbors' toilet flush, food area very hectic. If price is no object, I would recommend (in order of preference) Animal Kingdom resort, Saratoga Springs, Beach Club.

Reviews.Title: “7 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: thausagethandwich
Reviews.Content: Have just returned having spent a week at this hotel. It aspires to be a 4 star and on balance I think that is a fair rating. The best things being the hotel grounds, the boat link to Downtown Disney, and the staff. The food in the cafeteria was ok in terms of quality and cost. The hotel room was a good size. However, the bathroom/ washbasin area looked a little dated (more akin to a 2 or 3 star). The bed wasn't great as it was so creaky. The main pool was nice, the others were adequate (fairly basic in design - but clean etc). The room service menu was pretty basic - however, the cafereria was only a short walk away so you soon got over that. My only other gripe is that the accommodation is dispersed over quite a wide area and they could do with some more sign posts as it really is a bit of a maze. The key question is would I go back - yes I would!! Overall a good experience for what I paid. I

Reviews.Title: “loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: chewy961
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from a wonderful trip to WDW April 3-7. This hotel is absolutely gorgeous. The grounds were immaculate. Our room was just the perfect size for us, 2 Adults and 2 kids.... it was clean and everything was replaced as we asked everyday. Only one towel animal on the night before we left, but it was okay. We were in building 90 of the Magolina Bend with a corner room and view of the river. This was the perfect location for us, very close to the main building and close to the main pool. The pool was so much fun, my son was in it for hours... we didn't get to try the restaurants as we were on the dining plan and had already made all of our reservations elsewhere. Check in was a breeze and very easy to locate our building. So no compliants here!

Reviews.Title: “Laid back Disney”
Reviews.Author: mpteke
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans Riverside from 4-11 April 2009. Overall it was a pleasant experience and about what I expected based on my eating at Boatrights, the hotel restraunt, on a previous vacation. We have a family of 5 to include 2 adults, 2 grade school children, and a 2 year old and the room fit us fine with the pack and play behind the curtain to the bathroom area so he could sleep at night and nap in the afternoons. We were by the quiet pool in alligator bayou building 17 which is adjacent to a parking lot. This made the loading and unloading of our vehicle easy but it was quite a walk to the main heated pool and hotel lobby hub which is the center of everything. It was a pleasant trip, the proximity to the parks and downtown disney is unbeatable but you are paying for this as well. The highlights of this resort were the boat ride to downtown disney and the piano player at the river roost (he plays wed-sat). Would I stay at Port Orleans again? I would but I think I would stay at the french quarter side that seemed a little more well maintained and less crowded if I were to stay again at Port Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely grounds, not too much Disney, soundproofing issues”
Reviews.Author: Lizzim
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 days in March as part of our two week holiday. We arrived at about 8pm and although dark had no issues finding our room as others have mentioned. There were signs and the map wasn't difficult to read. We had a kingsize room in building 37, the walk was quite nice and we saw turtles most days! The Food Court had quite a good variety of choices. We bought the refillable cups and made many trips to refill them - making them excellent value at $12.95. We also liked the boat to Downtown Disney, although the queue was quite long at peak times - made a nice change from the buses. We also rented one of the pontoon boats to take out on the river, this was a fun way to spend half an hour. The only real downside to this hotel for us was the soundproofing - on several occasions we could hear the people upstairs talking and using the bathroom. Having said that we probably would still return to this hotel as the overall package was good.

Reviews.Title: “It is Disney World Nothing bad to say”
Reviews.Author: disneyfan1972
Reviews.Content: My wife, children, and I stayed there during the week of March 19th. The rooms were great, clean and roomy enough for all of us. I do not dwell to much on room settings seeing that my eyes are usually closed while in the room (sleeping). The resort itself was clean with plenty of things to do and places to go. Buses pick you up to drive you anywhere you want in Disney World. The differnet cafe's and resturants they have are great and wewll priced. Cannot wait to go back. Actually thinking about becomming a vacation club member.

Reviews.Title: “2nd experience at Riverside”
Reviews.Author: julietsmom
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay so much in 2005 that we returned this year. I asked for the same building (Alligator Bayou #18) because of its proximity to the main building/food court; and while I wasn't given guarantees via phone, they were able to accommodate us when we arrived. Our room was on the 1st floor (also requested as we are no spring chickens), clean and well stocked with coffee and toiletries. The maid service had even fashioned a Mickey Mouse outline on the bed made of rolled towels. Very cute. The food court was terribly crowded (spring break...my fault), but the servers and cashiers did their best to keep people moving. Would suggest avoiding the 9-10 am hour. Go either earlier or later. The food was delicious w/a variety of choices. The parks were also very crowded; Fast Pass was a Godsend. An added advantage to staying at Riverside is the free ferry to Downtown Disney which we used three times. It runs every 20 minutes and is a pleasant 30 minute tour. Recommended restaurants in Downtown Disney: T-Rex and Rainforest Cafe. Both were excellent and worth the trip just for the decor.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Best Trip Ever! Even I , ME could not complain!”
Reviews.Author: beeneverywhereDfw
Reviews.Content: Were back! Just returned from a 7 day Walt Disney vacation! 10 Stars!!!!! Talk about the time of our lives! If you have never in your life experienced Disney, it is a must do, have to have, Top notch vacation! Even me yes me. could not find one thing to complain about! Yeah thatâ€™s right! Even from the start, when our flight got delayed due to bad weather, and we didnâ€™t arrive to Disney until 10:00pm at night! Disney greeted us with a 75.00 credit, and a gigantic welcome with a smile! We stayed at one of the moderate resortâ€™s Port of Orleans Riverside . Beautiful! Clean! Excellent service! Animal towels everyday, Mickey soap, shampoo, clean room everyday! We took advantage of the dining plan which includes: Character breakfast/dinner one each day, counter meal each day, and snack each day. We all gained 5.lbs. We ate at the best restaurants; Hollywood studios had two great ones: Hollywood and Vine, excellent buffet style. They had a beautiful salad bar, Prime Rib, Roasted Chicken, Seafood Pasta Alfredo, and much more, then there was 50â€™s Prime Time, this was themed after 1950â€™s style home kitchens. All of the serverâ€™s names were mom and they were all in character, they made you take your elbows off of the table, eat all your veggies, and say yes mam and no mam, the food was great home-style cooking with Pot Roast, Steak, and Fried chicken. In Epcot they had a fantastic restaurant by the name of Laisellie (spelling oops!) this is a 5 star upscale spot in the Canada section; here is where we celebrated our daughters 13th Birthday. We each had a Filet topped with garlic mushroom gravy; they sang and brought my daighter a telephone with Goofy on the line wishing her a happy Birthday. We ate at several other places but those places stood out the most! Okay the fun begins! We started with Magic Kingdom AWESOME from the moment you step through the front gate! I am talking Huge Parades every hour, Music was phenomenal, everything was over the top, perfect, and nothing at Disney is half way done! We took advantage of the free fast passes and never stood in line more than 20 minutes (this is available to everone until the passes run out. You scan your room key and the machine will print out a ticket with a time for you to come back and ride the ride, you have to get these early in the day). The end of the night fireworks show â€œWishesâ€� was breathtaking, I cried three times, just in disbelief that I was actually there. Watching my kidâ€™s faces was just indescribable! I always felt that my kids were spoiled and unappreciative, but not this time! They were so grateful and happy! No arguing! Just in complete Bliss! 2nd day we went to Animal Kingdom, which is like going to the zoo! My son was even pulled into the Lion King Stage show! 3rd day we took a rest and slept in, went swimming over at French Quarter, which by the way is availble to all guests. We took a Ferry boat to downtown Disney for shopping with the $200.00 gift card that came with the package! I ended up buying three lanyards with Disney pins! Let me tell you about this! Every kid at Disney is doing this! You buy a lanyard with character pins, they are all valued differently! The trick is! You buy cheap and go around to cast members who wear the Lanyards with Pins and you trade with them. They have to trade with you no matter if you have a small inexpensive pen you can trade for whatever pin you like. So let me tell you, my kids had more fun running up to the employees asking to see their pins and trading, than they did riding the rides! Fantastic idea from Walt Disney because it detours the attention from standing in line to trading pens. So all of the kids walk around comparing there pins to the other kids, before you know it it's time to board the ride! So anyway, back to the trip, so after we were rested from the Ferry Ride! We took the monorail to one of the other resorts and had a wonderful dinner at Ohanas with Lilo and Sticth at the Polynesian themed resort with big sumo wrestler looking chefs behind the big flames, grilling up Steak, turkey and giant shrimp on skewers. This is a literally a feast! Not beetr than Texas de Brazil, But similar! The next morning we woke up and went fishing at our resort, where my 9 year old son caught a fish!
