He has been talking about catching that fish for days now! â€œCan you believe I caught a fishâ€� he sayâ€™s over and over geeesh! Then we headed to our favorite park of all Hollywood Studios! We went there twice! The American Idol Show was great! If 7you want to audition you have to be 14. And it takes an entire day if you get chosen to do the show! So be prepared! OMG! Everywhere you look people are acting like big Hollywood stars, driving around in old time cars, big extravagant colorful costumes. Parades, and the best show I ever seen was Fantasmic! AWWWWWWW! It is a water show under the stars! They play cartoons on a huge Water Screen, with vibrant laser lights and fireworks. I canâ€™t even describe it other than beautiful! Music was moving and just a perfect ending to a perfect day! The next day we went to Epcot! We enjoyed visiting all of the different countryâ€™s France , Canada , China , Germany , America , Mexico , each of the counties had a show telling about the country! Very educational! My husband got pulled into a show! Hilarious! Best rides must get fast passes for these: #1 Souring (Epcot) you feel like your flying, this ride is amazing! #2 Test Track (Epcot) you drive in a race car going 60 around a speed track, testing different road conditions ice, heat, bumpy. They even do a crash test with you on it! #3 Rockin Roller-Coaster (Hollywood Studios) 0-60 in .2 seconds! #4 Toy Story Mania ( Hollywood ) Youâ€™re inside of a video game #5 Dinosaur (Animal Kingdom) Roller-Coaster, You have giant dinosaurâ€™s popping out at you. #6 Tower of Terror ( Hollywood ) Big Hotel elevator that drops you 15 stories! Well that about tells you our vacation story! Making memories! Enjoying Family! And loving this life that we live! P.s. Word of advice! # 1 Take your own camera, do not trust disposable cameras! As you can see the quality of the photos are terrible! Butâ€¦. At least we have pictures! CVS damaged a whole roll! I was very hurt! Anyway the video quality isn't that great because I had to make the file smaller. Sorry! # 2 Book a non-stop flight! Do not use Delta! Very unorganized!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Disney Standards”
Reviews.Author: AJmom143
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms for my son'd first trip into Magic Kingdom. Upon check in, NO Valet or Bellman service, do not unpack your car until you DRIVE to your room. Check in was smooth and friendly. It was a little difficult to find the rooms, but we managed with no assistance or escort from the hotel. Our first warning was the filthy "white" doors to our rooms, once inside I felt the need to make a run to Walmart for a sleeping bag! The room is way out-dated and smelly. The size of the room was nice, as I had a 1 year old with me. They could not accomodate our king size bed, so we ended up pushing the beds together. No fitted sheets, so if you move a lot in the night, you will wake up on the dirty mattress! It was also very noisey, as mentioned before with toliet & shower noises. We decided to put everything behind us and just enjoy the grounds, which were beautiful. We just looked forward to having a drink at the pool bar! Of course as we got to the pool, it was closed, so was the bar! The few things we were really looking forward to. At that point we decided to complain to the manager and see if we could either be compensated or moved to a nicer place with accomedations we were looking for. The manager made us wait for about 30 minutes before he did nothing to make us feel any better. Bottom line...do not expect Disney Quality when coming here. You are better off staying at Pop Culture or the least expensive Disney Resorts, they are newer and cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “Probably would not stay here again....”
Reviews.Author: kris504
Reviews.Content: We were a little disappointed in the size of the rooms. This was one of the only hotels that allowed 5 people to a room. We did not know that the 5th person would be sleeping on the floor on a mattress kept under the bed! The shower was pathetic and tiny. We asked fro more hangers and were deliverd the wrong type twice so we gave up. We were in building 17 which was a LONG walk to/from the shuttle service or lobby. The grounds are beautiful with a few pools and the gift shop was big too. Breakast counted a a quick service in their food court and was probably the best in wdw.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Texas1020
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 11:00pm on March 16. The Magic Express from the airport to the hotel was a breeze. We checked in quickly, no lines. The Riverside Hotel clerk gave us a map, but the place is so large and it was dark, we searched for our room about 30 minutes before finally finding it. My husband called the front desk & complained, but no one ever called back. We ordered pizza right before 12:00am and it came within 15 minutes. It costs about $27.00 for a large, but was plenty for 2 adults & 2 kids. I requested a few days before arriving, by phone, to be near a bus station. We were at the Acadian Mansion, next to the North bus stop. It was great. We always caught the buses quickly. Even though they were sometimes crowded & we had to stand, the ride to the Disney parks were quick. The rooms were nice, not anything extravagant. Each room comes with a mini fridge and a safe with key. Maid service was great. The Food Court was nice, but always crowded. We had the dining plan, so breakfast or lunches were included as quick services. Ask the cashier what you can get before you start picking out your food. It's very confusing if you don't. We also ate at the Boatwright Restaurant...more expensive & good food. We had the dining plan so it was included. Be sure to call for a reservation, even though you're staying there. I called about 6:00pm and they got us in at 8:10pm on a Friday nite. People that didn't have reservations were waiting a long time & frustrated. The pools are nice. My kids played at the main one and also the less crowded one near the Acadian. They have towels at a stand, so you don't need to bring one from your room. Be sure to catch the free boat ride to Downtown Disney. It's relaxing & really beautiful. We had to wait a long time for a bus back to the Riverside Resort, so I suggest you ride the boat back. Checkout was a breeze...they put an envelope on your door the night before...we checked at the desk the next morning and we were set to go. Your luggage can be stored free if you need to stay after your checkout time. Checkout time is 11:00am, but I called the day before to see if we could extend it, and they gave us till 12:00pm. Catching the Magic Express back to the airport was really easy. It's just right out front of the hotel near Bell Services and the luggage storage. This was a great place to stay. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family resort”
Reviews.Author: Relaxing13
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect family getaway... we have been waiting years to take our son... we wanted to wait till he could enjoy everything and every part of the Disney experience. Glad we waited, as a family we got to enjoy every park and had our supper at Cinderellas castle, great experience. great tip...the disney dining plan is the way to go. no hastle, everything is taken care of and you don't have to worry about taking money along with you when going out. Great experience. my son is now talking about when we get to go again. That will happen without a doubt. Thank you Disney for the perfect Family experience. rooms were the perfect size, clean and wait staff friendly. using the trolleys was a breeze and this resort is in a perfect location. most of the time you are the last to be picked up and the first delivered... no waiting.

Reviews.Title: “Good times in Disney”
Reviews.Author: MichiganBoots
Reviews.Content: My family ( four of us) two kids ( 9 and 7) just returned from a week stay at the POR. My first impressions were good, fairly quick check in, It was along walk to the room in the Alligator Bayou section, but knew that coming in based on past reviews. The grounds are beautiful and well maintained. Once we got to the room, we found it to be clean, and well decorated. We also had a trundle bed that my 9 year old used all week. The beds were comfortable, and we had no issues with the room all week. The pool, both the main ol man pool and the quiet pool got alot of use by the kids, and again no complaints. We were on the Disney dining plan and used the restaurant every morning for breakfast, food was decent, it was usually fairly crowded, but no big deal. The buses would very as far as how long you wait. But I would not wait at the main entrance to the resort, seems the buses get their last, and it is standing room only. Their are three other bus stops depending on where your room is. Overall we had a good stay here, and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful on the outside but not so much on the inside”
Reviews.Author: shan72
Reviews.Content: Upon seeing the stunningly beautiful grounds of this Disney moderate hotel one would think that the inside would be just as nice- not the case. The inside of our hotel room was dated, musty smelling and our shower was plugged up so much that it felt like you were taking a bath and shower at the same time. The food at the cafeteria style eatery was absolutely awsome though! try the "make your own pasta" it was so yum! Line ups for breakfast can be a pain- and then searching for a table- not the kind of thing you want to do when you have big plans for the day at Disney. Would I reccomend this hotel? Yes because of the food and beautiful grounds- No because of the musty hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in WDW”
Reviews.Author: 1Train
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caribbean Beach Resort (CBR) in 2007 and very much enjoyed it. This time we tried Riverside (POR) and were more than happy. After spending six hours per day within the theme parks itâ€™s great to walk by the quiet river and bridges of POR. The food court has upscale pasta and salad bar options and does not resemble the mall like atmosphere of the CBR food area. Our room was slightly run down and was not immaculate but where can you find hotel rooms that are brand new without paying over $300? The size was fine and the location is what I requested in advance. I found it worth paying slightly extra for being near the river and food/check-in area (a/k/a water view). The water taxi to Downtown is worth the trip even if you have no interest in Downtown - - itâ€™s a quiet distraction from a high energy trip. The main pool is crowded but has a great waterslide for kids. If you want a quiet pool, the other six or so are not heavily used. The Magical Express operated without a hitch. The only complaint I may have is that the buses to the theme parks did not work like clock work - - especially to/from MK. They came in clusters and sometimes had to wait up to 30 minutes and most of the time there were no seats. Overall, I again have to give Disney credit for doing what they do best, which is providing a magical experience. The one insiderâ€™s tip I would give is that during a morning or evening when extended magical hours for resort guests are offered, actually try going to another park, where you may find even less crowds, especially on the transportation to/from the parks. Also be aware that most attractions within the respective park are not open during extended magical hours. For more info re: POR, I found the following site to be helpful: www.portorleans.org. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Worth staying on Disney property”
Reviews.Author: xeno111
Reviews.Content: We had excellent service all over the resort, from the front desk to the pool staff to the restaurants to housekeeping. The rooms were cozy and clean, but fairly basic on sheets, towels, design. But that was all fine by us, as we didn't want to spend much time there. The grounds were well kept. The on-site restaurant was forgettable. The best advice we got before going was from a friend who works at the park. It's worth spending a little extra to stay on Disney property for the convenience. You can take a bus to any park from your hotel. That saves time and gives you more of the day to enjoy the parks. But, it is not worth spending extra money to stay in one of the most expensive resorts like the Grand Floridian. Basically, as our Disney friend explained it, there's little difference between the rooms themselves in the different levels of resorts. You're basically paying for the extravagance of the lobby and the restaurants. If you want to experience that, better to book a table at one of the high-end resort restaurants and have a great dinner there. But there's no need to spend hundreds more a night to sleep at the high-end places. We had an excellent meal at Jiko, the Animal Kingdom resort restaurant one night. So we got to see the wild animals out back, the impressive lobby and try the great food and wine. But when we went to bed, we stayed at the much cheaper PO resort, satisfied at the money we saved on lodging.

Reviews.Title: “decent room but noisy”
Reviews.Author: smiley063
Reviews.Content: I was registered for just one night to visit with my son and his family. All was good until that night. Around 2:00 AM I was awakened by the flushing of a toilet from some where in the building and I continued to hear flushing and water running threw pipes for the remainder of the night. I tried to doze but my sleep was so interrupted that by 6:00 AM I was up and got ready to get on the road. I feel that when the charge for a room is over $200.00 the construction of the building should be of better quality.

Reviews.Title: “Safe and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: thedivinewoman
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this resort, the first was in October 2007. The first visit was let down by very poor housekeeping, so I was slightly concerned when I re visited this resort. However, I had nothing to fear, perhaps leaving a tip everyday helped, but, the housekeeping was much better this time. As a female travelling on my own my major concern is safety, this hotel made me feel secure at all times, it has a lovely charming relaxing atmosphere and because it is so popular there were always plenty of people about. The rooms are a nice size, I would imagine four adults would find it a tight squeeze as there are not enough hangers in the 'wardrobe', although I'm sure if you asked housekeeping would provide more. For a family with young children it would be quite comfortable. For myself on my own it was great. The staff were in general friendly, although they need to train their new staff better, particularly in food hygeine as one night a new employee from China attempted to give me a display pasta salad that had been under lights for god knows how long and didn't understand when I tried to explain it could give me or whoever ate it food poisoning, that aside I had no other real problems with the food court except that it can be a bit boring for choice in the evenings and for snack choices, even the All Stars provide a better choice. My other gripe came on checking in, the lad on reception gave me directions to my room that led me all around the houses and I was furious after 15 minutes of looking to find that it very near to the river itself. All he needed to say was across the bridge, building with the square fountains first floor at the front. All reception staff should have training in giving directions and made to walk around the site to familarise themselves with the layout. The fifteen minute walk with a heavy suitcase after a 10 hour journey didn't enamour me at all. Saying that this hotel is a perfect location for the parks, is very nicely laid out and ideal for a relaxing break. I do intend staying there on my next holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Large property”
Reviews.Author: sheamac
Reviews.Content: My family (kids aged 9,6,4) stayed in the Alligator Bayu section of the hotel. Check in crowded waited about 15 minutes. Bell man very friendly and efficient, was worth it to have him bring our bags up to the second floor. Room was small, clean with comfortable beds. Trundle bed pretty much just a mattress on the floor, my 4year old didn't seem to mind. Resort itself was very pretty. The kids loved the main pool area, although we could not use it that much, weather was cold, was about a five minute walk from the room. Quiet pool was closed during our stay, but it opened the day we were leaving. Food court very crowded, food choices limited, but ok quality. Overall very nice, however I think we would choose a resort less sprawling and have a seperate room for the children. Houskeeping ok, just basics done.

Reviews.Title: “First time at PO Riverside”
Reviews.Author: wajah2
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to a Disney property and our first to PO Riverside. We checked in late afternoon and the lobby was extremely busy to be the value season. Check in staff were polite and efficient. We were placed in the Magnolia bend buildings the first "mansion" closest to the bridge. Our room appeared to be and smelled clean. My brother and his family had the room next door. We were close to the bridge that takes you to the lobby and food court. The walk to the 'Ol Man Island was not very long, my two y.o. nephew could even make it. The quiet pool and laundry were a short walk away. The smoking area for the two smokers with us were close by and I must compliment the location was not some ugly out of the way place yet it was not so close to rooms that it may offend. The bus terminal closest to us was the main stop at the lobby which was moderately busy most of the time. There was however another bus stop two buildings over that was quieter and offered a visually nice stroll if we were in no hurry. As for mousekeeping I must say yes the quality of cleaning is not top notch, most of them speak little english, therefore it is sometimes difficult to communicate to them your needs. But most of us who travel and especially if you are not familiar with Florida this is how things are here, don't get upset over it. Best advice is to take it in stride and find ways to ease the situations. We were always smiling and saying thank you even if we got decaf instead or regular coffee, or hand towels instead of bath, etc... then we would politely ask again for what we still needed. With kindness in your voice and on your face I feel this helps ease the situation and make it less stressful. The food court is where we mainly had dinner. With two growing, hungry boys this was our best value. We were able to eat here for around $40 and our hollow legged boys were full and everyone could choose from a variety of foods. Pizza, make your own pasta (two could share this meal with a salad.), Carving station with roasts, turkey and hams, southern side dishes (greens, mac n cheese, mashed potatoes, etc.) the old stand by burgers, chicken strips and fries. There is a bakery and cold case with salads, fruit, juices, etc. The quality of the food would in my opinion be equal to golden corral or such places. The French Quarter fc had somewhat different menu items which adds to the variety if you eat at the resort courts, and the walk is about 2-3 minutes maybe less. The grounds, pool and rooms were clean, however I agree that the rooms need new carpets or thorough cleaning. But as we experienced first hand, Disney staff are CONSTANTLY working on things. Case in point follows: My brother had maintenance knock on our door (early), when we opened it the gentleman apologized and pointed at my brother exclaiming "he made me do it!" My brother then exclaimed "you gotta see this!" These men came in and changed out the Air unit and replaced it quicker than a NASCAR pit road crew! Our dad worked maintenance in a hospital for 30 years, so seeing this was astounding to say the least. These men told us they are always changing them daily at all the resorts and when they have made it to the last room they start all over again. They get taken to a shop for cleaning, charging and repairs to be used again later. They stated that Disney is constantly working such projects like these to keep the resorts up (hence "maintenance"). So, if you get a room that looks worn, you just got one that has not been taken care of yet. They do their job and stay busy,these people are the unsung castmembers of the "WORLD". Our overall experience with PO Riverside was great, we got to do most of what there was to offer and enjoyed it all. We would have loved a water view, but we didn't open the windows to our room much so it would have been wasted. Why stay in your room when their is so much to see around the place? It was packed while we were there, yet we never were disturbed by anyone. One exception was like another person said was door slaming from "mousekeeping" coming in and out of nearby rooms. We did have a couple of times where the bus just took sooo long! But again the "World" was busy for a value season. I must say one bus driver in particular was great, we were his first group of the night and he made us feel like we were on "Letterman" or "The Tonite Show", he gave a monologue and jokes, welcomed us to the bus and stated he would be here til 3 am. He even offered photo ops for us as people departed. We literally took him up on this and still have a pic. We never once came across an ill mannered castmembers on our trip, although we did witness some annoying visitors (line jumpers and the types with expired fast passes or no fastpass and pretend they didn't know and they get on the ride anyway. If it had been me they would have made me go to the back of the line!) But as for PO Riverside, If you go here with the understanding that Disney properties are always higher w/ less accommodations. And this is not five star housekeeping nor five star dining. Remember to try to keep a friendly face when dealing with castmembers who do not understand you, try to help them understand you and they will do their best to accommodate your wishes. It truly is their job to make you happy. Just remember, pixie dust does not exist in real life but and open mind and patience can make your trip magical.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but main pool was closed”
Reviews.Author: katdav4
Reviews.Content: Be sure and check when booking the main pool was closed during our recent visit (Feb. 8th-15th) to Port Orleans Riverside. They do have 7 pools but the main "fun" pool for kids was closed much to my kids disappointment. We stayed in the Alligator Bayou building 15. Glad I had articles beforehand and knew to request a close building because the last thing we wanted to do is to have to walk miles to our room. The room was okay the good part was we had a trundle on which one of my daughters could sleep which gave a bed for each of the girls. Our room was not the cleanest around that is for sure! The grounds of the hotel were very beautiful. The main dining hall was crowded and noisy every morning. The pastries were great though! Extrememly good! The boat ride from downtown Disney was a neat thing to do. I would (maybe) stay here again. I plan on comparing other Disney moderate hotels next time. The best thing was the extra trundle bed!

Reviews.Title: “First time at Riverside - will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: nodaybut2day
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in everything from 5 star Hotels in Rome, to youth hostels in Amsterdam. I think for the money Port Orleans Riverside was a good value and nice location at WDW. Over the week we were there the staff was friendly and helpful on many occasions. We requested a room close to the main building and couldn't have been happier to be placed in building 14. Super quiet, but just a 1 minute walk to the restaurant, boat rides and the bus stop. We had a clean comfortable room for 4 with a trundle bed for our toddler. I think for 2 kids (4 and 11) and 3 adults it was cozy - probably too tight for 4 adults. Fridge was handy for keeping milk and OJ cold. Housekeeping fulfilled all of our requests and left a cute puppy made of towels to welcome us back at night. Outside our room was the river and a variety of unique birds that shared the sidewalks with us. At night you can spot little brown bunnies along the wooded trails. It's really quite peaceful and pretty there. My family enjoyed the food court and ate there many times. Often we'd save our snack credit and bring home a treat at night.On 3 nights we took the boat over to Port Orleans French Qtr to use the pool with slide. We used the WDW busses everyday and never waited more than 10 minutes for a pick up. I'm fairly sure that if we did not stay at a Disney resort, we would not bother to leave midday for a nap - it just takes to long to get off site. My only complaint was that a small business center with WIFI would be handy in the main building at Port Orleans. There were also bikes and boats you could rent by the hour, but I thought the prices were pretty outrageous.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, Ok rooms.”
Reviews.Author: spunkypug100
Reviews.Content: We really liked this resort. All tho I think Disney is over priced, the convernence is worth it. The resort grounds are beautiful. The rooms are ok, the bathrooms could use some fixing up, but they were clean and the bed were nice. The only thing that I didn't enjoy about staying in Disney is the lack of free WiFi. My husband and I both need the Internet to work and we had to pay $9.95 a day for cable internet. For the price you would think you could get free internet. We got the meal plan which worked out great for us, I would highly recomend it. Also if you are staying in the park you can ride the free buss to the parks, but if your car is there it seems to be less of a pain to drive, you will not have to pay for parking if you are staying in Disney. We will stay here again next time we go to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here before but will not return ...disappointed”
Reviews.Author: brigette621LA
Reviews.Content: This is not our first time at the POR. We have stayed 3 times at the POR, 1 time at POP and 1 time at the POFQ. I did read poor reviews on the POR before I booked but had loved POR so much the last time we stayed about 5 years ago, I ignored the reviews. OK short version ....maid service was horrible. We tipped our maid 5 dollars a day and still got horrible serivce. My 10 year old was so upset because there were no towel animals we have always gotten. We didn't even have the cute little setups they usually do with the toys and animals the kids have in the room. Unfortunately, because we have been so many times, this is the Disney magic my kids were so used to and looked forward to. We were there celebrating my 10 year olds birthday that was 2 weeks before our trip and I was told that his favorite character would leave something special for him in our room. Well every day we would return to the hotel after a long day at the parks and he would be so excited ready to open the door and find his surprise. Day one...nothing. Day two...nothing. Day three...nothing. 3 phone calls later and finally day 5 when we returned to our room at 11:30 that night...a simple card signed by Buzz. Wow that was it????? And it took them 5 days to do that???? My back is still hurting from the beds....my feet are still sticky from the nasty carpet. All I can say is for the $$$$ I do not thing staying off the grounds would be that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for family of 5 at Disney.”
Reviews.Author: happygirlof5
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a trip to Disney with a family of 5 on a budget this is by far your best bet. We traveled with our three children ages 14,12 and 7 last summer. I was worried about the space being tight but we managed. I would have rather had a suite but I was going for cheap and still wanted to be on Disney property. We had wonderful housekeeping service. We had no problems with the bus service. The counter service restaurant was good and suited our needs for variety. The grounds were beautiful. My only compliant is that it is a very large resort. It was a good 5-10 min walk to the main lobby and the main pool. We only went to the main pool once and preferred to take quick swims in the smaller pool next to our room. I often got lost for the first several days. They should have more signs. Plan on doing a lot of walking if you plan to use the main facilities often. We had a bus stop near our room so that wasn't a problem.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: pezza27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the port orleans riverside July 2007 for 2 weeks. We had a great time no complaints apart from when the room above flushed their toilet it sounded as thought the water was running down the inside of the wall. Annoying but you did get used to it after a few days. I would definetly stay here again. Look forward to returning in the near future. Also found out I was pregnant on my stay so it will always be special too me as it was my first baby.

Reviews.Title: “So-So”
Reviews.Author: dco12
Reviews.Content: I just returned from POR yesterday and definitely have mixed emotions about my stay there. The grounds are lovely but that was about all I can really say on the positive side. I traveled with my husband and 3 children, ages 10, 6 & 3. When I arrived there at about 5 pm on Tuesday, there were about 5 people in front of me in line to check in and only two people working at the front desk. It took almost an hour to get checked in and after a long day of traveling it was very frustrating. I had requested a room in building 14 which is close to the main lobby but when I arrived I was told that they could not accommodate me and that I had been placed in building 24 which is very far out on the property. They offered to move me the next day which I accepted. We ultimately did not end up switching because we realized we were close to a pool that was open and a bus stop which suited our needs better after all. The room was fairly small (equivalent to a Best Western or Comfort Inn) but I expected that. Our room was not cleaned very well - almost every day we had to call for more soap, shampoo, pillows (they kept taking one away from us -weird). I noticed that the floor was not vacuumed at all and I also found a Micky shaped pasta under the table which must have been from someone who stayed there before us. I have stayed in all levels of hotels and am not that picky so I just tried to go with the flow but I was bothered by the price I was paying for very minimal service. We also didn't get any cute towel animals or other things that people have talked about. We were in one of the farthest rooms out so I guess maybe the maids were ready to call it a day when they got to our room. The food was decent but throughout our stay we were met with long lines at the food court, no matter what time of day it was. The grounds are pretty and well kept and the pool at Old Man Island reopened on our last day and that was a lot of fun. We tried the cane pole fishing but didn't catch anything. I don't think I'd spend the money to stay at a Disney hotel again. I could have spent the same amount and stayed in a townhouse or condo off property. I also can't believe that this hotel does not have wireless internet or a business center. Even economy hotels off property have this. It seems like they just want you to spend the $10 per day to use their Ethernet cables. The only real benefit from what I saw is the bus transportation system and the fact that you can do the Disney dining plan. I'm not sure I'd recommend this hotel either.

Reviews.Title: “Waterview misleading”
Reviews.Author: aroto
Reviews.Content: Just returned yesterday from the Riverside after 5 days. paid for a waterview and got an air conditioner view, when I complained they told me because it was in close proximity to the pool even though you couldnt see it, also the main pool was closed all week for renovations were not told that when I booked through expedia.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL TRIP!”
Reviews.Author: jazztrumpeter
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying on site at Disney World. I worried that it would be too much Disney, too much of the time. But it wasn't. Very relaxing. We didn't have a car and didn't miss it. Stayed at the Riverside in the Magnolia building. After reading some of the reviews I was a little apprehensive as to what the room would be like. We arrived at 1:30 a.m., so check in was not too much of a problem (certianly no long lines). I asked for an upgrade, but at that time of night could not get one. Finding the room was a slight challenge. The room was way in the back and the signs did not seem too helpful in getting to the room. Once at the room, it was clean and quiet. It was far from the restaurant. The next morning I asked for a room closer to the restaurant and they quickly were able to find me one. We moved our own bags (though they offered to do that) and found this room to be clean with no problems. Lots of clean towels (including the five extra I was given off the cart), extra coffee, etc. Fridge worked fine. Beds were comfortable for us (maybe a little too hard if you like a soft mattress). The pools are clean and at this time of the year, not crowded. The food court area is large and has a variety of foods, plenty of check out lines, and lots of seating. If the weather is nice, there are some outdoor tables (but you must enjoy birds to sit there). The main restaurant was only a few dollars more and very enjoyable. Be sure to get reservations. The French Toast was excellent. The lounge area was o.k. We stayed for part of the entertainment one night, but that was just o.k. I would have liked a variety of entertainment on different nights since we were there for seven nights. More jazz to fit the theme would have been great. The gift shop (with some food and drinks) was more than adaquate. The one day it rained some of the Cast members came in and offered games to help pass the time. I highly recommend the Magical Express to and from the airport. This was a last minute trip, so we did not get our luggage tags in time and had to pick up our own bags (which was fine since we were getting in so late). The check out service for the airlines was really great. They give you a phone number to call and pay the airline fee for checked bags. Take your bags and the confirmation number showing you paid the fee, and that is it. They weigh your luggage so you know you are not over the limit. We didn't see our bags until we arrived at our home airport. They also held our carry on bags until we were ready to leave for the airport. The resort bus service was perfect for us. We waited no more than about 12 minutes (and that was for a downtown disney bus in the morning when few are running). Be sure to use the stop closest to your room. Riverside has four bus stops scattered around the buildings. The boat trip to downtown is relaxing and takes about 20 minutes. At night, the return trip can get crowded, so plan to wait for a few minutes. All the cast members were really nice and friendly. And I can honestly say we had no complaints about staying at the Riverside. But please remember, we were there the last week of January, so crowds were very light. One helpful hint. If you like spending a lot of time at Epcot, you might want to think about staying at the Boardwalk. You can walk to Epcot and Studios. In fact, the walk from Boardwalk to Epcot is shorter than the walk from where the resort busses drop you off. However, if you stay at Riverside, ask for a room as close to the main pool and restaurant as possible. Otherwise, the walk will be significant.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly what I expected from a Disney Resort Hotel”
Reviews.Author: annsundberg
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived I loved the room. It was a bit of a walk from the lobby but close to 1 of the pools & a bus depot so it evened out. The housekeeping was lacking the first few days till I complained, & they did compensate for it. This was my kids first trip to Disney & my first time staying on Disney Property, I do have to say if it wasn't for being able to purchase the dining plan through this, I don't feel it would have been worth it to pay the rates they charge for staying on property. I could have stayed off property & spent less money. I didn't experience any of the magical touches they rave about. This hotel was an ok hotel, rooms were nice, & grounds were beautiful. Not sure that I would stay here again, or recommend this hotel to family or friends.

Reviews.Title: “What a place to be...”
Reviews.Author: renoky2261
Reviews.Content: This hotel had everything you could ask for at WDW...location...food...cleanliness...price....all around FUN at WDW. I couldn't have asked for more. You want to try and request a room closest to the lobby because it is so spread out but they do accomadate to that. This is the best resort in WDW because of its affordable price, location, and true Disney character.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Location but Accomodations are Too Far Spread Out!”
Reviews.Author: momof4inmd
Reviews.Content: We had requested a location in Bldg 14 in Alligator Bayou because the bldgs are so spread out and we have a small child but we didn't get our request. We stayed in Bldg 17. Unless you don't mind doing a lot of walking then this location is ideal. The problem is that it takes about 10 minutes to walk to the bus stop, lobby and food everytime you need to do anything. Not practical with small children. We also had to pay for a waterview room because the regular rooms were all booked and keep in mind a waterview room may be of a stagnant watering hole. The rooms are really small. There were 5 of us with a trundle bed and 2 double beds it makes for a crowded area. Luckily we don't spend a lot of time in the rooms. The food I thought in the restaurants on the grounds was average to above average. My daughter really liked the make your own pasta bar. We didn't get to take advantage of our refillable mugs like we would have liked because of the long walk to the area to get them refilled. The staff was somewhat helpful when asked questions. Word of caution, when you set up to have things charged to your credit card on file while staying there they have a limit of 1000.00. Noone told us that at check-in. So on day 5 when we hit that limit our cards were being declined at the stores in the parks even though we knew we had enough limit on our credit card on file. I then waited in line that evening for 25 minutes in the lobby to find out that I had to go ahead and pay the 1000.00 against my credit card on file before I could charge anymore???? Didn't make much sense to me since I had already given them permission to charge that credit card on day one at check in. Two other issues....the wait for the buses is way too long. We almost missed reservations because buses were taking 20 - 25 minutes to arrive and then making additional stops once they picked us up. It was really hard to plan. Lastly, they really need to do something about their check out procedure for checking your bags for Magical Express on the day your leaving. We had to wait in line for 45 minutes and then they make you catch the bus to the airport 3 hours before your flight when you have already prechecked everything. Alot of wasted time on your last day there. We were very rushed around just to sit at the airport. The main swimming pool was closed for refurbishment so we had to take a boat to the French Quarter. We just felt that with all the money we paid we should have maybe gotten a little more. Housekeeping kept us stocked with towels and came back when we were still in the room at a later time.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Location & Surroundings at Disney Port Orleans Riverside”
Reviews.Author: morninwood
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Disneyworld Port Orleans Riverside from December 30, 2008 to January 10, 2009 with a large group including 4 children and six adults in 3 side by side rooms in the Oak Manor bldg directly accross the Sasagoula River from the Boathouse Restaurant and main reception building. We found the inside of the rooms fairly basic and on the small side and not the cleanest, but nevertheless adequate for our purposes given that we did not spend much time in the rooms other than to sleep. The rooms are definitely not posh or 5 star, but of moderate rating. The outside of the buildings were beautiful, very clean and well maintained and styled in the southern plantation manor. The walkways and grounds were also very well kept and beautiful with many trees, foliage and the lovely Sasagoula River with many little bridges crossing over it. Our rooms were perfectly situated very close to the dining hall and main reception building which also had a decent souvenir and small food store along with a small bar/lounge. In addition there was a fantastic little wharf area that had many different types of boats to rent and ferry terminal to catch the ferry boat to downtown disney (about a 15 minute ride with some good scenery). Our building was also very close to two swimming pools including the larger and excellent pool at Old Man's Island. The island also had bar. The bus stops for connections to everywhere in the park were also very close by. We found the main dining hall to be fairly quick on most occassions despite usually large crowds. The staff were very effecient and polite. We never had any trouble finding seeting. Note that we only ate here for breakfasts however on the Disney meal plan. Most of the breakfast and bakery foods we found to be tasty and of decent quality with the exception of the coffee, which is without doubt the worst all of us has ever had. Disney has a contract to use only Nescafe instant coffee which can best be described as hot tasteless brown water! We craved Starbucks greatly during our stay. We had some fantastic dinners in the park at Teppan Edo in Japan pavilion in Epcot, Le Cellier in Canada Pavilion at Epcot, Wolfgang Pucks in downtown disney for lunch, Boma at Animal Kingdom Lodge, Coral Reef in Epcot, Chef Mickey's in the Contemporary Resort and Akershus for Princess Storybook dinner at the Denmark Pavillion in EPCOT. The only complaints that come to mind about our resort are that Disney gouges an extra $10 per day for in room internet access that is not even wi-fi and the connections are very slow and irratic. The plug is also most inconveniently located behind the tabel between the two beds instead of beside the table and chairs near the front door of the room. Also, the prices in the store in the main building were quite steep, most notably for beer and alcohol, e.g. $5 usd per beer or cooler and wine and spirits approx double the price of anywhere outside the park. We can see Disney adding a premium, but double or more is an outrageous gouge. The beer and liquor in the parks and restaurants is also ridiculously overpriced. We plan on going back to Disneyworld when are children are older as we were there 10 days and didn't even come close to seeing all there was to see in Disney World, let alone the additional things to see outside the park such as Seaworld, Universal and Kennedy Space Center. We would not go back for less than 14 days next time given the amount to see. All in all a fantastic experience! We would recommend this resort on the basis of its excellent central location and lovely grounds/setting. It also offers pretty good value for money relative to the many other hotels located within the park. Next time we go we will likely stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge so we can enjoy the savannah views and setting with all the animals right outside your window.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value, gorgeous grounds, pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: Aerosmith
Reviews.Content: I brought my mother to Disney with me to be my cheerleader while I ran the Disney Marathon. We ended up paying $$$ for a cab to Disney because the line for the free Magical Express was nearly out of the door, and I had to get to the Expo before it closed. This was a good move because we beat the bus to the resort, and I was able to check in with only about a 10 minute wait. The staff and check in were extremely friendly. The hotel grounds are huge, and it was a little confusing finding our room, but the grounds are spectacular. Every staff member (a/k/a "cast member") had a smile and was pleasant. Our room had 2 full size beds which were very comfortable. The bathroom area had 2 pedestal sinks with a ledge for your toiletries that ran the length of the wall. There was another, wider shelf along the perpendicualr wall as well. The bathroom/sink area could be separated from the bed area by pulling a curtain across the room. This was a great convenience when I had to be up at 2:30am to get ready to catch the marathon bus at 3:15am and didn't have to wake mom up. There are 2 restaurants on site, one is sit down, the other is cafeteria style. We only had coffee there. The bus service to the parks is great. I would have rated this hotel higher if it had 2 queen beds rather than the 2 full size (double?) beds. It was just my mom and I this trip, and we each had our own bed. However I would like to return with my children and it will be a tight squeeze putting 2 people in 1 bed, regardless of whether it is 1 parent/1 child, or 2 parents or 2 kids in a bed. I think Disney does this to force us parents of teens and tween to upgrade to a deluxe resort that has queen beds. We were here in January, which is off season, and the rate, for a Disney property was reasonable. But if it were high season, and I was only getting 2 full size beds, I would stay in one of their budget accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “NOT GOOD”
Reviews.Author: mahoneyth
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 01-06 FEB and the grounds are beautiful. The food court and restaurant is very good with lots of choices. This is why we are given them two stars. Now, the room is out-dated, stains on the carpet, mold in the bathroom, and the toilet system is horrible! we stayed in the plantation house/partene (sp). Forget about sleeping past 6:00 am because you will here the toliet flush, new eco friendly system, sounds like the airplane toilet, everyday above, below, and beside you. My husband re-named this resort to PORT-A-TOLIET, LOL.... We will never stay here again. Go to the Coronado Springs instead for the same price, i heard they renovated all their rooms and its a 100 times nicer. If you are already booked, just ask for the aligator bayou section, maybe the rooms are better on that side.

Reviews.Title: “very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: travelolsen
Reviews.Content: This is the place to be if you want to be relaxing and away from the busy crowds. Don't have anything to complain about this resort than the food they serve, taste like airplane food. You got several pools around the resort, bikes, boats for rent and a boat trip in their self made canals. You got as all other disney resort free shuttle to everything owned by Disney, its a good place to be for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Great !!!!”
Reviews.Author: RASSIG
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Port Orleans Riverside is fabulous! We just loved it! It was the first time of my kids at Disney, and it was great. The staff was so friendly , hepful and nice all the time. The housekeeping make you remeber all the time that you are at a Disney resort by making little animals with towels for the kids and making the best clean they can. The beds should be larger specially that we were 2 in each bed and the matress should be more soft but in general it was ok. I recomend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tolerable”
Reviews.Author: NewWrldTrvlr
Reviews.Content: My family and I have wanted to go to Disney World for quite some time, and we recently made the trip to world famous amusement park/resort in October. We decided to stay at a moderate resort as opposed to a value resort in hopes that we may receive amenities that would otherwise be unavailable. We chose Port Orleans: Riverside because of it's "homey" appearance, affordable rate, and its easy access to the water taxi that serves as transportation to Downtown Disney. Upon arrival, the facade as well as the interior of the resort was all that we expected it to be. Clean, reminiscent of the old south, very pleasant. However, upon checking into our hotel room, we found ourselves rather.. underwhelmed. Two double beds, a television, a table with two chairs, a bathroom, two sinks, and a nightstand, nothing special. We quickly unpacked and decided to spend this first day exploring the resort. While the rooms were not spectacular, the resort provides its temporary residents with an array of things to do. There are 6 quiet pools that are indeed quiet. They are located in secluded alcoves in the resort and serve as a place to relax. I personally never made it to the large "noisy" pool, I found no need; I was quite pleased with my experiences in 3/6 quiet pools. Furthermore, the resort has an arcade that has a plethora of games for all kinds of people. My family and I spent many a night after a long day at a park racing to the arcade for a game of air hockey. Outside, one may rent a bicycle and take a ride around the resort, absorbing the breathtaking scenery and crisp clean air. As far as food is concerned, (**side note--I recommend getting the meal plan, it is a beautiful thing that takes your mind off of paying for the expensive food in Disney World) the riverside mill is a buffet of sorts that shifts from breakfast to lunch. The food isn't spectacular, but it serves its purpose: a quick meal to start your day. My family and I did not eat at boatwrights, only because it is the same food you will receive at the riverside mill. Your money (or meal card) can be spent elsewhere on better food for dinner. All in all, the resort was a fun place to be. If you are doing Disney the correct way, you will only be in your hotel room to sleep, so not much concern is needed when dealing with it. OH! The staff at the hotel, much like everywhere in Disney, is very nice, and eager to assuage any concerns you may have.

Reviews.Title: “price, grounds, staff, makes this a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ILuvEngland
Reviews.Content: Rooms: Our family of four stayed at Port Orleans Riverside for 7 nights this Jan. As we had stayed there before, over 10 years ago, we knew what size room to expect. What we forgot was that the double beds are really doubles, and were too tight to accomodate our two grown children and my husband and I. One (adult child) had to sleep on the pull -out trundle bed (they are only in Alligator Bayou, I heard) each night and they took turns, they both said the bed was "fine". Fortunately, they are not very large young adults! We stayed in a very convenient location as I had requested in advance. . It was building 14 and was near both the main building with the food and registration, and near the main bus stop that goes to the parks. there are four on the property, this was the South Depot. The room was quite clean and in good repair. The service was good to excellent and seemed to depend on who cleaned the room. Plenty of whatever you needed, I would leave a note with the tip! The pillows were okay, not the best but at least not so big that they break your neck. The mattresses were about medium in hardness. Grounds: People rave about the grounds. It was quite cold most of the time we were there, so we could only appreciate looking at them, they are very beautiful. Transportation: We used the Disney Magical Express. I don't like to be parted from my luggage for too long, so we transferred it to the bus ourself. the service worked fine in both directions to the airport . The buses fron the property to the Disney parks usually came fairly quickly, waits ranged from a few minutes to 25 minutes (that was unusual) and we always had a seat. We did not try to take buses to other hotels, but my son did one afternoon and it took a long time, he had to change buses and was told the wrong bus to get on, etc. I would think you would want a car if you did a lot of that, we did not rent one. There are busses and a boat that take you to Downtown Disney (with restaurants, shopping and entertainment) , the buses seemed to run very regularly. Food: We ordered food before we left home from gardengrocer.com, this is a service where you can pick out what ever you want on-line and have it delivered to your room , prices are the "high" end of a regular grocery store and they deliver it for a fee of $12 for less than $200, free if above that. the refrigerator in the room is big enough to hold quite a bit of chilled things, but it does not have a freezer. This service worked very well and saved us time and money by our usually eating breakfast in the room, and making sandwiches to eat in the park for 2 or 3 days. The food in the cafeteria at Port Orleans Riverside is okay, probably the breakfast is best, but the lack of variety does get to you after a few days. If you really are fussy about what you eat, you won't eat there every night! The prices were reasonable. They do have a small general type of store on property, but the prices were very high there Overall: We enjoyed our trip to disney and going to the parks most every day, and the property was fine. If i had to do it over again, I think I would spring for a second room for our adult children as the room was really quite tight for four adults. Don't miss the trundle bed if you need to use it - but make sure that your room has one first.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again, without question”
Reviews.Author: nbchica
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the last week at Port Orleans Riverside and had a great stay. We had read the prior reviews and I was a bit worried before we left--there was no reason to worry, though. The place was great! We used the Magical Express transportation from the airport, which was very convenient. My only gripe would be the line at the airport for the Magical Express check-in. It was a bit long, which really is to be expected. Once checked in, we left the airport quickly. The bus made two stops before getting to Riverside. We had reserved a king room, which is what we received. However, the original room assigned to us was on the very end of the property. When I located it on the map, I asked to be moved to one a little bit closer to the main building, which was no problem at all. They seemed happy to make the change for us. We were in building 18 in Alligator Bayou. Our room was a very spacious corner room that overlooked the pool. The room was very clean and didn't appear to be "worn out" like other reviewers have said. The bed was comfy, the linens were nice, the pillows were soft and we promptly received extra pillows and blankets when we requested them. The enitre resort was very quiet--we rarely heard or saw any other guests. The only complaint (noisewise) was that the toilets flush very loudly--almost like rockets taking off. Every now and then, we would hear someone flushing a toilet. There are 4 bus stops in the resort and the buses were running regularly. We never waited longer than 10 minutes for a bus. We always had a seat on the bus, but it did get crowded on a couple of rides. Still, it was extremely convenient. I would definitely use the Disney transportation again. We used the Magical Express transportation back to the airport, which worked out great. The bus got us there with plenty of time to spare and the bus driver was very friendly and helpful. We had also looked at the French Quarter when we were first booking this trip--we had a chance to see it while there and I'm glad we chose Riverside instead. The grounds are much prettier at Riverside and the atmosphere is better. It's true that the resort is huge but they have 4 bus stops for their guests. French Quarter only had one bus stop for the entire resort--and some of the rooms are far from the stop. I wouldn't hesitate to stay at Riverside again. Overall, it was a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: PAB130465
Reviews.Content: What can I say here? My wife, daughter and I stayed at this hotel for the second time in November 2008. â€¢ Check-in was efficient; the young lady that checked us in was polite professional and was able to answer all of our questions. â€¢ Room was large and well laid out (Not that you spend much time in there) â€¢ Facilities were excellent, the food court met our needs for snacks etc but I would recommend going out for your main meals. The bar in the evening is a blast with the entertainment provided by Mr Bob Jackson, this man is a genius and certainly brought a great conclusion to our days whenever he performed. We also hired the four seated bikes and small boat during our stay, once again a memorable and enjoyable experience. â€¢ Grounds, the hotelâ€™s grounds are a pleasure to see and stroll round, well maintained and kept and a perfect backdrop for the charming hotel buildings at the Port Orleans Riverside. â€¢ Transport, the transport availaibe throughout Disney is a real bonus as are the extra hours you benefit from being a guest at a Disney Resort. â€¢ Check-out was exactly the same as checking-in, efficient and smooth. All in all I canâ€™t fault this hotel for the price bracket it falls within, we stayed a week before leaving for a Disney Cruise and we all had a fantastic time, I have attached a few photos from around the hotel which I hope you enjoy and I am more than happy to answer any questions if you have any?

Reviews.Title: “Great for families and budget!”
Reviews.Author: ehan31
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here since it was Dixie Landings at least a dozen times over the past 15 years. It is a beautiful resort, well-appointed and family-friendly. The rooms are quiet (surprisingly), the pool options are great, esp for travelers with multiple ages, and I LOVE the cafeteria dining option. Boatwright's sit-down restaurant is also great. There is a shop on property that lacks a bit in the sundry department but does have basics. The rooms are clean, kept in great shape. The transportation (bus) depot works well, and the waterway is a plus as it is very pretty. The only downside can be the time it takes to get to and from the parks due to multiple bus stops within the resort itself combined with the other nearby resorts, along with the distance you may have to walk if anyone in your party is mobility-impaired. (Not a problem for active adults, teens and kids, a potential problem for dad carrying the zonked-out 3 year old or grandma, or even the 5 year old after a long day of walking). Overall a great value for your money, with a fun atmosphere and nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Surisingly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: debmorgan100
Reviews.Content: I was very skeptical about this property as I read some of the reviews after booking our trip. We are a family of 5 - 17, 13 and 7 year old kids. When we arrived (very late in the night) we went to our room in the Alligator Bayou section. To our surprise they expected my 17 year old son and 13 year old daughter to sleep together. Because we booked through Disney, they are very aware of the ages of children you are brining so I was very surprised of the sleeping arrangements. I immdiately called the front desk and spoke to the night-time supervisor. He listened to me and agreed that the sleeping arrangements would be inappropriate and moved us to another room. Mind you it was past midnight by now... the room sizes are all the same. All I wanted was a cot brought up but for some reason they do not do that in this section. So we were moved to the Magnolia section which was beautiful as well. If you are looking for a large room, this is NOT the place for you. However, if you are looking for a room to accomodate you and your family with beautiful outdoor surroundings then this is the place for you! The stream was beautiful with all the bridges. The water wheel was so neat! The restaurant was very nice with both counter and sit down meals. On certain evenings they offered a camp fire with other fun things to do.... The pools were nice. And I agree the waterslide was a tad bit lame but it was quite cholly when we were there and pools were not used. We also did not use the bus transportation offered. We had our car and decided we would drive to the parks since parking was free and the options to come and go as we please was nice for us. We have stayed at The Grand Floridian. Polynesian and All-Star in the past and I have to say that Port Orleans Riverside really appealed to me. I think mostly because of the scenery... It was just beautiful! The horse and carriage ride in the evenings was such a nice touch! I would reccommend this hotel and would probably stay in it again. One thing tho... WATCH THE STEPS IN THE MORNING!! They are wet and they are slippery! 2 people fell down them that we know of - one being my oldest son! He was not hurt but sure did shock us all! They really don't need to have all the water on the steps knowing how slick they get.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: Belle1217
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed here for 6 nights. We have 3 children and we all loved it. There was enough stuff to keep us all busy when we were not in the parks. The room was kept very clean. The lady who was cleaning our room was very nice. She always left some kind of a towel animal or would take time to set up the kids stuffed animals nice. We were in building 27 and thought it would be far but it was perfect. We will go back again. Also the kids enjoyed the pool. It had a slide that they all loved.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for a Disney Moderate”
Reviews.Author: Flahdagal
Reviews.Content: This property is getting mixed reviews I believe out of misconception of the Disney way of doing things. This is a Disney Moderate hotel, and you get what you pay for. If you have never been to Disney and want the full experience, spring for a Deluxe accomodation. If you want a decent, clean hotel room on lovely grounds with some fun ammenities, book a moderate. If you want more, book an off-property resort, of which there are many. Traveling alone with my small son, I wanted the convenience of the Disney transportation system and a fun pool, so we booked the Riverside. I found the room itself to be clean and in good condition. No obvious repairs or attention needed. Plenty of towels. Decent basic dining, pricey per the Disney way. An interesting and well managed pool. Most of our time is NOT spent in the room, but in the parks, so a clean bed and bath is the number one requirement, and this property delivers. Why pay for a room that we're only in for a few hours at night? The cons: this is a big rambling property and getting around takes some getting used to, especially since we arrived at night and the signage is subdued. The rooms are basic hotel rooms, dressed up in plantation style buildings, but again this is a big property with many rooms. Had they been filled (they weren't even close), I can imagine this place to be crowded to an uncomfortable extent. If you compare this to a Disney Deluxe, the Wilderness Lodge, for instance, it comes up lacking. If you compare to a good road hotel, a very good LaQuinta or similar, this property works well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: WillSC777
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort from Dec. 4-7 during a quick Christmas trip to Disney World for my wife's birthday. Being frequent Disney visitors, we have our favorite resorts such as the Wilderness Lodge, but due to the short notice of the trip we were forced to find other options. We decided on Disneys Port Orleans Riverside after checking out other reviews and viewing pictures of the resort property. We arrived mid morning on the 4th ( a few ours prior to check-in) and were pleasantly surpised to find that our room was already available. The staff were all quite accomodating and polite during the entire checkin process. The room was located in Aligator Bayou, as I had requested to be as close to the main building as possible. The grounds in and around the buildings were very well kept, as you would expect with many Disney properties. We had a king bed room which seemed as if it must of had a recent facelift. The bed, flooring and furnishings all appeared very clean as if new. Other than the slightly smaller size and lack of a flat screen tv, we found the room nearly identical to the quality of rooms we have experienced at the Wilderness Lodge and other deluxe level resorts. Overall, the room and buildings location gave our stay a very cozy and slightly rustic feel. After a long day at the park, it was very nice to be able to return to the resort and park almost right below our room. As other reviewers may have stated, be prepared for a pretty hectic experience at times in the resorts restaurant area. We waited in line for our food at least 10 minutes at times, and then waited again just to pay, only to spend another 5 minutes trying to secure a table. I imagine that we could have just picked the busiest meal times of the day. We had grown use to the less crowded meal times at Wilderness Lodge which had virtually no waiting in line. Although we drove down, we did make use of Disneys transportation system, and found that buses ran regular to all parks every 10-15 minutes or so. I know that our trip was during a least crowded time of the year, so I imagine that the wait could be quite a bit longer depending on when you go. Overall we found the experience of staying at Port Oleans Riverside to be a good one. It was a nice place to come home to and relax after 8-12 hours out in the parks. Due to the fact that we came primarily to spend at much time out in the parks as we could, we werent as concerned with staying at a more expensive/nicer resort, but were quite pleased with what we discovered here. We found this to be a wonderful time of year to visit the parks as well, as we waited an average of no more than 15 minutes in line for any attraction (of course using fast passes throughout the day didnt hurt either). If youre looking to make a trip down to Disney but dont want to spend a lot of cash on a bed for the night, I would definately recommend this resort. It offers all the benefits of being on Disney property without breaking the bank in the process, while at the same time still managing to be a pretty nice place.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Port Orleans Riverside”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandDollyDimples
Reviews.Content: I was worried about my stay at Port Orleans Riverside as I had read some terrible reviews and I can honestly say we had nothing to complain about. My husband, 2 children and myself stayed in the Magnolia Villas for 17 nights over christmas and new year and our room was excellent, very spacious and very clean. Our bedding was changed every 3 days and our towels and glasses every day. The sinks and baths have been installed a while but they were cleaned every day. We did not have to wait long for buses to the parks and twice we were asked to take part in a survey about the waiting times for buses - so disney are interested in your comments. The pools were great, the kids loved the water slide on ole man island and we liked the hot tub. The only slight niggle was that some of the guests seemed to forget that people may be sleeping when they were returning to their rooms at night or leaving for the parks in the morning and allowed their children to run about the place screaming! All in all we had an amazing stay and we hope that if you have booked to stay here you are not put off by the bad reviews you may have read.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aligot
Reviews.Content: I have read many of the reviews about this hotel and I think the great reviews are a little misleading. There is no question that this hotel is affordable and that the grounds are very nice. However, every traveler should go into their vacation knowing what to expect. While the hotel common areas are nice, the hotel rooms are not very nice. I have stayed at the Animal Kingdom previously and I thought that hotel was average at best. This hotel makes the Animal Kingdom feel like a palace. When we arrived, there were dirty towles in our sink, the coffee maker was on a shelf and filled with dirty water and the radio/alarm clock was broken. The room is very small and the beds are also small. That being said, our room was quiet and we got what we were looking for, a place to sleep. If your vacation happiness hinges at all on the quality of the hotel room, you should spend more and stay somewhere else. If you are simply looking for a place to crash at the end of a long day at the parks, this place is ok. One tip, try to take a cab home at the end of the night. The cost is only around $12.00 and it is definitely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Moderate resort”
Reviews.Author: crauddi
Reviews.Content: Disney POp Century has clean but small rooms. I did not see many differences from disney value resorts which have a lower price. It has all the advantages of staying in a Disney hotel ( early and late hours, disney dining etc) but I expected some more differences between value disney hotels like POp century and moderate hotels and except for the pool I found none. I would recomend either a value resort or try a deluxe resort.

Reviews.Title: “YUCKY !!!!”
Reviews.Author: yomom
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed here for 9 days (11/28/08-12/6/08). Let me just say "YUCKY!!!!" The second night we were there, my son opened the drawer in the nightstand and we found 2 bottles of 'RID" . For those of us who have never had head lice, these were steps 2 and 3 of lice remedy. I went bolistic and my son was in tears. The hotel maintenance manager was really nice and had the disney pest patrol check out our room and found nothing- thank goodness. Who could sleep comfortable in that hotel after that? They moved us to another tiny room which was just as dirty as the first. I even tried leaving a $5 tip for the housekeeping crew for every day we were there and it didn't help. Glasses were not changed out, room was not clean. We are clean people and put all of our towels in one place for them and pick up after ourselves. It looked like they made the beds and left. This hotel is in serious need of a renovation. Carpets were old and dirty (black socks) . Also, we have 3 small children and we had a room on the 3rd floor. Every night we had to carry sleeping children up 3 flights of stairs. To my knowlege, there are no elevators at this hotel, or at check-in we were not told of any. I hope disney does something about this hotel and it's condition. They spend alot of money upkeeping the hotel's beautiful grounds, they need to spend some money updating and totally renovating these rooms. Or maybe just a good cleaning would help.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but rooms are not being kept up”
Reviews.Author: mnickseattle
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Riverside twice before. We love the beautiful landscaping and long walks you can take. The boat ride to Downtown Disney is fun too. The buses run fairly quickly from the 4 bus stops. We took advantage of the free parking you get when staying at a disney resort and drove to all the parks, except for the magic kingdom, to save time. Because the parking for the magic kingdom is on the other side of the lake from the magic kingdom entrance it's actually much faster to take the bus because it goes directly to the entrance. Our room was a short walk across the pool island (nice pool!) from the food court. The food court is somewhat average, I do NOT recommend the hamburgers or fish basket, very bland and overpriced. A negative for riverside is one that I've been hearing from my other disney travelling friends. The room upkeep has gone downhill over the past 5 years. I was a bit disappointed since the carpet was a bit worn, the tile a bit dirty and nothing seemed bright, new and maintained like I remembered from previous visits. My family tends to sleep late (9:30 or so) and then stay late at the parks. We heard almost no noise from adjacent rooms with one big exception. When the housekeepers started cleaning they would pull out the metal locking bar on the door so they would not have to keep using a card key to unlock the door. Unfortunately, since the doors close automatically they would make a booming metal sound each of the 20 or so times they entered and left the room. Not a pleasant experience. I've checked other disney resorts (moderate and value class) and there are comments about slack housekeeping from most of them. Be careful to look your room over at checkin and demand a different room immediately if you see problems.

Reviews.Title: “The worst Disney Expirence i ever had and we stay there yearly”
Reviews.Author: LisaRPa
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stay on Disney Property yearly from just before Christmas to New years . We have stayed in the budget to upper range of Disney Properties for the last seven years.... Sadly i do have to report this is the worst and very unhappy with our experience at this resort.. First i must say if you are more than a family of four NEVER book this resort unless you are ready to leave your luggage in the car and take in what you need daily as there is no room to unpack, no room for luggage just small and cramped space, The rooms with the trundle beds have no linen on them and the cover that is on the thin mattress which is more like a mat is thin and DIRTY.. I would not lay my pet on it no less my child. The towels are old and shabby and better towels can be found at a thrift store.. Added to that the sink area has a tile floor and a marbe counter and they give you GLASS drinking cups which they place on this narrow counter over the sink and can easily fall and shatter in a million pieces. The eight days we stayed on property the glasses were never changed.. I guess in trying to save money Disney did away with paper cups but bar glasses sure don't belong in the room with floors for them to shatter on and to cut someone. The services of housekeeping stink. My little boy brushed his teeth looking in the full length mirror which is on the bathroom door. The whole time we were there housekeeping did not clean it once. The tub i would not let my child bath in and we took showers. the tub is dated and shows major signs of wear and dirt. The carpets are filthy and my son who was playing on the floor with toys had black marks on his feet and knees.. The grounds outside the room are lovely and the pools are clean.. The staff is nice and even being crowded there is places to sit if you want to go to the dining hall.. The place does need a good cleaning and sadly not worth the money you spend staying there.. I wish i could give a better report as we do stay yearly and make reservations asoon as we get back from our previous trip but we have not this year and probably won't.. We spend too much money to live in suitcases and filth! Walt would be sadden to know that the corporate dummies running his paradise think about money over their guests and not to even clean is a disgrace and sad to guests who save their money to stay on their property... Disney is a wonderful place but sadly this resort is 5 thumbs down! I would be afraid to waste more money for a repeat trip like the one this next year...

Reviews.Title: “Waste of money! Dont stay here!”
Reviews.Author: cbiinc
Reviews.Content: Look, save your money. The Dsiney moderate resorts and lower are all over priced. The rooms are like motel rooms. Beds are hard. There are few things to do. No weight rooms. The food is terrible, just fried stuff out of the box. They are seriously overpriced. You would be better off staying at off property hotel or 3rd party hotel on property located on Dsiney property. The higher resorts like animal kingdom or wilderness lodge at least have some atmosphere for the money, but the rooms are terrible. For all the money disney makes they try to nickel and dime you! For example I paid extra for a river view room and it turned out being a view of a pool. When I called them, they said well they promised water view and a pool has water. Don't waste your money on disney resorts, they are all crap, especially the moderate resorts and lower.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but crowded”
Reviews.Author: LongIslandMom3girls
Reviews.Content: We chose this resort because the Carribean Beach was under renovation. We arrived for a family trip over Columbus Day weekend with my family of 5 and my parents. We took the Disney "Magical Express" bus to get to the hotel. That took a long time-the line was incredibly long. The hotel was moderate priced. Of course the hotel staff-cast members- were typical Disney-so no complaints there. We had to walk over a bridge to get to our room-it was a little far but by the third day I was loving the walk . We stayed in Magnolia-our room was ok. Definitely showing some wear and tear. We booked 2 rooms that were not adjoining, but whose doors were right next to each other. The two sinks in the bathroom were separated from the beds by a curtain. The toilet and bathtub were old but in working order. The beds were only double, so it helped that my one daughter stayed next door with my parents, because the beds were small. I heard that some of the rooms come with a trundle bed. The cafeteria style restaurant that we ate in for breakfast/lunch got real crowded at certain times. The buses to Disney were a great convenience, but they also got crowded. We enjoyed the boat ride from the resort that took us right to Downtown Disney. We also took advantage of magical hours-when certain parks opened early or stayed open later for resort guests. Make sure you have your room key. You needed the key to get on the attractions after hours. My kids loved the resort pool area, called Ol Man River. We ordered pizza and they had fun playing bingo with the staff. It was small, but it was only a moderately priced hotel-and we were there for a long weekend. I think if were going to stay longer I would look into one of the newer resorts with a larger pool. But overall, I have no major complaints. Disney is what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Im 18, and i think Disney isnt just for kids!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nickykanicky
Reviews.Content: It was a great and wonderful vacation! When me and my family first came, i was 14. The next time we went i was 16. Now we are going again 2 years later and we are staying in the same resort. The resort was so so much fun!! there was so much to do at the resort for everyone at any age!! it was so so much fun!!!

Reviews.Title: “WDW Rules”
Reviews.Author: TheCards
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at many different WDW resorts and Riverside is one of our favorites. Room adequate and comfortable. Nice to have toilet area seperate from sink area. Would stay there again and hopefully will. Food court OK but can get very busy on a weekend morning and can be a madhouse. Grounds and quietness of area are a welcome relief from hustle of parks.

Reviews.Title: “VERY MERRY TIME”
Reviews.Author: mare592
Reviews.Content: We are first time visitors to Disney at Christmas; but are seasoned veterans of Walt Disney, having stayed on various properties over the last 21 yrs. We love the Port Orleans Riverside. We stayed in the Alligator Bayou section. I know everyone has their own experiences, and they are all different, but we have stayed here a dozen times, and we have a ball every time. We had 2 rooms for me, hubby, and 2 sons( ages 25 and 21).
