The rooms were connecting, although we didn't ask for them to be. We ended up having my nephew join us for a few nights, so it was nice having the extra room. The bathroom is small but functional, with the toilet and shower/tub combo. The double sinks are separate, and the sink area is private with a curtain you can pull closed to dress, etc. The bath area is granite countertops and slate floors with granite accents. The rooms are clean and decorated in an outdoorsy way. The property is spread out, but a pleasant walk with stamped concrete to look like wood planks, and native Florida landscaping. There are squirrels and ducks everywhere to add to the backwoods feel. My only complaint was the bar at the main pool was closed. This was the first time it has been closed during our stay. The food court was very good, and the prices were a little high, although I didn't think they were outrageous. We typically eat at the food courts and pass on the sit down restaurants due to time constraints. We did find the place got really busy the day after Christmas, with a huge influx of guests. Most of the people visiting seemed to be foreigners. I do have a bit of advice for inexperienced Florida visitors~ my son and I got eaten alive by the evasive NO SEE UMS. I laughed at a post from a message board from a poor lady who thought she had been attacked by bedbugs. The Florida NO SEE UMS are a small biting insect ,like mosquitos , that bite, and leave you with welts within 24 hours. The welts then become pussy with golden puss, they scab over. They itch a couple of days. The No SEE UMS are worse around water. To make sure you don't get bit, spray on some OFF. The weather was in the 80's and this probaly added to the bug attack. They had 2 horse drawn carriages going during our stay. We did take the bus one day while the other boys went golfing. We had to wait about 20 min before the bus picked us up at our stop. We caught a bus at the park and got back to our room very quickly, with no wait for the bus. This was during the late afternoon. We had a wonderful time. No one treats you like Disney.

Reviews.Title: “The reason why we keep going back to Disney !!!”
Reviews.Author: ProudMommy4evr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I surprised our kids with a trip to Disney World Orlando. We arrived on a Sunday, and we quickly boarded the magical express to take us to our resort. I was hoping to get "the" magical express bus, but we got was a big yellow charter bus instead. I'll be honest, I was a little disappointed because I wanted my kids to board the bus with the mickey mouse on it, but that's too petty. So, we arrived to Port Orleans Riverside, it was beautiful as always (my husband and I stood here 1997 when it was called Dixie Landings). Check in was great and fast. The staff was very polite and friendly. As we were checking in my kids were watching mickey mouse cartoons and coloring in the lobby, and they loved it. Our room was a bit of a walk, but nothing to complain about. We stayed in the Magnolia Bend right across Ol' Man Island. The grounds were beatiful and clean. We had lunch at the food court, we had the Disney Dinning plan which I HIGHLY recommend. We changed into our bathing suits right away after lunch, and jumped into Ol' man Island. It has one slide, and drops you into 4ft section of the pool. My 4 yr old loved it !!! The pool was very clean, not so crowded, and the lifeguards were very vigilant. After 1 hour of swimming, we showered and changed and headed right to the water taxi which takes visitors from Riverside and French Quarters into Downtown Disney for dinner and fun. We had dinner reservation with Wolfgang Puck (disney dinning plan). The food, quality, and service was above average. My husband is a big cigar fan, and he went and bought himself a nice mild cigar at Sosa Cigars. Took the water taxi back to our resort. We enjoyed the next 3 days, going to Animal Kingdom, EPCOT, and Magic Kingdom (7pm Pirate and Princess Party) On the second to last day, we enjoyed the resort. We rented a surrey bike, and the kids loved it. We enjoyed more of the Ol' man Island pool, and one of the quiet pools near the laundry room (we did laundry) This resort has 7 pools in all. The bus stops are a bit of a walk, but we weren't in a rush most of the time, so we didn't mind. In all, the room was clean, and stocked with the usual supplies. The service was great, friendly and professional. The food was great, Wolfgang Puck, Garden Grill, Coral Reef, Goofys Liberty Tree Tavern, and Planet Hollywood. The ride back to the airport was great too. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone traveling with small children.

Reviews.Title: “A Great, Reasonable Choice for a Lovely Disney Experience”
Reviews.Author: cecomp76
Reviews.Content: Our family of four had a wonderful, weeklong, Christmastime stay at the Port Orleans Riverside and would wholly recommend it to those traveling to Disney. Keep in mind that this is one of Disney's "moderate" resorts. The name is exactly what it says it is - moderate - it is not one of Disney's "deluxe" resorts and it is certainly not a luxury resort by any means. Do not expect that - if a deluxe or luxury resort is what you need, then pay the extra money for one. However, the grounds of Riverside are beautiful and generally quiet and serene, rooms are clean and satisfactory, and the amenities are plentiful for a moderate resort. Here are some observations about Port Orleans Riverside and some general recommendations I think may be helpful: 1) First and foremost, DO YOUR RESEARCH before you book your room and before you go to Disney. Look at Trip Advisor reviews, buy a current travel book on Disney World and use this website - www.wdwinfo.com - it is an "unofficial" website on Disney, has a ton of information on all things Disney and comes in very handy. For instance, it is true that the Riverside grounds are very large. For us, and because the grounds were so picturesque, it added to the appeal. However, because I had gone to the website above, I had looked at a map of the resort in advance and picked the building I thought looked the most centrally-located. When I made our reservations through Disney online, I requested this building. When we checked in 11 months later (at 11 a.m. without difficulty), the lady at the counter had us in a different building. I nicely asked her if we could be moved, she made a phone call to see if a room was ready there, and made the change - no problem! Disney is there to please, and courtesy and politeness is appreciated by them as well. I'm sure they deal with more than their fair share of cranky travelers so be nice! 2) We traveled with three adults and a teenage girl. The room was plenty big for all of us. It is not huge. The curtain between the double-sinks and the bedroom area is nice for changing or getting ready in privacy, even while someone else is showering through the door. The room was also clean. Based on some of the pictures below, I was looking in the corners and cracks and crevices for something gross - but found nothing. 3) Our housekeeper left us fun surprises - a Christmas tree made out of a large pine cone the first day and different towel animals other days. She left us plenty of extra coffee packets each time so that the three of us were able to enjoy at least 2-3 cups every morning. Tip your housekeeper! 4) Two observations where I thought the resort needed to improve. First, the quality of the towels are not great. They are thin, and sometimes stringy. Second, the doors to the rooms, at least the ones I saw, needed a fresh paint job. Hopefully Disney is getting around to fixing both! 5) Food in the food-court area was fine. We especially liked the create-your-own omelets for breakfast and the create-your-own pasta for lunch. One day we walked along the river to the French Quarter and had lunch in the food court there. They have made-to-order beignets. Anyway, it was nice to have two options. 6) We spent time at both the main pool and the smaller pool by our room. Not having any little kids with us this trip, we thought the main pool might be too noisy or little kiddy for us. Though there were kids, of course, it was not loud. There is a bar at the main pool that has fun cocktails and beer. We also went down the little water slide a couple of times! Towels are available at the main pool, but not at the smaller pools. 7) The bus transportation is fine. The longest we waited for a bus was probably 10 minutes. Also, depending on which park you're coming back from, you may stop at the French Quarter to drop off its guests first (there is only one stop at the French Quarter, though, compared to Riverside's four). 8) Utilize the free Magical Express if you're flying into Orlando. It was so nice not to have to worry about our bags. We checked in and went straight to a park. When we got back from dinner that night, our bags were waiting for us in the room. (As a side note, we chose not to take the Magical Express back to the airport because you typically have to leave the resort at least 3 hours in advance of your flight. We took a cab. If you do this, call the bell desk and arrange a time for them to pick up your luggage - they won't make you lug it through the resort. They'll also check it for you if you want to hit a park before you leave.) So â€“ have a great time at Disney and the Port Orleans Riverside! We would stay here again, but would like to try other resorts in the future because Disney has so much to offer. Riverside was our second stay on Disney property and neither disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans Riverside”
Reviews.Author: schappymommy
Reviews.Content: OK people. This is the down to the nitty gritty review! I will be completely honest and give you a review from a regular middle-class stay at home mom of 2 kids. Resort- I was a little disappointed in the resort. For the money we paid, we could have stayed at the Hilton across from Downtown Disney. The only reason we stayed inside Disney was b/c of our 2 year old and we thought the convenience would override anything. We found out that anything you buy can also be delivered to the Hilton or any other "offsite Disney" hotels. Just so you know, a double stroller rental was $170 for 6 days. I could have bought a jam-up stroller to keep for that price. My own fault though for not checking ahead! The resort is very "green". Breakfast was ok, but the burgers were great. The piano man was awesome, although we didn't eat at that restaurant. You could see him as you walked through the hotel. I wish I had heeded the warning from the other review that said it's hard to make the south interesting when you live in the south. I think this resort would be great for someone from the city who lives in an apartment, but we can see woods in our backyard. Also, there was not much for the kids here. They had a 25" or so tv in the lobby playing the classic cartoons. My kids thought it was great. There was also an arcade there that my 5 year old son loved. They did have carriage rides and boat rentals, which we didn't do. The boat to downtown Disney was convenient. The room was clean and service was great. We needed extra blankets and towels on 2 different occasions. Each time they were there within 5 minutes.No cute towel animals, though. Also, the guys who helped with our luggage were super! One gave us tips and the other talked like Donald Duck for the kids. Super-nice guys!!!! I can say that I would not want to stay there again. We went to the Hilton just to see what it was like. It was more beautiful than the PO Riverside. We also toured the campground at Fort Wilderness. It was awesome!!!! We have already booked for 2009. It had horseback riding, a marina, pools, playgrounds, smores campfires at night, Mickey's Backyard BBQ, Hoop De Doo?, etc. So many things for kids!!!! Places to eat---- We had the dining plan and saved lots of $$$$. The average meal would have been about $100 for dinner and counter service (hamburger, fries, wraps, combos, etc) would have been about $40 for 2 adults and 1 child. We paid $38.99 per adult per day. Favorite was Wolfgang Puck's Cafe at Downtown Disney-sushi was excellent!! Mud pie was best dessert at Disney World! Boma at Animal Kingdom Lodge was very interesting and very tasty! Pecos Bills at MK was good for a counter service (dining plan is good idea) Kona Cafe at Polynesian is awesome! Le Cellier was delicious! (Canada at Epcot) Tokyo Dining was good. Raglan's Road had best bread pudding ever, but chowder was not good. I had mixed grill. It was good. I hope this helps. Have a good trip. See ya at the campground or the Hilton!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Family Vote is No”
Reviews.Author: hypopion
Reviews.Content: We planned this vacation for our family of 5 through Disney. In order to accommodate 5 ,our choices were limited. We stayed 4 days 3 nights at Port Orleans Riverside. We are from Michigan and live on a farm. I wanted this one and only true vacation to be wonderful for our 19,16 and 11yr old daughters. A Christmas to remember. Due to snow storm we arrived later in the day and in the dark and we were given a map indicating to "go over the bridge stay to the left, circle around to here" and your room is in this area. Wow, after what seemed 20 minutes through the curvy, dark, sidewalks with 5 suitcases we finally found our room.The hideabed was a mattress on wheels. NO SHEETS which at 7pm is a bummer.The room was fine. Quiet. My recommendation is get closer to the main lobby. Dont stay in 34, recommend 17,18 otherwise you are in the boonies. Each time we went to the lobby we never found the same way twice. It is too spread out. The food is definitely overpriced. YOU MUST take the dining plan. We took the shuttle(fortunately close by) to downtown disney and ate our Reserved dinner at Wolfgang Puck $168 ,good food, good portions, our favorite. The tip is not included and is 15-18%. Bring extra$! We purchased breakfast the next day and traveled to Polynesian Resort ate at Kona Kafe good, $65+ tip. Monorail to the Magic Kingdom. The older kids did not like MK. Bored after the fast rides were exhausted. The castle and night parade were great. We ate off the 2 meal Dinner Plan Plus 1 snack/ each day We recommend paying for breakfast (cheapest) and use the plan for Lunch (cafeteria service) and Dinner table service (make reservations for dinner), The Crystal Palace was nice- character dining. Prime rib, salmon, shrimp, and other palatable kid foods $190 + tip. EPCOT The Princess Story Book in Norway $215+ tip, small portions - character dining, over rated. The kids overall were not particularly impressed by the characters, and likely would avoid character dining in the future, in search for better food. Disney personnell were great. Crowds at Christmas and waiting 70 minutes for rides were the norm. Take the Fast Pass opportunity. Advantages: since you have access to any Disney area, you can eat or go anywhere. We brought our swim suits and when we were tired of walking at EPCOT, we slipped over to The Beach Club and Yacht Resort and swam a couple of hours. Changed our clothes and went to finish Epcot. In the future we will pay the extra dollars and stay at the Yacht Club. Alot less hassel for kids enjoyment and less shuttle service required. We left Disney and Alamo car rental picked us up and brought us to their door. We traveled to the Gulf coast and stayed in St. Pete. Beautiful beaches. Returned the car at Orlando Airport easily. Hope this is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Love It!”
Reviews.Author: Marfala
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived in Disney, we stayed in a Downtown Disney resort hotel. This was a mistake! We moved over to Port Orleans and thankfully they had a room available on such short notice. From the moment we arrived, the vacation took a different tone. There is absolutely no comparison to staying on Disney property. The transportation was great, the food selections at this property were unbelievably good and the room itself was was quite adequate. My only negative thing is just the sheer size of the property and it is alot of walking to your room. The ferry offers another mode of transportation to the Downtown Disney area which is another activity in itself (what a nice ride at night!). They have bike and kayak rentals along with carriage rides for hire. This is perfect for a family because the dining areas are large and accomodate families very well. I would recommend this to anyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Dining Experience”
Reviews.Author: lmkFtLauderdale
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent our first Anniversary weekend at your resort. Our special Dinner at Boatwright's was the highlite of our weekend. The special attention we received was above and beyond what we expected. The food was phenonemal, and the service by the staff was tremendous. Special thanks to Ty and Jorge who made our dinner one we'll never forget. Our table was the same as our first date seating, and the end of our meal was a surprise, as we were presented with balloons, champagne, strawberries, gifts, and an announcement of our presence by the staffers to the whole restaurant...all this unexpected to us. We were seated at the same table we sat at on our first date 12 years ago, which was all we requested. Port Orleans Riverside has and will always be our favorite Resort. It's relaxing, clean, and has a special charm. We've spent many visits there, and highly recommend it to anyone we know visiting Disneyworld. An added note: We are 61 and 55 years of age, and don't expect that we'll be spending a whole lot of wedding anniversaries together, but your efforts will never be forgotten, especially in these difficult economic times. Thank you from the bottom of our hearts.

Reviews.Title: “Ok resort, but you may spend a lot of time in the busses”
Reviews.Author: mominut
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans riverside for 6 nights at the first of December. The resort was OK, the rooms were a little dated but clean. I did not realize that Port Orleans riverside has 4 bus stops, there may be other resorts that have more than 1 stop, but none that I saw. It is something to ask about though because it made for some long bus rides when they had to stop at the other stops before they took you to were ever you were going! We have also stayed at the Animal Kingdom lodge which was great! I totally recommend it if you have the money to upgrade to a deluxe resort, one main reason is that you don't have to go outside for anything if you don't want to. One day that we were there it rained buckets on us all afternoon so we went back to the hotel and it was covered all the way from the bus stop to our room and then we did laundry and went to eat , they had activities going on for the kids and we never had to go outside and get wet. At the Riverside we would have had to go outside and have quite a walk to do all those things. Anyway back to the Port Orleans riverside, I was also disappointed that they could not guaranty us adjoining rooms, we booked 9 months in advance and had a Grand Gathering and they still could not guaranty us adjoining rooms or even side by side. I was told to call 3 days prior to arrival and ask then, which I did and I was told they still didn't know if we would get adjoining rooms and then the night before we checked in I called and was told we would get adjoining rooms, but we did not, they weren't even side by side. I guess I just can't understand why they can't get you adjoining rooms especially if you book so far in advance.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: travelcrazy2
Reviews.Content: we loved it. we have stayed here about 10 times. everything is clean and nice beautiful landscaping. great food court nice lobby. nasty pop warner screamers but overall nice

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: enchantedeverafter
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel. We were traveling with an infant and it was the best vacation of our lives. Upon arrival the front desk saw we had a baby and made sure to call ahead to mousekeeping and have a crib set up for us with cute little Mickey Mouse sheets. When we arrived home from the parks each day there were adorable towel animals waiting for us. The food was totally amazing (Boatwrights breakfast is so good) and the ambiance there is just something you need to experience to understand...you are completely whisked away to someplace dreamlike. The theming is perfect. Our room was pristine and cleaned thouroughly each day, and the customer service was some of the best we have ever received. This hotel is worth each and every penny. I would reccomend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rachelpoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Alligator Bayou. My husband and my 2 daughters ages 21 and 25. The room was big enough and always cleaned by noon. If you can ask for Alligator Bayou. Its very close to everything,(bus station, store etc.) The other buildings were a nice hike from everything. Over all for the price you pay you will be very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly BRILLIANT.”
Reviews.Author: Jetsrock26
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in 2006, and it wasn't that great then. But we came back this year and we LOVED it. Everything about it was great. The staff, the rooms, even the landscape. We stayed in the Magnolia Terrace building. The Acadian house, Magnolia Terrace, Oak Manor, Parterre Place Buildings may look like they're more expensive than the regular buildings, but they're really not. The rooms and prices are the same as everything. You should request the Magnolia Terrace or Oak Manor Buildings because of the features, though. They have elevators, vending machines, and they both have their own quiet, private pools for their guests. Anyway, the staff was excellent. They were all so helpful and friendly, and would help you with anything you needed. There are two places to eat at the PO Riverside resort: There's a great food court that has salads, sandwiches, pasta, pizza, and a bakery. It's also open until 11:00 PM. Then there's the Boatwright's Dining Hall, which you need reservations for, but it's very good. The rooms were great too. They were a little small, but they were perfect for what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great time had by all!”
Reviews.Author: SouthDakotaGrannyof7
Reviews.Content: This was a trip I've waited for a long time to come. My husband and I came with our whole family. There were 13 of us which included 7 grandchildren ages 14-3. We commented several times how friendly everyone on staff was. The room was a bit small but big enough for my scooter to be charged each night! After all, we only slept and showered in the room. The grounds were beautiful and well kept. Unfortunately the weather was a bit chilly to swim in the pool even though it was heated. This was the first time we stayed on Disney property and believe it's the way to go! The meal plan was helpful but a bit confusing at first. We weren't sure what we had left until we finally asked. The food was yummy and hot. Both at the resort and in the park restraunts. And the bus system was great. It was relaxing not to have to drive and find a parking spot and remember where you parked. You get picked up at the hotel and dropped off at the parks. What more could you want? I'm starting to save up so we can do it again. The only complaint was that it went by so quickly!! I'd like to thank everyone at Port Orleans Riverside for treating us like family. We hope to see you again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Loved IT!”
Reviews.Author: jkk0752
Reviews.Content: I loved this Hotel. I was only there for about 2 days but I was impressed. The Double king size bed and a pull out army cot amazed me. Also, The actual room itself was almost as big as a school room. The placement is awesome, the 4 different pools were great, the breakfast hall Amazing and thats just the half of it....... well i gotta go gotta get back to study hall haha

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: sgcollection
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay! This was our third stay here and every time has been outstanding. My only advice is DO NOT MAKE LONG DISTANCE CALLS FROM YOUR ROOM! We made a couple very short calls and our bill was over $100. We were in shock! Another tip, for a great lunch, buy everyone kids meals and take them back to your room (technically they are only for children under the age of 10). And try out the T-Rex restaurant at downtown disney for a special treat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: suzhorn
Reviews.Content: Not the Grand Floridian, but comfortable, clean and much less expensive. Rooms offer good-sized sleeping areas and bathrooms, with double sinks and small refrigerators. Grounds are pretty, but be prepared for fairly lengthy walks from rooms to main buildings. Dining area, like most self-service eating places at Disney World resorts, can be very crowded and hectic. Food at the one sit--down restaurant is surprisingly good.

Reviews.Title: “We got bed bugs......”
Reviews.Author: dimplesbe9
Reviews.Content: Would never stay there again...... got attacked by bed bugs and brought them home with us. We have spent over $1000.00 between doctors and trying to remedy the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans Riverside.... Great for familys”
Reviews.Author: Fazza01
Reviews.Content: We are a family of five, three girls (18, 13, &10). We live in Essex UK and this is our fifth visit to Port Orleans Riverside. We have stayed here for the last five years and just felt it was time to write a review. We have got to know this hotel and some of the staff very well over the years and the kids have always looked forward to staying here. The hotel is very big, it takes a bus fifteen minutes to get around the whole complex. There are plenty of pools in the complex although the bigger one (ol' man river) tends to get a little too busy. All disney hotels are nice, well maintained, well staffed and above all very secure. From the moment you arrive at the gatehouse check in, you know you are going to feel safe and relaxed. This is classed as a mid range hotel by Disney, but it isa decent four star to say the least. The rooms are spacious, with comfy beds, good size bathroom/shower and sat TV. The big thing about Disney is that you feel like you are part of it, that you are coming home as such, and you only really get that feeling by staying in one of these big resorts. Most nights we would get the 30 minutes ferry boat to Disney Downton & Marketplace. There are plenty of shops and restaurants to choose from and the BIGGEST Disney shop in the world. It is worth mentioning that the last two years we have travelled to Disney, we have used the Disney Dinning package. This is a MUST especially if you have children. You can get to eat in any Disney restaurant, but you must book early. We planned and booked our dinners 6 months in advance. Sadly we will not be going back to Port Orleans next year as we have booked a two bedroom/kitchen suite in Saratoga Springs for 2009. We feel a change (although only small) is needed. I am sure we can find a way to get our favorite ferryboat trip in some how....

Reviews.Title: “Pretty but not too impressed.”
Reviews.Author: Mommymagic
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice, very pretty grounds. I was a little dissapointed when I found my request for a Oak Manor or Magnolia building not filled and since I paid for a perferred room I was really bummed to be in the furthest building away (building 25)from everything and the pool outside my room was closed for all but one day of my 7 day trip. It was a pretty walk but a pretty long walk too. If this was a hotel any where but in Disney I would have been thrilled but I hold Disney to a higher standard! I do have to say our housekeeper was very nice, I got to meet her when my small baby and I had to run back to the room from the pool (very far) in a down poor. She even left a thank you note for the tips. As for the other staff, no one seemed to care about the fact that I paid for a perferred room to be close to the center of things and no offer to compensate the price diffrence or care that the pool that was close to our room was closed almost the whole time. Not the magic I'm used too. Pop Century has always had a magical staff and fun atmosphere. For a value resort, I like it better then the Moderate Port Orleans. The hotel was ok but I am not too impressed...

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil Grounds”
Reviews.Author: KershKomments
Reviews.Content: My family had previously stayed at Coronado Springs twice in the last three years. We were hesitant to try a different resort, as we were very comfortable with CS, but we were actually a little "tired" of the Pepper Market at CS, so we stayed at POR. It was a good decision, as Port Orleans, with it's beautiful and tranquil grounds, is probably the best of the moderate hotels within WDW. The boat ferry to Downtown is an attraction unto itself. We did pay a visit to Coronado Springs and it seems that resorrt has now been positioned as a convention property; we noticed several businessmen around the property with alcoholic beverages whooping it up a bit after the meetings and seminars. Um, not the kind of atmosphere I'd want my kids around. The POR food court gave us a lot of dining options and we ended up doing pizza a few nites and sharing a lot to save money. With four kids (three under 6) you can't spend $50/60 for every meal. We were able to do a lot of meals under $40 and all were happy and filled. You can't beat the free shuttle to and from the airport and within the WDW complex. Although it did seem that the shuttle buses were way less frequent to and from the resorts/parks as opposed to our previous stays at CS. Still, I guess it's also a matter of being at the right place at the right time and catching the buses at the right moment. But for the convenience of not having to drive for a week, you put up with having to wait a bit for the buses. Besides, we're on vacation. The rooms are small, as they are at most Disney properties. And to pay an extra $150 (or more) to stay at a Deluxe resort for an extra 100 square feet of space doesn't make sense. And it's really true that you are only in the rooms to sleep. We were up and out everyday at 8a and returned around 7p. Just in time to grab dinner, a shower and then sleep. And boy do you sleep after a day at Disney. We didn't spend a lot of time in the pool, mostly because it's tough watching the little ones, but the times we did go in, the kids just loved the little waterslide. How can you beat it? It looks like we're not going to do Disney this year, but we can't wait until next year when we will definitely return to Port Orleans Riverside. We still have fond memories. Trust me: You get a lot of bang for the buck at this beautiful resort. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: jamchr37
Reviews.Content: The family and myself loved this place, when we go back we will stay at Port Orleans Riverside. Very nice, room was very clean, service was excellent, all that you would expect from Disney. For the money it is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans is a nice option”
Reviews.Author: michigansup
Reviews.Content: My 5 y.o. daughter and I stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside from Nov 4-10, 2008. Overall, we enjoyed our stay. Magical Express was fine. I would not pay extra for a taxi or other shuttle. We were at the hotel within 1 hour of landing. Check in went fairly quickly, waited 15 minutes in line at 8 pm. Went right to room, then to the quick service restaurant to eat. Luggage arrived at 10 pm at the room. We used the Magical Express and checked our bags for them to pick up. Did not eat at Boatwrights, the table service at the hotel, but did use the quick service quite a few times. The food was fine (not fabulous) and there were many choices, including pasta, salad, fruit, pizza, and your typical fried food, as well as many breakfast choices. Our room was in the Magnolia Terrace Building (85), room 8788. I must say that I was dissapointed by the room, even though the grounds, common areas, and pools were nice. The furnishings are in need of an upgrade, ours had some scarring and scuffing. The carpet was older and made my feet black, so we wore our flip flops in the room. There was noticible thick dust behind everything, on top of the hair dryer and coffeepot, and the mouldings needed a good cleaning. The bathroom area was pretty clean with no mold or mildew. I did ask for more sheets to remake the beds as they use full flat sheet for the bottom that do not fit, and my feet were on the mattress pad. Pillows were hard and uncomfortable. Air conditioner worked just fine. The only thing that dissapointed me was the room. However, we did not spend alot of time in it. The walking at the resort we did not mind as we hike our farm daily anyway. Our building was extremely close to the East bus stop, which picked up here before going to the main stop so we always had a seat on bus. I would stay here again, but would hope that they will be refurbishing in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK, Wouldn't Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: joalexajeff
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the POR from November 4 - 9, 2008. This was a group trip so we had no choice in the matter, but we went with high expectations (after all, this is Disney). Perhaps we are a bit spoiled from staying at the Grand Floridian on prior trips to Disney, but this resort was disappointing. The room we stayed in at AB, building 37, showed some wear, especially in the tub where the floor was cracked and had a funny color. The sheets were not changed during our entire stay. There were no animal towels or special treats to make us think "Disney" (I was there with my 11 year old daughter). The walk to the food court and the main pool was long, and the breakfast was bad compared to the prices. We had much better breakfasts in the parks (especially at France in Epcot where we stopped at the bakery...yum). Stick with the muffins or cinnamon buns at the POR, the rest is average and overpriced. One member of our group had problems with bugs in their room, and was basically ignored by Disney management. Bell service was bad, I had to call three times before someone showed up to help us, and the bellman was less than friendly. At other resorts, guests are transported in the golf carts. At POR, don't even think about getting a ride. I won't even go into all that time wasted on airline check-in at the lobby area. Suffice to say none of these problems occurred at the Grand Floridian! Bus service to the parks was ok, the parks were not crowded at all, except for Saturday at Epcot where the food and wine festival was going on. My advice is to save up enough $$$ to stay at a deluxe resort unless you prefer just okay hotel accomodations on your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Port Orleans Riverside... Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: MPS0619Deptford
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4-night (November 5th â€“ 9th) stay at the Disney Port Orleans Riverside hotel. One Adult and three children (age 11, 12 & 14). The check in process was quick and efficient; we arrived at noon, and were promptly given our keys to our room even though check-in time is at 3:00 pm. We were asked if anyone was a 1st time visitor, or if we were celebrating any birthdays. Answering yes to both questions got us buttons to wear; the kids loved that. All three children were celebrating birthdays, so our check in person asked for their favorite character. On day three, we returned to our room and were surprised to find color photo cards; addressed and autographed to each kid, wishing them a special birthday celebration. That was a nice touch, and it even impressed the 14 year old. The room was more than adequate in size for the four of us, there was plenty of storage in the drawers for us to unpack and get comfortable. Since the kids were boys and girls, it was nice to have the curtain section near the sinks for some privacy. Our room was nicely located in Oak Manor, facing the river and next to one of the small pools. We were a very short walk to the main building, the main pool, the boat depot, the food court and the South bus Depot. I had hesitated to make the reservation at Riverside, wondering if one of the â€œPOPâ€� hotels would be better for the kids and was surprised to note that they really enjoyed the look and feel of the hotel. They loved crossing the wooden footbridge over the river. We all enjoyed the quite peacefulness of the resort, especially after a long day at the Parks. Meals in the food court were quick, efficient, and tasty. We had one lunch, three breakfasts and a number of snacks at the hotel. My picky eaters ate almost everything. Although I had rented a car, we did not use it. It sat parked not far from our room for the duration. We choose to use the Disney Transportation each day, which was wonderful. The busses do get crowded, and on a few occasions we did stand on the bus. But the Port Orleans Riverside is so nicely located that it never took more than 20 minutes of travel time to arrive at our destination. The queue for the return from the parks was very large, and our hotel seemed to be full the dates we were there. Sometimes we saw three or four busses arrive at one time, or shortly after each other. We never had to wait more than 12-15 minutes for a bus; which was just good timing on our part. The boat service from Riverside to French Quarter and to Disney Marketplace was fun and enjoyable. Our boat driver gave us an update on the construction along the riverside, while keeping us informed of time tables, and how to return from the Marketplace if we choose to travel after the last boat at 11pm. We were prepared to â€œover useâ€� our fast pass, but the parks were not as crowded or full as we had expected. We used the fast passes, so we could ride something a second or third time. We didnâ€™t miss out on anything we wanted to do. It was amazing to be in the Magic Kingdom at 11:00 pm on Friday Night then again at 9:00 am on Saturday Morning and see the Christmas Decorations that â€œmagically appearedâ€� overnight. I had dinner reservations for three nights, and each one was better than the previous. We started at the 50â€™s Prime Time CafÃ© in Hollywood Studios on Thursday; if you go please say hello to â€œUncle Timâ€� for us. It was a treat to eat in momâ€™s kitchen and enjoy talking with Uncle Tim during dinner. And even funnier when he put the 14 year old in the corner for not eating his string beans. Even when Uncle Tim disguised them as desserts, the kids would not eat them. We all had a great laugh. Friday was at the Contemporary Hotel at Chef Mickeyâ€™s. Nice way to meet and greet the characters getting photos with Mickey, Minnie, Donald Duck, Goofy and Pluto. Saturday was the real treat, to have dinner at Cinderellaâ€™s Royal Table. Cinderella gave my 11 year old daughter a hug like they were best friends that had not seen each other in months. The dinner includes a photo with Cinderella at no extra charge, soft drinks, appetizer, dinner and desert. Just when we were leaving there was also a meet and greets with the godmother and the coach mice. Even the 12 year old enjoyed looking around the castle, and getting photoâ€™s taken with the Knight in Armor. Overall, a fantastic trip, wonderful hotel, which was both enjoyable and relaxing. We would definitely stay at Riverside again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - fulfills the dream!”
Reviews.Author: TheBoveyBacks
Reviews.Content: For our long-awaited, long-saved-for, eagerly anticipated family holiday of a lifetime, the Back Family - 2 adults & 2 boys (7 & 9) - booked into the Port Orleans Riverside on the 15th October 2008. This resort - it is a series of 2-storied bedroom apartments - met every need & wish we had. The service from reception to room cleaning to maintenance staff was unwaveringly fantastic. The apartment, albeit effectively one en-suite room, was well-appointed, clean & quiet. This resport is one of the Disney resports that has a boat service that suplements the standard bus services, & this was an addition that we used regularly - a casual boat to Downtown Disney was used on several occasions. Buses to all six (!) Disney parks were regular & were always staffed by friendly people. Pool areas were plentiful, & the main pool was good to use. The food court was the poorest of it's facilities, but even this was good enough for us to use on several occasions. All in all, excellent - you get the ultra-convenience of a Disney resort hotel combined with a feeling of being slightly away from the madding throng. Loved it & would recommned it in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: marine45
Reviews.Content: This is a great location for your holiday in Florida, buses run every 20 mins to most Disney locations. Universal, Sea world, Wet and Wild are only a short drive away. The food was overall very disappointing and expensive, it was not a problem for us as we generally eat out. In the food hall be prepared for just about all the staff not having much of an understanding of English they can come over as a little rude. The facilities on site are good, great pool with loads of life guards on duty, the shop is ok for your bits and bobs. One thing to remember when planning your holiday in Floriday is that you pay tax on most purchases, over the two weeks we spent over Â£250.00 in tax!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful property!!!”
Reviews.Author: pixietink09
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at this hotel numerous times and absolutely love it! Of course all of the Disney properties that we have stayed at have been amazing but this one is just wonderful! I love the Animal Kingdom Lodge, and although that one is a deluxe this one can really match up to it! The rooms aren't as fancy and the lobby is simpler but the property is so well kept up and peaceful! I love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good resort - questionable housekeeping for room 8034”
Reviews.Author: bf67
Reviews.Content: Disney World is a great trip if you enjoy waiting ... in lines. Two adults and our 14 year old visited for the 1st time and stayed 4 days. We liked the Riverside Resort property very much. The setting, grounds & landscaping are beautiful. Sadly the Magical Express was disappointing upon arrival. It took too long before it left the airport to drop us along with other newly arrived guests off - too much time and opportunity waisted. Check-in at the resort went smoothly with a very helpful and polite young lady. Then off to our room (#8034) which was not magical at all. Simple, plain, unexciting but functional. Tolerable until I discovered both a filthy coffee maker and hairdryer. (I took photos! Nasty, nasty, nasty). However the beds were clean, well made & comfortable each day of our visit. A few general thoughts about our Disney World experience/lessons - Stop by your local library and borrow a few Disney World advice books prior to booking your trip - they are full of great insights. We would strongly encourage you NOT to use their luggage delivery service - why wait 3 hours for your stuff - one of our bags arrived around 11pm?! The bus system between resorts and parks is a great service & worked well, just expect some buses to be packed with visitors and leave enough time between points. The Disney meal/dining plan is a TERRIFIC VALUE! Don't second guess it - Buy it! Make dining (table service) reservations. The food was generally very good. Buying food items a la carte in the Disney Resorts without the dining plan, is very very pricey. We reserved dinners at Boatwrights, Mama Melrose's, Ohana & Marrakesh - all delicious meals. Choose your breakfast/lunch/snack (quick service meals & snacks) venues in the parks (Except EPCOT) carefully - they were hit and miss. It was encouraging to find salads and a few other non-typical fast food menu items in a few of the parks venues. The FASTPASS service for the park rides is super, once you figure it out. Use it! Go and see Fantasmic! Wow! Wow! Wow! The evening fireworks displays were very impressive. Take a river boat ride from Riverside into Downtown Disney. Spend a few hours in your room or by the pool regenerating each day - the constant standing, walking and lines are draining. The Magical Express back to the airport was prompt, efficient and easy. Thank you. We would consider a future visit to another resort property and to revisit EPCOT.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for a disney holiday”
Reviews.Author: delacourt
Reviews.Content: We (6 yr old my husband and myself)have just returned from 9 nights at Disney's port orleans - riverside hotel and it is a good choice for an extended stay in Disney World. I will begin by saying that the hotel was by no means full and my review will probably reflect this. Both my husband and myself agree it could be a really diffent experience (not a particullary good one) if the hotel was busy!!! I found every area of the hotel inside and out to be very clean and tidy. The reception staff were always on hand to help, and with a smile, we never had to wait long in a queue. The rooms are NOT posh but are adequate for crashing in. We had two small double beds and a small childs pull out bed, one bedside table. There is a table and two chairs, a bench and tv cabinet, with draws underneath. The sink area of the bathroom is open onto the bedroom with a curtain you can pull over, in this area is a hanging rail for clothes - no wardrobe. From the sink area is a door leading to the toilet and small bath and shower over. You have a fridge which is not stocked like a mini bar so great for cooling drinks bought at wal mart. There are 6 pools in the riverside part of the hotel, one with a slide. We used 2 of the 6 and they both appeared to be heated. Later on in the afternoon you may struggle for a sunbed if you want one in the sun, otherwise there were plenty in the shade. They have a lake where you can go fishing. You can hire boats of varing sizes to take out for a spin. You can hire bikes of varing types. In the evenings they have a couple of horse drawn carriages you can take a ride in. ( all extra charge) The free transport worked well whilst we were there, but if it's busy we can see that it could become a bit of a nightmare as previous people have reported. There are coaches constantly running from disney to the hotel and visa versa. You can also get on a boat to downtown disney. At the hotel there is a restaurant and also a small food court. We ate in the restaurant only once - it was dire, food and service. We were rushed through, the main course came whilst we were half way through our starter, half way through the main course we were asked if we were going to order dessert and when we said no the bill was put on the table. The food court was a bit better but really there was only burger/ fish fingers/ pizza/ chips, pasta, roast meat and salad stations. Breakfast was ok but get down earlier rather than later as it gets busy. The hotel sell cups that cost $32 and this allows you to have as many refills from the food court drinks station as you wish during your stay, anything from coffee to fizz drinks, there is also a sink at the staion so you can wash your cups. On these counts I would be very wary about opting for the disney food and drink option as you'd not have the choice to go to eat elsewhere. There are some good restaurants in downtown disney and on international drive. Although the hotel is a disney one it is not in your face, infact if you just stumbled on the hotel i doubt you would realise it was a disney one, except if you went into the shop! Would I stay here again probably not BUT just because we like to try a different hotel even if we are going back to the same place. Would I recommend it to friends with kids. YES for a longer holiday in disney it is a good value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very very good, and very very bad!”
Reviews.Author: PeedieLizzie
Reviews.Content: I had fully researched this hotel, through this website prior to booking. The hotel is vast, and a little impersonal. Don't expect to see the manager strolling past! However, check in was quick and our room was exactly what I was expecting. Its not huge, but was perfectly adequate for a family of 5. The beds were high enough to stow the suitcases underneith, which helped. Mousekeeping was absolutely brilliant. They arranged the childrens toys into amusing situations every day, left towel animals and cleaned to room to a satisfactory standard. The children raced to the room at the end of the day to see what their toys had been getting up to. It was a lovely touch. The room was a little walk from the main foodhall, but it was a very pleasant walk, and only took about 4 minutes. Over the last few months I've read many reviews which had lamented the distance involved. I think its healthy to have a stroll after a meal, and there were quite a few folk here who needed to do a bit more walking! My husband hated the foodhall with a passion, The carvery was fine, and the pasta bar was good too. The bakery was ok. However, the pizzas were dreadful, and the childrens options were very poor. I tried to get the lady serving to give me 'adult' chicken nuggets for my daughter - as they looked a bit more appetizing than the childrens ones. She was very unhappy to oblige, but I stuck to my guns. The customer is always right. Boatwrights restaurant was fine - we ate there twice. Its got a very limited menu, and again the childrens options were very poor, As a Brit I found it quite disconcerting that waiting staff would swoop on the table and remove a plate as soon as someone had finished. Don't they realise that this is a real faux pas? Leave the plates till everyone at the table has finished! Its not rocket science! The waiting staff were attentive, but I grudged leaving the requested tip, when they repeatedly removed plates before we required. The corn bread was very good though. The boat to downtown disney was brilliant - very pleasant way to start or end an evening, and we never waited more than 10 minutes or so. However, the buses were disgraceful. If all you want is to get to the parks within half an hour, with no regard to safety, they hit the spot. The heavy wait times predicted in previous reviews did not materialise. No wait time was longer than 20 minutes, which I think is acceptable. However, what is definately NOT acceptable is the crowding on the buses. I think it is ludicrous to expect small children to stand, holding on to rails. What happens if the bus brakes suddenly? It doesn't bear thinking about. Occasionally adults could be pursuaded to vacate their seat to allow a 3 year old to travel more safely, but more often than not, the adults already seated would look away, avoiding meeting the parents' eyes. Shame on you! Give your seat to senior citizens and children you rotters!! Also, much has been written on the web about Disney system of giving priority to motorised scooters. I don't mind at all waiting on someone who is genuinely disabled - and I realise it can be hard to tell - but there were occasions when we were held up considerably while the driver loaded on someone who was not disabled, but who had hired a scooter for the duration. A walk round the park would probably be just what the doctor ordered! The pool and landscaping of this hotel is fabulous. The lifeguards are very attentive. Generally the staff were good. Don't try to order pizza with a Scottish accent though. The non English speaking staff made the food court a trial at times. The shop is grand - with just the right mix of goods for sale. I probably won't stay here again, but that has more to do with the bus safety issues than any issues with the hotel itself. We stayed here a fortnight, and felt it was a little long. I think 5 or 6 days here would be just right, and the rest in a hotel off property.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Port Orleans, Riverside”
Reviews.Author: Angelcat467
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort with lovely river views, and walking paths. Plenty to do on site and easy access to Disney parks. Staff was courteous and helpful. The food was just so-so though, I'd recommend eating nothing but breakfast at the resort! And if you DO want a nice breakfast treat, take a short walk to the French Quarter hotel next door and order some beignet! This was probably the best item between both hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans Resort - Riverside Best Place to stay on Disney Property”
Reviews.Author: Stacy494
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside Resort for our honeymonn on October 19-25, 2008. I have stayed at several other Disney Resorts, and Port Orleans Riverside is the best one I have stayed at so far. The landscaping is beyond anyone's dreams. Our check it day at the resort was a breeze; it took all of 15 minutes total. When I originally booked the vacation I read several comments that the Alligator Byou section was the best section to stay in. They ended up putting us in the Oak Wood Manor Building 90 Mansion side; boy was that the best building ever. We had a corner room, looking at the river and a beautiful fountain. There was also a quite pool next to us as well. There are so many things to do at this resort that anyone could make a vacation just staying at the resort without going to any of the parks. They have horse and buggy rides, boats, and several other wonderful things to do. Our favorite thing to do was to take the riverboat to the French Quarter and Downtown Disney - wow what a beautiful site. I will have to agree with other reviews that the buses to the parks were a little overcrowed at times, but nothing super bad. The food court was the best way to go as far as taste and cost. A little hint - take a taxi ride from the resort to the Win Dixie to stock up on food; the resort has a fridge in the room and the cab ride was only $24.00. I would recommend this resort to anyone that loves nature and beautiful sites.

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice”
Reviews.Author: momofthree990003
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5, three children ages 2, 4, & 6. We originally booked Port Orleans because they offered a trundle bed which would accomodate the third child, this option was offered on the initial booking from the Disney Vacations website. When we arrived, we waited 45 minutes before a room could be found and were informed that no non-smoking trundle bed rooms were available and when questioned that it was reserved were informed this was not a guarantee. How can you take a reservation for 5 when a room can only accomodate 4? We were given the option to transfer to Coronado Springs which we took. Again, this only had 2 double beds and were given a fold away at no charge. Quite an imposition when traveling with three small children and we didn't receive our luggage until 10:00 that evening. Quite a disappointment with our first stay at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest resort for the price”
Reviews.Author: m1t2w3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Port Orleans Riverside with our two children ages 16 and 13. We all really enjoyed our stay. They had our room ready when we checked in (before normal time). The also had arranged the furniture to fit a roll away bed (which they had set up before our arrival). They also had the room very clean and even had washcloth shaped into a boy and a girl for our children. We always had a seat in the shade a the bus stop, which was only a few feet from our room in Magnolia Bend, even though we never had to wait long for a bus. The fact that they had the sinks outside the bathroom and it had a curtain for privacy was excellent for getting ready with many people, including the children. We had such a great time a Port Orleans that we already made a return trip to stay here again in December of this year. I would not stay any where else.

Reviews.Title: “My first stay at Disney and would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: EffinIllini
Reviews.Content: My family made our first trip to WDW this past September and we were able to take advantage of some reduced rate promotions on resorts. For our timeframe, the Port Orleans Riverside was the only moderate hotel offering this rate, so we chose to stay there. Our room was in building 28 of Alligator Bayou, which was some distance from the main resort buildings, but was quiet and very close to a smaller auxiliary swimming pool. From our building we used the west bus depot for transportation to the parks. This was nice at it was generally the first of the resort's bus stops. We had a standard 2 double bed room with a small table and chairs. Nothing fancy, but large enough to give the 3 of us room to move and as most things Disney - it was clean. A couple of nice feature about these rooms were the two sinks and separate room for the toilet and tub/shower. A couple of improvements would have been nice for the sinks to be in a counter rather than pedestal, and for there to be a fan in the bathroom with the tub/shower and toilet. Overall, however, the room was fine. As it seemed we were always in one of the parks, we may not have fully utilized our resort's amenities. As I mentioned there was a smaller pool very near our building that we used. We did try to use the main pool, but it was closed due rain. The main pool did have an outdoor bar. We did not use the main restaurant or bar in the resort, but we did get some take out from the food court. No complaints about the quality - I thought it was reasonable for cafeteria food. In the evenings when we purchased food there were baked goods, a salad bar, pasta bar which included pizzas, and a more traditional meal counter with items like turkey & mashed potatoes, etc. Overall I liked the relaxed tone of the resort and would stay here again. Maybe my only complaint is with the size of the resort and the distance we were located from the main building, but that was balanced out by the quietness we enjoyed. As for additional notes on transportation, the trips to Epcot and Disney Studios seemed quick, and the trip to the Magic Kingdom was just a little longer. Certainly the longest ride was to Animal Kingdom. We also used the Magical Express transportation to and from the airport. The trip went smoothly both ways, possibly helped that we may not have been at the busiest time of year. To note, though, Port Orleans is the last of 4 destinations to be dropped off coming from the airport and the first of 4 stops to be picked up going back to the airport, so just plan on some extra riding time.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: DisneyMa
Reviews.Content: We had many encounters with rude staff. Waiters ignored us in lounge. Management not sympathetic. Very long waits for the bus, 45 minutes most days ..in off season. Dirty housekeeping, dirty linens. Broken or missing security locks in restroom and laundry facilities. Pools not heated. The only postive here is the beautiful theming.

Reviews.Title: “Not good for business traveler”
Reviews.Author: scubachick_7
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 3 nights at the Disney Port Orleans resort to attend a conference being held at the Dolphin/Swan. Unfortunately, waited too long to book hotel reservations and the only conference hotel rate available was at Port Orleans $163 per night. While this hotel is probably a great option for families visiting Disney, I do not recommend it for business travel. Very limited hotel amenities - no room service - cafeteria style food - at high Disney prices. Rooms are very dated - which is not usually a problem for me - the issue was that the rooms were not clean. Cobwebs on the ceiling and sheets had not been changed from a previous guest as their was blood on one of the pillows. I'd choose to stay off disney property in the future - there are many nicer hotel with business traveler amenities with lower rates near by.

Reviews.Title: “Love Disney!”
Reviews.Author: 2bundles
Reviews.Content: I was a bit nervous after reading the reviews, but our stay was great. The room was really clean, big enough, and we got towel animals!! On the downside, a room requested close to the lobby for my disabled niece was not honoured, and the resort is very spread out. Anyone with difficulty walking needs a wheelchair. We were told they had run out, but we walked outside to see at least 15 stacked up! The beds are very high, so we pushed it against the wall so our 3 yr old wouldn't fall out. There was a trundle bed, but it was $15/night! Food court food was better than expected. Shuttle buses excellent and very frequent. There was a little bit of mould on the shower curtain, but it is a very humid climate and no real ventilation. Also, if you book through Disney Cruise lines (as we did) you have to pay for the "free" airport shuttle???

Reviews.Title: “Great Moderate Resort”
Reviews.Author: scottca075
Reviews.Content: Great Moderate Resort. Is that an oxymoron? I generally prefer the Disney Deluxe Resorts, with the Yacht Club being my favorite, but I had conference in Orlando and none of the Deluxes had rooms. My choices were to go to the Hyatt Grand Cypress (a hotel I like a lot) or do a Moderate resort. I opted for the Moderate resort because of the advantages of staying on property. I was pleasntly surprised on just about everything with the hotel. The grounds were great and well laid out. My room was nothing special, but was very clean, comfortable, spacious and very functional. The housekeeping staff did a great job during my four night stay and there was always some nice, personal touch when I returned to my room after they had cleaned it. The two greatest things about this resort were the pool at Ol' Man Island and being able to use the water taxi to get to Pleasure Island. The pool was nice because it is isolated from the rooms so you didn't hear any noise from it and it was a great pool to have fun in. Not as nice as the Yacht Club, but what pool can compare to theirs? The only negative for me is that they don't have more nice sit down restaurants. I was happy I stayed here over the Hyatt Grand Cypress. Even on a business trip Disney magic works for me.

Reviews.Title: “Preferred Fort Wilderness”
Reviews.Author: tsgeek
Reviews.Content: I like Port Orleans - the grounds are beautiful, and we had a quiet location, which was nice. I would likely stay here again with the kids - they'd love the main pool, the fishing hole, etc. (But this was a kid-free week!) Getting around to the parks was easy and convenient, though the Magic Express from the airport was really rather slow. I only have a couple of areas of concern: 1) There seemed to be something in the room I was allergic to. There was some mildew in the bathroom that might have been the culprit, but I'm not sure. At any rate, my sinuses and throat would flare up any time I was in the room to the point I had to go to urgent care to get medication to take the swelling down in my throat. After being out of the room for a while, I felt much better, then would go back and it would start all over again. 2) Dining options at the resort - one of the things that was recommended to us was to visit the resort restaurants at lunch time when they were not as crowded or booked solid. The restaurant at Port Orleans Riverside is not open at lunch. They have a food court, but to be honest, it wasn't really that good. At dinner, they had additional options that were much better, but those items, such as carved roast beef or turkey with all the fixings, are not available at lunch time. So that was rather disappointing. So, I think this is a perfectly fine place - just a couple of things. We stayed with the kids at the Fort Wilderness Lodge a couple of years ago, and I really liked that much better. But, it is a bit higher priced option, too. Again, I would bring my kids to Port Orleans Riverside, though would be more prepared for allergies next time.

Reviews.Title: “A break from Mickey”
Reviews.Author: alyson.johnson-smith_123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed on Disney property 3 times now, once at Animal Kingdom Lodge (Deluxe), once at All star Movies (Budget) and this time thought we would try a moderate resort and we were not disappointed. This is a really good hotel if you want to relax after a long day out and have a bit of down time from Mickey and friends. The hotel resort is huge and very relaxing, you can even go fishing at the fishing hole for $10 a hour which my husband loved (Fish not huge but great relaxation) There is a bit of a walk from most rooms to the bus stops/ shop and main bar but this is not a problem unless you find walking difficult. The only downside with the walk is that if you buy a refilable drinks cup ($12 I think) then you keep having to walk to the front of the hotel to fill it. The rooms are great and the Housekeeping did not let us down. We have found in America if you leave a small tip every couple of days rather than all at the end you do get a slightly better service. This is probably because they get paid less than $3 an hour. The main pool is lovely and nice and warm, there are other pools dotted around also. The Pool Bar is great and again relaxing. We never had a problem with the buses. They run about every 20 minutes but we found them more frequent than this. If you choose to go to the parks around 11am then the buses will be busy which is why I think people have to wait for the next one. You can also get a boat from the resort to Downtown Disney which run every 20 mins before 4pm and every 10 mins after (Journey time 20 mins) Overall this is an impressive resort and we would visit again. Any questions please feel free to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans - Mostly Good - Travel Agents Review”
Reviews.Author: Michelle0503
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd visit to PO Riverside (4th to Orlando) and we had a great holiday. This hotel is an ideal base for the parks and Downtown Disney, It is a huge resort, with stunning scenery, lovely walkways, plenty of wildlife(squirrels, ducks, lizards etc) but it has got a couple of issues: On our previous visit in 2006 we were allocated rooms in Oak Manor this year we were given Alligator Bayou, building 14, both are ideally situated for buses, food court etc, but the beds in Oak Manor are much more comfortable than Alligator Bayou, none of our party of 6 had a good nights sleep in 17 nights. Rooms are clean and the housekeeping was very good. We visited the bar a couple of times, which was not really to our taste and you need to keep an eye on your change from a couple of the not so friendly bar staff. We found this on our last visit, but think they are a little less friendly this year. Most of the other staff are great - as Disney staff should be. FOOD COURT:- We only used it a couple of times to grab something quick, but it does get very, very busy and there does seem to be only one speed - SLOW! BUSES:- This does need some improvement, one day we waited 30 minutes for a bus to Hollywood Studios, in that time there were 2 buses for Epcot, Magic Kingdom and Typhoon Lagoon, so you can imagine the queue when the bus did eventually turn up! Most of time the wait was only approx. 10 minutes but they do squeeze in as many people as possible, again this seems to be worse than before. The boat service to Downtown is really good, you might fall asleep on the return as it's so relaxing. DINING PLAN:- This is the 1st time we have had the dining plan and it was EXCELLENT and it was free with our package - you get 1 counter service meal, 1 snack and 1 table service meal per person per day of your disney ticket. We ate at a few top restaurants ie. California Grill at the Contemporary, the Maya Grill at the Coronado Springs, the Yachtsman Steakhouse at the Yacht Club and the Aloha at the Polynesian (character breakfast)these were all excellent you do have to give 2 of your table service allowances for the signature restaurants, if you plan where you would like to eat, rather than just using food courts you can get really good food, obviously we had to pay the 18% gratuity to pay, being a party of 6, but we still saved a fortune. Other places to try are Planet Hollywood and Raglan Road in Downtown Disney. We actually had 18 counter service meals left this is because we went to Universal, Island of Adventure and Seaworld, any snacks that are left you can use them on crisps, chocolate, drinks etc, we used 17 on the last day for nibbles on the plane. Overall this hotel is very good and yes we would stay here again, because there are more good points than bad.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: JINXYSouthWales
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome family,single,couple holiday .......We are allready booked to go back next year but staying in Animal Kingdom Lodge not that there was anything wrong at all in the Port Orleans I do not believe any hotel in Disney is bad, Its just that inc in our booking was the Disney Dining Plan....Well worth having as we basically spent no money inside of Disney at all ....... I believe they have changed it this year coming 09' to Quick service dining if you are staying in a 4 mickey key rated hotel, If on the other hand you stay in a 5/6 MIckey key you will have the dining plan we had this year dependant on when staying (check out Disneys site for dates). Sept was really a great time to go what little rain we did have was refreshing also the longest we waited for a ride was 10mins & as i mentioned previously the dining plan was amazing we ate at Cinderella's royal table an hour after arriving on our 1st night & also had a character breakfast dinner or evening meal everyday & all these were inc in the table serv dining plan ....even Planet hollywood so the only money we needed were for tips. It was also a year of a million dreams while we there & we were lucky enough to win special park dream time event tickets which gave us the chance to experience Magic Kingdom almost empty it normally holds 65000. people that evening there were approx 250 of us quite spooky but amazing all the same :) I would say to any one booking to stay in 4* or above simply for the plan the quick serv wont give you the character meals but it will save you a fortune especially if you have children with you. The rooms at Riverside are comfortable, air cond, staff are most helpful & grounds are beautiful, there are 2 pools but you can also go over to French Quarter to use that one & the boat rides to Downtown Disney are nice just remember the Mozi spray.

Reviews.Title: “Is this really a moderate level resort??”
Reviews.Author: blondelacy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I with our 3 children stayed at this resort last week. Housekeeping was not aware there were 5 not 4 people in our room and it took us 2 days to get an extra pillow. We also asked for an additional towel but never got it. The bathroom was so small I could not help give my son a bath. I was disappointed that a "moderate" level resort had no microwave and that we had to pay $10/day for internet services. On the positive side...check-in went very smoohtly, room was clean and the employees were very friendly. We requested a room close the bus lines and this was very helpful with 3 children returning back late in the evening. Overall, we had the best vacation at Disney and would probably stay at another resort if we ever do another Disney vacation...maybe a "deluxe" resort.

Reviews.Title: “Handicapped Room very good”
Reviews.Author: ZoomerToronto
Reviews.Content: Lovely room plus given adjoining room at no charge for third adult in our party. Clean, spacious, but a bit far from the dining facilities since we had a guest in her own wheelchair. Would definitely recommend Riverside. Left PhotoPass in room and phoned from Canada when we got home asking if it could be found, but no one called us back.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans Riverside is lovely but French Quarter feels like home!”
Reviews.Author: TINKGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Disney's Port Orleans Riverside for 2 weeks mid-September. We have previously stayed at French Quarter 3 times previously but felt like a change this year! Check-in was a little slow but there were 7 of us altogether, checking into 3 different rooms. We were happy with the Decor of our room in the Alligator Bayou section of the hotel. We were in building 14 which is the nearest building to the main lobby and food court. The other family members stayed in building 95 other at Magnolia Bend, these rooms have not been recently renovated like the Alligator Bayou rooms but they were still well presented. Our rooms were all clean and well stocked with soaps etc... The food-court was very busy and the main problem was by the time you waited in line to pay for your food, it had gotten cold. No choc chip pancakes at this food-court, which I thought was strange because you can get them at French Quarter which is a smaller food-court? Bacon delicious, burgers good also. Staff friendly and helpful. We also ate at Boatwrights for breakfast 3 times, try the Banana Stuffed French Toast, amazing! Wish I could have some now. Staff at Boatwrights also really polite and helpful. Used the main pool as well as the smaller pools, they were all clean and not too crowded. Didn't use the Bus Service as we rented a mini-van. We used the Boat Service to Downtown Disney once and it was nice, got a seat no problem. We rented bicycles which was fun and we also booked a Horse and Carriage ride around the resort which was very pleasant. The bar at the hotel is not bad but we didn't enjoy the entertainment it was a children's entertainer, not that he was bad, just that it was a bit loud. We visited Scat Cat's Lounge at French Quarter to see Elliot Dyson perform, he is really good. Overall we really enjoyed our visit but we did pop over to French Quarter's food-court 3 times and I have to say it just felt more like home. I would stay at Riverside again but only if French Quarter wasn't available.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend Riverside”
Reviews.Author: Ravens4ever
Reviews.Content: Overall I would rate the Port Orleans Riverside an 8 out of 10. This was actually my second stay at Riverside, but since my first stay was only a few nights on a business trip it really doesn't count. Check in was initially painless, but I was not provided a room right away (I initially checked in around 12:30 PM). At first this was no big deal and we took our three boys (6, 4 & 4) to Downtown Disney for lunch. However upon return to Riverside, the room was still not available at 2:30 PM, 3:00 PM and at 3:30 PM. After being told that the room might not be ready until after 5:30 PM, I had the issue escalated to a manager and was given another room. This process may not be an issue for families with older children (i.e. - they can check in, hit the parks right away and then come back in the evening) this does not work for other travelers that simply want to get in a room (like we did with our young boys). Admittedly I became very frustrated with the cast members considering that there are over 2,000 rooms at Riverside and they were trying to tell me that none of them were available at 3:30 PM. It is the norm (not the exception) for large hotels to provide travelers with a room well in advance of the standard 3:00 PM check in. This situation was made even worse by the cast member indicating that could end up being well after 5:00 PM before I ever got into a room. Just beware on this front. We ended up staying in Alligator Bayou # 34. At first I thought it was retribution for my escalation at check in since the room seemed to be in the building that was the greatest distance way a from the Lobby and Ol' Man Island. However we ended up enjoying # 34 because it was A) very quiet and B) right next to the West Depot bus stop. It was very nice having only a short walk from the bus to our room after a long day at the park. Speaking of the bus system, I would give it an overall grade of a B. It actually was a little more crowded than I expected (this holds true for the parks as a whole considering it was September - supposedly one of the least crowded times of the year), but our average wait was probably 10 minutes. For those of you new to Disney, beware that in terms of parks the Animal Kingdom is the greatest distance from Riverside. On top of that, the AK bus is often combined with a stop at Blizzard Beach. This can make for a very long ride. Considering that AK ended up being our kid's favorite park, we got to know this route very well. Also don't be afraid to grab a cab (either at the Resort or at one of the parks heading back to the Resort). We did this several times and it was always well worth the $15. Back to the room. Overall it was clean and met our needs during our 8 nights. However there was nothing special about the room or the Housekeeping (no cute towel animals or anything like that). My kids loved Ol' Man Island. While the water slide is probably too tame for teenagers, my kids thought it was the best. The layout of the pool also worked well in respect that my wife and I could hang out on a lounge chair and enjoy a cocktail while the kids enjoyed the pool. The lifeguards are also on top of their game at Riverside. There are always three monitoring the pool and they seemed to be doing a great job. We ate at Boatwrights one night. Pretty much what I expected (which was not much). It is OK when you have nowhere else to go (I think I threw the server for a loop when I ordered a bottle of wine). We ate in the food court once or twice and I would put it in the same category as Boatwrights (once again not much, but will make do). The best dining experience we had at the Resort was the in room pizza delivery. The pizza was very good and delivered in well under 30 minutes. I also used the laundry facilities on several occasions and have no complaints. There was even a "broken" drying during our visit that everyone was using to dry their clothes for free. Overall I would recommend Riverside. The grounds are beautiful (my kids loved chasing the lizards), the pool is very good, the rooms are as advertised, the bus service is acceptable and the food is OK in a pinch. Just beware that if you are used to checking into a large hotel before 3:00 PM (i.e. - actually getting into a room) it may not hold true at Riverside.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans Riverside - still a great resort”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbell39
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 14 night stay as Port Orleans Riverside and this is our third stay ( and 13th trip to WDW) at this resort and again we werent disappointed. Even though we had stayed here before after reading some reviews I was a little worried about this trip, but there was no need. We booked directly with Disney and used their Dining Plan, unless you opt for the "deluxe" dining plan, tips are now not included and this suited us much better, because unless you get good service you dont have to tip and when you do its your call how much! The room was exactly as we had asked for on the booking, high floor in a quiet location, it was clean and smelt great, we also noticed that the a/c had been updated since our last stay this time last year - the room was always cool, but with the new A/.C it also seemed to remove the moisture so nothing felt damp, which was great.
