Bathroom was clean, no mould or mildew, no stay hairs left behind and always had fresh towels, and room was cleaned daily, i think the mouse keepers get to know your pattern as we always left early in the morning sometimes returning lunchtime but our room was always done on our return. Bed/sheets were clean and comfy... little high up I am not the tallest person so have to climb up onto the bed, but hey its all part of the adventure. The resort is large but we find the walks from our lodge to the food hall quite nice and part of the holiday.. we walk at a relaxed place and where ever we have stayed in this resort at most its taken us 15 mins to walk but because the landscape is so nice, and the walks with bridges and all the foliage its really nice and relaxing, they even have different coloured paths so you know if you are on the right route! We hired bicycles and also the sea raycers and had a great time, so you dont need to spend all day every day at the parks, we swam in our quiet pool just a few steps from our room, this was always clean, we used the guest laundry, again this was great and really convenient. Also I have never seen so much maintainence, they are always doing something here, last year they were painting the external sections of the lodge we were in, this year they were doing some near to where we were staying this time, and also the main building was getting a makeover! Also they always seemed to hose down around the pools in the early morning. I think that the wildlife in the resort is great - squirrels, rabbits, ducks and also those little lizards are all part of it. The Cast members were good too, always said hello when going past in their carts and waving when on the boats.... all part of it to make you feel like you matter, we never had a problem with rude cast members. Our stay was excellent, and we wouldnt hesitate staying here again, infact we are most likely to be back at this same report next summer and I cant wait.

Reviews.Title: “Love/Hate Relationship”
Reviews.Author: swan7girl
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at Port Orleans Riverside for 7 days. We stayed in one of the "mansions" close to the main entrance on advice of our travel agent. Our room was very clean, spacious and suited our needs just fine. The grounds were beautifully landscaped, but Disney could do a little better w/ the lighting at night - it's very dark and difficult to see when walking, Add in all the tall plants and you could easily get creeped out if by yourself. Resort was very family-friendly. The pool: Kids loved the main pool w/ the water slide (grown ups liked it too!) and sprinklers. Lifeguards very observant. Pool clean and warm. Never used the hot tub once I saw a parent bring their toddler in it wearing a swim diaper! Ick!!!! The food court/restaurant: GO EARLY. Food court gets very crowded, especially in the morning. Buy a refillable mug but just remember its only good AT this resort, not at the parks as we were originally told. Also, if on the Disney dining plan, be aware of what your ENTITLED to per meal. Create- your-own omelets and pasta dishes were very good. Send in a family member to reserve a table. Bugs: I read several reviews about cockroaches but I never saw one myself or we'd have been out of there in a hot minute. My husband informed me after returning home that he did see one outside our room on the walkway. There are also plenty of little salamanders scurrying around outside too which wouldn't surprise me due to thick foliage. Buses: Holy cow does this ever need an improvement. Be prepared to wait and get crammed in like sardines. I'm convinced on more than one occasion we were over legal capacity. Hotel staff also swears they come every 20 minutes which is also not the case. If you have dining reservations at the parks, get to the bus stop an hour before you need to at your destination. No need to locate which bus your on when leaving any of the parks, just look for the LONGEST line possible and thats the one for Riverside. Honestly this needs some Disney magic to improve. Also parents w/ young children - don't expect grown adults to give up their seats for your kids. Service: We had great experience w/ the concierge, check-in, wait staff and life guards. All friendly, helpful and provided good advice. The only rudeness we encountered were other tourists! Extras: Character meal w/ princesses in Norway/Epcot and Mickey's Not So Scary Halloween Party were definitely worth the money. The Polynesian/luaua was boring and didn't keep anyone's interest. All in all, we had a great time at our resort and all the parks. It is what you make of it. I have no bones about recommending this resort but I would stay at another one just to get a change of scenery the next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Problems”
Reviews.Author: John73
Reviews.Content: First of all,I want to say that my family and I have stayed on Disney Resorts now for the last 5 years and we enjoyed it but this year there were problems at this resort hotel.I am not a Disney Basher but I have to be honest with this review as I have wrote other good reviews for our previous Disney trips on TripAdvisor before.First of all there were problems such as taking 40 mins to check in,very crowded Disney buses at the end of the night when leaving the parks compared to other resorts like the Carribean resort hotel which did not seem to have long waits/crowds for their buses.Then the management staff refused to honor our travel agents contract for the tips to be included in our Disney Dining meals which I was later paid for after writing a letter of complaint against Disney thru our travel agent.To top it all off on our last night in our room we saw bugs crawling around outside our room in the walkway and when we went to open our minifridge door we saw a bug crawling around top of the fridge.A staff member came up to our room within mins of our complaint to the front desk and when he moved the mini fridge we saw a dead cockroach behind the fridge along with a baby pacifier.We were throughly disappointed with this resort hotel and I will be staying off site close to downtown Disney when visting Disney parks in the future.The only postives for this hotel resort are the beautiful grounds and river views along with the relaxing river boat ride to downtown Disney which was excellent.Folks you can decide for yourself about staying at this resort but here is one person who will not be staying here again based on this bad experience which I felt had to be shared with the TripAdvisor readers.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in WDW”
Reviews.Author: Helztelz
Reviews.Content: Would definitely recommend a stay within the WDW complex. The settings and landscaping at Port Orleans Riverside was lovely and well laid out however it was let down by a few things. Firstly the food court in the mornings was crazy. If they were late in emptying the bins, we found food cartons/trays flowing out and onto the floor. It could get extremely crowded and chaotic. The food served was of reasonably quality. The sheets did not fit the beds in the rooms and the cleanliness could have been better. Also it was annoying to be woken in the night by the sound of neighbours flushing their loos. Great resort for families as the pools were plentiful and ideal for children.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely stay on WDW resort”
Reviews.Author: trojansarah
Reviews.Content: After having stayed off property the previous two times we had traveled for Disney vacations, this time we decided to try out the Disney Resorts. It was definitely worth the money. The property is wonderful, you could spend a day just there enjoying the riverboat, the pool, etc. They had a self-serve restaurant on property that you can walk to and a small video arcade as well. Staying on property gave us the luxury of never having to drive (and PARK) at the amusement parks, we just hopped on the FREE Disney Shuttles and let them get us where we wanted to go. This also meant that we could easily go back to our hotel room and take a nap before we went back out for dinner. Very nice! The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The hotel service was wonderful as well. Staying on property also allows you to have a FREE shuttle service to and from the airport. Great perk. They also provide FREE delivery service. If you buy something at one of the parks, you don' t have to lug it around for the entire day - just tell them you are staying at one of the resorts and they will deliver it to you at your hotel. WOW. Disney really goes out of the way to think of everything. Definitely stay on the property, its worth it. The extra services you get on a WDW property is worth any cost difference you'd pay at a hotel off the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Riverside”
Reviews.Author: NicolaAndRuss
Reviews.Content: Recently come back from a 10 night stay at Disneys Port Orleans Riverside Resort which was fantastic. The room was comfortable and larger than I had expected. The setting was very nice beside the river and we were lucky to have a room which was not too far away from the lobby, dining hall etc. The main hotel pool was situated on 'ol man island' and was nice and well attended by lifeguards. There are about 5 smaller pools dotted around the resort too. Tips: The Riverside hotel is vast so remember to make a note of which of the 4 bus stops you need when you are allocated your room i.e. North, South etc. The refillable cups which can be purchased at Boatwrights Dining Hall are great and we certainly got our moneys worth from them. Remember they are only refillable at the resort hotel though, not at the parks. They are still worthwhile though. There is a ferry which runs regularly from the Riverside hotel to Downtown Disney and this runs until about 11.40pm. You can charge purchases made at any of the Disney parks to your room. You can also have items that you have purchased in the parks delivered back to the resort shop Fultons General Store so you dont have to carry them around with you. I would definately stay at the hotel again and can't wait to go back to Disneyworld!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelDover_DE
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this resort! We stayed in one of the "mansions" and thought it was lovely. The grounds are beautiful and perfect for a romantic stroll. The room was clean and the maid service was great. We asked for extra towels, we got them; we asked for extra coffee, we got it. Everyone we came into contact with was very helpful and friendly. The food court was crowded, but what do you expect? The food was good at both the food court and at Boatwright's. Of course it was pricey, but what at Disney World is not? The one and only problem we had was the bus service. Going to a park was no problem, but returning to the resort was awful. Every single park we went to, Port Orleans's queue was always crowded. That's because we seemed to be the forgotten resort- every other resort would get 2, 3, or sometimes 4 buses before we got one. And by that time, there would be enough people waiting to fill 2 buses, seated and standing. We really hated that. But, the resort itself gets my praises and I would definitely stay again (if they fix the bus problem : ) )

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: jna1004
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD. The rooms are clean but stay off the first floor. Water and floor traffic. Stay as close to the lobby as you can. Buildings 14, 18 or 84. We were in 18, perfect! Water shuttle to downtown easy to use trip time is 20 min. Check in/out easy. Food court always has available tables. Nice theme overall and fun pool for the kids. THE BAD. Buses are completly undependable, use taxies if you need to be some where on time. We used taxies several times and saved us alot of headach.The most it will cost you is $15.00. Remember that wheel chairs have priority and will fill the bus you have been waiting an hour for. The food court has limited choices and its mostly for kids. In all we liked the hotel, BUT you get what you pay for. If you can swing it stay at the Beach/Yacht club, They are perfect in every way.

Reviews.Title: “The best of Disney”
Reviews.Author: Phibbles
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside (POR) resort for 8 nights in Aug 08. It was great. The hotel is beautiful from the lobby, to the food court, to the pool(s), to the rooms. It is just amazing the extent they go to transport you to a specific time and place. Check-in may have taken a little long, but the desk staff was super friendly and helpfull. He was very good at explaining the details of the resort and how my room key worked as tickets. The food court had a good selection of food and at a reasonable, theme park price. Not too bad. The room was great. We stayed in an Aligator Bayou room. The double beds weren't the biggest, but my wife and I managed to share one just fine. No complaints all week. My son loved sleeping on the roll-out trundle bed. All of the facilities in the room were very clean and working in proper order. During the visit, our housekeeper even left us little towel animals as decoration. We thought it was great. The one day she made a basket out of our towel and organized some of our bathroom supplies into the basket for us. I can't say enough GREAT things about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in a nicely themed hotel”
Reviews.Author: EmilioLargo
Reviews.Content: This hotel has over 2,000 rooms all laid out in a number of different buildings so please consider that this hotel complex is huge. We stayed in block 16 in the Alligator Bayou section which was about 5 minutes walk from the lobby area although you could be unlucky and get a room in one of the outlying blocks and face a long walk for breakfast. I would not recommend paying extra (as we did) for a water view as the corridors are on the outside of the rooms so you cant really sit on a balcony and enjoy the view. The room itself was well maintained with a nice bathroom. The air conditioning was a little noisy at night. As well as the main Olâ€™ Man Island pool, there are many other pools around the complex, enabling you to have a quick dip close to your room. The food court has a wide variety of fast food (burgers, pizza, pasta etc) with some healthy options too. Boatwrights restaurant is adjacent to the food court and was able to accommodate special meal requests (my partner is vegan). If you are a UK visitor, I would suggest checking any offers on the US Disney website as you may find some offers that are not available on the UK site - we got the meal plan thrown in free saving $$$, plus a few other extras like a round of mini golf and a free photo in the parks. Finally if you are in two minds about saving a little money by staying off site or spending a little more by staying on Disney property, I would strongly recommend choosing a Disney hotel. Disney staff are so helpful and make your holiday all the more magical. But the big thing is that you get the Disney transport included which makes for a much more relaxing trip back after a day in the parks and also enables you to go out and have a drink in the evening without worrying about having to drive home.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Port Orleans Riverside!”
Reviews.Author: nakt
Reviews.Content: This review is pretty long, but, I did a lot of reviewing before choosing a Disney accommodation, so wanted to provide detail for those who might do the same. Overall, I thought Port Orleans Riverside was a great Disney Resort because it offered peace, relaxation, and a great pool after busy, tiring days at the park. I thought we got a lot for our money in the moderate category. I struggled to decide between Deluxe and Moderate and wasn't displeased w/our choice at all. Overall Resort: We were in bldng. 16, further back then our request of 14 but not as far as it could have been. I LOVED the room. It was very clean, and the decor was wonderful. I loved Alligator Bay and was so happy we ended up there. The theming, too us, seemed more apparent and kid-friendly vs. the Mansions, though those seemed beautiful as well. The rooms offer curtains that form a changing area which is so nice for families. Though the double beds are small, they are comfy. Having two sinks was very nice. I didn't think there was enough room to set toilitries out and would have liked a few more hangers. Other than that, all was wonderful! We always had plenty of towels, mousekeeping was wonderful. The views in AB are so nice, it's such a relaxing place after the parks, with beautiful scenario. I never felt that we had sacrificed in theming from being at a moderate vs. a deluxe. I truly loved the southern theme. POR Foodcourt Review: There is a wide variety of hot and cold options. The make your own pasta bar is yummy but can take a while. The deli sandwiches are good. The fries, burgers, chicken fingers, etc. are good and because that is what so many people eat, always seemed very fresh. Didn't try the salads but they did look really good, they make them there and you pick your ingredients. I recommend getting the refillable mug, whether you are on the dining plan or not. We filled ours ALL the time. Room location Notes: I read before we left that POR was very large and could take a while to get to bus stops, food court, and main pool. I figured, hey, we don't have babies or even very young kids, this won't be an issue. Please don't underestimate the impact this will have on you at the end of a long day or when you're exhausted and want to relax in the main pool. It is VERY spread out, even our location, 16, which is not near as far away as others, seemed like a very long walk at times. I am not complaining, as it is a lovely walk. I am just wanting everyone to be fully aware that it is a WALK. There were several times when my daughter said she'd rather go to the near-by pool (I think it's GREAT that they have these) vs. getting to play on the water slide @ the main pool, just because her feet hurt and she didn't want to walk. I would have loved location 14 or 18! We would absolutely stay here again, however, I might consider paying the extra for the water view, as I think this might help you get a little closer. Also, if we went back w/a baby or very young child, we might consier POFQ for the compactness. Summary, the walks and grounds are gorgeous and enjoyable, however, they can be long and tiring and you need to be prepared that in a lot of room locations you'll do a great deal of walking. This resort couldn't, be more beautiful, calming, peaceful, and expertly themed. LOVED IT! Pool Review: The pool is great. The slide is long and fast and kids and adults both can enjoy it. Despite crowds, we were always able to find chairs. The pool-side bar was very nice and convenient but expensive. I reco getting a 6-pack of beer in the gift shop and bringing a small cooler, this would have been much more affordable and will be what we do next time. The hot-tub is very nice, not a luke-warm, over-taken by kids hot tub. It was nice, hot, and relaxing. Yes, there were kids, but we were never unable to find room in it. There are waterfalls in the pool that are fun to play in. Overall, the pool is very nice, offering chairs, pool-side bar, hot-tub for parents and great options for kids in the size of the pool, water slide, and waterfalls. We had a great time playing w/our 8 yo in the pool. It is open until midnight, but, at 7 when the lifeguards go off duty the slide and waterfalls shut down. There are towels at the pool but we chose to bring our own. We also used the smaller pools several times, these are quieter and more relaxing and are very convenient to the buildings. These were nice to have as a secondary option.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Landscaping”
Reviews.Author: Rach217
Reviews.Content: Well I'm rather late with this review but thought it was time now I'm planning my next trip to Disney World and am seriously considering revisiting Port Orleans Riverside. The Great: * The Theming at Port Orleans Riverside is comparable with the deluxe Disney resorts, its just a matter of personal taste which hotels you prefer, but for me this is one of the best 'looking' * The price. Okay so you could stay at the Hilton or Holiday Inn and get more *'s for less $'s, but for my $ you can't beat being inside the 'world' (WDW not earth 8:o)) * Travel times to resorts. Despite the apparent distance from some resorts, the commute was very reasonable ~30 mins each way, to all parks. I spend more time getting to work each day. The coaches are clean and punctual and if there's a queue at the end of the day at the parks they just provide additional buses * Ol Man Island. The pool is large and nicely styled and there are 5 other small pools if it is busy * Fulton's General Store. A really good Disney Store in the hotel which, quite frankly is about 5 times better (and bigger) than the one at Covent Garden in London. They also do useful stuff like painkillers and plasters. The shop staff were lovely too * Boatwrights. We only used it for breakfast on our last day but now wish we'd used it more. The Eggs Benedict were perfect 8:o) * The boat to downtown disney. We found excuses to go to downtown just to have another trip on the boat. Really relaxing and great views enroute * Surrey Bikes and boats to rent add nice little extras The Good: + The room was fine, plenty large enough and clean. The maid replaced the towels daily and brought new Disney soaps, shampoo and cardboard coasters 8:o) + The food court did some nice fast food. Mickey waffles were my favourite, some food was a bit 'so what' but so what!! The Disappointing: - I had requested a king room with a water view in building 27. You can pay for 1 or the other but not both. There were no king rooms with water views available at all - The aircon unit was a bit noisy (my guess, its a bit old and needs replacing) In summary we will probably go back for a longer stay. It is half the price of the deluxe resorts and way better than half as good. Bear in mind though that its a 3* resort and however good or bad the write ups are, thats what you're getting.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: nanapop
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Port Orleans Riverside and had a wonderful vacation. We were there 8-31/ 9-7. I have to say we were really concerned after reading reports of dirty rooms, bad mousekeeping, and bed bugs. This was not the case for us. Our room was clean, sheets fit the bed, and mousekeeping was very diligent in keeping our room clean and our supplies well stocked. Everyone who worked at Disney and at the resort were very courtious and wishd us happy anniversary (Wore our Disney pins) multiple times. At almost every meal, they brought us a little something special ie. A chocolate covered strawberry, or a glass of champagne ,or a cupcake with a candle. These were the nice things I believe set Disney apart from other places, and I for one am glad they kept my dreams alive. The restaurants were really good, especially Spoodles at the boardwalk. I ordered Roasted Pork Loin and it was delicous. Melt in your mouth. I would highly reccomend this resort to anyone who wants a nice relaxing time. Jeanne Baker

Reviews.Title: “What a dreadful time we had”
Reviews.Author: happy0007
Reviews.Content: If you decide to stay here, when you are checking in, do not let them put you in room 4819 of Arcardia House as it is not clean, it needs a serious refurb and it has an awful room maid. The grounds of this hotel are nice, a small army keeps them that way, even in the awful heat of August when we stayed here. Our room was on the top floor and it was very annoying that other people thought it fine to shout loudly throughout the night and constantly wake me up, including families leaving their rooms from 6am, letting their younger children shout loudly or play around outside other people's rooms whilst they are trying to sleep. We had water tanks above us that were so noisey that they also kept waking me up during the night. I came back, from this hotel, in desparate need of a holiday after the lack of sleep I'd had. The bed was diabolical. It was dirty - both beds had carved, wooden bedheads that had not been dusted for months. I lifted up the mattress protector on our bed and found a used, dirty tissue screwed up, lying on top of the mattress. The mattress was so lumpy and when my husband and I got into bed, we rolled into one another! It was terrible. We did try reporting things to housekeeping, but they were just not interested. If we needed more soap or coffee, fine - they'd bring some more along in minutes, anything more than that, then they'd pretend to not be able to understand you!! Even the manager tried that one, what a very poor excuse and how disgraceful. Disney management do not care about anything but saving money. The bathroom had a very dirty, stained bath - yeuck. The carpet had several stains on. The air-conditioning - there is only one unit in the room, under the window. It had not been serviced in a very long time. The filters were filthy and this is a serious fire hazard - people be warned. My husband serviced ours. Disney should be routinely doing this, they are not - they are out to save money at all costs, beware of this. Due to there only be one unit, it meant that when you got dressed, with the curtain pulled across, you had no air-con in that area at all, this made it very hot and uncomfortable. The first evening we arrived late and went to the food court to get something to eat. I had chicken nuggets and chips and a small amount of salad, I don't know which bit of it made me ill, but I woke up 4 hours later with terrible pains in my stomach and had to go to the restroom where I was very ill - I didn't eat at this food court again. It wasn't being kept very clean - the carpet in there, is dirty and sticky - how mad is it, to have carpet in an eating area?! The tables were all sticky. The food is left sitting around, this is probably why I got ill, please be careful what you eat, if you eat here. I found the staff very unhelpful and quite rude when I tried to get served. We did try the sitdown restaurant at this hotel, once, for breakfast, that was awful too. I had the eggs benedict, which was extremely poor quality in comparison to the same dish I had at the Grand Floridian Cafe, which cost $1 dollar more! I dropped my strawberry from my drink and asked the waitress if she'd be so kind as to bring me another one, as I love strawbs and she bought me one that was mouldy!!! This was just what I came to expect from staff at this place. The boats from here to Downtown Disney - they are open, so you boil alive. It takes a very long time, the drivers are in no hurry and often stop for a very long time at the P>O French 1/4 - so we tried them twice and didn't enjoy either time and took the car, much better! Transport - buses - fine if you like waiting ages - in the heat! Disney's magical express - if you call taking hours for a journey that should take minutes, a driver who got lost and generally being over-heated in an old bus, magical - then go for it. To anyone who prefers air-con, being taken properly from place to place and quickly - then get a hire-car from the airport or a taxi! Even the Disney rep who we found in the airport, MCO, sent us to the wrong place for the magical express to the hotel!!!! If it could have gone more wrong, I would have been surprized. I wouldn't go back to this place if it were offered to me free of charge, I paid Â£1200 for 2 weeks and to me, after paying Â£500 last year to stay at the Caribe Royal - which was far, far better, I would have to be paid a million pounds to stay at this dump again!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic stay at Riverside!”
Reviews.Author: sar2036
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two week stay at Disney's Port Orleans, Riverside. The hotel is fantastic value and I strongly recommend going in August or September as you will be eligible for the free dining plan which was simply amazing! (We booked through Travelcity direct). Using the free dining plan, we ate for free at Planet Hollywood and Disney's signature restaurants, 'Jiko', 'Citrico's' and 'Artist Point'. Included in the plan was also breakfast, snacks and self-service meals. The resort was spotless and the staff very eager to please. The rooms were clean and adequate. After eating at Disney's top hotels such as Animal Kingdom and The Grand Floridian, I don't really see why there is a need to pay the extra money to stay at such resorts as Port Orleans has everything you could possibly wish for, and if you want to visit those resorts, then you can do so in any case! Port Orleans is in a great location and has free buses to all the Disney parks and resorts. You must go; it will not disappoint!

Reviews.Title: “Great Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: cj-poohfan
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I celebrated our honeymoon 15 years ago in Disney and we wanted to rekindled our closeness so we visited without our kids. We had a great time!! Disney is not just for kids!! The hotel was very nice. We had a bottle of champagne waiting in our room when we arrived. Getting around Disney was very easy with the bus, monorail, and boats. We tried the food plan for the first time....definately worth the money!! It's a savings in the end. (we did not do the plan for the day we arrived or left)

Reviews.Title: “A very good Disney property for some travellers”
Reviews.Author: Dave's_reviews
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family on the free Disney Dining program (note: if you can ever get Disney Dining for free -- it's usually offered in the springtime for late August/September bookings -- take it). The hotel worked well for us. Consider it a peaceful oasis (well, relatively peaceful) from the "madness" that is Disney. You do feel a bit like you're staying "along the Bayou" at this property, which is beautifully and peacefully landscaped. Rooms are decent sized and comfortable. Not luxurious, but equivalent to a Sheraton or Hilton, with some Southern "theming." I wish they'd have installed 2 queens instead of doubles, but that's a common problem with many hotels. There is a group of people who should NOT stay here. They are the folks who put value first, or are travelling with pre-teen children. Unless you'll be "hanging around" the hotel (and I rarely am, what with the theme parks and water parks beckoning), it doesn't really matter much where you stay at Disney, and you get better value from the value resorts, instead of this mid-priced resort. And if you travel with kids, they would PREFER that you save money and check into the value-priced Pop Century. Although SLIGHTLY less comfortable and SLIGHTLY more crowded, the Pop Century is much more fun. Your kids will be much more impressed. So it all depends on what you're looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Whealingfamily
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans Riverside resort is a fantastic chillin place, we had our 15 year old daughter with us and she loved the rabbiits running around and the ducks and we even spied a baby turtle r one morning, after the mad rush of the parks it was a pleasure to get back to this resort, food was excellent, staff very helpful and polite. We stayed in Block 18 Alligator Bayou which was central to everything, rooms were of course southen themed and were cleaned daily and the towels and bedding were changed regularly. The pool areas especially "Ole Man Island" were excellent and very well maintained, life guards everywhere at the main pool. Transportation to parks as usual for a WDW resort were no hassle. Taking the boat ride to Downtown Disney in the evening was great. This was our third trip to Orlando and most definitely the best one yet. If we come again (hopefully) we would definitely stay at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again but still some problems”
Reviews.Author: Christy142
Reviews.Content: Overall, I found the grounds very well maintained, the room clean and nice and the building we stayed in was very pretty (Magnolia building). I did not find the staff in the lobby either very friendly or helpful - same thing for the staff in the food court. Some of the staff in the food court were almost rude. However, the staff in the gift shop and bell services more than made up for it - they were very nice. Prior to arriving, I had requested a room in the same building with friends we were meeting there. I was told it would be taken care of. Upon arrival, we were booked in a different buidling, quite some way away from our friends. The hotel said they would move us the next day. We were instructed to call the hotel by 10:00 am the next morning to confirm and that if confirmation was not received, they would assume we were not moving. Since we went to the park that day (and our room was very nice), we decided to stay and did not call to confirm. Later in the day, Housekeeping knocked on the door and said their records indicated the room was vacant - that we had moved. I explained the situation to the person who came to the door. She assured me she would take care of it. We went out that night and I returned alone to my room late. My key did not work. Tropical Storm Fay was in full swing, pooring rain. I did not have any rain gear with me. I called from my cell phone and the lobby told me that we had been moved. I explained the situation to them. At first I was told to come into the lobby. I explained that it was pouring, didn't have any rain gear...finally they agreed to send someone out to the room. Half an hour passes, no one shows up. I call again. Now I'm told that it's raining and they can't send someone out to in the rain! Again, I explained the situation. They were not all all helpful. Another promise to send someone out. No one shows and I'm forced to make another phone call. This time I was very angry and told them that if I had to walk in the pouring rain, without any rain gear, they should make certain a manager meets me. Another promise to send someone. Finally, 45 minutes later, someone does show up - but the new cards he was given didn't work! Another 20 minutes waiting for him to get it corrected. It was late at night, I was alone and it was very uncomfortable for me. There was never an apology. 'That said, I would still stay there again - but just won't expect exceptional service. The food in the food court is not very good although the resturant was somewhat better. The pool, the grounds made up for some of what this placed lacked.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt ask for more from a moderate resort”
Reviews.Author: loveholidays08
Reviews.Content: Myself and My Husband stayed at POR in May for our 1st Wedding Anniversary. I have very high standards and have been lucky enough to stay in some wonderful hotels around the world. The POR was a wonderful romantic base for our Disney stay. There were only 2 negative points throught the whole stay. Firstly, the room we were allocated on arrival was at the back of the resort in the Magnolia bend part of the hotel. There was virtually no view and the room had a rather disappointing feel to it, even though it was a King size room that we had booked. I rang the reception desk and asked if any other rooms were avaliable. I was told that no other King size rooms would be avaliable until the next day, but as this was our actual anniversary day, I did not want the inconvience of moving so we elected to move to a double room in a beautiful spot in Partierre Place. I would highly recommend this Mansion to couples as it is very romantic and peaceful, with rabbits running around the grounds, the fountains and gardens are so pretty it really is a lovely spot to stay. The only other minus was the Disney Buses, they dont really seem to have a timetable and we did have quite a long wait on a few occassions and my Husband did end up standing most of the time to make way for children - obviously he did not mind this but we felt that the busses should be more frequent so that no guests should have to stand after a long day on your feet in the parks. On the very positive side the Food court was much better than we had expected, the oatmeal at breafast was lovely and the Salads at lunch are the best I have ever had. The food court was very good value for money. We only went to Boatwrights once for Breakfast which was nice but I would not rush to go there again. The drinks in the bar are more expensive than the rest of Disney therefore it is not very busy in there. The gift shop is fantastic and you can buy nearly everything you want in there. We went on the horse and carriage ride and our Driver talked to us non stop, which was not ideal as we were looking for a quite romantic ride so we, did not feel this was a good trip to advise you to go on. All in all this a wonderful resort for the money and the rating of a moderate 3.5*. If you are put off anything in these reviews I would suggest paying the extra for a deluxe resort but these are considerably more money. Happy Holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mickey3Regina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 8 nights . The grounds were beautiful the rooms were clean. We had a one small problem our sandwich meat spoiled because our fridge had broken when we were gone and they replaced the meat for us no problem and bought us supper. It was great would stay there again !!!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay - especially if you can get a good deal!”
Reviews.Author: Thaliant
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay at Disney's Port Orleans Riverside resort. This is a HUGE resort which is divided into several sections. Our room was in the Lodge 36 area which is on the north side of the complex near the smaller (a.k.a. the "quiet pool") of two pools. As expected of a Disney resort, we enjoyed our stay and would consider staying here again. The room was clean and quiet. It had two double beds and a pull-out trundle bed, a large TV, refrigerator and double-vanity sinks. Our only real complaint was that we felt the beds were too firm and double beds are a little crowded for two adults. My daughters were delighted with all of the wildlife we saw. There were rabbits, a cat, a hundred little geckos running all over and all sorts of birds. The so-called "quiet pool" was really nice to have right outside our room. This pool has no water falls, slides, bar or hot tub - so it attracts a quieter crowd. Parents sat by the pool reading and sunbathing while their kids swam. The pool was open until midnight and while we would hear kids laughing and splashing while we walked to our room, once our door was closed we couldn't hear a thing. We would typically head to the parks in the morning, return in the afternoon to beat the heat with a swim and then go back to the parks in the evening. Disney has four bus stops situated around the hotel which take you to their attractions. It was a couple of minute walk to the North Depot which was really nice. The buses tend to pickup and drop-off at these depots before it went to the main pickup area. This meant we usually got seats on the bus so our kids could sit and look out the windows when we left for the theme parks in the morning and were among the first to be dropped off late at night. Epcot, Magic Kingdom and Animal Kingdom could be reached in about 15-20 minutes from this hotel. We took the boat to Downtown Disney but had problems getting back - there was a long line for the boat back to the hotel so we tried the buses - but they don't pickup as often and there are no queues so everyone had to "jockey" to get on the bus when it finally arrived. That's a problem in general with Downtown Disney and no fault of the hotel itself. We found the staff to be friendly although we didn't interact with them too much. They smiled and waved at our kids. At one point, my two year old was having a meltdown in the cafeteria and a staff member came over with a free package of grapes which calmed her down immediately. We ate there once and the food was very good and not unreasonably expensive. The child meals included a main dish and two healthy sides (fruit and vegetables, for example). We were there early afternoon and it was unusually quiet. We tried to have breakfast there the next morning but it was too crowded - it was our own fault because we had gotten up later than usual. I have stayed at two other Disney resorts (Port Orleans French Quarter and Coronado Springs) and have found this one to be of equal or better quality. Our family got a particularly good deal through our travel agent so it was practically impossible not to enjoy our stay. I would definitely stay in the Lodge area of this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Disney at its finest”
Reviews.Author: jtkirkfan2002
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay here because we have three children and needed the optional trudle bed, something they should add at all of their moderate resorts. However we fell in love with this place and unless the opportunity comes along to stay in a deluxe resort, will go back here in a heartbeat. We had one of the five-person rooms in Alligator Bayou and it was a short walk from the main pool, restaurants and bus stop. The landscaping here is on a par with the deluxe resorts. Buses connect you with all areas of WDW and a boat goes to Downtown Disney. We hardly used our car at all. The main pool is called Ol' Man Island and is guarded during the day. Their are fountains and showers for the kids to play in and a water slide that our three-year old couldn' t get enough of. Quiet pools are all over the property. A huge food court, a sit down restaurant and adjacent lounge are available for meals and the lounge often has live entertainment. For those who believe that staying on property means an overdose of Mickey and Donald, the Port Orleans Riverside will be a pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Disney Property”
Reviews.Author: ellegirl119
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Disney hotel from Aug.6- Aug. 14 and it was just wonderful. We booked two rooms here instead of a suite at a Disney Deluxe hotel because of the price and we would have two bathrooms instead of one. We were in Lodge 24 which was located in the Alligator Bayou, we paid extra for a pool view which was nice. Since we had a pool view we were located very close to the pool and we had about a 3 minute walk to the West Depot bus stop. The West Depot bus stop was usually the first or second stop on the bus list which was great because you usually got a seat instead of having to stand. We were about a 10 minute walk from the lobby and food court, which was okay for our family because we don't really have a problem with walking. We purchased the refillable mugs which was a great deal since we were always filling them up. We also purchased the Disney dining plan which was such a great choice. We were able to eat so much for only paying an average fee per day. The amount of food that you receive is between average to a lot more than you can even eat. The hotel was great and the staff was too. The room was always clean and sometimes they even left towel animals in the bathroom. The room were a decent size and they were so quaint looking. Even though you are at Disney which is so busy, Port Orleans Riverside is such a relaxing hotel. The decor and all of the surroundings allow you to believe that you are in Louisana.This hotel was such a great pick!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I would stay at a nicer resort next time”
Reviews.Author: teazingweezer
Reviews.Content: First off the rooms were dirty and full of bugs. Everyday we would kill or get the bugs out and then housekeeping would let them back in the next day. The rooms were very noisy. You could hear everyone else's noise. The staff we found for the most part were not friendly, especially in the food court area. If I were to stay on a WDW resort again, I would spend the extra money and go somewhere nicer. I could write a novel about the bad experiences there.

Reviews.Title: “loved the riverside”
Reviews.Author: lovage
Reviews.Content: I was a bit concerned about some reviews of this hotel-but this hotel was great.The hotel is set in lovely grounds and we were on the mansion side.We had a corner room over looking some of the many beautiful landscape gardens.This was perfect and very quiet.We used the large pool area,but manly used the smaller pool near our room(not so crowded).The dining hall served its purpose when needed(try the yoghurt for breakfast).Being on the disney site we thought the prices for food would be expensive.We got a really good exchange rate,being from England so prices were alot cheaper than expected.The boat ride to Downtown Disney was good,we found no problems with the bus transport.The parks were very busy and the weather was very hot.We have been in July and August before and this time we only had about two rain showers for the two week stay.House of Blues restaurant at Downtown Disney is a must.We ate at Bongos,but much preferred the food at House of Blues.Rainforest Cafe was too busy and the foods not as good as Bongos or House of Blues.Discovery Cove is a must ,this was one of our best trips of the whole holiday.We did both Universal parks in one day as we upgraded our ticket to an express ticket,worth every penny if you can afford it.The ques would of been two hours for most rides.My only complaint about the holiday ,is that the two double beds in our room seemed smaller than the average double bed.We are not a large family just my husband,11 year old daughter and myself.I think for a bigger family the beds are too small.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans riverside was nice again”
Reviews.Author: momingreatlakesarea
Reviews.Content: Sorry this review is late, but we've had a busy summer. We stayed at Riverside for 15 nights. When we go to Disney, we always stay at least two weeks so that we can really enjoy our vacation--and get some relaxation. When we figure the cost of getting there, the small difference between a 5 day versus the 10 day pass, it just makes sense to go for a longer period of time. We've stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge two times in the past, at least 8 times at Riverside(during many of those times it was called Dixie Landings), and a couple times off property when our youngest was a baby/toddler so we could have a suite without the high price. We prefer staying on Disney property even though we do go to Seaworld(went to Aquatica) and take a couple of side trips to the Gulf side of Florida. As in the past, the grounds were beautiful and the water ride to Downtown Disney was wonderful. The room was fairly clean as long as you don't look too close at the corners or under the bed. Wear your slippers in the room...as the carpet in our room wasn't cleaned(steam cleaned) for sometime. The bottom of my slippers which were cream colored when we went were black when we left. The shelf that you can hang items(like a jacket or beach bag on) was very dusty. The bottom sheets do not fit the mattress and come undone which is very annoying. The last time we stayed at Riverside was in 2006 and I don't remember having these problems---are hotels just going downhill because they don't want to spend the extra money--it's ashame if that's the case. The bed was comfortable and didn't squeak as someone had mentioned in an earlier review. I've never had a bed that squeaked at Disney. I'm glad we didn't have one this time either. We didn't do the dining plan since we take Amtrak's auto train from Lorton, Virginia and am able to take a small refrigerator and plug-in cooler(the plug-in cooler doesn't freeze our fruits and salad as the small refrigerators can). And since we have a car there we are able to go to the grocery store(we like Publix) and stock up on what we need. We also have a pull along cooler that we take into the parks with our lunch, water bottles(I freeze them in my small refrigerator's freezer area), snacks, and we especially like to have a lot of fresh fruit with us. Our 12 year old daughter, my husband and I were on this trip(our other two children are past 20 and tired of Disney) and had a great time. If you are flying in and do not want to pack a lunch and etc., then the dining plan is probably a good value as long as you eat at one of the buffets. If you have room in a suitcase or are willing to pay the extra baggage fee, I would take some food along such as peanut butter and jelly, bagels or pita bread to put it on(bread will get smashed--or they have bread for sale in Riverside's store), some of those powdered drink mixes(or the tube kind you put into a bottle of water), some cereal and powdered milk(you can mix with water in container and refrigerate it to save money--or there's milk that comes in juicebox containers that do not need refrigeration. This will help your wallet and save you from wasting time in the restaurant which is very busy. Your empty suitcase could hold your souvenirs on the way home! You could also take snacks like fruit snacks and whatever else you and your children like. We ate at what used to be our favorite restaurant Boma at Animal Kingdom Lodge and were very disappointed. The desserts used to be very good(excellent!), but unfortunately have gone downhill. The other foods offered didn't seem to be the same quality as in the past either. One of the people that work there told me that Disney is contracting out many of their restaurants among other things and that's why the food isn't what it used to be. I personally think it's because of the Dining plan...they are getting less money and thus giving less quality than they used to. We did enjoy the supreme pizza at the French Quarter(they left part of it cheese for our daughter). Riverside just has pepperoni and cheese. We also enjoyed some of the desserts Riverside has. We tried breakfast at Riverside and were disappointed. The potatoes were very greasy and the bacon not cooked well enough. The food is mass produced and not the quality is used to be. The transportation was terrific again and this is one of the main reasons we stay on Disney property. When you figure in the parking, gas, and time, it doesn't make sense to stay off property. We had a 10 day hopper pass with waterparks. It was more than enough days with doing non-disney attractions. Even trying to get time in to do the quiet pool, Old Man Island, and relaxation within two weeks can seem tricky. Just a note: When you're at Disney or anywhere, do not expect other people to make your trip wonderful. You and who you are with can only do that. Yes, I do feel that Disney employees do try to do their best to make people's vacations/holidays enjoyable, but they can only do so much. I think it is the way we feel about what we are doing and who we are with. Yes, I do expect a clean room, good food, nice attractions, and polite employees. I think Disney needs to sharpen up on the quality of food and cleanliness of their rooms as they used to be in the past. But overall, it is a wonderful place to have a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Port Orleans Riverside! We had a handicapped access room.”
Reviews.Author: WDWMOMMY1
Reviews.Content: We booked our rooms directly with WDW special services because we needed a handicapped room . We are a family of 5 (2 adults, one 18 year old with wheelchair, one 17 year old and one 5 year old. We requested Alligator Bayou . We had requested 2 adjoining rooms which is exactly what we got. The first room was large and had 2 full sized beds and a trundle bed. The second room was equally as large and had a king sized bed, and a roll in shower. The rooms were both very clean. The "Mousekeeping staff" was wonderful. We requested clean sheets on the king bed everynight as my son has diapers. They were wonderful and he always had fresh, clean sheets on his bed. There were always towel animals on the bed for the children. The trundle was a matress on wheels that went under the full sized bed. This was perfect for my 5 year old. She loved hiding her bed away in the morning. If you do get a trundle make sure to ask for extra sheets and a blanket. They were not there when we checked in and we had to ask and they were brought right out to us. The trundle would probably not be comfortable for anyone over the age of 12. There is a small fridge in every room. We requested a room close to the main bldg and we were given one. It is very easy to lose your way walking the paths at the hotel. The pool is FANTASTIC. The children loved the waterslide and the fountains in the pool. The quiet pools are very nice and they are open very late at night. My daughter and I used them late at night every night we were there. Word of advice if you are swiming late, bring a towel from your room. They just re-furbished the playground and took out the old chlimbing structure and put in a nice new metal one for the children to play on. We had a car so we did not use the bus service. We took the boat to Down Town Disney a few times. It was nice to not have to worry about parking. There is lots to do at POR. There is an arcade, bicycles, surrey bikes, and water crafts to rent. There is a fishing hole and a scavenger hunt is held for the children on specific days. The Alligator Bayou section is very rustic looking and the rooms have log beds. The rooms are very dark when the blinds are drawn which made it great for my daughter to nap.The Mansion section is a bit more refined and fancy with water fountains etc. The main building has a beautiful lobby , restaurant and bar. The hotel also has a cute little general store where you can purchase just about anything. It is expensive but isnt everything in a hotel store. We loved this hotel. It has a very laidback feel to it. The landscaping is breathtaking. The wildlife (ducks, birds, squirrels, rabbits etc) just sit on the grass and watches you watch it. My daugher loved sitting and watching the rabbits etc in the early morning. We didnt eat in the sit down restaurant but did have a few breakfasts and lunches in the food court which is very big and has lots of choices. This is by far our favorite moderate WDW resort.

Reviews.Title: “No Major Complaints”
Reviews.Author: 7_62mm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Riverside for 4 days, in Late July of this year. We were a little skeptical after reading some previous reviews about bed bugs and dirty rooms, I didn't buy into it too much although my fiancee didn't share my optimism. I'm glad to say I was right, we stayed in Parterre Place in Magnolia Bend, which is farely close to the reception. The grounds where absolutely beautiful and the room was clean and well kept. No bed bugs in our room and I did see the cleaning staff doing their job. I did see some mildew on the shower curtain, but nothing that would ruin our trip or worth talking about. Afterall you don't spend much time in your room, its just a place to shower, sleep, and cool down during midday. Boatwrights made awesome Breakfast, especially the Sweet Potato Pancakes (a must). The reception staff where very friendly and pleasent to deal with. The absolute best thing about the resort is that you can skip the bus when going downtown Disney and can take a relaxing boat ride down the Sasagoula river on a riverboat, the boats go back and forth every 10 mins. The boat makes one stop at the French Quarters, then on to Downtown. I think next time i'd stay off Disney though, because you can get a better hotel at a cheaper rate, but you'll need a rent a car to get to the parks...take the good with the bad.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: southernpleasure
Reviews.Content: Our visit to Port Orleans Riverside was much better than expected. I had read many reviews, many were good, but some were not so good. We have a family of five and were blown away by how generous and kind everyone was. We resided in the Alligator Bayou section and it was only about a 3min walk from our room to the South Depot bus stop. The buses to the park ran every fifteen minutes and dropped us off at the park admission gates. There were over five pools, which made it convenient to swim with a large crowd or just the family. There were also many activities such as biking, fishing, playground, shopping at the general store, and dining. We got the dining plan, and we used it at the resort and the food was GREAT! It was between 96 and 100 degrees each day and the ac worked excellent. We actually got cold a few times. The bed linens, carpet, and the bathrooms were clean. We will stay here again if we had the chance. I truly enjoyed out stay.

Reviews.Title: “Going Back For SURE!!”
Reviews.Author: hakunamatata_7
Reviews.Content: We have booked already for next year! We rang R/S the week before our holiday to ask if we could stay in bauyo 39 the one furthest away! so we could take in the grounds on a morning and evening the reviews we had read said its a loooong way to reception ( we like to stroll!) it isnt a long walk it took us 5 mins and we dont rush on holiday! so please don't let that put you off. the grounds are just lovley, our room was nice size the only downside was our bed we have a king at home and we got a double at R/S we are not big people and we found it small, but no worries we have booked a king for next time. Evenings were great we would get the boat from R/S to Downtown Disney makes a great start to your evening. we have looked at other Disney hotels but to be honest, if you want away from it all relaxed feel and close to Downtown Disney, you couldn't get better.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved Port Orleans Riverside and will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Aharvey1031
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside Resort from July 26th-August 2nd. Lets just say we were very sad to leave. From the time you arrive till you leave the accomodations were wonderful. This resort was beautiful and very clean in our room. We stayed in the Acadia House and the room was great. We had a very clean room that was done up very well when we got back from the parks. The music was wonderful throughout the resort. The main dining hall was excellent with there selection of food courts we ate breakfast there everyday. We highly recommend using the Disney' Magic Express when arriving to Orlando because when we arrived we did not have to even look for our luggage. We also used the Disney Dining plan while there and Port Orleans uses the plan for there food as well. We loved taking the boat from Port Orleans to Downtown Disney it was a pleasant boat ride. You can also rent watercraft by the 30 minutes to the hour or you can take a pleasant horse and carriage ride throughout the resort it was 35 dollars and hour though. The gift store is huge and has everything you could possibly need. We strolled around at a couple of other resorts such as the Saratoga Springs, Coranado Springs, The Contemporary, and Port Orleans French Quarter and it did not compare to Port Orleans Riverside in beauty. The Acadia House is not far from the food, main check in, and the bus stops. We only waited between 5-15 minutes for a bus daily to the different Disney Parks. Again we highly recommend this park to the whole family. My son loved the pool and waterslide at this resort while I enjoyed the hot tub not far from the pool. This is the best resort I have ever been to at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Get Your Sneakers On”
Reviews.Author: Jyoti05
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself and it's surroundings are beautiful. My only complaint is the distance from the lobby to our room and then the distance from our room to the "big" pool. We only stayed here one night and then transferred to Animal Kingdom. Everything kind of looks the same at Port Orleans Riverside and it's very easy to get lost in the vastness of the hotel grounds. I'm sure if we were there for more than one evening we would have had the trail to the pool and the lobby down pat, but needless to say we all needed a GPS to find our room or thought about a breadcrumb trail. There was a smaller pool near our room, but the kids wanted to go to the more exciting "big" pool. The room itself was small, but clean and nicely decorated. There were no elevators that I saw, so being that we were on the 2nd floor...we had to haul all of our bags up the steps. If you're exhausted or tire easily from walking, this might not be your thing. It wasn't mine. I knew I would be doing enough walking in the parks and didn't want to have to walk a mile to our room. There may also be rooms that are poolside or near the lobby...I would suggest looking in to one of those or at least a ground level room. Better yet, it you have the extra money...spend it on one of the other resorts such as Animal Kingdom, Beach/Yacht Club, etc. Sometimes you definitely get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: purple60
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside for three nights before switching over to the All-Star Movie Resort. The rooms were almost exactly the same. The Riverside was much more quiet than the Movies. Beds comfortable, pillows good, internet cost $9.95 for 24 hrs. Coffee maker in room (none in Movies). The bathroom however is tiny. The tub/shower and toilet all crammed together so with multiple people using it, things can get wet and messy. We had a fridge in our room which was nice. The air conditioning was the coldest I ever have experienced! A nice stay and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: endOfPath
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this resort for 2 nights with our 14 month old daughter. Everything went great. Check-in was smooth. The resort itself is very nice and very clean. The room was very clean and the bathroom was also very clean. During our first evening our daughter threw up. We made a call to housekeeping in the morning to inform them that there had been vomit on the floor. We cleaned it up ourselves in the evening but figured they'd want to know. When we came back to our room in the evening they had left extra towels for us (at our request) and they also left a folded towel in the shape of an elephant! I presume this was to cheer up our daughter who, luckily, wasn't ill (we still have no idea what caused her to throw up). It just so happens that our daughters favorite animal is the elephant and she was very excited to see the folded towel. The pool at this resort is excellent. It has waterfalls and a waterslide. There is also a hot tub and a bar there. The pool is located on an island at the resort. For runners this is also a decent resort. Running around the street that runs around the perimeter of Port Orleans (Riverside and the French Quarters) as well as the walking path was a great route. I even came across a cast member who wished me a good run.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic WDW Resort!”
Reviews.Author: catho72
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for seven nights in February, 2008. The hotel is beautiful! The landscaping is very lush and well-maintained. Our room was in the Alligator Bayou section, building 16. Our room had two full-size beds and a trundle bed. Our kids loved the trundle! Having two sinks was very convenient, especially since my husband spent two days in the room sick with bronchitis. Housekeeping cleaned our rooms well each day. The walk from our room to the main building took about three minutes. The food court was fantastic! It was busy almost every time we were there. The food was very good. The refillable mugs came with our package and worked great. It was very convenient to fill the mugs with pop, coffee, milk, hot chocolate, etc. Boatwright's, the full service restaurant, has excellent food as well. At night, there was entertainment at the bar. As I walked past, everyone sounded like they were enjoying themselves. There are many quiet pools at POR as well as a large, activity-filled pool. Our kids enjoyed the smaller pool so much that they didn't want to go to the big pool! There are laundry facilities at the smaller pools which was extremely convenient. We took a pontoon boat from the resort to Downtown Disney. It was very scenic and relaxing. You are also able to fish, rent a carriage ride and rent bikes at the resort. We enjoyed our stay in February and are going back in September. I highly recommend Port Orleans Riverside!

Reviews.Title: “Liked it but it is a BIG place!”
Reviews.Author: JKL1
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed at Port Orleans Riverside from July 22- July 27, 2008. I think overall it is definately better than a value resort but the size does bring issues to the table. First let me say that the check-in was very smooth, very fast and they had our room ready before noon. The CM checking us in was knowledegable but not overly friendly. I was so enthusiastic and he did a lot to bring down my excitement. We booked through Disney and asked for the Magnolia Terrace. I requested a standard view room to save some dollars and we got basically a room about as far back as you can go in that particular building. To get to the food court from our room was a chore. The mansion buildings themselves are enormous, bigger than most hotels and just to walk from one end of the building to the other was a workout. Once we covered the expanse of the Magnolia Terrace building we had to go maybe 100 yards to the right, across a sizeable bridge, a long left along the pool area, and across another bridge just to reach the food court. At a good pace this was an 8 minute walk and we were in one of the buildings that is "close" to the food court! Some people must have had 20 minute walks from the buildings they were in. The last thing I wanted to do after walking about 10 miles in the theme park was to come back and walk another 8 minutes to get a soda. We bought refillable mugs but it was such a pain to walk to the food court for just that purpose that it may not have been the wisest thing. The good thing about being in the back of Magnolia Terrace was being fairly close to the east depot bus stop. It was a quick 100 yards across the parking lot to get to our bus stop. Before you get excited about that though you must understand that the buses will make 5 stops. One at the French Quarter, and four at Riverside. We were usually the last on (crowded buses at that point) and the last off (a looong ride home from anywhere). We usually didnt wait long for a bus but my oh my what a long ride. It was not zipitty do dah. We found the grounds to be immaculate and pretty much like a picture post card. It was usually quiet and every morning I ventured out before anyone else was up in our room just to marvel at the scenery. The property is very, very nice. The food was pretty decent in the food court which was open until midnight I think. We utilized both the main pool that had a slide and water falls and the basic but very large quiet pool closer to our room. We also did laundry once and they are located at the quiet pools where you can swim or relax while the laundry tumbles itself clean. We took a water taxi once to Downtown Disney but it was sort of a long ride (but pretty) with a full boat of people and yep, you guessed it, we stopped at the French Quarter in route to pick up more people. Needless to say we took it one way and only did it once. Downtown Disney by the way is unbelievably crowded right now. Stay away unless you are bored to death. Riverside has a really nice general store, has lots of activities to do, has a certain southern charm, and has lots of character. The rooms are adequate. Having two sinks is nice, having a curtain for privacy is nice. Having a fridge is nice. The bathrooms are small. The beds are doubles not the queens you would expect when paying this amount of money. The mouse keeping is excellent and accomodated our requests for extra towels, shampoo etc. The air conditioner is either too cold or not cool enough. There are both thick pillows or flat pillows in each room to utilize based on your needs. On getaway day we checked in for our flight in the lobby. They took our bags and that was that. Great service! Magical Express was nice but again, you stop at several properties before getting to your destination. It is included in the price though so that made it bearable. All in all, I liked Riverside better than All-Star Sports and Carribean Beach Resort. I really want to move up to Deluxe to see if it is worth it or not. Those considering this resort should know that the place is huge, you will walk a great deal and yes I know it is a beautiful, serene walk but man my feet were already walked out in the evenings. I would conider staying here again. I would advise anyone to spend the extra bucks by getting a water view room but specifying you want to see the river from Magnolia Terrace. This will put you in a position where the walk to the food court and the walk to the bus stop is moderate in length. We were pleased with the resort in general and felt like we had a good experience for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Loved it! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Alwaysonthego_8
Reviews.Content: First of all! Stay on the property, it is the best way to see Disney. This hotel is in a great location and when you stay here you fell as if you are in new orleans. It is a great way to relax after the wild and hot days at the park!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ejssupermom
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the All Star Movie Resort earlier in the year, I was REALLY pleased with Port Orleans - Riverside. Not only was the room bigger, but it had more amenities: a refrigerator, two sinks, a curtain to deliniate the dressing area, a larger table and chairs. Additionally, there was soooo much more to do on site. We rode bikes one day, fished the next, and enjoyed the show in the bar one evening. (Make sure the whole family goes to the show....it's hard to decide who has more fun the adults or the kids!) There were so many pools on the property, we were always able to find one that was close by and not crowded. The buildings and landscaping were beautiful, and we had fun just taking walks around the property and spotting rabbits, frogs, dragon flies, lizards, and some of the most amazing flowers we'd seen. We enjoyed our breakfast and dinner at Boatwright's and the food court choices weren't great, but were okay for the price. We'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Honestly A Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: mom2knk
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on this site to get a feel for the Port Orleans, we thought that this would be a great hotel to stay at. People have written that it's better than a deluxe at a moderate price. I will honestly say you get what you pay for in this case. We are a family of five, two adults and three children. So here goes.... 1. We stayed in Alligator Bayou and the rooms are really, really small and dark. The pull out bed is nothing more than a mattress on wheels without any real bedding. We had to take our comforter off of the double bed and give it to our child because of being cold. The air conditioner options were cold or hot and because the rooms open up to the outside, you had to keep it on cold. The walls are paper-thin and we could hear our neighbors, especially the turbo-flush toilets at all hours of the night. I will say that I read the complaints about housekeeping, thinking people were being picky...wrong on that one. Our room was not clean, even when cleaned. My husband had to shift the nightstand to get something that fell behind it, and the dust bunnies behind it were huge!!! Our room was never vaccumed the 13 nights we were there. The best thing about P.O.R was the staff at the main lobby ...very helpful, very professional. Always willing to be of assistance in any situation. 2. The complaints about the hotel being far away from everything is very, very true. We thought it couldn't be that bad...well if you don't have your own vehicle (which we thankfully did) you are at the mercy of hot, crowded buses. We saw all these guests at the park waiting for the bus in hot, humid weather or rain and thunder looking miserable. This hotel is far from all the parks and other hotels, and therein lies problem #3. 3. The food at Boatwrightsand the Dining Hall was just terrible. Maybe we are just picky because I cook for my family, but part of Disney is the dining experience. You need to consider the average QS meal costs $70 (for 5 people) and the average TS meal cost $150. We added the meal plan and are very thankful we did. We saved $2000 from what we thought we would "really" spend before adding the plan!!! After adding up all the meals from the receipts we "ate" $3500 of overinflated meals. That's $270 a day! We met a family that didn't do the meal plan, and had a budget of $100 a day for a family of 5. They could only afford lunch. What a shame. Another issue is that if you don't eat at the park or Port Oleans, it's going to take you a good amount of time to make it to the other hotels to eat if you don't have a car. The Polynesian and Animal Lodge have the best food at WDW. 4. You get what you pay for...meaning that there are no little luxuries at P.O.R. I wasn't looking for a deluxe stay and most definitely not a value stay. But this resort leans heavily to the value stay. Not much to do except for the pools, which were terribly crowded. Which leads me to point #5. 5. I know you must be thinking "Well, I'm not there for the hotel and I will be in the parks all the time." This could be true in the off, cool season. NOT during the spring and summer though. One huge, huge problem is the foreign tourists. Our dollar is weak, making their currency strong. I had more Disney employess tell me that March-August is just miserable now because of these groups. It is winter break in the Southern Hemisphere, so you have these tourist groups (from a specific country which I will leave unnamed) of teenagers that take over the parks. I mean 100 teenagers with four chaperones. My children ages 10, 9 and 8 were so tired of being push, poked and run over by these groups, that we had to take a break to the hotel in the afternoons. These groups of hundreds will wipe out Fast Passes faster than you can blink. Do all the "kiddie" rides in the morning, because by noon these groups have taken over everything. And that includes the dining facilities at P.O.R. Another problem is that these groups will cut you in line, and claim to understand no English. They only speak Portugese. When you tell them they can't cut in line, you get a dirty look and they push ahead anyway. I know you must be thinking that it can't be that bad and you can stay away from it...Good Luck! These groups use the moderate hotels for their stays. 6. Final point...just because Disney has been a favorite American pasttime doesn't mean it has continued in that direction. We were there to celebrate the Fourth of July. My husband is in the military and we were excited to see the celebration. We stayed on property so that we could get into the Magic Kingdom, but guess what? Hotel guests are never guaranteed park admission on busy days, especially if you don't have the monorail at your resort. (We were told this is a problem at Christmas too, so beware.) Kind of strange if you ask me. So my husband who has been in harm's way in the past for this country, wasn't able to see fireworks on the most Patriotic Day of the year. What a slap in the face from such iconic American company. So in conclusion...I would not stay at the Port Orleans again. Pay the extra $50 and stay at a Deluxe if you want a truly American experience. We have dicussed if we will ever go back to Disney and our suggestions are: *Stay at a Deluxe. *Take the kids out of school and go during the Value Season. *Plan your meals wisely, because most of the food is only good, at best. *Use the Morning Magic Hours. *Plan to spend $500-$1500 over what's in your budget. *Avoid the spring and summer like it's the "Plague". *Save all of your patience up for this trip because it's not a vacation in the relaxing sense. It's a fight of the fittest to get through the inconsiderate mobs. *Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: oec7516
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at Disney. The hotel was exactly as described and surpassed my expectations for a moderate resort. The room was spacious, clean and was very well maintained by the mouse keepers. The staff was very friendly at all times. The on property dining hall had great food. The scenery is beautiful and the river is wonderful! I highly recommend this hotel. I will be staying there again in December!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: H0liday-Pe0ple
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fab family holiday to Riverside and it was great. We have a 2 and 5 year old and they loved all of the animals and birds walking around the edges of the paths. We were allocated room 1440 on our first night but promptly asked to be moved first thing in the morning. It was by the restaurant delivery area so we heard beeping from 4:30am in the morning. Our other room was fantastic, in a quiet area not far from the dining area and near to a quiet pool. I would highly recommend this Disney resort. The buses made the transport to the parks so convenient and the food in the fast-food area was freshly cooked to order within a few minutes which was also good value. The resort mugs were also a bonus. I will definitely return to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice size themed rooms”
Reviews.Author: leavinATL
Reviews.Content: Pros: I really liked the themed rooms & they accommodated a family of 4 well. I also liked the nice wooded walk to the bus stop. Having 2 sinks was also very convenient w/4 people sharing a room. It's on Disney property, so you have convenient transportation to all of the parks, resorts, etc... Cons: The pool closest to our room was very small and rather dirty. Luckily we went in Jan & didn't plan on swimming. However, we did sit out by the pool & read one day. It left much to be desired. The bathroom is also very small in the room.

Reviews.Title: “We cannot say enough good things about this place!”
Reviews.Author: creativetraveler
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel at 11 AM in the morning. There was a long line to check in, but it moved rather quickly. Kim, checked us in right away and offered us our rooms. Although we asked for adjoining rooms, there were none available at that time. We could have waited and gotten them, but we were more anxious to get our things into a room. No matter there was only 1 room between us. The room was small as most Disney rooms are, but that was expected. The amenities were as described. We found the rooms clean and well kept as was the property! Although everything is at an extra cost, we made use of the bicycles, fishing, horse and buggy, and laundry. We loved the fact that we did not need to get into our car! We had only 2 complaints. 1st, our wait for the Disney bus was always long. Even when leaving the parks, other resorts had very short lines and ours seemed to go past the gated area. 2nd, the stairs in our building (Bayou #37) seemed to have no connection. Guests seemed to have already made their own paths through the landscaping to shorten the walk.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff & Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JerseyTinkerbell
Reviews.Content: Me and my family just got back from DisneyWorld and we stayed at Port Orleans Riverside. This is a wonderful hotel and the staff was exceptional.
