We traveled with another family making the total number of people 9 and we all agreed we would stay there again. The rooms are big enough for a family of 4 and 5 , the beds were comfy and the water pressure from the shower was pretty good. The pool was clean, fun and refreshing. The life guards were totally on their job and made it more fun. As soon as you walk into the hotel, the staff greets you with a warm smile and are eager to make your stay headache-free. The rooms are really a long distance from the front desks, but use the Disney tranports (bus) to get to the front desk if your in a hurry (the wait isn't long at all, despite what you might hear). There are bus depots at the north, east, west and south sections of the hotels. I love the staff in the general store, they are exceptionally polite and eager to please without coming off phony. There weren't any problems at all, the hotel is very cozy and clean and we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “If it wasn't a typical hotel room I would love staying here”
Reviews.Author: SWsalesGuy
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at the Port Orleans Riverside WDW resort for the past week. Location was great near all the parks. Parking was ample. But don't expect much regarding the room, it was pretty typical. The room consisted of two double beds, plus another mattress that rolled out from under the bed. You be the judge if a double bed can accomodate two adults. A plus in the bathroom was the two sinks. The shower/tub and toilet area was cramped but functional. Other than the room, we really enjoyed staying there. This property had many buildings that are surrounded by walking paths, ponds and lush vegetation and trees. Walking the grounds was rather peaceful but not completely isolated. A nice change from some of their larger hotels. Riverside is connected by a nice jogging/bike path with Disney's French Quarter hotel. There are multiple small pools throughout the complex plus two larger ones that each have a water slide. You can take a water taxi to Downtown Disney or rent boats.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: #1bamafan
Reviews.Content: I am a long time Disney Traveler but this is the first time that I had stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside Resort in several years. I was a little hesitant but that hesitation soon disappeared - it was wonderful......I could not have asked for a nicer room, and the grounds and transportation were certainly up the the high Disney Standards. We will be back to visit the Port Orleans Riverside - it might just be my new favorite Disney Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: kkw2
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed in Oak Manor in May. The hotel grounds are amazing. All of the trees, grass and flowers are wonderful. The landscaping is awesome. The rooms were average hotel rooms in size except with two sinks. The theming is nice. Having a main themed pool in addition to the quiet pools was nice. Really the only downside to the hotel for us was the walking. The hotel is spread out so there is considerable walking between bus stops, food, swimming and the room. We never had a bus issue. We always picked up at the main stop and were dropped off at the east stop. I think if you get picked up at a stop other than the main one you risk standing and waiting.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: welsh_gal21
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Port Orleans resort for 2 weeks in July 2007 with family. It was my first time to Florida and I believe staying at a Disney hotel made my holiday more enjoyable than, for example, staying in a hotel on International Drive. Our check-in was quick and hassel free and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The main part of the hotel had a very southern feel and housed a shop, arcade, bar and main dining hall. The main pool was large and catered for children well with slides etc. The room were situated in blocks and each block had its own smaller pool which we found better as it was always quieter. The rooms were large (with 2 double beds) and always clean and our room in particular was situated at the side of the river that ran through the resort which made the grounds idyllic. The hotel has a steam boat that operates taking guests to such locations as Downtown Disney, and it is highly recommended as a relaxing way to travel though the operator does talk a lot. Overall there was nothing to complain about during our stay, we would highly recommend it and definately go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Long waits and lots of walking”
Reviews.Author: huc2tech
Reviews.Content: Our first Disney trip was to the Port Orleans Riverside and overall the stay was very nice. Check-in was easy and friendly. We had a water-view room. The view was part of a pool through a tree. After we contacted the desk about the obstructed view they credited our account for the difference with no problems. The premesis was beautiful. A LOT of walking. Long wait lines for buses and they are CROWDED.

Reviews.Title: “Alright”
Reviews.Author: i_luv_vacati0n
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in January for our honeymoon. At check in, the agent noticed in the notes we were on our honeymoon and gave us pins to wear that had Cinderella and Prince Charming on them that said "Just Married". After check in we arrived at our room to find 2 double beds, not the queen we were expecting. I know you cannot reserve a type of room here, but I would have expected to be given a room with only one bed, especially since she did see "honeymoon couple" in the notes. The room was not the cleanest. There was a hair on the sink and a corner in the vanity area was filthy. Our room did not have a remote control, so we called and had one delivered. A few days later we thought maybe we weren't supposed to have one, because it disappeared after the housekeeper had been in, so we called for one again. Overall, our trip was magical, except for the stay. The Port Orleans resort is really nice, but the rooms are just ok, no better than a Holiday Inn down the street. Next time we stay at Disney it will be in a delux resort!

Reviews.Title: “Great value family resort”
Reviews.Author: iGoFarDallas
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value and offered all of the amenities anyone could ask for at a Disney resort. The check-in process was rather slow due to the arrival of a tour bus. The general store was well stocked and offered anything and everything with a Disney branding. The food selections were varied and met my needs as a vegetarian. The dining room was well spread out and very capable of handling the large number of diners. A family visiting Disney can skip a day at the parks and enjoy the multiple pools on the property. We enjoyed the larger pool that catered to children with an adventerous water slide. The Sassagoula River offers guests the opportunity to catch a water taxi to Downtown Disney as well as a couple other Disney properties. I was very impressed to see the H2O bath products in the rooms. It was nice to see Disney offer fridges in the rooms. I would stay at this hotel again should we return to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little place”
Reviews.Author: pj4man
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Riverside... June 4, 2008. If you are reading this... no doubt, you are considering a trip to Disneyworld and are seeking a place to rest your tired heads when you are done with the day. Well... I must say that our trip to Disney with Riverside as our away-from-home-home was most pleasant. I emphasize that point... our trip was awesome. Yet, nobody comes to this site to just read about all the awesomeness that somebody else experienced. Read on... and perhaps your trip can be even more "Dream-worthy" than ours. We booked our trip fairly "Last-minute" and I didn't have time to research much. If I did... I would have done a couple of things different. 1. Pack a spare set of clothes for everyone in a carry-on bag (including swimsuits). 2. Investigate the "Meal-plan." Ok... About number 2. I don't know much about the "Meal-plan" option, but I'm sure others will figure it out if they dig into the Disney Vacation website. I didn't have time to do it, but it might have saved my family some money if I did. The first (and practically the last) I heard of it was when one of the cashiers at the place asked if we were on a "Meal Plan" or not. Investigate it... It might save you some money. Back to #1. Pack a thourough carry on. We used the Disney Magical Express service. With that service, you simply make the LONG walk through the Orlando Airport towards the baggage claim... but continue on past baggage claim to the Disney Magical Express counter. At that counter you "Check-in" with Disney, then just follow their directions to the bus that takes you to your destination... Ours was Riverside. More on #1. For anyone living in a dryish climate like Colorado, the sight of a swiming pool at your destination while adjusting to the heat and humidity of Florida will cause and unresistable urge to swim... especially if you are travelling with a three year old and a pregnant wife. Your bags however will not arrive with you. They will be faithfully delivered to your room later... in our case 5 hours later at 10:30pm with me and my family wearing towels and/or covered with sheets watching the Disney Chanel on the room tv. Ok... I really didn't mean to dwell on that point.... honestly that was the only downside to the whole experience. The place is big and fairly well spread out. Expect a long walk to the "Mill" for all of your meals. Spread out is not a bad thing, though. A long walk to get breakfast for your family in the morning or some yogurt for your little one before bed in this peacefull environ is certainly not a bad thing. Just don't make the mistake of trying to be in a rush. Unlike some places you research on the internet... this place is exactly what it seems like in the pictures and even more. Tranquil and relaxing. The boats in the river, horse-drawn carriges, and water-wheel add to the ambiance in a way that photos don't capture. At mealtime, I suggest finding a table near the gear mechanism just inside the water wheel and windows overlooking the river for some extra interest. There is a big table with tons of Legos, crayons, paper, and a tv with Disney cartoons (of course) near there to keep your little one occupied while you finish your meal in peace. Of course, the place is there to make a buck, though. Expect to pay to rent a boat for a while, ride the horse-drawn carriage, or ride the bike-car-thing around the complex. The food isn't McCheap... but it is solid and will keep you and your family fueled. (I suggest getting one "big breakfast platter," some fruit and a few forks so your family can all share it. Your family will need fuel for the day ahead when you go to the theme parks. The more you fuel up back "at home" at the resort the less you will need to answer the call of hunger (and pay the price) for food past the gates in the parks. The place was super clean and everyone was pleasantly cheerful without being cheezy... even the guy working the weed eater down by the river had some pleasant words for us and our 3 year old. The pool was nice and had a little water slide. The lifeguards will kindly tell you "One at a time" down the slide if you go down with your kid on your lap, but there are free floatation jackets for kids at the marina if you want to use them at the pool. The transportation to Downtown Disney takes about 30 minutes or so by boat. That was free, but of course there are plenty of ways to spend your money downtown. We hopped on the bus to get back to the resort. After the heat while walking around downtown, we were ready for the air contitioned bus ride. Transportation to all other Disney parks works just as advertized. No need for a rental car here, unless you plan to get off the reservation. I planned on it, but once I got there I decided that I just didn't want to leave. Hmmm... I just got back, so maybe I'm just on that vacation high, but honestly my experience was fairly awesome on the whole. Yeah... it was hot. Hot and humid. Well... its Florida in the summer. Go figure.

Reviews.Title: “Value at it's best”
Reviews.Author: Lissie1975
Reviews.Content: I have been to Disney my whole, life and Port Orleans Riverside is one of the more quiet resorts on Disney Property. Although it is a little walk to the front to get breakfast if you have to carry it back, the pool is clean and the views are like being in the bayou down south. Staff is friendly, our room, had 2 double beds with a trundle under one, there was a sitting area, and the sinks were outside the bathroom, to allow 2 people to get ready at once. The laundry was right by the smaller pool, and the bar scene was a fun night with entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service, unclean room”
Reviews.Author: epcotgirl
Reviews.Content: Whilst the grounds of this resort are beautiful the vanity area of the room was really dirty, with dirt, dead flies, hairs and various stains on the woodwork. Despite asking housekeeping and then a manager to deal with it nothing was done so in the end I spent an evening cleaning the room myself. I felt that the hotel did not have enough staff to deal with the number of guests staying there as several other problems I encountered also took a long time to be dealt with. Although the state of the room may have been an isolated incident I will not be staying at this hotel again as the customer service I received was almost non existant. I also felt the transportation to the theme parks was patchy as about half of the time there were not enough buses for the number of people wishing to use them and so quite often there was a long wait.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with Port Orleans Riverside”
Reviews.Author: readabouttravel
Reviews.Content: We spent one week at Port Orleans Riverside, and we were very satisfied with the resort. After taking the Magical Express from the airport, which by the way, was better than expected given reviews we had read (though some of the drivers can be a bit pushy about tips), we walked up to a well-staffed front desk. Our first encounter with the staff was perfect in that the woman who helped us was friendly and helpful. Since we arrived at 11:00am, our room was not ready (no surprise). We just grabbed our key, which is also the park pass, checked our carry-on bags with the AMAZING Luggage handlers and went on our merry way to EPCOT. When we returned that evening, everything was in our neat and tidy rooms. We had adjoining rooms in the Aligator Bayou Bldg. 28. The rooms were clean and fresh (no musty smells as some had reported). Housekeeping was good about cleaning the baths, changing towels, and making beds. We had no complaints. One comment I would make about the Bayou is that if you have a stroller, you might want to request the 1st floor since there are no elevators. Every night when arriving back with our son sleeping in the stroller, my husband and I had to carry the two up the steps. Luckily, our stroller is light. The pool, though we only went once during our stay, was nice for our older children and our three year old. There were plenty of chairs and towels available while we visited. The food court was great for breakfast. I especially liked the yogurt bar, my kids enjoyed eggs or pancakes, and my mom had an omlette every morning. We had the basic dining plan, so our breakfast was on us, and we found the prices to be reasonable. The yogurt counted as a snack, and by mid week it was obvious that we had lots of extra snacks, so I put my yogurt on our plan. If there was one concern, it had less to do with Port Orleans than it did with Disney transportation. Yikes!!!!!!!!!! We were sadly disappointed, as were many others. This was our first time on property. In the past, we rented a car, and could come and go at our leisure. This time, we stood waiting for a bus only to often be jammed in with other irritated guests. Not pleasant - let alone "magical." What was maddening was that other resort buses would pull away from the parks with 10 passengers??? I don't know who manages the system, but that person should be re-evaluated. My husband and I thought about how Mr. Walt Disney went to such great extremes to create the perfect experience for his guests - even so far as to build Magic Kingdom above a level of tunnels so that a cast member from Frontierland would not be seen walking through Fantasyland. I am sad to say that our beloved Walt would be horrified to see his guests stuffed onto a bus where the elderly, along with parents holding sleeping children, and toddlers are holding on for dear life after waiting sometimes up to an hour for the experience. With this said, though we enjoyed our stay at Port Orleans, we might consider a resort with better transportation service, or perhaps better yet, renting a car.

Reviews.Title: “Glad We Chose Riverside”
Reviews.Author: LAMOM77
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a magical week at Walt Disney World. I stayed at Port Orleans Riverside years ago, but was worried about my stay here years later after reading some of the reviews. Let me say that our experience here was a pleasant one. The Magical Express ride to the resort was great. We practically stepped off the plane and onto the bus with little wait. Check in was easy and the staff was very courteous and answered all my questions. We requested a room in the Magnolia Bend area. These rooms look more like the antebellum mansions rather than rustic log beds found in Alligator Bayou. For the most part our rooms were clean. The sheets were very clean, the bed comfortable. No BED BUGS! The bathroom sinks and tub looked clean. Each day the maid service did a good job cleaning the room and replenishing the towels. The furniture looked a bit worn and scuffed. The baseboards and the bathroom tile looked as if it needed a good scrubbing. I had considered upgrading to the Wilderness Lodge resort shortly before leaving for Orlando. I am glad I did not. We visited the Wilderness Lodge for dinner the first night we arrived. Although the lobby and exterior of the resort was impressive, the same theme reemerged at this resort as well. The true attention to detail and cleanliness I have come to expect when visiting a Disney resort was lacking. When paying $300+ per night I expect perfection! When you consider the cost of the rooms at the Wilderness Lodge compared to those at Port Orleans, I feel that I got a lot more for my money by staying at Riverside. My kids loved the large pool area and slide at the main pool, and our room was also very close to a smaller less crowded pool. We ate breakfast each morning in the food court. The breakfast was great. I recommend adding the dining plan to your vacation package. The grounds at this resort are quite extensive so be prepared to walk to everything- bus, food court, pool, etc. I would definitely plan to stay at this resort again. However, I encourage other trip advisor readers to join me in writing Disney to express my disappointment with the lack of cleanliness and attention to details that once was a Disney mainstay.

Reviews.Title: “Probably good for a family Disney vacation”
Reviews.Author: Counterweight
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside for two nights on a recent business convention trip. It's clear that this is a hotel that caters to families on vacation and not business travelers, so I will consider that in expressing my opinions here. For the vacationer, the Port Orleans has a number of benefits. It's directly on the Disney property, so you get the Disney hospitality and there are transportation options for getting to other parts of the park and property. However, you are not in walking distance to any of the other Disney sites, which means you are reliant on shuttle bus schedules. There are several pools and other recreational options at the Port Orleans property, which is nice for a day outside the park. I thought the price was a big high for what the Port Orleans offered, but I guess you have to expect an upcharge for the Disney brand and the Disney experience. The rooms were decent, for a family vacation it had several nice extras (two sinks instead of one, a privacy curtain that could be drawn between the bath area and the bedroom area, a decent-sized mini-fridge, etc.) and it did have high speed Internet access for business travelers or recreational web surfers. The food was OK, and it was cheaper than I expected for a Disney property. There is a sit-down restaurant and a cafeteria-style dining area as well, so you can balance your needs and your budget. I found it a bit strange that many of the rooms were in buildings that required a fairly significant walk from the main building, I was traveling light but for those with a couple suitcases and no car it could be an awkward and uncomfortable walk to your room...I did see several resort golf-carts cruising the grounds, but I didn't see any guests on them nor did I see anyone offer this help to a guest. All in all, I would say that there are better options for a family vacation at DisneyWorld, but this is fine option for a family with a little bit of energy and patience. For the business traveler, I would recommend looking at other properties that cater more to this audience segment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: ArgyleJoshTaylor
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights and generally had a great time. There is nothing drastically wrong with this resort and the criticisms I will mention are not going to ruin your stay; they just outline the difference between the moderate and deluxe hotels at WDW. First and most annoying, the only way to get anywhere is by bus. Yes, there is a water launch to Downtown Disney, but because of wake restrictions, it is like a slow boat to China. So buses are the primary mode of transport. They run frequently, but it seems if they have more than one stop, the stop you want is always down the list. Tuesday morning we took the Downtown Disney bus to go shopping. But we had to stop at Typhoon Lagoon first. On the way back, another stop at Typhoon Lagoon. Later that morning we decided to go to Typhoon Lagoon, but this bus went to Downtown Disney first. ARGH!. Aside from the potential crowds on the buses, the worst part is the music they play, which is computer programmed by the route you are on. The Port Orleans music starts out with a good 6 minutes of a duet of banjos and crickets. Then a [--] rendition of One by U2. Then one or two other songs and it starts over. Unless an announcement is made and the whole banjo hell thing starts from the beginning. ARGH! Have these people not heard of an Ipod? The theme of the old south is done just fine. But looking at the landscaping closely makes you realize they are not manicuring it the way they might at Grand Floridian. We had the Deluxe Dining plan. The restaurants at Riverside are nice, although a bit on the loud side. The dining plan lets you eat at over 100 different restaurants, including those at other resorts. The problem is there is no way to get easily between resorts. You always have to take at least two buses. This gets tedious. One night we tried the water launch to Downtown Disney and then the other water launch to Old Key West for dinner. We really like the restaurant, but it took over 40 minutes to travel the approximate mile between the resorts. ARGH! The room itself was fine. The resort is getting a bit long in the tooth, but has been kept up right along so nothing was particularly worn out. The room had a ceiling fan, a refrigerator and a safe. The resort has one main swimming pool, but the best kept secrets for adult parties are the other 6 pools scattered about. They are much quieter. The gift shop was large and had everything from Mickey Mouse shirts and ice cube trays to Advil and bourbon. Overall not a bad value for the price, but if you can swing a hotel on the monorail line or even Wilderness Lodge with a short boat ride to the Magic Kingdom, you will find it far more convenient to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Just Terrific!!!”
Reviews.Author: nyrhky94
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed 6 nights at Port Orleans Riverside during April school break, along with several other families from our town/area. Our daughter's dance company was performing at the Magic Kingdom during that week. As this was a large group travel situation, a travel agent coordinated the entire trip for us. Our stay at Port Orleans Riverside was just terrific!!! The grounds are absolutely beautiful and very well maintained. We were located in the Alligator Bayou section of the resort, which we loved. The lush grounds and meandering paths made for very pleasant walks to the pools, main dining house & bus stops of the resort. I know some folks don't care for the "longish" walks involved in staying here, but we rather enjoyed them. Given the amount of park food we were consuming during the week, we actually looked forward to the walks as part our daily exercise. The whole river/bayou layout & theme was just great. It really felt like you were living that type of lifestyle while you were there. Service at the front desk and elsewhere around the resort was excellent. The rooms were cleaned promptly every day and were just fine for their intended purpose (a place to sleep/crash). The 4 of us slept fine in the two queen beds, but my son also put the spare trundle bed to use on a couple of those nights. We did a 4-day park hopper while down there and had no real issues with the buses. Sometimes the wait was a bit longer than others, but generally the wait times were not that bad at all. A really nice benefit of staying at Riverside is the free water taxi (boat) to Downtown Disney. We found that to be a nice relaxing way to get there and used it several times. Learning about the Disney tree house villas along the river was kind of neat. As far as food goes, we were happy with the overall dining experience. While the main dining hall area gets quite busy in the morning as folks get ready to go to the parks, there was always an open table and the food lines moved along at a decent pace. Our favorite breakfast was the omelet station. A ton of ingredient choices and a hearty portion for a decent price. The guy making the omelets (4 at a time) was fun to watch. The other food stations were good as well for both lunch & dinner. And the desert station had a nice selection of goodies. Lastly, the drink refill cups that we bought on our first day was a very good value. Over the course of our stay, we got all of our money back & more on all the fountain drinks, juices, water etc. Overall, I would have to say that if you're looking for a good family value (i.e. moderate Disney resort), Port Orleans Riverside is a great way to go. From the lush, well maintianed grounds to the "realistic" look & feel of being in a river/bayou setting, this is a great place to stay with the kids (mine were even older) while "park hopping" at WDW. I would highly recommend it to others and would go back there again on our next visit without hesitation. Great job Disney!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for short stays.”
Reviews.Author: wellydog
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Disney's Port Orleans Riverside. We would recommend this hotel for short stays but we stayed for 14 nights and that was far too long. The rooms were big but not the beds for two adults used to a double bed in England this felt bit small. Regardless of previous reviews we found it to be clean and well kept. The grounds are amazing, We would recommend a walk along the river at about 7:15 to 7:30 am when the water is very still and the reflections are wonderful, you may also be lucky to see the otters hunting for food they come right up on the bank with there catch of the day. The rooms are very dark and you will need the lights on regardless of the time of day. Also the air conditioning noise came to be very irritating. The main pool is noisey at all times the music goes on late into the night and people swin until at least midnight, we were lucky to be a little way away and the quiet pools are worth visiting. Disney Transport is good, if you want an excellent night out book the Hoop de Do show at the Fort wilderness campground, Buckets of ribs and Chicken and great entertainment..Go on the bus to Magic Kingdom and get a boat from there to the campground, this in its self is a great boat trip, there are buses straight from the campground home but don't take too long about getting to them. The Aloha dinner show was also good but if you can only go to one then go to Hoop de do. Food at Riverside is not brilliant, not much choice and seemed mostly to be buggers and chips. But the French Quarter does a great Taco salad and for a smaller quieter restaurant seemed to have more choice well worth the walk down the riverside. Overall we enjoyed our stay but were thoroughly all themed out by the end, relaxation and peace and quiet seemed to be hard to come by in disney. Other trips worth a visit are the Kennedy Space Centre (Which was really really excellent). If you can get there and afford the time then Billie swap adventure in the Everglades to see Alligators up close and personal is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful first family vacation at this resort”
Reviews.Author: mtmtreasures68
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying at this resort for 8 days. Myself, hubby and 5 year old son. We loved this resort. Although we have nothing to compare it to because it's our first trip to Disney but I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Next time we may try somewhere different just to see what other resorts are like but it's not because we had any problems at all at this resort. The only rude person I ran into during my vacation was the guy working with Disney who was working at the airport. We used the yellow Disney tags on our luggage but I was still a little nervous about leaving our luggage for the Disney people to pick up and expressed this to the 'gentleman'. He was extremely rude to me when I expressed my concerns. We did in fact hop on the Disney express and trusted the Disney staff to get our luggage to our room safely...and they did! So we get to the resort after a comfy ride on the Disney bus. We were second in line to check in, therefore we didn't have to wait at all. We had paid for a 'preferred location' when we booked our trip assuming this meant we would be located in a building near the main pool and main building which housed the restaurant, food court and store. But a preferred location just means a water view...either the river or a pool. Next time we won't pay the extra cost for a preferred location because we were not in the room long enough to care much about the view. We did request a building near the main building and the lady working on the front desk did get us into the Acadian House...which is pretty close. So if you don't really care about the view, don't pay for a preferred location. If you want a building close to the main areas, just request it when you check-in. And guess what? It was approximately 1:00 pm and the room was ready! We went to our room, changed into our swim clothes that we had in our carry-ons and headed for the pool. When we came back to our room perhaps 2 hours later our luggage was sitting there. The room was quite clean. The bed was one of the comfiest beds I've ever slept in! My son slept better than he does at home...but that may be because he was exhausted after our busy days at the theme parks! The lady who cleaned our room didn't do the towel art thing but each day she did do cute things with my son's MANY stuffed animals and he really enjoyed coming back to our room each evening to find what she had done. The resort is beautiful...very large but beautiful. We never heard any noise at all from the outside when we were in our room. I don't even know if we had neighbours because it was so quiet. The food court at breakfast time was crazy!!! The food was pretty good and we enjoyed having our breakfast outside each morning before we started our busy day. Used the bus system and had no problems. But if you watch the fireworks at Magic Kingdom just remember that after the fireworks are over the park closes and EVERYONE is heading for the busses! More than once my husband had to carry our son to the bus depots and wait extra long for a bus....and then we were lucky to get a seat. Most men are very polite and will give up their seat for women and children. My hubby hardly ever got to sit down....'cause he's one of the nice ones! Other than that I highly recommend using the bus service to the theme parks. The store at the resort has everything you need that's Disney related. That's where I did most of my shopping and it was great. We did buy a few grocery items and found that they were quite costly but you have to expect that I guess. There is an arcade at the resort that my son loved. The pool was a lot of fun and he loved the water slide. The quiet pool was nice as well. Loved seeing the little lizards, squirrels and rabbits that seemed to be everywhere. My son even loved feeding the fish in the river. Found our room to be kept pretty clean each day and noticed the staff doing painting and upkeep all around the resort. I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. I called the front desk several times to ask various questions about locations of things, etc. and they were always able to give me answers.....never an 'I don't know'. The room wasn't perfect but it suited us just fine and I highly recommend this resort. It is a very busy resort but I believe the reason for that is because it has a reputation of being the best moderate resort that is owned by Disney. My husband really enjoyed the steak at Boatwrights. The desserts at the food court, ie; the carrot cake and cheese cake are fabulous! All in all we had a wonderful first family vacation and would definitely go back to Riverside again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort.”
Reviews.Author: SConthemove
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed 3 nights with three kids 6 and under. Moderate Disney resorts are definitely a step up from economy level. Rooms are bigger and grounds much nicer. Worth the extra money. This hotel is very cozy. Lots of greenery along trails. Blocks of rooms are lodge style and feel much less motel like. Rooms are large - one of the only place's in Disney where you can have 5 to a room (trundle bed is great for younger kids- not quite big enough for an adult -trust me.) Food court very nice if not somewhat chaotic at meal time. Food quality is good - pasta bar very nice - huge portions. Pizza looked good - individual or large pies for families. Outside dining is nice with the water and boat docks. Horse drawn carriage rides a nice touch. Pool is on central island with a waterslide and there are smaller pools located amongst the lodges. Service is typical Disney excellent -and if not they'll fix it. Only draw back here is lack of luggage carts and elevators to second floor. Rooms are a good walk from the parking lot. If you are on the second floor you must carry all your gear upstairs which is tough with strollers etc. While this is a negative, it nowhere near outweighs all the positives. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Believe I forgot to review this place!!”
Reviews.Author: Geminiangel
Reviews.Content: April 2007 6 nights. Me-37 Hubby-44 Daughter-5 AWESOME! AWESOME! AWESOME! We had the times of our lives. This resort is huge, to us that's a plus. The grounds were so beautiful we enjoyed the walk to breakfast every morning. We live in Vegas, a desert. So to see all kinds of birds, rabbits, lizards was a treat. Not to mention the greenery! Trees, other than palm trees! Night time was amazing. You could hear owls, crickets, and frogs. The grounds were very dim and added to the theme'ing. We were in BLD. 25 and had a corner room, diagonal view of one of the smaller pools. It was all very quiet. Returing from our days adventure was a snap! We simply stayed on the bus and got off at the west depot. Our room was right around the corner. I've read mixed reviews about the bus service and I must say we never waited more that 10mins. I think that just depends on the time of the year it is. We fell in love so much with this place we are returning Feb 2009 for 10 nights this time.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: church1
Reviews.Content: well we my family, have just got back from a fantastic holiday and we stayed at the Port Orleans riverside, was a little bit wary as read some of the reviews before we went, however we found no problems at all we stayed in block 17 in Aligator Bayou which was near the small pool which did us ok and not far from the food court, the room was big enough for my family of 5 which include my 2 year old, the beds were really comfortable and we fitted in quite well, however we did not spend much time in the room, but it was clean and tidy and housekeeping was really good, the food court was ok, after a week you got a little bored so we tried to eat in the parks to try something different, a little tip if you have small children who are picky eaters like my two year old then you could have problems, my little one spent the two weeks on soup and ice cream, i did talk the food court manager who was pleasant, but could not provide me with jelly for my little one, where as you could get it in other places in disney, we did not hire a car as we relied on the disney transport which was good, however like other reviews we did have to wait a while for some buses, it seemed to me like this resort had the longest queues, also this resort is quite big and you do some walking, we loved the boat to downtown disney and we did hire the bikes which was a really good way to see all of the resort and get some excercise, we found the shop really good, and sold most of what you could get in parks in Disney, we did book a character dinner only because there was a cancellation, so I would try and book before you go, we went to Chef Mickey's in the Contempory Resort, which was great, the food was fantastic and my little one ate really well and the characters really spent time with you, so overall we had a fantastic time, would I go back yes I would without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grounds at Port Orleans Riverside!”
Reviews.Author: CasWaukesha_WI
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at POR. The grounds are beautiful and well maintained for such a huge resort. The rooms are basic and were clean upon arrival. I did notice there wasn't much clean up in the room during our week stay by the cleaning staff other than emptying the garbages and giving us new towels. I really enjoyed the main dinning halls selection of food they had to offer but did not care at all for BoatWright's dinner menu. Wasn't that great for the price. Overall it was a great trip and had no real complaints. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Riverside - GO and Enjoy It !”
Reviews.Author: DisneyW0rld
Reviews.Content: Having read some real bad reviews here on trip advisor, I made a promise that I would really evaluate the place and write a honest review. I am not that picky and dont really notice all that much, I couldnt believe how much people really notice and get bothered by. My wife and I agreed that only the people who have a bad time write reviews and people who have a good time couldnt be bothered. Well, I had a great time and I want to share it with you all. Yes, I saw some of the things people talked about, but we'll get to that later. To me, its mostly funny stuff and all part of the Disney (sightseeing) vacation, note: Sightseeing does not equal relaxation, and this week was a marathon of sights. We started our trek with our three kids, took the Disney magical express from the aiport, Went right downstairs and was checked in by a cast member in 2 seconds. First question? Did I see any any cast members up in the main airport to help me down here? NO, none at all !!! But one really helpful security lady helped me find it, very easy too.. Next, no wait for the Magic Bus, but for some reason, the magic express bus going to Riverside was not the yellow and blue bus with Travelin-Mickey on the hood and the side. I thought to myself - uh oh ! not a good sign. But it was just as comfy with the movies and everything, funny driver made a joke about having two hours to now pray for our luggage to make it to our room. Got to Riverside, very grand entrance way, lots of people already vacationed-up, shopping, waiting for cruise-line buses and park buses. Off we go to the lobby, about 1pm, only 2 people in line, im the second. Kids immediately spot Crayons and paper and the TV, then spot the Riverside boat and other boats at the Marina right outside the window, their pretty excited and I cant wait to stroll around. Very nice place. One thing people havent written about that is absolutely the coolest thing about Disney to me is: There is Mood-setting MUSIC playing in each place you go. So the lobby has some nice trumpets playing, I felt all steam-boated up... Checked in in 5 minutes, only problem, room is not ready, have to call from house phone more towards 3pm to see when ready. I asked for a different room, she checked and said, this waterfront room is for you, there is some other room but it is further back. Waterfront can be a Pool View or a river view, She told me we would have a pool view which at first I wasnt that thrilled about. Noticed: People at checkin are dressed up and the concierge people are even more dressed up in some bonnet type get ups. Everyones hungry, so we set off to the food court, which is not too crowded, but is built for at least a thousand people (which we see tommorrow at breakfast). Have a good selection of food and immediately we use 5 quick service meals off our dining. Sat next to the awesome water-wheel which is just nice. Noticed: Tables were like sticky from Syrup or something, this does bug me out, so I went over and wet a few napkins and cleaned it myself, I saw some people during the week making the bus service people clean it up for them. Noticed: The bus service people and the cafeteria people are dressed up in these bonnet type suits too !!! There is a lot of attention paid to the whole theming of the resort, the more you look around, the more you see. We quickly bought two mugs to refill for the whole week, a 12.00 investment that pays off in hours. Ok, went to Ol man Island pool, again, music is playing from the landscaping, and now I really feel relaxed already. This time its more of like rag-time, happy go lucky bayou river music. Wife has a Pina-Colava(raspberry twist) and I have a Mai-Tai, which become the daily routine, kids jump in the pool, hit the slides. I ran to see if the room was ready at 3:00pm, man advises, No, their painting the door ? I said I hope its the outside of the door, because Im not into smelling paint. he said yes its only the outside, should be ready by 4:00pm. Im kind of bummed out because I wanted to hit a park that night, which by the pool are the park open-close times which I notice most of the parks close at 7:00pm to 8:30pm. I was shocked about that. Is april not full swing ? So anyway, killing one more hour at a pool is not really a problem. I go back at 3:50, and the room is ready, Im given the Room# now, it was a secret until then, Its Alligator Bayou # 3906, Let me tell ya, Im very glad we waited for this room, after making a few wrong turns, we came upon our room, 1st floor and literally 30 steps from one of the quiet pools. In fact we can see the pool from our window !!! Score !!!! on the way there, we see all sorts of towel animals and displays in peoples room windows. We already have an Elephant waiting for us in the window ! We were in the room no more than 1 minute and PooF our Luggage appears which was not really a surprise considering it was here already for three hours just like us. But we happily tipped the guy ! Two other things I know that Disney knows how to do, When the AC is running, and you sit outside, you can not hardly even hear it. It is the quietest unit Ive ever heard, It cranked, we never had to turn it on to hi-cool, and kept it only on 5-1/2 (out of 10) on lo-cool all the time, 6 was too cold ! And then, they have the best pillows in the world, they are really small, you think you need two, but when you use just one, it like explodes around your head and it feels like theres three, no matter how you turn it, you have just the right support. There are plenty of shelves, one over the two sinks, held all of our stuff for all 5 of us. There is a nice marble shelf near the tub, mirror on the bathroom door, nice touch for kids because they cant see them selves in the over-sink mirrors. There is a nice armoir with a big tv, lots of drawers. A shelf with 6 hanging pegs which I used to keep all my Park Maps, cell phone, money, watch, its up high and worked out nice. A big trunk thing that held one of our suitcases. The beds have wooden posts that are great for hanging hats, jackets and things. There was a big table and two chairs. The window had nice wood blinds that closed up nice and nice thick room-darkening curtains. We are just totally impressed by the room, it looks just like the Wilderness lodge we were in two years ago. Im so happy about the pool location. I guess if I was a real complainer, I could say there was a pink-milk of magnesia type stain on the floor near the corner of the refrigerator. But who cares about that ? I got bigger things to worry about. Like how much fun Im going to be having all week. The refrigerator was cool and helped alot with milk for the kids. We wanted a micro-wave, so I called for one, they have them, but they must have a limited number and asked if we needed it for medical reasons, I said, yes, my children need warm food and drinks, that did the trick, we had it in two hours. So now we were set, un-packed watching the Disney tour channel. We set off to Epcot the first night just to get out. We could hit the North bus-stop in a pretty fast 5 minute walk. The grounds like everyone says are just awesome, little ponds, bridges, turning sidewalks, lush gardens, Oh yeah, we had a bunny rabbit lived near our house, we saw her everyday. And plenty of lizards, ducks and assorted birds. Just a real paradise. One thing I want to mention is: Dont think that Disney has not put millions into this resort and maintains it very well. Every one is on the ball ! After some peoples reviews, you would think the place is falling apart, absolutely not true. Oh yeah, remember the painting of the door ? No one painted anything near this room. He must have been drinking some Mai-Tai's. I wasnt about to make sure any thing about the painting either. So when we got back to the room that night, the beds are pretty high up in the air. It would not be good to fall out from that height, so I ordered bed-rails. This was later in the evening, and we did not receive them the first night. We passed out without them anyway and I called in the morning, and told them we asked for them last night, she apologized and we had them in our room in 20 minutes. Thats good service. Our first official day was about to start, we head off to the food court, wow ! its packed ! We quickly came up with a plan we did every morning. We all spot the table, grab it. Wife goes and gets the food. Pancakes, bacon, eggs every day, awesome ! I settle the kids at the table, fill the mugs with coffee, get the knives/forks/napkins, and get the syrup. Note You need a knike to stir the coffee in the mug, the coffee stirrers are not tall enough for the mug. We have this down to a science, and the kids are at their best at breakfast, we have a great time watching all of the people so happy to be at Disney. Everyone is very courteous, polite and helpful, holding doors, etc... The only time all week I saw anything remotely problematic was with some bad mouthed teenagers, hey but what are you gonna do ? their teenagers ! The buses ? your curious about them right ? well, I saw it all, mostly they were always there and ready within 5 or 10 minutes, I had a few times of over 30 minutes, and one really bad time where it was 50 minutes. I watched the time like a hawk, but the majority of the time, it was only 10 minutes. and Yes, I did stand a few times, but im a guy, and my wife sat everytime as did my kids, people would go way out of their way to stand for a lady, an elder or the kids ! It was actually very nice to see such nice people. I love America, we're the best people ! And the toilets ? Yes ! they're loud !! its like a suction -explosion just like everyone says, but I couldnt really hear other rooms toilets like some people say. I was actually laughing to myself because I remember the toilet noise problem ! haha ! Do the dining, and make sure you try to get reservations, we had only one when we left from home: At BoatWrights, I ended up making another one at BoatWrights, and we got a reservations at: Tuskar House in Animal Kingdom, Mama Melrose in Holly wood studioes, Liberty TreetTavern in Magic Kingdom, and do believe!!!!!!!!!!! we got a reservation at Cinderellas Round Table Sunday Morning for Monday Night, dont give up, just call every morning. People really do cancel, it happened for us last time, and it happened for us again this time !!! Boatwrights I couldnt say more about, I was more relaxed there than at cinderellas castle. Just like Cinderellas castle has these pretzel appetizer rolls, Boatwrights has fresh corn bread with real corn for appetizers, also got the romain lettuce with parmesan and the spiced shrimp. Then got an excellent Filet mignon. You have to get the top shelf things at the top shelf restaurants because with Disney dining, 1 table service is 1 table service no matter where you eat, so get to the nice places and order up the most expensive stuff. So glad we really ate well all week. Still had 10 snacks after 6 days. Well we put a whole lot of blisters onto our feet, each day we had a new towel display in our bath room, one day it was a dress shirt and tie, next day it was a sea shell, all of our toothbrushes where spread in different patterns, There was always something to see when we got back to the room. And the kids got a Bunny one day, and on the next to last day they got a kangaroo ! so the Elephant, bunny, kangaroo and a bunch of toys were all looking out the window. We never got to do the fishing hole or rent the surrey bike. But we saw people everyday fishing and biking, We did take the Horse and carriage ride on our last night after another fantastic meal at boatwrights. Luke was our horses name, almost 2,000 pounds he is, a really beauty. We went down to the french quarter as the sun was setting, the kids first time in a buggy, it was just surreal. Very beatiful. We took the boat to downtown disney which was very relaxing and also beautiful, you can put the strollers right up into the front of the boat and just relax. We also took the boat on our last day to the French Quarter swimming pool because the kids just HAD to go down the Dragon Tongue Slide ! Oh yeah ! The gift shop at riverside is gigantic, we saw a lot of the things that were in the parks were also available right here in the Hotel gift shop. We also bought stuff in the parks, and they shipped to the hotel gift shop for free! it was there the next day, we did that twice, really worked out great. I was just totally relaxed by the day we had to leave and really comfortable with Riverside, the Magic Express arrived like clockwork, and we checked in for our airline right at the hotel, took 5 minutes. I wish we didnt have to leave, couldve stayed another few days. I hope people remember Disney has done alot with Riverside to make it a great place for anyone, couples, families, tours. If your reading reviews and are thinking - uh oh ! that doesnt sound nice. Remember this, I read them and thought the same thing, and unless im just not a nit-picking party pooper, I just totally had a blast there. I would go back in a second. Its a paradise waiting for you to explore it. Go ! and enjoy !

Reviews.Title: “More Bed Bug Stories!”
Reviews.Author: SvenJorgensen
Reviews.Content: Stayed that the (fomer Dixie Landings) POR 9 years ago. Was very satisfied back then, had a terrific time. This time was much different. Asked for adjoining rooms and recieved them. (I felt I had to check on this thoughout my trip planning process to ensure it) We checked in and the rooms seemed resonably clean. During the trip my children noticed 'bumbs' on their skin but added this up to sun exposure. Only upon closer examination did we realize that the bumps were bed bug bites. Please check any hotel room thoroghly. Check the internet to see examples of tell tale signs. The family is fine, Disney offered to make a claim but we've no medical bills, just a feeling of disgust. They said they would alert the hotel to take care of the situation, I hope they do, so another family won't have to go through that experience.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, but under-whelming stay”
Reviews.Author: staplehead
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 5 nights at Riverside in the Acadian House. The grounds are really well done. The atmosphere outside really was wonderful. Water taxi to Downtown Disney was very enjoyable and convenient. The resort was quiet - the pool is on an island away from the guest buildings. We had a room that looked back at the parking lots. A little bit of a bummer if the room view is important. Try to get one facing the river side, otherwise you could be staying anywhere with a parking lot view. The room itself was a typical budget-style room. Ours was little tired, but tidy. The handicapped shower and bathroom were well laid out (neither of us is handicapped, but we have a wheelchair bound parent). The shower curtain rings in our room were of a style that were difficult to slide, particularly if you are sitting. The bathroom fan was wicked loud and randomly timed, it seemed. However the bed was comfortable and the sheets were, too. The pillows are puffy and compress down to nothing. My Kaymed pillow it wasn't. :-) The room had a small fridge to store food, beverages, or refrigerated medication. Check-in service was fine. Check-out was easy (we used the Magical Express - I highly recommend it going between airport and resorts). The restaurant, Riverside Mill serves typical cafeteria food. The Nescafe coffee is horrible. It's huge and gets very crowded. My local hole-in-the-wall diner serves better eggs for half the price. It's pretty much the same breakfast everywhere and gets tired, quickly - especially at $7 for scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, and potato wedges. If getting an early seat on a bus to one of the parks is important, I recommend getting a room near the west depot. The south depot (near the main entrance) is always most crowded and is arrived at after the other depots. Coming back from a park, we got off at the south depot and walked to our room through the pleasant grounds. Staying within the Disney grounds has definite transportation advantages. However, Riverside drop-offs and pick-ups seemed to be further away than most and definitely much more populated. For the handicapped: the buses all kneel and accommodate scooters and wheelchairs. The bus driver will let you on first, closing the front doors until you are situated. On return trips from parks, you are allowed and encouraged to move to the head of line, bypassing substantial lines. The "general store" is decent. The big store in Downtown Disney has better prices for Disney gear. If wanting to have a beer (and all of it is pretty mainstream), it is better to spend $17 for a six-pack of Corona or Bud Light than $5-$7 for a bottle or a glass of beer. The staff at Riverside and throughout the resorts was generally outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: cliff_rock
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Disney. Very satisifed w/ the overall value of this property when you consider the resort transportation component that is included. I did not observe anything "tired" about this resort. Party of 5 visited this property for 4 nights over a long weekend. It is a good property, with excellent grounds. Our room was in the Alligator Bayou Building #28. We were given a parking lot view at check-in, but was switched to a garden view at my request. This is a large resort, be prepared to do some walking. Room size was fine, 2 beds, 1 trundle bed, 1 table w/ 2 chairs. Bathroom fixtures were good, with 2 sinks outside the toilet/shower area. Linens and towels OK, pretty typical 3-star. Pool area was quite nice. There is pool towel service. We used Disney buses for all transportation to/from parks with no complaint. We did opt for a taxi for a couple hotel-to-hotel trips (~$10/one-way) to save time. Disney airport transport was flawless, including baggage handling. We used the quick-service dining restaurant. It was fine, about what you'd expect from a food court.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Port Orleans Riverside”
Reviews.Author: RichA252
Reviews.Content: We (family of 4, kids 7 and 9) stayed at Port Orleans Riverside from April 13 to 17 and were very pleased with the resort. The rooms themselves are nothing special, but were comfortable enough. Only glitch on check in was that we requested a room in Alligator Bayou in order to get a room with a trundle bed. We ended up in Parterre Place, but when I called the front desk, they promptly provided a rollaway cot that met our needs. Otherwise the room was quiet and housekeeping provided adequate service. Rooms have a refrigerator so you can pick up some milk, juice, yogurt, etc. if you want to eat a quick breakfast in the room. The resort property more that made up for the average room. The grounds are beautiful and our boys absolutely loved the pools, particularly the main pool with the slide. The lifeguard staff at the main pool are very attentive, so parents can relax a bit and let the kids have some fun without having to keep a constant eye on them. Main dining hall is busy, but we were satisfied with the food in general. Staff were very helpful in sorting out the details for the Disney Dining Plan (I highly recommend the plan). Had breakfast there a couple of days and also picked up a pizza one night when we just wanted a quick meal. Also, you can buy mugs for $13.75 that allow for unlimited coffee/soft drink refills at the resort for the duration of your stay. If you are staying more than a few days, they are a great deal considering you can get your coffee and cool drinks for pool time each day. Was somewhat skeptical about how much more convenient it would be to stay on the resort as opposed to in Kissimmee, but am now definitely sold on the value. We were able to easily zip back to the hotel from the Disney theme parks for a break in the afternoons, then return to the theme parks in the evening. The extra magic hours for resort guests are also a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: gemmaharroduk
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend, His brother and wife and two children stayed at Disneys Port Orleans resort for Christmas 2007 through to the 4th Jan this year!! When we arrived jet lagged from the long flight to the UK we discovered that our suitcases had been taken on the Mickey Bus to the hotel whilst we collected our Hire Car!! ( Great Idea) When we got to the hotel and checked in the staff couldnt be more friendly until they told me and my boyfriend that our luggage may not be with us for up to 4 hours!!! We went to our rooms but after being awake so long ( Due to the delayed flight) I started to get restless and just wanted some clean clothes and my make up remover!! After waiting 30 Mins my boyfriend phoned reception to see if it would really be 4 hours waiting for our luggage, They explained yes it would be, Within 5 mins of this conversation there was a knock at the door and a young guy brought our suitcases straight in!! I could not have been happier!! The rooms were extremely clean and tidy and every morning our maid would leave clean towels! To be honest when you are in orlando you dont really spend much time in your hotel room as there is so much to see and do!! However the swimming pool was really clean, There was even a llaundry room!! ( Tip go to Walmart to buy washing powder so much cheaper than on the resort) I managed to do all my washing before we left for the UK! Overall it was a great holiday, The food at the resturant was very over priced and not very good food, But with International Drive not far there is enough restaurants and bars to keep u full!! Drinks were quite pricey and as was gifts, Its much cheaper to go to the Florida Mall or the souniver shops on International Drive. You did get the free Buses going to all of the Disney Parks many times a day and also the extra magic hours in the parks so you can stay in there later than the general public, You also get free car parking at the disney parks as well. There is also the Steam Boat that takes you to downtown disney for free as well. Disney Port Orleans resort is ideal for family with young children, Staff are friendly and nice.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED our stay at POR”
Reviews.Author: oliv2b
Reviews.Content: My husband, two sons ages 5 and 4 and I stayed at Port Orleans Riverside March 30-April 5. Upon arriving at the beautiful resort, we were ecstatic to find our room available at check-in (we arrived at noon). We stayed in the Oak Manor and the grounds were gorgeous and the room was inviting. I had read many reviews before arriving that stated the POR had poor mousekeeping and that the bus routes were awful--we did not find that to be the case during our stay. Our room was clean, cozy and warm. We never had to wait for a bus longer than 15 minutes, and all but once we were able to get a seat. We had the Disney Dining Plan, and we felt the counterservice meals at Riverside Mill were well above our expectations. The staff was friendly and we would look forward to returning to Riverside for future Disney vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Graham7720
Reviews.Content: We spent three interesting nights at the Riverside Resort in Disneyland this week. This particular resort is part of the greater New Orleans Resort which encompasses both the New Orleans and French Quarter resorts and are of a surprisingly high standard and are an excellent venue for a vacation particularly if you are with children. Our lodge was named Alligator Bayou and was nestled in an area crammed with trees and bushes close to a meandering river that twisted its way around the resort making access to other attractions easy and providing in itself opportunities for fishing and sailing made possible by the availability of various types of watercraft. A bayou is a name for a small slow moving creek that originated in Louisiana and this landscape is evident if you spend any amount of time walking about the lavish landscape which is particularly pleasant in the evening when the heat has dissipated and there is a warm perfume emanating from the gardenia bushes speckled beside the sidewalks. The Ol' Man Island is the largest swimming pool in the resort. It has a slide which is popular with the kids and a poolside bar popular with the big people. There are five other pools which are spread out in close proximity to the other lodges. There is a full A La Carte restaurant and a self service restaurant which provided adequate eateries and free soda and coffee refills after an initial minimal deposit and a shop, arcade and indoor bars populated by the crowds who were there during our visit. The rooms are reasonable in size and clean. There is easy transport to the other resorts and all in all this is an ideal place to get away from the hustle and bustle and paradoxically a good` place to go if you like a bit of fun in the sunshine.

Reviews.Title: “*** Great Resort---Great Time--It's Disney***”
Reviews.Author: piverriver
Reviews.Content: We were at riverside April 2nd - 8th We have been to disney about 20 times and have stayed at most all resorts. We have been to riverside many times and were there when it open up as dixie landings. The grounds and the service has not change and yes the rooms do show some wear and tear. The housekeeping does seem to go downhill every time we come. You will notice when you get to your room the 1st day everything will be there the soap-shampoo-coffee-cups but after that it will not happen so you will need to call housekeeping and they will bring it over no problem. I did talk to a gal in housekeeping and told her that for $200 a night i would like it there and told her that i notice that the housekeeping is going down and she said that disney cut back on a lot of people and said that is why they seems to rush a little. We love the resorts so to us it's no problem unlike some reviews where some people just look for things to complain about and ruin there vacation not us we are just happy to be able to go as there are a lot of people that wish they could go. The food is good at the food court but we go to all of the resorts to eat plus disney downtown (earl of sandwich--wolfgang puck express) are great. If you are looking to stay at riverside please do and the part about a lot of walking around the resort just be happy you can walk and not laying in a bed. P.S. we checked in at noon and the lines were long as there were 12 windows and only 4 open so it took a 1 1/2 hours to check in. It seem early morning and later afternoon is the best no line then. Any questions just ask i can tell you just about anthing about disney

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location for Navigating WDW”
Reviews.Author: HFamily6
Reviews.Content: We took our two adult sons and their wives to WDW March 30-April 6. We stayed at the Magnolia Bend in room 8082. We had 3 rooms near one another and on the bottom level. We requested "riverview" and we got it, but being on the ground level, we could not see the river. But that was OK. We woke up to birds singing each morning and that was great. We were a short distance from the pool and didn't get much noise from there. Our room was pretty good. The tub, shower and toilet areas were clean. The carpets were worn but OK. The two pedestal sinks were great and made getting ready much faster and easier in the mornings. One of our sons experienced ants the first night and next day, so they requested another room and didn't have a problem after that. The bus service was great. We usually got on at the bus pickup near the lobby since it was a nice short walk from our room. We also took advantage of the river as we went from Port Orleans to Downtown Disney. Scenery was great. The rest of the time we used the buses to AK, Hollywood Studios, MK and Epcot. One day, we rented a car and drove to Universal/Islands of Adventure and spent the whole day there. The WDW Meal Plan was great once you learned how it works. I had made reservations prior to our arrival at several restaurants throughout WDW. Since we did not eat on site the one day we went to Universal, we used a "2 table service" meal at JIko's - at AK - well worth the double meal. We also had the4-day Park Hopper. We used up all our leftover "snacks" and got cookies/bars for our plane trip home. We had no problem using our Quick Meals withing WDW at the hotel restaurants or in the parks. We rode on almost everything and didn't have to wait too long. We never did use the Fast Pass. Most of the rides took "singles" so we just split up and got on pretty quick. We do not have any grandchildren yet, but I do know that we will NOT be taking our grandchildren to WDW. We saw too many parents and grandparents who were pretty exhausted and short tempered after just 3 days. It was very crowded (spring break) and it was humid and pretty warm. Parents and grandparents want to "get their money's worth", but the kids just wanted to play and ride a few rides. This was our first time "on site" and as a package, I would recommend it. Otherwise, it is very expensive for meals and pop/water. I'm glad we did it this way this time. Port Orleans Riverside was good for us and I would stay there again. Their Boatwright's Restaurant and Food Court were very good. The food court, although very large, was always very crowded. It has very pretty grounds and they were well groomed. All in all, it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice ground-Rooms are dirty”
Reviews.Author: TigGal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside for five nights. The grounds and pools are beautiful and well kept. The rooms are neglected by some of the housekeeping staff. We saw some of the same things others reviewers have mentioned. Mirrors and walls were dirty, dirty stained tub and shower stall with mold on the tiles and shower curtain. Tile floors were dirty never mopped nor were items picked up off the floor. Urine stains on toilet by bolts. A thick layer of dust was on the shelves, headboard, and on top of the armoire. Bed spread was okay but pulled that off the bed. Blankets need replacing...holes etc. Towels first day were worn, following days new towels were left every day for the remainder of our stay. Carpet did not appear to be vacuumed except for the next to last day we were there. The day before we left there was a new housekeeper who actually cleaned up the mess the other housekeepers left. We entered the room and it smelled clean with the scent of bleach in the air. My sheets had also been changed, nice new thick ones verses the frayed see through ones. The only thing I can say is that you donâ€™t spend that much time in the room! I cleaned up what I could so that I could be comfortable. The food at the food court was good. Transportation to the various parks was easy to catch and ran every 20 min or less. Over all I would stay here again, Iâ€™d just bring some Clorox clean up.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort”
Reviews.Author: TheMacsfiveplus1
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Disney and walked through the airport, there was a guy holding the Disney Magical Express card. He told us the easiest way to get to our bus. We waited no more then 2 minutes in the line before our bus loaded. We stopped at Saratoga Springs, POFQ and then to our resort. I was not even 12:00 when we got to the check in. We had Mary taking care of us. This is the only name I remember because I took notice since she was so nice and personable. Our rooms were ready, I was shocked being we had requested connecting rooms since traveling with our 6 kids. We walked to our room in building 15 (alligator bayou), we paid for standard rooms but had a beautiful view of landscape with a quiet pool in the distance. The rooms were very nice, and very clean. We had towel animals already and receive a few more during our trip. Our rooms were close to everything, the main building, the boats, the main bus stop and quiet pool. The furthest thing was the main pool and that was not far either. We did not eat in the resort restaurant, but did use the food court. It is fine for a quick meal. The refillable mugs are well worth the money and the coffee was pretty good. I thought I would be missing dunkin donuts since we were not renting a car this trip. I was happy to fill my coffee fix. The General Store has everything you would need, we even got a binky (pacifier) since we forgot it at home. The boat ride to FQ and downtown disney are great, easier then taking the buses and some great views. You can see the old tree house villas. The bus system was pretty good being it was a busy time of year, the only places that took some time were the water parks since you had to stop somewhere before. I washed some clothes in the laundry area near the quiet pool, they have a machine with detergents and softeners. Everyone was very nice and helpful, we would stay here again. It is amazing how many details disney gets right. It was a flawless visit to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “gtreat place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rodneydempich
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the resort for 8 days and had a great time the rooms were very clean the cleaning lady was great every day she made a new towel animal for my daughter. the grounds were kept very clean . the resort was very full but all servie was fast and polite. the only the i did not like was the food court food was not that good but we had the disney meal plane and only ate there twice. I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Objective review of Rooms 3505 and 3506”
Reviews.Author: nesmith033
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this resort from March 23-27 as part of the Disney Land and Sea vacation package. We had two adults and a total of 5 children in the Alligator Bayou section. The pros: as everyone else has stated, the grounds are truly attractive. The staff that we encountered was friendly and helpful. Also, the buses, while sometimes very crowded, were generally efficient, and a great way of getting around. The food court is open until midnight to accomodate everyon's schedule and eating habits. The cons: the rooms were somewhat clean, but in a very superficial way. I never felt that the room was truly clean. The carpets were stained, and we saw a dead cockroach on the room refrigerator. Also, the air conditioner didn't seem to be that effective. The rooms can be a bit of a walk from the lobby area, and not easy to find when arriving at night. The bathroom areas are extremely small. The food court was okay, certainly nothing special. We were on the Disney meal plan, and the food at the parks was somewhat better. All in all, if given a choice, I would not stay here again. We booked our trip at the last minute, and this was the only resort with openings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: melbagals
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this resort several times. We also have stayed at Port Orleans French Quarter and at Coronado Springs. We always come back to Riverside. Th grounds are beautifull, the service unmatched. There is very limited room service, however there is a large food court, a full restaurant and a full lounge, as well as a Tiki Bar by the main pool. We live in Florida, so make several trips a year to the Disney complex. Perhaps you could find a room off grounds cheaper, but it is just not worth the traffic, the parking etc. When you stay in the complex parking at the parks is free. I think it runs about fifteen dollars otherwise. Also, when you stay on the grounds you are allowed to enter and exit different parks earlier or later than the general public. The riverboat runs to "Downtown Disney" where there are many more shops, restaurants and nightlife. I would HIGHLY recomend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: dooper84
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed at Port Orleans Riverside. The grounds are beautifully landsaped. Pool was nice though they could use more lounge chairs. Our room slept four and the fifth was on a pullout bed (which the kids fought over who would get to sleep there). The front desk was very accommodating at all of our requests. Food was OK and fast. The dining hall can fill up quickly, especially at breakfast time. Food is expensive all over Disney - I'd recommend the dining plan. The buses that transport resort guests to the various parks are wonderful. Many people say the Riverside is too spread out, but we enjoyed the walk and had a bus depot very close to our room. An added bonus - the kids loved feeding the ducks in the resort's pond.

Reviews.Title: “By far the best vacation and what a time to visit Disney”
Reviews.Author: kam45impala
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a week so we could visit all the parks and take advantage of the free transport, extra hours etc. I did a lot of research on Disney sites and requested the Acadian House, which was a nice building, just a short walk over the bridge...main pool wasn't to far. This area was so peaceful and there was a small pool at the side of our building. The hotel itself was nice, the room was spacious and included a small refrig and coffee pot. We took advantage of the disney dining plan, which I would highly recommend. Just if you take advantange of this book all your dinners ahead of time. We had the best dinners, wonderful seating. Our service was absoultely wonderful and being on the dining plan had no affect on how you were treated...as a matter of fact we felt the staff went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed. We asked about how the tip worked and the staff received a 15% tip on what the total bill would have been if not on the meal plan. One of the nicest meals we had was at The Contemporary Hotel "California Grill" although it used 2 of our dining credits it was still well worth it. The view is amazing with the fireworks over the castle. This was a belated 50th birthday celebration my husband gave me as I always wanted to see Disney all decorated for Christmas. I would highly recommend visiting during this time and make sure to see the Osborne's lights in MGM and take part in all th special Disney events at each theme park.

Reviews.Title: “So close to a Deluxe Resort, you barely know the difference”
Reviews.Author: travelingcheap
Reviews.Content: Recently spent a couple of nights at Port Orleans - Riverside (Magnolia Bend). This after coming off the Disney Magic for a week. This was our second stay at Port Orleans and this trip was better than the first. Here's a breakdown. Service: Very helpful at the front desk. Our guy was "earning his ears" but was very helpful in getting us checked in. Entertainment: The piano player in the bar was hilarious!!! Too bad he was only there a couple of nights a week. Don't remember his name, but you can't miss the yellow suit!! The Rooms: Spacious, clean and in our opinion, there was very little if any difference between the interior the rooms here and those in the Boardwalk, Wilderness and other Deluxe Rooms. With that said, my wife and I still wonder if this was a recently remodeled room since everything was borderline flawless! The Grounds: Scenic, but spread out. Nice walk and the main building isn't too far from Magnolia Bend. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again - this coming from someone that has been spoiled with trips to the Wilderness Lodge, Beach Club and Boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: foodee999
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a spring break vacation and stayed at Port Orleans Riverside. Our room was clean with a mini fridge and all appliances worked well. I have 2 children aged 7 and 4 and what I liked about the property was the blocks of rooms are like mini hotels so you don't hear alot of people running around outside. The laundry facility was near by and the swimming pools stayed open 24 hours a day. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: babytay
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights in this hotel in october 2007 and it was very crowded. there are 2 hotels in the vicinity, Port orleans RIVERSIDE and FRENCH QUARTERS. In terms of Location, Riverside is better than the French Quarters. It is the first stop for the river boat transport service from Downtown Disney. Just as expected, the Disney decorations of the hotel is.. very... pleasantly DISNEY.. However the food was not cheap. Customer Service was Great. Much better than some other budget/moderate hotels in the Disney hotels.
