Reviews.Title: “POR Value and Comparison to Pop Century”
Reviews.Author: Xerillion
Reviews.Content: This review would be helpful for anyone trying to decide if the extra cost of Disney Port Orleans Riverside is worth the extra money over another well reviewed value resort - Disney Pop Century. I stayed at the Pop Century in October 2007, and stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside March 2-8th. I enjoyed the Pop very much and thougth it was a tremendous value. I decided to upgrade this time and spent an extra $100/night to stay at POR, which is a moderate resort. I thought POR was nice, but not worth the extra $100/night over the Pop. POR has a nice southern theme. The rooms are slightly bigger than the Pop with double sinks and a refrigerator. POR has a boat that does to Downtown Disney which was OK and nice for strollers. The POR property was very big and my family and I did talk a walk around the river, down to French Quarter. We did think taking one of those family bycles or carrige rides would be fun but we really didn't have time to do it. I thought the pools were really great. They were heated and open until 12am. The main pool had a nice bar that opened up at 11:30am and onece I got a $8 Mai Tai that was good. I thought the food court wasn't that great and better at the POP. I gave up on the food court for breakfast and ate at Boatwrights for breakfast which was very good. I had the bannan and strawberry stuffed french toast which was so great. One morning I also had a mimosa to start the day for $11. Again, expensive, but it was fun and I enoyed it. I was at building 18 of POR and it was a quick walk to the main building and I paid for a water view, which meant I got a view of one of the smaller pools. The smaller pools were also heated and open until 12am. I paid for a water view hoping to get a view of the river. We called the front desk to see if they had any river view rooms and they did but I didn't want to relocate. That's OK. Bus times between POR and POP are about the same. I thought the bus queue situation at POP was handled better. POR is not "In your face" Disney where the POP is. At any rate I thought POR was nice but not worth the extra money over the POP century. My wife actually commented thatt she missed the whimsical theming of the POP. A week stay at POR was $3300, and the same package was $2600 at the POP. If you are booking a similar vacation, I recommend keeping the $700 in your savings account and going with the POP. We did the dining plan (highly recommend) and if you are too and love to eat your way through a vacation here is some input for you: Boatwright (Port Orleans Riverside) - ate breakfast there 3 times during my stay and thought it was very good. Boma (Animal Kingdom Lodge) - very good, but you must be a little adventurous! Whispering Canyon Cafe (Wilderness Lodge) - very good and get the BBQ skillet--all you an eat and includes a bottomless milkshake! La Cellier (Epcot Canadian Pavillion) - PHENOMINAL, don't miss this if you can get reservations. This is amazing it is only a 1 table service restaurant. 1900 Park Fare (Grand Floridian) - food is pretty unimpressive, but the show they put on with Cinerella, Prince Charming the stepmother, stepsisters is really very nice. I don't recommend having a birthday here though. We spent $60 on a special cake from the Grand Floridan bakery to celebrate a birthday and the waitress forgot it before handing us our check. What a bummer. I wouldn't recommend this place. Chef's de France (Epcot French Pavillion) - food was so-so which was suprising. I woudln't recommend it. Biergarten (Epcot German pavillion) - really great food, and you can order one of those huge german bears. Enjoyed the Oktoberfest band that plays every hour. Highly recommend this place. Liberytree Tavern (Magic Kingdom) - really good. There is nothing on the menu to choose, it just comes to you family style. Well done, tasty Thanksgiving style food. And after dinner you can stand right outside for the parade!

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: runner110
Reviews.Content: In the past, I've stayed at Port Orleans Riverside and Carribean Beach (all Disney moderate resorts). Riverside was a major disappointment! While no one argues that the grounds aren't beautiful (they are), I expect a lot more from a room. Our first room, in Acadian House, was simply disgusting. There was blood on the toilet and brown substance (hopefully coffee, but maybe not) on the walls. That night, very large groups of apparently unsupervised teenagers ran around screaming and throwing things off of balconies. We called security, and about an hour later they stopped. Then they began slamming the heavy metal door above us and stomping on the floor (they must have seen us look outside before security showed up). After security showed up again, they stopped until around 2:30. At 7am, I dragged myself to the front desk to complain. The staff was very apologetic, and offered a very honest complaint about Brazilian teenage tour groups. They moved our room to Alligator Bayou. Compared to the first room, it seemed nice (at least it was clean). However, the trundle bed was a joke - barely big enough for my six year old, and having him sleep basically on the floor with dirty carpet was a big concern. The beds were incredibly noisy. Any movement at all would wake up everyone in the room. When other toilets would flush, they sounded like torpedos being lauched. For three days, we didn't hear anything from our neighbors (we were on the corner), but then a family with two little girls moved in, and I doubt that we could have heard them better if they had shared our room with us. In the other two moderate resorts, we never heard another guest. Another reviewer commented on "crabby" guests. We experienced that too. When entering the overcrowded dining room, absolutely no one held the door open for other guests carrying luggage or food, or said "thank you" if we did. All in all, there was nothing "magical" about this stay (although we did enjoy the parks). Buses weren't bad, except for Sunday to the Magic Kingdom. The line for the bus was so long that we rode the water taxi to the French Quarter and got a bus from there. When I read things that other reviewers post, like "if this were a European hotel it would be 4 stars", I have to point out that it's not a European hotel! It's a Disney hotel, and you have a right to expect better quality for $185. I'd stay at the French Quarter again, or upgrade if I could afford it and stay at a "deluxe", but on our next trip we're staying off-site. I wouldn't stay at Riverside again.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 007disney
Reviews.Content: I have been to Disney World at least 10 times and have stayed at almost every Disney/Downtown Disney resort. The Port Orleans RIVERSIDE has many buildings and even the staff was unable to find our building as we tramped around on the golf cart. After day one my brother and I (seperate rooms) both had bites on our ankles and legs--while waiting for our Disney bus I struck up a conversation with another guest as she was complaining about her legs itching and was wearing shorts--I could see she also had bites--I told her to take pictures-- I am not sure of the year stated above--but just a FYI. Hotel recleaned our rooms and DENIED the bugs--I have work in health care (30 years experience) and have seen it ALL from the emergency center. Food is was good, location excellent, staff very friendly and helpful. I have never returned to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place”
Reviews.Author: Kimmy06
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stopped at the Port Orleans Riverside Hotel and had the most amazing holiday. We found the whole resort to be a very clean calm and relaxing place to be. Our room was just a standard room but was quite spacious and cleaned every day throughout our 10 day holiday. We chose to go to the quieter of the two pools as we don't have children and this was very peaceful. The staff on the resort were all very helpful and accommodating. We never ate in the restaurant but we used the food court on a regular basis and never had a bad meal. If this hotel was in Europe it would def get a 4 star rating. If you are going to Walt Disney world I would recommend you stay in a Disney hotel as I feel this just adds to the whole experience, there really is no happier place than Disney world. If you can afford to splash out al ittle I would recommend an evening at Victoria & Alberts the food was out of this world.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised by gorgeous landscaping”
Reviews.Author: NapandNat
Reviews.Content: My expectations were not high before our arrival, based on mixed reviews and the "moderate" categorization of the resort. However, the Riverside Resort surprised us with its beautiful scenery and landscaping, and wonderful service we've all come to expect from Disney cast members. While the room was not the fanciest I've ever seen, it was just fine for my wife and myself. A king sized bed would have been nice, but I realize that's difficult to come by in a resort geared toward families. The room did have clean bathrooms and comfortable beds, as well as a refrigerator, safe, and coffee machine. Linens and towels were plentiful for the two of us, and the beds, while not fancy, were comfortable. The grounds of the Riverside Resort are what blew me away. It was wonderful to come back from a long day at the hectic theme parks to the quiet, scenic, and beautiful resort. It seemed like we were in another state during another time, and not just a few miles down the road. The waterways, pools, foliage, and architecture provided a photogenic spot in any direction I looked, and romantic strolls along the paved walkway were easily had. I saw many other couples there as well, young and old (we're in between!), so it was clear that this was not a resort for families only. The food in the restaurant was okay, and priced reasonably. The gift shop had a large variety of souvenirs as well as bathroom necessities, snacks, and medications. The staff in the lobby and luggage areas was terrific, and the bellhops went above and beyond their duties in making sure my wife and I received our luggage as soon as possible, following a flight delay. "Matt" in the luggage area quickly informed us when our bags arrived and personally delivered them on a tram to our room so that we could change clothes and get to the parks. If you enjoy scenic strolls, and a relaxed Old-South atmosphere with some peace and quiet, then this is the resort for you. My wife and I will likely stay there again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Trip, Very Busy!”
Reviews.Author: erikakayd
Reviews.Content: We were very happy to be able to spend a week at Port Orleans Riverside. We were able to book through a friend who is a castmember for Disney, so we received a discounted rate. That was a huge money saver for us, as we soon realized, as always, that Disney World is also known as "Spend Lots of Money World." This was my 6th trip to Disney, first to Riverside. The resort was beautiful- had beautiful grounds and there were always people powerwashing and groundskeeping to make everything look nice. The rooms were moderately nice. I have stayed at the value resorts twice and Riverwide was a step up- but not a huge one. I think I was expecting a little more elegance for the stated 185 per night rate. Everything was very clean. We had our little towel animals upon arrival. Did not receive anymore through the duration of our stay, but we are both adults with no children so they probably thought we didn't need them :) Housekeeping was kind and considerate each day, as we both slept in until 10. They always did a great job. The fridge was a very nice size and was a convenience to us. The bed was comfortable- we got a king room. Sinks and bath were both nice and worked just fine! The food court was always extremely busy in the AM, until around noon. For lunch and supper it was usually pretty vacant. There were many crabby patrons- kids and adults included. The food court staff were also more crabby than I remember Disney staff being, but we found that throughout our entire Disney experience. I no longer say that Disney World is the happiest place on earth- times are changing I guess. The food was alright- not many choices but that is to be expected. I'm guessing most of the moderate and value resort food courts are the same with choices. The resort is very large but manageable if you are ok with walking. We stayed in the Acadian house and it was about a 3 minute walk to the food court. We had a nice and quiet pool right next to our house, but the walk to the busier pool was about 3 minutes as well. If you have kids- bring your strollers! Transportation was alright as Disney transport goes. We did not use Magical Express but we did use the buses and the boats to get to various parks. Never had to wait very long but the rides themselves seem to take forever. We were glad to have a rental car for those times that we didn't want to sit on the bus. Riverside is also slightly further away than the deluxe resorts, so transport time is longer. Overall, Riverside was a fine resort. We will not stay there again though. I will probably save the money for next time and stay at a Deluxe- We went to two of them to eat while we were there- Animal Kingdom Lodge looks FANTASTIC!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay had by all”
Reviews.Author: Gspud2000
Reviews.Content: We booked a 12 night stay at Port Orleans Riverside through Expedia. Arrived at Orlando International at about 5pm (flying Virgin) and collected luggage. Walked a few yards through the exit doors and the luggage was taken off us for delivery to the hotel, as all guests at this property qualify for the Disney Magical Express Service. We were directed to the basement level of the terminal where after a brief check of our tickets we were put on a free coach to the hotel. This took about 25 minutes journey time. On arrival at the hotel, check-in was very fast, you are given the option to leave a credit card to be able to charge anything you purchase(at any Disney Park/Resort) to your room, but this is optional. The rooms are very spread out over the resort, we were allocated a room in the Alligator Bayou section - about 5 mins walk from the lobby area. The room was more than adequate in size, very clean and tastefully decorated. There was a refrigerator in the room, and a wall safe although this was on the small side and not suitable for large cameras or laptops. The room was serviced daily, usually with a small surprise left for the kids. The only thing that caused a small annoyance was when we needed internet access. The rooms have a wired connection available at $9-95 per day, however we were having problems connecting, which took 2 days for their tech team to resolve and apparently they do not allow guests to access their Wi-fi at the lobby area. The resort seems very quiet and peaceful despite the large numbers of guests staying there. There was no smoking in any rooms and smoking was only permitted in designated areas however these are reasonably spread over the resort and within a short walk from any room. The main pool area has hot-tubs and a bar area serving drinks and snacks, and life-guards on duty. There are also smaller pools dotted about the resort, these have no-one on duty and tend to be almost deserted, however perfect for a relaxing, undisturbed swim. We were not on any dining plan and purchased a few meals and snacks from the food court, the food there is rather basic fare and pretty much what you'd get at any shopping mall food court. Most meals cost less than $8 and much less for children. One thing that was great value was the refillable drink cups that we purchased on arrival at the food court. They cost about $12 each but can be refilled from the drinks station as often as you wish during your stay and do save a lot of money in the long run. There was also a large gift shop at the hotel selling souvenirs and basic food items at a reasonable price. We had a ten day Disney Park ticket and used the free hotel shuttle service every day. I could not fault this service - the buses ran to all the Disney Parks every 20 mins and also to Downtown Disney. There were 3 bus stops servicing this resort and the maximum we had to wait was about 15 minutes. They did not stop at any other resort and we were at the park gates within 15 minutes. They also run a free boat shuttle to/from Downtown Disney until 11-30 at night. The park shuttles ran til an hour after park closing and continued to run during the extra magic hours available to Disney Resort guests. On return to the airport, a phone call to bell services got the luggage collected, and again a courtesy coach provided travel to the airport. Unfortunately security was extremely tight at Orlando International and there was not a great deal of time after check-in and security clearance, so make sure you don't miss the coach!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not business friendly”
Reviews.Author: travelstork
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference from 3/4/08 to 3/8/08. The conference was held in a different Disney hotel. All of the rooms were sold out months in advance and we were instructed Port Orleans Riverside was the alternative. This was not a problem due to the conference arranged direct transportation to and from the conference hotel. The problem started when you needed to do ANY business. One examaple was I tried to ship some documents and was instructed "the front desk could accommodate any of my needs" by the hotel staff. But upon bringing my documents to the front desk I was instructed to go into the gift shop and ask for a box. I then was given a large Desani water bottle box to ship my documents. (The box has vent holes and was taped on the bottom with masking tape and had obviously been wet at some time in the past and was much too large for my documents I needed to send.) I was then told that the front desk would have newspaper to pack the box with. I asked the woman at the gift shop whether she could ship the documents due to she was packing up several things and shipping them directly from the gift shop. She said, "we can only ship Disney merchandise." I then went back up to the front desk with my unraveled box. The front desk staff said, "well, that won't work!â€� I agreed and asked if there was anything different. The front desk said, "Well, you will have to go back to the gift shop and ask her for something else." I then decided I would take my shuttle back over to the other hotel where the conference was being held and they promptly shipped the package. Bottom line - I don't understand why it is so difficult for one Disney resort and not for another. The next thing is the overall room rating. Pretty poor. The room was dirty upon arrival. I called to ask it be cleaned. I came back four hours later and the room had been "made" but not cleaned. There were urine drops on tile floor near the toilet and hair on the floor that remained there my entire stay. Besides this - the transport to and from the parks and other hotels is very easy and useful. Another tip would be to bring an umbrella even if you think the weather is supposed to be good. The rain doesn't last long, but can catch you off guard.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Surroundings, OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jbridge
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive to stay at Port Orleans Riverside because I have stayed at the Grand Floridian on previous visits to Disney World and thought it was fairly standard. The grounds around Port Orleans Riverside are really the best part of the resort. The grounds are really beautiful and well taken care of. I was not disappointed by the general atmosphere of the lobby, gift shop and pool either. The staff at our check in was very friendly and helpful. The dining room of fast food service restaurant was a little bit grimy. The food was not great either. The room, however was the most disappointing part of the whole experience. The room was smaller than expected and I was expecting it to be small. The room smelled fresh and appeared clean but there were a few stains on the carpet and the bathroom floor tile although swept, did not look clean. After the first day our cleaning person stopped leaving clean cups and became very lax about cleaning the room. We had pizza in the room our first night and snack just about every other night and the same crumbs remained on the floor for the entire time we were there. Also, the air conditioner did not work well. It would only run for about thirty minutes at a time. Luckily it was not very hot but it still made the room uncomfortable at times. Final analysis is that although the resort grounds and amenities are nice, the room is lacking enough so that next time we go to Disney World we will look into Hotels off the Disney World property. For what they charge, I am not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and they didn't care!!!”
Reviews.Author: CanandaiguaTraveler
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at Port Orleans Riverside in Bdg 25. We had a Grand Gathering with 17 people. Our room was very run down and dirty. When we arrived I asked for some additional pillows. The pillows arrived in a plastic bag with the pillow cases next to them. Not the Disney Experiance I expected. The room carpet was torn. The bath tub had mold on the walls. The bathroom ceiling had a red stain on it. The showerhead had some sort of orange buildup all over it. The sheets did not fit the bed. One of the bedframes was cracked and made noise everytime the kids rolled over. The ironing board pad was black! On day 2 the maid never changed the ice bag and left it full of water. They also never swept the floor. I know this because I dropped a small plactic pice of a braclett on the floor late the night before. This little piece of plastic stayed on the floor, in clear view, for 4 straight days. I thought it was a simple oversignt. The next day I left it on the sink with the ripped bag. The bag was gone without a replacement and the floor was not swept. That night I called the front desk to speak with a manager about the issues. I was told that no manager was available. The lady that answered the phone took all of my information and said she would take care of it. Next day no change. Called the desk for a manager again and got to speak with Ann (Anna?) who stated she was the manager on duty. She appoligized up one side and down the other and promised the room would be cleaned and the problems corrected. Guess what, next day the problems were still there (and of course no ice bag which is now a shopping bag full of water). I called and asked for a manager and again was told that no manager was available. I was transfered to housekeeping. I requested to speak with the resort manager. After a 10 minute wait I was put into his voicemail. I left a very detailed message about the ongoing problems. Within a couple of hours I had a return call and someone coming to "check" on my room. The resort manager, Mr Mario Ferno, called at 8:01 a.m. on day 6 of our vacation and promised to "make things right" and that there would be "something for me" at checkout. He also promised to have the room cleaned. On the night of our last stay the housekeeping staff arrived to clean the room as we were trying to get ready for dinner. They cleaned the stained ceiling and showerhead, removed some of the mold in the bathtub, swept, and replaced the ironing board cover, and yes, they finally gave me a plastic bag for the ice. Too little, too late. Disneyworld is a wonderful place and an incredible experience. Unfortunately the Port Orleans Riverside was not. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great time at Riverside!”
Reviews.Author: Stacelet
Reviews.Content: I am a regular Disney guest and this was my 3rd time at Port Orleans Riverside. Overall I love this resort! It is beautifully maintained and the way it is spread out makes it never feel crowded. The rooms are fairly average but nice. On this particular trip my mom & I were traveling together and requested connecting rooms. While Disney will not guarantee this (they told me priority is actually given to families with young children) we had no trouble with getting our request. We were put in building 17 in the Alligator Bayou. My mom has a fear of bugs, lizards, alligators and other Florida "creepy crawlies" and she said if we had to do it over she would have requested the Mansions at Magnolia Bend or else stayed at the French Quarter. She felt that even though is was maintained, there was a little too much "foliage" and it was not all that well lit at night. (I did not think it was bad, but I thought I would mention this in case others are not much for the "wooded" atmosphere) As many other reviewers have mentioned, this resort is BIG. Expect to walk a LOT. We are in better than average shape (I was actually at Disney for the marathon weekend) and still found the walking to be a bit much at the end of a long day on your feet (or after running a half marathon!). However, I still think I would choose this over noise which is minimal because of the way it is spread out. Just don't choose this resort if you have physical limitations that make walking difficult. (Or at least make sure to stress to reservations the need to be in a close building!) The food court is very nice with a decent selection (for Disney). I know they renovated this area about a year ago and they did a nice job. We had no troubles with the Disney buses. Our only transportation issues were with the special marathon weekend buses. None of the Disney employees knew a thing about this and repeatedly gave me wrong information about bus time and locations to get to the race expo. Even the concierge seemed to know nothing about the marathon weekend even though at least half the guests at the resort seemed to be there specifically for that. That was our biggest gripe with the actual resort staff. Other than that they were great from check-in, mouse-keeping and bell services. It is a wonderful convenience to be able to check in your bags for your return flight at the resort! Overall it was another great visit to Riverside. I will definitely stay there again, though I might try the French Quarter if I go back for marathon weekend (less walking!). The one major advantage I see with Riverside over French Quarter are the "quiet pools." There are something like 6-7 smaller pools throughout the resort that do not get nearly as busy as the main building. We used our nearest "quiet pool" several times and at the most there were 4-5 other people at any given time. One other great thing about Port Orleans is the boat to downtown Disney. Definitely take it at least once during your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: mardia
Reviews.Content: I had originally booked our stay at the Port Orleans French Quarter, but after finding out that the resort's pool would be closed during our visit, changed our reservation to the Riverside. I received a letter stipulating that the pool was closed one week after returning home. As there were 6 of us, I booked 2 rooms and requested connecting rooms, and also requested a room not too far from the main dining area in the Alligator Bayou section, unfortunately our request was not honoured. The rooms were next to each other but not adjoining and were located in the Magnolia building - rooms 8925 and 8926. The rooms were fine, although you could definitely see the wear and tear. The location was okay, but I would definitely pay the extra $15 and get a view room. Although we did not have a view of the parking lot, the room was right beside two very large air conditioners, which you couldn't hear in the room, but sounded like airplanes taking off as soom as you opened the door. Mousekeeping did clean the room nice, and although we tipped every day, we never did get a towel animal, which my grandson looked for everyday. As per staying at a Disney Resort due to the perks is absolutely true. The Disney Express at the airport was hassle free; there was a Disney agent waiting at the airport giving directions to the loading area. Check in was absolutely hassle free. I must rave about the Disney transportation - absolutely wonderful throughout our entire stay - very seldom did we wait more than 10 minutes. The boat ride from the Riverside to Downtown Disney was always fun and quick - 20 minutes. We bought the refillable mugs - it's a must do! Great for soft drinks and coffee - for an 8 day stay we really saved a lot of money. As for the food court at the Riverside, I must say it was just okay. Most of the time the food was okay, but most of the time the food was cold. Never ate at Boatwrights, but heard it was good. This was our first visit to Disney World and we absolutely loved it. The parks were great and we absolutely loved Downtown Disney. As for the staying at the Riverside Resort, the visit was good but not excellent. We had a few hours to scour the resort before our vacation was over, so we took a trek over to the French Quarter. We had lunch at the food court there, far better than the Riverside and not as spread out. We would love to go back to Disney World and stay at a Disney World Resort, but would probably not stay at the POR. Would either stay at the French Quarter, with a water view, or try a value resort, as we spent so little time at the resort anyways.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: kferrell
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 5 night stay at the Port Orleans Riverside. First, I will start with the positives. The grounds are very nice with lots of lush vegetation, the pool is great for kids with the slide and some of the life guards even played games with the kids, the quiet pools were warm and for the most part quiet, there is plenty to do with the pools, arcade, bikes, walks, etc. The food was decent and there is a good variety. Boatwrights is ok in my opinon but I am not a very big fan of southern style food. Now for the reasons the hotel was just average. The rooms were not that clean. The shelf in our room, which the top was clearly visible, was very, very dusty. The same knat was on the shower wall our whole visit, the top of the moulding in the bathroom was extremely dirty with dust and hair that was not ours. When I we were gathering things up I checked under the bed skirts to see if we had forgotten anything and there were pens, a luggage lock and trash, none of which we had. Also, we were looking forward to seeing the animals made from towels and we had non drung our stay from housekeeping, I guess you have to tip to get those. The rooms are in need of major updating! We did not have issues with the buses, we were closest to the North Depot but I could see if you were getting a bus at the South Depot it could be a problem. The North Depot is the second stop to be picked up and only one day did we make it around to the East or South Depot, all the other days the bus was too full. All in all since we basically just slept there it was ok and the reason I gave it 3 stars, but I would not stay here again or recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat disappointed”
Reviews.Author: pigi
Reviews.Content: We visit Disney World about every 4 years, just enough of a time lag to be able to partake in some new experiences in the parks. (Loved Finding Nemo, Mt. Everest, and Soarin'.) We had stayed at the French Quarter before, but this was our first stay at Riverside. We were a little disappointed with PO Riverside. Yes, it is beautiful, as everyone agrees. We loved the gazebo and landscaping. However, our room was run down. We stayed in the Magnolia Bend section. The furniture was badly chipped, the top of the wooden beadboard in the sink area was coated with a layer of dust, the long mirror on the door was badly spotted, and the same hair in the shower area stayed there for 5 days. (It wasn't ours.) The light fixture above the bed had at least 12 long strands of dust hanging from it. Another aggravation was waiting for buses when leaving the parks. PO ALWAYS had the longest lines. The resort is so huge. I think the next time we go, we will stay at Caribbean Beach or Coronado Springs. Their lines were always shorter. I would hate to see what the lines would be like if we had gone during a peak time. I think I was able to sit down on the bus only a couple times. They were always packed. Standing was not that big of a deal, though. I am able-bodied. I don't want to cut down this resort because I did like it. Cleanliness and the bus situation were the only down-sides. The boat to Downtown Disney was a nice touch. We really didn't use the food court...just once for a small late night pizza. It was ok . Also bought a cookie once. We liked having a 'fridge for milk. We arrived at midnight. Wish we had had better directions on how to find our room. When you are tired, it is dark, and you are dragging suitcases, it gets frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “Not Happy”
Reviews.Author: IowaFuzzy
Reviews.Content: WE returned todisney port orleans (river side) my wife and i we were here 4 years ago.disney great. hotel was very subpar.dirty. beds stained . carpets stained havent been cleaned in some time. sheets were stained.bed smelled of urin (sorry) dust and dust webs in every corner. BUT WE LOVED DISNEY..the bath room was very small with mold around the tub and all over the shower curtain.we contacted the desk and ask for a different room we looked at the other room and it was just as bad so we stayed where we were. we were a 8 minute walk from the front desk had to cut through bushs to walk because of water on side walk. the service was not at all helpful for the 1800.00 dollars we spent on this trip next time we will buy a tent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: carribeancruising
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a GREAT 5 night stay at POR. We've previously stayed at this hotel in 2002 and have noticed many nice improvements. As many others have said, and as we found before, the grounds are beautiful! Very lush and green and well-maintained. It was such a calm, peaceful greeting when we returned from a day at the parks. We stayed in the Alligator Bayou section and I loved the recent renovations! The beds are framed with a faux curtain, the bed frame are branches and sticks, and the lights are designed to resemble tin lanterns. Also, since our last stay, they've added the privacy curtain in the bathroom sink area which is very helpful in the morning. The rooms are adequate size, not overly large, but not too small either. It was a bit of a walk from our room to the restaurant/registration area. I'd estimate it took us 5-10 minutes from the South depot to reach our room. If this is a concern for anyone, make sure and request something closest to the main building and avoid that walk. I've always found that WDW does a great job in trying to meet a customer's requests. After reading some of the recent reviews, I was a bit nervous about housekeeping. I can honestly say that our room was very clean and well-maintained! The only day we had a slight issue, was on the day we all slept in and didn't leave the room until noon. When we returned that evening, it was evident that the mousekeeper was more hurried as forgot some minor things. . such as replenshening the coffee supplies and cleaning the coffee pot, and the tub looked as if it was wiped quickly vs. more thoroughly. But otherwise, no stained sheets, dirty floors, cracked tiles as others have reported. The food court was adequate for a quick meal. We didn't eat breakfast there at all (had granola and breakfast bars in the room instead) but did have lunch and dinner on several occasions. There's a nice selection and the cast members were cheerful and friendly. Buses were fast and frequent. If you're going to Typhoon Lagoon via the bus, be prepared for a ride! The bus will stop at all 3 POR stops, then the FQ, then off to Old Key West, then both stops at Downtown Disney and then Typhoon lagoon. It took us 45 minutes to reach Typhoon Lagoon from our bus stop. To avoid this, hop on the boat to Downtown Disney and grab the Typhoon Lagoon bus there!! I will note that on the return, it was direct bus service and we were at the resort in 10 minutes. We thoroughly loved our magical visit to WDW and our stay at Port Orleans Riverside. I'm a person who views lodging as part of the experience vs. a place to crash and shower and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Just missed 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: meliachia
Reviews.Content: My family (5 adults and two kids - ages 3 and 4) just returned from our first trip to Disney. Lets just say I'm a convert. I always thought it was tacky and not my style (I preferred exotic travel), but everyone wanted to try it and, after all, its a must for kids. The whole place was fantastic. I loved it for a variety of reasons, but it started with our hotel. It's been said, but I'll reiterate it, the grounds of riverside are gorgeous. Meandering rivers, bridges, gorgeous flowers, herons and egrets combine to create a truly remote feeling. As for the amenities, my daughter adored the pool, and, I must say, it was pretty great. THere was a good sized slide, shallow and deep and even a kiddy pool. We also took advantage of fishing and of the horse drawn carriage ride ... fabulous. The rooms are better than average. Plenty of room and nicely appointed. We stayed in Magnolia building .... and it was very convenient to everything (although if I were at one of the more distant buildings, I think the walk would have been a bit much. We had absolutely no issues with buses and also loved taking the boat into downtown Disney. I did not give the hotel five stars for a bunch of minor reasons that combined to keep them short of the perfect score: 1. We had several issues calling down to either the front desk or other services including being hung up on, given incorrect information and being transfered incorrectly. 2. There was a tile missing from the bathroom floor. 3. Even after leaving a note for housekeeping requesting some things that they forgot to replenish (glasses and decaf) they still forgot to leave refils. 4. No towel animals 5. Bed rails delivered and then never collected (even after we called and asked them to come get them). 6. Broken air conditioning (although they did come and fix it when we called). 7. Truly over crowded food court with several SLOW employees making it worse. 8. FInally, and the worst, it took them 45 minutes to check us in (after we waited in line half an hour to get to the counter) and then we found out that they had made a mistake and did not put us all together as requested. They apologized, but were unable to remedy the situation. Even with these minor issues, the place was amazing and we loved every minute. Can't wait to return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel-loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: -JesscaD-
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the hotel with my family in 2006, i already knew what the hotel was like and had loved it. This time it was only me and my nan, who is nearly 70 and we had no car to get around so had to rely on buses and taxis. The staff at the hotel were very helpful, offering to take us to our rooms and bringing our bags up upon arrival. Then on our second day our room fan broke and someone came up to fix it right away. We did have a problem with the ironing board as we couldn't fold it back down, and so we left a note for the maid to see if she could fix it for us but when we arrived back at the room it was still up! so i would recommend not to take the ironing board down! As it was a disney hotel there were disney buses that went regularly from the hotel bus stops and there was normally at least one every ten minutes. These were extremely convenient and free of charge! Also it meant you could avoid getting the monorail or ferry to the magic kingdom as they dropped off right outside the entrance. The hotel itself was gorgeous and extremely large! So i would advise asking to be dropped at your room as you can then work out how far away you are from reception and the way to go without lugging your suitcases around aimlessly! The rooms are large enough but i would say bring your own hangers as they only provide a small amount. The hotel has two restaurants, one that is a proper restaurant with fixed meals and then a hall with a wide variety of food to suit everybody, this is where we tended to eat as it was less expensive and suited us both. There are many other things to do at the hotel, horse and carriage rides around the resort, hiring a bike, hiring a boat to go down the river, there is also a boat service that takes you to downtown disney and the port orleans french quarter resort. The transportation to anywhere not in disney was very good too. there was an office just outside reception from which you could book a taxi to wherever you wanted, the staff were friendly and sorted it out as soon as they could. All in all this hotel is a lovely place to stay as it offers everything you would need for a holiday in Orlando but only really if you're doing Disney. I would willingly go back again and again :)

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected from a Disney property”
Reviews.Author: PaulAlma
Reviews.Content: My wife, adult son, our eleven year old and myself just returned from a ten day stay at Disney World, where we stayed at the Port Orleans Resort Riverside. We were initially interested in buying a DVC time share, but after staying at the Riverside, we decided not to purchase based on how poor the two rooms at our hotel were maintained. The carpets in both rooms were severely stained, the rooms smelled musty all of the time, the walls and doors and trim were dirty and chipped, the beds were always short sheeted (and one did not have a mattress cover), glasses were never cleaned or replaced, and there was thick dust on and behind all of the furniture. As well, we could hear outside noises, banging (and partying the night of the Superbowl), until into the early morning hours. It was nice to have the convenience of staying on Disney property, given the bus and boat service to all of the parks, however at $400 a night for the two rooms, we would have gotten much better value and far superior accomodations had we stayed outside of the park. We won't be staying at any Disney property ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MONKEYNottinghamUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in port orleans riverside for the first time every this was our first disney experience so we were hoping it was going to be wonderful it wasnt i took my family on a hoilday of a lifetime and it was a holiday from hell there was me and my hubsand and my 7 year old daughter and my sister in law so there was four people altoghter and when we got to riverside and got our room it was a big shock to us we had booked a room which should of had privacy in it but it was nothing like that at all it was terrible there were 2 double beds next to each other and 1 single pull out bed underneath one of the beds for my daughter to sleep on it was terrible the bed for my daughter was vertiaually like sleeping on the floor for her this is not how it should of been. The room was just utter rubbish whenever we wanted to plug anything in to charge like camcorders or other thngs like that we colkdnt because all of the sockets in there didnt work we told maintance and all they did was come and look at the sockets and that was it nothin else was done. The worst thing about this holiday was the food oh my god i was terrible it was the same menu everyday it was either chips chips or more chips served with burger or cheeseburger or chicken strips and the table servce restaurants were just as bad and everytime you had a table service meal you had to give them a tip which they told you to give then which my family thought was very rude. there was not alot to do on the hotel site apat from the pools that was it unless you went out each day to the diney parks on the disney buses but even the disney parks had the same food as the hotels were serving it was horrible it would no recommend this hotel to anyone and if anyone was to ask me how the hotel was i would tell them absoulete rubbish very bad

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Moderate Resort!”
Reviews.Author: BarleyJack
Reviews.Content: Just returned yesterday from a fantastic stay at Riverside! We had never stayed onsite at Disney before, and Riverside did not disappoint. This resort is HUGE mind you, so if it is in your budget I highly recommend putting up the cash for a preferred room closer to the main building. There are bus stops all around the resort (4 in total) but if you need to visit the food court or shops you may be in for a bit of a trek. Our room was in Alligator Bayou, building 37. The theming was very nice, lush vegetation, bridges, ponds and wild life everywhere. The room was quite comfortable actually. Two pedestal sinks, entertainment armoire, sitting bench, table/chairs, refrigerator and coffee maker were there; the bathroom area has neat tile work on the floor and marble accents in the tub area as well. The room also comes with a ceiling fan and overbed lights on dimmers...thought that was a great touch! Our room was cleaned daily, and we received 3 towel animals during our 7 night stay. Concierge and check in were extremely prompt and helpful, going above and beyond. Transportation was quick and easy, rarely had to wait for a bus at all, and think we only had to stand one time; not bad for Disney! Overall a great resort!

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations...Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: relic10
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in early December at Disney's Port Orleans Riverside. We had actually stayed here 10 years ago for our honeymoon when it was known as Dixie Landings and enjoyed our return visit to celebrate our anniversary and take our 2 children (ages 5 & 7) to Disney for the first time. As other reviewers have noted, the POR grounds are lovely, but large and quite spread out. There can be quite a walk for your room to the main building/dining areas...we were OK with it, but anyone with trouble getting around may be turned off by this. We stayed in the Alligator Bayou section in a room that was more than adequate for the 4 of us. Nice features to note: *trundle bed, *apartment size refrigerator, *curtain between sleeping area and sinks/vanity...really nice for travelling with children. I was a little disappointed in the cleanliness of the room, but I will be the first to say that I have high standards when it comes to that. On our first day we noticed that the soap holder in the shower was loose and actually came right off the shower wall. That was finally covered with duct tape by maintenance around the 3rd or 4th day of our stay and was not repaired until the last day. The carpets could have been cleaner as well, but again, overall this was a pleasant hotel and for the amount of time we actually spent in the room, it was more than adequate for us. Other reviewers have commented negatively on the bus transportation system from POR and while we definitely did have some wait-time, I'd estimate it was no more than 20 minutes or so and that was in leaving the parks in the evenings after closing time. Often on those evenings it was standing room only on the buses, but again, if you go into it expecting that, it really wasn't bad. The wait times in the morning to board buses to the parks was minimal. A pleasant perk of staying at POR is the river cruise that will take you to Downtown Disney. It is leisurely and was a favorite among the grownups and kids as well. The foodcourt was typical fare that you could expect, and while we only ate one meal at Boatwright's (the table service restaurant) it was also fine. We had the dining plan and used it in both places.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Riverside”
Reviews.Author: disneygeekette
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed staying at Riverside for 4 nights in January. Check-in was smooth and quick. The grounds are beautiful. We stayed in Alligator Bayou which I thought was prettier than Magnolia Bend, only because the Bayou was more lush with trees, shrubs, and landscaping; but the entire resort was lovely. Didn't use the pools, but they looked nice. Rooms aren't extremely large, but not any smaller than any other standard hotel room. Our room was clean, and housekeeping replaced our towels daily. Food Court was excellent, with a nice variety to choose from; salads, pasta, pizza, burger/fries, chicken strips, bakery (the frosted brownies were fantastic), carved beef and turkey for dinner; pancakes, french toast, waffles, made-to-order omlettes, potatoes, cereal, fruit. Food is a little pricey, especially if you have a family of more than two, but it's Disney and none of their food is what you would call cheap. We had a corner room, which was nice because it had two windows, rather than just one, and it's nice to have more light coming into the room. We've stayed at six Disney hotels, and I have to say Riverside is my favorite. I even preferred it over the Grand Floridian; GF is beautiful also, but their standard rooms aren't any larger than Riverside. I also thought GF was ridiculously expensive, unless you have alot of money to burn. Riverside also has boat transportation to and from Downtown Disney. It's about a 15-minute ride. I would highly recommend Riverside. I would gladly stay there again on our next visit to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic family place”
Reviews.Author: TSHIndiana
Reviews.Content: Our family had a great time at this Disney resort. The room was extremely comfortable. Features I appreciated were a curtain that could be pulled in the sink bathroom area to allow privacy without going into the bathroom itself. The in room refrigerator was nice too. The pool area was nice. One night it was 25 degrees but the pool was heated to 80 degrees making it fun for my teenage sons to go swimming. (Yes it was cold when they got out!) The food court was good and the guest service people helpful. If you are planning a Disney vacation, I recommend the Disney dining plan. It was very economical if you eat at the right places. All our food was great.

Reviews.Title: “Urine Saturated Bed, Hair In Ice Bucket... Nasty!!”
Reviews.Author: vanedge
Reviews.Content: We have 2 kids. One 4 and the other was turning 8 on our trip. It was our 1st trip to disney. We book 6 nights at disneys port orleans riverside in orlando for $186 a night. We had curly hair in our ice bucket, and before the morning came we found that our was soaked in dried urine the size of the whole mattress. it was through the comforter, sheets and mattress. we went to the lobby and wanted to switch hotels. they were rude and did not care. we were traumatized that we had laid in someones dried urine stained sheets. when we came home we had to go to the dr and we had to pay the bill! the stain was so big that you had to stand back by the door to see it. the people next to use sounded like they were in our room. the walls were paper thin. i asked for a upgrade for what we had been through and they said we would have to pay the difference. we just wanted to sleep in clean sheets!! this is the memory of my kids 1st disney trip & my daughters 8th birthday. we got a new room at 3 pm, lost most of the day of our tickets & meal plan. we were sent to carribean beach resort which was just a bad-- yep, they had bed bugs!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at Port Orleans”
Reviews.Author: mateo1380
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many Disney hotels so far, and Port Orleans Riverside is our favorite. My boyfriend and I stayed here for the first time the week before Christmas. Check-in was much better than at other Disney hotels as all our requests were given to us without even asking again. Our room also was ready at noon which was great so that we could relax before going to the park. We stayed in Alligator Bayou Building 14. This seemed to be the closest building to the main building: about a two minute walk. It was also close to the main bus depot. While the buses were more crowded than at Coronado Springs, we didn't wait long any day and only had to stand up twice the entire week. It was also close to every park, only about a ten minute ride to each, except Animal Kingdom which took longer. The food court was good, room was clean and comfortable, the grounds were amazing, and the Christmas decorations were great. Our favorite part of the hotel was taking the boat to Downtown Disney. If we stay again, we might try the horse-drawn carriage rides they offer around the property. We will be back to Port Orleans Riverside on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with Port Orleans Riverside”
Reviews.Author: clamc40
Reviews.Content: We are not regulars of Walt Disney World - this being our first and only time we were visiting. For that reason, though, we put a lot of research into selecting a property and we're glad we settled on Port Orleans Riverside. We were there Jan.1 - Jan. 6, 2008. Check in was smooth as silk - we arrived around 4:00 pm and were checked in immediately. We were put in Acadian House (part of the "mansions" section). It was a very pleasant and pretty - and quite relaxing - walk from our room through the courtyard, over a lovely bridge, past the amusing main pool, over another scenic bridge to the main food area. It sounds long but the walk was really only about 5 minutes at a stroll and we enjoyed it each time. I can only imagine how pretty it must be when the flowers are in bloom! Our room was actually more spacious than I expected - there was plenty of room for my family of 4 (kids aged 8 and 11). We did not feel crowded at all. While it is obvious that the room is old and in need of freshening up, it didn't bother us at all. We were only in our rooms long enough to sleep, that's it. We didn't notice anything terribly wrong with the room other than perhaps it looked tired, but nothing that stood out as terrible. The beds felt comfortable to us and the linens were just fine! It was very quiet in a our room, too - we were not disturbed at all by any other guests. It was nice to have rooms opening to the outside vs. to an inside hallway. It was too cool (there was a weird cold snap hitting Florida when we were there) to swim other than the last day we were there - but my boys certainly enjoyed the pool that day. The water was heated quite nicely. I just found this was a very pretty resort and I really liked the fact that it didn't scream "Disney". I felt like I was somewhere other than Disneyworld, in fact! The area where the boat docks and that leads into the food court and the whole area around the river with the bridges is quite scenic. We did take the boat to Downtown Disney one evening and that was relaxing and peaceful and enjoyable - highly recommended (we were pretty much alone on the boat, due to either weather or time of year). We ate at the Riverside Mill for breakfast and we were very happy with the variety and selection for breakfast. I especially liked the yogurt/oatmeal bar - great idea! We did eat there one night for supper and again, there was enough selection and variety to please us all. We won't go back to Disneyworld because we had decided once was enough for our family, but I'm totally satisfied that on our one trip we selected Port Orleans Riverside. I am sure I would have been even happier if the weather had cooperated! We did take the Disney bus a few times (we were closest to the North Depot) and did not experience any problems at all. I'd absolutely recommend Port Orleans Riverside to my friends without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Sweet!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2025
Reviews.Content: This Hotel Is Very Nice. The Rooms Are Small, Yet Very Comfortable. The Mattresses Were Top - Notch, And I Would Sleep Comfortably Throughout The Night On Them. The Lobby Of This Hotel Is Amazing. There Is A Shop In The Lobby That Carries The Basics : Food, Gifts, And If You Have A Small Child, Diapers. There Is Also A Large Arcade Located In The Back Of The Lobby. Good If You Have Tweens Or Teenagers. The Food Court Was Amazing Too. There Are Many Food Booths, Like For Pizza, Desserts, Breakfast, And Many More. The Landscaping Was Very Beautiful, Too. If You Like To Walk, There Is A Path That Goes Along The Creek Next To The Resort. There Is Also A Boat Stop At The Resort, And The Boat Will Go Down The Creek To Downtown Disney. There Were Two Tiny Problems, Though. First, The Buildings Don't Have Elevators. Just Stairs. So, The Resort Offers A Service That Carries Your Luggage To Your Room. But If You Arrive Late At Night, Like We Did, The Luggage Will Come Around 1:00 AM. My Mom Requested The Luggage Be Brought Up In The Morning, And The Staff Said Yes, But Instead, My Dad Had To Leave The Room At 2:00 AM In His P.J.'s , To Retrieve Our Luggage, Which Was, For Some Reason, Sitting Outside Our Room. The Staff Was Very Helpful And Friendly In All Other Cases, Though. I Also Spotted A Bug In The Bathroom, But Hey, That's Florida. I Would Recommend This Hotel To Anybody, I Really Enjoyed My Stay Here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Disney Vacation”
Reviews.Author: davidandnealia
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in several Disney resorts over the years and have had good experiences in all of them, BUT Riverside was by far the best experience we have had on Disney property. The check in went without a hitch, the food was great, rooms were very clean when we arrived and housekeeping kept it that way during our stay. My wife, myself, two grown children, and grandson had the time of our lives. My son had to fly out of Orlando to return to graduate school in New York, and all of his plane preparations, checked baggage and shuttle to the airport were taken care of for him at the resort. When we return to Disney, we are already planning to return to Riverside. It was pleasant and overall, perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: CP1MiltonKeynes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside for 2 weeks at Christmas and New Year and loved it. The arrival was fine and there was only a slight wait at check in. We were given our room keys and a map to our room; it was all very straight forward and easy. We were in Magnolia Terrace. This was across the river from the main reception and food areas. We had hired a car and it was a short drive to the car park, with plenty of space to park. Our room was on the south side of the building and had a nice outlook. The room was clean and in a good state of dÃ©cor. We had no problems during our stay with the cleaning standard. Try and avoid the rooms near the car park, all the cars beep when they are locked which might be audible from those rooms. The ground of the resort are really nice and there is a relaxed quiet feel to the place even during the busy â€˜holiday seasonâ€™. It didn't feel like a massive resort, where we were, in terms of the number of guests we came across. Magnolia Terrace was only a short walk ( couple of minutes) to the main building over a bridge. The main pool was half way between the two. There were also quiet pools located around the resort which were relaxing places to go. There are two food outlets, Riverside Mill which is a food court and the Boatwrightâ€™s Dining Room. Both good places to go for something to eat. The food hall has a range of food and any queue moved quickly. There is a free boat shuttle that takes you to downtown Disney which is a nice bonus. It takes about 15m and is a pleasant trip. You can also walk to the neighbouring French Quarter and use their facilities if you wish. You can park your car in any of the other resorts or in the theme parks for free when staying at any Disney property. A car is also useful to get to Florida Mall and all the other outlet shopping places, as well as the other theme parks nearby. All the staff were very helpful and polite; this was also the case around the theme parks too. As it was the high season there were plenty of people about in the parks, New Years Eve in the Magic Kingdom was jam packed but we still got a great place to see the New Year fireworks which were excellent. Overall a great holiday and we would go back to the Port Orleans Riverside.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel we have ever stayed in on disney”
Reviews.Author: bebop08
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great ! The transport to the parks were very reliable. the rooms were great and spacious they were cleaned daily with new sheets also the mini bar was stocked everyday. I would reccomened this hotel to anyone with children. It is great for families. John crowther ferryhill

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: happyone62
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from a week spent at the Disney's Port Orleans Riverside with my daughter and my sister. I can not say enough about the whole experience! We were greeted warmly by the Cast Members (Hotel Employees) and we were treated as if we were really guests in their home. Our room, although not as close to the reception area as I had originally wanted, was in a perfect area. We had been upgraded to a garden view and the view did more than live up to its name. We were pleasantly surprised by the landscaping, which was lovely and we were even greeted by a small frog on the way to our room. The room was spacious for its size and the decor was very homey. We so appreciated the curtain between the bedroom and sink areas, which allowed extra privacy for our group. The in-room coffee maker was also a very much appreciated amenity. I also think we had the best room care! Each day when we got back to our room there were bows made out of the bathmat and towels and one day we came back to find a peacock, that was just adorable! Our room was also situated fairly convenient to one of the Disney bus stops. We also took advantage of the on-property restaurant, Boatwrights. The Cast Member that was our server was exceptional. She was not only very helpful when it came to helping my (very picky) daughter decide what to eat but all of her suggestions regarding the menu were right on! We also tried out the Food Court and were very pleased by the variety of selections that were available. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a great value for the money. The rooms are quiet, clean, and the staff are awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to stay again”
Reviews.Author: mattingly
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this resort two times. We have a four year old and think this is a spacious resort with a lot of benefits. It was easy to navigate to parks and downtown disney with a quaint feel. We took a horsedrawn carriage ride for only $35 for the whole family for 25 minutes. It was super. My daughter roasted smores from a campfire. The main reason we love this resort is because it's like getting two resorts for one. You can enjoy all the french quarter has to offer including their fun pool. I can't wait to stay here again. Christmas week was very busy but the staff at the resort handles it well. What a fabulous way to spend some time away from home. I have stayed at the Wilderness lodge as well and find this to be charming. But... there is something about the spacious feel of this property that would encourage me to tell any friend to take their family there. You can't beat it for the price. Go there and enjoy it all!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good 3 Star Resort”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFamilyFive
Reviews.Content: Our family enjoyed this resort over the Christmas Holidays.The room we had was fine and not too far from things, beds are small for 2 people but the trundle bed worked great for 5 year old. Pool was clean and well maintained, the waterslide lots of fun, a hit with the kids. Transportation to and from the parks to the hotel was excellent. The food in the main dining hall was quick and easy when we needed to get moving. Although I would say that the portions are over the top. Too much food for some of us. Overall this resort offers good value for the $$$. People that want or expect more should be prepared to pay for a higher level hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Flush the Toilet and Run!”
Reviews.Author: Susan1002
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Port Orleans- Riverside from Dec 14-21. To begin with I had a big problem getting a confirmation from DIsney when I sent my deposit in months ago, to the point where I had to write to the Presidents office. Guest relations then called me and sent me a hand written confiirmation with the amount that needed to be paid when I checked in. OK, so I thought that was settled. NOT! I arrived at the resort and check in took close to 45 minutes for me and there was no line. Of course they wanted to charge me more then I was supposed to pay and it was a good thing I called for the manager and showed him all of the back-up documents I had saved to prove the correct price. They also were supposed to give me a free $50 dinner card (go to mousesavers.com to find out how to get this and other freebies) but they did not have it. We finally agreed to deduct $50 from my bill. I then told them that I wanted a room close to the main lobby, food, etc. They gave me a room that they said was a 3 minute walk. Yea, it was three minutes if you are a marathon runner. It took 10 mintues to walk there and 10 minutes back to my room. I really don't want to spend that much time just to go get a cup of coffee or breakfast in the am before I go to the parks. The resort is huge and this was my major complaint. If you dont mind this then go stay there. Finding the room took another 45 minutes because even though there are some signs once you get to the block of rooms where yours is located it is very difficult to find the numbers. I had to go back to the main lobby and get someone to escort me to the room. Once in the room it was just OK. The decor was nice. However, the beds were very small. This is definitely not for someone who wants to sleep two to a bed unless you want to sleep on top of each other. Pillows were hard and so were the mattresses. As a previous reviewer mentioned there was refuse in the room under beds and other furniture from previous guests. Rooms was not cleaned very well. It was quiet until the last night when a couple moved in next door and had a huge party staying in other rooms on the floor. Everytime someone went in or out their door slammed and vibrated in my room. For anyone reading this please be consious of this and considerate of others. Now for the kicker. I don't know whether to laugh or cry. I ended up laughing because I didn't want this to ruin my vacation. When you flush the toilet it sounds like a bomb going off. You can also hear then from other rooms. The flushing was so powerful that water would come flying out of the toilet when you flushed it. One night I went to the bathroom and flushed the toilet and water shot up so high that it hit my neck. Can you believe this? The next morning I called the front desk to tell then about this and they laughed ansd transferred me to maintenance. Maintenance said they would see to it but never came and fixed it and I never got another call from anyone about it either. In the usual Disney tradition when there is a problem they cannot fix they generally just look the other way and ignore it. I didn't pay much for the room, I think around $113 a night because I am a yearly passholder and got a good rate but I would not pay much more then this.

Reviews.Title: “Disney is Great”
Reviews.Author: Leannek
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing the workers and people were Great. I truly enjoyed the food and the pools and giftshops were grate. I also has beautiful landscaping and decor

Reviews.Title: “A bit if the Bayou - all of the best parts”
Reviews.Author: Columbus_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Last year we had a bad experience at one of Disney World's "Luxury" resorts, so it was with a little trepidation that we booked another Disney hotel. We decided not to pay top dollar and went for one of the moderate resorts. We shouldn't have worried. Started with the Disney Magical Express. This one feature almost makes it worth the stay on property. We made it quickly through the airport even though we had 5 sub-10 kids with us. The lines went quickly and we were on our bus in under 15 minutes. The busses were immaculate and very comfortable. Our luggage arrived later that evening with no problems. On arrival at the hotel I was prepared for battle. I had researched the hotel and, because of last years bad experience, knew what to ask for in a room. Using the Unofficial Guide to Disney World (the best $20 you can spend in preparation for Disney) I asked for a room in building 18. I was offered a room there but told that my friends with their three kids would be in a different area, as opposed to being in adjoining rooms as it was in building 16. The desk clerk assured me that we had very quiet, nice rooms so we took the building 16 rooms with the threat that we would be right back in all was not perfect. He could not have been more right. Even though we were only about 50 feet from one of the small pools it was quiet all of the time. The lush, tropical landscaping kills the noise in this property. Building 16 is just a short walk to the 1st bus stop for the property, so we always got seats. The room was good sized and well set up. A $20 tio to room service ensured towel animals all week. The kids stuffed animals were creatively arranged every evening, waiting for us in the window one night, watching tv another, a fun touch for the kids. Service was wonderful. We used the concierge service several times and each time I felt like I was dealing with an old family friend. The gift shop people went WAY out of their way. One night, we bought a toy for my son that did not include batteries, which we didn't discover until we were back at the room. When I found they were out of AAA batteries at the shop (?!?) the manager found some back in the office and didn't even charge me for them. Disney level service at it's best. The food court was nice and well themed. It was busy and the flow isn't very well designed, a rarity for Disney, but the food was tasty and had a nice selection. This is a beautiful property and the staff was well trained and very personal. This is what I expected from a Disney property and really blew away the service at the pricier, animal themed hotel we stayed at last year.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: louchie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week so we could visit all the parks and take advantage of the free transport, extra hours etc. We were given 2 rooms in Acadian House, which was a nice building as it was a distance away from the main reception area so it was more peaceful and there was a small pool at the side of our building which on most days we had to ourselves. The hotel itself was nice, the room was spacious, my only critism of the room was that I felt it could have been slightly cleaner. Although the bedding, bathroom areas were clean I felt the 'unseen' areas hadn't been cleaned in weeks (maybe even months) ie tops of shelves, between beds etc. We did have a few problems with one of the rooms, we checked in and were given maps to our room, when we got to one of the rooms the key wouldn't work in the door. When we doubel checked we realised we had been given someone else's room key (as it had someone else's name on it) admitedly we should have double checked ourselves. The other problem we had was one afternoon when we came back from the parks we were in our room when a couple were trying to get in our room. The hotel had told them that their room was ours (despite the fact that we weren't leaving for another 3 days). Their key didn't work and we assume it was just a mix up when giving the number out ... We took advantage of the disney dining plan, although not sure if we would use this again as we felt by the end of the week we hadn't really got the benefit from it, as in order to make maximum savings and get value for money you should have had a starter (appetiser), main and dessert. However most days we didn't want all 3! We had breakfast in our hotel most mornings, although we did go for breakfast in one of the resturants in the swan (it was a buffet and very nice). Evening meals we went to 50's Prime Time Diner (in MGM) which was pretty nice (traditional homecooked style food - meatloaf, pot roast etc), Ohana in Polynesian, food was lovely although we felt the service could have been a little better as other tables around us kept getting more meat brought to them. I had read on this forum before that often if you were on the dining plan you didn't get as good service as staff don't usually get a tip as tip in included in price of dining plan. We also ate in Boma in the vening, myself and my husband enjoyed this. However my dad (who's not very adventorous with his food didn't really enjoy it). We also went to Cape May Buffet at The beach hotel, this was a nice meal (and very handy for walking back to epcot to view the evening fireworks). One of the nicest meals we had was at The Contemporary Hotel (the name of the resturant I can't rememeber) it was on the 15th floor, although it used 2 of our dining credits it was still well worth it. The view is amazing. We got talking to one of the waiters and he recommended going back on one of the evenings when MVMCP was on and eating then, to tie in dining with the fireworks as he said the fireworks were amazing or to go back and tell them you have already dined there and you are just wanting a drink and you can watch Â£40,000 worth of fireworks (which cost people approx Â£40 for a ticket) FREE! Which we thought was a good tip. All in all the hotel was nice and it was worth staying at a disney hotel to take advantage of extra magic hours, no extra travel etc on top. However we all said we thought other hotels looked nicer (I would like to stay at Disney Beach Club hotel, it was amazing)!!!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Vacation at Port Orleans”
Reviews.Author: toothgal
Reviews.Content: Visited Port Orleans Riverside 12-11 through 12-16 2007 and we stayed in the Parterre section of the resort room #9561. This room was on the bottom floor and it was in great location to the parking lot. About a five minute walk to the dining hall and main lobby. Traveled with husband, myself, five year old and 2 year old. Resort: The resort itself is very large as other reviews state, but it is very spread out. We did visit the FUN pool one evening and it was nice. There were towels there and a slide which my five year old enjoyed. The room was fine. We got along fine in it. We had a pack and play and still was able to manage in the room. The housekeeping did leave our door open one evening and we came back to our room with the door hatch open and we complained to housekeeping and front desk. They said they were sorry and that if we found anything missing to let them know. Thankfully we were able to account for all of our belongings. Food: We ate at Boatwrights two nights with previous reservations made. The food was very good, but if you are not on the Disney Dining Plan it would be very pricey. The Dining hall was always busy. Transportation: We rented a car and I am so glad we did. My son was persistent about riding a Disney bus so we did to Epcot one evening and it was jammed full. And we had to wait thirty minutes to catch a bus back. So for me and for you guys with kids and strollers, rent a car!!! I am so glad we did!! Summary: All in all I would stay there again.... and I would do Dining Plan again we only spent money on souveniers this time and it was much better for the wallet!!! Request a lower floor and of course when in Disney be prepared for People!!! But I must say everyone was really nice when we visited!!

Reviews.Title: “love the riverside”
Reviews.Author: mandy16
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed at port orleans riverside for the first 2 weeks of december the hotel grounds are beautiful we stayed in the mansions area the room we had was really lovely. for the first 2 days it was wonderful very nice and peaceful and then we went down to the food court for breakfast the 3rd day and what a shock the whole place was crammed full of cheerleaders and their parents which apparently is the case every year for the pop warner cheerleader contest unfortunatly they seemed to think they were the only people there now i don't mind people enjoying themselves but when there is about 50 girls cheering while you are eating it gets a bit much and the parents were no better very loud and rude. I think if the hotel is going to have them there every year they should lay down some ground rules for the benefit of other guests. As for the resort itself it is wonderful very spaced out but very pleasant to walk around the staff are all very friendly and helpful. Any other time of the year i would highly recommened it but if your planning a trip in early december i would advise you to give it a miss and stay somwhere else it's not worth the headache and the long lines in the food court.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic get away”
Reviews.Author: zambukamum
Reviews.Content: Went to Port Orleans Riverside Disney this past Monday, December 10th and just got home Friday December 14th. I recommend arriving in the AM. We left Boston at 7AM and arrived at Orlando Airport by 9:30 AM. The Magical Express bus was waiting for us, no wait at the airport. Upon arrival at our hotel, which was the one and only stop that morning, we entered the lobby, and were taken directly to the front desk. No lines, no wait. The lobby was decorated festively for the holidays, absolutely stunning. We got into our room right away, and were off for a full day at the Magic Kingdom. Our room was more than large enough, ample towels, extra pillows, coffee maker and fridge. Very clean, lots of hot water, and a very quiet AC. What ever our need was at the time, we always got our questions answered promptly and with a smile! When we came back from our days at the park, it was lovely to sit by the fireplace off the lobby, have a beverage, and have pub style food at the bar. We love the buffalo boneless chicken fingers!! It was a lovely way to end our day. We have nothing against children, (have one ourselves) but after a long day of lines, children crying, it was such a relief to sit quietly and have appetizers and drinks. The horse drawn buggies, are so romantic, and for the more athletic you can rent a surrey bicycle (but they are not allowed at the French Quarter). We took the ferry almost every night to have dinner at downtown Disney. The Ferry ride in the night time is also very romantic, and quiet. After dinner, a 25 minute ferry ride back to the resort. Who could ask for better? We have been to many disney resorts, including the luxury resorts, but this one is quiet, awesome food, romantic, and away from the hussle and bustle of being directly in Disney. Leigh and Brian Keezer

Reviews.Title: “Very nice relaxing resort with lots of wildlife”
Reviews.Author: travelagent69
Reviews.Content: My self (37), husband (53) and 15 year old niece stayed here from 25 Nov - 01 Dec 2007. I had booked a water view room almost a year in advance. Upon checking in around 9am we were assigned our room. When we got to the room, there wasn't even a pool view. I called the front desk and asked for a room change, it took some time but we were finally given a room on the second floor of the Acadian house with a view of the river. Very nice.
