This was my first stay at this moderate catagory hotel and I liked it better than the Coronado and the caribbean beach resorts. I really liked all the plants, flowers and trees around the resort , not to mention the beautiful river that winds it's way thru the resort. It made me feel like I was at home in Seattle. Our room was very clean and the only thing missing was shampoo and soap in the bathroom. One call to mousekeeping and they were brought to our room. The bathroom area was large but not much shelf space for stuff. Luckily we had a hanging toiletry bag so I just hung it from one of the hangers. It was also really nice to have a mini frige in the room to hold water and any left over snacks or food. We stayed in room 8255 and it was a short walk to the main pool, quiet pool and the food court/check in area as well as the north depot bus stop to go to the parks. The resort has all kinds of activities such as watercraft rental, horse drawn carriage rides in the evenings, the water taxi to the sister resort the Port Orleans French Quarter and Downtown Disney, a video game arcade, bike and surrey rentals, and you can even rent fishing poles and go fishing. Catch and release of course :-) We had a breakfast one morning at Boatwrights, I had eggs benedict (very good), niece had the french toast which was 3 HUGE slices of french bread baguette covered with cinnamon and sugar and hubby had the stuffed french toast which he said was very good also. Service at Boatwrights was friendly and pretty fast. We did purchase the dining plan as part of our package thru AAA. We also ate several times in the food court area and found the selections to be pretty good and the quality of the food to be pretty good. I don't think any of us completely finished our meals as the portions are very large. My fondest memory of this resort will be my encounter with some wildlife. One evening after returning from the parks. I was outside late at night just enjoying the quiet night air and I happened to look over in the bushes and there was a pretty good sized critter creeping out of the bushes. I had to do a double take before I realized I was looking at a armadillo! He walked right across the path in front of me! He didn't seem to even know I was there or he didn't care because he just went on his way. Pretty cool to see one that close up. We sure don't have them back in Seattle! We used the airport check desk at the resort and this is a really great service for guests. If you use the magic express service to return to the airport, a word to the wise....... Call bell services as soon as your bags are all packed and ready on the moring you check out and have them take your luggage to the check out area, get in line for the airline check in desk as soon as you can. There was a pretty long line when I got there and it took about an hour for me to get to the desk to check in. This desk closes at 1pm and I think this is because the connection between the resort and the airline gets cut off at that time. The cast members working this desk are at the mercy of the computer system linked to the airlines so please be patient with them. There are luggage scales right there and your luggage will be weighed before being tagged. If your luggage is over the 50 pound weight limit, it's my understanding you will not be able to use this service. I suggest buying a luggage scale and weighing your bags prior to getting in this line. We had a hand held luggage scale and it worked perfectly! Overall our experience at the Port Orleans Riverside was a wonderful one and I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a beautiful resort and great Disney service at a moderate price. This was my fifth trip to Walt Disneyworld and I've stayed at the Grand Floridian, the Coronado Springs, the Caribbean Beach Resort, the Beach Club and now the PO Riverside. The Riverside was by far my favorite moderate catagory hotel and I would stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “My second favorite moderate resort!”
Reviews.Author: srcrmcky
Reviews.Content: My favorite moderate resort is Disney's Port Orleans-French Quarter, but Riverside comes in a close second! This resort is themed with "Southern Belle Charm" while POFQ is "Mardi Gras". Riverside is relaxed with rooms themed from the bayou to cotton plantation mansions. This resort is quite large and spread out. It can also be confusing with 4 different bus stops. Our first night there, we got off the bus a stop too early and then had a hard time finding our room. There are a lot of windy paths and if you aren't careful, you can end up walking a ways. It was very quiet during our stay, which was enjoyable. We had one of the quiet pools to ourselves many afternoons. The main pool (which is very themed) was always quite busy. This resort is also located within walking distance to its sister resort-French Quarter. There is another food court as well as amazingly themed pool. The rooms are decent size and very clean. There are 2 sinks separated from the toilet/bath area. This is very helpful when getting ready in the morning! I found this resort to be very relaxing. I was not visiting during peak season, so I know that played a part. It was a great experience though!

Reviews.Title: “Fanastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: Melissaj24
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in POR on Honeymoon 31st Oct - 7th Nov and I have to say that it is a wonderful resort. We arrived in at 9pm and went to the check in unfortunately they could not find our booking which started to panic me. The girl was so nice and told us not to worry go and get a drink and something to eat and she would get it sorted out for us. Feeling a bit worried still we went down to Boatwrights and got some food. When we returned she said we had been booked into Carribean Beach Resort instead but we could stay in POR as they had rooms available. We said we wanted to stay as it was the resort we wanted. They gave us a lovely room in Magnolia Terrace only a short walk to the bus stop and just across from the quiet pool. The room was great and the maid service was excellent. It was nice coming back and seeing what animal the towels were made into. We even got a card left in our room from Cinderella & her Prince wishing us a happy Honeymoon which was a nice touch. Boatwrights and the Food Hall were both brilliant as was the gift shop. Staying in Disney has definately got its benefits the one we found most useful was the delivery service back to the resort on purchases in any of the parks especially for attraction pictures. The location of the resort was great, not too far from any of the disney parks (you could even see Illumaintions at Epcot over by the main pool) and still in a good location to travel to the non Disney Parks. Taxis were ordered for you by the Bell Staff and pick you up from the main doors. The staff were lovely as you would expect at Disney and the resort is so picturesque. We will hopefully be back to POR someday and would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful at POR!”
Reviews.Author: gatorfreud
Reviews.Content: My husband, I and two children (2 and 4) stayed at POR 11/25-30. I had requested Alligator Bayou 14 or 15, and was a bit disappointed to be in bldg. 28â€¦ however it turned out great. It was a bit of a walk to the front, but we didnâ€™t find it to be a hassle at all (although if you have mobility issues, it could be a problem). We were also right next to a quiet pool and the laundry. No pool towels at quiet pools, so grab at the main pool or take your room towels. The main pool was great funâ€¦ the kids enjoyed the slide, as well as the kiddie pool which was fun for them to jump around in (very big and warm). The pool bar was nice, and the playground was right next to the pool as well. It was an easy walk to the food court to grab a bite and bring it back to the pool to eat. There were also bike and boat rentals and a little place to fish, none of which we had time to do (but wished we did). We enjoyed the water taxi twiceâ€¦ once to go to French Quarterâ€™s pool, which the kids loved as well, especially the slide (a bit gentler than at POR). As a comparison, FQ also seemed nice and more compact (food court didnâ€™t seem to have as many choices as at POR). We also water taxi-ed to Downtown Disney. It was a fun ride for the kids, although the boat is a bit loud. Easy transportation option, and the kids think theyâ€™re on a ride! The food court was pretty good, lots of choices and pretty quick service (the last day we were there, the crowds picked up and it was a bit slower). We also did pin trading in the lobby. The arcade was pretty decent, but I like the arcades at All Star Sports and Pop Century better than this one (for little kids at least). One morning, many of the machines werenâ€™t working, but someone at the front desk got a manager on the phone and he was very apologetic and refunded the money we lost. As for bus transportation, I would walk to the front to catch a bus if I were you. We got one easily the first morning at the West Depot for AK magic hours. The next morning, we were going to MK and ended up at the main stop after breakfast, and still had to wait three buses to catch one (also, once they are full, they do not make the trip around to West, etcâ€¦). I do not know when the 1st one actually made it around. But all in all, I found the bus transport to be good. The room was pretty standard, but I liked the privacy curtain at the sink area (good for putting a small child in a pack nâ€™ play or blow-up bed behind it like an extra room). And the main room lights had dimmers which was AWESOME!!! I have never had that at any of the other 4 Disney resorts I have stayed at. The pull out trundle was great for my big kidâ€¦ a much bigger kid could probably fit as well. Refrigerator was nice to have as well. We stayed the next 4 nights of our vacation at Coronado Springs, I will post a review there as well. Overall, I liked POR, and would stay there again. I really like the â€œsouthernâ€� atmosphereâ€¦ reminds me of many trips to New Orleans. We had a great trip and hope you do too!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: brucemickey
Reviews.Content: We have just returned after spending 2 weeks at riverside (12/11-26/11) and have to say the place was fantastic. We arrived at reception with not a single person in line and checked in within 5 minutes. Our room was in oak manor, and within a few minutes walk to a bus stop, the main pool, the shops and resturants. The room was a good size ( 2 adults ) and cleaned , with fresh towels daily and the fridge was handy. The whole resort is spotless and the grounds are very well maintained. We never had to wait more than 10 minutes for a bus or boat and there is always the option of using the french quarter bus and walking to the riverside. I would not hesitate in recomending this resort to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy location but dirty, dark, small room..”
Reviews.Author: lprstn
Reviews.Content: I was very dissappointed in this hotel. The room was dark, dirty, and the bed's not as comfortable as Disney Ft. Wilderness. We were 5 people and extremely cramped. This place had a refridgerator but no microwave even. We were miserable, thank goodness we only stayed 1 night! We had a carraige ride from the resort and went over to the French Quarter pool to swim, as the desk clerk suggested. We were close to a pool, but it wasn't heated, so she told us to go to the French Quarter Pool which was heated and open.

Reviews.Title: “Disney overloaded”
Reviews.Author: tthib
Reviews.Content: A few points to keep in mind when you book your stay at Disney resorts. The Port Orleans hotels are offered in the lower priced packages. Overall I would say they are a decent value. However, the Port Orleans locations pack more people in one location and these locations seem to be furthest from the parks. The biggest disappointment was the "Magical Express" buses to the parks. We continually had to wait in long lines for the buses and they make stops at four different depots in Port Orleans going to and coming from the parks. Door to door to a park took well over 40 minutes each trip and the buses were packed. Overall, Disney has become overwhelming with lines for everything. You find yourself in a constant rush and wait cycle.

Reviews.Title: “Combination of Mark Twain and Scarlett O'Hara”
Reviews.Author: ethelmaepotter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from our twenty-fourth visit to Disneyworld and stayed, for the first time, on property, at Port Orleans Riverside. We chose this hotel because we had visited some of the resorts last year on a day that we had deemed too rainy to go to the parks, and loved the atmosphere of Riverside. Part Mississippi riverboat, part Southern plantation, this is very nearly a perfect resort for the price, but I'm afraid the secret is out: Riverside must be very crowded, for the lines for the free bus transport are always longer than those for any of the other resorts. However, we found the grounds to be practically deserted most of the time. (Probably because the resort is very large and spread-out.) The food court was usually crowded, but we never had any difficulty finding a table close to the water wheel. The lobby, store, lounge, and restaurants are beautifully designed and decorated, each in its' own unique style. My husband grumbled about the "high" prices of food in the food court, but I thought they were very reasonable. We ate all of our meals at the food court and found the food to be of a higher quality than that of mall food courts. The breakfast made-to-order omelets and Mickey-shaped waffles with strawberries were fabulous. We stayed in one of the "mansion" rooms; furnished in a simple elegance, these rooms feature two double beds or one king, an ample table and two comfortable chairs, a comfortably upholstered bench, a beautiful mirrored armoire, refrigerator hidden in a wooden cabinet, and twin pedestal sinks in the dressing area. The resort is full of amenities I would have expected to find at a higher-priced property: beautifully landscaped grounds, spectacular views, bridges over a winding river with a free boat ride (to Downtown Disney,) seven pools, hidden and very private little nooks, and romantic rentals: bicycles built for one, two, four, or more; two-or-more passenger boats, and twilight horse and carriage rides. The lobby (like most of the Disney hotels) also features a little tv area just for children, with Disney (of course!) programs constantly playing. We found the entire staff to be extremely pleasant, helpful, considerate, and, seemingly dedicated to their jobs. The only drawbacks to this hotel (or any Disney hotel) are that they do not provide free wireless internet (a hook-up will cost you $9.95 per 24-hours,) the small size of the rooms, and prices of snack and pharmacy items in the store. (Almost $4 for a two-liter Coke!) However, this IS Disney, and nobody goes expecting to find bargains. Overall, a great experience, and I would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: AZNonni
Reviews.Content: Lucky to snag Room 1839 (Alligator Bayou, 2nd floor), close enough to lobby and food court as well as to the main pool. Quiet pool close by but too chilly for my liking. A bit of a walk to the bus but got us in tune for the rest of our walking day. The grounds are so serene and took a stroll over to the Oak Manor area and could actually believe I was down south. We were a bit snug (3 adults, 2 kids - ages 5 and 3) but with so much time spent either in the parks, visiting other resorts, or on property, it worked with the young one sleeping in the trundle bed. We opted for the dining plan so meals were not an issue. I ate at Boatwright's and while the ambiance and service were very good, the food (Filet Mignon) was bit tasteless and chewy. The couple beside me had the Prime Rib and said about the same - even asked for steak sauce. Staff were VERY friendly and helpful. The boat to Downtown Disney is fascinating (w/Capt Lisa) and just a boat ride with any other captain. As much as I wanted to sample the beignets at French Quarter, I never made time (or had the appetite - we had excess Counter Service and Snack Credits up to our last hour). I would say the one upgrade to the resort would be to offer hot tubs alongside the quiet pools. Everytime I visited the main pool the hot tub was jammed with individuals both in AND around it. I look foward to returning with my husband and enjoying the ambiance the resort has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Port Orleans Riverside!”
Reviews.Author: DisneyfanBerkshire
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 have just returned from Port Orleans Riverside, having stayed 5-15th Nov. We thoroughly enjoyed the stay and would gladly return! We stayed in Magnolia Terrace, with our particular room just a short walk to the main amenities and old man island pool (which the kids loved due to the water fountains and slide!). We also had a 'quiet' pool near our room, together with a laundry room which turned out to be very convenient. If you don't like, or are unable to walk far, it's best to request a room near to the main lobby and food court - the grounds are beautiful but vast and it's easy to get lost when you first arrive! We found the staff very helpful on the whole, the maid did a good job (we were generous with the tips mind!) and the kids couldn't wait to see which animal shape the towels had been turned into when we returned from the parks! We didn't eat at Boatwrights, as the food court suited us more with the kids. Choice a little limited if you were to eat there every day but food pretty good. I'd make use of the refillable mug - really worth it in the long run. We weren't keen on hiring a car and we found the Disney transport system to be very quick and convenient, never waited longer than 10 mins for the bus - we particularly liked taking the boat to Downtown Disney. We took a taxi to Seaworld - if I remember rightly, a cab cost approx $25-$30. Bike hire was good fun and on one occasion we took an evening horse carriage ride around the grounds - well the kids had just been turned into princesses so it had to be done!! We really enjoyed our stay at Port Orleans Riverside and would highly recommended it for all ages.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Of All Disney Resort Properties!”
Reviews.Author: Taurus4554
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Contemporary, the Wilderness Lodge, and the Caribean Beach, but by far, Port Orleans Riverside (formerly Dixie Landings) has been our favorite for almost 20 years. This resort does not feel like a tourist destination unlike the other on-property resorts. It is the largest of the resorts, yet it is quiet, spread out, with beautiful recreations of the mansions of the south, and the Bayou. Unlike most hotels/motels/resort properties, when you leave your room, seeing other people around is sparce (except when you get to the lobby/restaurants/food court). Even the pools never seem crowded. With the Sassagoula River, you can walk along the side, boat, take a boat to the Downtown Disney. Boatwright's Dining is EXCELLENT, and the food court is really terrific for a budget. The cast members are helpful, and always have a smile on their faces. Most of them truly seem to enjoy their work. Sometimes, the room attendants like to play games. Many years ago when our daughter was small, she was really into stuffed animals. One day, we returned after a day full of fun at the parks to find something strange in the window. The stuffed animals that our daughter had brought with her were arranged in an adorable fashion on the window seal, waiting for their "owner" to return home. Our daughter, not to be outdone, decided to play the game with her, and each day thereafter (after adding new Disney Stuffed animals), she and the attendant played the game back and forth for 9 days. We never met her, but we will always remember someone went out of their way to make a small child truly feel welcome. EXCELLENT PLACE TO STAY! We LOVE it!

Reviews.Title: “very nice resort , a few minor issues”
Reviews.Author: Patsfan42
Reviews.Content: The resort has a very good location in Disney and is super clean. Housekeeping gets an excellent rating. Toilet flushing in the rooms is very loud for some reason. Some buildings (and there are many) require you to walk a good distance so if your not in good health or you like to return to your room often go through Disney to book and make sure you get a room close to the lobby. At check in they did not have our check in package prepared. I think this had to do with booking through Hotels.com. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: labwalkr
Reviews.Content: It was great! Would highly recommend the Riverside to anyone. We have 10 and 13 year old girls, we stayed in Oak Manor, its really close to everything, food, pools, and bus stop. Sometimes the buses where packed but its Disney! My only "gripe" is that they only have double beds, so we didn't get the best nights sleep, which is so needed after 10 hours on your feet in the parks. Take advantage of the extra magic hours, the lines are not long and its not too crowded. We stayed for 5 days, food was good in the resort and would recommend getting the dining plan and using the magically express transportation back and forth to the airport, it was a breeze! enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “First time at WDW, Port Orleans Riverside was very nice”
Reviews.Author: boyumz
Reviews.Content: I went to WDW for the first time Oct 23-30th with a friend of mine, her daughter and my teenage son. We got a great rate of $110 a night so I feel we definitely got our money's worth. We stayed in the Acadian House which had a bus stop right behind it so that was a big plus. The grounds are beautiful, it feels like you are staying at a southern plantation. But the rooms themselves are nothing to get excited over. Very typical hotel rooms, small with never enough electrical outlets. It was very difficult for three women because the bathroom area has two stand up sinks--no vanity or counterspace. We had a hard time finding room for all our "stuff". Housekeeping was just OK, nothing spectacular. Coffee supplies were not replenished. Food court was expensive and again, just OK. One way to save money is to buy a refillable cup as soon as you arrive. You are allowed unlimited free refills for the length of your stay. And if you go resort hopping, take your cup. All the resorts used the same cup so we could refill for free at Animal Kingdom, the Polynesian, etc. We dined at Boatright's one night and while it was good, it was expensive and not alot of food on your plate. $9 for a cocktail was also a little steep! The general store sells alcohol but it too is very expensive. $19 for a 325 ml bottle of Absolut. As stated in another review, there is only one hot tub for the entire resort. It does get very crowded especially for us, the parks all closed early while we were there. One thing we noticed was how incredibly friendly all the cast members were. Everyone we passed had a sincere greeting for us whether it was hotel employees, park workers or bus drivers. Gotta love that southern hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Quite Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Ninao5
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside from 10/14-10/21. We stayed in a waterview room (of the pool), with double beds, first floor, in the Alligator Bayou section (rooms beginning with number 24). We requested a room with a king size bed, but we were told it would cost an additional $30 a night. Since we were on a first floor, our view was obstructed by the plants and bushes surrounding the pool. Tip: A waterview room cost extra, if you get a room on the first floor it is not worth the extra money since your view will be obstructed. Rooms were cleaned everyday, but housekeeping had to be reminded to replenish the toiletries. Though I was on vacation, I unfortunately had to work for a couple of hours, Disney premises are not wi-fi capable and I could not use my aircard. Instead I had to rent a computer line from the hotel. Our room was located on the opposite side of the registration building. The walk around the premises and to the main building where all the restaurants and store was located was a nice leisurely stroll from our room. At night the view was beautiful. The buildings and architecture are reminiscent of New Orleans French Quarter. The main pool with the slide was always filled with families as to be expected, but the property offered four other quiet pools. The pool by the Alligator bayou rooms was always quiet, and there was always chairs available. Overall, the hotel was better than what I expected and I enjoyed my vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans Riverside in the Fall”
Reviews.Author: Jason654Blue
Reviews.Content: My wife & I & our 2 children ages 2 and 4 stayed 9 nights at POR arriving Oct. 18, 2007. We stayed in one of the "Oak Manor" mansion rooms for our first 7 nights, then relocated to the Alligator Bayou building 26 for our last two nights. The grounds are beautiful, and there are alot of things to do around the resort if you decide not to go to the parks, ie.: The "Surrey Bikes", boat rentals, horse drawn carriage rides, swimming pools, fishing hole, and ferry boat rides to French Quarter & Downtown Disney. The "mousekeeper" at our Oak Manor room pretty much just made the beds & re-supplied the Disney soaps.....and that was about it. The mousekeeper at the Alligator Bayou room was great, a very noticable difference, and more what we expect for a Disney Resort. We liked the mansion room better I think- location closer to the center of activities, transportation, food, etc. We did have one problem aside from the lackluster Oak Manor mousekeeping, and it only happened one night, but that was enough for us to ask to relocate. Our next door neighbors (two rooms next to ours) -both rooms- a bunch were all traveling together, and decided to have a big party on the front balcony/walkway of the hotel. The room walls are all very well insulated for sound, but the front of the rooms where there are windows, are not so great keeping the sound out. That night was the only problem we had with noise, the partying adjacent neighbors were very loud & obnoxious. The next morning, I spoke with one of check-in managers, & she was wonderful, understanding of the situation-( I think others must of also complained besides us). That is when they relocated us to the bayou, where it seemed there was no one else around us for the remainder of our vacation. The only other minor critism I have is that there is only one hot tub, & it is big, but very popular & crowded after a day at the parks...the only time we were able to enjoy the hot tub was in the morning one day. They could use a few more hot tubs maybe with the quiet pools. Overall we really enjoyed our stay at the Riverside Resort, and would probably stay there again in the future- but we want to try out other Disney Resorts first.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, but resigned....”
Reviews.Author: bellpup117
Reviews.Content: Coming from a Disney fanatic, this is going to feel odd. Back in February, I booked a MYW with Dining for October 21-27. We arrived in Orlando on the morning of the 21st. We used Magical Express from the airport to Riverside. Check in was smooth and they gave my boyfriend a pin since it was going to be his birthday during the week. We stayed in Acadian House, which is not too bad a walk from the building to Riverside Mill, but our room was at the furthest point in the building. The room was furnished OK. There was no overall cleanliness problem, just the whole place looked rundown. This place deserves a major rehab soon. Our bags were delivered while we were away in the parks. We had some snacks and wine delivered by wegoshop.com. I can't recommend them enough. You can shop from your preferred grocery/discount store and have it delivered directly to your room at the time of your choosing. No surprises or hidden fees. My boyfriend and I got engaged when we were down there as well. Buses were slow in coming and frequently overloaded. We were told at check in that the resort was at full capacity, yet the bus route was still shared with French Quarter. Being a former Disney resort employee, I was underwelmed by the attitude, performance, helpfullness and friendliness of the staff. Even when wearing pins announcing we had gotten engaged and it was his birthday, we didn't get any "congratulations" and only one "happy birthday". For me, it was very, very odd - not because I was expecting special treatment, but no acknowledgement was given and I found it disheartening. We used Magical Express for the return trip. Our flight was scheduled for 12:48 PM. Our Magical Express instructions told us to take the 10 AM bus. We arrived at the hotel lobby with our luggage at 8:45 AM, knowing it can take a while to check in. When we finally got to the front of the airline check in line, we were told that our luggage would not make it on our flight because we were not within the three hour window prescribed by Disney. We showed the letter which was left on our door instructing us which bus to take. We were told they could not guarantee anything and we would probably not make the bus ourselves. The next bus would be able to take us, but we may not make our flight. Fortunately, I knew enough to force the issue with the correct people and both we and our luggage made both the bus and the flight. The food court was at best average. The Disney Dining Plan was definitely worth the money. I would advise using Magical Express from the airport to Disney, especially if you want to take advantage of the facilities and parks upon arrival and do not need your luggage immediately to do so. I would not advise it for the return trip. You would be better off riding the bus, taking your luggage with you to the airport on the ME bus and checking in at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “A step above”
Reviews.Author: geogfan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a wonderful 2 nights at the Riverside while we traveled through Florida. We had previously stayed at the Carribean Beach Resort, All Star Sports, and Pop Century, the Riverside was clearly a step above these and well worth the extra money. The rooms are not big but very comfortable and clean. The atmosphere was a Southern Fishing Camp and was right on with the decor. The food was good, especially the Boatwright restaurant. We especially enjoyed the boat ride to Downtown Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Rest After A Long Day!!”
Reviews.Author: KarenEB
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the POR 10-18 to 10-25-2007.. Arrived at the hotel at 9:00 am. Checked in with no problem, requested an ajoining room with another family we were traveling with and had no problem getting it. Our room was not ready at that early time, so we gave our carry ons over to the Luggage Storage and were on our way. At 3:00 pm we had to call and see if our room was ready and they said they were shampooing the carpets and it wouldn't be ready for another 2 hours. This made me a little grumpy because we had been up since 3 am and just wanted to get back and relax. Our friends room was ready so we went to there room and tried the keys in our room and it was done. Don't know why they said another 2 hours but we had our luggage delivered probably within 1/2 hour of calling. We were in the Alligator Bayou Building 25. A walk to the main buildings, but close to the West Bus Stop and we had a quiet pool and laundry facilities right outside our room-- which was extremely nice. If going for a long time... Do not overpack... the laundry room was very nice and accessable at all hours. $2.00 per wash and $2.00 per dry-- I brought my own travel size detergent. Food was ok...nothing special but there was a large selection. Dining hall was sometimes crowded, but you could usually find a table within a few minutes. Buy the refillable mugs!!!!!! It may seem like a lot in the beginning ($13 each) but you are sure to get your monies worth. I know we made several random trips just to get a drink. The buses.... YUCK!!! Depending on what time you leave to go to the parks... you will be herded onto the bus until there is absolutely no more room for one more person. I know the drivers tried their best, but leave in plenty of time if you have a reservation. You may stop at other resorts plus all of the bus stops around the hotel. You will learn the best times to go for the buses... But be prepared for a not so great experience. We decided just to make the best of it and altered our plans as necessary. The grounds were beautiful. The kids loved the pool and the waterslide. Take the boat to and from Downtown Disney. It is a nice relaxing boat ride. Helpful hint: We traveled with our 2 kids.. 5 & 7. Before we left, I packed a small box of snacks, juice boxes & goodies to keep in the room (Rooms have refrig). With airline restrictions and having to pay for luggage or over the weight limits, I UPS'd ($10-$15) it to myself at the hotel to be there when we arrived. I packed peanut butter and jelly and you can get 2 slices of bread at the dining hall for cheap. It made for a quick snack or even a breakfast some mornings when we wanted to avoid the crowds and the lines and we ate in our room. It was nice to be able to take snacks to the parks so I could feed the kids to avoid a hunger meltdown in the lines. Overall, had a wonderful time. I would definetely recommend it and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bsjleeds
Reviews.Content: third time staying at disney we have stayed at Caribbean Beach and All Star Music but this is the best hotel yet. We had a really fabulous time and we were on th disney dining plan which was even better - but advice to anyone on it reserve your table before you travel - we had real difficulty getting into the restaurants as we didn't book them until we arrived. This hotel is vast and really really good - staff extremely friendly - We had a truely fab time. Highly recommended. Janet, Barry & Sam - West Yorkshire England.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans is Super !”
Reviews.Author: Patnmel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I & my brother and his significant other stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside Hotel October 5-6-7, 2007. When we booked we asked for adjacent or adjoining rooms, but arrived to find we were in different buildings. OK, we can deal with that ! We trudged what seemed like miles to our rooms. As we entered the room we had been assigned, we discovered the room was already occupied !! So we found a housekeeper who let us use the phone to call the front desk and they said to go back to the lobby and they would get us another room. As my husband and I were walking in the front door, my brother was walking in the back !! He had not received any room "keys". The young lady at the front desk found us another room (in the same building as my brother) so we were able to settle in fairly quickly. We got a gift sent to our room for our trouble, which I thought was very nice. Other than that, we had a great time !!! The rooms were quiet , comfortable and spotlessly clean. The Magic Kingdom pretty spectacular for Halloween !! Wow ! We had a ball !!! It was nice not to have a car and the Disney transportation system is the best. We love not having to worry about getting from Place A to Place B. Boatwright's was a great place to eat. We enjoyed the variety of food they have and everything was very tasty ! All in all, I would highly recommend this Disney property !

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: tom42n
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located with great transport if you're using the Disney parks. We didn't once need the car during our four day stay as both the Disney bus transportation system and the very convenient boat ferries took us virtually from our room's doorstep to Downtown Disney or the parks whenever we liked. The resort itself is well planned and very clean with the rooms providing plenty of space and all the necessary conveniences. We would definetly return. Well recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Review of Port Orleans Riverside and DisneyWorld”
Reviews.Author: cbrinks
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Port Orleans Oct 8-13 and booked the entire trip though the Disney website. We used the disney magical express so there was a bus to take us from the airport to the hotel and they delivered the luggage to our rooms so we did not have to wait for it at the airport. No lines at check inn at 2:30 pm however our room was not ready till 3:30pm, so we just walked around the resort and checked out the stores\food court. The room was fine for two people any more it would have been cramped. The bed was fine however the pillows were small and stiff. The room was pretty clean but far from the food court but close to a bus stop, somtimes a little noisy as it was right next to the pool. We stayed in the Aligator Bayou room 2042. Maid service was good, no issues. I highly recommend using the Disney dinning plan and make your reservations way in advance. We ate at Borights one night at the resort it was real good. Food court was also had a big selection. We also ate at Wolfgang Pucs, Spoodles, Sci-Fi Drive inn, 50's primetime, food was good everywhere, again you need to make reservations and leave your hotel at least 1.5 hours before your dinner time as the buses can take a while and the walk to the restaruant can also take a while. The hotel grounds we nice and clean, Port Orleans Riverside I would say is more for adults then children. Most of the time the room was pretty quiet, sometimes you could hear kids at the pool late at night but eventually they went to bed. Another thing to note after fireworks at night, there is a mad rush to the buses so you may be waiting up to an hour. There is also a growing trend of non-handicap (overweight-lazy) people using scooters to get around, they can hold the bus up for 20-30 min while the driver has to load their scooter on, one "handicap" man actually picked his scooter up and carried it onto the bus after making everyone wait 20 min. So always allow extra time. All in all I would recommed Riverside for adults that dont mind a little walking, again use the meal plan and make reservations and you will have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay this year!”
Reviews.Author: DawnCarlo
Reviews.Content: This Disney moderate hotel is wonderful. We were here in May with one set of grandparents and returned with the other in October. Everyone was satisfied. The grounds, albeit huge, are beautiful and after a busy morning at the Magic Kingdom are great to return to. We stayed at both sides of the hotel and loved both. The hotel has a lot to offer or we wouldn't have come back. We recommend renting a tandem bicycle with your family and spending an afternoon at the hotel's Ol Man Island pool. Very nice atmosphere at the pool. Our kids loved the slide as well as the playful lifeguards who tossed the football w/them in the pool. Boatwright's Dining Hall on premises has great food, and the Dining Plan is the only way to go. If you're hesitatant about having a rental car instead of using the bus, the car is totally worth the extra $. As a long-time Disney vacationer who has stayed many times at the three monorail hotels, I'm highly recommending the Port Orleans Riverside.

Reviews.Title: “My Husband and I lboth liked it.”
Reviews.Author: przank
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, and neat. The check in was easy and quick and the lady behind the counter was from our home town. The room (bldg. 4) was as close to the bus service as we could get. The little wash cloth decorations were cute. Plenty of towels everywhere. Pool was centrally located to all bldgs. and had a nice bar to the side of it. If you travel downtown, Use the ferry system. It is located close to stores since the main bus stop in the downtown area is under construction and you need to walk otherwise. And the ride is very romantic if you are coming home late in the evening. Our only bad experience was at check out. Disney is suppose to give you your boarding passes and tag your luggage so you can go directly to the airport. After waiting 45 min. the girl could not get into American Airlines and blamed it on them. Finally we got borading passes but no luggage tags so we had to take our luggage to the airport and wait in the line anyway. I also saw bellboys at the hotel who were stacking luggage kick and shove suitcases. DO NOT pack anything breakable as they throw these bags all over everywhere. Over all it was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Continues to Shine!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug66
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Disney's Port Orleans Riverside from September 18 to September 27. This was about the 8th time we've made this our vacation home during our last 13 visits to Disney. During this visit we stayed in Lodge 27 of Alligator Bayou. It was a nice location, offering a rather short walk to the food courts, Old Man Island swimming pools, and the main bus depot. Overall, the rooms have been slightly updated during the past couple of years, with noticeable upgrades in the bathroom and the addition of a privacy curtain near the sinks. The best upgrade is the addition of a refridgerator! Sure, it's not huge, but it still offers plenty of room for leftovers, milk and water. Overall we continue to be very pleased with this resort--which is one of the main reasons we continue to return to Riverside. At check in, our room had a few housekeeping concerns that took longer to correct than should be the norm. There were traces of leftover shaving cream on the tile at the back of the shower, lip marks from a toddler on the mirror, and two mystery spots on the tile (one of which was nearly petrified gum). My wife called housekeeping and despite being assurred we would get the "VIP Cleaning", it still took two days to correct these. My recommendation to the Housekeeping Manager would be to focus periodically on a true deep clean and dusting. Unless you're really brave, you probably should not look (or most importantly place) anything on top of the television stand, as this is a major source of dust bunnies. We traveled with our 4.5 year old and 15-month old sons. A pack and play was provided, however full-size bed sheets were the only sheets provided for the pack and play. A call to housekeeping and the matter was resolved within minutes and fitting sheets for the pack and play were provided. The rooms are quite goods sized by Disney standards. A recommendation for those traveling with small ones using a stroller would be to request a first floor room--as hauling a stroller up and down the stairs became rather tedious by the end of our vacation. The food court has been updated--offering about the same variety of food as in the past with the addition of some "flair". The food court is usually very crowded in the morning and evenings. The onsite restaurant Boatwrights offers a very nice menu, especially for those on the Disney Dining plan. One plus of Riverside is the location. Although the trips to and from the parks can be trying--especially on a crowded bus at the end of the day, the location assures you're not trapped in a bus for nearly as long as you would be if you stayed in one of the All-Star resorts. The idea of being able to take a boat from Downtown Disney at the end of the evening where most times you don't have to break a stroller down is a definite plus. Port Orleans Riverside is a gem among Disney properties.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, unlike the entertainment”
Reviews.Author: ben123015
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Port Orleans Resort Riverside in early September, and I was more than happy there. The resort is huge, along with the slightly smaller French Quarter. On arrival we were unsure on the area we had been allocated - a ground floor room in the Magnolia Terrace part of the resort, only because you can get some traffic/noisy people outside your door on a ground floor! However we needn't have worried, it was a lovely area of the resort and no-one had any trouble sleeping after busy days visiting the parks. From here it was a short walk to the lobby/food court area. When we needed a swim in the pool to cool down later in the day, we tended to use the smaller pool nearby rather than go to the main pool which tended to be very crowded at times, even late at night! The boat service to the French Quarter/Downtown Disney was excellent, and boat drivers were happy chatting away during the journey and giving a bit of info on the surroundings. Boats were pretty regular, probably around 10-15 minutes between them. Also the bus service was impressive, rarely did we have to wait any length of time - the only time we had a reasonable wait (20-25 mins) was when we were waiting at the Magic Kingdom after the fireworks, obviously a very busy time! Just a couple of warnings - the food court is very busy in the mornings! With most people getting to the parks between 9-10am, everyone was eating between 8.30-10am in my experience. You have to queue to get your food, then queue again to pay for it - this can be a bit time consuming. I did not enjoy the entertainment - Bob the Piano Player. Personally I wanted to enjoy a quiet beer in the bar, but this was impossible with the entertainer urging everyone to sing along to the most irritating songs. In the UK you can go to Butlins for such entertainment, rather than pay Disney prices to get that. We went there on a couple of occasions and it was exactly the same show. On one evening we went to the French Quarter to avoid him and instead we listened to Jazz musician Elliot Dyson, who was excellent. All in all it was a very nice resort and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Riverside!”
Reviews.Author: sunnyday12
Reviews.Content: My parents took 6 of us to Disney's Port Orleans Riverside for the week of Labor Day. Having stayed at Riverside in the past, we decided this would be a perfect place again, especially booking 3 rooms, the price is affordable. We booked a Riverview Room on the mansion side of the resort. We enjoyed our location, especially being able to walk out right to the quiet pool, but were dissappointed after one night that it was closed for renovations. However, the resort is wonderful. There are at least 6 pools on the property, a great food court, restaurant and 2 bars. The rooms are a great size with a nice setup (his/her sinks). The rooms are used frequently and are due for an update down the road, but still are in great shape. We highly recommend the Disney Dining Plan as it was truly a money saver. This was our 20+ trip back to the Disney Resort and we were really impressed with some changes that had been made including the Disney Magical Express that was fantastic, real healthy food/snack options and the Dining Plan. Disney transportation was great, especially taking the boat to Downtown Disney. If you head to Disney, Port Orleans Riverside is a great choice! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay, But Missed the Bayou Section”
Reviews.Author: Kat_Cubs_fan
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Port Orleans Riverside on Tuesday, Sept. 18th at around 12:30 P.M. We had only a short wait in the line for registration of perhaps 5 or so minutes, our check-in papers were all in order and correct, and we had keys in hand in about 10 minutes. Prior to my arrival, I had requested to be in the Alligator Bayou section in buildings #14, #15, or #16 if possible. However, upon check-in, we were informed that all 16 Bayou buildings were full of families who had 5 people. The registration cast member did try to re-check one more time about getting us in a Bayou building, but to no avail. We also had requested a ground room floor, but were again denied, due to the sheer number of rooms booked at P.O.R. for the week. The cast member informed us that over 800 rooms were â€œchecked inâ€� on Saturday, and so by Tuesday, rooms were very limited for requests (something to keep in mind for future visits). We were assigned room 8912 in the Magnolia Terrace building of the resort on the 3rd floor facing the river, but no direct water view. This room location was a much longer walk to both the food court and the parking lot than I was hoping for, but we still managed pretty well. The room was large and clean for the most part, but the mansion buildingâ€™s rooms have not been renovated in some time, so the wear-and-tear is starting to show and renovations appear to be needed. We had two very comfortable double beds, however, with good mattresses. Linens were very clean with some signs of wear, but not much. Carpet was vacuum-clean, but had seen its share of traffic over the years. The two pedestal sinks were so convenient for us, and there was a full-length shelf running the length of the sink area to place our cosmetic items on. There was a ceiling fan which helped with cooling of the room, and the A/C was very cold and worked great with no motion sensor, just an adjustable thermostat. I found no â€œblack dirtâ€� along the vents of the A/C, so I had no cleaning of that to do either. We found no residual dirt or hair in or around the bathroom or sink areas. I also loved the individual light fixtures over each bed which had dimmer switches instead of â€œflipâ€�ones. Disney has converted many of the room light bulbs to the longer-lasting, low-energy florescent bulbs, so lighting is very bright in the bathroom areas now. In the room, we had a mini-fridge, coffee pot, ironing board with iron, safe, wall-mounted hair dryer, and 27-inch remote controlled T.V. inside a large T.V. cabinet with several drawers underneath for storage. No problems with the mini-fridge this year, as it stayed cold enough to practically freeze our liquids during the week. We also had an extra pillow in the closet area, bringing the total of 5 to the room. The closet area had 11 wooden clothes hangers with a long shelf above the hanging rack. There was an additional small rack in the main room with pegs for hanging items and a short shelf. There was also a retractable â€œclothes lineâ€� in the bathtub/shower area for hanging wet items over the tub. The exhaust fan in the bathtub area was â€œmotion sensitiveâ€� and would cut on anytime you entered the bathroom area and flipped on the light. The tub had a very nice shelf section across the entire back side for your cosmetic items and there were two built-in soap dishes in the tile walls of the tub area. The tub also had a "pull up" bar for those who need a hand-hold. The shower head was an actual â€œShower Massageâ€� brand and had several water settings to choose from for water. I was also very happy to see a "recycling" bin in the room for paper, plastic bottles, and cans. We had very little actual garbage as a result. Housekeeping during our stay was excellent. Each day, we were left with 2 or 3 bars of bath soap and at least 2 bars of facial soap, along with 2 or 3 small bottles of shampoo/condition. The soaps have changed this year and are round-shaped instead of bar-shaped as in the past. We always had one to two spare rolls of toilet paper (2-ply, but rough texture). Since Carol drank coffee each morning, the coffee supplies were also replenished each day, and the coffee pot cleaned. We had one â€œtowel critterâ€� in the room when we arrived (a puppy dog), but we never received any more during our 5-night stay. I was looking forward to having a collection of them by weekâ€™s end, but it never came to be. Each day, we were left 4 bath towels, 2 hand towels, and 4 wash clothes. I left a $2 tip each day during our stay, and $5 tip on our check-out day. The area surrounding our building was brimming with greenery and, during the week, we crossed paths with rabbits, mallard ducks, and other native water birds regularly, along with countless lizards. The grounds of the entire resort were once again simply wonderful and beautiful to explore. The main pool area is large, and the regional â€œquietâ€� pools within the building complexes were also nice. There were surrey bikes rentals, horse carriage rides, boat rentals, a childrenâ€™s playground, and a fishing hole area. Our Magnolia Terrace building had a beautiful garden gazebo out front near the river. The river setting of this section of Port Orleans is a real delight for a nature lover. The main pool on Olâ€™ Man Island was very busy and noisy during our entire stay, so Carol choose to visit the quiet pool next to our mansionâ€™s building on one of our resort days. During our stay, we utilized the boat transportation service to Downtown Disney, and what a delightful ride it is. The boat ride takes about 20 minutes total, with a stop at the French Quarter section, but itâ€™s a very relaxing experience. The food court, called Riverside Mill, was excellent as well. I loved the large water wheel you could sit near and watch as you ate. While we only ate two meals at the food court, both were excellent. I had no problems using the Disney Dining Plan at the food court as everything was clearly labeled as to whether it was counter service or snack credit. We did purchase the refillable mugs for the resort, but didnâ€™t make as much use of them as I would have liked, due to the distance from our room. However, the choices for drinks were excellent. Condiments of all kinds were plentiful as well. We never had the chance to eat at Boatwrightâ€™s Dining Hall. When check-out time arrived, weâ€™d opted for the express check-out when we registered, so it was extremely fast and easy. We were leaving early in the morning around 8:00 A.M., so we had no wait at all for check-out. One thing I noticed during the week was that all varieties of the refillable mugs were being used by guests, and all were allowed. You didnâ€™t have to have the 2007 version at all, and one man we saw each morning actually had a mug from back when the resort was still called Dixie Landings. I even saw mugs from other resorts being used, but no one from Disney seemed to object. I was also somewhat disappointed that the current mugs are smaller than previous versions. I now regret not purchasing one of these mugs last year on my first trip. Price of the mugs is still $11.99 + tax, and, after visiting other resorts, it does appear that the same mug is being sold at each resort this year, rather than each having itâ€™s own version. I hope you find this review helpful and informative. If you have questions, simply reply.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: melbagals
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several of the Disney resorts, though we always come back to this one. The grounds are great for walking, jogging or biking. There are several pools to choose from, some very public and others secluded. The restaurant "The Boatright" absolutly has the best eggs benidict that I have ever tried! The service within the restaurants, desk, bar and housekeeping cannot be matched.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Resort”
Reviews.Author: mrzip
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at Disney's Port Orleans Riverside for one night, Friday, August l7th. We decided to come to Orlando one day early and only needed a hotel for one night. We arrived at the resort around 12:30 p.m via Disney's magical express. Check in went quickly. Our room wasn't ready but I was given a phone number to call periodically to check on the room status. We had lunch at the food court. I had the chicken pasta and my son had the chicken tender, fries and a sundae. My pasta was good but I didn't like the chicken in it ( it was very tough). Chicken tenders, fries and sundae were fine. I called to see if the room was ready and it was not. Actually, the room was not ready until approx. 3:45p.m. I packed a swim suit for my son for this reason so we headed over to the pool. While my son swam, I found a nice spot at the Muddy Rivers bar overlooking the pool. I really liked the set up of the bar area. I sat in a comfortable chair with a drink while watching my son in the pool. I requested a room in the AB section, bottom floor and I was given this (Building 28) Our room was located at the back of the building. There wasn't much of a view, but I liked how you got the feeling of a cabin in the woods because of all the foilage. The room was really cute. I liked how the beds were made out of timbers and the double sinks in the bathrrom area. The room appeared very clean and we had three towel animals waiting for us (adorable). The walk to the main building took between 5 and 10 minutes. I would have preferred to be closer to the main building but our location was fine for one night. The next morning we had breakfast at Boatwrights restaurant. We had an omelette (sp.) and french toast. The breakfast was large and very good. Our waitress was friendly and efficient. I would have enjoyed another day or two to check out the rest of the resort but because we were heading to Universal Sat. and returning to Wilderness Lodge on Monday we didn't have the time. Overall, I enjoyed the stay here and I would certainly consider staying longer.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: rainbwblu
Reviews.Content: We were Orlando for only one day and wanted to see Disney. We booked thru AAA for one night at Riverside. We really debated between Riverside and French Quarter. We chose Riverside because it had more things to offer such as restaurants and a bar if we wanted to visit it. We rented a car so we did not use Magical Express. We arrived around 1:30pm to find only one other person in line to check in. Check in went smoothly. Our room was 1521 at Alligator Bayou. It was a first floor room which was really nice. It was also right to a parking lot which was right next to the entrance to the resort so the location was perfect for us. The room was very clean and better than I even expected. We recieved a call about an hour after we checked in asking if we approved of our room. They left a message since we were already go to the parks! We drove to the parks instead of using their shuttles. With the parks being as empty as they were while we were there, driving was a smart option since we parked so close! We visited the foodcourt for pizza at 11:30pm. The pizza was very good. We visited the quiet pool which was a short walk away. We were there at 1am and had the place to ourselves to just relax and unwind from our busy day. The next day we wandered around the resort and found that it was very beautiful. We were sad we had to leave after only one night but will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel101
Reviews.Content: We had mixed feelings about this property. For a Disney property and what we expected from a Disney property, we were disappointed. The front desk staff was not overly helpful or friendly. The room we originally paid for was not the room we got and we had to haggle about that with them. While we realize that the property was to have the "bayou" feel to it, we did find the vegetation was very overgrown and there was a lot of trash on the ground. However, the convenience of not having to rent a car because they take you wherever you want on Disney property is fantastic! The staff at the restaurant was superb and their stuffed French toast was the best!!!!!! Take what you want from this review. We would certainly stay at a different Disney property next time.

Reviews.Title: “All in All, A Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: LorieGreenville_RI
Reviews.Content: We loved this resort! The rooms are small but very clean. We stayed in the Alligator Bayou section of the resort, which is the section I would recommend. It is close to the restaurants, pool and bus stop. We also had a trundle bed in our room, which was wonderful since we have three children. We thought the food at the restaurants was really good. We also used the Disney Magical Express transportation from the airport. It worked out great and we received our luggage just about three hours after we checked in. I would definitely, without a doubt, stay at this resort again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “5 year anniversary”
Reviews.Author: tkru
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week stay and I have to say we had a great time. We stayed at the same place for our honeymoon 5 yrs. ago and I wanted to stay at the same place again. First of all I would advise everyone to consider the dining plan. You don't have to just eat at Port Orleans, they give you a brochure that includes places in all the parks and downtown Disney. I would suggest to each at Captain Jack's. Excellant , we ate there twice. We had no problem with our room. The only thing I would suggest is to have the baggage people deliver your luggage. It helps......Our room was very clean, by the time we came back to our room around 3:00pm from the parks it was already clean. We stayed at 6755. It was far from the main location about a 5 min. walk but it wasn't that bad. Also, this time we went to Universal Studios and Sea World to receive a shuttle to both places you go to the counters across from registration. For two people around trip it was $32.00. There are many bus stops I believe 3 for Riverside I would try not to use the main one in the front of the building in the morning its very crowded. Over all it was great. I would suggest Port Orleans Riverside to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs way up for Port Orleans Riverside”
Reviews.Author: Ridgerebs
Reviews.Content: I read numerous reviews about the Riverside and the same complaints are on most of them. It is a large property. We were fortunate enough to have a closer room but of course there are several different bus depots for those out a bit farther. We only ate on the property once but it was fine. The grounds are beautiful and a nice change from the overwhelming Disney themes everywhere. We truly had an awesome time. This was our first Disney trip in nearly 20 years and I thought the service was wonderful. I'm amazed that they can make you feel special dealing with the number of people they deal with on a daily basis. Yes, I'm not a huge fan of the buses. I think it's ultimately down to your attitude. The longest wait we had was at park closing and that was probably 20 minutes. It was hot and humid but the crowds were great AFTER Labor Day weekend. I'm already planning our next 'adults only' trip to do all the things the kids were just not up for. Can't wait to go back in cooler weather.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Darrenzo1
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the end of a 2 week family Florida vacation. We absolutely loved the resort. We stayed in building 37 of the Alligator Bayou. It was a little crowded for the 5 of us, but was well designed for families and quite quiet. The privacy curtain between the main part of the room and the sinks made it possible to get ready while the kids slept. The small trundle bed was perfect for kids (although probably not larger teens). Housekeeping did a great job and left towel animals most days. It was a 7 or 8 minute walk to the main building along beautiful walkways. The main pool was large, with a waterslide. The pool by our building was well kept and less crowded. The busses were quick and the bus stop was only a 2 minute walk. Fulton's General store was large and had lots of Disney souvenirs and a limited selection of snacks and simple breakfast items. We checked in quickly at 9am and called in later to get our room number. Our flight on the last day left late and we had no trouble getting a 1 pm check out. The food court was good, reasonable, but very busy for breakfast (but quiet for the lunch we had there). We had no complaints and loved our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings!!!”
Reviews.Author: Capazools
Reviews.Content: We just got back from this hotel. I wanted to write a review while things are still fresh in mind. I have done quite a bit of traveling in my time and stayed at many different hotels. I have been to Disney before, but have never stayed in one of the Disney resorts. I was expecting more. While the grounds were beautiful and well kept at this resort, you had to walk a long distance to get to everything within the resort. The resort is huge. My husband got lost trying to find his way to our parking lot. Nothing is convienently located. They have many winding pathways all over. I was excited to see our room when we first got there because it was a "DISNEY ROOM". Some how I thought it was going to be nicer than staying in a non-Disney resort hotel. I have stayed in some MUCH nicer rooms offsite. Other than a musty gross smell when you first walked in the door, our room was small but nice. Nothing magical or fancy. It was very plain. We found a dirty pair of socks when we first walked in by the trundle bed. We did have cute soaps and shampoo in our bathroom each day with Mickey Mouse on them . The main pool was very nice. The kids and adults enjoyed it. They do provide poolside towels so you can leave yours at home. Overall it's a nice place to stay, but I was expecting more from Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Rodman355
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went for 10 days for our honeymoon staying at the Port Orleans Riverside. The rooms were very quiet and clean. If you go to Disney World I highly recommend the Disney Dining Plan. The food was fantastic and can not say enough about amount of food, Way to much but I will never complain about that. The only complaint I have is about the Disney transportation. Every park we went to on the way home there was a huge line-up to the Port Orleans resorts. Obviously this is nothing new as previous reviews suggest. One night when we were leaving the Magic Kingdom we went on the French Quarter bus, the Riverside bus was extremely lined up and no one was waiting for the FQ bus. When we arrived at the FQ the bus driver said if anyone was going to Riverside stay on the bus. 75% of the passengers stayed on the bus. I do feel bad for the drivers as they take the abuse for poor planning by Disney. Overall I recommend this resort, it was great and I look forward to returning for our 10th anniversary, If you get a chance go to the Fulton Crab House at Downtown Disney GO It wasa AWESOME!!

Reviews.Title: “NIce, but too spread out”
Reviews.Author: mrsblanco05
Reviews.Content: First, I love staying on property at Disney, There are so many benefits including the buses to the parks as well as the extra magic hours. I would and will always stay on property when we go. I did not pick Port Orleans, my friend and her family were staying, and we wanted to join them. We were in the rustic section. The rooms were clean, and the fridge was great in the room with a little one.... The resort is just too spread out for my liking. I don't think we even saw 1/2 the resort. They had many pools, but they were so small and the water felt like a bath tub.. I think next time we will try one of the other middle of the road resorts. I hear the French Quarter side is much smaller and more like a hotel atmosphere..

Reviews.Title: “Love it! Housekeeping needs to be evaluated!”
Reviews.Author: odiosa
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Port Orleans Riverside with my family. From the moment we checked in the service was wonderful. Everyone was so charming and more than willing to help! The Port Orleans Riverside property is beautiful and calm. We stayed in building 24 which was great. Our room was on the 1st floor right next to the pool and when your trying to sleep and people are screaming in the pool it isn't so great. But besides that it was a nice location. The room was actually nice and spacious. The place was pretty much clean however we did find a couple of things housekeeping didn't see. Things like someone's hair accessories and a used coffee bag.... We ate breakfast at the Boatwright's Dining Hall which was very cute casual dining. Both the food and service was good. The hotel would be a lot better if it had room service...the only room service type of thing they provide is pizza delivery not really my cup of tea. I hope to visit again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: OmniCognateNW
Reviews.Content: I am not going to cover the hotel in detail as this has been done many times by many other people. Instead I shall address some of the points raised by other and give you my views on the resort. Size Matters One of the biggest issues posted about this resort is its size and the amount of time it takes to get around it. Even one of the better known (and extremely comprehensive) Disney guides says how its staff rent bikes when staying there. All I can think is that in this modern day certain people, and possibly certain nationalities have forgotten how to use their legs. I walked around the entire inner road and it took about 10 minutes. I can not believe any room is more than 5 to 7 minutes from reception. The resort is big but it is not enormous and is certainly not so big that it will cause any but the most rotund guests problems with walking. If you are concerned about carting your luggage around they will pick it up or drop it off at your room if you ask. This resort is NOT too big as long as you have at least a vague recollection of what your legs were designed for. The only size issue I have with POR is that as some people are too lazy to walk to the main bus stop POR has 4 of them. This means you can get on a resort bus at the main reception (the south depot) and still be on the same bus 15-20 minutes later after stopping at the 3 other stops at the same resort and end up practically back where you started from. To Flush or Not to Flush (the big noise debate)â€¦ Another issue that seems to arise a lot is that of noise from other rooms, specifically the noise of the neighbours flushing their toilet. To answer the question â€œcan you hear the neighbouring rooms when they flush their toiletâ€� simply, the answer is yes you can. However, to answer it in a bit more detail, you can hear it mainly because the toilets flush with a similar noise and ferocity as aeroplane toilets, and flush for about the same amount of time. You can hear it but only just and itâ€™s hardly a big problem. I travel a lot on business and have a real issue with noisy rooms but I can confirm that these rooms are not noisy in the traditional sense i.e you can not hear the neighbours. However, I suspect the main reason you canâ€™t hear the neighbours is because itâ€™s difficult to hear anything much over the air-conditioning. Sadly POR still uses the old-fashioned â€œin-windowâ€� type aircon units rather than central air and this causes 2 problems. Firstly it isnâ€™t quiet and secondly the person in the bed nearest the aircon unit freezes at night whilst the person furthest away boils. The only time we heard noise other than of our own making (and the infamous flushing of toilets) was when the people in the room next door decided to have a loud conversation on the balcony outside our room. Cleanliness is next to Disneynessâ€¦. There have been comments about the bathrooms being dirty with mildew on the tiles and shower curtains. All I can say is that our bathroom was spotless. There was a slight stain on the carpet in the main living area but nothing unexpected for a hotel room. We did find a mini-donut under the front of the aircon unit the day we left and it wasnâ€™t ours so it must have been there for at least 17 days but on the whole the housekeeping and cleanliness were adequate. We had loads of towel animals made for us too, and the maid kept re-arranging all of my sons soft toys in the window in amusing ways. Made us laugh every time we came back to the room. On the whole the maid service was excellent and the room was certainly on a par with the better hotels I have stayed in. Spooky Lighting One of the other reports referred to the â€œspookyâ€� lighting at POR and said it reminded them of a Scooby Doo set. I find this very odd. The lighting is probably best described as â€œromanticâ€�. If you want floodlighting sleep on a football field. The lighting is minimal but very nicely done. Wildlife There is lots of wildlife at POR in the form of very friendly rabbits, ducks, egrets, tree frogs, massive butterflies and see if you can spot the otter at the fishing-hole (a real one, not a Disney animatronic). Riverside Views For some reason we were given a riverside view even though we hadnâ€™t requested (or paid) for one. However, when I say riverside view what I actually mean is tree view. You could see the river but only partially as it was blocked by a large tree. This is actually more of a problem than it sounds as the tree blocked about 80% of the light coming into the room. This means that even during the day the room was so dark we needed to have the lights on. POR or POFQ There is obviously a little bias here but we spent a fair bit of time at POFQ and although I am sure the rooms are pretty much the same I can make the following observations. The arcade is about 1/3 the size of POR as are the check-in and the food court. PRFQ has no full service restaurant. The boats, bikes etc are rented from POR so youâ€™ll have a bit of a walk or a boat ride to rent them. The grounds and the pool look distinctly shabby in comparison to POR. Also the general architecture makes POFQ look like a cheap motel rather than a nice hotel. I think if you stay at POFQ and walk up to POR you will spot a massive difference in the styles and layouts of the hotel. There is also no large dock at POFQ as there is at POR, just the doc for the boats to downtown Disney (which start at POR so are often full by the time they get to POFQ). Conclusions Port Orleans Riverside is a fantastic family hotel. You would have to be in a very bad mood or be very unlucky not to enjoy your stay there. We visited many of the other hotels whilst there, including the Grand Floridian, and found POR to be the best hotel by a long way. The food in the food court is very good but the sit-down restaurant is just ok. It is a very very nice hotel with excellent amenities and a really great place to stay. Have a great time there, we certainly did.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: funinthesun0007
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 just got back from Disney's Port Orleans Riverside and LOVED IT! The facilities of the resort were very nice, the general store was one of Disney's best, and the front lobby was helpful. The food court had 5 stations, one of them being a bakery. The sitting area of the food court was big, sometimes not big enough(it could get crowded sometimes.) We ate on the Dining Plan and found that it was way too much food! (Quick Service meals (like in the food court) you get an entree and a drink and a dessert, Table service you get a drink, an appetizer(for each person), entree, and dessert. That was too much food. Our room was clean, towel animals were made by housekeeping. The Ole Man Island pool was nice. It has a slide. no problems with transportation to and from parks, not a big deal If I had to stand sometimes. I would definately pick this hotel because with the scenery, you feel like you are at a Disney Deluxe resort.

Reviews.Title: “Good Resort, Great People, Not so Hot Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: fauddie123
Reviews.Content: We found our experience at the Disney Port Orleans resort to be a pleasurable one. Traveling with our three children (ages 1,4 and 6), we found our double Queen room in Oak Manor to be more than adequate. After spending 10-13 hours each day in near 100-degree heat at the theme parks, it was a cool and comfortable respite from the hustle and bustle around us. Even though our room was close to the pool, it seemed the walls were thick enough that we were never bothered by noise. The property itself is well-maintained with plenty of shade trees and manicured lawns. (Look out for some agressive ducks, though. Disney grounds personnel fed a group of ducks near our building every morning and the waterfowl would spend the rest of the day following guests around "begging" for food. Some may find this cute but the last thing I want is my toddler nipped by a wild duck.) There were plenty of paths for quiet strolls about the grounds. The common buildings were clean and charming. We used the Disney Dining Plan and found the quick-service restaurant on the property to be convenient and filled with tasty options. The Boatwright's Dining Hall table service restaurant on the property was seldom crowded but featured large portions of outstanding food and excellent, friendly service. The crawfish cakes are a must-try. While we did not use the main pool on Ol' Man Island at the center of the resort, the one between our bulding and the next was very clean, well-kept and often left open after hours to accommodate guests due to the heat wave. Throughout our stay, the people working at the resort catered to our every request and really took time out make sure and spoil our children. The concierge and bell hop personnel were especially accommodating. One particularly good experience for the older boys was renting a pole and using the fishing pond on the property to catch some small bass and blue-gills with which the "river" (more of a man-made canal running through the resort to PO French Quarter and Downtown Disney) was well stocked. Two areas left something to be desired, however. The Disney Magical Express and bus service to and from the theme parks was anything but Magical. We lost 2 hours of our first day at the airport waiting with hundreds of people in a space that did not feel air-conditioned for busses that seemed to only trickle in. On the way home, our driver dropped us off at entirely the wrong terminal , even though he knew what airline we wwere flying. Once we got to the resort and checked in, things went well however, until we needed to get back and forth to the theme parks. Time and again, whether coming to or going from a park and whether it was 10 AM, 2 PM, or 2 AM, we waitied in long lines for busses while people going to other resorts were picked up at least 1 1/2 times as frequently. My elderly mother and wound up on a three-hour odyssey trying to get back to her room from Blizzard Beach because of bad directions from staff and inefficient route service. It got to the point one day at EPCOT that myself and several other guests were saying we had gotten the "real New Orleans experience" and Disney must be run by FEMA becuase we waited forever in the heat for busses that would never seem to come. The only other negative was what I found when I went to retrieve my glasses that had fallen in front of the night stand one morning. While the room seemed quite clean otherwise, I found adult entertainment items and a half-eaten bag of chips under the night stand from a previous guest. This did not mesh with the rest of our stay because the room really seemed properly cleaned on a daily basis. Overall, it was a good experience at an affordable price for our family (I would liken it to a clean Holiday Inn with Embassy Suites-level customer service) and we will most likely book this resort for our next Disney vacation in two years.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: silver1ME
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a FANTASTIC experience. I went with my two teenagers (17 & 18). I was a bit hesitant to stay at Port Orleans Riverside after reading some of the reviews but boy am I glad we did. We had no problem checking in - it only took 15 - 20 minutes and our room was ready.
