We were in Building 85 in Magnolia Terrace and we loved it - perfect location. We were only a few minutes walk from the theme pool and the dining areas and only a short walk to the bus stop and the quiet pool. Yes the weather was hot.... but what else do you expect in Florida during August! We took advantage of the pools in the morning and then went off to the parks in the afternoon. We were happy with the food in the food court and extremly happy with the restaurant. We had dinner their the first night and found both the food and the service excellent (by the way we highly recommend the Disney Dining Plan and making reservation at least a month prior to your trip). The buses were great. The average wait was approx 15 minutes and the only time we found the buses full were at night when the parks were closing and everyone was going back to their rooms for the night. However, we expected that and so we were fine with it. We did take the boat a couple times. It was relaxing but we found it was abit slower than the buses. The kids rented the two man boats at the resort and had a blast. They also loved the extra evening hours at the parks. They would stay at the parks til they closed and then come back and swim at the quiet pools at 2am! They loved it. They also liked the arcade at the resort. The only negative things I can add is that their was a hole in the wall in the bathroom (where the bathroom door knob had gone thru the wall) and there were times that our room could have been cleaned abit better. However, overall..... a great stay. We had stayed at the Caribbean Beach resort a few years back and didn't really care for it. This trip we took time to tour and eat at many of the other resorts (Animal Kingdom Resort, Polynesian, The Contemporary, The Boardwalk, French Quarter). All in all, I would not hesitate at all to stay at POR again. The grounds were gorgeous, loved the laid back atmosphere. A truly Magical experience (yes even with two teenagers)!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What an experience!”
Reviews.Author: pjhorton21
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed Aug. 14-22. We arrived and were checked in within 10 minutes. The lobby is very impressive and ornate; really helps to set the mood. We stayed in Building 27 (Alligator Bayou section). The landscaping and theming are absolutely beautiful. The main pool was a big hit with the kids; as were the quiet pools interspersed throughout the buildings. We also ate at Boatright's (the upscale restaurant on premises) as well as the food court. Both were very good; the Filet Mignon at Boatright's was the best I have ever had! The transportation service was good as well. No mosquitoes to deal with was a pleasant surprise. Our building was as far away from the main building as you can get at the resort, but our family found the walk very pleasant walking along the river - it took about 5-8 minutes to get there. There is also a large general store there with almost everything you would need; we were pleased to find ear drops for our 9 year old who had developed swimmer's ear. They also rent bikes, kayaks, and boats at the resort. You can also take a boat to the French Quarter (sister resort) or to Downtown Disney; we just didn't have enough time to do that, but it looked like fun. On the last day, we were able to check our luggage in and obtain our boarding passes from the lobby - a great service that worked flawlessly. Sure beats lugging luggage around Orlando International or having to wait in line to check in. This was our first Disney World vacation and I have absolutely nothing negative to say about this resort!

Reviews.Title: “A Real Disney Treat”
Reviews.Author: satchman
Reviews.Content: I spent 8 days (Aug 10-18, 2007) At Disney's Port Orleans Riverside Hotel. I was a little reluctant to book this resort because of some of the negative comments posted. I booked it anyway and I am glad I did. First off, the food and dining was the best I have ever had at a Disney Resort. Boatwright was fantastic. The dining area where all meals are served had exceptional choices of food. Last year I stayed at the Animal Kingdom Resort. The food court at Animal Kingdom was no where near as good as Port Orleans Riverside. The Resort, as all Disney Resorts I visit was always clean. Never see any garbage! I saw a soda fall in the dining area. In 3 minutes it was cleaned up. You would never know there was a spill! The pool was great, the New Orleans feel was right on! My wife and two kids loved the hotel. We spoke with people who stayed at the French Quarter and they all felt that 'Riverside' had a better restauraunt and food court. The room we had was great. A little tight, but who cares? Especially when you spend the day at the parks. The Resort is HUGE so if you mind a little walking around to get from point A to point B, you may want to stay at the French Quarter. People who complain it is a little overpriced don't put into account the great food and transportation Disney provides to the parks. You can literally get to any Disney Resort, SPA or Park when staying at Disney. That in itself is worth the money! Would I stay there again? Probably, although I really like the Animal Kingdom Resort the best.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans...We had a great time”
Reviews.Author: Chiefy
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed at Port Orleans Riverside August 7th - 14th, and enjoyed ourselves immensely. It was hot, it was crowded, but neither of those things were Disney's fault, as some of the other reviewers would like to have youthink. Sure we waited to check in, but it was because the clerk was explaining what we needed to know..Sure the busses were crowded, but you could see that they had a person watching, calling for other busses as needed out front of the hotel. As far as the hotel itself, we were very pleased with our room and its location (9101 and 9102 in Magnolia) and it was a 2 minute walk to the main building, a three minute walk to old man island, and super quiet. the room itself was clean and well thought out. There was an accumulation of dust on the top of the armoire, and on the light fixture in the sink area, but the room ws made up every day by 2pm or so. No towel animals or posing of my daughters stuffed animals, but no deal breaker there. For the hotel, we used the food court several times...we were on the meal plan, so we used the counter service for either breakfast or lunch, and some mornings just used a snack credit for a muffin or yogurt and off we went. The meal plan was a great value, but thats another review... We ate at Boatwrights one night...I enjoyed it very much. Our waitress, Kerri, was excellent, and the food and portions were just right. The little store in the main building had everything you might need. (hint: One day, while back at the pool in the afternoon, we used a snack credit for a bag of chips, and another or a jar of salsa, and had a great snack at the pool.) The boat to Downtown Disney was relaxing and easy, the kids and we ejoyed it very much. On two afternoons it was shut down due to lighning in the area. Captain lisa was very informative and chatty ion one particular trip, full of Disney knowledge and information... Oerall, I would not hesitate to stay here again, and would recommend this to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Southern Charm”
Reviews.Author: valkgal
Reviews.Content: Disney World was the first leg of our "Vacation of a lifetime, so far," trip. We are a family of 5 with Mom, Dad, preteen daughter, and sons ages 9 and 7. We have stayed at Disney twice before, and have always been pleased with the service and the attention to detail. In the past, we've stayed at the cabins at Fort Wilderness, and at All Star Movies. Since this is a moderate resort, we expected decent, Disney service. We were disappointed. When I initially made our reservations, I requested the Disney Magical Express service. When we received our documents, our tags weren't included. When I called to ask, they said that I was signed up, and not to worry. I wasn't surprised to find out that we weren't on the DME list when we got to the airport. They did take care of us, and we arrived at the hotel just fine. Once at the resort, we were charmed by the decor. We live in a Victorian home in a historic district, so we really felt at home with the charming trim and soft colors. The check in process was not very good. Although it was quick, it wasn't accurate. I had major surgery in May, and requested a room on the first floor, since I was renting a scooter. I was assured that there was no problem. When I reminded them of that request at check in, they again said it was no problem. The clerk then told me where to go to get my scooter. She was well aware of my needs. We were given very poor directions to our room, and actually ended up on the path to the Port Orleans French Quarter resort. Once I realized this, and we were on the path back to our room, a half an hour had passed. When we got to our room, we found it was on the 2nd floor. There were no elevators, and no way to get the scooter upstairs. Fuming, we went back to the front desk, and again reminded them that I was unable to use a 2nd floor room, and to please put us in a first floor room, as I had requested, and as they had said we had when we initially checked in. They gave us a new room, and we were again given poor directions to the room. Another hour wasted. I couldn't believe we had been there over 3 hours, and were still messing with check in! Once situated in our new room, we tried to find the bus stop to take us to the parks. There were no signs anywhere. We walked/scooted for about 20 minutes before we found a sign that told us that the bus stop was behind our original circle. At this point, I didn't think we'd ever get to the parks. The rooms are adorable. We were in Alligator Bayou, which had two beds and a trundle, along with overhead ceiling fans, adjustable lighting, rustic decor and a soft bench. We loved that the bath and sinks were separate, and that the sink area was separated by a curtain. It was charming. The rooms are small, but large enough, even with all of our luggage! The paths were rustic and nice. The river running through the resort was nice. Every so often, you'd see a bird or lizards. There was a family of ducks ahead of us on a trail one day. That was a neat touch. We loved the little bridges connecting the main hall to the rest of the resort. The dining hall was kind of a mess. The floor by the drinks was always sticky and filthy, and I never saw anybody cleaning it. It was very difficult to find a clean, empty table, and we didn't even eat during the peak times! There is a charming water wheel on the outside of the building, which was very thematic. The main swimming pool was nice enough, but it would have been better if the slide was turned on, or at least if there had been a sign stating that the slide wasn't working. Instead, my children climbed the bath, only to be turned away. The hot tub was a nice touch, and very comfortable after a busy day at the parks. The poolside bar was never open, and we were there three different times. We have never had these issues with Disney before, and were very disappointed that we had them this time. Even my children were disappointed, and for the first time, we aren't planning a follow up Disney trip. The hotel was nice, but we really got the feeling that the staff was overwhelmed by the summer crowds. We will probably not return to POR, and definitely not during the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Go beneath the Disney propaganda”
Reviews.Author: SouthWalesMarkRich
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Disney resorts previously and once you are prepared to psychologically break down the propaganda there are some nasty truths out there. The Walt Disney Swan was excellent last year but is not a Disney run property and owned/managed excellently by Starwood hotels. However, the Port Orleans Riverside is a bit of a Jekyll and Hyde resort. The lobby and boating area is a delight and very well-maintained - whilst the huge, sprawling resort is a different scenario, with much maintenance now needed. Our room was old and contained a previous roomer's dirt such as a pot of sour cream and nachos under the bed. Check-in took us 1 and a half hours - somewhat eating away at the the Disney magic. This is the sort of resort you could get outside of Disney at less than half price - the choice is yours but having stayed at Universal's Royal Pacific resort earlier in our trip there was no comparison apart from Â£4 less per night for the much less preferred Disney's Port Orleans Riverside.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended resort”
Reviews.Author: Loobylou43
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family at Riverside for two weeks. After a very longwinded departure from Orlando International Airport (you collect your luggage and then get separated from it again) we collected our hire car and drove ourselves to the resort. It is possible to book Disneys Magical Express which is a free service, if you don't plan to hire a car. You park at the front of the main resort building to check in. This is a slow process considering it is tea-time there, but our body clocks are almost at midnight!, however, this is due to the staff being very helpful. We were given a map to our rooms, directions for parking and also advice where to catch the nearest Disney bus to get to the parks. This is a large resort, and our room was quite a walk from the main building, which feels much longer after a day at the park. The site was immaculate and the staff work very hard to keep it that way. The buildings are all two storeys high. We stayed in the area known as Alligator Bayou. The landscaping gives it a traditional swamp feeling with lots of greenery. There are little lizards flitting around when its hot and we saw owls, hares and even a raccoon whilst we wandered around. Be prepared for the afternoon storms. We tended to get very sunny mornings and around mid afternoon a wet and windy storm would arrive. We carried our little raincoats everywhere and they were a Godsend. You do dry off fairly quickly, temps were around 90 deg+. Food is of an average standard in the food hall. You can make your own yoghurt parfait (add fruit and cereals of your choice to yoghurt) but this is large enough for two people. There is a cooked breakfast with Mickey waffles, bacon, scrambled egg and sausage. There is also a grill and a bakery where you can get lovely cinnamon buns, cookies etc. We tended to just get small pots of yoghurt and fresh fruit pots here. The food hall is open from 7am until 11pm. In the evening you can make your own salad, have a roast or design your own pasta (although this is flooded with cooking oil) and visit the grill. This is absolutely fine if you are on a budget. There is a restaurant next door, which we visited a couple of times which introduced us to cornbread - delicious! A nice varied menu with much smaller portion sizes, which we prefer as most meals in and around the parks there are huge. There is a shop here where you can buy all the usual souvenirs as well as sun lotions, toiletries, and chilled beers, milk and butter, books, magazines etc. We used to buy the cereals and milk as there is a small fridge in the room. This way we could get out to the parks early (much easier to get on the rides before lunchtime when the parks get packed). We used to leave a small tip for the maid each day and she would leave our childrens cuddly toys arranged in little hammocks and also make little shapes out of the facecloths and towels. We never knew what we were coming back to, which was great fun. Our children used to get tired at the parks by mid afternoon and wanted to come back to the pool. The pool in Alligator Bayou has no lifeguard, so parents need to supervise. There are sunloungers around the pool. There is another pool called Ol' Man River which is nearer to the main resort building, but we didn't visit this. It has a bar and is manned by lifeguards for part of the day but is often busy. The dragon slide which features in the brochures is actually in the French Quarter, nowhere near us at all. You can catch a river boat from Riverside that stops at French Quarter and then takes you on to Downtown Disney. This is great in the evenings and very relaxed. They run regularly, so you never wait for too long. I would recommend Riverside to anyone, and was very impressed by how welcoming the Disney staff were, despite the many thousands of people that pass through their doors. The only downside is the water. Even the bottled water has a strong chemical taste. The rooms have a coffee machine but the taste of the water overpowers everything. I recommend purchasing the $11.99 cups in the food hall. Once purchased, you refill them as often as you like throughout your stay. You can also take them into the restaurant and bar. You can't use them in any other resort. The bar is very welcoming to families and there is entertainment from Bob Jackson from Weds to Sat in the evening. Lots of singalong songs and audience participation. If you register your credit card when you check in, you can use your park entrance card to charge meals and shopping to (in Disney areas only). The morning you are due to checkout, an envelope detailing your spending is placed on your room doorhandle and it is automatically debited to your card so you don't have to checkout. This is optional and they will leave a message on your room phone the day before giving you the option of checking out yourself. Most Disney Parks offer the same food - the usual burgers, fries, turkey legs, pizzas etc. I tended just to purchase fruit pots during the day. At Downtown Disney there is a Rainforest Cafe and Planet Hollywood, but get there early if you want a seat or you could look at a 2hr wait. You can reserve a table through Riverside Reception the day before but on the day it is walk in only. Wear comfortable shoes, you do a lot of walking. The Disney Transportation System is very clean, regular and welcoming, giving priority to anyone with mobility difficulties. Riverside has 3 bus stops.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at Port Orleans”
Reviews.Author: dbs1969
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Port Orleans Riverside August 4-11, 2007 with my family of 4 and had a great experience. I cannot emphasize enough, however, that room location here is critical because the property is so large. We stayed in Alligator Bayou # 14 and this is very close to the main building, pools and bus stop. I recommend this building. The food court has a great selection and my kids (6 and 8) loved both the main and quiet pools. Overall, cannot say enough about the place.

Reviews.Title: “Very big, but very nice resort - worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: luaar78
Reviews.Content: We always stay on Disney property, and wanted to try a new resort. We had never stayed at a moderate level resort before, and were not disappointed. Great pool and super food court with many choices all day long! There were also horse-drawn buggy rides, and a fishing area. We also saw many people renting boats at the marina. The sit down restaurant was nothing special; we only ate there once. Our room was very nice in the Alligator Bayou section. Everything was immaculate, as Disney always is. Transportation was good. There is a short boat ride that takes you to Downtown Disney, which was great for us. My only warning is that this resort is huge! Expect a lot of walking to the food court, lobby, and possibly buses, depending on where your room is. Overall, this is one of my favorite Disney resorts because of the theming and overall quality. It is worth the extra money over a value resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully lanscaped but dirty rooms”
Reviews.Author: yooperkid
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at Port Orleans Riverside. The resort is beautifully lanscaped. The pool area-Old Man's Island- was great for the kids. Wonderful selection at the food court. We enjoyed the convience of the buses and the boat ride to Downtown Disney. The only down side was that our room was not clean. There were LAYERS of dust on the light fixtures and ceiling fan. As well as garbage under our bed. We have stayed at other moderate resorts and this room did not live up to our expectations. Other than the dirty room, we enjoyed the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Not that Great”
Reviews.Author: lovewaltdisney
Reviews.Content: I just came back from the Port Orleans Riverside Resort and it was our very first trip to Walt Disney World. The property and landscaping was beautiful but the room we stayed in was uncomfortable because we kept seeing ants on the table between the two queen size beds and I was scared they were going to get in the bed. There was also no microwave and the refrigerator did not cool down well so we were forced to do nothing but eat out everynight which got expensive. I was traveling with my 7 year old daughter and husband who was on a cane due to a injured knee so the walk we had back and forth to our room was to much for him. I loved the shuttle bus service very convenient, unfortunately we did not get to visit the pools due to busy days in the parks. At the end of our stay it was pouring down rain and we needed help to get our luggage to the car because we were leaving, we had to wait 45 minutes for someone to come to help us and not counting that I had already made two trips to the car to load some of our luggage and got soaked because of the distance to the parking lot. I love Walt Disney World and will return but never to this resort. We definetly will be trying somewhere different next time. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: travlrguy
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed at Port Orleans from July 14-21st and we really enjoyed the resort. I know there are more luxurious resorts at Disney b/c we visited some but for the money, Port Orleans was well worth it. Our room was exactly what was needed, enough room for five, a few cable channels to watch at bedtime, and ice cold air conditioning to relax after very long and hot days at the parks. The good: The food package was not amazing but as much as you could ask for if you have small kids. The pool(s) at the resort with water slides, Boatrights restaurant, and the constant free buses to the parks. The bad: Really nothing! I suggest this resort to families without hesitation. ONE NOTE TO THOSE ON THE MEAL PLAN: MAKE RESERVATIONS IN ADVANCE AT WOLFGANG PUCK'S RESTAURANT IN DOWNTOWN DISNEY, it was the best food we had all trip and was part of the meal plan.

Reviews.Title: “Better for romance or couples”
Reviews.Author: georgiagrl
Reviews.Content: Last year we stayed at the Yacht club which was awesome but a little pricey. This year we spent two nights at the Pop Century, which for what we paid was right up there with the Yacht Club for the fun and charm of the place. We decided to stay one more night, and asked for a moderate hotel, whatever was available. The reservation was made for Riverside, and I paid an additional $20 for a waterview room, hoping to get a view of the river. This place is huge. Unfortunately our waterview room was a side view of a swimming pool and we were about a 10 minute walk away from the main building, about as far away as you could get. And the paths are kind of spooky, especially at night. We called it Camp Creepy, which I know is unfair, but the place after the brightness and fun of Pop Century, and the activity and fun of the Yacht Club, was very subdued, very isolated seeming--felt like we were in a Savannah cemetary at night with fog rising and spooky noises. So I think, this isn't really a fun place for families with small children, it is more of a quiet, restful place for couples. We went to the French quarter the next day to walk around and eat and it was fun and bright and we loved it and think that part of the resort is probably more exciting for children. We also drove to the Coronado to look around and that looked like a fun place to stay as well. So nothing really wrong with Riverside, it is just a different atmosphere for families wanting a more restful vacation or couples having a romantic vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms for special needs kids and excellent new food options”
Reviews.Author: Change_of_Scene
Reviews.Content: I own a travel agency and have been to Walt Disney World more than 30 times. We returned from our 5th trip (in 7 years) with our three children. Two of our children are autistic. We stay at Port Orleans Riverside Resort, which is one of the moderate resorts. The rooms have two double beds and a trundle bed that pulls out from under one of the doubles. This is a great resort for children who cannot sleep in beds high off the floor. We request an extra trundle mattress to go under the other double bed. This way our children sleep safely and we are all well rested. Disney's Port Orleans Riverside has re-vamped it's food court. There are many healthy options and the pricing is excellent-- even for Disney. From carved turkey breast to carved roast beef to design your own salad and pasta, what a positive change! Children's meals ( through age 9, but adults can purchase them, too) range from 3.99 - 5.79 and include an entree, 2 side dishes (grapes, applesauce, baby carrots, fries, cookie) and a drink ( white or chocolate milk, juice box or soda). Give Walt Disney World a try if you have not been there recently (or not at all).

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: DisneyBonkers
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in this wonderful resort. Our first trip to this resort was in August 2005, where we stayed in the Port Orleans French Quarter and we loved it! We loved in so much we came back in October 2006 and stayed at the Riverside. The resort is split into the French Quarter and Riverside - the French Quarter has all the atmosphere of New Orleans, with cobbled streets and a carnival atmosphere! The Riverside is about taking things easy on the Big Lazy River! Whatever side you decide to stay on, both are simply lovely! And please note guests have access to both sides of the resort. From the minute you arrive at this resort it feels special. The old style decor in the lobby makes you feel like you have gone back in time! The reception area is in the theme of an old bank, where you talk to the teller to check-in! When you check-in you are given a map to find your room. Please note this is a large resort and depending on where your room is you may have a long walk, so if this does not appeal have a look at the resort map on the Disneyworld website and it will give you an idea of which block is closest to the reception area, and the buses to the parks, and you can request this building when booking. The buildings are split into Aligator Bayou and the great Plantation Mansions. I personally thought that the white mansions were prettier and requested one of these when booking and got one! When you leave the reception area you come outside where there is a beautiful marina, where you can see the mansions in the background. There are lots of wodden bridges and a huge water wheel on the side of the "eating hole" which all adds to the wonderful atmosphere. The resort sits on the river which makes it very pretty to stroll around, especially at night. There are lamps that light up the river. My boyfriend and I would often walk to the French Quarter and have a drink in the bar and listen to the jazz music that played on the loud speakers. There is also a horse drawn carriage service, which will take you on a romantic ride around the resort. Perfect! For the kids there are several pools and the fishing hole! Bikes can also be hired and there is the games arcade - lots to keep them occupied! The rooms are reasonably big and spacious, I have stayed at Disney's All Star Movies and the rooms here are a lot bigger. If you are travelling in a family of four, I feel there is plenty of room. As I was travelling with my boyfiend, we had more than enough room! There is an in-room safe, ironing board and hairdryer and of course a lovely big television with all the Disney channels! The room and bathroom were clean, but in hard to reach places further cleaning was required. The eats at the resort are much the same as anywhere else at Disneyworld, good variety and big portions! Please buy the Mickey Waffle for breakfast, made in the shape of Mickey Mouse, a great way to start a Disney day! Another thing I can recommend is buying the Port Orleans Resort drinking cup. For a one off price of $19.99 (the price may have altered) this allows you unlimited drinks for the duration of your stay - tea / coffee / soft drinks at any time of the day. It can only be used in the Port Orleans Resort but we did find we saved a lot of money with this! As well as the standard self service dining, there also is a sit down restaurant at the Riverside, "Boatwrights" which serves lovely cajun style food. Where most resorts have only one means of transport to get to the parks - the Port Orleans has another - a river boat ride to Downtown Disney! Its lovely sailing down the Sassagoula river - very relaxing and the driver gives you some Disney facts along the way. Another reason, I feel to pick this resort. The Port Orleans Riverside has all the magic of a Disney resort but has a relaxing feel. If you are travelling as a couple and are looking for a hotel with a romantic setting this is the one! As a moderate resort it does cost a bit more than the value resorts - but it really is worth it. It feels a lot less cramped. The Port Orleans Riverside really is something very special.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort!”
Reviews.Author: amy-claire
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside July 2nd, 2007 for 9 nights. We had a great time. This is a large resort, but still easy to get around. Very quiet, pleasant surroundings, we stayed in Magnolia Bend and it was nicely decorated. The quiet pool(s) are wonderful! They have surrey bikes to rent there which is nice to do something different from the parks. Rooms were nice, they were kept neat and tidy by mousekeeping. TV with great selection of channels, internet connection, coffee maker and refridgerator which was great to have! Overall I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Moderate Resort in Disney with beautiful landscape”
Reviews.Author: Paulvacation
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family from 7-13 July 2007 in Riverside. This is my first time in Orlando disney resort. It has a beautiful landscape, with lot of trees and a river running across the resort. The room is of medium size, and it is OK clean. The carpet might be a bit sticky. The beds were very comfortable. The choice of food in food court is OK, but less impressive in quality than in other disney resort. The main pool was very crowded with lot of children playing the slide and no swimming at all. However, it has 5 quiet pools which is very good for swimming and relax. The transportation is good to all theme parks but not that convenient to the other resorts. There is a dining plan in disney package which is very value for money. You can have counter service and table service in restaurant in other resorts, which is a very good experience. However, then you have got your own car or rent a car. Otherwise, it will eat up lot of your time in disney's own transportation. I will try other Disney Resort next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Riverside”
Reviews.Author: zahs
Reviews.Content: Am writing this review a little late - we stayed at the Riverside for 2 weeks at the end of January/beginning february. This was our first stay in Florida so we decided to book a disney moderate resort. We arrived at the Riverside very late (long flight delay), and our first impressions were good. The grounds are absolutely beautiful and we had a lovely room in one of the mansion style buildings. The rooms themselves are a reasonable size with two queen size beds. As it was only my boyfriend and I on this trip there was obviously plenty of room - for a family of four I would say that there isn't really enough storage space for your clothes etc. We filled the wardrobe and and all the drawers and there was only two of us! The room itself was also a little dark, not that this really bothered us, we weren't in it that much of the time. Our room was in the middle, but the rooms on the end have an extra window, so maybe they are not quite so dark. One of the restaurants was closed whilst we were there (it was January after all), so only Boatwrights was open. We had two breakfasts in Boatwrights, both which we found to be good value for money (we got 2 dollars to the pound though) and plenty of food for us. We only had one evening meal here which was again great, but we had made a reservation and still had to wait nearly an hour for a table! This was much longer than we waited at any of the restaurants in downtown disney. We were not on the disney dining plan, but found it very easy to make reservations at restaurants via the conceige, or by direct telephone. As it was January, and absolutely freezing the first week we were there, we did not use the pool. We did manage to get the boat to downtown disney a couple of times which made a nice change to the bus. We didn't find the queues for the disney transport to be that busy, and we didn't wait more than 20mins for a bus. Even on the evenings that we watched the fireworks at the Magic Kingdom and Epcot the queue for the bus wasn't very long. I guess this had something to do with it being January! We found the staff to be polite, friendly and helpful, if a little unsure at times. Some of the staff on reception in particular seemed a little inexperienced, but this didn't spoil our stay. With regards to travelling from the UK. We flew with First Choice which was fine (despite the long delay and the completely pointless food voucher of Â£2.50 - what can you buy with that at Gatwick airport?!) We did use the telephone in the room a couple of times, but I think it would have been cheaper to buy a phone card - the bill was over $100!! In our 2 week stay we spent Â£800 between the two of us. This included all our food and drink, souvenirs (such as photos, a scrapbook, clothes...), tips, the phone bill, taxis and tickets for seaworld. All in all I think the Riverside is a good base for a holiday at Disney. The grounds are beautiful, the rooms a nice size, and the food pretty good. If you are planning on spending time in the room then maybe a delux resort would be better, but if you are going to be out all day then a moderate resort like the Riverside is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Loved IT!!”
Reviews.Author: disneytravelfanatic
Reviews.Content: Once again another Disney Hotel that was magnificant! Check-In: We went with my cousins so we had requested to rooms next to each other, the front desk had already had the rooms ready, we weren't expecting them to be ready because our plane had landed a half hour early. Lobby: Was very quaint and inviting and well air conditioned. The resort was very large though now connecting to Port Orleans French Quater, when we stayed here it was called Dixie Landings. Room: The rooms were a nice size and very well kept. The housekeeping came in the morning I am guiesing because we would return around noon for my cousins to nap and the rooms were already done. Not once was anything missing from the room, there were always fresh towels and always new shampoo or soap. The maid even left us little towle dolls one day! The beds were beyond comfortable and the pillows felt like cotton candy. Recreation: There is a nice size pool and waterslide, although thay might have changed that now we haven't stayed there in a while. There are bikes we rented and there is s boat to Downtown Disney. I also believe that there is a marina. Other: The buses did take twenty minutes to arrive whicj we didn't really mind, and the whole resort was beautiful we did also stay ate the French Quarter and loved it and we loved this resort to would definatly go back!!

Reviews.Title: “SMALL trundle bed, great pool!”
Reviews.Author: Andais
Reviews.Content: I am used to staying at Disneyâ€™s deluxe resorts but chose to save money for this trip and selected the Riverside. The rooms were clean, service was fantastic, and the grotto pool had a really cool waterslide. (Saratoga Springs has the best pool so far: zero entry, a water slide for small children, and one for larger children.) The trundle bed was really small. (My 3-yr-old said she couldnâ€™t wait to get home and sleep in her â€œbigâ€� bed â€“ she is sleeping in her crib converted to a daybed.) I thought it would have a mattress but instead found an extremely thin pad. When I pulled it out it looked dirtyâ€¦until I realized that what I was looking at was the cover for the bed. When I took off the cover there were clean sheets. Other than more restaurant choices I thought the Riverside was GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans Riverside peaceful”
Reviews.Author: FondduLac
Reviews.Content: We were at Port Orleans Riverside June 1 to June 5, 2007. This is still the "off season" for tourists. We thought the resort was great. The landscaping and vegetation was beautiful, the hotel (each unit is only 2 stories talls) was nice, the small pool right outside our door was uncrowded. We had the pool to ourselves much of the time. The area was quiet and the food at the Boat house was ok. Again, make reservations before even coming if you want to enjoy a sit down meal. It was booked up early and we never did a sit down meal. Check in was easy, no wait for us. The maids made little animals with the washclothes each day and had our daughter's stuffed animals in cute displays each day when we returned. We thought the rooms were clean. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Port Orleans Riverside”
Reviews.Author: travelersfromIndy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans Riverside for 7 nights. We stayed in building 14 which is close to the main building. We loved our room. The room was a decent size. All of the beds were comfortable even the trundle bed, however the pillows were not. Unless someone was walking right by our room yelling we did not hear sounds from the outside. The pools were nice, our favorite was the quiet pool area. The main pool was too shallow for our teenager to enjoy. Whenever we called for extra towels or blankets they arrived in minutes. I was not extremely happy with our mousekeeping, they did not leave towels and shampoo everyday. I also had read that the mousekeeping would leave towel animals,ours did not. We rented a bike and rode around the property that was fun. I am really glad we rented a car,the bus service from the hotel always took at least 20 minutes to arrive. The food court had good food, however the lines are very long.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent setting...rooms disappointing”
Reviews.Author: RussBedfordshireUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the Easter break. we love Disney and we were looking forward to our stay. Had read all reviews on this site and thought we had made right choice for a moderate resort, which, lets face it is still not cheap when compared to staying off sight. In retrospect we were probably spoilt on our last visit when we stayed at the Dolphin....There is no comparison. Still you get what you pay for. Dont get me wrong we enjoyed our stay. Riverside is in a beautiful setting. There is a main pool and several smaller pools dotted about. The resort was full when we visited. Frustrating that people put towels on beds early in morning and finally arrived at 3pm !! but not the resorts fault. We often used the smaller pool and had no trouble finding beds and much quieter. The resort is, as you would expect with Disney, very well maintained. The grounds are beautiful and loads of wildlife. Very spread out but as surroundings are so special we did not mind the walk. Reception area is superb and attractively designed. The transportation to the parks is very good and the longest we waited for a bus or boat was 20 minutes. When parks close the bus to Riverside does appear to have longest queues ! We really enjoyed the boat trip to Downtown Disney. Me and my lads hired a small boat for an hour or so they thought this was fantastic. Also went 'fishing' which I thought would be a waste of time with a cane and a giant hook, but to be fair they both caught several small fish and again really enjoyed it. The negatives....... When we arrived we had a long walk to our room and no one offered to help us with our cases. I did see other guests being ferried about on golf buggies but no help was offered to us. Expected better service than this. Did not think staff were that friendly. Have seen reports about towels being made into models etc. Never experienced this, think we must have had a grouchy maid ! Rooms not very clean, although we are quite fussy. Several times had to request coffee etc as maid never left any. There was 5 of us. Room is too small for five. Although you don't send much time their it was cramped. Rooms are very dark and appear dingy. I expected better standard. We stayed for 14 nights food okay but starts to get repetitive. Many better places to eat. Boatwrights average. So overall we enjoyed our stay and are already planning our next trip...but not at Riverside. Hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “Just OK for families”
Reviews.Author: Momwith5kids
Reviews.Content: Our family consists of 3 kids with two parents, so it's hard to find accomodations that have enough space without breaking our budget. We have stayed at Disney's Polynesian resort (2 Queen beds + one day bed) previously but only because I found a great 40% off that rate just that one time 2 years ago.)--- Having said that, I know the Riverside is a "moderate" hotel and isn't meant to be as grande, but I did expect more for the money I paid. First of all, check-in took us 42 minutes standing in line in the main lobby (they said the computers were down but who knows--they had hardly anyone working the desk with 20 people waiting behind us as well!). Second, when we FINALLY got the room it was VERY cramped. The bathroom is so small that you have to lean over the toilet to shut the door. The recent rains flooded out both the sidewalks to our particular building, so our rolling luggage had to be dragged through a nearby hedge in the mud just to reach our pathway to the right building. The trundle bed is very small--bigger than a crib but too small for my 11-year old--just right for my 9 year old barely. I agree with a previous post that the room cleanliness was much less than I expected for Disney. The privacy curtain helped us deal with dressing for the day but the beds were only full-sized beds and were not that comfortable--not terrible but not good. I like a firm mattress and these were just too firm (cheap). The shower curtain (I stayed in building 19 Alligator Bayou) was molded on the bottom. I like a good walk, but it was a LONG flight for us and it was more than I needed after a long day in the sun with jet lag and a LONG check-in. I looked forward to riding the surrey bikes with my family but be aware that they only rent bikes during a certain time during the day so we never got there (due to all the long lines at the other places). We also looked forward to eating at Boatrights that I had heard was a good on-site restaurant, and we were unable to do that during our stay due to advanced reservations of everone else--make reservations before you leave your home at least a week in advance! It was easier for us to make reservations in Epcot the day before a dinner meal than it was for us to dine at Boatrights all week. To me, it seems that Disney is just packing people in as much as they can and disregarding their comfort as far as ease of dining on property, or crowd control. The pool is small and crowded--very loud--On another note with the pool, there is a small hot tub and many people were allowing their diapered toddlers into the hot water --IKK! I noticed that several of the people allowing their babies into this hot water (unsafe) were speaking foreign languages, so perhaps it is not a health issue in their native areas, but its not only unsafe for babies to be in a hot tub but it's rude to the adults that expect to enjoy it. I was hoping that staying at a moderate hotel would be enough to separate ourselves from that type of behavior--yes I am a hotel snob when I pay $170 a night for a hotel--no offense intended to anyone, I just want my money's worth. On the upside, we heard NO hotel noise from nearby rooms, even when our neighbors with very small kids showed up about midnight each night, {which was better than our experience at the Polynesian where we had to call the front desk to get some teenagers there to stop running around and shouting at 3am but that's another story}. Also, the grounds were beautiful and I highly recommend it for a romantic getaway especially on the Magnolia side--very romantic looking--and my kids liked the boatride to downtown Disney but it was frustrating and hardly worth it because even as early as 4pm all the restaurants had 2 hour wait times for dinner. Disney should "FAST-PASS" the Downtown Disney Dining situation!! ON a trival note, my kids like to watch tv before bed and the tv channels you get in the disney resort consist of about four news shows, a couple of sports channels, a couple religious channels, and about five Disney channels and the weather channel and that's it--My kids love the Discovery channel and the HIstory channel and there was not "good stuff" to lull them to bed--I know, a trivial point but there it is if it is important to you. For the money, even with the Disney perks, I would not recommend this hotel unless you were just a couple looking for romance and no kids to keep comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Port of Orleans”
Reviews.Author: SKH2
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back today from the Riverside Resort. It is a beautiful resort that looks like an old Southern Mansion from the days of Gone with the Wind. As beautiful as it is and the scenery around it, (trees, flowers, gazabos, water, water wheel, ducks, otter, etc) the rooms are average and not overly clean. During our stay there they left a card in our room saying our linens would be changed every 3 days during our stay. Also, they encourage you to reuse towels to help the environment. I want clean towels and sheets everyday when I am on vacation and spending a great deal of money on the vacation. Also, there was mold growing in between our shower curtain in the bathroom and there was a dirty used band-aid on the floor in the bathroom behind the toliet that was NOT ours, and mold in the grout of the tile on the bathroom shower. The resort is very spread out and after a long flight with children they were not able to take us to our room or take our bags to our room even when we asked specifically. We had to drag our children along with their large heavy suitcases pulling them behind. Also, directions to our rooms were not specific enough and we ended up walking much farther than necessary. We requested a room near the food court and was placed quite a ways from there, at least a 5-7 min. walk. If you are not in shape or don't want to walk a long way in the hot hot Florida sun, this is not the place you want to stay. It is beautiful and the landscaping is exquisite, I have the most beautiful pictures. The boat takes you to Downtown Disney every 20 minutes and buses are available to the Parks every 20 minutes or so. The food is average, at best so don't waste your money or dining plan (which is a must and a great money saver) on the food at the Riverside. Wolf Gang Puck's Express is a wonderful place to have lunch in Downtown Disney. I enjoyed not having to deal with airline lines as The Riverside has an airline check in for baggage and boarding passes. However, we waited in line for 1 hour and 10 minutes, which is a long time. Many people behind us had flights very shortly and stood in line so long they were NOT sure if their bags would be sent ahead to the airport. If you use this service do it early in the morning, they start at 5:00 a.m. Our flight left at 5:30 and we got in line at 10:00 and weren't checked in until 11:10. You must check your bags and get boarding passes at LEAST 3 hours prior to your flight. Would I stay here again? Probably not, too much walking after spending many hot days in the theme parks, bathrooms not as clean as possible, employees not overly helpful or friendly, and food so so. If it were more convienent? Yes, the rooms were a nice size, much larger than the Value resorts, had 2 nice comfortable beds, beautiful scenery, good transportation to parks, and a lovely lobby. If you do decide to stay there stay away from the pool areas people swim late and with the lights and noise you won't get to sleep. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at Port Orleans”
Reviews.Author: tabbyw
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans Riverside was a very nice stay for our family of four. We were just there in mid-June. The resort itself was very nice. It felt very peaceful compared to the hustle and bustle of going to the parks. It has nice landscaping around a lake. There's lots to do centered around the lake such as: rent bikes, rent small or large boats, go fishing, carriage ride around the lake. There's also a boat that goes to Port Orleans French Quarter and Downtown Disney. The foodcourt had a good variety of food and pleny of seating and the souvenier shop & arcade were great places too. The main pool was very nice with spilling water, a slide and it was a nice size. If you want a more quiter setting, each cluster of rooms has it's own pool. The room was standard as far as most go. It's nice that they provide a privacy curtain so that you can change near the sinks and be seperated from the rest of the room. If you book in Alligator Bayou you can request a pull out trundle for another place for someone to sleep. My 11yr son slept here and it was a bit small for him, but a younger child would definitely be fine here. We liked the selection of food at the French Quarter Food Court even more, so we took the boat one night and ate there for dinner. I highly recommend getting the refillable mugs as soon as you check in. For $12 you can refill your mug anytime during your stay. This can be coffee, hot chocolate, and the soda fountain. It can be brought to the other resorts too (not to the parks.) All in all, if Port Orleans fits your budget, I would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Views, Great Room”
Reviews.Author: mytwobuckaroos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our second trip to Disney and I would highly recommend this resort. The lobby is old and outdated but the rest of the resort is great. We stayed at the Animal Kingdom for our first trip and I was happier with riverside. The rooms were large and had a trundle bed for the kids to sleep on. The views were pretty with a lake, boating, bike rentals, etc. The buses moved quickly from the resorts to the parks. The food at the hotel was also very good. The value of this resort is equal to the price. I think it was a great bargain for really nice accomadations.

Reviews.Title: “Disney knows how to build resorts and this is a great example”
Reviews.Author: kathy884
Reviews.Content: This is a huge nicely laid out resort with lots of walking paths. The rooms at the resort were nicely decorated and very clean. We were in the Alligator Bayou section. I appreciated the in room refrigerator and the fact that there were bridges that provided easy access to the main swimming area / food court / arcade area no matter where you stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort - beware of beds though!”
Reviews.Author: reekev
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans for 8 days with our kids. The grounds were beautiful, the kids loved the ducks and bunnies everywhere, the buses to the parks were fast, kids loved to swim and order mocktails from the pool bar, we rented bikes, fished, took the ferry to Downtown Disney - really a topnotch experience EXCEPT the beds. The beds are only full beds NOT queens. We had a hard time sleeping comfortably. This is my only complaint. Buy the Disney Meal Plan, and when you check into the hotel, the staff will help you reserve meals at the hotel, and throughout the parks. It saved a lot of money, and allowed us to eat like royalty everywhere we went!!

Reviews.Title: “great place better then the beach club!”
Reviews.Author: princessjsoiebird
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel ! Clean helpful friendly nice place going back here next year already booked! Way better then the Beach club and way better service and price pool is a lot more user friendly and fun !Great time we even stayed an extra day it was so nice . Nice food options shopping and fun at the resort. Bus service good and fast boat ride to downtown disney nice way to get around. It is great for all types of travlers what a great clean nice place and great bang for you $ Best place next to Animal Kingdom lodge. You could really relax when you got back to this resort. We will be staying here for now on!

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans Riverside-well worth it”
Reviews.Author: rebeccacord
Reviews.Content: I have been to disney world various times throughout mylife and this was by far one of the best experiences I have had. The hotel was wonderful and very beautifully landscaped felt nothing like a normal square hotel. Our room was typical of middle class hotel and there was plenty to eat nearby in the lobby, you could also take a nice stroll or boat ride to the nearby French quater if you wanted different types of food. There was an occasional wait for a bus but not too terribly long unless you went to animal kingdom (prepare for a wait anywhere you stay). The meal plan is the way to go makes it much easier than worrying about tiping and paying as you go plus all the resturants cater to meal plans in serving size and portions. The whole atmosphere was wonderful with one crazy pool for the older kids, a baby pool and various other quiet pools throughout the area not a too far walk from your room. I would with out a doubt recommend those on a medium value budget to stay here

Reviews.Title: “perfect mix of fun & relaxation”
Reviews.Author: iluvdmouse
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Disney World and a friend recommended Port Orleans Riverside. I was skeptical, because it looked too boring. I really wanted Port Orleans French Quarter (which was full) or Polynesian or Contemporary Resort (with my fantasy bank account). We went with Port Orleans Riverside, and we were so happy that we did. When we arrived by Magical Express, we were warmly greeted by a castmember, who gave us First Visit buttons as well as a birthday button for our daughter who informed him that she was celebrating a birthday later that week. The lobby was busy, but we were checked in immediately. The downside was that our room wouldn't be ready for several hours (since it was only 9am) and two of the three restrooms in the main building were closed for cleaning --while our 3 year old "had to go". After a bit of a wait for the one restroom, we ate at the food court, which had lots of choices and very courteous and patient castmembers. Afterwards, we had a swim in the main pool, which was fabulous. We were able to take the Disney water taxi over to Downtown Disney, which was aprox 15 minutes. When we were given our room assignment, it was in Parterre Place. It was a short walk across the bridge from the main building and food court. There was a quiet pool just outside our door, and laundry facilities were in a building next to the pool. Our room was smallish for $200 a night, but it was pretty and well laid out. There were even a few hidden Mickeys in the decor too! On the days that we used the Disney bus, we ate breakfast and then caught the bus out in front of the main building. We always were able to get seats. One night, we had a dinner reservation at the Fort Wilderness Campground and found out that we would have to take a bus to one of the parks or downtown Disney and then catch another bus to Fort Wilderness. With a small child, this seemed too time consuming, so we asked for a taxi, which was around $10 dollars -- and worth every penny in time savings. While we were in the parks the next day, a surprise autographed photo & birthday card from Donald Duck was left for our daughter in our room. How fun! Checking out, we called the belldesk the night before, and they said to call about 20 minutes ahead in the morning. When we called, they picked up our luggage within 10 minutes (and gave us more buttons and stickers!) Overall, we loved Port Orleans Riverside. It was gorgeous! Even though we were told that they were full, it never seemed like there were that many people. There was plenty to do, with carriage rides in the evenings and they had surrey bikes for rental and boats too. They also had fishing. Even though we had originally wanted to stay at Port Orleans French Quarter, when we actually saw it from the dock, it wasn't as pretty, and the buildings seemed so much more packed together. The grounds at Port Orleans Riverside were incredible and very spacious and luxurious (without being boring!) On the downside, our room always felt slightly damp from the humidity (our swimsuits never dried out). Probably typical of a moderate. I also found a crawly bug on our bathroom floor one night. Otherwise, the room was great --quiet ground floor room, always clean, plenty of towels, no funny smells. Although it has nothing to do with the hotel, during May, all over Disney World we found big black flying bugs --June bugs? They don't bite, but they're a little of a nuisance.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: ilive2travel6
Reviews.Content: Our visit was short but memorable. We booked Disney's Magic Your Way for June 8 - 10. The hotel was beautiful, the pool was great, the people were great, very peaceful and quiet. Loved it! Wish we could have stayed longer would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: jlodimaggio
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 week stay at DIsney's Port Orleans Riverside. It was our 3rd visit to the Orlando area, but our first on WDW property. What a pleasant surprise! We checked in super fast, which was lovely after a delayed flight from UK. Our room in Building 17 was very quiet but close enough to everything to not feel cut off. The room had plenty of, well room for my party. The beds, which were unusually high thus giving us lots of laughs! were extremely comfortable. The sinks being separate from the bathroom were really useful in getting us out of the door in the morning! Every day mousekeeping made towel animals and arranged my daughters stuffed animals which made returning to the room an adventure in itself! The walkways are beautifully laid out and easy to navigate. We didn't use the main pool as we tended to grab a quick dip in the quiet pool instead. We also used the laundry near our room, which was a very conveniant way of not stinking! The food court was ok. Nothing wildly special, but edible-and the only place my daughter could get a strawberry shake (her absolute favourite thing in all the world!). Boatwrights had nicer food. On lazy mornings we ate breakfast there and really enjoyed the varied menu. On our last morning we hired a Surrey bike. Wished we'd done it sooner. Had a wonderful ride around the property. I can't recomend this hotel highly enough. I had fairly high expectations of Disney, but they were exceeded by far. Enjoy your stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, buss service could be better”
Reviews.Author: shuseby
Reviews.Content: The major plus for me was that the grounds were very beautiful!! The room was clean after I rinsed the previous occupants body hair out of the tub. We had a trundle bed for my son but the mattress was very obviously ruined. It was such a joke it looked like an elephant had danced on it. When he layed down he touched the floor and it was very uncomfortable for my him to sleep on at night. We stayed on the riverside section. One day we waited 1 hour and 20 minutes for the bus to take us to animal kingdom. When we called the front desk from the stop, they didnt really care and told us to keep waiting. We missed a large portion of animal kingdom that day because by the time we got there, it was too hot to stay very long. Disney did nothing to make it up to us. Usually by the time that the busses made it to our depot (west) we had to stand and we were extremely packed in. From my observations, the other hotel busses came more frequently and I never saw the people on them standing. That being said, it wasw nice not to have to drive ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “This moderate resort worth the extra $”
Reviews.Author: dler
Reviews.Content: Disneyworld is not my husband's favorite place, but since we were going to South Florida for a family reunion anyway...The crowds are the main reason he doesn't like it, so we upgraded to a moderate resort instead of a value. It was a great idea. We had stayed in the All Star Movie Resort before, and while the kids loved the decor, it seemed as if we never left the parks (crowds of children, no place to move, constant visual and audio stimulation). If you are trying to decide whether to spend the extra money on a moderate, there are definite benefits. This resort truly felt like a vacation. It was quiet, spacious, and beautifully landscaped. The pools were more shaded and less crowded. The restaurant areas were nicer. It had lots of the Disney touches without being overwhelming. We spent a bit shorter day at the parks and a bit more time in the evening at the resort. Fewer meltdowns from the kids, and my husband actually enjoyed himself. I'm cheap, but the extra money was worth it in this case.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: beachcomber87
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at POR the last week of May and had a lovely time. The grounds are just beautiful. We were there Memorial Day weekend and the hotel was at full capacity and was still very quiet and peaceful.Check in was speedy and the room was available earlier than the posted check in time. Very clean room and we received all of our request except one and we requetsed Mansion side, king bed, non-smoking, near bus depot and water view. We received all except water view. Very pleased. The king bed was very firm. The refrigerator in room was nice as well as the curtain that separated sinks from rest of room. The food court was above average for breakfast and average for other meals.The boat ride to downtown disney was pleasant. Housekeeping was fine....we had heard that the maids would wake you up early even with do not disturb sign...this was not the case..they worked around our schedule. Our only complaint was with the bus service. We seemed to miss the bus we needed each time and had to wait the full 20-30 minutes plus ride time to the parks. Overall a very good experience. This was our first time in a moderate resort and for the price difference a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: prunie8
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about this place. It's absolutely beautiful, the food in the restaurants is excellent and well-priced and the buses to the parks are often and comfortable. Typical of the Disney organization in it's well thought out planning and layout. Stay here and you will want for nothing! The double beds are a bit narrow so try to get a king-size if two adults plan to sleep in the same bed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay, Beautiful Grounds”
Reviews.Author: JenP123
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time at Port Orleans. Wish I had more time, only stayed 2 nights after attending a conference downtown at another resort. Had some difficulty upon check in and they weren't able to provide us a with a king size room and then our key card didn't work after walking what seemed miles with your luggage (they don't assist unless you pay extra apparently). I was frustrated at that point. We weren't happy with the location of our first room but they did happily accomadate us and adjust our rate lower to go to another room. That worked out. But be aware a double size bed is quite small for two people. My husband and I were not comfortable sharing a double. The grounds were impeccably kept and I loved the old southern charm of the place. We only drove near the other Port Orleans (French Quarter) and I didn't like the architecture nearly as much, plus it looked awfully small. We only ate on the premises once, that being for breakfast and the banana stuffed french toast was SO good. They gave you generous portions for your meal and the price was very resonable. I thought waiting around for the shuttle could have been more efficient. They don't seem to have as many buses coming and going and the wait time for the airport shuttle was very excessive. By the time, we got to the aiport after leaving 3 hours prior and making way too many pickups, we were cutting it close to making our flight. With all that said, the resort itself was lovely and I do recommend it. Its very kid friendly and the pools were very nicely maintainted. We stayed in the Mangolia area which wasn't as far as a walk as some of the other areas. I would look into what area you are staying before booking because you could be quite a distance from the main lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again but needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: chamoissammy
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 3 nights at the Port Orleans Riverside. The pluses were the pool, the pleasant meandering walkways, the trees and dense foliage, the location on the river (you could take a boat to Downtown Disney as well as rent small watercraft), and the fantastic food court. The food was tasty, reasonably priced, and available until midnight! It was always surprising to us how many families were ordering food at 11:00 p.m. They also offer a bottomless beverage souvenir cup good for the length of your stay which seems like a good value. Food court staff were very courteous, patient, and well-managed. On the other hand, the bell staff were very cranky indeed! I requested luggage pickup about 9 hours in advance of my departure and was told they were totally booked! This was not my only encounter with a disgruntled staff member. Two other bell staff sounded exasperated when I asked questions. The unit was obviously understaffed and poorly managed! Though the room was small, it was well thought out and accommodated 4 of us quite well. I would stay again but would request a room in a building that is close to the central hub of the hotel (i.e. transportation, food, and the main swimming pool). The Disney transportation system and their Magical Express are two reasons to stay on Disney property. Prior to our stay on Disney property we stayed at a convention hotel that was about 3 minutes from Disney property. Taxi rides cost us between $22-25 per ride!! Non-Disney hotel shuttles tend to run less frequently and do not run as early in the a.m. or as late in the p.m.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Disney0043
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Riverside from May12-20th. We couldnt have asked for a nicer hotel. The grounds are just beautiful. We were in the alligator bayou building 39, which wasn't a far walk from the lobby or the main pool area at all. In fact we had a quiet pool almost right outside our door. The mousekeeping was great, the staff was very polite, and the boat ride to Downtown Disney at night was a delight. All in all its a wonderful hotel, we would recomend this hotel to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed visiting this wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: tymetraveler222
Reviews.Content: I recently visited this hotel. It has such lovely grounds, and beautiful landscaping.The rooms are lovely. The people were all friendly, especially in the wonderful store they have. The merchandise selection is more than adequate, and is well displayed. I walked the entire resort, and it is good excersise, as well as relaxing. I sat near the river for a long time, contemplating life! I then took the boat ride to Downtown Disney and back-a very nice ride! Love this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price...”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTechie
Reviews.Content: Lobby, grounds, and marina of this hotel are very nice. Problem 1: Asked for a King bed, they gave us two doubles. Problem 2: When we got to our room, the bathroom was not clean. There were urine stains on the floor next to the toilet and the shower had black mold in the tile grout. For $150 a night, I don't want to see this, especially at a Disney resort. Problem 3: Our building/room was so far from the lobby/restaurant building and main pool (15 minute walk in 90 degree heat) that it wasn't fun going to the pool each day. I would suggest asking for a room as close to the main lobby as possible. There was no Disney bus stop near our building/room either so we had to trek to the lobby where the bus picked us up to go tto the parks. With a child and stroller, the bus transportation is not fun. We had to stand most of the time. Problem 4: The rude bus driver had such a strong foreign accent that we could not understand what he was saying when he would stop at a bus stop and announce the location. At night you cannot see outside the bus window to know where you are so we got off at the wrong stop. This is not something you want to do with a child at 11:30 PM after a day at the Magic Kingdom. Will not stay at a Disney hotel again. Have stayed at much better and cleaner hotels outside the property for less and they include a free breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans Riverside - great resort for the kids - nice landscaping and layout”
Reviews.Author: Jason Koulouras
Reviews.Content: First of all some background on the resort - it is what Disney refers to as a moderate resort - the rooms are about 315 square feet and either have 2 double beds or 1 king bed - there are two sinks in an area open to the room with a hanging pole for clothes and then a separate comode with bath/shower combo. Rooms are accessed from outdoors and there is limited room service and amenities in the room (thus the term moderate). Some people like the above layout and some people do not - it is something to consider before booking this property. The resort is very spread out and quite large - lots of rooms and many bus stops. There are two sections - the alligator bayou and the mansions (think Southern Rustic and Southern Formal and you get the picture). There are a number of pools throughout the resort and a great main pool (ole man island) especially for the under teenager kids. There are many activities going on for kids, a marina with boat rentals, a pirate jester cruise and cane pole fishing - all things my kids loved to do there. The rooms were reasonably comfortable, well maintained and the landscaping around the bayou was awesome - lots of little ponds, plants, winding footpaths - a very peaceful resort and also nice walkways by the sassagoula river as well. You can hop on a small ferry to Downtown Disney as well. The resort is more expensive (like any other Disney property) than an equivlent non-Disney offsite property. However if the parks are on your priority list this is a great location especially for the Magic Kingdom, Typhoon Lagoon and Epcot and pretty much as far as you can get from the Animal Kingdom and Blizzard Beach. The beds were comfortable - nothing fantastic. There is a mini-fridge in the room along with a small table and two chairs, regular TV with an armoire and a reaosnable amount of clothing storage space as well. All in all a solid choice for those with pre-teen kids or for couples (stay in the mansions area) looking for a nice Disney stay without breaking the bank. The main sit down dining restaurant - Boatwrights - did not impress us for dinner but did have a great breakfast. There is a bar there as well that would appeal to adults looking for a quiet apertif and the food court had a wide selection of choices and had a mill wheel that turned around (the kids loved this) and there was a functional water wheel outside as well. We would not recommend this property for young spring breakers or adults with teen kids in the family.

Reviews.Title: “loved the place and people”
Reviews.Author: paulypoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riverside from May 13 to 20,2007. From Halifax,Nova Scotia.Canada Davidson family room 9725 I can not begin to say what a wonderful time we had at the resort..The people were great.In the gift shop,the boat Captains expecially Steve who went all out to explain anything the children asked(with alot of humor)The maid Maria who made animals out of face clothes for the children and placed them around the room. It was a race to open the door to see what she had done.And the food was great the desserts wonderful,and the portions more than enough.And the people were very helpfull.Our 8 year old grandson seems to think that fishsticks would be a good addition on your child's menu.thanks for some great memories. Curtis,Paulette,Erika and Dylan....

Reviews.Title: “Nice Quiet Retreat”
Reviews.Author: SueD_MA
Reviews.Content: I've stayed on property at WDW six times over the past 20 years. My stay at POR (5/5-5/9/07) was my first at this hotel, and my overall impression was quite favorable. Check in was pleasant and efficient; however, my room was unavailable until 4:00 PM. This was inconvenient since I arrived at 11:00 AM with luggage and heavy clothes. I changed in the small bathroom off the main lobby (only two stalls - not enough for the Saturday demand), and checked my luggage with bell services. My room when I did get it was wonderful. It was on the top floor of one of the Magnolia buildings, about a five minute walk from the lobby. The bed was extremely comfortable with a nice choice of pillows. The layout of the room was smart with separate sink and shower facilities. The shower was good pressure with ready hot water. There was a plethora of mirrors in the room which struck me as odd. The room was extraordinarilly quiet from outside noise; however, the AC cycled quite often no matter the setting and was a bit on the loud side. Nothing ear plugs couldn't handle. The high speed Internet was in fact high speed and easy to access. The phone line was a bit buzzy, which made calls home a little difficult. And even though the web site had listed the rooms as having in-room safes, I couldn't find one in mine. It did have a refridgerator though. The food court had a bakery which made fresh croissants and cookies every day. Yum! Selection around the court and seating was plentiful. Service was efficient and pleasant. I didn't use the pool but it looked like fun, was shaded and well attended by happy guests. The grounds are very beautiful; lots of good paths to walk off the croissants and cookies! Lots of cute little brown bunnies around too. My only complaint is having to take buses everywhere. I have been spoiled by staying at monorail hotels. However, the buses came frequently and we never missed a reservation or plan. I would recommend POR to anyone and would stay here again. It is Deluxe quality for Moderate rates.

Reviews.Title: “Very SWEET Place”
Reviews.Author: jepso
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans Riverside from May 8 to May 14 2007 and loved it. Check in was so smooth in less than 10 minutes. We had more than enough room, with 3 adults and 2 children. The food court was good too. If you go there try to get in Joanne's line to check out.......she is so helpful and patient. The service was great. The "mousekeeping" was average, nothing special done for us. We ate at Boatwrights 2 nights and it was good food each time. The bus transportation to the parks was o.k. We had to wait about 30 min. the one night we left MK and we left about 2 hours before the park closed. I found the bed comfortable and my 5 year old had no problem sleeping on the trundle bed. It was QUIET, no noise, only the occassional flushing sound from another room. There is a lot of walking but the grounds are beautiful as are the pools. We stayed in building #28 and used the pool near us. The main pool was nice too, a bit crowded at times but what do you expect? There was a slide there. The boats to Downtown Disney was a nice relaxing ride.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ericjulie
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a great vacation at the Port Orleans Riverside Resort. We were there from May 5 - 12. The hotel grounds are beautiful! Our building was in the Alligator Bayou # 26. The resort is so big, sometimes it is fairly easy to get lost. The service was great! The checkin was a breeze and having the Disney Magical Express deliver the luggage to the room made everything easy. We traveled with 2 kids - ages 4 and 5. They loved the pool and the waterslide. We took advantage of both pools at the Riverside and French Quarter. The lifeguards are excellent and were constantly patrolling the pools. The room was very clean, nothing spectacular. The 2 complaints I have are that the pillows are too hard/big and the air conditioner turned off and on constantly all night long. We were on the Disney Dining plan. Way too much food! It was very convenient. The first night we dined at Boatwrights. The service was great and the pot roast was excellent. Every morning we had breakfast at the Riverside Mill food court. The food was good and the pastries were fresh and hot early in the morning. The transportation system at the resorts is spectacular. Very easy and convenient, both buses and boats.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience at Port Orleans - Riverside”
Reviews.Author: jb3600
Reviews.Content: We organized our trip to Riverside with our best friends and their parents, a total of 3 rooms that were supposed to be together. The experience started poorly and only got worse. They gave away two of our rooms so that none of us were together or even close by. Our room was dirty with dried raisins on the floor. Don't they vacuum? Our eithernet did not work. When our friends arriived late (around 1:00am) after checking in with their young kids and walking to their rooms (across the property) their keys did not work. The list goes on and on. We are used to the Disney experience with great customer service. We didn't get it at Riverside. Everyone from the bellmen to the front desk people to the boat drivers didn't seem to care about anyone. We stayed at the Hilton on our last two visits to Disney and that's where we'll go back to next. We don't see any reason to pay the extra to stay on Disney property for mediocre treatment in a 1-2 star motel.

Reviews.Title: “Had A Great Time!!!”
Reviews.Author: 3girlsmomhockessin
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to the Port Orleans Riverside. The hotel and grounds were beautiful. I can still smell the honeysuckels by the boardwalk. You feel like you are down south and it makes for a great transition from the madness at the Disney parks. Check in was a breeze and our luggage was delivered right to the room. The room was average size, very clean, might be a little tight for a party of 4 or more people. My children loved the towel animals left every evening by the mousekeepers.
