We stayed in bulding 16, right by one of the smaller pools. The food court was wonderful for breakfast and we never had to wait more than 5 minutes for a shuttle bus. We did not get to enjoy the property as much as we would have liked ~ I would suggest staying an extra 1-2 days to do the pools and bike riding/boats. We are already looking forward to our next stay at Port Orleans Riverside!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: mimo613
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews, I thought things could go towards the good or the bad. We loved the entire resort! It was clean and the staff were friendly. The room was definatly spacious enough and had a mini-fridge! We loved the curtain that you could close to block off a changing area since the bathroom is a little small for changing. From the inside the rooms were nice enough to be a hotel , and it wasn't too noisy. We stayed in the Magnolia building, and didn't hear any plumbing issues that we have read about. The "Quiet" pools were nice because of location, but not quiet at all. There were still plenty of children at all hours. Overall, my now fiance (we got engaged in Disney) and I were happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans Riverside just o.k.”
Reviews.Author: psl300
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Port Orleans Riverside for two nights in April...very standard room, no extras so to speak. We usually try to stay on Disney property for the convenience, etc..however, do feel that this place (as others we have stayed at: Caribbean Beach, Dolpin) is nothing special over any other hotel off-site. For the money, actually, it is not worth it. The room was clean, staff friendly enough, but expect the same crowds and wait. I think that if you are going to do the whole "Disney" vacation, then absolutely stay on-site and this hotel is fine for that. But if you want to save money and are really only going to use the hotel for sleeping and such, due to spending all your time in the parks, then you'd be just as well off at any hotel near Disney. We really didn't walk the grounds, or see the pools, we just went to the parks and returned to the hotel at night to sleep. The buses (as always) are convenient, but at the savings of $10 a day to park, you have to sometimes stand (we did both days) and with kids, it's hard, especially when you have to go to a few stops before getting to your own....sometimes hardly worth it. Honestly, I could take it or leave it because I don't think the Disney hotels are worth the money you spend (we spent $189 a night). The Port Orleans is in the same class as a Holiday Inn, if that, and you are really only paying for the location and the whole "Disney" thing that goes with it. Again, no complaints, but really not worth it. You can find better off-site, if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Disney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanadaSmallworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside on April 20th to April 26th of this year and I must say we were very pleasantly surprised. Having stayed at the Wilderness Lodge the previous year, I was somewhat skeptical about staying at a moderate rather than deluxe Disney hotel. The grounds are beautifully landscaped--azaleas and other plants in bloom and lots of trees and shrubs made for shade and privacy. We were situated in Alligator Bayou and although it was a bit of a walk to get to the food court and main lobby, we were not far from a bus stop for Disney transportation to the parks. The room was lovely. It felt quite spacious and it was very clean. Double beds were a bit small and that is probably my only complaint about the room. Mousekeeping was excellent. Food court was great--never felt really crowded and the food was very good. (I strongly recommend the cinnamon rolls for a treat!) We would certainly not hesitate to come back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Just Wonderful, April 17-26”
Reviews.Author: Sopers
Reviews.Content: We are so glad that we read the reviews on this website. it was so helpful in picking the right building, having an idea of bus travel and the best bus stop and general things to expect. We loved this resort. From the moment we arrived at the air--port with the magical express to the check in to the grounds, we loved it!! We read a number of negative reports about this resort and we just couldn't understand what people were getting at, the place for us was nearly perfect. We stayed in the building number 17 with a corner room on the second floor. I do not believe there is a bad spot at the resort, but ours was very convient (5 min walk to anywhere). The quite pool right outside our door was great. We liked it better than the large pool as it was not as busy. The water slide and waterfall at the big pool were fun, but it is busy. The mugs that you can buy for 11.99 are worth every penny. We got our monies worth in the first day. We were on the disney dinning plan. EVERYONE, GET THIS in your package. It is so worth it. We reaseared all our resturants before we left and had all our reservations made 2-3 months before. We ate like kings and queens. Service at every resturant was amazing, the food was wonderful (check out BOMA, Ohanna's, Coral Reef, Boatwrights and Beirgarden). There are so many wonderful places to eat, we didn't get to the all. Even the lunches throughout the parks are great. Our room was confortable, we had a trendal bed, which was great for one child. We read that our building was noisy as it was near the main road, it WASN"T. The room was clean most days and it was just so nice to come back to after a full day at the park. The boat ride to downtown disney was so relaxing. The bus service was amazing, I am sure we waited no more than 10 minutes for any bus. We only waited once after going to Fantasmic, but there was a big dance competition there, so it was very busy. We would go back to this hotel in a moment. We loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Room at Port Orleans Riverside”
Reviews.Author: GretchenE
Reviews.Content: My husband, my 5 year old daughter and I arrived at 8:00pm on a Saturday evening. We checked into the hotel and then went to have some dinner. It was almost 10pm when we got to our room. Unfortunately, our room had not been cleaned. One bed was unmade, there were dirty glasses in the room and dirty/wet towels in the bathroom. I called down to the front desk and they said they'd send someone "right up" to clean it. After 20 minutes, no one had arrived to clean the room. I called the front desk again. They said that someone should be there shortly. After 15 more minutes, still no one had showed up. I called again. I got transferred to the housekeeping manager who never picked up the phone. I called the front desk again and was again transferred to the housekeeping manager who still did not pick up the phone. My 5 year old daughter fell asleep in a chair in the room. At 11pm, I went down to the front desk and asked to be moved to a clean room. They did not do that but instead finally sent a cleaning crew to the room. You can guess how happy a mother was to have her 5 year old daughter sleeping in a chair in a dirty hotel room. I asked to speak with a manager and had to wait for that too. It was after 11:30pm when I got back to a (finally) cleaned hotel room. I was very dissatisfied with the service at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My 2nd visit to Port Orleans”
Reviews.Author: TAMN8R2
Reviews.Content: WOW. I wrote a review after our honeymoon, and I am just as impressed this time. Our trip was 2/3/07 - 2/11/07 and way too short! Exactly 2 years after our honeymoon. This is the perfect time of year to go to Disney...crowds are light, weather is cool to warm...not hot or cold. No humidity. The weekends are full of dance teams and drill teams, but the weekdays are not crowded at all. This time we brought along my parents and my brother and his friend. My brother stayed at Pop Century while my parents and my husband and I stayed at Riverside. I got that same awestruck feeling I had on our honeymoon when we walked into the main building to check in. We stayed in Oak Manor on our homeymoon, so this time I was really wanting to experience Alligator Bayou. We were in room 1844. Our location was perfect! I just loved the "woodsy" feel of it all. Check in was a little slow, but we were checking in early, about 1100am. The girl was "earning her ears" so we gave her the benefit of the doubt. We requested rooms near, but not connected to each other. We got connected rooms, no big deal. Worked out better this way anyway. My husband and I ended up on the 2nd floor with a corner room. The food court was closed for reconstruction, but they did have this great breakfast set up and the food was awesome!!! We didn't have to wait very long at all for any of our buses. The staff was very kind and the grounds were beautiful. I will most certainly stay here again and again. I have this urge to check out the other resorts at Disney World, but I am held back by the fact taht I may not have as enjoyable a stay. I loved the view from our room, I love taking walks. The boat to Downtown Disney is such a beautiful and serene ride. I will most certainly be back..hopefully sooner than later. It was incredible to recapture those honeymoon "feelings."

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday”
Reviews.Author: WitneyOxford
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort for the first 2 weeks of April. First trip to Florida. Great location with lovely grounds. Convenient for all Walt Disney parks with free bus transport which was very efficient - never having to wait more than 10 minutes for a bus. Hotel room OK. Two double beds which were a little on the small side but fine. Housekeeping somewhat haphazard - some days towels were taken for washing and no clean ones left! Fridge in room which was ideal for keeping milk etc for breakfast cereal. Ironing board very useful too. We were in building 27 which was very close to all facilities. Food hall was OK. Avoid usual mealtimes if you don't want to queue. Quality of food OK and reasonably priced. Boatwrights Restaurant very good but need to book a table in advance. On site shop supplies everything needed. We avoided the main swimming pool as not enough sun beds. Smaller pools were much better - quieter and preferred by the children in our group. Pool always quiet in the morning and evening when everyone in the parks. Convenient for Downtown Disney boat transport although I wouldn't recommend going there of an evening unless you have booked a meal in advance - overcrowded! Overall, I would definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite Disney resorts!”
Reviews.Author: 1AvidTraveler
Reviews.Content: I absolutely fell in love with the Port Orleans Riverside resort from the moment I stepped foot onto the property! Yes, some of the rooms can be far away from the main area (and ours was one of them), but those Disney values of quality service and cleanliness were still there, and the resort as a whole was just completely enjoyable. The pool was themed and very fun, the poolside bartender was awesome, and there is even a little fishing hole where you can rent cane poles by the half hour--my husband and I thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. We also had an amazing dinner at Boatwright's, which only added to our great experience. If I ever stay at a Disney Moderate Resort again, this one will be my first and only choice!

Reviews.Title: “romantic landscaping!”
Reviews.Author: LAStravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for my honeymoon and my husband and I absolutely loved it! The grounds are beautiful. We stayed in the Magnolia Bend side of the hotel. You will really feel like you are in an old southern mansion by the river. We had a standard room, and the room itself is not amazing, but you will spend most of your time at the parks anyway and they have everything you would need for your stay as well as cute theming that fits in with the resort. Make sure you take the time to enjoy a walk through the grounds because that is what makes this place worth the stay. The shuttle service was great. The food at the food court is just okay...I would rather eat in the parks. There is a ferry ride that goes from the hotel to downtown disney and it is convienient and fun. Make sure you ask about discounts especially if you have triple A and pay attention to disney's value/regular/ and peak seasons you can get deep discounts if you go during the value season and the parks will be less crowded too!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: momof317
Reviews.Content: We went to Florida from April 6-12--Yes, it was spring break. The resort was beautiful, clean, and relaxing. Our three children, ages 7, 10, and 12 loved the main pool. We did take the riverboat to Port Orleans French Quarter to use that pool, but after an hour the kids wanted to go back to our pool because it has a better slide. The weather in Florida was not the greatest during our trip, but that did not hinder our daily plans that much. We did have to purchase jackets--very expensive. Make sure you take the warm clothes even if you think you will not use them!! We used the bus transportation, which I highly recommend, to get to and from the parks. When returning to the resort from the parks, we were the first drop off point which was nice. We stayed at Alligator Bayou building 15. This building is very convenient to the food court, boating, and the bus stop. We originally asked for first floor, but we settled for the second floor because we were able to check in at 1pm because the room was ready. Housekeeping was great. The room was made up by the time we returned from breakfast. The trundle bed was nice. The kids took turns using it. No complaints about it though. The food at the hotel was good, just pricey. But...all of Disney was pricey at this time of the year. This resort was absolutely worth the price--we paid $185 a night. We enjoyed the parks, but it was nice to return to a resort, not just a hotel. There were many things to do on the property. I highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Cozy101
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our stay at Port Orleans, early April, 2007. We had a great time. The pools were very nice, the staff was friendly, housekeeping did an outstanding job, check in was a very quick process, and the food court offered many choices for kids and adults alike. I would tell people to stay here, without hesitation. Thanks for a great vist!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with Disney's Port Orleans Riverside”
Reviews.Author: BrooksSurrey
Reviews.Content: Stayed 31 March to 8 April 2007. Booked as an add-on to our Virgin fly-drive, cheaper than going direct. Spent a second week at St Pete beach in a condo. Hotel was everything I had hoped - grounds and landscaping absolutely beautiful, very relaxing feel to it. Hotel was very full as it was Easter week, but this did not cause us any problems, no big queues within the hotel. Food Court had just re-opened following renovation - thank goodness. This was fine, good breakfasts and nice meals such as freshly prepared pasta, roasts etc. We stayed in Alligator Bayou building 37, which was a nice location, not particularly near anything but the walk was so lovely to the pool and main building. There was a bus stop quite close though we often used the main one at the front of the hotel. Hired a Surrey bike for 4 and went around the bike route which was lovely. Perfectly happy with room, although did find double bed quite small - but OK! - and comfortable. Kids enjoyed pool although not ultra warm. Free bus services were very good, did have to wait a while a couple of times but generally very happy. We did also have a car which we used to get to Seaworld, Discovery Cove etc. Thoroughly recommend the hotel unless you require absolute luxury.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved this Resort!!!!”
Reviews.Author: stjohnnurse
Reviews.Content: We Loved this resort. We spent a week there with our four children. Last year we stayed at a value resort. This hotel was worth the extra money to upgrade. Our room was nice and clean. We had plenty of room for the kids. We had a fridge, coffee pot and ironing board in the room. Items we did not have at the value resort. This resort was much quieter than the value resort even though it is bigger. We loved the boat ride to downtown disney. We were a little worried after reading the mixed reviews. You will not be disappointed. The kids loved the pools. We did not have to wait long for buses. We went during winter break which is one of the busiest times of the year. The longest we waited was maybe 15 minutes. We can't wait to go back next year. We would definately stay here again. My husband is very picky about hotels and even he loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel-Good value for WDW”
Reviews.Author: tsrny2nc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at POR April 1-6, 2007. It was a great experience. I was definitely a little worried after reading many mixed reviews on this and other websites. But, I'd have to say that we had virtually none of the problems that others complained about. Our room was very clean and comfortable. We stayed in Acadian House 8261 which was convenient to the food court, main pool and had its own quiet pool as well. Our room was about a 3-4 minute walk to the parking lot and the bus stop. Not bad. The room was extremely quiet - we heard no noises except for the air conditioner, which worked just fine. You could occasionally hear a toilet flush in one of the surrounding rooms, but it was definitely not loud enough to be disturbing. Housekeeping was good - no towel animals, but they arranged all of the kids' stuffed animals every day. And we always had enough towels and toiletries. The rooms are small in the hotel, and the full-size bed was a little small for my husband and I! Since it was Spring Break, the lines at the food court could sometimes be long - but we expected nothing less. It was one of the busiest weeks of the year at WDW and we encountered lines wherever we went all week. The food at the food court was o.k. Sometimes very good, sometimes just adequate - but again, no surprises there. We were on the dining plan, which I strongly recommend. We definitely saved a lot of money on food over the course of the week. The grounds at POR are lovely - very lush and beautifully maintained. We took the boat to Downtown Disney, which was very pleasant. We never had to wait more than a few minutes for any transportation from or to POR. I would say 20 minutes was the longest we waited. We sometimes had to stand on the way back from the Parks to the hotel, but again, it was an extremely busy time. All in all I would say that we would definitely return to POR.

Reviews.Title: “Not like it used to be”
Reviews.Author: airline_employeeOhio
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at Port Orleans Riverside. I could tell that the quality of service has declined in the last five years. We were there from Mar 21st - Mar 26th 2007. The food court opened up our second day there. We were never told it would be closed when booking. We were given a map and then dragged our own bags all the way across the resort property. I remember when they used to put you in a stretch golf cart, and show you to your room. The pools were always heated during our other trips. This time they were cold. Even when it was 85 degrees outside. I was happy with the maid service and towels, but I did notice mold on the back of our shower curtain that was there for our entire stay. All in all I would have to say that the Quality of service throughout the entire Disney complex has declined. Especially at Epcot, and Magic kingdom. My family has made its last trip to Disney and will now find a new place to vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, Loved, Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: ballstatealum94
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel with small children and we absolutely love it! The pools are easily accessible and the staff paid lots of attention to our kids adding to the enjoyment. We love using the bikes and boats available for rental. The disney transportation can't be beat - we didn't need to move our car all week!

Reviews.Title: “Wow,its beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Sleekgal
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous booking here with so many mixed reviews. We were so glad we stayed here. We stayed in the bayou area nearest the food court building. The room was nice, a little on the dark side. But was very clean and quiet. We had a pool and landuary next to our building and about a two minute walk to the main pool. We really enjoyed the boat ride to downtown Disney and seen parts of Disney I did not know about. You could spend alot of time just exploring the grounds. We have stayed at the Cribbean Beach resort and found we liked Port Orleans better. We didn't use the food court here, but we did eat at Boatwrights. The food here was the very best. We wished we had booked more meals here(we were on the dinning plan). Overall this was a wonderful property with great service. We did not run into the problems other have when staying here. I would be careful which building I booked as it could be rather far from the main building and bus stops.

Reviews.Title: “Best for the money!”
Reviews.Author: amfpvks
Reviews.Content: Our extended family (10) spent five great nights at POR recently. We've stayed at most resorts in WDW and keep coming back to POR. It, along with it's next door, smaller sister, POFQ are the best buys in WDW! Check in can take some time but they seem to move people through quickly. The staff is very friendly and accomodating as possible. We've noticed that, just like everyone, when people are nice to them, they will bend over backwards to help you. The property is large but it doesn't feel so. The grounds are beautifully landscaped and grouped around smaller quiet pools. Rooms are good sized with refrigerators (comparable to a Hampton Inn or Fairfield Inn but more nicely decorated). The food court is large with plenty of seating. Even at the busiest of times they move people through quickly. Check out the River Roost Lounge for drinks and entertainment Thursday through Saturday nights (great piano player who involves the audience). If there is a down side then it's the bus system. Seems you can wait a good while in the AM. However we always get the AAA Diamond parking pass (free, just ask your local office) and drive right to the front of every lot next to the handicap parking in each park. Thus we come and go when we want. I still think having a car makes the WDW experience better. One of these days we may win the lottery and stay at the Grand Floridian. Until then, we will continue to go back to POR.

Reviews.Title: “Good Looking Hotel, Enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: MsLindsey2
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Port Orleans, Riverside in early January. The grounds were good looking as was the room. I wouldn't say anything was particularly spectacular. Though, then again, we didn't stay in the room very long. Check-in was quick, check-out was a breeze. There were no issues with the room or anything else for that matter. A great deal for a good night's sleep in a beautiful atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Disney magic”
Reviews.Author: BigDaddyUk
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel. We liked it so much in 2004 that we came back to the same hotel this time. Thats not something we've ever done before in the last 20 years! Booked it through Virgin as we get a frequent Virgin discount and getting discounts on Disney properties is very hard. The hotel is much as it was last time. The Disney Magic is still there and we wouldnt stay anywhere but a Disney hotel - the attention to detail and the quality of all the staff is just so good and really makes your holiday. We stayed in Aligator Bayou which is a fantastic location near the food court and buses to Disney. Some of the other Bayous are a fair walk, but the grounds are so immaculately prepared that its a pleasure to walk through them. They even have bike hire and horse and carriage rides through them so that is part of the attraction. The main pool is lovely with a water slide and was warm enough to swim in January. The boat hire is great - all different sizes from 2 man up through 10 man to a big public boat to Downtown Disney. The only problem was the food court closed for refurb. They had a minimal food service and we only used it once as it was poor quality. You can use the court at the French Quarter though. The rooms take 5, although our kids are bigger now and I think next time we will have to move to either 2 rooms or something bigger as we felt a bit squashed. It probably means we wont go back there next time and in any case its time for a change. We'll certainly treasure the memories and can recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: evp3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans during the third week in March. It's a great hotel. The rooms were a great size and yes you can hear everyone's toilets flushing but just every now and then. We had a king bed and it was huge and pretty comfy. The landscaping was very pretty and the resort is HUGE. We were lucky to get a room right next door to the lobby which is what you should try to ask for. Room has a frig which was a nice touch. It was building 14, it's a short walk to the lobby and it's close to the first bus stop so you can be sure to get a seat. We bought the refillable mugs for about $10 and very useful, and very short walk for us to refill because of our great location. The main pool wasn't very warm even though it's supposed to be heated. There is a very hot hot tub though. The food court was just renovated so it's nice and clean, but somewhat pricey. Also you can rent boats to take around the river. Boats from 2 ppl to big 10 foot boats for the whole family which was a blast. Also can rent bikes for 1 up to 6 ppl. The bus services were wonderful, the longest wait was 10 min and you can also take a boat to downtown disney which was fun and different. All around a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it!”
Reviews.Author: Jerseychic
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the ground floor, courtyard view. Comfortable, fresh and clean room, clean bathroom, soft towels, hair dryer, complimentary shampoo and Mickey soap, good service, very beautiful grounds with flowers and fountains. It was nice taking the boat over to Downtown Disney. The only downside was that you need a reservation to get in the restaurant and the food court was under renovation and I wasn't that thrilled with it. We ate at the French Quarter food quart on our first day and that was very good. We also used the French Quarter pool. My 6 yr old son LOVED the dragon slide. I would stay there again and would recommend to family and friends. However, with so many resorts to choose from I'd probably try out another resort next trip to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “not the Disney Quality you would expect.”
Reviews.Author: expertguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this location on a business trip. The hotel staff were not very knowlegable about the the activies as well as transportation. during the stay and when I left not one person ever asked me how my stay was. maid service was poor-I think they never dusted the room in the last year or so, as the dust looked like tumbleweeds iaound the wals of the room. they only emptied the trash cans once during a multiple night stay, never cleaned the "in room" coffee pot after it was used. the room was ok, at least the linnens were clean and there were no Bed Bugs to worry about. the electrical lugs were so old that if you tried to plug in your cell phone charger the receptical would almost push into the wall- overall, I was very unhappy with the apparent lack of customer service. I had to be int he lobby at 5:30 to catch the shuttle and there was no coffee to be found,...they never offered to even bring my bags to my room when I checked in nor did they offer to bring me to the room via cart, whichw as available to guests-if you did not ask they didn't tell. .

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pdelis50
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March 2007 as a last minute place as my flight back to NY from a business trip was cancelled and I was stuck in Orlando, Everything was smooth, from check in to Room, to buying a theme park ticket, bus to Epcot and a dinner reservation, Grounds were nice and relaxing and the rooms were very clean and fine.Staff were very friendly. The only thing is could possibly see happening is that perhaps in the hotter months, it looks like it COULD get buggy. ( like by the river) But I didn't experience any of that in March. Also as part of the WDW resort, you can get the extra hours from the theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Disney property in our budget!”
Reviews.Author: Gallaghermom
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans Riverside is by far my favorite Disney property. We can't afford the super expensive ones, but I would prefer this one over many of the higher priced ones anyway. There is a central pool with a slide, beautiful landscaping, smaller pools all over the place and a theme to the entire location. One evening in the late 1990s, we were able to park our stroller at the piano bar and have a few drinks with the baby sleeping in the stroller. We weren't the only ones there that were enjoying a "night out" with young ones nearby. And, I LOVE being able to park my car when I get there and never look at it until we leave. The Disney transportation is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Limited Food Service at Port Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: Kapw
Reviews.Content: Great theme and room size, but terrible food service. The dining room was always booked, even though many empty tables were visible, the quick service food court was closed, and the bar had a very limited appetizer menu (nothing for kids) that ended at 10 p.m. - right when you were coming home from the park, looking for a snack. They had pizza delivery service that never materialized after a 1and a half hour wait. The staff never informed us that food was limited when we booked this trip, and the management team was fairly unresponsive. Would likely not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “POR - March 7 - 9, 2007 - GREAT Property!”
Reviews.Author: cpeterstx
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from the Port Orleans Riverside property and completely love the place. The landscaping and decor really make you feel as if you are in the old south walking down River Road in Louisiana. We requested a river view room with a refrigerator. At check-in, we did not encounter any long lines or delays. The service was very friendly and chatty [a nice departure from last time at the Polynesian (see previous review at the Poly)]. At check-in, I requested a King room if they had any. They did but they did not have one ready right away (it was 10:30am, so not too surprised). She was very apologetic about it even though I didnâ€™t think it was big deal at all. We gave our luggage to the bell staff and left for the parks. Upon our return to property, we got our room number and went to our room. The room was very nice. It was smaller than our room at the Polynesian but that didnâ€™t surprise me, but was plenty big for the two of us. The bed was very, very comfortable. We were in the first building on the Riverside side. We had a very short walk from our door to the lobby area. The ONLY complaint that I have about the property is the fact that the walls are pretty thin. In fact, my wife and I were treated to the symphony of other guests using the facilities. If we had a musical accompaniment, we would have called it â€˜Fartasiaâ€™. Again, though, this is a very minor complaint and actually was more funny than annoying. We started our days by having breakfast at Boatwrightâ€™s. It was very good. Try the Sweet Potato Cakes with the honey-pecan butter. Yummy!! My wife ordered two eggs for breakfast and when she got her plate, it was overflowing with eggs. She asked me if they were serving Ostrich eggs. The portions are very generous; most could probably split a breakfast. During our stay, we also rented the small water craft and puttered around the river. Very nice. Watch out for the â€œdock masterâ€� who takes you to the boat, gives you your life jacket, etc. He was a bit gruff around the edges. Also, if you rent the smallest craft, warning: the steering is not too great. To these boats a turn of the wheel is merely a suggestion and often not heededâ€¦ All in all, it was a great property and we would gladly stay againâ€¦and again. It was better than the Polynesian, in terms of price and landscaping. It was also, $150 less per night! We drove from park to park and did not take the buses provided but we saw them coming and going all the time so the wait for a bus must not be too long at all. We recommend this property for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Disney's Port Orleans Resort-Riverside”
Reviews.Author: JEANYLASER
Reviews.Content: I love Disney's Port Orleans Resort-Riverside will be great hotel has great room space. I can't wait to stay in this wonderful hotel. This will be a perfect 10 in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Fab - Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: tomandbarbandsam
Reviews.Content: Disney's port orleans riverside is a great place to stay. The accommodation was very clean and comfortable, the daily maid service outstanding and the pool facilities excellent. The only negative is that the food in any of the restaurants is quite poor so I would not recommend the hotel as your dining place other than getting a bagel or cereal for breakfast. The Disney transportation provided was reliable, comfortable and extremely user friendly, we used the Disney transportation all the time chosing not to get a car and would do this again. We also visited the Universal sights but just hopped in a cab, the cost of which was reasonable. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and couldn't do enough for you, particularly in the bar! The hotel grounds were a pleasure to walk through and overall we had a fantastic holiday with Disney's Port Orleans playing a major part in this.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon Location”
Reviews.Author: Tinkerbell97
Reviews.Content: I have stayed on Disney property before, but never with the attentiveness of the Port Orleans Riverside Staff. The room was clean, quiet, and comfortable. We were close to one of the "quiet pools" and only a short walk away from Old Man Island and the Main Building. The housekeeping staff left us little suprises to find every day and even gave us an autographed keepsake certificate commemorating our Honeymoon. The food court had a variety to choose from if we didn't want to eat in one of the parks and decided just to lounge around the pool. But, Downtown Disney was only a short boat trip away. (The skipper of the boat was entertaining and had more Disney knowledge than any other cast member I know.) We did not have a car on property with us, but the bus system was more than sufficient. The busses came in a timely manner and if there was a high volume of guests for any one park, they made sure that another bus was not far behind. Checkout included checkin with the airline which made the day much less stressfull.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Hotel - Stay On-Property for the Perks”
Reviews.Author: cvg_day_cmh_triad
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights @ Port Orleans Riverside - Room 8798, which is in the Magnolia section. As with all Disney resorts, the grounds are spectacular and the layout of the property is very nice. The rooms (at least the ones I usually stay in) are your typical hotel rooms, so don't expect anything extravagant. You pay a little more for these rooms for the perks of being on property, those being: -- Magical Express -- On-Property Transportation (Busses / Boats / Monorail) -- Extra Magic Hours For me, it was more economical to stay on property and make use of the free transportation than pay a minimum of $50 per day for a rental car. Back to the room, there was significant mildew on the shower head and some odd "purple kool-aid" looking stuff on some of the shower tiles that came off with some rubbing. So I requested that housekeeping try to clean that ickyness. Unfortunately, they never did, so that was disappointing, especially by Disney standards. The bonus to staying in this particular room is that I think it is the closest room to the East Depot for Disney buses. The room is set far enough back from the road that the small amount of bus noise is not noticable. See other reviews for pool, etc as I didn't get to do that much. The relatively quick boat ride to Downtown Disney was nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: ericm315
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort from 03/03/07 to 03/04/07 (3 Nights). I had made reservations by going directly through Disney World. I made hotel reservations and also ordered park passes for 3 days. If you are a Florida resident, ask the agent if they have Florida Resident rates for both rooms and tickets. I made out very well for both. I received a 3 day park hopper for me and my wife for 300.00. I booked the resort for 126.00 a night. When we arrived at the resort, the staff was very helpful, but the computers were slow and not processing the information fast enough. The room was on the second floor of building # 35 next to the pool area. The room was nice with 2 full size beds. I had earlier requested 1 king size bed, but the request was not fulfilled. We asked to be re-located to another room, but the resort was sold out for the weekend. The restaurant in the Riverside portion of the resort was closed due to remodeling. We ate dinner one night at the French Quarter of Port Orleans. WHAT A MAD HOUSE!!! It was total chaos, the staff were extremely slow to prepare food and pay at register. It took over 30 mimutes to get a small pizza and drink. A big disappointment. Disney World was very fun. If you want to get on all the "Good" rides at all the parks without really waiting, go when the parks when they open in the morning. There is little to no wait at all.

Reviews.Title: “an overall nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: lumpyLongIsland
Reviews.Content: The resort was a good resort for the moderatly priced ones. There was a wide veriety of food there. We did not go to the restaurant because we heard it was not to great. If you want a good meal, take a quick boat ride to downtown Disney and you will be happy. There are some great places to eat there. The boat ride was about 15-20 minutes if I remember. The hotel itself was ok, nothing special. It was nice to have the river right near the pool. The main pool was nice, but the private pools quiet and more enjoyable. Overall the resort was good. If you are planning to go to a "moderate" resort I would recomend the Carribean beach hotel, that was a little nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Other choices might be better”
Reviews.Author: grantime
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice, BUT... know two things we didn't going in. 1) Mosquitoes are terrible. It wasn't even high season for them when we stayed, but they are huge and bite! 2) Don't pay extra for a water view. The only way I could see the water was to step out on the balcony (which was more of a walkway, not a private balcony) and lean over to see the water. Everything else was very nice as usual with Disney properties, all you would expect: clean, great staff, all as advertised. But with all the other Disney properties available, you might think about trying another site.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Disney”
Reviews.Author: BeachBunnie0830
Reviews.Content: I visited Disney's Port Orleans Riverside (for the second time) September 29-October 3, 2006. It had been a few years since I had been to disney, but going by what I could remember as a child I picked this hotel. It was everything I expected and more. As always Disney went above and beyond to make the trip an enjoyable one. It all starts when Disney's Magical Express loads you onto one of their Deluxe motorcoachs and takes you to your hotel of choice. Be aware that the transfer may take well over an hour and may stop at several other hotels in the same area. It's not such a bad thing as you get to see some of the other hotels you may want to one day stay at! Upon arrival at the hotel I jumped into the check-in line, which can be pretty long around noon. Unfortunatly my room wasn't ready but I was able to leave my bags with the bellman and I had my "key to the kingdom" so there was no problem going right to the park. My room was ready, as expected, at 3pm sharp. The resort will give you a number to call as often as you'd like to check on the status of your room. As soon as I opened the door I was pleasently suprised to see my bags had already arrived. Being a travel agent I was aware that somtimes it can take several hours for Magical Express to get your bags to you, but that wasn't the case with me. The rooms at the resort are clean and comfortable, but the resort is large so you can bet on a pretty long walk to the public areas if you do not go with the "preferred" room category. The lawns are well manicured and the people you run into along the way are usually friendly so I didn't mind the walk much. I love Disney. My personal opinion: Take the dining plan, and make reservations for the "must do" restraunts far in advance. Without reservations it's challenging to get into any of the sit down restraunts. The dining plan saved my boyfriend and I at least a few hundred dollars thorughout the stay. Also buy the refillable mug while at your resort, you will get thirstly laying by that pool and it'll save you money in the long run. Make sure you allow plenty of travel time from this property to any of the four main parks. The buses do run often, but the parks aren't as close as you might think. Also, if you're planning on leaving the park as soon as it closes you're in for a long wait. Throughout most of the day the same bus services both Port Orleans Riverside and French Quarter. On occasion there were two seperate buses running when the parks were closing, but I wouldn't bet money on that. I could say pretty much the same thing about any of the Disney properties i've been to, they're amazing. There's not a better way to go. For those of you who are thinking of staying somewhere off-site, don't bother... even if it does save you a bit in the beginning the experience won't be 1/2 as good and you'll spend a mini fortune once you're there. Go directly with a Disney resort and purchase everything you can in advance! You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Look for sticky ice bucket in room 2416...It's probably still there.....”
Reviews.Author: kittnluver
Reviews.Content: We checked in to room 2416 on Feb 22. It was very late. My husband discovered a baby blanket on the bathroom floor from a previous guest or from the person who "cleaned" the room. I called the front desk. They said "Oh my" and passed me on to 2 others who basically said the same thing. I asked for another room and got put on hold for quite awhile. I was told no more rooms available. They said someone would pick up the blanket the next day. I told them we were too exhausted to find another hotel and too exhausted to argue anymore that evening. The bed looked clean, so we decided to stay the night. The next morning I decided to try to get some ice. The ice bucket was stuck down to the table. Once again, I called the front desk. "Yuck" was their reply. I told them I thought it was coffee and sugar. I also reminded them about the baby blanket on the floor. We don't drink coffee and we did not use the table, but still.... I called and went to the front desk 3 or 4 times about this within the next 2 days. Was told we would have a VIP cleaning with inspection the next day. When we got back, the room appeared clean. Guess what happened after this "inspected VIP cleaning" when I lifted the ice bucket? Yep, it was stuck to the table. This time, I wrote a note and stuck it to the bottom of the ice bucket. It's probably still there. Disney, if you're reading this, check room 2416 to see if the ice bucket is still stuck down to the table.... The TV remote also died. Called about that too. They finally brought 1 extra pillow and left a pack of AAA batteries and a different ice bucket. They left a different ice bucket but did not pick the other one up! Go figure. Sticky ice bucket remained and is probably still there. Maybe they weren't strong enough to lift the ice bucket off of the table.... I would advise anyone going to this hotel to take your own cleaning supplies and your own pillows. Might also want to take your own remote batteries. Don't know for sure if this is a management problem or "got your money and just don't care" problem or what. Maybe they just don't understand English. The room was clean other than this ice bucket problem. And what was the deal with a baby blanket being on the floor when we got there??? That was so strange. Oh I almost forgot....there was cleaner or something all over the toilet when we got there. I told my husband there was no way I was going to sit on that. My husband used one of their bath towels and cleaned the toilet himself. Poor man. He drove all day then had to clean a toilet. We have never had this bad of an experience with a hotel room. Honestly, we are not picky people. We expected more from Disney. Advice to any future guests of this hotel: 1. Take your own cleaning supplies 2. Take your own pillows 3. Bring extra garbage bag for leftover clothes from the last guests...maybe you can have a garage sale.... 4. Bring your own TV remote batteries...type AAA 5. Take a chill pill and just have fun at the parks.... Seriously, if you need to ask for anyting, go up to the front desk and ask in person. Don't leave until you have what you need. Something gets lost in translation if you ask for it over the phone. Remember....you may ask for it this vacation, but you might not receive it until the next vacation...if there is a next vacation... For Disney's million wishes...I would wish for better hotel management or cleaning for Port Orleans Riverside. We stayed at All Star Sports resort one time. It was a much less expensive room and it was clean. Then again, that was 3 years ago or so. The drawback to All Star Sports is that it was noisy. Our room at Port Orleans Riverside may have not been well kept or clean, but by gosh it was quiet..... Other than that time we heard the neighbor coughing...and flushing...and showering.... Yeh, other than that, it was quiet....

Reviews.Title: “More Good than Bad”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTravelista
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Port Orleans Riverside after my husband's convention was over. We got a good rate of $130 per night. After reading some of the negative reviews I was worried but mostly everything was fine. Pros: Magical Express very convenient (they take your luggage directly to the hotel and you ride a free shuttle from the airport) Initial impression of landscaping and grounds very nice Boat to Downtown Disney very relaxing and a definite plus! Refrigerator in room Rooms were clean and no problems with housekeeping Shuttle to parks and Downtown Disney convenient Airport check-in very convenient Overall relaxing and quiet atmosphere Cons: Walls were thin- you could hear the toilet flush in the room next door Bedding could use updating - the sheets didn't fit well and a comforter would be nice, also mattress was too soft Closet with a closing door would be better Didn't get request for king room Long lines at check in/concierge/airport check in/bus All in all, seemed like a good place for families and a good value. Not a luxury hotel but that's not what you expect at the moderate level resorts. The conveniences of not renting a car and parking outweighed the long lines.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it”
Reviews.Author: TeresaFoster
Reviews.Content: We have four young children aged 1 through 11 and were originally going to book two adjoining rooms in Pop Century. The Disney reservations rep mentioned that we could also stay at Riverside because they have trundle beds. We decided to go for it and are so happy we did. We all really loved staying here. The grounds are absolutely spectacular - so lush and full of life. Our requests for a building relatively close to both the lobby and pool as well as on the first level were accommodated without question. The grounds are confusing at first; there are lots of meandering paths and it does take a little while to get oriented to the layout. The main pool and waterslide are terrific and you get to check out (at no charge) life jackets to use during the length of your stay. We did that for the kids and it worked out well. There are several things to take advantage of - fun bicycles (the one we rented fit all six of us; it had a basket on the front for the baby!), boat rentals to cruise around the river, hair braiding, an adventure cruise for elementary aged kids, campfire on Tuesday and Thursday nights, fishing hole, very neat playground, and perfect boat transportation to Downtown Disney. The food at the sit-down restaurant was very, very good but a bit limited. When I wasn't hungry for one of their hearty adult dinners, though, they let me order from the kid's menu without any fuss. Unfortunately, when we were there, the food court was closed for remodeling. Instead, they had a buffet that was reasonably priced but not all that great. It was fine for one time but I can't imagine people would have gone back more than once (the menu stayed the same every day). We had the opportunity to see a couple other resorts - Key West and French Quarters - and really liked Riverside much, much more. Riverside has more of a natural, rustic feel to it, which is what we prefer. It's a Tom Sawyer/Huck Finn-like atmosphere. There aren't any bright colors or funky statues at Riverside. It all depends on what you're after though. If you're into Mardi Gras, you'd probably love the French Quarters. Our kids got a big kick out of all the fun and lively statues when we went there for breakfast. Our in-laws stayed on the Plantation side; we stayed on the Alligator Bayou side. Definitely strongly preferred the Alligator Bayou side, which had more lush landscaping and more pleasant walking paths. Tip: If you're taking the shuttle bus to the parks, pick it up at the lobby station. The bus will stop at other places around the resort. The lobby station is the first stop so you should definitely get a seat. After that stop, you may have to stand or wait for another bus. One warning - if you stay here, be prepared to meander your way everywhere. Direct paths were definitely not a priority when they designed this resort. Usually it was fine and actually quite pleasant because the setting is so incredibly beautiful. At the end of the evening when everyone was exhausted and when hauling all the luggage to the lobby for check-out, though, it was frustrating. We would definitely stay here again without hesitation! For the price paid, it can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Save Your Money!! ”
Reviews.Author: Buddybelly
Reviews.Content: Please do not go to this hotel. My Husband and I have been to Disney several times. This was our first trip with our 2 year old Son. After waiting in line for check-in, we were informed that our room would not be ready until "after 4pm, at least" due work being done on the room. After letting them know that it was not acceptable we were given another room (Blg. 14). Just by looking at the old, smelly lobby & level of service we knew this was not going to be a good stay. The room was small, run down & slightly dirty. The walls were paper thin. We requested bedrails for our son and were given DIRTY OLD broken ones. There was no where to get food, unless you ate at Boatwrights The coffee in the room was never replenished or cleaned. All in all, The resort was a MESS!!! If you can't afford to stay at a luxury hotel, stay at the All-Star. At least you won't feel ripped off and/or dirty...

Reviews.Title: “Great Disney Hotel - Riverside”
Reviews.Author: csblinky
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at this hotel twice. We loved it both times. Upon entering the hotel you are greeted by a large and beautifully decorated sign in area that is designed like the inside of a 19th century riverboat. The sign in staff are friendly and there are pleny of people working to check you in. After you check in you get your "keys to the kingdom" which are how you get into everything at Disney, including your room. The rooms are spacious. We have 5 and Riverside has a trundle in addition to the 2 double beds. The furniture at Riverside is rough hewn log with the bark still on it. The decorations are very cozy and the rooms are very well maintained. Our area was a good hike to the main building where the dining and check in are. The food was good - as good as anything in Disney. We didn't bother with the 10 dollar mug. Some people think its a great deal, but we didn't want to fool with carrying it everywhere. If you want a really good meal go to the Trails End restaraunt at the campground. They have a very good buffet that isn't outrageously priced. The hotel has various pools spread out across the property and our room was near one of them. The pool was clean, they had a hot tub too. It wasn't too crowded and of course everyone is happy to be there. I find it interesting to talk to people in these areas because they all have their own story about how they love Disney. The grounds of the property are very well maintained. They had replaced virtually every wooden structure (benches, bridges, handrails, etc) with that artificial wood which is very durable and long lasting. Our room was a short wooded walk to the nearest bus stop. Our kids made a game out of counting lizards every time we went that way. One thing I liked about this resort was you could take a bus or a boat to Disney. They also have bikes, canoe, paddle boats, and peddle cars that you can rent to ride around the property. We didn't do this the second time around but if you wanted to take breaks from the parks they are a nice diversion. If you have that odd number of 5 people, and are on a budget, then this is the absolute best place to stay at Disney. We are going this year (April 2007) but are going to have 6 this time around so we had to reserve at the Pop Century... but my kids could care less and I know we are going to love it no matter what. After all - it's DISNEY. And Disney is a truly magical experience.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rdudik
Reviews.Content: We loved this trip!! We booked adjoining rooms, as we have a family of six. We had not one complaint at all. Beds were comfy, and we couldn't hear a thing from the room next door. The grounds were immaculate. We are looking to go back again this year, 2007. A+++++++ The Dudik Family NJ

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: robsocal
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Port Orleans Riverside the first week in February and really enjoyed it for the most part. The grounds are beautiful and very relaxing. Loved the river flowing by our room. The room itself was adequate, fairly roomy, ask for a corner room, you get an additional window which brightens things up a little. The housekeeping, however, was pretty bad. We had stains on the walls, room was was given a quick daily "once over." Housekeeping tip went from $5 to $2 on the third day of this nonsense, management really needs to work on this in my opinion. Plenty of lighting, temperature control worked very well and water pressure was good. Forget about the closet in these rooms, it's too close to the sinks to be of any use and doesn't have doors. Mini fridge was appreciated. There's no room service but one can order pizza, and it's pretty good. Food court is closed, but they do offer a limited selection of items. Boatright's restaurant was fine for lunch and dinner. The lounge area was a nice place to unwind after a day in the parks, and the piano player is a must see, he is fantastic! Bus transportation was fine for the most part. Buses were often full and we had to stand on many rides. The boat transportation to Downtown Disney is slow but that was OK with us. Keep in mind, this resort is HUGE! Like so many others, we got lost the first day on the way to our room, maps are very confusing, worthless really. Ask for a room close to the lobby and restaurant area, you'll be glad you did. We were in the Oak Manor section and loved it. You will hear toilets flushing in neighboring rooms, but overall they are very quiet. Looking forward to returning and would stay at the Riverside again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time will definitely go again.”
Reviews.Author: BCDisneyMom
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a 12 night stay at Port Orleans Riverside and would not hesitate to stay again. After booking our trip I started reading some of the reviews on this web site and was worried we had made the wrong choice. I read about the uncleanliness of the rooms, the poor bus service as well as the bad housekeeping. Nothing could have been further from the truth. The rooms were very well kept, we never had to wait for a bus longer than 10 minutes and the housekeeping did a great job. There was maybe one time we had to wait 20 minutes for a bus but that was at the end of a day when Magic Kingdom had closed and everyone headed for the bus at once. As soon as one bus filled up another wasn't far behind. The grounds at Riverside were also immaculate. After a busy day at the parks it was nice to come back to the peace and quiet of the resort hotel. The staff were very accommodating and ready to help with any question you may have. Because of the time of year we went the Food Court had a limited choice of food because they were renovating. We also ate at Boatwrights for both breakfast and dinner and enjoyed the meals. This was our first time staying at a resort hotel in Walt Disney World and in my opinion it was well worth while and recommend it to anyone considering it.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for us big kids, too!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaKara
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traipsed down to Disney, and we brought along three folks to do the World with us from September 30 â€“ October 3, 2006. This review of Port Orleans Riverside (POR) comes from the perspective of a straight couple (us), a gay couple (my best friend and his partner, who flew in from L.A.), and a single gal (my friend), so hopefully, no matter who you are, youâ€™ll find something interesting about this review! SNAPSHOT: Pros â€“ Great flexibility when it came to room requests; excellent theming. Cons â€“ Dirty towels outside our door for a couple of days. The Bottom Line â€“ Having stayed at all three moderate level Disney hotels, this is officially my favorite. ARRIVAL/CHECK-IN From the minute you walk in the door at POR, you are transported to the Old South. The grand foyer is bright, with ample lighting and soothing dÃ©cor that at once makes you feel at home. We arrived around 11:30 a.m. on a Saturday, and there were wall to wall people. Be aware that you get in the proper line â€“ we were waiting in line for about 10 minutes (the line formed immediately inside the main door) before I sent my husband to the actually check-in area to se if we were in the correct line. Turns out, there were two lines: one for hotel check-in, and one for people who were checking out of the hotel and checking their baggage into the Disney Cruise line. I would suggest that if there are massive amounts of people in the lobby when you get to POR, have someone from your party find the location of the correct line. Disney could help with this by having signs or a cast member to direct traffic. Once we got in the correct line, the check-in process only took about 15 minutes from beginning to end. There were about 20 people ahead of us, but there were cast members helping folks along at this point so that helped. The woman who checked us in went out of her way to be helpful, especially since Iâ€™d wanted to stay at Alligator Bayou. The problem? My best friend had flown in the day before and had checked into a Mansion room (POR is set up as two sections: Alligator Bayou â€“ more rustic looking rooms, and the Mansions â€“ more elegant, stuffy looking rooms). Lucky for us, the two types of accommodations are within spitting distance of each other, so we all got the rooms we wanted, and my best friend was a four minute walk from our room to his Mansion, Acadian House. Once the rooms were sorted out, we began the trek to our room in Building 38, which was about an eight minute walk from the front desk. ROOM QUALITY Which room you select all depends on your taste, though both types, Alligator Bayou and Mansions, are impeccably themed. Alligator Bayou has a rustic look to it (see pictures located at http://new.photos.yahoo.com/kvichko22/album/576460762387255041), while the Mansions, in my opinion, go for a more elegant, refined look. As someone who likes to feel comfy and at home, I knew the Alligator Bayou was more up my alley, and Iâ€™m glad to say the room didnâ€™t disappoint. It had your two standard beds (they said the beds are queen, Iâ€™d argue theyâ€™re double beds â€“ which seem to be a bit smaller), and a twin size trundle bed under one of them. The beds were very comfortable, and you sank ever so slightly into them. Thereâ€™s a good size twin sink area, and I liked that each sink was a pedestal sink that stood on its own, so you really could have up to three people getting ready at once (which we did each morning). I really liked the detail in the green and mosaic tile floor, which followed through to the bathroom. The room size itself accommodated three adults comfortably, and we could have fit a fourth adult in there with no problem. A trick I learned on our honeymoon that I used here was well worth it â€“ at check-in, ask for a corner room because you get two huge windows that make the room seem so much larger. We had a TV hidden away in the cabinet, and our room came with a nice little fridge, which held our drinks and chocolate Iâ€™d bought at the U.K. in Epcot. The housekeeping service did a great job in the room, though I will note that at the bottom of our stairs each day there seemed to be a towel or washcloth that somehow didnâ€™t make it into Housekeepingâ€™s laundry pile. No big deal, so we called the Front Desk, and Housekeeping came and got it. It kept happening for our first three days, though, so by the fourth day we were a smidge put off. By then, Housekeeping knew our names, so they actually went into our account and comped our dinner at Boma for the inconvenience. How nice of them! On a final note, once again, the refillable mugs that you can buy at Boatwrightâ€™s are completely worth the price (when we were there it was about $11.99 each). The three of us took turns each day going down in the morning to fill them up, and then at night weâ€™d do it again and keep them in our fridge. TIME OF YEAR We went end of September to beginning of October, and there werenâ€™t a ton of people. Besides the check-in confusion and mass people, the resort itself was quiet and not too crowded. We didnâ€™t wait too long at Boatwrightâ€™s for dinner, nor were the walking paths or pool overflowing with people. ON-SITE TRANSPORTATION The bus system, as usual, rocked. We always got where we needed to go with ample time to spare. We did rent a car, though, and I must say if you can afford it, do it, because parking at the parks is included in your room price, and it is quicker to get around. OUR PACKAGE Disney offered the free dining plan with purchase, and we booked that. As on our honeymoon, we did lunch at about 11:30 a.m. and dinner around 6:30 p.m. so we ended up paying very little out of pocket. I will say that the new dining plan (1 table service, 1 counter service, and 1 snack) pales in comparison to the Wishes we used in 2004, but Iâ€™m sure thatâ€™s just the nature of Disney tweaking the plan so that they donâ€™t lose too much money. At the end of the day, itâ€™s still a great deal, and it saved us quite a bit of money! All in all, we loved POR, and are now torn between POR and Caribbean Beach for our next visit! We cannot recommend it highly enough, especially for heading down to the World with friends! Best regards, Kara

Reviews.Title: “Left early and stayed elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Mich_AuburnHills
Reviews.Content: Would not recommend this hotel for many reasons. In our room the beds were squeaky and lumpy like hay wrapped in wire. I have had better beds at a Motel 6. The noise from adjoining rooms was loud and kept me awake at 2:30 am. There were beer bottles all over the balcony the next morning. The room was cute overall, but even it had problems including ripped bedspreads and the vacuum flush on the toilet was like being on an airplane, once again better quality can be had at a motel 6. The cafeteria was closed for renovations and the so-called buffet was not really a buffet. The servers chose what you would eat and what your portions would be. This is no joke and really happened. The main pool was closed several hours on the really nice day. The grounds are very nice but do not make up for the poor quality of the rooms and the lack of other services. Avoid this overpriced mess and stay somewhere else. On a positive note, it was very easy to check out early--they had no interest of why we were leaving early. We went to a hotel on Palm Parkway for half the price and with a nicer room with comfy beds.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: kberry2007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside for 1 week in Jan 07. We stayed in Magnolia Bend (as there are 2 sides of this large resort - Alligator Bayou is the other side). this was the most beautiful place to vacation. The resort was eye candy. The cast members were so polite and helpful. The rooms were fantastic, the grounds were exceptional. The horsedrawn carriage rides were fantastic. The boat rentals and boat rides to Downtown Disney were extremely nice. I cannot say enough about this place. The food was fantastic and the environment was breathtaking!!! I would recommend this place to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely going back”
Reviews.Author: punch-7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Alligator Bayou at Riverside in Port Orleans. The landscaping was lovlier and more lush than any pictures we saw. The rooms were adorable and beds very comfortable. The restaurant was very enjoyable and even though the cafeteria is being re-modeled Disney made sure no one went hungry!!! Staff very friendly, and rooms were very well maintained. The Disney Express is a "must", it made the trip much more enjoyable and relaxing. Luggage was one less thing to worry about. Good job!!! Suggestions: Put signs of which buses stop at which building eye-level and in multiple places. We saw a lot of confusion because people do not ordinarily "look up" and did not know which stop was for what attraction. We will definitely be coming back to Riverside this year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: M&SPhilly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Port Orleans Riverside for a conference held at the Disney Convention center. We were very disappointed with the service, food and room conditions. From booking the room to finding breakfast to arranging shuttle service, we felt like a cog in the Disney machine rather than a valued customer. Definitely would not return here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds - sprawling resort...”
Reviews.Author: donaldrees
Reviews.Content: As with all Disney resorts, expect great customer service and an extremely clean environment. Particularly, the gardens at Port Orleans Riverside are award-winning. You stay in either a Mansion or in the Bayou. I am not a fan of the bayou syle buildings and some of them are extremely far from the food court at the front of the resort. The main pool is nice, but certainly not the best Disney has to offer. The quiet pools located between the individual buildings were very quiet during our stay and I actually preferred them to the main pool. Bus service to the parks was just okay. We usually ended up standing en route to the parks and back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Writer5595
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Riverside for 6 nights and couldn't have been happier. The grounds were beautifully kept, the resort was quiet, and our room was very nicely appointed and spotlessly clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and the food in the restaurant was excellent. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Wood5iowa
Reviews.Content: We stayed Dec. 23-29. Had a total of 22 in all. The rooms were very nice. My 13 and 19 year old even slept on the trundle bed. The resort was a little confussing at times to get around. We never waited very long for the bus to pick us up. The food in the riverside mill was good. It was worth getting the refillable mugs. The check in went very smooth having 6 rooms it did not take very long at all. 4 rooms were ready at noon already so that was nice. Magical express was great. Would recommend this place. We have not stayed at anyother place.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT - STAYED HERE 3 DIFFERENT TIMES”
Reviews.Author: SilverV
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Port Orleans, Riverside on 3 different vacations - twice in one year. I went in September, April and December. September can be quite hot - but after the 2nd day, I was kinda used to it. This is a large resort, with wonderful grounds. Take a morning or early evening stroll around the resort and you'll see what I mean. Take the boat to Downtown Disney - better than waiting for and riding the bus - adds to the fun. Speaking of Transportation - once you are staying at a Disney Resort - transportation to all theme parks is included. This is great - you never have to worry about a car. The beauty of this resort with the river and the manicured grounds really makes you feel like you are really away from home - what a true vacation should do. The food-court can be wild at times, but expected. It's a great place to people watch. I laugh thinking about it. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Large resort but peaceful with beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: Chinners
Reviews.Content: I know this is a bit late (we stayed here in June) but I thought I'd put my thoughts down. This is a very large resort, comparable to Carribean Beach in size. However, it is well dispersed and the grounds are extremely peaceful and well manicured. I have no idea what the garden maintenance budget must be but I guess it's huge. Port Orleans Riverside (POR) is the sister resort to the French Quarter which is about a 10-15 minute walk down river (and is a very nice walk too). The 'river' is actually more of a canal but is very wide, calm and winding and the resort is on both sides. We stayed at Alligator Bayou (AB), which are more informal buildings (2 storey, we stayed on the ground floor - no lifts here). The Food Courts and reception/shop are on the same side of the river between POR and FQ. The 'marina' is also alongside reception and this is where you can catch the boat to Down Town Disney and West Side. On the other side of the river are the 'mansions' which go up to 3 storeys and have lifts. In case you are wondering, the rooms are all the same size regardless; the decor is slightly different depending on whether you choose AB or Mansions. AB has a 'Disney Rustic' theme with patchwork quilts, faux wooden fixtures etc. The main difference is the landscaping - AB is informal, with winding paths, lots of foilage, little ponds etc whereas the Mansions are formally landscaped. I preferred AB as it seemed a little more "tucked away and private". We were in building 18 and did not have far to walk to the reception/entertainment areas. It's worth noting that, if you don't like walking, you'll need to be sure to ask for a room closer to the food courts. I notice a lot of comments are about the size of this resort and the potential for "remoteness" from the main buildings. Frankly, compared to the walking you'll be doing around the parks, I have to say this is a bit daft. Even at the far end of the resort you are really less than 10 minutes leisurely walk away - and it's a really nice, peaceful walk as well. I should put this review in context - we've (2 adults) previously stayed at hotels on Hotel Plaza Boulevard at Downtown Disney. Whilst decent enough, the 'on Disney Resort' experience was unbelievably better and the cost was not much more. We will only stay on Disney property from now on. The convenience in terms of transportation, extra hours at parks, friendliness factor and the overall holiday feeling were amazing. We did not eat at the food court although we picked up the odd takeout. The food in all honesty is just 'OK' but nothing special - mainly fast food with fairly large queues at busy times and is not particularly good value (Disney prices). Having said that, I can see how it would be useful for many families to top up before heading out. The restaurant was better although you really need to book. I had a very decent meal there. Look out for the freshly baked cinnamon buns in the bakery at the foodcourt too - available in the mornings and still warm and sticky. Yum. If you have a car, also consider Dennys for a large breakfast once in a while - more taste and half the cost and will keep you going till afternoon. There is also an arcade for the kids, boat hire of varying types (take a ride all the way to DTD is you want), a bar with a very entertaining guy (Bob the piano man who has you laughing and on your feet again in the evenings), and a decent enough shop with essentials and gifts. The rooms in all honesty are nothing special but are far from poor - they are comfortable for 2 adults but would guess they become more crowded for families. The beds were fine (trundle beds available in AB), the TV worked, the refrigerator was fine and you don't pay extra for the privilege, there are 2 washbasins and a smallish (but perfectly adequate bathroom with WC and overhead shower. The maid service we had was outstanding and had some nice touches too. It was my wifes birthday and a nice sculpture out of facecloths was made with a few flowers inside - on one occasion we also came back to find our 'Eeyore' and a Richard Branson teddy bear watching the TV, together with remote control in hand (they were watching the Disney Channel). We had no problems with unsatisfactory cleanliness as has been noted in some of these reviews. Regardless of the room sizes, I have to say that we woke up, showered and slept in them - we were out most of the time. If you are thinking of spending a lot of time in your room, go somewhere with bigger rooms. But why would you want to spend all your time in your room when out here? Transportation here was OK - at least when heading out to the parks. No longer than a 10-15 minute wait, and there are 4 stops around this resort. Coming back when the parks were closing was a different story - huge queues and up to 30 minute waits or more. I think the issue needs to be addressed. At other times it was fine. (TIP: the queues for FQ were a lot shorter - hop on one of those and walk from FQ to POR. If you have a car, consider driving as you are entitled to free parking). The boat ride to downtown Disney was great and we used it 6 or 7 times. Relaxing, peaceful, lots of wildlife and the odd yarn during the trip from the "salty sea dog captain". It's also worth mentioning there is plenty of wildlife in the resort (rabbits, ducks, birds of all descriptions). We only used the main pool once, It gets busy and you may also like to consider there are 5 more 'quiet pools' around the resort (3 in AB and 2 at the mansions). The pools were fine; if you get in early enough you may be sharing with the odd duck. Word of caution - lifeguards are only at the main pool. You can also share the pool at FQ if you wish. In summary, the theming of this resort is very natural. It's large but spread out and seems quiet in the grounds at all times. The food court is busier and more frenetic during "rush hour". The grounds are beautiful and worth walking around. The transport is generally good but watch out for peak times when it's fairly poor. The rooms are adequate and comfortable. The staff were friendly. If you've stayed "off-Disney" before, you'll be surprised what a difference it makes to be in the "magic"! We'll be back once we've saved again!

Reviews.Title: “Not again”
Reviews.Author: Lincoln8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel for one week and at another Hotel in Orlando for one week. This hotel was twice the price. The rooms were half the size, check in took 2 hours, taxi's couldn't find the hotel, and there was no service. Restaurants were very expensive and hard to get to, not to mention there were lineups for everything. This was our first and last time staying on site in Disneyland. Not terrible but compared to our other experience, it gets a thumbs down.

Reviews.Title: “OK Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: Tampa_FL_Girl
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at POR for two nights in early December. WE had originally booked the Port Orleans - French Quarter resort, but when we went to check-in they had no 'non-smoking' rooms available. As my children are highly sensitive to smoke, Disney was very accomodating and found us a non-smoking room at its sister property, Port Orleans-Riverside. We are local to the area (Tampa), but wanted our kids to experience staying on a Disney property. Our room was nice, but a bit small. There were two full size beds. One of the beds had a pull-out trundle underneath, which was good for our 3 yr old as the regular bed was pretty high off the ground and we were worried he might fall out. He was not terribly fond of staying in the trundle, so the next night we ordered bed-rails from housekeeping with no problem. There was a small fridge in the room which was nice to keep cold drinks or whatever. The bathroom area was ok, but also fairly small. It had two pedestal sinks and a built-in blow dryer. There was also an in-room safe. The property itself was nice, but we weren't there long enough to really check it out or enjoy it. We did eat at the food court restaurant one night and it was ok. One of the perks of staying 'on property' is the accessibility to the parks 'magic hours', which during our stay included EPCOT (stayed opened 3 hours after normal closing time for Disney resort guests). We thought that was nice & were planning to take advantage of this, but our kids were much too tired to stay up that late :( . We did not use Disney transportation because we thought by the end of each day the kids would just want to get back the resort w/o dealing w/waiting for transportation. Since we were a resort guest we did not have to pay to park at the parks even though we drove our own car, which was a nice perk as parking at the parks is $10/day. The only real issues we had with POR are (1) that at the time we were staying there, a large convention of Pop Warner athletes were staying there as well and the kids were rowdy and noisy until all hours of the night and (2) the toilets flush Very Loudly in both your own room & you can hear them in other nearby rooms as well.
