Though it was nice to stay 'on property' I think there are several resorts in & around Lake Buena Vista that are also nice & offer a better value than staying on Disney property (our in-laws stayed at Hawthorne Suites in LBV & had a much bigger place w/a bedroom, separate living room area, kitchenette, etc. for about $50 less per night). Lastly, we went to the Disney's Very Merry Christmas Party one night & though it was nice, I don't think it is worth the extra money to attend.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Disney Property!”
Reviews.Author: Pudge
Reviews.Content: The last time my wife and I were at Disney was 1993 and until now have never stayed on-site. We booked our room at our local AAA office and received a discounted rate for 9 nighs. The Port Orleans Riverside is a beautiful resort. It has a very peaceful setting and a river runs through it. Before booking, we were debating whether to stay here or Coronado Springs and were glad that we chose Port Orleans. We visited Coronado Springs out of curiousity and although it is nice, I think we would have gotten sick of it after a few days. The Port Orleans Riverside resort has two themed areas - The Alligator Bayou and The Mansion section. We requested a room in the mansions and received it, although we ran into one snag. Being both non smokers (the majority of the rooms are non smoking), we requested and received a non smoking room overlooking the river. Upon entering the room, it reaked of smoke. Why on earth would someone smoke in a non smoking room and spoil it on everyone else? Anyway, my wife suffers from asthma and could not stay in this room. We finally ended up with another room facing the river that did not smell, in fact it was very clean. After this minor setback, the rest of the trip was smooth sailing. We were not on the meal plan and did not use Disney transportation so I cannot comment on those things. We like to have a car to be able to come and go as we please. We did eat in Boatwrights one night and the food was just ok. We preferred the food court at the French Quarter over Riverside. The rooms have a small refigerator, iron and board, and in room safe. It is also a big plus having two separate sinks. It is very nice walking around the resort early in the morning or late at night. The resort has a very relaxing feel to it and is well shaded. We even rented a boat at the resort. I also felt that this resort has that Disney feel to it. I did not feel that at Coronado Springs. I was very happy with the stay and would not hesitate to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A magical family vacation at Port Orleans Riverside”
Reviews.Author: emindc
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here for a six day/five night Disney adventure during the first few days of December. Our family stayed at Port Orleans on a similar trip two years ago and we were delighted to return to this wonderful resort. The resort is quite large and far flung, which has advantages and disadvantages, as others have noted. Advantages: buses come frequently and we never had to wait long, no matter where or when we were going; landscaping is beautiful and wildlife bountiful; relative quiet. A disadvantage is that sometimes it can be quite a long walk from guest room to dining, front desk and other services, with long waits at peak times. Check in was efficient and my son watched movies on the TV in the lobby while I got situated. Had to return when I inadvertently deactivated my room card a few days later (tip: don't let your key card get near your magnetic clip-on sunglasses!) and also got through quickly. Our room was in Alligator Bayou 35. We found the room comfortable and clean. Each room now contains a mini-refrigerator, which ran a bit cold but did the job. There is a coffee maker with free coffee packs to make your own java. Housekeeping left my son quite a towel menagerie, to his delight. Lots of choices on the TV, of course heavy on the Disney/ABC offerings. We had a guest laundry and pool nearby which were never crowded and quite inviting. I was amazed at how quiet the room was, given that a Pop Warner football/cheerleading competition was going on at the time of our visit, with many large groups in our area. We never heard a peep once inside our room. My only disappointment was our one meal at the food court -- definitely nothing to rave about. But with so many dining choices at Disney, most of which we loved, it was a small problem for us. On a more general note, we found this to be a great time to visit Disney -- the Christmas decorations enhance the magic, but the crowds are light and the parks very enjoyable. Overall, I think this property is an excellent value for the money. I can't compare Port Orleans to other Disney Resorts -- since we discovered this one, we have not been tempted to stay anywhere else! Hope you enjoy the magic as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Sooooo Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: bluegardenia
Reviews.Content: The last time I went to WDW was Grad Nite 1989! For 17 years I had been look forward to going back, and now that my daughter is almost 4, what better time! I made my reservations in June and the Disney Travel Agent was telling me that each room is cleaned top to bottom, including NEW, CLEAN bedspreads, before a new guest checks in. Well, I'm one of those hypergermaphobs and I felt that for once, I could stay at a hotel and not be preoccupied with wiping down every surface before I touch it! WRONG Anyway, we get to the hotel, Thansgiving night around 6. There are only 2 people working the check in desk and 5 working the Concierge desk. I waited in line 20 minutes or so and was helped by a young lady earning her ears. Check-in went smoothly enough. Drove to our room, Aligator Bayou Lodge 18, room 1809. We didn't know how to have anyone help us with our luggage (BELL SERVICES ONVIOUSLY) and we made 5 trips from the parking lot to our room. No big deal, been in the car all day! The ROOM: OK, given the expectations I had about the cleanliness of the room - I about cried when I saw it. The carpets hadn't been vacuumed from the previous occupants, the refrigerator door had smudges on it, there was toothpaste on the ledge, soap in the sink, dirt and hair on the floor, etc. etc. I called the front desk to complain, they couldn't switch us to another room, so they sent housekeeping. WONDERFUL ladies. Bent over backwards to please me. My anxiety level contained, my husband, daughter and I ventured to the hotel to eat. BTW, the room was great when we came back. However, I can't believe I didn't notice that they put us in a SMOKING ROOM until I was in bed. I requested Non Smoking........... My fault for not noticing.... Make sure you purchase the dining plan - so worth it. Food court food pretty good. Make sure you purchase the refillable cup. Worth the money. The world famous WDW customer service didn't rear its beautiful head to those we interacted with. However, the people who went out of their way to be pleasant and smile are the ladies who cleaned our room the first night, Claudinette in the hotel gift shop and Michelle from Howell, MI with housekeeping. The grounds of the hotel were beautiful. Wish I had more time to walk around. The buses were not a problem. We got where we needed to go without a problem. However, the cleanliness of the monorail late at night was GROSS!!!!! And some of the attractions at the Magic Kingdom were littered and dirty. Very disappointed in the cleanliness in general. We had a terrific time at the Magic Kingdom. NO LINES at 9a in the morning!!!! Weather was cool and beautiful. It was wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, quiet retreat”
Reviews.Author: topazcat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at POR with my husband and 3 kids for two weeks end Oct, beginning Nov. The rooms were quite spacious even for five of us and they were spotless. Housekeeping was excellent, plenty of towels and toiletries, we even got a duck and toothbrush holder and when it was my birthday, a birthday cake, all made out of facecloths. A really nice touch. The resort was beautiful and again clean and well maintained. Everything was really convenient, there was a quiet pool just across the path from our room, also a laundrette which came in very handy and vending and ice machines. It was a wee bit of a walk to the main building which consisted of the lobby, bar, restaurant, shop and food courts but its such a nice walk with lovely views that you dont even notice. There is horse drawn coach rides round the resort and a bout that goes to downtown disney regularly which was great and it gave my husband a night off from driving. The staff are friendly and helpful, so all in all we had a wonderful stay at the POR and would'nt hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at POR”
Reviews.Author: Helen5791
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the POR 21st Oct to 10th Nov 2006 and really enjoyed our stay. This was my third visit to WDW and my boyfriends tenth time but our first experience of staying on Disney property. Disney has excelled itself with elegant buidings in a beautiful setting. We paid for an upgrade to a king room and it was well worth it. Other reviews have commented that the rooms at this hotel are small but this was not the case for us. Again other reviews have commented on the large amount of walking involved but we did not find this to be the case - maybe we were lucky as we stayed in Parterre Place just over the bridge from the main buildings. We found the room to be clean on arrival and it was by enlarge kept that way, but by the end of the 3 weeks the floor could have done with a vacuum! A cute addition was the ghost made out of a face cloth which stayed in our window the whole holiday. We also were left a couple of animals made from towels which is a really nice touch. One thing I thought was very good about housekeeping was that on two occasions we stayed in the room and put out the 'privacy please' sign and were not disturbed at all, yet clean towels, soap etc. were left hanging on the door - this was unexpected but to me displayed good customer service. Following our late afternoon arrival and smooth check-in (a short wait) we visited Boatwrights restuarant and were pleasantly surprised at both how quiet it was and how good the food was (French Onion soup and Jambalaya). During the stay we visited the food court on a couple of occasions and found the queues to be long and the serving staff dis-interested. The food was adequate albeit overpriced (although this was not a surprise). A must is the resort refillable mug if you will be staying more than a couple of days - you will easy make your money back and it's so good not to have to join a queue at Disney!!!! We used the boat to Downtown Disney once (in the evening) and enjoyed the relaxing journey - would recommend. We also booked a carriage ride around the resort but unfortunately the night we booked for ended up being windy and rainy (infact there was a tornado watch!) so it was cancelled and we just ran out of time to use the rebooking offered to us. As we didn't use any of the resort buses we can't comment on the service. We also rented a surrey bike and cycled round the resort which was enjoyable. We did encouter two problems with the check in desk. For a couple of reasons we had two seperate bookings of 10 days. When we checked in we made this clear and requested to stay in the same room for the whole 20 nights (as advised by Disney Reservation staff when the bookings were made). We were asked to visit the front desk on the day to check out and check in again. This wasn't as straightforward as it should have been and it was left to us to spot that we had been given resort keys for the first part of the stay again. This could have caused a problem if we hadn't checked and had just gone straight to use them in a park etc. It also wasted half an hour of the day. The second problem was a billing error for the first part of the stay which although not shown on the statement delivered to the room, was deducted from our credit card - this was quickly resolved when brought to their attention. Overall, staying on Disney property was a great experience but we will not be staying there again as for us the benefits (EMH, transport, charging to room key etc.) are outweighed by the extra cost (we would rather be able to visit Disney more and stay off property to make our dollars stretch that bit further!!).

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, but at a price”
Reviews.Author: r_ling
Reviews.Content: Awesome stay for 2 weeks. Arrived late from Las Vegas by a day due to ATC delays at Phoenix caused missed connecting flight. Arrived on Tuesday am at 0700, and check in was a breeze. Disney magic Express picked us up at airport and delivered us to hotel. No other customers at check in. Collected room key and was in room a few minutes later. Suitcases were already in room, having arrived on an earlier flight! Room was a lot more spacious than anticipated. After reading reviews about small rooms we were apprehensive. Dining table, 2 lounge chairs, king bed, TV, open wardrobe next to two sinks, plus bathroom/toilet. Riverside is a large compound, with 4 bus stops around the perimeter. Main bus stop was close to the block we got put in - block 17. Some may have to walk a distance to get to the dining room/lobby depending on the block you got put in. Rooms are clean, and the cleaner does a commendable job. The little one loves the folded animals left on the bed every night. On the occasions where the cleaner forgot, a quick phone call, and house keeping would deliver the 'surprise'. Room was adjacent to the small pool. Noise from the pool not a factor, as the loud A/C drowned out everything else! I slept through the noise, but Mrs was disturbed by the noise. Ended up just using the ceiling fan at night. Main pool situated behind the main building, and involved a walk of some 3-400 meters. Good slide for the kids. Checked out some of the pools on other resorts - the pool at French Quarter looks awesome, and great in photos, but the slide was decidedly short. Bus system for the resort was very efficient. One may not get a seat at peak times, and only ever had to miss one bus because it was full, and that was immediately after the closing of Magic Kingdom. Ferry to Downtown Disney via French Quarters also used frequently. If I were to criticise anything, it would be the food. They tend to be overpriced, and loaded with fat. After 2 weeks of eating the same fried stuff, we were desperate for some home cooked meals. The dining room was never crowded, and clean all the time. The refillable mugs were used very very often, for soft drinks during the day, and then hot chocolate during the night. Its a pity the refill bar close at midnight! Wound definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Some snags...but a good experience”
Reviews.Author: tryingtohavefun
Reviews.Content: This was my 7th visit to WDW...We just got back last night. Stayed from Nov.2nd - Nov. 8th. Our first time staying at the Port Orleans Riverside. Made the trip from Colorado with hubby, and three kids! Must admit, I mostly picked this resort because it was the only moderate that slept five. However, having been born in New Orleans, I was also interested in the theme. I had read a lot of the previous reviews on this hotel, and wasn't sure exactly what we would end up with! We have always stayed on grounds. A couple of times in the deluxe hotels and on our last visit we stayed at the All Star Sports....(that one did not impress us at all!) So we hoped a moderate would be better! Port Orleans was a big improvement. Used the magical express bus service from the airport. The line at service desk, and to board the buses were quite long! I was surprised because it was supposed to be a "slow" time of the year. ( I am beginning to think there are no longer any "slow" times) It was still very nice to use the bus service and they show a nice video as you ride. Once at the hotel-check in didn't go as smoothly as I would have hoped. None of my requests worked out. They had us in the mansion section, which does not have the trundle beds...(remember we had 5 people) so they changed us over to alligator bayou. I had also requested to be close to the main building...that didn't end up happening either. We ended up in building 26. However, when I saw the grounds and the room, I couldn't be mad! (Besides how can you be mad when you're at Disney?!) The grounds are very pretty. The buildings are really nice, almost like little apartments. They are set far enough apart and with so many trees and bushes, that from our room we couldn't even see another building. It is a LARGE complex and there is ALOT, repeat ALOT of walking....and the layout is slightly confusing, but if you are prepared in advance it's no big deal. Our room was clean, and I felt like we had plenty of space. At one point our blow-dryer conked out, and they had a new one installed within hours! We had the dining plan so we didn't use the food court area too much. The hotel has character, and is comfortable, and homey. Of course the kids loved the gift shop and the arcade. The kids got to see an armadillo one night, an animal we don't have in Colo.! We spent one evening at the River Roost to catch Bob the piano guy. It was a blast! Buses seemed to be a little slow this trip...Took usually 15-20 minutes to catch the one we wanted...and did have many times we had to stand. Tried the boat ride one evening to downtown Disney, it was a nice ride...allow about 20 minutes down and 20 minutes back. I really would recommend this hotel it is very pretty, however because of how busy Disney has become....I think our next visit we will go back to a monorail hotel. It can shave an hour or two off of "commuting" time...plus relieve some crowd stress! Snags will happen, so just remember a positive attitude is the key to a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Pleased with Port Orleans”
Reviews.Author: rogcol04
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3 night romantic anniversary getaway at the Port Orleans Riverside Resort. We loved it!!!! I originally booked the French Quarter but there was something about the Riverside that I couldn't walk away from! It was almost calling my name! Also I had read trip advisor reviews from people who had stayed at FQ and Riverside and stated the Riverside was much nicer! Those reviews were right, especially if you want romance and this is a trip for just you and hubby or someone special! The grounds of the resort were very well groomed and maintained. I did not know this but all Disney Resorts are even gated! That was a nice bonus as well. The rooms were very neat because of the theming. You really did feel like you were on vacation somewhere on the Mississippi! Ol Man Island pool was kept clean and refreshing although for some reason it wasn't heated even though I was told it was. It was actually cold and will only be colder as the winter months swing around! I could not fully immerse myself in the spa because I am 7 months pregnant but I put my feet in while hubby enjoyed the full body experience and it was awesome! The Sassagoula river boat to Downtown disney is romantic as well and convenient. If you have the time and extra cash, I'd reccomend doing the horse drawn carriage ride! It was very nice as well! We did not eat at boatwrights dining hall but did eat at the riverside food court and the food was surprisingly good for a food court! I had the Philly cheese steak which tasted just as good as any philly cheesesteak I have ever had. My husband had a double cheeseburger and exclaimed, "Yep, it's real meat!" He said it was pretty good :) We also shared a chocolate icing brownie from the bakery which honestly did taste like it wasn't too fresh, maybe made earlier that day. It was still not bad at all! Previous complaints of the toilet flus being loud are true. They are loud and will wake you up, guaranteed! Also previous complaints of the rooms being "dirty" are somewhat true as well. Like I said, the rooms were nice and well themed but they did seem a little dust laden. The paint on the walls definetely needs to be freshened up. It appears they focus their upkeep more on the exterior than the interior, I will say that. All in all, this is the only reason I gave this resort 4 stars as opposed to 5! The minor room flaws but thats it! It's just an older, moderate resort, that's all! We toured the Caribbean Beach, Coronada Springs and French Quarter and hands down, PO Riverside is the prettiest and most quaint/appealing to the eye and has a relaxing look and vibe to it. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “1st time at PO-Riverside”
Reviews.Author: DLH1959
Reviews.Content: Our group of 6 (ages 7 to 75) just returned from Disney World. We flew into Orlando and did not rent a car. As Disney property guests, we took advantage of the Magical Express (bus). We picked up our own luggage from baggage claim because the ME brochure stated it could take up to 3 hours to receive your luggage at your Resort. Our bus stopped at OKW, SS, PO-FQ, and finally PO-Riverside. There was a long line at check-in, but at least 10 registration windows were open so it moved quickly. We had requested rooms in the Magnolia Bend section, but were given rooms in Alligator Bayou Building 28. This building was too far from everything and we were very disappointed! The rooms themselves are average--2 double (not queen) beds, alarm clock, ceiling fan & AC unit, table/chairs, tv/armoire, coffee maker, and mini fridge. The bathroom has a privacy curtain, safe, clothes rod, 2 sinks, and a shower/tub. We utilzed the Disney buses to each of the parks and the Disney boat to Downtown Disney. We rarely waited more than 5 minutes and getting a seat was usually not a problem. We also purchased the Disney Dining Plan and highly recommend it. We ate at the Electric Umbrella and Coral Reef in Epcot, the Backlot Express and Mama Melrose in MGM, Donald's Breakfastosaurus and Pizzafari at AK, Wolfgang Puck Cafe and Planet Hollywood at Downtown Disney, and the Riverside Grille at PO-Riv. You are given a lot of food, but we definitely walked it off. We had several snack credits left over and used them in the Resort gift shop to "buy" cookies, pretzels, and candy (all must be $4 or under). These are great souveniers to keep or give away once back home. We were in Disney World for 3 full days and went to Epcot, MGM Studios, and Animal Kingdom (we had already been to Magic Kingdom in California, so we skipped this park). We enjoyed all 3 parks, but MGM was probably our favorite. On our return trip, we utilized the Resort airline check-in and received our boarding passes and checked our luggage, so we were able to skip these lines at the Orlando Airport. The ME once again stopped at FQ, OKW, and SS, so the trip to the Airport took 1 hour vs. 30 minutes. It was a nice mini vacation and we look forward to our next trip to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Riverside”
Reviews.Author: thewiganer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at POR for two weeks at end of oct(Half-Term in UK). Fantastic and beautiful surroundings, reminded us of Centreparcs in UK. Likes 1.Widlife around resort when running in morning.Rabbits, ducks, squirrels,various birds. 2.Refil mugs a must have and coffee is lovely, not too strong. 3.Two modes of transport. You can get to Downtown Disney by boat or by bus.(We tend to spend our evenings at resturants around there and strolling around having a drink from the kiosks) 4. Good, frequent transport too and from all parks. 5.Friendly staff, they always smile and greet you(but we have found this everywhere in Disney) 6. Nice but unusual food combinations for us from the UK(waffle,blueberry sauce and sausage together!!!!!!) tended to get things individually i.e plain bagel and side of sausage etc. Pizza was MASSIVE 16 INCHES!!!! and was delicious. Mickey waffles are great shaped in a Mickey face, nice touch. Dislike 1 Rooms are small compared with those we have stayed in off site but we knew this already and it suited us fine. We only tended to sleep there and only used pool a handful of times as we did the parks to death. As you can see not many downsides and I have been back two days and am already considering booking again this week. Disney properties continue the theme and make your holiday special, my daughter loved the Mickey Mouse and Stitch wake up call and the cookie making they did with cast members in the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for the price”
Reviews.Author: TheLeemings
Reviews.Content: Our family(2adults ,3 kids) stayed 21st Oct to 30 Oct in room 1751 .It is a great mid budget hotel that does everything you need for a Disney hotel,comfortable rooms,great gardens and pools, only complaint- queues at check in which is annoying and unneccessary,otherwise we would have no hesitation in going back here on a future visit if only to see the resident pianist Bob Jackson who is AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: “lovely resort a little like stepford.”
Reviews.Author: fluffysweet
Reviews.Content: after a 9 hour delay the transport was already waiting at the airport to take my husband , 2 children, mam, dad and myself to the first time on a disney resort. on arrival the receptionist give me a map at 3 in the morning, with cases ,to find the rooms myself. after half an hour finally got there, do not follow signs as you go 25 mins out your way. the room was manky ( dirty ) i may be a bit picky but the room needed a good clean.i was going to complain but the cleaner softened us up by leaving animals made out of the towels all around the room, the kids thought it fun to see what was left each day. the first morning we had a light breakfast which cost $60 the word extortion comes to mind as when we went to either sizzlers or the ponderosa on i-drive it was more like $20 for all you can eat. getting any where but disney was an ordeal, take note anyone who wants to get off disney as we became expert after the wrong details from hotel(they do not want you to go off resort) ,take the disney bus to magic kingdom get the monorail to transportation centre get the 50 to seaworld remember you need $1 notes for buses unless you cant get on and get a transfer so you can get the 8 up i-drive, stay at the stop you got off , to wet and wild then walk up universal blvd for approx 15-20 mins and your at universal or you could wait for up to an hour and catch the 43 which takes you straight to universal. or you could pay an extra $1 and get the i-trolley and get of at stop 9 and walk. back to the resort, it would have benefited from some sort of activities for the kids on an evening as all it had was the arcade which cost more money, i could go on but to sum things up beautiful resort but remember to hire a car and take your credit card.going back into a villa the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay a the Riverside Resort”
Reviews.Author: KJSLJACQUES
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at Port Orleans Riverside October 19-23, 2006 and had yet another wonderful stay! There was no waiting for Magical Express or at check in. In fact, we didn't encounter any lines at all. We stayed in room 9298 of Oak Manor and really appreciated the private pool. After a long day at the parks, it was nice to enjoy a quiet swim without tons of shouting kids. Boatwrights was awesome. Their herb crusted chicken is to die for! And at 4pm the piano player comes in and the whole resturaunt and bar start hopping. It was soooo much fun! As this was our 6th stay at POR my dd and I tried to do all new things. We rented bikes and biked over to French Quarter for swimming and lunch, took the horse drawn carriage ride around the resort, did the bonfire and campout and even rented the small watercraft to boat up and down the Sassalouga River. We really has a fabulous time. Housekeeping was wonderful our room was extremely clean. The only negative was that we had a 5a.m. Magical Express pickup and the airline check-in station didn't even open until 5a.m. so we couldn't take advantage of that convience. A hint to all newcomers to POR, we bring cereal, plastic bowls and spoons in our luggage and buy a milk at Fulton (the general store). As all rooms have complimentary refrigerators, it makes more sense than spending $3.00 on a small box of cereal at the counter service and wasting a dining option. We had a wonderful time and are booked to go back October 18-23, 2007. (if you're looking at doing something extraordinary, go see Cirque du Soleil La Nauba in Downtown Disney. That's worth making the trip down for by itself.)

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Cmoe
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Riverside and had a great time.It has a very relaxing atmosphere.We were fortunate enough to have a river view room in the Magnolia Terrace Mansion. The bed was very comfortable but it would be great if they provided the staff with sheets that fit the Kingsize bed...I think they were trying to "stretch" a queen size sheet as a bottom sheet...needless to say by the middle of the night we were on the mattress. The restaurant food wasn't too bad but the fodd court was typical food court fare. The boat ride to Downtown Disney was very nice. The buses to the different parks were great and ran very efficently.They could be a little crowded at the end of the day but that is to be expected.It would be helpful if the parents of little ones put the child in their laps so that other people could sit down too, thereby allowing more people on board...a 3 or 4 year old doesn't need a seat to themselves at the expense of others. The staff are very pleasant and very helpful. We ventured over to some of the other resorts and were pleased that we chose the Riverside. The Contemporary had no atmosphere, The Grand Floridian was too "snooty", The Polynesian wasn't too bad but a little tacky and we thought that the French Quarter didn't have the relaxing and inviting atmosphere that Riverside had.

Reviews.Title: “Many positives outweighed the few negatives”
Reviews.Author: DearJenn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans-Riverside for 6 nights from Sept 29-Oct 5. Overall, we enjoyed the hotel and the disney experience. We would return to hotel again in the future. Some NEGATIVES: Disney seemed short-staffed which caused slowness and lines...one needs to bring patience with them on vacation here. Most counters, registers and food court areas seemed to only have one employee and as soon as that person would leave to look into something, a line would quickly form. Upon check-in, we were given a handicap room. Luckily, the man told us that meant the room had no tub. This was unacceptable to me because I take baths. Initially, he was saying the hotel was booked and had no other rooms. This bothered me since I made the reservation 6 months prior and neither of us were seniors or handicap...so I don't understand why we were given a handicap room. After about 20 mins, the man did find us a regular room. Also, I asked for an extra pillow upon check-in and was told they didn't have any. Then I asked if I could get one the next day and I was told they still might not have one. I found this annoying... why doesn't Disney just buy a few thousand extra pillows for their hotels?! There did end up being a spare pillow in the room. After check-in, we had no issues with the hotel. The rooms could use new carpeting and new tubs...they are getting worn. They only give soap and a small shampoo, so if you need conditioner or mouthwash bring your own. The gift shop and downtown disney stores don't have a good selection of personal care items ...no zantac, no soap, no saline solution, no nyquil...so bring these things if you might need them...otherwise you have to go off disney property to buy them. And going off disney property requires a car. I recommend renting a car. We were in building 95 of the southern mansion section. It was the furthest building and took us about 15 mins each way to walk to lobby and food areas. Also, be sure to buy anything you need by 10pm, when the gift shop and food court close. There is an old vending machine near each building but it only has some chip selections on top and cans of soda on bottom...doesn't even have water. Some POSITIVES: No need to call housekeeping at all. Room was kept clean and new supplies were provided daily. We found no bed bugs, which was a concern after reading some reviews. The disney magical express was wonderful. Our bags were delivered directly to our room from airport and then from hotel lobby to airport upon check-out. We were also able to get boarding passes right in the lobby. So convenient. We used the disney buses, boats a few times to go to various areas. We didn't wait more than 10 mins and didn't find them overly crowded, but we did prefer using the rental car. The food was amazing. Boatrights was great for dinner. I wouldn't recommend breakfast at Boatrights though cause it isn't much different than the food court and requires using a "dinner" option with the meal plan. Food court requires a "counter service" option. The food we had at disney was some of the best food we ever ate in our lives. RECOMMENDATIONS: Visit the food court and pool at French Quarter for a change of scenery and it is less crowded than Riverside. Book dinner at Ohana in Polynesia resort for 8:30pm and you can watch the fireworks over the castle from the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans is truly 'moderate'”
Reviews.Author: 4peasinapod
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay in Disney World Port Orleans, Riverside. This is a moderate resort, and it is definitely not one bit higher on the scale than moderate. The rooms are TINY and nothing to write home about. The beds were very comfortable though, and we slept well during our stay. The biggest negative was the food. Being secluded and largely dependent upon your resort's dining, this place was not impressive. Our best meal of the entire trip was Cape May Cafe at Beach Club Resort. We're saving to stay there on our next Disney Trip. Location, location, location and food, food, food--Beach Club has it all, and Port Orleans has neither.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the money”
Reviews.Author: jjax
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside from Oct. 9th through the 12th. This was the last vacation my husband and I were going to take before we have our baby in February. Check in was fine - we arrived around 10:00am and were happy to find our room ready, but the person at the front desk who was "earning her ears" was not really helpful. She was very nice but did little more than give us our room keys - there was no explanation about what how to take advantage of property amenities. Our room was in the Arcadian building (I'm not sure what number that is), and it was about a 10 minute walk from check in with our suitcases. The room was a standard hotel room with two full sized beds and a decent sized bathroom with a separate area holding the two pedastal sinks. As mentioned in other reviews, the property is very pretty, and well kept. There are rabbits and frogs and lizards running all over the place, which is fun. Our room was spotless and comfortable, and our mousekeeper did a great job. She didn't leave us any animals, but did create a "cup" out of washcloths, and stuck our toothbrushes in it, which was cute. We ate in the dining hall for breakfast one day and dinner another evening. The food was surprisingly good, with a nice selection of items, and all of the staff members were very friendly. The other two mornings we ate at the table service restaurant, boatwrights, and we had the banana stuffed french toast - it was FABULOUS!! It is two huge pieces of texas toast, with a banana in the middle, which is then deep fried, coated in cinnamon and sugar, and served with a strawberry banana sauce. So yummy! We took a horse-drawn carriage ride one night ($35 for 24 minutes) which was relaxing and nice - the driver took us over to the French Quarter property for a different view. We also took advantage of the boat service to downtown disney, which was very convenient. The only transportation problem we had was due to some misinformation we were given by the front desk. We had dinner reservations at Boma one night, at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. We called the front desk to find out how to get there and were told to take a bus, which should come by every 15-20 minutes. After waiting literally 1 hour and 15 minutes (well past our reservation time), my husband called the front desk and was told that there are no buses from resort to resort. The concierge we spoke with was kind enough to come pick us up at the bus stop and drive us to dinner, which saved the night. Other days we took the bus to the parks with no incident, and very little wait. It is nice to stay at Riverside, as it is the first pick up stop, with people staying at the French Quarter getting picked up second. We used the Disney's magical express back to the airport, which was quick and convenient, and I recommend it. Would we go back to Port Orleans Riverside? Probably not, but only because I think next time we would like to spend a little more and have a hotel that was a little more centrally located to the parks, and involved a lot less walking to get to the restaurant and gift shop. We had a nice time, though, and would recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: acgurl58
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 9/24 to 9/28. After we checked in, it was a little confusing trying to find our room, we could have been given better explanation on how to get there, but we did find it. It is a very large complex! Just beautiful grounds but an average room, very small toilet/shower area. Everything was very clean though, maid service was excellent and the hotel and restaraunt employees were all very friendly. Boat ride to Downtown DIsney was very nice, but there really isnt much to do there. If we ever visited Disney again we would stay somewhere much closer to Epcot where it was easier to get back and forth to the park.

Reviews.Title: “Another great trip to Disney”
Reviews.Author: mamasitta6
Reviews.Content: First let me say I would never book a trip without first reviewing it on Tripadvisor!! That is how I came to choose the Riverside resort. The trip included my three daughters (16,13,6) and myself. It has become a "girls only" holiday for us and we try to make it to Disney World at least twice a year. This time we were there from Sept. 24th -30th. I was a little worried about some of the earlier comments but want to assure you this is an awesome resort. Lets get to the good stuff... We used the Magical Express and it was very speedy. No waits at the airport and there were only two other couples on our bus to the resort. Check in was great and Ann was a dear. We checked in but because we were so early, 9 am, our room was not ready. No problem, we would wait because they had us booked in building 14, the most desired location on property. Thrilled we decided to wait in the lobby. Well, one of the girls needed to get to the room due to becoming ill. I went back and they found us a room in building 17 that was available. Thank you!! When we arrived at the room it was freshly cleaned from top to bottom. My daughter needed her bags and they were brought to the new room within the hour. Again, great!! I can't say enough about our maid who cleaned our room spotless everyday. She left the 6 year old a towel doll, complete with legs, dress and even a bead necklace. The next day the doll was left with a puppy dog. Oh my too cute. The rooms were more than large enough for all of us and we did take advantage of the trundle. A nice suprise because I hadn't requested it. The ac and fridge were ice cold and we never heard a peep from anyone or any toilet as some had stated before. The grounds we found to be as clean and well kept as the room. We had a quiet pool right outside our room which was a nice end to a long day at the parks. We never waited more than 15-20 minutes for a bus from the resort or from any of the parks. But, had to stand on numerous occassions because the bus was so packed. We found the food court to be very good and do take advantage of the refillable mugs and dining plan. You will save lots of money. Make your reservations early for the best chances of eating where you want. I highly reccommend having breakfast in Cinderella's castle. We love you David. It was the best time at a meal we had during our entire stay. The food was delicious and you can't beat the atmosphere. We attended the halloween party which required a seperate ticket. Again, purchase your seperate tickets to any event early. It was awesome!! We all dressed up and let me tell you, the headless horseman was amazing. The rider can't see a thing. The horse is trained to run the whole parade route on his own with no help from the rider. I would have paid just to see that. It was tons of fun and disney does a wonderful job at doing it up right. The lines at the park were fast moving as well and the only real wait we had was for splash mountain which was 30-45 minutes. The girls just walked up to ride Everest a few times with no wait. Wow. Now lets get to the not so good stuff..... As mentioned before there is an airport check in desk. Good idea, yes, bad set up though. I had arranged the night before check out for a bellman to be at our room at 11:20 am. At 11:15 am I get a call saying they are running late and to proceed to the lobby for the airport check in and our luggage would be brought to us. Ok, no problem. Wrong. The line was all the way to the gift shop. I waited for over an hour. I was just two people away from checking in before my luggage got to me. If they hadn't have made it with the bags before then I would have had to start all over again becasue they won't allow you to check in without your luggage. There was only one computer meaning just one person checking all these people in. One person to attached luggage tags and one person loading luggage on a cart for storage or delivery. It was so bad that people were missing their buses to the airport because of the delays. I have used the airport check in at other resorts and never, ever had this problem. So be forewarned to allow yourself plenty of time or if you can have one member of your party stand in line for everyone. I hate to leave on a bad remark so lets not... This resort is one you should definatley try. It is quiet, clean and everyone of the staff we encountered was friendly with a big smile. You can't go wrong with the Riverside Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Riverside, cannot wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: asiacat1
Reviews.Content: My family of five stayed at this resort from september 14 until september 24 and we loved everything that this resort had to offer. Last october we stayed at the Nickelodeon suites and what a difference between the two hotels lets just say that we will never stay off site again. We used the Magical Express without any problems and check in was fairly easy except when we got to the Magic Kingdom they had not put a number on my sons card so we had to go to guest services to get a temporary card until we got back to the resort. The grounds at this resort are beautiful, it made the resort feel more private and relaxing with all the greenery around you. We used the main pool once and it was quite busy and being in building 17 it was quite a walk to the main pool so we just spent time at the quiet pool beside our building. We used the laundry facilities once and the dryers do not dry very well but the laundry area was clean. The boat ride to Downtown Disney is relaxing and quite nice we took the boat twice and really enjoyed it. The food court was nice to use if you were around the resort in the morning or early evening but as the night wore on the food area got really busy after everyone returned from the parks, we purchased the refillable mugs and these were wonderful we would fill it up on our way to a park in the morning and we would have a drink at the park and then when we returned we would stop to fill up before returning to our room and therefore would have fruit punch or lemonade if needed in the morning in the room before breakfast. The buses were for the most part okay, there were times at the end of the night that of course they would be busy when the whole entire park is leaving because the park was closing but they do their best and most of the time they had two buses at a time waiting. they always had lines of buses waiting one night at MGM we saw a guy directing a line up of empty buses to the resort pick up areas so everything seemed to move pretty good.The one complaint would be that they had a bus for Blizzard Beach and the Animal Kingdom to share i do not know if it is always like this but by the time we got to Blizzard Beach after picking up at Animal Kingdom the bus would already be pretty full. All in all though we do not have any complaints about the buses. The rooms were really quite nice, the trundle bed worked out well and my eight year old slept on it every night. the room is not huge but was okay for two adults and three kids we would basically just sleep there and were gone for the other times to the parks and water parks. Our fridge was great it actually froze anything put in there so we had frozen water to start off the day and it stayed cold longer at the parks. As mentioned before we were in building 17 which we thought was quite a walk to the buses and the main building i would try for a closer building next time but it was nice being beside a quiet pool which was not too quiet it seems that everyone needed a swim after returning from the parks which is understandable in the heat but not very many tried to keep quiet at midnight they would actually be loud and such.Overall we loved this resort and we are glad that Disney has a moderately priced resort for families of five and we wish they had more resorts like this so we could experience more of the Disney resorts and themes, but for now we are happy to return to the Riverside resort and hope to do so soon.

Reviews.Title: “shuttle system not what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: lauridale
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort from Sept 20-25. We had a nice time but there were some kinks in this trip. The first kink we experienced was using the magic express service with an 8:20p.m. arrival time. Nobody suggested to us that this was a mistake but we soon figured this out. The shuttle to the hotel was excellent with no wait time. However, the bags take 2-3 hours to arrive. This would have worked fine if it had been a daytime arrival but with little tired children this was a disaster. We had no clothes, no toothbrushes, toothpaste(thanks to new airline restrictions), or pajamas. To top it off we were given a room that had dead batteries in the doorlock so we were locked out of our room for over an hour while my husband stayed with crying children and I walked back and forth through the maze of buildings in the dark for each of three different sets of keys, none of which worked. They finally sent a repair man to the room who fixed it very quickly but it was now midnight. We shut the door and 5 minutes later after we had tucked the kids to bed in their clothes the bags arrived. Riverside did give us our first night free because of all the trouble, which I greatly appreciated. The shuttle system was VERY slow. It would take up to 40 minutes at times during the day to get a shuttle to the park, and we went during an off peak time. At the park we would watch bus after bus roll up and have to stop to load disabled scooter bound folks on the bus. This took approximately 20 minutes per scooter and on one day I watched as four scooters piled up in a line waiting for a bus. This caused huge delays. Disney shuttle service has never been this slow and I believe it is due to the increase in the use of these motorized scooters. I hope they will tweak their system to accomodate more disabled people travelling to their parks. Right now it is a disaster for all. If I came again I would stay at a park directly serviced by monorails or I would rent a car. The shuttle service at the end of a busy funfilled day sucks the magic right out of it. I also would not recommend using the Disney express if you have a flight time after 4pm with little children with early bedtimes. We also chose the dining program which is very nice but you have to book all your dinners well in advance because you will find nothing available anywhere when you get there. We found that the dining plan has filled up all the restaurants, even some of the ones that used to be empty like Tony's in Disney. All in all the kids had a fabulous time and the parks itself are as always wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Disney's Grand Floridian! (and much cheaper too)”
Reviews.Author: Dniedajr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside from 8/31/06-9/4/06. I must admit that I was totally pleased with the overall experience. We stayed in the "Alligator Bayou's" which were themed in an outdoor/lodge type manner. We previously stayed at this resort in 1999 prior to the construction of those lodges. Please be sure to book your stay at the Alligator Bayou rooms rather than the older ones that are themed like nineteenth century southern mansions. I have stayed at Disney's Grand Floridian, which is touted as Disney's flagship resort; for the money, you CANNOT beat Port Orleans Riverside. The boat trip to Downtown Disney is great. It is relaxing and convenient. The pool was great, fun little slide and all. The dining area was great to get a good breakfast before hitting the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with my stay at Riverside”
Reviews.Author: michigan007
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Disney's Port Orleans Riverside Resort (Sept 16-22) and were pleasantly surprised as the hotel itself exceeded our expectations. I was a bit apprehensive after reading some earlier posts which described the hotel as dirty and complaints of hearing toilets flushing through the walls. I found all of this to be untrue. We stayed in Alligator Bayou Building 15 which was excellent. While I did not put a microscope to the carpets, it appeared to be very clean (much cleaner than the Comfort Suites I stayed in the previous week) and I only heard a neighboring room's toilet flush once and the sound was faint at best. The room itself was outstanding, had a fridge, trundle bed, and a safe. It even had a nice curtain that separated the vanity area from the rest of the room which my wife really appreciated. If you do decide to stay in the Alligator Bayou section of Riverside I recommend building 14 or 15 in that order to be close to food court, main pool, and bus transportation. Also, be sure to request a first floor room. We stayed on the second floor and found the stairs to be awkwardly located away from the paths leading to the buildings which made for a lot of extra walking. Transportation was one of the few complaints I had with this resort. The buildings are sprawled out with multiple bus stops at the resort making for longer bus rides. This is the same way with all the moderates (stayed at Carribean Beach four years ago). Sometimes the bus would also stop at Port Orleans French Quarter but most of the time the resorts had separate buses. We seemed to encounter long waits for the Riverside bus when returning from the Magic Kingdom. One night after the fireworks we had to wait for three buses just to board while French Quarter guests experienced little wait. This was not fun with exhausted little ones. The pools were nice, the food court was decent, and all the staff was extremely friendly. A housekeeper actually let me borrow a disney bike to go to the lobby to get change. And if you stay here you gotta see "Piano Bob" in the Riverside lounge. This guy is like nothing you've ever seen. He sings on a moving piano and gets everyone in the action. Make sure you bring the kids cause they're sure to have a great time. We got the Disney dining plan for free when we booked but let me tell you I would gladly pay for it if I ever stayed at Disney again. We racked up over $200 a day in food and ate at some of the best restaurants Disney has to offer. I probably gained 10 pounds. We did have a problem one night getting back to our resort. We booked at California Grill atop of the Contemporary which was awesome, however, we had a difficult time getting back to Riverside after our meal. After the parks close the only bus routes are to Downtown Disney. We had to find a bus to Downtown Disney and then take the boat ride back to Riverside. This took over 2 hours!!!. Keep in mind that no buses run directly from one resort to another and some of Disney's best restaurants are in the deluxe resorts. This always results in 2 bus rides or a bus ride and a monorail ride to another resort. I really did enjoy my stay at Riverside. It's an excellent choice among the moderates and I liked the theme a little bit better than Carribean Beach. As far as I know the Alligator Bayou section at Riverside are the only rooms in the moderate class that offer a trundle bed (it's free!!!) so if you got 5 in your family like I do it's a no brainer. I think if I stayed there again I would probably suck it up and rent a car. If money is not an factor than I suggest staying at the Poly, the Contemporary, or the Grand Floridian because they're on the monorail line which makes for quick travel to the Magic Kingdom (Epcot by switching monorails at the TTC). For the rest of us Port Orleans Riverside is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “neat but not luxury”
Reviews.Author: edwin_f
Reviews.Content: I was at Riverside on the last week of August. It is a neat resort but not a luxury hotel. The magical express counter is a little difficult to find (besides the car rental). I could not see a direction sign in the airport. Otherwise, the magical express is very convenient with a few stops. I arrived at early afternoon; there were not a lot of people queuing at the registration. There was TV cartoon for my son to enjoy while waiting. We went to the theme park in the afternoon and the luggage already in the room when we returned at night. The buses to the theme parks departed every 10 to 15 minutes and rarely full. If I stayed until the parks closed, I might wait for 3 buses or 30 minutes because I had small children who could not stand all the way. I observed that the queue for the value resorts were significantly longer. I had called the resort for reserving a convenient quiet room before departure. My room was at block 15 ground floor which is close to everything, bus stop, swimming pool and restaurants. The resort spreads out quiet a bit of area. If you are far from the main building, it will take quite a while to figure out all the winding paths. The room is not splendid but clean. The room cleaner made towel arts of a fish, doll and a heart, pretty nice. Is it because of the tips I am not sure. There is an additional bed you can slide out from one of the double bed. It is very nice that each one of us slept on a separate bed. The air condition had some compressor noise since individual machine at each room as in most resort. The refill mug is worthwhile only if you plan to eat often in the resort. The restaurant and food court are rarely full. But we prefer to eat inside the theme parks which save time and more varieties. There is pretty nice food within Epcot. I joined the meal plan and they were all covered. There are some activities within the resort, even the main swimming pool, in my opinion, is not big. Because my main goal is to visit the theme parks, so it does not concern me too much. I believe because of the low season, we got very good service at low low price. Hope this information helps!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: storckyb
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the POR from 7/31/06-8/5/06 and we totally loved it!! This was our very first Disney World Trip. We have children 13, 9, 6, and 3, and they had a blast. We drove from Texas, which took forever and stayed in a two off site hotels for the first 3 nights. And what a awesome change..The off sites were HOJO's, the first of which was totally disgusting(Enchanted), the second was as hotels/motels go, but way better than the first. But I digress. POR was great. From the time we checked in, till the day we checked out. The staff was very helpful with answering questions a first timer had and housekeeping was great. We didn't get any special towel animals or anything, but we always came back from the parks to a very clean room and made beds. Now being a mother of four, when someone else makes your bed, you're just soooo happy!!! The kids collected the little soaps and shampoos, and they were replaced the next day. The pool was eh, a pool to relax at. The kids enjoyed it. As for the food court, well, it wasn't four star dining, but it worked just fine. We ate there twice, once for breakfast and once for dinner. For us it was a bit pricey, but it was Disney. We walked around the premises(when we weren't too tired), took the boat to Downtown Disney, and just took it all in. The bus system worked out greaaaattt!! Since we drove our own car, it saved alot on gas for us. But the wait wasn't long and I think the longest we waited for a bus was coming back from an Extra Magic Hour night which was only about 10 mins. Being a slightly big family, we would let others get on the bus and just wait for the next one. It wasn't a big deal, while waiting the kids would just talk about the parks and rides. My son(3 now), was more excited about riding the bus than anything else(well except for Pluto). We booked the POR thru the military hotel "overflow" and got a great deal, we paid about $124 a night. I would recommend this hotel to everyone we know..

Reviews.Title: “Loved Every Experience Here”
Reviews.Author: copilotcrj
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far the best hotel I have stayed at in the entire Disney Resort, Including the Deluxe Hotels. It is charming and the rooms and the property is clean. Holding true to its namesake, this is exactly what you would expect in an earlier era visiting new orleans. From the way the staff dressed, to the large water mill and the design and decor of the buildigs. Delicious breakfast in the morning. Definitely try their french toast...it is to die for. If you have a chance, take the relaxing boat ride down the river to down town disney. The only complaint I have about this hotel is that what was supposed to be a waterview room was not. Simply because I had to leave my room and go out on the public corridor/porch to see the water, which was one of the quiet pools. Also I wish they had more kind size beds. What kind of hotel these days have mostly double rooms anyway???? Don't pay more for a waterview room. We rode on the bus with another couple who did not pay for a waterview room, but got one when they checked in. Why would you pay for something you can get for free??? Apart from that, the staff was nice and very accommodating. Marilyn, a waitress at boatrights, got my fiance a cake with a candle in it for his birthday. The bus transportation is great especially that magical express from/to the airport...although the process at the airport could be a little faster checking onto the bus. I am yet to meet a rude person for the 3 days that I was there. From the bus drivers, to the concierge and front desk agents, to the theme park attendants and the security guards...nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: MikeNewYork99
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back from a wonderful stay at Port Orleans Riverside. We checked into the resort after a long plane ride and we were wisked away to the resort by the Magic Express. The bus driver was okay, not the over the top service that I am used to from Disney. However, things took a turn for the better when we arrived at our resort. After waiting in line for about 15-minutes, we were greeted by a smiling cast member named Kevin. He was 'Earning his Ears' and was all smiles the entire checkin time. I was especially impressed by his interaction with our two children telling them that Timon and Pumba had dropped off coloring books for them. This really made the kids feel very special. Then when our room cards were ready, he had both the kids sign the back of their very own key cards. His interaction really made the check in smooth and painless for us parents! Kevin was personable and a true compliment to the Walt Disney World resort. He was truly refreshing to deal with. The rest of our vacation was wonderful and we encountered some great cast members, none like Kevin though. We will be returning to Port Orleans in December, in part thanks to Kevin. He really made our stay there very special.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific stay”
Reviews.Author: twodaughters
Reviews.Content: We stayed at POR for the second time August 13-20 and had a wonderful experience. The staff was friendly and attentive, the room was clean and quiet, the pools were wonderful, and if you caught the bus at the main depot early in the day, the wait time was short (some early morning buses only stop at the South depot and then head right to the destination--something we discovered on our last trip). We loved the dining plan and used it to its full advantage, including four character meals booked in advance. Between the savings in food and the use of reward dollars from my Disney credit card, this was a very inexpensive vacation. We got going early every day and seldom had to stand in line for a ride longer than 30 minutes. My 4 year old and 8 year old daughters loved the rides, the characters, and the hotel. The 8 year old loved Expedition Everest and Space Mountain; the 4 year old Splash Mountain and Dumbo. My only complaints: the beds were a bit small and we sometimes encountered rather rank/August heat odors as we walked from our room in Oak Manor to the food court. I would stay at POR again without hesitation although we are likely to try a different resort on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “We were quite happy here - surprised at negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: WillieC
Reviews.Content: I am really surprised at the very negative reviews of this property, but I do understand that is a HUGE hotel and it is possible that some rooms are worse than others. However, our stay was quite pleasant. My wife and I, along with our 4 year old grandson, traveled to Disney World from Sep 1 to Sep 4, 2006. We spent three nights in POR. The young man at the front desk was very pleasant and spent quite a bit of time with us when we checked in to help us select a good room. His advice was spot on, as we ended up in the Magnolia Terrace building, in a ground floor room just steps from the quiet pool there, the laundry room (which we used and it was a nice facility), just around the corner from the ice machine and very close to the bus stop for Disney Transportation. The room was clean and in excellent condition, no stains, no mold, no damaged furniture. Housekeeping was great - the room was always done up when we returned, with fresh soap and shampoo and great towel animals to entertain our grandson. The maid paid so much attention to detail that she even noticed that we did not use the decaf coffee and from that point on she left only regular coffee. She of course earned herself a very nice tip. Our room had two double beds, a fridge in a cabinet (which worked very well and kept things very cold), a table with two chairs, and of course a TV in a cabinet. The bathroom was pretty typical hotel style but did have two sinks which was a nice feature. The only thing we found odd was the room had no closet but just an open rod along one wall of the sink area of the bath room. However, I understand this is typical of all the moderate and less resorts at WDW. The room also had a safe built into the wall. We only ate one time at the resort, using the food court and taking our food back to the bar to listen to the piano player (he was great and our grandson really got a kick out of him). We were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food from the food court and the prices, while high, were not outlandish. We also ordered pizza from the resort one night and it was good as well but not great. The pizza was large and the package included a two liter bottle of soft drink with the whole thing costing $25 .... again too much but not outlandish. The Disney Transportation (bus only from POR to the parks, boats to Downtown Disney) worked well and was timely. We never waited more than 10 minutes for a bus. We also used the Magical Express from the airport and that is a really good service. We rented a car the last two days so we did not use the Express back to the airport. We thought the main pool with the water slide was well done and the lifeguards were good. It of course was much busier and noisier than the pool closer to our room, but more fun for the kids. The noise from the pool could not be heard from our room at all. Over all, we were quite happy with POR. We are not among the Disney "regulars", having been there once before about 4 or 5 years ago (just the two of us), and will not be returning again until our youngest grandchild is old enough to go. Our grandson enjoyed the hotel and the Disney experience and that is the reason we went. The fact that we were happy with the hotel and the staff just added to the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed- would not recommend or stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Denali72
Reviews.Content: Really disappointed. The rooms were adequate at best. Much too warm and humid in the rooms- poor climate control. No water or food available later in the evening except vending machines, and no refridgerator even in the room. No basic toiletry items in the room. Landscaping ok- I think small kids might have enjoyed it. too much walking outside required (even for this athletic person) with our own bags. No gym on the premises. We were there for a business trip - totally inadequate for those purposes. Poor cell reception, no internet. The service was adequate- just barely. I could never get the concierge to help at all. Incredibly slow check in and check out even with only a few people in line. Surprised that is "Disney hospitality". I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pinksue
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans Riverside 8/16/06 - 8/23/06, it was wonderful. Very few complaints. Cons: No fish in the "fishing hole", if you're going there to fish, don't plan on catching fish in the fishing hole; they leave the large containers of clean or dirty towels in the walkways overnight. Pros: Food Court was awesome, staff was great and most important, the room was clean. I would definately recommend Port Orleans Riverside.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE this beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: court82801
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel form may 27th to june 3rd. I absolutely loved it and my family did, as well. The rooms are great, the pools are awesome and the food court, although it is pricey for the kinds of foods you are buying, is full of different selections. For breakfast you can buy eggs, oatmeal, pancakes, waffles, bacon, sausage, anything you can think of for breakfast. Later, they offer nachos, chicken, pizza, soups, sandwiches (very pricey...8 dollars for tuna or ham and cheese on sliced bread!!!) and much more. The court is open late so you can come in from a long day at the parks and get late night snacks and sit and relax. It is great! FOr some reason, the bus stations for PO RIVERSIDE are always packed, though. If you look over at the lines for the other parks a few people are there, but in the riverside line you might wait a few buses to get on. THis hotel is just so couple or family oriented, so comfy and cozy and has a boat that can take you to downtown disney or pleasure island that just adds to the old-fashioned feel. STAY AT THIS HOTEL!! YOu will fall in love with it! Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Another good stay at Riverside at Port Orleans”
Reviews.Author: rocketsdad
Reviews.Content: Me, my wife, & son (10 yrs.) stayed at Riverside August 20-24, 2006. This was our second visit to this hotel in the last 4 years. It was just as good a stay as before. We paid $155.00 per night (plus tax) & booked the room through Disney's web site. That was a little higher than it should have been but when you factor in the free transportation, extended park hours for on-site guests, & the ability to use your room key as a charge card, it wasn't so bad. The hotel's restaurant (Boatright's) is very good. Our only complaint was the carpet by the door in our room was quite dirty. We look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful resort!!”
Reviews.Author: opera48
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday August 22 from a week at the Riverside. I wasn't feeling well when we arrived and was treated kindly and quickly by the front desk staff. The person checking us was able to move our designated rooms closer to the main lobby and food areas. We stayed in two adjoining rooms(which we requested) in Oak Manor. We were on the parking lot side but still had a lovely view of the lush gardens and greenery. The rooms were quite spacious and very quiet. You seemed to get more noise around the pool view rooms and river view rooms. We were on a disney dining plan and loved every minute of it. The main dining room in the hotel Boatrights was great. Huge portions! The food court was suitable for breakfast and lunches when we wern't in the parks. I would suggest to anyone making dining reservations anywhere in disney to make them before you leave as we tried to change one and there was nothing available. The resort is suitable for all ages. We loved the quite pool while our teens enjoyed the main pool. We also found the rooms very clean. I didnt see any bugs or holes in walls that other reviewers seem to notice. We would definetly go to the Port Orleans Riverside again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Go Moderate Save And Go Deluxe!!!”
Reviews.Author: Champtraveler
Reviews.Content: My family and I returned from Walt Disney World. We were in Disney Orlando for one week, 8-13-06 to 8-20-06. We were told this was off peak since most of the schools in Florida were returning that week. This was not true at all. It must have been the last week before school resumed because every park was over crowded and the lines on an average were an hour and a half to two hours to wait. Despite the crowds and lines we were excited to be staying on the Disney property. We chose the Disney, Port Orleans Riverside resort. We've actually stayed with the POR 3 years ago and it was a nice resort. In the past we have traveled with eight or more family members with varying budgets so we decided to stay at one of Disney's Moderate resorts to keep the cost affordable without feeling budget and three years ago this worked. Unfortunately, Disney seems to have lost the "Magic" at this "Moderate" resort. I am not one to complain unless it is warranted and this actually is my first written hotel review, but, my experience at Disney's Port Orleans was one of my worst experiences and I definitely left feeling like I overpaid! I paid Disney Resort prices for less than Motel 6 quality. Here were some of my observations: 1. The staff from the front desk, concierge and in every restaurant were inattentive, out of touch and a lot of times rude! 2. The rooms were unkempt, with dirty stained carpets, spots and scratches on the walls and the bathrooms were disgusting my rooms had mildewed shower curtains and brown drip stains behind the toilet. 3. Housekeeping, though very nice, never cleaned the tub and in one incident didn't show up to clean the rooms until 5:30pm. 4. The grounds for the most part were well maintained, however, the smells that one could encounter ranged from manure fertilizer to duck droppings and for the first time I encountered a dead snake lying between the pathway and the bushes. 5. The restaurants had mediocre offerings and the hosts a Boatrights had no clue about reservations or customer service the server at our table actually dropped salsa down my sister's back and on her white pants and the only thing offered was a cloth napkin with a dash of seltzer water to wipe at the stain. Not even an apology was given. Long story short, if this is indicative of the quality and customer service one receives from the Disney Moderate hotel than the Moderate hotel is not for me. The next time will be Deluxe accommodations even if some of us have to save all year to pay for it. This Disney experience was one of my worst experiences and we frequently visit Disney at least once a year. Although our accommodations were at Disney's Port Orleans Riverside we dined at their various Deluxe resorts and at one glance of the grounds and their customer service and attention to detail, it was clear that anyone staying in anything less was being treated like a second class citizen and that is unfortunate since Disney advertises their "Magic" for all pockets and price ranges. The truth is if you can't afford to go Deluxe you may want to consider staying off of Disney property to feel like a valued guest.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful relaxing resort”
Reviews.Author: madge62
Reviews.Content: We stayed at POR from August 4 through 12, 2006 and had a fantastic stay. The theming at this resort is great. We stayed in Oak Manor in the Magnolia Bend section, I've always wanted to stay in a mansion! We were in a courtyard with a lovely fountain, overlooking the river. Such a treat to open the door in the morning and see a fishing boat out on the river and lots of ducks waddling about. We were also very close to a quiet pool and laundry room which was truly nice. A little far away from parking but I considered it needed exercise to walk off all the wonderful food eaten while at our stay at WDW! The housekeeping staff was most accommodating. I had requested extra hangers and towels and this was done quickly. The room was in great condition. Loved the sink area with 2 sinks, handy when sharing with a teenage daughter. We tried Boatwrights for breakfast one morning, yummy banana-stuffed french toast, and had a dinner, lunch and breakfast at the food court all of which were good meals. Never managed to rent any of the bicycles or boats available but we did catch a boat to Downtown Disney early one evening and it was a very pleasant ride and good way to view POFQ and Saratoga Springs. Wouldn't hesitate to stay at this resort again. My plan, however, is to try at least every resort at WDW at least once so it may be awhile before we get back!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice place”
Reviews.Author: 3Penguins
Reviews.Content: This is a nice place with a terrific atmosphere. Good: Grounds - beautiful with lots of landscaping, nice walking paths, the river alongside the property, the feel and look of a "Riverside" with the huge water mill. Activities - lots to do such as take a horse carriage ride, rent many different types of bikes, rent pontoon boat, small sea razer boat, kayak. Pools - were really nice although crowded. After all, it was 96 degrees out and humid as could be! There was also a smaller quieter pool located near our building 35. Transportation - this was good and bad. Good because it's available and free and ran about every 20 minutes. Bad because we spent 2 hours/day waiting for buses and traveling. Each trip is usually 5-15 minutes wait, then 10-20 minutes to get there, then the same to get back. If you only go to one place/day that's an hour. But usually we'd go at least 2 places a day, say once to Disney World and then maybe to Downtown Disney at nite. So that's 2 hours day taken up! You could hardly plan on getting to three places/day because there's not enough time. Each park is soooo huge, you're walking a lot within the park and that itself is time-consuming. If I went again, which I probably won't any time in the near future, I'd check into a hotel with more transportation options so you could get places quicker. TIP - take the free boat ride down the river to French Quarter and Downtown disney, even if you don't get off! Especially at nite, it's really pretty, quiet, and a charming ride! rooms - nice decor, fair sized, came with free frig. service - very friendly staff, easy check-in, but a bit of a wait. Magical Express service is nice because they take of your bags to and from airport, but again, a wait in line for service because there's only one attendant for the airline check-in. food - not bad at all and for decent prices. Four of us could get a meal for about $30 breakfast, $40 dinner. But if you stayed there a while, you'd get sick of the same thing every day because choices are limited. I'd say 3 days and you'd want to move on to somewhere else. But the convenience was nice. We didn't eat at the Boathouse. We figured it might be the same food as the food court but maybe with more choices. I can't say for sure. But there were always long lines anyways any my kids didn't have the patience to wait. Bad - (aside from transportation stated above) cleanliness of rooms - not good! We didn't unpack and put our stuff away in the drawers because each one was dirty with hairs and other dust/dirt. There was a big hole in the bathroom wall behind where the doorknob had hit. You could also tell they didn't clean behind furniture, under beds, etc. Port Orleans is a really nice place overall and we enjoyed our stay at the resort. Disney World is a whole different story because it's packed behind belief in August and hotter than you can imagine. Two days I got heat stroke and had to recuperate back at the hotel. The lines were unbearably long everywhere you go and fast passes are limited. If you didn't get one by 11am or so for the most popular rides, you could be out of luck. We went to Animal Kingdom 3x to try and get on the newest ride and never got a chance. You'd have to be there when it first opens and we like to sleep in on vacation. Also, even though they have extra magical hours (open early and late once in a while for Disney resort guests), it's still a madhouse because EVERYONE tries to take advantage and it's just a mad rush to get in and there's still THOUSANDS of people who are guests. We got up at 6:30 am (!!) one morning to take advantage of 8AM early hours at Epcot. Had breakfast and got to the bus at 7:30. well, so did everyone else! Lucky for us, we were at the front of the line and able to get on the first bus. For those unfortunate people who didn't get on the first bus, they probably didn't get there until at least 8:15 - 8:30 and there goes your EXTRA magical hour! When we got to Epcot, there was a THRONG of people already waiting at the gate for it to open. By the time we got to the Fastpass line, another 10-15 minute walk through the park, Fastpass tickets were being given out for 9:45 AM. So we waited in line for half an hour for another ride (because you can only have one Fastpass at a time). Then we had to wait until about 9:45 for another Fast pass, got that, went on the first Fastpass ride, and had to wait another two hours for the third Fastpass ride. Get it? Needless to say, I would NEVER go to DIsney world again in August - terrible weather and long, long lines. But the resort - very nice.
