If you rented a car, you could get to parks faster, but you'd have to pay $9/day for parking and then still walk to a tram to get to the front of the park.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, but too much litter....”
Reviews.Author: dolligirl812
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at 4 other Disney resorts (2 deluxe, 1 mod and 1 value), I can honestly say that POR is my new favorite. The property offers lots of things to do for the family (boat ride to Downtown Disney, boat rentals, carriage ride, pools, arcade, etc.) and we enjoyed everything very much. The only problem was the amount of litter, towels, and articles of clothing in the shrub beds. It was a little distracting to see a towel in a bush in the evening and the same towel still there the next day. Other than that, it was a great stay, and we will be staying here again. This resort is perfect for families, and a good bargain by Disney standands. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: pointe201
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Port Orleans Riverside and French Quater. All I can say is that I loved both places and would recommend them to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay for the family”
Reviews.Author: xpyrrd
Reviews.Content: Stayed at POR from July 19th to the 26th with my wife and 2 kids. Only request was to have adjoining rooms with sister-in-law and niece which was met. I wish now we would have requested a building closer to the lobby. We stayed in alligator bayou building 34, Very long walk to the lobby, food court, and gift shop. My family arrived late on the 19th. Was roughly a 20 minute wait to register, then we ran to the food court to eat before they closed. Bought the re-fillable mugs, very good deal. $11.99 and drink at the resort for free afterward. The only negative is they don't hold a lot. Since I've been home I filled it with ice and took a measuring cup and only was able to fit less than 1 cup of water in the mug. So buy the mug , but take a "real mug" with you. During dinner I had to go re-fill my mug three times. Food court was hit and miss. My wife loved the philly cheese steak sandwich. The nachos and taco salad were very good to greasy depending on who made it. The burgers were what I expected! The fridge in the room never seemed to get cold. We called to ask for help with this , but nothing ever came from the call. There are no knobs or instructions in the fridge we had. It did keep bottle water and milk we bought at the food court cool enough for us. The resort has paddle boats, kayaks, and multi person bikes to rent. We took the boat to DTD one night and it was a nice little ride, highly recommend this. The bus transpotation to the parks was very decent. Only one very long wait, otherwise 10-15 minute wait. The one bad thing about the buses while I was there was that it seemed as if everyone was at POR. When you leave the park at night you go to a bus station and every night it seemed that the POR bus station was the busiest. Always a large crowd, after getting stuck a couple times standing on a crowded bus holding a stroller we decided to wait for the next bus near the end of our stay. My wife , who held our 3y/o, was always able to get a seat, but the other four of us had to stand a lot. So let other people pass you if they want to stand on the bus, it's not that long of a wait for the next one and it a much better ride sitting down holding a stroller, kids, packages and such. The room always looked clean, the grounds were very nice, and workers very friendly. Some towels looked as if they needed to be replaced, but otherwise everything was very nice. I didn't spend much time at the pool except for the last day waiting to leave. Got to the main pool a little after 12 noon and it was full. Or actually what I mean was there were no loungers left. Over all the resort is very nice I would recommend it to anyone and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just returned from POR- great experience”
Reviews.Author: london654
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on here, I wasn't sure what to expect. My main expectations are that the hotel be clean and convenient. POR was both of these and more. We stayed in Alligator Bayou, building 15, which was a perfect location for the bus stop and lobby/restaurant. There was nothing flashy, but the rooms were clean and the decor was appealing. It was perfect for my husband and me. We will certainly stay again. The rooms are a bit small for a larger family. My sister and her family had a bit more of a difficult time with 2 full beds and a small mattress that slid out from under the bed (rested on the floor). It is nice that there is a curtain that can be drawn to separate the bedroom from the dressing area, as larger families may want some privacy for dressing. Overall, we enjoyed POR and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the resort”
Reviews.Author: tmann20
Reviews.Content: My mother and myself along with 3 children under 9 stayed from july 16 - July 20 2006. The resort is GREAT. Loved the rooms(almost like a cabin) Very nice. We were lucky enough to have a room on the riverside. Pool right around the corner, buses to the park about a 5 min. walk. Ran every few min. NO WAIT!! The room keys were your tickets to the parks since we added tickets to our stay as well as charging while on the resort grounds. No money needed kept card on file up front. We had a great stay. Suggest the refillable mugs if you plan to walk the resort(HUGE nice walking grounds.)Cost $11.99 but can fill for free the whole stay. You don't even need to leave the resort. Food court there and I suggest Boatwright's breakfast-wonderful(order the mickey pancakes for the kids--to cute.Had to take my daughter to ER our first day staff helped us find very easily. After that things were good. Never made it to Epcot this visit but all other parks were great. My children had never been to Disney they enjoyed so much.I've been before but this was my first visit to Animal Kingdom. Get the battery water bottles with fans(HOT,HOT,HOT)in JULY OF COURSE. All in all we had a great time, my daughter had the best time and her face lit up when she was able to pose with the princesses. Disney has this thing called PHOTO PASS, they scan this card with every picture you take with characters. You then bring it home and can pull it up and purchase if you choose to do so. I hope that we will be able to return in a few years when the children are a little older but we will definately stay at the Port Orleans Resort again. I enjoyed my stay there very much. Word of advice CHECK IN EARLY or you may stand in a line that has about 100 people in it. Luckily I was not one of those people our room was ready about 11:00 am when we arrived. Rate at least 9.5 out of 10. Enjoy hope your stay is as nice as ours was. Thanks Port Orleans for the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth my money, and then some!”
Reviews.Author: WDB
Reviews.Content: First of all, I'd like to address the naysayers who claim the rooms are dirty or in need of refurbishment: they couldn't be further from the truth. I am a very objective person and I always call it like it is. When I got to our room, the first thing I did was look around to inspect the cleanliness. Except for a little dab of what looked like toothpaste in a crevice of the tile floor near the sinks, it was SPOTLESS! In fact, the room was more attractive than any picture I've seen of it online or anywhere else. Everything was in top shape and the theming here is fantastic. It has a very, very homey, rustic feel to it, without sacrificing any creature comforts or amenities like coffemakers, refrigerator, or room safe (fyi--the room safe is located on the other side of the wall where the sinks are, just behind the privacy curtain. It took me 3 days to discover this!). Yes, this is a big resort, so there will be a lot of walking, but I don't mind that. Besides, we all could use a little more exercise in this country, can't we? Bus wait? Never, ever, even at the busiest times, was more than 20 minutes. Usually about 5-10. Where some of these people are coming up with these ridiculously long wait times is beyond me. I just know we never waited more than 20. Landscaping? We stayed in the Alligator Bayou section so the theme here was the swampy bayous of the deep south. Beautiful, serene, tropical, lush, full of life. Look for the tiny lizards, they're all over and really add to the feel of the bayou. The main building is very classy, really has an old south feel to it. Elegant and welcoming at the same time. Food Court is hit or miss. Sometimes it was good other times, not too good. Try to get there when it's not too busy. You'll get better service and it will feel more relaxing, as it is one of the most attractive food courts I've seen. For a really great breakfast, head to there table-service restaurant Boatwright's. I got the sweet potatoe pancakes as others had suggested and let me say that they were heaven to the palate. They taste incredible! Don't pass them up when you go; you won't be sorry. Only got to swim in the pool briefly one night, but from what I could tell it's a huge pool with pretty decent themeing, but it could have been done better. Pool was well heated, much to my delight. Overall service was quick and everyone I encountered was pleasant. Registration was just about the quickest I've ever experienced in a hotel, anywhere! Very impressive. Overall, this hotel is great place to stay inside Disney World. I certainly was pleased!

Reviews.Title: “A bit of peace amidst the mayhem”
Reviews.Author: SharonLC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for 10 days with our two teens. We had excellent service from the moment we arrived at check in (hot and flustered from a long flight from UK) to the moment we left. I noticed some people dragging their own luggage around - why? Bell Services were very attentive and we even hitched a lift on the cart with our luggage to our room which was approx. 8 - 10 minutes stroll away from check in. Although the resort was very busy we had been allocated a room in the mansions I had requested (By fax a few days earlier) and the grounds afforded little areas of peace and quiet. There was nothing more enjoyable than obtaining our morning coffee and a newspaper and sitting in the wooden pavilion almost outside our room, watching the occasional jogger or walker go past. It was a very peaceful start to the madness of the day in the parks. The room was kept very clean with additional towels when requested. Occasionally on our return to the room our girls' soft toys had been arranged in an amusing manner (apparently sunbathing on one day!). All in all a wonderful place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to the negative talk about this resort”
Reviews.Author: leanneisom
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay at Disney's Port Orleans Riverside in February 2006 and then I proceeded to read all the reviews on this webpage (good and bad). We stayed at this resort July 15th-22nd with my husband and 3 kids and my parents. We stayed in Magnolia Bend Building 85. It was central to the pool, bus depot (we used the one at the front of the hotel), the food court, etc. The grounds were absolutely gorgeous. The housekeeping was exceptional. The staff (both hotel and pool) were both very accommodating. We never waited more than 10 minutes for a bus both coming and going to the hotel. Definitely buy into the Disney Dining Plan. We saved right at $300.00 by using this plan. The food was incredible. Try Wolfgang Puck's and Captain Jack's - both in Downtown Disney - the lobster at Captain Jack's is mouth-watering. I believe the people who write the negative reviews are just looking for something to complain about. My dad who is the pickiest man in the world to travel with had a delightful time and commented continuously about how nice the accomodations were. We are planning a trip back in 2008 and would definitely choose the Port Orleans Riverside Resort.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely beautiful and magical place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kaytielove374
Reviews.Content: I recondment this hotel to everyone! Disney goes above and beyond by far! I have never stayed at a more beautifully landscaped and themed hotel in my life. Everything about this place is romantic. great for couples/honeymoons! The ferry to take downtime was great, their bus transportation is great, for the person who said in the review before me that you need atleast an hour if you're using their transportation needs to get there watch fixed. I only waited 20 minutes max for a bus. They go all day, all year, who can beat that? I already have another vacation booked with them from expedia and will continue to stay there when I go to orlando. This hotel was beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “The staff made our honeymoon magical!!!!”
Reviews.Author: divagirl28
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans Riverside during our honeymoon and they were great! The room was beautiful, elegant, and each day, our room had been picked up and nice things were left pertaining to our honeymoon. We couldn't wait to find out what was in our room each day! The food was awesome.....the resort had a wonderful eatery that we ate breakfast at each morning. We stayed across from a pool that stayed open till midnight, which was great for late-night dips. The resort was very romantic and family friendly. They had a horse-drawn carriage ride that was just delightful. All in all, we would definately come back to Port Orleans Riverside. It's beautiful, romantic, and has tons of stuff to do.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the POR from 15th to 29th June and would highly recommend it. This was our first visit to Florida and our two daughters aged 14 and 10 loved every minute. The hotel was set in beautiful landscaped grounds and our room in Magnolia Terrace was close to one of the smaller, quieter pools and a short walk to the main building. Our room was a reasonable size for the four of us, it was clean, the beds were quite comfortable (although the sheets could have fitted better) and there were always plenty of fresh clean towels. Pool towels are also available at the main pool (which was always really busy). The restaurant was excellent but also very busy (so make reservations) and a little expensive. The food court was really good value for money - pasta, pizza, burgers,chicken and, our particular favorite, the Philly cheese steak sandwich. Buy the refillable mugs in the foodcourt for $12 and you're sure to get your moneys worth (try the hot chocolate!) We heard a lot about the Disney Dining Plan which seemed to be a good idea but we enjoyed the flexibility of being able to eat out on International Drive (would recommend Ponderosa, Denny's and Olive Gardens). We did not use the bus service because we had a hire car and the hotel was so close to all the parks (usually a 10 - 15 minute drive) and also as a Disney hotel guest you get free parking. We also found it more convenient to use the car park at the back of our building. We did take the boat from the hotel to Downtown Disney which we all enjoyed. The trip takes about 20 minutes but go early in the evening because everyone seems to want to go Downtown after 6.30pm but it is great fun. Before we left the UK my husband was not looking forward to the whole Disney experience (having endured 3 long weekends in Disneyland Paris) but on our return he admitted that this had been a really good holiday, the hotel was great value and that he would go there again - so I'm already checking it out!

Reviews.Title: “I expect better from Disney”
Reviews.Author: KrisCommerce_MI
Reviews.Content: I agree that the themeing is pretty and so are the grounds and pool. But the rooms are not what I would expect from a Disney moderate Hotel. They are run down and in desperate need of updating. New carpet, bedding and a fresh coat of paint would do wonders for the rooms. We have been to Disney every year for the last 5 years and will not be returning to this hotel. We went at a very slow time in mid January and the food court was never busy, but we still had to wait forever for service.

Reviews.Title: “Our Family Had a Great time!”
Reviews.Author: momathome
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at riverside in alligator bayou in sept. and we could'nt have had a better stay! Disney truly does think of everything,from the sliding curtain that gives privacy at the sinks to the clothesline over the tub, it was a great room for our family(8, 9&16 year olds). The room was clean and the staff was so helpful it truly was a dream vacation spot. The buses made getting around so easy, we just parked our car for the 5 days we were there. A little advice when booking anything Disney, ask about specials, that is how we found out about the dining plan, SOOO worth the money. We ate at all the best places from the Castle to counter service restuarants and were so full (even my husband). It was so great not to have to worry about anything. Disney is great and we are planning to go back in 07 and you bet we will stay at riverside!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely grounds, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: cgrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at POR June 12 thru June 20th, 2006. If you have not stayed at a Disney resort, I recommend that you research what you get before you decide to stay at Disney. There are many websites by Disney devotees where you can learn the smallest detail about Disney and their resorts, seek them out. We did and it was very helpful. We knew what to expect going in so we were happy. This is one of Disneys moderate resorts. Two double beds (not queens), average size room, clean with good housekeeping service, quiet, good AC that didn't stink and wasn't too noisy, very comfortable beds (we slept like logs) . The rooms are probably small compared to what you could get off site. Everything was in good working order, Transportation runs every 15 to 20 minutes to every park. That adds a lot to the room price. We did not rent a car, we used Disneys Magical Express. We never wished we had a car. It was really easy to come back to the room during the day for naps and to freshen up. Boatwrights was good for breakfast, food court is reasonable, nothing fancy. The pools are well cared for. The best part might have been that not once, anywhere at Disney, did we experience mosquitoes or bugs. Yet we heard crickets, frogs, saw ducks and bunnies. The landscaping is truly lovely and adds to the feeling of seclusion and relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't pay me to stay here again”
Reviews.Author: vacgal90
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I'm a seasoned traveller. I've stayed at many hotels from a Motel 6 to 5 star resorts. I do research on the places I stay at and usually know what to expect. I'm not a complainer by nature but expect to get what I pay for. In this case, I did not get what I paid for by any means. First the Good: * Food court has one of the best cheeseburgers I've every had. It just took a long time to get it. *Hotel has nice themeing. Disney pays attention to detail and I definitely had that "old" south feeling. *Most of the Service people (Maids, groundskeepers, luggage folks, ladies in the store) were kind and friendly and helpful. *The Boat to Downtown Disney is a nice ride and much more relaxing that the bus. *Bob Jackson (the Piano Guy) is a hoot and definitely worth a trip over to this hotel to see him if your not staying here. *The pool is nice, but getting a bit rundown and looks like it needs some sprucing up. But my kid enjoyed going there in the evenings. The Bad: *Everything that Disney's touts as being a perk to staying onsite is non-existant. Bus service from this hotel is horrible. Either Drive and use your own car or rent one. Riverside shares buses with French Quarter and there is always a significant wait for the bus anytime you want to go anywhere. Give yourself at least 1 hr to get anywhere by bus. Expect to stand too, because buses are packed like sardines in a can. *The Food court is confusing and overcrowded. It took me 30 minutes from the time I ordered until I paid for my food. *The rooms where dirty and shabby looking. They do wash the blankets on the beds but not the bedspreads, so throw the bedspread off and call for an extra blanket. They only change sheets every three days, so if they are dirty you have to call housekeeping. The bathroom floors where dirty ( I wiped the floor and it came up black!) and I found dust bunnies everywhere in the room. When I dropped the remote control behind the side table and pulled it out to retrieve it, I found an old band-aid and some popcorn that had obviously been there awhile. *The worst experience was walking (A very lonnnnnggggg walk) back to my room one night, I nearly stepped on a kingsnake which looked like a coral snake in color. I nearly had a heartattack. I know that there are critters everywhere (we are on a swamp) but snakes scare me. *Found peoples socks hanging in the trees, used towels laying in the bushes, broken glass in the corridors and the trash cans where always full of empty pizza boxes. *The first concierage we encountered was very friendly and helpful. The second time we sought help from the concierage, she was surly, distracted and obviously overworked and underpaid. *Management at this hotel was also less than stellar. We had a bug issue in our room that was not handle in the best way. We were not impressed at all with their rudeness and lack of utter disregard for our situation. I came close to moving to another resort at this point, but everything was booked up. *If it's raining outside and your stuck in your room watching tv, good luck trying to find anything. Their tv stations suck. Heck they got one called "Your next Disney Vacation". Just another way to suck you into spending more money. Conclusion: For the amount of money one pays to stay at a Disney resort, you can do better. Next time I go to Disney, I planning on staying off-property. Mainly when you stay at one of their resort, they got you. You spend all your money here, which is fine with them. You are nickel and dimed to death there. Everything costs something. Don't even bother making a collect call, because that costs money too. When you stay off property, you have more freedom to eat where you want, go where you want and get better accdomadations for a much better price. I was sadly dissapointed in my stay here and will not return to ANY Disney property in the future. IF my dealings with management at this hotel had been different, I'd probally give them another try but it ruined my vacation.

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs, and could be cleaner”
Reviews.Author: JoanieJ
Reviews.Content: My daughter, her husband, 7 year old child and myself stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside Resort during our stay at Disney from June 17th through June 25, 2006. When we arrived, our rooms were not ready, so off to the parks we went. Came back around 10 pm to finally get our room number and keys. Although we asked for 1st floor adjoining rooms when the reservations were made ( I am disabled), we were given 2nd floor rooms that did not adjoin. We were told nothing else was available. We went to the rooms and they looked ok-could have been cleaner. We went to bed and slept soundly due to exhaustion. The second night, I received a cell phone call around 12:30 pm, turned on the light and was freaked out when I saw the bed bugs all over the night stand, both beds, pillows and crawling all over my grandson. There were large ones as well as tiny ones. I immediately called the front desk, told them the problem. The night clerk was there within 10 minutes and had us pack up to move to different rooms. ( first floor, adjoining) We received credit for a night's lodging. Big deal. The next day I received a message from the front desk to assure me that the old room had been exterminated. But they did not ask if we needed any medical attention or if we were satisfied with the new rooms. My grandson and I were so freaked out we were afraid to shut the lights off at night for most of the rest of the trip. On the morning we left, he broke out in a horrible rash all over his body, including face, neck, ears, torso, arms, legs. Looked like poison ivy. The doctor said it was an allergic reaction to the bed bug bites. Also, we are now paranoid about bringing the bugs into the house via our luggage. Had to make a trip to the laundry mat to wash all the clothes. Fumigate the suitcases and vehicle. What a pain in the neck/ What a nightmare instead of a dream vacation. I think Disney needs to do a better job.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Dguiter
Reviews.Content: This was my family's second time staying in this resort. It is definitely a beautiful resort, there is no doubt about that. I requested Alligator Bayou a year ago when making reservations for this June. Checked in - did not receive a room in Alligator Bayou - simply wanted a trundle. My husband called the front desk and they said they could move us in the morning, as there were no rooms available. We went to the front desk instead and there was a room available, go figure. We went into our new room, pulled out the trundle and found there was trash under the bed, HOWEVER, truthfully speaking the room was not dirty. Housekeeping did a very good job cleaning the sinks everyday, changing the towels, making the beds. I can forgive a mistake, like maybe not checking under the bed. I am not a complainer, however this time the bus service was hit or miss. We never waited more than 20 minutes for a bus, which is what they say, but there were a few times we waited 20 minutes. They were off times, for example late morning, early afternoon. My family was not in a rush, this time we decided we would have a relaxing DISNEY vacation and it was. We enjoyed the moments and didn't feel like we had to do everything and thoroughly enjoyed what we did. One day we slept in and didn't leave the resort until 2:00 p.m. This was so relaxing. We just ate at the food court and enjoyed the pool. If considering staying here you will not be disappointed. This resort is beautiful and has everything you need in terms of restaurant, boat service to downtown and a nice sized gift shop. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at POR”
Reviews.Author: travelgangedmonton
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and our 6 year old daughter spent a week at POR May 6 - 13, 2006. I would rate this hotel above average. The reviews are true, the resort is huge!!! The layout is very confusing and you can easily get lost looking for the smaller pools so be careful. At checkin I was quite tired and didn't confirm our room. Instead of lodge 18, as I had requested at when I booked the room, we were sent way over to lodge 38. I still remember the clerk making a comment that this lodge was quite close to everything. Overall I can handle the extra walking but on our first day there I fell and split open one knee and twisted my ankle quite badly so being so far from everything made the experience less than positive. This is where Disney could really stand some improvement. I've broken both ankels at lease once each, I'm not clumsey just quite active, so I knew that it was a bad sprain not a break. Disney did not provide any help. A very nice couple from Missouri helped me out, my husband and daughter were back at the main pool and I couldn't get ahold of them. A number of disney cast members zipped by my in their little carts with no offer to stop and help. The next day as I hobbled out of the hotel not one of them mentioned their free wheel chairs. It wasn't until the end of a very long day limping around Epcot that someone mentioned that the resorts have free wheel chairs. What a difference that made. The next day my husband wheeled me and my daughter all over the Magic Kingdom. We were given access to the wheel chair lines which meant no waiting. Overall we enjoyed POR. Our daughter fell in love with the beautiful horses that pull the carriages around the resort. The meal plan is definately worth it. It simplifies things and if you book your meals a day in advance you'll likely get what you want. We're going back next year but will try the Carribean Beach Resort. My husband now has a policy of not letting me go for a walk without our communicators. Another good idea. The communicators certainly made everything quite a bit easier. If my husband wanted to go off and ride the Rockin' Roller Coaster he could. My daughter and I were able to wander through the shops and we were able to easily meet up. Without them you end up waiting for eachother and waisting quite a bit of time. We use them for skiing, mountain biking etc. and don't leave home without them.

Reviews.Title: “Huge, pretty, housekeeping is so so..”
Reviews.Author: reginaldppuppy
Reviews.Content: Only complaint is I tipped the housekeepers 5 bucks a day and every day, it looked LESS clean! The hotel was VERY kind to give us our requested room in our requested area. The housekeeping was bad. They never wiped anything down, moped the floor, ect....I was surprised with 5 bucks a day I didn't get a little more effort?? 2 adults in the room, so we were pretty neat, we piled our dirty towels, put our trash in the cans ect...Oh ya, and Magical Express by Disney put SOMEONE elses luggage ( 6 bags) in OUR ROOM on day 5. We came back at 10PM to a room with other peoples bags all over it......Lucky we are honest people (however, I did want to hide all their underwear! :))

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at POR from June 7-12. They upgraded us at no cost to a King Size bed overlooking one of the pools in the Magnolia building. It was the perfect location as we where close to the main pool and the dinning room/lobby. The bus stop was just a minutes walk away. We had a wonderful time and will def. stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and awesome experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my sister and nieces from June 2 to June 8 and I have to tell you ... I adore it!!! If you really love a forest (bambi like) enviroment, then you will defenetely love Riverside. It is a beautiful hotel, we always left very early and when we returned at night, the hotel was like new again, so clean and beautiful. The staff was very very friendly. The pool was great and very family like. The restaurant ... oh my God ... I can't describe those pancakes ... mmm. If you are looking for a relaxing family vacation, go to Riverside, I totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the second time and booked it again for next March. It was great, just as you expect at Disney. Way worth the extra dollars over the all star resorts. We had a miscommunication with getting a room with the trundle bed. The management had a roll away bed brought up immediately and left a sack of goodies for our troubles. The last day of our stay the cleaning staff left a towel rolled up on the bed in the shape of a puppy dog. Put our sun glasses on it and gave it a cup to drink out of. My kids thought it was adorable. There is also a boat to downtown disney. Never had to wait in a line yet. One more tip, buy the Meal Plan. Also a great deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, Great Time Had By All”
Reviews.Author: nik26gray
Reviews.Content: I just got back from POR on June 11. I had really done my homework on this resort before leaving. There were 5 of us (3 adults, 2 kids) that stayed there. We were in building 24 and a quiet pool was right below our room (2449). I was speechless from the moment we entered the grounds. Yes, things are very spread out, but who wants to stay in a cookie cutter hotel at Disney. The walk around the trails wasn't nearly as bad as some people say. I had read reviews about people getting lost on all of the trails. The only "lost" people I encountered had just left the River Roost and were extremely inebriated. I would not suggest trying to find your way when your drunk. The room was as expected from seeing pictures. I can't complain about them, because all we did in the room was sleep. The only time I heard toilets flushing was when I was in the bathroom, never when I was trying to sleep. We had no problem getting a bus to any park, and the most we waited was 10 minutes. However, getting from the parks back to our resort was a little more difficult. Our first day we went to EPCOT and when we got to the bus stop to go back to the resort, the line was very long. This is to be expected at most parks because POR and FQ together is the biggest resort in Disney. The only thing to say is maybe Disney should double up on buses returning to POR at the end of the night. All in all, I can't complain about anything. Every person I encountered was helpful and nice. My oldest daughter celebrated her birthday while we were there and the cast members at the parks went out of their way to say happy birthday to her. She even got free fudge at the candy store in Magic Kingdom. When I go back, I won't even think about staying somewhere else. POR will be the resort I stay in every time I go. I strongly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- Beautiful Grounds”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at POR at the end of May. Our hotel room was in Building 17, we were right by the quiet pool. Great location near the bus stops and main building! Food Court was busy at times, but had a great array of food. Buying the refillable mug is a great bargain. We took advantage of the boat between downtown Disney and POR. Our hotel was very quiet too, not like other reviewers said. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, especially couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Disney's Port Orleans Riverside”
Reviews.Author: captjdl
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel we have stayed there many times but have never written a review. As far a Disney hotels go this one has reasonable prices especially for Florida residents make sure you call the Disney reservations number instead of making your reservation on the website if you are a Florida resident you will get a better rate we have seen them as low as $89.00 per night. This hotel has great beds and excellent room amenities. The activities and food court is better than average there are several pools to choose from for your best stay ask for a room in any of the Magnolia sections these are closer to the main lodge and food court. We have stayed at many of the Disney hotels and this hotel is well run and a great value as one of the moderate priced Disney resorts especially for Florida residents. Also for a great dining experience try the Boma restaurant at the Animal Kingdom lodge you will experience some great tasting and very unusual food.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel, but the food court can be tiresome!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit to Riverside in just over 1 year. It is a beautiful hotel, with fantastic grounds and clean, well-maintained rooms. We stayed in Alligator Bayou, in block 27, which was very handy for walking across to the main building. The room was sufficient for the 5 of us (children aged 10, 7 and 5) but we were feeling a little cramped by the end of the fortnight. The fridge was invaluable, and I even used the iron this time - just the once though! There were vending machines (crisps, cans, chocolate) and ice machines all over the place, so I guess you'll never be too far from one. The only thing which we found inconvenient was the food court - like many others, there were several queues for different types of food, and the service was not particularly quick, which, with 3 children all wanting different meals, meant that food was often cold by the time we reached the table. Also, portions from the evening menu were not especially big, although the breakfasts were very generous. The food was varied and tasty, though, and all freshly prepared. Fridges carry fresh fruit bowls, crudites and dips, yogurts etc. We liked the shop at the hotel, which had the usual range of Disney souvenirs, but also carried basic medical supplies such as pain relief and plasters, basic baby care products, milk, beer, cigarettes, soft drinks, bakery items, basic toiletries etc - useful if you've forgotten something and don't want to venture off-site. We used 2 of the pools, the main one with slide and waterfall, and one near the room which was just a pool - both were good fun, clean and safe. There were free pool towels and we borrowed a flotation jacket for our youngest for the duration, free of charge. We also used the pool over at Port Prleans French Quarter, which was lovely - the toilets there have ample changing facilities. We will definitely stay at Riverside again, partly because it's the cheapest Disney hotel which sleeps 5 to a room, but also because we love it there!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would definately go back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from POR and we loved it. Everything went great. Check in went very smoothly and we were given our passes to the parks. Upon returning later in the evening our luggage was in our room and the crib we requested was there as well. I was a little concerned about the rooms, but they were great. My biggest concern was cleanliness and I could not have been happier. Clean, clean, clean...We stayed in the Alligator Bayou section and we loved it..The rooms were quiet and secluded among winding paths and trees. The kids loved the pool and the water temp. was perfect. The grounds were beautiful and peaceful. We ate in the dining hall quite a bit and found that the food was fine, we were not expecting fabulous food so we were not disappointed. The prices were not all that bad either, maybe a buck or two more than what we pay at home per person. The main lobby area was very nice and had a general store and a nice lounge area. Overall this hotel was a wonderful place to return to after the long hot days at the parks and we will definately be staying here in the future and would recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Mater Dei Band Trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our Band from Breese, IL. stayed at your hotel from May 29 through May 31 (checking out June 1 in the AM). When we arrived, your people were very helpful with putting our luggage,etc. into the storage area, instisting that we were ON VACATION and that it was their job to accommidate us. Upon returning later that day to pick up our belongings from the storage room, instead of helping us get our luggage to our rooms (which were at the very end of the resort #25 Alligator Bayou) they basically just piled our luggage, etc on the sidewalk and told us to do for ourselves. I was under the impression we were still " ON VACATION " and they were there to help make our stay as pleasurable as possible. We asked for carts to help accommidate uswith this task, but were refused and told we were not DISNEY CLUB members and could not use them. I even spoke to one of your employees and told him I would return this cart when we were unloaded and still was refused the use of it. This is not a very professional way to treat paying guest. We might have been a large group of people, but we were still paying guest. With around 100 of us staying there for 3 days ( a fairly hefty sum of money had already been paid to your resort) I feel that the small request for help being made, should have been the least that your staff could have done for us. I can guarantee you that I will let all my future Disney visitors know that your resort would not be my first choice, since it is apparent that your resort really doesn't care about helping their patrons. The resort was very well kept and clean. The rooms were a little cramp for 4 to 5 people in them. but we managed. The food was tasty and have a good variety of choices. My main complaint is the way we were treated upon arrival to our rooms. Your staff should have made sure that all of our belonging were approperately distributed to our rooms for us, not making us caring it ourselves. Thats just WRONG! Cindy Warden & Members of the Mater Dei Band RM#2561

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Port Orleans Riverside!”
Reviews.Author: Joteddy
Reviews.Content: I have to completely disagree with the reviewer who wrote 'disappointing' about the Port Orleans Riverside. I stayed there with my husband and 2 children aged 8 and 5 for 10 nights from 15th-25th May and we absolutely loved it. Our check-in procedure was smooth and I received all the requests I had asked for (a room in Magnolia Terrace; ground floor; and a waterview - which fair enough, we had paid for ). We were astounded by the beauty of the 'mansions' - a lovely river, lots of greenery and just a wonderful calm atmosphere (which is just what we wanted after a mad full-on day at the Disney parks). We were situated just steps away from a 'quiet pool' (each building has it's own quiet pool plus there is the Ole Man Rivers themed pool - which in my opinion is certainly far from boring as the previous reviewer says - it has a waterslide, and water spraying out from 'overflowing' logs). Oh, and the Muddy Rivers pool bar - you must try the Mud Slide cocktail mmmmmmm! The food court (think it was called the Riverside Mill) was great - there was huge choice at breakfast and we ate there for dinner a few evenings too, each time our food was really tasty. We also ate in Boatwrights - the table service restaurant, which was also nice. The Disney bus service we found to be excellent. We never waited longer than 5 minutes for a bus; both going to the parks and coming back to the hotel. I think the reviewer must have stayed at a different hotel to us! Our room was ample big enough for the 4 of us - 2 double beds with room to move around them. Double sinks outside of the bathroom, and a bath with power shower and obviously a toilet. Room was always cleaned well, and Mousekeeping always did fun things with our kid's newly purchased soft toys! We hired a boat one day from the marina which was good fun. We also took the free boat to Downtown Disney one evening. My husband and son also hired a 4-seater bike (you know the thing - with a roof?!), which they had good fun on. For a special treat and especially for ease of visiting the Disney parks without a car, I think staying onsite is the way to go. I know our children will treasure their memories of the holiday forever!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: mominpa31
Reviews.Content: Family of 5 stayed at POR the first week of May. They said our room was ready gave us our keys when we got to the room they were still cleaning it no big deal only had to wait a few minutes. The room was average size, not to bad for 5 of us staying. We stayed in buliding 18 which was a great location close to the pools, resturant and transportation. The room was kept pretty clean the whole time we were there. Always gave us new soap and shampoo but we did run out of coffee which they never restocked and toilet paper we had to call housekeeping a couple times for it.They brought us extra pillows no problem. The only thing that upset me and I would like to warn parents about is we had a small bed that slid under our bed it is on wheels for our 3 year old. Well the 2nd night we were there she got up about 2am to use the bathroom and when she got back into bed the bed moved and she fell forward hitting her face off of our bed, she was bleeding very badly she had cut her top lip wide open. Thank god I am a nurse and was able to handle it if it was someone with no training they would have called a dr because of how bad the cut was. Anyway I think the small bed should lock so it can't move getting in and out of.Beside this everything else was wonderful about this hotel we would stay again. And the boatride was wonderful to downtown disney. Buses we always packed when coming back from parks had to stand most of the time which is hard with a 3 year old.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, Mediochre Rooms, A touch overpriced”
Reviews.Author: DisneyLoverKell
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel back in April of 2004, and I'm going back to Disney this October 2006. My only beef with this hotel was the cleanliness of the rooms. My mom and I went and we found the room to look a little old and dusty. The lighting wasn't terribly great either, specifically in the bathroom, where I needed to apply my makeup in the morning. The decor of the room was charming enough, It was to reflect the bygone era of Antebellum mansions along the Mississippi River. The resort itself was fantastic, The busing system, though most people seem to have trials with, wasn't a problem for us. Our section,(I believe it was Magnolia Bend) was near the bus stop, so we had a five minute walk to the buses, and waited maybe at the longest fifteen minutes for one. Which in my estimation, is not a big deal. I have to compliment the breakfast I had at the Restaurant, Sassagoula? I can't remember the name now. It was very delicious, though not as good as the breakfast I had at Grand Floridian's 1900 Park Faire, or the Breakfast at Crystal Palace in Magic Kingdom. However, the eggs were delcious, and the puffed cinnamon french toast to die for. The food court was fine, except my beef was with ignorant people butting in front of me as there is no obvious start of line in there. My mom especially enjoyed the refillable coffee mug deal since she's a big coffee drinker. The Ice cream was great too. Another compliment to this resort was the gift shoppe staff. There was an adorable older man in there that swapped pins with me and was really charming and funny. I also loved the fact that you could take a little shuttle boat to Pleasure Island and have dinner and shop etc. We also really loved that you could feed the ducks and Ibyss' at the hotel, they'd come right up to you and take peanuts out of your hand! Last, but certainly not least, the scenery and the pool. The scenery, is typical Florida. A swampy pond attatching itself to Lake Buena Vista, man-made I expect, which is supposed to emulate the Mississipi, lots of cypress trees, pretty gardens and bridges. Disney definitely does the scenery and gardens beautifully. The Pool was great, I even got id' at the pool bar, which made me feel fabulous since Im well over 21. The pool was fun if not a little overcrowed with kids, but hey its Disney. It had a little water slide resembling a little rocky ledge thing, and a rope to swing off of type of deal, and water falls. It was supposed to be like a Bayou or something. You also had access to the Port Orleans French Quarter pool if you wanted, but I never went there. All in all it was a great time, but for the amount of time you spned in your hotel its almost worth it to stay at a Value resort. If money isnt an issue, and you want the ambience of a Southern country living style, this would be a great resort for you, as its not that noisy, and its a little more adult friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: Kfisher
Reviews.Content: So many problems with this hotel, it is tough to know where to begin. We arrived at approximately 1:00 p.m., and were told that our luggage would be taken directly from the airport to our hotel. It did not arrive until approximately 11:30 p.m. Though our children had already passed out in their clothes, my husband and I were forced to stay awake, waiting for the luggage to arrive. There was never any apology or any concern shown by any of the hotel staff, despite the fact that they had told us the luggage would be in our room within a couple of hours from our arrival. The room was tiny, far too small to sell as 5 to a room. We could hardly move around each other. Though clean, it was hardly worth the price charged. I have stayed at low budget hotels that are just as clean with more room and are a lot less expensive! The Disney transportation (the main reason we stayed at a Disney hotel) was the worst, particularly at this hotel! One night, we waited for over an hour to get back from the park to our hotel. Having run a couple marathons, I could have walked back to the hotel faster if I didn't have 3 exhausted children to carry. I cannot stress enough what a problem this was each and every day, no matter what time we arrived or left the park. The on site meal options were really pathetic, and overpriced. I was prepared to spend the money; but the quality should have been a lot better! The pools were boring, and offered no excitement for our children. We are frequent visitors to Orlando, and will never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but probably wouldn't stay here again..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The grounds of this hotel were absolutely beautiful. We stayed in the Magnolia terrace building(85). I had requested that particular building 2 months in advance. Upon checking in, I was told I would have a room in the Parterre bldg(dont know if I am spelling it right)and not the bldg I requested. Supposedly there were no rooms in magnolia or oak terrace. I wasn't thrilled because there was no laundry area near that building, and the walk wasn't that close to the bus stop. The agent was able to find a room that might be ready in magnolia so she told me to wait a couple of minutes and she would have someone check it. The agent then dissapeared and never returned. After waiting about 25 minutes or so, my husband in his frustration went back up to registration and checked with another agent about our room. She said there were rooms available in magnolia and gave us our keys. Don't know why the other agent said there were no rooms. Anyway...The room was nice. Nothing great, no conditioner or lotions were left in the room, just shampoo and soap.Only disney commercial type channels and a few misc. channels on the tv.The room was on the small side. We had stayed at Homewood Suites near universal for a few days before this hotel and that room was much nicer. I kind of felt nickel and dimed here. At homewood I did laundry for a dollar for the washer and a dollar for the dyer. Here the machines were 2 buck each. It cost me 8 dollars to do laundry here, where at homewood it cost 2. I had to do double cycles in the dryers. Didn't rent the bikes,kind of pricey.The pool was great, food court was nice and big. The boatride to downtown disney was nice also. The best part about staying at this hotel is the transportation to the parks. Very very convenient. Almost always had a seat, buses ran pretty often. If you are a coffee lover definitely buy the refillable travel mugs they sell in the food court. The coffee in the room was terrible.You can refill your mug at the food court with coffee,tea,soda whatever you want as much as you want for the duration of your stay at the hotel. As beautiful as this hotel was, I doubt I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: mejo1111
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip in January 2006. I thought the rooms were decent and I liked the double sinks that are located outside of the bathroom, with a privacy curtain. The resort was cute keeping up with it's theme. I liked how all the rooms were part of small buildings and you walked down winding paths to your room. I thought it was very quiet and peaceful. The main pool was very nice, and there was a water slide that many kids were having a blast at. I noticed that there many life guards on duty, and they all seemed to be taking their jobs very seriously keeping an eye on everyone. Also the pool was open late at night with many lights on, so that was a big plus since many places close their pool early. I didn't eat at this resort or take the bus to Disney, so I can't comment on that. Overall I was happy with my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - won't bother staying anywhere else!!!”
Reviews.Author: mcgill93
Reviews.Content: Hello! I thought I would post a review since I was really interested in feedback and agonized over the resort choice before going... First, let me just say that POR was AMAZING - I doubt I will ever take a chance and stay anywhere else again. It exceeded every expectation I had -and I found that a lot of the negative info. I read on here before we went did not hold true for us. I also want to say that none of the pictures that are posted anywhere for this site do it justice - it is so much more beautiful in person - I was blown away. We also considered the POFQ site - but was really glad we didn't once we got there. It just didn't look as nice as POR. Having seen it, we would not stay there. I just want to say that we drove through Old Key West, Saratoga Springs, POFQ, and Carribbean Beach, and none of them looked as nice as POR. We put in a request for a Magnolia Bend room but were placed in building 28 in Alligator Bayou - though I was disappointed at check in, I am so glad now that I was in the Alligator Bayou section. The room was so clean and neat and everything in it (furniture, linens etc.) looked brand new. Even though it was a bit of a walk to things - the grounds were so beautiful that we didn't care. Also, the West Bus Depot was just a short walk from our room. We never waited more than 3 minutes (honestly) for a bus, either from or to our resort. We had heard that the bus was always full at POR - but that was not true - we were always the first on if we got on at West Depot. Also, people complained of how loud the building was, saying they could hear toilets flushing in adjacent rooms, etc. We wouldn't have even known there were other people around - the rooms were so quiet. The Magnolia buidings are so big and more like a hotel style and we heard others complaining about the noise there. The Alligator Bayou rooms are so secluded and quiet. I highly recommend them. People also complained about the Riverside Mill for food - we are really picky and thought it was great. We thought the food selection was pretty diverse and everything we tried was good. We ate a breakfast and lunch there. We did not eat at Boatwrights. The pool at Ol' Man Island was amazing and never too crowded - you did have to be a little pushy to get into the hot tub though as it was always pretty full. The layout of the main buildings is so beautiful, especially at night. We particularly enjoyed the boat ride to Downtown Disney. The staff were really helpful, even going on to our airline website to check in for us so we would get good seat choices. The housekeeping staff also made fun characters out of our towels, facecloths etc. Also, we used the Disney Magical Express and had a very good wexperience with that, though we did bring our bags with us. Anyway... I could go on and on - we loved it and plan to return ASAP. Thanks for reading!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After checking out quite a few hotels and having someone recommend the Port Orleans Riverside to us we chose the Port Orleans-Riverside...mistake #1. Rooms are just as they look on the internet...dark, dingy, extremely small for the price, no privacy, service was terrible, walk to our room horrendous, dim at night, buggy, room was too. It felt like we were walking sideways all the time... Prices were ridiculous, waiting time at the desk for any info was long and boring, but the main complaint was the status of our room...we left with many bites...don't think they were from the bed just the area...the pool was so so...the chairs were like sitting on cement...no cushions...no supervision at one of the pools, barside pricey...drinks not full for the price they charge...Totally disappointed...will never return... If you think that this is the place....forget it...too many nicer places for the same price...we are not overly particular but I did not find the room to be as clean as it could be. We could have stayed at the lower priced end and had the same type of room. Run don't walk from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans Riverside in March. I was really disappointed with this hotel.. The grounds of the hotel are very nice.The rooms were very average.The rooms are really small. Bathroom is very small. No heater in bathroom. My 7 year old daughter complained every time she took a bath that she was freezing This was spring break which turned out to be peak travel time. We paid $200 per night for this average room. This was much too expensive for this room. They have a food court there which is convenient but the food we had wasn't very good and of course was way over priced.Eating there once was enough for us. One thing that I really did not like was the way the grounds were spread out. You had to walk forever to get to your room. And after walking about fifty miles every day at Disney the last thing I wanted to do was walk another mile just to get to my room. The majority of rooms have no view at all. You are in like a grove of trees. The views are so bad that the first room they put us in we requested a move, the second wasn't much better. I probably would not ever stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort,but long bus lines”
Reviews.Author: disneyfanmomofboys
Reviews.Content: We statyed at the POR May 7-12 upon doing alot of research and from taking to heart the advise of this forum. The grounds were beautiful and the resort had alot to do with carriage rides, boat and bike rentals and pools. We did not get any of the 3 buildings that I had requested several months ago and even had my travel agent call 2 weeks before arrival, did not matter. I did get into building #85 in the Magnolia Bend section and it was centrally located, however, do not waste the money on a "waterview" room! We could see a pool but not the river, too many trees to look through. That was disappointing. My boys preferred the small quiet pool near our building, only went to the main pool once. The dining plan was a great option for us, worked out very well! You get a ton of food! The most disappointing thing with this resort were the lines at the bus stops!! You could always tell where the POR bus stop was, it ALWAYS had the longest lines of all the Disney resorts!! We have stayed at the All Star Movie and Pop Century in the past and never had as long of lines as we did last week! For that reason we will not return to the POR with our next trip to Disney in 2008! I read alot of reveiws on housekeeping and our rooms were clean and tidy as were the grounds. Very quiet resort. The boat to Downtown Disney was nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and overrated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overpriced for the money. Four chief complaints: 1) bus service to and from theme parks was extremely slow. 2) Personnel at main pool acted as though they would rather be anywhere else. Definitely did not make one feel welcome. 3) While one can rent bikes, boats, etc, the prices are absolutely outrageous. 4) Charged an extra 10 bucks per day to provide wired internet. Hey, Disney! Ever heard of WiFi?? Most reputable hotel chains offer it, and for free! I felt like my pocket was being picked at every opportunity for below average food and service.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Vacation awesome- hotel average”
Reviews.Author: Cyni
Reviews.Content: Vacationed April 24th to the 30th. We just came back from a week long vacation at Disney. We stayed at Port Orleans Riverside, for the first tme. We have stayed at a few other resorts in the past; Pop Century, The Polynesian, The Caribbean, and thought we would like to experience a new hotel. DisneyWorld was just great- magical. Port Orleans Riverside was not our favorite. The rooms were not the cleanest, but I do understand that it is hard to clean so many rooms in a day. We were at Disney during Grad week, and some of the kids stayed at this resort. They were not bad, just being kids- running and doing cannon balls in the quiet pool, talking loudly on the buses. Also the property was not landscaped with what we have come to expect at Disney. When we first arrived the grass was long, there were brown spots on the lawn, flower beds looked like they need raking. If I could choose again I would stay at the Polynesian or Caribbean, and not go during grad week. I guess when I'm paying so much money for a family vacation, I don't want to see teenagers running around without their guardians. When kids have adults with them, they are usually much better behaved, like you would expect in a family resort. The overall property of the resort was pretty with the river and mansions. The food court was not as cheerful as the Caribbean's. We took the boat to Downtown Disney which was really fun!! Contrary to other reports I did not see an alligator, and when I asked the captains of the boat they both told me that the river did not have alligators.... I lost a bet to my husband, because I told him there were.:) We stayed in the magnolia bend section, right across from the quiet pool. We were pretty close to everything, the pools, bus stop, lobby/food court. I think it was bldg. 85.

Reviews.Title: “One of the BEST hotels i have been to!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dolphin-mad
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Disney since I was born! And this was one of the best, fun, funny, exciting place I have been to! At night around 9pm if you go to the bar a wonderful guy sings and makes jokes, Bob, it is great fun for all the family. If you are bored in the night there are many pools to choose from or catch a bus to one of the theme parks for a night show. The rooms are magnificent, the pools, foodcourt, shops, arcade, everything is magical, I can not find any other words to describe it! I would defiantly go there again. And the price is worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Riverside was WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: Latie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Building 18 in Alligator Bayou. I think this is the ideal location-- very close to the lobby, but not so close you have tons of foot-traffic sounds. Also, it's not next to a parking lot (I don't know if those get noisy or not). We were on the second floor, which was fine. We have two smallish kids (5 and 3) so it was wonderful getting to use the trundle bed, although we hadn't officially requested it. I believe they have available portable bed rails if you are concerned about kids falling out of the somewhat high beds. Our room, 1840, was very clean and in good repair, although I did think my dh's side of the bed seemed like it was lower at the head than the foot. We all slept great the whole time, which isn't even usual for us-- the beds must be pretty decent. I had never really given much thought to the "theme" of the Deep South, but I can tell you I appreciated it after our 7 night stay. Riverside is so beautiful and relaxing and fun. We went for some runs around the resort, and a surrey bike ride. We went for a few trips on the boat to Downtown Disney (sometimes we only went as far as the French Quarter). The Riverside pool was not as fun-looking, and not as heated, as the FQ one, but that was fine b/c it was so easy and enjoyable to get from one resort to the other. Both my kids loved the FQ slide, and I saw kids as young as 2 enjoying it. The main pools at each resort not only have plenty of their bright white, absorbent towels, but also snug-latching swim vests for the kids who don't know how to swim. We liked the food court, esp the Mickey waffles in the morning. I walked to the FQ one morning for the beignettes (sorry spelling is mangled)-- freshly made fried dough covered with an inch of powdered sugar. When we ate dinner at Riverside's food court, we usually stuck to the spaghetti with meatballs. The kid's plate of spaghetti will come with a free meatball if you request it. Fruit costs $1 per piece, and the tiny yoplait yogurts are $2 each. One of those basically single-serving bottles of oj is $2.99 at the food court, but only $2.39 down the hall at the general store. Items are not well marked as to price at either the food court or the general store. The Riverside hot chocolate (just down from the coffee) is really yummy. Plenty of white towels in the room. I tipped the maid $3 to $5 per day (depending on if I had any ones). We did not get any towel animals, so I was glad I hadn't mentioned them to my kids. The maid would leave the tv on a kids' station, and after a while I figured out it was to make it look like the collection she made of our stuffed animals, were watching. Plenty of hot water. I only noticed noise from another room one night (they must have been checking in to it around 10 pm before I was asleep). It's true that you will hear the sound of toilets flushing in other rooms, but this was not loud enough to be obnoxious or irritating-- more something I noticed b/c I had read so many references to it. We had only about 2 mosquito bites (and they LOVE me, and we had spent a few dusk trips on the boat to downtown Disney). One of the best things I did with this vacation, was stick around the resort each afternoon and some evenings to enjoy the place. I really had a fantastic stay and would recommend this resort highly. I can't imagine not choosing to stay here again the next time (I hope there's a next time!) we go. Note-- I bought an Annual Pass mostly for the room discount, so we paid after tax $132 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans Riverside-Property is beautiful but the rooms are less exciting.”
Reviews.Author: shellgirl
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at a Disney resort was at Port Orleans Riverside. We arrived at 1:45 pm and were told that we would have to wait until 4 pm to check in to our room. We had requested the Mansions side and wanted to stay on that side. Suddenly after several minutes of conversation about what to do while we waited to get into our room, suddenly a room was ready. We took the room in Oak Manor. It was a nice walk over a bridge from the main lobby to get to our building. We loved the Mansions side with large stately buildings with wrought iron railings with large steps up to each floor. They had beautiful couryards that faced the river outside each mansion building. Our room overlooked the courtyard with a nice grassy area and a large water fountain. Our children were greeted almost daily by little bunnies in the courtyard. They looked forward to getting up in the morning to see if the bunnies were outside. They have nice walkways that go all around the resort. You see horse drawn carriages and family bicycles on the pathways daily. There are several bridges that cross over the river. They have a nice playground and family pool with a water slide on the center island of the resort. This can be quite a walk depending on what area you are staying in! They also have smaller pools between some of the other buildings that are convenient to get to. We only used the family pool one time. The main lobby area has a nice gift shop, arcade, bar, sit down restaurant and food court. Behind the lobby area is a dock area that leads down to the boat access area. You can rent boats or use the resort ferry to get to dowtown disney. We used the ferry one night to get to downtown disney and back. They pick up at POR first and then go to French Quarter. We ate at Boatwrights for dinner one night. It was a very good meal! We used the food court for dinner one night, pizza one night and breakfast our last morning. The kids loved the mickey waffles. The resort had pretty much everything we needed to be comfortable for a weeks stay. We spent very little time at the resort itself but most of our days/nights were at the parks. The outside of the resort was beautiful and nicely spread out. The rooms were pretty average to other hotel standards. There were two double beds, small table with two chairs, armoire with tv inside and some drawers. A bench for luggage and some wall hooks above it. There was one night stand between the two beds and a refrigerator by the armoire.. Each bed had a lamp on the wall above them. There was a ceiling fan and a ceiling light. The room had one large window with blinds and curtains. The bathroom was very small with just a toilet and shower/bath combo with two towel rods. They left fresh towels each day and soap and shampoo. The maids would fold the kids blankets and put their stuffed animals on top of them on the bed. They folded the towels differentely through the week and sometimes made the the towels look like animals. The room had a small dressing area that had a curtain that you could close off for some privacy. There were two pedastal sinks and a large counter for toiletries. The room had a hairdryer on the wall. There was a shelf and rod for extra clothes, luggage, etc. There was a coffee pot with some cups and coffee on teh shelf. I guess you would have to find a place on the small table to use it daily. We never used it. The room has a very small safe area to lock up small valuables and cash! The beds were pretty comfy but the beds needed two pillows per person. The pillows were not comfortable at all! The walls are thin. We could hear our neighbors talking, taking showers, flushing the toilet, etc. You could also easily hear people walking by your rooms at night. It took me a few nights to learn to sleep with the noise. This was irritating to me. The bus system also was frustrating. The closest bus area to our room was the last stop and we never got a seat and ended up staning to and from the parks. We switched and started to walk over the main bus pickup by the main lobby but it was not much better. They pick up from French Quarter first and then come to POR so you get what seats are left over. We rarely had a seat on the bus to the parks. It was pretty much the same way back from the parks. The lines were always long for the port orleans buses and we stood most of the time! That was annoying by the end of the week...We enjoyed our stay and wished we could have spend some more time checking out the resort, using the pools, playground, etc. but we just spent every waking moment in one of the disney parks. It is a nice resort but beware of the bus situation and thin walls! Other than those two things we enjoyed POR.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to go back!! I miss it more than ever!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mom and I visited Disney's Port Orleans Riverside for a Mother-Daughter week(end) and had such a wonderful time. I am so anxious to go back. We were able to participate in Disney's Magical Express and boy was that amazing. It was easy to find and it was a great treat to see "team members" greeting us with Mickey hands! The wait for the bus was around 10 to 15 minutes - but once on the bus we were off for our magical trip and we were able to watch a video to pass the time. Our check in was fabulous! We had to wait a few minutes - but hey its THE Walt Disney World - people coming to visit should expect a short wait for just about anything - but not necessarily everything! We were able to check in and buy our tickets - and also make dinner reservations all at the same place! It was also and extra treat to see town from around our area adorning the ceiling in the main lobby. (Cape Girardeau, Ste. Genevieve, etc.) The only thing I should mention about the Disney Magical Express is to expect your luggage to come later. We arrived late at night - so we received our luggage at about 1 or 2 am (by our choice). We stayed at Magnolia Bend on the outside - closer to the parking lot. It was about a 5 minute walk from our room to the main building and a 2 minute walk from our room to the closest bus stop. Our room was fabulous. We did have two full size beds - which were perfect for us .. the room had just been updated and I loved the newer bathrooms and tile! I took pictures of the room to take home as an inspiration for some remodeling! We had a "private" (more adults only) pool just a few feet from our room that was fabulous. And the smell of the Magnolia trees was absolutley wonderful! (Can you tell we had a great time!) The food at Riverside was good - it would be what you expect. Yes - it is a little bit pricey - but you should expect that at a resort. We were able to split some meals and save some money that way. We are planning on going back again and we will definetly participate in the Disney Dining Plan next time! It sounds so wonderful! I would like to save the best for last: The Disney transportation system and the extended magical hours. The transportation system saved us soooo much money! We did not have to rent a car, we did not have to pay for airport transfers and we could go where ever we wanted to on a Disney property. One afternoon - we were able to go and visit the other Disney resort property and make a "next time" list. That list comprised off all of the resorts we want to stay at for "next time"! And last but not least - the extended magical hours! The first day - my mom and I were really excited so we got up extra early and we attended the "opening show" for the Magical Kingdom. Once the show was over - the doors opened and we went on 5 rides in 1 hour (before the park opened up to the regular guest). We went on Pirates of the Caribean (twice), Thunder Mountain, Splash Mountain and the Haunted Mansion!! There were little to no lines for the rides in the morning extended hours but more of a wait for the evening extended hours. If you can go ... go! Just make sure to keep a positive attitude and know that the team members are doing their best! Looking on the Disney wedsite if you go from 8/13/06 to 9/30/06 you can get a free Disney Dining Package if you stay at a value resort!

Reviews.Title: “Really liked Port Orleans”
Reviews.Author: librarybooks
Reviews.Content: We stayed over spring vacation (April 16-22) and had a wonderful time. I thought the grounds were lovely, I liked the convenience of separate pools per cluster of buildings (we stayed at Acadian House), housekeeping was prompt and thorough, and though our room was nothing special, it was comfortable and quiet. The staff was great, and the experience was fun. Skip the food court; too busy and awkward. We will probably stay there again if we go back to Disney, and I would definitely recommend it over Fort Wilderness, Polynesian, Contemporary, and Caribbean Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Pleased Travel Consultant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at PO-Riverside in May of 2005. My husband and I have been visiting Walt Disney World for almost 30 years. Each time we visit, we try to stay at a different location so that I may better serve my clients and have a first hand review of each resort. We have stayed in the Value resorts up to the Deluxe and by far, this property was the most relaxing place we have ever visited. All of the Disney properties are outstanding for one reason or another and prove to be very clean, comfortable and family, or honeymoon appropriate. Our room was wonderful, very clean, nice amenities and conveniently located close to the bus stops, restaurant and pools. We stayed in the Acadian/Magnolia area. My adult children also commented on this hotel as being their favorite as far as relaxation. The pools are awesome. We enjoyed the quieter pool located just outside of the Magnolia Bend, but enjoyed watching the families enjoy the central pool and it's play areas. There is something for everyone on this property. Boat rentals, "fishing hole", bike rentals, horse and carriage rides, and the awesome walking trails. My family and I enjoyed walking to the neighboring Port Orleans French Quarters. It is a beautiful stroll down the riverside through the Southern style buildings over to the New Orleans themed French Quarter. Food in both resorts was very good and quite a variety. Having the water taxi to the Downtown Disney area was also very relaxing. We love Disney and enjoy visiting each time someting new is offered. If you have not taken advantage of the awesome FREE DINING plan this year....jump on board...you will not want to miss it. Is my family planning to go back.......OF COURSE!. We have our reservations at...you guessed it...Port Orleans Riverside for this September. We look forward to trying many different restaurants and visiting different resorts when we visit this fall. What a great value!! REE DINING....don't forget to call you travel agent today....

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: GarysMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Disney's Port Orleans Riverside over the last school break (April 12-19). This was not the first time we had been there and it definitely will not be the last. We have stayed on the property at least 4 or more times over the years (from when it was called Dixie Landings). We have also tried other properties (most recently in December Coronado Springs - see my posting "Beauty is only skin deep") for a change of pace. We always come back to Riverside. Visiting Disney World during school breaks is a unique experience. The parks can be crowded and sometimes overwhelming. And Florida can be hot. When you stay at Riverside, you can enjoy the hustle and bustle of the parks along with the crowds, but at the end of the day (or even in the middle of the day as a break) you can come back to this beautiful, relaxed property and just "chill out". The pools are fun and plentiful, there is a playground for the younger children, and if you want to, you can rent a boat and take a lazy cruise to downtown disney or you can take the ferry. You can cyle around or take a walk. This is a true resort. The food court is simple, yet reasonably priced. Boatwrights Restaurant, although not gormet, will give you a good meal. One of the best evening diversions if you don't want to stay late in the parks or don't want to or can't go to Pleasure Island is to go to the bar and sing along with Bob, Riverside's piano man. He's clean and includes the children. It's just a fun evening at your own resort. If anyone is thinking about going to Disney World, I would recommend this property hands down. The property is great, the rooms are comfortable, the staff is great, the atmosphere is great and, for a Disney property, the price is right. Look no further, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: luvdisney
Reviews.Content: The main reason we chose the Port Orleans Riverside is that they have trundle beds. My 8 year old has ADHD and it is almost impossible to get her and her sister to go to sleep in the same bed. I was a little nervous about not getting the trundle bed (because we are a family of four) and I know Disney does not always honor requests. I did fax them ahead of time and explained the situation. We did get our trundle bed, what a relief! Anyway . . . I was concerned because there were many comments about the maid service and the rooms not being very clean. We did not have this problem. Our room was very clean (Alligator Bayou, building 25) and the maid did an excellent job every day! We were close to the smaller pool, laundry and not too far from the food court and gift shop. Only ate at the food court once, the food was okay. We always stay at the moderate resorts and I find the food courts to be too chaotic. The boat to Downtown Disney is a definite plus.
