It's so relaxing and the kids loved it. I would highly recommend this hotel. If you have transporation, eat at Joe's Crab Shack - it's so much fun & reasonable!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarah946
Reviews.Content: We stayed here off season, everything was open, just the pool bar closed (didn't bother us). There were some problems at check in however they were dealt with fairly well (we had a trainee checking us in). The resort itself is beautiful and the rooms are very tastefully decorated. Cleaning service was excellent, however we found the previous guests underwear down the side of the bed! The reception staff could not have been better and gave us $50 credit on our room charge card. They also issued us with new park tickets completely free of charge when my boyfriend lost his (that we had bought through an independent operator in the UK) This was a life saver as we had run out of money by then! This really made the holiday for us. Pools are excellent, constantly patrolled by life guards, restaurants are ok but why bother when there's hundreds of better ones a short bus/boat ride away.The little general store is also excellent with the friendliest most helpful staff you could imagine. We had a brilliant time and would definately recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “loved it - i'm a repeat customer”
Reviews.Author: lisachris
Reviews.Content: i have stayed at port orleans riverside (dixielandings) 3 times over the years and am planning another stay there this november 2006. i think that it is the best hotel for your money. it is a moderate hotel that feels like top notch. it is above average in cleanliness both in and out of the room. and the bus rides to the parks were every 10 minutes or less. i would highly recommend it and have to many people!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Moderate Resort”
Reviews.Author: the3ds
Reviews.Content: As new Florida residents, we go to Disneyworld every other month. For our honeymoon 7 years ago, we traveled from Arizona, stayed at the Dixie Landings (now called Port Orleans Riverside) and had a wonderful time. On our first trip to Disneyworld as annual passholders, we decided to stay there again and we paid extra to upgrade to a "riverview" room. That was a mistake. POR rooms do not have a balcony to sit and enjoy the river, so your view of the river can only be seen from your hotel window. Am I missing something? What's the point of charging extra? Plus, we stayed in the last building of the property so our "riverview" room was totally blocked by trees and shrubbery. We could not see the river until you actually left the room, walked around the edge of the building and onto the path. We were very disappointed. On the plus side, the POR is well-themed. Sure, the rooms are a little run down and yes, the toilets are loud, but the antebellum "homes" and cajun country area are great. We had a nice trip down the river to Downtown Disney on the boat that leaves from POR, so make sure to take the time to do that. The food court has the best breakfast food compared to other moderate resorts and the bus stops are nice too. Overall, the hotel is a good one, but we enjoyed the Caribbean Beach Resort more. Both hotels are very large and spread out and there will be a lot of walking, but if you plan for that and plan for the time it takes to get from your room to the hotel bus stop, you won't feel rushed. Also, take time to notice the landscaping while you walk to your rooms. That is what separates Disney from its competitors. Once you're on Disney property, you can totally immerse yourself in "Disney Fever". As an additional tip, don't bother eating at the hotel for anything besides breakfast. There are great places to eat in the parks and since you will be spending at least $10 per person per meal, why not find a place to enjoy it?

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay when visiting Mickey”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I were pleased with the stay. We had a room in the Oak Mansion building. We had a little pool area, and we were close to the main building, the bus stop and the ferry boat launch. The staff was friendly and helpful. I really appreciated the enthusiasm of the person who welcomed us and checked us in. The only draw-back, and thus why it is one of the more moderate resorts a WDW, is that you will have longer bus rides to the parks and the ferry trip to Downtown Disney is also a distance. Count on at least 45 minutes to an hour total in transit as part of your round trip voyages to all of the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: shelbywu
Reviews.Content: My family loved the POR. This was our first time staying in a moderate Disney property, we have previously stayed at the Grand Floridian and the Polynesian. We were not disappointed. The property is beautiful. We were in the Magnolia Terrace which was very convenient to everything. The Food Court was convenient for breakfast in the morning. The refillable mug is a must, well worth the money. The staff was very friendly. I had no major complaints, although I have to agree with other reviewers the flushing of the toilets is very loud. We used both pool areas, my 6 year old son preferred the French Quarter slide. The rest of us liked the Riverside pools better, the quiet pool next to our building was very pleasant. All in all we had a great trip and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: daver1
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Port Orleans was great! We enjoyed the room and its rustic theme. We stayed in building 14 which was about 30 seconds away from the main building, a 2 minute walk to the Disney busses, and a 2 minute walk from the main pool area. The room was well laid out and we never had a problem. Even room service was quick when we needed extra bedding. We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This was a pleasant, comfortable and quiet place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pelete
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a 7 night stay at port orleans riverside (alligator bayou section)...I was not sure what to expect..I had read some of the reviews here...but it was a lovely place I was pleasantly surprised.....We wanted to stay at a disney resort to be nearest to our daughter...who is currently an intern at epcot. Our room was consistently clean, every day. comfortable beds just enough room. (not overly spacious...but enough space to rest and even eat there if you wanted. The refridgerator was a plus. Our room was so quiet....the place seemed to have a full parking lot, and many people on the boats, bikes and pool and food court. but did not seem crouwded and we slept like logs. Now my husband has been ill for several years and needed a break and see our daughter too. But he needed rest also. So he slept late many mornings.....and you never were bothered by noise from the many kids there, or by cleaning ladies. A very solid place. (I hate thin walled places) The toilets are thunderous...very powerful in order to use less water.....that was the noisiest part if a neighbor used one at night...but it was not bad. We rented a car so he did not have to stand for long at bus stops....but I was impressed with what I saw of the bus service and the stops also. It is a gorgeously laid out place, peaceful... we spent just one day by the pool, on the riverboat to downtown disney and just eating out. You need that break sometimes at disney. One thing is that the food court IS badly laid out, in my estimation...you have to go too many places to assess what you want...but it was fine for basic breakfasts and a quick lunch. I did notice that many of Disneys restaurants have limited menus...small in each place, but sufficient. It might be good to check out the menus before hand....do they list the menu's on line? We Loved the Bahama Breeze restaurant just outside the main gates by the way....wonderful atmosphere and food....great deal on food compared to other places. I would definitely go there again...even tho I would like to try other places...I am impressed with this one and doubt I will want to gamble on something less restful. And pay attention to the map of the rooms/buildings....it can be confusing because they are laid out in such a way that they look similar...particularly at night. It is a nice place for an evening stroll also.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite Disney Moderate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Readaloud
Reviews.Content: Our third stay at this property proved to be just as lovely as our other stays. Everything was just so clean and nice. The decor is so charming. We were in Alligator Bayou for the first time this visit. We moved to this property from Disney's Wilderness Lodge and though technically a "step down" in resort category we did not resent the transition at all! Now, if the weather had been awful, it would have hampered our enjoyment of Riverside immensely. We walked at least twice a day (for a week) from our rooms to the food court area. We purchased refillable mugs for our party of 9 and enjoyed "free" hot cocoa and other beverages all week long. Twice we rented bikes (even one with a baby seat) for $4.50 per half an hour and enjoyed ourselves tremendously! Our stay was unexpectedly extended and no rooms were available at Riverside for the two extra nights we needed. We moved over to Carribean Beach resort and that was a HUGE step down!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Disney Trip!”
Reviews.Author: KarCstl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at PO Riverside September 26-October 1, 2005 and had a great time. This was my third stay at Riverside and I was not disappointed. The recently renovated rooms were great - the new bedspreads and carpet and addition of the refrigerators made a big difference. I had fallen and sprained my ankle the week before our trip so I called a few days before we left to request a first floor room near the food court and they were very accomodating. We were on the first floor in Magnolia Terrace. The resort appeared to be full with lots of people (like us) taking advantage of the free dining plan promo Disney was offering, but Riverside was still a peaceful retreat at the end of each day in the parks. We really only noticed a lot of other visitors in the food court in the mornings. We found the bus and boat service to be timely and efficient and housekeeping was great as well. We had a magical stay overall and will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “magic holiday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our room was just over the bridge from the reception area and other ameneties including restaurants and general store.We had a water view room which faced the river.No complaints about the room and as advised on many websites we left a tip daily for the cleaner and were rewarded with plenty of towels for swimming and shampoo ect. after seeing other resorts i felt the landscaping of riverside took a lot of beating.If i am lucky enough to go back to Disney this is where i would go back to.My only comment not complaint is that the main restaurant could not always cater for the amount of customers there were.The restaurant itself was good.This was a truly magical holiday and staying in this resort played a big part towards that.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite resort of all WDW places to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Riverside (formerly Dixie Landings) 4 times with my first stay being the year it opened. This is by far my favorite place to stay on WDW property (among those that I've stayed at is The Polynesian, Grand Floridian, Caribbean Beach). I love the relaxed atmosphere, how it's laid out, the boat ride to the Marketplace, the various pools, etc. I just can't say enough. The staff has always been very helpful and friendly. Last time I stayed at WDW I booked a room at the Caribbean Beach which was OK, but it seemed too spread out with a lot of walking.

Reviews.Title: “Still Our Favourite 'Moderate'”
Reviews.Author: tigger137
Reviews.Content: We stayed at POR for 7 nights from 25th Feb; we had previously stayed at the hotel when it was Dixie Landings and visited since when staying at other resorts. We did enjoy our week and it's still our 2nd favourite Disney resort after Wilderness Lodge, but we didn't have a very good start to our stay. When we booked the only room request we made was for Alligator Bayou. However, when we checked in we were told no AB rooms were available and we were allocated a room in Magnolia Terrace (8762). As we approached the room, which was very close to a stairwell, we could hear a loud noise. This turned out to be from a large metal fan-looking object in the garden immediately below the walkway in front of the room. Once inside the room, with the door shut, this noise was still loud, constant and intrusive. I phoned the front desk and asked if we could move to another room as this noise was unacceptable. The Cast Member (CM) insisted the hotel was fully booked and no other room was available. I was very polite but said that I whilst I understood they may be full that night, I could not believe everyone else had already checked in. I pointed out that we were staying for a full week and wanted to spend some time relaxing in our room so the noise really did make a difference to us. Perhaps to someone only staying for a night or two, or not planning to spend much time in the room, this noise wouldn't be such a problem. She said she had checked with the room manager and the only option was a room just a few doors down, which would most likely have the same problem. When I pressed further she said we could probably move to another room the next day, but she could not guarantee where it would be, not even the approximate vicinity. We would have to leave our bags at Bell Services in the morning then later on check in again, and only then would we know where the room was â€“ and we could end up no better off. When I asked if we could have an AB room if we waited until the following day, she very sharply said that those rooms are for families of 5 only. I pointed out that we had stayed in an AB room on previous occasions, only ever the 2 of us, but she insisted that they are only for groups of 5. I agreed that we would move the following day, and she said "they" would call me in the morning (no idea of time) to tell me what I needed to do. After a long day and a transatlantic flight, I really did not need this disappointment and aggravation. And I certainly did not expect it from Disney. I sat for a few minutes but then decided I really couldn't settle, so I went back to the front desk in person. There I explained the situation, said how disappointed we were, and asked if there was any chance of a different room. Kimberley looked on the computer and said she was unable to release another room but that she would check with someone else. She went over and spoke to a man further down the desk, then came back and said she had another room for us. She gave me the keys, explaining that once we'd used them to access the new room then the keys for the old room would be disabled. (She was so kind I could have hugged her â€“ bless you Kimberley!) We went to see where the new room (9212, in Oak Manor) was situated and found it was in a nice quiet area, overlooking gardens. So we collected our bags from 8762 and left there gladly, although with some sympathy for whoever ended up in that room later. It seems a shame that when a hotel is so beautifully themed, some rooms are blighted by equipment noise like this â€“ surely there must be a way of designing the building so this is avoided? It was disappointing to be allocated such a room in a Disney hotel, but more disappointing to be treated as I was by the CM on the phone. She insisted time and again that there was nothing she or her manager could do, yet Kimberley was able to help very quickly. The landscaping and theming at POR are lovely, and we enjoyed just walking around the grounds, admiring the views and watching the wildlife â€“ particularly the rabbits on the lawns in the evenings. The boat ride to Downtown Disney is pleasant and relaxing. Our nearest bus stop was the East Depot, the last pick-up point at POR, which meant we generally didn't get a seat. This wasn't a problem for us really, although we were surprised how often children stayed seated when adults â€“ particularly older adults â€“ were standing. The food court leaves much to be desired. The food is reasonable given that it's mass catering, but the organisation is terrible. Having to wait in line separately for each type of food is crazy and means families either don't eat together or some end up with their food going cold by the time everyone has their meal. It's always been like this, even in Dixie days, but there must be a better way â€“ perhaps by placing orders for all food, like in Roaring Forks at Wilderness Lodge. I think going away from pizza slices to individually prepared pizzas was a backward step; the line used to move much quicker because the pizza was there ready to be served. We enjoyed breakfast and dinner in Boatwrights; breakfast in particular was excellent, although the menu choice isn't as extensive as it once was. No steak and eggs, and no pastries of any sort, not even beignets â€“ which seems strange when the bakery is right next door. But the scrambled eggs were to die for. I have to agree with previous opinions that the cleanliness of rooms leaves something to be desired. Nothing major, but it seemed as if the room hadn't been cleaned thoroughly for quite some time. The daily housekeeping seemed to be fairly superficial â€“ make the beds, change the towels, and quickly wipe down the bath, toilet and sinks. The area behind the taps on the sinks wasn't clean when we arrived and wasn't touched during our stay. Similarly the bathroom floor behind the toilet â€“ in fact, the floors of both the bathroom and sink area did not appear to have been properly cleaned for a long time and were looking pretty grubby. This was very different from our previous stays, and we can only think that fewer housekeepers are now having to work on a greater number of rooms and simply don't have the time to clean properly. That said, most days we came back to find towel animals waiting for us! All in all â€“ after a rough start â€“ we had a relaxing and enjoyable stay, and it is still our favourite 'moderate' Disney resort.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Macfamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from March 5th to 11th with 2 adjoining rooms and 4 small children under 8. Stayed in Alligator Bayou section which I found to be nicely designed. The beds were very comfortable, especially after a long day of walking. The grounds are beautifully landscaped. My only complaint was that it took a long time to walk to our room b/c it was centered in the building and stairs were only on the ends. B/c of the cute way it is designed, nothing is a straight shot. Also, the walk to the bus took us a while (we were in building 25). Just be prepared to walk everywhere while on property, but at least the scenery is nice. The pool area is nice too, but was surprised to see only one whirlpool area for a resort that size. Odd. The buses were timely. I was at the west side stop which meant stopping at 3 more places on the riverside location before getting off to the parks. Be informed that at Epcot, the Riverside and French Quarter share one stop. This was the only place where we had to wait a really long time late at night to get home. The lobby area is pretty. The food court is just that, so I expected food court food, which is fine. However, with that said, I was disapointed that there were no vegetables available except a side salad in the fridge section which was 3.99. But I guess as long as your not eating every meal there, you'll be ok. We didn't eat in the restaurant. Bottom line, I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first family vacation, two adults and three kids (5,9,11). I have done a lot of research and consulted many websites such as trip advisor. I booked at The Port Orleans Riverside based on the comments on trip advisor. I have to say I was extremely happy with the hotel. The grounds were fabulous, very clean. We stayed in the Alligator Bayou, very quiet, clean and peaceful. The buses to all the parks was incredible, little or no wait. We were on the Disney Dining Plan, which I highly recommend...we brought our own breakfast (protein shkes, cereals, yogurt, granola) so we could be out quickly and carry on with our day. We mostly ate lunch and dinner at the parks. We were very lucky as we were able to do walk-ins for dinner, which apparently is not alway the case, reservations were recommneded. Excellent time of year to visit Dinsey, the weather was perfect: not too hot, chilly in the evening. I have to agree with some of the comments about the food at the Riverside Mill Food Court, it was tolerable, nothing to write home about. We didn't try the others. The boat rides down the Sassagoula River was very nice and relaxing. Overall an excellent vacation, would definitley recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Problems at Riverside”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I reserved a room at Port Orleans Riverside for a six night stay in Feb., 2006. I regularly travel for work, and my wife - besides being a regular traveler also - was the manager of Disney stores for eight years. We've both been to DisneyWorld many times. Our Port Orleans experience was not very good. * It took over 40 minutes to check in at the hotel. * We used Magic Express to have Disney transport or luggage from the airport to our room. Five hours after we had gotten off the plane, still no luggage had arrived. At about 6PM my wife called and the bags finally showed up a little while later. * We had arranged with the hotel to have two cribs in the room. After we called at about 6PM, the cribs were brought up. * We went to the lobby to have our park passes added to our room keys (luckily, only 10 minutes in line this time). When we returned to the room, the key cards would no longer open the door. We went back to the lobby, and saw that the line had gotten long again. We asked someone who looked like a security person about getting help fixing the mistake without waiting another 40 minutes, and were told that we would have wait in line. I cut to the front of the concierge line, and asked for a manager. One of the nearby Disney employees called me "line cutter, line cutter." The employee I was talking to didn't get a manager as I requested, but went ahead and corrected the problem with our key cards. I gave up trying to deal further with the hotel staff. * We went to the food court to eat, and there was garbage on the floor. Many of the tables had not been cleaned. We had to return two steak sandwiches that were so tough and fatty that we couldn't eat them. And this was our initial afternoon at the hotel... To be fair, the pool areas are nice. The rooms, though in need of renovation, were OK for us. The grounds are attractive. RD

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at Port Orleans Resort Riverside seven times so far. We have NEVER been disappointed! The food court is fabulous and the rooms are especially clean. We've stayed in the south of France and didn't even find a hotel that comes close to this one. We've ate at the best restaurants and nothing beats this food court. We laughed so hard at Bob Jackson we had to wheel my grandfather back to the room in a wheel chair because he was laughing so hard he couldn't stand up. My grandmother thought that the hotel was the magic kingdom. The boat ride to downtown disney was better than a gondula ride in Venice. The beds were so comfortable my grandmother didn't want to get out of bed for two days. Boatwrights banana stuffed french toast was so good we got ten orders!!!!!!! DISNEY YOU'RE THE BEST!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Marginally tolerable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong. The trip to Disney was great. The Port Orleans -Riverside, however, had little to do with the trip's greatness. The grounds of the resort are nice. Fun to rent a bike and tour around, or rent a boat and cruise the river. My big problem with the room was that it was unclean. A thick coating of dust on the coat rack, and obvious mildew/mold in the shower. The pier fishing was a joke - cest pool (we just looked, did not fish) Perhaps the chartered fishing trip they offer would have been nice, but its really expensive. The price for 2 hours was more than a full day guided trip at any other fishing destination. Let's face it - you're going to Disney to see Mickey and the gang, not hang out at a hotel. What made the trip a success for us was the fabulous weather (80 degress and not a cloud in the sky), the relatively light crowds on weekdays in February, and watching our 4 year old son go completely bonkers. The big selling point for a WDW resort is the extended park hours. Unless your kids are older than ours (4), then they likely won't have the stamina to use the extended hours. You're probably better off staying at a nicer/cleaner hotel in Orlando and taking a shuttle to the Parks. Word of caution: The Disney Express bus from the airport to the hotel, is nice, however, PICK UP YOUR BAGS FROM BAGGAGE CLAIM AND BRING THEM TO THE BUS. Nobody bothered to tell us that our bags would not show up at the hotel until 4 hours after we arrived. When we got in to the hotel at 8:00 p.m., it was another 4 hours before we could shower off the day's travel and go to bed. Its safe to check the bags at the hotel for your return flight - ours made it.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed it here”
Reviews.Author: dreimer043
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights, my husband and 2 sons 7 and 10. The grounds were beautiful, it was very clean. I enjoyed taking early morning jogs around the river. There was so much to do the kids enjoyed it there more than the parks . The busses and boat to downtown disney were a big perk. We went during presidents week a very busy time and we never had to wait more than 5 minutes for either. Only complaint the food at the food court wasnt too good.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from PO Riverside. Family of four with 2 kids under the age of 8. Though most of our time was in the parks, I thought this hotel(motel feel) was rundown, dirty, and simply outdated. Rennovations are needed! The pool was supposed to be rustic, but I think it was rusted! I have nothing to compare to cuz I have not stayed at a DW resort before, but I just think they should update it a bit! The food was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Disney is still the best place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: BARFESSER
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans Riverside (POR) After out big family get-together of 2005 at Disneyâ€™s Caribbean Beach Resort (CBR) our family moved to the POR for a four night stay. We had never been there before and were not sure what to expect. But itâ€™s Disney! Itâ€™s somewhat like CBR in that itâ€™s large in area and almost everywhere you walk itâ€™s quiet and serene and everywhere you walk thereâ€™s something different. If you start wondering around you might want to take a map. It may be hard to get lost but you might not know where you are in relation to where your going:-). There is a food court but I would recommend the restaurant: â€œBoat Wrightsâ€�. For a few dollars more, itâ€™s much more relaxed and the food is much better (leave the court for the teenagers): For breakfast, Boat Wrightâ€™s has the biggest/best omelet: â€œThe Blue Printâ€� for $7.99. My wife calls it â€œthe omelet as big as your headâ€� and itâ€™ll hold you until a late lunch or early dinner. If youâ€™re just about 200lbs and hungry, I guarantee. The rooms are Disney clean. We had a refrigerator in ours. (I guess the word is to not request one until you find your room doesnâ€™t have one [if you need it]). The show in the lounge is not to be missed. Bob Jackson is a one-man-show of seldom seen quality. Be prepared to join in the show too. He gets everyone involved. On our return trip 8 months later in Oct of 05 (we had annual passes) we made a special trip to POR just to see Bob. We also enjoyed the boat ride to and from Downtown Disney (a bit chilly in Feb but it gave me a chance to snuggle with my wife). Barfesser

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice resort. We were amazed at how quiet the place was. Sometimes you felt like you were the only ones there. The grounds are very clean and well kept. Our room was clean and the housekeeping did a good job each day. We were in building 99 facing the fountains and the river, which was beautiful. Our building was also not too far from the lobby, restuarants, and store; although it looks like some of the buildings are quite a long distance. The pools were nice. There was one by each building as well as the big one that the kids like, so they didn't get overcrowded. Our only gripe was the food at the food court. It was typical disney food, not very good, and spendy. The best thing we had there was the nachos for an afternoon snack. Otherwise we found the breakfast to be not at all good. Further more in the mornings the food court is absolutely packed! After two days we decided to just skip breakfast and have an early lunch at whatever park we were at.

Reviews.Title: “nice property”
Reviews.Author: kevnbren
Reviews.Content: We started out at the Aligator Bayou in the rustic and charming rooms of blds 27. Our first morning we had a rude awakening after the people next door let their children loose at 7am to run up and down outside our room SCREAMING!! (We had arrive at 2am the night before!). They did this every morning. We had rooms that ajoined and I wonder if this made the noise level worse. We could actually hear their phone ring, toilet flush, and angry parents YELLING at their children!! We changed rooms after the second night to the Magnolia Terrace section. These rooms were identical in furniture arangement, though the decor was more southern charm. It was much quieter also. We thought the restaurants were adequate, and not too overpriced. I would recommend getting kids meals for everyone, especially at breakfast. It was identical to the adult meal, though $2 cheaper. We were very unhappy with the bell service. When we arrived at 2am, we were told to wait for the bellman to drive us to our room. After waiting 20 mins, we gave up and walked in the dark, eventually finding our room. When we had to change rooms, we were instructed to leave our bags packed in the old room and they would bring them to the new room while we were at the parks. Ten hours later when we returned, our bags were not there. After many calls and checking around by the bell staff, they found they were still in the old room. Two hours after confirming this, they were finally brought to our room! It also took 6 hours for our bags to arrive from the time our plane arrived. Overall we really enjoyed our stay. We would return. I did pack breakfast food (and a toaster) from home and we had breakfast every day but one in our room. We also had sandwiches in our room. The mini fridge was very handy.

Reviews.Title: “More Bang for Your Buck!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in other much more expensive resorts around Disney I was a bit apprehensive about he discounted rate for which I was paying at Port Orleans Riverside. We stayed in the Acadian House (building 80). I was surprised when I saw that my room was larger than almost all the other resorts I had previously stayed in. The property was more like an apartment complex than a hotel, but this wasnâ€™t a bad thing. It gave more privacy than other hotels where you see everyone all day in the halls. The dinning for breakfast was great in the Bowrights restaurant, but Id advise to skip any meal if you decide to try dining in the food court. The restaurant wasnâ€™t much more expensive than the food court and came with 1000 times better food and service. We even ventured over to the Port Orleans French Quarter to look but were very disappointed. The food and dining hall were loud and dirty. The staff didnâ€™t have the "Have a magical day" feel like the staff at riverside did. Transportation was also a concern for us because the only way to the theme parks was by bus. I was pleasantly surprised to find our longest wait to go anywhere was 8 mins. The busses are dispatched according to need. If a bus fills and passengers are left behind the driver will radio for backup which arrives shortly after. The busses can get crowded at peak times (I.E.) opening/closing but everything is crowded in the park. We would just leave a bit later and return a bit earlier to avoid the sardine feeling. Riverside sprawling property was home to plenty of pools and recreational things to do. A fishing hole which is perfect to take small children to teach fishing. There are boat rentals of all sizes and I could go on, but why stay at your resort? Theme parks await! Maybe I crazy but I donâ€™t want to hang out at my room. I want to taste the food around the world showcase in Epcot, or ride the new rollercoaster "Everest" (which is very cool) in Animal Kingdom. Ok so before I ramble on and on I give this resort above average rating and would defiantly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, dirty rooms.”
Reviews.Author: kb111570
Reviews.Content: I was at the POR 2-8 through 2-13. I've read good and bad reviews about housekeeping. Unfortunately, we had a bad experience. We were in 8915 and 8914 located in Magnolia Terrace. The bathrooms were not cleaned and the rooms sometimes were not vaccuumed even after complaining to housekeeping. We discovered various items under furniture that were there when we checked in until the time we checked out. The room size was fine for a family of four. The grounds were gorgeous. If we return to POR I would hope to luck out with a better housekeeper. And by the way, the housekeeper had no problem taking the money I left everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Disneyâ€™s Port Orleans Riverside â€“ A Brilliant Family Friendly Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Dr Ali M.
Reviews.Content: Disneyâ€™s Port Orleans Riverside â€“ A Brilliant Family Friendly Resort! I recently took my family of six (2 adults, 2 children and 2 infants) for our annual pilgrimage to Walt Disney World in Orlando, Florida. This year we stayed at Disneyâ€™s Port Orleans Riverside from 7-17 January 2006. We booked our ten night stay in the middle of November 2005. We have been to Walt Disney World four times in the past two years because the kids just love it. The first time we stayed in Disneyâ€™s Caribbean Beach Resort and the second and third times we stayed at Disneyâ€™s Pop Century Resort. Although we have thoroughly enjoyed our previous stays at these other resorts, this year we had to book into Disneyâ€™s Port Orleans Riverside because this is the only resort that could reasonably accommodate our family of six. Disneyâ€™s Port Orleans Riverside is one of a small number of resorts that offer trundle beds for an additional child allowing 2 adults and up to three or four children to stay in the same room. We booked our Disney guestroom directly with the Walt Disney Travel Company. Before booking, I studied other reports of this resort posted on the TripAdvisor website. We really appreciate the useful comments of Lisa Jane, another TripAdvisor member who had recently stayed at Disneyâ€™s Port Orleans Riverside. Resort Facilities: Disneyâ€™s Port Orleans Riverside used to be called Dixie Landings. Disneyâ€™s Port Orleans Riverside and Disneyâ€™s Port Orleans French Quarter technically function as a single but vast resort. Disneyâ€™s Port Orleans Riverside is more or less in the centre of Walt Disney World and is 10-15 minutes by Disney bus to all the major theme parks. Disneyâ€™s Port Orleans Riverside is quite reminiscent of the rural South. The resort is divided into two parts: the Alligator Bayou and the Magnolia Bend. These areas consist of â€œparishesâ€�. Closest to the â€œcityâ€� the guestrooms are in Mansion homes; farther upriver the guestrooms are in less luxurious rustic buildings. However, the rooms are all decorated to a similar standard. Only Disneyâ€™s Port Orleans French Quarter has more luxuriously decorated guestrooms. The resort has many facilities including seven swimming pools and a playground. There is plenty to do here; biking, boating, fishing and horse-drawn carriage rides. The proximity to Downtown Disney is a great bonus. There is a river shuttle that takes guests up river to Downtown Disney via Disneyâ€™s Port Orleans French Quarter and Disneyâ€™s Old Key West. As with all other Disney resorts regular buses take you wherever you care to go in Walt Disney World. During busy periods people tend to jump the lines at the bus stops! Rooms: Our room was a standard garden view room (340 square feet) with two queen size beds. We requested and got a room with a child's trundle bed and a refrigerator. The trundle bed and refrigerator were included in the price we paid. Only Disney value resorts (Pop Century and All Star resorts) charge for a refrigerator. You definitely need a refrigerator if you are travelling with two children and two infants! I had already read the reports of other TripAdvisor members regarding the best buildings in this resort. My preferences were building 18 or, as an alternative, building 14 - as these are closest to the guest-services building, Fultonâ€™s General store, Boatrightâ€™s Dining Hall and Riverside Mill, the food court. Luckily, we were given a room in Alligator Bayou block 14 which was great for us as this building is only a 3 minute walk from all the resort facilities. Our room was on the first floor and featured a color TV, telephone, Disneyâ€™s voicemail system, data port/internet access, coffee maker, safe, two sinks and a hairdryer. I have to admit that our room was not particularly luxurious. I can also confirm that our building appeared to be older and not so well maintained. However, the location of building 14 is ideal. If you want a more attractive building ask for a room in either of the H shaped buildings. Buildings 15, 16, 17 and 24 are best avoided due to traffic noise from Bonnet Creek Parkway. Disney's Magical Express: This limited offer is a complimentary service for Walt Disney WorldÂ® Resort hotel Guests only. It features complimentary shuttle and luggage delivery direct from Orlando International Airport to Walt Disney World Resorts. It includes delivery of your luggage direct to your hotel guestroom -and back to the airport again! The service is complimentary and includes round-trip motor coach transportation and baggage handling between the airport and Disney World. Use this service before Disney withdraws it at the end of 2006 when the â€œHappiest Celebration On Earthâ€� comes to an end! Dining: We did not try Boatrightâ€™s Dining Hall but had dinner at the Riverside Mill on most evenings. The food was great but the variety was not great. I recall there was more variety at the Caribbean Beach and Pop Century resorts. However, Riverside Mill was huge with lots of tables. We always managed to get seats even when the food court was heaving with resort guests. The take away pizzas were OK â€“ not the best I have had. The Disney cast members in the Riverside Mill and Fultonâ€™s General store were very friendly, helpful and polite. Our Experience Overall: As with all other Disney resorts staying onsite is fantastic â€“ staying with Mickey is a real bonus and I would not stay outside Walt Disney World especially since I donâ€™t like to hire a car and drive in unfamiliar roads while Iâ€™m on vacation. I must admit that the so-called heated swimming pools at the hotel were freezing in January and only suitable for polar bears! However, the pools were very clean and the kids loved the slides. Our room was clean and comfortable. We had no major problems until a noisy family moved into one of the guestrooms next to us. This is when we noticed how thin the walls were! A quick call to concierge remedied the situation! My family love Walt Disney World and on this trip Disneyâ€™s Port Orleans Riverside was the only resort which could accommodate all of us. Nevertheless I was impressed with this resort. We were very happy here and eagerly look forward to staying here again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “As expected.........”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort from 12th January to 20th January and, having stayed at a number of Disney hotels over the years (last one 5 years ago), you know what to generally expect. Port Orleans - Riverside meets that expectation. The setting is very pleasant and the rooms are OK. The food court in a morning was manic, but it always is and a good tip for UK tourists is that Americans get up early so try to get to the food court at about 8:30am to avoid the rush. Also, picking the location of your room is important as some locations are quite a walk. Ask for Oak Manor as it's two minutes from all the important things on-site. To me the real treat for this resort is the boat ride to Downtown Disney......a very pleasant experience on a warm night. As to the Disney Parks, I think Disney is cost cutting. The fireworks at Epcot don't last as long as they used to and the 3:00pm parade at Magic Kingdom isn't as big. The new ride Sorin' is very good. As always the 'England' part of the World Showcase is terrible. Why can't they have attractions like the French or the Norwegians? Will I go again? Of course I will.....my grand-daughter is three this year.

Reviews.Title: “Best Moderate Resort in Disney”
Reviews.Author: Edith_C
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at every Moderate and Value hotel on Disney property, and this one is now our favorite. We stayed in the Mansion Section, we were central to the pool, the lobby, restaurants and the bus stops. If you want to request a building, this would be it. It was called Magnolia. The room was wonderful. The furnishings were mock-antiques from the headboards to the armoire and fridge box. We had plenty of room. Look for the hidden Mickey on the bedspread. There were 2 sinks!!! That is a true plus. The pool was large and had a great water slide, but you can also go over to the French Quarter and use their pool, which was smaller, but had a fun theme. One of our favorite parts about this resort was the boat ride to Downtown Disney. It was so much more relaxing than hopping on a bus. They also offered horse drawn carriage rides, boat rentals, bike rentals, fishing gear rentals, you name it!!! We did encounter a few problems though. When we checked in they had us under a higher rate, it took a while to straighten out, so make sure you bring ALL DOCUMENTATION of your rate with you. Also the safe had no key, but that was fixed in less than an hour. All in all a great stay and we defiantly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. Stayed here for two weeks in June 2004. Very friendly staff especially in the bar and restaurant. The maid made my son's stay by making small displays with his soft toys every day. He couldn't wait to get back to the hotel to see what she had done next. It is well worth paying the extra to stay at this hotel. I speak from bitter experience. Stayed at All Star Movies for a week in June 2005 and it was so basic and lacked any real facilities. At Port Orleans you can hire bikes, boats, go for a ride in a horse and carriage and take advantage of the lovely boat ride down to Downtown Disney. And the transportation to the Parks is very regular and not too busy. Can't praise this hotel enough and if I ever get back to Florida will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “So very Peautiful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome. We Loved it. It is very beautiful. The only thing that we had a problem with was we had my parents and they had problems walking the long distance from the front door to our room. It was quite a long walk. Pictures can not do this place justice.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Time Was Had by All !”
Reviews.Author: tojojijo
Reviews.Content: Highly reccommend this place. We took a family Christmas trip (6 adults) and Stayed here. First stay at this resort. I requested Aligator Buyou for Dad, Mom, Sis in law & partner. Having Multiple Chemical Sensitiviy, I had to request the Acadia Bldg. since it is a non-smoking Bldg. And the only problem we had was upon check in when they tried to give me a non-smoking room in a smoking bldg. even though I confirmed via phone 2 days before for medical reasons. (Can't do it, get fever and swollen glands) But they were quick to resolve the problem and kept smiling too! When the rest of the gang was exhausted and went to bed, hubby and I took a walk & discovered the wild & crazy Piano man at the River Roost bar. Don't miss him! Hilarious Fun!!! Much audience participation. All ages too.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Perks”
Reviews.Author: nancydrew43
Reviews.Content: First let me start by saying that the best thing about staying at the Port Orleans, are the advantages you have when staying on Disney property. Our visit, (family of 5), started on Dec. 16th, 2005. Check-in had long long lines, took us about 45 minutes, so I reccomend you check in before official check-in time, a lesson we learned too late. The staff in lobby, very very nice and helpful, makes you feel like a valued customer. They make your wait as pleasurable as they can which did seem to make your wait shorter. The rooms , (we were I believe, alligator building 46 or 47, water view), were average, small, rustic, but very clean and actually came with a refrigerator at no extra cost!! The grounds are beautiful. Many pools, but too cold to use. They have several restaurants on site but we ate mostly in the theme parks. I can say, however, the pizza was not very good. I would stay here mostly for the perks, such as free parking at all Disney theme parks,free use of Disney transportation system, early entry into Disney theme parks, ect....Staying at a "Disney" hotel really makes you feel more a part of the Disney dream world atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Very Beautiful Resort !! Quiet, Clean & Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived just after New Years and requested a room in Magnolia Terrace based on good reviews - building 85 was very convenient...less than a 5 minute walk to the bus, 5 minutes to dining/lobby area. Our room did not have a spectacular view (shrubs & generator) but we didn't request a change as the location was SO convenient and not a problem for even a light sleeper like myself. Something I haven't seen mentioned is the comfort of the beds & bedding - a definite plus for the finicky. The room was quiet, clean and comfortable but on the small side for a family of four - one being a teenager. Next time I would splurge on adjoining rooms for more space. My kids enjoyed the rented motor boats (my son could drive at 14 - loved that!) & arcade was a definite plus! The boat ride to Downtown is also a real treat & beautiful at sunset! As far as buses go, we only had trouble 1 night returning by bus from the Magic Kingdom (after fireworks). Wait was almost an hour which is worse when you're tired.. but all other bus trips were quick and not too crowded. On the positive side, we had a great driver one night coming back from Epcot - told jokes and had everyone singing. He really improved the mood on a crowded bus. I would also recommend the dining plan - gave us great options for restaurants and meals (our reciepts were usually $140+) for 4 people. Our favorite was Biergarten at Epcot. Lunch with Cinderella at the Castle was also great for my daughter! She got pictures with Sleeping Beauty, Belle, Mary Poppins, Snow White & Cinderella. I would recommend this hotel and a vacation in Disney World - it is beautiful and my kids will have lasting memories!

Reviews.Title: “wasn't impressed with the service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was spacious couldn't have loved it more my children enjoyed the pool when we were there and the buses to all the theme parks came approximately every 20 minutes so once we checked in we never used our vehicle again and that was wonderful. Buying the meal tickets that disney offers is the Best idea a family should look into for staying on grounds I was told it was new this year and my family went to a vast majority of restaurants. The only true problem that I had was when we checked in I was told that by accident they had overbooked and our room that I had called to confirm before leaving Michigan would be what we had and well they had to give us a smaller room to my son had to sleep on a rollaway bed and when I did complain about this I was told well atleast you're not having to pay extra for it. We are now in the process of planning our trip back to Disney this year and I'm shying away from staying at this hotel again only because I want my whole family to be accomdated not only 2.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas High Season Transportation Needed Attention”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed "on property" 2 of the last 3 Christmas visits over the past 5 years. This was the first time at Port Orleans Riverside - previously had been at Caribbean Beach. This was by far the most challenging of the three trips. My spouse and I traveled with my 8, 6 and 2 year old and my parents - one in a wheelchair, and brother in law. For the most part the staff was very courteous and responsive with us. We were able to have not only rooms next door, but also with an adjoining door so that we did not have to go outside to visit each other - nice touch! We read in Frommers to request bldg 14 for proximity to dining hall and bus stops - this was accurate and a God Send!! We were pleased with not having to "hike" everywhere. In Alligator Bayou however the beds are very high to accommodate the trundle bed found in the two rooms we had. My mom 5 foot tall and early Parkinsons (among other issues) had GREAT difficulty getting into the beds. We requested a stool and they brought a shower stool like you sit on - not a step stool. They said this was all they had. - NOT Adequate. Resort to Park and Back Busing - again NOT adequate. I honestly felt that we were the bastard resort. While at the parks we tried to leave at off peak times (before park close, yet night right after fireworks or whatever) since we required additional assistance with the wheel chair. There were times we waited up to 40 minutes for our bus while seeing other resorts with much fewer guests waiting in line getting 2 or more buses. There was more than one of these such occasions where people were even left behind because the buses were at capacity. I have no idea how much longer they had to wait tho. I would have been more accepting of this if we were at a value resort and the deluxe ones were getting the extra buses, as I know money talks, but these were other Moderate resorts getting the extra buses (same category). In general Riverside seemed to be the fartherst bus stop before the value resorts also. Magical Express was great when we got there - the bags did "magically" appear, but if your flight leaves before 8 am - you have to check your own bags, and no matter what they tell you at the resort, for Delta, they DON'T take you to Level 3 where you catch a sky cap - they take you to Level 1 where you have to walk haul your own bags up to level 3, stand in line with the masses, and hope you an get thru in time to catch your plane (we were last people loaded 5 minutes before we took off). **READ THIS** If you have a wheel chair make sure you tell them when you check at the counter - only 20 or the 40 buses are accessible - but they will arrange for one when needed.

Reviews.Title: “A real travel agents opinion”
Reviews.Author: JJTravelAgent
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews about the Port Orleans Riverside before selecting this particular disney propety and my research paid off. This hotel could be a million miles from disney. The grounds and setting are as pretty as what people say. Having seen the propety I can now see why there are a few mixed reports as the resort is very spread out with four different bus stops, food court (so so prices but a poor set up trying to get breakfast!) and a main dining hall (breakfast very expensive but dinner seems good value). We paid for the water view and would say was worth it for the location more than anything. Best tip???? Ask for Oak Mansions, River View. 5 minutes max walk to the one of two bus stops, food court, main pool etc. Pool view room were we first given had a very annoying genarator right outside. Would definatly say these rooms are small for a family of four with slightly older kids. No MTV or video/pay movies in the room which would of been nice... cant quite understand why Disney haven't discovered that money maker! Staff were nice, friendly and helpful. Bus service was fantastic... most times we waited no more than 5/10 minutes to anywhere ... sometimes a bit busier of a night although they do seem to be getting a little better as I think previous guests had issues over the last few months/years. Takes little more than 15 minutes to any of the parks at any time. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel for its value for money, location and grounds.... just as long as you request the room location above.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay - very spread out and a little expensive for what you get...”
Reviews.Author: cdntravel_lovr
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans is a lovely resort to look at but if you're searching for convenience look elsewhere. We stayed here on our honeymoon and found that the buildings are VERY spread out. There are two huge sections to this resort. The first room we were given in Alligator Bayou had a 15 minute walk back to the main building/restaurants/cafeteria/shops, etc. which was a pain because that was where we ate most of the time - also the food is very expensive. We were then switched to a closer room but given two double beds (on our honeymoon!) The upsides are the nice grounds and the very nice (heated!) pool, but I can't imagine trecking little ones all around this resort. Also the price is a little steep for what you get. I would try a different Disney property next time.

Reviews.Title: “Disney at its best”
Reviews.Author: eagle241
Reviews.Content: This hotel incorporates all that is best about Disney World: imaginative, attractive, well-designed, immacculate and serviced by unfailingly cheerful staff. This was our third trip to Disney in the past two years. This time we went with 3 kids and spouses and 5 grandchildren. Staff worked hard to insure that we had four adjoining rooms, which were located in the scenic Alligator Bayou section of this enormous hotel (about 2000 rooms). The hotel is a short boat ride from Downtown Disney and has convenient access to all areas of the park through Disney's amazingly efficient transportation system. If you stay on site you do not need a car. You can stay at less expensive hotels off premises, but you lose the full Disney experience (e.g. expanded park hours for hotel guests) and the convenience of stating on-site. By Disney standards the hotel is moderately priced--much less expensive than, for example, the Grand Floridian or Animal Kingdom. Yet the only difference I could detect is that the rooms are slightly smaller. We stayed at Caribbean Beach a few years ago, which is in the same price range but not as nice as Port Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Halloween trip 2005”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and my 5 year old son stayed at Port Orleans Riverside for our 2005 trip to Disney, the year before we stayed at Caribbean Beach and enjoyed the trip immensely that we decided to try a different resort this time. We stayed for a little over 2 weeks at the resort, the first week we stayed in Alligator Bayou and found the location confusing (the signs didn't put you in the right direction) and it felt a little claustrophobic on the walk to and from the building 34 in which we were located. As it was my son's and my birthday whilst visiting, we asked for a move to the other part of the resort, and was very pleased to stay in Oak Manor building in Magnolia Bend, which was very clean and very well laid out with a lot of southern charm. The foodcourt at Riverside was extremely busy and the staff behind the counters were very rude and unhelpful, but the other staff throughout the resort were very gracious and friendly. We found the boat to Downtown Disney a very pleasant journey the first time, but then it became very busy at certain times and we waited up to an hour for a boat on 2 occasions, also the buses to the parks were a little hit and miss with what seemed much longer times to wait this year. Obviously we were visiting when it was halloween holidays, and that did make the resort much busier. We did enjoy our visit to Mickeys not so scary halloween party in the Magic Kingdom and would recommend that to anyone visiting at that time. Due to hustle and bustle of Riverside we spent most of our eating time over at the French Quarter as it was quieter and easier to navigate their menu's, being television screen's rather than boards at Riverside. The pool's both the main one and the quier pools were lovely and the Muddy Rivers bar was a pleasant to visit for a quiet drink. The playpark was rated highly by our son! We had a car the second and third week and found navigation inside of WDW very easy - and you didn't have to pay for car parking at the WDW parks if you showed your parking pass. All in all our stay was good but we won't be staying at Riverside again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations Not Met”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I can't compare POR to other Disney World Resorts, because this is my first visit. But I will address my disappointment in some things. First of all, our check in cast member did not have the Disney magical personality happening that day. I think she needed a hug or something!! She wasn't rude, but she was very friendly. We were assigned Alligator Bayou (#17). I had really hoped for the Mansion side of the river. The pictures I've seen of POR show more outdoor pictures of that section than the Alligator Bayou section. The Mansion section looked more clean, stately and peaceful. When we arrived we were given a highlighted map. We were so confused by the map and the dead-end paths leading to buildings that we thought we'd never get to our room. It would have been nice to have been given some more direction. Eventually we found short cuts to the dining hall and the bus stops. The good thing about the Alligator Bayou side is that you don't have to walk across the bridge to get to the dining hall. By the end of the day, walking is not your favorite thing to do. I felt like the grounds could have been cleaner. There was alot of algae and standing water. The quiet pool was not so quiet, fortunately our building did not face the pool. The boat service to Downtown Disney was a nice change from the buses. Next time I go, I will choose a resort that doesn't have so many stops. We never could figure out the route the buses took. They either went directly to a park, or they stopped at the other three resort stops as well as French Quarter. We waited for a bus anywhere from 3 minutes to 20 minutes. I recommend Spoodles at the Boardwalk. The food and atmosphere were excellent. Also go the the Prime Time Cafe and Sci Fi Theater at Disney-MGM. Our son is currently a cast member, so it was great to have a personal tour guide. Also, the bottomless mugs definitely paid for themselves.

Reviews.Title: “brillant and nothing to complain about”
Reviews.Author: A&Col
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here both of us 29 years old and from ireland. We were a little worried about if it was going to too full on staying a disney hotel. well it was fab, the water taxi and bus services to and from the parks were brillant and it saves you a lot of money instead of staying in other hotels that dont have the free bus service. the food court has all types of food and the dinner area is good and very friendly staff. the menu is a little limited tough. I would definately recommend this hotel to any one ,plus you can rent out boats and drive down the river in them. Also the room was cleaned every day with any amount of fresh towels . I would return in the morning ,,,,

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: happywanderer23
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this resort from Sept 29 through October 6. Our party consisted of 8 people - 2 parties of 2 and 1 party of 4 which included two children (aged 7 and 5). Everyone enjoyed their stay at Acadia House in Magnolia Bend. It was in a great location within the resort! Everything (including a bus stop) was within a few minutes walk away. The resort is maturely themed with beautiful landscaping. Quiet and peaceful. The children enjoyed the active swimming area of Ol' Man Island. The rooms were spacious, clean and attractive. Each of our three rooms had a requested fridge which proved to be beneficial for breakfast. The grade for the food court varied amongst our party. Some of us ate several meals there. The party with children ate there only once because of a less than favourable experience with the kids' meals. A good selection of restaurants is available at Downtown Disney which is a short and relaxing boat trip away. Bus transportation was quick and plentiful with the exception of Downtown Disney during the day. It is recommended to take the boat at that time because you will probably get to Downtown Disney quicker. All of the staff were extremely friendly. Overall, we loved our stay here and all of us would return again!!

Reviews.Title: “Riverside Was Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Steve284
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 week nov. 6 to 13th. Stayed here once 9 years ago when it was Dixie Landing. Rooms have not shown any wear since our last visit. Enjoyed the beautiful quiet pool next to our room rather then the loud larger pool in the resort center. (Old man Island) My daughthers are older now and enjoy the sun rather then the slides and water falls. Pools were constantly cleaned and checked for chemical levels. Grounds were lush and extremely well kept. Awesome winding walks along the man made river. 3 different bus stops plus the one outside the main reception area to transport you to the various parks. Some wait on the return after park closing but never that long. There was an attendant who monitored the time lapse between the park and resort at night. Ferry service between the resort and Downtown Disney area was great. We used this several times. 2 ferries running at all times and a fantastic senic ride to the resturants, shopping and clubs. The disney magic service delivered our luggage directly from the airport terminal to our room. Not having to lug suitcases from the airport to the resort is so worth it !!! All in all a great resort. There is no doubt I would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Will Go Back Again”
Reviews.Author: tammymacb
Reviews.Content: I returned from a long weekend at Port Orleans Riverside on Nov 13th. I went into the trip knowing I'd be staying at a nice hotel but I didn't plan to love. Boy, did I! The rooms are smallish ( common for Disney Moderates) but well appointed and cozy. The curtain separating the double sinks from the sleeping area gave an extra place to change that came in handy with everyone getting ready for dinner. Port Orleans is the only mod resort with a trundle bed and it will accomodate 5 people. I asked the chambermaid for extra towels, washcloths etc to supply my room of five and got plenty plus a bag of extra shampoos, soaps and facial soaps. The rooms are also equipped with a refridgerator, an iron, ironing board and in room safe. I was in Alligator Alley building 37 and it seemed far out but was still an easy walk to the main pool and lobby, restaurant etc. I never heard a noise outside in the evening, though. The grounds are beautiful, clean, expansive and really make you feel like you are living the Southern good life. ( Coming from Charleston, I felt right at home) The pools were great and you could also use the dragon pool at the French Quarter. We didn't though as the main pool at riverside had a hot tub, a large nice pool with a slide and plenty of chairs. The restaurants were good and the cafeteria style area was great at feeding everyone quickly and letting everyone chose what they wanted to eat. The Port Orleans are served by the Disney bus system, which I swear get slower and slower ( or I'm getting older and older) but another very nice option was the ferry into Downtown Disney. We did that in the evening and it was very pretty. Boat and bike rentals and horse and buggy rides rounded out the stay. Would I stay again? Definately! I have been to Disney at least 20 times and have stayed at almost every resort on property though this was my first time at Port Orleans. It won't be my last.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny!”
Reviews.Author: Manatee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed from Nov. 5-12 and from the moment we arrived until the moment we left we felt very comfortable. ALL of the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. We opted to rent a car so we did not take advantage of the Magical Express, but we did use the excellent Disney transportation to and from the parks, Downtown Disney and other resorts. Whoever designed the roads was brilliant! Resorts and parks were easier to find within the WDW boundries than outside (even though it wasn't that difficult outside of WDW). We stayed in the Oak Manor portion of the resort. Our room was very clean and the bed and pillows comfortable. We made good use of the two different sinks/vanity areas and the divider between the beds and bathroom. The shower and bath was consistantly hot and the pressure was good. The refrigerator was a plus to store extra water and drinks. We ate at Boatwright's and the food was very tasty. My husband ordered the prime rib which he thought was done perfectly. The service was fast and friendly. We only grabbed a quick snack at the food court, but thought there were plenty of choices for all tastes. We did stop into the River Roost bar for a drink. The bartender was full of advice along with making good drinks. We felt that the prices for drinks were a bit high but the atmosphere made up for it. The prices at Boatwright's were normal for what were are used to paying at home for a similar meal. We checked out the game room....which was huge. If you had someone in your party who enjoys that kind of thing I'm sure they would have fun. Our room was close to one of the quite pools and the river. We didn't go to the pool, but it looked nice and clean. We did rent a SeaRacer (two seater boat) for a spin around. The boats don't go super fast but it was relaxing to cruise up and down the river. Even though we didn't go on the horse and carriage ride it looked relaxing too. The horses were very calm. Fulton's General Store had wide variety of merchandise ranging from souveniers to snacks to medicines to beverages(alchohlic and non). I would definitely recommend this beautiful and quiet resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed the room and our stay

Reviews.Title: “Really loved Port Orleans Riverside”
Reviews.Author: MariaS22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Riverside Oct. 12-19. What a peaceful, beautiful resort it was. We stayed at the Mansion rooms at Magnolia Bend. We were right on the Sassagoula river and directly across from the main lobby/restaurant building. It was so nice to come back from the parks and relax while boats cruised up and down the river and horse & carriages clippity clopped up the pathway. The rooms were nice and always kept clean. The mattress was awesome, so comfortable. We stayed at the Coronado Springs on our last visit. Although I preferred the Riverside, the Coronado Springs Main Pool was amazing, better than Riverside's Old Man River pool. However, our kids preferred the quiet pool by our room anyway. We enjoyed the Riverside Mill food court. The decor was so nice and there was enough choices of food, however, service was pretty slow at times. We made a reservatio at Boatwrights too, prime rib was great and atmosphere very nice. Warning - if you daughter wants to have her hair wrapped at the booth by the marina, be prepared to spend a lot of money for one section of hair wrapped in string and beads. The price is $1.50 per inch, but in the end, the length on my daugther's hair came to 19inches! plus they charge extra for beads (total $37!). I learned my lesson. All in all this was a great place to stay. Service was great, the Fulton General Store had everything we needed including nice souvenirs, milk, bread, wine. Coming off the bus at night after the parks closed and walking across the wooden bridge to our rooms, it felt like coming home.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans lives up to our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at Port Orleans Riverside October 20-24 and just got home last night. This is our 7th straight year staying there and once again it was above our expectations. We tried the dining plans this time and what a bargain. I figured out that I saved over $500 just on food and character shows. The staff was wonderful, as usual, and they really kept us informed as to what was happening with the hurricane and what Disney's preperations would be. We went to Mickey's Not So Scarey Halloween party and it was totally worth the additional cost! We had so much fun! Definatley something I'd do again next year. The Magical Express was okay. Just make sure to pack an overnight bag to carry on the plane with you. We landed in Orlando at 3p and our luggage showed up at our room at 10pm. Good thing we packed our Halloween costumes in our carry-on! Disney leaves mail on your door explaining when your pick-up time for the Magical Express will be back to the airport and you can even check-in with your airline in the main lobby of the resort. Really neat. Even though we flew out in the middle of a hurricane, Disney and Port Orleans went above and beyond to make sure we made it to the airport safely (and our flight still left on time, in spite of the category 2 winds at Orlando Int'l) and were prepared to house us for an extra couple of days, if needed. Once again Port Orleans comes through with a fabulous time!

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights. Beautiful grounds. Rooms are very small, so keep in mind. Not in all that much but would have been nice to be able to move around easier after a long day at the park. 2adults,a 3 yr old and a 15 yr old so kinda cramped. Boat to downtown was enjoyable. Checkin easy as can be. Did'nt use meal plan or mug, went other places. Had car, so never used buses.Building 25 Alligator Bayou directly across from a pool, so at 1am and 2am . loud kids playing at pool is disruptive.would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Return stay-family vac.”
Reviews.Author: disneyfanforever
Reviews.Content: Our stay was from sept/oct value season. This was our 2nd time staying at this resort worth the extra $30 or so vs. value resort which we have also stayed. I booked the room through Disney reservation number on the website. ASK for AAA rate I pd $107 per night. they will not give you this info you must ask. We prefer this resort due to the boat transporation to the downtown disney area. During the Fall- parks close much earlier.. it's just nice to have another "boat" option rather then heading to the bus stop again. This was our first "real" family vac. We choose to return here also for the fact that it is so open, beautiful, and we knew the girls-who are 4 and 2 1/2 would enjoy playing ball in the grassy courtyards, like stroller rides along the S.river and watching the horses go by. To our surprise they have added refrig, coffee makers and the best of all curtain divider between the sinks and sleeping area. OK to all the moms who need to iron clothes and plan the next day while her family is sleeping..this was a God send. Food it is expense it does not change wherever you eat. You are going to disney..you budget money and then add some to that. ;) be safe a family of four. 2 adults 2 kids ave $100 a day you may spend less and it is very possible to do. all the reviews are spot on. We stay in the mansion we did not get mag. terrace like I requested months in advance, but Oak manor was actually in my opinion closer to the one bridge to the main building. pool was right next to building and no more then 5 people every time. Our daughters are still asking us if we can go back to our big white house :) They were very comfortable there and this is where we will return in the future. We did use the magical express..there are 3 stops before riverside driver was quick in unloading bags/strollers. Pick up ahhh you will be the first of the 4 resorts so it may seem you are leaving for the airport way to early. With the stops it all pans out. MExp. buses where nice and comfortable. Would use again if free. Just because you are at disney does not mean you are trapped in disney call mears from a house phone and get picked up to go to seaworld.. Dine with shamu..its better then a character brkfast. MOUSEKEEPERS- we tipped $1 a day which is expected we found if we tipped more nothing extra magical happened. The stuffed animals where always place nicely on the kids pillows. Soaps where always replaced. come on! you know you will take them also. BONUS at check in I told the desk that our daughter was here as a part of her bday celebration. Upon arriving at the room one even there was a 5x7 autog and message card from cinderella. They havent fizzled out all of the freebie perks YET. SNACKS- you are able to receive mail! we mailed a box of snacks to the resort and they where happy to store it and even delivered it to our room, not expected a thing. We mailed everything from fish crackers-cheerios, pudding and pretzels. Pack a bowl and load up your bev in the fridge each day. We ate brkfast in our room many days. We sent daddy to pick up warm things in the morning while the girls got dressed. REFILL mugs. this was the 1st time we bought them. We were water drinkers before, but now with the whole family we needed more bev options. WE HAVE 2 FOR SALE if you are interested. 2 for the price of 1 plus ship obo jodig76@zbzoom.net I have even seen people trying to sell previos yrs mugs on ebay. Its a nice keep sake but if it would help another family...we are willing to part with ours. TICKET and DINING desk- stop by early and get priorty seating for all your meal that you plan to sit down for. For all Of your day.....IMPORTANT! you will not be able to get in, very few restaurants had avaible seating for walk ins. we were not planning to eat in many "sit down places" but tried at the last minute to get into the aircond. one because it was in the 90's in oct. remember the parks close earlier...so do the restaurants. WE DID LEARN a new fact. If you make a priorty seating time..you are not obligated to keep it. there is no penalty, no charge..they just give your time away to a walk in. But it is extremely unlikely that a group would forgo a dinner reservation. Just book all your meals and be safe. DO NOT WAIT until the day of. hmm our 2nd trip I was preg with our first child we did not go to the parks, rather we went resort hopping every day we have experienced them all in one way or another I would still to this day choose riverside over the Grand floridian , Cont and Polyn deluxes. theese resorts are easy access to the magic king. but have not more magical touch then the riverside. I find nothing to complain about. We are 30, 29, 4 and 2 and have found are disney home forever here at PO

Reviews.Title: “Disney Resorts - is they way to go”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Port New Orleans Riverside was above average. We stayed from Sept 18-25/ 2005. Mickey Express: We were really worried about our bags getting lost... but in the end they arrived in our room, when we returned to after dinner. So use this service. Hotel Lobby Service: Overal Great Expereince - Don't ask Jon to help you because he doesn't have a clue... Car Rental: Rent from Hertz. Don't go to Magic Kingdom (Parking Lot) to rent a car. cars are booked fast and the services... was no service. Best thing to do - make arrangements before you arrive. Best Best things: They are very detailed - We went the week of my birthday and "Mickey" remembered! They brought a bday card to our room. Room - was always clean with extra soaps and towels. The Extra Magic Hours and the Meal Plan - A must! Food at the Port Orlean's wasn't that great! Very salty - Cape May's Seafood Buffet and Narcouzes are the best restaurants with exceptional services and food.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Port Orleans Resort in Disney”
Reviews.Author: casseydog
Reviews.Content: Me and my Partner and our 12 year old nephew stayed at the Port Orleans resort in disney, we stayed in the riverside section and where only a short walk away from the main complex where we went for breakfast. The staff were very friendly and willing to help, I would reccomend you spent the $12 on a refillable mug if you take kids, as they love being able to help them self at no extra cost. Would reccomend 9/10

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Way to Stay Disney”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I just returned after 8 days at Port Orleans Riverside. We were placed at Magnolia Terrace and the room was beautiful. We were in a quiet courtyard, very close to one of the pools. It was very quiet and the pool was a fantastic way to cool off after a day in the parks. The room was very clean and the staff left towel sculptures in our room each day. We did have a problem with the TV but that was fixed shortly after we reported it. Boatwrights was a great discovery, you must try the Sweet Potato Pancakes for Breakfast. We were hesitant about the Crab Cakes since we are from the Chesapeake Bay area, but when we tried them we were surprised on how good they were. The staff at the POR was fantastic and very,very friendly. We had the Dinning Plan and honestly could not eat all of the food it provided for us. We took many a dessert back to the room to snack on later. One thing that is important especially during the Food and Wine Festival, MAKE RESERVATIONS. We were blocked out of a few places we wanted to try simply because they were booked well in advance, up to two weeks. We also tried the Magical Express Luggage Service and we were both pleased with the ease and fast delivery of the service. A short time after we arrived our luggage was delivered to our room.
