When leaving you have to get your luggage to the bus, but they provided assistance and took very good care of us. While waiting to leave a staff member asked about our stay and asked how they could improve. He took our one suggestion and noted it. It was our experience in the past that when you checkout of the Hotel you were almost invisible, Disney does seem to be changing that and we were very pleased. One last tip, when shopping you can have the items shipped to your home from the Disney Stores on site. While it may sound expensive it's really not. In shipping you do not pay sales tax and the shipping cost is only slightly above the tax rate if you use the lower price option. We arrived home to find the first shipment waiting for us. Everything was wrapped in padding and even the most breakable items arrived in mint condition.

Reviews.Title: “Riverside Bldg 24”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at Port Orleans - Riverside Resort Bldg 24. The hotel is great and well landscaped....almost like a home in the country. The room turned out better than expected for three people. Your not in the room much any way, worked out great. The room appeared to recently been updated and a view of the pool which was hardly crowded. The walk to the main bldg was long but manageable. The service was great and cast members were great / helpful. The bus stop to the parks was close on the west side. This place does not remind you of a hotel more like a estate with small rooms. There are nearby vending machines for drinks. The only complaint is the food court closes fairly early (around 10pm) if you are a night owl...so if you have the refill mug and spend lots of time at the parks and the distance to the main bldg you may break about even with the cost of the mug. Also depending on how long of time you are staying at the resort. I figured you will have to get at least 5 or 6 refills to break even, which is difficult if you also have the dining plan as we did. You can order room service of pizza till midnight but did not try since we had the dining plan. The dining plan is great and is well worth it. The first day we were there the total $7.61 for snacks, $28.93 for lunch and a little over $109 for dinner. I suggest watching the newspapers or check disney website for bargins at disney resorts if you like to vacation in off season, they some times give free dining which was my case. We had a great time and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: horizonbound
Reviews.Content: We checked into Port Orleans - Riverside on September 14, late in the evening. Navigating Walt Disney World is not for the faint-hearted on their first visit...it took us awhile to find the place. Once you've arrived, do yourself a favor and let the excellent Disney transportation folks handle the driving. The room layout was unspectacular, with a generic outside-corridor motel arrangement. Nevertheless, the room was beautifully decorated with many features including an in-room safe, iron with ironing board, coffee maker and a shower massage among others. There were two minor complaints: one corner of one of the beds had come loose and was sitting on top of the trundle bed underneath, and the television remote control didn't work. A call to the front desk elicited friendly responses, and a real nice guy that showed up almost immediately to fix the bed and supply us with a replacement remote. In the bathroom, many folks like the idea of two separate sinks, but I would have preferred a vanity counter. Small glass shelves above the sinks aren't really the best substitute. And the tap water tastes TERRIBLE! Your room has a complimentary refrigerator; use it to chill the bottled water you supply yourself. Although the service in the food court isn't bad, the food is forgettable. The sit-down restaurant is much better, although pretty expensive. If you can, try to grab the boat to downtown Disney for better food and better choices. The hotel's gift shop is interesting, and the prices aren't too bad considering the venue: Not cheap, but not ridiculously expensive, either. Go in with an open mind, and you'll not be surprised. Daylight brought uncomfortably warm temperatures for a guy from the Pacific Northwest. Still, it's Florida. Some things have to be anticipated. The pool close to our room wasn't bad, although a bit generic. I'm not much of a swimmer, so my reviews end there. My sister's kids reported the "Dragon Pool" at Port Orleans French Quarter is much better, and there are of course the water parks of Walt Disney World. My sister was in an adjoining room, and while trying to knock on the wall to get her attention, we discoverd these buildings are of masonry construction and built to last...the wall was concrete. Small wonder why these rooms were so very quiet. This should be an attraction for many folks. I fully intend to return to WDW in the near future, since our stay was too short to take everything in. Port Orleans Riverside is an excellent choice as a base for your Disney adventures.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: missbb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at POR for two weeks in September and had a waterview room which was stunning. We stayed in Parterre place and contary to previous reviews thought it was the perfect location with a gorgeous view of the river and the boat going past. The grounds are beautiful and well worth a stroll. We do not have children and if you are a couple or group without young children i would suggested that Riverside is more suitable than the french quater, particularly if you want some relaxation after the parks. We had a quiet pool fairly near us and it was as it states- completly quiet and just what we wanted. Boatwrights was lovely and we would recommed the Pot Roast. We were not on a meal plan but would seriously look into it for next time. The on-site store was very helpful and useful and the staff often gave plenty of advice and help, we even got some stickers for waking up in the morning by the guy outside the main entrance which was a lovely touch. I thought the rooms could have been cleaned more thouroughly but it was a minor glitch in what was a fantastic holiday. Staying on site was well worth the extra money. The buses were brilliant and we got the boat to Down Town Disney regularly as it is beautiful. I would not hesitate in staying here again. Loved it! Thanks Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Riverside”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon, and let me tell you, it was great. The hotel had the ambiance of a stately antibellum mansion, and astounding views outside the hotel window. I felt like I was at Tara. :) White columns, cast iron rails and beautiful gardens set the scene in this quiet get away. I'd recommend the bingents for breakfast, found in the Port's food court. If you've never had them, you'll be hooked!

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Port Orleans-Riverside Wonderfull!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravellerDave
Reviews.Content: Returned last evening from spending 5 wonderfull days at the Port Orleans-Riverside (Sept. 14 - 19). Nobody does it better than Disney. From the moment you arrive at the Orlando airport, there is a friendly Disney cast member directing you to the transportation centre and Magic Bus. It was nice not to pick up the luggage, it just appeared in our room later in the day. We arrived in late morning and after a pleasant 30 minute bus ride (informaiton movie on board) we arrived at the hotel after a few drop offs which gave you a chance to see some of the other hotels. Our room was available immediatly, however, we just took a quick break and then on to the Magic Kingdom. The bus service from the hotel to all of the theme parks was quick and efficient. There is one ususally every 10 minutes so there is no waiting or long lines. Returning at the park closing is much busier, so what if you have to stand, most rides take only 10 minutes or so for the return to the hotel. Please note that if you wish to transfer to another resort, you have to go from your hotel to a theme park then get on a bus to that resort (plan extra time for that). The package plan including meals and Park Hopper Pass was wonderfull. Upon check-in they give you a swipe card with your name on it. It is your room key, park entrance ticket (you have to have place your hand in the gate wicket for finger print ID. each time you enter a theme park), and your meal ticket. Even for your snacks every restaurant, soda/popcorn stand in Disney takes the card. What an excellent system. We stayed in block 9200 which is just over the bridge from the main reception/restaurant area (about a 2 minute walk). There was a 24 hr. pool just outside the room which was never crowded or noisy. The food court was large with plenty of selection. Never felt crowded or had to line up for any period of time. Nice touch with the bakery, can still taste those cinnimon rolls right out of the oven. We had made reservations for evening dinner a month prior to leaving for the five full sitdown meal service credits. You are given a brochure on check- in which outlines which restaurant the 'meal plan' is approved for. The best dinners were at the other resorts especially O'Hannas at the Polynesian Resort. Ask for a table along the glass area and be seated prior to the Magic Kingdom fireworks show at 8:00, what a view. Boumas is also excellent at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. We also ate at the Liberty Square Tavern at the Magic Kingdom and at the Italy pavillion at Epcot. The Riverside Resort also has a good restaurant called Boatwrights, however, it pales in comparison to Boumas and O'Hannas. The meal package is very generous, however, a bit confusing at first. It you email me I would be more than happy to explain it to you. The front desk clerk at check-in did not do a good job with this and we had to stop in Guest Relations at one of the parks for a better explanation. The Riverside is a LARGE resort with 4 different bus platforms. For adults this resort has fever families with small children than the other moderate or budget resorts. I would not hesitate to stay there again, the grounds are beautifull and well kept. The rooms are very spacious and recently renovated. The Disney cast members are the company's best asset, all are friendly and greet you with a nice "hello". After talking to other people staying at the much more expensive luxury resorts, the Riverside compares favourably if not better in some aspects. Thanks Disney for making our vacation one of the best we have experienced for many years (this was our 9th trip to Disney world, the first time staying at a Disney Resort). Nice touch also with the "extended hours" at the theme parks for Disney Resort ONLY guests. Please feel free to email me at: dcardy2@cogeco.ca for any more details. Dave

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here very much. After reading a lot of reviews I requested a room at Magnolia Terrace. We were given a lovely room near the back area, which was nice and quite. The for of us were comfortable with the size. We put my son's crib in the vanity area, which is curtained off, and he got his own little private room. My husband, daughter and I were fine in the 2 double beds. The main pool was a lot of fun! The water slide entertained my 8 year old dau. for a long time. And the kiddie pool, which is nice and shaded, was perfect for my 2 year old boy. There is a bar, Muddy Waters, right there so we could enjoy some drinks too. We took the boat to downtown disney for dinner one night, and that was neat. The Boatwright resturant was really good and we all loved our meals. The food court, is well, a food court. Food is acceptable, but not great. We will stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: tb1966
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to the Us and we loved it. the standard of service was excellent ot POR. the rooms are comfortable and clean with excellent daily maid service. perhaps thye are ready for an upgrade but they were luxurious by european holiday standards. the maid did special surpirses with the chiildrens toys which thye looked forward to each day. we were in block 18 whcih backed on to a small pool which we pratcically had to ourselves. great for parking. bus transfers were plentiful. the parks were magical. Dont try mission space unless you have a very strong stomach!!!! 'soarin' was our favourite ride. the food hall is good and offers a selewction of fast foods. altho we were a bit vegatable deprived by the end of two weeks. the 12dollar mugs were indespensible. would certainly go again. Very hot 19th aug to 2 nd sep however queues were minimal and fast pass helped. great place kids adored it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, Very Spread Out”
Reviews.Author: Glendamax
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Port Orleans Riverside Sept. 9th - Sept. 15th, with a friend. I arrived on the Magical Express Bus, which was very nice. BUT, they did only send one suitcase to the room, and we had to wait another 30mins for the second one to get there. Check-in was very easy. The Cast Members were very friendly and helpful. We stayed in the Oak Manor Section of the Mansions, room 9014. The grounds are very beautiful, but it's very spread out. At the end of the day after hours of walking and standing, the last thing I wanted to do was walk around the resort. Even though my section of the resort was near the main bldg, I was nearest the parking lot. So I never had the luxury of taking a quick trip to the store, or food court because it was a little too far after a long day. Most of the photos I saw made the rooms look a bit dark. They were not. I was there with one adult, which to me was enough for the room. There was only one bench to put a suitcase on, and the pedestal sinks in the bathrooms leave little room for personal items. I GREATLY appreciate the reviewer on this site who posted pics of what the room looks like AFTER you have unpacked. Those pics accurately showed how much space you're really dealing with. We only ate one meal at their sit-down restaurant Boatwrights. We ordered a house salad, garlic cheese bites, pot Roast, grilled pork loin, 2 sodas and 2 slices of pecan pie. The total was 60.31. The entrees were just okay. But the Pecan Pie was GREAT! We got a slice from the food court just about everyday we were there. We were glad that we were on the Disney Dinning plan. Our waitress Patricia gave us extra corn muffins and packed up our desserts to go. This was extremely helpful, because we ate these as snacks for the next few days. THANKS PATRICIA! We went back to thank Patricia but it was her day off. We enjoyed the food court. We ate both breakfast and dinner there. It was surprising how good and big the dinner portions were. And don't forget the pecan pie! For those of you who enjoy old arcade games, I'm pleased to tell you that they have MILLIPEDE!!!! (YES YES) They also have Ms. Pac Man, Space Invaders, Bowling, Centipede and Galaga. But unlike when I was a kid, the games cost 50cents. If I booked this hotel again, I would ask for a room that was closer to the main bldg. Those rooms appeared to be the ones in Oak Manor with a water view. I enjoyed my stay here, the rooms were big enough for 2 adults and comfortable. However, since the people staying there have been walking and standing at the parks all day, it would be great if it wasn't so spread out.

Reviews.Title: “A Magical Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed at the hotel at the end of August. It was a wonderful experience. The check-in was quite easy, the room clean, the food court had a great selection, and the people very friendly and helpful. The scenery was nice and we had a pool right outside our building that was open 24 hours. There was a laundry facility there also (which I did not utilize on my vacation). I would definitely recommend that a large family take advantage of the Disney Magic Express package. We found it to be a great money saver especially for the food. We had dinner at some great restaurants and everything was paid for prior to arriving. Boatwrights at Port Orleans was one of the restaurants on the meal plan and their food is delicious. Along with the Magical Express package is the convenience of not seeing your luggage from the time you check-in at the airport until you get to your room. Also, when you check out, the hotel staff will check your luggage and you won't see it again until you arrive at your home destination. Very convenient! It was the first time any of us ever visited Disney and we truly enjoyed all the parks and Downtown Disney. I highly recommend Port Orleans Riverside!

Reviews.Title: “Transferred to the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Charpature
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the Port Orleans Riverside hotel late in the day. We were assigned a handicapped room (neither of us are handicapped) in the Parterre Place building. We were both extremely disappointed. The building itself (in the much heralded Magnolia Place part of the resort) looked like a desolate nursing home. The room itself was...lacking. It did not seem like it had been renovated in awhile, the carpets were dingy. It just did not seem very "magical" at all. After a call to the Disney guest service line, we were cheerfully and promptly transferred to the French Quarter (yay for Disney Guest Service). Much, MUCH happier there. The rooms were freshly renovated and just gorgeous theming. Really look at the pictures before you book Riverside. Also - the bus back from the parks will drop French Quarter off first, then go through all four stops for Riverside after. Definitely a plus to get dropped off first!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: mparry1964
Reviews.Content: We have returned from a wonderful family holiday and this resort was perfect for our family of 5. The check in was very quick and took a few minutes, the room was perfect and very clean ( building 17), it had a quiet pool a few yards away, the housekeeping was superb and every day arranged the kids toys things etc in a fun or special way which made returning to the room excitng for the kids. The bar in the evening with Bob the Piano man was fantastic and again fun for all the family, Bowrights the resturant was a great place for a meal, we did have a go at the fast food section once and that was ok aswell. The grounds are truely beautiful and breath taking, so all in all this is a must stay at resort and we will be staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic holiday”
Reviews.Author: Tracey77
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Port Orleans on 12th August and in spite of TravelCity not booking us the water view we had paid for, the staff arranged for one anyway. Our room was in a great location, in Oak Manor right next to the small swimming pool - ideal for cooling off after a busy day. Our two kids loved the Old Man River pool with its fountains and water slide, and we too made good use of the $12 refillable cups. As we were there for two weeks this was invaluable! The whole resort is beautifully landscaped and spotlessly clean. The boat to downtown Disney was great and we never waited more than ten minutes for a bus to any of the parks. Staff at the resort were friendly and helpful and Bob, the piano man in the bar, had everybody singing within minutes of sitting down! Our only gripe was the size of the beds. Having stayed in other hotels in Orlando we were used to the luxury of queen sized beds! However, we are now converted to staying at Disney properties for the atmosphere, convenience and friendliness of the staff. We would definitely return to Port Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the beauty and charm of the South”
Reviews.Author: DDore
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a fabulous vacation at this gorgeous resort. We had a king room on a corner. The view of the river from Patre Place was well worth the extra cost. Everyone on staff was friendly and knowledgable. The meals in the food court were well above average. Try the omelettes. They were fluffy and delicious. The bus service was timely and delivered with a smile. Take the boat ride to Downtown Disney. You may be surprised at what you see and what you learn. This is one of the most romantic resorts in the US. POR is not crowded during the last two weeks of August. But it is quite hot and humid. All four theme parks are very close to POR. You can see the fireworks from EPCOT. You can also hear the fireworks from the Magic Kingdom. The Magical Express Service works just as advertised. We arrived before our room was ready. They stored our carry-on luggage for free. Our main luggage arrived in our room before we returned from our first day at the parks. Couples, both young and old, will find the mansions to be their romantic home away from home. We hope to return when the weather is not so sultry.

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: 1NoPlaceLikeHome1
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans Riverside at Disneyworld as fantastic. I stayed for 3 nights in Partere Place Mansion with water views and it rained for 2 of the day but the staff made the experience worth it. The rooms were spacious and clean, I loved the 2 basin wash area. The food court was convenient and food was always interesting.. there was something available for everyone. The hotel had a general store that sold the usual Disney merchandise (great for last minute souvenirs), snacks and drinks. The buses were frequent and not too overcrowded. A great please to visit if you want to be a kid again and like to experience some southern atmosphere. Reccommended.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: tmr_723
Reviews.Content: My family & I visited Disney just a few weeks ago. Last year we stayed at Port Orleans, French Quarter. This year we stayed at Riverside. Very relaxing, georgous landscaping, incredible atmosphere. We were further away from the food court this year, but all in all the stay was great! Rooms were cleaned daily and we always had an ample amount of towels. Would recommend using one of the other pools in that the pool at Old Man Island was always crowded. My 8 year old daughter always enjoyed the less crowded pool. Would recommend this resort to anyone! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in the disney resort, our first in Port Orleans and we thoroughly enjoyed every aspect of our holiday. The setting is idyllic, we felt a million miles away from the hustle and bustle of the parks, when in reality we were just a bus ride, or a 5 minute water taxi ride away. This hotel is officially classed as a moderate resort but we felt truly pampered and looked after by all of the on site cast members. You park near your room wherever it is, have the infamous "pizza button" on the phone and get to rent various size boats to go up and down the river in...come on what more do you want?!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel! Great!”
Reviews.Author: rata_200
Reviews.Content: The gratest hotel! I have stayed in a lot of very good hotels like four seasons, ritz etc.. and this one is one of my favorite! The rooms were very confortable and clean, The staff was great and kind, the public areas were really beautifull and marvelous, the pools were great, and the lobby was very very beautiful. The food was great. I would absolutely reccomend this hotel to everyone!!! You will be amazed!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, great service”
Reviews.Author: marting
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 9 nights with my wife and 2 kids (3 and 8). On arrival the recption staff were very friendly, the wait for check in took a while because everything was explained in detail, plus they changed my room to a nicer block (90, just across from the boat pier) without a problem. The room itself was a bit small, with the sinks in the living area. It was cleaned well each day with a new arrangement of towels on the bed (Mickey ears etc) for the kids which they liked a lot. The food court was a bit poor for the money so try to eat away from the hotel (I recommend House of Blues in Downtown Disney). Entertainment wise Bob Jackson was good fun in the resort bar, getting the crowd going and involving the kids in sing songs. The "quiet pools" were a bit deep for the kids but we only had a small walk across a bridge to the fun pool which was good, although it's also worth the 2 minute drive to the French Quarter to use their pool - a bit better for the smaller ones. Buses were regular and not too crowded except at Fireworks time - we watched them for the bus queue to miss the crush! Overall we had a great time in Disney and thought POR was great place to stay. The only thing I could have asked for was a slightly larger room. Well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “We felt as if we were home and protected.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I know that this is a dated review of Port Orleans-Riverside but I want everyone to know what my husband and I experienced during the horrible time from September 11, 2001 to September 14, 2001. Both my husband and I are in our late fifties. We have travelled many times to Disney World and stayed at Port Orleans Riverside three times. We arrived at Port Orleans Riverside on September 5, 2001 and for those 6 days at Disney World we had a wonderful time - just the two of us! We visited all the parks and spent a day at Typhoon Lagoon, and spent every night taking the boat from Riverside to Downtown Disney and Pleasure Island. The room was clean, the surroundings were romantic, calm and peaceful and the services offered to us were more than just acceptable. The only complaint we had was the food offered at the food court, but then again, we had wonderful choices once we entered Epcot and all the marvelous restaurants at World Showcase. However, I digress. On the morning of 9/11/2001, we were scheduled to fly home to Michigan. I called my daughter to remind her to pick us up at Detroit Metro airport and she told me to turn the tv on. Our whole world began to fall apart watching the horrendous events of that day. We knew we could not leave nor could we get home anytime soon since all flights were cancelled. There were hundreds of guests at this resort all concerned about loved ones at home and wanting to get home. I cannot say enough positive things about Disney Corporation and how they treated us at Port Orleans Riverside. While we were there, my husband and I made many long distance calls home to talk with our family and friends. All of these calls were "backed out and off" of our long distance calls and these calls were not charged to our room. We were reassured that as soon as Disney had any information about getting home we would be notified. On 9/11/2001 many families had arrived with their children to celebrate their vacations and good times and memories. Since Disney World was considered a prime terrorist target, all the parks were shut down immediately after the attacks. Disney World made sure that the children in the resorts had at least some form of entertainment and reassurance. They brought in Mickey, Minnie, Goofy, Pluto, Chip and Dale and many other disney characters into the lobbies of their resorts in order that the children staying there would be entertained and reassured that everything was really OK! The young people who dressed up as Disney characters did this on their own time to make the children feel better. When we could not leave Florida, we were told by Disney "You are our guests and therefore our families and you will not be charged for the rooms we stay in for the interim until we can get home." When the parks were opened on September 12, the guests were given free admission to all the parks and free lodging at the resorts until we could go home. What can I say? I felt protected and cared for during a horrible, horrible time when all my husband and I wanted to do was get home. All during 09/11 the guests of our resort gathered around the large tv screens in the main lobby area, watched the horrors and cried and hugged each other even though we were all strangers. We felt helpless and vulnerable and filled with grief that day. The staff at the front desk did everything they could to help us and reassure us and make us feel safe even though they wanted to be home with their loved ones that day. God forbid this ever happens to our country again, but if it does, Disney World is the place to be, other than home, where you will feel safe, protected and cared for. My husband and I have travelled extensively to Europe, Great Britain and taken many cruises. The week we spent at Disney World before 09/11/2001, will be remembered as one of the best vacations my husband and I ever had. We were in our late fifties and we felt like 10 year olds again visiting all the parks and in the evenings we felt like college students again enjoying the nightlife at Pleasure Island. We have been to Walt Disney World six times (twice with our children when they were young) and we are looking at a seventh trip this fall to make us feel young again. Disney World is a class act and well worth the money spent. Paul and Elizabeth Dyas, Canton Michigan

Reviews.Title: “A great vacation at POR”
Reviews.Author: rachael'smom
Reviews.Content: My husband, 3 daughters (age 8, 16 and 19) and I just returned from 5 nights at the Port Orleans - Riverside. We selected POR as it was the only moderate hotel on the property that would accomodate the 5 of us. We were worried about the 5 of us staying in one tiny hotel room, but were pleasantly surprised. There was plenty of storage space, the closet area was large and the tub/toilet separate from the sink area was a plus. There was also a huge drape that could be closed around the closet/sink area for additional privacy. What a huge benefit that was! Not only did it give us privacy but blocked the light when the early risers were up getting ready while the rest of the gang was still in bed. We were in Building 26. It was a bit of a walk to the closest bus stop and main pool but not outrageous. However, the main building was quite a hike and not very convenient. We were only in there on our first and last days and didn't even bother to purchase the refillable mugs because of the distance. POR is huge and we found that the buses to be much more crowded than on our previous visit at Coronado Springs. With a party of 5, I would definitely stay there again. Otherwise, I would try another one of the moderates. I like trying different places and some of the other moderates are not quite as large.

Reviews.Title: “a great week”
Reviews.Author: pk30015
Reviews.Content: To start, its Disney, its great and it certainly lived up to that. Myself and my fiancee stayed in port orleans for 2 nights on arrival in late may and then again (after some travelling) for 9 nights in early June and we had a terrific time. The idyllic location was superb and certainly looked as good as the pictures had implied, if not better. The weather unfortuneately wasnt brilliant - 4-5 days of solid rain which is so unusual for florida at this time of year. However that wasnt Disney's fault or Port Orleans, and the whole place was just so beautiful and condusive to relaxation, we would certainly stay here again. We got to stay in both type of sections and we certainly preferred the mansion type areas for looks and location but thats purely a personal opinion. Others may prefer Alligator Bayou. The food court was probably the only 'average' part of Port Orleans: Riverside because it is exactly that - a food court, just like in a shopping mall - however there were plenty of eating options which I felt was adequate. Certainly better than the French Quarter which we tried out once and were shocked by how tiny it was and how much lack of choice there was. With the weather being so bad, we did find that the choice of television channels was quite limited compared to back home in England or many other places and htoels we have stayed in the USA but that shouldnt be an issue if its good weather or if you dont spend a minute in your room which most dont. The rooms we stayed in were clean on arrival and regularly cleaned throughout our stay, the pool areas were superb and had everything we needed. Another minor issue which for most will never happen as our trip was somewhat unique, was that Disney nearly lost our luggage. We were assured by Disney that as we were going travelling for a few days around the carolinas, to take in a NASCAR race in Charlotte, that we could leave some of our luggage we didnt need for those few days, with Disney for safekeeping. This was terrific as we didnt want to cart everything around with us knowing we were coming back to Disney for 9 days. The only proviso they gave us, when I checked this before booking, being that we returned to the same resort which was fine. Anyway on departure for our travelling, we handed in one suitcase and received the equivalent of a receipt slip - I made extra efforts to make sure the person understood we were returning in 6 days again to confirm. On our return they could not find the luggage for 20 mins or so only to find it behind the front desk, taped up and ready for fed ex delivery back to the United Kingdom later that evening as they thought we had returned home to the UK and had left it behind. Its minor and unlikely to happen to most but worth mentioning in case anyone has similar plans, so they might be wary. To conclude, if you've got the money to spend then stay here, its worth it!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for a moderate price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans for our one-year anniversary trip. We couldn't quite justify the cost of the deluxe resorts, but wanted something nicer than the all-stars for the special occasion. We got exactly what we expected - a nicely decorated and very clean hotel, with very nice grounds and landscaping throughout. The food at both the food court and the sit-down restaurant was quite good. Access to the theme parks via the busses was fast and efficient, and the boat ride to Downtown Disney was a nice change. Every time we interacted with a staff member, we found them friendly and helpful. The only real negative I can think of is the distance we had to cover to get from our room to the main buildings, pool, or bus stop. I imagine though that the staff would be happy to find a room closer for you if this was a problem, and if not, the beautiful grounds are a pretty nice walk. We've stayed at all-star and deluxe Disney resorts as well as Port Orleans, a moderate resort. For the money, it's probably the nicest place we've stayed, and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Service should be better- Overall Good-Riverside”
Reviews.Author: collinstrip
Reviews.Content: My family, wife, children ages 13 and 14 and I stayed July 18-23. Magical Express turned out to run very smoothly, even though we had heard differently. We arrived at the airport at 10 AM and were at the resort by 11:30. Check in was a breeze, and the service was wonderful. They answered all our questions, and provided us with maps and schedules. We stayed in building 14 which was very convenient to the food court, lobby, General store, and the main bus stop. We prearranged a carriage ride, which I would recommend for the family, cost $30, for our first evening there. The food court left our family less than pleased. The food itself was average, the counter service was at times poor. We did not eat there that much, maybe 3 times total, however every time we did we waited sometimes 30-45 min. for our food. The Boatwright service was fine, however the food was below average. My wife and I both ordered the ribs and they were of very poor quality. We didn't eat there again. Get the refillable mugs for $11.99. The maid service was very good. There were numerous times we returned to our room to find the maid had left us something, or arrange the toiletries in a special way. The pool area was fun, and both our children made new friends while visiting. The lifeguards were very responsable, and helpful. I would recommend the Sea-Raycer, the small two seater boats. The gentleman at the service area went out of his way to try to accommodate our desire to rent two at one time. We spend an hour riding from the resort to DTD. The bus transportation from the resort to the various theme parts were very good; we waited no more than 10 min. I would recommend visiting the lounge in the evening, the entertainer, "Joe" was very funny and enjoyed making everyone laugh. The show is for the entire family. The landscape was well maintained, however my wife thought there would be more flowers than there were. The boat ride to DTD was very pleasant, the CM's made it entertaining, even giving my children, as a joke "co-captain" buttons, for them to wear. I would recommend the resort because of its overall service, price, and Southern theme, however I would recommend eating elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Had an amazing honeymoon at the Riverside”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been reading reviews for a company trip that we are planning for Cancun later this year and the thought crossed my mind that I should write a review for my honeymoon trip to the Port Orleans Riverside. We were supposed to fly in from Gulfport, MS. However, we had major airport delays the day after our wedding. Atlanta was snowed in and our flight was no longer available. The next flight out was booked so we had to drive 45 minutes to the Mobile, AL airport that afternoon in order to leave. So, we were hoping to arrive early in the day in order to have time to see some of the parks that day but we did not arrive until 7pm or so. We had arranged with Disney to have a car pick us up at the airport so that we would not have to wait for the Disney bus and wait for others to get off before our hotel. We were picked up by a white Lincoln which was a nice touch since we were on our honeymoon! The driver was very nice and the ride was completely no hassle. When we arrived, we went to the desk to check in. However, the girl at the desk informed us that there were no more King Beds available. This was NOT acceptable, we were on our honeymoon! Nothing like a fifties-style sleeping arrangement! We asked if we could at least be placed in a King room the next morning. She said yes but we would have to call down the next morning to check to be sure. Not at all comforting. I showed her my tickets and info I had received from Disney, with the note about requesting a king bed and she said she was sorry but there was nothing she could do. We were so tired and frustrated with the airport delays and king bed issue we just went to the room they gave us and ordered a pizza. We decided to try ONE more time and called down to the front desk and asked them to search and see if there were any king rooms available...amazingly, they said there were some available and we were moved right away. I think that the first girl at the front desk did not want to take the time to search for one since it was late. Well, that was the only problem we had the whole time and it was forgotten the next day since we had so much fun! The buses to and from the parks are great and the rooms were really nice. The only thing some people may not like is the amount of walking you have to do from the bus stops but there was one right behind our building. I live near New Orleans so this place was really no different from the southern atmosphere I'm used to. Now then, if anyone ever asks you when to go to Disney, weigh the options, and only tell the people you think should really know! If too many people find out, then it'll be too busy! But truly, if you ever want to know when the slowest time of the year is with gorgeous weather, look no further than the last week in January and first week in February. It is value season, it didn't rain any and the weather is short-sleeve or thin long-sleeve, Shorts or jeans, depends on your prefernce. It was almost dead in the parks. We like Epcot because of all of the different options for dinner but when we went during the day, it was almost like a ghost-town, which we loved. It was like having the park to yourself. We had such a blast and the trip was so fun. My husband and I are fun loving 20-somethings and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The Port Orleans breakfast buffet was nice as was the pizza delivery, and the resort grounds were well kept and quiet. It's a nice relaxing place away from the parks. If you have any room problems, just be persistent-it paid off for us. This resort is huge, they're bound to have what you're looking for or need. Hope you enjoy is as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: michellelo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at POR from June 26 for 11 nights. There are 3 adults and 2 kids in our party so we stayed in the Aligator Bayou to take advantage of the trundle. The grounds are very beautiful with lots of vegetation, and transportation to different parts of WDW is very convenient. However, we were not too impressed with the cleanliness of the room. There was a live cockroach in the room on the night we arrived, and there was trash on the floor (in the gap between the fridge and the chest) left behind by the previous guests. There was also visible stain on the side of the sink (again, left by previous guests) which still existed a few days into our stay so I ended up cleaning it myself. Also, we often had items in the room missing when we returned in the evening, including coffee pots, coasters for the glasses, flat and fitted sheet for the trundle, kleenex, etc. The food in the food court was only "so-so", we had 1 dinner and 2 breakfasts there but that was more than enough. All in all, we think POR is OK for the price we paid ($124 per night after annual pass holder discount, plus tax), but we'll probably stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased!”
Reviews.Author: TampaBay4
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 night stay at Riverside, July 2005. I was very pleased with the staff, room and resort grounds. I have stayed at both Yacht Club and Beach Club in the past. Both very nice resorts but not much better than Riverside. Riverside's price is a DEAL! I would recommend Riverside for it's beautiful landscaping, clean rooms and queit surroundings. Very nice stay all arround!

Reviews.Title: “inservice better”
Reviews.Author: GRANDOF2
Reviews.Content: i enjoy staying at the resort with my family we stood for 8 night and 9 days the room was very pretty BUT,the maids did not do a good job keeping the room clean they didnt pick up empty soda bottles that was left behind the night before one day we ordered pizza and the pizza box stood on the table for 2 days and finally it got thrown out,I was very surprise that in a resort that belongs to disney that holds a high standard in service their maids where not doing their job correctly! Also my little guy who is 3 years old got bitten by a spider on his lower lid of the right eye i thought it was a misquito bite but it wasnt i had to call a doctor so he could come and check him. All together i spend 200.00 dollars on the doctor to come to my room and 85.00 for the medicine. My little guy slept on the trundle bed so i guess that where he got the bite from they need to clean underneath the trundle bed cause spider do nest and hide underneath thing. They need to inservice their employee better on how to clean a room correctly All and all i enjoy the resort and in the future will visit again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Disney Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MidwestFella
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Stayed for 8 nights beginning on June 25th. Had a fabulous time. Room was very clean and comfortable. Prior to arriving had asked for a corner room in a specific building near the main pool, and was assigned the perfect room at time of check in. Our daughter turned 8 while we were there, so I called the front desk and they delivered an autographed 5x7 photo of Cinderella. Also had a birthday line wherein Goofy wished her a happy birthday! A true Disney experience. No service problems of any kind.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside from June 26-July 3rd. This was our first visit to one of the WDW properties. First of all, what people have written about the landscaping is true- absolutely beautiful. The different variety of trees and plants, the wildlife, the river- was truely like staying on a southern plantation. We ate at the River Mill a few times, and the food is good- although somewhat pricey (although the prices were not out of line with food all around Disney). The best deal going is the cinnamon rolls-they are out of this world and reasonably priced. I would recommend stopping at a grocery store before getting to the resort and stocking up on lunchmeats, bread, etc, as that will save you a few bucks, and there are small refrigerators in the rooms (there was in ours anyway). I would recommend bringing some 2 liter bottles of soda also; even though there are free refills on the soda, hot chocolate, coffee, etc. if you buy the $11.99 length-of-stay refillable mug, it can be a long walk to the dining hall to fill up the mug. WDW offers a great transportation system; we rarely had to wait more than 10 minutes for a ride anywhere within WDW. The feature pool is awesome, with a nice water slide and water pouring down on you at some places from above; my children couldn't get enough. We are making plans to come back again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at Port Orleans-Riverside”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans-Riverside (POR) in early April 2005. This was our first stay at POR, second trip to Orlando. There are 2 sections at POR; Magnolia Bend and Alligator Bayou. We were in a nonsmoking room in the Magnolia Bend Section, about a 5-minute walk from the main building. The room had plenty of space for 2 adults and 1 child. The room was equipped with 2 double beds, a television, small round table with 2 chairs, and a small fridge. The bathroom was small with toilet and shower/tub but there was a nice area outside the bathroom with 2 sinks/mirrors and a curtain which could be pulled which made it easy for one person to be getting ready while another using the shower/toilet. The room was clean and housekeeping had always come before we had returned from the parks in the afternoon. There were many activities at POR including 1 main pool with a slide and many spraying fountains and a spa along with several satellite pools around Magnolia Bend and Alligator Bayou. We spent much of our time in the quiet pools which were spacious and less active, easier to keep an eye on a child. Among other activities were bike rentals, boat rentals, an arcade, and horse drawn carriage rides at an extra cost of course; and if you like to walk or jog, the grounds are beautiful with nice walkways and many trees and flowers. The bus transportation was very efficient to the parks. We never waited more than 10 minutes for a bus. There was also boat service to Downtown Disney that was very convenient for a meal or shopping. The Riverside Mill Food Court at POR was great with many selections to please everyone. It was a little pricey but comparable to other WDW eateries. There was also a restaurant, Boatright's Dining Hall, which we never ate at but always had many customers. Fulton's General Store was wonderful for souvenirs or snacks but also had baby items, non-prescription medications, film, and other convenience items. Overall beautiful well-kept grounds with a friendly helpful staff making it a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is simply an excellent hotel. We chose Riverside over staying at one of the budget hotels and are so glad we did. The landscaping is awesome and the rooms were neat and well stocked. When the room maid realized we had 4 in the room she left extra towels and soaps for us. There are several quiet pools around the complex so we didn't have to be around splashing if we didn't want to. We will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “There is no better place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: JeanAnn1988
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our vacation stay at Port Orleans Riverside. There is no better place to stay in Disney in my opinion. The grounds are, simply put, beautiful. There are plenty of activities to keep everyone satisfied. We took the boat one night to Downtown Disney. That is an added bonus. After long hours at the park, you have the luxury of a nice boat ride, no hassles with finding a place to park. The pools are great. We spent the mornings at them. They are not crowed during the day at all! Plenty of chairs for all to enjoy. The rooms are nice size and very clean. This makes our third stay at this hotel and I guarantee we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great once again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 10 day trip to Disney for the 4th year in a row. We just can't get enough. This is our second stay at the Riverside and once again no complaints. We are a party of 5 (2 single moms (sisters) with 3 kids combined) and this hotel was spacious enough for us all. The mini fridge was a great bonus this time...however being on the Disney dining plan we didn't find much need to bring extra food or drinks with us to the parks. I would highly recommend the dining plan as well...it worked out great for us. The resort itself is spacious and beautiful but me who gets lost easily didn't find if hard to navigate at all. The pools are great and the food in the fast food area was great. The cashiers were quick and friendly. The one complaint would be the bus waiting area...they should have que lines like at the parks set up because on busy days people come from everywhere to board the bus so the first come first served doesn't apply there...it's whoever is most aggressive boards the bus first. But the buses seem pretty frequent so its not a major problem. I would put up with it for the convienience of not having to drive myself around there. We also used the new magical express service to and from the airport...it worked out great for us. 1 piece of our luggage was lost on the way there which happened to be mine (it arrived 2 days later) but i must say the manager on duty "Xavier" did a BRILLIANT job of accomodating me in the mean time and getting the luggage to me. THANKS AGAIN for that! I love Disney and would definetly come back to this resort. The character meals are fun for the kids but the food is not the greatest...we have been to many of them...my highlights being the Princess Breakfast in Norway at Epcot (best food), and both the character breakfast and dinners at 1900 Pare Fark in the Grand Floridian. However my kids would choose Chef Mickeys...they love the atmosphere. I would also recommend the dinner at O'Hana (no characters but it does have kids activities)...loved the food and the atmosphere...we had a great time. The one sit down meal I would highly recommend is the Kona Cafe at the Polynesian. Great food...best service and even better if you are on the dining plan! I hope to be back again next year! Hope I helped a few of you out there! Let me know if I can help more and have a great time on your trip! I miss the palm trees already!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: kmhbarr
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at Port Orleans Riverside. This was the first time that our children had ever been to Disney, so of course we were all rather excited! Very pleased with the rooms at Riverside...beautiful, relaxing, quiet, BUT...hard to find. After we had checked in, it took us about 10 minutes to actually find our room. Then, the walk from our vehicle to our room was rather long. However, once we found our room...the walk didn't seem that long. Rooms are nice, but I recommed for those who like to have the room cold when you sleep to bring a plug-in fan. The pools were perfect...the kids especially liked the one with the water slide in it. They have a nice bar by the pool which serviced mom and dad's needs....a daiqurie for us and a smoothie for the kids. Much to do...horse and buggy, boat rides, bike rides, even just take a walk around the grounds...watch our for the cute little bunnies that hop around. The services were wonderful. The cleaning lady always made us feel at home when returning to our room...everything was perfect...she even made a toothbrush holder out of towels for us. The fast food dining area is great...get the free refillable mugs(worth the money). The sit down restaurant in the hotel is fabulous... food is unbelievable awesome!!! Everyone was very nice to us for our entire stay at Port Orleans Riverside. With that said, I recommend this hotel highly!!! Hints for the parks...make sure to bring rain jackets for each person...keep them in zip lock bags so they don't get anything else wet(bring box of zip lock bags, never know when you will need them!!), bring the hand held misting fans that work on batteries(bring extra batteries too), get strollers for the kids(even 9yr olds enjoy the ride), bring small icechest to fit plenty of water and snacks(worth it!!!)...you can put the ice chest on the stroller also, buy the stroller for the entire amount of days you are there...keep your name badge that goes on the stroller...reuse it for the next day...saves time and no need for the line, get the fast passes--saves time! Make sure to take the monorail, even if it is just for the ride...beautiful...also, the boat...wonderful!! Go to a character breakfast or two...makes the kids feel special!! Also...don't miss the Hoop Dee Doo Revue...priceless!! The buses do take a while to get to you(especially when you are waiting with kids who are sooo excited to get there, but sooo ready at the end of the day to get to a bed)...but buses beat driving to me!! Hope this is helpful to those thinking of staying at Port Orleans...worth it, and would definetly stay there again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: ImaBeachbum
Reviews.Content: My family and I loved this resort. The landscaping was beautiful and lush, making it very private and quiet. You have no idea that it has over 2,000 rooms. But that does come at a price. After walking all day at the parks, it is kind of hard to get motivated to walk more than five minutes to the food court to refill your drink mug. But that is my only complaint. The food was great. Get the dining plan and you don't have to worry about prices. The banana stuffed french toast at Boatrights was awesome. And you have to get the Mickey waffles in the food court at least once. My kids absolutely loved the pool and the slide. The rooms were fine. You are not ever there anyway. We had a corner room and the extra window helped it to seem bigger. I would definitely stay here again if I can't ever afford the Deluxe resorts. It is in a good location to all the parks, and the boat ride to Downtown Disney is great. Since there are so many rooms, expect long lines for the buses when you leave the park. A couple of times there wasn't a wait for the French Quarter bus, so we took it and walked the ten minutes back to Riverside. I would rather be walking toward my room than standing in line 3 bus loads back. One side note, the evening extra magic hours at Magic Kingdom are not worth it. We still had to wait 45 minutes for some rides and just could not get on others. That is at 1:00 in the morning in the pouring down rain.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: star64Colorado
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed at Port Orleans Riverside in May, 2005. We absolutely loved our experience! Very nice room, comfortable beds and the bathroom was really nice and had a privacy curtain and double sinks. The housekeeping was excellent, no problems there. My kids loved the pool area and slide and we also used one of the quiet pools one evening while I did laundry in the laundry room. Excellent laundry room, plenty of washers and dryers and very clean. Machines worked well and it was not crowded. We were in the Alligator Bayou section in Bldg. 36 which was a bit of a walk to the food court and main pool but it was a pleasant walk through beautiful scenery. This is a very spread out resort but we enjoyed that. Parking was easy, right up to our building and never had trouble finding a spot. Food court was fine, your basic food court selections but very good. Always clean and low key. Bus service to the parks was fine and the location of the resort was great. We totally enjoyed going to Downtown Disney via the resort boat service. The resort was 98% sold out when we were there but it never felt crowded. That is one advantage to being in such a large, spread out place, plenty of room for people to spread out in! I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a beautiful, fun, relaxing place to stay at while at Disneyworld!

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans Riverside Rocks!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans Riverside is one of my absolute favorite resorts in "the world" at Disney. My family and I are frequent Disney goers and I really enjoyed my stay. They have one main pool with a dragon water slide and another main pool called old man's island. Another perk was the surrey bikes and paddle boats/water mice. Our family of four rented a surrey bike ( they are just 4 seater bikes that everyone can pedal) for a half an hour and had lots of fun. The way Port Orleans is set up they have a great area to ride around and plent of things to look at. While we were there we ate at the food court multiple times. It had pretty good food, but was a bit pricey- but hey, it's Disney, what'd you expect???? Port Orleans also offers the Disney busses that can transport you to any and every disney park and even to Down town Disney and a few other places. Staffing at Port Orleans and every other Disney resort we've ever stayed at is top-notch and very friendly. Staff are especially accommodating. While at Disney, the main thing is to enjoy yourself and have a good time, it's not hard to do. So everybody enjoy Disney World and I hope this review wasn't too long. One last helpful hint- if you are thinking about skipping the water parks DON'T!!! Blizzard Beach is an absolute must. It is the best water park I have ever been to and none can compare. It has stuff for all ages. Okay, Bye.

Reviews.Title: “It's like being in a park”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 2 weeks at the Port Orleans Riverside. Here are some of the things I noticed. The landscaping and look of the entire Resort is gorgeous. It's like being in a park. Lots of trees, rivers, flowers, wildlife, bridges, etc. It surely must be the best landscaped resort at WDW, beating even the Deluxe Resorts! The room itself was very nice, primarily because all 2048 rooms were recently (2003-2005) refurbished. Everything in the room worked (all the lights) and the paintwork looked as good as new (because it was). The room had a small fridge, which was very useful for storing bottled drinks, sweets and chocolate snacks. There was also a coffee maker, ice bucket, electric hairdryer, and iron and ironing board. The basin area had a tiled floor and a privacy curtain, which divided the basins from the rest of the room. My one complaint about the room is the size of the beds. Most rooms have two double beds. If you're a couple, and enjoy sleeping together, then you might be a bit annoyed because the double beds are tight. There's not much space in them for two adults, so you're best off sleeping in separate beds! The Cotton Mill food court is very large, and offers a wide selection of food. There is tons of seating, but the best tables look out over the river and water wheel. My one complaint about the food court is the way you're forced to eat cereal. The cereal packs are tiny, so you'll have to buy two of them. The catch is, the food court has no bowls. So you have to eat the cereal out of the tiny packs, with a plastic spoon. It's just like being a baby again, and can get very annoying after 2 weeks! Outside the food court is the levee. This is a great place to hire a boat or surrey bike. The SeaRaycer boats are fun, but be warned; you might get soaked by the wave of a passing water taxi! Overall though, the Resort is great. It's definitely one of the more tastefully themed and decorated WDW Resorts (no garish colours or oversized toys) and certainly a good option if you're not travelling with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Resort but pricey for rooms”
Reviews.Author: FloridaFan75
Reviews.Content: We love Port Orleans Riverside and have now stayed there twice. The greatest strength of the complex is its beautiful surroundings. The grounds are beautifully themed and are always spotlessly clean. It is very peaceful and very relaxing. It is definitely a step up in this respect from the All Star Resorts, though I would say that for families with children I wouldn't spend the money to upgrade to the moderate resort for their benefit because they will appreciate the styling of the All Stars far more than the beauty of Riverside. Another great strength is the staff, who are very friendly and helpful but unobtrusive. The Sassagoula Ferry to Downtown is another great reason to stay at the resort. The service is frequent and a lovely, hassle-free way of getting around. Entertainment on property is also very good in the bar: really rousing and fun. The only real downsides to this resort are its cost considering the amenities in the room and the very limited fare at the food court. If you can get a great deal from one of the cut-price websites or go off-season it would be great, but as someone booking a British package holiday and having to travel in school holidays the moderate resorts are expensive, especially when you basically get just a bedroom and bathroom. We discovered how restricting this can be this year when we all had bad colds while we were out there. Until you are stuck in the room you don't realise how claustrophobic you can feel as you have no balcony or outside space - you just end up closeted away in a dim room with the blinds closed (as you have people walking past your windows). This is why we have decided to stay elsewhere this Summer - for the same money (or even less!) you can get a room with a balcony and more amenities elsewhere and for us this has become a big issue, especially as the leap up to the next grade of Disney resort is comparatively expensive. Perhaps this will backfire on us as we won't have the advantage of the Disney service or attention to detail, but it does make you start to think about paying the premium for Disney Resorts. As for the food court, it's great for snacks, but the fare is limited to fries, pizzas, ribs, chicken etc with some sandwiches and salads. You really need to have a car and get off Disney to have the variety and advantage or more reasonable prices. Would I go again? Yes, definitely, but I'd look for a deal with more in-room amenities first.

Reviews.Title: “everything we had hoped for”
Reviews.Author: crystalvoorhees
Reviews.Content: After many years of hoping for a Disney vacation, we were finally able to go. My husband had just returned from Irac. After many reviews we chose Port New Orleans Riverside. It was everything we had hoped for. When we arrived we went straight to the pool. When we returned our luggage was waiting in our room. The grounds we so well kept and made you feel so far away from reality. Walks at night were very magical. The rooms were clean as was the pools. The foodcourt was crowded in the morning but reasonably priced. Refillable mugs a must. Our children are 15,14 and 5. There was something for everyone. Very happy with the staff and overall stay. The only problem we had was the phone did not work when we arrived. Overall wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Love, Love it here! (please See Our Photos!!)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: (Please see our beautiful PHOTOS) Our family of 4 just returned from 10 days â€œPort Orleans Riversideâ€� beautiful resort in Disney World. (May 9-18, 2005). Words defy description--we absolutely love staying here---the resorts Managers are simply the best to be found anywhere, and all the Cast Members (the staff) are so helpful and wonderful. (Itâ€™s our 3rd time staying at this gorgeous resort) First, have you heard of Disneyâ€™s â€œMagical Expressâ€�? Itâ€™s a brand new service and being offered for the next 18 months for all Disney World Resort guests, (which we experienced) as part of their â€œHappiest Celebration on Earthâ€�. As a â€˜giftâ€™, at no charge, (for the next 18 months only) Disney World members greet you at the airport, (the Disney "Magical Express" greeters are everywhere in the airport waving at youâ€”itâ€™s so cute!) you go to the â€œ Disney Magical Expressâ€� desk at the airport and confirm the information on your luggage etc. etc. (this takes only a couple of minutes) and they take your luggage to the resort for you (later delivered right to your room) and you board the clean air-conditioned bus to ride to your resort. Tip: This service is all new, so Disney is truly working to make it as smooth as possibleâ€¦they really do careâ€¦.so please be patient with them as itâ€™s truly a kind gesture and a saving of over $100.00+ compared to taking a taxi or Mears etc.. (itâ€™s no charge for the next 18 months only----and at the end of your trip, on the way back when you return back to the airport, itâ€™s even more of a treat!, Iâ€™ll tell you more about that at the end). Now, about Disney Worldâ€™s â€œPort Orleans Riversideâ€� resort---we love, love, love, love, love, it here! The front desk area is beautiful (photo). Check-in was a breeze, and took just minutes (we arrived at about 6:00pm, no line-ups). With no luggage to carry, except our small carry-on luggage, it made is so easy to make our way to our pretty room. This resort is a vacation all by itself!! The beautiful landscaping is breath-taking, truly spectacular! There are beautiful Magnolia trees that border the river area, and whenever we visit in April/May they are in full bloom, with their lovely fragrance aroma in the air. And lovely flower gardens & urns along the pathways. Just the walk to-and-from your room will be a wonderful experience each day and night! The beautiful â€œRiversideâ€� resort is a Disney concept of grand old South Mansions and bayou villages. We stayed in "Magnolia Bend", in the â€œOak Manorâ€� section. (There are 4 mansion themed sectionsâ€”and also another section called â€œAlligator Bayouâ€�) All the various themed sections in this resort are beautiful, some overlooking the peaceful river, others facing the various 6 of the beautiful swimming pool areas (more than one), others face into gorgeous courtyards with fountains and gardens; others nestled among beautiful grand tall trees, so peaceful. Because of the beauty of this resort, many lovely birds have made their â€˜homeâ€™ here, you can hear them singing sweetly each day, and it really touches your heart. And adorable little brown bunny rabbits roam free all over the â€œPort Orleans Riversideâ€� property, so charming. As mentioned we were situated in "Magnolia Bend"--the â€œOak Manorâ€�, on the second floor, with a lovely view of the courtyard & fountain, and could see a little view of the river too. The room was lovely and clean, a good size too. (photo) Complimentary mini-fridge included. There are 2 pedestal sinks outside the inner locked bathroom, which contains the bathtub & toilet. (Donâ€™t worry about the 2 sinks being outside the main bathroom, as many of the rooms here have a curtain to shut, between the sink area and the bedroom, to avoid disturbing others in the room when washing your hands etc. It actually makes it easier to get ready to have the 2 sinks outside, saving much time, (photo). We love the Food Court! (Photo) After experiencing other resort foodcourts, we think the â€œRiverside Millâ€� food court is one of the best in Disney World! (A fancy cafeteria style restaurant) Not only is it a magnificent showpiece of a room (with the large Mill water wheel and gorgeous views of the river etc.)â€”but the food choices are awesome! Here are some of the many choices: Pizza, Spaghetti & Meatballs, Alfredo Pasta, Chicken & Ribs, Hamburgers, hotdogs, fries (of course), Soup-of-the-day, Special-of-the-day (a hearty main meal), and wonderful Chicken Caesar Salads (great to share with a pizza!). A Wonderful bakery, with everything you can dream of: Cheesecake, Pecan Pie, cakes & cookies, various breads. What we enjoy is the refrigerated coolers, filled with so many healthy choices: Magnificent chef salads, (generous size, with ham, cheese, boiled eggs, etc.) Cottage Cheese containers, Peaches, fruit grapes & cheese platters, fruit cups, yogurt parfaits with granola etc. etc. (the list is endless) And a wonderful fresh fruit wagon, changed everyday, with lovely bananas, apples, oranges etc. For breakfast, we loved the steamy hot oatmeal, served with a little container of raisins and brown sugar-----it was heaven. Plus they have beautiful bacon/sausage eggs breakfasts with all the trimmings for both adults & children, French toast, pancakes etc. Besides the food court, there is also a lovely full-service restaurant. It has lovely choices too, and beautiful breakfasts. Sometimes itâ€™s nice to sit down and just be served. And as mentioned, the resort is a vacation all by itself. There are so many fun things to do here, besides the charming "Sassagoula Steamboat" that takes resort guests to-and-from downtown Disney, guests can rent boats of various sizes to sail yourself, or rent old-fashioned bikes to ride on the walkways, or pay for a lovely horse & carriage ride (everyone that does this raves about it!). (Please see photos) We love it because of of this wonderful 'Sassagoula Steamboat' service that takes you to and from your resort, to downtown Disneyâ€™s Market Place. (Photo) The 'Sassagoula Steamboat' â€˜captainsâ€™ are so friendly and helpful. Only Port Orleans Riverside & French Quarter resorts offer this wonderful steamboat service to-and-from Downtown Disney! Itâ€™s such a fun and lovely relaxing steamboat rideâ€¦.you will love it! It stops at the partner pretty resort, â€œPort Orleans French Quarterâ€�, which is also a beautiful resortâ€”and a nice place to eat too---we love their â€œPot Roastâ€� dinner at their Food Court and sometimes take the boat over there for dinner. Then the 'Sassagoula Steamboat' goes over to â€œDowntown Disneyâ€�. There you will find so many wonderful places to eat shop and see. We love the â€œEarl of Sandwichesâ€� and Ghirardelliâ€™s Soda Fountain and Chocolate Shop (what a fun and yummy experience!) the â€œRain Forest CafÃ©â€�, etc. etc. Great if you have ticket to "Cirque de Soliel" which we also enjoyed on our last visit. Not to mention all the other wonderful things to see and do at Downtown Disneyâ€™s Marketplace. Itâ€™s wonderful day or night and a lovely 'Sassagoula Steamboat' ride home at night is such a delightful experience! (the last boat leaves at 11:00pm and after this you can take a bus to-and-from downtown disney to the resort) Another great thing at Port Orleans Riverside is â€œFultonâ€™s General Storeâ€�â€”itâ€™s a fantastic shop! Great for gifts, treats and also necessities you might have forgotten from home (bandages, sunscreen, pharmacy type things etc.) And also a great place for late-night snacks, chips, cookies, Soda drinks, juice, milk etc.) Just like a little corner store---but even nicer! The staff there is so friendly too! One of the greatest things about staying on-site at Disney World, is the free transporation service to and from the resort to the various Disney Parks & Water Theme parks. The Disney buses run all the time, if you â€˜missâ€™ one, donâ€™t worry or kill yourself running for it---as another one will come within a few minutes. (Always funny to see people running for the buses) The one that seemed to take the longest to arrive at Port Orleans Riverside, was the â€œEpcotâ€� buses, not sure whyâ€” but happily the resort provides lovely shaded areas to sit and wait for the buses. However, during this last vacation, we did note that the lineups for some (not all) buses to return from parks to the resort were very long at certain parks/nights. It was a bit of a concern to usâ€”but hopefully Disney will allow for more buses at night for this resort. And this might only be because of the â€œHappiest Celebrationâ€� and the resort being totally booked, as we did not have this concern during our other Vacations. Not to be overlooked, the wonderful caring housekeepers at Port Orleans Riverside who are so adorable, this is our third vacation, and all the ones we have met are from Haiti. They are so sweet (some very shy), and so helpful. French is their native language, but most speak quite good English too. If you need anything, donâ€™t hesitate to kindly ask them or leave a note. We came prepared with little thank you envelopes for their tips and a written note in French for themâ€”and were so happy to leave little treats for them too. They deserve so much appreciation, as they work so hard to make your vacation so perfect. And as for the Front Desk cast members (staff), they are truly the best-of-the-best! The Managers are so helpful, if you have any sort of problem/concern, donâ€™t hesitate to kindly ask for their assistance. We sent them flowers at the end of this vacation; it was not much, but just a little something to let them know what an amazing job they are doing! In our opinion, after staying here for 3 years, (and comparing it to our other vacations where we stayed at other resorts) this resort is one of the best to visit on the entire Disney World site! And to finish off, the â€œMagical Expressâ€� was a wonderful way to end our trip! At the resort front desk area, they printed out our airplane boarding passes, and took our luggage for us to the airport for us!!! (We kept our carry-on luggage with the bellman) We were able to enjoy a leisurely lunch, catch the â€œMagical Expressâ€� bus to the airport, with only our carry-on luggage to care for. It was so easy and relaxing! Once they get this service all figured out---itâ€™s going to be the best! And if offered, after the 18 months, it will be worth paying for in the future, in our opinion. So as you can see, we once again highly recommend a stay at this beautiful "Port Orleans Riverside" resort! We are already planning our next vacation here! Can't wait!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another Happy Repeat Guest”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4, including 2 teens, spent 5 days at PO Riverside during April break. This was our second time at this Disney property and it was like coming home. We came from the Royal Pacific in Universal, which was nice, but the rooms were smaller and much more expensive than Riverside. We have previously also stayed at All Star Sports but feel that Riverside is well worth the extra $ (used AAA discount). We stayed in Alligator Bayou # 27 which was quiet and beautifully landscaped. There was also a laundry, quiet pool, and frig in room. The food court is great and provides affordable dining. The Riverside is so family friendly for all ages. Compared to Universal, nobody does it like Disney for family comfort and affordability.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have been many times to Port Orleans Riverside. Great hotel for either families, couples , or groups. There are several front counter chk-in attendants so chk-in line always seems to move quickly. Now service is wonderful. real southern hospitality is displayed at Riverside. Anybody working there is more then willing to take the time to help you answer any questions or give you any advice on hotel or Disney parks etc. Rooms average size and very clean. Whenever we may have requested extra towels or anything else, they have been quick to respond. Food court is very reasonable and plenty to chose from. Buy the $12 refillable cups if staying more then 2 days. Worth the bucks & great for families on budget too. Refill them anytime at The Riverside hotel or even next door at the Port Orleans French Quarters Hotel with soda, coffee, ice tea or lemonade. The Boatrights restaurant is a bit pricey as are many hotel restaurants but food is good. Love the grounds!!! Very spacious & romantic setting. Many building are spread out through-out the property into 2 sections. One section being Alligator Bayou which the buildings are more rustic in appearance but rooms exact same layout. Magnolia Bend is the other section with buildings fashioned after old southern mansions. You can rent bikes or just stroll the walkways over the wooden bridges and along the river path . Take a walk on over to Port Orleans French Quarters hotel. Different hotel so don't confuse it with Port Orleans Riverside. Main pool is huge and also has a bar in pool area. Kids love the slide . I believe there are 5 more quiet pools inbetween the buildings and there are laundry facilities in each pool area. Just take a swim while laundry is is washing! We love the rose arbors in front of the Magnolia building and the gazebo there is a great place to sit and gaze at the river and watch the people stroll by. Take the water taxie boat down the river early evening to watch the sunset at Downtown Disney over Lake Buena Vista and grab a bite to eat at any of the restaurants in there or in Westside. Shop or see a movie and boat back to hotel and grab a late night snack at food court. There is also a horse drawn coarch ride that you can request & reserve in the evening for about $35 a half hour that is so romantic and takes you all around the huge hotel grounds and along the river. One other thing...there are 4 bus stops around the Riverside hotel gounds so it makes it very convienent to get a Park bus near your building. Love the idea of free buses into all Disney parks and Downtown etc. Makes vacation more relaxing after a long day walking the parks. No fighting traffic. So if you are looking for a hotel inside Disney World that has great grounds & room to walk and bike with great service and clean rooms....Then you can't go wrong with Port Orleans Riverside. We have brought family & friends there and all have returned again and love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort in the moderate category!”
Reviews.Author: chapopote
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4 day stay at the Port Orleans Riverside (April 2005), and enjoyed ourselves very much. I travelled with my husband, our two kids (one of which is a toddler) and my older brother. We stayed in the Alligator Bayou section, because of the trundle bed which accomodated my 6 year old daughter. The trundle was really nothing more than a thin mattress on a roll out frame, but it served its purpose. The room had been recently renovated, and was very tastefully done. We found it to be comfortable, but slightly on the small side, as we also had a crib in the room.
