This left us with not much space to move around in the room, but we were not in the room during the day, so we could live with it at night. We liked the tile in the bathroom/vanity area and the decorative tile in the tub. My one complaint in terms of the bathroom/vanity area is that there was no room for you to put your "stuff." The sinks were pedestal sinks, and while they looked nice, I really missed the counter space. The shelf that ran the length of the mirror above the sink was not very wide, and I was in constant fear that my cosmetic bag would fall off into the sink. However, this is just a minor flaw. The other thing I would change would be the fact that there are no closets in the room. There is a rack to hang your clothes bag on, and a curtain to draw across the vanity area so that you can get dressed in private, but I am not used to not having a closet. Our check-in was a breeze, and we had a very nice and knowledgeable cast member assist us. Our room was ready within an hour of arriving, and the bags were delivered promptly. We stayed in Building 14, which I would recommend to anyone. It was recently renovated, and close to everything, including the food court, the boat, the lobby, and most importantly, to the bus stop. We waited no more than 2-3 minutes for the buses which took us to the parks at all hours of the day. I recommend Disney transportation. Our 6 year old loved the main swimming pool and the arcade. You could check out a life vest for children at the marina, which was nice. The adults loved the boat that took us to the Port Orleans French Quarter and Downtown Disney. The guys who ferry the boats were very friendly and had lots of tidbits to impart about Disney and life in general. The food court served standard fare, but we were able to get fresh fruit for breakfast, which was a plus. My recommendation would be to get there before 8:00 am if you want to avoid the crowds. We only did one dinner there, which was just so-so. Boatwright's, the sit down restaurant, was expensive for the quality of food, especially at dinner, but my daughter loved the Mickey Mouse shaped pancake she got at breakfast. We took a special trip on the boat to Port Orleans French Quarter to see if their food court was any better. It was very similar, with the one outstanding difference being the beignets. Love that deep fried dough dipped in powdered sugar! We were fortunate to plan our stay at a good time, right when the last of the spring breakers had departed. One of the cast members told us that the resort was only 50% full at the time of our stay. I can't imagine what it would be like at capacity. Next time, I think we might try the Magnolia Bend "mansions." They looked inviting. All in all, a good trip. We wish we would have had more time to explore the grounds and see the various critters scampering around. We had 2 bunnies that hung around outside our building that fascinated our toddler. But, alas, the theme parks called. We'll be back in a few years.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the POR!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the POR for spring break the first week of April. Disney gave us a great rate on the property and we chose it because of the trundle bed. We had a room on the second floor in the Alligator Bayou. I thought it was beautifully landscaped. We were in building 16 which was not too far from the main pool or the lobby. My kids loved the pool and the Surrey bikes. The pool had a great slide. We also used the pool at the French Quarter and the "quiet"pool near our building. We also went fishing in the lake one morning. At the end of the week, we enjoyed it so much we extended our stay another night. The staff was nice and our room was VERY clean. All the rooms have refrigerators so we ate breakfast in our room every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific property”
Reviews.Author: travelwith5
Reviews.Content: I wasn't going to write a review this time because so many great reviews of this property were already posted. However, after I read the last one regarding Port Orlean's having a bad theme and gloomy grounds, I had to write. The other trip advisor must be writing about the wrong property. Port Orleans is a terrific property with GORGEOUS tropical grounds. I will give you that it is very spread out and somewhat hard to navigate, but it is because you get to walk around there lush landscape. I would recommend a mansion room if the thought of Alligator Bayou seems dark. We chose the Bayou this time because we have three children and needed the trundle bed that this property offers. I visited my parents in the mansion rooms and they were beautiful. As nice as my brother and his family had at the pricey Beach Club on the concierge floor. The pool was a lot of fun,clean, had a fun water slide and included a pool side bar. My teen, 9 year old, and three year old ALL had a great time. Port Orleans also offers ferry to Downtown Disney, Surrey Bikes for families to ride around the grounds, and Water Sprites to drive around the river and Downtown Disney lake area. My twelve year old loved this because he could drive himself(Note this is not the case at the Contemporary-the boats are faster and you need a valid license there). Overall Great hotel for a great price. Can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place”
Reviews.Author: annesg
Reviews.Content: We opted for a disney hotel only six weeks from our holiday after reading reviews which didn't seem to good on our first chioce hotel(non disney).It did cost a considerable sum more,but by the end of our two weeks we felt it had been well worth the extra expense.We couldn't fault any area of our stay.The staff,facilities and transportation system had all been great.We stayed in Paterre Place which was very peaceful and scenic.We enjoyed getting the boat to Downtown Disney.There was enough to amuse our nine year old daughter whether we were at the resort or out all day.Both the fast food court and Boatwright's restuarant served lovely food.Sit down breakfast in the restuarant was wonderful,staff were extra attentive the two mornings I ate myself whilst my husband and daughter went off to golf! We hope to return again as soon as we have saved enough.

Reviews.Title: “Simple Southern Charm, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: BronteJD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (along with another couple) stayed at Port Orleans Riverside from April 10th through April 14th for our honeymoon. We absolutely loved this hotel, and plan to return. The check in process was quick and efficient, with friendly and capable staff. We had ground floor rooms, which helped with access, near the two pools. The rooms were spacious, clean, and neat. They were always made up by our return in the late afternoon, and nothing was ever amiss. The rooms are not overly "luxe", but for the price (discount for Florida residents) were just fine. The shower/toilet area of the bathrooms are a bit smallish, but still more than adequate. The grounds of both the Riverside and the French Quarter are absolutely beautiful. We spent a lot of time just walking around, both during the day and at night, admiring the landscaping, the Sassagoula river, etc. The ferryboat to Downtown Disney is a great plus, as well! We will definitely stay at Port Orleans again - probably alternating between Riverside and French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation of a LIfetime”
Reviews.Author: sswayze
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 10 day vacation at Disney. We stayed at Port Orleans Riverside. What a vacation. We didn't tell our 2 girls(10 and turning 8 while there) they were going until we woke them up to go. They were very excited. Their first plane ride and also limo ride to the airport. My oldest daughter was exhausted by the time we got there and ended up getting sick that day and we could not get into our rooms till later in the day. I kept calling and they finally found us a room. When we arrived our keys did not work but that is because they were for the first room we were supposed to get, so keep that in mind if your room gets switched before actually entering. They did send someone with new key cards but that took about 40 mins. Any other time you wouldn't mind the wait but when your daughter wants to get into an airconditioned room mins seem like hours. Finally at 6:30 our vacation began and it was magical till the day we left. My other daughter had her 8th birthday there. We had arranged (free of charge) to have a birthday card of her favourite disney character autographed and delivered to our room with balloons. She was tickled with that. We also had it arranged that goofy would give her a wake up call on her birthday also free of charge. We booked the Princess Storybook Princess Breakfast in Norway (Epcot) on her birthday. 5 storybook princesses were there and they come to your table and fuss over you and you get their autograph and pics taken. That was the highlight of her trip. It was a bit pricey but worth it. ($70 something for breakfast but our reservations were for 11:30 so we made it lunch and it was excellent food). You are seated and have fresh fruit and carmel buns waiting for you. Then your meal comes which is a great big skillet filled with bacon, biscuits, sausages, eggs and potato casserole. You are definetly filled at the end and soon after the princesses come by. I will tell you that you must book before 3 months in advance. I left it till 3 weeks and was dissappointed that everything was booked solid but they told me to keep calling which I did and finally got a reservation but I strongly recommend that you do it as soon as you book your trip as to not be dissappointed because they did say that most of them book up 3-4 months ahead. Lots of pools to swim in. The biggest one being the themed pool which is in the french quarter which is about a 10 min walk or you can take the boat there which runs frequently. The rooms in the hotel we nice, not overly big but standard size for a hotel. Everything was clean and what a bonus having a fridge which was a very good size and coffee maker. Our car that we ordered to pick us up at the airport made a free grocery stop for us at publix store so we did a bit of food shopping for our room. We decided to eat breakfast in our room so we wouldn't be rushed and could make the parks by opening time. The girls just ate cereal or muffins and fruit, same with us. We bought cheese and crackers and bread, pb, and jam. We brought our own bowls, utensils and cups and lots of snacks because snacks are very expensive here and add up over 10 days. We brought granola bars, scooby snacks, candies, suckers, cookies etc... We saved lots by doing this and time in the morning. They provided coffee packs each day too. We just went to the food court and "borrowed" creamer each evening to have for our morning coffee. No one seemed to mind and if they are providing coffee machines they should provide the creamer and sugar too right. We did invest in 2 of the refillable mugs and our girls loved the fact they could have whatever they wanted and as much. We purchased a few bottles of water the first day and just kept filling them up at the soda machines where you fill up your refillable mugs. The money you saved doing this and once again we did this everyday, lots of times for 10 days and no one approached us saying we could not do that. Water is a must in WDW and why should you have to pay for it. We filled up in the morning and took with us to the parks. Another little trick I came up with is to go to the dollar store before you come to WDW and pick up glow stick necklaces and braclets. I brought about $12 worth of the stuff and gave them to the girls each night we went out to a night show. They never once asked to purchase any of the glowing nick nacks that they try to sell to you for the price of large pizza. Rip off I say. We had lots of people come up to us and ask where they could buy them. Alot of the rides come out into the gift shops, very clever I say. We gave the girls there own money and told them to spend it wisely. They spent most on the trading pins there and never really asked to buy alot of the other stuff. We usually b-lined it right out of the store to go to the next ride so they never really had a chance to browse and want. You could spend lots of money on stuff that you will probably never use when you get home and the prices are high but some reasonable stuff too. The pins are begin 6.95-8.95 US. If you are the first family rider on a ride when the park opens they give you a free 5X7 photo and may escort you to another ride and be first in line. That happened to us twice once at splash mtn and the other at buzz lightyear. The new Stitch ride, which is not a ride at all is horrible and the line ups are like 60mins long. Most dissappointing. You go in and watch a clip, then run to the next mission and sit in these seats with shoulder bars and they come down and you think you are going on a ride but all you get is wet and smelly stuff in your ear and that is it. So don't wait for it if you don't have too. Tower of terror in MGM was awesome, so was Rock'n'Roller Coaster. Lots of good rides. The parks were somewhat busy but not too bad. Plan what you want to do and take advantage of the early opening of the parks if you stay on a disney resort. It is early to get up but you can get all your big rides done before the park opens and the crowds come. We played till about 2-3 each day then went back to our resort to swim, relax, have supper, then plan to see one of the night spectacular shows every other night or take advantage of the park closing late which would be till 12. The parks can still be busy at the time too. The shuttle system was excellent and we never seemed to wait for a bus more than 10-15 mins. I strongly suggest hitting the internet and printing off the schedule for what shows are what nights, late and early openings etc... and do what I did is make up a 10 day schedule of what you want to do each day and also each day indicate which park has the early and late opening so you have all your options available to you right on one piece of paper. You might want to find on the internet which rides are open when you have the early and late closing because it isn't all of them. I printed everything off and took stuff with me and each night we read and researched everything we wanted to do the next day and in which order. Walkie talkies would have been nice if you are not always going to do the same things. I printed off disney coloring pics to take with us for the girls to color on the plane. They liked that and it killed time. I also went to the dollar store and found mickey mouse note pads which we used as autograph books. We got tons of autographs and never really had to wait in much of a line up. And there were lots of characters around all the time. In Magic Kingdom you can go to the fair section right in the very back or the park by the mad tea cup party and the go cart car ride and in the section you will privately meet mickey mouse and have your photo taken by a photographer or they will just use your own camera. You can go through minnies house and on the tour outside goofy was there signing too. So lots of opportunities. One day as we were leaving the park there was about 4 characters lined up signing. Well I could type for hours but I am sure I have lost some readers already as this is a long one but I so want to give all my ideas. I don't imagine we will get back this way for some time but the time we did have was very magical and I stronly recommend that you come and have some fun.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Port Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Port Orleans Riverside twice--once in 2/02 and once in 10/04. Both times were good experiences. The grounds are beautiful. I would reccomend staying on Magnolia Bend, although it is a little bit more of a walk to get to the lobby & food court. My room was clean and towels, toiletries were plentiful both trips. I did not travel with any children, but had brought a beanie baby that resembles my dog with me. Each day I returned to my room to find her doing something else in my absence--watching TV, looking out the window, watersliding in the sink, etc. Cute touch, and would be magic for a kid. The room was big enough for 3 adults. There is plenty of room for your personal toiletries on the bathroom shelf, unless you travel with a lot of cosmetics. The food court is good--still theme park food, but was very hot and fresh. I would reccomend the loaded fries and the nachos, BBQ and Burgers. Breakfast can be very crowded at about 8-8:15, but we timed ourselves to be getting done by then. The refillable mug is the best deal in Disney. My family drinks a lot of soda, and this mug gets you as many refills of soda, coffee or tea that you want. Too bad they don't include a juice or milk at breakfast time, though! My 10/04 trip was a second honeymoon. For all you romantic couples--the horse-drawn carraige ride after dusk is a must. The grounds are beautifully lit with old style gas lights, which reflect off the river. So romantic! I did notice a difference in the staff during my 10/04 trip. Not so many smiles, not so eager to interact with guests. I attributed that to the fact that much of the state had recently been devastated by hurricaines, and that the residents of Florida probably weren't feeling too "magical" at the time of my visit. The bus system is great. That alone is reason enough to stay on property. If you don't rent a car and want to get to other non-Disney theme parks you can get a ride on a paid shuttlebus (I suggest Mears for $12 per person, roundtrip). My hsuband and I spent most of the time waiting for our Disney bus(5-10 min, max) singing "Magic Bus" by the Who. We waited much longer for the Mears shuttle, with no apology that they were late. All in all, this is a good value. You can easily entertain kids at the resort all day long with the pools, arcade and other activites. It is romantic for couples, while still being family-focused.

Reviews.Title: “A great value for Disney”
Reviews.Author: wishbone958
Reviews.Content: My family just got back from a six day stay at the Riverside, and as usual it was wonderful. The kids love the main pool with the waterslide and the quiet pools that are within each section. There is so much to do within the resort and the grounds are beautiful. The food court has a nice selection, especially for kids. Boatwrites is excellent if you want a nice sitdown dinner or breakfast. Kids loved taking the ferry from the Marina to Downtown Disney. We'll definately be back to the Riverside next time we come to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Addnos
Reviews.Content: This is more of a motel than hotel. The rooms are all outside rooms, not inside. Just cautioning you because I did not expect outside rooms. Our family is fortunate in that our daughter works at Disneyland so we were able to take advantage of a 50% off discount. We had two rooms, parents in one room and 18 and 23 year old in another room. We were there during Easter week from Easter Sunday through Saturday. I thought the hotel would be more crowded but I guess people come and go to all the different parks so it was never as crowded as I expected. The rooms are a nice size. We had two queen beds in each room. We orginally were going to have 3 to a room but two other kids couldn't go. Good thing because we would have had a tight fit in those beds. If you had two parents in one bed and two small children in the other bed you could probably get by in one room. Interestingly, I had originally asked if we could have a trundle bed placed in each room for the 3rd person and they said they do not allow extra beds. However, in both rooms there were trundle beds underneath one of the beds so, in fact, we could have slept 3 in each room on separate beds. As others have mentioned there is no high speed access but you can suffer with dial up that is going to cost you. The bathroom/tub is a small space but the waterpic shower head and water pressure are good. They give you plenty of towels (we always ask for more). Lots of drawer space. The weird thing is that we had double pedestal sinks. A nice feature, but when you have pedestal sinks that means you won't have counter space. They make for that by putting a shelf above the sinks. But it isn't very wide and once there are cups, shaving gear, make-up gear, etc. on the ledge you won't find much room left. We didn't have any problem with noise since we were upstairs. I would advise asking for an upstairs room for two reasons: 1) you won't have anyone above you and, 2) You're pretty much going to just be sleeping in the room anyway so having to walk up one flight of stairs is really no bother at all. We stayed in building 36. The room numbers are like 3624, 3625, etc. If you have a number around 3635 you will be upstairs. I think less that 3620 is downstairs. In this particular building the pool behind the building was open 24 HOURS!! Luckily, from what I saw people had sense enough not to use the pool at all hours of the evening, although they could have. Other pools had restricted ours of 10 or 11pm. Our room was facing away from the pool and was not near the river. Believe me, there isn't any advantage facing the pool or the river because, honestly, if you want to stare at either of them it is a 60 second walk to either. Unlike the neighboring PO-French Quarter's one bus stop, the Riverside has 4 bus stops located on the South (lobby), West, North, and East sides of the resort. This makes it convenient when waiting for buses to the amusement parks. The bus transportation is free and is prompt and comfortable. If you miss a bus another will be by in a few minutes. I don't think we waited more than 10 minutes at any time and most times were waiting 5 minutes or less. I have posted 10 pictures of what our room looked like when we were in it. Anyone can show you a clean room but I wanted to show you the space, or lack thereof, available when you start unpacking and placing your items around the room. You can see those pictures by going to the picture viewing area. I posted them separate from this review. However, I am posting a view of the pedestal sinks so you can see the set up in that area and lack of space. As for food...make sure you stock up on water and snacks OUTSIDE of the park. The rooms have refrigerators so you can stuff them with drinks if you'd like. If you buy a 12oz bottle of water at the Riverside general store it's going to cost you 1.25, while a 24oz bottle will cost you 2.00. We ate all of our meals in the cafeteria. The cafeteria offers breakfast until 11am. Each of the counters has different food, like pizza, hot dogs, etc. In the morning they all offer different breakfasts, after 11am they all offer different lunches and dinners. Disney makes it "convenient" to hook your credit card into you resort card/room key so that you can use the card at the hotel or in any of the parks. All of your keys will be activated so if you have kids with cards, watch out because they can use them. A typcial breakfast platter will cost you about 5.95. You get scrambled eggs, one sausage, 3 bacon, a very small biscuit and some wedge potatoes. If you buy a small orange juice in a plastic bottle you can plan on spending around 8-8.50 for a breakfast. It adds up quick. The good thing is that the food court stays open late in the evening to accommodate the late park returnees. As for activities, you can rent two seater boats, fish off a bridge, off the bank, off a boat, you can rent bikes, two seater bikes, 4 seater bikes with kiddie baskets in front. You can take the busses to Downtown Disney or you can take a boat to Downtown Disney (recommended at least once). All in all it was a good stay for us. Oh, one other thing. Someone mentioned about hearing the toilets in other rooms. Yep, they have those super-duper toilets that work like the ones you find in planes. When you pull down the handle you'll hear a loud swoosh that is almost deafening. So be prepared the first time you do that because you're going to be surprised. Have fun MD addnos@-yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans Riverside - Good, But...”
Reviews.Author: 916Travel
Reviews.Content: On our first trip to Orlando, we stayed four nights in the Magnolia Bend section of Port Orleans Riverside, from February 11 to February 15th 2005. Our stay was just before the high season, so we paid $132.50 a night with AAA discount for a water view room. Our "water view" was a diagonal view of the pool area, so I don't recommend paying extra for this feature. There was no line at check-in, which took about 10 minutes. The grounds were clean and, well groomed making the resort a nice place for a morning walk. The hotel was relatively uncrowded when we were there. We had no problems with traffic or parking. The breakfast at Boatwrights was outstanding, though a bit expensive (around $35 for two). Our room was reasonably sized, well decorated and clean. However, none of the reviews mentioned that the walls are paper thin. On our first night, the upstairs neighbors returned to their room with two small children at 3:30 AM. (Who keeps their kids out until 3:30 AM?) Although we couldn't make out every word, we could hear their conversations from downstairs. We could also hear their toilet use and flushes from our room. We bought earplugs the next day. Note that it costs 75 cents to make a local call and the hotel does not offer high-speed Internet access. Overall, I'd recommend Port Orleans Riverside (along with a set of earplugs). However, if I had to do it over again, I wouldn't pay the premium to stay at this Disney resort. The Downtown Disney hotels are only a mile or so further from the parks and they generally offer free local calls, high-speed Internet and free continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: hjn0901
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans Riverside during Christmas of 2004. It is a very beautiful hotel with lots of charm. Had a few problems with housekeeping, but everything was resolved to our satisfaction. Very helpfull staff at the front desk, and a good selection at the restaurant. We had a great vacation and has already booked our stay at POR this summer.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed the riverside”
Reviews.Author: graceg
Reviews.Content: just returned from port orleans riverside on march 18. very nice resort, rooms were clean and comfortable. we stayed in building 18 it was convenient to the lobby, bus transportation and restaurant. there is a river launch that takes you to downtown disney, very nice at night with all the resorts & lights along the way. We enjoyed the food in boatwright, costs about $50.00 for two with tip. Breakfast was about $20.00 for two. Food court is very noisy and crowded. They have a horse & carriage ride around the resort, also boats for rent and bicycles. Bus transportation is great, never waited longer then 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Slice of Southern Relaxation and Charm”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My extended family had a 7 day DisneyWorld family reunion, and we all stayed at Port Orleans Riverside in the Magnolia Bend Plantation homes. We had an excellent time and were so pleased with this beautiful resort. The setting, building, and rooms are charming and relaxing. The staff were friendly and so accomodating for our large group. Our maid was friendly and helpful also. The bus transportation was so convenient to all of the Theme Parks and extra buses were always ready to accomodate the park closing rush. The food at the Boatman's Restaurant really wasn't worth the money - but that at the Food Court was excellent! My family spent a lot of time hanging out there at the end of the day. I really enjoyed the MIckey Mouse waffles during the one breakfast I had there. You had to wait in line to order, because all the food was made fresh when you ordered it. And definitely spend the $12.99 for the refillable mug. I don't drink soda, but filled mine regularly with delicious hot chocolate made from chocolate syrup, iced tea, or hot tea. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not great”
Reviews.Author: topazmom
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 night stay at the Port Orleans Riverside on March 11. We stayed in the Allagator Bayou section in Lodge 37. Check in was a breeze. They immediately charged my card for the amount of the stay, but we were given a $1000 room charge credit limit without them even putting an additional hold on my credit card, which I thought was nice, and which is always important info for me. Some hotels automatically put a hold on your account for the amount of your room plus an extra couple hundred dollars for amounts they think you might rack up on room incidentals, and if you're like me, this could tie up some of the spending money you have available while you're on vacation. We made our reservations through AAA and got a rate of $143 per night. Our room was clean upon arrival, and did include a complementary mini-fridge even though on the hotel info it says a fridge is an extra $10 per night. It isn't. There is no extra charge. This was nice, but on the other hand the fridge sucked. It wasn't very cold at all. We had our little girl with us who is still on the bottle and were afraid to store her milk in there because of worrying about it spoiling. I'm not sure if this is the case with all of the fridges or if maybe the one in our room was just older or torn up. The armoire that holds the tv is tall, but when my husband reached up there to store a bag, all kinds of dust came tumbling down. I requested they change the sheets after the second night of our stay(I did leave a tip that day) and the sheets that they changed the bed with had a few small holes in it. I think this may be due to over bleaching, and wasn't that great big of a deal, but not something I would expect from Disney. The housekeeping staff was friendly and did a very good job. One day we returned from the park and 2 dolls my little girl had left in the room were laying propped on the bed in little towel "doll beds" the staff had created. So cute and such a sweet touch. They do a good job, but I think a few "deep cleaning" days should be squeezed in for the rooms when they're not occupied to clear up little problems like the dust on top of the tv armoire. Also, I would recommend to anyone with a child for whom you are bringing a stroller along, especially if it isn't one of those little collapsible ones be sure if you stay in Allagator Bayou to ask for a room on the bottom floor. The Allagator Bayou lodges have no elevators and we had to lug our big, heavy stroller up and down several steps several times during the course of our stay to get it to our room. It did come in very handy though, as the walk around the grounds to get to the pool, general store, and food court was about 10 minutes for adults, and even longer if you let your dawdling toddler walk on their own! So take that stroller. The pool was nice and we loved that the water was heated and the slide. Life guards were very attentive. I thought the food at the food court was very good. Expensive, as to be expected, but good. A burger and fry basket was around $7. A small pizza was around $7. A can of soda was $1.79 so if you have room in your suitcase pack a few 12 packs if you're a soda lover. This is what we did instead of buying the free refill cups simply because it was so much more convenent to have soda in our room than to make that journey over to the food court to get the free refill every time we were thirsty. We didn't use any of the transportation because we drove and planned on taking our big stroller into the parks with us, which isn't allowed on the buses. Being a resort guest, you get free parking at the parks anyway. All you do is show them your room key as you enter the park where they normally collect parking fees and you're in. It was a nice visit. Everyone on staff that we dealt with was very nice.If you order the pizza delivery be aware that a 15% delivery charge is automatically added onto your total so you don't double tip like I did. I'm a server, so I'm all about tipping, but the guy just had about a 7 or 8 minute walk from the food court to our room and for that he ended up receiving a $4.50 automatically added in tip, plus I tipped him another $4 because I didn't know it was already added until I looked at the receipt after he left. He ended up getting an $8.50 tip on a $26 order. He was nice, but not THAT nice! Just a little heads up! I know this is long, and I apologize but hopefully some of this info will help. I would possibly go back if it were just my husband and myself, but not taking the kids again. The property is just a little bit too spread out for having to walk to and from things with little ones. Also, if you're going for the water sports. The fishing is cane pole only and my husband says the fish are conditioned to having all the people around and you can see them come right up to the worms and then swim away, and the Sea Racers have a very low maximum speed set on them. They're not like the ones you see racing around at your local river. They go fairly slow. Thanks for looking and good luck on your trip planning.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside (me, wife and two kids) from 18th February to March 4th 2005. Allocated in Alligator Bayou, rooms were bit smaller than expected but no problem if you are out enjoying yourselves as we were. Housekeeping very friendly, and deserved tips. Scenery is gorgeous from room, and well maintained. The grounds are picture postcard. Staff are excellent and very willing to help at all times. Facilities (eating/shopping) on site fine, but breakfast court very busy after 8am. The Disney Lifeguards are to be commended for their attention to the pool safety, and were never to be found chatting and passing the day with each other, which we appreciated with two small children. One small niggle was the cost of hiring the bicycles ($ 24 for half an hours trip round the grounds!!). These are on site and could be offered at a discount or free as they were not over used. The only thing we would change would be to request the Magnolia rooms but this has to be balanced with the extra few minutes journey to the reception/food courts/on site shops. Overall, a thoroughly enjoyable (but tiring!) break at the Riverside and we would certainly wish for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the outdoor layout - Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: mothra1446
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans Riverside - 2/10-2/14/05. It was my first trip to Disney and my husband's second. The grounds were huge and beautiful - it was about a 10 minute walk to get to our building (#35). Our room had recently been renovated and was so cute - very disney:) Disney buses came to 3 different stops on hotel property every 10-15 minutes. The food was overpriced, but good - but that's the case no matter where you go on Disney property. What I loved most is that we got exactly what we expected and a little more - For example - we didn't have any dollar bills to tip the maid one of the days we were there and put the don't disturb paper in the door. When we came back to our room at the end of the day, maidservice had left a bag full of towels/washcloths/soap/shampoo/. I felt that all staff(especially at the hotel) went out of their way to make your trip special. Port Orleans is not a full service hotel property(for example no room service) So if you go in knowing this - you won't be suprised, but you will definitely get more than you expected!! Highly recommended!! My husband stayed at the Contemporary before and thought Port Orleans was a better deal($$) and also for the layout/amenities on site.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, an enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: zxcv1
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from a week at PO-Riverside, 2-21 to 2-26-05. There were five of us (3 kids) so we stayed in Alligator Bayou to get the extra trundle bed. We started in building 15. The room was fine, but on Day 3 we were woken up by loud renovation construction going on in a room next door. Disney completely shut down Building 14 for total renovation (it is now done) and somehow the renovation leaked over into 15 - which was stupid considering that 15 was pretty well occupied. Anyhow, Disney eventually moved most if not everybody out of Building 15. We were moved to 18, which was terrific - we got a good chance to see the difference between a renovated room (in Bldg 18) and a non-renovated room (in 15). The room in 18 was much nicer. We also got 50% off our room for the day we were woken by drills. That was the bad part - though Disney basically handled it well, if slowly. The good part is that the grounds at PO-R are beautiful, the food is good, and the pools are great. The best part about PO-R is piano man Bob - his act in the lounge is not to be missed. Both adults and kids loved him. I don't know what they pay him, but it isn't enough. Like the Disney Theme Parks, you can expect to stand in some lines at PO-R. Check-in, even at 8 pm, likely means a 10 to 15 minute line. The food court has some irritating lines, though - again - the food is good and the prices really aren't bad. The folks in the back right corner - where you would get burgers, Phillys, chicken strips, etc., are RIDICULOUSLY slow. The free boat transportation to PO-FQ and Downtown Disney is excellent. The boat operators were terrific and great sources of information. The bus service to the parks was basically OK. We typically had waits of 5-15 minutes for everything. We had one awful wait - nearly an hour to get a bus from MGM Park back to PO-R mid-afternoon on a Wednesday. While a huge gang of us waited, we watched buses for the other disney resorts come and go at least twice each. In my opinion, Disney Transportation simply does not yet have a good handle on the Port Orleans complex. It is one of if not the biggest resort, and therefore needs additional buses. Once the buses do come, they are jammed. I don't feel it is acceptable for Disney to expect people to be standing and jammed on every PO bus. The parks were terrific. The Magic Kingdom was magical, and Animal Kingdom and Epcot were great. MGM Studios is OK, and the Tower of Terror and Rock ' n Roller Coaster there are MUST-rides. The best ride is at Epcot - I think it is called Mission Space. Absolutely remarkable - but DO NOT ride if you are prone to motion sickness. Mission Space is very different, very original, and very - ah - convincing. The bottom line is that my family & I had a terrific time in Orlando. PO-R, though not perfect, is a good option for those who don't want the hassles associated with staying off-site. The "magic" is found in the parks, not at the Disney resorts. I'm sure we'll be back to Disney World in a year or two. We may well return to PO-R. All things considered, for the money it was a decent deal. My kids had a great time, which is what really matters.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed Port Orleans Riverside.”
Reviews.Author: seagoer5
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at this resort. We were assigned a newly renovated room. It was nicely decorated. The grounds were beautiful. We took advantage of the fishing and swimming at the resort. The restaurant was great for breakfast when we were not in a hurry to get to the parks. Otherwise, the food court was adequate. The gift shop was very large with a great selection of Disney souvenirs. The staff was friendly and helpful. There was a bar that had a piano bar. The bus system was great. The only problem was in the cleanliness of the room upon check-in. The carpets looked like they were not vacuumed and there was paper on the floor. Also the sheets had stains on them. Be advised that they only change the sheets every 4 nights unless you request them to do so. After the room was cleaned the next day and vacuumed, everything was OK. Another thing we found strange was that they did not have towels at the pool. We are a family of 3, so the room was spacious enough. All in all an enjoyable time was had by all. I would recommend this resort if you are looking for a place in the moderately priced category.

Reviews.Title: “Bugs, dirty & no help at all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in Sept. 2003. My fiance and I went down to disney to celebrate our engagement. We went with another couple. We arrived about 11am, our rooms were not ready until after 5:30pm! My fiance and I could barely open the door to our room. There were so many bugs. It looked like an episode of fear factor. We finally get inside and there are bugs on the wall and in the bed. The bathroom was filthy. The towels had blood on them and fire ants. We went back to check in and asked for another room. We were told that it was bug season. My fiance demanded another room, after all this trip cost $2300. They decided to move us two doors down, where the same problem was. We told them to put us in a second floor room, and so they did. The bus stops were worse, you could not even stand up without bugs attacking you from all ends and there were ants everywhere. The hotel is so rundown and the rooms were dirty. As the days went on we found fire ants in the bed, bugs in our drawers, bugs in our suitcase, and more dirty towels. The front desk told us they could spray our room with bug repellant, but we would have to leave the room and breathe all that junk in for the rest of our stay. My fiance told them we just got engaged, hoping they would try to make this stay better. We did not even get a congratulations. My friends also had trouble too. My friend was sleeping when her bed broke and she fell to the floor. She called housekeeping and they did nothing. She told front desk; again nothing. Her bed stayed broke the entire stay, luckily they had a double bed room and slept on the other bed. At the end of trip we were told to email disney communications with our complaint. They did nothing. I wrote to them and they never even responded. Disney is not the way it used to be, we stayed at this hotel in early 2002 and did not have any problems. The staff used to be friendly and the rooms clean. Think twice before staying here, especially during their bug season.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong at the Riverside”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Riverside twice, once in the mansions and the other in the bayou and enjoyed both sections. Found the rooms to be clean and modern. The resort is very large and scenic and there is a ton of things to do there from renting mouse boats, taking horse drawn carriage rides, or twin bicycle rides. The boat ride to downtown disney is also great, much nicer than taking the bus. The pools are great, spaced out around the resort and the Restaraunt, Boatwrights has very good food. Also, don't miss the comedy paino man Bob who plays in the bar four nights a week.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: LETSGORACING
Reviews.Content: MY family of 5 just stayed at POR.FEB.-3-8.loved it.of course we picked the wrong time to go this year."SUPER BOWL"IN JACKSONVILLE.made the parks UNBEARABLE.so we spent alot of time at the resort.kids loved the main pool with the slide.ROOM was fine for us.had the trundle bed which was GREAT.RESORT was so nice at night,BOAT RIDE TO DOWNTOWN DISNEY WAS GREAT.

Reviews.Title: “No lines, no crowds - great time of year.”
Reviews.Author: disneydawg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from WDW. We stayed 5 days at Port Orleans Riverside. I have never been to WDW in January but I think I will make it my new vacation season. There were no crowds, no lines and best of all no priorty seatings were necessary in many of the restaurants - we just walked right in and were seated. We stayed in the Magnolia Bend section of the resort which was just refurbished. The rooms were freshly painted, bright and clean. All the moderate resorts now have refrigerators in each room which is really a plus. If you get a chance head over to the lounge for the live nightly entertainment. Disney is still a nice destination for vacation with or without children. - GO EAGLES!

Reviews.Title: “A good all-rounder!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went here on our honeymoon last year and we had a fantasic time! The port orleans resort was excellent. Our room was kept very clean and tidy during the whole trip and it's a very quiet, scenic place to stay. There is a fairly big pool by each of the several accomodation mansions which were never busy and always very quiet and pleasant. The food in the food court was very nice although slightly expensive which is to be expected on a disney resort. The free buses and boat to the various disney areas were excellent and made it very easy to get around for people who dont have a car. All in all a really nice place to stay. We have very happy memories of our stay there and would definately consider staying there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans-Riverside--Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Marathon Weekend at Disney and was required to stay three nights at the Riverside Resort through my Tour Package. I have never stayed on Disney Property before so I was excited to go there with my husband and see what it was like. We used the free transportation shuttle bus from the Country Inn and Suites to Epcot and then took the free bus to the resort. Check in was a breeze at 12PM and off we went to our room in the Magnolia Terrace building. It took us almost 5 minutes to walk around the whole building to find our room and once we entered, we were disappointed with a dirty room. There was a dirty glass filled with water on one of the pillows in the room, the sink was filled with blue toothpaste and the garbage barrel was filled to the top. We called the front desk an they graciously moved us to another room. I did, however, have to walk back to the front desk, wait in line for 5 minutes and then wait another 10 minutes for the girl at check in to figure out what was going on. I got another room key and we moved to another room about 5 doors down. On the surface the room looked so much better but after searching for the remote control that was missing, we found 3 dirty tissues under the bedskirts, a used cap filled with couch syrup and about 15 M&M's all over the floor. We didn't want to move so we just left them there for the full three nights we stayed. Housekeeping did deliver our Remote control in a few minutes. Our new room had the worst overhead fan in the bathroom that kept making loud "knocking" noises when it was shut off. The first night was so loud in the middle of the night, that I thought someone was knocking on our door. The next two nights had me turning on the light in the bathroom the entire night to prevent the knocking noises. They weren't kidding about the toilet flushing noises from other rooms...boy was that loud. With that said, the resort itself was wonderful. It was spread out beautifully but it ended up killing me after my marathon on Sunday. It normally took me about 6 minutes to walk over the two bridges to get to the food court but my knee was so swollen after the race that it took me almost 15 minutes to walk to get something to eat. Not the resorts fault but I was dying. The free transportation to and from the resorts and the marathon was wonderful. Never had to wait more than 5 minutes to get a bus. I don't know if anyone had this problem but I was looking for a computer with internet access everywhere on Disney property and could not find one. The only place I knew that had internet access was DisneyQuest and I was not paying the admission fee to log onto a computer. I went to 5 different properties and could not find a business center in any of them. Oh well... I don't think I will be staying on Disney property again. It was convenient but not worth the extra cash in my opinion. I loved the Country Inn and Suites and the Fairfield Inn in Lake Buena Vista. I like having all of the food places within walking distance and having the Supermarkets and Walgreens right there. I'll rent a car next time.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved Disney's Port Orleans, Riverside”
Reviews.Author: starmgm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans - Riverside from December 22 thru December 29, 2004 and had a fabulous time. The room was ready upon our arrival (12:00 noon) and was very clean and nicely decorated. The bus transportation to the parks was adequate although it did get crowded at times due to the holiday period. The food court was excellent in that there were many choices and the food was pretty good. The grounds were beautiful and as we stayed at Magnolia Terrace, the walk to the lobby, food court, restaurant and main pool was quite convenient. We would definitely stay here again when visiting Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “I'd Do It Again in a Nanosecond!”
Reviews.Author: PMBtheDad
Reviews.Content: Our family of five was happy to get an excellent price for the Christmas holidays ($111/night, including taxes and fees -- usually $184+taxes, etc.) at the Port Orleans Riverside. We had reservations for three nights. Check-in on December 23 was a bit hectic as there were a large number of people staying there for Christmas. But within 20 minutes we were assigned a room at Alligator Bayou in Building 14 which is the closest to the main lobby. The room had not yet been refurbished, but was in great shape. Our kids loved the rustic setting and almost instantly found one of Br'er Rabbit's cousins in the bushes near our room. We had a great meal at the resort's Boatwright's Dining Hall that first night. In the River Roost the family thoroughly enjoyed the antics of YeeHaa Bob at the piano. When we left for a day at Animal Kingdom and Epcot, we came back to a cleaned room, plus! Resort "mousekeepers" are adept at putting an added touch on mundane housekeeping efforts by making washcloth animals. Disney's hotels are hard to beat if you are a fan of such theming. We've become fans of Port Orleans Riverside.

Reviews.Title: “We will stay at dinsey again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed between December 30th and January 02 3 nights (1 Room 3 adults +1yearold) The room we stayed at Magnoliabend section of the Resort was very good, nicely decoratedand Decent. The housekeeping cleanliness was not so good they dont change any of the linens althought we stayed 3 nights 4 days (instead they have turn the pillow cases back wards !). Our room was convinient to Hotels Bar and Restaurant. We have made priority seating arrangements at Boathouse Restaurant and worked fine the food was good but Pricey. We have eat every breakfast at the resorts Food court not much selection and prices was also expensive. We have used the shutlle services to the part did not wait more than 15 minutes each way we used the Free boat service from Hotel to Downtown disney great way to explore and overall we are satisfied we will stay again at disney resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs down for Port Orleans Riverside”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Cosmetically speaking, this resort is beautiful. But that's all there is to this resort. It took 3 rooms after check-in to get one that was clean. None of the carpets had been vacuumed, there were other people's hair in the bathtubs which were only "spot" cleaned, dirty wrappers on the floors, and stains on the bed sheets. Housekeeping was awful and did not do much to fix the problems. The food court was fine on weekdays, but during busy weekends they did not have enough help, causing you to have to wait in line for 10 minutes to pay for your food, while your food was getting cold. Transportation was fine, no trouble with the buses. The pool was nice but almost always crowded, especially at night, with unsupervised children running rampid. We would not stay at this particular resort again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We Just returned December 26th after a week at the Port Orleans Riverside. I was thoroughly impressed with this hotel. The check in process was efficient and professional. We arrived early and our assigned room was not available, however they were able to relocate us into the Oak Manor building into great room and location that was a five minute walk from the transportion stop and main hotel lobby and food court. I think the prices of food at breakfast time were very reasonable considering the huge portion size. Service in the food court was rapid and the food was pretty good. We found the room size to be adequete for us (two adults and one toddler) and it was very well maintained and was spotless upon our arrival. I did however find the mattress to be a bit stiff. I think that the disney transportation was outstanding with the exception of Christmas day when there was a mass exodus out of Magic Kingdom due to heavy rains. There was close to a 2 hour wait to get on the shuttle to return to the hotel, so we opted to take a taxi from the Contemporary Resort. This one negative point however can not be taken to mean that the transportation was inadequete, as we found it to be very efficient and timely. I would highly recommend this resort as it provides good value with all of the amenities you would expect for a moderate disney resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Port Orleans as a whole”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 4 nights at the Port Orleans Riverside - Magnolia Bend - 12/11 thru 12/15. The resort as a whole was terrific - clean and comfortable. I payed extra for a waterview room - I would not recommend that for future travelers.. First of all you don't spend much time in your room anyways and also the view is not all that great. Upon our first checkin and getting to our room we were staring at the back of a big cement stairwell so had to change rooms and the next view still wasnt any better so save your money. The restaurant was a little smaller than I would have expected for such a large resort but the staff in all aspects were terrific. As far as Disney transportation - we never waited longer than 8 min for any bus... Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Southern Comfort”
Reviews.Author: je1026
Reviews.Content: My wife my 4 year old son and I stayed 12 nights from 12-3-04 to 12-15-04. The Resort grounds are beautiful, we stayed at the Oak Manor Building, less than a 5 min. walk to the Main Lobby. Rooms are spacious. You have to remember that we are talking about a nearly 3,000 rooms hotel, it's big. The dinning area is small for the size of the hotel, specially if there is a 100% occupation rate. We never use Disney's transport, was too slow and crowded. The pool was great, warm water and only a copuple of ducks swimming in the early mornings. I definetly recomend the hotel, but not for 12 nights, we still have neck and low back pain because of the bed and pillows. Bring your own one (pillow).

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at Riverside for 5 nights over Thanksgiving and had a great time. We really enjoyed the two Port Orleans pools, the Riverside one has rustic charm, shade, and a great pool and slide and the French Quarter one is colorful and fun and has another great slide. Playground at Riverside is excellent, a wooden fort sand-bottomed kids dream with tree houses and other fun stuff. The FQ playground is you standard modern plastic and metal version, probably safer, but less fun! Our room in Magnolia Terrace was very nice and looked freshly renovated. There was even a refrigerator neatly tucked away in a cherrywood cabinet, with no $10 surcharge per day (finally!). Rent a surrey bike, great fun, but you do need to be somewhat fit! Also have boat rentals, none of it outrageously priced. Location is very close to Epcot and convenient to the other parks as well. If you drive, be sure to plot a route right to Riverside, the signs were hard to read and we ended up driving up to Magic Kingdom and back around to Riverside. Very nice hotel, especially for under $100 including tax (fall special). Only negative is he external walkways are a bit annoying, just like at the Coronado, you have people walking by a lot. Probably would have been better on the second floor. However, the ambiance of this resort is far higher than even the peak season, undiscounted price, and you can't beat the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Port Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our son and daughter-in-law just returned from a five night stay over Thanksgiving at Port Orleans-Riverside, Magnolia Bend. We could not have been happier with our rooms. They were clean, of adequate size, and even included a refrigerator (Which is new to the moderate resorts at Disney). I appreciated the two sinks outside of the bathroom. The furnishings appeared to be rather new and the beds were very comfortable. I needed an egg crate (mattress topper) for a back problem and it was provided by the hotel. Our room was within a five minute walk to the shuttle bus and the hotel restaurant. We thoroughly enjoyed the scenic walk back to our room each day. We ate at the hotel 2-3 times and were satisfied with the meals. Much to our surprise, we were able to take a boat to Downtown Disney from our hotel. It was a very pleasant experience. We would difinitely stay at Port Orleans-Riverside again. Overall it was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite Disney Resort!”
Reviews.Author: dergenie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a one week stay at Port Orleans Riverside, and thoroughly enjoyed it. One needs to know that there are basically two parts to this resort, the Alligator Bayou section and the Magnolia Bend section. We stayed at the Magnolia Bend section which is lovely in architecture - fashioned in the style of a southern plantation. The Alligator Bayou section is still nice, but not as nice as Magnolia Bend, in our opinion. Everything was clean and neat, and very efficient. The setting of the entire complex is peaceful and relaxing. By way of comparison, my husband and I had breakfast one morning at the Animal Kindgom Lodge and it had a more frenetic atmosphere. We much preferred ours, and noticed that a lot of couples, both young and old, were staying at the Port Orleans Riverside. There is a pool on the "island" part that you cross to get to Boatwright's Restaurant, and that pool is more for children.-slides and such and lifeguards. The pools in the various Magnolia Bend sections were more peaceful and enjoyable for an older couple such as ourselves. We enjoyed Boatwrights for breakfast. Breakfast selections were great! The Sassagoula Swing drink is delicious!! Evening meals were still good, but did not have as many menu items that we enjoy eating, even though very well prepared. We enjoyed meeting Sue at the restaurant- she is one of the "seaters" and is very enjoyable to chat with- she is at the breakfast shift. We do recommend, though, that one take advantage of priority seating, which Disney World offers. On Friday and Saturday nights in particular, the wait can be an hour or longer if you do not have priority seating. All the resort staff with whom we came in contact were courteous and friendly. We rented a car and are glad we did. It gave us so much more freedom- we did not have to wait for buses. If you do rent a car, we strongly suggest that you ask the resort for maps on how to get back to the resort at night- the first two nights we got lost, coming from the varous parks. Going is not a problem. It is the coming back that is a bit confusing, especially at night. Enjoyed the various parks- MGM and Animal Kingdom were our favorites. Downtown Disney was fun as well. If you are not in a hurry, take the ferry boat to this area from the resort- takes about 25 minutes -very relaxing. All in all, a very enjoyable vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Scared by reviews, couldn't have had a better time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After booking our trip at Port Orleans-Riverside, I made the mistake of reading a bunch of reviews. I was a little nervous until we pulled into the lot. The security at the front gate is amazing, very reassuring. The front desk staff were pleasant and very accomodating. We loved our room, you've seen the pictures online, small yes but well kept and a nice warm feeling. We stayed in the Magnolia section of the hotel and we were just a short walk to the bus stop and the foot bridge to cross the river. Our first night we bought milk and some snacks for our stay and found our refrigerator was not getting very cold. The next morning I called the front desk and when we had returned from the parks, a new refrigerator was in the room, cold and had been stocked with our snacks! By that time, the other refrigerator was very cold and we had two! Great for kids. The pool is so fun with the showers and the slide. You can sign out a life jacket for the little guys the whole time you are there and it is free. My little guy loved that he could go down the slide and did not need to be caught by one of us. I was at Disney a few years ago but never stayed in a hotel, but I can say that the hotels and parks are geared towards adults now too! You are allowed to carry alcoholic beverages anywhere, even on the ferry boat down the river to downtown disney. Nothing was better than sipping a cold beer and sailing down the river at night. The trails around the pool are fun, my son rented a bicycle and had a blast! We ate in the sit down restaurant for breakfast and the food was great, moderately priced and well worth it. I would suggest calling when you wake up and make a reservation so you don't have to wait. The food court is great too! At first I was turned off by it, but all the food turned out to be great. We are already planning our next trip and we know where we are going to stay, Port Orleans!! If you are the type to complain about every little thing, then don't go anywhere. When booking your room go online to the resort map so you see which building you will be staying in. All in all, this was the best vacation ever, I'm 28 and have been to a lot of places but this was great! And the water parks, so much fun!! One more suggestion, if you buy the park hoppers, go to a park early and come home around 2or3p. Take a nap, trust me you will love it and the kids will too! Then go back out after dinner. Downtown disney is so much fun, all my son kept saying was "I love this place mom." And all we had bought him was a $4 package of Legos. The atmosphere is incredible and the clubs are fun too. We used the babysitting service two nights, and though it is pricey think of the precious cargo. Also, the fireworks at Magic Kingdom are great!! Well, I could go on but I should stop. DISNEY ROCKS!!! Anyone need any more pointers, feel free to email me.

Reviews.Title: “Moderate is a good description”
Reviews.Author: anne_nyc
Reviews.Content: FiancÃ© and I just took a four day vacation to Disney World 8/25 â€“ 8/29 and stayed at the Port Orleans â€“ Riverside in the Alligator Bayou buildings. I have to say overall we were disappointed but, to be fair, may have been expecting too much. We arrived rather late (11 pm) on Wednesday and had a bit of tough time finding our hotel. Neither of us realized the resorts are grouped by the park they are closest to â€“ Port Orleans is an Epcot resort. When we arrived, the host was friendly and chatty. I tried hinting for an upgrade by saying I was hoping for a waterside room. He must have missed the hint. We drove over to Building 17 and used our key card to enter the room we had been given â€“ no luck. The key didnâ€™t work. We decided to try other rooms and found that our key cards worked in a room two doors down. My first surprise was that the buildings have external hallways. While the room we ended up with was on a corner with two lovely windows, we had to keep the shades pulled the entire time because people walk by constantly. On a better note, the smaller pool near our room was fun to relax by during a break from the parks one day. We also made sure to visit the Port Orleans â€“ French Quarter for the beignets and their pool. The beignets were wonderful and the pool was fun for two adults looking to be silly and go down the small slide. There is a boat that will take guests from the Port Orleans â€“ Riverside to Downtown Disney. We enjoyed the trip but do keep in mind that it takes awhile for a boat to arrive and the trip by boat takes a good half hour. We didnâ€™t leave enough time and almost missed our dinner reservation.

Reviews.Title: “I've never been so disappointed in Disney”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at WDW hotels many, many times over the years, and last year decided to "return" to our favorite Dixie Landings, now renamed and combined with Port Orleans. We had absolutely loved the resort our first time, over ten years prior. This time was awful! We had just returned from the 7 day cruise and were spending two days at the park before returning home. When we arrived we went to the pool which was filled with leaves and just filthy. The poolside rest rooms were also disgusting. I wouldn't let my daughter use them. The next morning, my husband was standing by the sink and kicked something with his foot. When he checked it out, it was a HYPODERMIC NEEDLE!!!! Mind you, I was staying there with two small children! I immediately called the front desk. The first person who answered asked why I didn't just throw it away. I requested a manager who was a little better and said he would send someone within the hour to remove it. We left for the parks and returned 10 hours later and it was still sitting there. I called again and complained. nearly an hour later a hotel worker came with a red hazardous waste container and gloves. He picked it up and placed it in the container, taking all precautions, although it was okay to leave it all day in a hotel room occupying kids. When I complained about the situation at check out, they replyed that it must have been dropped by a previous guest, like it happens all the time. Not only was this poor housekeeping, but also a potentially lethal health hazard. The hotel offered us nothing...not even an apology. When I returned home I complained to WDW Corporation, who issued us a 10% discount on one night which we received 60 days later. We're returning to WDW this year...we've booked offsite!

Reviews.Title: “Magical Southern Charm!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The South shall rise again! This hotel is exquisite, cozy, charming, huge, detailed, and BEAUTIFUL!!!! I love evrything about this hotel. It is absolutely charming and romantic for couples, for example the Horse and carriage rides available around the scenic resort. For families this resort is ideal as well, a very fun and large pool for the kids, and plenty of activities like bike surreys, and boats to go on. The service is your ideal Disney service with a big smile. I have stayed at the Grand Floridian and other Deluxe level resorts in Disney which are lovely. BUT the riverside, which is considered a "Moderate" resort, is by far the most fun, and the most scenic Disney hotel I have ever stayed at. I also got a great deal on the Disney site . They are having a "Fall special rate" I got my room for $109 (thats including taxes) BEAUTIFUL!

Reviews.Title: “Great trip to Disney”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned hom from 4 days at Disney. This was my first time to stay @ a Disney Resort and I will do this every time. I loved the food court, it had something for everyone and it stayed open late. The only thing I would do different is take a taxi to the resort from the airport, the wait for the shuttle was way to long. We also had to wait a while for a bus back to the hotel when leaving Disney, but staying for the fireworks show was definitly worth it. Great Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort and alot of fun at Disney”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at Port Orleans Riverside and was very pleased with this resort. Check-in was fast and we were able to get to our room early. The room was beautiful-comfortable bed, plenty of space, attractive furnishings. I was concerned walking into our building because there seemed to be alot of wear, but the room was like new. Maid service was outstanding and there were pleasant touches waiting for us when we'd return to the room. The grounds were pretty especially at night with the lights on the river. There is some refurbishment going on near the food court but it didn't detract from the overall appearance and ambience of the central resort area. We had a pool right next to our building that was quieter than the central pool. It was a very nice area and never crowded. The only problem here was that pool towels were not provided-but we ended up buying towels so it wasn't really an issue. The bar at the central pool was a nice place to relax and have a drink. Boatwright's restaurant was pretty good. The menu is quite limited, however. Breakfast at Boatwrights is a must. We found the food court extremely disappointing. The ice cream and shakes were the only items that were decent. Don't get the pizza!!! Food overall was quite expensive. I really liked the gift shop. It had a good cross-section of merchandise and an excellent selection of sundries. I was surprised and pleased that the shop had such long hours. My only complaint about Disney in general is how difficult it is to have dinner. We didn't want to eat at Boatwrights every night, the food court was substandard and to eat at Downtown Disney involved long waits. We always struggled with what we were going to do for dinner. I can't say enough about the kindness and friendliness of everyone working at this resort and at Disney overall. I would highly recommend this resort for couple and families.

Reviews.Title: “Disney is the Greatest!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved this resort! But then again I've loved every Disney resort. I've stayed at the Wilderness Lodge and the Polynesian several times. The only complaint I would have isn't really about the hotel. We went in May and the bus lines are harder to get on than any other resort I've been to. By the time another bus comes there are so many people at the other stops that you may not be able to get on. The boat to the Marketplace is great. The resort is huge and you may have to walk to get to where you want to go but my parents are young and my brother and I are in our mid 20's so the walk wasn't a big deal to us but if you are traveling with older people or little kids I imagine after a long day at the park getting back to your room is not your favorite part of the day. Be sure to ask for a room close to the the main building or close to a bus stop. Also be sure to take advantage of the cups for sale in the snack area. Every Disney resort has there own travel mug for sale. You then can get unlimited refills at that resort. We loved these for coffee in the morning while you're waiting for the bus or a soda in the afternoon. Disney transportation is one of the best parts of the park. It's so nice to leave your car in the hotel parking lot and not have to see it again for the rest of the week. We went to Disney with my cousins and aunt and uncle a couple of years ago and the best investment you can make when you have a larger group is two way walkie talkies. My cell phone didn't have service when we were there so these were perfect when we all wanted to meet for dinner but wanted to go to different parks during the day. Also when we went in May a different park was open 3 hours later every night only for Disney resort guests. This was very nice so we could sleep in and enjoy the cooler nights and less lines at the park. This is a great resort but I have found it's hard to go wrong when you stay anywhere Disney. Oh and another tip the amount of car break ins at the resort parking lots is enormous be sure to park in a well-lit area and not to leave ANYTHING in your car. We've never had anything happen but it's better to be safe then to end your vacation filling out a police report.

Reviews.Title: “BIG FUN IN FLORIDA”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited florida for 2 Weeks from 07 August 2004. We have two small children aged 5 and 7 years. This was our first trip to Florida and we had a fabulous time. We were very impressed with the hotel and the helpful staff. The main pool was ideal for the children and had secluded chairs for a bit of quiet time. The bus service to the parks was exceptional and the maximum wait was only ten minutes- very impressive. The food hall was our main eatery and we were pleased with the choice and found the prices to be very reasonable.The resort was very clean and tidy and after hurricane Charley the staff were out in force to clear the pathways and gardens to their origianl beauty.

Reviews.Title: “UNHAPPY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The bedding was dirty. The room service was falsely advertised in the room. The laundry was left in front of door by housekeeping for a day and a half. Staff was hard to understand.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing bad to say”
Reviews.Author: bbalde01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside for five nights July 31st - Aug 5 2004, and it was a fantastic place to stay, the southern charm of the mansion style rooms, we were located just outside one of the quiet pools on the third floor (we had elevators) the kids loved the main pool with the waterslide, the bridge crossing the river as we are walking to the main building made for great photo ops. We would highly recommend this resort and will probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at the Riverside Resort on three occasions over the years and have found this resort to be worth the money and to be one of the better "modarte" resorts. It is great for kids as well as adults. One of the attractions is the boat ride to Downtown Disney, this can be a little slow at certian times of the day but is a nice cool ride and beats the buses. The rooms are average and depending on where you are can be a walk to the main building. The staff for the most part is friendly and helpful. The food is a little overpriced. We drove last year and took a small "frig" for the room which if rented would have been $10.00 a day. This a good resort and I highly recommend this over Port Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Quit dramatizing! POR is a great resort!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the POR Sunday August 1, 2004 through the 3rd. We have stayed there many times over the years even when it was called Dixie Landings, and NEVER HAD A BAD EXPERIENCE THERE!! Check in was quick and friendly. Our room was ready upon check in. We found it to be very clean and all was in order AS ALWAYS. We have stayed in several of the different areas of this resort over the years. The pools were clean and well attended. We had lunch at the food court and all was fresh and hot. The walk to the main buildings is 5-10 minutes tops, and can be very enjoyable because of the beautiful landscaping. No sense being in a hurry if you're on vacation. We found this time away to be very relaxing and very enjoyable. Other family members will be visiting POR next week and I am VERY SURE they will not be dissapointed. I felt a lot of the negative comments to be a bit dramatized. We definately got our moneys worth. We will definitely be returning to POR.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at port orleans riverside for our honeymoon on 5th July 04. the resort was perfect for us. we could take walks along the river or have a boat ride to downtown disney. the room was clean and spacious, but nothing special. we felt the the hotel surroundings were what made our honeymoon special.

Reviews.Title: “Sounthern Charm”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Disney's Riverside/Port Orlean's resort was a peaceful and pleasant stay even for just an overnight get-away. My son and I wanted a quick trip before school started again and choose Disney's Riverside Hotel. Check-in was quick and, as always, our room was ready right away. We stay in the Aligator Bayou area and our room was cozy and overlooked the river. We were near the food court, where we ate a nice lunch and then rented a two man kayak and paddled toward Downtown Disney. Later that day we took the bus (only waited 3 minutes) and rode to EPCOT, where we went on a few "rides" and ate dinner at Le Celler. Then we watched the fireworks and rode the bus back to our hotel. The next day, we fished at The Fishin' Hole, swam in the pool, had a nice lunch and went home. Disney always provides the best service and most fun for the money.

Reviews.Title: “"NICE PLACE"”
Reviews.Author: newtont
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our honeymoon during the Fall and the resort was perfect for us and our budget. The grounds were so beautiful and the staff very helpful and friendly. Eat at Boatwright's Dining Hall at least once during your stay for dinner, Good New Orleans cuisine. Make sure when you check in that you ask for the Mansion side, that's the best area in the resort, close to the main building and you have your own quiet pool too, like most of the buildings anyway. Take a water taxi to downtown Disney at night, or rent a boat (20 dollars for an hour), very romantic. Would definitely stay here again for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week stay at the Port Orleans - Riverside Resort. It was wonderful resort and we enjoyed it very much. When we arrived at check-in time we had no wait at all in getting our room. I had requested the Alligator Bayou section because I wanted to enjoy a more casual atmosphere. They processed my request with no problem and we had a lovely room looking over lush landscaping. Each cluster of rooms has its own "quiet" pool. We loved this! It made for a perfect dip after a hard day of walking all over the parks. The room was clean and most importantly, kept cold! That AC worked fabulously! It was just wonderful to be all hot and then open the room to the cool air. We ate one night in Boatwright's dining room. We felt that it was a tad expensive for the quality of food. Better to stick with other sit down restaurants in the parks or at other resorts. We really enjoyed eating at California Grill at the Contemporary Resort. The food court was good and provided a great combination of foods for all tastes. We will definately stay here again. It was a very relaxed resort and made for a wonderful contrast to all the hectic activity in the parks.

Reviews.Title: “150% Recommended, We Had A FANTASTIC Holiday!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
