Reviews.Content: I was very dubious whilst we were booking our holiday - I work for a large UK Travel Agent and had been told this was one of the oldest Disney Resorts and in need of a major refurbishment. Some of the reader reviews on here worried me slightly too! (I have a fussy family!!) We arrived quite late in the day and one of the few bad points I should mention is that check-in does take a long time. We were thankful it wasn't busy and we'd not had to wait in a 'line' to be served! We made our way to our rooms and were disappointed to find my parents hadn't been given the Waterview Room they had pre-paid for and also my room and my sister's was inter-connecting - which is normally good fun - but this was her Honeymoon and we did need to be a few doors away!!! We went back to Reception, they moved my parents over to the Magnolia Bend side (we were originally in the Alligator Bayou side) and they got a beautiful room with a Waterview. It was extremely clean, well kept - their only minor complaint was that a new shower-head would be needed soon. We also got moved to seperate rooms in the Alligator Bayou, which were very nice too. Clean, well kept and had a traditional rustic Port Orleans type feel!! Both room changes were done with NO problems, they were more than happy to accommodate our requests. However, after seeing my parents room - it felt much lighter and more spacious so my sister & I cheekily asked if it was possible for us to have rooms in Magnolia Bend and again they were only too happy to move us, even upgrading us to King Bedrooms!! We didn't have a long walk to the main lobby / restaurant area and we also had a bus stop right behind our building so this was excellent. We didn't eat in the main restaurant but the menu looked good and prices reasonable. We did eat a few meals, including breakfast most mornings, in the "Food Court" area. They served just about anything you could want. Muffins, pastries, omlettes, pancakes, bacon, eggs, fruit and cereal in the morning. Then from lunchtime until late late at night they served freshly prepared salads, pre-packed sandwichs & salads, pizzas, pasta, hot dogs, burgers, chicken, fries, tacos - also ice creams, crisps, chocolate & other deserts. I would recommend spending the $11.99 on a drinks mug. It allows you to refil drinks throughout the duration of your stay. We were there for 2 weeks and had a fair few afternoons and late morning relaxing so got full use out of them. We hired a boat and used the boat to Downtown Disney a few times - it's so much nicer than the bus!! We spent an evening by the pool near our building and it was wonderful, very relaxing, great atmosphere, very clean. The only downside were the toilets being locked (it was 9pm ish) and of course the mosquitos!!!!! The main pool was also great, plenty of shade there if you're not really a sun-lover. We only encountered one slight problem when our cleaner cut herself on my boyfriends razor - the hotel kindly asked if he would go to a local clinic for blood tests. He's a good man so had no issues with this, it was just an inconvenience to us and wasted at least a day of the holiday whilst he waited to be seen and when we went back for the (negative) results!!! The hotel was still good about this and provided two of our rooms with complimentary fridges as a goodwill gesture. All in all we had a fantastic trip, I would definitely recommend this Resort and I hope my review has been of some help to at least 1 person!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disney works its magic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Port Orleans in 2000 for 2 weeks in November. (It was called "Dixie Landings" then.) The weather wasn't great - it was really cold for 4 days, but I'm sure the magicians at Disney would have changed it if they could. The hotel was wonderful and we were based in Block 39, Alligator Bayou. It was away from the noise and about a 10 minute walk to the dining area, but that was fine as both of us enjoyed strolling through the beautiful grounds. We went to celebrate my 40th birthday, and have booked again for November 2004. I thoroughly recommend the place. Although it's spread out the rooms are nice, the staff are fabulous, and because of the time we were there (before Thanksgiving) the queues for the buses were short and we never had to wait more than 5 minutes for a bus either. Only 1 tiny hiccup - no coffee/tea makers in the room. In a hotel of this magnitude I expected one as you either carried coffee back to your room for breakfast, or schlepped the insulated mugs around with you. Maybe it's changed now, but it was a bit of a pain then. But, as that was the only grouse we had in a 2 week holiday - we were lucky! The laundry facilities are great; the quiet pools around Alligator Bayou were magical if you wanted a late-night peaceful swim and Housekeeping had no problems providing extra pillows and blankets in quick time either. All in all, a fabulous experience and one I can't wait to repeat!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went there for our honeymoon last August 2003, had a fantastic time and the hotel made it too, don't think I could stay in a non Disney hotel in Florida! Rooms were brilliant, 2 sinks 2 beds what more can you ask for. The only thing we did find is that once the restaurant closed there was no where to buy any water to take to bed as all the vending machines only sold fizzy drinks. Apart from that the place was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans is an awesome place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: SiestaFan
Reviews.Content: Our visit was from 6/6/04 to 6/12/04, and we can't say enough about the resort. Excellent daily cleaning services, plenty of clean towels. We did tip each morning before we left for the parks. I wish I had planned an extra day or two just to enjoy all the resort had to offer. We would definitely stay again. We received a special of $94 a night and were real pleased. Only comment was the beds were not as firm as we like, but doubt anyone would have as firm as we are used to. Everyone we came in contact with at the resort had an awesome personality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Real Soythern Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: mcel33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Riverside November 2003 for 1o days. It was excellent! You'd swear you were on the Mississippi Delta! The grounds are absoultely beautiful. And the staff was so friendly and made you feel welcome. I loved Boatwright's Dining Hall and the food court--the prices were great and you got a lot of food. Even the standard room we had was exceptional for a moderate hotel. I've stayed at other Disney moderate hotels before but this one is the best. On our next trip to WDW, we are definitely staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: WE spent April 16 to 23 at the Riverside and were amazed. It's a park in itself, true disney style. The grounds were absolutly beautiful and our room was fantastic. we had a great view of the river and the king size bed we requested. This really made the room seem so much bigger. It would have been nice to have a fridge but we did not want to spend the $10 a day. Bus transportation was fantastic. The most we waited at a resort was 10 minutes. The longest wait we had was coming home from Magic Kingdom. The boat ride to downtown disney is a must as is eating at the Rainforest Cafe. Boatwrights had a great breakfast at what we thought was a reasonable price. The cafeteria has limited selection but everything we had was fantastic. We stayed in Magnolia Bend, the Acadia House and the walk to the main area was all of 3 minutes. Just a pleasent walk over the bridge. We had a very nice quiet pool right next to our building which we took advantage of mor then once for some quiet R&R.We would definitley go back to this resort on our next trip to disney. We checked out a few others including some deluxe resorts and found it to be the best value for ambiance. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort! Loved it! Will return!”
Reviews.Author: ymanes24
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans Riverside Riview---May, 2004. We just returned from 4 nights at the Port Orleans Riverside with our 2 kids (1 and 4). We had an absolutely fabulous time!!! Room: Our room was in Magnolia Bend 8311, which was in Acadia House, directly in front of the stairwell. The room was in great condition, there was unlimited hot water, the beds were comfortable (although the pillows were a little flat). We requested bed rails both through the reservations number and through the front desk, but had to call housekeeping from the room to get them. Housekeeping was fine, no complaints...although tipping didn't get us any towel animals or anything other than basic housekeeping. Pool: The main pool was warm and there were plenty of lounge chairs both in the sun and in the shade. The slide was fun, although there should be no reason not to allow parents to slide down with the smaller children. Many parents were reprimanded for this, myself included. If you visit the pool bar, bring bugspray. A few angry (horseflies?) bugs took some bites out of us. Recreaction: The surrey bikes were fun, as were the rental boats. We loved riding down the Sassagoula River to Downtown Disney and back. You get to see some beautiful 2-story "treehouses". We couldn't figure out if they were part of the golf package or what. Dining: I have to admit that we only ate once in the cafeteria, and once in Boatwright's. It wasn't exactly our type of food (and a little overpriced for what it was). Instead we ate at Kimono's at the Swan, Rainforest Cafe in Downtown Disney, and the Yachtsman Steak House at the Yacht Club. We also had a character breakfast one morning at the Garden Grove Cafe at the Swan. Evenings: We visited the boardwalk a couple of nights to see the Magic Kingdom fireworks and for dessert. The other nights we went to Downtown Disney. By far one of the best family trips ever! This is our 4th family trip to Disney (2 trips to the Allstars and once to Coronado Springs) and I think we will be staying at PO Riverside from now on!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service at Port Orleans Riveside”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside in the Alligator Bayou section from 20 April to 27 April. The resort's grounds are beautifully maintained and cleverly designed. The food court area is much larger than the French Quarter and offered a bit more variety but was insanely busy in the mornings. The rooms are well appointed but starting to show their age. Fridge rentals are $10 USD night. Bus service seemed to be hit and miss with the longest wait being for the Animal Kingdom/ Blizzard Beach bus. Their is a water launch to French Quarter and Downtown Disney which is most convenient. The various pools are well maintained and we were in buidling 18 which was close to the 24 hour pool. Staff were very polite and friendly at every turn. This hotel is still a good bet for young families but perhaps a bit too busy for those travelling without smaller children. Overall a very pleasant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We will never stay anywhere else in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: amash
Reviews.Content: What an awesome vacation spot! My family and I have stay at Port Orleans about six times in the last 10 years and have NEVER been disappointed. The service is absolutely top notch, and the facility is gorgeous. This resort is laid back and quiet, perfect for any family or couples trip. Our rooms have always been clean and tidy, and housekeeping is fantastic. The food is great, but don't expect 5 star dining. It's much like the resort, simple, yet appetizing. One tip: RENT THE BICYCLES!! The resort is beautiful, but you'll never get to see it all without the help of a trusty old bike. You can ride over to Port Orleans French Quarter and check it out, too. I cannot express how lovely this resort is. We have always had great experiences here, and will return each time we visit Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Port New Orleans - Riverside”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the accomodations at Riverside. It is less hectic than the French Quarter Side of the resort. I would like to stay again and check out the French Quarter Pool. It looked very impressive. The room was well designed and the grounds were perfect. Great walking, biking and jogging paths.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be refurbished”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife, two children (3 & 4) satyed at the Port Orleans Riverside from April 26 thru April 30, 2004. The service was good, the employees were fantastic. The shuttle service was awesome. Now for the bad news:The room was in bad shape. The bed's box spring was falling apart. I took a picture and plan to send to the manager. You could actually see the coils to the box spring. A hazard when traveling with kids. The rugs were old, musty and grungy. The tourlet was rusty. When we checked in and were ready tom make our first pot of coffee the next morning, the coffee grind were still in the basket form the prior guest. Their was also old coffee in the pot. For a moderate levele resort, this place was lousy. Stay at one of the value resorts (at least they are newer) or at Carribean Beach or Coronado Springs. Riverside is in poor shale and should be refurbrished. DO NOT STAY THERE. Plus, you have to walk far to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Riverside is Superb!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've just returned home from our stay at Disney's Port Orleans Riverside. I have not one complaint about this resort. It was not only beautiful and romantic but also very well staffed and organized. This resort is A+ in my book and I would definately recommed it to anyone. We stayed in Alligator Bayou, building 27. I am shocked at some of the comments I've read, especially about urine on the seat.....um, the toilets have a power flush..don't you think it could be water! When you check in they'll ask which building you'd like to stay in, so request to stay closer to the lobby. It's a huge resort so of course you'll have a bit of a walk if your in the farthest buildings. All of the walk ways are amazing. Wonderful bridges, ponds, and wildlife. The room itself is a little small, but our family of five was comfortable. You really spend very little time in your room. I consider myself to be extremely picky when it comes to service and cleanliness and I can not think of one thing to complain about. The staff was friendly and very fast to bring us anything we requested. Our remote for the t.v. needed new batteries and they arrived in less that 10 minutes. More pillows... not a problem...bed rails for young children.. they've got them too. Anything we needed they provided. If you have small children you should definately bring a stroller, it will be hard to carry them around this large resort. Riverside Is All Around SUPERB! ( for a moderate resort)

Reviews.Title: “Major drawback”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A major drawback to staying at this hotel is that they freely give out your room number. Everything else was great, the accommodations, service and transportation set up by travelocity.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the money”
Reviews.Author: bagoda1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with wife and 5 year old in August, 2003 (over Thanksgiving). For the money, it was acceptable, but it needs a face lift big time. There is one main restaurant, which is very average, and a lousy cafeteria. It has one modest size bar area, which was very crowded every night. The pool area looked worked. On the other hand, the service was good, the rooms were adequate, the place was clean, and transporation was convenient. If you want luxury, go to the Grand Floridian. This is a modest priced property at Disney, and it shows. I agree with those who would stay elsewhere until they renovate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mekopp
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Port Orleans 8/23/03 - 8/30/03. I really enjoyed my stay there. If you can only go to Disney during the summer, the last week of August is the time to go. The rates drop to the fall rates and the resort was only about 1/2 full. I was able to check into my room at 8am and I got a water view room, which I did not request or pay for. I am a runner, so the place was perfect for me. I was able to run through the entire resort and the French Quarters which was undergoing renovation. My room was clean and big enough for 4 people for the entire week. Everything was bright and cheery and relaxing. The beautiful, relaxing grounds are a great contrast to the sensory overload you experience in the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Upside, downside for disabled”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 days (6 nights) at Riverside late March 2004. Room we finally occupied met our expectations in every way. Roll in shower, 2 double beds , a little small but adequate. Restaurants, shops, and services were nearby in main building. Staff here and everywhere we went were most friendly and helpful to this blind/vi man and my wheelchair sighted companion. Bus service was faultless and we particularly enjoyed the chair accessable boat ride to Downtown Disney and it's shops and restaurants. Hired a scooter at Epcot and spent 10 hours in the park. Lots of families and kids, but what would you expect on spring break. Downside ----- the bell service at Riverside was deplorable. Let us down big time both on check-in and check-out. Compared to all other staff, they were shameful. Sorry. Warning to wheelchair and other disabled ----- if you can't schlep your own bags and/or find your room acres away in the dark, go elsewhere. Sad because Disney excels in handling handicapped persons, except in this area. Been home 10 days and have yet to hear a plausable explanation from management. Maybe the nearby French Quarters (newly refurbished) might do better.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I stayed at this resort 2/2/04 to 2/9/04. I can't say enough about this resort. It's landscaping will leave you speechless. It's so peaceful. The boat ride to downtown Disney is a must. The food court actually amazed me. I thought it would just be "average" but it was above average in my opinion. Every meal I had there was good if not great. The bakery is a must!!!!! Staff was all very friendly and helpful. Housekeeping was fine. No problems with our room. (AB #2710) I would love to stay there again!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Get ready to walk!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans the first week of April and visited all the theme parks. the only advice we could give to visitors planning to stay at the Port Orleans is "request a room close to the main building." Our 3 kids were wiped after the theme parks and the lodges are so spread out it is an added irritant to have to walk so far to get to the food court,pool,buses etc.. The landscaping is pretty and the pool is fun for the kids due to the great water slide but the layout of the grounds is enormous and exhausting.

Reviews.Title: “Loved POR”
Reviews.Author: cmt18
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans from 24th July 2003 for 14 nights. This was our second visit to Disney, having stayed previously on International Drive. After reading the various reports on Port Orleans, I was a little concerned as to what to expect. On arrival after a ten hour flight and our seven year old as excited as anyone can be, we were really pleased at the warm welcome we were given by the Disney staff. They really made a fuss of him as soon as they noticed his English accent and he was quite happy to sit and watch the TV in reception while we checked in. I had purchased the unofficial guide and had picked out some of the buildings that they advised were quiet but unfortunately we had been placed in one of the buildings which they rated as noisy. No problem, said the receptionist and immediately swopped us. Our room was very clean and the maid service was superb. In all European hotels we hire a fridge for 14 nights ususally at a cost of $2 per night and was astounded at the cost required by Disney! We did without. My criticisms of the resort are as follows; The service in the food court is slow due to the large number of guests especially at busy times. We were also disappointed that the boat from Downtown Disney was sometimes cancelled on the journey back but found throughout all of our visit that the Disney transportation was excellent. Our room was next to the West Depot and it was like our own personal taxi service. The drink refills are excellent and I have saved our cups as we are again visiting in July 2004 and hope to be able to get the same room. Port Orleans is excellent for a comfortable vacation. It is not the height of luxury but is clean, well designed with beautiful grounds, has friendly staff and an excellent transport system.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans Riverside-Had a Blast in the Bayou!”
Reviews.Author: renty
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved Port Orleans Riverside Resort. We stayed there 3/20-3/26 '04. After reading the reviews, I was skeptical, especially regarding all the walking. Well, if you are in pretty good shape you will be just fine. We stayed in Alligator Bayou Building 35 and the West Bus Depot was just a 2 minute walk away. We didn't wait more than 15 minutes for a bus and if you get on at the West Depot, you will be the first passengers on the bus. We even had one of the small pools right outside our door and my boys would go there if we only had time for a quick swim. Yes, the main building is a bit of a walk, but the grounds are beautiful and you don't even notice the distance. My 3 1/2 year old ran all the way to the Ol' Man Island and back and it didn't phase him a bit! The staff was very courteous and we enjoyed delicious meals at the food court and Boatwrights too. We never had to wait either. My boys loved the Fishin' Hole and the pools. Our room was very clean and large enough for 2 adults and 3 rambunctous boys!

Reviews.Title: “Thrilled!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before with all the kids and loved it, so we decided to come for our anniversary. The setting is romantic. We were in the Aligator Bayou area and had a perfect river view from the second floor.Our room was quiet even thought the floor was full. All of my requests were honored. We were thrilled. We loved the pool bar, Muddy Rivers. You must try a Mississippi Mud Slide or a Southen Belle, yummy drinks. The food was fine there but we mostly ate in the parks , except once at Ohana's at the polly, which was great food and we got a window seat and could see the fireworks (wishes) while we were served desert!!! Talk about awesome!!! The busses arrived quickly. The boat ride to downtown Disney was fun. Our captian told us so much information, it was great. We will be back again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best resort!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans Riverside is a FABULOUS hotel. The people who say otherwise do not know what they are talking about. People complain about luggage service and such, but why? Are we too lazy to carry it ourselves anymore??? I have never used the luggage service because I see no need to, but my friends that have thought that it was fabulous. The food is great and the views are BEAUTIFUL! I love everything from the atmosphere to the many pools and places to walk around this resort. This is the first year I have not been able to go down in 13 years, and am very disappointed, but cannot wait until I can return next year. This is the place that I love second to home and enjoy spending 10 days at a time. I do not even go to parks, I stay at Port Orleans Riverside and enjoy everything about it. This, I must say is the absolute BEST Disney World Resort after having stayed at some of the others (ex. All Stars).

Reviews.Title: “Cant get any better than Riverside”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well I have to admit, when I first read all these reviews I was very skeptical about the resort, terrified almost but it was too late to turn back, We really wanted to stay at French Quarter but it was closed for rennovation. We stayed for 2 nights for my 21st birthday on March 9-11, orginally we booked at one of the "Value" resorts...The Pop Century but decided to go for a more "adult like" resort and P.O. seemed perfect b/c of its "mardi gras" themes,,,,well we actually got there very early so we can take advantage of our park passes and hit the parks early...but the gentleman at the front desk was more than helpful, we was friendly and efficient, gave us all the park info and resort info and even went out of his way to call the security office out front to advise that a family member would come by to drop off our luggage (since you cant get into the resort without a reservation or a key-which i defintely commend , with all the wackos out there you never know)....anyways Magic Kingdom was great i was a little disappointed that Big Thunder Mountain was just shut down for technical difficulties right when we got there but overall was a good time,,decent wait,,,,one quick call around 3 to check if the room was ready and we were all set.. the room they gave was just what we asked for...about 10 feet from parking and walking distance to bus stop for shuttles , we didnt get the smoking room we asked for but its ok-were trying to quit anyways!....well next day blizzard beach was awsome...it was cold out so we really got that "blizzard like" feel got back and had dinner at the food court -quick, cheap and didnt make me sick...so i was satisfied... check out was a snap...we charged it to a card so when we got up we had an "express checkout" envelope....basically a list of everything we charged to the room....which by the way another MAJOR PLUS!!!!!......you can use your room key as a ticket/charge card and instead of carrying credit cards around or cash you can cash anything in the resort or parks to your room key...HOW CONVENIENT IS THAT!? anyways....so everything we purchased was listed and as long as its correct...consider yourself checked out no need to head to the front desk, and since our park tickets didnt expire till midnight we decided to head to another park and bell services was nice enough to hold our luggage until we left the resort......I LOVED THIS PLACE....it felt like a whole separate little world in there it was absoulutely beautiful, clean, very friendly staff, and good prices....especially with the florida resident deal right now. I will defintely go back and to all of you who are considering this resort....forget what these other nuts are complaining about...you really should check it out its great. Thanks to all the friendly staff for your kindness and efficiency,,,,oh and for the extra towels too :)

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL EXPERIENCEE WON'T STAY ANWHERE ELSE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel it is a wonderful place to stay. The prices are great the food court is wonderful, buy a mug and get your drinks for free for your entire visit and bring it back for your next visit and you will get them free then too. We go to WDW every other year and my child who is 12 always wants to stay at ort rleans Riverside. She loves the pools, the arcade, and she gets a real charge from feeding the birds. The rooms are clean and the staff is as friendly as all get out. So to all you people out there who bust on this resort I can truthfully say that I have never seen the problems you are talking about.

Reviews.Title: “Some good some bad”
Reviews.Author: wink63
Reviews.Content: We visited Port Orleans Riverside in January 2004. We had stayed at the Riverside in Oct 2002 and had a great experience so we thought let's do it again. However this time our room was in Alligator Bayou. The room seemed small and somewhat outdated but the worst part was the noise from the other rooms. We could hear everything in the rooms next to us, the bathroom noise was the worst. We had also requested a room near the main pool as we know the resort is larger and the walk to the main pool can be difficult for smaller children. The request was not honored. The final complaint was the transportation to the parks which is one of the perks of staying "on property" was slow and unorganized. The staff at the Riverside was great as well as the food court. We have stayed at several of the Disney resorts and this is one we will not return to any time soon. We did have a great time at the parks once we got there.

Reviews.Title: “It was great! - and im picky...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and i stayed at Rivereside in January of 2004 and we were both pleased with it, and we're very picky when it comes to cleanliness, quality and service. And you should expect high quality from disney, especially with the prices you pay. Flight-Our flight to orlando was delayed almost two hours, so we were already aggrivated when we arrived. then our patience was tested again. were unsure of where to go to get our Mears shuttle. We had to get all our crap, find the mears desk, wait in that line, get our tickets, drag all our crap outside get on the bus...it was just annoying traveling stuff. We had'nt eaten for a long time, and we missed a good portion of our day in the park becasue of our delay. Arrival/CHeck in-So when we finally arrived at Riverside, we were starving, and we were tired, and aggrivated. But the welcome really brightened us up. A staff member greeted us as we got off of the bus and she took our bags while we checked in. The check in line was long, but the lobby was really nice atmopsphere. THe check in lady explained everything to us, and answered all of our questions, gave us maps and information,and was really informative. Then we went back outside to get our bags and they got a bellman to drive us and our stuff to our rooms. He was also really helpful with directing us around and just telling us general information about the park and stuff. Room-Our room was in the second farthest from the lobby in the Alligator Bayuo. And the drive to the room seemed really far. But I was glad to see that the bus depot was only a two minute walk from our room, and the pool was just around the corner. And the more we walked back and forth from the lobby to our room, the more we got used to the walk. It only ended up being about a 7 minute walk...not bad. Youre in disney...youre gonna walk. So anyway, the room was clean. I've read complaints here and there about the rooms being dirty. Maybe those people got stuck in rooms with new maids. Maybe they just had bad luck. Or maybe we had good luck. I don't know. But our room was clean. Would i soak in the bath tub? no....but im a germophobe. I wouldn't soak in a hotel bathtub. The shower curtains looked brand new, the floor behind the toilet was clean, there were no stains on the walls, the remote to the tv was clean, the lamp shades were clean. The bed spread looked and smelled clean. overall i was satisfied. Our heat worked really well....yes i said HEAT haha. It was chilly while we were there. Our maid took into account the way we slept in the bed, how we didnt like the sheets tucked in, what blankets we used, how many pillows we used, and thats the way she made the bed every day. I thought that was really thoughtful.The furniture in the room was of good quality. Lots of drawer space. Nice little table and chair....hooks to hang stuff....lighting is bright enough. Nuff said about the room. It was a good hotel room.Pool Ahhh...the pool. I'm sure every disney vacation needs at least one trip to the pool to wind down. The main pool at Riverside was nice. A good size. Its not all crazy with the sea serpant (or whatever it is) like the one at the frech quarter...it fits the theme of the resort. Its big, theres a fun slide for kids (or silly grown ups like me and my hunny) to slide down. Its heated. Attentive life guards. Clean towels provided. And to help ease the pain of walking all day and night, theres a nice little jacuzzi. Theres a bar right at the pool, so you can get a drink and sip it in the hot tub...i dont knwo if youre really allowed to do that. but thats what we did every night hah.Food So theres a food court and a resturaunt. Maybe it was just me and my fiance, but we didn't like the resturaunt. We read some good stuff about it so we were looking forward to it. We ate there once for breakfast and once for dinner. Well my fiance threw up the breakfast and I had an upset stomach all night from dinner. It was pretty pricey too. The food court was fine. I think it depends what you choose. The bacon, frech toast, pancakes, and cinnimon buns were good. It was pricey for a food court though. Cereal, milk, and grapes was like, 6-7 dollars. We did buy those refillable mugs. They were good idea. They weren't very big though. And there's a little sink set up in the food court to wash out your cup too. Our Boating Excursion-They have boats there that you can rent, for reasonable prices, and you can drive them around the river, its actually like a swamp i guess...heh. The river goes all through Port Orleans, Old Key West and into Downtown Disney. They had boats in three sizes, a teeny little boat for two people, a medium sized boat and a bigger party boat. We decided to get the little boat, becasue we thought it was go faster. Not really, they were all adjusted to only be able to reach like, 12 mph. So we rose all around in that little boat for about an hour, and on our way back to the dock, the motor shorted out, and we couldnt get the boat started again! My fiance just kept pulling and pulling to try to get it going, but it wasnt working. So we had to hollar for the construction workers at French Quarter to call RIverside and tell them we were standed in the middle of the lake. THen our boat started taking on some water....apparently thats what they do when theyre not moving....it was exciitng....But for our troubles they let us take a big party boat out. That was great. He drove the boat and i layed out and got a little tan. We drove down town, docked our boat and went shopping for a little bit. The groundsThe property was beautiful. The landscaping was really outstanding. It is a little confusing to find your way around at first, but we got used to it after walking to the food court a few times. It is a pretty big place. overall, i really reccomend Riverside. Its no Grand Floridian, but its a nice place to stay at a good value.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable rooms for $114.00 but verify your reservation.”
Reviews.Author: lrauers
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend at PO Riverside. I initially booked 3 rooms at the published Disney rate but called a few days later to see if I could get a much reduced special rate advertised in the Atlanta paper. I got the reduced rate but only after hours on the phone with central reservations. Then I called a week ahead of time to verify our reservation only to find that they had it all wrong. Again, it took forever on the phone until they got it right. BE SURE TO CALL a week before you go to make sure your reservation is correct. However, the Riverside is a good choice for the money. Our rooms were in the 9580 area which is close to the pool, restaurant and bus, but very quiet. Busses are frequent to the parks, the boatride to Downtown Disney is beautiful. The food court has a wide selection but for breakfast you need to get there as early as possible. For those who drink wine, there is no red wine in the gift shop but I found a rack in the food court. A glass of wine at the bar is 7.50, a small bottle in the food court is 5.00. Service in the restaurant is good but the food is average at best. This was a good time of year to go, the lines were minimal. Don't miss Mickey's Philharmagic #D. The best I've seen.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans for anniversary”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Port Orleans Resort to celebrate our 2nd anniversary in Disney. It is a very romantic setting - we stayed in the Magnolia Bend area (plantation-style buidings). We never waited more than 5 minutes at a bus stop for Disney transportation, and the boat ride to Downtown Disney was great. We thought Boatwright's was a bit over-priced, but the food court had a lot of choices and was reasonable. We look forward to staying here again after the refurbishments to the rooms. They were a bit dated, but that would be my only negative about this great resort.

Reviews.Title: “February 5th, 2004 thru February 9th, 2004”
Reviews.Author: ssi6
Reviews.Content: Stayed at POR Feb. 5th-9th. Had I realized this was the old Dixie Landings hotel, I would've kept my reservation at the new Pop Century for $20/night less. But with the FL resident discount, I thought why not upgrade. It's a good hotel but just not my preference. The only thing I think is worth the extra money is the rooms seemed to be slightly larger then the All-Star resorts. I asked for a room close to the lobby and they put us in bldg. 36, the absolute furthest one FROM the lobby. And they put us upstairs with two small children. We stayed at All-Star Music last September and my 4 year old thought that pool was the coolest thing in the world. Food court seemed to stay crowded and they rarely had all of the restaurants open at the same time, making the lines longer. We went back to the room and ordered pizza one night because it was so crowded, but our pizze took well over an hour to get there. Like I say, it's a good hotel. I just don't think it's worth the extra money unless you can get a discount or something. Very beautiful landscaping.

Reviews.Title: “Second time in 10 years”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Second time...I checked every corner to see if it was going down in quality...Not a speck of dirt anywhere in the room. Vanity lights very bright, hairdryer avail from housekeeping. The food court was very crowded(Labor Day weekend), but the mugs are the Best Deal! The customer service was great when my teenage son lost his room key. He thought our vacation was ruined, she explained how they were numbered and she just listed that card as "dead" and gave him a new one. The grounds are huge, request a room near the center, don't forget to use the East, West bus stops, as they may be closer to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Alligator Bayou”
Reviews.Author: Creepella
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2003, and though it was wonderful. The theming was enchanting, and the landscaping was fantastic. Having the boat to Downtown Disney was convenient, and fun, and bus service to the parks was, for the most part, extremely efficient. This resort is wonderful, and the quiet pools are excellent for moonlight or dawn swims. I would stay here again, if I was going to do moderate again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth $238/night”
Reviews.Author: Shandell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riverside during Christmas Week, 2003. We found the room dreary, dank and too small. The bathroom was especially tiny. For what we paid we felt there should have at least been a coffee pot in the room. If not that, free coffee in the main building would have been appreciated. The wait for a bus to anywhere was long. On a positive note, the pool is beautiful, as are the grounds.

Reviews.Title: “11th Birthday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I all 7 of us. Just got back from Disney. December 18th through December 22nd 2003. Stayed at PO Riverside. It was my son's 11 birthday. I had faxed my request to the room assigner on that monday the 15th. I had requested 3 rooms in the Oak Manor Mansions water views. When we arrvied we had all 3 rooms side by side and two connected together. Off to a perfect start. The rooms are ok. Clean. Everything looks old(aged). The grounds are very well kept. Spread out though. I requested the Oak Manor knowing it was close to the food, lobby ect... The theme of the resort is really neat. Tom Sowyer , steam boat. The first moring on the 19th we ate in the resturant instead of the food court. The waitress was so Rude and I could tell she was use to dealing with rude people on a daily basis, because she was so defensive right from the start. I had eggs and oj and coffee my bill was $ 25.00. I would never do that again. Always use food court same food same sitting half the price. We then took the bus to down town disney no wait for the bus. Had lunch at Rain Forest Cafe (vey nice). We went to the Disneys Very Merry Xmas Party from 7:00 to 12:00. It was wonderful everything was perfect. Lines were a bit crowded for the free group photo so we passed on that. All the good rides were packed as well. Its a small world. peter pan ect... The best part of the evening was the fire works at 9:15. It was the best fire works display we had ever seen. The sky was glowing in colors in all directions. We all went the Roosters Lounge on Saturday night at the Po Riverside Resort. Very friendley staff. We saw the piano man who entertained us all. Including the kids . We all sang christams carols and disney songs. Group participation a must. He had everyone sing my son Happy Birthday and really made him feel special. He makes up for what the resort lacks. Would I go make to this Resort probibly not. It was worth the Florida residents rate we spent of $ 99.00 a night for a water view room. However for about $20.00 more a night I can stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge deluxe resort for $ 120.00 a night. (big difference). My son had a wonderful time using the mice boats and playing the video games and the piano man and that is all that matters to us. This was our 5th trip to disney this year. We live approx 1hr ffrom disney so we go at least that many times a year. We have stayed at a lot of the resorts. It is a plus to stay on disney property with free transportation and all the resorts are themed which is super neat. I would say if it fits your budget stay at a duluxe resort where everything is in one building and the rooms and hotel is so much nicer. First class all the way. The Modern are nice just so spread out you feel like you cant see everything. The Value are what the are Value resorts. Total kid friendley and very plain no extras. In conclusion this was by far my sons best Birthday yet. Always next year though....

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our last stay (3rd total) at PO was horrendous. Aside from the fact the AC unit was hangining loose in the room with crayon drawings all over it, there was URINE crusted all along the base of the toliet. By the looks of the URINE I'd say it had been there for weeks, not days. We couldn't switch rooms at 1am with our sleeping 1 year old so we waited until checkout time to notify the desk. While checking out I informed the lady behind the counter who responded "you should have told us last night, is there anything else I can help you with?"!! We are frequent visitors to WDW and will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Skaneateles, NY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 2 rooms at the riverside in Magnolia Terrace on the 2nd floor fron Nov 28-Dec 3 with my husband and children ages 6, 7, 15, & 16. Thank goodness we had 2 rooms. The grounds were beautiful and the inside of the rooms were clean and ok looking. The bathroom is very small. When you open the door the tub is appx. 12 inches away from the door. the 2 sinks are not in the bathroom but in a little out-cove. There is a ledge above the sink and very often things will fall into the sink. Next to the sinks there is a bar to hang clothes and a shelf above that, there is one tv whch is very small and No VCR for the kids. I found this very surprising. Even though you are not in the room that much - it is still nice for the kids to relax in front of thir favorite movies. Our 6 & 7 Year olds could not use the pool in our section because it was too deep and over their heads. 4ft plus. The old man river pool was also too deep (4 feet plus) and my little ones needed to wear a life jacket which thank goodness we were able to borrow from the marina-ferry boat area free of charge. There was a kiddie pool for babies appx 1 ft but too low for my kids. The ferry boat ride to Downtown Disney was nice and the bus transportation works well. The food courts are on the expensive side as well as the food at the parks themselves. On our next vacation we will not stay here again but will stay where we have a kitchen, washer and dryer and a pool more appropriate for our children like the Vistana Resort where we stayed from Nov 23-Nov 28th.(Prior to Disney).

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort for the Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from a 4 night stay at Port Orleans Riverside. We stayed from 11/19 to 11/23. We thought it was wonderful. Our room was on the 3rd floor overlooking the river and had a King Size bed. The room was always clean and the staff was extremely friendly. This was our second stay at a Disney Resort. Our first stay was at the All Star Resort. My wife and I both agree that this was a definite improvement and worth the extra money. We were quite impressed. We plan on staying here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Our family of Five Loved POR !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just recently returned (10/20 - 10/27) from Disney's Port Orleans Riverside staying at the Alligator Bayou section of the property. Our room had a water view and had two double beds and a small trundle-bed. The room was fairly big for our family, considering it is a "moderate" hotel; but I think the room size is meant for four people, however POR is the only hotel that allows for 5 people (and you have to stay in the Alligator Bayou section because it has the trundle bed--can't stay in the mansions. The grounds were VERY beautiful (rustic Dixie Style), and everything was very clean (room, lobby, lounge, etc). Would definitely recommend this Disney hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Lighten Up!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: SOME people out there need to lighten up! After reading some of these reviews, I have to laugh. Of course there are bugs in Florida! Disney can't change that for you. And of course there is standing water. It rains in Florida almost daily at certain times of the year. Disney can't do a thing about that, either. We've stayed at Port Orleans a few times. It has always been quite satisfactory to us. Clean, efficient. Food at the courts a little pricy, but you're on vacation. You can't expect McDonald's prices at any resort that I know of. If you don't like paying the high prices, consider a cooler and a local grocery store for kids' milk, etc. All in all, any Disney resort is a great place to stay. It's Disney, for goodness sake!

Reviews.Title: “Fun at Disney and Port Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back on 10/25. The kids 3 and 4 loved the main pool and the "quiet pool" that was near our "mansion". The grounds were nice, food court was ok, we really did not eat there except for one lunch. The rooms were ok, nothing special but clean and maid service was good. I can see why they are next on the list to be refurbished, the furniture could use updating. The mattresses and pillows were also comfortable. Of course the best thing about the Disney resort is unlimited access to the parks. You can experience everything at a leisurely pace and bring the kids back to nap or swim in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed this last time”
Reviews.Author: the-z-family
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after disembarking off a Disney cruise, and had actually stayed here two months prior as well. Last time was much better...this time we had an ant issue also as another reviwer did. There was a large cobweb filled with dust above the curtains, which just makes you feel yucky. We were on the bottom floor and could hear the people above us using the bathroom, one word for that...gross. The grounds and pool are wonderful, we enjoy taking the boat to DTD. Wouldn't stay here agin though, for the money can stay off site at a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fun time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the PO Riverside from 9/14 - 9/21, 2003 with my daughter, son-in-law, and 3 grandchildren ages, 4, 6 & 10. We had a great time, weather cooporated, only rained one day & that was while we were inside so it didn't matter. We have stayed at the PO before, but the section we stayed was closed for renovations. When we checked in my daughter asked for Building #14 which was close to the pool, food court & to the bus pick-up. The rooms were okay, but the lighting in the bathroom was very dim. We had plenty of supplies & since there was no hair dryer on the wall I just called down to the desk & they sent one up for me to use for the week. The bus service was for the most part good - the only problem was getting around at night when the theme parks were closed. The only park that stayed open later was Epot & that was because of the fireworks & laser show. The food court was also okay & we didn't find that food was that expensive - we did buy the mugs though which was a very good investment. I understand that shortly the PO Riverside is going to be closed for rennovations which probably is a good idea. Even though our rooms were okay they could use a little freshening up. For the money I think we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans Riverside at the end of August and had a wonderful time! We had 2 rooms for the 5 of us. We were in the Acadian House on the 2nd floor. We were very pleased with the rooms and the location of everything! It is an EXTREMELY beautiful resort! Very nice scenery! We were a bit confused when we first got there, but we soon learned how to get around! It was a very fun and clean resort! The pools were great and of course the Cast Members were too! And let me tell you, I met some of the nicest and friendliest people ever at that resort! It is so magical there! The food court's food was GREAT! The lines weren't too bad either- they moved very quickly! This is a very family-friendly resort! So pack you bags, make the reservations, and book a stay at Disney's Port Orleans Riverside Resort! Have a MAGICAL day! Welcome home!!! <3 I luv Gary 4eva!!! <3 B&G 4eva!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in August 2003. We were not impressed with the rooms at all. All of the rooms are in several different buildings spread out all over the area. The rooms itself were about the same size as other hotels in the area. The rooms all have 2 double beds, a table with 2 chairs and a dresser. The room had painted walls with a border around top, and cheap carpeting, nothing special for the money you pay. We were on the ground level and had problems with many small red fire ants, despite their sending the exterminators to our room to spray. The grounds were quite pretty, but we were too tired after a long day to go for a walk. The swimming pool is quite large and nice (open 24 hrs), but far away from many rooms. The check-in lodge with the restaurants is a bit of a distance from most of the rooms. There is a fast food court in the main lodge. The food court prices were reasonable but they are terribly under staffed. Everyone stood in long lines to get waited on to get food (most people we talked to said it is like that all day long). You can take a boat ride to downtown disney. This boat ride is quite nice and a pretty view. The lines for the boat ride back to the hotel are long at night, so we took the bus back. The maid we had was the best part of being there, she was wonderful. Driving around the area was terrible, the signs are not marked well and we missed our turn several times (Follow the signs to downtown disney, then watch for the hotel sign). All in all, I would not go there again. It was not worth the extra money we paid. We had stayed at nicer hotels off the disney property for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Disneyland Lover loves Port Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had an absolute great time at the PO Riverside. First, I was wary about the bus system, I could see my wife and I waiting in the blistering Florida humidity for a bus. DID NOT HAPPEN ONCE! We did not wait for a bus for more than ten minutes the entire time. The transit system was great. We took the waterway once, just to do it, then we took the bus from there on. The buses were way to convenient not to. Now the hotel, every day we left, we came back to the room being clean and even the towels were folded all cute and stuff. The grounds were well kept and the pool was very nice. On our way back to our room once we saw a cool looking toad, just hangin around staring right back at us. The brown water was a little ugly, but it comes from the trees that keep the mosquitoes out, so I'll take the brown/black water and no mosquitoes. The gift shop was well stocked and it seemed that every time we got off at the main bus stop, we would end up going through there just to grab something fast. The food at the food court was really good, and the service was really nice making special pizza's for my no-cheese liking self. It was a little expensive, but not that much than the All Star's and it seemed that a lit of people were at the All Star's and I heard that All Star's are always loud and noisy and busy. If you like it quiet, with nice rooms and service with a smile(from everyone!) stay here. All in all, it was a great place to stay and I would stay there again without hesitation. But we might go somewhere else just for the variety.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Port Orleans Riverside”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 4 children, and I stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside the week after Thanksgiving '02. We were given ajoining rooms in one of the southern mansion homes (Parterre Place). What a beautiful place. I wish we could have spent more time at the resort. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The grounds were so amazing. We really loved our time at Port Orleans, and hope to be able to go back again in a few years.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I thought it would be like!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi all Disney travel planners! I wanted to share with everyone who is maybe planning a trip to Disney and wanting to stay at this resort. It is okay, totally not worth the money. We visit Disney once a year, and we choose one park per year and we normally stay at the All Star Resort. We wanted to try something alittle bit more expensive thinking we would get more. We were totally wrong and pretty unhappy with our decision. We almost checked out after seeing the rooms. Dirty is a good word, but just OLD. These rooms do have a rustic flair to them, but it was soo dark in the room I had a heck of a time with even seeing to put my makeup on. The rug in the floor was so dirty my son and daughters socks were black just after having a bath. The grounds of the resort were very well kept, but there is lots of standing brown water in the streams, and lots of bugs out after dusk. I know that Florida is known for bugs, but the standing water everywhere made it worse. The eating cafeteria was nice. The food was really expensive! 2 8 oz. bottles of milk for my son and daughter was over 5.00 dollars. I thought wow, they are expensive here. But have to admit we did eat there a couple of times just out of convenience of having it right there in walking distance. As you walk to the cafeteria, watch out for the ducks. Tons of ducks live right there on the walkway. Sort of hard to keep a 18 month old away from them but these ducks are VERY bold. They are not afraid of anyone walking by, so that sort of put a damper on walking to the cafeteria, so we would kid that get ready for attack of the ducks!! To be honest with you all, next year we are staying outside of the disney property on International Drive. There is a ton of places to walk to and it is really great area with lots of cheaper hotels that look really really nice! Have a GREAT trip where ever you stay! Judy

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed here in May '02. We loved it. We were in one of the antebellum houses. We had a pretty room that was clean. (I am very picky.) The landscaping was gorgeous!! The pools were nice as well. My husband wants to go back, just to stay at the hotel! The only problem I see with this hotel is the food court was expensive.

HotelInfo.Name: Disney's Port Orleans Resort - Riverside
HotelInfo.Address: 1251 Riverside Dr, Orlando, FL 32830 (Formerly Dixie Landings)
